bereshit.name: Bereshit
bereshit.summary: The creation of the world, Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden, Cain and Abel, the generations from Adam to Noah, and the corruption of humanity leading to the Flood.

1.hebrewText: <big>בְּ</big>רֵאשִׁ֖ית בָּרָ֣א אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֵ֥ת הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֵ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
1.englishText: When God began to create*When God began to create Others “In the beginning God created.” heaven and earth—
1.transliteration: <big>bְּ</big>rֵashִׁ֖yt bָּrָ֣a aֱlֹhִ֑yם aֵ֥t hַshָּׁmַ֖yִם vְaֵ֥t hָaָֽrֶץ׃

1.hebrewText: וְהָאָ֗רֶץ הָיְתָ֥ה תֹ֙הוּ֙ וָבֹ֔הוּ וְחֹ֖שֶׁךְ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י תְה֑וֹם וְר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֔ים מְרַחֶ֖פֶת עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַמָּֽיִם׃
1.englishText: the earth being unformed and void, with darkness over the surface of the deep and a wind from*a wind from Others “the spirit of.” God sweeping over the water—
1.transliteration: vְhָaָ֗rֶץ hָyְtָ֥h tֹ֙hvּ֙ vָbֹ֔hvּ vְchֹ֖shֶׁךְ aַl־pְּnֵ֣y tְh֑vֹם vְr֣vּchַ aֱlֹhִ֔yם mְrַchֶ֖pֶt aַl־pְּnֵ֥y hַmָּֽyִם׃

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֖ים יְהִ֣י א֑וֹר וַֽיְהִי־אֽוֹר׃
1.englishText: God said, “Let there be light”; and there was light.
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֱlֹhִ֖yם yְhִ֣y a֑vֹr vַֽyְhִy־aֽvֹr׃

1.hebrewText: וַיַּ֧רְא אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָא֖וֹר כִּי־ט֑וֹב וַיַּבְדֵּ֣ל אֱלֹהִ֔ים בֵּ֥ין הָא֖וֹר וּבֵ֥ין הַחֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
1.englishText: God saw that the light was good, and God separated the light from the darkness.
1.transliteration: vַyַּ֧rְa aֱlֹhִ֛yם aֶt־hָa֖vֹr kִּy־t֑vֹb vַyַּbְdֵּ֣l aֱlֹhִ֔yם bֵּ֥yן hָa֖vֹr vּbֵ֥yן hַchֹֽshֶׁךְ׃

1.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ לָאוֹר֙ י֔וֹם וְלַחֹ֖שֶׁךְ קָ֣רָא לָ֑יְלָה וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃ {פ}
1.englishText: God called the light Day and called the darkness Night. And there was evening and there was morning, a first day.*a first day Others “one day.”
1.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֨a aֱlֹhִ֤yם ׀ lָavֹr֙ y֔vֹם vְlַchֹ֖shֶׁךְ kָ֣rָa lָ֑yְlָh vַֽyְhִy־aֶ֥rֶb vַֽyְhִy־bֹ֖kֶr y֥vֹם aֶchָֽd׃ {p}

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים יְהִ֥י רָקִ֖יעַ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַמָּ֑יִם וִיהִ֣י מַבְדִּ֔יל בֵּ֥ין מַ֖יִם לָמָֽיִם׃
1.englishText: God said, “Let there be an expanse in the midst of the water, that it may separate water from water.”
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֔yם yְhִ֥y rָkִ֖yaַ bְּt֣vֹךְ hַmָּ֑yִם vִyhִ֣y mַbְdִּ֔yl bֵּ֥yן mַ֖yִם lָmָֽyִם׃

1.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֱלֹהִים֮ אֶת־הָרָקִ֒יעַ֒ וַיַּבְדֵּ֗ל בֵּ֤ין הַמַּ֙יִם֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ מִתַּ֣חַת לָרָקִ֔יעַ וּבֵ֣ין הַמַּ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֖ר מֵעַ֣ל לָרָקִ֑יעַ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
1.englishText: God made the expanse, and it separated the water which was below the expanse from the water which was above the expanse. And it was so.
1.transliteration: vַyַּ֣aַshׂ aֱlֹhִyם֮ aֶt־hָrָkִ֒yaַ֒ vַyַּbְdֵּ֗l bֵּ֤yן hַmַּ֙yִם֙ aֲshֶׁr֙ mִtַּ֣chַt lָrָkִ֔yaַ vּbֵ֣yן hַmַּ֔yִם aֲshֶׁ֖r mֵaַ֣l lָrָkִ֑yaַ vַֽyְhִy־kֵֽן׃

1.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֱלֹהִ֛ים לָֽרָקִ֖יעַ שָׁמָ֑יִם וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם שֵׁנִֽי׃ {פ}
1.englishText: God called the expanse Sky. And there was evening and there was morning, a second day.
1.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֧a aֱlֹhִ֛yם lָֽrָkִ֖yaַ shָׁmָ֑yִם vַֽyְhִy־aֶ֥rֶb vַֽyְhִy־bֹ֖kֶr y֥vֹם shֵׁnִֽy׃ {p}

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים יִקָּו֨וּ הַמַּ֜יִם מִתַּ֤חַת הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ אֶל־מָק֣וֹם אֶחָ֔ד וְתֵרָאֶ֖ה הַיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
1.englishText: God said, “Let the water below the sky be gathered into one area, that the dry land may appear.” And it was so.
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֗yם yִkָּv֨vּ hַmַּ֜yִם mִtַּ֤chַt hַshָּׁmַ֙yִם֙ aֶl־mָk֣vֹם aֶchָ֔d vְtֵrָaֶ֖h hַyַּbָּshָׁ֑h vַֽyְhִy־kֵֽן׃

1.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים <small>׀</small> לַיַּבָּשָׁה֙ אֶ֔רֶץ וּלְמִקְוֵ֥ה הַמַּ֖יִם קָרָ֣א יַמִּ֑ים וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
1.englishText: God called the dry land Earth and called the gathering of waters Seas. And God saw that this was good.
1.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֨a aֱlֹhִ֤yם <small>׀</small> lַyַּbָּshָׁh֙ aֶ֔rֶץ vּlְmִkְvֵ֥h hַmַּ֖yִם kָrָ֣a yַmִּ֑yם vַyַּ֥rְa aֱlֹhִ֖yם kִּy־tֽvֹb׃

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים תַּֽדְשֵׁ֤א הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ דֶּ֗שֶׁא עֵ֚שֶׂב מַזְרִ֣יעַ זֶ֔רַע עֵ֣ץ פְּרִ֞י עֹ֤שֶׂה פְּרִי֙ לְמִינ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר זַרְעוֹ־ב֖וֹ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
1.englishText: And God said, “Let the earth sprout vegetation: seed-bearing plants, fruit trees of every kind on earth that bear fruit with the seed in it.” And it was so.
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֗yם tַּֽdְshֵׁ֤a hָaָ֙rֶץ֙ dֶּ֗shֶׁa aֵ֚shֶׂb mַzְrִ֣yaַ zֶ֔rַa aֵ֣ץ pְּrִ֞y aֹ֤shֶׂh pְּrִy֙ lְmִyn֔vֹ aֲshֶׁ֥r zַrְavֹ־b֖vֹ aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vַֽyְhִy־kֵֽן׃

1.hebrewText: וַתּוֹצֵ֨א הָאָ֜רֶץ דֶּ֠שֶׁא עֵ֣שֶׂב מַזְרִ֤יעַ זֶ֙רַע֙ לְמִינֵ֔הוּ וְעֵ֧ץ עֹֽשֶׂה־פְּרִ֛י אֲשֶׁ֥ר זַרְעוֹ־ב֖וֹ לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
1.englishText: The earth brought forth vegetation: seed-bearing plants of every kind, and trees of every kind bearing fruit with the seed in it. And God saw that this was good.
1.transliteration: vַtּvֹtsֵ֨a hָaָ֜rֶץ dֶּ֠shֶׁa aֵ֣shֶׂb mַzְrִ֤yaַ zֶ֙rַa֙ lְmִynֵ֔hvּ vְaֵ֧ץ aֹֽshֶׂh־pְּrִ֛y aֲshֶׁ֥r zַrְavֹ־b֖vֹ lְmִynֵ֑hvּ vַyַּ֥rְa aֱlֹhִ֖yם kִּy־tֽvֹb׃

1.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥ו��ם שְׁלִישִֽׁי׃ {פ}
1.englishText: And there was evening and there was morning, a third day.
1.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־aֶ֥rֶb vַֽyְhִy־bֹ֖kֶr y֥v��ם shְׁlִyshִֽׁy׃ {p}

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים יְהִ֤י מְאֹרֹת֙ בִּרְקִ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם לְהַבְדִּ֕יל בֵּ֥ין הַיּ֖וֹם וּבֵ֣ין הַלָּ֑יְלָה וְהָי֤וּ לְאֹתֹת֙ וּלְמ֣וֹעֲדִ֔ים וּלְיָמִ֖ים וְשָׁנִֽים׃
1.englishText: God said, “Let there be lights in the expanse of the sky to separate day from night; they shall serve as signs for the set times—the days and the years;
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֗yם yְhִ֤y mְaֹrֹt֙ bִּrְkִ֣yaַ hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם lְhַbְdִּ֕yl bֵּ֥yן hַyּ֖vֹם vּbֵ֣yן hַlָּ֑yְlָh vְhָy֤vּ lְaֹtֹt֙ vּlְm֣vֹaֲdִ֔yם vּlְyָmִ֖yם vְshָׁnִֽyם׃

1.hebrewText: וְהָי֤וּ לִמְאוֹרֹת֙ בִּרְקִ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם לְהָאִ֖יר עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
1.englishText: and they shall serve as lights in the expanse of the sky to shine upon the earth.” And it was so.
1.transliteration: vְhָy֤vּ lִmְavֹrֹt֙ bִּrְkִ֣yaַ hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם lְhָaִ֖yr aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vַֽyְhִy־kֵֽן׃

1.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־שְׁנ��֥י הַמְּאֹרֹ֖ת הַגְּדֹלִ֑ים אֶת־הַמָּא֤וֹר הַגָּדֹל֙ לְמֶמְשֶׁ֣לֶת הַיּ֔וֹם וְאֶת־הַמָּא֤וֹר הַקָּטֹן֙ לְמֶמְשֶׁ֣לֶת הַלַּ֔יְלָה וְאֵ֖ת הַכּוֹכָבִֽים׃
1.englishText: God made the two great lights, the greater light to dominate the day and the lesser light to dominate the night, and the stars.
1.transliteration: vַyַּ֣aַshׂ aֱlֹhִ֔yם aֶt־shְׁn��֥y hַmְּaֹrֹ֖t hַgְּdֹlִ֑yם aֶt־hַmָּa֤vֹr hַgָּdֹl֙ lְmֶmְshֶׁ֣lֶt hַyּ֔vֹם vְaֶt־hַmָּa֤vֹr hַkָּtֹן֙ lְmֶmְshֶׁ֣lֶt hַlַּ֔yְlָh vְaֵ֖t hַkּvֹkָbִֽyם׃

1.hebrewText: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים בִּרְקִ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם לְהָאִ֖יר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
1.englishText: And God set them in the expanse of the sky to shine upon the earth,
1.transliteration: vַyִּtֵּ֥ן aֹtָ֛ם aֱlֹhִ֖yם bִּrְkִ֣yaַ hַshָּׁmָ֑yִם lְhָaִ֖yr aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

1.hebrewText: וְלִמְשֹׁל֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם וּבַלַּ֔יְלָה וּֽלְהַבְדִּ֔יל בֵּ֥ין הָא֖וֹר וּבֵ֣ין הַחֹ֑שֶׁךְ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
1.englishText: to dominate the day and the night, and to separate light from darkness. And God saw that this was good.
1.transliteration: vְlִmְshֹׁl֙ bַּyּ֣vֹם vּbַlַּ֔yְlָh vּֽlְhַbְdִּ֔yl bֵּ֥yן hָa֖vֹr vּbֵ֣yן hַchֹ֑shֶׁךְ vַyַּ֥rְa aֱlֹhִ֖yם kִּy־tֽvֹb׃

1.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם רְבִיעִֽי׃ {פ}
1.englishText: And there was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
1.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־aֶ֥rֶb vַֽyְhִy־bֹ֖kֶr y֥vֹם rְbִyaִֽy׃ {p}

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים יִשְׁרְצ֣וּ הַמַּ֔יִם שֶׁ֖רֶץ נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֑ה וְעוֹף֙ יְעוֹפֵ֣ף עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ עַל־פְּנֵ֖י רְקִ֥יעַ הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
1.englishText: God said, “Let the waters bring forth swarms of living creatures, and birds that fly above the earth across the expanse of the sky.”
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֔yם yִshְׁrְts֣vּ hַmַּ֔yִם shֶׁ֖rֶץ nֶ֣pֶshׁ chַyָּ֑h vְavֹף֙ yְavֹpֵ֣ף aַl־hָaָ֔rֶץ aַl־pְּnֵ֖y rְkִ֥yaַ hַshָּׁmָֽyִם׃

1.hebrewText: וַיִּבְרָ֣א אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־הַתַּנִּינִ֖ם הַגְּדֹלִ֑ים וְאֵ֣ת כׇּל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַֽחַיָּ֣ה <small>׀</small> הָֽרֹמֶ֡שֶׂת אֲשֶׁר֩ שָׁרְצ֨וּ הַמַּ֜יִם לְמִֽינֵהֶ֗ם ��ְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־ע֤וֹף כָּנָף֙ לְמִינֵ֔הוּ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
1.englishText: God created the great sea monsters, and all the living creatures of every kind that creep, which the waters brought forth in swarms, and all the winged birds of every kind. And God saw that this was good.
1.transliteration: vַyִּbְrָ֣a aֱlֹhִ֔yם aֶt־hַtַּnִּynִ֖ם hַgְּdֹlִ֑yם vְaֵ֣t kׇּl־nֶ֣pֶshׁ hַֽchַyָּ֣h <small>׀</small> hָֽrֹmֶ֡shֶׂt aֲshֶׁr֩ shָׁrְts֨vּ hַmַּ֜yִם lְmִֽynֵhֶ֗ם ��ְaֵ֨t kׇּl־a֤vֹף kָּnָף֙ lְmִynֵ֔hvּ vַyַּ֥rְa aֱlֹhִ֖yם kִּy־tֽvֹb׃

1.hebrewText: וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ אֹתָ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר פְּר֣וּ וּרְב֗וּ וּמִלְא֤וּ אֶת־הַמַּ֙יִם֙ בַּיַּמִּ֔ים וְהָע֖וֹף יִ֥רֶב בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
1.englishText: God blessed them, saying, “Be fertile and increase, fill the waters in the seas, and let the birds increase on the earth.”
1.transliteration: vַyְbָ֧rֶךְ aֹtָ֛ם aֱlֹhִ֖yם lֵamֹ֑r pְּr֣vּ vּrְb֗vּ vּmִlְa֤vּ aֶt־hַmַּ֙yִם֙ bַּyַּmִּ֔yם vְhָa֖vֹף yִ֥rֶb bָּaָֽrֶץ׃

1.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם חֲמִישִֽׁי׃ {פ}
1.englishText: And there was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.
1.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־aֶ֥rֶb vַֽyְhִy־bֹ֖kֶr y֥vֹם chֲmִyshִֽׁy׃ {p}

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים תּוֹצֵ֨א הָאָ֜רֶץ נֶ֤פֶשׁ חַיָּה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ בְּהֵמָ֥ה וָרֶ֛מֶשׂ וְחַֽיְתוֹ־אֶ֖רֶץ לְמִינָ֑הּ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
1.englishText: God said, “Let the earth bring forth every kind of living creature: cattle, creeping things, and wild beasts of every kind.” And it was so.
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֗yם tּvֹtsֵ֨a hָaָ֜rֶץ nֶ֤pֶshׁ chַyָּh֙ lְmִynָ֔hּ bְּhֵmָ֥h vָrֶ֛mֶshׂ vְchַֽyְtvֹ־aֶ֖rֶץ lְmִynָ֑hּ vַֽyְhִy־kֵֽן׃

1.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֱלֹהִים֩ אֶת־חַיַּ֨ת הָאָ֜רֶץ לְמִינָ֗הּ וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־רֶ֥מֶשׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֖ה לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
1.englishText: God made wild beasts of every kind and cattle of every kind, and all kinds of creeping things of the earth. And God saw that this was good.
1.transliteration: vַyַּ֣aַshׂ aֱlֹhִyם֩ aֶt־chַyַּ֨t hָaָ֜rֶץ lְmִynָ֗hּ vְaֶt־hַbְּhֵmָh֙ lְmִynָ֔hּ vְaֵ֛t kׇּl־rֶ֥mֶshׂ hָֽaֲdָmָ֖h lְmִynֵ֑hvּ vַyַּ֥rְa aֱlֹhִ֖yם kִּy־tֽvֹb׃

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים נַֽעֲשֶׂ֥ה אָדָ֛ם בְּצַלְמֵ֖נוּ כִּדְמוּתֵ֑נוּ וְיִרְדּוּ֩ בִדְגַ֨ת הַיָּ֜ם וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וּבַבְּהֵמָה֙ וּבְכׇל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּבְ��ׇל־הָרֶ֖מֶשׂ הָֽרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
1.englishText: And God said, “Let us make humankind in our image, after our likeness. They shall rule the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the cattle, the whole earth, and all the creeping things that creep on earth.”
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֔yם nַֽaֲshֶׂ֥h aָdָ֛ם bְּtsַlְmֵ֖nvּ kִּdְmvּtֵ֑nvּ vְyִrְdּvּ֩ bִdְgַ֨t hַyָּ֜ם vּbְa֣vֹף hַshָּׁmַ֗yִם vּbַbְּhֵmָh֙ vּbְkׇl־hָaָ֔rֶץ vּbְ��ׇl־hָrֶ֖mֶshׂ hָֽrֹmֵ֥shׂ aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

1.hebrewText: וַיִּבְרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים <small>׀</small> אֶת־הָֽאָדָם֙ בְּצַלְמ֔וֹ בְּצֶ֥לֶם אֱלֹהִ֖ים בָּרָ֣א אֹת֑וֹ זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה בָּרָ֥א אֹתָֽם׃
1.englishText:
And God created humankind in the divine image,
creating it in the image of God—
creating them male and female.
1.transliteration: vַyִּbְrָ֨a aֱlֹhִ֤yם <small>׀</small> aֶt־hָֽaָdָם֙ bְּtsַlְm֔vֹ bְּtsֶ֥lֶם aֱlֹhִ֖yם bָּrָ֣a aֹt֑vֹ zָkָ֥r vּnְkֵbָ֖h bָּrָ֥a aֹtָֽם׃

1.hebrewText: וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹתָם֮ אֱלֹהִים֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָהֶ֜ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֛וּ וּמִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ וּרְד֞וּ בִּדְגַ֤ת הַיָּם֙ וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּבְכׇל־חַיָּ֖ה הָֽרֹמֶ֥שֶׂת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
1.englishText: God blessed them and God said to them, “Be fertile and increase, fill the earth and master it; and rule the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, and all the living things that creep on earth.”
1.transliteration: vַyְbָ֣rֶךְ aֹtָם֮ aֱlֹhִyם֒ vַyֹּ֨amֶr lָhֶ֜ם aֱlֹhִ֗yם pְּr֥vּ vּrְb֛vּ vּmִlְa֥vּ aֶt־hָaָ֖rֶץ vְkִbְshֻׁ֑hָ vּrְd֞vּ bִּdְgַ֤t hַyָּם֙ vּbְa֣vֹף hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vּbְkׇl־chַyָּ֖h hָֽrֹmֶ֥shֶׂt aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים הִנֵּה֩ נָתַ֨תִּי לָכֶ֜ם אֶת־כׇּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב ׀ זֹרֵ֣עַ זֶ֗רַע אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָעֵ֛ץ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֥וֹ פְרִי־עֵ֖ץ זֹרֵ֣עַ זָ֑רַע לָכֶ֥ם יִֽהְיֶ֖ה לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
1.englishText: God said, “See, I give you every seed-bearing plant that is upon all the earth, and every tree that has seed-bearing fruit; they shall be yours for food.
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֗yם hִnֵּh֩ nָtַ֨tִּy lָkֶ֜ם aֶt־kׇּl־aֵ֣shֶׂb ׀ zֹrֵ֣aַ zֶ֗rַa aֲshֶׁr֙ aַl־pְּnֵ֣y kׇl־hָaָ֔rֶץ vְaֶt־kׇּl־hָaֵ֛ץ aֲshֶׁr־bּ֥vֹ pְrִy־aֵ֖ץ zֹrֵ֣aַ zָ֑rַa lָkֶ֥ם yִֽhְyֶ֖h lְaׇkְlָֽh׃

1.hebrewText: וּֽלְכׇל־חַיַּ֣ת הָ֠אָ֠רֶץ וּלְכׇל־ע֨וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ רוֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־בּוֹ֙ נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֔ה אֶת־כּ��ל־יֶ֥רֶק עֵ֖שֶׂב לְאׇכְלָ֑ה וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
1.englishText: And to all the animals on land, to all the birds of the sky, and to everything that creeps on earth, in which there is the breath of life, [I give] all the green plants for food.” And it was so.
1.transliteration: vּֽlְkׇl־chַyַּ֣t hָ֠aָ֠rֶץ vּlְkׇl־a֨vֹף hַshָּׁmַ֜yִם vּlְkֹ֣l ׀ rvֹmֵ֣shׂ aַl־hָaָ֗rֶץ aֲshֶׁr־bּvֹ֙ nֶ֣pֶshׁ chַyָּ֔h aֶt־kּ��l־yֶ֥rֶk aֵ֖shֶׂb lְaׇkְlָ֑h vַֽyְhִy־kֵֽן׃

1.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤רְא אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וְהִנֵּה־ט֖וֹב מְאֹ֑ד וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם הַשִּׁשִּֽׁי׃ {פ}
1.englishText: And God saw all that had been made, and found it very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.
1.transliteration: vַyַּ֤rְa aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶt־kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֣r aָshָׂ֔h vְhִnֵּh־t֖vֹb mְaֹ֑d vַֽyְhִy־aֶ֥rֶb vַֽyְhִy־bֹ֖kֶr y֥vֹם hַshִּׁshִּֽׁy׃ {p}

2.hebrewText: וַיְכֻלּ֛וּ הַשָּׁמַ֥יִם וְהָאָ֖רֶץ וְכׇל־צְבָאָֽם׃
2.englishText: The heaven and the earth were finished, and all their array.
2.transliteration: vַyְkֻlּ֛vּ hַshָּׁmַ֥yִם vְhָaָ֖rֶץ vְkׇl־tsְbָaָֽם׃

2.hebrewText: וַיְכַ֤ל אֱלֹהִים֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מְלַאכְתּ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה וַיִּשְׁבֹּת֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מִכׇּל־מְלַאכְתּ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
2.englishText: On the seventh day God finished the work that had been undertaken: [God] ceased*ceased Or “rested.” on the seventh day from doing any of the work.
2.transliteration: vַyְkַ֤l aֱlֹhִyם֙ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔y mְlַakְtּ֖vֹ aֲshֶׁ֣r aָshָׂ֑h vַyִּshְׁbֹּt֙ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔y mִkׇּl־mְlַakְtּ֖vֹ aֲshֶׁ֥r aָshָֽׂh׃

2.hebrewText: וַיְבָ֤רֶךְ אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־י֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י וַיְקַדֵּ֖שׁ אֹת֑וֹ כִּ֣י ב֤וֹ שָׁבַת֙ מִכׇּל־מְלַאכְתּ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁר־בָּרָ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ {פ}
2.englishText: And God blessed the seventh day and declared it holy—having ceased on it from all the work of creation that God had done.
2.transliteration: vַyְbָ֤rֶךְ aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶt־y֣vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔y vַyְkַdֵּ֖shׁ aֹt֑vֹ kִּ֣y b֤vֹ shָׁbַt֙ mִkׇּl־mְlַakְtּ֔vֹ aֲshֶׁr־bָּrָ֥a aֱlֹhִ֖yם lַaֲshֽׂvֹt׃ {p}

2.hebrewText: אֵ֣לֶּה תוֹלְד֧וֹת הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם וְהָאָ֖רֶץ בְּ<small>הִ</small>בָּֽרְאָ֑ם בְּי֗וֹם עֲשׂ֛וֹת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶ֥רֶץ וְשָׁמָֽיִם׃
2.englishText: Such is the story of heaven and earth when they were created. When God יהוה made earth and heaven—
2.transliteration: aֵ֣lֶּh tvֹlְd֧vֹt hַshָּׁmַ֛yִם vְhָaָ֖rֶץ bְּ<small>hִ</small>bָּֽrְaָ֑ם bְּy֗vֹם aֲshׂ֛vֹt yְhֹvָ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶ֥rֶץ vְshָׁmָֽyִם׃

2.hebrewText: וְכֹ֣ל ׀ שִׂ֣יחַ הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה טֶ֚רֶם יִֽהְיֶ֣ה בָאָ֔רֶץ וְכׇל־עֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה טֶ֣רֶם יִצְמָ֑ח כִּי֩ לֹ֨א הִמְטִ֜יר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאָדָ֣ם אַ֔יִן לַֽעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
2.englishText: when no shrub of the field*shrub of the field I.e., suitable for pasturage. was yet on earth and no grasses of the field*grasses of the field I.e., cereal grasses, suitable as crops. had yet sprouted, because God יהוה had not sent rain upon the earth and there were no human beings to till the soil,
2.transliteration: vְkֹ֣l ׀ shִׂ֣ychַ hַshָּׂdֶ֗h tֶ֚rֶם yִֽhְyֶ֣h bָaָ֔rֶץ vְkׇl־aֵ֥shֶׂb hַshָּׂdֶ֖h tֶ֣rֶם yִtsְmָ֑ch kִּy֩ lֹ֨a hִmְtִ֜yr yְhֹvָ֤h aֱlֹhִyם֙ aַl־hָaָ֔rֶץ vְaָdָ֣ם aַ֔yִן lַֽaֲbֹ֖d aֶt־hָֽaֲdָmָֽh׃

2.hebrewText: וְאֵ֖ד יַֽעֲלֶ֣ה מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהִשְׁקָ֖ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
2.englishText: but a flow would well up from the ground and water the whole surface of the earth—
2.transliteration: vְaֵ֖d yַֽaֲlֶ֣h mִן־hָaָ֑rֶץ vְhִshְׁkָ֖h aֶֽt־kׇּl־pְּnֵ֥y hָֽaֲdָmָֽh׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּ֩יצֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֗ם עָפָר֙ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה וַיִּפַּ֥ח בְּאַפָּ֖יו נִשְׁמַ֣ת חַיִּ֑ים וַיְהִ֥י הָֽאָדָ֖ם לְנֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּֽה׃
2.englishText: God יהוה formed the Human*the Human I.e., the progenitor of the species and the point of origin for human society. Heb. ha-’adam; trad. “man.” In the eyes of ancient Israel, the typical initiator of a lineage was male, and so the first human being would also have been imagined as male. See further the Dictionary under ’adam. from the soil’s humus,*soil’s humus Heb. ‘afar min ha-’adamah, rendered to emulate the wordplay with Heb. ha-’adam “the Human”; more precisely, “loose dirt from the soil.” NJPS “dust of the earth.” blowing into his nostrils the breath of life: the Human became a living being.
2.transliteration: vַyִּ֩ytsֶr֩ yְhֹvָ֨h aֱlֹhִ֜yם aֶt־hָֽaָdָ֗ם aָpָr֙ mִן־hָ֣aֲdָmָ֔h vַyִּpַּ֥ch bְּaַpָּ֖yv nִshְׁmַ֣t chַyִּ֑yם vַyְhִ֥y hָֽaָdָ֖ם lְnֶ֥pֶshׁ chַyָּֽh׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּטַּ֞ע יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים גַּן־בְּעֵ֖דֶן מִקֶּ֑דֶם וַיָּ֣שֶׂם שָׁ֔ם אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָצָֽר׃
2.englishText: God יהוה planted a garden in Eden, in the east, and placed there the Human who had been fashioned.
2.transliteration: vַyִּtַּ֞a yְhֹvָ֧h aֱlֹhִ֛yם gַּן־bְּaֵ֖dֶן mִkֶּ֑dֶם vַyָּ֣shֶׂם shָׁ֔ם aֶt־hָֽaָdָ֖ם aֲshֶׁ֥r yָtsָֽr׃

2.hebrewText: וַיַּצְמַ֞ח יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה כׇּל־עֵ֛ץ נֶחְמָ֥ד לְמַרְאֶ֖ה וְט֣וֹב לְמַאֲכָ֑ל וְעֵ֤ץ הַֽחַיִּים֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַגָּ֔ן וְעֵ֕ץ הַדַּ֖עַת ט֥וֹ�� וָרָֽע׃
2.englishText: And from the ground God יהוה caused to grow every tree that was pleasing to the sight and good for food, with the tree of life in the middle of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and bad.
2.transliteration: vַyַּtsְmַ֞ch yְhֹvָ֤h aֱlֹhִyם֙ mִן־hָ֣aֲdָmָ֔h kׇּl־aֵ֛ץ nֶchְmָ֥d lְmַrְaֶ֖h vְt֣vֹb lְmַaֲkָ֑l vְaֵ֤ץ hַֽchַyִּyם֙ bְּt֣vֹךְ hַgָּ֔ן vְaֵ֕ץ hַdַּ֖aַt t֥vֹ�� vָrָֽa׃

2.hebrewText: וְנָהָר֙ יֹצֵ֣א מֵעֵ֔דֶן לְהַשְׁק֖וֹת אֶת־הַגָּ֑ן וּמִשָּׁם֙ יִפָּרֵ֔ד וְהָיָ֖ה לְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה רָאשִֽׁים׃
2.englishText: A river issues from Eden to water the garden, and it then divides and becomes four branches.
2.transliteration: vְnָhָr֙ yֹtsֵ֣a mֵaֵ֔dֶן lְhַshְׁk֖vֹt aֶt־hַgָּ֑ן vּmִshָּׁם֙ yִpָּrֵ֔d vְhָyָ֖h lְaַrְbָּaָ֥h rָashִֽׁyם׃

2.hebrewText: שֵׁ֥ם הָֽאֶחָ֖ד פִּישׁ֑וֹן ה֣וּא הַסֹּבֵ֗ב אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽחֲוִילָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם הַזָּהָֽב׃
2.englishText: The name of the first is Pishon, the one that winds through the whole land of Havilah, where the gold is.
2.transliteration: shֵׁ֥ם hָֽaֶchָ֖d pִּyshׁ֑vֹן h֣vּa hַsֹּbֵ֗b aֵ֚t kׇּl־aֶ֣rֶץ hַֽchֲvִylָ֔h aֲshֶׁr־shָׁ֖ם hַzָּhָֽb׃

2.hebrewText: וּֽזְהַ֛ב הָאָ֥רֶץ הַהִ֖וא ט֑וֹב שָׁ֥ם הַבְּדֹ֖לַח וְאֶ֥בֶן הַשֹּֽׁהַם׃
2.englishText: (The gold of that land is good; bdellium is there, and lapis lazuli.*lapis lazuli Others “onyx”; meaning of Heb. shoham uncertain. )
2.transliteration: vּֽzְhַ֛b hָaָ֥rֶץ hַhִ֖va t֑vֹb shָׁ֥ם hַbְּdֹ֖lַch vְaֶ֥bֶן hַshֹּֽׁhַם׃

2.hebrewText: וְשֵֽׁם־הַנָּהָ֥ר הַשֵּׁנִ֖י גִּיח֑וֹן ה֣וּא הַסּוֹבֵ֔ב אֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ כּֽוּשׁ׃
2.englishText: The name of the second river is Gihon, the one that winds through the whole land of Cush.
2.transliteration: vְshֵֽׁם־hַnָּhָ֥r hַshֵּׁnִ֖y gִּych֑vֹן h֣vּa hַsּvֹbֵ֔b aֵ֖t kׇּl־aֶ֥rֶץ kּֽvּshׁ׃

2.hebrewText: וְשֵׁ֨ם הַנָּהָ֤ר הַשְּׁלִישִׁי֙ חִדֶּ֔קֶל ה֥וּא הַֽהֹלֵ֖ךְ קִדְמַ֣ת אַשּׁ֑וּר וְהַנָּהָ֥ר הָֽרְבִיעִ֖י ה֥וּא פְרָֽת׃
2.englishText: The name of the third river is Tigris, the one that flows east of Asshur. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
2.transliteration: vְshֵׁ֨ם hַnָּhָ֤r hַshְּׁlִyshִׁy֙ chִdֶּ֔kֶl h֥vּa hַֽhֹlֵ֖ךְ kִdְmַ֣t aַshּׁ֑vּr vְhַnָּhָ֥r hָֽrְbִyaִ֖y h֥vּa pְrָֽt׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֛ח יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּנִּחֵ֣הוּ בְגַן־עֵ֔דֶן לְעׇבְדָ֖הּ וּלְשׇׁמְרָֽהּ׃
2.englishText: God יהוה settled the Human in the garden of Eden, to till it and tend it.
2.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֛ch yְhֹvָ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־hָֽaָdָ֑ם vַyַּnִּchֵ֣hvּ bְgַן־aֵ֔dֶן lְaׇbְdָ֖hּ vּlְshׇׁmְrָֽhּ׃

2.hebrewText: וַיְצַו֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים עַל־הָֽאָדָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר מִכֹּ֥ל עֵֽץ־הַגָּ֖ן אָכֹ֥ל תֹּאכֵֽל׃
2.englishText: And God יהוה commanded the Human, saying, “Of every tree of the garden you are free to eat;
2.transliteration: vַyְtsַv֙ yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhִ֔yם aַl־hָֽaָdָ֖ם lֵamֹ֑r mִkֹּ֥l aֵֽץ־hַgָּ֖ן aָkֹ֥l tֹּakֵֽl׃

2.hebrewText: וּמֵעֵ֗ץ הַדַּ֙עַת֙ ט֣וֹב וָרָ֔ע לֹ֥א תֹאכַ֖ל מִמֶּ֑נּוּ כִּ֗י בְּי֛וֹם אֲכׇלְךָ֥ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ מ֥וֹת תָּמֽוּת׃
2.englishText: but as for the tree of knowledge of good and bad, you must not eat of it; for as soon as you eat of it, you shall die.”
2.transliteration: vּmֵaֵ֗ץ hַdַּ֙aַt֙ t֣vֹb vָrָ֔a lֹ֥a tֹakַ֖l mִmֶּ֑nּvּ kִּ֗y bְּy֛vֹם aֲkׇlְךָ֥ mִmֶּ֖nּvּ m֥vֹt tָּmֽvּt׃

2.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים לֹא־ט֛וֹב הֱי֥וֹת הָֽאָדָ֖ם לְבַדּ֑וֹ אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לּ֥וֹ עֵ֖זֶר כְּנֶגְדּֽוֹ׃
2.englishText: God יהוה said, “It is not good for the Human to be alone; I will make a fitting counterpart for him.”
2.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhִ֔yם lֹa־t֛vֹb hֱy֥vֹt hָֽaָdָ֖ם lְbַdּ֑vֹ aֶֽaֱshֶׂh־lּ֥vֹ aֵ֖zֶr kְּnֶgְdּֽvֹ׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּ֩צֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים מִן־הָֽאֲדָמָ֗ה כׇּל־חַיַּ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיָּבֵא֙ אֶל־הָ֣אָדָ֔ם לִרְא֖וֹת מַה־יִּקְרָא־ל֑וֹ וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִקְרָא־ל֧וֹ הָֽאָדָ֛ם נֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּ֖ה ה֥וּא שְׁמֽוֹ׃
2.englishText: And God יהוה formed out of the earth all the wild beasts and all the birds of the sky, and brought them to the Human to see what he would call them; and whatever the Human called each living creature, that would be its name.
2.transliteration: vַyִּ֩tsֶr֩ yְhֹvָ֨h aֱlֹhִ֜yם mִן־hָֽaֲdָmָ֗h kׇּl־chַyַּ֤t hַshָּׂdֶh֙ vְaֵt֙ kׇּl־a֣vֹף hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vַyָּbֵa֙ aֶl־hָ֣aָdָ֔ם lִrְa֖vֹt mַh־yִּkְrָa־l֑vֹ vְkֹl֩ aֲshֶׁ֨r yִkְrָa־l֧vֹ hָֽaָdָ֛ם nֶ֥pֶshׁ chַyָּ֖h h֥vּa shְׁmֽvֹ׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֨א הָֽאָדָ֜ם שֵׁמ֗וֹת לְכׇל־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ וּלְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּלְכֹ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּלְאָדָ֕ם לֹֽא־מָצָ֥א עֵ֖זֶר כְּנֶגְדּֽוֹ׃
2.englishText: And the Human gave names to all the cattle and to the birds of the sky and to all the wild beasts; but no fitting counterpart for a human being was found.
2.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֨a hָֽaָdָ֜ם shֵׁm֗vֹt lְkׇl־hַbְּhֵmָh֙ vּlְa֣vֹף hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vּlְkֹ֖l chַyַּ֣t hַshָּׂdֶ֑h vּlְaָdָ֕ם lֹֽa־mָtsָ֥a aֵ֖zֶr kְּnֶgְdּֽvֹ׃

2.hebrewText: וַיַּפֵּל֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> תַּרְדֵּמָ֛ה עַל־הָאָדָ֖ם וַיִּישָׁ֑ן וַיִּקַּ֗ח אַחַת֙ מִצַּלְעֹתָ֔יו וַיִּסְגֹּ֥ר בָּשָׂ֖ר תַּחְתֶּֽנָּה׃
2.englishText: So God יהוה cast a deep sleep upon the Human; and, while he slept, [God] took one of his sides*sides Heb. ṣela‘ot, trad. “ribs.” Cf. 1 Kings 6.34; Exod. 25.12; 26.20, 26–27, 35; 30.4. and closed up the flesh at that site.
2.transliteration: vַyַּpֵּl֩ yְhֹvָ֨h aֱlֹhִ֧yם <small>׀</small> tַּrְdֵּmָ֛h aַl־hָaָdָ֖ם vַyִּyshָׁ֑ן vַyִּkַּ֗ch aַchַt֙ mִtsַּlְaֹtָ֔yv vַyִּsְgֹּ֥r bָּshָׂ֖r tַּchְtֶּֽnָּh׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּ֩בֶן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> אֶֽת־הַצֵּלָ֛ע אֲשֶׁר־לָקַ֥ח מִן־הָֽאָדָ֖ם לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיְבִאֶ֖הָ אֶל־הָֽאָדָֽם׃
2.englishText: And God יהוה fashioned the side that had been taken from the Human into a woman, bringing her to the Human.
2.transliteration: vַyִּ֩bֶן֩ yְhֹvָ֨h aֱlֹhִ֧yם <small>׀</small> aֶֽt־hַtsֵּlָ֛a aֲshֶׁr־lָkַ֥ch mִן־hָֽaָdָ֖ם lְaִshָּׁ֑h vַyְbִaֶ֖hָ aֶl־hָֽaָdָֽם׃

2.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ הָֽאָדָם֒ זֹ֣את הַפַּ֗עַם עֶ֚צֶם מֵֽעֲצָמַ֔י וּבָשָׂ֖ר מִבְּשָׂרִ֑י לְזֹאת֙ יִקָּרֵ֣א אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּ֥י מֵאִ֖ישׁ לֻֽקְחָה־זֹּֽאת׃
2.englishText:
Then the Human said,
“This one at last
Is bone of my bones
And flesh of my flesh.
This one shall be called Woman,*Woman Heb. ’ishshah; so trad. More precisely in context, “a (female) member of the human species.” See next note and the Dictionary under ’ish.
For from a Human*a Human More precisely, “the (formerly lone) member of the human species.” NJPS “man”; trad. “Man.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. was she taken.”
2.transliteration: vַyֹּ֘amֶr֮ hָֽaָdָם֒ zֹ֣at hַpַּ֗aַם aֶ֚tsֶם mֵֽaֲtsָmַ֔y vּbָshָׂ֖r mִbְּshָׂrִ֑y lְzֹat֙ yִkָּrֵ֣a aִshָּׁ֔h kִּ֥y mֵaִ֖yshׁ lֻֽkְchָh־zֹּֽat׃

2.hebrewText: עַל־כֵּן֙ יַֽעֲזׇב־אִ֔ישׁ אֶת־אָבִ֖יו וְאֶת־אִמּ֑וֹ וְדָבַ֣ק בְּאִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וְהָי֖וּ לְבָשָׂ֥ר אֶחָֽד׃
2.englishText: Hence a man*man So trad.; Heb. ’ish. Contrast the previous verse. leaves his father and mother and clings to his wife,*wife So trad.; Heb. ’ishshah (with possessive suffix). Cf. the previous note and contrast the previous verse. so that they become one flesh.
2.transliteration: aַl־kֵּן֙ yַֽaֲzׇb־aִ֔yshׁ aֶt־aָbִ֖yv vְaֶt־aִmּ֑vֹ vְdָbַ֣k bְּaִshְׁtּ֔vֹ vְhָy֖vּ lְbָshָׂ֥r aֶchָֽd׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּֽהְי֤וּ שְׁנֵיהֶם֙ עֲרוּמִּ֔ים הָֽאָדָ֖ם וְאִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֖א יִתְבֹּשָֽׁשׁוּ׃
2.englishText: The two of them were naked,*naked Heb. ‘arummim, play on ‘arum “shrewd” in 3.1. the Human*the Human Heb. ha-’adam; trad. “the man.” See note at v. 7. and his wife, yet they felt no shame.
2.transliteration: vַyִּֽhְy֤vּ shְׁnֵyhֶם֙ aֲrvּmִּ֔yם hָֽaָdָ֖ם vְaִshְׁtּ֑vֹ vְlֹ֖a yִtְbֹּshָֽׁshׁvּ׃

3.hebrewText: וְהַנָּחָשׁ֙ הָיָ֣ה עָר֔וּם מִכֹּל֙ חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה אַ֚ף כִּֽי־אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֔ים לֹ֣א תֹֽאכְל֔וּ מִכֹּ֖ל עֵ֥ץ הַגָּֽן׃
3.englishText: Now the serpent was the shrewdest of all the wild beasts that God יהוה had made. It said to the woman, “Did God really say: You shall not eat of any tree of the garden?”
3.transliteration: vְhַnָּchָshׁ֙ hָyָ֣h aָr֔vּם mִkֹּl֙ chַyַּ֣t hַshָּׂdֶ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r aָshָׂ֖h yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhִ֑yם vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֶl־hָ֣aִshָּׁ֔h aַ֚ף kִּֽy־aָmַ֣r aֱlֹhִ֔yם lֹ֣a tֹֽakְl֔vּ mִkֹּ֖l aֵ֥ץ hַgָּֽן׃

3.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֥אמֶר הָֽאִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־הַנָּחָ֑שׁ מִפְּרִ֥י עֵֽץ־הַגָּ֖ן נֹאכֵֽל׃
3.englishText: The woman replied to the serpent, “We may eat of the fruit of the other trees of the garden.
3.transliteration: vַtֹּ֥amֶr hָֽaִshָּׁ֖h aֶl־hַnָּchָ֑shׁ mִpְּrִ֥y aֵֽץ־hַgָּ֖ן nֹakֵֽl׃

3.hebrewText: וּמִפְּרִ֣י הָעֵץ֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּתוֹךְ־הַגָּן֒ אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים לֹ֤א תֹֽאכְלוּ֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְלֹ֥א תִגְּע֖וּ בּ֑וֹ פֶּן־תְּמֻתֽוּן׃
3.englishText: It is only about fruit of the tree in the middle of the garden that God said: ‘You shall not eat of it or touch it, lest you die.’”
3.transliteration: vּmִpְּrִ֣y hָaֵץ֮ aֲshֶׁ֣r bְּtvֹךְ־hַgָּן֒ aָmַ֣r aֱlֹhִ֗yם lֹ֤a tֹֽakְlvּ֙ mִmֶּ֔nּvּ vְlֹ֥a tִgְּa֖vּ bּ֑vֹ pֶּן־tְּmֻtֽvּן׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַנָּחָ֖שׁ אֶל־הָֽאִשָּׁ֑ה לֹֽא־מ֖וֹת תְּמֻתֽוּן׃
3.englishText: And the serpent said to the woman, “You are not going to die,
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr hַnָּchָ֖shׁ aֶl־hָֽaִshָּׁ֑h lֹֽa־m֖vֹt tְּmֻtֽvּן׃

3.hebrewText: כִּ֚י יֹדֵ֣עַ אֱלֹהִ֔ים כִּ֗י בְּיוֹם֙ אֲכׇלְכֶ֣ם מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְנִפְקְח֖וּ עֵֽינֵיכֶ֑ם וִהְיִיתֶם֙ כֵּֽאלֹהִ֔ים יֹדְעֵ֖י ט֥וֹב וָרָֽע׃
3.englishText: but God knows that as soon as you eat of it your eyes will be opened and you will be like divine beings who know*divine beings who know Others “God, who knows.” good and bad.”
3.transliteration: kִּ֚y yֹdֵ֣aַ aֱlֹhִ֔yם kִּ֗y bְּyvֹם֙ aֲkׇlְkֶ֣ם mִmֶּ֔nּvּ vְnִpְkְch֖vּ aֵֽynֵykֶ֑ם vִhְyִytֶם֙ kֵּֽalֹhִ֔yם yֹdְaֵ֖y t֥vֹb vָrָֽa׃

3.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֣רֶא הָֽאִשָּׁ֡ה כִּ֣י טוֹב֩ הָעֵ֨ץ לְמַאֲכָ֜ל וְכִ֧י תַֽאֲוָה־ה֣וּא לָעֵינַ֗יִם וְנֶחְמָ֤ד הָעֵץ֙ לְהַשְׂכִּ֔יל וַתִּקַּ֥ח מִפִּרְי֖וֹ וַתֹּאכַ֑ל וַתִּתֵּ֧ן גַּם־לְאִישָׁ֛הּ עִמָּ֖הּ וַיֹּאכַֽל׃
3.englishText: When the woman saw that the tree was good for eating and a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was desirable as a source of wisdom, she took of its fruit and ate. She also gave some to her husband, and he ate.
3.transliteration: vַtֵּ֣rֶa hָֽaִshָּׁ֡h kִּ֣y tvֹb֩ hָaֵ֨ץ lְmַaֲkָ֜l vְkִ֧y tַֽaֲvָh־h֣vּa lָaֵynַ֗yִם vְnֶchְmָ֤d hָaֵץ֙ lְhַshְׂkִּ֔yl vַtִּkַּ֥ch mִpִּrְy֖vֹ vַtֹּakַ֑l vַtִּtֵּ֧ן gַּם־lְaִyshָׁ֛hּ aִmָּ֖hּ vַyֹּakַֽl׃

3.hebrewText: וַתִּפָּקַ֙חְנָה֙ עֵינֵ֣י שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֵּ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֥י עֵֽירֻמִּ֖ם הֵ֑ם וַֽיִּתְפְּרוּ֙ עֲלֵ֣ה תְאֵנָ֔ה וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם חֲגֹרֹֽת׃
3.englishText: Then the eyes of both of them were opened and they perceived that they were naked; and they sewed together fig leaves and made themselves loincloths.
3.transliteration: vַtִּpָּkַ֙chְnָh֙ aֵynֵ֣y shְׁnֵyhֶ֔ם vַyֵּ֣dְa֔vּ kִּ֥y aֵֽyrֻmִּ֖ם hֵ֑ם vַֽyִּtְpְּrvּ֙ aֲlֵ֣h tְaֵnָ֔h vַyַּaֲshׂ֥vּ lָhֶ֖ם chֲgֹrֹֽt׃

3.hebrewText: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֞וּ אֶת־ק֨וֹל יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים מִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בַּגָּ֖ן לְר֣וּחַ הַיּ֑וֹם וַיִּתְחַבֵּ֨א הָֽאָדָ֜ם וְאִשְׁתּ֗וֹ מִפְּנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים בְּת֖וֹךְ עֵ֥ץ הַגָּֽן׃
3.englishText: They heard the sound of God יהוה moving about in the garden at the breezy time of day; and the Human and his wife hid from God יהוה among the trees of the garden.
3.transliteration: vַֽyִּshְׁmְa֞vּ aֶt־k֨vֹl yְhֹvָ֧h aֱlֹhִ֛yם mִtְhַlֵּ֥ךְ bַּgָּ֖ן lְr֣vּchַ hַyּ֑vֹם vַyִּtְchַbֵּ֨a hָֽaָdָ֜ם vְaִshְׁtּ֗vֹ mִpְּnֵy֙ yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhִ֔yם bְּt֖vֹךְ aֵ֥ץ hַgָּֽן׃

3.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֛א יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ אַיֶּֽכָּה׃
3.englishText: God יהוה called out to the Human and said to him, “Where are you?”
3.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֛a yְhֹvָ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶl־hָֽaָdָ֑ם vַyֹּ֥amֶr l֖vֹ aַyֶּֽkָּh׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֶת־קֹלְךָ֥ שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי בַּגָּ֑ן וָאִירָ֛א כִּֽי־עֵירֹ֥ם אָנֹ֖כִי וָאֵחָבֵֽא׃
3.englishText: He replied, “I heard the sound of You in the garden, and I was afraid because I was naked, so I hid.”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr aֶt־kֹlְךָ֥ shָׁmַ֖aְtִּy bַּgָּ֑ן vָaִyrָ֛a kִּֽy־aֵyrֹ֥ם aָnֹ֖kִy vָaֵchָbֵֽa׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֚י הִגִּ֣יד לְךָ֔ כִּ֥י עֵירֹ֖ם אָ֑תָּה הֲמִן־הָעֵ֗ץ אֲשֶׁ֧ר צִוִּיתִ֛יךָ לְבִלְתִּ֥י אֲכׇל־מִמֶּ֖נּוּ אָכָֽלְתָּ׃
3.englishText: “Who told you that you were naked? Did you eat of the tree from which I had forbidden you to eat?”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr mִ֚y hִgִּ֣yd lְךָ֔ kִּ֥y aֵyrֹ֖ם aָ֑tָּh hֲmִן־hָaֵ֗ץ aֲshֶׁ֧r tsִvִּytִ֛yךָ lְbִlְtִּ֥y aֲkׇl־mִmֶּ֖nּvּ aָkָֽlְtָּ׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הָֽאָדָ֑ם הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תָּה עִמָּדִ֔י הִ֛וא נָֽתְנָה־לִּ֥י מִן־הָעֵ֖ץ וָאֹכֵֽל׃
3.englishText: The Human said, “The woman You put at my side—she gave me of the tree, and I ate.”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr hָֽaָdָ֑ם hָֽaִshָּׁh֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r nָtַ֣tָּh aִmָּdִ֔y hִ֛va nָֽtְnָh־lִּ֥y mִן־hָaֵ֖ץ vָaֹkֵֽl׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים לָאִשָּׁ֖ה מַה־זֹּ֣את עָשִׂ֑ית וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה הַנָּחָ֥שׁ הִשִּׁיאַ֖נִי וָאֹכֵֽל׃
3.englishText: And God יהוה said to the woman, “What is this you have done!” The woman replied, “The serpent duped me, and I ate.”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֧h aֱlֹhִ֛yם lָaִshָּׁ֖h mַh־zֹּ֣at aָshִׂ֑yt vַtֹּ֙amֶr֙ hָֽaִshָּׁ֔h hַnָּchָ֥shׁ hִshִּׁyaַ֖nִy vָaֹkֵֽl׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֶֽל־הַנָּחָשׁ֮ כִּ֣י עָשִׂ֣יתָ זֹּאת֒ אָר֤וּר אַתָּה֙ מִכׇּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה וּמִכֹּ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה עַל־גְּחֹנְךָ֣ תֵלֵ֔ךְ וְעָפָ֥ר תֹּאכַ֖ל כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
3.englishText:
Then God יהוה said to the serpent,
“Because you did this,
More cursed shall you be
Than all cattle
And all the wild beasts:
On your belly shall you crawl
And dirt shall you eat
All the days of your life.
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֩amֶr֩ yְhֹvָ֨h aֱlֹhִ֥yם <small>׀</small> aֶֽl־hַnָּchָshׁ֮ kִּ֣y aָshִׂ֣ytָ zֹּat֒ aָr֤vּr aַtָּh֙ mִkׇּl־hַbְּhֵmָ֔h vּmִkֹּ֖l chַyַּ֣t hַshָּׂdֶ֑h aַl־gְּchֹnְךָ֣ tֵlֵ֔ךְ vְaָpָ֥r tֹּakַ֖l kׇּl־yְmֵ֥y chַyֶּֽyךָ׃

3.hebrewText: וְאֵיבָ֣ה ׀ אָשִׁ֗ית בֵּֽינְךָ֙ וּבֵ֣ין הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וּבֵ֥ין זַרְעֲךָ֖ וּבֵ֣ין זַרְעָ֑הּ ה֚וּא יְשׁוּפְךָ֣ רֹ֔אשׁ וְאַתָּ֖ה תְּשׁוּפֶ֥נּוּ עָקֵֽב׃ {ס}
3.englishText:
I will put enmity
Between you and the woman,
And between your offspring and hers;
They shall strike at your head,
And you shall strike at their heel.”
3.transliteration: vְaֵybָ֣h ׀ aָshִׁ֗yt bֵּֽynְךָ֙ vּbֵ֣yן hָֽaִshָּׁ֔h vּbֵ֥yן zַrְaֲךָ֖ vּbֵ֣yן zַrְaָ֑hּ h֚vּa yְshׁvּpְךָ֣ rֹ֔ashׁ vְaַtָּ֖h tְּshׁvּpֶ֥nּvּ aָkֵֽb׃ {s}

3.hebrewText: אֶֽל־הָאִשָּׁ֣ה אָמַ֗ר הַרְבָּ֤ה אַרְבֶּה֙ עִצְּבוֹנֵ֣ךְ וְהֵֽרֹנֵ֔ךְ בְּעֶ֖צֶב תֵּֽלְדִ֣י בָנִ֑ים וְאֶל־אִישֵׁךְ֙ תְּשׁ֣וּקָתֵ֔ךְ וְה֖וּא יִמְשׇׁל־בָּֽךְ׃ {ס}
3.englishText:
And to the woman [God] said,
“I will greatly expand
Your hard labor—and your pregnancies;
In hardship shall you bear children.
Yet your urge shall be for your husband,
And he shall rule over you.”*rule over you (So NJPS.) I.e., for matters of sexual relations he will have the last word.
3.transliteration: aֶֽl־hָaִshָּׁ֣h aָmַ֗r hַrְbָּ֤h aַrְbֶּh֙ aִtsְּbvֹnֵ֣ךְ vְhֵֽrֹnֵ֔ךְ bְּaֶ֖tsֶb tֵּֽlְdִ֣y bָnִ֑yם vְaֶl־aִyshֵׁךְ֙ tְּshׁ֣vּkָtֵ֔ךְ vְh֖vּa yִmְshׇׁl־bָּֽךְ׃ {s}

3.hebrewText: וּלְאָדָ֣ם אָמַ֗ר כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֘עְתָּ֮ לְק֣וֹל אִשְׁתֶּ֒ךָ֒ וַתֹּ֙אכַל֙ מִן־הָעֵ֔ץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר צִוִּיתִ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א תֹאכַ֖ל מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֲרוּרָ֤ה הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ בַּֽעֲבוּרֶ֔ךָ בְּעִצָּבוֹן֙ תֹּֽאכְלֶ֔נָּה כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
3.englishText:
To Adam [God] said, “Because you did as your wife said and ate of the tree about which I commanded you, ‘You shall not eat of it,’
Cursed be the ground because of you;
By hard labor shall you eat of it
All the days of your life:
3.transliteration: vּlְaָdָ֣ם aָmַ֗r kִּֽy־shָׁmַ֘aְtָּ֮ lְk֣vֹl aִshְׁtֶּ֒ךָ֒ vַtֹּ֙akַl֙ mִן־hָaֵ֔ץ aֲshֶׁ֤r tsִvִּytִ֙yךָ֙ lֵamֹ֔r lֹ֥a tֹakַ֖l mִmֶּ֑nּvּ aֲrvּrָ֤h hָֽaֲdָmָh֙ bַּֽaֲbvּrֶ֔ךָ bְּaִtsָּbvֹן֙ tֹּֽakְlֶ֔nָּh kֹּ֖l yְmֵ֥y chַyֶּֽyךָ׃

3.hebrewText: וְק֥וֹץ וְדַרְדַּ֖ר תַּצְמִ֣יחַֽ לָ֑ךְ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ אֶת־עֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
3.englishText:
Thorns and thistles shall it sprout for you.
But your food shall be the grasses of the field;
3.transliteration: vְk֥vֹץ vְdַrְdַּ֖r tַּtsְmִ֣ychַֽ lָ֑ךְ vְaָkַlְtָּ֖ aֶt־aֵ֥shֶׂb hַshָּׂdֶֽh׃

3.hebrewText: בְּזֵעַ֤ת אַפֶּ֙יךָ֙ תֹּ֣אכַל לֶ֔חֶם עַ֤ד שֽׁוּבְךָ֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה כִּ֥י מִמֶּ֖נָּה לֻקָּ֑חְתָּ כִּֽי־עָפָ֣ר אַ֔תָּה וְאֶל־עָפָ֖ר תָּשֽׁוּב׃
3.englishText:
By the sweat of your brow
Shall you get bread to eat,
Until you return to the ground—
For from it you were taken.
For dust*dust Heb. ‘afar. Cf. the second note at 2.7. you are,
And to dust you shall return.”
3.transliteration: bְּzֵaַ֤t aַpֶּ֙yךָ֙ tֹּ֣akַl lֶ֔chֶם aַ֤d shֽׁvּbְךָ֙ aֶl־hָ֣aֲdָmָ֔h kִּ֥y mִmֶּ֖nָּh lֻkָּ֑chְtָּ kִּֽy־aָpָ֣r aַ֔tָּh vְaֶl־aָpָ֖r tָּshֽׁvּb׃

3.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֧א הָֽאָדָ֛ם שֵׁ֥ם אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ חַוָּ֑ה כִּ֛י הִ֥וא הָֽיְתָ֖ה אֵ֥ם כׇּל־חָֽי׃
3.englishText: The Human named his wife Eve,*Eve Heb. ḥawwaḥ. because she was the mother of all the living.*living Heb. ḥai.
3.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֧a hָֽaָdָ֛ם shֵׁ֥ם aִshְׁtּ֖vֹ chַvָּ֑h kִּ֛y hִ֥va hָֽyְtָ֖h aֵ֥ם kׇּl־chָֽy׃

3.hebrewText: וַיַּ֩עַשׂ֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים לְאָדָ֧ם וּלְאִשְׁתּ֛וֹ כׇּתְנ֥וֹת ע֖וֹר וַיַּלְבִּשֵֽׁם׃ {פ}
3.englishText: And God יהוה made garments of skins for Adam and his wife, and clothed them.
3.transliteration: vַyַּ֩aַshׂ֩ yְhֹvָ֨h aֱlֹhִ֜yם lְaָdָ֧ם vּlְaִshְׁtּ֛vֹ kׇּtְn֥vֹt a֖vֹr vַyַּlְbִּshֵֽׁם׃ {p}

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֗ים הֵ֤ן הָֽאָדָם֙ הָיָה֙ כְּאַחַ֣ד מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לָדַ֖עַת ט֣וֹב וָרָ֑ע וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ פֶּן־יִשְׁלַ֣ח יָד֗וֹ וְלָקַח֙ גַּ֚ם מֵעֵ֣ץ הַֽחַיִּ֔ים וְאָכַ֖ל וָחַ֥י לְעֹלָֽם׃
3.englishText: And God יהוה said, “Now that humankind has become like any of us, knowing good and bad, what if one should stretch out a hand and take also from the tree of life and eat, and live forever!”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr ׀ yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhִ֗yם hֵ֤ן hָֽaָdָם֙ hָyָh֙ kְּaַchַ֣d mִmֶּ֔nּvּ lָdַ֖aַt t֣vֹb vָrָ֑a vְaַtָּ֣h ׀ pֶּן־yִshְׁlַ֣ch yָd֗vֹ vְlָkַch֙ gַּ֚ם mֵaֵ֣ץ hַֽchַyִּ֔yם vְaָkַ֖l vָchַ֥y lְaֹlָֽם׃

3.hebrewText: וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֛הוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים מִגַּן־עֵ֑דֶן לַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֻקַּ֖ח מִשָּֽׁם׃
3.englishText: So God יהוה banished humankind*humankind Moved up from v. 24 for clarity. from the garden of Eden, to till the humus*humus Lit. “soil.” See the second note at 2.7. from which it was taken:
3.transliteration: vַֽyְshַׁlְּchֵ֛hvּ yְhֹvָ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם mִgַּן־aֵ֑dֶן lַֽaֲbֹd֙ aֶt־hָ֣aֲdָmָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r lֻkַּ֖ch mִshָּֽׁם׃

3.hebrewText: וַיְגָ֖רֶשׁ אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּשְׁכֵּן֩ מִקֶּ֨דֶם לְגַן־עֵ֜דֶן אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֗ים וְאֵ֨ת לַ֤הַט הַחֶ֙רֶב֙ הַמִּתְהַפֶּ֔כֶת לִשְׁמֹ֕ר אֶת־דֶּ֖רֶךְ עֵ֥ץ הַֽחַיִּֽים׃ {ס}
3.englishText: it was driven out; and east of the garden of Eden were stationed the cherubim and the fiery ever-turning sword, to guard the way to the tree of life.
3.transliteration: vַyְgָ֖rֶshׁ aֶt־hָֽaָdָ֑ם vַyַּshְׁkֵּן֩ mִkֶּ֨dֶם lְgַן־aֵ֜dֶן aֶt־hַkְּrֻbִ֗yם vְaֵ֨t lַ֤hַt hַchֶ֙rֶb֙ hַmִּtְhַpֶּ֔kֶt lִshְׁmֹ֕r aֶt־dֶּ֖rֶךְ aֵ֥ץ hַֽchַyִּֽyם׃ {s}

4.hebrewText: וְהָ֣אָדָ֔ם יָדַ֖ע אֶת־חַוָּ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וַתַּ֙הַר֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶד אֶת־קַ֔יִן וַתֹּ֕אמֶר קָנִ֥יתִי אִ֖ישׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
4.englishText: Now the Human knew*knew Heb. yada‘, often in a sexual sense. his wife Eve, and she conceived and bore Cain, saying, “I have gained*gained Echoing the Heb. wordplay: qanithi, connected with “Cain”; lit. “created, acquired.” a person*a person Or “someone new.” Lit. “a participant whose involvement defines the depicted situation.” Unlike “man” in contemporary English, Heb. ’ish can include infants in its denotative scope, as here and in Isa. 66.13. NJPS “male child”; trad. “man.” Cf. note at Num. 30.4 and see the Dictionary under ’ish. with the help of*with the help of Or “as did”; precise force of Heb. ’et uncertain. יהוה.”
4.transliteration: vְhָ֣aָdָ֔ם yָdַ֖a aֶt־chַvָּ֣h aִshְׁtּ֑vֹ vַtַּ֙hַr֙ vַtֵּ֣lֶd aֶt־kַ֔yִן vַtֹּ֕amֶr kָnִ֥ytִy aִ֖yshׁ aֶt־yְhֹvָֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣סֶף לָלֶ֔דֶת אֶת־אָחִ֖יו אֶת־הָ֑בֶל וַֽיְהִי־הֶ֙בֶל֙ רֹ֣עֵה צֹ֔אן וְקַ֕יִן הָיָ֖ה עֹבֵ֥ד אֲדָמָֽה׃
4.englishText: She then bore his brother Abel. Abel became a keeper of sheep, and Cain became a tiller of the soil.
4.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣sֶף lָlֶ֔dֶt aֶt־aָchִ֖yv aֶt־hָ֑bֶl vַֽyְhִy־hֶ֙bֶl֙ rֹ֣aֵh tsֹ֔aן vְkַ֕yִן hָyָ֖h aֹbֵ֥d aֲdָmָֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִ֖י מִקֵּ֣ץ יָמִ֑ים וַיָּבֵ֨א קַ֜יִן מִפְּרִ֧י הָֽאֲדָמָ֛ה מִנְחָ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
4.englishText: In the course of time, Cain brought an offering to יהוה from the fruit of the soil;
4.transliteration: vַֽyְhִ֖y mִkֵּ֣ץ yָmִ֑yם vַyָּbֵ֨a kַ֜yִן mִpְּrִ֧y hָֽaֲdָmָ֛h mִnְchָ֖h lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וְהֶ֨בֶל הֵבִ֥יא גַם־ה֛וּא מִבְּכֹר֥וֹת צֹאנ֖וֹ וּמֵֽחֶלְבֵהֶ֑ן וַיִּ֣שַׁע יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־הֶ֖בֶל וְאֶל־מִנְחָתֽוֹ׃
4.englishText: and Abel, for his part, brought the choicest of the firstlings of his flock. יהוה paid heed to Abel and his offering,
4.transliteration: vְhֶ֨bֶl hֵbִ֥ya gַם־h֛vּa mִbְּkֹr֥vֹt tsֹan֖vֹ vּmֵֽchֶlְbֵhֶ֑ן vַyִּ֣shַׁa yְhֹvָ֔h aֶl־hֶ֖bֶl vְaֶl־mִnְchָtֽvֹ׃

4.hebrewText: וְאֶל־קַ֥יִן וְאֶל־מִנְחָת֖וֹ לֹ֣א שָׁעָ֑ה וַיִּ֤חַר לְקַ֙יִן֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ פָּנָֽיו׃
4.englishText: but to Cain and his offering [God] paid no heed. Cain was much distressed and his face fell.
4.transliteration: vְaֶl־kַ֥yִן vְaֶl־mִnְchָt֖vֹ lֹ֣a shָׁaָ֑h vַyִּ֤chַr lְkַ֙yִן֙ mְaֹ֔d vַֽyִּpְּl֖vּ pָּnָֽyv׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־קָ֑יִן לָ֚מָּה חָ֣רָה לָ֔ךְ וְלָ֖מָּה נָפְל֥וּ פָנֶֽיךָ׃
4.englishText:
And יהוה said to Cain,
“Why are you distressed,
And why is your face fallen?
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־kָ֑yִן lָ֚mָּh chָ֣rָh lָ֔ךְ vְlָ֖mָּh nָpְl֥vּ pָnֶֽyךָ׃

4.hebrewText: הֲל֤וֹא אִם־תֵּיטִיב֙ שְׂאֵ֔ת וְאִם֙ לֹ֣א תֵיטִ֔יב לַפֶּ֖תַח חַטָּ֣את רֹבֵ֑ץ וְאֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ תְּשׁ֣וּקָת֔וֹ וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּמְשׇׁל־בּֽוֹ׃
4.englishText:
*Meaning of verse uncertain. Surely, if you do right,
There is uplift.
But if you do not do right
Sin couches at the door;
Its urge is toward you,
Yet you can be its master.”
4.transliteration: hֲl֤vֹa aִם־tֵּytִyb֙ shְׂaֵ֔t vְaִם֙ lֹ֣a tֵytִ֔yb lַpֶּ֖tַch chַtָּ֣at rֹbֵ֑ץ vְaֵlֶ֙yךָ֙ tְּshׁ֣vּkָt֔vֹ vְaַtָּ֖h tִּmְshׇׁl־bּֽvֹ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר קַ֖יִן אֶל־הֶ֣בֶל אָחִ֑יו וַֽיְהִי֙ בִּהְיוֹתָ֣ם בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה וַיָּ֥קׇם קַ֛יִן אֶל־הֶ֥בֶל אָחִ֖יו וַיַּהַרְגֵֽהוּ׃
4.englishText: Cain said to his brother Abel …*… Ancient versions, including the Targum, read “Come, let us go out into the field.” and when they were in the field, Cain set upon his brother Abel and killed him.
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr kַ֖yִן aֶl־hֶ֣bֶl aָchִ֑yv vַֽyְhִy֙ bִּhְyvֹtָ֣ם bַּshָּׂdֶ֔h vַyָּ֥kׇם kַ֛yִן aֶl־hֶ֥bֶl aָchִ֖yv vַyַּhַrְgֵֽhvּ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־קַ֔יִן אֵ֖י הֶ֣בֶל אָחִ֑יךָ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי הֲשֹׁמֵ֥ר אָחִ֖י אָנֹֽכִי׃
4.englishText: יהוה said to Cain, “Where is your brother Abel?” And he said, “I do not know. Am I my brother’s keeper?”
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־kַ֔yִן aֵ֖y hֶ֣bֶl aָchִ֑yךָ vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lֹ֣a yָdַ֔aְtִּy hֲshֹׁmֵ֥r aָchִ֖y aָnֹֽkִy׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֑יתָ ק֚וֹל דְּמֵ֣י אָחִ֔יךָ צֹעֲקִ֥ים אֵלַ֖י מִן־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
4.englishText: “What have you done? Hark, your brother’s blood cries out to Me from the ground!
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr mֶ֣h aָshִׂ֑ytָ k֚vֹl dְּmֵ֣y aָchִ֔yךָ tsֹaֲkִ֥yם aֵlַ֖y mִן־hָֽaֲdָmָֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֖ה אָר֣וּר אָ֑תָּה מִן־הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּצְתָ֣ה אֶת־פִּ֔יהָ לָקַ֛חַת אֶת־דְּמֵ֥י אָחִ֖יךָ מִיָּדֶֽךָ׃
4.englishText: Therefore, you shall be more cursed than the ground,*more cursed than the ground See 3.17. which opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.
4.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֖h aָr֣vּr aָ֑tָּh mִן־hָֽaֲdָmָh֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r pָּtsְtָ֣h aֶt־pִּ֔yhָ lָkַ֛chַt aֶt־dְּmֵ֥y aָchִ֖yךָ mִyָּdֶֽךָ׃

4.hebrewText: כִּ֤י תַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה לֹֽא־תֹסֵ֥ף תֵּת־כֹּחָ֖הּ לָ֑ךְ נָ֥ע וָנָ֖ד תִּֽהְיֶ֥ה בָאָֽרֶץ׃
4.englishText: If you till the soil, it shall no longer yield its strength to you. You shall become a ceaseless wanderer on earth.”
4.transliteration: kִּ֤y tַֽaֲbֹd֙ aֶt־hָ֣aֲdָmָ֔h lֹֽa־tֹsֵ֥ף tֵּt־kֹּchָ֖hּ lָ֑ךְ nָ֥a vָnָ֖d tִּֽhְyֶ֥h bָaָֽrֶץ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר קַ֖יִן אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה גָּד֥וֹל עֲוֺנִ֖י מִנְּשֹֽׂא*(בספרי ספרד ואשכנז מִנְּשֽׂוֹא)׃
4.englishText: Cain said to יהוה, “My punishment is too great to bear!
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr kַ֖yִן aֶl־yְhֹvָ֑h gָּd֥vֹl aֲvֺnִ֖y mִnְּshֹֽׂa*(bspry sprd vashknz mִnְּshֽׂvֹa)׃

4.hebrewText: הֵן֩ גֵּרַ֨שְׁתָּ אֹתִ֜י הַיּ֗וֹם מֵעַל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה וּמִפָּנֶ֖יךָ אֶסָּתֵ֑ר וְהָיִ֜יתִי נָ֤ע וָנָד֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ וְהָיָ֥ה כׇל־מֹצְאִ֖י יַֽהַרְגֵֽנִי׃
4.englishText: Since You have banished me this day from the soil, and I must avoid Your presence and become a restless wanderer on earth—anyone who meets me may kill me!”
4.transliteration: hֵן֩ gֵּrַ֨shְׁtָּ aֹtִ֜y hַyּ֗vֹם mֵaַl֙ pְּnֵ֣y hָֽaֲdָmָ֔h vּmִpָּnֶ֖yךָ aֶsָּtֵ֑r vְhָyִ֜ytִy nָ֤a vָnָd֙ bָּaָ֔rֶץ vְhָyָ֥h kׇl־mֹtsְaִ֖y yַֽhַrְgֵֽnִy׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ יְהֹוָ֗ה לָכֵן֙ כׇּל־הֹרֵ֣ג קַ֔יִן שִׁבְעָתַ֖יִם יֻקָּ֑ם וַיָּ֨שֶׂם יְהֹוָ֤ה לְקַ֙יִן֙ א֔וֹת לְבִלְתִּ֥י הַכּוֹת־אֹת֖וֹ כׇּל־מֹצְאֽוֹ׃
4.englishText: יהוה said to him, “I promise, if anyone kills Cain, sevenfold vengeance shall be exacted.” And יהוה put a mark on Cain, lest anyone who met him should kill him.
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֧amֶr l֣vֹ yְhֹvָ֗h lָkֵן֙ kׇּl־hֹrֵ֣g kַ֔yִן shִׁbְaָtַ֖yִם yֻkָּ֑ם vַyָּ֨shֶׂם yְhֹvָ֤h lְkַ֙yִן֙ a֔vֹt lְbִlְtִּ֥y hַkּvֹt־aֹt֖vֹ kׇּl־mֹtsְaֽvֹ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥צֵא קַ֖יִן מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בְּאֶֽרֶץ־נ֖וֹד קִדְמַת־עֵֽדֶן׃
4.englishText: Cain left the presence of יהוה and settled in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
4.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥tsֵa kַ֖yִן mִlִּpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h vַyֵּ֥shֶׁb bְּaֶֽrֶץ־n֖vֹd kִdְmַt־aֵֽdֶן׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֤דַע קַ֙יִן֙ אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד אֶת־חֲנ֑וֹךְ וַֽיְהִי֙ בֹּ֣נֶה עִ֔יר וַיִּקְרָא֙ שֵׁ֣ם הָעִ֔יר כְּשֵׁ֖ם בְּנ֥וֹ חֲנֽוֹךְ׃
4.englishText: Cain knew his wife, and she conceived and bore Enoch. And he then founded a city, and named the city after his son Enoch.
4.transliteration: vַyֵּ֤dַa kַ֙yִן֙ aֶt־aִshְׁtּ֔vֹ vַtַּ֖hַr vַtֵּ֣lֶd aֶt־chֲn֑vֹךְ vַֽyְhִy֙ bֹּ֣nֶh aִ֔yr vַyִּkְrָa֙ shֵׁ֣ם hָaִ֔yr kְּshֵׁ֖ם bְּn֥vֹ chֲnֽvֹךְ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיִּוָּלֵ֤ד לַֽחֲנוֹךְ֙ אֶת־עִירָ֔ד וְעִירָ֕ד יָלַ֖ד אֶת־מְחֽוּיָאֵ֑ל וּמְחִיָּיאֵ֗ל יָלַד֙ אֶת־מְת֣וּשָׁאֵ֔ל וּמְתוּשָׁאֵ֖ל יָלַ֥ד אֶת־לָֽמֶךְ׃
4.englishText: To Enoch was born Irad, and Irad begot Mehujael, and Mehujael*Mehujael Heb. Meḥiya’el. begot Methusael, and Methusael begot Lamech.
4.transliteration: vַyִּvָּlֵ֤d lַֽchֲnvֹךְ֙ aֶt־aִyrָ֔d vְaִyrָ֕d yָlַ֖d aֶt־mְchֽvּyָaֵ֑l vּmְchִyָּyaֵ֗l yָlַd֙ aֶt־mְt֣vּshָׁaֵ֔l vּmְtvּshָׁaֵ֖l yָlַ֥d aֶt־lָֽmֶךְ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֥וֹ לֶ֖מֶךְ שְׁתֵּ֣י נָשִׁ֑ים שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאַחַת֙ עָדָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית צִלָּֽה׃
4.englishText: Lamech took to himself two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other was Zillah.
4.transliteration: vַyִּֽkַּֽch־l֥vֹ lֶ֖mֶךְ shְׁtֵּ֣y nָshִׁ֑yם shֵׁ֤ם hָֽaַchַt֙ aָdָ֔h vְshֵׁ֥ם hַshֵּׁnִ֖yt tsִlָּֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֥לֶד עָדָ֖ה אֶת־יָבָ֑ל ה֣וּא הָיָ֔ה אֲבִ֕י יֹשֵׁ֥ב אֹ֖הֶל וּמִקְנֶֽה׃
4.englishText: Adah bore Jabal; he was the ancestor of those who dwell in tents and amidst herds.
4.transliteration: vַtֵּ֥lֶd aָdָ֖h aֶt־yָbָ֑l h֣vּa hָyָ֔h aֲbִ֕y yֹshֵׁ֥b aֹ֖hֶl vּmִkְnֶֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וְשֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו יוּבָ֑ל ה֣וּא הָיָ֔ה אֲבִ֕י כׇּל־תֹּפֵ֥שׂ כִּנּ֖וֹר וְעוּגָֽב׃
4.englishText: And the name of his brother was Jubal; he was the ancestor of all who play the lyre and the pipe.
4.transliteration: vְshֵׁ֥ם aָchִ֖yv yvּbָ֑l h֣vּa hָyָ֔h aֲbִ֕y kׇּl־tֹּpֵ֥shׂ kִּnּ֖vֹr vְavּgָֽb׃

4.hebrewText: וְצִלָּ֣ה גַם־הִ֗וא יָֽלְדָה֙ אֶת־תּ֣וּבַל קַ֔יִן לֹטֵ֕שׁ כׇּל־חֹרֵ֥שׁ נְחֹ֖שֶׁת וּבַרְזֶ֑ל וַֽאֲח֥וֹת תּֽוּבַל־קַ֖יִן נַֽעֲמָֽה׃
4.englishText: As for Zillah, she bore Tubal-cain, who forged all implements of copper and iron. And the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.
4.transliteration: vְtsִlָּ֣h gַם־hִ֗va yָֽlְdָh֙ aֶt־tּ֣vּbַl kַ֔yִן lֹtֵ֕shׁ kׇּl־chֹrֵ֥shׁ nְchֹ֖shֶׁt vּbַrְzֶ֑l vַֽaֲch֥vֹt tּֽvּbַl־kַ֖yִן nַֽaֲmָֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לֶ֜מֶךְ לְנָשָׁ֗יו עָדָ֤ה וְצִלָּה֙ שְׁמַ֣עַן קוֹלִ֔י נְשֵׁ֣י לֶ֔מֶךְ הַאְזֵ֖נָּה אִמְרָתִ֑י כִּ֣י אִ֤ישׁ הָרַ֙גְתִּי֙ לְפִצְעִ֔י וְיֶ֖לֶד לְחַבֻּרָתִֽי׃
4.englishText:
And Lamech said to his wives,
“Adah and Zillah, hear my voice;
O wives of Lamech, give ear to my speech.
I have slain a person for wounding me,
And a lad for bruising me.
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr lֶ֜mֶךְ lְnָshָׁ֗yv aָdָ֤h vְtsִlָּh֙ shְׁmַ֣aַן kvֹlִ֔y nְshֵׁ֣y lֶ֔mֶךְ hַaְzֵ֖nָּh aִmְrָtִ֑y kִּ֣y aִ֤yshׁ hָrַ֙gְtִּy֙ lְpִtsְaִ֔y vְyֶ֖lֶd lְchַbֻּrָtִֽy׃

4.hebrewText: כִּ֥י שִׁבְעָתַ֖יִם יֻקַּם־קָ֑יִן וְלֶ֖מֶךְ שִׁבְעִ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָֽה׃
4.englishText:
If Cain is avenged sevenfold,
Then Lamech seventy-sevenfold.”
4.transliteration: kִּ֥y shִׁbְaָtַ֖yִם yֻkַּם־kָ֑yִן vְlֶ֖mֶךְ shִׁbְaִ֥yם vְshִׁbְaָֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֨דַע אָדָ֥ם עוֹד֙ אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שֵׁ֑ת כִּ֣י שָֽׁת־לִ֤י אֱלֹהִים֙ זֶ֣רַע אַחֵ֔ר תַּ֣חַת הֶ֔בֶל כִּ֥י הֲרָג֖וֹ קָֽיִן׃
4.englishText: Adam knew his wife again, and she bore a son and named him Seth, meaning, “God has provided me with*provided me with Or “established for me”; Heb. shath, connected with “Seth.” another offspring in place of Abel,” for Cain had killed him.
4.transliteration: vַyֵּ֨dַa aָdָ֥ם avֹd֙ aֶt־aִshְׁtּ֔vֹ vַtֵּ֣lֶd bֵּ֔ן vַtִּkְrָ֥a aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ shֵׁ֑t kִּ֣y shָֽׁt־lִ֤y aֱlֹhִyם֙ zֶ֣rַa aַchֵ֔r tַּ֣chַt hֶ֔bֶl kִּ֥y hֲrָg֖vֹ kָֽyִן׃

4.hebrewText: וּלְשֵׁ֤ת גַּם־הוּא֙ יֻלַּד־בֵּ֔ן וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ אֱנ֑וֹשׁ אָ֣ז הוּחַ֔ל לִקְרֹ֖א בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
4.englishText: And to Seth, in turn, a son was born, and he named him Enosh. It was then that יהוה began to be invoked by name.
4.transliteration: vּlְshֵׁ֤t gַּם־hvּa֙ yֻlַּd־bֵּ֔ן vַyִּkְrָ֥a aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ aֱn֑vֹshׁ aָ֣z hvּchַ֔l lִkְrֹ֖a bְּshֵׁ֥ם yְhֹvָֽh׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: זֶ֣ה סֵ֔פֶר*(בספרי תימן סֵ֔פֶר בסמ״ך גדולה) תּוֹלְדֹ֖ת אָדָ֑ם בְּי֗וֹם בְּרֹ֤א אֱלֹהִים֙ אָדָ֔ם בִּדְמ֥וּת אֱלֹהִ֖ים עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
5.englishText: This is the record of Adam’s line.—When God created humankind, it was made in the likeness of God;
5.transliteration: zֶ֣h sֵ֔pֶr*(bspry tymן sֵ֔pֶr bsm״ך gdvlh) tּvֹlְdֹ֖t aָdָ֑ם bְּy֗vֹם bְּrֹ֤a aֱlֹhִyם֙ aָdָ֔ם bִּdְm֥vּt aֱlֹhִ֖yם aָshָׂ֥h aֹtֽvֹ׃

5.hebrewText: זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה בְּרָאָ֑ם וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹתָ֗ם וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֶת־שְׁמָם֙ אָדָ֔ם בְּי֖וֹם הִבָּֽרְאָֽם׃
5.englishText: male and female were they created. And when they were created, [God] blessed them and called them Humankind.*Humankind Heb. ’adam; NJPS “Man,” trad. “Adam.” —
5.transliteration: zָkָ֥r vּnְkֵbָ֖h bְּrָaָ֑ם vַyְbָ֣rֶךְ aֹtָ֗ם vַyִּkְrָ֤a aֶt־shְׁmָם֙ aָdָ֔ם bְּy֖vֹם hִbָּֽrְaָֽם׃

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י אָדָ֗ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וּמְאַת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בִּדְמוּת֖וֹ כְּצַלְמ֑וֹ וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שֵֽׁת׃
5.englishText: When Adam had lived 130 years, he begot a son in his likeness after his image, and he named him Seth.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y aָdָ֗ם shְׁlֹshִׁ֤yם vּmְaַt֙ shָׁnָ֔h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bִּdְmvּt֖vֹ kְּtsַlְm֑vֹ vַyִּkְrָ֥a aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ shֵֽׁt׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּֽהְי֣וּ יְמֵי־אָדָ֗ם אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־שֵׁ֔ת שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵאֹ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
5.englishText: After the birth of Seth, Adam lived 800 years and begot sons and daughters.
5.transliteration: vַyִּֽhְy֣vּ yְmֵy־aָdָ֗ם aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־shֵׁ֔t shְׁmֹnֶ֥h mֵaֹ֖t shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּֽהְי֞וּ כׇּל־יְמֵ֤י אָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁר־חַ֔י תְּשַׁ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
5.englishText: All the days that Adam lived came to 930 years; then he died.
5.transliteration: vַyִּֽhְy֞vּ kׇּl־yְmֵ֤y aָdָם֙ aֲshֶׁr־chַ֔y tְּshַׁ֤a mֵavֹt֙ shָׁnָ֔h vּshְׁlֹshִׁ֖yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּmֹֽt׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־שֵׁ֕ת חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־אֱנֽוֹשׁ׃
5.englishText: When Seth had lived 105 years, he begot Enosh.
5.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־shֵׁ֕t chָmֵ֥shׁ shָׁnִ֖yם vּmְaַ֣t shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־aֱnֽvֹshׁ׃

5.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־שֵׁ֗ת אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־אֱנ֔וֹשׁ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
5.englishText: After the birth of Enosh, Seth lived 807 years and begot sons and daughters.
5.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־shֵׁ֗t aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־aֱn֔vֹshׁ shֶׁ֣bַa shָׁnִ֔yם vּshְׁmֹnֶ֥h mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵי־שֵׁ֔ת שְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
5.englishText: All the days of Seth came to 912 years; then he died.
5.transliteration: vַyִּֽhְyvּ֙ kׇּl־yְmֵy־shֵׁ֔t shְׁtֵּ֤yם aֶshְׂrֵh֙ shָׁnָ֔h vּtְshַׁ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּmֹֽt׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֥י אֱנ֖וֹשׁ תִּשְׁעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־קֵינָֽן׃
5.englishText: When Enosh had lived 90 years, he begot Kenan.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֥y aֱn֖vֹshׁ tִּshְׁaִ֣yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־kֵynָֽן׃

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י אֱנ֗וֹשׁ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־קֵינָ֔ן חֲמֵ֤שׁ עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
5.englishText: After the birth of Kenan, Enosh lived 815 years and begot sons and daughters.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y aֱn֗vֹshׁ aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־kֵynָ֔ן chֲmֵ֤shׁ aֶshְׂrֵh֙ shָׁnָ֔h vּshְׁmֹnֶ֥h mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י אֱנ֔וֹשׁ חָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
5.englishText: All the days of Enosh came to 905 years; then he died.
5.transliteration: vַyִּֽhְyvּ֙ kׇּl־yְmֵ֣y aֱn֔vֹshׁ chָmֵ֣shׁ shָׁnִ֔yם vּtְshַׁ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּmֹֽt׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֥י קֵינָ֖ן שִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־מַֽהֲלַלְאֵֽל׃
5.englishText: When Kenan had lived 70 years, he begot Mahalalel.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֥y kֵynָ֖ן shִׁbְaִ֣yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־mַֽhֲlַlְaֵֽl׃

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י קֵינָ֗ן אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־מַֽהֲלַלְאֵ֔ל אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
5.englishText: After the birth of Mahalalel, Kenan lived 840 years and begot sons and daughters.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y kֵynָ֗ן aַchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־mַֽhֲlַlְaֵ֔l aַrְbָּaִ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h vּshְׁmֹnֶ֥h mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י קֵינָ֔ן עֶ֣שֶׂר שָׁנִ֔ים וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
5.englishText: All the days of Kenan came to 910 years; then he died.
5.transliteration: vַyִּֽhְyvּ֙ kׇּl־yְmֵ֣y kֵynָ֔ן aֶ֣shֶׂr shָׁnִ֔yם vּtְshַׁ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּmֹֽt׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י מַֽהֲלַלְאֵ֔ל חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים וְשִׁשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־יָֽרֶד׃
5.englishText: When Mahalalel had lived 65 years, he begot Jared.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y mַֽhֲlַlְaֵ֔l chָmֵ֥shׁ shָׁnִ֖yם vְshִׁshִּׁ֣yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־yָֽrֶd׃

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י מַֽהֲלַלְאֵ֗ל אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־יֶ֔רֶד שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
5.englishText: After the birth of Jared, Mahalalel lived 830 years and begot sons and daughters.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y mַֽhֲlַlְaֵ֗l aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־yֶ֔rֶd shְׁlֹshִׁ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h vּshְׁmֹnֶ֥h mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י מַהֲלַלְאֵ֔ל חָמֵ֤שׁ וְתִשְׁעִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
5.englishText: All the days of Mahalalel came to 895 years; then he died.
5.transliteration: vַyִּhְyvּ֙ kׇּl־yְmֵ֣y mַhֲlַlְaֵ֔l chָmֵ֤shׁ vְtִshְׁaִyם֙ shָׁnָ֔h vּshְׁmֹnֶ֥h mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּmֹֽt׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־יֶ֕רֶד שְׁתַּ֧יִם וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־חֲנֽוֹךְ׃
5.englishText: When Jared had lived 162 years, he begot Enoch.
5.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־yֶ֕rֶd shְׁtַּ֧yִם vְshִׁshִּׁ֛yם shָׁnָ֖h vּmְaַ֣t shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־chֲnֽvֹךְ׃

5.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־יֶ֗רֶד אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־חֲנ֔וֹךְ שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
5.englishText: After the birth of Enoch, Jared lived 800 years and begot sons and daughters.
5.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־yֶ֗rֶd aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־chֲn֔vֹךְ shְׁmֹnֶ֥h mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵי־יֶ֔רֶד שְׁתַּ֤יִם וְשִׁשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
5.englishText: All the days of Jared came to 962 years; then he died.
5.transliteration: vַyִּֽhְyvּ֙ kׇּl־yְmֵy־yֶ֔rֶd shְׁtַּ֤yִם vְshִׁshִּׁyם֙ shָׁnָ֔h vּtְshַׁ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּmֹֽt׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י חֲנ֔וֹךְ חָמֵ֥שׁ וְשִׁשִּׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־מְתוּשָֽׁלַח׃
5.englishText: When Enoch had lived 65 years, he begot Methuselah.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y chֲn֔vֹךְ chָmֵ֥shׁ vְshִׁshִּׁ֖yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־mְtvּshָֽׁlַch׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּתְהַלֵּ֨ךְ חֲנ֜וֹךְ אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֗ים אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־מְתוּשֶׁ֔לַח שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
5.englishText: After the birth of Methuselah, Enoch walked with God 300 years; and he begot sons and daughters.
5.transliteration: vַyִּtְhַlֵּ֨ךְ chֲn֜vֹךְ aֶt־hָֽaֱlֹhִ֗yם aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־mְtvּshֶׁ֔lַch shְׁlֹ֥shׁ mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃

5.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֖י כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י חֲנ֑וֹךְ חָמֵ֤שׁ וְשִׁשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָֽה׃
5.englishText: All the days of Enoch came to 365 years.
5.transliteration: vַyְhִ֖y kׇּl־yְmֵ֣y chֲn֑vֹךְ chָmֵ֤shׁ vְshִׁshִּׁyם֙ shָׁnָ֔h vּshְׁlֹ֥shׁ mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָֽh׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ חֲנ֖וֹךְ אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְאֵינֶ֕נּוּ כִּֽי־לָקַ֥ח אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
5.englishText: Enoch walked with God; then he was no more, for God took him.
5.transliteration: vַyִּtְhַlֵּ֥ךְ chֲn֖vֹךְ aֶt־hָֽaֱlֹhִ֑yם vְaֵynֶ֕nּvּ kִּֽy־lָkַ֥ch aֹt֖vֹ aֱlֹhִֽyם׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י מְתוּשֶׁ֔לַח שֶׁ֧בַע וּשְׁמֹנִ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־לָֽמֶךְ׃
5.englishText: When Methuselah had lived 187 years, he begot Lamech.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y mְtvּshֶׁ֔lַch shֶׁ֧bַa vּshְׁmֹnִ֛yם shָׁnָ֖h vּmְaַ֣t shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־lָֽmֶךְ׃

5.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י מְתוּשֶׁ֗לַח אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־לֶ֔מֶךְ שְׁתַּ֤יִם וּשְׁמוֹנִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
5.englishText: After the birth of Lamech, Methuselah lived 782 years and begot sons and daughters.
5.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y mְtvּshֶׁ֗lַch aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־lֶ֔mֶךְ shְׁtַּ֤yִם vּshְׁmvֹnִyם֙ shָׁnָ֔h vּshְׁbַ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י מְתוּשֶׁ֔לַח תֵּ֤שַׁע וְשִׁשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
5.englishText: All the days of Methuselah came to 969 years; then he died.
5.transliteration: vַyִּhְyvּ֙ kׇּl־yְmֵ֣y mְtvּshֶׁ֔lַch tֵּ֤shַׁa vְshִׁshִּׁyם֙ shָׁnָ֔h vּtְshַׁ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּmֹֽt׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־לֶ֕מֶךְ שְׁתַּ֧יִם וּשְׁמֹנִ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד בֵּֽן׃
5.englishText: When Lamech had lived 182 years, he begot a son.
5.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־lֶ֕mֶךְ shְׁtַּ֧yִם vּshְׁmֹnִ֛yם shָׁnָ֖h vּmְaַ֣t shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd bֵּֽן׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֶת־שְׁמ֛וֹ נֹ֖חַ לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֞֠ה יְנַחֲמֵ֤נוּ מִֽמַּעֲשֵׂ֙נוּ֙ וּמֵעִצְּב֣וֹן יָדֵ֔ינוּ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽרְרָ֖הּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
5.englishText: And he named him Noah, saying, “This one will provide us relief*relief Connecting Noah with Heb. niḥam “to comfort”; cf. 9.20ff. from our work and from the toil of our hands, out of the very soil which יהוה placed under a curse.”
5.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֧a aֶt־shְׁm֛vֹ nֹ֖chַ lֵamֹ֑r zֶ֞֠h yְnַchֲmֵ֤nvּ mִֽmַּaֲshֵׂ֙nvּ֙ vּmֵaִtsְּb֣vֹן yָdֵ֔ynvּ mִן־hָ֣aֲdָmָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r aֵֽrְrָ֖hּ yְhֹvָֽh׃

5.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־לֶ֗מֶךְ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־נֹ֔חַ חָמֵ֤שׁ וְתִשְׁעִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֹ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
5.englishText: After the birth of Noah, Lamech lived 595 years and begot sons and daughters.
5.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־lֶ֗mֶךְ aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־nֹ֔chַ chָmֵ֤shׁ vְtִshְׁaִyם֙ shָׁnָ֔h vַchֲmֵ֥shׁ mֵaֹ֖t shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃

5.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ כׇּל־יְמֵי־לֶ֔מֶךְ שֶׁ֤בַע וְשִׁבְעִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
5.englishText: All the days of Lamech came to 777 years; then he died.
5.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ kׇּl־yְmֵy־lֶ֔mֶךְ shֶׁ֤bַa vְshִׁbְaִyם֙ shָׁnָ֔h vּshְׁbַ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּmֹֽt׃ {s}

5.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־נֹ֕חַ בֶּן־חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֣וֹלֶד נֹ֔חַ אֶת־שֵׁ֖ם אֶת־חָ֥ם וְאֶת־יָֽפֶת׃
5.englishText: When Noah had lived 500 years, Noah begot Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
5.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־nֹ֕chַ bֶּן־chֲmֵ֥shׁ mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֣vֹlֶd nֹ֔chַ aֶt־shֵׁ֖ם aֶt־chָ֥ם vְaֶt־yָֽpֶt׃

6.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּֽי־הֵחֵ֣ל הָֽאָדָ֔ם לָרֹ֖ב עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה וּבָנ֖וֹת יֻלְּד֥וּ לָהֶֽם׃
6.englishText: When humankind began to increase on earth and daughters were born to them,
6.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ kִּֽy־hֵchֵ֣l hָֽaָdָ֔ם lָrֹ֖b aַl־pְּnֵ֣y hָֽaֲdָmָ֑h vּbָn֖vֹt yֻlְּd֥vּ lָhֶֽם׃

6.hebrewText: וַיִּרְא֤וּ בְנֵי־הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־בְּנ֣וֹת הָֽאָדָ֔ם כִּ֥י טֹבֹ֖ת הֵ֑נָּה וַיִּקְח֤וּ לָהֶם֙ נָשִׁ֔ים מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּחָֽרוּ׃
6.englishText: the [males among the] divine beings*divine beings Others “sons of God.” saw how pleasing the human women were and took wives from among those who delighted them.—
6.transliteration: vַyִּrְa֤vּ bְnֵy־hָֽaֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶt־bְּn֣vֹt hָֽaָdָ֔ם kִּ֥y tֹbֹ֖t hֵ֑nָּh vַyִּkְch֤vּ lָhֶם֙ nָshִׁ֔yם mִkֹּ֖l aֲshֶׁ֥r bָּchָֽrvּ׃

6.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה לֹֽא־יָד֨וֹן רוּחִ֤י בָֽאָדָם֙ לְעֹלָ֔ם בְּשַׁגַּ֖ם ה֣וּא בָשָׂ֑ר וְהָי֣וּ יָמָ֔יו מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
6.englishText: יהוה said, “My breath shall not abide*abide Meaning of Heb. uncertain. in humankind forever, since it too is flesh; let the days allowed them be one hundred and twenty years.”—
6.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָ֗h lֹֽa־yָd֨vֹן rvּchִ֤y bָֽaָdָם֙ lְaֹlָ֔ם bְּshַׁgַּ֖ם h֣vּa bָshָׂ֑r vְhָy֣vּ yָmָ֔yv mֵaָ֥h vְaֶshְׂrִ֖yם shָׁnָֽh׃

6.hebrewText: הַנְּפִלִ֞ים הָי֣וּ בָאָ֘רֶץ֮ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵם֒ וְגַ֣ם אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָבֹ֜אוּ בְּנֵ֤י הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־בְּנ֣וֹת הָֽאָדָ֔ם וְיָלְד֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם הֵ֧מָּה הַגִּבֹּרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר מֵעוֹלָ֖ם אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַשֵּֽׁם׃ {פ}
6.englishText: It was then, and later too, that the Nephilim appeared on earth—when divine beings cohabited with the human women, who bore them offspring. Such were the heroes of old, the men of renown.
6.transliteration: hַnְּpִlִ֞yם hָy֣vּ bָaָ֘rֶץ֮ bַּyָּmִ֣yם hָhֵם֒ vְgַ֣ם aַֽchֲrֵy־kֵ֗ן aֲshֶׁ֨r yָbֹ֜avּ bְּnֵ֤y hָֽaֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶl־bְּn֣vֹt hָֽaָdָ֔ם vְyָlְd֖vּ lָhֶ֑ם hֵ֧mָּh hַgִּbֹּrִ֛yם aֲshֶׁ֥r mֵavֹlָ֖ם aַnְshֵׁ֥y hַshֵּֽׁם׃ {p}

6.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣רְא יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י רַבָּ֛ה רָעַ֥ת הָאָדָ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְכׇל־יֵ֙צֶר֙ מַחְשְׁבֹ֣ת לִבּ֔וֹ רַ֥ק רַ֖ע כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
6.englishText: יהוה saw how great was human wickedness on earth—how every plan devised by the human mind was nothing but evil all the time.
6.transliteration: vַyַּ֣rְa yְhֹvָ֔h kִּ֥y rַbָּ֛h rָaַ֥t hָaָdָ֖ם bָּaָ֑rֶץ vְkׇl־yֵ֙tsֶr֙ mַchְshְׁbֹ֣t lִbּ֔vֹ rַ֥k rַ֖a kׇּl־hַyּֽvֹם׃

6.hebrewText: וַיִּנָּ֣חֶם יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־עָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּתְעַצֵּ֖ב אֶל־לִבּֽוֹ׃
6.englishText: And יהוה regretted having made humankind on earth. With a sorrowful heart,
6.transliteration: vַyִּnָּ֣chֶם yְhֹvָ֔h kִּֽy־aָshָׂ֥h aֶt־hָֽaָdָ֖ם bָּaָ֑rֶץ vַyִּtְaַtsֵּ֖b aֶl־lִbּֽvֹ׃

6.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶמְחֶ֨ה אֶת־הָאָדָ֤ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּרָ֙אתִי֙ מֵעַל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה מֵֽאָדָם֙ עַד־בְּהֵמָ֔ה עַד־רֶ֖מֶשׂ וְעַד־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כִּ֥י נִחַ֖מְתִּי כִּ֥י עֲשִׂיתִֽם׃
6.englishText: יהוה said, “I will blot out from the earth humankind whom I created—humans together with beasts, creeping things, and birds of the sky; for I regret that I made them.”
6.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָ֗h aֶmְchֶ֨h aֶt־hָaָdָ֤ם aֲshֶׁr־bָּrָ֙atִy֙ mֵaַl֙ pְּnֵ֣y hָֽaֲdָmָ֔h mֵֽaָdָם֙ aַd־bְּhֵmָ֔h aַd־rֶ֖mֶshׂ vְaַd־a֣vֹף hַshָּׁmָ֑yִם kִּ֥y nִchַ֖mְtִּy kִּ֥y aֲshִׂytִֽם׃

6.hebrewText: וְנֹ֕חַ מָ֥צָא חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
6.englishText: But Noah found favor with יהוה.
6.transliteration: vְnֹ֕chַ mָ֥tsָa chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynֵ֥y yְhֹvָֽh׃ {p}

6.hebrewText: אֵ֚לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת נֹ֔חַ נֹ֗חַ אִ֥ישׁ צַדִּ֛יק תָּמִ֥ים הָיָ֖ה בְּדֹֽרֹתָ֑יו אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֖ים הִֽתְהַלֶּךְ־נֹֽחַ׃
6.englishText: This is the line of Noah.—Noah was a righteous man; he was blameless in his age; Noah walked with God.—
6.transliteration: aֵ֚lֶּh tּvֹlְdֹ֣t nֹ֔chַ nֹ֗chַ aִ֥yshׁ tsַdִּ֛yk tָּmִ֥yם hָyָ֖h bְּdֹֽrֹtָ֑yv aֶt־hָֽaֱlֹhִ֖yם hִֽtְhַlֶּךְ־nֹֽchַ׃

6.hebrewText: וַיּ֥וֹלֶד נֹ֖חַ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים אֶת־שֵׁ֖ם אֶת־חָ֥ם וְאֶת־יָֽפֶת׃
6.englishText: Noah begot three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
6.transliteration: vַyּ֥vֹlֶd nֹ֖chַ shְׁlֹshָׁ֣h bָnִ֑yם aֶt־shֵׁ֖ם aֶt־chָ֥ם vְaֶt־yָֽpֶt׃

6.hebrewText: וַתִּשָּׁחֵ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ לִפְנֵ֣י הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ חָמָֽס׃
6.englishText: The earth became corrupt before God; the earth was filled with lawlessness.
6.transliteration: vַtִּshָּׁchֵ֥t hָaָ֖rֶץ lִpְnֵ֣y hָֽaֱlֹhִ֑yם vַtִּmָּlֵ֥a hָaָ֖rֶץ chָmָֽs׃

6.hebrewText: וַיַּ֧רְא אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְהִנֵּ֣ה נִשְׁחָ֑תָה כִּֽי־הִשְׁחִ֧ית כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֛ר אֶת־דַּרְכּ֖וֹ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
6.englishText: When God saw how corrupt the earth was, for all flesh had corrupted its ways on earth,
6.transliteration: vַyַּ֧rְa aֱlֹhִ֛yם aֶt־hָaָ֖rֶץ vְhִnֵּ֣h nִshְׁchָ֑tָh kִּֽy־hִshְׁchִ֧yt kׇּl־bָּshָׂ֛r aֶt־dַּrְkּ֖vֹ aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃ {s}

6.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֜ים לְנֹ֗חַ קֵ֤ץ כׇּל־בָּשָׂר֙ בָּ֣א לְפָנַ֔י כִּֽי־מָלְאָ֥ה הָאָ֛רֶץ חָמָ֖ס מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וְהִנְנִ֥י מַשְׁחִיתָ֖ם אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
6.englishText: God said to Noah, “I have decided to put an end to all flesh, for the earth is filled with lawlessness because of them: I am about to destroy them with the earth.
6.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֱlֹhִ֜yם lְnֹ֗chַ kֵ֤ץ kׇּl־bָּshָׂr֙ bָּ֣a lְpָnַ֔y kִּֽy־mָlְaָ֥h hָaָ֛rֶץ chָmָ֖s mִpְּnֵyhֶ֑ם vְhִnְnִ֥y mַshְׁchִytָ֖ם aֶt־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

6.hebrewText: עֲשֵׂ֤ה לְךָ֙ תֵּבַ֣ת עֲצֵי־גֹ֔פֶר קִנִּ֖ים תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֶת־הַתֵּבָ֑ה וְכָֽפַרְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛הּ מִבַּ֥יִת וּמִח֖וּץ בַּכֹּֽפֶר׃
6.englishText: Make yourself an ark of gopher wood; make it an ark with compartments, and cover it inside and out with pitch.
6.transliteration: aֲshֵׂ֤h lְךָ֙ tֵּbַ֣t aֲtsֵy־gֹ֔pֶr kִnִּ֖yם tַּֽaֲshֶׂ֣h aֶt־hַtֵּbָ֑h vְkָֽpַrְtָּ֥ aֹtָ֛hּ mִbַּ֥yִt vּmִch֖vּץ bַּkֹּֽpֶr׃

6.hebrewText: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֹתָ֑הּ שְׁלֹ֧שׁ מֵא֣וֹת אַמָּ֗ה אֹ֚רֶךְ הַתֵּבָ֔ה חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים אַמָּה֙ רׇחְבָּ֔הּ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אַמָּ֖ה קוֹמָתָֽהּ׃
6.englishText: This is how you shall make it: the length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits.
6.transliteration: vְzֶ֕h aֲshֶׁ֥r tַּֽaֲshֶׂ֖h aֹtָ֑hּ shְׁlֹ֧shׁ mֵa֣vֹt aַmָּ֗h aֹ֚rֶךְ hַtֵּbָ֔h chֲmִshִּׁ֤yם aַmָּh֙ rׇchְbָּ֔hּ vּshְׁlֹshִׁ֥yם aַmָּ֖h kvֹmָtָֽhּ׃

6.hebrewText: צֹ֣הַר ׀ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לַתֵּבָ֗ה וְאֶל־אַמָּה֙ תְּכַלֶּ֣נָּה מִלְמַ֔עְלָה וּפֶ֥תַח הַתֵּבָ֖ה בְּצִדָּ֣הּ תָּשִׂ֑ים תַּחְתִּיִּ֛ם שְׁנִיִּ֥ם וּשְׁלִשִׁ֖ים תַּֽעֲשֶֽׂהָ׃
6.englishText: Make an opening for daylight in the ark, and terminate it within a cubit of the top.*terminate it within a cubit of the top Meaning of Heb. uncertain. Put the entrance to the ark in its side; make it with bottom, second, and third decks.
6.transliteration: tsֹ֣hַr ׀ tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h lַtֵּbָ֗h vְaֶl־aַmָּh֙ tְּkַlֶּ֣nָּh mִlְmַ֔aְlָh vּpֶ֥tַch hַtֵּbָ֖h bְּtsִdָּ֣hּ tָּshִׂ֑yם tַּchְtִּyִּ֛ם shְׁnִyִּ֥ם vּshְׁlִshִׁ֖yם tַּֽaֲshֶֽׂhָ׃

6.hebrewText: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנְנִי֩ מֵבִ֨יא אֶת־הַמַּבּ֥וּל מַ֙יִם֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ לְשַׁחֵ֣ת כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֗ר אֲשֶׁר־בּוֹ֙ ר֣וּחַ חַיִּ֔ים מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־בָּאָ֖רֶץ יִגְוָֽע׃
6.englishText: “For My part, I am about to bring the Flood—waters upon the earth—to destroy all flesh under the sky in which there is breath of life; everything on earth shall perish.
6.transliteration: vַaֲnִ֗y hִnְnִy֩ mֵbִ֨ya aֶt־hַmַּbּ֥vּl mַ֙yִם֙ aַl־hָaָ֔rֶץ lְshַׁchֵ֣t kׇּl־bָּshָׂ֗r aֲshֶׁr־bּvֹ֙ r֣vּchַ chַyִּ֔yם mִtַּ֖chַt hַshָּׁmָ֑yִם kֹּ֥l aֲshֶׁr־bָּaָ֖rֶץ yִgְvָֽa׃

6.hebrewText: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֥י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וּבָאתָ֙ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֔ה אַתָּ֕ה וּבָנֶ֛יךָ וְאִשְׁתְּךָ֥ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנֶ֖יךָ אִתָּֽךְ׃
6.englishText: But I will establish My covenant with you, and you shall enter the ark, with your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives.
6.transliteration: vַhֲkִmֹtִ֥y aֶt־bְּrִytִ֖y aִtָּ֑ךְ vּbָatָ֙ aֶl־hַtֵּbָ֔h aַtָּ֕h vּbָnֶ֛yךָ vְaִshְׁtְּךָ֥ vּnְshֵֽׁy־bָnֶ֖yךָ aִtָּֽךְ׃

6.hebrewText: וּמִכׇּל־הָ֠חַ֠י מִֽכׇּל־בָּשָׂ֞ר שְׁנַ֧יִם מִכֹּ֛ל תָּבִ֥יא אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֖ה לְהַחֲיֹ֣ת אִתָּ֑ךְ זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה יִֽהְיֽוּ׃
6.englishText: And of all that lives, of all flesh, you shall take two of each into the ark to keep alive with you; they shall be male and female.
6.transliteration: vּmִkׇּl־hָ֠chַ֠y mִֽkׇּl־bָּshָׂ֞r shְׁnַ֧yִם mִkֹּ֛l tָּbִ֥ya aֶl־hַtֵּbָ֖h lְhַchֲyֹ֣t aִtָּ֑ךְ zָkָ֥r vּnְkֵbָ֖h yִֽhְyֽvּ׃

6.hebrewText: מֵהָע֣וֹף לְמִינֵ֗הוּ וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ מִכֹּ֛ל רֶ֥מֶשׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֖ה לְמִינֵ֑הוּ שְׁנַ֧יִם מִכֹּ֛ל יָבֹ֥אוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ לְהַֽחֲיֽוֹת׃
6.englishText: From birds of every kind, cattle of every kind, every kind of creeping thing on earth, two of each shall come to you to stay alive.
6.transliteration: mֵhָa֣vֹף lְmִynֵ֗hvּ vּmִן־hַbְּhֵmָh֙ lְmִynָ֔hּ mִkֹּ֛l rֶ֥mֶshׂ hָֽaֲdָmָ֖h lְmִynֵ֑hvּ shְׁnַ֧yִם mִkֹּ֛l yָbֹ֥avּ aֵlֶ֖yךָ lְhַֽchֲyֽvֹt׃

6.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֣ה קַח־לְךָ֗ מִכׇּל־מַֽאֲכָל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֵלֶ֑יךָ וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֛ וְלָהֶ֖ם לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
6.englishText: For your part, take of everything that is eaten and store it away, to serve as food for you and for them.”
6.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֣h kַch־lְךָ֗ mִkׇּl־mַֽaֲkָl֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r yֵֽaָkֵ֔l vְaָsַpְtָּ֖ aֵlֶ֑yךָ vְhָyָ֥h lְךָ֛ vְlָhֶ֖ם lְaׇkְlָֽh׃

6.hebrewText: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ נֹ֑חַ כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֛וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים כֵּ֥ן עָשָֽׂה׃
6.englishText: Noah did so; just as God commanded him, so he did.
6.transliteration: vַyַּ֖aַshׂ nֹ֑chַ kְּ֠kֹ֠l aֲshֶׁ֨r tsִvָּ֥h aֹt֛vֹ aֱlֹhִ֖yם kֵּ֥ן aָshָֽׂh׃

noach.name: Noach
noach.summary: Noah builds the ark, the Flood, Noah's family and animals survive, the rainbow covenant, Noah's drunkenness, the Tower of Babel, and the genealogy to Abram.

6.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּֽי־הֵחֵ֣ל הָֽאָדָ֔ם לָרֹ֖ב עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה וּבָנ֖וֹת יֻלְּד֥וּ לָהֶֽם׃
6.englishText: When humankind began to increase on earth and daughters were born to them,
6.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ kִּֽy־hֵchֵ֣l hָֽaָdָ֔ם lָrֹ֖b aַl־pְּnֵ֣y hָֽaֲdָmָ֑h vּbָn֖vֹt yֻlְּd֥vּ lָhֶֽם׃

6.hebrewText: וַיִּרְא֤וּ בְנֵי־הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־בְּנ֣וֹת הָֽאָדָ֔ם כִּ֥י טֹבֹ֖ת הֵ֑נָּה וַיִּקְח֤וּ לָהֶם֙ נָשִׁ֔ים מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּחָֽרוּ׃
6.englishText: the [males among the] divine beings*divine beings Others “sons of God.” saw how pleasing the human women were and took wives from among those who delighted them.—
6.transliteration: vַyִּrְa֤vּ bְnֵy־hָֽaֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶt־bְּn֣vֹt hָֽaָdָ֔ם kִּ֥y tֹbֹ֖t hֵ֑nָּh vַyִּkְch֤vּ lָhֶם֙ nָshִׁ֔yם mִkֹּ֖l aֲshֶׁ֥r bָּchָֽrvּ׃

6.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה לֹֽא־יָד֨וֹן רוּחִ֤י בָֽאָדָם֙ לְעֹלָ֔ם בְּשַׁגַּ֖ם ה֣וּא בָשָׂ֑ר וְהָי֣וּ יָמָ֔יו מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
6.englishText: יהוה said, “My breath shall not abide*abide Meaning of Heb. uncertain. in humankind forever, since it too is flesh; let the days allowed them be one hundred and twenty years.”—
6.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָ֗h lֹֽa־yָd֨vֹן rvּchִ֤y bָֽaָdָם֙ lְaֹlָ֔ם bְּshַׁgַּ֖ם h֣vּa bָshָׂ֑r vְhָy֣vּ yָmָ֔yv mֵaָ֥h vְaֶshְׂrִ֖yם shָׁnָֽh׃

6.hebrewText: הַנְּפִלִ֞ים הָי֣וּ בָאָ֘רֶץ֮ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵם֒ וְגַ֣ם אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָבֹ֜אוּ בְּנֵ֤י הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־בְּנ֣וֹת הָֽאָדָ֔ם וְיָלְד֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם הֵ֧מָּה הַגִּבֹּרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר מֵעוֹלָ֖ם אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַשֵּֽׁם׃ {פ}
6.englishText: It was then, and later too, that the Nephilim appeared on earth—when divine beings cohabited with the human women, who bore them offspring. Such were the heroes of old, the men of renown.
6.transliteration: hַnְּpִlִ֞yם hָy֣vּ bָaָ֘rֶץ֮ bַּyָּmִ֣yם hָhֵם֒ vְgַ֣ם aַֽchֲrֵy־kֵ֗ן aֲshֶׁ֨r yָbֹ֜avּ bְּnֵ֤y hָֽaֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶl־bְּn֣vֹt hָֽaָdָ֔ם vְyָlְd֖vּ lָhֶ֑ם hֵ֧mָּh hַgִּbֹּrִ֛yם aֲshֶׁ֥r mֵavֹlָ֖ם aַnְshֵׁ֥y hַshֵּֽׁם׃ {p}

6.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣רְא יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י רַבָּ֛ה רָעַ֥ת הָאָדָ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְכׇל־יֵ֙צֶר֙ מַחְשְׁבֹ֣ת לִבּ֔וֹ רַ֥ק רַ֖ע כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
6.englishText: יהוה saw how great was human wickedness on earth—how every plan devised by the human mind was nothing but evil all the time.
6.transliteration: vַyַּ֣rְa yְhֹvָ֔h kִּ֥y rַbָּ֛h rָaַ֥t hָaָdָ֖ם bָּaָ֑rֶץ vְkׇl־yֵ֙tsֶr֙ mַchְshְׁbֹ֣t lִbּ֔vֹ rַ֥k rַ֖a kׇּl־hַyּֽvֹם׃

6.hebrewText: וַיִּנָּ֣חֶם יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־עָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּתְעַצֵּ֖ב אֶל־לִבּֽוֹ׃
6.englishText: And יהוה regretted having made humankind on earth. With a sorrowful heart,
6.transliteration: vַyִּnָּ֣chֶם yְhֹvָ֔h kִּֽy־aָshָׂ֥h aֶt־hָֽaָdָ֖ם bָּaָ֑rֶץ vַyִּtְaַtsֵּ֖b aֶl־lִbּֽvֹ׃

6.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶמְחֶ֨ה אֶת־הָאָדָ֤ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּרָ֙אתִי֙ מֵעַל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה מֵֽאָדָם֙ עַד־בְּהֵמָ֔ה עַד־רֶ֖מֶשׂ וְעַד־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כִּ֥י נִחַ֖מְתִּי כִּ֥י עֲשִׂיתִֽם׃
6.englishText: יהוה said, “I will blot out from the earth humankind whom I created—humans together with beasts, creeping things, and birds of the sky; for I regret that I made them.”
6.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָ֗h aֶmְchֶ֨h aֶt־hָaָdָ֤ם aֲshֶׁr־bָּrָ֙atִy֙ mֵaַl֙ pְּnֵ֣y hָֽaֲdָmָ֔h mֵֽaָdָם֙ aַd־bְּhֵmָ֔h aַd־rֶ֖mֶshׂ vְaַd־a֣vֹף hַshָּׁmָ֑yִם kִּ֥y nִchַ֖mְtִּy kִּ֥y aֲshִׂytִֽם׃

6.hebrewText: וְנֹ֕חַ מָ֥צָא חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
6.englishText: But Noah found favor with יהוה.
6.transliteration: vְnֹ֕chַ mָ֥tsָa chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynֵ֥y yְhֹvָֽh׃ {p}

6.hebrewText: אֵ֚לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת נֹ֔חַ נֹ֗חַ אִ֥ישׁ צַדִּ֛יק תָּמִ֥ים הָיָ֖ה בְּדֹֽרֹתָ֑יו אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֖ים הִֽתְהַלֶּךְ־נֹֽחַ׃
6.englishText: This is the line of Noah.—Noah was a righteous man; he was blameless in his age; Noah walked with God.—
6.transliteration: aֵ֚lֶּh tּvֹlְdֹ֣t nֹ֔chַ nֹ֗chַ aִ֥yshׁ tsַdִּ֛yk tָּmִ֥yם hָyָ֖h bְּdֹֽrֹtָ֑yv aֶt־hָֽaֱlֹhִ֖yם hִֽtְhַlֶּךְ־nֹֽchַ׃

6.hebrewText: וַיּ֥וֹלֶד נֹ֖חַ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים אֶת־שֵׁ֖ם אֶת־חָ֥ם וְאֶת־יָֽפֶת׃
6.englishText: Noah begot three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
6.transliteration: vַyּ֥vֹlֶd nֹ֖chַ shְׁlֹshָׁ֣h bָnִ֑yם aֶt־shֵׁ֖ם aֶt־chָ֥ם vְaֶt־yָֽpֶt׃

6.hebrewText: וַתִּשָּׁחֵ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ לִפְנֵ֣י הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ חָמָֽס׃
6.englishText: The earth became corrupt before God; the earth was filled with lawlessness.
6.transliteration: vַtִּshָּׁchֵ֥t hָaָ֖rֶץ lִpְnֵ֣y hָֽaֱlֹhִ֑yם vַtִּmָּlֵ֥a hָaָ֖rֶץ chָmָֽs׃

6.hebrewText: וַיַּ֧רְא אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְהִנֵּ֣ה נִשְׁחָ֑תָה כִּֽי־הִשְׁחִ֧ית כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֛ר אֶת־דַּרְכּ֖וֹ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
6.englishText: When God saw how corrupt the earth was, for all flesh had corrupted its ways on earth,
6.transliteration: vַyַּ֧rְa aֱlֹhִ֛yם aֶt־hָaָ֖rֶץ vְhִnֵּ֣h nִshְׁchָ֑tָh kִּֽy־hִshְׁchִ֧yt kׇּl־bָּshָׂ֛r aֶt־dַּrְkּ֖vֹ aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃ {s}

6.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֜ים ��ְנֹ֗חַ קֵ֤ץ כׇּל־בָּשָׂר֙ בָּ֣א לְפָנַ֔י כִּֽי־מָלְאָ֥ה הָאָ֛רֶץ חָמָ֖ס מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וְהִנְנִ֥י מַשְׁחִיתָ֖ם אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
6.englishText: God said to Noah, “I have decided to put an end to all flesh, for the earth is filled with lawlessness because of them: I am about to destroy them with the earth.
6.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֱlֹhִ֜yם ��ְnֹ֗chַ kֵ֤ץ kׇּl־bָּshָׂr֙ bָּ֣a lְpָnַ֔y kִּֽy־mָlְaָ֥h hָaָ֛rֶץ chָmָ֖s mִpְּnֵyhֶ֑ם vְhִnְnִ֥y mַshְׁchִytָ֖ם aֶt־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

6.hebrewText: עֲשֵׂ֤ה לְךָ֙ תֵּבַ֣ת עֲצֵי־גֹ֔פֶר קִנִּ֖ים תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֶת־הַתֵּבָ֑ה וְכָֽפַרְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛הּ מִבַּ֥יִת וּמִח֖וּץ בַּכֹּֽפֶר׃
6.englishText: Make yourself an ark of gopher wood; make it an ark with compartments, and cover it inside and out with pitch.
6.transliteration: aֲshֵׂ֤h lְךָ֙ tֵּbַ֣t aֲtsֵy־gֹ֔pֶr kִnִּ֖yם tַּֽaֲshֶׂ֣h aֶt־hַtֵּbָ֑h vְkָֽpַrְtָּ֥ aֹtָ֛hּ mִbַּ֥yִt vּmִch֖vּץ bַּkֹּֽpֶr׃

6.hebrewText: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֹתָ֑הּ שְׁלֹ֧שׁ מֵא֣וֹת אַמָּ֗ה אֹ֚רֶךְ הַתֵּבָ֔ה חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים אַמָּה֙ רׇחְבָּ֔הּ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אַמָּ֖ה קוֹמָתָֽהּ׃
6.englishText: This is how you shall make it: the length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits.
6.transliteration: vְzֶ֕h aֲshֶׁ֥r tַּֽaֲshֶׂ֖h aֹtָ֑hּ shְׁlֹ֧shׁ mֵa֣vֹt aַmָּ֗h aֹ֚rֶךְ hַtֵּbָ֔h chֲmִshִּׁ֤yם aַmָּh֙ rׇchְbָּ֔hּ vּshְׁlֹshִׁ֥yם aַmָּ֖h kvֹmָtָֽhּ׃

6.hebrewText: צֹ֣הַר ׀ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לַתֵּבָ֗ה וְאֶל־אַמָּה֙ תְּכַלֶּ֣נָּה מִלְמַ֔עְלָה וּפֶ֥תַח הַתֵּבָ֖ה בְּצִדָּ֣הּ תָּשִׂ֑ים תַּחְתִּיִּ֛ם שְׁנִיִּ֥ם וּשְׁלִשִׁ֖ים תַּֽעֲשֶֽׂהָ׃
6.englishText: Make an opening for daylight in the ark, and terminate it within a cubit of the top.*terminate it within a cubit of the top Meaning of Heb. uncertain. Put the entrance to the ark in its side; make it with bottom, second, and third decks.
6.transliteration: tsֹ֣hַr ׀ tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h lַtֵּbָ֗h vְaֶl־aַmָּh֙ tְּkַlֶּ֣nָּh mִlְmַ֔aְlָh vּpֶ֥tַch hַtֵּbָ֖h bְּtsִdָּ֣hּ tָּshִׂ֑yם tַּchְtִּyִּ֛ם shְׁnִyִּ֥ם vּshְׁlִshִׁ֖yם tַּֽaֲshֶֽׂhָ׃

6.hebrewText: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנְנִי֩ מֵבִ֨יא אֶת־הַמַּבּ֥וּל מַ֙יִם֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ לְשַׁחֵ֣ת כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֗ר אֲשֶׁר־בּוֹ֙ ר֣וּחַ חַיִּ֔ים מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־בָּאָ֖רֶץ יִגְוָֽע׃
6.englishText: “For My part, I am about to bring the Flood—waters upon the earth—to destroy all flesh under the sky in which there is breath of life; everything on earth shall perish.
6.transliteration: vַaֲnִ֗y hִnְnִy֩ mֵbִ֨ya aֶt־hַmַּbּ֥vּl mַ֙yִם֙ aַl־hָaָ֔rֶץ lְshַׁchֵ֣t kׇּl־bָּshָׂ֗r aֲshֶׁr־bּvֹ֙ r֣vּchַ chַyִּ֔yם mִtַּ֖chַt hַshָּׁmָ֑yִם kֹּ֥l aֲshֶׁr־bָּaָ֖rֶץ yִgְvָֽa׃

6.hebrewText: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֥י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וּבָאתָ֙ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֔ה אַתָּ֕ה וּבָנֶ֛יךָ וְאִשְׁתְּךָ֥ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנֶ֖יךָ אִתָּֽךְ׃
6.englishText: But I will establish My covenant with you, and you shall enter the ark, with your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives.
6.transliteration: vַhֲkִmֹtִ֥y aֶt־bְּrִytִ֖y aִtָּ֑ךְ vּbָatָ֙ aֶl־hַtֵּbָ֔h aַtָּ֕h vּbָnֶ֛yךָ vְaִshְׁtְּךָ֥ vּnְshֵֽׁy־bָnֶ֖yךָ aִtָּֽךְ׃

6.hebrewText: וּמִכׇּל־הָ֠חַ֠י מִֽכׇּל־בָּשָׂ֞ר שְׁנַ֧יִם מִכֹּ֛ל תָּבִ֥יא אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֖ה לְהַחֲיֹ֣ת אִתָּ֑ךְ זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה יִֽהְיֽוּ׃
6.englishText: And of all that lives, of all flesh, you shall take two of each into the ark to keep alive with you; they shall be male and female.
6.transliteration: vּmִkׇּl־hָ֠chַ֠y mִֽkׇּl־bָּshָׂ֞r shְׁnַ֧yִם mִkֹּ֛l tָּbִ֥ya aֶl־hַtֵּbָ֖h lְhַchֲyֹ֣t aִtָּ֑ךְ zָkָ֥r vּnְkֵbָ֖h yִֽhְyֽvּ׃

6.hebrewText: מֵהָע֣וֹף לְמִינֵ֗הוּ וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ מִכֹּ֛ל רֶ֥מֶשׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֖ה לְמִינֵ֑הוּ שְׁנַ֧יִם מִכֹּ֛ל יָבֹ֥אוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ לְהַֽחֲיֽוֹת׃
6.englishText: From birds of every kind, cattle of every kind, every kind of creeping thing on earth, two of each shall come to you to stay alive.
6.transliteration: mֵhָa֣vֹף lְmִynֵ֗hvּ vּmִן־hַbְּhֵmָh֙ lְmִynָ֔hּ mִkֹּ֛l rֶ֥mֶshׂ hָֽaֲdָmָ֖h lְmִynֵ֑hvּ shְׁnַ֧yִם mִkֹּ֛l yָbֹ֥avּ aֵlֶ֖yךָ lְhַֽchֲyֽvֹt׃

6.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֣ה קַח־לְךָ֗ מִכׇּל־מַֽאֲכָל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֵלֶ֑יךָ וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֛ וְלָהֶ֖ם לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
6.englishText: For your part, take of everything that is eaten and store it away, to serve as food for you and for them.”
6.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֣h kַch־lְךָ֗ mִkׇּl־mַֽaֲkָl֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r yֵֽaָkֵ֔l vְaָsַpְtָּ֖ aֵlֶ֑yךָ vְhָyָ֥h lְךָ֛ vְlָhֶ֖ם lְaׇkְlָֽh׃

6.hebrewText: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ נֹ֑חַ כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֛וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים כֵּ֥ן עָשָֽׂה׃
6.englishText: Noah did so; just as God commanded him, so he did.
6.transliteration: vַyַּ֖aַshׂ nֹ֑chַ kְּ֠kֹ֠l aֲshֶׁ֨r tsִvָּ֥h aֹt֛vֹ aֱlֹhִ֖yם kֵּ֥ן aָshָֽׂh׃

7.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ לְנֹ֔חַ בֹּֽא־אַתָּ֥ה וְכׇל־בֵּיתְךָ֖ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֑ה כִּֽי־אֹתְךָ֥ רָאִ֛יתִי צַדִּ֥יק לְפָנַ֖י בַּדּ֥וֹר הַזֶּֽה׃
7.englishText: Then יהוה said to Noah, “Go into the ark, with all your household, for you alone have I found righteous before Me in this generation.
7.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ lְnֹ֔chַ bֹּֽa־aַtָּ֥h vְkׇl־bֵּytְךָ֖ aֶl־hַtֵּbָ֑h kִּֽy־aֹtְךָ֥ rָaִ֛ytִy tsַdִּ֥yk lְpָnַ֖y bַּdּ֥vֹr hַzֶּֽh׃

7.hebrewText: מִכֹּ֣ל ׀ הַבְּהֵמָ֣ה הַטְּהוֹרָ֗ה תִּֽקַּח־לְךָ֛ שִׁבְעָ֥ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֡ה אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹ֣א טְהֹרָ֥ה הִ֛וא שְׁנַ֖יִם אִ֥ישׁ וְאִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
7.englishText: Of every pure animal you shall take seven pairs, males and their mates, and of every animal that is not pure, two, a male and its mate;
7.transliteration: mִkֹּ֣l ׀ hַbְּhֵmָ֣h hַtְּhvֹrָ֗h tִּֽkַּch־lְךָ֛ shִׁbְaָ֥h shִׁbְaָ֖h aִ֣yshׁ vְaִshְׁtּ֑vֹ vּmִן־hַbְּhֵmָ֡h aֲ֠shֶׁ֠r lֹ֣a tְhֹrָ֥h hִ֛va shְׁnַ֖yִם aִ֥yshׁ vְaִshְׁtּֽvֹ׃

7.hebrewText: גַּ֣ם מֵע֧וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם שִׁבְעָ֥ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה זָכָ֣ר וּנְקֵבָ֑ה לְחַיּ֥וֹת זֶ֖רַע עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
7.englishText: of the birds of the sky also, seven pairs, male and female, to keep seed alive upon all the earth.
7.transliteration: gַּ֣ם mֵa֧vֹף hַshָּׁmַ֛yִם shִׁbְaָ֥h shִׁbְaָ֖h zָkָ֣r vּnְkֵbָ֑h lְchַyּ֥vֹt zֶ֖rַa aַl־pְּnֵ֥y kׇl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

7.hebrewText: כִּי֩ לְיָמִ֨ים ע֜וֹד שִׁבְעָ֗ה אָֽנֹכִי֙ מַמְטִ֣יר עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָ֑יְלָה וּמָחִ֗יתִי אֶֽת־כׇּל־הַיְקוּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔יתִי מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
7.englishText: For in seven days’ time I will make it rain upon the earth, forty days and forty nights, and I will blot out from the earth all existence that I created.”
7.transliteration: kִּy֩ lְyָmִ֨yם a֜vֹd shִׁbְaָ֗h aָֽnֹkִy֙ mַmְtִ֣yr aַl־hָaָ֔rֶץ aַrְbָּaִ֣yם y֔vֹם vְaַrְbָּaִ֖yם lָ֑yְlָh vּmָchִ֗ytִy aֶֽt־kׇּl־hַyְkvּם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aָshִׂ֔ytִy mֵaַ֖l pְּnֵ֥y hָֽaֲdָmָֽh׃

7.hebrewText: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ נֹ֑חַ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
7.englishText: And Noah did just as יהוה commanded him.
7.transliteration: vַyַּ֖aַshׂ nֹ֑chַ kְּkֹ֥l aֲshֶׁr־tsִvָּ֖hvּ yְhֹvָֽh׃

7.hebrewText: וְנֹ֕חַ בֶּן־שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וְהַמַּבּ֣וּל הָיָ֔ה מַ֖יִם עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
7.englishText: Noah was six hundred years old when the Flood came, waters upon the earth.
7.transliteration: vְnֹ֕chַ bֶּן־shֵׁ֥shׁ mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vְhַmַּbּ֣vּl hָyָ֔h mַ֖yִם aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

7.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣בֹא נֹ֗חַ וּ֠בָנָ֠יו וְאִשְׁתּ֧וֹ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנָ֛יו אִתּ֖וֹ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֑ה מִפְּנֵ֖י מֵ֥י הַמַּבּֽוּל׃
7.englishText: Noah, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, went into the ark because of the waters of the Flood.
7.transliteration: vַyָּ֣bֹa nֹ֗chַ vּ֠bָnָ֠yv vְaִshְׁtּ֧vֹ vּnְshֵֽׁy־bָnָ֛yv aִtּ֖vֹ aֶl־hַtֵּbָ֑h mִpְּnֵ֖y mֵ֥y hַmַּbּֽvּl׃

7.hebrewText: מִן־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ הַטְּהוֹרָ֔ה וּמִ֨ן־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵינֶ֖נָּה טְהֹרָ֑ה וּמִ֨ן־הָע֔וֹף וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־רֹמֵ֖שׂ עַל־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
7.englishText: Of the pure animals, of the animals that are not pure, of the birds, and of everything that creeps on the ground,
7.transliteration: mִן־hַbְּhֵmָh֙ hַtְּhvֹrָ֔h vּmִ֨ן־hַbְּhֵmָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r aֵynֶ֖nָּh tְhֹrָ֑h vּmִ֨ן־hָa֔vֹף vְkֹ֥l aֲshֶׁr־rֹmֵ֖shׂ aַl־hָֽaֲdָmָֽh׃
