7.hebrewText: שְׁנַ֨יִם שְׁנַ֜יִם בָּ֧אוּ אֶל־נֹ֛חַ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֖ה זָכָ֣ר וּנְקֵבָ֑ה כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־נֹֽחַ׃
7.englishText: two of each, male and female, came to Noah into the ark, as God had commanded Noah.
7.transliteration: shְׁnַ֨yִם shְׁnַ֜yִם bָּ֧avּ aֶl־nֹ֛chַ aֶl־hַtֵּbָ֖h zָkָ֣r vּnְkֵbָ֑h kַּֽaֲshֶׁ֛r tsִvָּ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־nֹֽchַ׃

7.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֖י לְשִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֑ים וּמֵ֣י הַמַּבּ֔וּל הָי֖וּ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
7.englishText: And on the seventh day the waters of the Flood came upon the earth.
7.transliteration: vַyְhִ֖y lְshִׁbְaַ֣t hַyָּmִ֑yם vּmֵ֣y hַmַּbּ֔vּl hָy֖vּ aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

7.hebrewText: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֤וֹת שָׁנָה֙ לְחַיֵּי־נֹ֔חַ בַּחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י בְּשִׁבְעָֽה־עָשָׂ֥ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה נִבְקְעוּ֙ כׇּֽל־מַעְיְנֹת֙*(בספרי ספרד ואשכנז מַעְיְנוֹת֙) תְּה֣וֹם רַבָּ֔ה וַאֲרֻבֹּ֥ת הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם נִפְתָּֽחוּ׃
7.englishText:
In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on that day
All the fountains of the great deep burst apart,
And the floodgates of the sky broke open.
7.transliteration: bִּshְׁnַ֨t shֵׁshׁ־mֵa֤vֹt shָׁnָh֙ lְchַyֵּy־nֹ֔chַ bַּchֹ֙dֶshׁ֙ hַshֵּׁnִ֔y bְּshִׁbְaָֽh־aָshָׂ֥r y֖vֹם lַchֹ֑dֶshׁ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַzֶּ֗h nִbְkְavּ֙ kׇּֽl־mַaְyְnֹt֙*(bspry sprd vashknz mַaְyְnvֹt֙) tְּh֣vֹם rַbָּ֔h vַaֲrֻbֹּ֥t hַshָּׁmַ֖yִם nִpְtָּֽchvּ׃

7.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֥י הַגֶּ֖שֶׁם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָֽיְלָה׃
7.englishText: (The rain fell on the earth forty days and forty nights.)
7.transliteration: vַyְhִ֥y hַgֶּ֖shֶׁם aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ aַrְbָּaִ֣yם y֔vֹם vְaַrְbָּaִ֖yם lָֽyְlָh׃

7.hebrewText: בְּעֶ֨צֶם הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ בָּ֣א נֹ֔חַ וְשֵׁם־וְחָ֥ם וָיֶ֖פֶת בְּנֵי־נֹ֑חַ וְאֵ֣שֶׁת נֹ֗חַ וּשְׁלֹ֧שֶׁת נְשֵֽׁי־בָנָ֛יו אִתָּ֖ם אֶל־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
7.englishText: That same day Noah and Noah’s sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth, went into the ark, with Noah’s wife and the three wives of his sons—
7.transliteration: bְּaֶ֨tsֶם hַyּ֤vֹם hַzֶּh֙ bָּ֣a nֹ֔chַ vְshֵׁם־vְchָ֥ם vָyֶ֖pֶt bְּnֵy־nֹ֑chַ vְaֵ֣shֶׁt nֹ֗chַ vּshְׁlֹ֧shֶׁt nְshֵֽׁy־bָnָ֛yv aִtָּ֖ם aֶl־hַtֵּbָֽh׃

7.hebrewText: הֵ֜מָּה וְכׇל־הַֽחַיָּ֣ה לְמִינָ֗הּ וְכׇל־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ וְכׇל־הָרֶ֛מֶשׂ הָרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וְכׇל־הָע֣וֹף לְמִינֵ֔הוּ כֹּ֖ל צִפּ֥וֹר כׇּל־כָּנָֽף׃
7.englishText: they and all beasts of every kind, all cattle of every kind, all creatures of every kind that creep on the earth, and all birds of every kind, every bird, every winged thing.
7.transliteration: hֵ֜mָּh vְkׇl־hַֽchַyָּ֣h lְmִynָ֗hּ vְkׇl־hַbְּhֵmָh֙ lְmִynָ֔hּ vְkׇl־hָrֶ֛mֶshׂ hָrֹmֵ֥shׂ aַl־hָaָ֖rֶץ lְmִynֵ֑hvּ vְkׇl־hָa֣vֹף lְmִynֵ֔hvּ kֹּ֖l tsִpּ֥vֹr kׇּl־kָּnָֽף׃

7.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־נֹ֖חַ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֑ה שְׁנַ֤יִם שְׁנַ֙יִם֙ מִכׇּל־הַבָּשָׂ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ ר֥וּחַ חַיִּֽים׃
7.englishText: They came to Noah into the ark, two each of all flesh in which there was breath of life.
7.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֥avּ aֶl־nֹ֖chַ aֶl־hַtֵּbָ֑h shְׁnַ֤yִם shְׁnַ֙yִם֙ mִkׇּl־hַbָּshָׂ֔r aֲshֶׁr־bּ֖vֹ r֥vּchַ chַyִּֽyם׃

7.hebrewText: וְהַבָּאִ֗ים זָכָ֨ר וּנְקֵבָ֤ה מִכׇּל־בָּשָׂר֙ בָּ֔אוּ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּסְגֹּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּֽעֲדֽוֹ׃
7.englishText: Thus they that entered comprised male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him. And יהוה shut him in.
7.transliteration: vְhַbָּaִ֗yם zָkָ֨r vּnְkֵbָ֤h mִkׇּl־bָּshָׂr֙ bָּ֔avּ kַּֽaֲshֶׁ֛r tsִvָּ֥h aֹt֖vֹ aֱlֹhִ֑yם vַyִּsְgֹּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h bַּֽaֲdֽvֹ׃

7.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִ֧י הַמַּבּ֛וּל אַרְבָּעִ֥ים י֖וֹם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּרְבּ֣וּ הַמַּ֗יִם וַיִּשְׂאוּ֙ אֶת־הַתֵּבָ֔ה וַתָּ֖רׇם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
7.englishText: The Flood continued forty days on the earth, and the waters increased and raised the ark so that it rose above the earth.
7.transliteration: vַֽyְhִ֧y hַmַּbּ֛vּl aַrְbָּaִ֥yם y֖vֹם aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vַyִּrְbּ֣vּ hַmַּ֗yִם vַyִּshְׂavּ֙ aֶt־hַtֵּbָ֔h vַtָּ֖rׇם mֵaַ֥l hָaָֽrֶץ׃

7.hebrewText: וַיִּגְבְּר֥וּ הַמַּ֛יִם וַיִּרְבּ֥וּ מְאֹ֖ד עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַתֵּ֥לֶךְ הַתֵּבָ֖ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַמָּֽיִם׃
7.englishText: The waters swelled and increased greatly upon the earth, and the ark drifted upon the waters.
7.transliteration: vַyִּgְbְּr֥vּ hַmַּ֛yִם vַyִּrְbּ֥vּ mְaֹ֖d aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vַtֵּ֥lֶךְ hַtֵּbָ֖h aַl־pְּnֵ֥y hַmָּֽyִם׃

7.hebrewText: וְהַמַּ֗יִם גָּ֥בְר֛וּ מְאֹ֥ד מְאֹ֖ד עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיְכֻסּ֗וּ כׇּל־הֶֽהָרִים֙ הַגְּבֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
7.englishText: When the waters had swelled much more upon the earth, all the highest mountains everywhere under the sky were covered.
7.transliteration: vְhַmַּ֗yִם gָּ֥bְr֛vּ mְaֹ֥d mְaֹ֖d aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vַyְkֻsּ֗vּ kׇּl־hֶֽhָrִyם֙ hַgְּbֹhִ֔yם aֲshֶׁr־tַּ֖chַt kׇּl־hַshָּׁmָֽyִם׃

7.hebrewText: חֲמֵ֨שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה אַמָּה֙ מִלְמַ֔עְלָה גָּבְר֖וּ הַמָּ֑יִם וַיְכֻסּ֖וּ הֶהָרִֽים׃
7.englishText: Fifteen cubits higher did the waters swell, as the mountains were covered.
7.transliteration: chֲmֵ֨shׁ aֶshְׂrֵ֤h aַmָּh֙ mִlְmַ֔aְlָh gָּbְr֖vּ hַmָּ֑yִם vַyְkֻsּ֖vּ hֶhָrִֽyם׃

7.hebrewText: וַיִּגְוַ֞ע כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֣ר ׀ הָרֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ בָּע֤וֹף וּבַבְּהֵמָה֙ וּבַ֣חַיָּ֔ה וּבְכׇל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֣ץ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְכֹ֖ל הָאָדָֽם׃
7.englishText: And all flesh that stirred on earth perished—birds, cattle, beasts, and all the things that swarmed upon the earth, and all humankind.
7.transliteration: vַyִּgְvַ֞a kׇּl־bָּshָׂ֣r ׀ hָrֹmֵ֣shׂ aַl־hָaָ֗rֶץ bָּa֤vֹף vּbַbְּhֵmָh֙ vּbַ֣chַyָּ֔h vּbְkׇl־hַshֶּׁ֖rֶץ hַshֹּׁrֵ֣ץ aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vְkֹ֖l hָaָdָֽם׃

7.hebrewText: כֹּ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁמַת־ר֨וּחַ חַיִּ֜ים בְּאַפָּ֗יו מִכֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֶּחָֽרָבָ֖ה מֵֽתוּ׃
7.englishText: All in whose nostrils was the merest breath of life, all that was on dry land, died.
7.transliteration: kֹּ֡l aֲshֶׁr֩ nִshְׁmַt־r֨vּchַ chַyִּ֜yם bְּaַpָּ֗yv mִkֹּ֛l aֲshֶׁ֥r bֶּchָֽrָbָ֖h mֵֽtvּ׃

7.hebrewText: וַיִּ֜מַח אֶֽת־כׇּל־הַיְק֣וּם ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֗ה מֵאָדָ֤ם עַד־בְּהֵמָה֙ עַד־רֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ וְעַד־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיִּמָּח֖וּ מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּשָּׁ֧אֶר אַךְ־נֹ֛חַ וַֽאֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ בַּתֵּבָֽה׃
7.englishText: All existence on earth was blotted out—humans, cattle, creeping things, and birds of the sky; they were blotted out from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those with him in the ark.
7.transliteration: vַyִּ֜mַch aֶֽt־kׇּl־hַyְk֣vּם ׀ aֲshֶׁ֣r ׀ aַl־pְּnֵ֣y hָֽaֲdָmָ֗h mֵaָdָ֤ם aַd־bְּhֵmָh֙ aַd־rֶ֙mֶshׂ֙ vְaַd־a֣vֹף hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vַyִּmָּch֖vּ mִן־hָaָ֑rֶץ vַyִּshָּׁ֧aֶr aַךְ־nֹ֛chַ vַֽaֲshֶׁ֥r aִtּ֖vֹ bַּtֵּbָֽh׃

7.hebrewText: וַיִּגְבְּר֥וּ הַמַּ֖יִם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת יֽוֹם׃
7.englishText: And when the waters had swelled on the earth one hundred and fifty days,
7.transliteration: vַyִּgְbְּr֥vּ hַmַּ֖yִם aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ chֲmִshִּׁ֥yם vּmְaַ֖t yֽvֹם׃

8.hebrewText: וַיִּזְכֹּ֤ר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־נֹ֔חַ וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַֽחַיָּה֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ בַּתֵּבָ֑ה וַיַּעֲבֵ֨ר אֱלֹהִ֥ים ר֙וּחַ֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיָּשֹׁ֖כּוּ הַמָּֽיִם׃
8.englishText: God remembered Noah and all the beasts and all the cattle that were with him in the ark, and God caused a wind to blow across the earth, and the waters subsided.
8.transliteration: vַyִּzְkֹּ֤r aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶt־nֹ֔chַ vְaֵ֤t kׇּl־hַֽchַyָּh֙ vְaֶt־kׇּl־hַbְּhֵmָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r aִtּ֖vֹ bַּtֵּbָ֑h vַyַּaֲbֵ֨r aֱlֹhִ֥yם r֙vּchַ֙ aַl־hָaָ֔rֶץ vַyָּshֹׁ֖kּvּ hַmָּֽyִם׃

8.hebrewText: וַיִּסָּֽכְרוּ֙ מַעְיְנֹ֣ת תְּה֔וֹם וַֽאֲרֻבֹּ֖ת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיִּכָּלֵ֥א הַגֶּ֖שֶׁם מִן־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
8.englishText: The fountains of the deep and the floodgates of the sky were stopped up, and the rain from the sky was held back;
8.transliteration: vַyִּsָּֽkְrvּ֙ mַaְyְnֹ֣t tְּh֔vֹם vַֽaֲrֻbֹּ֖t hַshָּׁmָ֑yִם vַyִּkָּlֵ֥a hַgֶּ֖shֶׁם mִן־hַshָּׁmָֽyִם׃

8.hebrewText: וַיָּשֻׁ֧בוּ הַמַּ֛יִם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָ֖רֶץ הָל֣וֹךְ וָשׁ֑וֹב וַיַּחְסְר֣וּ הַמַּ֔יִם מִקְצֵ֕ה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת יֽוֹם׃
8.englishText: the waters then receded steadily from the earth. At the end of one hundred and fifty days the waters diminished,
8.transliteration: vַyָּshֻׁ֧bvּ hַmַּ֛yִם mֵaַ֥l hָaָ֖rֶץ hָl֣vֹךְ vָshׁ֑vֹb vַyַּchְsְr֣vּ hַmַּ֔yִם mִkְtsֵ֕h chֲmִshִּׁ֥yם vּmְaַ֖t yֽvֹם׃

8.hebrewText: וַתָּ֤נַח הַתֵּבָה֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י בְּשִׁבְעָה־עָשָׂ֥ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ עַ֖ל הָרֵ֥י אֲרָרָֽט׃
8.englishText: so that in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.
8.transliteration: vַtָּ֤nַch hַtֵּbָh֙ bַּchֹ֣dֶshׁ hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔y bְּshִׁbְaָh־aָshָׂ֥r y֖vֹם lַchֹ֑dֶshׁ aַ֖l hָrֵ֥y aֲrָrָֽt׃

8.hebrewText: וְהַמַּ֗יִם הָיוּ֙ הָל֣וֹךְ וְחָס֔וֹר עַ֖ד הַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽעֲשִׂירִ֑י בָּֽעֲשִׂירִי֙ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ נִרְא֖וּ רָאשֵׁ֥י הֶֽהָרִֽים׃
8.englishText: The waters went on diminishing until the tenth month; in the tenth month, on the first of the month, the tops of the mountains became visible.
8.transliteration: vְhַmַּ֗yִם hָyvּ֙ hָl֣vֹךְ vְchָs֔vֹr aַ֖d hַchֹ֣dֶshׁ hָֽaֲshִׂyrִ֑y bָּֽaֲshִׂyrִy֙ bְּaֶchָ֣d lַchֹ֔dֶshׁ nִrְa֖vּ rָashֵׁ֥y hֶֽhָrִֽyם׃

8.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֕י מִקֵּ֖ץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֑וֹם וַיִּפְתַּ֣ח נֹ֔חַ אֶת־חַלּ֥וֹן הַתֵּבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
8.englishText: At the end of forty days, Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made
8.transliteration: vַyְhִ֕y mִkֵּ֖ץ aַrְbָּaִ֣yם y֑vֹם vַyִּpְtַּ֣ch nֹ֔chַ aֶt־chַlּ֥vֹן hַtֵּbָ֖h aֲshֶׁ֥r aָshָֽׂh׃

8.hebrewText: וַיְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָֽעֹרֵ֑ב וַיֵּצֵ֤א יָצוֹא֙ וָשׁ֔וֹב עַד־יְבֹ֥שֶׁת הַמַּ֖יִם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
8.englishText: and sent out the raven; it went to and fro until the waters had dried up from the earth.
8.transliteration: vַyְshַׁlַּ֖ch aֶt־hָֽaֹrֵ֑b vַyֵּtsֵ֤a yָtsvֹa֙ vָshׁ֔vֹb aַd־yְbֹ֥shֶׁt hַmַּ֖yִם mֵaַ֥l hָaָֽrֶץ׃

8.hebrewText: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הַיּוֹנָ֖ה מֵאִתּ֑וֹ לִרְאוֹת֙ הֲקַ֣לּוּ הַמַּ֔יִם מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
8.englishText: Then he sent out the dove to see whether the waters had decreased from the surface of the ground.
8.transliteration: vַyְshַׁlַּ֥ch aֶt־hַyּvֹnָ֖h mֵaִtּ֑vֹ lִrְavֹt֙ hֲkַ֣lּvּ hַmַּ֔yִם mֵaַ֖l pְּnֵ֥y hָֽaֲdָmָֽh׃

8.hebrewText: וְלֹֽא־מָצְאָה֩ הַיּוֹנָ֨ה מָנ֜וֹחַ לְכַף־רַגְלָ֗הּ וַתָּ֤שׇׁב אֵלָיו֙ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֔ה כִּי־מַ֖יִם עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ וַיִּקָּחֶ֔הָ וַיָּבֵ֥א אֹתָ֛הּ אֵלָ֖יו אֶל־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
8.englishText: But the dove could not find a resting place for its foot, and returned to him to the ark, for there was water over all the earth. So putting out his hand, he took it into the ark with him.
8.transliteration: vְlֹֽa־mָtsְaָh֩ hַyּvֹnָ֨h mָn֜vֹchַ lְkַף־rַgְlָ֗hּ vַtָּ֤shׇׁb aֵlָyv֙ aֶl־hַtֵּbָ֔h kִּy־mַ֖yִם aַl־pְּnֵ֣y kׇl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vַyִּshְׁlַ֤ch yָdvֹ֙ vַyִּkָּchֶ֔hָ vַyָּbֵ֥a aֹtָ֛hּ aֵlָ֖yv aֶl־hַtֵּbָֽh׃

8.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣חֶל ע֔וֹד שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וַיֹּ֛סֶף שַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הַיּוֹנָ֖ה מִן־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
8.englishText: He waited another seven days, and again sent out the dove from the ark.
8.transliteration: vַyָּ֣chֶl a֔vֹd shִׁbְaַ֥t yָmִ֖yם aֲchֵrִ֑yם vַyֹּ֛sֶף shַׁlַּ֥ch aֶt־hַyּvֹnָ֖h mִן־hַtֵּbָֽh׃

8.hebrewText: וַתָּבֹ֨א אֵלָ֤יו הַיּוֹנָה֙ לְעֵ֣ת עֶ֔רֶב וְהִנֵּ֥ה עֲלֵה־זַ֖יִת טָרָ֣ף בְּפִ֑יהָ וַיֵּ֣דַע נֹ֔חַ כִּי־קַ֥לּוּ הַמַּ֖יִם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
8.englishText: The dove came back to him toward evening, and there in its bill was a plucked-off olive leaf! Then Noah knew that the waters had decreased on the earth.
8.transliteration: vַtָּbֹ֨a aֵlָ֤yv hַyּvֹnָh֙ lְaֵ֣t aֶ֔rֶb vְhִnֵּ֥h aֲlֵh־zַ֖yִt tָrָ֣ף bְּpִ֑yhָ vַyֵּ֣dַa nֹ֔chַ kִּy־kַ֥lּvּ hַmַּ֖yִם mֵaַ֥l hָaָֽrֶץ׃

8.hebrewText: וַיִּיָּ֣חֶל ע֔וֹד שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וַיְשַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־הַיּוֹנָ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יָסְפָ֥ה שׁוּב־אֵלָ֖יו עֽוֹד׃
8.englishText: He waited still another seven days and sent the dove forth; and it did not return to him any more.
8.transliteration: vַyִּyָּ֣chֶl a֔vֹd shִׁbְaַ֥t yָmִ֖yם aֲchֵrִ֑yם vַyְshַׁlַּch֙ aֶt־hַyּvֹnָ֔h vְlֹֽa־yָsְpָ֥h shׁvּb־aֵlָ֖yv aֽvֹd׃

8.hebrewText: וַ֠יְהִ֠י בְּאַחַ֨ת וְשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֜וֹת שָׁנָ֗ה בָּֽרִאשׁוֹן֙ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ חָֽרְב֥וּ הַמַּ֖יִם מֵעַ֣ל הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּ֤סַר נֹ֙חַ֙ אֶת־מִכְסֵ֣ה הַתֵּבָ֔ה וַיַּ֕רְא וְהִנֵּ֥ה חָֽרְב֖וּ פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
8.englishText: In the six hundred and first year, in the first month, on the first of the month, the waters began to dry from the earth; and when Noah removed the covering of the ark, he saw that the surface of the ground was drying.
8.transliteration: vַ֠yְhִ֠y bְּaַchַ֨t vְshֵׁshׁ־mֵa֜vֹt shָׁnָ֗h bָּֽrִashׁvֹן֙ bְּaֶchָ֣d lַchֹ֔dֶshׁ chָֽrְb֥vּ hַmַּ֖yִם mֵaַ֣l hָaָ֑rֶץ vַyָּ֤sַr nֹ֙chַ֙ aֶt־mִkְsֵ֣h hַtֵּbָ֔h vַyַּ֕rְa vְhִnֵּ֥h chָֽrְb֖vּ pְּnֵ֥y hָֽaֲdָmָֽh׃

8.hebrewText: וּבַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י בְּשִׁבְעָ֧ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ יָבְשָׁ֖ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
8.englishText: And in the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.
8.transliteration: vּbַchֹ֙dֶshׁ֙ hַshֵּׁnִ֔y bְּshִׁbְaָ֧h vְaֶshְׂrִ֛yם y֖vֹם lַchֹ֑dֶshׁ yָbְshָׁ֖h hָaָֽrֶץ׃ {s}

8.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־נֹ֥חַ לֵאמֹֽר׃
8.englishText: God spoke to Noah, saying,
8.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶl־nֹ֥chַ lֵamֹֽr׃

8.hebrewText: צֵ֖א מִן־הַתֵּבָ֑ה אַתָּ֕ה וְאִשְׁתְּךָ֛ וּבָנֶ֥יךָ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנֶ֖יךָ אִתָּֽךְ׃
8.englishText: “Come out of the ark, together with your wife, your sons, and your sons’ wives.
8.transliteration: tsֵ֖a mִן־hַtֵּbָ֑h aַtָּ֕h vְaִshְׁtְּךָ֛ vּbָnֶ֥yךָ vּnְshֵֽׁy־bָnֶ֖yךָ aִtָּֽךְ׃

8.hebrewText: כׇּל־הַחַיָּ֨ה אֲשֶֽׁר־אִתְּךָ֜ מִכׇּל־בָּשָׂ֗ר בָּע֧וֹף וּבַבְּהֵמָ֛ה וּבְכׇל־הָרֶ֛מֶשׂ הָרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ (הוצא) [הַיְצֵ֣א] אִתָּ֑ךְ וְשָֽׁרְצ֣וּ בָאָ֔רֶץ וּפָר֥וּ וְרָב֖וּ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
8.englishText: Bring out with you every living thing of all flesh that is with you: birds, animals, and everything that creeps on earth; and let them swarm on the earth and be fertile and increase on earth.”
8.transliteration: kׇּl־hַchַyָּ֨h aֲshֶֽׁr־aִtְּךָ֜ mִkׇּl־bָּshָׂ֗r bָּa֧vֹף vּbַbְּhֵmָ֛h vּbְkׇl־hָrֶ֛mֶshׂ hָrֹmֵ֥shׂ aַl־hָaָ֖rֶץ (hvtsa) [hַyְtsֵ֣a] aִtָּ֑ךְ vְshָֽׁrְts֣vּ bָaָ֔rֶץ vּpָr֥vּ vְrָb֖vּ aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

8.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֖צֵא־נֹ֑חַ וּבָנָ֛יו וְאִשְׁתּ֥וֹ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
8.englishText: So Noah came out, together with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives.
8.transliteration: vַyֵּ֖tsֵa־nֹ֑chַ vּbָnָ֛yv vְaִshְׁtּ֥vֹ vּnְshֵֽׁy־bָnָ֖yv aִtּֽvֹ׃

8.hebrewText: כׇּל־הַֽחַיָּ֗ה כׇּל־הָרֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ וְכׇל־הָע֔וֹף כֹּ֖ל רוֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם יָצְא֖וּ מִן־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
8.englishText: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, everything that stirs on earth came out of the ark by families.
8.transliteration: kׇּl־hַֽchַyָּ֗h kׇּl־hָrֶ֙mֶshׂ֙ vְkׇl־hָa֔vֹף kֹּ֖l rvֹmֵ֣shׂ aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ lְmִshְׁpְּchֹ֣tֵyhֶ֔ם yָtsְa֖vּ mִן־hַtֵּbָֽh׃

8.hebrewText: וַיִּ֥בֶן נֹ֛חַ מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֞ח מִכֹּ֣ל ׀ הַבְּהֵמָ֣ה הַטְּהֹרָ֗ה וּמִכֹּל֙ הָע֣וֹף הַטָּה֔וֹר וַיַּ֥עַל עֹלֹ֖ת בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
8.englishText: Then Noah built an altar to יהוה and, taking of every pure animal and of every pure bird, he offered burnt offerings on the altar.
8.transliteration: vַyִּ֥bֶן nֹ֛chַ mִzְbֵּ֖chַ lַֽyhֹvָ֑h vַyִּkַּ֞ch mִkֹּ֣l ׀ hַbְּhֵmָ֣h hַtְּhֹrָ֗h vּmִkֹּl֙ hָa֣vֹף hַtָּh֔vֹr vַyַּ֥aַl aֹlֹ֖t bַּmִּzְbֵּֽchַ׃

8.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣רַח יְהֹוָה֮ אֶת־רֵ֣יחַ הַנִּיחֹ֒חַ֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־לִבּ֗וֹ לֹֽא־אֹ֠סִ֠ף לְקַלֵּ֨ל ע֤וֹד אֶת־הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ בַּעֲב֣וּר הָֽאָדָ֔ם כִּ֠י יֵ֣צֶר לֵ֧ב הָאָדָ֛ם רַ֖ע מִנְּעֻרָ֑יו וְלֹֽא־אֹסִ֥ף ע֛וֹד לְהַכּ֥וֹת אֶת־כׇּל־חַ֖י כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִֽׂיתִי׃
8.englishText: יהוה smelled the pleasing odor, and יהוה resolved: “Never again will I doom the earth because of humankind, since the devisings of the human mind are evil from youth; nor will I ever again destroy every living being, as I have done.
8.transliteration: vַyָּ֣rַch yְhֹvָh֮ aֶt־rֵ֣ychַ hַnִּychֹ֒chַ֒ vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h aֶl־lִbּ֗vֹ lֹֽa־aֹ֠sִ֠ף lְkַlֵּ֨l a֤vֹd aֶt־hָֽaֲdָmָh֙ bַּaֲb֣vּr hָֽaָdָ֔ם kִּ֠y yֵ֣tsֶr lֵ֧b hָaָdָ֛ם rַ֖a mִnְּaֻrָ֑yv vְlֹֽa־aֹsִ֥ף a֛vֹd lְhַkּ֥vֹt aֶt־kׇּl־chַ֖y kַּֽaֲshֶׁ֥r aָshִֽׂytִy׃

8.hebrewText: עֹ֖ד כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ זֶ֡רַע וְ֠קָצִ֠יר וְקֹ֨ר וָחֹ֜ם וְקַ֧יִץ וָחֹ֛רֶף וְי֥וֹם וָלַ֖יְלָה לֹ֥א יִשְׁבֹּֽתוּ׃
8.englishText:
So long as the earth endures,
Seedtime and harvest,
Cold and heat,
Summer and winter,
Day and night
Shall not cease.”
8.transliteration: aֹ֖d kׇּl־yְmֵ֣y hָaָ֑rֶץ zֶ֡rַa vְ֠kָtsִ֠yr vְkֹ֨r vָchֹ֜ם vְkַ֧yִץ vָchֹ֛rֶף vְy֥vֹם vָlַ֖yְlָh lֹ֥a yִshְׁbֹּֽtvּ׃

9.hebrewText: וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־נֹ֖חַ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֧אמֶר לָהֶ֛ם פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֖וּ וּמִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
9.englishText: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Be fertile and increase, and fill the earth.
9.transliteration: vַyְbָ֣rֶךְ aֱlֹhִ֔yם aֶt־nֹ֖chַ vְaֶt־bָּnָ֑yv vַyֹּ֧amֶr lָhֶ֛ם pְּr֥vּ vּrְb֖vּ vּmִlְa֥vּ aֶt־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

9.hebrewText: וּמוֹרַאֲכֶ֤ם וְחִתְּכֶם֙ יִֽהְיֶ֔ה עַ֚ל כׇּל־חַיַּ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם בְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּרְמֹ֧שׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֛ה וּֽבְכׇל־דְּגֵ֥י הַיָּ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶ֥ם נִתָּֽנוּ׃
9.englishText: The fear and the dread of you shall be upon all the beasts of the earth and upon all the birds of the sky—everything with which the earth is astir—and upon all the fish of the sea; they are given into your hand.
9.transliteration: vּmvֹrַaֲkֶ֤ם vְchִtְּkֶם֙ yִֽhְyֶ֔h aַ֚l kׇּl־chַyַּ֣t hָaָ֔rֶץ vְaַ֖l kׇּl־a֣vֹף hַshָּׁmָ֑yִם bְּkֹl֩ aֲshֶׁ֨r tִּrְmֹ֧shׂ hָֽaֲdָmָ֛h vּֽbְkׇl־dְּgֵ֥y hַyָּ֖ם bְּyֶdְkֶ֥ם nִtָּֽnvּ׃

9.hebrewText: כׇּל־רֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוּא־חַ֔י לָכֶ֥ם יִהְיֶ֖ה לְאׇכְלָ֑ה כְּיֶ֣רֶק עֵ֔שֶׂב נָתַ֥תִּי לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־כֹּֽל׃
9.englishText: Every creature that lives shall be yours to eat; as with the green grasses, I give you all these.
9.transliteration: kׇּl־rֶ֙mֶshׂ֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r hvּa־chַ֔y lָkֶ֥ם yִhְyֶ֖h lְaׇkְlָ֑h kְּyֶ֣rֶk aֵ֔shֶׂb nָtַ֥tִּy lָkֶ֖ם aֶt־kֹּֽl׃

9.hebrewText: אַךְ־בָּשָׂ֕ר בְּנַפְשׁ֥וֹ דָמ֖וֹ לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
9.englishText: You must not, however, eat flesh with its life-blood in it.
9.transliteration: aַךְ־bָּshָׂ֕r bְּnַpְshׁ֥vֹ dָm֖vֹ lֹ֥a tֹakֵֽlvּ׃

9.hebrewText: וְאַ֨ךְ אֶת־דִּמְכֶ֤ם לְנַפְשֹֽׁתֵיכֶם֙ אֶדְרֹ֔שׁ מִיַּ֥ד כׇּל־חַיָּ֖ה אֶדְרְשֶׁ֑נּוּ וּמִיַּ֣ד הָֽאָדָ֗ם מִיַּד֙ אִ֣ישׁ אָחִ֔יו אֶדְרֹ֖שׁ אֶת־נֶ֥פֶשׁ הָֽאָדָֽם׃
9.englishText: But for your own life-blood I will require a reckoning: I will require it of every beast; of humankind, too, will I require a reckoning for human life, of everyone for each other!
9.transliteration: vְaַ֨ךְ aֶt־dִּmְkֶ֤ם lְnַpְshֹֽׁtֵykֶם֙ aֶdְrֹ֔shׁ mִyַּ֥d kׇּl־chַyָּ֖h aֶdְrְshֶׁ֑nּvּ vּmִyַּ֣d hָֽaָdָ֗ם mִyַּd֙ aִ֣yshׁ aָchִ֔yv aֶdְrֹ֖shׁ aֶt־nֶ֥pֶshׁ hָֽaָdָֽם׃

9.hebrewText: שֹׁפֵךְ֙ דַּ֣ם הָֽאָדָ֔ם בָּֽאָדָ֖ם דָּמ֣וֹ יִשָּׁפֵ֑ךְ כִּ֚י בְּצֶ֣לֶם אֱלֹהִ֔ים עָשָׂ֖ה אֶת־הָאָדָֽם׃
9.englishText:
Whoever sheds human blood,
By human [hands] shall that one’s blood be shed;
For in the image of God
Was humankind made.
9.transliteration: shֹׁpֵךְ֙ dַּ֣ם hָֽaָdָ֔ם bָּֽaָdָ֖ם dָּm֣vֹ yִshָּׁpֵ֑ךְ kִּ֚y bְּtsֶ֣lֶם aֱlֹhִ֔yם aָshָׂ֖h aֶt־hָaָdָֽם׃

9.hebrewText: וְאַתֶּ֖ם פְּר֣וּ וּרְב֑וּ שִׁרְצ֥וּ בָאָ֖רֶץ וּרְבוּ־בָֽהּ׃ {ס}
9.englishText: Be fertile, then, and increase; abound on the earth and increase on it.”
9.transliteration: vְaַtֶּ֖ם pְּr֣vּ vּrְb֑vּ shִׁrְts֥vּ bָaָ֖rֶץ vּrְbvּ־bָֽhּ׃ {s}

9.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־נֹ֔חַ וְאֶל־בָּנָ֥יו אִתּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
9.englishText: And God said to Noah and to his sons with him,
9.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶl־nֹ֔chַ vְaֶl־bָּnָ֥yv aִtּ֖vֹ lֵamֹֽr׃

9.hebrewText: וַאֲנִ֕י הִנְנִ֥י מֵקִ֛ים אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְאֶֽת־זַרְעֲכֶ֖ם אַֽחֲרֵיכֶֽם׃
9.englishText: “I now establish My covenant with you and your offspring to come,
9.transliteration: vַaֲnִ֕y hִnְnִ֥y mֵkִ֛yם aֶt־bְּrִytִ֖y aִtְּkֶ֑ם vְaֶֽt־zַrְaֲkֶ֖ם aַֽchֲrֵykֶֽם׃

9.hebrewText: וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־נֶ֤פֶשׁ הַֽחַיָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתְּכֶ֔ם בָּע֧וֹף בַּבְּהֵמָ֛ה וּֽבְכׇל־חַיַּ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ אִתְּכֶ֑ם מִכֹּל֙ יֹצְאֵ֣י הַתֵּבָ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל חַיַּ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
9.englishText: and with every living thing that is with you—birds, cattle, and every wild beast as well—all that have come out of the ark, every living thing on earth.
9.transliteration: vְaֵ֨t kׇּl־nֶ֤pֶshׁ hַֽchַyָּh֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aִtְּkֶ֔ם bָּa֧vֹף bַּbְּhֵmָ֛h vּֽbְkׇl־chַyַּ֥t hָaָ֖rֶץ aִtְּkֶ֑ם mִkֹּl֙ yֹtsְaֵ֣y hַtֵּbָ֔h lְkֹ֖l chַyַּ֥t hָaָֽrֶץ׃

9.hebrewText: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֤י אֶת־בְּרִיתִי֙ אִתְּכֶ֔ם וְלֹֽא־יִכָּרֵ֧ת כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֛ר ע֖וֹד מִמֵּ֣י הַמַּבּ֑וּל וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה ע֛וֹד מַבּ֖וּל לְשַׁחֵ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
9.englishText: I will maintain My covenant with you: never again shall all flesh be cut off by the waters of a flood, and never again shall there be a flood to destroy the earth.”
9.transliteration: vַhֲkִmֹtִ֤y aֶt־bְּrִytִy֙ aִtְּkֶ֔ם vְlֹֽa־yִkָּrֵ֧t kׇּl־bָּshָׂ֛r a֖vֹd mִmֵּ֣y hַmַּbּ֑vּl vְlֹֽa־yִhְyֶ֥h a֛vֹd mַbּ֖vּl lְshַׁchֵ֥t hָaָֽrֶץ׃

9.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים זֹ֤את אֽוֹת־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֣י נֹתֵ֗ן בֵּינִי֙ וּבֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵ֛ין כׇּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתְּכֶ֑ם לְדֹרֹ֖ת עוֹלָֽם׃
9.englishText: God further said, “This is the sign that I set for the covenant between Me and you, and every living creature with you, for all ages to come.
9.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֗yם zֹ֤at aֽvֹt־hַbְּrִyt֙ aֲshֶׁr־aֲnִ֣y nֹtֵ֗ן bֵּynִy֙ vּbֵ֣ynֵykֶ֔ם vּbֵ֛yן kׇּl־nֶ֥pֶshׁ chַyָּ֖h aֲshֶׁ֣r aִtְּkֶ֑ם lְdֹrֹ֖t avֹlָֽם׃

9.hebrewText: אֶת־קַשְׁתִּ֕י נָתַ֖תִּי בֶּֽעָנָ֑ן וְהָֽיְתָה֙ לְא֣וֹת בְּרִ֔ית בֵּינִ֖י וּבֵ֥ין הָאָֽרֶץ׃
9.englishText: I have set My bow in the clouds, and it shall serve as a sign of the covenant between Me and the earth.
9.transliteration: aֶt־kַshְׁtִּ֕y nָtַ֖tִּy bֶּֽaָnָ֑ן vְhָֽyְtָh֙ lְa֣vֹt bְּrִ֔yt bֵּynִ֖y vּbֵ֥yן hָaָֽrֶץ׃

9.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֕ה בְּעַֽנְנִ֥י עָנָ֖ן עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְנִרְאֲתָ֥ה הַקֶּ֖שֶׁת בֶּעָנָֽן׃
9.englishText: When I bring clouds over the earth, and the bow appears in the clouds,
9.transliteration: vְhָyָ֕h bְּaַֽnְnִ֥y aָnָ֖ן aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vְnִrְaֲtָ֥h hַkֶּ֖shֶׁt bֶּaָnָֽן׃

9.hebrewText: וְזָכַרְתִּ֣י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֤ר בֵּינִי֙ וּבֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵ֛ין כׇּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּ֖ה בְּכׇל־בָּשָׂ֑ר וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֨ה ע֤וֹד הַמַּ֙יִם֙ לְמַבּ֔וּל לְשַׁחֵ֖ת כׇּל־בָּשָֽׂר׃
9.englishText: I will remember My covenant between Me and you and every living creature among all flesh, so that the waters shall never again become a flood to destroy all flesh.
9.transliteration: vְzָkַrְtִּ֣y aֶt־bְּrִytִ֗y aֲshֶׁ֤r bֵּynִy֙ vּbֵ֣ynֵykֶ֔ם vּbֵ֛yן kׇּl־nֶ֥pֶshׁ chַyָּ֖h bְּkׇl־bָּshָׂ֑r vְlֹֽa־yִֽhְyֶ֨h a֤vֹd hַmַּ֙yִם֙ lְmַbּ֔vּl lְshַׁchֵ֖t kׇּl־bָּshָֽׂr׃

9.hebrewText: וְהָיְתָ֥ה הַקֶּ֖שֶׁת בֶּֽעָנָ֑ן וּרְאִיתִ֗יהָ לִזְכֹּר֙ בְּרִ֣ית עוֹלָ֔ם בֵּ֣ין אֱלֹהִ֔ים וּבֵין֙ כׇּל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֔ה בְּכׇל־בָּשָׂ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
9.englishText: When the bow is in the clouds, I will see it and remember the everlasting covenant between God and all living creatures, all flesh that is on earth.
9.transliteration: vְhָyְtָ֥h hַkֶּ֖shֶׁt bֶּֽaָnָ֑ן vּrְaִytִ֗yhָ lִzְkֹּr֙ bְּrִ֣yt avֹlָ֔ם bֵּ֣yן aֱlֹhִ֔yם vּbֵyן֙ kׇּl־nֶ֣pֶshׁ chַyָּ֔h bְּkׇl־bָּshָׂ֖r aֲshֶׁ֥r aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

9.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־נֹ֑חַ זֹ֤את אֽוֹת־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֲקִמֹ֔תִי בֵּינִ֕י וּבֵ֥ין כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
9.englishText: That,” God said to Noah, “shall be the sign of the covenant that I have established between Me and all flesh that is on earth.”
9.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶl־nֹ֑chַ zֹ֤at aֽvֹt־hַbְּrִyt֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r hֲkִmֹ֔tִy bֵּynִ֕y vּbֵ֥yן kׇּl־bָּshָׂ֖r aֲshֶׁ֥r aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃ {p}

9.hebrewText: וַיִּֽהְי֣וּ בְנֵי־נֹ֗חַ הַיֹּֽצְאִים֙ מִן־הַתֵּבָ֔ה שֵׁ֖ם וְחָ֣ם וָיָ֑פֶת וְחָ֕ם ה֖וּא אֲבִ֥י כְנָֽעַן׃
9.englishText: The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth—Ham being the father of Canaan.
9.transliteration: vַyִּֽhְy֣vּ bְnֵy־nֹ֗chַ hַyֹּֽtsְaִyם֙ mִן־hַtֵּbָ֔h shֵׁ֖ם vְchָ֣ם vָyָ֑pֶt vְchָ֕ם h֖vּa aֲbִ֥y kְnָֽaַן׃

9.hebrewText: שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵי־נֹ֑חַ וּמֵאֵ֖לֶּה נָֽפְצָ֥ה כׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
9.englishText: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole world branched out.
9.transliteration: shְׁlֹshָׁ֥h aֵ֖lֶּh bְּnֵy־nֹ֑chַ vּmֵaֵ֖lֶּh nָֽpְtsָ֥h kׇl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

9.hebrewText: וַיָּ֥חֶל נֹ֖חַ אִ֣ישׁ הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה וַיִּטַּ֖ע כָּֽרֶם׃
9.englishText: Noah, the tiller of the soil,*the tiller of the soil Or “a man of the soil.” was the first to plant a vineyard.
9.transliteration: vַyָּ֥chֶl nֹ֖chַ aִ֣yshׁ hָֽaֲdָmָ֑h vַyִּtַּ֖a kָּֽrֶם׃

9.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥שְׁתְּ מִן־הַיַּ֖יִן וַיִּשְׁכָּ֑ר וַיִּתְגַּ֖ל בְּת֥וֹךְ אׇהֳלֹֽה׃
9.englishText: He drank of the wine and became drunk, and he uncovered himself within his tent.
9.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥shְׁtְּ mִן־hַyַּ֖yִן vַyִּshְׁkָּ֑r vַyִּtְgַּ֖l bְּt֥vֹךְ aׇhֳlֹֽh׃

9.hebrewText: וַיַּ֗רְא חָ֚ם אֲבִ֣י כְנַ֔עַן אֵ֖ת עֶרְוַ֣ת אָבִ֑יו וַיַּגֵּ֥ד לִשְׁנֵֽי־אֶחָ֖יו בַּחֽוּץ׃
9.englishText: Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father’s nakedness and told his two brothers outside.
9.transliteration: vַyַּ֗rְa chָ֚ם aֲbִ֣y kְnַ֔aַן aֵ֖t aֶrְvַ֣t aָbִ֑yv vַyַּgֵּ֥d lִshְׁnֵֽy־aֶchָ֖yv bַּchֽvּץ׃

9.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּח֩ שֵׁ֨ם וָיֶ֜פֶת אֶת־הַשִּׂמְלָ֗ה וַיָּשִׂ֙ימוּ֙ עַל־שְׁכֶ֣ם שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ אֲחֹ֣רַנִּ֔ית וַיְכַסּ֕וּ אֵ֖ת עֶרְוַ֣ת אֲבִיהֶ֑ם וּפְנֵיהֶם֙ אֲחֹ֣רַנִּ֔ית וְעֶרְוַ֥ת אֲבִיהֶ֖ם לֹ֥א רָאֽוּ׃
9.englishText: But Shem and Japheth took a cloth, placed it against both their backs and, walking backward, they covered their father’s nakedness; their faces were turned the other way, so that they did not see their father’s nakedness.
9.transliteration: vַyִּkַּch֩ shֵׁ֨ם vָyֶ֜pֶt aֶt־hַshִּׂmְlָ֗h vַyָּshִׂ֙ymvּ֙ aַl־shְׁkֶ֣ם shְׁnֵyhֶ֔ם vַyֵּֽlְkvּ֙ aֲchֹ֣rַnִּ֔yt vַyְkַsּ֕vּ aֵ֖t aֶrְvַ֣t aֲbִyhֶ֑ם vּpְnֵyhֶם֙ aֲchֹ֣rַnִּ֔yt vְaֶrְvַ֥t aֲbִyhֶ֖ם lֹ֥a rָaֽvּ׃

9.hebrewText: וַיִּ֥יקֶץ נֹ֖חַ מִיֵּינ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֕דַע אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥שָׂה ל֖וֹ בְּנ֥וֹ הַקָּטָֽן׃
9.englishText: When Noah woke up from his wine and learned what his youngest son had done to him,
9.transliteration: vַyִּ֥ykֶץ nֹ֖chַ mִyֵּyn֑vֹ vַyֵּ֕dַa aֵ֛t aֲshֶׁr־aָ֥shָׂh l֖vֹ bְּn֥vֹ hַkָּtָֽן׃

9.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָר֣וּר כְּנָ֑עַן עֶ֥בֶד עֲבָדִ֖ים יִֽהְיֶ֥ה לְאֶחָֽיו׃
9.englishText:
he said,
“Cursed be Canaan;
The lowest of slaves
Shall he be to his brothers.”
9.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr aָr֣vּr kְּnָ֑aַן aֶ֥bֶd aֲbָdִ֖yם yִֽhְyֶ֥h lְaֶchָֽyv׃

9.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹ֣הֵי שֵׁ֑ם וִיהִ֥י כְנַ֖עַן עֶ֥בֶד לָֽמוֹ׃
9.englishText:
And he said,
“Blessed be יהוה,
The God of Shem;
Let Canaan be a slave to them.
9.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr bָּr֥vּךְ yְhֹvָ֖h aֱlֹ֣hֵy shֵׁ֑ם vִyhִ֥y kְnַ֖aַן aֶ֥bֶd lָֽmvֹ׃

9.hebrewText: יַ֤פְתְּ אֱלֹהִים֙ לְיֶ֔פֶת וְיִשְׁכֹּ֖ן בְּאׇֽהֳלֵי־שֵׁ֑ם וִיהִ֥י כְנַ֖עַן עֶ֥בֶד לָֽמוֹ׃
9.englishText:
May God enlarge*enlarge Heb. yapht, play on Heb. yepheth “Japheth.” Japheth,
And let him dwell in the tents of Shem;
And let Canaan be a slave to them.”
9.transliteration: yַ֤pְtְּ aֱlֹhִyם֙ lְyֶ֔pֶt vְyִshְׁkֹּ֖ן bְּaׇֽhֳlֵy־shֵׁ֑ם vִyhִ֥y kְnַ֖aַן aֶ֥bֶd lָֽmvֹ׃

9.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־נֹ֖חַ אַחַ֣ר הַמַּבּ֑וּל שְׁלֹ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַֽחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
9.englishText: Noah lived after the Flood 350 years.
9.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־nֹ֖chַ aַchַ֣r hַmַּbּ֑vּl shְׁlֹ֤shׁ mֵavֹt֙ shָׁnָ֔h vַֽchֲmִshִּׁ֖yם shָׁnָֽh׃

9.hebrewText: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙*(בספרי ספרד ואשכנז וַֽיְהִי֙) כׇּל־יְמֵי־נֹ֔חַ תְּשַׁ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {פ}
9.englishText: And all the days of Noah came to 950 years; then he died.
9.transliteration: vַyִּֽhְyvּ֙*(bspry sprd vashknz vַֽyְhִy֙) kׇּl־yְmֵy־nֹ֔chַ tְּshַׁ֤a mֵavֹt֙ shָׁnָ֔h vַchֲmִshִּׁ֖yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּmֹֽt׃ {p}

10.hebrewText: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת בְּנֵי־נֹ֔חַ שֵׁ֖ם חָ֣ם וָיָ֑פֶת וַיִּוָּלְד֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם בָּנִ֖ים אַחַ֥ר הַמַּבּֽוּל׃
10.englishText: These are the lines of Shem, Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah: sons were born to them after the Flood.
10.transliteration: vְaֵ֙lֶּh֙ tּvֹlְdֹ֣t bְּnֵy־nֹ֔chַ shֵׁ֖ם chָ֣ם vָyָ֑pֶt vַyִּvָּlְd֥vּ lָhֶ֛ם bָּnִ֖yם aַchַ֥r hַmַּbּֽvּl׃

10.hebrewText: בְּנֵ֣י יֶ֔פֶת גֹּ֣מֶר וּמָג֔וֹג וּמָדַ֖י וְיָוָ֣ן וְתֻבָ֑ל וּמֶ֖שֶׁךְ וְתִירָֽס׃
10.englishText: The descendants of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
10.transliteration: bְּnֵ֣y yֶ֔pֶt gֹּ֣mֶr vּmָg֔vֹg vּmָdַ֖y vְyָvָ֣ן vְtֻbָ֑l vּmֶ֖shֶׁךְ vְtִyrָֽs׃

10.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֖י גֹּ֑מֶר אַשְׁכְּנַ֥ז וְרִיפַ֖ת וְתֹגַרְמָֽה׃
10.englishText: The descendants of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
10.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֖y gֹּ֑mֶr aַshְׁkְּnַ֥z vְrִypַ֖t vְtֹgַrְmָֽh׃

10.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֥י יָוָ֖ן אֱלִישָׁ֣ה וְתַרְשִׁ֑ישׁ כִּתִּ֖ים וְדֹדָנִֽים׃
10.englishText: The descendants of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish, the Kittim and the Dodanim.*Dodanim Septuagint and 1 Chron. 1.7 “Rodanim.”
10.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֥y yָvָ֖ן aֱlִyshָׁ֣h vְtַrְshִׁ֑yshׁ kִּtִּ֖yם vְdֹdָnִֽyם׃

10.hebrewText: מֵ֠אֵ֠לֶּה נִפְרְד֞וּ אִיֵּ֤י הַגּוֹיִם֙ בְּאַרְצֹתָ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ לִלְשֹׁנ֑וֹ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם בְּגוֹיֵהֶֽם׃
10.englishText: From these the maritime nations branched out. [These are the descendants of Japheth]*[These are the descendants of Japheth] Cf. vv. 20 and 31. by their lands—each with its language—their clans and their nations.
10.transliteration: mֵ֠aֵ֠lֶּh nִpְrְd֞vּ aִyֵּ֤y hַgּvֹyִם֙ bְּaַrְtsֹtָ֔ם aִ֖yshׁ lִlְshֹׁn֑vֹ lְmִshְׁpְּchֹtָ֖ם bְּgvֹyֵhֶֽם׃

10.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֖י חָ֑ם כּ֥וּשׁ וּמִצְרַ֖יִם וּפ֥וּט וּכְנָֽעַן׃
10.englishText: The descendants of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
10.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֖y chָ֑ם kּ֥vּshׁ vּmִtsְrַ֖yִם vּp֥vּt vּkְnָֽaַן׃

10.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֣י כ֔וּשׁ סְבָא֙ וַֽחֲוִילָ֔ה וְסַבְתָּ֥ה וְרַעְמָ֖ה וְסַבְתְּכָ֑א וּבְנֵ֥י רַעְמָ֖ה שְׁבָ֥א וּדְדָֽן׃
10.englishText: The descendants of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The descendants of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
10.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֣y k֔vּshׁ sְbָa֙ vַֽchֲvִylָ֔h vְsַbְtָּ֥h vְrַaְmָ֖h vְsַbְtְּkָ֑a vּbְnֵ֥y rַaְmָ֖h shְׁbָ֥a vּdְdָֽן׃

10.hebrewText: וְכ֖וּשׁ יָלַ֣ד אֶת־נִמְרֹ֑ד ה֣וּא הֵחֵ֔ל לִֽהְי֥וֹת גִּבֹּ֖ר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
10.englishText: Cush also begot Nimrod, who was the first mighty figure on earth.
10.transliteration: vְk֖vּshׁ yָlַ֣d aֶt־nִmְrֹ֑d h֣vּa hֵchֵ֔l lִֽhְy֥vֹt gִּbֹּ֖r bָּaָֽrֶץ׃

10.hebrewText: הֽוּא־הָיָ֥ה גִבֹּֽר־צַ֖יִד לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֙ יֵֽאָמַ֔ר כְּנִמְרֹ֛ד גִּבּ֥וֹר צַ֖יִד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
10.englishText: He was a mighty hunter by the grace of יהוה; hence the saying, “Like Nimrod a mighty hunter by the grace of יהוה.”
10.transliteration: hֽvּa־hָyָ֥h gִbֹּֽr־tsַ֖yִd lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h aַl־kֵּן֙ yֵֽaָmַ֔r kְּnִmְrֹ֛d gִּbּ֥vֹr tsַ֖yִd lִpְnֵ֥y yְhֹvָֽh׃

10.hebrewText: וַתְּהִ֨י רֵאשִׁ֤ית מַמְלַכְתּוֹ֙ בָּבֶ֔ל וְאֶ֖רֶךְ וְאַכַּ֣ד וְכַלְנֵ֑ה בְּאֶ֖רֶץ שִׁנְעָֽר׃
10.englishText: The mainstays of his kingdom were Babylon, Erech, Accad, and Calneh*and Calneh Heb. we-khalneh, better vocalized we-khullanah “all of them being.” in the land of Shinar.
10.transliteration: vַtְּhִ֨y rֵashִׁ֤yt mַmְlַkְtּvֹ֙ bָּbֶ֔l vְaֶ֖rֶךְ vְaַkַּ֣d vְkַlְnֵ֑h bְּaֶ֖rֶץ shִׁnְaָֽr׃

10.hebrewText: מִן־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַהִ֖וא יָצָ֣א אַשּׁ֑וּר וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ אֶת־נִ֣ינְוֵ֔ה וְאֶת־רְחֹבֹ֥ת עִ֖יר וְאֶת־כָּֽלַח׃
10.englishText: From that land Asshur went forth and built Nineveh, Rehoboth-ir, Calah,
10.transliteration: mִן־hָaָ֥rֶץ hַhִ֖va yָtsָ֣a aַshּׁ֑vּr vַyִּ֙bֶן֙ aֶt־nִ֣ynְvֵ֔h vְaֶt־rְchֹbֹ֥t aִ֖yr vְaֶt־kָּֽlַch׃

10.hebrewText: וְֽאֶת־רֶ֔סֶן בֵּ֥ין נִֽינְוֵ֖ה וּבֵ֣ין כָּ֑לַח הִ֖וא הָעִ֥יר הַגְּדֹלָֽה׃
10.englishText: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah, that is the great city.
10.transliteration: vְֽaֶt־rֶ֔sֶן bֵּ֥yן nִֽynְvֵ֖h vּbֵ֣yן kָּ֑lַch hִ֖va hָaִ֥yr hַgְּdֹlָֽh׃

10.hebrewText: וּמִצְרַ֡יִם יָלַ֞ד אֶת־לוּדִ֧ים וְאֶת־עֲנָמִ֛ים וְאֶת־לְהָבִ֖ים וְאֶת־נַפְתֻּחִֽים׃
10.englishText: And Mizraim begot the Ludim, the Anamim, the Lehabim, the Naphtuhim,
10.transliteration: vּmִtsְrַ֡yִם yָlַ֞d aֶt־lvּdִ֧yם vְaֶt־aֲnָmִ֛yם vְaֶt־lְhָbִ֖yם vְaֶt־nַpְtֻּchִֽyם׃

10.hebrewText: וְֽאֶת־פַּתְרֻסִ֞ים וְאֶת־כַּסְלֻחִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצְא֥וּ מִשָּׁ֛ם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וְאֶת־כַּפְתֹּרִֽים׃ {ס}
10.englishText: the Pathrusim, the Casluhim, and the Caphtorim,*Caphtorim I.e., the Cretans; moved up for the sake of clarity; cf. Amos 9.7. whence the Philistines came forth.
10.transliteration: vְֽaֶt־pַּtְrֻsִ֞yם vְaֶt־kַּsְlֻchִ֗yם aֲshֶׁ֨r yָtsְa֥vּ mִshָּׁ֛ם pְּlִshְׁtִּ֖yם vְaֶt־kַּpְtֹּrִֽyם׃ {s}

10.hebrewText: וּכְנַ֗עַן יָלַ֛ד אֶת־צִידֹ֥ן בְּכֹר֖וֹ וְאֶת־חֵֽת׃
10.englishText: Canaan begot Sidon, his first-born, and Heth;
10.transliteration: vּkְnַ֗aַן yָlַ֛d aֶt־tsִydֹ֥ן bְּkֹr֖vֹ vְaֶt־chֵֽt׃

10.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַיְבוּסִי֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י וְאֵ֖ת הַגִּרְגָּשִֽׁי׃
10.englishText: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
10.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַyְbvּsִy֙ vְaֶt־hָ֣aֱmֹrִ֔y vְaֵ֖t hַgִּrְgָּshִֽׁy׃

10.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַֽחִוִּ֥י וְאֶת־הַֽעַרְקִ֖י וְאֶת־הַסִּינִֽי׃
10.englishText: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
10.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַֽchִvִּ֥y vְaֶt־hַֽaַrְkִ֖y vְaֶt־hַsִּynִֽy׃

10.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְוָדִ֥י וְאֶת־הַצְּמָרִ֖י וְאֶת־הַֽחֲמָתִ֑י וְאַחַ֣ר נָפֹ֔צוּ מִשְׁפְּח֖וֹת הַֽכְּנַעֲנִֽי׃
10.englishText: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Afterward the clans of the Canaanites spread out.
10.transliteration: vְaֶt־hָֽaַrְvָdִ֥y vְaֶt־hַtsְּmָrִ֖y vְaֶt־hַֽchֲmָtִ֑y vְaַchַ֣r nָpֹ֔tsvּ mִshְׁpְּch֖vֹt hַֽkְּnַaֲnִֽy׃

10.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֞י גְּב֤וּל הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ מִצִּידֹ֔ן בֹּאֲכָ֥ה גְרָ֖רָה עַד־עַזָּ֑ה בֹּאֲכָ֞ה סְדֹ֧מָה וַעֲמֹרָ֛ה וְאַדְמָ֥ה וּצְבֹיִ֖ם עַד־לָֽשַׁע׃
10.englishText: (The [original] Canaanite territory extended from Sidon as far as Gerar, near Gaza, and as far as Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, near Lasha.)
10.transliteration: vַyְhִ֞y gְּb֤vּl hַֽkְּnַaֲnִy֙ mִtsִּydֹ֔ן bֹּaֲkָ֥h gְrָ֖rָh aַd־aַzָּ֑h bֹּaֲkָ֞h sְdֹ֧mָh vַaֲmֹrָ֛h vְaַdְmָ֥h vּtsְbֹyִ֖ם aַd־lָֽshַׁa׃

10.hebrewText: אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵי־חָ֔ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לִלְשֹֽׁנֹתָ֑ם בְּאַרְצֹתָ֖ם בְּגוֹיֵהֶֽם׃ {ס}
10.englishText: These are the descendants of Ham, according to their clans and languages, by their lands and nations.
10.transliteration: aֵ֣lֶּh bְnֵy־chָ֔ם lְmִshְׁpְּchֹtָ֖ם lִlְshֹֽׁnֹtָ֑ם bְּaַrְtsֹtָ֖ם bְּgvֹyֵhֶֽם׃ {s}

10.hebrewText: וּלְשֵׁ֥ם יֻלַּ֖ד גַּם־ה֑וּא אֲבִי֙ כׇּל־בְּנֵי־עֵ֔בֶר אֲחִ֖י יֶ֥פֶת הַגָּדֽוֹל׃
10.englishText: Sons were also born to Shem, ancestor of all the descendants of Eber and older brother of Japheth.
10.transliteration: vּlְshֵׁ֥ם yֻlַּ֖d gַּם־h֑vּa aֲbִy֙ kׇּl־bְּnֵy־aֵ֔bֶr aֲchִ֖y yֶ֥pֶt hַgָּdֽvֹl׃

10.hebrewText: בְּנֵ֥י שֵׁ֖ם עֵילָ֣ם וְאַשּׁ֑וּר וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֖ד וְל֥וּד וַֽאֲרָֽם׃
10.englishText: The descendants of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.
10.transliteration: bְּnֵ֥y shֵׁ֖ם aֵylָ֣ם vְaַshּׁ֑vּr vְaַrְpַּkְshַׁ֖d vְl֥vּd vַֽaֲrָֽם׃

10.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֖י אֲרָ֑ם ע֥וּץ וְח֖וּל וְגֶ֥תֶר וָמַֽשׁ׃
10.englishText: The descendants of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
10.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֖y aֲrָ֑ם a֥vּץ vְch֖vּl vְgֶ֥tֶr vָmַֽshׁ׃

10.hebrewText: וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֖ד יָלַ֣ד אֶת־שָׁ֑לַח וְשֶׁ֖לַח יָלַ֥ד אֶת־עֵֽבֶר׃
10.englishText: Arpachshad begot Shelah, and Shelah begot Eber.
10.transliteration: vְaַrְpַּkְshַׁ֖d yָlַ֣d aֶt־shָׁ֑lַch vְshֶׁ֖lַch yָlַ֥d aֶt־aֵֽbֶr׃

10.hebrewText: וּלְעֵ֥בֶר יֻלַּ֖ד שְׁנֵ֣י בָנִ֑ים שֵׁ֣ם הָֽאֶחָ֞ד פֶּ֗לֶג כִּ֤י בְיָמָיו֙ נִפְלְגָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ וְשֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו יׇקְטָֽן׃
10.englishText: Two sons were born to Eber: the name of the first was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided;*divided Heb. niphlegah, play on “Peleg.” and the name of his brother was Joktan.
10.transliteration: vּlְaֵ֥bֶr yֻlַּ֖d shְׁnֵ֣y bָnִ֑yם shֵׁ֣ם hָֽaֶchָ֞d pֶּ֗lֶg kִּ֤y bְyָmָyv֙ nִpְlְgָ֣h hָaָ֔rֶץ vְshֵׁ֥ם aָchִ֖yv yׇkְtָֽן׃

10.hebrewText: וְיׇקְטָ֣ן יָלַ֔ד אֶת־אַלְמוֹדָ֖ד וְאֶת־שָׁ֑לֶף וְאֶת־חֲצַרְמָ֖וֶת וְאֶת־יָֽרַח׃
10.englishText: Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
10.transliteration: vְyׇkְtָ֣ן yָlַ֔d aֶt־aַlְmvֹdָ֖d vְaֶt־shָׁ֑lֶף vְaֶt־chֲtsַrְmָ֖vֶt vְaֶt־yָֽrַch׃

10.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הֲדוֹרָ֥ם וְאֶת־אוּזָ֖ל וְאֶת־דִּקְלָֽה׃
10.englishText: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
10.transliteration: vְaֶt־hֲdvֹrָ֥ם vְaֶt־avּzָ֖l vְaֶt־dִּkְlָֽh׃

10.hebrewText: וְאֶת־עוֹבָ֥ל וְאֶת־אֲבִֽימָאֵ֖ל וְאֶת־שְׁבָֽא׃
10.englishText: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
10.transliteration: vְaֶt־avֹbָ֥l vְaֶt־aֲbִֽymָaֵ֖l vְaֶt־shְׁbָֽa׃

10.hebrewText: וְאֶת־אוֹפִ֥ר וְאֶת־חֲוִילָ֖ה וְאֶת־יוֹבָ֑ב כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י יׇקְטָֽן׃
10.englishText: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the descendants of Joktan.
10.transliteration: vְaֶt־avֹpִ֥r vְaֶt־chֲvִylָ֖h vְaֶt־yvֹbָ֑b kׇּl־aֵ֖lֶּh bְּnֵ֥y yׇkְtָֽן׃

10.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֥י מוֹשָׁבָ֖ם מִמֵּשָׁ֑א בֹּאֲכָ֥ה סְפָ֖רָה הַ֥ר הַקֶּֽדֶם׃
10.englishText: Their settlements extended from Mesha as far as Sephar, the hill country to the east.
10.transliteration: vַyְhִ֥y mvֹshָׁbָ֖ם mִmֵּshָׁ֑a bֹּaֲkָ֥h sְpָ֖rָh hַ֥r hַkֶּֽdֶם׃

10.hebrewText: אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵי־שֵׁ֔ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לִלְשֹׁנֹתָ֑ם בְּאַרְצֹתָ֖ם לְגוֹיֵהֶֽם׃
10.englishText: These are the descendants of Shem according to their clans and languages, by their lands, according to their nations.
10.transliteration: aֵ֣lֶּh bְnֵy־shֵׁ֔ם lְmִshְׁpְּchֹtָ֖ם lִlְshֹׁnֹtָ֑ם bְּaַrְtsֹtָ֖ם lְgvֹyֵhֶֽם׃

10.hebrewText: אֵ֣לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֧ת בְּנֵי־נֹ֛חַ לְתוֹלְדֹתָ֖ם בְּגוֹיֵהֶ֑ם וּמֵאֵ֜לֶּה נִפְרְד֧וּ הַגּוֹיִ֛ם בָּאָ֖רֶץ אַחַ֥ר הַמַּבּֽוּל׃ {פ}
10.englishText: These are the groupings of Noah’s descendants, according to their origins, by their nations; and from these the nations branched out over the earth after the Flood.
10.transliteration: aֵ֣lֶּh mִshְׁpְּchֹ֧t bְּnֵy־nֹ֛chַ lְtvֹlְdֹtָ֖ם bְּgvֹyֵhֶ֑ם vּmֵaֵ֜lֶּh nִpְrְd֧vּ hַgּvֹyִ֛ם bָּaָ֖rֶץ aַchַ֥r hַmַּbּֽvּl׃ {p}

11.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֥י כׇל־הָאָ֖רֶץ שָׂפָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת וּדְבָרִ֖ים אֲחָדִֽים׃
11.englishText: Everyone on earth had the same language and the same words.
11.transliteration: vַyְhִ֥y kׇl־hָaָ֖rֶץ shָׂpָ֣h aֶchָ֑t vּdְbָrִ֖yם aֲchָdִֽyם׃

11.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֖י בְּנׇסְעָ֣ם מִקֶּ֑דֶם וַֽיִּמְצְא֥וּ בִקְעָ֛ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ שִׁנְעָ֖ר וַיֵּ֥שְׁבוּ שָֽׁם׃
11.englishText: And as they migrated from the east, they came upon a valley in the land of Shinar and settled there.
11.transliteration: vַyְhִ֖y bְּnׇsְaָ֣ם mִkֶּ֑dֶם vַֽyִּmְtsְa֥vּ bִkְaָ֛h bְּaֶ֥rֶץ shִׁnְaָ֖r vַyֵּ֥shְׁbvּ shָֽׁם׃

11.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֗הוּ הָ֚בָה נִלְבְּנָ֣ה לְבֵנִ֔ים וְנִשְׂרְפָ֖ה לִשְׂרֵפָ֑ה וַתְּהִ֨י לָהֶ֤ם הַלְּבֵנָה֙ לְאָ֔בֶן וְהַ֣חֵמָ֔ר הָיָ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לַחֹֽמֶר׃
11.englishText: They said to one another, “Come, let us make bricks and burn them hard.”—Brick served them as stone, and bitumen served them as mortar.—
11.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֞vּ aִ֣yshׁ aֶl־rֵaֵ֗hvּ hָ֚bָh nִlְbְּnָ֣h lְbֵnִ֔yם vְnִshְׂrְpָ֖h lִshְׂrֵpָ֑h vַtְּhִ֨y lָhֶ֤ם hַlְּbֵnָh֙ lְaָ֔bֶן vְhַ֣chֵmָ֔r hָyָ֥h lָhֶ֖ם lַchֹֽmֶr׃

11.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ הָ֣בָה ׀ נִבְנֶה־לָּ֣נוּ עִ֗יר וּמִגְדָּל֙ וְרֹאשׁ֣וֹ בַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנַֽעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֖נוּ שֵׁ֑ם פֶּן־נָפ֖וּץ עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
11.englishText: And they said, “Come, let us build us a city, and a tower with its top in the sky, to make a name for ourselves; else we shall be scattered all over the world.”
11.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֞vּ hָ֣bָh ׀ nִbְnֶh־lָּ֣nvּ aִ֗yr vּmִgְdָּl֙ vְrֹashׁ֣vֹ bַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vְnַֽaֲshֶׂh־lָּ֖nvּ shֵׁ֑ם pֶּן־nָp֖vּץ aַl־pְּnֵ֥y kׇl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

11.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֣רֶד יְהֹוָ֔ה לִרְאֹ֥ת אֶת־הָעִ֖יר וְאֶת־הַמִּגְדָּ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י הָאָדָֽם׃
11.englishText: יהוה came down to look at the city and tower that humanity had built,
11.transliteration: vַyֵּ֣rֶd yְhֹvָ֔h lִrְaֹ֥t aֶt־hָaִ֖yr vְaֶt־hַmִּgְdָּ֑l aֲshֶׁ֥r bָּn֖vּ bְּnֵ֥y hָaָdָֽם׃

11.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה הֵ֣ן עַ֤ם אֶחָד֙ וְשָׂפָ֤ה אַחַת֙ לְכֻלָּ֔ם וְזֶ֖ה הַחִלָּ֣ם לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת וְעַתָּה֙ לֹֽא־יִבָּצֵ֣ר מֵהֶ֔ם כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָזְמ֖וּ לַֽעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
11.englishText: and יהוה said, “If, as one people with one language for all, this is how they have begun to act, then nothing that they may propose to do will be out of their reach.
11.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָ֗h hֵ֣ן aַ֤ם aֶchָd֙ vְshָׂpָ֤h aַchַt֙ lְkֻlָּ֔ם vְzֶ֖h hַchִlָּ֣ם lַaֲshׂ֑vֹt vְaַtָּh֙ lֹֽa־yִbָּtsֵ֣r mֵhֶ֔ם kֹּ֛l aֲshֶׁ֥r yָzְm֖vּ lַֽaֲshֽׂvֹt׃

11.hebrewText: הָ֚בָה נֵֽרְדָ֔ה וְנָבְלָ֥ה שָׁ֖ם שְׂפָתָ֑ם אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יִשְׁמְע֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ שְׂפַ֥ת רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
11.englishText: Let us, then, go down and confound their speech there, so that they shall not understand one another’s speech.”
11.transliteration: hָ֚bָh nֵֽrְdָ֔h vְnָbְlָ֥h shָׁ֖ם shְׂpָtָ֑ם aֲshֶׁr֙ lֹ֣a yִshְׁmְa֔vּ aִ֖yshׁ shְׂpַ֥t rֵaֵֽhvּ׃

11.hebrewText: וַיָּ֨פֶץ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֹתָ֛ם מִשָּׁ֖ם עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיַּחְדְּל֖וּ לִבְנֹ֥ת הָעִֽיר׃
11.englishText: Thus יהוה scattered them from there over the face of the whole earth; and they stopped building the city.
11.transliteration: vַyָּ֨pֶץ yְhֹvָ֥h aֹtָ֛ם mִshָּׁ֖ם aַl־pְּnֵ֣y kׇl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vַֽyַּchְdְּl֖vּ lִbְnֹ֥t hָaִֽyr׃

11.hebrewText: עַל־כֵּ֞ן קָרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ בָּבֶ֔ל כִּי־שָׁ֛ם בָּלַ֥ל יְהֹוָ֖ה שְׂפַ֣ת כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וּמִשָּׁם֙ הֱפִיצָ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־פְּנֵ֖י כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
11.englishText: That is why it was called Babel,*Babel I.e., “Babylon.” because there יהוה confounded*confounded Heb. balal “confound,” play on “Babel.” the speech of the whole earth; and from there יהוה scattered them over the face of the whole earth.
11.transliteration: aַl־kֵּ֞ן kָrָ֤a shְׁmָhּ֙ bָּbֶ֔l kִּy־shָׁ֛ם bָּlַ֥l yְhֹvָ֖h shְׂpַ֣t kׇּl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vּmִshָּׁם֙ hֱpִytsָ֣ם yְhֹvָ֔h aַl־pְּnֵ֖y kׇּl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃ {p}

11.hebrewText: אֵ֚לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת שֵׁ֔ם שֵׁ֚ם בֶּן־מְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֔ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־אַרְפַּכְשָׁ֑ד שְׁנָתַ֖יִם אַחַ֥ר הַמַּבּֽוּל׃
11.englishText: This is the line of Shem. Shem was 100 years old when he begot Arpachshad, two years after the Flood.
11.transliteration: aֵ֚lֶּh tּvֹlְdֹ֣t shֵׁ֔ם shֵׁ֚ם bֶּן־mְaַ֣t shָׁnָ֔h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־aַrְpַּkְshָׁ֑d shְׁnָtַ֖yִם aַchַ֥r hַmַּbּֽvּl׃

11.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־שֵׁ֗ם אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־אַרְפַּכְשָׁ֔ד חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
11.englishText: After the birth of*After the birth of Lit. “After he begot,” and so through v. 25. Arpachshad, Shem lived 500 years and begot sons and daughters.
11.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־shֵׁ֗ם aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־aַrְpַּkְshָׁ֔d chֲmֵ֥shׁ mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֣ד חַ֔י חָמֵ֥שׁ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־שָֽׁלַח׃
11.englishText: When Arpachshad had lived 35 years, he begot Shelah.
11.transliteration: vְaַrְpַּkְshַׁ֣d chַ֔y chָmֵ֥shׁ vּshְׁlֹshִׁ֖yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־shָֽׁlַch׃

11.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י אַרְפַּכְשַׁ֗ד אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־שֶׁ֔לַח שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
11.englishText: After the birth of Shelah, Arpachshad lived 403 years and begot sons and daughters.
11.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y aַrְpַּkְshַׁ֗d aַֽchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־shֶׁ֔lַch shָׁlֹ֣shׁ shָׁnִ֔yם vְaַrְbַּ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וְשֶׁ֥לַח חַ֖י שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־עֵֽבֶר׃
11.englishText: When Shelah had lived 30 years, he begot Eber.
11.transliteration: vְshֶׁ֥lַch chַ֖y shְׁlֹshִׁ֣yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־aֵֽbֶr׃

11.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־שֶׁ֗לַח אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־עֵ֔בֶר שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
11.englishText: After the birth of Eber, Shelah lived 403 years and begot sons and daughters.
11.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־shֶׁ֗lַch aַchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־aֵ֔bֶr shָׁlֹ֣shׁ shָׁnִ֔yם vְaַrְbַּ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־עֵ֕בֶר אַרְבַּ֥ע וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־פָּֽלֶג׃
11.englishText: When Eber had lived 34 years, he begot Peleg.
11.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־aֵ֕bֶr aַrְbַּ֥a vּshְׁlֹshִׁ֖yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־pָּֽlֶg׃

11.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־עֵ֗בֶר אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־פֶּ֔לֶג שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
11.englishText: After the birth of Peleg, Eber lived 430 years and begot sons and daughters.
11.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־aֵ֗bֶr aַchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־pֶּ֔lֶg shְׁlֹshִׁ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h vְaַrְbַּ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־פֶ֖לֶג שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־רְעֽוּ׃
11.englishText: When Peleg had lived 30 years, he begot Reu.
11.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־pֶ֖lֶg shְׁlֹshִׁ֣yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־rְaֽvּ׃

11.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־פֶ֗לֶג אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־רְע֔וּ תֵּ֥שַׁע שָׁנִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
11.englishText: After the birth of Reu, Peleg lived 209 years and begot sons and daughters.
11.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־pֶ֗lֶg aַchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־rְa֔vּ tֵּ֥shַׁa shָׁnִ֖yם vּmָatַ֣yִם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י רְע֔וּ שְׁתַּ֥יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־שְׂרֽוּג׃
11.englishText: When Reu had lived 32 years, he begot Serug.
11.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y rְa֔vּ shְׁtַּ֥yִם vּshְׁlֹshִׁ֖yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־shְׂrֽvּg׃

11.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י רְע֗וּ אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־שְׂר֔וּג שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
11.englishText: After the birth of Serug, Reu lived 207 years and begot sons and daughters.
11.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y rְa֗vּ aַchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־shְׂr֔vּg shֶׁ֥bַa shָׁnִ֖yם vּmָatַ֣yִם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֥י שְׂר֖וּג שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־נָחֽוֹר׃
11.englishText: When Serug had lived 30 years, he begot Nahor.
11.transliteration: vַyְchִ֥y shְׂr֖vּg shְׁlֹshִׁ֣yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־nָchֽvֹr׃

11.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י שְׂר֗וּג אַחֲרֵ֛י הוֹלִיד֥וֹ אֶת־נָח֖וֹר מָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
11.englishText: After the birth of Nahor, Serug lived 200 years and begot sons and daughters.
11.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y shְׂr֗vּg aַchֲrֵ֛y hvֹlִyd֥vֹ aֶt־nָch֖vֹr mָatַ֣yִם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י נָח֔וֹר תֵּ֥שַׁע וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־תָּֽרַח׃
11.englishText: When Nahor had lived 29 years, he begot Terah.
11.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y nָch֔vֹr tֵּ֥shַׁa vְaֶshְׂrִ֖yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֖vֹlֶd aֶt־tָּֽrַch׃

11.hebrewText: וַיְחִ֣י נָח֗וֹר אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־תֶּ֔רַח תְּשַֽׁע־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
11.englishText: After the birth of Terah, Nahor lived 119 years and begot sons and daughters.
11.transliteration: vַyְchִ֣y nָch֗vֹr aַchֲrֵy֙ hvֹlִyd֣vֹ aֶt־tֶּ֔rַch tְּshַֽׁa־aֶshְׂrֵ֥h shָׁnָ֖h vּmְaַ֣t shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֥vֹlֶd bָּnִ֖yם vּbָnֽvֹt׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וַֽיְחִי־תֶ֖רַח שִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֙וֹלֶד֙ אֶת־אַבְרָ֔ם אֶת־נָח֖וֹר וְאֶת־הָרָֽן׃
11.englishText: When Terah had lived 70 years, he begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
11.transliteration: vַֽyְchִy־tֶ֖rַch shִׁbְaִ֣yם shָׁnָ֑h vַyּ֙vֹlֶd֙ aֶt־aַbְrָ֔ם aֶt־nָch֖vֹr vְaֶt־hָrָֽן׃

11.hebrewText: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת תֶּ֔רַח תֶּ֚רַח הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־אַבְרָ֔ם אֶת־נָח֖וֹר וְאֶת־הָרָ֑ן וְהָרָ֖ן הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־לֽוֹט׃
11.englishText: Now this is the line of Terah: Terah begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begot Lot.
11.transliteration: vְaֵ֙lֶּh֙ tּvֹlְdֹ֣t tֶּ֔rַch tֶּ֚rַch hvֹlִ֣yd aֶt־aַbְrָ֔ם aֶt־nָch֖vֹr vְaֶt־hָrָ֑ן vְhָrָ֖ן hvֹlִ֥yd aֶt־lֽvֹt׃

11.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣מׇת הָרָ֔ן עַל־פְּנֵ֖י תֶּ֣רַח אָבִ֑יו בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מוֹלַדְתּ֖וֹ בְּא֥וּר כַּשְׂדִּֽים׃
11.englishText: Haran died in the lifetime of his father Terah, in his native land, Ur of the Chaldeans.
11.transliteration: vַyָּ֣mׇt hָrָ֔ן aַl־pְּnֵ֖y tֶּ֣rַch aָbִ֑yv bְּaֶ֥rֶץ mvֹlַdְtּ֖vֹ bְּa֥vּr kַּshְׂdִּֽyם׃

11.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַבְרָ֧ם וְנָח֛וֹר לָהֶ֖ם נָשִׁ֑ים שֵׁ֤ם אֵֽשֶׁת־אַבְרָם֙ שָׂרָ֔י וְשֵׁ֤ם אֵֽשֶׁת־נָחוֹר֙ מִלְכָּ֔ה בַּת־הָרָ֥ן אֲבִֽי־מִלְכָּ֖ה וַֽאֲבִ֥י יִסְכָּֽה׃
11.englishText: Abram and Nahor took wives for themselves, the name of Abram’s wife being Sarai and that of Nahor’s wife Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah and Iscah.
11.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֨ch aַbְrָ֧ם vְnָch֛vֹr lָhֶ֖ם nָshִׁ֑yם shֵׁ֤ם aֵֽshֶׁt־aַbְrָם֙ shָׂrָ֔y vְshֵׁ֤ם aֵֽshֶׁt־nָchvֹr֙ mִlְkָּ֔h bַּt־hָrָ֥ן aֲbִֽy־mִlְkָּ֖h vַֽaֲbִ֥y yִsְkָּֽh׃

11.hebrewText: וַתְּהִ֥י שָׂרַ֖י עֲקָרָ֑ה אֵ֥ין לָ֖הּ וָלָֽד׃
11.englishText: Now Sarai was barren, she had no child.
11.transliteration: vַtְּhִ֥y shָׂrַ֖y aֲkָrָ֑h aֵ֥yן lָ֖hּ vָlָֽd׃

11.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֨ח תֶּ֜רַח אֶת־אַבְרָ֣ם בְּנ֗וֹ וְאֶת־ל֤וֹט בֶּן־הָרָן֙ בֶּן־בְּנ֔וֹ וְאֵת֙ שָׂרַ֣י כַּלָּת֔וֹ אֵ֖שֶׁת אַבְרָ֣ם בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּצְא֨וּ אִתָּ֜ם מֵא֣וּר כַּשְׂדִּ֗ים לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ אַ֣רְצָה כְּנַ֔עַן וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ עַד־חָרָ֖ן וַיֵּ֥שְׁבוּ שָֽׁם׃
11.englishText: Terah took his son Abram, his grandson Lot the son of Haran, and his daughter-in-law Sarai, the wife of his son Abram, and they set out together from Ur of the Chaldeans for the land of Canaan; but when they had come as far as Haran, they settled there.
11.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֨ch tֶּ֜rַch aֶt־aַbְrָ֣ם bְּn֗vֹ vְaֶt־l֤vֹt bֶּן־hָrָן֙ bֶּן־bְּn֔vֹ vְaֵt֙ shָׂrַ֣y kַּlָּt֔vֹ aֵ֖shֶׁt aַbְrָ֣ם bְּn֑vֹ vַyֵּtsְa֨vּ aִtָּ֜ם mֵa֣vּr kַּshְׂdִּ֗yם lָlֶ֙kֶt֙ aַ֣rְtsָh kְּnַ֔aַן vַyָּbֹ֥avּ aַd־chָrָ֖ן vַyֵּ֥shְׁbvּ shָֽׁם׃

11.hebrewText: וַיִּהְי֣וּ יְמֵי־תֶ֔רַח חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּ֥מׇת תֶּ֖רַח בְּחָרָֽן׃ {פ}
11.englishText: The days of Terah came to 205 years; and Terah died in Haran.
11.transliteration: vַyִּhְy֣vּ yְmֵy־tֶ֔rַch chָmֵ֥shׁ shָׁnִ֖yם vּmָatַ֣yִם shָׁnָ֑h vַyָּ֥mׇt tֶּ֖rַch bְּchָrָֽן׃ {p}

lech-lecha.name: Lech-Lecha
lech-lecha.summary: God commands Abram to leave his homeland, Abram and Sarai in Egypt, separation from Lot, the war of the kings, the covenant between the pieces, Hagar and Ishmael, and the covenant of circumcision.

12.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אַבְרָ֔ם לֶךְ־לְךָ֛ מֵאַרְצְךָ֥ וּמִמּֽוֹלַדְתְּךָ֖ וּמִבֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַרְאֶֽךָּ׃
12.englishText: יהוה said to Abram, “Go forth from your native land and from your father’s house to the land that I will show you.
12.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־aַbְrָ֔ם lֶךְ־lְךָ֛ mֵaַrְtsְךָ֥ vּmִmּֽvֹlַdְtְּךָ֖ vּmִbֵּ֣yt aָbִ֑yךָ aֶl־hָaָ֖rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֥r aַrְaֶֽךָּ׃

12.hebrewText: וְאֶֽעֶשְׂךָ֙ לְג֣וֹי גָּד֔וֹל וַאֲבָ֣רֶכְךָ֔ וַאֲגַדְּלָ֖ה שְׁמֶ֑ךָ וֶהְיֵ֖ה בְּרָכָֽה׃
12.englishText:
I will make of you a great nation,
And I will bless you;
I will make your name great,
And you shall be a blessing.*a blessing I.e., a standard by which blessing is invoked; cf. v. 3 end.
12.transliteration: vְaֶֽaֶshְׂךָ֙ lְg֣vֹy gָּd֔vֹl vַaֲbָ֣rֶkְךָ֔ vַaֲgַdְּlָ֖h shְׁmֶ֑ךָ vֶhְyֵ֖h bְּrָkָֽh׃

12.hebrewText: וַאֲבָֽרְכָה֙ מְבָ֣רְכֶ֔יךָ וּמְקַלֶּלְךָ֖ אָאֹ֑ר וְנִבְרְכ֣וּ בְךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
12.englishText:
I will bless those who bless you
And curse the one who curses you;
And all the families of the earth
Shall bless themselves by you.”
12.transliteration: vַaֲbָֽrְkָh֙ mְbָ֣rְkֶ֔yךָ vּmְkַlֶּlְךָ֖ aָaֹ֑r vְnִbְrְk֣vּ bְךָ֔ kֹּ֖l mִshְׁpְּchֹ֥t hָaֲdָmָֽh׃

12.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אַבְרָ֗ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אִתּ֖וֹ ל֑וֹט וְאַבְרָ֗ם בֶּן־חָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנִים֙ וְשִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּצֵאת֖וֹ מֵחָרָֽן׃
12.englishText: Abram went forth as יהוה had commanded him, and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he left Haran.
12.transliteration: vַyֵּ֣lֶךְ aַbְrָ֗ם kַּaֲshֶׁ֨r dִּbֶּ֤r aֵlָyv֙ yְhֹvָ֔h vַyֵּ֥lֶךְ aִtּ֖vֹ l֑vֹt vְaַbְrָ֗ם bֶּן־chָmֵ֤shׁ shָׁnִyם֙ vְshִׁbְaִ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h bְּtsֵat֖vֹ mֵchָrָֽן׃

12.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אַבְרָם֩ אֶת־שָׂרַ֨י אִשְׁתּ֜וֹ וְאֶת־ל֣וֹט בֶּן־אָחִ֗יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־רְכוּשָׁם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָכָ֔שׁוּ וְאֶת־הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֣וּ בְחָרָ֑ן וַיֵּצְא֗וּ לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ אַ֣רְצָה כְּנַ֔עַן וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
12.englishText: Abram took his wife Sarai and his brother’s son Lot, and all the wealth that they had amassed, and the persons that they had acquired in Haran; and they set out for the land of Canaan. When they arrived in the land of Canaan,
12.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֣ch aַbְrָם֩ aֶt־shָׂrַ֨y aִshְׁtּ֜vֹ vְaֶt־l֣vֹt bֶּן־aָchִ֗yv vְaֶt־kׇּl־rְkvּshָׁם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r rָkָ֔shׁvּ vְaֶt־hַnֶּ֖pֶshׁ aֲshֶׁr־aָshׂ֣vּ bְchָrָ֑ן vַyֵּtsְa֗vּ lָlֶ֙kֶt֙ aַ֣rְtsָh kְּnַ֔aַן vַyָּbֹ֖avּ aַ֥rְtsָh kְּnָֽaַן׃

12.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר אַבְרָם֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ עַ֚ד מְק֣וֹם שְׁכֶ֔ם עַ֖ד אֵל֣וֹן מוֹרֶ֑ה וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י אָ֥ז בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
12.englishText: Abram passed through the land as far as the site of Shechem, at the terebinth of Moreh. The Canaanites were then in the land.
12.transliteration: vַyַּaֲbֹ֤r aַbְrָם֙ bָּaָ֔rֶץ aַ֚d mְk֣vֹם shְׁkֶ֔ם aַ֖d aֵl֣vֹן mvֹrֶ֑h vְhַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֖y aָ֥z bָּaָֽrֶץ׃

12.hebrewText: וַיֵּרָ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אַבְרָ֔ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לְזַ֨רְעֲךָ֔ אֶתֵּ֖ן אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את וַיִּ֤בֶן שָׁם֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לַיהֹוָ֖ה הַנִּרְאֶ֥ה אֵלָֽיו׃
12.englishText: יהוה appeared to Abram and said, “I will assign this land to your offspring.” And he built an altar there to יהוה who had appeared to him.
12.transliteration: vַyֵּrָ֤a yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־aַbְrָ֔ם vַyֹּ֕amֶr lְzַ֨rְaֲךָ֔ aֶtֵּ֖ן aֶt־hָaָ֣rֶץ hַzֹּ֑at vַyִּ֤bֶן shָׁם֙ mִzְbֵּ֔chַ lַyhֹvָ֖h hַnִּrְaֶ֥h aֵlָֽyv׃

12.hebrewText: וַיַּעְתֵּ֨ק מִשָּׁ֜ם הָהָ֗רָה מִקֶּ֛דֶם לְבֵֽית־אֵ֖ל וַיֵּ֣ט אׇהֳלֹ֑ה בֵּֽית־אֵ֤ל מִיָּם֙ וְהָעַ֣י מִקֶּ֔דֶם וַיִּֽבֶן־שָׁ֤ם מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֖א בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
12.englishText: From there he moved on to the hill country east of Bethel and pitched his tent, with Bethel on the west and Ai on the east; and he built there an altar to יהוה and invoked יהוה by name.
12.transliteration: vַyַּaְtֵּ֨k mִshָּׁ֜ם hָhָ֗rָh mִkֶּ֛dֶם lְbֵֽyt־aֵ֖l vַyֵּ֣t aׇhֳlֹ֑h bֵּֽyt־aֵ֤l mִyָּם֙ vְhָaַ֣y mִkֶּ֔dֶם vַyִּֽbֶן־shָׁ֤ם mִzְbֵּ֙chַ֙ lַֽyhֹvָ֔h vַyִּkְrָ֖a bְּshֵׁ֥ם yְhֹvָֽh׃

12.hebrewText: וַיִּסַּ֣ע אַבְרָ֔ם הָל֥וֹךְ וְנָס֖וֹעַ הַנֶּֽגְבָּה׃ {פ}
12.englishText: Then Abram journeyed by stages toward the Negeb.
12.transliteration: vַyִּsַּ֣a aַbְrָ֔ם hָl֥vֹךְ vְnָs֖vֹaַ hַnֶּֽgְbָּh׃ {p}

12.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֥י רָעָ֖ב בָּאָ֑רֶץ וַיֵּ֨רֶד אַבְרָ֤ם מִצְרַ֙יְמָה֙ לָג֣וּר שָׁ֔ם כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד הָרָעָ֖ב בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
12.englishText: There was a famine in the land, and Abram went down to Egypt to sojourn there, for the famine was severe in the land.
12.transliteration: vַyְhִ֥y rָaָ֖b bָּaָ֑rֶץ vַyֵּ֨rֶd aַbְrָ֤ם mִtsְrַ֙yְmָh֙ lָg֣vּr shָׁ֔ם kִּֽy־kָbֵ֥d hָrָaָ֖b bָּaָֽrֶץ׃

12.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הִקְרִ֖יב לָב֣וֹא מִצְרָ֑יְמָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־שָׂרַ֣י אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ הִנֵּה־נָ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֛י אִשָּׁ֥ה יְפַת־מַרְאֶ֖ה אָֽתְּ׃
12.englishText: As he was about to enter Egypt, he said to his wife Sarai, “I*I Or “You”; cf. the second-person feminine form -ti in Judg. 5.7; Jer. 2.20; Mic. 4.13, etc. know what a beautiful woman you are.
12.transliteration: vַyְhִ֕y kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r hִkְrִ֖yb lָb֣vֹa mִtsְrָ֑yְmָh vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֶl־shָׂrַ֣y aִshְׁtּ֔vֹ hִnֵּh־nָ֣a yָdַ֔aְtִּy kִּ֛y aִshָּׁ֥h yְpַt־mַrְaֶ֖h aָֽtְּ׃

12.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּֽי־יִרְא֤וּ אֹתָךְ֙ הַמִּצְרִ֔ים וְאָמְר֖וּ אִשְׁתּ֣וֹ זֹ֑את וְהָרְג֥וּ אֹתִ֖י וְאֹתָ֥ךְ יְחַיּֽוּ׃
12.englishText: If the Egyptians see you, and think, ‘She is his wife,’ they will kill me and let you live.
12.transliteration: vְhָyָ֗h kִּֽy־yִrְa֤vּ aֹtָךְ֙ hַmִּtsְrִ֔yם vְaָmְr֖vּ aִshְׁtּ֣vֹ zֹ֑at vְhָrְg֥vּ aֹtִ֖y vְaֹtָ֥ךְ yְchַyּֽvּ׃

12.hebrewText: אִמְרִי־נָ֖א אֲחֹ֣תִי אָ֑תְּ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יִֽיטַב־לִ֣י בַעֲבוּרֵ֔ךְ וְחָיְתָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י בִּגְלָלֵֽךְ׃
12.englishText: Please say that you are my sister, that it may go well with me because of you, and that I may remain alive thanks to you.”
12.transliteration: aִmְrִy־nָ֖a aֲchֹ֣tִy aָ֑tְּ lְmַ֙aַן֙ yִֽytַb־lִ֣y bַaֲbvּrֵ֔ךְ vְchָyְtָ֥h nַpְshִׁ֖y bִּgְlָlֵֽךְ׃

12.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֕י כְּב֥וֹא אַבְרָ֖ם מִצְרָ֑יְמָה וַיִּרְא֤וּ הַמִּצְרִים֙ אֶת־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּֽי־יָפָ֥ה הִ֖וא מְאֹֽד׃
12.englishText: When Abram entered Egypt, the Egyptians saw how very beautiful the woman was.
12.transliteration: vַyְhִ֕y kְּb֥vֹa aַbְrָ֖ם mִtsְrָ֑yְmָh vַyִּrְa֤vּ hַmִּtsְrִyם֙ aֶt־hָ֣aִshָּׁ֔h kִּֽy־yָpָ֥h hִ֖va mְaֹֽd׃

12.hebrewText: וַיִּרְא֤וּ אֹתָהּ֙ שָׂרֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַיְהַֽלְל֥וּ אֹתָ֖הּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַתֻּקַּ֥ח הָאִשָּׁ֖ה בֵּ֥ית פַּרְעֹֽה׃
12.englishText: Pharaoh’s courtiers saw her and praised her to Pharaoh, and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s palace.
12.transliteration: vַyִּrְa֤vּ aֹtָhּ֙ shָׂrֵ֣y pַrְaֹ֔h vַyְhַֽlְl֥vּ aֹtָ֖hּ aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֑h vַtֻּkַּ֥ch hָaִshָּׁ֖h bֵּ֥yt pַּrְaֹֽh׃

12.hebrewText: וּלְאַבְרָ֥ם הֵיטִ֖יב בַּעֲבוּרָ֑הּ וַֽיְהִי־ל֤וֹ צֹאן־וּבָקָר֙ וַחֲמֹרִ֔ים וַעֲבָדִים֙ וּשְׁפָחֹ֔ת וַאֲתֹנֹ֖ת וּגְמַלִּֽים׃
12.englishText: And because of her, it went well with Abram; he acquired sheep, oxen, asses, male and female slaves, she-asses, and camels.
12.transliteration: vּlְaַbְrָ֥ם hֵytִ֖yb bַּaֲbvּrָ֑hּ vַֽyְhִy־l֤vֹ tsֹaן־vּbָkָr֙ vַchֲmֹrִ֔yם vַaֲbָdִyם֙ vּshְׁpָchֹ֔t vַaֲtֹnֹ֖t vּgְmַlִּֽyם׃

12.hebrewText: וַיְנַגַּ֨ע יְהֹוָ֧ה <small>׀</small> אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֛ה נְגָעִ֥ים גְּדֹלִ֖ים וְאֶת־בֵּית֑וֹ עַל־דְּבַ֥ר שָׂרַ֖י אֵ֥שֶׁת אַבְרָֽם׃
12.englishText: But יהוה afflicted Pharaoh and his household with mighty plagues on account of Sarai, the wife of Abram.
12.transliteration: vַyְnַgַּ֨a yְhֹvָ֧h <small>׀</small> aֶt־pַּrְaֹ֛h nְgָaִ֥yם gְּdֹlִ֖yם vְaֶt־bֵּyt֑vֹ aַl־dְּbַ֥r shָׂrַ֖y aֵ֥shֶׁt aַbְrָֽם׃

12.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֤א פַרְעֹה֙ לְאַבְרָ֔ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַה־זֹּ֖את עָשִׂ֣יתָ לִּ֑י לָ֚מָּה לֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֔י כִּ֥י אִשְׁתְּךָ֖ הִֽוא׃
12.englishText: Pharaoh sent for Abram and said, “What is this you have done to me! Why did you not tell me that she was your wife?
12.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֤a pַrְaֹh֙ lְaַbְrָ֔ם vַyֹּ֕amֶr mַh־zֹּ֖at aָshִׂ֣ytָ lִּ֑y lָ֚mָּh lֹa־hִgַּ֣dְtָּ lִּ֔y kִּ֥y aִshְׁtְּךָ֖ hִֽva׃

12.hebrewText: לָמָ֤ה אָמַ֙רְתָּ֙ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֔וא וָאֶקַּ֥ח אֹתָ֛הּ לִ֖י לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וְעַתָּ֕ה הִנֵּ֥ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֖ קַ֥ח וָלֵֽךְ׃
12.englishText: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her as my wife? Now, here is your wife; take her and begone!”
12.transliteration: lָmָ֤h aָmַ֙rְtָּ֙ aֲchֹ֣tִy hִ֔va vָaֶkַּ֥ch aֹtָ֛hּ lִ֖y lְaִshָּׁ֑h vְaַtָּ֕h hִnֵּ֥h aִshְׁtְּךָ֖ kַ֥ch vָlֵֽךְ׃

12.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֥ו עָלָ֛יו פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
12.englishText: And Pharaoh put agents*agents Lit. “participants whose involvement defines the depicted situation”; trad. “men.” Cf. Josh. 10.18. See the Dictionary under ’ish; Agent. in charge of him, and they sent him off with his wife and all that he possessed.
12.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֥v aָlָ֛yv pַּrְaֹ֖h aֲnָshִׁ֑yם vַֽyְshַׁlְּch֥vּ aֹt֛vֹ vְaֶt־aִshְׁtּ֖vֹ vְaֶt־kׇּl־aֲshֶׁr־lֽvֹ׃

13.hebrewText: וַיַּ֩עַל֩ אַבְרָ֨ם מִמִּצְרַ֜יִם ה֠וּא וְאִשְׁתּ֧וֹ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ וְל֥וֹט עִמּ֖וֹ הַנֶּֽגְבָּה׃
13.englishText: From Egypt, Abram went up into the Negeb, with his wife and all that he possessed, together with Lot.
13.transliteration: vַyַּ֩aַl֩ aַbְrָ֨ם mִmִּtsְrַ֜yִם h֠vּa vְaִshְׁtּ֧vֹ vְkׇl־aֲshֶׁr־l֛vֹ vְl֥vֹt aִmּ֖vֹ hַnֶּֽgְbָּh׃

13.hebrewText: וְאַבְרָ֖ם כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד בַּמִּקְנֶ֕ה בַּכֶּ֖סֶף וּבַזָּהָֽב׃
13.englishText: Now Abram was very rich in cattle, silver, and gold.
13.transliteration: vְaַbְrָ֖ם kָּbֵ֣d mְaֹ֑d bַּmִּkְnֶ֕h bַּkֶּ֖sֶף vּbַzָּhָֽb׃

13.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ לְמַסָּעָ֔יו מִנֶּ֖גֶב וְעַד־בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל עַד־הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁר־הָ֨יָה שָׁ֤ם אׇֽהֳלֹה֙ בַּתְּחִלָּ֔ה בֵּ֥ין בֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל וּבֵ֥ין הָעָֽי׃
13.englishText: And he proceeded by stages from the Negeb as far as Bethel, to the place where his tent had been formerly, between Bethel and Ai,
13.transliteration: vַyֵּ֙lֶךְ֙ lְmַsָּaָ֔yv mִnֶּ֖gֶb vְaַd־bֵּֽyt־aֵ֑l aַd־hַmָּk֗vֹם aֲshֶׁr־hָ֨yָh shָׁ֤ם aׇֽhֳlֹh֙ bַּtְּchִlָּ֔h bֵּ֥yן bֵּֽyt־aֵ֖l vּbֵ֥yן hָaָֽy׃

13.hebrewText: אֶל־מְקוֹם֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥שָׂה שָׁ֖ם בָּרִאשֹׁנָ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֥א שָׁ֛ם אַבְרָ֖ם בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
13.englishText: the site of the altar that he had built there at first; and there Abram invoked יהוה by name.
13.transliteration: aֶl־mְkvֹם֙ hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ aֲshֶׁr־aָ֥shָׂh shָׁ֖ם bָּrִashֹׁnָ֑h vַyִּkְrָ֥a shָׁ֛ם aַbְrָ֖ם bְּshֵׁ֥ם yְhֹvָֽh׃

13.hebrewText: וְגַ֨ם־לְל֔וֹט הַהֹלֵ֖ךְ אֶת־אַבְרָ֑ם הָיָ֥ה צֹאן־וּבָקָ֖ר וְאֹהָלִֽים׃
13.englishText: Lot, who went with Abram, also had flocks and herds and tents,
13.transliteration: vְgַ֨ם־lְl֔vֹt hַhֹlֵ֖ךְ aֶt־aַbְrָ֑ם hָyָ֥h tsֹaן־vּbָkָ֖r vְaֹhָlִֽyם׃

13.hebrewText: וְלֹא־נָשָׂ֥א אֹתָ֛ם הָאָ֖רֶץ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת יַחְדָּ֑ו כִּֽי־הָיָ֤ה רְכוּשָׁם֙ רָ֔ב וְלֹ֥א יָֽכְל֖וּ לָשֶׁ֥בֶת יַחְדָּֽו׃
13.englishText: so that the land could not support them staying together; for their possessions were so great that they could not remain together.
13.transliteration: vְlֹa־nָshָׂ֥a aֹtָ֛ם hָaָ֖rֶץ lָshֶׁ֣bֶt yַchְdָּ֑v kִּֽy־hָyָ֤h rְkvּshָׁם֙ rָ֔b vְlֹ֥a yָֽkְl֖vּ lָshֶׁ֥bֶt yַchְdָּֽv׃

13.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־רִ֗יב בֵּ֚ין רֹעֵ֣י מִקְנֵֽה־אַבְרָ֔ם וּבֵ֖ין רֹעֵ֣י מִקְנֵה־ל֑וֹט וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י אָ֖ז יֹשֵׁ֥ב בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
13.englishText: And there was quarreling between the herders of Abram’s cattle and those of Lot’s cattle.—The Canaanites and Perizzites were then dwelling in the land.—
13.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־rִ֗yb bֵּ֚yן rֹaֵ֣y mִkְnֵֽh־aַbְrָ֔ם vּbֵ֖yן rֹaֵ֣y mִkְnֵh־l֑vֹt vְhַֽkְּnַaֲnִy֙ vְhַpְּrִzִּ֔y aָ֖z yֹshֵׁ֥b bָּaָֽrֶץ׃

13.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַבְרָ֜ם אֶל־ל֗וֹט אַל־נָ֨א תְהִ֤י מְרִיבָה֙ בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֔ךָ וּבֵ֥ין רֹעַ֖י וּבֵ֣ין רֹעֶ֑יךָ כִּֽי־אֲנָשִׁ֥ים אַחִ֖ים אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
13.englishText: Abram said to Lot, “Let there be no strife between you and me, between my herders and yours, for we are kin.
13.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aַbְrָ֜ם aֶl־l֗vֹt aַl־nָ֨a tְhִ֤y mְrִybָh֙ bֵּynִ֣y vּbֵynֶ֔ךָ vּbֵ֥yן rֹaַ֖y vּbֵ֣yן rֹaֶ֑yךָ kִּֽy־aֲnָshִׁ֥yם aַchִ֖yם aֲnָֽchְnvּ׃

13.hebrewText: הֲלֹ֤א כׇל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ הִפָּ֥רֶד נָ֖א מֵעָלָ֑י אִם־הַשְּׂמֹ֣אל וְאֵימִ֔נָה וְאִם־הַיָּמִ֖ין וְאַשְׂמְאִֽילָה׃
13.englishText: Is not the whole land before you? Let us separate:*Let us separate Lit. “Please separate from me.” if you go north, I will go south; and if you go south, I will go north.”
13.transliteration: hֲlֹ֤a kׇl־hָaָ֙rֶץ֙ lְpָnֶ֔yךָ hִpָּ֥rֶd nָ֖a mֵaָlָ֑y aִם־hַshְּׂmֹ֣al vְaֵymִ֔nָh vְaִם־hַyָּmִ֖yן vְaַshְׂmְaִֽylָh׃

13.hebrewText: וַיִּשָּׂא־ל֣וֹט אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־כׇּל־כִּכַּ֣ר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן כִּ֥י כֻלָּ֖הּ מַשְׁקֶ֑ה לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ שַׁחֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־סְדֹם֙ וְאֶת־עֲמֹרָ֔ה כְּגַן־יְהֹוָה֙ כְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בֹּאֲכָ֖ה צֹֽעַר׃
13.englishText: Lot looked about him and saw how well watered was the whole plain of the Jordan, all of it—this was before יהוה had destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah—all the way to Zoar, like the garden of יהוה, like the land of Egypt.
13.transliteration: vַyִּshָּׂa־l֣vֹt aֶt־aֵynָ֗yv vַyַּrְa֙ aֶt־kׇּl־kִּkַּ֣r hַyַּrְdֵּ֔ן kִּ֥y kֻlָּ֖hּ mַshְׁkֶ֑h lִpְnֵ֣y ׀ shַׁchֵ֣t yְhֹvָ֗h aֶt־sְdֹם֙ vְaֶt־aֲmֹrָ֔h kְּgַן־yְhֹvָh֙ kְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם bֹּaֲkָ֖h tsֹֽaַr׃

13.hebrewText: וַיִּבְחַר־ל֣וֹ ל֗וֹט אֵ֚ת כׇּל־כִּכַּ֣ר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וַיִּסַּ֥ע ל֖וֹט מִקֶּ֑דֶם וַיִּפָּ֣רְד֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ מֵעַ֥ל אָחִֽיו׃
13.englishText: So Lot chose for himself the whole plain of the Jordan, and Lot journeyed eastward. Thus they parted from each other;
13.transliteration: vַyִּbְchַr־l֣vֹ l֗vֹt aֵ֚t kׇּl־kִּkַּ֣r hַyַּrְdֵּ֔ן vַyִּsַּ֥a l֖vֹt mִkֶּ֑dֶם vַyִּpָּ֣rְd֔vּ aִ֖yshׁ mֵaַ֥l aָchִֽyv׃

13.hebrewText: אַבְרָ֖ם יָשַׁ֣ב בְּאֶֽרֶץ־כְּנָ֑עַן וְל֗וֹט יָשַׁב֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י הַכִּכָּ֔ר וַיֶּאֱהַ֖ל עַד־סְדֹֽם׃
13.englishText: Abram remained in the land of Canaan, while Lot settled in the cities of the Plain, pitching his tents near Sodom.
13.transliteration: aַbְrָ֖ם yָshַׁ֣b bְּaֶֽrֶץ־kְּnָ֑aַן vְl֗vֹt yָshַׁb֙ bְּaָrֵ֣y hַkִּkָּ֔r vַyֶּaֱhַ֖l aַd־sְdֹֽם׃

13.hebrewText: וְאַנְשֵׁ֣י סְדֹ֔ם רָעִ֖ים וְחַטָּאִ֑ים לַיהֹוָ֖ה מְאֹֽד׃
13.englishText: Now the inhabitants of Sodom were very wicked sinners against יהוה.
13.transliteration: vְaַnְshֵׁ֣y sְdֹ֔ם rָaִ֖yם vְchַtָּaִ֑yם lַyhֹvָ֖h mְaֹֽd׃

13.hebrewText: וַֽיהֹוָ֞ה אָמַ֣ר אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם אַחֲרֵי֙ הִפָּֽרֶד־ל֣וֹט מֵֽעִמּ֔וֹ שָׂ֣א נָ֤א עֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ וּרְאֵ֔ה מִן־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֣ה שָׁ֑ם צָפֹ֥נָה וָנֶ֖גְבָּה וָקֵ֥דְמָה וָיָֽמָּה׃
13.englishText: And יהוה said to Abram, after Lot had parted from him, “Raise your eyes and look out from where you are, to the north and south, to the east and west,
13.transliteration: vַֽyhֹvָ֞h aָmַ֣r aֶl־aַbְrָ֗ם aַchֲrֵy֙ hִpָּֽrֶd־l֣vֹt mֵֽaִmּ֔vֹ shָׂ֣a nָ֤a aֵynֶ֙yךָ֙ vּrְaֵ֔h mִן־hַmָּk֖vֹם aֲshֶׁr־aַtָּ֣h shָׁ֑ם tsָpֹ֥nָh vָnֶ֖gְbָּh vָkֵ֥dְmָh vָyָֽmָּh׃

13.hebrewText: כִּ֧י אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה רֹאֶ֖ה לְךָ֣ אֶתְּנֶ֑נָּה וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
13.englishText: for I give all the land that you see to you and your offspring forever.
13.transliteration: kִּ֧y aֶt־kׇּl־hָaָ֛rֶץ aֲshֶׁr־aַtָּ֥h rֹaֶ֖h lְךָ֣ aֶtְּnֶ֑nָּh vּֽlְzַrְaֲךָ֖ aַd־avֹlָֽם׃

13.hebrewText: וְשַׂמְתִּ֥י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֖ כַּעֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ אִם־יוּכַ֣ל אִ֗ישׁ לִמְנוֹת֙ אֶת־עֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ גַּֽם־זַרְעֲךָ֖ יִמָּנֶֽה׃
13.englishText: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if one can count the dust of the earth, then your offspring too can be counted.
13.transliteration: vְshַׂmְtִּ֥y aֶֽt־zַrְaֲךָ֖ kַּaֲpַ֣r hָaָ֑rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֣r ׀ aִם־yvּkַ֣l aִ֗yshׁ lִmְnvֹt֙ aֶt־aֲpַ֣r hָaָ֔rֶץ gַּֽם־zַrְaֲךָ֖ yִmָּnֶֽh׃

13.hebrewText: ק֚וּם הִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ בָּאָ֔רֶץ לְאׇרְכָּ֖הּ וּלְרׇחְבָּ֑הּ כִּ֥י לְךָ֖ אֶתְּנֶֽנָּה׃
13.englishText: Up, walk about the land, through its length and its breadth, for I give it to you.”
13.transliteration: k֚vּם hִtְhַlֵּ֣ךְ bָּaָ֔rֶץ lְaׇrְkָּ֖hּ vּlְrׇchְbָּ֑hּ kִּ֥y lְךָ֖ aֶtְּnֶֽnָּh׃

13.hebrewText: וַיֶּאֱהַ֣ל אַבְרָ֗ם וַיָּבֹ֛א וַיֵּ֛שֶׁב בְּאֵלֹנֵ֥י מַמְרֵ֖א אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּחֶבְר֑וֹן וַיִּֽבֶן־שָׁ֥ם מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
13.englishText: And Abram moved his tent, and came to dwell at the terebinths of Mamre, which are in Hebron; and he built an altar there to יהוה.
13.transliteration: vַyֶּaֱhַ֣l aַbְrָ֗ם vַyָּbֹ֛a vַyֵּ֛shֶׁb bְּaֵlֹnֵ֥y mַmְrֵ֖a aֲshֶׁ֣r bְּchֶbְr֑vֹן vַyִּֽbֶן־shָׁ֥ם mִzְbֵּ֖chַ lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃ {p}

14.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י בִּימֵי֙ אַמְרָפֶ֣ל מֶֽלֶךְ־שִׁנְעָ֔ר אַרְי֖וֹךְ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֶלָּסָ֑ר כְּדׇרְלָעֹ֙מֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ עֵילָ֔ם וְתִדְעָ֖ל מֶ֥לֶךְ גּוֹיִֽם׃
14.englishText: Now, when King Amraphel of Shinar, King Arioch of Ellasar, King Chedorlaomer of Elam, and King Tidal of Goiim
14.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y bִּymֵy֙ aַmְrָpֶ֣l mֶֽlֶךְ־shִׁnְaָ֔r aַrְy֖vֹךְ mֶ֣lֶךְ aֶlָּsָ֑r kְּdׇrְlָaֹ֙mֶr֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ aֵylָ֔ם vְtִdְaָ֖l mֶ֥lֶךְ gּvֹyִֽם׃

14.hebrewText: עָשׂ֣וּ מִלְחָמָ֗ה אֶת־בֶּ֙רַע֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ סְדֹ֔ם וְאֶת־בִּרְשַׁ֖ע מֶ֣לֶךְ עֲמֹרָ֑ה שִׁנְאָ֣ב ׀ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַדְמָ֗ה וְשֶׁמְאֵ֙בֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ (צביים) [צְבוֹיִ֔ם] וּמֶ֥לֶךְ בֶּ֖לַע הִיא־צֹֽעַר׃
14.englishText: made war on King Bera of Sodom, King Birsha of Gomorrah, King Shinab of Admah, King Shemeber of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar,
14.transliteration: aָshׂ֣vּ mִlְchָmָ֗h aֶt־bֶּ֙rַa֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ sְdֹ֔ם vְaֶt־bִּrְshַׁ֖a mֶ֣lֶךְ aֲmֹrָ֑h shִׁnְaָ֣b ׀ mֶ֣lֶךְ aַdְmָ֗h vְshֶׁmְaֵ֙bֶr֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ (tsbyyם) [tsְbvֹyִ֔ם] vּmֶ֥lֶךְ bֶּ֖lַa hִya־tsֹֽaַr׃

14.hebrewText: כׇּל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ חָֽבְר֔וּ אֶל־עֵ֖מֶק הַשִּׂדִּ֑ים ה֖וּא יָ֥ם הַמֶּֽלַח׃
14.englishText: all the latter joined forces at the Valley of Siddim, now the Dead Sea.*Dead Sea Heb. “Salt Sea.”
14.transliteration: kׇּl־aֵ֙lֶּh֙ chָֽbְr֔vּ aֶl־aֵ֖mֶk hַshִּׂdִּ֑yם h֖vּa yָ֥ם hַmֶּֽlַch׃

14.hebrewText: שְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה עָבְד֖וּ אֶת־כְּדׇרְלָעֹ֑מֶר וּשְׁלֹשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה מָרָֽדוּ׃
14.englishText: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
14.transliteration: shְׁtֵּ֤yם aֶshְׂrֵh֙ shָׁnָ֔h aָbְd֖vּ aֶt־kְּdׇrְlָaֹ֑mֶr vּshְׁlֹshׁ־aֶshְׂrֵ֥h shָׁnָ֖h mָrָֽdvּ׃

14.hebrewText: וּבְאַרְבַּע֩ עֶשְׂרֵ֨ה שָׁנָ֜ה בָּ֣א כְדׇרְלָעֹ֗מֶר וְהַמְּלָכִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ וַיַּכּ֤וּ אֶת־רְפָאִים֙ בְּעַשְׁתְּרֹ֣ת קַרְנַ֔יִם וְאֶת־הַזּוּזִ֖ים בְּהָ֑ם וְאֵת֙ הָֽאֵימִ֔ים בְּשָׁוֵ֖ה קִרְיָתָֽיִם׃
14.englishText: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him came and defeated the Rephaim at Ashteroth-karnaim, the Zuzim at Ham, the Emim at Shaveh-kiriathaim,
14.transliteration: vּbְaַrְbַּa֩ aֶshְׂrֵ֨h shָׁnָ֜h bָּ֣a kְdׇrְlָaֹ֗mֶr vְhַmְּlָkִyם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aִtּ֔vֹ vַyַּkּ֤vּ aֶt־rְpָaִyם֙ bְּaַshְׁtְּrֹ֣t kַrְnַ֔yִם vְaֶt־hַzּvּzִ֖yם bְּhָ֑ם vְaֵt֙ hָֽaֵymִ֔yם bְּshָׁvֵ֖h kִrְyָtָֽyִם׃

14.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַחֹרִ֖י בְּהַרְרָ֣ם שֵׂעִ֑יר עַ֚ד אֵ֣יל פָּארָ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
14.englishText: and the Horites in their hill country of Seir as far as El-paran, which is by the wilderness.
14.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַchֹrִ֖y bְּhַrְrָ֣ם shֵׂaִ֑yr aַ֚d aֵ֣yl pָּarָ֔ן aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־hַmִּdְbָּֽr׃

14.hebrewText: וַ֠יָּשֻׁ֠בוּ וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ אֶל־עֵ֤ין מִשְׁפָּט֙ הִ֣וא קָדֵ֔שׁ וַיַּכּ֕וּ אֶֽת־כׇּל־שְׂדֵ֖ה הָעֲמָלֵקִ֑י וְגַם֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב בְּחַֽצְצֹ֥ן תָּמָֽר׃
14.englishText: On their way back they came to En-mishpat, which is Kadesh, and subdued all the territory of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who dwelt in Hazazon-tamar.
14.transliteration: vַ֠yָּshֻׁ֠bvּ vַyָּbֹ֜avּ aֶl־aֵ֤yן mִshְׁpָּt֙ hִ֣va kָdֵ֔shׁ vַyַּkּ֕vּ aֶֽt־kׇּl־shְׂdֵ֖h hָaֲmָlֵkִ֑y vְgַם֙ aֶt־hָ֣aֱmֹrִ֔y hַyֹּshֵׁ֖b bְּchַֽtsְtsֹ֥ן tָּmָֽr׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֨א מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹ֜ם וּמֶ֣לֶךְ עֲמֹרָ֗ה וּמֶ֤לֶךְ אַדְמָה֙ וּמֶ֣לֶךְ (צביים) [צְבוֹיִ֔ם] וּמֶ֥לֶךְ בֶּ֖לַע הִוא־צֹ֑עַר וַיּ��ֽעַרְכ֤וּ אִתָּם֙ מִלְחָמָ֔ה בְּעֵ֖מֶק הַשִּׂדִּֽים׃
14.englishText: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar, went forth and engaged them in battle in the Valley of Siddim:
14.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֨a mֶֽlֶךְ־sְdֹ֜ם vּmֶ֣lֶךְ aֲmֹrָ֗h vּmֶ֤lֶךְ aַdְmָh֙ vּmֶ֣lֶךְ (tsbyyם) [tsְbvֹyִ֔ם] vּmֶ֥lֶךְ bֶּ֖lַa hִva־tsֹ֑aַr vַyּ��ֽaַrְk֤vּ aִtָּם֙ mִlְchָmָ֔h bְּaֵ֖mֶk hַshִּׂdִּֽyם׃

14.hebrewText: אֵ֣ת כְּדׇרְלָעֹ֜מֶר מֶ֣לֶךְ עֵילָ֗ם וְתִדְעָל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ גּוֹיִ֔ם וְאַמְרָפֶל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ שִׁנְעָ֔ר וְאַרְי֖וֹךְ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֶלָּסָ֑ר אַרְבָּעָ֥ה מְלָכִ֖ים אֶת־הַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃
14.englishText: King Chedorlaomer of Elam, King Tidal of Goiim, King Amraphel of Shinar, and King Arioch of Ellasar—four kings against those five.
14.transliteration: aֵ֣t kְּdׇrְlָaֹ֜mֶr mֶ֣lֶךְ aֵylָ֗ם vְtִdְaָl֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ gּvֹyִ֔ם vְaַmְrָpֶl֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ shִׁnְaָ֔r vְaַrְy֖vֹךְ mֶ֣lֶךְ aֶlָּsָ֑r aַrְbָּaָ֥h mְlָkִ֖yם aֶt־hַchֲmִshָּֽׁh׃

14.hebrewText: וְעֵ֣מֶק הַשִּׂדִּ֗ים בֶּֽאֱרֹ֤ת בֶּאֱרֹת֙ חֵמָ֔ר וַיָּנֻ֛סוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹ֥ם וַעֲמֹרָ֖ה וַיִּפְּלוּ־שָׁ֑מָּה וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֖ים הֶ֥רָה נָּֽסוּ׃
14.englishText: Now the Valley of Siddim was dotted with bitumen pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah, in their flight, threw themselves into them, while the rest escaped to the hill country.
14.transliteration: vְaֵ֣mֶk hַshִּׂdִּ֗yם bֶּֽaֱrֹ֤t bֶּaֱrֹt֙ chֵmָ֔r vַyָּnֻ֛svּ mֶֽlֶךְ־sְdֹ֥ם vַaֲmֹrָ֖h vַyִּpְּlvּ־shָׁ֑mָּh vְhַnִּshְׁaָrִ֖yם hֶ֥rָh nָּֽsvּ׃

14.hebrewText: וַ֠יִּקְח֠וּ אֶת־כׇּל־רְכֻ֨שׁ סְדֹ֧ם וַעֲמֹרָ֛ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־אׇכְלָ֖ם וַיֵּלֵֽכוּ׃
14.englishText: [The invaders] seized all the wealth of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their provisions, and went their way.
14.transliteration: vַ֠yִּkְch֠vּ aֶt־kׇּl־rְkֻ֨shׁ sְdֹ֧ם vַaֲmֹrָ֛h vְaֶt־kׇּl־aׇkְlָ֖ם vַyֵּlֵֽkvּ׃

14.hebrewText: וַיִּקְח֨וּ אֶת־ל֧וֹט וְאֶת־רְכֻשׁ֛וֹ בֶּן־אֲחִ֥י אַבְרָ֖ם וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וְה֥וּא יֹשֵׁ֖ב בִּסְדֹֽם׃
14.englishText: They also took Lot, the son of Abram’s brother, and his possessions, and departed; for he had settled in Sodom.
14.transliteration: vַyִּkְch֨vּ aֶt־l֧vֹt vְaֶt־rְkֻshׁ֛vֹ bֶּן־aֲchִ֥y aַbְrָ֖ם vַyֵּlֵ֑kvּ vְh֥vּa yֹshֵׁ֖b bִּsְdֹֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹא֙ הַפָּלִ֔יט וַיַּגֵּ֖ד לְאַבְרָ֣ם הָעִבְרִ֑י וְהוּא֩ שֹׁכֵ֨ן בְּאֵֽלֹנֵ֜י מַמְרֵ֣א הָאֱמֹרִ֗י אֲחִ֤י אֶשְׁכֹּל֙ וַאֲחִ֣י עָנֵ֔ר וְהֵ֖ם בַּעֲלֵ֥י בְרִית־אַבְרָֽם׃
14.englishText: A fugitive brought the news to Abram the Hebrew, who was dwelling at the terebinths of Mamre the Amorite, kinsman of Eshkol and Aner, these being Abram’s allies.
14.transliteration: vַyָּbֹa֙ hַpָּlִ֔yt vַyַּgֵּ֖d lְaַbְrָ֣ם hָaִbְrִ֑y vְhvּa֩ shֹׁkֵ֨ן bְּaֵֽlֹnֵ֜y mַmְrֵ֣a hָaֱmֹrִ֗y aֲchִ֤y aֶshְׁkֹּl֙ vַaֲchִ֣y aָnֵ֔r vְhֵ֖ם bַּaֲlֵ֥y bְrִyt־aַbְrָֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אַבְרָ֔ם כִּ֥י נִשְׁבָּ֖ה אָחִ֑יו וַיָּ֨רֶק אֶת־חֲנִיכָ֜יו יְלִידֵ֣י בֵית֗וֹ שְׁמֹנָ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וַיִּרְדֹּ֖ף עַד־דָּֽן׃
14.englishText: When Abram heard that his kinsman’s [household] had been taken captive, he mustered his retainers,*retainers Meaning of Heb. ḥanikh uncertain. born into his household, numbering three hundred and eighteen, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.
14.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֣a aַbְrָ֔ם kִּ֥y nִshְׁbָּ֖h aָchִ֑yv vַyָּ֨rֶk aֶt־chֲnִykָ֜yv yְlִydֵ֣y bֵyt֗vֹ shְׁmֹnָ֤h aָshָׂr֙ vּshְׁlֹ֣shׁ mֵa֔vֹt vַyִּrְdֹּ֖ף aַd־dָּֽן׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֵּחָלֵ֨ק עֲלֵיהֶ֧ם <small>׀</small> לַ֛יְלָה ה֥וּא וַעֲבָדָ֖יו וַיַּכֵּ֑ם וַֽיִּרְדְּפֵם֙ עַד־חוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִשְּׂמֹ֖אל לְדַמָּֽשֶׂק׃
14.englishText: At night, he and his servants deployed against them and defeated them; and he pursued them as far as Hobah, which is north of Damascus.
14.transliteration: vַyֵּchָlֵ֨k aֲlֵyhֶ֧ם <small>׀</small> lַ֛yְlָh h֥vּa vַaֲbָdָ֖yv vַyַּkֵּ֑ם vַֽyִּrְdְּpֵם֙ aַd־chvֹbָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r mִshְּׂmֹ֖al lְdַmָּֽshֶׂk׃

14.hebrewText: וַיָּ֕שֶׁב אֵ֖ת כׇּל־הָרְכֻ֑שׁ וְגַם֩ אֶת־ל֨וֹט אָחִ֤יו וּרְכֻשׁוֹ֙ הֵשִׁ֔יב וְגַ֥ם אֶת־הַנָּשִׁ֖ים וְאֶת־הָעָֽם׃
14.englishText: He brought back all the possessions; he also brought back his kinsman Lot and his possessions, and the women and the rest of the people.
14.transliteration: vַyָּ֕shֶׁb aֵ֖t kׇּl־hָrְkֻ֑shׁ vְgַם֩ aֶt־l֨vֹt aָchִ֤yv vּrְkֻshׁvֹ֙ hֵshִׁ֔yb vְgַ֥ם aֶt־hַnָּshִׁ֖yם vְaֶt־hָaָֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֣א מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹם֮ לִקְרָאתוֹ֒ אַחֲרֵ֣י שׁוּב֗וֹ מֵֽהַכּוֹת֙ אֶת־כְּדׇרְלָעֹ֔מֶר וְאֶת־הַמְּלָכִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ אֶל־עֵ֣מֶק שָׁוֵ֔ה ה֖וּא עֵ֥מֶק הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
14.englishText: When he returned from defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings with him, the king of Sodom came out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh, which is the Valley of the King.
14.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֣a mֶֽlֶךְ־sְdֹם֮ lִkְrָatvֹ֒ aַchֲrֵ֣y shׁvּb֗vֹ mֵֽhַkּvֹt֙ aֶt־kְּdׇrְlָaֹ֔mֶr vְaֶt־hַmְּlָkִ֖yם aֲshֶׁ֣r aִtּ֑vֹ aֶl־aֵ֣mֶk shָׁvֵ֔h h֖vּa aֵ֥mֶk hַmֶּֽlֶךְ׃

14.hebrewText: וּמַלְכִּי־צֶ֙דֶק֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ שָׁלֵ֔ם הוֹצִ֖יא לֶ֣חֶם וָיָ֑יִן וְה֥וּא כֹהֵ֖ן לְאֵ֥ל עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
14.englishText: And King Melchizedek of Salem brought out bread and wine; he was a priest of God Most High.*God Most High Heb. El ‘Elyon.
14.transliteration: vּmַlְkִּy־tsֶ֙dֶk֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ shָׁlֵ֔ם hvֹtsִ֖ya lֶ֣chֶם vָyָ֑yִן vְh֥vּa kֹhֵ֖ן lְaֵ֥l aֶlְyֽvֹן׃

14.hebrewText: וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֖הוּ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר בָּר֤וּךְ אַבְרָם֙ לְאֵ֣ל עֶלְי֔וֹן קֹנֵ֖ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
14.englishText:
He blessed him, saying,
“Blessed be Abram of God Most High,
Creator of heaven and earth.
14.transliteration: vַֽyְbָrְkֵ֖hvּ vַyֹּamַ֑r bָּr֤vּךְ aַbְrָם֙ lְaֵ֣l aֶlְy֔vֹן kֹnֵ֖h shָׁmַ֥yִם vָaָֽrֶץ׃

14.hebrewText: וּבָרוּךְ֙ אֵ֣ל עֶלְי֔וֹן אֲשֶׁר־מִגֵּ֥ן צָרֶ֖יךָ בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֥וֹ מַעֲשֵׂ֖ר מִכֹּֽל׃
14.englishText:
And blessed be God Most High,
Who has delivered your foes into your hand.” And [Abram] gave him a tenth of everything.
14.transliteration: vּbָrvּךְ֙ aֵ֣l aֶlְy֔vֹן aֲshֶׁr־mִgֵּ֥ן tsָrֶ֖yךָ bְּyָdֶ֑ךָ vַyִּtֶּן־l֥vֹ mַaֲshֵׂ֖r mִkֹּֽl׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹ֖ם אֶל־אַבְרָ֑ם תֶּן־לִ֣י הַנֶּ֔פֶשׁ וְהָרְכֻ֖שׁ קַֽח־לָֽךְ׃
14.englishText: Then the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the persons, and take the possessions for yourself.”
14.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr mֶֽlֶךְ־sְdֹ֖ם aֶl־aַbְrָ֑ם tֶּן־lִ֣y hַnֶּ֔pֶshׁ vְhָrְkֻ֖shׁ kַֽch־lָֽךְ׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אַבְרָ֖ם אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ סְדֹ֑ם הֲרִמֹ֨תִי יָדִ֤י אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ אֵ֣ל עֶלְי֔וֹן קֹנֵ֖ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
14.englishText: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I swear*swear Lit. “lift up my hand.” to יהוה, God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth:
14.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aַbְrָ֖ם aֶl־mֶ֣lֶךְ sְdֹ֑ם hֲrִmֹ֨tִy yָdִ֤y aֶl־yְhֹvָh֙ aֵ֣l aֶlְy֔vֹן kֹnֵ֖h shָׁmַ֥yִם vָaָֽrֶץ׃

14.hebrewText: אִם־מִחוּט֙ וְעַ֣ד שְׂרֽוֹךְ־נַ֔עַל וְאִם־אֶקַּ֖ח מִכׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לָ֑ךְ וְלֹ֣א תֹאמַ֔ר אֲנִ֖י הֶעֱשַׁ֥רְתִּי אֶת־אַבְרָֽם׃
14.englishText: I will not take so much as a thread or a sandal strap of what is yours; you shall not say, ‘It is I who made Abram rich.’
14.transliteration: aִם־mִchvּt֙ vְaַ֣d shְׂrֽvֹךְ־nַ֔aַl vְaִם־aֶkַּ֖ch mִkׇּl־aֲshֶׁr־lָ֑ךְ vְlֹ֣a tֹamַ֔r aֲnִ֖y hֶaֱshַׁ֥rְtִּy aֶt־aַbְrָֽם׃

14.hebrewText: בִּלְעָדַ֗י רַ֚ק אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽכְל֣וּ הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וְחֵ֙לֶק֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלְכ֖וּ אִתִּ֑י עָנֵר֙ אֶשְׁכֹּ֣ל וּמַמְרֵ֔א הֵ֖ם יִקְח֥וּ חֶלְקָֽם׃ {ס}
14.englishText: For me, nothing but what my servants have used up; as for the share of the parties who went with me—Aner, Eshkol, and Mamre—let them take their share.”
14.transliteration: bִּlְaָdַ֗y rַ֚k aֲshֶׁ֣r aָֽkְl֣vּ hַnְּaָrִ֔yם vְchֵ֙lֶk֙ hָֽaֲnָshִׁ֔yם aֲshֶׁ֥r hָlְk֖vּ aִtִּ֑y aָnֵr֙ aֶshְׁkֹּ֣l vּmַmְrֵ֔a hֵ֖ם yִkְch֥vּ chֶlְkָֽם׃ {s}

15.hebrewText: אַחַ֣ר ׀ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה הָיָ֤ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אַבְרָ֔ם בַּֽמַּחֲזֶ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אַל־תִּירָ֣א אַבְרָ֗ם אָנֹכִי֙ מָגֵ֣ן לָ֔ךְ שְׂכָרְךָ֖ הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
15.englishText:
Some time later, the word of יהוה came to Abram in a vision:
“Fear not, Abram,
I am a shield to you;
Your reward shall be very great.”
15.transliteration: aַchַ֣r ׀ hַdְּbָrִ֣yם hָaֵ֗lֶּh hָyָ֤h dְbַr־yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־aַbְrָ֔ם bַּֽmַּchֲzֶ֖h lֵamֹ֑r aַl־tִּyrָ֣a aַbְrָ֗ם aָnֹkִy֙ mָgֵ֣ן lָ֔ךְ shְׂkָrְךָ֖ hַrְbֵּ֥h mְaֹֽd׃

15.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְרָ֗ם אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ מַה־תִּתֶּן־לִ֔י וְאָנֹכִ֖י הוֹלֵ֣ךְ עֲרִירִ֑י וּבֶן־מֶ֣שֶׁק בֵּיתִ֔י ה֖וּא דַּמֶּ֥שֶׂק אֱלִיעֶֽזֶר׃
15.englishText: But Abram said, “O lord יהוה,*lord יהוה Heb. ’adonai y-h-w-h, traditionally read aloud as ’adonai ’elohim (rather than ’adonai twice). NJPS “Lord God.” See also the Dictionary under “male metaphors for God.” what can You give me, seeing that I shall die childless, and the one in charge of my household is Dammesek Eliezer!”*and the one in charge of my household is Dammesek Eliezer Meaning of Heb. uncertain.
15.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aַbְrָ֗ם aֲdֹnָ֤y yֱhֹvִh֙ mַh־tִּtֶּן־lִ֔y vְaָnֹkִ֖y hvֹlֵ֣ךְ aֲrִyrִ֑y vּbֶן־mֶ֣shֶׁk bֵּytִ֔y h֖vּa dַּmֶּ֥shֶׂk aֱlִyaֶֽzֶr׃

15.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְרָ֔ם הֵ֣ן לִ֔י לֹ֥א נָתַ֖תָּה זָ֑רַע וְהִנֵּ֥ה בֶן־בֵּיתִ֖י יוֹרֵ֥שׁ אֹתִֽי׃
15.englishText: Abram said further, “Since You have granted me no offspring, my steward will be my heir.”
15.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aַbְrָ֔ם hֵ֣ן lִ֔y lֹ֥a nָtַ֖tָּh zָ֑rַa vְhִnֵּ֥h bֶן־bֵּytִ֖y yvֹrֵ֥shׁ aֹtִֽy׃

15.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּ֨ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א יִֽירָשְׁךָ֖ זֶ֑ה כִּי־אִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵצֵ֣א מִמֵּעֶ֔יךָ ה֖וּא יִֽירָשֶֽׁךָ׃
15.englishText: The word of יהוה came to him in reply, “That one shall not be your heir; none but your very own issue shall be your heir.”
15.transliteration: vְhִnֵּ֨h dְbַr־yְhֹvָ֤h aֵlָyv֙ lֵamֹ֔r lֹ֥a yִֽyrָshְׁךָ֖ zֶ֑h kִּy־aִם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r yֵtsֵ֣a mִmֵּaֶ֔yךָ h֖vּa yִֽyrָshֶֽׁךָ׃

15.hebrewText: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א אֹת֜וֹ הַח֗וּצָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַבֶּט־נָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֗יְמָה וּסְפֹר֙ הַכּ֣וֹכָבִ֔ים אִם־תּוּכַ֖ל לִסְפֹּ֣ר אֹתָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ כֹּ֥ה יִהְיֶ֖ה זַרְעֶֽךָ׃
15.englishText: [Then in the vision, God] took him outside and said, “Look toward heaven and count the stars, if you are able to count them”—continuing, “So shall your offspring be.”
15.transliteration: vַyּvֹtsֵ֨a aֹt֜vֹ hַch֗vּtsָh vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ hַbֶּt־nָ֣a hַshָּׁmַ֗yְmָh vּsְpֹr֙ hַkּ֣vֹkָbִ֔yם aִם־tּvּkַ֖l lִsְpֹּ֣r aֹtָ֑ם vַyֹּ֣amֶr l֔vֹ kֹּ֥h yִhְyֶ֖h zַrְaֶֽךָ׃

15.hebrewText: וְהֶאֱמִ֖ן בַּֽיהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶ֥הָ לּ֖וֹ צְדָקָֽה׃
15.englishText: And he put his trust in יהוה, who reckoned it to his merit.
15.transliteration: vְhֶaֱmִ֖ן bַּֽyhֹvָ֑h vַyַּchְshְׁbֶ֥hָ lּ֖vֹ tsְdָkָֽh׃

15.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הוֹצֵאתִ֙יךָ֙ מֵא֣וּר כַּשְׂדִּ֔ים לָ֧תֶת לְךָ֛ אֶת־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
15.englishText: Then [God] said to him, “I am יהוה who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans to assign this land to you as a possession.”
15.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr aֵlָ֑yv aֲnִ֣y yְhֹvָ֗h aֲshֶׁ֤r hvֹtsֵatִ֙yךָ֙ mֵa֣vּr kַּshְׂdִּ֔yם lָ֧tֶt lְךָ֛ aֶt־hָaָ֥rֶץ hַzֹּ֖at lְrִshְׁtָּֽhּ׃

15.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה בַּמָּ֥ה אֵדַ֖ע כִּ֥י אִֽירָשֶֽׁנָּה׃
15.englishText: And he said, “O lord יהוה, how shall I know that I am to possess it?”
15.transliteration: vַyֹּamַ֑r aֲdֹnָ֣y yֱhֹvִ֔h bַּmָּ֥h aֵdַ֖a kִּ֥y aִֽyrָshֶֽׁnָּh׃

15.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו קְחָ֥ה לִי֙ עֶגְלָ֣ה מְשֻׁלֶּ֔שֶׁת וְעֵ֥ז מְשֻׁלֶּ֖שֶׁת וְאַ֣יִל מְשֻׁלָּ֑שׁ וְתֹ֖ר וְגוֹזָֽל׃
15.englishText: Came the reply, “Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old she-goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young bird.”
15.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵlָ֗yv kְchָ֥h lִy֙ aֶgְlָ֣h mְshֻׁlֶּ֔shֶׁt vְaֵ֥z mְshֻׁlֶּ֖shֶׁt vְaַ֣yִl mְshֻׁlָּ֑shׁ vְtֹ֖r vְgvֹzָֽl׃

15.hebrewText: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֣וֹ אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֗לֶּה וַיְבַתֵּ֤ר אֹתָם֙ בַּתָּ֔וֶךְ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אִישׁ־בִּתְר֖וֹ לִקְרַ֣את רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְאֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֖ר לֹ֥א בָתָֽר׃
