15.englishText: He brought all these and cut them in two, placing each half opposite the other; but he did not cut up the bird.
15.transliteration: vַyִּֽkַּֽch־l֣vֹ aֶt־kׇּl־aֵ֗lֶּh vַyְbַtֵּ֤r aֹtָם֙ bַּtָּ֔vֶךְ vַyִּtֵּ֥ן aִyshׁ־bִּtְr֖vֹ lִkְrַ֣at rֵaֵ֑hvּ vְaֶt־hַtsִּpֹּ֖r lֹ֥a bָtָֽr׃

15.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥רֶד הָעַ֖יִט עַל־הַפְּגָרִ֑ים וַיַּשֵּׁ֥ב אֹתָ֖ם אַבְרָֽם׃
15.englishText: Birds of prey came down upon the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.
15.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥rֶd hָaַ֖yִt aַl־hַpְּgָrִ֑yם vַyַּshֵּׁ֥b aֹtָ֖ם aַbְrָֽם׃

15.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֤י הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ לָב֔וֹא וְתַרְדֵּמָ֖ה נָפְלָ֣ה עַל־אַבְרָ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה אֵימָ֛ה חֲשֵׁכָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה נֹפֶ֥לֶת עָלָֽיו׃
15.englishText: As the sun was about to set, a deep sleep fell upon Abram, and a great dark dread descended upon him.
15.transliteration: vַyְhִ֤y hַshֶּׁ֙mֶshׁ֙ lָb֔vֹa vְtַrְdֵּmָ֖h nָpְlָ֣h aַl־aַbְrָ֑ם vְhִnֵּ֥h aֵymָ֛h chֲshֵׁkָ֥h gְdֹlָ֖h nֹpֶ֥lֶt aָlָֽyv׃

15.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאַבְרָ֗ם יָדֹ֨עַ תֵּדַ֜ע כִּי־גֵ֣ר ׀ יִהְיֶ֣ה זַרְעֲךָ֗ בְּאֶ֙רֶץ֙ לֹ֣א לָהֶ֔ם וַעֲבָד֖וּם וְעִנּ֣וּ אֹתָ֑ם אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָֽה׃
15.englishText: And [God] said to Abram, “Know well that your offspring shall be strangers in a land not theirs, and they shall be enslaved and oppressed four hundred years;
15.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr lְaַbְrָ֗ם yָdֹ֨aַ tֵּdַ֜a kִּy־gֵ֣r ׀ yִhְyֶ֣h zַrְaֲךָ֗ bְּaֶ֙rֶץ֙ lֹ֣a lָhֶ֔ם vַaֲbָd֖vּם vְaִnּ֣vּ aֹtָ֑ם aַrְbַּ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָֽh׃

15.hebrewText: וְגַ֧ם אֶת־הַגּ֛וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲבֹ֖דוּ דָּ֣ן אָנֹ֑כִי וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֥ן יֵצְא֖וּ בִּרְכֻ֥שׁ גָּדֽוֹל׃
15.englishText: but I will execute judgment on the nation they shall serve, and in the end they shall go free with great wealth.
15.transliteration: vְgַ֧ם aֶt־hַgּ֛vֹy aֲshֶׁ֥r yַaֲbֹ֖dvּ dָּ֣ן aָnֹ֑kִy vְaַchֲrֵy־kֵ֥ן yֵtsְa֖vּ bִּrְkֻ֥shׁ gָּdֽvֹl׃

15.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֛ה תָּב֥וֹא אֶל־אֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ בְּשָׁל֑וֹם תִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּשֵׂיבָ֥ה טוֹבָֽה׃
15.englishText:
As for you,
You shall go to your ancestors in peace;
You shall be buried at a ripe old age.
15.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֛h tָּb֥vֹa aֶl־aֲbֹtֶ֖yךָ bְּshָׁl֑vֹם tִּkָּbֵ֖r bְּshֵׂybָ֥h tvֹbָֽh׃

15.hebrewText: וְד֥וֹר רְבִיעִ֖י יָשׁ֣וּבוּ הֵ֑נָּה כִּ֧י לֹא־שָׁלֵ֛ם עֲוֺ֥ן הָאֱמֹרִ֖י עַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
15.englishText: And they shall return here in the fourth generation, for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet complete.”
15.transliteration: vְd֥vֹr rְbִyaִ֖y yָshׁ֣vּbvּ hֵ֑nָּh kִּ֧y lֹa־shָׁlֵ֛ם aֲvֺ֥ן hָaֱmֹrִ֖y aַd־hֵֽnָּh׃

15.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֤י הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ בָּ֔אָה וַעֲלָטָ֖ה הָיָ֑ה וְהִנֵּ֨ה תַנּ֤וּר עָשָׁן֙ וְלַפִּ֣יד אֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָבַ֔ר בֵּ֖ין הַגְּזָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
15.englishText: When the sun set and it was very dark, there appeared a smoking oven, and a flaming torch which passed between those pieces.
15.transliteration: vַyְhִ֤y hַshֶּׁ֙mֶshׁ֙ bָּ֔aָh vַaֲlָtָ֖h hָyָ֑h vְhִnֵּ֨h tַnּ֤vּr aָshָׁן֙ vְlַpִּ֣yd aֵ֔shׁ aֲshֶׁ֣r aָbַ֔r bֵּ֖yן hַgְּzָrִ֥yם hָaֵֽlֶּh׃

15.hebrewText: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא כָּרַ֧ת יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־אַבְרָ֖ם בְּרִ֣ית לֵאמֹ֑ר לְזַרְעֲךָ֗ נָתַ֙תִּי֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את מִנְּהַ֣ר מִצְרַ֔יִם עַד־הַנָּהָ֥ר הַגָּדֹ֖ל נְהַר־פְּרָֽת׃
15.englishText: On that day יהוה made a covenant with Abram: “To your offspring I assign this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates—
15.transliteration: bַּyּ֣vֹם hַh֗vּa kָּrַ֧t yְhֹvָ֛h aֶt־aַbְrָ֖ם bְּrִ֣yt lֵamֹ֑r lְzַrְaֲךָ֗ nָtַ֙tִּy֙ aֶt־hָaָ֣rֶץ hַzֹּ֔at mִnְּhַ֣r mִtsְrַ֔yִם aַd־hַnָּhָ֥r hַgָּdֹ֖l nְhַr־pְּrָֽt׃

15.hebrewText: אֶת־הַקֵּינִי֙ וְאֶת־הַקְּנִזִּ֔י וְאֵ֖ת הַקַּדְמֹנִֽי׃
15.englishText: the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,
15.transliteration: aֶt־hַkֵּynִy֙ vְaֶt־hַkְּnִzִּ֔y vְaֵ֖t hַkַּdְmֹnִֽy׃

15.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַחִתִּ֥י וְאֶת־הַפְּרִזִּ֖י וְאֶת־הָרְפָאִֽים׃
15.englishText: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,
15.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַchִtִּ֥y vְaֶt־hַpְּrִzִּ֖y vְaֶt־hָrְpָaִֽyם׃

15.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְאֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י וְאֶת־הַגִּרְגָּשִׁ֖י וְאֶת־הַיְבוּסִֽי׃ {ס}
15.englishText: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”
15.transliteration: vְaֶt־hָֽaֱmֹrִy֙ vְaֶt־hַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֔y vְaֶt־hַgִּrְgָּshִׁ֖y vְaֶt־hַyְbvּsִֽy׃ {s}

16.hebrewText: וְשָׂרַי֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת אַבְרָ֔ם לֹ֥א יָלְדָ֖ה ל֑וֹ וְלָ֛הּ שִׁפְחָ֥ה מִצְרִ֖ית וּשְׁמָ֥הּ הָגָֽר׃
16.englishText: Sarai, Abram’s wife, had borne him no children. She had an Egyptian maidservant whose name was Hagar.
16.transliteration: vְshָׂrַy֙ aֵ֣shֶׁt aַbְrָ֔ם lֹ֥a yָlְdָ֖h l֑vֹ vְlָ֛hּ shִׁpְchָ֥h mִtsְrִ֖yt vּshְׁmָ֥hּ hָgָֽr׃

16.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר שָׂרַ֜י אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם הִנֵּה־נָ֞א עֲצָרַ֤נִי יְהֹוָה֙ מִלֶּ֔דֶת בֹּא־נָא֙ אֶל־שִׁפְחָתִ֔י אוּלַ֥י אִבָּנֶ֖ה מִמֶּ֑נָּה וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע אַבְרָ֖ם לְק֥וֹל שָׂרָֽי׃
16.englishText: And Sarai said to Abram, “Look, יהוה has kept me from bearing. Consort with my maid; perhaps I shall have a child*have a child Lit. “be built up,” play on ben “child” and banah “build up.” See the Dictionary under ben. through her.” And Abram heeded Sarai’s request.
16.transliteration: vַtֹּ֨amֶr shָׂrַ֜y aֶl־aַbְrָ֗ם hִnֵּh־nָ֞a aֲtsָrַ֤nִy yְhֹvָh֙ mִlֶּ֔dֶt bֹּa־nָa֙ aֶl־shִׁpְchָtִ֔y avּlַ֥y aִbָּnֶ֖h mִmֶּ֑nָּh vַyִּshְׁmַ֥a aַbְrָ֖ם lְk֥vֹl shָׂrָֽy׃

16.hebrewText: וַתִּקַּ֞ח שָׂרַ֣י אֵֽשֶׁת־אַבְרָ֗ם אֶת־הָגָ֤ר הַמִּצְרִית֙ שִׁפְחָתָ֔הּ מִקֵּץ֙ עֶ֣שֶׂר שָׁנִ֔ים לְשֶׁ֥בֶת אַבְרָ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַתִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛הּ לְאַבְרָ֥ם אִישָׁ֖הּ ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
16.englishText: So Sarai, Abram’s wife, took her maid, Hagar the Egyptian—after Abram had dwelt in the land of Canaan ten years—and gave her to her husband Abram as concubine.
16.transliteration: vַtִּkַּ֞ch shָׂrַ֣y aֵֽshֶׁt־aַbְrָ֗ם aֶt־hָgָ֤r hַmִּtsְrִyt֙ shִׁpְchָtָ֔hּ mִkֵּץ֙ aֶ֣shֶׂr shָׁnִ֔yם lְshֶׁ֥bֶt aַbְrָ֖ם bְּaֶ֣rֶץ kְּnָ֑aַן vַtִּtֵּ֥ן aֹtָ֛hּ lְaַbְrָ֥ם aִyshָׁ֖hּ l֥vֹ lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

16.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֥א אֶל־הָגָ֖ר וַתַּ֑הַר וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ כִּ֣י הָרָ֔תָה וַתֵּקַ֥ל גְּבִרְתָּ֖הּ בְּעֵינֶֽיהָ׃
16.englishText: He cohabited with Hagar and she conceived; and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was lowered in her esteem.
16.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֥a aֶl־hָgָ֖r vַtַּ֑hַr vַtֵּ֙rֶa֙ kִּ֣y hָrָ֔tָh vַtֵּkַ֥l gְּbִrְtָּ֖hּ bְּaֵynֶֽyhָ׃

16.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר שָׂרַ֣י אֶל־אַבְרָם֮ חֲמָסִ֣י עָלֶ֒יךָ֒ אָנֹכִ֗י נָתַ֤תִּי שִׁפְחָתִי֙ בְּחֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ כִּ֣י הָרָ֔תָה וָאֵקַ֖ל בְּעֵינֶ֑יהָ יִשְׁפֹּ֥ט יְהֹוָ֖ה בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽיׄךָ׃
16.englishText: And Sarai said to Abram, “The wrong done me is your fault! I myself put my maid in your bosom; now that she sees that she is pregnant, I am lowered in her esteem. יהוה decide between you and me!”
16.transliteration: vַtֹּ֨amֶr shָׂrַ֣y aֶl־aַbְrָם֮ chֲmָsִ֣y aָlֶ֒yךָ֒ aָnֹkִ֗y nָtַ֤tִּy shִׁpְchָtִy֙ bְּchֵykֶ֔ךָ vַtֵּ֙rֶa֙ kִּ֣y hָrָ֔tָh vָaֵkַ֖l bְּaֵynֶ֑yhָ yִshְׁpֹּ֥t yְhֹvָ֖h bֵּynִ֥y vּbֵynֶֽyׄךָ׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַבְרָ֜ם אֶל־שָׂרַ֗י הִנֵּ֤ה שִׁפְחָתֵךְ֙ בְּיָדֵ֔ךְ עֲשִׂי־לָ֖הּ הַטּ֣וֹב בְּעֵינָ֑יִךְ וַתְּעַנֶּ֣הָ שָׂרַ֔י וַתִּבְרַ֖ח מִפָּנֶֽיהָ׃
16.englishText: Abram said to Sarai, “Your maid is in your hands. Deal with her as you think right.” Then Sarai treated her harshly, and she ran away from her.
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aַbְrָ֜ם aֶl־shָׂrַ֗y hִnֵּ֤h shִׁpְchָtֵךְ֙ bְּyָdֵ֔ךְ aֲshִׂy־lָ֖hּ hַtּ֣vֹb bְּaֵynָ֑yִךְ vַtְּaַnֶּ֣hָ shָׂrַ֔y vַtִּbְrַ֖ch mִpָּnֶֽyhָ׃

16.hebrewText: וַֽיִּמְצָאָ֞הּ מַלְאַ֧ךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה עַל־עֵ֥ין הַמַּ֖יִם בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר עַל־הָעַ֖יִן בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ שֽׁוּר׃
16.englishText: A messenger of יהוה found her by a spring of water in the wilderness, the spring on the road to Shur,
16.transliteration: vַֽyִּmְtsָaָ֞hּ mַlְaַ֧ךְ yְhֹvָ֛h aַl־aֵ֥yן hַmַּ֖yִם bַּmִּdְbָּ֑r aַl־hָaַ֖yִן bְּdֶ֥rֶךְ shֽׁvּr׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמַ֗ר הָגָ֞ר שִׁפְחַ֥ת שָׂרַ֛י אֵֽי־מִזֶּ֥ה בָ֖את וְאָ֣נָה תֵלֵ֑כִי וַתֹּ֕אמֶר מִפְּנֵי֙ שָׂרַ֣י גְּבִרְתִּ֔י אָנֹכִ֖י בֹּרַֽחַת׃
16.englishText: and said, “Hagar, slave of Sarai, where have you come from, and where are you going?” And she said, “I am running away from my mistress Sarai.”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּamַ֗r hָgָ֞r shִׁpְchַ֥t shָׂrַ֛y aֵֽy־mִzֶּ֥h bָ֖at vְaָ֣nָh tֵlֵ֑kִy vַtֹּ֕amֶr mִpְּnֵy֙ shָׂrַ֣y gְּbִrְtִּ֔y aָnֹkִ֖y bֹּrַֽchַt׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה שׁ֖וּבִי אֶל־גְּבִרְתֵּ֑ךְ וְהִתְעַנִּ֖י תַּ֥חַת יָדֶֽיהָ׃
16.englishText: And the messenger of יהוה said to her, “Go back to your mistress, and submit to her harsh treatment.”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr lָhּ֙ mַlְaַ֣ךְ yְhֹvָ֔h shׁ֖vּbִy aֶl־gְּbִrְtֵּ֑ךְ vְhִtְaַnִּ֖y tַּ֥chַt yָdֶֽyhָ׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה הַרְבָּ֥ה אַרְבֶּ֖ה אֶת־זַרְעֵ֑ךְ וְלֹ֥א יִסָּפֵ֖ר מֵרֹֽב׃
16.englishText:
And the messenger of יהוה said to her,
“I will greatly increase your offspring,
And they shall be too many to count.”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr lָhּ֙ mַlְaַ֣ךְ yְhֹvָ֔h hַrְbָּ֥h aַrְbֶּ֖h aֶt־zַrְaֵ֑ךְ vְlֹ֥a yִsָּpֵ֖r mֵrֹֽb׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנָּ֥ךְ הָרָ֖ה וְיֹלַ֣דְתְּ בֵּ֑ן וְקָרָ֤את שְׁמוֹ֙ יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־עׇנְיֵֽךְ׃
16.englishText:
The messenger of יהוה said to her further,
“Behold, you are pregnant
And shall bear a son;
You shall call him Ishmael,*Ishmael I.e., “God heeds.”
For יהוה has paid heed to your suffering.
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr lָhּ֙ mַlְaַ֣ךְ yְhֹvָ֔h hִnָּ֥ךְ hָrָ֖h vְyֹlַ֣dְtְּ bֵּ֑ן vְkָrָ֤at shְׁmvֹ֙ yִshְׁmָaֵ֔al kִּֽy־shָׁmַ֥a yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־aׇnְyֵֽךְ׃

16.hebrewText: וְה֤וּא יִהְיֶה֙ פֶּ֣רֶא אָדָ֔ם יָד֣וֹ בַכֹּ֔ל וְיַ֥ד כֹּ֖ל בּ֑וֹ וְעַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־אֶחָ֖יו יִשְׁכֹּֽן׃
16.englishText:
He shall be a wild ass of a person;*person Or perhaps “sire” (cf. Josh. 14.15, Gen. 2.22b–4.1, and Phoenician usage). Trad. “man.” See the Dictionary under ’adam.
His hand against everyone,
And everyone’s hand against him;
He shall dwell alongside of all his kin.”
16.transliteration: vְh֤vּa yִhְyֶh֙ pֶּ֣rֶa aָdָ֔ם yָd֣vֹ bַkֹּ֔l vְyַ֥d kֹּ֖l bּ֑vֹ vְaַl־pְּnֵ֥y kׇl־aֶchָ֖yv yִshְׁkֹּֽן׃

16.hebrewText: וַתִּקְרָ֤א שֵׁם־יְהֹוָה֙ הַדֹּבֵ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יהָ אַתָּ֖ה אֵ֣ל רֳאִ֑י כִּ֣י אָֽמְרָ֗ה הֲגַ֥ם הֲלֹ֛ם רָאִ֖יתִי אַחֲרֵ֥י רֹאִֽי׃
16.englishText: And she called יהוה*יהוה The messenger who spoke is labeled with the principal’s name, to underscore that the message was delivered on the principal’s behalf. (A narrative convention in the Hebrew Bible.) who spoke to her, “You Are El-roi,”*El-roi Apparently “God of Seeing.” by which she meant, “Have I not gone on seeing after my being seen!”*Have I not gone on seeing after my being seen Meaning of Heb. uncertain.
16.transliteration: vַtִּkְrָ֤a shֵׁם־yְhֹvָh֙ hַdֹּbֵ֣r aֵlֶ֔yhָ aַtָּ֖h aֵ֣l rֳaִ֑y kִּ֣y aָֽmְrָ֗h hֲgַ֥ם hֲlֹ֛ם rָaִ֖ytִy aַchֲrֵ֥y rֹaִֽy׃

16.hebrewText: עַל־כֵּן֙ קָרָ֣א לַבְּאֵ֔ר בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִ֑י הִנֵּ֥ה בֵין־קָדֵ֖שׁ וּבֵ֥ין בָּֽרֶד׃
16.englishText: Therefore the well was called Beer-lahai-roi;*Beer-lahai-roi Apparently “the Well of the Living One who sees me.” it is between Kadesh and Bered.—
16.transliteration: aַl־kֵּן֙ kָrָ֣a lַbְּaֵ֔r bְּaֵ֥r lַchַ֖y rֹaִ֑y hִnֵּ֥h bֵyן־kָdֵ֖shׁ vּbֵ֥yן bָּֽrֶd׃

16.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֧לֶד הָגָ֛ר לְאַבְרָ֖ם בֵּ֑ן וַיִּקְרָ֨א אַבְרָ֧ם שֶׁם־בְּנ֛וֹ אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָ֥ה הָגָ֖ר יִשְׁמָעֵֽאל׃
16.englishText: Hagar bore a son to Abram, and Abram gave the son that Hagar bore him the name Ishmael.
16.transliteration: vַtֵּ֧lֶd hָgָ֛r lְaַbְrָ֖ם bֵּ֑ן vַyִּkְrָ֨a aַbְrָ֧ם shֶׁם־bְּn֛vֹ aֲshֶׁr־yָlְdָ֥h hָgָ֖r yִshְׁmָaֵֽal׃

16.hebrewText: וְאַבְרָ֕ם בֶּן־שְׁמֹנִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים בְּלֶֽדֶת־הָגָ֥ר אֶת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל לְאַבְרָֽם׃ {ס}
16.englishText: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
16.transliteration: vְaַbְrָ֕ם bֶּן־shְׁmֹnִ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h vְshֵׁ֣shׁ shָׁnִ֑yם bְּlֶֽdֶt־hָgָ֥r aֶt־yִshְׁmָaֵ֖al lְaַbְrָֽם׃ {s}

17.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֣י אַבְרָ֔ם בֶּן־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְתֵ֣שַׁע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיֵּרָ֨א יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֲנִי־אֵ֣ל שַׁדַּ֔י הִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ לְפָנַ֖י וֶהְיֵ֥ה תָמִֽים׃
17.englishText: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, יהוה appeared to Abram and said to him, “I am El Shaddai.*El Shaddai Traditionally rendered “God Almighty.” Walk in My ways and be blameless.
17.transliteration: vַyְhִ֣y aַbְrָ֔ם bֶּן־tִּshְׁaִ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h vְtֵ֣shַׁa shָׁnִ֑yם vַyֵּrָ֨a yְhֹvָ֜h aֶl־aַbְrָ֗ם vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֵlָyv֙ aֲnִy־aֵ֣l shַׁdַּ֔y hִtְhַlֵּ֥ךְ lְpָnַ֖y vֶhְyֵ֥h tָmִֽyם׃

17.hebrewText: וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה בְרִיתִ֖י בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ וְאַרְבֶּ֥ה אוֹתְךָ֖ בִּמְאֹ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
17.englishText: I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and I will make you exceedingly numerous.”
17.transliteration: vְaֶtְּnָ֥h bְrִytִ֖y bֵּynִ֣y vּbֵynֶ֑ךָ vְaַrְbֶּ֥h avֹtְךָ֖ bִּmְaֹ֥d mְaֹֽd׃

17.hebrewText: וַיִּפֹּ֥ל אַבְרָ֖ם עַל־פָּנָ֑יו וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּ֛וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵאמֹֽר׃
17.englishText: Abram threw himself on his face; and God spoke to him further,
17.transliteration: vַyִּpֹּ֥l aַbְrָ֖ם aַl־pָּnָ֑yv vַyְdַbֵּ֥r aִtּ֛vֹ aֱlֹhִ֖yם lֵamֹֽr׃

17.hebrewText: אֲנִ֕י הִנֵּ֥ה בְרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וְהָיִ֕יתָ לְאַ֖ב הֲמ֥וֹן גּוֹיִֽם׃
17.englishText: “As for Me, this is My covenant with you: You shall be the father of a multitude of nations.
17.transliteration: aֲnִ֕y hִnֵּ֥h bְrִytִ֖y aִtָּ֑ךְ vְhָyִ֕ytָ lְaַ֖b hֲm֥vֹן gּvֹyִֽם׃

17.hebrewText: וְלֹא־יִקָּרֵ֥א ע֛וֹד אֶת־שִׁמְךָ֖ אַבְרָ֑ם וְהָיָ֤ה שִׁמְךָ֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם כִּ֛י אַב־הֲמ֥וֹן גּוֹיִ֖ם נְתַתִּֽיךָ׃
17.englishText: And you shall no longer be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham,*Abraham Understood as “father of a multitude.” for I make you the father of a multitude of nations.
17.transliteration: vְlֹa־yִkָּrֵ֥a a֛vֹd aֶt־shִׁmְךָ֖ aַbְrָ֑ם vְhָyָ֤h shִׁmְךָ֙ aַbְrָhָ֔ם kִּ֛y aַb־hֲm֥vֹן gּvֹyִ֖ם nְtַtִּֽyךָ׃

17.hebrewText: וְהִפְרֵתִ֤י אֹֽתְךָ֙ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד וּנְתַתִּ֖יךָ לְגוֹיִ֑ם וּמְלָכִ֖ים מִמְּךָ֥ יֵצֵֽאוּ׃
17.englishText: I will make you exceedingly fertile, and make nations of you; and kings shall come forth from you.
17.transliteration: vְhִpְrֵtִ֤y aֹֽtְךָ֙ bִּmְaֹ֣d mְaֹ֔d vּnְtַtִּ֖yךָ lְgvֹyִ֑ם vּmְlָkִ֖yם mִmְּךָ֥ yֵtsֵֽavּ׃

17.hebrewText: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֨י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֜י בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֗ךָ וּבֵ֨ין זַרְעֲךָ֧ אַחֲרֶ֛יךָ לְדֹרֹתָ֖ם לִבְרִ֣ית עוֹלָ֑ם לִהְי֤וֹת לְךָ֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֖ אַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃
17.englishText: I will maintain My covenant between Me and you, and your offspring to come, as an everlasting covenant throughout the ages, to be God to you and to your offspring to come.
17.transliteration: vַhֲkִmֹtִ֨y aֶt־bְּrִytִ֜y bֵּynִ֣y vּbֵynֶ֗ךָ vּbֵ֨yן zַrְaֲךָ֧ aַchֲrֶ֛yךָ lְdֹrֹtָ֖ם lִbְrִ֣yt avֹlָ֑ם lִhְy֤vֹt lְךָ֙ lֵֽalֹhִ֔yם vּֽlְzַrְaֲךָ֖ aַchֲrֶֽyךָ׃

17.hebrewText: וְנָתַתִּ֣י לְ֠ךָ֠ וּלְזַרְעֲךָ֨ אַחֲרֶ֜יךָ אֵ֣ת ׀ אֶ֣רֶץ מְגֻרֶ֗יךָ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן לַאֲחֻזַּ֖ת עוֹלָ֑ם וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
17.englishText: I assign the land you sojourn in to you and your offspring to come, all the land of Canaan, as an everlasting holding. I will be their God.”
17.transliteration: vְnָtַtִּ֣y lְ֠ךָ֠ vּlְzַrְaֲךָ֨ aַchֲrֶ֜yךָ aֵ֣t ׀ aֶ֣rֶץ mְgֻrֶ֗yךָ aֵ֚t kׇּl־aֶ֣rֶץ kְּnַ֔aַן lַaֲchֻzַּ֖t avֹlָ֑ם vְhָyִ֥ytִy lָhֶ֖ם lֵalֹhִֽyם׃

17.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֔ם וְאַתָּ֖ה אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֣י תִשְׁמֹ֑ר אַתָּ֛ה וְזַרְעֲךָ֥ אַֽחֲרֶ֖יךָ לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃
17.englishText: God further said to Abraham, “As for you, you and your offspring to come throughout the ages shall keep My covenant.
17.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֔ם vְaַtָּ֖h aֶt־bְּrִytִ֣y tִshְׁmֹ֑r aַtָּ֛h vְzַrְaֲךָ֥ aַֽchֲrֶ֖yךָ lְdֹrֹtָֽם׃

17.hebrewText: זֹ֣את בְּרִיתִ֞י אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁמְר֗וּ בֵּינִי֙ וּבֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵ֥ין זַרְעֲךָ֖ אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ הִמּ֥וֹל לָכֶ֖ם כׇּל־זָכָֽר׃
17.englishText: Such shall be the covenant between Me and you and your offspring to follow which you shall keep: every male among you shall be circumcised.
17.transliteration: zֹ֣at bְּrִytִ֞y aֲshֶׁ֣r tִּshְׁmְr֗vּ bֵּynִy֙ vּbֵ֣ynֵykֶ֔ם vּbֵ֥yן zַrְaֲךָ֖ aַchֲrֶ֑yךָ hִmּ֥vֹl lָkֶ֖ם kׇּl־zָkָֽr׃

17.hebrewText: וּנְמַלְתֶּ֕ם אֵ֖ת בְּשַׂ֣ר עׇרְלַתְכֶ֑ם וְהָיָה֙ לְא֣וֹת בְּרִ֔ית בֵּינִ֖י וּבֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
17.englishText: You shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and that shall be the sign of the covenant between Me and you.
17.transliteration: vּnְmַlְtֶּ֕ם aֵ֖t bְּshַׂ֣r aׇrְlַtְkֶ֑ם vְhָyָh֙ lְa֣vֹt bְּrִ֔yt bֵּynִ֖y vּbֵynֵykֶֽם׃

17.hebrewText: וּבֶן־שְׁמֹנַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים יִמּ֥וֹל לָכֶ֛ם כׇּל־זָכָ֖ר לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֑ם יְלִ֣יד בָּ֔יִת וּמִקְנַת־כֶּ֙סֶף֙ מִכֹּ֣ל בֶּן־נֵכָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹ֥א מִֽזַּרְעֲךָ֖ הֽוּא׃
17.englishText: And throughout the generations, every male among you shall be circumcised at the age of eight days. As for the homeborn slave and the one bought from an outsider who is not of your offspring,
17.transliteration: vּbֶן־shְׁmֹnַ֣t yָmִ֗yם yִmּ֥vֹl lָkֶ֛ם kׇּl־zָkָ֖r lְdֹrֹtֵykֶ֑ם yְlִ֣yd bָּ֔yִt vּmִkְnַt־kֶּ֙sֶף֙ mִkֹּ֣l bֶּן־nֵkָ֔r aֲshֶׁ֛r lֹ֥a mִֽzַּrְaֲךָ֖ hֽvּa׃

17.hebrewText: הִמּ֧וֹל <small>׀</small> יִמּ֛וֹל יְלִ֥יד בֵּֽיתְךָ֖ וּמִקְנַ֣ת כַּסְפֶּ֑ךָ וְהָיְתָ֧ה בְרִיתִ֛י בִּבְשַׂרְכֶ֖ם לִבְרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
17.englishText: they must be circumcised, homeborn and purchased alike. Thus shall My covenant be marked in your flesh as an everlasting pact.
17.transliteration: hִmּ֧vֹl <small>׀</small> yִmּ֛vֹl yְlִ֥yd bֵּֽytְךָ֖ vּmִkְnַ֣t kַּsְpֶּ֑ךָ vְhָyְtָ֧h bְrִytִ֛y bִּbְshַׂrְkֶ֖ם lִbְrִ֥yt avֹlָֽם׃

17.hebrewText: וְעָרֵ֣ל ׀ זָכָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יִמּוֹל֙ אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר עׇרְלָת֔וֹ וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵעַמֶּ֑יהָ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י הֵפַֽר׃ {ס}
17.englishText: And if any male who is uncircumcised fails to circumcise the flesh of his foreskin, that person shall be cut off from kin; he has broken My covenant.”
17.transliteration: vְaָrֵ֣l ׀ zָkָ֗r aֲshֶׁ֤r lֹֽa־yִmּvֹl֙ aֶt־bְּshַׂ֣r aׇrְlָt֔vֹ vְnִkְrְtָ֛h hַnֶּ֥pֶshׁ hַhִ֖va mֵaַmֶּ֑yhָ aֶt־bְּrִytִ֖y hֵpַֽr׃ {s}

17.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֔ם שָׂרַ֣י אִשְׁתְּךָ֔ לֹא־תִקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמָ֖הּ שָׂרָ֑י כִּ֥י שָׂרָ֖ה שְׁמָֽהּ׃
17.englishText: And God said to Abraham, “As for your wife Sarai, you shall not call her Sarai, but her name shall be Sarah.*Sarah I.e., “princess.”
17.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֔ם shָׂrַ֣y aִshְׁtְּךָ֔ lֹa־tִkְrָ֥a aֶt־shְׁmָ֖hּ shָׂrָ֑y kִּ֥y shָׂrָ֖h shְׁmָֽhּ׃

17.hebrewText: וּבֵרַכְתִּ֣י אֹתָ֔הּ וְגַ֨ם נָתַ֧תִּי מִמֶּ֛נָּה לְךָ֖ בֵּ֑ן וּבֵֽרַכְתִּ֙יהָ֙ וְהָֽיְתָ֣ה לְגוֹיִ֔ם מַלְכֵ֥י עַמִּ֖ים מִמֶּ֥נָּה יִהְיֽוּ׃
17.englishText: I will bless her; indeed, I will give you a son by her. I will bless her so that she shall give rise to nations; rulers of peoples shall issue from her.”
17.transliteration: vּbֵrַkְtִּ֣y aֹtָ֔hּ vְgַ֨ם nָtַ֧tִּy mִmֶּ֛nָּh lְךָ֖ bֵּ֑ן vּbֵֽrַkְtִּ֙yhָ֙ vְhָֽyְtָ֣h lְgvֹyִ֔ם mַlְkֵ֥y aַmִּ֖yם mִmֶּ֥nָּh yִhְyֽvּ׃

17.hebrewText: וַיִּפֹּ֧ל אַבְרָהָ֛ם עַל־פָּנָ֖יו וַיִּצְחָ֑ק וַיֹּ֣אמֶר בְּלִבּ֗וֹ הַלְּבֶ֤ן מֵאָֽה־שָׁנָה֙ יִוָּלֵ֔ד וְאִ֨ם־שָׂרָ֔ה הֲבַת־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה תֵּלֵֽד׃
17.englishText: Abraham threw himself on his face and laughed, as he said to himself, “Can a child be born to a man a hundred years old, or can Sarah bear a child at ninety?”
17.transliteration: vַyִּpֹּ֧l aַbְrָhָ֛ם aַl־pָּnָ֖yv vַyִּtsְchָ֑k vַyֹּ֣amֶr bְּlִbּ֗vֹ hַlְּbֶ֤ן mֵaָֽh־shָׁnָh֙ yִvָּlֵ֔d vְaִ֨ם־shָׂrָ֔h hֲbַt־tִּshְׁaִ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h tֵּlֵֽd׃

17.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים ל֥וּ יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל יִחְיֶ֥ה לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
17.englishText: And Abraham said to God, “O that Ishmael might live by Your favor!”
17.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aַbְrָhָ֖ם aֶl־hָֽaֱlֹhִ֑yם l֥vּ yִshְׁmָaֵ֖al yִchְyֶ֥h lְpָnֶֽyךָ׃

17.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲבָל֙ שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֗ יֹלֶ֤דֶת לְךָ֙ בֵּ֔ן וְקָרָ֥אתָ אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ יִצְחָ֑ק וַהֲקִמֹתִ֨י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֥י אִתּ֛וֹ לִבְרִ֥ית עוֹלָ֖ם לְזַרְע֥וֹ אַחֲרָֽיו׃
17.englishText: God said, “Nevertheless, Sarah your wife shall bear you a son, and you shall name him Isaac;*Isaac Heb. Yiṣḥaq, from ṣaḥaq, “laugh.” and I will maintain My covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his offspring to come.
17.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֱlֹhִ֗yם aֲbָl֙ shָׂrָ֣h aִshְׁtְּךָ֗ yֹlֶ֤dֶt lְךָ֙ bֵּ֔ן vְkָrָ֥atָ aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ yִtsְchָ֑k vַhֲkִmֹtִ֨y aֶt־bְּrִytִ֥y aִtּ֛vֹ lִbְrִ֥yt avֹlָ֖ם lְzַrְa֥vֹ aַchֲrָֽyv׃

17.hebrewText: וּֽלְיִשְׁמָעֵאל֮ שְׁמַעְתִּ֒יךָ֒ הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ בֵּרַ֣כְתִּי אֹת֗וֹ וְהִפְרֵיתִ֥י אֹת֛וֹ וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֥י אֹת֖וֹ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֤ר נְשִׂיאִם֙ יוֹלִ֔יד וּנְתַתִּ֖יו לְג֥וֹי גָּדֽוֹל׃
17.englishText: As for Ishmael, I have heeded you.*I have heeded you Heb. shema‘tikha, play on “Ishmael.” I hereby bless him. I will make him fertile and exceedingly numerous. He shall be the father of twelve chieftains, and I will make of him a great nation.
17.transliteration: vּֽlְyִshְׁmָaֵal֮ shְׁmַaְtִּ֒yךָ֒ hִnֵּ֣h ׀ bֵּrַ֣kְtִּy aֹt֗vֹ vְhִpְrֵytִ֥y aֹt֛vֹ vְhִrְbֵּytִ֥y aֹt֖vֹ bִּmְaֹ֣d mְaֹ֑d shְׁnֵyם־aָshָׂ֤r nְshִׂyaִם֙ yvֹlִ֔yd vּnְtַtִּ֖yv lְg֥vֹy gָּdֽvֹl׃

17.hebrewText: וְאֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אָקִ֣ים אֶת־יִצְחָ֑ק אֲשֶׁר֩ תֵּלֵ֨ד לְךָ֤ שָׂרָה֙ לַמּוֹעֵ֣ד הַזֶּ֔ה בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הָאַחֶֽרֶת׃
17.englishText: But My covenant I will maintain with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you at this season next year.”
17.transliteration: vְaֶt־bְּrִytִ֖y aָkִ֣yם aֶt־yִtsְchָ֑k aֲshֶׁr֩ tֵּlֵ֨d lְךָ֤ shָׂrָh֙ lַmּvֹaֵ֣d hַzֶּ֔h bַּshָּׁnָ֖h hָaַchֶֽrֶt׃

17.hebrewText: וַיְכַ֖ל לְדַבֵּ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ וַיַּ֣עַל אֱלֹהִ֔ים מֵעַ֖ל אַבְרָהָֽם׃
17.englishText: Done speaking with him, God was gone from Abraham.
17.transliteration: vַyְkַ֖l lְdַbֵּ֣r aִtּ֑vֹ vַyַּ֣aַl aֱlֹhִ֔yם mֵaַ֖l aַbְrָhָֽם׃

17.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בְּנ֗וֹ וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־יְלִידֵ֤י בֵיתוֹ֙ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־מִקְנַ֣ת כַּסְפּ֔וֹ כׇּל־זָכָ֕ר בְּאַנְשֵׁ֖י בֵּ֣ית אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיָּ֜מׇל אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר עׇרְלָתָ֗ם בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
17.englishText: Then Abraham took his son Ishmael, and all his homeborn slaves and all those he had bought, every male in Abraham’s household, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins on that very day, as God had spoken to him.
17.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֨ch aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֶt־yִshְׁmָaֵ֣al bְּn֗vֹ vְaֵ֨t kׇּl־yְlִydֵ֤y bֵytvֹ֙ vְaֵt֙ kׇּl־mִkְnַ֣t kַּsְpּ֔vֹ kׇּl־zָkָ֕r bְּaַnְshֵׁ֖y bֵּ֣yt aַbְrָhָ֑ם vַyָּ֜mׇl aֶt־bְּshַׂ֣r aׇrְlָtָ֗ם bְּaֶ֙tsֶם֙ hַyּ֣vֹם hַzֶּ֔h kַּaֲshֶׁ֛r dִּbֶּ֥r aִtּ֖vֹ aֱlֹhִֽyם׃

17.hebrewText: וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם בֶּן־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וָתֵ֖שַׁע שָׁנָ֑ה בְּהִמֹּל֖וֹ בְּשַׂ֥ר עׇרְלָתֽוֹ׃
17.englishText: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin,
17.transliteration: vְaַ֨bְrָhָ֔ם bֶּן־tִּshְׁaִ֥yם vָtֵ֖shַׁa shָׁnָ֑h bְּhִmֹּl֖vֹ bְּshַׂ֥r aׇrְlָtֽvֹ׃

17.hebrewText: וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בְּנ֔וֹ בֶּן־שְׁלֹ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה בְּהִ֨מֹּל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת בְּשַׂ֥ר עׇרְלָתֽוֹ׃
17.englishText: and his son Ishmael was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
17.transliteration: vְyִshְׁmָaֵ֣al bְּn֔vֹ bֶּן־shְׁlֹ֥shׁ aֶshְׂrֵ֖h shָׁnָ֑h bְּhִ֨mֹּl֔vֹ aֵ֖t bְּshַׂ֥r aׇrְlָtֽvֹ׃

17.hebrewText: בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה נִמּ֖וֹל אַבְרָהָ֑ם וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל בְּנֽוֹ׃
17.englishText: Thus Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised on that very day;
17.transliteration: bְּaֶ֙tsֶם֙ hַyּ֣vֹם hַzֶּ֔h nִmּ֖vֹl aַbְrָhָ֑ם vְyִshְׁmָaֵ֖al bְּnֽvֹ׃

17.hebrewText: וְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֤י בֵיתוֹ֙ יְלִ֣יד בָּ֔יִת וּמִקְנַת־כֶּ֖סֶף מֵאֵ֣ת בֶּן־נֵכָ֑ר נִמֹּ֖לוּ אִתּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
17.englishText: and all [men of] his household, his homeborn slaves and those that had been bought from outsiders, were circumcised with him.
17.transliteration: vְkׇl־aַnְshֵׁ֤y bֵytvֹ֙ yְlִ֣yd bָּ֔yִt vּmִkְnַt־kֶּ֖sֶף mֵaֵ֣t bֶּן־nֵkָ֑r nִmֹּ֖lvּ aִtּֽvֹ׃ {p}

vayera.name: Vayera
vayera.summary: The three visitors, the promise of Isaac, the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Lot's escape, Abraham and Abimelech, the birth of Isaac, and the binding of Isaac.

18.hebrewText: וַיֵּרָ֤א אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּאֵלֹנֵ֖י מַמְרֵ֑א וְה֛וּא יֹשֵׁ֥ב פֶּֽתַח־הָאֹ֖הֶל כְּחֹ֥ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
18.englishText: יהוה appeared*appeared Or “initiated communication (with); made contact (with)”—without indicating a visual experience—as in 12.7; 17.1; 26.2, 24; 35.9–10; 48.3–4; and seven passages elsewhere in the Bible. to him by the terebinths of Mamre; he was sitting at the entrance of the tent as the day grew hot.
18.transliteration: vַyֵּrָ֤a aֵlָyv֙ yְhֹvָ֔h bְּaֵlֹnֵ֖y mַmְrֵ֑a vְh֛vּa yֹshֵׁ֥b pֶּֽtַch־hָaֹ֖hֶl kְּchֹ֥ם hַyּֽvֹם׃

18.hebrewText: וַיִּשָּׂ֤א עֵינָיו֙ וַיַּ֔רְא וְהִנֵּה֙ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֔ים נִצָּבִ֖ים עָלָ֑יו וַיַּ֗רְא וַיָּ֤רׇץ לִקְרָאתָם֙ מִפֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ אָֽרְצָה׃
18.englishText: Looking up, he saw three figures*figures Lit. “participants whose involvement defines the depicted situation.” Or “agents [of the divine],” as the notice of the advent of divine communication in v. 1 (see previous note) implies an agency situation that casts these participants in their defining role as agents. Trad. “men.” Cf. Rashbam, Ramban; see further the Dictionary under ’ish; Agent. standing near him. Perceiving this, he ran from the entrance of the tent to greet them and, bowing to the ground,
18.transliteration: vַyִּshָּׂ֤a aֵynָyv֙ vַyַּ֔rְa vְhִnֵּh֙ shְׁlֹshָׁ֣h aֲnָshִׁ֔yם nִtsָּbִ֖yם aָlָ֑yv vַyַּ֗rְa vַyָּ֤rׇץ lִkְrָatָם֙ mִpֶּ֣tַch hָaֹ֔hֶl vַyִּshְׁtַּ֖chvּ aָֽrְtsָh׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֗י אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ אַל־נָ֥א תַעֲבֹ֖ר מֵעַ֥ל עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
18.englishText: he said, “My lords!*My lords Or “My lord,” referring either to the delegation’s apparent leader or to God. If it please you, do not go on past your servant.
18.transliteration: vַyֹּamַ֑r aֲdֹnָ֗y aִם־nָ֨a mָtsָ֤atִy chֵן֙ bְּaֵynֶ֔yךָ aַl־nָ֥a tַaֲbֹ֖r mֵaַ֥l aַbְdֶּֽךָ׃

18.hebrewText: יֻקַּֽח־נָ֣א מְעַט־מַ֔יִם וְרַחֲצ֖וּ רַגְלֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִֽשָּׁעֲנ֖וּ תַּ֥חַת הָעֵֽץ׃
18.englishText: Let a little water be brought; bathe your feet and recline under the tree.
18.transliteration: yֻkַּֽch־nָ֣a mְaַt־mַ֔yִם vְrַchֲts֖vּ rַgְlֵykֶ֑ם vְhִֽshָּׁaֲn֖vּ tַּ֥chַt hָaֵֽץ׃

18.hebrewText: וְאֶקְחָ֨ה פַת־לֶ֜חֶם וְסַעֲד֤וּ לִבְּכֶם֙ אַחַ֣ר תַּעֲבֹ֔רוּ כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֥ן עֲבַרְתֶּ֖ם עַֽל־עַבְדְּכֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֵּ֥ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
18.englishText: And let me fetch a morsel of bread that you may refresh yourselves; then go on—seeing that you have come your servant’s way.” They replied, “Do as you have said.”
18.transliteration: vְaֶkְchָ֨h pַt־lֶ֜chֶם vְsַaֲd֤vּ lִbְּkֶם֙ aַchַ֣r tַּaֲbֹ֔rvּ kִּֽy־aַl־kֵּ֥ן aֲbַrְtֶּ֖ם aַֽl־aַbְdְּkֶ֑ם vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ kֵּ֥ן tַּaֲshֶׂ֖h kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbַּֽrְtָּ׃

18.hebrewText: וַיְמַהֵ֧ר אַבְרָהָ֛ם הָאֹ֖הֱלָה אֶל־שָׂרָ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מַהֲרִ֞י שְׁלֹ֤שׁ סְאִים֙ קֶ֣מַח סֹ֔לֶת ל֖וּשִׁי וַעֲשִׂ֥י עֻגֽוֹת׃
18.englishText: Abraham hastened into the tent to Sarah, and said, “Quick, three seahs of choice flour! Knead and make cakes!”
18.transliteration: vַyְmַhֵ֧r aַbְrָhָ֛ם hָaֹ֖hֱlָh aֶl־shָׂrָ֑h vַyֹּ֗amֶr mַhֲrִ֞y shְׁlֹ֤shׁ sְaִyם֙ kֶ֣mַch sֹ֔lֶt l֖vּshִׁy vַaֲshִׂ֥y aֻgֽvֹt׃

18.hebrewText: וְאֶל־הַבָּקָ֖ר רָ֣ץ אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיִּקַּ֨ח בֶּן־בָּקָ֜ר רַ֤ךְ וָטוֹב֙ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶל־הַנַּ֔עַר וַיְמַהֵ֖ר לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת אֹתֽוֹ׃
18.englishText: Then Abraham ran to the herd, took a calf, tender and choice, and gave it to a servant-boy, who hastened to prepare it.
18.transliteration: vְaֶl־hַbָּkָ֖r rָ֣ץ aַbְrָhָ֑ם vַyִּkַּ֨ch bֶּן־bָּkָ֜r rַ֤ךְ vָtvֹb֙ vַyִּtֵּ֣ן aֶl־hַnַּ֔aַr vַyְmַhֵ֖r lַaֲshׂ֥vֹt aֹtֽvֹ׃

18.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֨ח חֶמְאָ֜ה וְחָלָ֗ב וּבֶן־הַבָּקָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וְהֽוּא־עֹמֵ֧ד עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם תַּ֥חַת הָעֵ֖ץ וַיֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
18.englishText: He took curds and milk and the calf that had been prepared and set these before them; and he waited on them under the tree as they ate.
18.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֨ch chֶmְaָ֜h vְchָlָ֗b vּbֶן־hַbָּkָr֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aָshָׂ֔h vַyִּtֵּ֖ן lִpְnֵyhֶ֑ם vְhֽvּa־aֹmֵ֧d aֲlֵyhֶ֛ם tַּ֥chַt hָaֵ֖ץ vַyֹּakֵֽlvּ׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵׄלָ֔יׄוׄ אַיֵּ֖ה שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּ֥ה בָאֹֽהֶל׃
18.englishText: They said to him, “Where is your wife Sarah?” And he replied, “There, in the tent.”
18.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֣vּ aֵׄlָ֔yׄvׄ aַyֵּ֖h shָׂrָ֣h aִshְׁtֶּ֑ךָ vַyֹּ֖amֶr hִnֵּ֥h bָaֹֽhֶl׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר שׁ֣וֹב אָשׁ֤וּב אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ כָּעֵ֣ת חַיָּ֔ה וְהִנֵּה־בֵ֖ן לְשָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וְשָׂרָ֥ה שֹׁמַ֛עַת פֶּ֥תַח הָאֹ֖הֶל וְה֥וּא אַחֲרָֽיו׃
18.englishText: Then one said, “I will return to you next year,*next year Heb. ka-‘et ḥayyah; cf. Gen. 17.21; 2 Kings 4.16–17. and your wife Sarah shall have a son!” Sarah was listening at the entrance of the tent, which was behind him.
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr shׁ֣vֹb aָshׁ֤vּb aֵlֶ֙yךָ֙ kָּaֵ֣t chַyָּ֔h vְhִnֵּh־bֵ֖ן lְshָׂrָ֣h aִshְׁtֶּ֑ךָ vְshָׂrָ֥h shֹׁmַ֛aַt pֶּ֥tַch hָaֹ֖hֶl vְh֥vּa aַchֲrָֽyv׃

18.hebrewText: וְאַבְרָהָ֤ם וְשָׂרָה֙ זְקֵנִ֔ים בָּאִ֖ים בַּיָּמִ֑ים חָדַל֙ לִהְי֣וֹת לְשָׂרָ֔ה אֹ֖רַח כַּנָּשִֽׁים׃
18.englishText: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in years; Sarah had stopped having her periods.*her periods Heb. ’oraḥ ka-nashim, lit. “the way of women”; NJPS “the periods of women.” (Perhaps, in light of Akkadian ’arḥu “month,” the lit. meaning is actually “women’s menses.”)
18.transliteration: vְaַbְrָhָ֤ם vְshָׂrָh֙ zְkֵnִ֔yם bָּaִ֖yם bַּyָּmִ֑yם chָdַl֙ lִhְy֣vֹt lְshָׂrָ֔h aֹ֖rַch kַּnָּshִֽׁyם׃

18.hebrewText: וַתִּצְחַ֥ק שָׂרָ֖ה בְּקִרְבָּ֣הּ לֵאמֹ֑ר אַחֲרֵ֤י בְלֹתִי֙ הָֽיְתָה־לִּ֣י עֶדְנָ֔ה וַֽאדֹנִ֖י זָקֵֽן׃
18.englishText: And Sarah laughed to herself, saying, “Now that I’ve lost the ability,*I’ve lost the ability Precise force of Heb. veloti uncertain. NJPS “I am withered,” trad. “I am waxed old.” am I to have enjoyment—with my husband so old?”
18.transliteration: vַtִּtsְchַ֥k shָׂrָ֖h bְּkִrְbָּ֣hּ lֵamֹ֑r aַchֲrֵ֤y bְlֹtִy֙ hָֽyְtָh־lִּ֣y aֶdְnָ֔h vַֽadֹnִ֖y zָkֵֽן׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם לָ֣מָּה זֶּה֩ צָחֲקָ֨ה שָׂרָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר הַאַ֥ף אֻמְנָ֛ם אֵלֵ֖ד וַאֲנִ֥י זָקַֽנְתִּי׃
18.englishText: Then יהוה*יהוה The agent who is speaking is labeled with the principal’s name, to underscore that the following message is delivered on the principal’s behalf. (A narrative convention throughout the Hebrew Bible; cf. Kimhi at 31.3.) said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh, saying, ‘Shall I in truth bear a child, old as I am?’
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֑ם lָ֣mָּh zֶּh֩ tsָchֲkָ֨h shָׂrָ֜h lֵamֹ֗r hַaַ֥ף aֻmְnָ֛ם aֵlֵ֖d vַaֲnִ֥y zָkַֽnְtִּy׃

18.hebrewText: הֲיִפָּלֵ֥א מֵיְהֹוָ֖ה דָּבָ֑ר לַמּוֹעֵ֞ד אָשׁ֥וּב אֵלֶ֛יךָ כָּעֵ֥ת חַיָּ֖ה וּלְשָׂרָ֥ה בֵֽן׃
18.englishText: Is anything too wondrous for יהוה ? I will return to you at the same season next year, and Sarah shall have a son.”
18.transliteration: hֲyִpָּlֵ֥a mֵyְhֹvָ֖h dָּbָ֑r lַmּvֹaֵ֞d aָshׁ֥vּb aֵlֶ֛yךָ kָּaֵ֥t chַyָּ֖h vּlְshָׂrָ֥h bֵֽן׃

18.hebrewText: וַתְּכַחֵ֨שׁ שָׂרָ֧ה <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֛ר לֹ֥א צָחַ֖קְתִּי כִּ֣י <small>׀</small> יָרֵ֑אָה וַיֹּ֥אמֶֽר <small>׀</small> לֹ֖א כִּ֥י צָחָֽקְתְּ׃
18.englishText: Sarah lied, saying, “I did not laugh,” for she was frightened. Came the reply, “You did laugh.”
18.transliteration: vַtְּkַchֵ֨shׁ shָׂrָ֧h <small>׀</small> lֵamֹ֛r lֹ֥a tsָchַ֖kְtִּy kִּ֣y <small>׀</small> yָrֵ֑aָh vַyֹּ֥amֶֽr <small>׀</small> lֹ֖a kִּ֥y tsָchָֽkְtְּ׃

18.hebrewText: וַיָּקֻ֤מוּ מִשָּׁם֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיַּשְׁקִ֖פוּ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י סְדֹ֑ם וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם הֹלֵ֥ךְ עִמָּ֖ם לְשַׁלְּחָֽם׃
18.englishText: The agents*agents Lit. “[other] participants whose involvement defines the depicted situation.” See note at 18.2. set out from there and looked down toward Sodom, Abraham walking with them to see them off.
18.transliteration: vַyָּkֻ֤mvּ mִshָּׁם֙ hָֽaֲnָshִׁ֔yם vַyַּshְׁkִ֖pvּ aַl־pְּnֵ֣y sְdֹ֑ם vְaַ֨bְrָhָ֔ם hֹlֵ֥ךְ aִmָּ֖ם lְshַׁlְּchָֽם׃

18.hebrewText: וַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אָמָ֑ר הַֽמְכַסֶּ֤ה אֲנִי֙ מֵֽאַבְרָהָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֲנִ֥י עֹשֶֽׂה׃
18.englishText: Now יהוה had said, “Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do,
18.transliteration: vַֽyhֹvָ֖h aָmָ֑r hַֽmְkַsֶּ֤h aֲnִy֙ mֵֽaַbְrָhָ֔ם aֲshֶׁ֖r aֲnִ֥y aֹshֶֽׂh׃

18.hebrewText: וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם הָי֧וֹ יִֽהְיֶ֛ה לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל וְעָצ֑וּם וְנִ֨בְרְכוּ־ב֔וֹ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
18.englishText: since Abraham is to become a great and populous nation and all the nations of the earth are to bless themselves by him?
18.transliteration: vְaַ֨bְrָhָ֔ם hָy֧vֹ yִֽhְyֶ֛h lְg֥vֹy gָּd֖vֹl vְaָts֑vּם vְnִ֨bְrְkvּ־b֔vֹ kֹּ֖l gּvֹyֵ֥y hָaָֽrֶץ׃

18.hebrewText: כִּ֣י יְדַעְתִּ֗יו לְמַ֩עַן֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְצַוֶּ֜ה אֶת־בָּנָ֤יו וְאֶת־בֵּיתוֹ֙ אַחֲרָ֔יו וְשָֽׁמְרוּ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת צְדָקָ֖ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט לְמַ֗עַן הָבִ֤יא יְהֹוָה֙ עַל־אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֖ר עָלָֽיו׃
18.englishText: For I have singled him out, that he may instruct his children and his posterity to keep the way of יהוה by doing what is just and right, in order that יהוה may bring about for Abraham what has been promised him.”
18.transliteration: kִּ֣y yְdַaְtִּ֗yv lְmַ֩aַן֩ aֲshֶׁ֨r yְtsַvֶּ֜h aֶt־bָּnָ֤yv vְaֶt־bֵּytvֹ֙ aַchֲrָ֔yv vְshָֽׁmְrvּ֙ dֶּ֣rֶךְ yְhֹvָ֔h lַaֲshׂ֥vֹt tsְdָkָ֖h vּmִshְׁpָּ֑t lְmַ֗aַן hָbִ֤ya yְhֹvָh֙ aַl־aַbְrָhָ֔ם aֵ֥t aֲshֶׁr־dִּbֶּ֖r aָlָֽyv׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה זַעֲקַ֛ת סְדֹ֥ם וַעֲמֹרָ֖ה כִּי־רָ֑בָּה וְחַ֨טָּאתָ֔ם כִּ֥י כָבְדָ֖ה מְאֹֽד׃
18.englishText: Then יהוה said, “The outrage of Sodom and Gomorrah is so great, and their sin so grave!
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָ֔h zַaֲkַ֛t sְdֹ֥ם vַaֲmֹrָ֖h kִּy־rָ֑bָּh vְchַ֨tָּatָ֔ם kִּ֥y kָbְdָ֖h mְaֹֽd׃

18.hebrewText: אֵֽרְדָה־נָּ֣א וְאֶרְאֶ֔ה הַכְּצַעֲקָתָ֛הּ הַבָּ֥אָה אֵלַ֖י עָשׂ֣וּ <small>׀</small> כָּלָ֑ה וְאִם־לֹ֖א אֵדָֽעָה׃
18.englishText: I will go down to see whether they have acted altogether according to the outcry that has reached Me; if not, I will take note.”
18.transliteration: aֵֽrְdָh־nָּ֣a vְaֶrְaֶ֔h hַkְּtsַaֲkָtָ֛hּ hַbָּ֥aָh aֵlַ֖y aָshׂ֣vּ <small>׀</small> kָּlָ֑h vְaִם־lֹ֖a aֵdָֽaָh׃

18.hebrewText: וַיִּפְנ֤וּ מִשָּׁם֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ סְדֹ֑מָה וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם עוֹדֶ֥נּוּ עֹמֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
18.englishText: The agents went on from there to Sodom, while Abraham remained standing before יהוה.
18.transliteration: vַyִּpְn֤vּ mִshָּׁם֙ hָֽaֲnָshִׁ֔yם vַyֵּlְk֖vּ sְdֹ֑mָh vְaַ֨bְrָhָ֔ם avֹdֶ֥nּvּ aֹmֵ֖d lִpְnֵ֥y yְhֹvָֽh׃

18.hebrewText: וַיִּגַּ֥שׁ אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַאַ֣ף תִּסְפֶּ֔ה צַדִּ֖יק עִם־רָשָֽׁע׃
18.englishText: Abraham came forward and said, “Will You sweep away the innocent along with the guilty?
18.transliteration: vַyִּgַּ֥shׁ aַbְrָhָ֖ם vַyֹּamַ֑r hַaַ֣ף tִּsְpֶּ֔h tsַdִּ֖yk aִם־rָshָֽׁa׃

18.hebrewText: אוּלַ֥י יֵ֛שׁ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים צַדִּיקִ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעִ֑יר הַאַ֤ף תִּסְפֶּה֙ וְלֹא־תִשָּׂ֣א לַמָּק֔וֹם לְמַ֛עַן חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים הַצַּדִּיקִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּקִרְבָּֽהּ׃
18.englishText: What if there should be fifty innocent within the city; will You then wipe out the place and not forgive it for the sake of the innocent fifty who are in it?
18.transliteration: avּlַ֥y yֵ֛shׁ chֲmִshִּׁ֥yם tsַdִּykִ֖ם bְּt֣vֹךְ hָaִ֑yr hַaַ֤ף tִּsְpֶּh֙ vְlֹa־tִshָּׂ֣a lַmָּk֔vֹם lְmַ֛aַן chֲmִshִּׁ֥yם hַtsַּdִּykִ֖ם aֲshֶׁ֥r bְּkִrְbָּֽhּ׃

18.hebrewText: חָלִ֨לָה לְּךָ֜ מֵעֲשֹׂ֣ת ׀ כַּדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה לְהָמִ֤ית צַדִּיק֙ עִם־רָשָׁ֔ע וְהָיָ֥ה כַצַּדִּ֖יק כָּרָשָׁ֑ע חָלִ֣לָה לָּ֔ךְ הֲשֹׁפֵט֙ כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ לֹ֥א יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
18.englishText: Far be it from You to do such a thing, to bring death upon the innocent as well as the guilty, so that innocent and guilty fare alike. Far be it from You! Shall not the Judge of all the earth deal justly?”
18.transliteration: chָlִ֨lָh lְּךָ֜ mֵaֲshֹׂ֣t ׀ kַּdָּbָ֣r hַzֶּ֗h lְhָmִ֤yt tsַdִּyk֙ aִם־rָshָׁ֔a vְhָyָ֥h kַtsַּdִּ֖yk kָּrָshָׁ֑a chָlִ֣lָh lָּ֔ךְ hֲshֹׁpֵt֙ kׇּl־hָaָ֔rֶץ lֹ֥a yַaֲshֶׂ֖h mִshְׁpָּֽt׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה אִם־אֶמְצָ֥א בִסְדֹ֛ם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים צַדִּיקִ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעִ֑יר וְנָשָׂ֥אתִי לְכׇל־הַמָּק֖וֹם בַּעֲבוּרָֽם׃
18.englishText: And יהוה answered, “If I find within the city of Sodom fifty innocent ones, I will forgive the whole place for their sake.”
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָ֔h aִם־aֶmְtsָ֥a bִsְdֹ֛ם chֲmִshִּׁ֥yם tsַdִּykִ֖ם bְּt֣vֹךְ hָaִ֑yr vְnָshָׂ֥atִy lְkׇl־hַmָּk֖vֹם bַּaֲbvּrָֽם׃

18.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַן אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הִנֵּה־נָ֤א הוֹאַ֙לְתִּי֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔י וְאָנֹכִ֖י עָפָ֥ר וָאֵֽפֶר׃
18.englishText: Abraham spoke up, saying, “Here I venture to speak to my lord, I who am but dust and ashes:
18.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַן aַbְrָhָ֖ם vַyֹּamַ֑r hִnֵּh־nָ֤a hvֹaַ֙lְtִּy֙ lְdַbֵּ֣r aֶl־aֲdֹnָ֔y vְaָnֹkִ֖y aָpָ֥r vָaֵֽpֶr׃

18.hebrewText: א֠וּלַ֠י יַחְסְר֞וּן חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים הַצַּדִּיקִם֙ חֲמִשָּׁ֔ה הֲתַשְׁחִ֥ית בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אֶת־כׇּל־הָעִ֑יר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִ֔ית אִם־אֶמְצָ֣א שָׁ֔ם אַרְבָּעִ֖ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃
18.englishText: What if the fifty innocent should lack five? Will You destroy the whole city for want of the five?” “I will not destroy if I find forty-five there.”
18.transliteration: a֠vּlַ֠y yַchְsְr֞vּן chֲmִshִּׁ֤yם hַtsַּdִּykִם֙ chֲmִshָּׁ֔h hֲtַshְׁchִ֥yt bַּchֲmִshָּׁ֖h aֶt־kׇּl־hָaִ֑yr vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lֹ֣a aַshְׁchִ֔yt aִם־aֶmְtsָ֣a shָׁ֔ם aַrְbָּaִ֖yם vַchֲmִshָּֽׁh׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨סֶף ע֜וֹד לְדַבֵּ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם אַרְבָּעִ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֔ה בַּעֲב֖וּר הָאַרְבָּעִֽים׃
18.englishText: But he spoke up again, and said, “What if forty should be found there?” “I will not do it, for the sake of the forty.”
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨sֶף a֜vֹd lְdַbֵּ֤r aֵlָyv֙ vַyֹּamַ֔r avּlַ֛y yִmָּtsְa֥vּן shָׁ֖ם aַrְbָּaִ֑yם vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lֹ֣a aֶֽaֱshֶׂ֔h bַּaֲb֖vּr hָaַrְbָּaִֽyם׃

18.hebrewText: וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר אַל־נָ֞א יִ֤חַר לַֽאדֹנָי֙ וַאֲדַבֵּ֔רָה אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֔ה אִם־אֶמְצָ֥א שָׁ֖ם שְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃
18.englishText: And he said, “Let not my lord be angry if I go on: What if thirty should be found there?” “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”
18.transliteration: vַ֠yֹּ֠amֶr aַl־nָ֞a yִ֤chַr lַֽadֹnָy֙ vַaֲdַbֵּ֔rָh avּlַ֛y yִmָּtsְa֥vּן shָׁ֖ם shְׁlֹshִׁ֑yם vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lֹ֣a aֶֽaֱshֶׂ֔h aִם־aֶmְtsָ֥a shָׁ֖ם shְׁlֹshִֽׁyם׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּֽה־נָ֤א הוֹאַ֙לְתִּי֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔י אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם עֶשְׂרִ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִ֔ית בַּעֲב֖וּר הָֽעֶשְׂרִֽים׃
18.englishText: And he said, “I venture again to speak to my lord: What if twenty should be found there?” “I will not destroy, for the sake of the twenty.”
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr hִnֵּֽh־nָ֤a hvֹaַ֙lְtִּy֙ lְdַbֵּ֣r aֶl־aֲdֹnָ֔y avּlַ֛y yִmָּtsְa֥vּן shָׁ֖ם aֶshְׂrִ֑yם vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lֹ֣a aַshְׁchִ֔yt bַּaֲb֖vּr hָֽaֶshְׂrִֽyם׃

18.hebrewText: וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר אַל־נָ֞א יִ֤חַר לַֽאדֹנָי֙ וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה אַךְ־הַפַּ֔עַם אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם עֲשָׂרָ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִ֔ית בַּעֲב֖וּר הָעֲשָׂרָֽה׃
18.englishText: And he said, “Let not my lord be angry if I speak but this last time: What if ten should be found there?” “I will not destroy, for the sake of the ten.”
18.transliteration: vַ֠yֹּ֠amֶr aַl־nָ֞a yִ֤chַr lַֽadֹnָy֙ vַaֲdַbְּrָ֣h aַךְ־hַpַּ֔aַם avּlַ֛y yִmָּtsְa֥vּן shָׁ֖ם aֲshָׂrָ֑h vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lֹ֣a aַshְׁchִ֔yt bַּaֲb֖vּr hָaֲshָׂrָֽh׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר כִּלָּ֔ה לְדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וְאַבְרָהָ֖ם שָׁ֥ב לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
18.englishText: Having finished speaking to Abraham, יהוה departed; and Abraham returned to his place.
18.transliteration: vַyֵּ֣lֶךְ yְhֹvָ֔h kַּaֲshֶׁ֣r kִּlָּ֔h lְdַbֵּ֖r aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֑ם vְaַbְrָhָ֖ם shָׁ֥b lִmְkֹmֽvֹ׃

19.hebrewText: וַ֠יָּבֹ֠אוּ שְׁנֵ֨י הַמַּלְאָכִ֤ים סְדֹ֙מָה֙ בָּעֶ֔רֶב וְל֖וֹט יֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּשַֽׁעַר־סְדֹ֑ם וַיַּרְא־לוֹט֙ וַיָּ֣קׇם לִקְרָאתָ֔ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ אַפַּ֖יִם אָֽרְצָה׃
19.englishText: The two messengers arrived in Sodom in the evening, as Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom. When Lot saw them, he rose to greet them and, bowing low with his face to the ground,
19.transliteration: vַ֠yָּbֹ֠avּ shְׁnֵ֨y hַmַּlְaָkִ֤yם sְdֹ֙mָh֙ bָּaֶ֔rֶb vְl֖vֹt yֹshֵׁ֣b bְּshַֽׁaַr־sְdֹ֑ם vַyַּrְa־lvֹt֙ vַyָּ֣kׇם lִkְrָatָ֔ם vַyִּshְׁtַּ֥chvּ aַpַּ֖yִם aָֽrְtsָh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֜אמֶר הִנֶּ֣ה נָּא־אֲדֹנַ֗י ס֣וּרוּ נָ֠א אֶל־בֵּ֨ית עַבְדְּכֶ֤ם וְלִ֙ינוּ֙ וְרַחֲצ֣וּ רַגְלֵיכֶ֔ם וְהִשְׁכַּמְתֶּ֖ם וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֣ם לְדַרְכְּכֶ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לֹּ֔א כִּ֥י בָרְח֖וֹב נָלִֽין׃
19.englishText: he said, “Please, my lords, turn aside to your servant’s house to spend the night, and bathe your feet; then you may be on your way early.” But they said, “No, we will spend the night in the square.”
19.transliteration: vַyֹּ֜amֶr hִnֶּ֣h nָּa־aֲdֹnַ֗y s֣vּrvּ nָ֠a aֶl־bֵּ֨yt aַbְdְּkֶ֤ם vְlִ֙ynvּ֙ vְrַchֲts֣vּ rַgְlֵykֶ֔ם vְhִshְׁkַּmְtֶּ֖ם vַhֲlַkְtֶּ֣ם lְdַrְkְּkֶ֑ם vַyֹּamְr֣vּ lֹּ֔a kִּ֥y bָrְch֖vֹb nָlִֽyן׃

19.hebrewText: וַיִּפְצַר־בָּ֣ם מְאֹ֔ד וַיָּסֻ֣רוּ אֵלָ֔יו וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לָהֶם֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה וּמַצּ֥וֹת אָפָ֖ה וַיֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
19.englishText: But he urged them strongly, so they turned his way and entered his house. He prepared a feast for them and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.
19.transliteration: vַyִּpְtsַr־bָּ֣ם mְaֹ֔d vַyָּsֻ֣rvּ aֵlָ֔yv vַyָּbֹ֖avּ aֶl־bֵּyt֑vֹ vַyַּ֤aַshׂ lָhֶם֙ mִshְׁtֶּ֔h vּmַtsּ֥vֹt aָpָ֖h vַyֹּakֵֽlvּ׃

19.hebrewText: טֶ֘רֶם֮ יִשְׁכָּ֒בוּ֒ וְאַנְשֵׁ֨י הָעִ֜יר אַנְשֵׁ֤י סְדֹם֙ נָסַ֣בּוּ עַל־הַבַּ֔יִת מִנַּ֖עַר וְעַד־זָקֵ֑ן כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם מִקָּצֶֽה׃
19.englishText: They had not yet lain down, when the town council [and] the militia of Sodom*town council [and] the militia of Sodom Cf. Gen. 34.20, Josh. 7.4–5, and Judg. 20.2. Heb. we-’anshe ha-‘ir ’anshe sedom; NJPS “the townspeople, the men of Sodom,” trad. “the men of the city, the men of Sodom.” —insignificant and influential alike,*insignificant and influential alike NJPS “young and old,” trad. “both young and old”; Heb. mi-na‘ar we-‘ad zaqen. See the Dictionary under na‘ar and “elders.” the whole assembly without exception—gathered about the house.
19.transliteration: tֶ֘rֶם֮ yִshְׁkָּ֒bvּ֒ vְaַnְshֵׁ֨y hָaִ֜yr aַnְshֵׁ֤y sְdֹם֙ nָsַ֣bּvּ aַl־hַbַּ֔yִt mִnַּ֖aַr vְaַd־zָkֵ֑ן kׇּl־hָaָ֖ם mִkָּtsֶֽh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרְא֤וּ אֶל־לוֹט֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֔וֹ אַיֵּ֧ה הָאֲנָשִׁ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ הַלָּ֑יְלָה הוֹצִיאֵ֣ם אֵלֵ֔ינוּ וְנֵדְעָ֖ה אֹתָֽם׃
19.englishText: And they shouted to Lot and said to him, “Where are the ones*ones Lit. “participants whose involvement defines the depicted situation.” NJPS “men.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us, that we may be intimate with*be intimate with I.e., humiliate. them.”
19.transliteration: vַyִּkְrְa֤vּ aֶl־lvֹt֙ vַyֹּ֣amְrvּ l֔vֹ aַyֵּ֧h hָaֲnָshִׁ֛yם aֲshֶׁr־bָּ֥avּ aֵlֶ֖yךָ hַlָּ֑yְlָh hvֹtsִyaֵ֣ם aֵlֵ֔ynvּ vְnֵdְaָ֖h aֹtָֽם׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֧א אֲלֵהֶ֛ם ל֖וֹט הַפֶּ֑תְחָה וְהַדֶּ֖לֶת סָגַ֥ר אַחֲרָֽיו׃
19.englishText: So Lot went out to them to the entrance, shut the door behind him,
19.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֧a aֲlֵhֶ֛ם l֖vֹt hַpֶּ֑tְchָh vְhַdֶּ֖lֶt sָgַ֥r aַchֲrָֽyv׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אַל־נָ֥א אַחַ֖י תָּרֵֽעוּ׃
19.englishText: and said, “I beg you, my friends, do not commit such a wrong.
19.transliteration: vַyֹּamַ֑r aַl־nָ֥a aַchַ֖y tָּrֵֽavּ׃

19.hebrewText: הִנֵּה־נָ֨א לִ֜י שְׁתֵּ֣י בָנ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יָדְעוּ֙ אִ֔ישׁ אוֹצִֽיאָה־נָּ֤א אֶתְהֶן֙ אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וַעֲשׂ֣וּ לָהֶ֔ן כַּטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֑ם רַ֠ק לָֽאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָאֵל֙ אַל־תַּעֲשׂ֣וּ דָבָ֔ר כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֥ן בָּ֖אוּ בְּצֵ֥ל קֹרָתִֽי׃
19.englishText: Look, I have two daughters*daughters I.e., of great value to Lot; cf. Judg. 11.35; 2 Sam. 12.3. who have not known a man. Let me bring them out to you, and you may do to them as you please;*do to them as you please I.e., I will entrust them to you as hostages if you will trust me meanwhile with the visitors. but do not do anything to the others,*the others NJPS “these men.” Cf. note at v. 5. since they have come under the shelter of my roof.”
19.transliteration: hִnֵּh־nָ֨a lִ֜y shְׁtֵּ֣y bָn֗vֹt aֲshֶׁ֤r lֹֽa־yָdְavּ֙ aִ֔yshׁ avֹtsִֽyaָh־nָּ֤a aֶtְhֶן֙ aֲlֵykֶ֔ם vַaֲshׂ֣vּ lָhֶ֔ן kַּtּ֖vֹb bְּaֵynֵykֶ֑ם rַ֠k lָֽaֲnָshִׁ֤yם hָaֵl֙ aַl־tַּaֲshׂ֣vּ dָbָ֔r kִּֽy־aַl־kֵּ֥ן bָּ֖avּ bְּtsֵ֥l kֹrָtִֽy׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ ׀ גֶּשׁ־הָ֗לְאָה וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ הָאֶחָ֤ד בָּֽא־לָגוּר֙ וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֣ט שָׁפ֔וֹט עַתָּ֕ה נָרַ֥ע לְךָ֖ מֵהֶ֑ם וַיִּפְצְר֨וּ בָאִ֤ישׁ בְּלוֹט֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַֽיִּגְּשׁ֖וּ לִשְׁבֹּ֥ר הַדָּֽלֶת׃
19.englishText: But they said, “Stand back! The fellow,” they said, “came here as an alien, and already he acts the ruler! Now we will deal worse with you than with them.” And they pressed hard against that householder*against that householder Heb. ba-’ish; NJPS “against the person [of Lot],” trad. “upon the man.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. —against Lot—and moved forward to break the door.
19.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֣vּ ׀ gֶּshׁ־hָ֗lְaָh vַyֹּֽamְrvּ֙ hָaֶchָ֤d bָּֽa־lָgvּr֙ vַyִּshְׁpֹּ֣t shָׁp֔vֹt aַtָּ֕h nָrַ֥a lְךָ֖ mֵhֶ֑ם vַyִּpְtsְr֨vּ bָaִ֤yshׁ bְּlvֹt֙ mְaֹ֔d vַֽyִּgְּshׁ֖vּ lִshְׁbֹּ֥r hַdָּֽlֶt׃

19.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁלְח֤וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֶת־יָדָ֔ם וַיָּבִ֧יאוּ אֶת־ל֛וֹט אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הַבָּ֑יְתָה וְאֶת־הַדֶּ֖לֶת סָגָֽרוּ׃
19.englishText: But the agents*agents See notes at 18.2, 16; cf. 19.1. stretched out their hands and pulled Lot into the house with them, and shut the door.
19.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁlְch֤vּ hָֽaֲnָshִׁyם֙ aֶt־yָdָ֔ם vַyָּbִ֧yavּ aֶt־l֛vֹt aֲlֵyhֶ֖ם hַbָּ֑yְtָh vְaֶt־hַdֶּ֖lֶt sָgָֽrvּ׃

19.hebrewText: וְֽאֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֞ים אֲשֶׁר־פֶּ֣תַח הַבַּ֗יִת הִכּוּ֙ בַּסַּנְוֵרִ֔ים מִקָּטֹ֖ן וְעַד־גָּד֑וֹל וַיִּלְא֖וּ לִמְצֹ֥א הַפָּֽתַח׃
19.englishText: And the people*people So NJPS; lit. “[other] participants whose involvement defines the depicted situation.” Trad. “men.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. who were at the entrance of the house, low and high alike,*low and high alike Cf. note at v. 4. Heb. mi-katon we-‘ad gadol; NJPS “young and old,” trad. “both small and great.” they struck with blinding light, so that they were helpless to find the entrance.
19.transliteration: vְֽaֶt־hָaֲnָshִׁ֞yם aֲshֶׁr־pֶּ֣tַch hַbַּ֗yִt hִkּvּ֙ bַּsַּnְvֵrִ֔yם mִkָּtֹ֖ן vְaַd־gָּd֑vֹl vַyִּlְa֖vּ lִmְtsֹ֥a hַpָּֽtַch׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים אֶל־ל֗וֹט עֹ֚ד מִֽי־לְךָ֣ פֹ֔ה חָתָן֙ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יךָ וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ֖ בָּעִ֑יר הוֹצֵ֖א מִן־הַמָּקֽוֹם׃
19.englishText: Then the agents said to Lot, “Whom else have you here? Sons-in-law, your sons and daughters, or anyone else that you have in the city—bring them out of the place.
19.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֨vּ hָaֲnָshִׁ֜yם aֶl־l֗vֹt aֹ֚d mִֽy־lְךָ֣ pֹ֔h chָtָן֙ vּbָnֶ֣yךָ vּbְnֹtֶ֔yךָ vְkֹ֥l aֲshֶׁr־lְךָ֖ bָּaִ֑yr hvֹtsֵ֖a mִן־hַmָּkֽvֹם׃

19.hebrewText: כִּֽי־מַשְׁחִתִ֣ים אֲנַ֔חְנוּ אֶת־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּֽי־גָדְלָ֤ה צַעֲקָתָם֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיְשַׁלְּחֵ֥נוּ יְהֹוָ֖ה לְשַׁחֲתָֽהּ׃
19.englishText: For we are about to destroy this place; because the outcry against them before יהוה has become so great that יהוה has sent us to destroy it.”
19.transliteration: kִּֽy־mַshְׁchִtִ֣yם aֲnַ֔chְnvּ aֶt־hַmָּk֖vֹם hַzֶּ֑h kִּֽy־gָdְlָ֤h tsַaֲkָtָם֙ aֶt־pְּnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֔h vַyְshַׁlְּchֵ֥nvּ yְhֹvָ֖h lְshַׁchֲtָֽhּ׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֨א ל֜וֹט וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר ׀ אֶל־חֲתָנָ֣יו ׀ לֹקְחֵ֣י בְנֹתָ֗יו וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ ק֤וּמוּ צְּאוּ֙ מִן־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה כִּֽי־מַשְׁחִ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־הָעִ֑יר וַיְהִ֥י כִמְצַחֵ֖ק בְּעֵינֵ֥י חֲתָנָֽיו׃
19.englishText: So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who had married his daughters, and said, “Up, get out of this place, for יהוה is about to destroy the city.” But he seemed to his sons-in-law as one who jests.
19.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֨a l֜vֹt vַyְdַbֵּ֣r ׀ aֶl־chֲtָnָ֣yv ׀ lֹkְchֵ֣y bְnֹtָ֗yv vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ k֤vּmvּ tsְּavּ֙ mִן־hַmָּk֣vֹם hַzֶּ֔h kִּֽy־mַshְׁchִ֥yt yְhֹvָ֖h aֶt־hָaִ֑yr vַyְhִ֥y kִmְtsַchֵ֖k bְּaֵynֵ֥y chֲtָnָֽyv׃

19.hebrewText: וּכְמוֹ֙ הַשַּׁ֣חַר עָלָ֔ה וַיָּאִ֥יצוּ הַמַּלְאָכִ֖ים בְּל֣וֹט לֵאמֹ֑ר קוּם֩ קַ֨ח אֶֽת־אִשְׁתְּךָ֜ וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֤י בְנֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ הַנִּמְצָאֹ֔ת פֶּן־תִּסָּפֶ֖ה בַּעֲוֺ֥ן הָעִֽיר׃
19.englishText: As dawn broke, the messengers urged Lot on, saying, “Up, take your wife and your two remaining daughters, lest you be swept away because of the iniquity of the city.”
19.transliteration: vּkְmvֹ֙ hַshַּׁ֣chַr aָlָ֔h vַyָּaִ֥ytsvּ hַmַּlְaָkִ֖yם bְּl֣vֹt lֵamֹ֑r kvּם֩ kַ֨ch aֶֽt־aִshְׁtְּךָ֜ vְaֶt־shְׁtֵּ֤y bְnֹtֶ֙yךָ֙ hַnִּmְtsָaֹ֔t pֶּן־tִּsָּpֶ֖h bַּaֲvֺ֥ן hָaִֽyr׃

19.hebrewText: וַֽיִּתְמַהְמָ֓הּ ׀ וַיַּחֲזִ֨יקוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים בְּיָד֣וֹ וּבְיַד־אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ וּבְיַד֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י בְנֹתָ֔יו בְּחֶמְלַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה עָלָ֑יו וַיֹּצִאֻ֥הוּ וַיַּנִּחֻ֖הוּ מִח֥וּץ לָעִֽיר׃
19.englishText: Still he delayed. So the agents seized his hand, and the hands of his wife and his two daughters—in יהוה’s mercy on him—and brought him out and left him outside the city.
19.transliteration: vַֽyִּtְmַhְmָ֓hּ ׀ vַyַּchֲzִ֨ykvּ hָaֲnָshִׁ֜yם bְּyָd֣vֹ vּbְyַd־aִshְׁtּ֗vֹ vּbְyַd֙ shְׁtֵּ֣y bְnֹtָ֔yv bְּchֶmְlַ֥t yְhֹvָ֖h aָlָ֑yv vַyֹּtsִaֻ֥hvּ vַyַּnִּchֻ֖hvּ mִch֥vּץ lָaִֽyr׃

19.hebrewText: וַיְהִי֩ כְהוֹצִיאָ֨ם אֹתָ֜ם הַח֗וּצָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הִמָּלֵ֣ט עַל־נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ אַל־תַּבִּ֣יט אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ וְאַֽל־תַּעֲמֹ֖ד בְּכׇל־הַכִּכָּ֑ר הָהָ֥רָה הִמָּלֵ֖ט פֶּן־תִּסָּפֶֽה׃
19.englishText: When they had brought them outside, one said, “Flee for your life! Do not look behind you, nor stop anywhere in the Plain; flee to the hills, lest you be swept away.”
19.transliteration: vַyְhִy֩ kְhvֹtsִyaָ֨ם aֹtָ֜ם hַch֗vּtsָh vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ hִmָּlֵ֣t aַl־nַpְshֶׁ֔ךָ aַl־tַּbִּ֣yt aַchֲrֶ֔yךָ vְaַֽl־tַּaֲmֹ֖d bְּkׇl־hַkִּkָּ֑r hָhָ֥rָh hִmָּlֵ֖t pֶּן־tִּsָּpֶֽh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹט אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אַל־נָ֖א אֲדֹנָֽי׃
19.englishText: But Lot said to them, “Oh no, my lord!
19.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr l֖vֹt aֲlֵhֶ֑ם aַl־nָ֖a aֲdֹnָֽy׃

19.hebrewText: הִנֵּה־נָ֠א מָצָ֨א עַבְדְּךָ֣ חֵן֮ בְּעֵינֶ֒יךָ֒ וַתַּגְדֵּ֣ל חַסְדְּךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ עִמָּדִ֔י לְהַחֲי֖וֹת אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֑י וְאָנֹכִ֗י לֹ֤א אוּכַל֙ לְהִמָּלֵ֣ט הָהָ֔רָה פֶּן־תִּדְבָּקַ֥נִי הָרָעָ֖ה וָמַֽתִּי׃
19.englishText: You have been so gracious to your servant, and have already shown me so much kindness in order to save my life; but I cannot flee to the hills, lest the disaster overtake me and I die.
19.transliteration: hִnֵּh־nָ֠a mָtsָ֨a aַbְdְּךָ֣ chֵן֮ bְּaֵynֶ֒yךָ֒ vַtַּgְdֵּ֣l chַsְdְּךָ֗ aֲshֶׁ֤r aָshִׂ֙ytָ֙ aִmָּdִ֔y lְhַchֲy֖vֹt aֶt־nַpְshִׁ֑y vְaָnֹkִ֗y lֹ֤a avּkַl֙ lְhִmָּlֵ֣t hָhָ֔rָh pֶּן־tִּdְbָּkַ֥nִy hָrָaָ֖h vָmַֽtִּy׃

19.hebrewText: הִנֵּה־נָ֠א הָעִ֨יר הַזֹּ֧את קְרֹבָ֛ה לָנ֥וּס שָׁ֖מָּה וְהִ֣וא מִצְעָ֑ר אִמָּלְטָ֨ה נָּ֜א שָׁ֗מָּה הֲלֹ֥א מִצְעָ֛ר הִ֖וא וּתְחִ֥י נַפְשִֽׁי׃
19.englishText: Look, that town there is near enough to flee to; it is such a little place! Let me flee there—it is such a little place—and let my life be saved.”
19.transliteration: hִnֵּh־nָ֠a hָaִ֨yr hַzֹּ֧at kְrֹbָ֛h lָn֥vּs shָׁ֖mָּh vְhִ֣va mִtsְaָ֑r aִmָּlְtָ֨h nָּ֜a shָׁ֗mָּh hֲlֹ֥a mִtsְaָ֛r hִ֖va vּtְchִ֥y nַpְshִֽׁy׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּה֙ נָשָׂ֣אתִי פָנֶ֔יךָ גַּ֖ם לַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה לְבִלְתִּ֛י הׇפְכִּ֥י אֶת־הָעִ֖יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
19.englishText: He replied, “Very well, I will grant you this favor too, and I will not annihilate the town of which you have spoken.
19.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵlָ֔yv hִnֵּh֙ nָshָׂ֣atִy pָnֶ֔yךָ gַּ֖ם lַdָּbָ֣r hַzֶּ֑h lְbִlְtִּ֛y hׇpְkִּ֥y aֶt־hָaִ֖yr aֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbַּֽrְtָּ׃

19.hebrewText: מַהֵר֙ הִמָּלֵ֣ט שָׁ֔מָּה כִּ֣י לֹ֤א אוּכַל֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת דָּבָ֔ר עַד־בֹּאֲךָ֖ שָׁ֑מָּה עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרָ֥א שֵׁם־הָעִ֖יר צֽוֹעַר׃
19.englishText: Hurry, flee there, for I cannot do anything until you arrive there.” Hence the town came to be called Zoar.*Zoar Connected with miṣ‘ar “a little place,” v. 20.
19.transliteration: mַhֵr֙ hִmָּlֵ֣t shָׁ֔mָּh kִּ֣y lֹ֤a avּkַl֙ lַaֲshׂ֣vֹt dָּbָ֔r aַd־bֹּaֲךָ֖ shָׁ֑mָּh aַl־kֵּ֛ן kָrָ֥a shֵׁם־hָaִ֖yr tsֽvֹaַr׃

19.hebrewText: הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ יָצָ֣א עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְל֖וֹט בָּ֥א צֹֽעֲרָה׃
19.englishText: As the sun rose upon the earth and Lot entered Zoar,
19.transliteration: hַshֶּׁ֖mֶshׁ yָtsָ֣a aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vְl֖vֹt bָּ֥a tsֹֽaֲrָh׃

19.hebrewText: וַֽיהֹוָ֗ה הִמְטִ֧יר עַל־סְדֹ֛ם וְעַל־עֲמֹרָ֖ה גׇּפְרִ֣ית וָאֵ֑שׁ מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה מִן־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
19.englishText: יהוה rained upon Sodom and Gomorrah sulfurous fire from יהוה out of heaven—
19.transliteration: vַֽyhֹvָ֗h hִmְtִ֧yr aַl־sְdֹ֛ם vְaַl־aֲmֹrָ֖h gׇּpְrִ֣yt vָaֵ֑shׁ mֵaֵ֥t yְhֹvָ֖h mִן־hַshָּׁmָֽyִם׃

19.hebrewText: וַֽיַּהֲפֹךְ֙ אֶת־הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔ל וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־הַכִּכָּ֑ר וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הֶעָרִ֔ים וְצֶ֖מַח הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
19.englishText: annihilating those cities and the entire Plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities and the vegetation of the ground.
19.transliteration: vַֽyַּhֲpֹךְ֙ aֶt־hֶaָrִ֣yם hָaֵ֔l vְaֵ֖t kׇּl־hַkִּkָּ֑r vְaֵt֙ kׇּl־yֹshְׁbֵ֣y hֶaָrִ֔yם vְtsֶ֖mַch hָaֲdָmָֽh׃

19.hebrewText: וַתַּבֵּ֥ט אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מֵאַחֲרָ֑יו וַתְּהִ֖י נְצִ֥יב מֶֽלַח׃
19.englishText: Lot’s*Lot’s Lit. “His.” wife looked back,*back Lit. “behind him.” and she thereupon turned into a pillar of salt.
19.transliteration: vַtַּbֵּ֥t aִshְׁtּ֖vֹ mֵaַchֲrָ֑yv vַtְּhִ֖y nְtsִ֥yb mֶֽlַch׃

19.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֥ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם בַּבֹּ֑קֶר אֶ֨ל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥מַד שָׁ֖ם אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
19.englishText: Next morning, Abraham hurried to the place where he had stood before יהוה,
19.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֥ם aַbְrָhָ֖ם bַּbֹּ֑kֶr aֶ֨l־hַmָּk֔vֹם aֲshֶׁr־aָ֥mַd shָׁ֖ם aֶt־pְּnֵ֥y yְhֹvָֽh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁקֵ֗ף עַל־פְּנֵ֤י סְדֹם֙ וַעֲמֹרָ֔ה וְעַֽל־כׇּל־פְּנֵ֖י אֶ֣רֶץ הַכִּכָּ֑ר וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה עָלָה֙ קִיטֹ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ כְּקִיטֹ֖ר הַכִּבְשָֽׁן׃
19.englishText: and, looking down toward Sodom and Gomorrah and all the land of the Plain, he saw the smoke of the land rising like the smoke of a kiln.
19.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkֵ֗ף aַl־pְּnֵ֤y sְdֹם֙ vַaֲmֹrָ֔h vְaַֽl־kׇּl־pְּnֵ֖y aֶ֣rֶץ hַkִּkָּ֑r vַyַּ֗rְa vְhִnֵּ֤h aָlָh֙ kִytֹ֣r hָaָ֔rֶץ kְּkִytֹ֖r hַkִּbְshָֽׁן׃

19.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י בְּשַׁחֵ֤ת אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־עָרֵ֣י הַכִּכָּ֔ר וַיִּזְכֹּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיְשַׁלַּ֤ח אֶת־לוֹט֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַהֲפֵכָ֔ה בַּהֲפֹךְ֙ אֶת־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יָשַׁ֥ב בָּהֵ֖ן לֽוֹט׃
19.englishText: Thus it was that, when God destroyed the cities of the Plain and annihilated the cities where Lot dwelt, God was mindful of Abraham and removed Lot from the midst of the upheaval.
19.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y bְּshַׁchֵ֤t aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶt־aָrֵ֣y hַkִּkָּ֔r vַyִּzְkֹּ֥r aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־aַbְrָhָ֑ם vַyְshַׁlַּ֤ch aֶt־lvֹt֙ mִtּ֣vֹךְ hַhֲpֵkָ֔h bַּhֲpֹךְ֙ aֶt־hֶ֣aָrִ֔yם aֲshֶׁr־yָshַׁ֥b bָּhֵ֖ן lֽvֹt׃

19.hebrewText: וַיַּ֩עַל֩ ל֨וֹט מִצּ֜וֹעַר וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב בָּהָ֗ר וּשְׁתֵּ֤י בְנֹתָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י יָרֵ֖א לָשֶׁ֣בֶת בְּצ֑וֹעַר וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בַּמְּעָרָ֔ה ה֖וּא וּשְׁתֵּ֥י בְנֹתָֽיו׃
19.englishText: Lot went up from Zoar and settled in the hill country with his two daughters, for he was afraid to dwell in Zoar; and he and his two daughters lived in a cave.
19.transliteration: vַyַּ֩aַl֩ l֨vֹt mִtsּ֜vֹaַr vַyֵּ֣shֶׁb bָּhָ֗r vּshְׁtֵּ֤y bְnֹtָyv֙ aִmּ֔vֹ kִּ֥y yָrֵ֖a lָshֶׁ֣bֶt bְּts֑vֹaַr vַyֵּ֙shֶׁb֙ bַּmְּaָrָ֔h h֖vּa vּshְׁtֵּ֥y bְnֹtָֽyv׃

19.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֧אמֶר הַבְּכִירָ֛ה אֶל־הַצְּעִירָ֖ה אָבִ֣ינוּ זָקֵ֑ן וְאִ֨ישׁ אֵ֤ין בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ לָב֣וֹא עָלֵ֔ינוּ כְּדֶ֖רֶךְ כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
19.englishText: And the older one said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is not a man on earth to consort with us in the way of all the world.
19.transliteration: vַtֹּ֧amֶr hַbְּkִyrָ֛h aֶl־hַtsְּaִyrָ֖h aָbִ֣ynvּ zָkֵ֑ן vְaִ֨yshׁ aֵ֤yן bָּaָ֙rֶץ֙ lָb֣vֹa aָlֵ֔ynvּ kְּdֶ֖rֶךְ kׇּl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

19.hebrewText: לְכָ֨ה נַשְׁקֶ֧ה אֶת־אָבִ֛ינוּ יַ֖יִן וְנִשְׁכְּבָ֣ה עִמּ֑וֹ וּנְחַיֶּ֥ה מֵאָבִ֖ינוּ זָֽרַע׃
19.englishText: Come, let us make our father drink wine, and let us lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”
19.transliteration: lְkָ֨h nַshְׁkֶ֧h aֶt־aָbִ֛ynvּ yַ֖yִן vְnִshְׁkְּbָ֣h aִmּ֑vֹ vּnְchַyֶּ֥h mֵaָbִ֖ynvּ zָֽrַa׃

19.hebrewText: וַתַּשְׁקֶ֧יןָ אֶת־אֲבִיהֶ֛ן יַ֖יִן בַּלַּ֣יְלָה ה֑וּא וַתָּבֹ֤א הַבְּכִירָה֙ וַתִּשְׁכַּ֣ב אֶת־אָבִ֔יהָ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֥ע בְּשִׁכְבָ֖הּ וּבְקוּׄמָֽהּ׃
19.englishText: That night they made their father drink wine, and the older one went in and lay with her father; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.
19.transliteration: vַtַּshְׁkֶ֧yןָ aֶt־aֲbִyhֶ֛ן yַ֖yִן bַּlַּ֣yְlָh h֑vּa vַtָּbֹ֤a hַbְּkִyrָh֙ vַtִּshְׁkַּ֣b aֶt־aָbִ֔yhָ vְlֹֽa־yָdַ֥a bְּshִׁkְbָ֖hּ vּbְkvּׄmָֽhּ׃

19.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַתֹּ֤אמֶר הַבְּכִירָה֙ אֶל־הַצְּעִירָ֔ה הֵן־שָׁכַ֥בְתִּי אֶ֖מֶשׁ אֶת־אָבִ֑י נַשְׁקֶ֨נּוּ יַ֜יִן גַּם־הַלַּ֗יְלָה וּבֹ֙אִי֙ שִׁכְבִ֣י עִמּ֔וֹ וּנְחַיֶּ֥ה מֵאָבִ֖ינוּ זָֽרַע׃
19.englishText: The next day the older one said to the younger, “See, I lay with Father last night; let us make him drink wine tonight also, and you go and lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”
19.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ mִֽmׇּchֳrָ֔t vַtֹּ֤amֶr hַbְּkִyrָh֙ aֶl־hַtsְּaִyrָ֔h hֵן־shָׁkַ֥bְtִּy aֶ֖mֶshׁ aֶt־aָbִ֑y nַshְׁkֶ֨nּvּ yַ֜yִן gַּם־hַlַּ֗yְlָh vּbֹ֙aִy֙ shִׁkְbִ֣y aִmּ֔vֹ vּnְchַyֶּ֥h mֵaָbִ֖ynvּ zָֽrַa׃

19.hebrewText: וַתַּשְׁקֶ֜יןָ גַּ֣ם בַּלַּ֧יְלָה הַה֛וּא אֶת־אֲבִיהֶ֖ן יָ֑יִן וַתָּ֤קׇם הַצְּעִירָה֙ וַתִּשְׁכַּ֣ב עִמּ֔וֹ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֥ע בְּשִׁכְבָ֖הּ וּבְקֻמָֽהּ׃
19.englishText: That night also they made their father drink wine, and the younger one went and lay with him; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.
19.transliteration: vַtַּshְׁkֶ֜yןָ gַּ֣ם bַּlַּ֧yְlָh hַh֛vּa aֶt־aֲbִyhֶ֖ן yָ֑yִן vַtָּ֤kׇם hַtsְּaִyrָh֙ vַtִּshְׁkַּ֣b aִmּ֔vֹ vְlֹֽa־yָdַ֥a bְּshִׁkְbָ֖hּ vּbְkֻmָֽhּ׃

19.hebrewText: וַֽתַּהֲרֶ֛יןָ שְׁתֵּ֥י בְנֽוֹת־ל֖וֹט מֵאֲבִיהֶֽן׃
19.englishText: Thus the two daughters of Lot became pregnant by their father.
19.transliteration: vַֽtַּhֲrֶ֛yןָ shְׁtֵּ֥y bְnֽvֹt־l֖vֹt mֵaֲbִyhֶֽן׃

19.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֤לֶד הַבְּכִירָה֙ בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ מוֹאָ֑ב ה֥וּא אֲבִֽי־מוֹאָ֖ב עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃
19.englishText: The older one bore a son and named him Moab;*Moab As though me-’ab “from (my) father.” he is the father of the Moabites of today.
19.transliteration: vַtֵּ֤lֶd hַbְּkִyrָh֙ bֵּ֔ן vַtִּkְrָ֥a shְׁm֖vֹ mvֹaָ֑b h֥vּa aֲbִֽy־mvֹaָ֖b aַd־hַyּֽvֹם׃

19.hebrewText: וְהַצְּעִירָ֤ה גַם־הִוא֙ יָ֣לְדָה בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ בֶּן־עַמִּ֑י ה֛וּא אֲבִ֥י בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃ {ס}
19.englishText: And the younger also bore a son, and she called him Ben-ammi;*Ben-ammi As though “son of my (paternal) kindred.” See further the Dictionary under ‘am. he is the father of the Ammonites of today.
19.transliteration: vְhַtsְּaִyrָ֤h gַם־hִva֙ yָ֣lְdָh bֵּ֔ן vַtִּkְrָ֥a shְׁm֖vֹ bֶּן־aַmִּ֑y h֛vּa aֲbִ֥y bְnֵֽy־aַmּ֖vֹן aַd־hַyּֽvֹם׃ {s}

20.hebrewText: וַיִּסַּ֨ע מִשָּׁ֤ם אַבְרָהָם֙ אַ֣רְצָה הַנֶּ֔גֶב וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בֵּין־קָדֵ֖שׁ וּבֵ֣ין שׁ֑וּר וַיָּ֖גׇר בִּגְרָֽר׃
20.englishText: Abraham journeyed from there to the region of the Negeb and settled between Kadesh and Shur. While he was sojourning in Gerar,
20.transliteration: vַyִּsַּ֨a mִshָּׁ֤ם aַbְrָhָם֙ aַ֣rְtsָh hַnֶּ֔gֶb vַyֵּ֥shֶׁb bֵּyן־kָdֵ֖shׁ vּbֵ֣yן shׁ֑vּr vַyָּ֖gׇr bִּgְrָֽr׃

20.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶל־שָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֑וא וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֲבִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ גְּרָ֔ר וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־שָׂרָֽה׃
20.englishText: Abraham said of Sarah his wife, “She is my sister.” So King Abimelech of Gerar had Sarah brought to him.
20.transliteration: vַyֹּ֧amֶr aַbְrָhָ֛ם aֶl־shָׂrָ֥h aִshְׁtּ֖vֹ aֲchֹ֣tִy hִ֑va vַyִּshְׁlַ֗ch aֲbִymֶ֙lֶךְ֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ gְּrָ֔r vַyִּkַּ֖ch aֶt־shָׂrָֽh׃

20.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֧א אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶל־אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ בַּחֲל֣וֹם הַלָּ֑יְלָה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ הִנְּךָ֥ מֵת֙ עַל־הָאִשָּׁ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־לָקַ֔חְתָּ וְהִ֖וא בְּעֻ֥לַת בָּֽעַל׃
20.englishText: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night and said to him, “You are to die because of the woman that you have taken, for she is a married woman.”
20.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֧a aֱlֹhִ֛yם aֶl־aֲbִymֶ֖lֶךְ bַּchֲl֣vֹם hַlָּ֑yְlָh vַyֹּ֣amֶr l֗vֹ hִnְּךָ֥ mֵt֙ aַl־hָaִshָּׁ֣h aֲshֶׁr־lָkַ֔chְtָּ vְhִ֖va bְּaֻ֥lַt bָּֽaַl׃

20.hebrewText: וַאֲבִימֶ֕לֶךְ לֹ֥א קָרַ֖ב אֵלֶ֑יהָ וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אֲדֹנָ֕י הֲג֥וֹי גַּם־צַדִּ֖יק תַּהֲרֹֽג׃
20.englishText: Now Abimelech had not approached her. He said, “O lord,*lord See the Dictionary under “male metaphors for God.” will You slay people even though innocent?
20.transliteration: vַaֲbִymֶ֕lֶךְ lֹ֥a kָrַ֖b aֵlֶ֑yhָ vַyֹּamַ֕r aֲdֹnָ֕y hֲg֥vֹy gַּם־tsַdִּ֖yk tַּhֲrֹֽg׃

20.hebrewText: הֲלֹ֨א ה֤וּא אָֽמַר־לִי֙ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֔וא וְהִֽיא־גַם־הִ֥וא אָֽמְרָ֖ה אָחִ֣י ה֑וּא בְּתׇם־לְבָבִ֛י וּבְנִקְיֹ֥ן כַּפַּ֖י עָשִׂ֥יתִי זֹֽאת׃
20.englishText: He himself said to me, ‘She is my sister’! And she also said, ‘He is my brother.’ When I did this, my heart was blameless and my hands were clean.”
20.transliteration: hֲlֹ֨a h֤vּa aָֽmַr־lִy֙ aֲchֹ֣tִy hִ֔va vְhִֽya־gַם־hִ֥va aָֽmְrָ֖h aָchִ֣y h֑vּa bְּtׇם־lְbָbִ֛y vּbְnִkְyֹ֥ן kַּpַּ֖y aָshִׂ֥ytִy zֹֽat׃

20.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אֵלָ֨יו הָֽאֱלֹהִ֜ים בַּחֲלֹ֗ם גַּ֣ם אָנֹכִ֤י יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ כִּ֤י בְתׇם־לְבָבְךָ֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ זֹּ֔את וָאֶחְשֹׂ֧ךְ גַּם־אָנֹכִ֛י אֽוֹתְךָ֖ מֵחֲטוֹ־לִ֑י עַל־כֵּ֥ן לֹא־נְתַתִּ֖יךָ לִנְגֹּ֥עַ אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
20.englishText: And God said to him in the dream, “I knew that you did this with a blameless heart, and so I kept you from sinning against Me. That was why I did not let you touch her.
20.transliteration: vַyֹּ֩amֶr֩ aֵlָ֨yv hָֽaֱlֹhִ֜yם bַּchֲlֹ֗ם gַּ֣ם aָnֹkִ֤y yָdַ֙aְtִּy֙ kִּ֤y bְtׇם־lְbָbְךָ֙ aָshִׂ֣ytָ zֹּ֔at vָaֶchְshֹׂ֧ךְ gַּם־aָnֹkִ֛y aֽvֹtְךָ֖ mֵchֲtvֹ־lִ֑y aַl־kֵּ֥ן lֹa־nְtַtִּ֖yךָ lִnְgֹּ֥aַ aֵlֶֽyhָ׃

20.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֗ה הָשֵׁ֤ב אֵֽשֶׁת־הָאִישׁ֙ כִּֽי־נָבִ֣יא ה֔וּא וְיִתְפַּלֵּ֥ל בַּֽעַדְךָ֖ וֶֽחְיֵ֑ה וְאִם־אֵֽינְךָ֣ מֵשִׁ֔יב דַּ֚ע כִּי־מ֣וֹת תָּמ֔וּת אַתָּ֖ה וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
20.englishText: Therefore, restore the man’s wife—since he is a prophet, he will intercede for you—to save your life. If you fail to restore her, know that you shall die, you and all that are yours.”
20.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֗h hָshֵׁ֤b aֵֽshֶׁt־hָaִyshׁ֙ kִּֽy־nָbִ֣ya h֔vּa vְyִtְpַּlֵּ֥l bַּֽaַdְךָ֖ vֶֽchְyֵ֑h vְaִם־aֵֽynְךָ֣ mֵshִׁ֔yb dַּ֚a kִּy־m֣vֹt tָּm֔vּt aַtָּ֖h vְkׇl־aֲshֶׁr־lָֽךְ׃

20.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּקְרָא֙ לְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֔יו וַיְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּֽירְא֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים מְאֹֽד׃
20.englishText: Early next morning, Abimelech called his servants and told them all that had happened; and they*they Lit. “the [salient] participants.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. were greatly frightened.
20.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֨ם aֲbִymֶ֜lֶךְ bַּbֹּ֗kֶr vַyִּkְrָa֙ lְkׇl־aֲbָdָ֔yv vַyְdַbֵּ֛r aֶt־kׇּl־hַdְּbָrִ֥yם hָaֵ֖lֶּh bְּaׇzְnֵyhֶ֑ם vַyִּֽyrְa֥vּ hָaֲnָshִׁ֖yם mְaֹֽd׃

20.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ לְאַבְרָהָ֗ם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר ל֜וֹ מֶֽה־עָשִׂ֤יתָ לָּ֙נוּ֙ וּמֶֽה־חָטָ֣אתִי לָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־הֵבֵ֧אתָ עָלַ֛י וְעַל־מַמְלַכְתִּ֖י חֲטָאָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֑ה מַעֲשִׂים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יֵֽעָשׂ֔וּ עָשִׂ֖יתָ עִמָּדִֽי׃
20.englishText: Then Abimelech summoned Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us? What wrong have I done that you should bring so great a guilt upon me and my kingdom? You have done to me things that ought not to be done.
20.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֨a aֲbִymֶ֜lֶךְ lְaַbְrָhָ֗ם vַyֹּ֨amֶr l֜vֹ mֶֽh־aָshִׂ֤ytָ lָּ֙nvּ֙ vּmֶֽh־chָtָ֣atִy lָ֔ךְ kִּֽy־hֵbֵ֧atָ aָlַ֛y vְaַl־mַmְlַkְtִּ֖y chֲtָaָ֣h gְdֹlָ֑h mַaֲshִׂyם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r lֹa־yֵֽaָshׂ֔vּ aָshִׂ֖ytָ aִmָּdִֽy׃

20.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם מָ֣ה רָאִ֔יתָ כִּ֥י עָשִׂ֖יתָ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
20.englishText: What, then,” Abimelech demanded of Abraham, “was your purpose in doing this thing?”
20.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֲbִymֶ֖lֶךְ aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֑ם mָ֣h rָaִ֔ytָ kִּ֥y aָshִׂ֖ytָ aֶt־hַdָּbָ֥r hַzֶּֽh׃

20.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם כִּ֣י אָמַ֗רְתִּי רַ֚ק אֵין־יִרְאַ֣ת אֱלֹהִ֔ים בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַהֲרָג֖וּנִי עַל־דְּבַ֥ר אִשְׁתִּֽי׃
20.englishText: “I thought,” said Abraham, “surely there is no fear of God in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.
20.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ aַbְrָhָ֔ם kִּ֣y aָmַ֗rְtִּy rַ֚k aֵyן־yִrְaַ֣t aֱlֹhִ֔yם bַּmָּk֖vֹם hַzֶּ֑h vַhֲrָg֖vּnִy aַl־dְּbַ֥r aִshְׁtִּֽy׃

20.hebrewText: וְגַם־אׇמְנָ֗ה אֲחֹתִ֤י בַת־אָבִי֙ הִ֔וא אַ֖ךְ לֹ֣א בַת־אִמִּ֑י וַתְּהִי־לִ֖י לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
20.englishText: And besides, she is in truth my sister, my father’s daughter though not my mother’s; and she became my wife.
20.transliteration: vְgַם־aׇmְnָ֗h aֲchֹtִ֤y bַt־aָbִy֙ hִ֔va aַ֖ךְ lֹ֣a bַt־aִmִּ֑y vַtְּhִy־lִ֖y lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

20.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֞י כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר הִתְע֣וּ אֹתִ֗י אֱלֹהִים֮ מִבֵּ֣ית אָבִי֒ וָאֹמַ֣ר לָ֔הּ זֶ֣ה חַסְדֵּ֔ךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשִׂ֖י עִמָּדִ֑י אֶ֤ל כׇּל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָב֣וֹא שָׁ֔מָּה אִמְרִי־לִ֖י אָחִ֥י הֽוּא׃
20.englishText: So when God made me wander from my father’s house, I said to her, ‘Let this be the kindness that you shall do me: whatever place we come to, say there of me: He is my brother.’”
20.transliteration: vַyְhִ֞y kַּaֲshֶׁ֧r hִtְa֣vּ aֹtִ֗y aֱlֹhִyם֮ mִbֵּ֣yt aָbִy֒ vָaֹmַ֣r lָ֔hּ zֶ֣h chַsְdֵּ֔ךְ aֲshֶׁ֥r tַּaֲshִׂ֖y aִmָּdִ֑y aֶ֤l kׇּl־hַmָּkvֹם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r nָb֣vֹa shָׁ֔mָּh aִmְrִy־lִ֖y aָchִ֥y hֽvּa׃

20.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֗ר וַעֲבָדִים֙ וּשְׁפָחֹ֔ת וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לְאַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיָּ֣שֶׁב ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת שָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
20.englishText: Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and male and female slaves, and gave them to Abraham; and he restored his wife Sarah to him.
20.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֨ch aֲbִymֶ֜lֶךְ tsֹ֣aן vּbָkָ֗r vַaֲbָdִyם֙ vּshְׁpָchֹ֔t vַyִּtֵּ֖ן lְaַbְrָhָ֑ם vַyָּ֣shֶׁb l֔vֹ aֵ֖t shָׂrָ֥h aִshְׁtּֽvֹ׃

20.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ הִנֵּ֥ה אַרְצִ֖י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ בַּטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ שֵֽׁב׃
20.englishText: And Abimelech said, “Here, my land is before you; settle wherever you please.”
20.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֲbִymֶ֔lֶךְ hִnֵּ֥h aַrְtsִ֖y lְpָnֶ֑yךָ bַּtּ֥vֹb bְּaֵynֶ֖yךָ shֵֽׁb׃

20.hebrewText: וּלְשָׂרָ֣ה אָמַ֗ר הִנֵּ֨ה נָתַ֜תִּי אֶ֤לֶף כֶּ֙סֶף֙ לְאָחִ֔יךְ הִנֵּ֤ה הוּא־לָךְ֙ כְּס֣וּת עֵינַ֔יִם לְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתָּ֑ךְ וְאֵ֥ת כֹּ֖ל וְנֹכָֽחַת׃
20.englishText: And to Sarah he said, “I herewith give your brother a thousand pieces of silver; this will serve you as vindication*vindication Lit. “a covering of the eyes”; meaning of latter half of verse uncertain. before all who are with you, and you are cleared before everyone.”
20.transliteration: vּlְshָׂrָ֣h aָmַ֗r hִnֵּ֨h nָtַ֜tִּy aֶ֤lֶף kֶּ֙sֶף֙ lְaָchִ֔yךְ hִnֵּ֤h hvּa־lָךְ֙ kְּs֣vּt aֵynַ֔yִם lְkֹ֖l aֲshֶׁ֣r aִtָּ֑ךְ vְaֵ֥t kֹּ֖l vְnֹkָֽchַt׃

20.hebrewText: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֥ל אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּרְפָּ֨א אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֧לֶךְ וְאֶת־אִשְׁתּ֛וֹ וְאַמְהֹתָ֖יו וַיֵּלֵֽדוּ׃
20.englishText: Abraham then prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech and his wife and his slave girls, so that they bore children;
20.transliteration: vַyִּtְpַּlֵּ֥l aַbְrָhָ֖ם aֶl־hָaֱlֹhִ֑yם vַyִּrְpָּ֨a aֱlֹhִ֜yם aֶt־aֲbִymֶ֧lֶךְ vְaֶt־aִshְׁtּ֛vֹ vְaַmְhֹtָ֖yv vַyֵּlֵֽdvּ׃

20.hebrewText: כִּֽי־עָצֹ֤ר עָצַר֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּעַ֥ד כׇּל־רֶ֖חֶם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ עַל־דְּבַ֥ר שָׂרָ֖ה אֵ֥שֶׁת אַבְרָהָֽם׃ {ס}
20.englishText: for יהוה had closed fast every womb of the household of Abimelech because of Sarah, the wife of Abraham.
20.transliteration: kִּֽy־aָtsֹ֤r aָtsַr֙ yְhֹvָ֔h bְּaַ֥d kׇּl־rֶ֖chֶם lְbֵ֣yt aֲbִymֶ֑lֶךְ aַl־dְּbַ֥r shָׂrָ֖h aֵ֥shֶׁt aַbְrָhָֽם׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וַֽיהֹוָ֛ה פָּקַ֥ד אֶת־שָׂרָ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמָ֑ר וַיַּ֧עַשׂ יְהֹוָ֛ה לְשָׂרָ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃
21.englishText: יהוה took note of Sarah as promised, and יהוה did for Sarah what had been announced.
21.transliteration: vַֽyhֹvָ֛h pָּkַ֥d aֶt־shָׂrָ֖h kַּaֲshֶׁ֣r aָmָ֑r vַyַּ֧aַshׂ yְhֹvָ֛h lְshָׂrָ֖h kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbֵּֽr׃

21.hebrewText: וַתַּ֩הַר֩ וַתֵּ֨לֶד שָׂרָ֧ה לְאַבְרָהָ֛ם בֵּ֖ן לִזְקֻנָ֑יו לַמּוֹעֵ֕ד אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
21.englishText: Sarah conceived and bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken.
21.transliteration: vַtַּ֩hַr֩ vַtֵּ֨lֶd shָׂrָ֧h lְaַbְrָhָ֛ם bֵּ֖ן lִzְkֻnָ֑yv lַmּvֹaֵ֕d aֲshֶׁr־dִּbֶּ֥r aֹt֖vֹ aֱlֹhִֽyם׃

21.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶֽת־שֶׁם־בְּנ֧וֹ הַנּֽוֹלַד־ל֛וֹ אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָה־לּ֥וֹ שָׂרָ֖ה יִצְחָֽק׃
21.englishText: Abraham gave his newborn son, whom Sarah had borne him, the name of Isaac.
21.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֨a aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֶֽt־shֶׁם־bְּn֧vֹ hַnּֽvֹlַd־l֛vֹ aֲshֶׁr־yָlְdָh־lּ֥vֹ shָׂrָ֖h yִtsְchָֽk׃

21.hebrewText: וַיָּ֤מׇל אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֔וֹ בֶּן־שְׁמֹנַ֖ת יָמִ֑ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
21.englishText: And when his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him, as God had commanded him.
21.transliteration: vַyָּ֤mׇl aַbְrָhָם֙ aֶt־yִtsְchָ֣k bְּn֔vֹ bֶּן־shְׁmֹnַ֖t yָmִ֑yם kַּaֲshֶׁ֛r tsִvָּ֥h aֹt֖vֹ aֱlֹhִֽyם׃

21.hebrewText: וְאַבְרָהָ֖ם בֶּן־מְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה בְּהִוָּ֣לֶד ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת יִצְחָ֥ק בְּנֽוֹ׃
21.englishText: Now Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.
21.transliteration: vְaַbְrָhָ֖ם bֶּן־mְaַ֣t shָׁnָ֑h bְּhִvָּ֣lֶd l֔vֹ aֵ֖t yִtsְchָ֥k bְּnֽvֹ׃

21.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר שָׂרָ֔ה צְחֹ֕ק עָ֥שָׂה לִ֖י אֱלֹהִ֑ים כׇּל־הַשֹּׁמֵ֖עַ יִֽצְחַק־לִֽי׃
21.englishText: Sarah said, “God has brought me laughter; everyone who hears will laugh with*with Lit. “for.” me.”
21.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr shָׂrָ֔h tsְchֹ֕k aָ֥shָׂh lִ֖y aֱlֹhִ֑yם kׇּl־hַshֹּׁmֵ֖aַ yִֽtsְchַk־lִֽy׃

21.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֗אמֶר מִ֤י מִלֵּל֙ לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם הֵינִ֥יקָה בָנִ֖ים שָׂרָ֑ה כִּֽי־יָלַ֥דְתִּי בֵ֖ן לִזְקֻנָֽיו׃
21.englishText:
And she added,
“Who would have said to Abraham
That Sarah would suckle children!
Yet I have borne a son in his old age.”
21.transliteration: vַtֹּ֗amֶr mִ֤y mִlֵּl֙ lְaַbְrָhָ֔ם hֵynִ֥ykָh bָnִ֖yם shָׂrָ֑h kִּֽy־yָlַ֥dְtִּy bֵ֖ן lִzְkֻnָֽyv׃

21.hebrewText: וַיִּגְדַּ֥ל הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַיִּגָּמַ֑ל וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אַבְרָהָם֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֣ה גָד֔וֹל בְּי֖וֹם הִגָּמֵ֥ל אֶת־יִצְחָֽק׃
21.englishText: The child grew up and was weaned, and Abraham held a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.
21.transliteration: vַyִּgְdַּ֥l hַyֶּ֖lֶd vַyִּgָּmַ֑l vַyַּ֤aַshׂ aַbְrָhָם֙ mִshְׁtֶּ֣h gָd֔vֹl bְּy֖vֹם hִgָּmֵ֥l aֶt־yִtsְchָֽk׃

21.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֨רֶא שָׂרָ֜ה אֶֽת־בֶּן־הָגָ֧ר הַמִּצְרִ֛ית אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָ֥ה לְאַבְרָהָ֖ם מְצַחֵֽק׃
21.englishText: Sarah saw the son whom Hagar the Egyptian had borne to Abraham playing.
21.transliteration: vַtֵּ֨rֶa shָׂrָ֜h aֶֽt־bֶּן־hָgָ֧r hַmִּtsְrִ֛yt aֲshֶׁr־yָlְdָ֥h lְaַbְrָhָ֖ם mְtsַchֵֽk׃

21.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם גָּרֵ֛שׁ הָאָמָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את וְאֶת־בְּנָ֑הּ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יִי��ַשׁ֙ בֶּן־הָאָמָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את עִם־בְּנִ֖י עִם־יִצְחָֽק׃
21.englishText: She said to Abraham, “Cast out that slave-woman and her son, for the son of that slave shall not share in the inheritance with my son Isaac.”
21.transliteration: vַtֹּ֙amֶr֙ lְaַbְrָhָ֔ם gָּrֵ֛shׁ hָaָmָ֥h hַzֹּ֖at vְaֶt־bְּnָ֑hּ kִּ֣y lֹ֤a yִy��ַshׁ֙ bֶּן־hָaָmָ֣h hַzֹּ֔at aִם־bְּnִ֖y aִם־yִtsְchָֽk׃

21.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֧רַע הַדָּבָ֛ר מְאֹ֖ד בְּעֵינֵ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם עַ֖ל אוֹדֹ֥ת בְּנֽוֹ׃
21.englishText: The matter distressed Abraham greatly, for it concerned a son of his.
21.transliteration: vַyֵּ֧rַa hַdָּbָ֛r mְaֹ֖d bְּaֵynֵ֣y aַbְrָhָ֑ם aַ֖l avֹdֹ֥t bְּnֽvֹ׃

21.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֗ם אַל־יֵרַ֤ע בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ עַל־הַנַּ֣עַר וְעַל־אֲמָתֶ֔ךָ כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תֹּאמַ֥ר אֵלֶ֛יךָ שָׂרָ֖ה שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלָ֑הּ כִּ֣י בְיִצְחָ֔ק יִקָּרֵ֥א לְךָ֖ זָֽרַע׃
21.englishText: But God said to Abraham, “Do not be distressed over the boy or your slave; whatever Sarah tells you, do as she says, for it is through Isaac that offspring shall be continued*continued Lit. “called.” for you.
21.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֱlֹhִ֜yם aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֗ם aַl־yֵrַ֤a bְּaֵynֶ֙yךָ֙ aַl־hַnַּ֣aַr vְaַl־aֲmָtֶ֔ךָ kֹּl֩ aֲshֶׁ֨r tֹּamַ֥r aֵlֶ֛yךָ shָׂrָ֖h shְׁmַ֣a bְּkֹlָ֑hּ kִּ֣y bְyִtsְchָ֔k yִkָּrֵ֥a lְךָ֖ zָֽrַa׃

21.hebrewText: וְגַ֥ם אֶת־בֶּן־הָאָמָ֖ה לְג֣וֹי אֲשִׂימֶ֑נּוּ כִּ֥י זַרְעֲךָ֖ הֽוּא׃
21.englishText: As for the son of the slave-woman, I will make a nation of him, too, for he is your seed.”
21.transliteration: vְgַ֥ם aֶt־bֶּן־hָaָmָ֖h lְg֣vֹy aֲshִׂymֶ֑nּvּ kִּ֥y zַrְaֲךָ֖ hֽvּa׃

21.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֣ם אַבְרָהָ֣ם <small>׀</small> בַּבֹּ֡קֶר וַיִּֽקַּֽח־לֶ֩חֶם֩ וְחֵ֨מַת מַ֜יִם וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶל־הָ֠גָ֠ר שָׂ֧ם עַל־שִׁכְמָ֛הּ וְאֶת־הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֶ֑הָ וַתֵּ֣לֶךְ וַתֵּ֔תַע בְּמִדְבַּ֖ר בְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
21.englishText: Early next morning Abraham took some bread and a skin of water, and gave them to Hagar. He placed them over her shoulder, together with the child, and sent her away. And she wandered about in the wilderness of Beer-sheba.
21.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֣ם aַbְrָhָ֣ם <small>׀</small> bַּbֹּ֡kֶr vַyִּֽkַּֽch־lֶ֩chֶם֩ vְchֵ֨mַt mַ֜yִם vַyִּtֵּ֣ן aֶl־hָ֠gָ֠r shָׂ֧ם aַl־shִׁkְmָ֛hּ vְaֶt־hַyֶּ֖lֶd vַֽyְshַׁlְּchֶ֑hָ vַtֵּ֣lֶךְ vַtֵּ֔tַa bְּmִdְbַּ֖r bְּaֵ֥r shָֽׁbַa׃

21.hebrewText: וַיִּכְל֥וּ הַמַּ֖יִם מִן־הַחֵ֑מֶת וַתַּשְׁלֵ֣ךְ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד תַּ֖חַת אַחַ֥ד הַשִּׂיחִֽם׃
21.englishText: When the water was gone from the skin, she left the child under one of the bushes,
21.transliteration: vַyִּkְl֥vּ hַmַּ֖yִם mִן־hַchֵ֑mֶt vַtַּshְׁlֵ֣ךְ aֶt־hַyֶּ֔lֶd tַּ֖chַt aַchַ֥d hַshִּׂychִֽם׃

21.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֩לֶךְ֩ וַתֵּ֨שֶׁב לָ֜הּ מִנֶּ֗גֶד הַרְחֵק֙ כִּמְטַחֲוֵ֣י קֶ֔שֶׁת כִּ֣י אָֽמְרָ֔ה אַל־אֶרְאֶ֖ה בְּמ֣וֹת הַיָּ֑לֶד וַתֵּ֣שֶׁב מִנֶּ֔גֶד וַתִּשָּׂ֥א אֶת־קֹלָ֖הּ וַתֵּֽבְךְּ׃
21.englishText: and went and sat down at a distance, a bowshot away; for she thought, “Let me not look on as the child dies.” And sitting thus afar, she burst into tears.
21.transliteration: vַtֵּ֩lֶךְ֩ vַtֵּ֨shֶׁb lָ֜hּ mִnֶּ֗gֶd hַrְchֵk֙ kִּmְtַchֲvֵ֣y kֶ֔shֶׁt kִּ֣y aָֽmְrָ֔h aַl־aֶrְaֶ֖h bְּm֣vֹt hַyָּ֑lֶd vַtֵּ֣shֶׁb mִnֶּ֔gֶd vַtִּshָּׂ֥a aֶt־kֹlָ֖hּ vַtֵּֽbְךְּ׃

21.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אֱלֹהִים֮ אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַנַּ֒עַר֒ וַיִּקְרָא֩ מַלְאַ֨ךְ אֱלֹהִ֤ים <small>׀</small> אֶל־הָגָר֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָ֖הּ מַה־לָּ֣ךְ הָגָ֑ר אַל־תִּ֣ירְאִ֔י כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֧ע אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶל־ק֥וֹל הַנַּ֖עַר בַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הוּא־שָֽׁם׃
21.englishText: God heard the cry of the boy, and a messenger of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, “What troubles you, Hagar? Fear not, for God has heeded the cry of the boy where he is.
21.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֣a aֱlֹhִyם֮ aֶt־k֣vֹl hַnַּ֒aַr֒ vַyִּkְrָa֩ mַlְaַ֨ךְ aֱlֹhִ֤yם <small>׀</small> aֶl־hָgָr֙ mִן־hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vַyֹּ֥amֶr lָ֖hּ mַh־lָּ֣ךְ hָgָ֑r aַl־tִּ֣yrְaִ֔y kִּֽy־shָׁmַ֧a aֱlֹhִ֛yם aֶl־k֥vֹl hַnַּ֖aַr bַּaֲshֶׁ֥r hvּa־shָֽׁם׃

21.hebrewText: ק֚וּמִי שְׂאִ֣י אֶת־הַנַּ֔עַר וְהַחֲזִ֥יקִי אֶת־יָדֵ֖ךְ בּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל אֲשִׂימֶֽנּוּ׃
21.englishText: Come, lift up the boy and hold him by the hand, for I will make a great nation of him.”
21.transliteration: k֚vּmִy shְׂaִ֣y aֶt־hַnַּ֔aַr vְhַchֲzִ֥ykִy aֶt־yָdֵ֖ךְ bּ֑vֹ kִּֽy־lְg֥vֹy gָּd֖vֹl aֲshִׂymֶֽnּvּ׃

21.hebrewText: וַיִּפְקַ֤ח אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־עֵינֶ֔יהָ וַתֵּ֖רֶא בְּאֵ֣ר מָ֑יִם וַתֵּ֜לֶךְ וַתְּמַלֵּ֤א אֶת־הַחֵ֙מֶת֙ מַ֔יִם וַתַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־הַנָּֽעַר׃
21.englishText: Then God opened her eyes and she saw a well of water. She went and filled the skin with water, and let the boy drink.
21.transliteration: vַyִּpְkַ֤ch aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶt־aֵynֶ֔yhָ vַtֵּ֖rֶa bְּaֵ֣r mָ֑yִם vַtֵּ֜lֶךְ vַtְּmַlֵּ֤a aֶt־hַchֵ֙mֶt֙ mַ֔yִם vַtַּ֖shְׁkְ aֶt־hַnָּֽaַr׃

21.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֧י אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הַנַּ֖עַר וַיִּגְדָּ֑ל וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וַיְהִ֖י רֹבֶ֥ה קַשָּֽׁת׃
21.englishText: God was with the boy and he grew up; he dwelt in the wilderness and became skilled with a bow.
21.transliteration: vַyְhִ֧y aֱlֹhִ֛yם aֶt־hַnַּ֖aַr vַyִּgְdָּ֑l vַyֵּ֙shֶׁb֙ bַּmִּdְbָּ֔r vַyְhִ֖y rֹbֶ֥h kַshָּֽׁt׃

21.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר פָּארָ֑ן וַתִּֽקַּֽח־ל֥וֹ אִמּ֛וֹ אִשָּׁ֖ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
21.englishText: He lived in the wilderness of Paran; and his mother got a wife for him from the land of Egypt.
21.transliteration: vַyֵּ֖shֶׁb bְּmִdְbַּ֣r pָּarָ֑ן vַtִּֽkַּֽch־l֥vֹ aִmּ֛vֹ aִshָּׁ֖h mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃ {p}

21.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֗לֶךְ וּפִיכֹל֙ שַׂר־צְבָא֔וֹ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר אֱלֹהִ֣ים עִמְּךָ֔ בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֖ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
21.englishText: At that time Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, said to Abraham, “God is with you in everything that you do.
21.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ bָּaֵ֣t hַhִ֔va vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֲbִymֶ֗lֶךְ vּpִykֹl֙ shַׂr־tsְbָa֔vֹ aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֖ם lֵamֹ֑r aֱlֹhִ֣yם aִmְּךָ֔ bְּkֹ֥l aֲshֶׁr־aַtָּ֖h aֹshֶֽׂh׃

21.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִשָּׁ֨בְעָה לִּ֤י בֵֽאלֹהִים֙ הֵ֔נָּה אִם־תִּשְׁקֹ֣ר לִ֔י וּלְנִינִ֖י וּלְנֶכְדִּ֑י כַּחֶ֜סֶד אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֤יתִי עִמְּךָ֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה עִמָּדִ֔י וְעִם־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־גַּ֥רְתָּה בָּֽהּ׃
21.englishText: Therefore swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me or with my kith and kin, but will deal with me and with the land in which you have sojourned as loyally as I have dealt with you.”
21.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֗h hִshָּׁ֨bְaָh lִּ֤y bֵֽalֹhִyם֙ hֵ֔nָּh aִם־tִּshְׁkֹ֣r lִ֔y vּlְnִynִ֖y vּlְnֶkְdִּ֑y kַּchֶ֜sֶd aֲshֶׁr־aָshִׂ֤ytִy aִmְּךָ֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h aִmָּdִ֔y vְaִם־hָaָ֖rֶץ aֲshֶׁr־gַּ֥rְtָּh bָּֽhּ׃

21.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם אָנֹכִ֖י אִשָּׁבֵֽעַ׃
21.englishText: And Abraham said, “I swear it.”
21.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ aַbְrָhָ֔ם aָnֹkִ֖y aִshָּׁbֵֽaַ׃

21.hebrewText: וְהוֹכִ֥חַ אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ עַל־אֹדוֹת֙ בְּאֵ֣ר הַמַּ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר גָּזְל֖וּ עַבְדֵ֥י אֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
21.englishText: Then Abraham reproached Abimelech for the well of water which the servants of Abimelech had seized.
21.transliteration: vְhvֹkִ֥chַ aַbְrָhָ֖ם aֶt־aֲbִymֶ֑lֶךְ aַl־aֹdvֹt֙ bְּaֵ֣r hַmַּ֔yִם aֲshֶׁ֥r gָּzְl֖vּ aַbְdֵ֥y aֲbִymֶֽlֶךְ׃

21.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי מִ֥י עָשָׂ֖ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וְגַם־אַתָּ֞ה לֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֗י וְגַ֧ם אָנֹכִ֛י לֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי בִּלְתִּ֥י הַיּֽוֹם׃
21.englishText: But Abimelech said, “I do not know who did this; you did not tell me, nor have I heard of it until today.”
21.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֲbִymֶ֔lֶךְ lֹ֣a yָdַ֔aְtִּy mִ֥y aָshָׂ֖h aֶt־hַdָּbָ֣r hַzֶּ֑h vְgַם־aַtָּ֞h lֹa־hִgַּ֣dְtָּ lִּ֗y vְgַ֧ם aָnֹkִ֛y lֹ֥a shָׁmַ֖aְtִּy bִּlְtִּ֥y hַyּֽvֹם׃

21.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֤ח אַבְרָהָם֙ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֔ר וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לַאֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ וַיִּכְרְת֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם בְּרִֽית׃
21.englishText: Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a pact.
21.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֤ch aַbְrָhָם֙ tsֹ֣aן vּbָkָ֔r vַyִּtֵּ֖ן lַaֲbִymֶ֑lֶךְ vַyִּkְrְt֥vּ shְׁnֵyhֶ֖ם bְּrִֽyt׃

21.hebrewText: וַיַּצֵּ֣ב אַבְרָהָ֗ם אֶת־שֶׁ֛בַע כִּבְשֹׂ֥ת הַצֹּ֖אן לְבַדְּהֶֽן׃
21.englishText: Abraham then set seven ewes of the flock by themselves,
21.transliteration: vַyַּtsֵּ֣b aַbְrָhָ֗ם aֶt־shֶׁ֛bַa kִּbְshֹׂ֥t hַtsֹּ֖aן lְbַdְּhֶֽן׃

21.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם מָ֣ה הֵ֗נָּה שֶׁ֤בַע כְּבָשֹׂת֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִצַּ֖בְתָּ לְבַדָּֽנָה׃
21.englishText: and Abimelech said to Abraham, “What mean these seven ewes which you have set apart?”
21.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֲbִymֶ֖lֶךְ aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֑ם mָ֣h hֵ֗nָּh shֶׁ֤bַa kְּbָshֹׂt֙ hָaֵ֔lֶּh aֲshֶׁ֥r hִtsַּ֖bְtָּ lְbַdָּֽnָh׃

21.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֚י אֶת־שֶׁ֣בַע כְּבָשֹׂ֔ת תִּקַּ֖ח מִיָּדִ֑י בַּעֲבוּר֙ תִּֽהְיֶה־לִּ֣י לְעֵדָ֔ה כִּ֥י חָפַ֖רְתִּי אֶת־הַבְּאֵ֥ר הַזֹּֽאת׃
21.englishText: He replied, “You are to accept these seven ewes from me as proof that I dug this well.”
21.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr kִּ֚y aֶt־shֶׁ֣bַa kְּbָshֹׂ֔t tִּkַּ֖ch mִyָּdִ֑y bַּaֲbvּr֙ tִּֽhְyֶh־lִּ֣y lְaֵdָ֔h kִּ֥y chָpַ֖rְtִּy aֶt־hַbְּaֵ֥r hַzֹּֽat׃

21.hebrewText: עַל־כֵּ֗ן קָרָ֛א לַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע כִּ֛י שָׁ֥ם נִשְׁבְּע֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
21.englishText: Hence that place was called Beer-sheba,*Beer-sheba I.e., “well of seven” or “well of oath.” for there the two of them swore an oath.
21.transliteration: aַl־kֵּ֗ן kָrָ֛a lַmָּk֥vֹם hַh֖vּa bְּaֵ֣r shָׁ֑bַa kִּ֛y shָׁ֥ם nִshְׁbְּa֖vּ shְׁnֵyhֶֽם׃

21.hebrewText: וַיִּכְרְת֥וּ בְרִ֖ית בִּבְאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיָּ֣קׇם אֲבִימֶ֗לֶךְ וּפִיכֹל֙ שַׂר־צְבָא֔וֹ וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
21.englishText: When they had concluded the pact at Beer-sheba, Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, departed and returned to the land of the Philistines.
21.transliteration: vַyִּkְrְt֥vּ bְrִ֖yt bִּbְaֵ֣r shָׁ֑bַa vַyָּ֣kׇם aֲbִymֶ֗lֶךְ vּpִykֹl֙ shַׂr־tsְbָa֔vֹ vַyָּshֻׁ֖bvּ aֶl־aֶ֥rֶץ pְּlִshְׁtִּֽyם׃

21.hebrewText: וַיִּטַּ֥ע אֶ֖שֶׁל בִּבְאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיִּ֨קְרָא־שָׁ֔ם בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵ֥ל עוֹלָֽם׃
21.englishText: [Abraham] planted a tamarisk at Beer-sheba, and invoked there the name of יהוה, the Everlasting God.
21.transliteration: vַyִּtַּ֥a aֶ֖shֶׁl bִּbְaֵ֣r shָׁ֑bַa vַyִּ֨kְrָa־shָׁ֔ם bְּshֵׁ֥ם yְhֹvָ֖h aֵ֥l avֹlָֽם׃

21.hebrewText: וַיָּ֧גׇר אַבְרָהָ֛ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃ {פ}
21.englishText: And Abraham resided in the land of the Philistines a long time.
21.transliteration: vַyָּ֧gׇr aַbְrָhָ֛ם bְּaֶ֥rֶץ pְּlִshְׁtִּ֖yם yָmִ֥yם rַbִּֽyם׃ {p}

22.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְהָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים נִסָּ֖ה אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
