22.englishText: Some time afterward, God put Abraham to the test, saying to him, “Abraham.” He answered, “Here I am.”
22.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y aַchַr֙ hַdְּbָrִ֣yם hָaֵ֔lֶּh vְhָ֣aֱlֹhִ֔yם nִsָּ֖h aֶt־aַbְrָhָ֑ם vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵlָ֔yv aַbְrָhָ֖ם vַyֹּ֥amֶr hִnֵּֽnִy׃

22.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר קַח־נָ֠א אֶת־בִּנְךָ֨ אֶת־יְחִֽידְךָ֤ אֲשֶׁר־אָהַ֙בְתָּ֙ אֶת־יִצְחָ֔ק וְלֶ֨ךְ־לְךָ֔ אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ הַמֹּרִיָּ֑ה וְהַעֲלֵ֤הוּ שָׁם֙ לְעֹלָ֔ה עַ֚ל אַחַ֣ד הֶֽהָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
22.englishText: “Take your son, your favored one, Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the heights that I will point out to you.”
22.transliteration: vַyֹּ֡amֶr kַch־nָ֠a aֶt־bִּnְךָ֨ aֶt־yְchִֽydְךָ֤ aֲshֶׁr־aָhַ֙bְtָּ֙ aֶt־yִtsְchָ֔k vְlֶ֨ךְ־lְךָ֔ aֶl־aֶ֖rֶץ hַmֹּrִyָּ֑h vְhַaֲlֵ֤hvּ shָׁם֙ lְaֹlָ֔h aַ֚l aַchַ֣d hֶֽhָrִ֔yם aֲshֶׁ֖r aֹmַ֥r aֵlֶֽyךָ׃

22.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם אַבְרָהָ֜ם בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַֽיַּחֲבֹשׁ֙ אֶת־חֲמֹר֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׁנֵ֤י נְעָרָיו֙ אִתּ֔וֹ וְאֵ֖ת יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֑וֹ וַיְבַקַּע֙ עֲצֵ֣י עֹלָ֔ה וַיָּ֣קׇם וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־אָֽמַר־ל֥וֹ הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
22.englishText: So early next morning, Abraham saddled his ass and took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. He split the wood for the burnt offering, and he set out for the place of which God had told him.
22.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֨ם aַbְrָhָ֜ם bַּbֹּ֗kֶr vַֽyַּchֲbֹshׁ֙ aֶt־chֲmֹr֔vֹ vַyִּkַּ֞ch aֶt־shְׁnֵ֤y nְaָrָyv֙ aִtּ֔vֹ vְaֵ֖t yִtsְchָ֣k bְּn֑vֹ vַyְbַkַּa֙ aֲtsֵ֣y aֹlָ֔h vַyָּ֣kׇם vַyֵּ֔lֶךְ aֶl־hַmָּk֖vֹם aֲshֶׁr־aָֽmַr־l֥vֹ hָaֱlֹhִֽyם׃

22.hebrewText: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗י וַיִּשָּׂ֨א אַבְרָהָ֧ם אֶת־עֵינָ֛יו וַיַּ֥רְא אֶת־הַמָּק֖וֹם מֵרָחֹֽק׃
22.englishText: On the third day Abraham looked up and saw the place from afar.
22.transliteration: bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֗y vַyִּshָּׂ֨a aַbְrָhָ֧ם aֶt־aֵynָ֛yv vַyַּ֥rְa aֶt־hַmָּk֖vֹם mֵrָchֹֽk׃

22.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶל־נְעָרָ֗יו שְׁבוּ־לָכֶ֥ם פֹּה֙ עִֽם־הַחֲמ֔וֹר וַאֲנִ֣י וְהַנַּ֔עַר נֵלְכָ֖ה עַד־כֹּ֑ה וְנִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה וְנָשׁ֥וּבָה אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
22.englishText: Then Abraham said to his servants, “You stay here with the ass. The boy and I will go up there; we will worship and we will return to you.”
22.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֶl־nְaָrָ֗yv shְׁbvּ־lָkֶ֥ם pֹּh֙ aִֽם־hַchֲm֔vֹr vַaֲnִ֣y vְhַnַּ֔aַr nֵlְkָ֖h aַd־kֹּ֑h vְnִֽshְׁtַּchֲvֶ֖h vְnָshׁ֥vּbָh aֲlֵykֶֽם׃

22.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־עֲצֵ֣י הָעֹלָ֗ה וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ עַל־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָד֔וֹ אֶת־הָאֵ֖שׁ וְאֶת־הַֽמַּאֲכֶ֑לֶת וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם יַחְדָּֽו׃
22.englishText: Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and put it on his son Isaac. He himself took the firestone*firestone Lit. “fire.” and the knife; and the two walked off together.
22.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֨ch aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֶt־aֲtsֵ֣y hָaֹlָ֗h vַyָּ֙shֶׂם֙ aַl־yִtsְchָ֣k bְּn֔vֹ vַyִּkַּ֣ch bְּyָd֔vֹ aֶt־hָaֵ֖shׁ vְaֶt־hַֽmַּaֲkֶ֑lֶt vַyֵּlְk֥vּ shְׁnֵyhֶ֖ם yַchְdָּֽv׃

22.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יִצְחָ֜ק אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֤ם אָבִיו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אָבִ֔י וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֶּ֣נִּֽי בְנִ֑י וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֤ה הָאֵשׁ֙ וְהָ֣עֵצִ֔ים וְאַיֵּ֥ה הַשֶּׂ֖ה לְעֹלָֽה׃
22.englishText: Then Isaac said to his father Abraham, “Father!” And he answered, “Yes, my son.” And he said, “Here are the firestone and the wood; but where is the sheep for the burnt offering?”
22.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yִtsְchָ֜k aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֤ם aָbִyv֙ vַyֹּ֣amֶr aָbִ֔y vַyֹּ֖amֶr hִnֶּ֣nִּֽy bְnִ֑y vַyֹּ֗amֶr hִnֵּ֤h hָaֵshׁ֙ vְhָ֣aֵtsִ֔yם vְaַyֵּ֥h hַshֶּׂ֖h lְaֹlָֽh׃

22.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֱלֹהִ֞ים יִרְאֶה־לּ֥וֹ הַשֶּׂ֛ה לְעֹלָ֖ה בְּנִ֑י וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם יַחְדָּֽו׃
22.englishText: And Abraham said, “It is God who will see to the sheep for this burnt offering, my son.” And the two of them walked on together.
22.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ aַbְrָhָ֔ם aֱlֹhִ֞yם yִrְaֶh־lּ֥vֹ hַshֶּׂ֛h lְaֹlָ֖h bְּnִ֑y vַyֵּlְk֥vּ shְׁnֵyhֶ֖ם yַchְdָּֽv׃

22.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ אֶֽל־הַמָּקוֹם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽמַר־ל֣וֹ הָאֱלֹהִים֒ וַיִּ֨בֶן שָׁ֤ם אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וַֽיַּעֲרֹ֖ךְ אֶת־הָעֵצִ֑ים וַֽיַּעֲקֹד֙ אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֔וֹ וַיָּ֤שֶׂם אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ מִמַּ֖עַל לָעֵצִֽים׃
22.englishText: They arrived at the place of which God had told him. Abraham built an altar there; he laid out the wood; he bound his son Isaac; he laid him on the altar, on top of the wood.
22.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֗avּ aֶֽl־hַmָּkvֹם֮ aֲshֶׁ֣r aָֽmַr־l֣vֹ hָaֱlֹhִyם֒ vַyִּ֨bֶן shָׁ֤ם aַbְrָhָם֙ aֶt־hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ vַֽyַּaֲrֹ֖ךְ aֶt־hָaֵtsִ֑yם vַֽyַּaֲkֹd֙ aֶt־yִtsְchָ֣k bְּn֔vֹ vַyָּ֤shֶׂם aֹtvֹ֙ aַl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ mִmַּ֖aַl lָaֵtsִֽyם׃

22.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־הַֽמַּאֲכֶ֑לֶת לִשְׁחֹ֖ט אֶת־בְּנֽוֹ׃
22.englishText: And Abraham picked up the knife to slay his son.
22.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁlַ֤ch aַbְrָhָם֙ aֶt־yָd֔vֹ vַyִּkַּ֖ch aֶt־hַֽmַּaֲkֶ֑lֶt lִshְׁchֹ֖t aֶt־bְּnֽvֹ׃

22.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֵלָ֜יו מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֣ם <small>׀</small> אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
22.englishText: Then a messenger of יהוה called to him from heaven: “Abraham! Abraham!” And he answered, “Here I am.”
22.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֨a aֵlָ֜yv mַlְaַ֤ךְ yְhֹvָh֙ mִן־hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vַyֹּ֖amֶr aַbְrָhָ֣ם <small>׀</small> aַbְrָhָ֑ם vַyֹּ֖amֶr hִnֵּֽnִy׃

22.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אַל־תִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָֽדְךָ֙ אֶל־הַנַּ֔עַר וְאַל־תַּ֥עַשׂ ל֖וֹ מְא֑וּמָה כִּ֣י ׀ עַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֗עְתִּי כִּֽי־יְרֵ֤א אֱלֹהִים֙ אַ֔תָּה וְלֹ֥א חָשַׂ֛כְתָּ אֶת־בִּנְךָ֥ אֶת־יְחִידְךָ֖ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
22.englishText: “Do not raise your hand against the boy, or do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your favored one, from Me.”
22.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr aַl־tִּshְׁlַ֤ch yָֽdְךָ֙ aֶl־hַnַּ֔aַr vְaַl־tַּ֥aַshׂ l֖vֹ mְa֑vּmָh kִּ֣y ׀ aַtָּ֣h yָdַ֗aְtִּy kִּֽy־yְrֵ֤a aֱlֹhִyם֙ aַ֔tָּh vְlֹ֥a chָshַׂ֛kְtָּ aֶt־bִּnְךָ֥ aֶt־yְchִydְךָ֖ mִmֶּֽnִּy׃

22.hebrewText: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ וְהִנֵּה־אַ֔יִל אַחַ֕ר נֶאֱחַ֥ז בַּסְּבַ֖ךְ בְּקַרְנָ֑יו וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ אַבְרָהָם֙ וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־הָאַ֔יִל וַיַּעֲלֵ֥הוּ לְעֹלָ֖ה תַּ֥חַת בְּנֽוֹ׃
22.englishText: When Abraham looked up, his eye fell upon a*a Reading ’eḥad with many Heb. mss. and ancient versions; text ’aḥar “after.” ram, caught in the thicket by its horns. So Abraham went and took the ram and offered it up as a burnt offering in place of his son.
22.transliteration: vַyִּshָּׂ֨a aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֶt־aֵynָ֗yv vַyַּrְa֙ vְhִnֵּh־aַ֔yִl aַchַ֕r nֶaֱchַ֥z bַּsְּbַ֖ךְ bְּkַrְnָ֑yv vַyֵּ֤lֶךְ aַbְrָhָם֙ vַyִּkַּ֣ch aֶt־hָaַ֔yִl vַyַּaֲlֵ֥hvּ lְaֹlָ֖h tַּ֥chַt bְּnֽvֹ׃

22.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֧א אַבְרָהָ֛ם שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> יִרְאֶ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ יֵאָמֵ֣ר הַיּ֔וֹם בְּהַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה יֵרָאֶֽה׃
22.englishText: And Abraham named that site Adonai-yireh,*Adonai-yireh I.e., “יהוה will see”; cf. v. 8. whence the present saying, “On the mount of יהוה there is vision.”*On the mount of יהוה there is vision Heb. be-har y-h-w-h yera’eh.
22.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֧a aַbְrָhָ֛ם shֵֽׁם־hַmָּk֥vֹם hַh֖vּa yְhֹvָ֣h <small>׀</small> yִrְaֶ֑h aֲshֶׁr֙ yֵaָmֵ֣r hַyּ֔vֹם bְּhַ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h yֵrָaֶֽh׃

22.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֛א מַלְאַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם שֵׁנִ֖ית מִן־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
22.englishText: The messenger of יהוה called to Abraham a second time from heaven,
22.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֛a mַlְaַ֥ךְ yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־aַbְrָhָ֑ם shֵׁnִ֖yt mִן־hַshָּׁmָֽyִם׃

22.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בִּ֥י נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֗י יַ֚עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה וְלֹ֥א חָשַׂ֖כְתָּ אֶת־בִּנְךָ֥ אֶת־יְחִידֶֽךָ׃
22.englishText: and said, “By Myself I swear, יהוה declares: Because you have done this and have not withheld your son, your favored one,
22.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr bִּ֥y nִshְׁbַּ֖aְtִּy nְaֻם־yְhֹvָ֑h kִּ֗y yַ֚aַן aֲshֶׁ֤r aָshִׂ֙ytָ֙ aֶt־hַdָּbָ֣r hַzֶּ֔h vְlֹ֥a chָshַׂ֖kְtָּ aֶt־bִּnְךָ֥ aֶt־yְchִydֶֽךָ׃

22.hebrewText: כִּֽי־בָרֵ֣ךְ אֲבָרֶכְךָ֗ וְהַרְבָּ֨ה אַרְבֶּ֤ה אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּכוֹכְבֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְכַח֕וֹל אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־שְׂפַ֣ת הַיָּ֑ם וְיִרַ֣שׁ זַרְעֲךָ֔ אֵ֖ת שַׁ֥עַר אֹיְבָֽיו׃
22.englishText: I will bestow My blessing upon you and make your descendants as numerous as the stars of heaven and the sands on the seashore; and your descendants shall seize the gates of their foes.
22.transliteration: kִּֽy־bָrֵ֣ךְ aֲbָrֶkְךָ֗ vְhַrְbָּ֨h aַrְbֶּ֤h aֶֽt־zַrְaֲךָ֙ kְּkvֹkְbֵ֣y hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vְkַch֕vֹl aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־shְׂpַ֣t hַyָּ֑ם vְyִrַ֣shׁ zַrְaֲךָ֔ aֵ֖t shַׁ֥aַr aֹyְbָֽyv׃

22.hebrewText: וְהִתְבָּרְכ֣וּ בְזַרְעֲךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ עֵ֕קֶב אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ בְּקֹלִֽי׃
22.englishText: All the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your descendants, because you have obeyed My command.”
22.transliteration: vְhִtְbָּrְk֣vּ bְzַrְaֲךָ֔ kֹּ֖l gּvֹyֵ֣y hָaָ֑rֶץ aֵ֕kֶb aֲshֶׁ֥r shָׁmַ֖aְtָּ bְּkֹlִֽy׃

22.hebrewText: וַיָּ֤שׇׁב אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶל־נְעָרָ֔יו וַיָּקֻ֛מוּ וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ יַחְדָּ֖ו אֶל־בְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב אַבְרָהָ֖ם בִּבְאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃ {פ}
22.englishText: Abraham then returned to his servants, and they departed together for Beer-sheba; and Abraham stayed in Beer-sheba.
22.transliteration: vַyָּ֤shׇׁb aַbְrָhָם֙ aֶl־nְaָrָ֔yv vַyָּkֻ֛mvּ vַyֵּlְk֥vּ yַchְdָּ֖v aֶl־bְּaֵ֣r shָׁ֑bַa vַyֵּ֥shֶׁb aַbְrָhָ֖ם bִּbְaֵ֥r shָֽׁbַa׃ {p}

22.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵי֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַיֻּגַּ֥ד לְאַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר הִ֠נֵּ֠ה יָלְדָ֨ה מִלְכָּ֥ה גַם־הִ֛וא בָּנִ֖ים לְנָח֥וֹר אָחִֽיךָ׃
22.englishText: Some time later, Abraham was told, “Milcah too has borne sons to your brother Nahor:
22.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y aַchֲrֵy֙ hַdְּbָrִ֣yם hָaֵ֔lֶּh vַyֻּgַּ֥d lְaַbְrָhָ֖ם lֵamֹ֑r hִ֠nֵּ֠h yָlְdָ֨h mִlְkָּ֥h gַם־hִ֛va bָּnִ֖yם lְnָch֥vֹr aָchִֽyךָ׃

22.hebrewText: אֶת־ע֥וּץ בְּכֹר֖וֹ וְאֶת־בּ֣וּז אָחִ֑יו וְאֶת־קְמוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִ֥י אֲרָֽם׃
22.englishText: Uz the first-born, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram;
22.transliteration: aֶt־a֥vּץ bְּkֹr֖vֹ vְaֶt־bּ֣vּz aָchִ֑yv vְaֶt־kְmvּaֵ֖l aֲbִ֥y aֲrָֽם׃

22.hebrewText: וְאֶת־כֶּ֣שֶׂד וְאֶת־חֲז֔וֹ וְאֶת־פִּלְדָּ֖שׁ וְאֶת־יִדְלָ֑ף וְאֵ֖ת בְּתוּאֵֽל׃
22.englishText: and Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel”—
22.transliteration: vְaֶt־kֶּ֣shֶׂd vְaֶt־chֲz֔vֹ vְaֶt־pִּlְdָּ֖shׁ vְaֶt־yִdְlָ֑ף vְaֵ֖t bְּtvּaֵֽl׃

22.hebrewText: וּבְתוּאֵ֖ל יָלַ֣ד אֶת־רִבְקָ֑ה שְׁמֹנָ֥ה אֵ֙לֶּה֙ יָלְדָ֣ה מִלְכָּ֔ה לְנָח֖וֹר אֲחִ֥י אַבְרָהָֽם׃
22.englishText: Bethuel being the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.
22.transliteration: vּbְtvּaֵ֖l yָlַ֣d aֶt־rִbְkָ֑h shְׁmֹnָ֥h aֵ֙lֶּh֙ yָlְdָ֣h mִlְkָּ֔h lְnָch֖vֹr aֲchִ֥y aַbְrָhָֽם׃

22.hebrewText: וּפִֽילַגְשׁ֖וֹ וּשְׁמָ֣הּ רְאוּמָ֑ה וַתֵּ֤לֶד גַּם־הִוא֙ אֶת־טֶ֣בַח וְאֶת־גַּ֔חַם וְאֶת־תַּ֖חַשׁ וְאֶֽת־מַעֲכָֽה׃ {פ}
22.englishText: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore [sons]—Tebah, Gaham, and Tahash—and [a daughter,]*[a daughter] As implied. In the Bible, the name Maacah is given to five or six other persons—all of whom are women. Biblical genealogies are known to identify a lineage by a woman’s name—especially at the end of a list of segments. Maacah.
22.transliteration: vּpִֽylַgְshׁ֖vֹ vּshְׁmָ֣hּ rְavּmָ֑h vַtֵּ֤lֶd gַּם־hִva֙ aֶt־tֶ֣bַch vְaֶt־gַּ֔chַם vְaֶt־tַּ֖chַshׁ vְaֶֽt־mַaֲkָֽh׃ {p}

chayei-sarah.name: Chayei Sarah
chayei-sarah.summary: Sarah's death and burial, Abraham's purchase of the Cave of Machpelah, Eliezer's mission to find a wife for Isaac, and the marriage of Isaac and Rebecca.

23.hebrewText: וַיִּהְיוּ֙ חַיֵּ֣י שָׂרָ֔ה מֵאָ֥ה שָׁנָ֛ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֖י חַיֵּ֥י שָׂרָֽה׃
23.englishText: Sarah’s lifetime—the span of Sarah’s life—came to one hundred and twenty-seven years.
23.transliteration: vַyִּhְyvּ֙ chַyֵּ֣y shָׂrָ֔h mֵaָ֥h shָׁnָ֛h vְaֶshְׂrִ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h vְshֶׁ֣bַa shָׁnִ֑yם shְׁnֵ֖y chַyֵּ֥y shָׂrָֽh׃

23.hebrewText: וַתָּ֣מׇת שָׂרָ֗ה בְּקִרְיַ֥ת אַרְבַּ֛ע הִ֥וא חֶבְר֖וֹן בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיָּבֹא֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם לִסְפֹּ֥ד לְשָׂרָ֖ה וְלִבְ<small>כֹּ</small>תָֽהּ׃
23.englishText: Sarah died in Kiriath-arba—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan; and Abraham proceeded to mourn for Sarah and to bewail her.
23.transliteration: vַtָּ֣mׇt shָׂrָ֗h bְּkִrְyַ֥t aַrְbַּ֛a hִ֥va chֶbְr֖vֹן bְּaֶ֣rֶץ kְּnָ֑aַן vַyָּbֹa֙ aַbְrָhָ֔ם lִsְpֹּ֥d lְshָׂrָ֖h vְlִbְ<small>kֹּ</small>tָֽhּ׃

23.hebrewText: וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י מֵת֑וֹ וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֶל־בְּנֵי־חֵ֖ת לֵאמֹֽר׃
23.englishText: Then Abraham rose from beside his dead, and spoke to the Hittites, saying,
23.transliteration: vַyָּ֙kׇם֙ aַbְrָhָ֔ם mֵaַ֖l pְּnֵ֣y mֵt֑vֹ vַyְdַbֵּ֥r aֶl־bְּnֵy־chֵ֖t lֵamֹֽr׃

23.hebrewText: גֵּר־וְתוֹשָׁ֥ב אָנֹכִ֖י עִמָּכֶ֑ם תְּנ֨וּ לִ֤י אֲחֻזַּת־קֶ֙בֶר֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם וְאֶקְבְּרָ֥ה מֵתִ֖י מִלְּפָנָֽי׃
23.englishText: “I am a resident alien among you; sell me a burial site among you, that I may remove my dead for burial.”
23.transliteration: gֵּr־vְtvֹshָׁ֥b aָnֹkִ֖y aִmָּkֶ֑ם tְּn֨vּ lִ֤y aֲchֻzַּt־kֶ֙bֶr֙ aִmָּkֶ֔ם vְaֶkְbְּrָ֥h mֵtִ֖y mִlְּpָnָֽy׃

23.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲנ֧וּ בְנֵי־חֵ֛ת אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
23.englishText: And the Hittites replied to Abraham, saying to him,
23.transliteration: vַyַּaֲn֧vּ bְnֵy־chֵ֛t aֶt־aַbְrָhָ֖ם lֵamֹ֥r lֽvֹ׃

23.hebrewText: שְׁמָעֵ֣נוּ ׀ אֲדֹנִ֗י נְשִׂ֨יא אֱלֹהִ֤ים אַתָּה֙ בְּתוֹכֵ֔נוּ בְּמִבְחַ֣ר קְבָרֵ֔ינוּ קְבֹ֖ר אֶת־מֵתֶ֑ךָ אִ֣ישׁ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ אֶת־קִבְר֛וֹ לֹֽא־יִכְלֶ֥ה מִמְּךָ֖ מִקְּבֹ֥ר מֵתֶֽךָ׃
23.englishText: “Hear us, my lord: you are the elect of God among us. Bury your dead in the choicest of our burial places; none of us will withhold his burial place from you for burying your dead.”
23.transliteration: shְׁmָaֵ֣nvּ ׀ aֲdֹnִ֗y nְshִׂ֨ya aֱlֹhִ֤yם aַtָּh֙ bְּtvֹkֵ֔nvּ bְּmִbְchַ֣r kְbָrֵ֔ynvּ kְbֹ֖r aֶt־mֵtֶ֑ךָ aִ֣yshׁ mִmֶּ֔nּvּ aֶt־kִbְr֛vֹ lֹֽa־yִkְlֶ֥h mִmְּךָ֖ mִkְּbֹ֥r mֵtֶֽךָ׃

23.hebrewText: וַיָּ֧קׇם אַבְרָהָ֛ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ לְעַם־הָאָ֖רֶץ לִבְנֵי־חֵֽת׃
23.englishText: Thereupon Abraham bowed low to the landowning citizens,*landowning citizens Heb. ‘am ha-’areṣ; lit. “people of the land.” See the Dictionary under ‘am. the Hittites,
23.transliteration: vַyָּ֧kׇם aַbְrָhָ֛ם vַyִּshְׁtַּ֥chvּ lְaַם־hָaָ֖rֶץ lִbְnֵy־chֵֽt׃

23.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתָּ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־יֵ֣שׁ אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁכֶ֗ם לִקְבֹּ֤ר אֶת־מֵתִי֙ מִלְּפָנַ֔י שְׁמָע֕וּנִי וּפִגְעוּ־לִ֖י בְּעֶפְר֥וֹן בֶּן־צֹֽחַר׃
23.englishText: and he said to them, “If it is your wish that I remove my dead for burial, you must agree to intercede for me with Ephron son of Zohar.
23.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r aִtָּ֖ם lֵamֹ֑r aִם־yֵ֣shׁ aֶֽt־nַpְshְׁkֶ֗ם lִkְbֹּ֤r aֶt־mֵtִy֙ mִlְּpָnַ֔y shְׁmָa֕vּnִy vּpִgְavּ־lִ֖y bְּaֶpְr֥vֹן bֶּן־tsֹֽchַr׃

23.hebrewText: וְיִתֶּן־לִ֗י אֶת־מְעָרַ֤ת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּקְצֵ֣ה שָׂדֵ֑הוּ בְּכֶ֨סֶף מָלֵ֜א יִתְּנֶ֥נָּה לִּ֛י בְּתוֹכְכֶ֖ם לַאֲחֻזַּת־קָֽבֶר׃
23.englishText: Let him sell me the cave of Machpelah that he owns, which is at the edge of his land. Let him sell it to me, at the full price, for a burial site in your midst.”
23.transliteration: vְyִtֶּן־lִ֗y aֶt־mְaָrַ֤t hַmַּkְpֵּlָh֙ aֲshֶׁr־l֔vֹ aֲshֶׁ֖r bִּkְtsֵ֣h shָׂdֵ֑hvּ bְּkֶ֨sֶף mָlֵ֜a yִtְּnֶ֥nָּh lִּ֛y bְּtvֹkְkֶ֖ם lַaֲchֻzַּt־kָֽbֶr׃

23.hebrewText: וְעֶפְר֥וֹן יֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּת֣וֹךְ בְּנֵי־חֵ֑ת וַיַּ֩עַן֩ עֶפְר֨וֹן הַחִתִּ֤י אֶת־אַבְרָהָם֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י בְנֵי־חֵ֔ת לְכֹ֛ל בָּאֵ֥י שַֽׁעַר־עִיר֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
23.englishText: Ephron was present among the Hittites; so Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the Hittites, the assembly in his town’s gate,*the assembly in his town’s gate Lit. “all who entered the gate of his town.” So NJPS, with a note: “I.e., all his fellow townsmen.” Cf. 34.20; Prov. 31.23. saying,
23.transliteration: vְaֶpְr֥vֹן yֹshֵׁ֖b bְּt֣vֹךְ bְּnֵy־chֵ֑t vַyַּ֩aַן֩ aֶpְr֨vֹן hַchִtִּ֤y aֶt־aַbְrָhָם֙ bְּaׇzְnֵ֣y bְnֵy־chֵ֔t lְkֹ֛l bָּaֵ֥y shַֽׁaַr־aִyr֖vֹ lֵamֹֽr׃

23.hebrewText: לֹֽא־אֲדֹנִ֣י שְׁמָעֵ֔נִי הַשָּׂדֶה֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לָ֔ךְ וְהַמְּעָרָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ לְךָ֣ נְתַתִּ֑יהָ לְעֵינֵ֧י בְנֵי־עַמִּ֛י נְתַתִּ֥יהָ לָּ֖ךְ קְבֹ֥ר מֵתֶֽךָ׃
23.englishText: “No, my lord, hear me: I give you the field and I give you the cave that is in it; I give it to you in the presence of my people. Bury your dead.”
23.transliteration: lֹֽa־aֲdֹnִ֣y shְׁmָaֵ֔nִy hַshָּׂdֶh֙ nָtַ֣tִּy lָ֔ךְ vְhַmְּaָrָ֥h aֲshֶׁr־bּ֖vֹ lְךָ֣ nְtַtִּ֑yhָ lְaֵynֵ֧y bְnֵy־aַmִּ֛y nְtַtִּ֥yhָ lָּ֖ךְ kְbֹ֥r mֵtֶֽךָ׃

23.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁתַּ֙חוּ֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י עַ֥ם הָאָֽרֶץ׃
23.englishText: Then Abraham bowed low before the landowning citizens,
23.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁtַּ֙chvּ֙ aַbְrָhָ֔ם lִpְnֵ֖y aַ֥ם hָaָֽrֶץ׃

23.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אֶל־עֶפְר֜וֹן בְּאׇזְנֵ֤י עַם־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַ֛ךְ אִם־אַתָּ֥ה ל֖וּ שְׁמָעֵ֑נִי נָתַ֜תִּי כֶּ֤סֶף הַשָּׂדֶה֙ קַ֣ח מִמֶּ֔נִּי וְאֶקְבְּרָ֥ה אֶת־מֵתִ֖י שָֽׁמָּה׃
23.englishText: and spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the landowning citizens, saying, “If only you would hear me out! Let me pay the price of the land; accept it from me, that I may bury my dead there.”
23.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֨r aֶl־aֶpְr֜vֹן bְּaׇzְnֵ֤y aַם־hָaָ֙rֶץ֙ lֵamֹ֔r aַ֛ךְ aִם־aַtָּ֥h l֖vּ shְׁmָaֵ֑nִy nָtַ֜tִּy kֶּ֤sֶף hַshָּׂdֶh֙ kַ֣ch mִmֶּ֔nִּy vְaֶkְbְּrָ֥h aֶt־mֵtִ֖y shָֽׁmָּh׃

23.hebrewText: וַיַּ֧עַן עֶפְר֛וֹן אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
23.englishText: And Ephron replied to Abraham, saying to him,
23.transliteration: vַyַּ֧aַן aֶpְr֛vֹן aֶt־aַbְrָhָ֖ם lֵamֹ֥r lֽvֹ׃

23.hebrewText: אֲדֹנִ֣י שְׁמָעֵ֔נִי אֶ֩רֶץ֩ אַרְבַּ֨ע מֵאֹ֧ת שֶֽׁקֶל־כֶּ֛סֶף בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵֽינְךָ֖ מַה־הִ֑וא וְאֶת־מֵתְךָ֖ קְבֹֽר׃
23.englishText: “My lord, do hear me! A piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver—what is that between you and me? Go and bury your dead.”
23.transliteration: aֲdֹnִ֣y shְׁmָaֵ֔nִy aֶ֩rֶץ֩ aַrְbַּ֨a mֵaֹ֧t shֶֽׁkֶl־kֶּ֛sֶף bֵּynִ֥y vּbֵֽynְךָ֖ mַh־hִ֑va vְaֶt־mֵtְךָ֖ kְbֹֽr׃

23.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אַבְרָהָם֮ אֶל־עֶפְרוֹן֒ וַיִּשְׁקֹ֤ל אַבְרָהָם֙ לְעֶפְרֹ֔ן אֶת־הַכֶּ֕סֶף אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י בְנֵי־חֵ֑ת אַרְבַּ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ שֶׁ֣קֶל כֶּ֔סֶף עֹבֵ֖ר לַסֹּחֵֽר׃
23.englishText: Abraham accepted Ephron’s terms. Abraham paid out to Ephron the money that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites—four hundred shekels of silver at the going merchants’ rate.
23.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֣a aַbְrָhָם֮ aֶl־aֶpְrvֹן֒ vַyִּshְׁkֹ֤l aַbְrָhָם֙ lְaֶpְrֹ֔ן aֶt־hַkֶּ֕sֶף aֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbֶּ֖r bְּaׇzְnֵ֣y bְnֵy־chֵ֑t aַrְbַּ֤a mֵavֹt֙ shֶׁ֣kֶl kֶּ֔sֶף aֹbֵ֖r lַsֹּchֵֽr׃

23.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣קׇם ׀ שְׂדֵ֣ה עֶפְר֗וֹן אֲשֶׁר֙ בַּמַּכְפֵּלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י מַמְרֵ֑א הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וְהַמְּעָרָ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֔וֹ וְכׇל־הָעֵץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּכׇל־גְּבֻל֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
23.englishText: So Ephron’s land in Machpelah, near Mamre—the field with its cave and all the trees anywhere within the confines of that field—passed
23.transliteration: vַyָּ֣kׇם ׀ shְׂdֵ֣h aֶpְr֗vֹן aֲshֶׁr֙ bַּmַּkְpֵּlָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֖r lִpְnֵ֣y mַmְrֵ֑a hַshָּׂdֶh֙ vְhַmְּaָrָ֣h aֲshֶׁr־bּ֔vֹ vְkׇl־hָaֵץ֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r bַּshָּׂdֶ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r bְּkׇl־gְּbֻl֖vֹ sָbִֽyb׃

23.hebrewText: לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְמִקְנָ֖ה לְעֵינֵ֣י בְנֵי־חֵ֑ת בְּכֹ֖ל בָּאֵ֥י שַֽׁעַר־עִירֽוֹ׃
23.englishText: to Abraham as his possession, in the presence of the Hittites, of the assembly in his town’s gate.
23.transliteration: lְaַbְrָhָ֥ם lְmִkְnָ֖h lְaֵynֵ֣y bְnֵy־chֵ֑t bְּkֹ֖l bָּaֵ֥y shַֽׁaַr־aִyrֽvֹ׃

23.hebrewText: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵן֩ קָבַ֨ר אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ אֶל־מְעָרַ֞ת שְׂדֵ֧ה הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֛ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵ֖א הִ֣וא חֶבְר֑וֹן בְּאֶ֖רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
23.englishText: And then Abraham buried his wife Sarah in the cave of the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan.
23.transliteration: vְaַchֲrֵy־kֵן֩ kָbַ֨r aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֶt־shָׂrָ֣h aִshְׁtּ֗vֹ aֶl־mְaָrַ֞t shְׂdֵ֧h hַmַּkְpֵּlָ֛h aַl־pְּnֵ֥y mַmְrֵ֖a hִ֣va chֶbְr֑vֹן bְּaֶ֖rֶץ kְּnָֽaַן׃

23.hebrewText: וַיָּ֨קׇם הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה וְהַמְּעָרָ֧ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֛וֹ לְאַבְרָהָ֖ם לַאֲחֻזַּת־קָ֑בֶר מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵי־חֵֽת׃ {ס}
23.englishText: Thus the field with its cave passed from the Hittites to Abraham, as a burial site.
23.transliteration: vַyָּ֨kׇם hַshָּׂdֶ֜h vְhַmְּaָrָ֧h aֲshֶׁr־bּ֛vֹ lְaַbְrָhָ֖ם lַaֲchֻzַּt־kָ֑bֶr mֵaֵ֖t bְּnֵy־chֵֽt׃ {s}

24.hebrewText: וְאַבְרָהָ֣ם זָקֵ֔ן בָּ֖א בַּיָּמִ֑ים וַֽיהֹוָ֛ה בֵּרַ֥ךְ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם בַּכֹּֽל׃
24.englishText: Abraham was now old, advanced in years, and יהוה had blessed Abraham in all things.
24.transliteration: vְaַbְrָhָ֣ם zָkֵ֔ן bָּ֖a bַּyָּmִ֑yם vַֽyhֹvָ֛h bֵּrַ֥ךְ aֶt־aַbְrָhָ֖ם bַּkֹּֽl׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֗ם אֶל־עַבְדּוֹ֙ זְקַ֣ן בֵּית֔וֹ הַמֹּשֵׁ֖ל בְּכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ שִֽׂים־נָ֥א יָדְךָ֖ תַּ֥חַת יְרֵכִֽי׃
24.englishText: And Abraham said to the senior servant of his household, who had charge of all that he owned, “Put your hand under my thigh
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aַbְrָhָ֗ם aֶl־aַbְdּvֹ֙ zְkַ֣ן bֵּyt֔vֹ hַmֹּshֵׁ֖l bְּkׇl־aֲshֶׁr־l֑vֹ shִֽׂyם־nָ֥a yָdְךָ֖ tַּ֥chַt yְrֵkִֽy׃

24.hebrewText: וְאַשְׁבִּ֣יעֲךָ֔ בַּֽיהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־תִקַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ לִבְנִ֔י מִבְּנוֹת֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י יוֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
24.englishText: and I will make you swear by יהוה, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I dwell,
24.transliteration: vְaַshְׁbִּ֣yaֲךָ֔ bַּֽyhֹvָh֙ aֱlֹhֵ֣y hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vֵֽalֹhֵ֖y hָaָ֑rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֨r lֹֽa־tִkַּ֤ch aִshָּׁh֙ lִbְnִ֔y mִbְּnvֹt֙ hַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֔y aֲshֶׁ֥r aָnֹkִ֖y yvֹshֵׁ֥b bְּkִrְbּֽvֹ׃

24.hebrewText: כִּ֧י אֶל־אַרְצִ֛י וְאֶל־מוֹלַדְתִּ֖י תֵּלֵ֑ךְ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ אִשָּׁ֖ה לִבְנִ֥י לְיִצְחָֽק׃
24.englishText: but will go to the land of my birth and get a wife for my son Isaac.”
24.transliteration: kִּ֧y aֶl־aַrְtsִ֛y vְaֶl־mvֹlַdְtִּ֖y tֵּlֵ֑ךְ vְlָkַchְtָּ֥ aִshָּׁ֖h lִbְnִ֥y lְyִtsְchָֽk׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ הָעֶ֔בֶד אוּלַי֙ לֹא־תֹאבֶ֣ה הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה לָלֶ֥כֶת אַחֲרַ֖י אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את הֶֽהָשֵׁ֤ב אָשִׁיב֙ אֶת־בִּנְךָ֔ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יָצָ֥אתָ מִשָּֽׁם׃
24.englishText: And the servant said to him, “What if the woman does not consent to follow me to this land, shall I then take your son back to the land from which you came?”
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֵlָyv֙ hָaֶ֔bֶd avּlַy֙ lֹa־tֹabֶ֣h hָֽaִshָּׁ֔h lָlֶ֥kֶt aַchֲrַ֖y aֶl־hָaָ֣rֶץ hַzֹּ֑at hֶֽhָshֵׁ֤b aָshִׁyb֙ aֶt־bִּnְךָ֔ aֶl־hָaָ֖rֶץ aֲshֶׁr־yָtsָ֥atָ mִshָּֽׁם׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו אַבְרָהָ֑ם הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּן־תָּשִׁ֥יב אֶת־בְּנִ֖י שָֽׁמָּה׃
24.englishText: Abraham answered him, “On no account must you take my son back there!
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֵlָ֖yv aַbְrָhָ֑ם hִshָּׁ֣mֶr lְךָ֔ pֶּן־tָּshִׁ֥yb aֶt־bְּnִ֖y shָֽׁmָּh׃

24.hebrewText: יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֨ר לְקָחַ֜נִי מִבֵּ֣ית אָבִי֮ וּמֵאֶ֣רֶץ מֽוֹלַדְתִּי֒ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּר־לִ֜י וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר נִֽשְׁבַּֽע־לִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְזַ֨רְעֲךָ֔ אֶתֵּ֖ן אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את ה֗וּא יִשְׁלַ֤ח מַלְאָכוֹ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ אִשָּׁ֛ה לִבְנִ֖י מִשָּֽׁם׃
24.englishText: יהוה, the God of heaven—who took me from my father’s house and from my native land, who promised me on oath, saying, ‘I will assign this land to your offspring’—will send a messenger before you, and you will get a wife for my son from there.
24.transliteration: yְhֹvָ֣h ׀ aֱlֹhֵ֣y hַshָּׁmַ֗yִם aֲshֶׁ֨r lְkָchַ֜nִy mִbֵּ֣yt aָbִy֮ vּmֵaֶ֣rֶץ mֽvֹlַdְtִּy֒ vַaֲshֶׁ֨r dִּbֶּr־lִ֜y vַaֲshֶׁ֤r nִֽshְׁbַּֽa־lִy֙ lֵamֹ֔r lְzַ֨rְaֲךָ֔ aֶtֵּ֖ן aֶt־hָaָ֣rֶץ hַzֹּ֑at h֗vּa yִshְׁlַ֤ch mַlְaָkvֹ֙ lְpָnֶ֔yךָ vְlָkַchְtָּ֥ aִshָּׁ֛h lִbְnִ֖y mִshָּֽׁם׃

24.hebrewText: וְאִם־לֹ֨א תֹאבֶ֤ה הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ לָלֶ֣כֶת אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ וְנִקִּ֕יתָ מִשְּׁבֻעָתִ֖י זֹ֑את רַ֣ק אֶת־בְּנִ֔י לֹ֥א תָשֵׁ֖ב שָֽׁמָּה׃
24.englishText: And if the woman does not consent to follow you, you shall then be clear of this oath to me; but do not take my son back there.”
24.transliteration: vְaִם־lֹ֨a tֹabֶ֤h hָֽaִshָּׁh֙ lָlֶ֣kֶt aַchֲrֶ֔yךָ vְnִkִּ֕ytָ mִshְּׁbֻaָtִ֖y zֹ֑at rַ֣k aֶt־bְּnִ֔y lֹ֥a tָshֵׁ֖b shָֽׁmָּh׃

24.hebrewText: וַיָּ֤שֶׂם הָעֶ֙בֶד֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ תַּ֛חַת יֶ֥רֶךְ אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֑יו וַיִּשָּׁ֣בַֽע ל֔וֹ עַל־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃
24.englishText: So the servant put his hand under the thigh of his master Abraham and swore to him as bidden.*as bidden Lit. “about this matter.”
24.transliteration: vַyָּ֤shֶׂם hָaֶ֙bֶd֙ aֶt־yָd֔vֹ tַּ֛chַt yֶ֥rֶךְ aַbְrָhָ֖ם aֲdֹnָ֑yv vַyִּshָּׁ֣bַֽa l֔vֹ aַl־hַdָּbָ֖r hַzֶּֽh׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֣ח הָ֠עֶ֠בֶד עֲשָׂרָ֨ה גְמַלִּ֜ים מִגְּמַלֵּ֤י אֲדֹנָיו֙ וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ וְכׇל־ט֥וּב אֲדֹנָ֖יו בְּיָד֑וֹ וַיָּ֗קׇם וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ אֶל־אֲרַ֥ם נַֽהֲרַ֖יִם אֶל־עִ֥יר נָחֽוֹר׃
24.englishText: Then the servant took ten of his master’s camels and set out, taking with him all the bounty of his master; and he made his way to Aram-naharaim, to the city of Nahor.
24.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֣ch hָ֠aֶ֠bֶd aֲshָׂrָ֨h gְmַlִּ֜yם mִgְּmַlֵּ֤y aֲdֹnָyv֙ vַyֵּ֔lֶךְ vְkׇl־t֥vּb aֲdֹnָ֖yv bְּyָd֑vֹ vַyָּ֗kׇם vַyֵּ֛lֶךְ aֶl־aֲrַ֥ם nַֽhֲrַ֖yִם aֶl־aִ֥yr nָchֽvֹr׃

24.hebrewText: וַיַּבְרֵ֧ךְ הַגְּמַלִּ֛ים מִח֥וּץ לָעִ֖יר אֶל־בְּאֵ֣ר הַמָּ֑יִם לְעֵ֣ת עֶ֔רֶב לְעֵ֖ת צֵ֥את הַשֹּׁאֲבֹֽת׃
24.englishText: He made the camels kneel down by the well outside the city, at evening time, the time when women come out to draw water.
24.transliteration: vַyַּbְrֵ֧ךְ hַgְּmַlִּ֛yם mִch֥vּץ lָaִ֖yr aֶl־bְּaֵ֣r hַmָּ֑yִם lְaֵ֣t aֶ֔rֶb lְaֵ֖t tsֵ֥at hַshֹּׁaֲbֹֽt׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמַ֓ר ׀ יְהֹוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם הַקְרֵה־נָ֥א לְפָנַ֖י הַיּ֑וֹם וַעֲשֵׂה־חֶ֕סֶד עִ֖ם אֲדֹנִ֥י אַבְרָהָֽם׃
24.englishText: And he said, “O יהוה, God of my master Abraham’s [house], grant me good fortune this day, and deal graciously with my master Abraham:
24.transliteration: vַyֹּamַ֓r ׀ yְhֹvָ֗h aֱlֹhֵy֙ aֲdֹnִ֣y aַbְrָhָ֔ם hַkְrֵh־nָ֥a lְpָnַ֖y hַyּ֑vֹם vַaֲshֵׂh־chֶ֕sֶd aִ֖ם aֲdֹnִ֥y aַbְrָhָֽם׃

24.hebrewText: הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י נִצָּ֖ב עַל־עֵ֣ין הַמָּ֑יִם וּבְנוֹת֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י הָעִ֔יר יֹצְאֹ֖ת לִשְׁאֹ֥ב מָֽיִם׃
24.englishText: Here I stand by the spring as the daughters of the townspeople*townspeople Or “town’s householders.” come out to draw water;
24.transliteration: hִnֵּ֛h aָnֹkִ֥y nִtsָּ֖b aַl־aֵ֣yן hַmָּ֑yִם vּbְnvֹt֙ aַnְshֵׁ֣y hָaִ֔yr yֹtsְaֹ֖t lִshְׁaֹ֥b mָֽyִם׃

24.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֣ה הַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֹמַ֤ר אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ הַטִּי־נָ֤א כַדֵּךְ֙ וְאֶשְׁתֶּ֔ה וְאָמְרָ֣ה שְׁתֵ֔ה וְגַם־גְּמַלֶּ֖יךָ אַשְׁקֶ֑ה אֹתָ֤הּ הֹכַ֙חְתָּ֙ לְעַבְדְּךָ֣ לְיִצְחָ֔ק וּבָ֣הּ אֵדַ֔ע כִּי־עָשִׂ֥יתָ חֶ֖סֶד עִם־אֲדֹנִֽי׃
24.englishText: let the maiden to whom I say, ‘Please, lower your jar that I may drink,’ and who replies, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels’—let her be the one whom You have decreed for Your servant Isaac. Thereby shall I know that You have dealt graciously with my master.”
24.transliteration: vְhָyָ֣h hַֽnַּaֲrָ֗ aֲshֶׁ֨r aֹmַ֤r aֵlֶ֙yhָ֙ hַtִּy־nָ֤a kַdֵּךְ֙ vְaֶshְׁtֶּ֔h vְaָmְrָ֣h shְׁtֵ֔h vְgַם־gְּmַlֶּ֖yךָ aַshְׁkֶ֑h aֹtָ֤hּ hֹkַ֙chְtָּ֙ lְaַbְdְּךָ֣ lְyִtsְchָ֔k vּbָ֣hּ aֵdַ֔a kִּy־aָshִׂ֥ytָ chֶ֖sֶd aִם־aֲdֹnִֽy׃

24.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־ה֗וּא טֶ֘רֶם֮ כִּלָּ֣ה לְדַבֵּר֒ וְהִנֵּ֧ה רִבְקָ֣ה יֹצֵ֗את אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֻלְּדָה֙ לִבְתוּאֵ֣ל בֶּן־מִלְכָּ֔ה אֵ֥שֶׁת נָח֖וֹר אֲחִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם וְכַדָּ֖הּ עַל־שִׁכְמָֽהּ׃
24.englishText: He had scarcely finished speaking, when Rebekah, who was born to Bethuel, the son of Milcah the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor, came out with her jar on her shoulder.
24.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־h֗vּa tֶ֘rֶם֮ kִּlָּ֣h lְdַbֵּr֒ vְhִnֵּ֧h rִbְkָ֣h yֹtsֵ֗at aֲshֶׁ֤r yֻlְּdָh֙ lִbְtvּaֵ֣l bֶּן־mִlְkָּ֔h aֵ֥shֶׁt nָch֖vֹr aֲchִ֣y aַbְrָhָ֑ם vְkַdָּ֖hּ aַl־shִׁkְmָֽhּ׃

24.hebrewText: וְהַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ טֹבַ֤ת מַרְאֶה֙ מְאֹ֔ד בְּתוּלָ֕ה וְאִ֖ישׁ לֹ֣א יְדָעָ֑הּ וַתֵּ֣רֶד הָעַ֔יְנָה וַתְּמַלֵּ֥א כַדָּ֖הּ וַתָּֽעַל׃
24.englishText: The maiden was very beautiful—[and] a virgin, no man having known her.*[and] a virgin, no man having known her Or “a young woman whom no man had known.” She went down to the spring, filled her jar, and came up.
24.transliteration: vְhַֽnַּaֲrָ֗ tֹbַ֤t mַrְaֶh֙ mְaֹ֔d bְּtvּlָ֕h vְaִ֖yshׁ lֹ֣a yְdָaָ֑hּ vַtֵּ֣rֶd hָaַ֔yְnָh vַtְּmַlֵּ֥a kַdָּ֖hּ vַtָּֽaַl׃

24.hebrewText: וַיָּ֥רׇץ הָעֶ֖בֶד לִקְרָאתָ֑הּ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הַגְמִיאִ֥ינִי נָ֛א מְעַט־מַ֖יִם מִכַּדֵּֽךְ׃
24.englishText: The servant ran toward her and said, “Please, let me sip a little water from your jar.”
24.transliteration: vַyָּ֥rׇץ hָaֶ֖bֶd lִkְrָatָ֑hּ vַyֹּ֕amֶr hַgְmִyaִ֥ynִy nָ֛a mְaַt־mַ֖yִם mִkַּdֵּֽךְ׃

24.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֖אמֶר שְׁתֵ֣ה אֲדֹנִ֑י וַתְּמַהֵ֗ר וַתֹּ֧רֶד כַּדָּ֛הּ עַל־יָדָ֖הּ וַתַּשְׁקֵֽהוּ׃
24.englishText: “Drink, my lord,” she said, and she quickly lowered her jar upon her hand and let him drink.
24.transliteration: vַtֹּ֖amֶr shְׁtֵ֣h aֲdֹnִ֑y vַtְּmַhֵ֗r vַtֹּ֧rֶd kַּdָּ֛hּ aַl־yָdָ֖hּ vַtַּshְׁkֵֽhvּ׃

24.hebrewText: וַתְּכַ֖ל לְהַשְׁקֹת֑וֹ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר גַּ֤ם לִגְמַלֶּ֙יךָ֙ אֶשְׁאָ֔ב עַ֥ד אִם־כִּלּ֖וּ לִשְׁתֹּֽת׃
24.englishText: When she had let him drink his fill, she said, “I will also draw for your camels, until they finish drinking.”
24.transliteration: vַtְּkַ֖l lְhַshְׁkֹt֑vֹ vַtֹּ֗amֶr gַּ֤ם lִgְmַlֶּ֙yךָ֙ aֶshְׁaָ֔b aַ֥d aִם־kִּlּ֖vּ lִshְׁtֹּֽt׃

24.hebrewText: וַתְּמַהֵ֗ר וַתְּעַ֤ר כַּדָּהּ֙ אֶל־הַשֹּׁ֔קֶת וַתָּ֥רׇץ ע֛וֹד אֶֽל־הַבְּאֵ֖ר לִשְׁאֹ֑ב וַתִּשְׁאַ֖ב לְכׇל־גְּמַלָּֽיו׃
24.englishText: Quickly emptying her jar into the trough, she ran back to the well to draw, and she drew for all his camels.
24.transliteration: vַtְּmַhֵ֗r vַtְּaַ֤r kַּdָּhּ֙ aֶl־hַshֹּׁ֔kֶt vַtָּ֥rׇץ a֛vֹd aֶֽl־hַbְּaֵ֖r lִshְׁaֹ֑b vַtִּshְׁaַ֖b lְkׇl־gְּmַlָּֽyv׃

24.hebrewText: וְהָאִ֥ישׁ מִשְׁתָּאֵ֖ה לָ֑הּ מַחֲרִ֕ישׁ לָדַ֗עַת הַֽהִצְלִ֧יחַ יְהֹוָ֛ה דַּרְכּ֖וֹ אִם־לֹֽא׃
24.englishText: The man,*man Or “agent.” Lit. “participant whose involvement defines the depicted situation.” See note at 18.2 and the Dictionary under ’ish; Agent. meanwhile, stood gazing at her, silently wondering whether יהוה had made his errand successful or not.
24.transliteration: vְhָaִ֥yshׁ mִshְׁtָּaֵ֖h lָ֑hּ mַchֲrִ֕yshׁ lָdַ֗aַt hַֽhִtsְlִ֧ychַ yְhֹvָ֛h dַּrְkּ֖vֹ aִם־lֹֽa׃

24.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר כִּלּ֤וּ הַגְּמַלִּים֙ לִשְׁתּ֔וֹת וַיִּקַּ֤ח הָאִישׁ֙ נֶ֣זֶם זָהָ֔ב בֶּ֖קַע מִשְׁקָל֑וֹ וּשְׁנֵ֤י צְמִידִים֙ עַל־יָדֶ֔יהָ עֲשָׂרָ֥ה זָהָ֖ב מִשְׁקָלָֽם׃
24.englishText: When the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold nose-ring weighing a half-shekel,*half-shekel Heb. beqa‘. and two gold bands for her arms, ten shekels in weight.
24.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y kַּaֲshֶׁ֨r kִּlּ֤vּ hַgְּmַlִּyם֙ lִshְׁtּ֔vֹt vַyִּkַּ֤ch hָaִyshׁ֙ nֶ֣zֶם zָhָ֔b bֶּ֖kַa mִshְׁkָl֑vֹ vּshְׁnֵ֤y tsְmִydִyם֙ aַl־yָdֶ֔yhָ aֲshָׂrָ֥h zָhָ֖b mִshְׁkָlָֽם׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ בַּת־מִ֣י אַ֔תְּ הַגִּ֥ידִי נָ֖א לִ֑י הֲיֵ֧שׁ בֵּית־אָבִ֛יךְ מָק֥וֹם לָ֖נוּ לָלִֽין׃
24.englishText: “Pray tell me,” he said, “whose daughter are you? Is there room in your father’s house for us to spend the night?”
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ bַּt־mִ֣y aַ֔tְּ hַgִּ֥ydִy nָ֖a lִ֑y hֲyֵ֧shׁ bֵּyt־aָbִ֛yךְ mָk֥vֹם lָ֖nvּ lָlִֽyן׃

24.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו בַּת־בְּתוּאֵ֖ל אָנֹ֑כִי בֶּן־מִלְכָּ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלְדָ֖ה לְנָחֽוֹר׃
24.englishText: She replied, “I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.”
24.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr aֵlָ֔yv bַּt־bְּtvּaֵ֖l aָnֹ֑kִy bֶּן־mִlְkָּ֕h aֲshֶׁ֥r yָlְdָ֖h lְnָchֽvֹr׃

24.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו גַּם־תֶּ֥בֶן גַּם־מִסְפּ֖וֹא רַ֣ב עִמָּ֑נוּ גַּם־מָק֖וֹם לָלֽוּן׃
24.englishText: And she went on, “There is plenty of straw*straw Heb. teben, shredded straw, which in the East is mixed with feed; cf. v. 32. and feed at home, and also room to spend the night.”
24.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr aֵlָ֔yv gַּם־tֶּ֥bֶן gַּם־mִsְpּ֖vֹa rַ֣b aִmָּ֑nvּ gַּם־mָk֖vֹם lָlֽvּן׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּקֹּ֣ד הָאִ֔ישׁ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
24.englishText: The man bowed low in homage to יהוה
24.transliteration: vַyִּkֹּ֣d hָaִ֔yshׁ vַyִּshְׁtַּ֖chvּ lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בָּר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹֽא־עָזַ֥ב חַסְדּ֛וֹ וַאֲמִתּ֖וֹ מֵעִ֣ם אֲדֹנִ֑י אָנֹכִ֗י בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ נָחַ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֔ה בֵּ֖ית אֲחֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
24.englishText: and said, “Blessed be יהוה, the God of my master Abraham’s [house], who has not withheld steadfast faithfulness from my master. For I have been guided on my errand by יהוה, to the house of my master’s kin.”
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr bָּr֤vּךְ yְhֹvָh֙ aֱlֹhֵy֙ aֲdֹnִ֣y aַbְrָhָ֔ם aֲ֠shֶׁ֠r lֹֽa־aָzַ֥b chַsְdּ֛vֹ vַaֲmִtּ֖vֹ mֵaִ֣ם aֲdֹnִ֑y aָnֹkִ֗y bַּdֶּ֙rֶךְ֙ nָchַ֣nִy yְhֹvָ֔h bֵּ֖yt aֲchֵ֥y aֲdֹnִֽy׃

24.hebrewText: וַתָּ֙רׇץ֙ הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ וַתַּגֵּ֖ד לְבֵ֣ית אִמָּ֑הּ כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
24.englishText: The maiden ran and told all this to her mother’s household.
24.transliteration: vַtָּ֙rׇץ֙ hַֽnַּaֲrָ֔ vַtַּgֵּ֖d lְbֵ֣yt aִmָּ֑hּ kַּdְּbָrִ֖yם hָaֵֽlֶּh׃

24.hebrewText: וּלְרִבְקָ֥ה אָ֖ח וּשְׁמ֣וֹ לָבָ֑ן וַיָּ֨רׇץ לָבָ֧ן אֶל־הָאִ֛ישׁ הַח֖וּצָה אֶל־הָעָֽיִן׃
24.englishText: Now Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban. Laban ran out to the man at the spring—
24.transliteration: vּlְrִbְkָ֥h aָ֖ch vּshְׁm֣vֹ lָbָ֑ן vַyָּ֨rׇץ lָbָ֧ן aֶl־hָaִ֛yshׁ hַch֖vּtsָh aֶl־hָaָֽyִן׃

24.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כִּרְאֹ֣ת אֶת־הַנֶּ֗זֶם וְֽאֶת־הַצְּמִדִים֮ עַל־יְדֵ֣י אֲחֹתוֹ֒ וּכְשׇׁמְע֗וֹ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֞י רִבְקָ֤ה אֲחֹתוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּֽה־דִבֶּ֥ר אֵלַ֖י הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־הָאִ֔ישׁ וְהִנֵּ֛ה עֹמֵ֥ד עַל־הַגְּמַלִּ֖ים עַל־הָעָֽיִן׃
24.englishText: when he saw the nose-ring and the bands on his sister’s arms, and when he heard his sister Rebekah say, “Thus the man spoke to me.” He went up to the man, who was still standing beside the camels at the spring.
24.transliteration: vַyְhִ֣y ׀ kִּrְaֹ֣t aֶt־hַnֶּ֗zֶם vְֽaֶt־hַtsְּmִdִyם֮ aַl־yְdֵ֣y aֲchֹtvֹ֒ vּkְshׇׁmְa֗vֹ aֶt־dִּbְrֵ֞y rִbְkָ֤h aֲchֹtvֹ֙ lֵamֹ֔r kֹּֽh־dִbֶּ֥r aֵlַ֖y hָaִ֑yshׁ vַyָּbֹa֙ aֶl־hָaִ֔yshׁ vְhִnֵּ֛h aֹmֵ֥d aַl־hַgְּmַlִּ֖yם aַl־hָaָֽyִן׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בּ֖וֹא בְּר֣וּךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה לָ֤מָּה תַעֲמֹד֙ בַּח֔וּץ וְאָנֹכִי֙ פִּנִּ֣יתִי הַבַּ֔יִת וּמָק֖וֹם לַגְּמַלִּֽים׃
24.englishText: “Come in, O blessed of יהוה,” he said, “why do you remain outside, when I have made ready the house and a place for the camels?”
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr bּ֖vֹa bְּr֣vּךְ yְhֹvָ֑h lָ֤mָּh tַaֲmֹd֙ bַּch֔vּץ vְaָnֹkִy֙ pִּnִּ֣ytִy hַbַּ֔yִt vּmָk֖vֹם lַgְּmַlִּֽyם׃

24.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֤א הָאִישׁ֙ הַבַּ֔יְתָה וַיְפַתַּ֖ח הַגְּמַלִּ֑ים וַיִּתֵּ֨ן תֶּ֤בֶן וּמִסְפּוֹא֙ לַגְּמַלִּ֔ים וּמַ֙יִם֙ לִרְחֹ֣ץ רַגְלָ֔יו וְרַגְלֵ֥י הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
24.englishText: So the man entered the house, and the camels were unloaded. The camels were given straw and feed, and water was brought to bathe his feet and the feet of the entourage*entourage Lit. “participants”; trad. “men.” See Dictionary under ’ish. under him.
24.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֤a hָaִyshׁ֙ hַbַּ֔yְtָh vַyְpַtַּ֖ch hַgְּmַlִּ֑yם vַyִּtֵּ֨ן tֶּ֤bֶן vּmִsְpּvֹa֙ lַgְּmַlִּ֔yם vּmַ֙yִם֙ lִrְchֹ֣ץ rַgְlָ֔yv vְrַgְlֵ֥y hָaֲnָshִׁ֖yם aֲshֶׁ֥r aִtּֽvֹ׃

24.hebrewText: (ויישם) [וַיּוּשַׂ֤ם] לְפָנָיו֙ לֶאֱכֹ֔ל וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֹכַ֔ל עַ֥ד אִם־דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי דְּבָרָ֑י וַיֹּ֖אמֶר דַּבֵּֽר׃
24.englishText: But when food was set before him, he said, “I will not eat until I have told my tale.” He said, “Speak, then.”
24.transliteration: (vyyshם) [vַyּvּshַׂ֤ם] lְpָnָyv֙ lֶaֱkֹ֔l vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lֹ֣a aֹkַ֔l aַ֥d aִם־dִּbַּ֖rְtִּy dְּbָrָ֑y vַyֹּ֖amֶr dַּbֵּֽr׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר עֶ֥בֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם אָנֹֽכִי׃
24.englishText: “I am Abraham’s servant,” he began.
24.transliteration: vַyֹּamַ֑r aֶ֥bֶd aַbְrָhָ֖ם aָnֹֽkִy׃

24.hebrewText: וַיהֹוָ֞ה בֵּרַ֧ךְ אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֛י מְאֹ֖ד וַיִּגְדָּ֑ל וַיִּתֶּן־ל֞וֹ צֹ֤אן וּבָקָר֙ וְכֶ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב וַעֲבָדִם֙ וּשְׁפָחֹ֔ת וּגְמַלִּ֖ים וַחֲמֹרִֽים׃
24.englishText: “יהוה has greatly blessed my master, who has become rich—giving him sheep and cattle, silver and gold, male and female slaves, camels and asses.
24.transliteration: vַyhֹvָ֞h bֵּrַ֧ךְ aֶt־aֲdֹnִ֛y mְaֹ֖d vַyִּgְdָּ֑l vַyִּtֶּן־l֞vֹ tsֹ֤aן vּbָkָr֙ vְkֶ֣sֶף vְzָhָ֔b vַaֲbָdִם֙ vּshְׁpָchֹ֔t vּgְmַlִּ֖yם vַchֲmֹrִֽyם׃

24.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֡לֶד שָׂרָה֩ אֵ֨שֶׁת אֲדֹנִ֥י בֵן֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י אַחֲרֵ֖י זִקְנָתָ֑הּ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֖וֹ אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
24.englishText: And Sarah, my master’s wife, bore my master a son in her old age, and he has assigned to him everything he owns.
24.transliteration: vַtֵּ֡lֶd shָׂrָh֩ aֵ֨shֶׁt aֲdֹnִ֥y bֵן֙ lַֽadֹnִ֔y aַchֲrֵ֖y zִkְnָtָ֑hּ vַyִּtֶּן־l֖vֹ aֶt־kׇּl־aֲshֶׁr־lֽvֹ׃

24.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁבִּעֵ֥נִי אֲדֹנִ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־תִקַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ לִבְנִ֔י מִבְּנוֹת֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י יֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּאַרְצֽוֹ׃
24.englishText: Now my master made me swear, saying, ‘You shall not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites in whose land I dwell;
24.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁbִּaֵ֥nִy aֲdֹnִ֖y lֵamֹ֑r lֹa־tִkַּ֤ch aִshָּׁh֙ lִbְnִ֔y mִbְּnvֹt֙ hַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֔y aֲshֶׁ֥r aָnֹkִ֖y yֹshֵׁ֥b bְּaַrְtsֽvֹ׃

24.hebrewText: אִם־לֹ֧א אֶל־בֵּית־אָבִ֛י תֵּלֵ֖ךְ וְאֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתִּ֑י וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ אִשָּׁ֖ה לִבְנִֽי׃
24.englishText: but you shall go to my father’s house, to my kindred, and get a wife for my son.’
24.transliteration: aִם־lֹ֧a aֶl־bֵּyt־aָbִ֛y tֵּlֵ֖ךְ vְaֶl־mִshְׁpַּchְtִּ֑y vְlָkַchְtָּ֥ aִshָּׁ֖h lִbְnִֽy׃

24.hebrewText: וָאֹמַ֖ר אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֑י אֻלַ֛י לֹא־תֵלֵ֥ךְ הָאִשָּׁ֖ה אַחֲרָֽי׃
24.englishText: And I said to my master, ‘What if the woman does not follow me?’
24.transliteration: vָaֹmַ֖r aֶl־aֲdֹnִ֑y aֻlַ֛y lֹa־tֵlֵ֥ךְ hָaִshָּׁ֖h aַchֲrָֽy׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י יְהֹוָ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־הִתְהַלַּ֣כְתִּי לְפָנָ֗יו יִשְׁלַ֨ח מַלְאָכ֤וֹ אִתָּךְ֙ וְהִצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכֶּ֔ךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ אִשָּׁה֙ לִבְנִ֔י מִמִּשְׁפַּחְתִּ֖י וּמִבֵּ֥ית אָבִֽי׃
24.englishText: He replied to me, ‘יהוה, whose ways I have followed, will send a messenger with you and make your errand successful; and you will get a wife for my son from my kindred, from my father’s house.
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr aֵlָ֑y yְhֹvָ֞h aֲshֶׁr־hִtְhַlַּ֣kְtִּy lְpָnָ֗yv yִshְׁlַ֨ch mַlְaָk֤vֹ aִtָּךְ֙ vְhִtsְlִ֣ychַ dַּrְkֶּ֔ךָ vְlָkַchְtָּ֤ aִshָּׁh֙ lִbְnִ֔y mִmִּshְׁpַּchְtִּ֖y vּmִbֵּ֥yt aָbִֽy׃

24.hebrewText: אָ֤ז תִּנָּקֶה֙ מֵאָ֣לָתִ֔י כִּ֥י תָב֖וֹא אֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתִּ֑י וְאִם־לֹ֤א יִתְּנוּ֙ לָ֔ךְ וְהָיִ֥יתָ נָקִ֖י מֵאָלָתִֽי׃
24.englishText: Thus only shall you be freed from my adjuration: if, when you come to my kindred, they refuse you—only then shall you be freed from my adjuration.’
24.transliteration: aָ֤z tִּnָּkֶh֙ mֵaָ֣lָtִ֔y kִּ֥y tָb֖vֹa aֶl־mִshְׁpַּchְtִּ֑y vְaִם־lֹ֤a yִtְּnvּ֙ lָ֔ךְ vְhָyִ֥ytָ nָkִ֖y mֵaָlָtִֽy׃

24.hebrewText: וָאָבֹ֥א הַיּ֖וֹם אֶל־הָעָ֑יִן וָאֹמַ֗ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם אִם־יֶשְׁךָ־נָּא֙ מַצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכִּ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י הֹלֵ֥ךְ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
24.englishText: “I came today to the spring, and I said: ‘O יהוה, God of my master Abraham’s [house], if You would indeed grant success to the errand on which I am engaged!
24.transliteration: vָaָbֹ֥a hַyּ֖vֹם aֶl־hָaָ֑yִן vָaֹmַ֗r yְhֹvָh֙ aֱlֹhֵy֙ aֲdֹnִ֣y aַbְrָhָ֔ם aִם־yֶshְׁךָ־nָּa֙ mַtsְlִ֣ychַ dַּrְkִּ֔y aֲshֶׁ֥r aָnֹkִ֖y hֹlֵ֥ךְ aָlֶֽyhָ׃

24.hebrewText: הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י נִצָּ֖ב עַל־עֵ֣ין הַמָּ֑יִם וְהָיָ֤ה הָֽעַלְמָה֙ הַיֹּצֵ֣את לִשְׁאֹ֔ב וְאָמַרְתִּ֣י אֵלֶ֔יהָ הַשְׁקִֽינִי־נָ֥א מְעַט־מַ֖יִם מִכַּדֵּֽךְ׃
24.englishText: As I stand by the spring of water, let the young woman who comes out to draw and to whom I say, “Please, let me drink a little water from your jar,”
24.transliteration: hִnֵּ֛h aָnֹkִ֥y nִtsָּ֖b aַl־aֵ֣yן hַmָּ֑yִם vְhָyָ֤h hָֽaַlְmָh֙ hַyֹּtsֵ֣at lִshְׁaֹ֔b vְaָmַrְtִּ֣y aֵlֶ֔yhָ hַshְׁkִֽynִy־nָ֥a mְaַt־mַ֖yִם mִkַּdֵּֽךְ׃

24.hebrewText: וְאָמְרָ֤ה אֵלַי֙ גַּם־אַתָּ֣ה שְׁתֵ֔ה וְגַ֥ם לִגְמַלֶּ֖יךָ אֶשְׁאָ֑ב הִ֣וא הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הֹכִ֥יחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה לְבֶן־אֲדֹנִֽי׃
24.englishText: and who answers, “You may drink, and I will also draw for your camels”—let her be the wife whom יהוה has decreed for my master’s son.’
24.transliteration: vְaָmְrָ֤h aֵlַy֙ gַּם־aַtָּ֣h shְׁtֵ֔h vְgַ֥ם lִgְmַlֶּ֖yךָ aֶshְׁaָ֑b hִ֣va hָֽaִshָּׁ֔h aֲshֶׁr־hֹkִ֥ychַ yְhֹvָ֖h lְbֶן־aֲdֹnִֽy׃

24.hebrewText: אֲנִי֩ טֶ֨רֶם אֲכַלֶּ֜ה לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־לִבִּ֗י וְהִנֵּ֨ה רִבְקָ֤ה יֹצֵאת֙ וְכַדָּ֣הּ עַל־שִׁכְמָ֔הּ וַתֵּ֥רֶד הָעַ֖יְנָה וַתִּשְׁאָ֑ב וָאֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יהָ הַשְׁקִ֥ינִי נָֽא׃
24.englishText: I had scarcely finished praying in my heart, when Rebekah came out with her jar on her shoulder, and went down to the spring and drew. And I said to her, ‘Please give me a drink.’
24.transliteration: aֲnִy֩ tֶ֨rֶם aֲkַlֶּ֜h lְdַbֵּ֣r aֶl־lִbִּ֗y vְhִnֵּ֨h rִbְkָ֤h yֹtsֵat֙ vְkַdָּ֣hּ aַl־shִׁkְmָ֔hּ vַtֵּ֥rֶd hָaַ֖yְnָh vַtִּshְׁaָ֑b vָaֹmַ֥r aֵlֶ֖yhָ hַshְׁkִ֥ynִy nָֽa׃

24.hebrewText: וַתְּמַהֵ֗ר וַתּ֤וֹרֶד כַּדָּהּ֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יהָ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁתֵ֔ה וְגַם־גְּמַלֶּ֖יךָ אַשְׁקֶ֑ה וָאֵ֕שְׁתְּ וְגַ֥ם הַגְּמַלִּ֖ים הִשְׁקָֽתָה׃
24.englishText: She quickly lowered her jar and said, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels.’ So I drank, and she also watered the camels.
24.transliteration: vַtְּmַhֵ֗r vַtּ֤vֹrֶd kַּdָּhּ֙ mֵֽaָlֶ֔yhָ vַtֹּ֣amֶr shְׁtֵ֔h vְgַם־gְּmַlֶּ֖yךָ aַshְׁkֶ֑h vָaֵ֕shְׁtְּ vְgַ֥ם hַgְּmַlִּ֖yם hִshְׁkָֽtָh׃

24.hebrewText: וָאֶשְׁאַ֣ל אֹתָ֗הּ וָאֹמַר֮ בַּת־מִ֣י אַתְּ֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר בַּת־בְּתוּאֵל֙ בֶּן־נָח֔וֹר אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָֽלְדָה־לּ֖וֹ מִלְכָּ֑ה וָאָשִׂ֤ם הַנֶּ֙זֶם֙ עַל־אַפָּ֔הּ וְהַצְּמִידִ֖ים עַל־יָדֶֽיהָ׃
24.englishText: I inquired of her, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, son of Nahor, whom Milcah bore to him.’ And I put the ring on her nose and the bands on her arms.
24.transliteration: vָaֶshְׁaַ֣l aֹtָ֗hּ vָaֹmַr֮ bַּt־mִ֣y aַtְּ֒ vַtֹּ֗amֶr bַּt־bְּtvּaֵl֙ bֶּן־nָch֔vֹr aֲshֶׁ֥r yָֽlְdָh־lּ֖vֹ mִlְkָּ֑h vָaָshִׂ֤ם hַnֶּ֙zֶם֙ aַl־aַpָּ֔hּ vְhַtsְּmִydִ֖yם aַl־yָdֶֽyhָ׃

24.hebrewText: וָאֶקֹּ֥ד וָֽאֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה לַיהֹוָ֑ה וָאֲבָרֵ֗ךְ אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִנְחַ֙נִי֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אֱמֶ֔ת לָקַ֛חַת אֶת־בַּת־אֲחִ֥י אֲדֹנִ֖י לִבְנֽוֹ׃
24.englishText: Then I bowed low in homage to יהוה and blessed יהוה, the God of my master Abraham’s [house], who led me on the right way to get the daughter of my master’s brother for his son.
24.transliteration: vָaֶkֹּ֥d vָֽaֶshְׁtַּchֲvֶ֖h lַyhֹvָ֑h vָaֲbָrֵ֗ךְ aֶt־yְhֹvָh֙ aֱlֹhֵy֙ aֲdֹnִ֣y aַbְrָhָ֔ם aֲshֶׁ֤r hִnְchַ֙nִy֙ bְּdֶ֣rֶךְ aֱmֶ֔t lָkַ֛chַt aֶt־bַּt־aֲchִ֥y aֲdֹnִ֖y lִbְnֽvֹ׃

24.hebrewText: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה אִם־יֶשְׁכֶ֨ם עֹשִׂ֜ים חֶ֧סֶד וֶֽאֱמֶ֛ת אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֖י הַגִּ֣ידוּ לִ֑י וְאִם־לֹ֕א הַגִּ֣ידוּ לִ֔י וְאֶפְנֶ֥ה עַל־יָמִ֖ין א֥וֹ עַל־שְׂמֹֽאל׃
24.englishText: And now, if you mean to treat my master with true kindness, tell me; and if not, tell me also, that I may turn right or left.”
24.transliteration: vְ֠aַtָּ֠h aִם־yֶshְׁkֶ֨ם aֹshִׂ֜yם chֶ֧sֶd vֶֽaֱmֶ֛t aֶt־aֲdֹnִ֖y hַgִּ֣ydvּ lִ֑y vְaִם־lֹ֕a hַgִּ֣ydvּ lִ֔y vְaֶpְnֶ֥h aַl־yָmִ֖yן a֥vֹ aַl־shְׂmֹֽal׃

24.hebrewText: וַיַּ֨עַן לָבָ֤ן וּבְתוּאֵל֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵיְהֹוָ֖ה יָצָ֣א הַדָּבָ֑ר לֹ֥א נוּכַ֛ל דַּבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ רַ֥ע אוֹ־טֽוֹב׃
24.englishText: Then Laban and Bethuel answered, “The matter was decreed by יהוה; we cannot speak to you bad or good.
24.transliteration: vַyַּ֨aַן lָbָ֤ן vּbְtvּaֵl֙ vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ mֵyְhֹvָ֖h yָtsָ֣a hַdָּbָ֑r lֹ֥a nvּkַ֛l dַּbֵּ֥r aֵlֶ֖yךָ rַ֥a avֹ־tֽvֹb׃

24.hebrewText: הִנֵּֽה־רִבְקָ֥ה לְפָנֶ֖יךָ קַ֣ח וָלֵ֑ךְ וּתְהִ֤י אִשָּׁה֙ לְבֶן־אֲדֹנֶ֔יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
24.englishText: Here is Rebekah before you; take her and go, and let her be a wife to your master’s son, as יהוה has spoken.”
24.transliteration: hִnֵּֽh־rִbְkָ֥h lְpָnֶ֖yךָ kַ֣ch vָlֵ֑ךְ vּtְhִ֤y aִshָּׁh֙ lְbֶן־aֲdֹnֶ֔yךָ kַּaֲshֶׁ֖r dִּbֶּ֥r yְhֹvָֽh׃

24.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֛ע עֶ֥בֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־דִּבְרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ אַ֖רְצָה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
24.englishText: When Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed low to the ground before יהוה.
24.transliteration: vַyְhִ֕y kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r shָׁmַ֛a aֶ֥bֶd aַbְrָhָ֖ם aֶt־dִּbְrֵyhֶ֑ם vַyִּshְׁtַּ֥chvּ aַ֖rְtsָh lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃

24.hebrewText: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א הָעֶ֜בֶד כְּלֵי־כֶ֨סֶף וּכְלֵ֤י זָהָב֙ וּבְגָדִ֔ים וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לְרִבְקָ֑ה וּמִ֨גְדָּנֹ֔ת נָתַ֥ן לְאָחִ֖יהָ וּלְאִמָּֽהּ׃
24.englishText: The servant brought out objects of silver and gold, and garments, and gave them to Rebekah; and he gave presents to her brother and her mother.
24.transliteration: vַyּvֹtsֵ֨a hָaֶ֜bֶd kְּlֵy־kֶ֨sֶף vּkְlֵ֤y zָhָb֙ vּbְgָdִ֔yם vַyִּtֵּ֖ן lְrִbְkָ֑h vּmִ֨gְdָּnֹ֔t nָtַ֥ן lְaָchִ֖yhָ vּlְaִmָּֽhּ׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּאכְל֣וּ וַיִּשְׁתּ֗וּ ה֛וּא וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־עִמּ֖וֹ וַיָּלִ֑ינוּ וַיָּק֣וּמוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שַׁלְּחֻ֥נִי לַֽאדֹנִֽי׃
24.englishText: Then he and the entourage under him ate and drank, and they spent the night. When they arose next morning, he said, “Give me leave to go to my master.”
24.transliteration: vַyֹּakְl֣vּ vַyִּshְׁtּ֗vּ h֛vּa vְhָaֲnָshִׁ֥yם aֲshֶׁr־aִmּ֖vֹ vַyָּlִ֑ynvּ vַyָּk֣vּmvּ bַbֹּ֔kֶr vַyֹּ֖amֶr shַׁlְּchֻ֥nִy lַֽadֹnִֽy׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אָחִ֙יהָ֙ וְאִמָּ֔הּ תֵּשֵׁ֨ב הַנַּעֲרָ֥ אִתָּ֛נוּ יָמִ֖ים א֣וֹ עָשׂ֑וֹר אַחַ֖ר תֵּלֵֽךְ׃
24.englishText: But her brother and her mother said, “Let the maiden remain with us some ten days;*some ten days Lit. “days or ten.” then you may go.”
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aָchִ֙yhָ֙ vְaִmָּ֔hּ tֵּshֵׁ֨b hַnַּaֲrָ֥ aִtָּ֛nvּ yָmִ֖yם a֣vֹ aָshׂ֑vֹr aַchַ֖r tֵּlֵֽךְ׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אַל־תְּאַחֲר֣וּ אֹתִ֔י וַֽיהֹוָ֖ה הִצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְ��ִּ֑י שַׁלְּח֕וּנִי וְאֵלְכָ֖ה לַֽאדֹנִֽי׃
24.englishText: He said to them, “Do not delay me, now that יהוה has made my errand successful. Give me leave that I may go to my master.”
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֲlֵhֶם֙ aַl־tְּaַchֲr֣vּ aֹtִ֔y vַֽyhֹvָ֖h hִtsְlִ֣ychַ dַּrְ��ִּ֑y shַׁlְּch֕vּnִy vְaֵlְkָ֖h lַֽadֹnִֽy׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ נִקְרָ֣א לַֽנַּעֲרָ֑ וְנִשְׁאֲלָ֖ה אֶת־פִּֽיהָ׃
24.englishText: And they said, “Let us call the girl and ask for her reply.”
24.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֖vּ nִkְrָ֣a lַֽnַּaֲrָ֑ vְnִshְׁaֲlָ֖h aֶt־pִּֽyhָ׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרְא֤וּ לְרִבְקָה֙ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יהָ הֲתֵלְכִ֖י עִם־הָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וַתֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלֵֽךְ׃
24.englishText: They called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man*man See note at v. 21.?” And she said, “I will.”
24.transliteration: vַyִּkְrְa֤vּ lְrִbְkָh֙ vַyֹּamְr֣vּ aֵlֶ֔yhָ hֲtֵlְkִ֖y aִם־hָaִ֣yshׁ hַzֶּ֑h vַtֹּ֖amֶr aֵlֵֽךְ׃

24.hebrewText: וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֛וּ אֶת־רִבְקָ֥ה אֲחֹתָ֖ם וְאֶת־מֵנִקְתָּ֑הּ וְאֶת־עֶ֥בֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם וְאֶת־אֲנָשָֽׁיו׃
24.englishText: So they sent off their sister Rebekah and her nurse along with Abraham’s servant and his entourage.
24.transliteration: vַֽyְshַׁlְּch֛vּ aֶt־rִbְkָ֥h aֲchֹtָ֖ם vְaֶt־mֵnִkְtָּ֑hּ vְaֶt־aֶ֥bֶd aַbְrָhָ֖ם vְaֶt־aֲnָshָֽׁyv׃

24.hebrewText: וַיְבָרְכ֤וּ אֶת־רִבְקָה֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ לָ֔הּ אֲחֹתֵ֕נוּ אַ֥תְּ הֲיִ֖י לְאַלְפֵ֣י רְבָבָ֑ה וְיִירַ֣שׁ זַרְעֵ֔ךְ אֵ֖ת שַׁ֥עַר שֹׂנְאָֽיו׃
24.englishText:
And they blessed Rebekah and said to her,
“O sister!
May you grow
Into thousands of myriads;
May your descendants seize
The gates of their foes.”
24.transliteration: vַyְbָrְk֤vּ aֶt־rִbְkָh֙ vַyֹּ֣amְrvּ lָ֔hּ aֲchֹtֵ֕nvּ aַ֥tְּ hֲyִ֖y lְaַlְpֵ֣y rְbָbָ֑h vְyִyrַ֣shׁ zַrְaֵ֔ךְ aֵ֖t shַׁ֥aַr shֹׂnְaָֽyv׃

24.hebrewText: וַתָּ֨קׇם רִבְקָ֜ה וְנַעֲרֹתֶ֗יהָ וַתִּרְכַּ֙בְנָה֙ עַל־הַגְּמַלִּ֔ים וַתֵּלַ֖כְנָה אַחֲרֵ֣י הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיִּקַּ֥ח הָעֶ֛בֶד אֶת־רִבְקָ֖ה וַיֵּלַֽךְ׃
24.englishText: Then Rebekah and her maids arose, mounted the camels, and followed the man. So the servant took Rebekah and went his way.
24.transliteration: vַtָּ֨kׇם rִbְkָ֜h vְnַaֲrֹtֶ֗yhָ vַtִּrְkַּ֙bְnָh֙ aַl־hַgְּmַlִּ֔yם vַtֵּlַ֖kְnָh aַchֲrֵ֣y hָaִ֑yshׁ vַyִּkַּ֥ch hָaֶ֛bֶd aֶt־rִbְkָ֖h vַyֵּlַֽךְ׃

24.hebrewText: וְיִצְחָק֙ בָּ֣א מִבּ֔וֹא בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִ֑י וְה֥וּא יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּאֶ֥רֶץ הַנֶּֽגֶב׃
24.englishText: Isaac had just come back from the vicinity of Beer-lahai-roi, for he was settled in the region of the Negeb.
24.transliteration: vְyִtsְchָk֙ bָּ֣a mִbּ֔vֹa bְּaֵ֥r lַchַ֖y rֹaִ֑y vְh֥vּa yvֹshֵׁ֖b bְּaֶ֥rֶץ hַnֶּֽgֶb׃

24.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֥א יִצְחָ֛ק לָשׂ֥וּחַ בַּשָּׂדֶ֖ה לִפְנ֣וֹת עָ֑רֶב וַיִּשָּׂ֤א עֵינָיו֙ וַיַּ֔רְא וְהִנֵּ֥ה גְמַלִּ֖ים בָּאִֽים׃
24.englishText: And Isaac went out walking*walking Meaning of Heb. lasuaḥ uncertain; others “to meditate.” in the field toward evening and, looking up, he saw camels approaching.
24.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֥a yִtsְchָ֛k lָshׂ֥vּchַ bַּshָּׂdֶ֖h lִpְn֣vֹt aָ֑rֶb vַyִּshָּׂ֤a aֵynָyv֙ vַyַּ֔rְa vְhִnֵּ֥h gְmַlִּ֖yם bָּaִֽyם׃

24.hebrewText: וַתִּשָּׂ֤א רִבְקָה֙ אֶת־עֵינֶ֔יהָ וַתֵּ֖רֶא אֶת־יִצְחָ֑ק וַתִּפֹּ֖ל מֵעַ֥ל הַגָּמָֽל׃
24.englishText: Raising her eyes, Rebekah saw Isaac. She alighted from the camel
24.transliteration: vַtִּshָּׂ֤a rִbְkָh֙ aֶt־aֵynֶ֔yhָ vַtֵּ֖rֶa aֶt־yִtsְchָ֑k vַtִּpֹּ֖l mֵaַ֥l hַgָּmָֽl׃

24.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־הָעֶ֗בֶד מִֽי־הָאִ֤ישׁ הַלָּזֶה֙ הַהֹלֵ֤ךְ בַּשָּׂדֶה֙ לִקְרָאתֵ֔נוּ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הָעֶ֖בֶד ה֣וּא אֲדֹנִ֑י וַתִּקַּ֥ח הַצָּעִ֖יף וַתִּתְכָּֽס׃
24.englishText: and said to the servant, “Who is that man walking in the field toward us?” And the servant said, “That is my master.” So she took her veil and covered herself.
24.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr aֶl־hָaֶ֗bֶd mִֽy־hָaִ֤yshׁ hַlָּzֶh֙ hַhֹlֵ֤ךְ bַּshָּׂdֶh֙ lִkְrָatֵ֔nvּ vַyֹּ֥amֶr hָaֶ֖bֶd h֣vּa aֲdֹnִ֑y vַtִּkַּ֥ch hַtsָּaִ֖yף vַtִּtְkָּֽs׃

24.hebrewText: וַיְסַפֵּ֥ר הָעֶ֖בֶד לְיִצְחָ֑ק אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
24.englishText: The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.
24.transliteration: vַyְsַpֵּ֥r hָaֶ֖bֶd lְyִtsְchָ֑k aֵ֥t kׇּl־hַdְּbָrִ֖yם aֲshֶׁ֥r aָshָֽׂh׃

24.hebrewText: וַיְבִאֶ֣הָ יִצְחָ֗ק הָאֹ֙הֱלָה֙ שָׂרָ֣ה אִמּ֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֧ח אֶת־רִבְקָ֛ה וַתְּהִי־ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֖ה וַיֶּאֱהָבֶ֑הָ וַיִּנָּחֵ֥ם יִצְחָ֖ק אַחֲרֵ֥י אִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
24.englishText: Isaac then brought her into the tent of his mother Sarah, and he took Rebekah as his wife. Isaac loved her, and thus found comfort after his mother’s death.
24.transliteration: vַyְbִaֶ֣hָ yִtsְchָ֗k hָaֹ֙hֱlָh֙ shָׂrָ֣h aִmּ֔vֹ vַyִּkַּ֧ch aֶt־rִbְkָ֛h vַtְּhִy־l֥vֹ lְaִshָּׁ֖h vַyֶּaֱhָbֶ֑hָ vַyִּnָּchֵ֥ם yִtsְchָ֖k aַchֲrֵ֥y aִmּֽvֹ׃ {p}

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֧סֶף אַבְרָהָ֛ם וַיִּקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה וּשְׁמָ֥הּ קְטוּרָֽה׃
25.englishText: Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah.
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֧sֶף aַbְrָhָ֛ם vַyִּkַּ֥ch aִshָּׁ֖h vּshְׁmָ֥hּ kְtvּrָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֗וֹ אֶת־זִמְרָן֙ וְאֶת־יׇקְשָׁ֔ן וְאֶת־מְדָ֖ן וְאֶת־מִדְיָ֑ן וְאֶת־יִשְׁבָּ֖ק וְאֶת־שֽׁוּחַ׃
25.englishText: She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
25.transliteration: vַtֵּ֣lֶd l֗vֹ aֶt־zִmְrָן֙ vְaֶt־yׇkְshָׁ֔ן vְaֶt־mְdָ֖ן vְaֶt־mִdְyָ֑ן vְaֶt־yִshְׁbָּ֖k vְaֶt־shֽׁvּchַ׃

25.hebrewText: וְיׇקְשָׁ֣ן יָלַ֔ד אֶת־שְׁבָ֖א וְאֶת־דְּדָ֑ן וּבְנֵ֣י דְדָ֔ן הָי֛וּ אַשּׁוּרִ֥ם וּלְטוּשִׁ֖ם וּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
25.englishText: Jokshan begot Sheba and Dedan. The descendants of Dedan were the Asshurim, the Letushim, and the Leummim.
25.transliteration: vְyׇkְshָׁ֣ן yָlַ֔d aֶt־shְׁbָ֖a vְaֶt־dְּdָ֑ן vּbְnֵ֣y dְdָ֔ן hָy֛vּ aַshּׁvּrִ֥ם vּlְtvּshִׁ֖ם vּlְaֻmִּֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן עֵיפָ֤ה וָעֵ֙פֶר֙ וַחֲנֹ֔ךְ וַאֲבִידָ֖ע וְאֶלְדָּעָ֑ה כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י קְטוּרָֽה׃
25.englishText: The descendants of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Enoch,*Enoch Or “Hanoch.” Abida, and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.
25.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֣y mִdְyָ֗ן aֵypָ֤h vָaֵ֙pֶr֙ vַchֲnֹ֔ךְ vַaֲbִydָ֖a vְaֶlְdָּaָ֑h kׇּl־aֵ֖lֶּh bְּnֵ֥y kְtvּrָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּתֵּ֧ן אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ לְיִצְחָֽק׃
25.englishText: Abraham willed all that he owned to Isaac;
25.transliteration: vַyִּtֵּ֧ן aַbְrָhָ֛ם aֶt־kׇּl־aֲshֶׁr־l֖vֹ lְyִtsְchָֽk׃

25.hebrewText: וְלִבְנֵ֤י הַפִּֽילַגְשִׁים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם נָתַ֥ן אַבְרָהָ֖ם מַתָּנֹ֑ת וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֞ם מֵעַ֨ל יִצְחָ֤ק בְּנוֹ֙ בְּעוֹדֶ֣נּוּ חַ֔י קֵ֖דְמָה אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ קֶֽדֶם׃
25.englishText: but to Abraham’s sons by concubines Abraham gave gifts while he was still living, and he sent them away from his son Isaac eastward, to the land of the East.
25.transliteration: vְlִbְnֵ֤y hַpִּֽylַgְshִׁyם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r lְaַbְrָhָ֔ם nָtַ֥ן aַbְrָhָ֖ם mַtָּnֹ֑t vַֽyְshַׁlְּchֵ֞ם mֵaַ֨l yִtsְchָ֤k bְּnvֹ֙ bְּavֹdֶ֣nּvּ chַ֔y kֵ֖dְmָh aֶl־aֶ֥rֶץ kֶֽdֶם׃

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֗לֶּה יְמֵ֛י שְׁנֵֽי־חַיֵּ֥י אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־חָ֑י מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֛ה וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְחָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
25.englishText: This was the total span of Abraham’s life: one hundred and seventy-five years.
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֗lֶּh yְmֵ֛y shְׁnֵֽy־chַyֵּ֥y aַbְrָhָ֖ם aֲshֶׁr־chָ֑y mְaַ֥t shָׁnָ֛h vְshִׁbְaִ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h vְchָmֵ֥shׁ shָׁnִֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּגְוַ֨ע וַיָּ֧מׇת אַבְרָהָ֛ם בְּשֵׂיבָ֥ה טוֹבָ֖ה זָקֵ֣ן וְשָׂבֵ֑עַ וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
25.englishText: And Abraham breathed his last, dying at a good ripe age, old and contented; and he was gathered to his kin.*kin (So NJPS.) See the Dictionary under “predecessors.”
25.transliteration: vַyִּgְvַ֨a vַyָּ֧mׇt aַbְrָhָ֛ם bְּshֵׂybָ֥h tvֹbָ֖h zָkֵ֣ן vְshָׂbֵ֑aַ vַyֵּaָ֖sֶף aֶl־aַmָּֽyv׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּקְבְּר֨וּ אֹת֜וֹ יִצְחָ֤ק וְיִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ בָּנָ֔יו אֶל־מְעָרַ֖ת הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֑ה אֶל־שְׂדֵ֞ה עֶפְרֹ֤ן בֶּן־צֹ֙חַר֙ הַֽחִתִּ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵֽא׃
25.englishText: His sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, facing Mamre,
25.transliteration: vַyִּkְbְּr֨vּ aֹt֜vֹ yִtsְchָ֤k vְyִshְׁmָaֵal֙ bָּnָ֔yv aֶl־mְaָrַ֖t hַmַּkְpֵּlָ֑h aֶl־shְׂdֵ֞h aֶpְrֹ֤ן bֶּן־tsֹ֙chַr֙ hַֽchִtִּ֔y aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־pְּnֵ֥y mַmְrֵֽa׃

25.hebrewText: הַשָּׂדֶ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־קָנָ֥ה אַבְרָהָ֖ם מֵאֵ֣ת בְּנֵי־חֵ֑ת שָׁ֛מָּה קֻבַּ֥ר אַבְרָהָ֖ם וְשָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
25.englishText: the field that Abraham had bought from the Hittites; there Abraham was buried, and Sarah his wife.
25.transliteration: hַshָּׂdֶ֛h aֲshֶׁr־kָnָ֥h aַbְrָhָ֖ם mֵaֵ֣t bְּnֵy־chֵ֑t shָׁ֛mָּh kֻbַּ֥r aַbְrָhָ֖ם vְshָׂrָ֥h aִshְׁtּֽvֹ׃

25.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵי֙ מ֣וֹת אַבְרָהָ֔ם וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב יִצְחָ֔ק עִם־בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִֽי׃ {פ}
25.englishText: After the death of Abraham, God blessed his son Isaac. And Isaac settled near Beer-lahai-roi.
25.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y aַchֲrֵy֙ m֣vֹt aַbְrָhָ֔ם vַyְbָ֥rֶךְ aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־yִtsְchָ֣k bְּn֑vֹ vַyֵּ֣shֶׁb yִtsְchָ֔k aִם־bְּaֵ֥r lַchַ֖y rֹaִֽy׃ {p}

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תֹּלְדֹ֥ת יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָלְדָ֜ה הָגָ֧ר הַמִּצְרִ֛ית שִׁפְחַ֥ת שָׂרָ֖ה לְאַבְרָהָֽם׃
25.englishText: This is the line of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s slave, bore to Abraham.
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֛lֶּh tֹּlְdֹ֥t yִshְׁmָaֵ֖al bֶּן־aַbְrָhָ֑ם aֲshֶׁ֨r yָlְdָ֜h hָgָ֧r hַmִּtsְrִ֛yt shִׁpְchַ֥t shָׂrָ֖h lְaַbְrָhָֽם׃

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל בִּשְׁמֹתָ֖ם לְתוֹלְדֹתָ֑ם בְּכֹ֤ר יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ נְבָיֹ֔ת וְקֵדָ֥ר וְאַדְבְּאֵ֖ל וּמִבְשָֽׂם׃
25.englishText: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, in the order of their birth: Nebaioth, the first-born of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֗lֶּh shְׁmvֹt֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׁmָaֵ֔al bִּshְׁmֹtָ֖ם lְtvֹlְdֹtָ֑ם bְּkֹ֤r yִshְׁmָaֵal֙ nְbָyֹ֔t vְkֵdָ֥r vְaַdְbְּaֵ֖l vּmִbְshָֽׂם׃

25.hebrewText: וּמִשְׁמָ֥ע וְדוּמָ֖ה וּמַשָּֽׂא׃
25.englishText: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,
25.transliteration: vּmִshְׁmָ֥a vְdvּmָ֖h vּmַshָּֽׂa׃

25.hebrewText: חֲדַ֣ד וְתֵימָ֔א יְט֥וּר נָפִ֖ישׁ וָקֵֽדְמָה׃
25.englishText: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedmah.
25.transliteration: chֲdַ֣d vְtֵymָ֔a yְt֥vּr nָpִ֖yshׁ vָkֵֽdְmָh׃

25.hebrewText: אֵ֣לֶּה הֵ֞ם בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ וְאֵ֣לֶּה שְׁמֹתָ֔ם בְּחַצְרֵיהֶ֖ם וּבְטִֽירֹתָ֑ם שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר נְשִׂיאִ֖ם לְאֻמֹּתָֽם׃
25.englishText: These are the sons of Ishmael and these are their names by their villages and by their encampments: twelve chieftains of as many tribes.—
25.transliteration: aֵ֣lֶּh hֵ֞ם bְּnֵ֤y yִshְׁmָaֵal֙ vְaֵ֣lֶּh shְׁmֹtָ֔ם bְּchַtsְrֵyhֶ֖ם vּbְtִֽyrֹtָ֑ם shְׁnֵyם־aָshָׂ֥r nְshִׂyaִ֖ם lְaֻmֹּtָֽם׃

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֛ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיִּגְוַ֣ע וַיָּ֔מׇת וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
25.englishText: These were the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred and thirty-seven years; then he breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his kin.—
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֗lֶּh shְׁnֵy֙ chַyֵּ֣y yִshְׁmָaֵ֔al mְaַ֥t shָׁnָ֛h vּshְׁlֹshִׁ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h vְshֶׁ֣bַa shָׁnִ֑yם vַyִּgְvַ֣a vַyָּ֔mׇt vַyֵּaָ֖sֶף aֶl־aַmָּֽyv׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁכְּנ֨וּ מֵֽחֲוִילָ֜ה עַד־שׁ֗וּר אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י מִצְרַ֔יִם בֹּאֲכָ֖ה אַשּׁ֑וּרָה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־אֶחָ֖יו נָפָֽל׃ {פ}
25.englishText: They dwelt from Havilah, by Shur, which is close to Egypt, all the way to Asshur; they camped alongside all their kin.
25.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁkְּn֨vּ mֵֽchֲvִylָ֜h aַd־shׁ֗vּr aֲshֶׁr֙ aַl־pְּnֵ֣y mִtsְrַ֔yִם bֹּaֲkָ֖h aַshּׁ֑vּrָh aַl־pְּnֵ֥y kׇl־aֶchָ֖yv nָpָֽl׃ {p}

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֥ת יִצְחָ֖ק בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֑ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־יִצְחָֽק׃
25.englishText: This is the story of Isaac, son of Abraham. Abraham begot Isaac.
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֛lֶּh tּvֹlְdֹ֥t yִtsְchָ֖k bֶּן־aַbְrָhָ֑ם aַbְrָhָ֖ם hvֹlִ֥yd aֶt־yִtsְchָֽk׃

25.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֤י יִצְחָק֙ בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּקַחְתּ֣וֹ אֶת־רִבְקָ֗ה בַּת־בְּתוּאֵל֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּ֔י מִפַּדַּ֖ן אֲרָ֑ם אֲח֛וֹת לָבָ֥ן הָאֲרַמִּ֖י ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
25.englishText: Isaac was forty years old when he took to wife Rebekah, daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-aram, sister of Laban the Aramean.
25.transliteration: vַyְhִ֤y yִtsְchָk֙ bֶּן־aַrְbָּaִ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h bְּkַchְtּ֣vֹ aֶt־rִbְkָ֗h bַּt־bְּtvּaֵl֙ hָֽaֲrַmִּ֔y mִpַּdַּ֖ן aֲrָ֑ם aֲch֛vֹt lָbָ֥ן hָaֲrַmִּ֖y l֥vֹ lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֶּעְתַּ֨ר יִצְחָ֤ק לַֽיהֹוָה֙ לְנֹ֣כַח אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י עֲקָרָ֖ה הִ֑וא וַיֵּעָ֤תֶר לוֹ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתַּ֖הַר רִבְקָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
25.englishText: Isaac pleaded with יהוה on behalf of his wife, because she was barren; and יהוה responded to his plea, and his wife Rebekah conceived.
25.transliteration: vַyֶּaְtַּ֨r yִtsְchָ֤k lַֽyhֹvָh֙ lְnֹ֣kַch aִshְׁtּ֔vֹ kִּ֥y aֲkָrָ֖h hִ֑va vַyֵּaָ֤tֶr lvֹ֙ yְhֹvָ֔h vַtַּ֖hַr rִbְkָ֥h aִshְׁtּֽvֹ׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּתְרֹֽצְצ֤וּ הַבָּנִים֙ בְּקִרְבָּ֔הּ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אִם־כֵּ֔ן לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה אָנֹ֑כִי וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ לִדְרֹ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
25.englishText: But the children struggled in her womb, and she said, “If so, why do I exist?”*why do I exist? Meaning of Heb. uncertain. She went to inquire of יהוה,
25.transliteration: vַyִּtְrֹֽtsְts֤vּ hַbָּnִyם֙ bְּkִrְbָּ֔hּ vַtֹּ֣amֶr aִם־kֵּ֔ן lָ֥mָּh zֶּ֖h aָnֹ֑kִy vַtֵּ֖lֶךְ lִdְrֹ֥shׁ aֶt־yְhֹvָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה לָ֗הּ שְׁנֵ֤י (גיים) [גוֹיִם֙] בְּבִטְנֵ֔ךְ וּשְׁנֵ֣י לְאֻמִּ֔ים מִמֵּעַ֖יִךְ יִפָּרֵ֑דוּ וּלְאֹם֙ מִלְאֹ֣ם יֶֽאֱמָ֔ץ וְרַ֖ב יַעֲבֹ֥ד צָעִֽיר׃
25.englishText:
and יהוה answered her,
“Two nations are in your womb,
Two separate peoples shall issue from your body;
One people shall be mightier than the other,
And the older shall serve the younger.”
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h lָ֗hּ shְׁnֵ֤y (gyyם) [gvֹyִם֙] bְּbִtְnֵ֔ךְ vּshְׁnֵ֣y lְaֻmִּ֔yם mִmֵּaַ֖yִךְ yִpָּrֵ֑dvּ vּlְaֹם֙ mִlְaֹ֣ם yֶֽaֱmָ֔ץ vְrַ֖b yַaֲbֹ֥d tsָaִֽyr׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּמְלְא֥וּ יָמֶ֖יהָ לָלֶ֑דֶת וְהִנֵּ֥ה תוֹמִ֖ם בְּבִטְנָֽהּ׃
25.englishText: When her time to give birth was at hand, there were twins in her womb.
25.transliteration: vַyִּmְlְa֥vּ yָmֶ֖yhָ lָlֶ֑dֶt vְhִnֵּ֥h tvֹmִ֖ם bְּbִtְnָֽhּ׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֤א הָרִאשׁוֹן֙ אַדְמוֹנִ֔י כֻּלּ֖וֹ כְּאַדֶּ֣רֶת שֵׂעָ֑ר וַיִּקְרְא֥וּ שְׁמ֖וֹ עֵשָֽׂו׃
25.englishText: The first one emerged red, like a hairy mantle all over; so they named him Esau.*Esau Synonym of “Seir,” play on Heb. se‘ar “hair.”
25.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֤a hָrִashׁvֹן֙ aַdְmvֹnִ֔y kֻּlּ֖vֹ kְּaַdֶּ֣rֶt shֵׂaָ֑r vַyִּkְrְa֥vּ shְׁm֖vֹ aֵshָֽׂv׃

25.hebrewText: וְאַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֞ן יָצָ֣א אָחִ֗יו וְיָד֤וֹ אֹחֶ֙זֶת֙ בַּעֲקֵ֣ב עֵשָׂ֔ו וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיִצְחָ֛ק בֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בְּלֶ֥דֶת אֹתָֽם׃
25.englishText: Then his brother emerged, holding on to the heel of Esau; so they named him Jacob.*Jacob Play on Heb. ‘aqeb “heel.” Isaac was sixty years old when they were born.
25.transliteration: vְaַֽchֲrֵy־kֵ֞ן yָtsָ֣a aָchִ֗yv vְyָd֤vֹ aֹchֶ֙zֶt֙ bַּaֲkֵ֣b aֵshָׂ֔v vַyִּkְrָ֥a shְׁm֖vֹ yַaֲkֹ֑b vְyִtsְchָ֛k bֶּן־shִׁshִּׁ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h bְּlֶ֥dֶt aֹtָֽם׃

25.hebrewText: וַֽיִּגְדְּלוּ֙ הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וַיְהִ֣י עֵשָׂ֗ו אִ֛ישׁ יֹדֵ֥עַ צַ֖יִד אִ֣ישׁ שָׂדֶ֑ה וְיַעֲקֹב֙ אִ֣ישׁ תָּ֔ם יֹשֵׁ֖ב אֹהָלִֽים׃
25.englishText: When the boys grew up, Esau became a skillful hunter, a man of the outdoors; but Jacob became a mild man, raising livestock.*raising livestock Heb. yoshev ’ohalim; NJPS “who stayed in camp,” lit. “a sitter in tents.” The idiom for a pastoralist; cf. 4.20.
25.transliteration: vַֽyִּgְdְּlvּ֙ hַnְּaָrִ֔yם vַyְhִ֣y aֵshָׂ֗v aִ֛yshׁ yֹdֵ֥aַ tsַ֖yִd aִ֣yshׁ shָׂdֶ֑h vְyַaֲkֹb֙ aִ֣yshׁ tָּ֔ם yֹshֵׁ֖b aֹhָlִֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב יִצְחָ֛ק אֶת־עֵשָׂ֖ו כִּי־צַ֣יִד בְּפִ֑יו וְרִבְקָ֖ה אֹהֶ֥בֶת אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹֽב׃
25.englishText: Isaac favored Esau because he had a taste for game;*he had a taste for game Lit. “game was in his mouth.” but Rebekah favored Jacob.
25.transliteration: vַyֶּaֱhַ֥b yִtsְchָ֛k aֶt־aֵshָׂ֖v kִּy־tsַ֣yִd bְּpִ֑yv vְrִbְkָ֖h aֹhֶ֥bֶt aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹֽb׃

25.hebrewText: וַיָּ֥זֶד יַעֲקֹ֖ב נָזִ֑יד וַיָּבֹ֥א עֵשָׂ֛ו מִן־הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וְה֥וּא עָיֵֽף׃
25.englishText: Once when Jacob was cooking a stew, Esau came in from the open, famished.
25.transliteration: vַyָּ֥zֶd yַaֲkֹ֖b nָzִ֑yd vַyָּbֹ֥a aֵshָׂ֛v mִן־hַshָּׂdֶ֖h vְh֥vּa aָyֵֽף׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הַלְעִיטֵ֤נִי נָא֙ מִן־הָאָדֹ֤ם הָאָדֹם֙ הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֥י עָיֵ֖ף אָנֹ֑כִי עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ אֱדֽוֹם׃
25.englishText: And Esau said to Jacob, “Give me some of that red stuff to gulp down, for I am famished”—which is why he was named Edom.*Edom Play on Heb. ’adom “red.”
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֵshָׂ֜v aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֗b hַlְaִytֵ֤nִy nָa֙ mִן־hָaָdֹ֤ם hָaָdֹם֙ hַzֶּ֔h kִּ֥y aָyֵ֖ף aָnֹ֑kִy aַl־kֵּ֥ן kָrָֽa־shְׁm֖vֹ aֱdֽvֹם׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֑ב מִכְרָ֥ה כַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־בְּכֹרָתְךָ֖ לִֽי׃
25.englishText: Jacob said, “First sell me your birthright.”
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr yַaֲkֹ֑b mִkְrָ֥h kַyּ֛vֹם aֶt־bְּkֹrָtְךָ֖ lִֽy׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר עֵשָׂ֔ו הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י הוֹלֵ֖ךְ לָמ֑וּת וְלָמָּה־זֶּ֥ה לִ֖י בְּכֹרָֽה׃
25.englishText: And Esau said, “I am at the point of death, so of what use is my birthright to me?”
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵshָׂ֔v hִnֵּ֛h aָnֹkִ֥y hvֹlֵ֖ךְ lָm֑vּt vְlָmָּh־zֶּ֥h lִ֖y bְּkֹrָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֗ב הִשָּׁ֤בְעָה לִּי֙ כַּיּ֔וֹם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֖ע ל֑וֹ וַיִּמְכֹּ֥ר אֶת־בְּכֹרָת֖וֹ לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
25.englishText: But Jacob said, “Swear to me first.” So he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yַaֲkֹ֗b hִshָּׁ֤bְaָh lִּy֙ kַּyּ֔vֹם vַyִּshָּׁbַ֖a l֑vֹ vַyִּmְkֹּ֥r aֶt־bְּkֹrָt֖vֹ lְyַaֲkֹֽb׃

25.hebrewText: וְיַעֲקֹ֞ב נָתַ֣ן לְעֵשָׂ֗ו לֶ֚חֶם וּנְזִ֣יד עֲדָשִׁ֔ים וַיֹּ֣אכַל וַיֵּ֔שְׁתְּ וַיָּ֖קׇם וַיֵּלַ֑ךְ וַיִּ֥בֶז עֵשָׂ֖ו אֶת־הַבְּכֹרָֽה׃ {פ}
25.englishText: Jacob then gave Esau bread and lentil stew; he ate and drank, and he rose and went away. Thus did Esau spurn the birthright.
25.transliteration: vְyַaֲkֹ֞b nָtַ֣ן lְaֵshָׂ֗v lֶ֚chֶם vּnְzִ֣yd aֲdָshִׁ֔yם vַyֹּ֣akַl vַyֵּ֔shְׁtְּ vַyָּ֖kׇם vַyֵּlַ֑ךְ vַyִּ֥bֶz aֵshָׂ֖v aֶt־hַbְּkֹrָֽh׃ {p}

toldot.name: Toldot
toldot.summary: The birth of Esau and Jacob, Esau sells his birthright, Isaac and Rebecca in Gerar, Isaac's wells, Jacob receives Isaac's blessing, and Jacob flees to Laban.

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֧סֶף אַבְרָהָ֛ם וַיִּקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה וּשְׁמָ֥הּ קְטוּרָֽה׃
25.englishText: Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah.
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֧sֶף aַbְrָhָ֛ם vַyִּkַּ֥ch aִshָּׁ֖h vּshְׁmָ֥hּ kְtvּrָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֗וֹ אֶת־זִמְרָן֙ וְאֶת־יׇקְשָׁ֔ן וְאֶת־מְדָ֖ן וְאֶת־מִדְיָ֑ן וְאֶת־יִשְׁבָּ֖ק וְאֶת־שֽׁוּחַ׃
25.englishText: She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
25.transliteration: vַtֵּ֣lֶd l֗vֹ aֶt־zִmְrָן֙ vְaֶt־yׇkְshָׁ֔ן vְaֶt־mְdָ֖ן vְaֶt־mִdְyָ֑ן vְaֶt־yִshְׁbָּ֖k vְaֶt־shֽׁvּchַ׃

25.hebrewText: וְיׇקְשָׁ֣ן יָלַ֔ד אֶת־שְׁבָ֖א וְאֶת־דְּדָ֑ן וּבְנֵ֣י דְדָ֔ן הָי֛וּ אַשּׁוּרִ֥ם וּלְטוּשִׁ֖ם וּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
25.englishText: Jokshan begot Sheba and Dedan. The descendants of Dedan were the Asshurim, the Letushim, and the Leummim.
25.transliteration: vְyׇkְshָׁ֣ן yָlַ֔d aֶt־shְׁbָ֖a vְaֶt־dְּdָ֑ן vּbְnֵ֣y dְdָ֔ן hָy֛vּ aַshּׁvּrִ֥ם vּlְtvּshִׁ֖ם vּlְaֻmִּֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן עֵיפָ֤ה וָעֵ֙פֶר֙ וַחֲנֹ֔ךְ וַאֲבִידָ֖ע וְאֶלְדָּעָ֑ה כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י קְטוּרָֽה׃
25.englishText: The descendants of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Enoch,*Enoch Or “Hanoch.” Abida, and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.
25.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֣y mִdְyָ֗ן aֵypָ֤h vָaֵ֙pֶr֙ vַchֲnֹ֔ךְ vַaֲbִydָ֖a vְaֶlְdָּaָ֑h kׇּl־aֵ֖lֶּh bְּnֵ֥y kְtvּrָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּתֵּ֧ן אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ לְיִצְחָֽק׃
25.englishText: Abraham willed all that he owned to Isaac;
25.transliteration: vַyִּtֵּ֧ן aַbְrָhָ֛ם aֶt־kׇּl־aֲshֶׁr־l֖vֹ lְyִtsְchָֽk׃

25.hebrewText: וְלִבְנֵ֤י הַפִּֽילַגְשִׁים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם נָתַ֥ן אַבְרָהָ֖ם מַתָּנֹ֑ת וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֞ם מֵעַ֨ל יִצְחָ֤ק בְּנוֹ֙ בְּעוֹדֶ֣נּוּ חַ֔י קֵ֖דְמָה אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ קֶֽדֶם׃
25.englishText: but to Abraham’s sons by concubines Abraham gave gifts while he was still living, and he sent them away from his son Isaac eastward, to the land of the East.
25.transliteration: vְlִbְnֵ֤y hַpִּֽylַgְshִׁyם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r lְaַbְrָhָ֔ם nָtַ֥ן aַbְrָhָ֖ם mַtָּnֹ֑t vַֽyְshַׁlְּchֵ֞ם mֵaַ֨l yִtsְchָ֤k bְּnvֹ֙ bְּavֹdֶ֣nּvּ chַ֔y kֵ֖dְmָh aֶl־aֶ֥rֶץ kֶֽdֶם׃

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֗לֶּה יְמֵ֛י שְׁנֵֽי־חַיֵּ֥י אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־חָ֑י מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֛ה וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְחָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
25.englishText: This was the total span of Abraham’s life: one hundred and seventy-five years.
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֗lֶּh yְmֵ֛y shְׁnֵֽy־chַyֵּ֥y aַbְrָhָ֖ם aֲshֶׁr־chָ֑y mְaַ֥t shָׁnָ֛h vְshִׁbְaִ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h vְchָmֵ֥shׁ shָׁnִֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּגְוַ֨ע וַיָּ֧מׇת אַבְרָהָ֛ם בְּשֵׂיבָ֥ה טוֹבָ֖ה זָקֵ֣ן וְשָׂבֵ֑עַ וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
25.englishText: And Abraham breathed his last, dying at a good ripe age, old and contented; and he was gathered to his kin.*kin (So NJPS.) See the Dictionary under “predecessors.”
25.transliteration: vַyִּgְvַ֨a vַyָּ֧mׇt aַbְrָhָ֛ם bְּshֵׂybָ֥h tvֹbָ֖h zָkֵ֣ן vְshָׂbֵ֑aַ vַyֵּaָ֖sֶף aֶl־aַmָּֽyv׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּקְבְּר֨וּ אֹת֜וֹ יִצְחָ֤ק וְיִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ בָּנָ֔יו אֶל־מְעָרַ֖ת הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֑ה אֶל־שְׂדֵ֞ה עֶפְרֹ֤ן בֶּן־צֹ֙חַר֙ הַֽחִתִּ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵֽא׃
25.englishText: His sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, facing Mamre,
25.transliteration: vַyִּkְbְּr֨vּ aֹt֜vֹ yִtsְchָ֤k vְyִshְׁmָaֵal֙ bָּnָ֔yv aֶl־mְaָrַ֖t hַmַּkְpֵּlָ֑h aֶl־shְׂdֵ֞h aֶpְrֹ֤ן bֶּן־tsֹ֙chַr֙ hַֽchִtִּ֔y aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־pְּnֵ֥y mַmְrֵֽa׃

25.hebrewText: הַשָּׂדֶ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־קָנָ֥ה אַבְרָהָ֖ם מֵאֵ֣ת בְּנֵי־חֵ֑ת שָׁ֛מָּה קֻבַּ֥ר אַבְרָהָ֖ם וְשָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
25.englishText: the field that Abraham had bought from the Hittites; there Abraham was buried, and Sarah his wife.
25.transliteration: hַshָּׂdֶ֛h aֲshֶׁr־kָnָ֥h aַbְrָhָ֖ם mֵaֵ֣t bְּnֵy־chֵ֑t shָׁ֛mָּh kֻbַּ֥r aַbְrָhָ֖ם vְshָׂrָ֥h aִshְׁtּֽvֹ׃

25.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵי֙ מ֣וֹת אַבְרָהָ֔ם וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב יִצְחָ֔ק עִם־בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִֽי׃ {פ}
25.englishText: After the death of Abraham, God blessed his son Isaac. And Isaac settled near Beer-lahai-roi.
25.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y aַchֲrֵy֙ m֣vֹt aַbְrָhָ֔ם vַyְbָ֥rֶךְ aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־yִtsְchָ֣k bְּn֑vֹ vַyֵּ֣shֶׁb yִtsְchָ֔k aִם־bְּaֵ֥r lַchַ֖y rֹaִֽy׃ {p}

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תֹּלְדֹ֥ת יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָלְדָ֜ה הָגָ֧ר הַמִּצְרִ֛ית שִׁפְחַ֥ת שָׂרָ֖ה לְאַבְרָהָֽם׃
25.englishText: This is the line of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s slave, bore to Abraham.
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֛lֶּh tֹּlְdֹ֥t yִshְׁmָaֵ֖al bֶּן־aַbְrָhָ֑ם aֲshֶׁ֨r yָlְdָ֜h hָgָ֧r hַmִּtsְrִ֛yt shִׁpְchַ֥t shָׂrָ֖h lְaַbְrָhָֽם׃

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל בִּשְׁמֹתָ֖ם לְתוֹלְדֹתָ֑ם בְּכֹ֤ר יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ נְבָיֹ֔ת וְקֵדָ֥ר וְאַדְבְּאֵ֖ל וּמִבְשָֽׂם׃
25.englishText: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, in the order of their birth: Nebaioth, the first-born of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֗lֶּh shְׁmvֹt֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׁmָaֵ֔al bִּshְׁmֹtָ֖ם lְtvֹlְdֹtָ֑ם bְּkֹ֤r yִshְׁmָaֵal֙ nְbָyֹ֔t vְkֵdָ֥r vְaַdְbְּaֵ֖l vּmִbְshָֽׂם׃

25.hebrewText: וּמִשְׁמָ֥ע וְדוּמָ֖ה וּמַשָּֽׂא׃
25.englishText: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,
25.transliteration: vּmִshְׁmָ֥a vְdvּmָ֖h vּmַshָּֽׂa׃

25.hebrewText: חֲדַ֣ד וְתֵימָ֔א יְט֥וּר נָפִ֖ישׁ וָקֵֽדְמָה׃
25.englishText: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedmah.
25.transliteration: chֲdַ֣d vְtֵymָ֔a yְt֥vּr nָpִ֖yshׁ vָkֵֽdְmָh׃

25.hebrewText: אֵ֣לֶּה הֵ֞ם בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ וְאֵ֣לֶּה שְׁמֹתָ֔ם בְּחַצְרֵיהֶ֖ם וּבְטִֽירֹתָ֑ם שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר נְשִׂיאִ֖ם לְאֻמֹּתָֽם׃
25.englishText: These are the sons of Ishmael and these are their names by their villages and by their encampments: twelve chieftains of as many tribes.—
25.transliteration: aֵ֣lֶּh hֵ֞ם bְּnֵ֤y yִshְׁmָaֵal֙ vְaֵ֣lֶּh shְׁmֹtָ֔ם bְּchַtsְrֵyhֶ֖ם vּbְtִֽyrֹtָ֑ם shְׁnֵyם־aָshָׂ֥r nְshִׂyaִ֖ם lְaֻmֹּtָֽם׃

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֛ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיִּגְוַ֣ע וַיָּ֔מׇת וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
25.englishText: These were the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred and thirty-seven years; then he breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his kin.—
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֗lֶּh shְׁnֵy֙ chַyֵּ֣y yִshְׁmָaֵ֔al mְaַ֥t shָׁnָ֛h vּshְׁlֹshִׁ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h vְshֶׁ֣bַa shָׁnִ֑yם vַyִּgְvַ֣a vַyָּ֔mׇt vַyֵּaָ֖sֶף aֶl־aַmָּֽyv׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁכְּנ֨וּ מֵֽחֲוִילָ֜ה עַד־שׁ֗וּר אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י מִצְרַ֔יִם בֹּאֲכָ֖ה אַשּׁ֑וּרָה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־אֶחָ֖יו נָפָֽל׃ {פ}
25.englishText: They dwelt from Havilah, by Shur, which is close to Egypt, all the way to Asshur; they camped alongside all their kin.
25.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁkְּn֨vּ mֵֽchֲvִylָ֜h aַd־shׁ֗vּr aֲshֶׁr֙ aַl־pְּnֵ֣y mִtsְrַ֔yִם bֹּaֲkָ֖h aַshּׁ֑vּrָh aַl־pְּnֵ֥y kׇl־aֶchָ֖yv nָpָֽl׃ {p}

25.hebrewText: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֥ת יִצְחָ֖ק בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֑ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־יִצְחָֽק׃
25.englishText: This is the story of Isaac, son of Abraham. Abraham begot Isaac.
25.transliteration: vְaֵ֛lֶּh tּvֹlְdֹ֥t yִtsְchָ֖k bֶּן־aַbְrָhָ֑ם aַbְrָhָ֖ם hvֹlִ֥yd aֶt־yִtsְchָֽk׃

25.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֤י יִצְחָק֙ בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּקַחְתּ֣וֹ אֶת־רִבְקָ֗ה בַּת־בְּתוּאֵל֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּ֔י מִפַּדַּ֖ן אֲרָ֑ם אֲח֛וֹת לָבָ֥ן הָאֲרַמִּ֖י ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
25.englishText: Isaac was forty years old when he took to wife Rebekah, daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-aram, sister of Laban the Aramean.
25.transliteration: vַyְhִ֤y yִtsְchָk֙ bֶּן־aַrְbָּaִ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h bְּkַchְtּ֣vֹ aֶt־rִbְkָ֗h bַּt־bְּtvּaֵl֙ hָֽaֲrַmִּ֔y mִpַּdַּ֖ן aֲrָ֑ם aֲch֛vֹt lָbָ֥ן hָaֲrַmִּ֖y l֥vֹ lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֶּעְתַּ֨ר יִצְחָ֤ק לַֽיהֹוָה֙ לְנֹ֣כַח אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י עֲקָרָ֖ה הִ֑וא וַיֵּעָ֤תֶר לוֹ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתַּ֖הַר רִבְקָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
25.englishText: Isaac pleaded with יהוה on behalf of his wife, because she was barren; and יהוה responded to his plea, and his wife Rebekah conceived.
25.transliteration: vַyֶּaְtַּ֨r yִtsְchָ֤k lַֽyhֹvָh֙ lְnֹ֣kַch aִshְׁtּ֔vֹ kִּ֥y aֲkָrָ֖h hִ֑va vַyֵּaָ֤tֶr lvֹ֙ yְhֹvָ֔h vַtַּ֖hַr rִbְkָ֥h aִshְׁtּֽvֹ׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּתְרֹֽצְצ֤וּ הַבָּנִים֙ בְּקִרְבָּ֔הּ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אִם־כֵּ֔ן לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה אָנֹ֑כִי וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ לִדְרֹ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
25.englishText: But the children struggled in her womb, and she said, “If so, why do I exist?”*why do I exist? Meaning of Heb. uncertain. She went to inquire of יהוה,
25.transliteration: vַyִּtְrֹֽtsְts֤vּ hַbָּnִyם֙ bְּkִrְbָּ֔hּ vַtֹּ֣amֶr aִם־kֵּ֔ן lָ֥mָּh zֶּ֖h aָnֹ֑kִy vַtֵּ֖lֶךְ lִdְrֹ֥shׁ aֶt־yְhֹvָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה לָ֗הּ שְׁנֵ֤י (גיים) [גוֹיִם֙] בְּבִטְנֵ֔ךְ וּשְׁנֵ֣י לְאֻמִּ֔ים מִמֵּעַ֖יִךְ יִפָּרֵ֑דוּ וּלְאֹם֙ מִלְאֹ֣ם יֶֽאֱמָ֔ץ וְרַ֖ב יַעֲבֹ֥ד צָעִֽיר׃
25.englishText:
and יהוה answered her,
“Two nations are in your womb,
Two separate peoples shall issue from your body;
One people shall be mightier than the other,
And the older shall serve the younger.”
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h lָ֗hּ shְׁnֵ֤y (gyyם) [gvֹyִם֙] bְּbִtְnֵ֔ךְ vּshְׁnֵ֣y lְaֻmִּ֔yם mִmֵּaַ֖yִךְ yִpָּrֵ֑dvּ vּlְaֹם֙ mִlְaֹ֣ם yֶֽaֱmָ֔ץ vְrַ֖b yַaֲbֹ֥d tsָaִֽyr׃

25.hebrewText: וַיִּמְלְא֥וּ יָמֶ֖יהָ לָלֶ֑דֶת וְהִנֵּ֥ה תוֹמִ֖ם בְּבִטְנָֽהּ׃
25.englishText: When her time to give birth was at hand, there were twins in her womb.
25.transliteration: vַyִּmְlְa֥vּ yָmֶ֖yhָ lָlֶ֑dֶt vְhִnֵּ֥h tvֹmִ֖ם bְּbִtְnָֽhּ׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֤א הָרִאשׁוֹן֙ אַדְמוֹנִ֔י כֻּלּ֖וֹ כְּאַדֶּ֣רֶת שֵׂעָ֑ר וַיִּקְרְא֥וּ שְׁמ֖וֹ עֵשָֽׂו׃
25.englishText: The first one emerged red, like a hairy mantle all over; so they named him Esau.*Esau Synonym of “Seir,” play on Heb. se‘ar “hair.”
25.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֤a hָrִashׁvֹן֙ aַdְmvֹnִ֔y kֻּlּ֖vֹ kְּaַdֶּ֣rֶt shֵׂaָ֑r vַyִּkְrְa֥vּ shְׁm֖vֹ aֵshָֽׂv׃

25.hebrewText: וְאַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֞ן יָצָ֣א אָחִ֗יו וְיָד֤וֹ אֹחֶ֙זֶת֙ בַּעֲקֵ֣ב עֵשָׂ֔ו וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיִצְחָ֛ק בֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בְּלֶ֥דֶת אֹתָֽם׃
25.englishText: Then his brother emerged, holding on to the heel of Esau; so they named him Jacob.*Jacob Play on Heb. ‘aqeb “heel.” Isaac was sixty years old when they were born.
25.transliteration: vְaַֽchֲrֵy־kֵ֞ן yָtsָ֣a aָchִ֗yv vְyָd֤vֹ aֹchֶ֙zֶt֙ bַּaֲkֵ֣b aֵshָׂ֔v vַyִּkְrָ֥a shְׁm֖vֹ yַaֲkֹ֑b vְyִtsְchָ֛k bֶּן־shִׁshִּׁ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h bְּlֶ֥dֶt aֹtָֽם׃

25.hebrewText: וַֽיִּגְדְּלוּ֙ הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וַיְהִ֣י עֵשָׂ֗ו אִ֛ישׁ יֹדֵ֥עַ צַ֖יִד אִ֣ישׁ שָׂדֶ֑ה וְיַעֲקֹב֙ אִ֣ישׁ תָּ֔ם יֹשֵׁ֖ב אֹהָלִֽים׃
25.englishText: When the boys grew up, Esau became a skillful hunter, a man of the outdoors; but Jacob became a mild man, raising livestock.*raising livestock Heb. yoshev ’ohalim; NJPS “who stayed in camp,” lit. “a sitter in tents.” The idiom for a pastoralist; cf. 4.20.
25.transliteration: vַֽyִּgְdְּlvּ֙ hַnְּaָrִ֔yם vַyְhִ֣y aֵshָׂ֗v aִ֛yshׁ yֹdֵ֥aַ tsַ֖yִd aִ֣yshׁ shָׂdֶ֑h vְyַaֲkֹb֙ aִ֣yshׁ tָּ֔ם yֹshֵׁ֖b aֹhָlִֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב יִצְחָ֛ק אֶת־עֵשָׂ֖ו כִּי־צַ֣יִד בְּפִ֑יו וְרִבְקָ֖ה אֹהֶ֥בֶת אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹֽב׃
25.englishText: Isaac favored Esau because he had a taste for game;*he had a taste for game Lit. “game was in his mouth.” but Rebekah favored Jacob.
25.transliteration: vַyֶּaֱhַ֥b yִtsְchָ֛k aֶt־aֵshָׂ֖v kִּy־tsַ֣yִd bְּpִ֑yv vְrִbְkָ֖h aֹhֶ֥bֶt aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹֽb׃

25.hebrewText: וַיָּ֥זֶד יַעֲקֹ֖ב נָזִ֑יד וַיָּבֹ֥א עֵשָׂ֛ו מִן־הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וְה֥וּא עָיֵֽף׃
25.englishText: Once when Jacob was cooking a stew, Esau came in from the open, famished.
25.transliteration: vַyָּ֥zֶd yַaֲkֹ֖b nָzִ֑yd vַyָּbֹ֥a aֵshָׂ֛v mִן־hַshָּׂdֶ֖h vְh֥vּa aָyֵֽף׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הַלְעִיטֵ֤נִי נָא֙ מִן־הָאָדֹ֤ם הָאָדֹם֙ הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֥י עָיֵ֖ף אָנֹ֑כִי עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ אֱדֽוֹם׃
25.englishText: And Esau said to Jacob, “Give me some of that red stuff to gulp down, for I am famished”—which is why he was named Edom.*Edom Play on Heb. ’adom “red.”
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֵshָׂ֜v aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֗b hַlְaִytֵ֤nִy nָa֙ mִן־hָaָdֹ֤ם hָaָdֹם֙ hַzֶּ֔h kִּ֥y aָyֵ֖ף aָnֹ֑kִy aַl־kֵּ֥ן kָrָֽa־shְׁm֖vֹ aֱdֽvֹם׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֑ב מִכְרָ֥ה כַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־בְּכֹרָתְךָ֖ לִֽי׃
25.englishText: Jacob said, “First sell me your birthright.”
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr yַaֲkֹ֑b mִkְrָ֥h kַyּ֛vֹם aֶt־bְּkֹrָtְךָ֖ lִֽy׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר עֵשָׂ֔ו הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י הוֹלֵ֖ךְ לָמ֑וּת וְלָמָּה־זֶּ֥ה לִ֖י בְּכֹרָֽה׃
25.englishText: And Esau said, “I am at the point of death, so of what use is my birthright to me?”
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵshָׂ֔v hִnֵּ֛h aָnֹkִ֥y hvֹlֵ֖ךְ lָm֑vּt vְlָmָּh־zֶּ֥h lִ֖y bְּkֹrָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֗ב הִשָּׁ֤בְעָה לִּי֙ כַּיּ֔וֹם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֖ע ל֑וֹ וַיִּמְכֹּ֥ר אֶת־בְּכֹרָת֖וֹ לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
25.englishText: But Jacob said, “Swear to me first.” So he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.
25.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yַaֲkֹ֗b hִshָּׁ֤bְaָh lִּy֙ kַּyּ֔vֹם vַyִּshָּׁbַ֖a l֑vֹ vַyִּmְkֹּ֥r aֶt־bְּkֹrָt֖vֹ lְyַaֲkֹֽb׃

25.hebrewText: וְיַעֲקֹ֞ב נָתַ֣ן לְעֵשָׂ֗ו לֶ֚חֶם וּנְזִ֣יד עֲדָשִׁ֔ים וַיֹּ֣אכַל וַיֵּ֔שְׁתְּ וַיָּ֖קׇם וַיֵּלַ֑ךְ וַיִּ֥בֶז עֵשָׂ֖ו אֶת־הַבְּכֹרָֽה׃ {פ}
25.englishText: Jacob then gave Esau bread and lentil stew; he ate and drank, and he rose and went away. Thus did Esau spurn the birthright.
25.transliteration: vְyַaֲkֹ֞b nָtַ֣ן lְaֵshָׂ֗v lֶ֚chֶם vּnְzִ֣yd aֲdָshִׁ֔yם vַyֹּ֣akַl vַyֵּ֔shְׁtְּ vַyָּ֖kׇם vַyֵּlַ֑ךְ vַyִּ֥bֶz aֵshָׂ֖v aֶt־hַbְּkֹrָֽh׃ {p}

26.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֤י רָעָב֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ מִלְּבַד֙ הָרָעָ֣ב הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה בִּימֵ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ יִצְחָ֛ק אֶל־אֲבִימֶ֥לֶךְ מֶֽלֶךְ־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים גְּרָֽרָה׃
26.englishText: There was a famine in the land—aside from the previous famine that had occurred in the days of Abraham—and Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, in Gerar.
26.transliteration: vַyְhִ֤y rָaָb֙ bָּaָ֔rֶץ mִlְּbַd֙ hָrָaָ֣b hָrִashׁ֔vֹן aֲshֶׁ֥r hָyָ֖h bִּymֵ֣y aַbְrָhָ֑ם vַyֵּ֧lֶךְ yִtsְchָ֛k aֶl־aֲbִymֶ֥lֶךְ mֶֽlֶךְ־pְּlִshְׁtִּ֖yם gְּrָֽrָh׃

26.hebrewText: וַיֵּרָ֤א אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַל־תֵּרֵ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יְמָה שְׁכֹ֣ן בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
26.englishText: יהוה had appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; stay in the land which I point out to you.
26.transliteration: vַyֵּrָ֤a aֵlָyv֙ yְhֹvָ֔h vַyֹּ֖amֶr aַl־tֵּrֵ֣d mִtsְrָ֑yְmָh shְׁkֹ֣ן bָּaָ֔rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֖r aֹmַ֥r aֵlֶֽyךָ׃

26.hebrewText: גּ֚וּר בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וְאֶֽהְיֶ֥ה עִמְּךָ֖ וַאֲבָרְכֶ֑ךָּ כִּֽי־לְךָ֣ וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֗ אֶתֵּן֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָֽאֲרָצֹ֣ת הָאֵ֔ל וַהֲקִֽמֹתִי֙ אֶת־הַשְּׁבֻעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם אָבִֽיךָ׃
26.englishText: Reside in this land, and I will be with you and bless you; I will assign all these lands to you and to your heirs, fulfilling the oath that I swore to your father Abraham.
26.transliteration: gּ֚vּr bָּaָ֣rֶץ hַzֹּ֔at vְaֶֽhְyֶ֥h aִmְּךָ֖ vַaֲbָrְkֶ֑ךָּ kִּֽy־lְךָ֣ vּֽlְzַrְaֲךָ֗ aֶtֵּן֙ aֶt־kׇּl־hָֽaֲrָtsֹ֣t hָaֵ֔l vַhֲkִֽmֹtִy֙ aֶt־hַshְּׁbֻaָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r nִshְׁbַּ֖aְtִּy lְaַbְrָhָ֥ם aָbִֽyךָ׃

26.hebrewText: וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּכוֹכְבֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנָתַתִּ֣י לְזַרְעֲךָ֔ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הָאֲרָצֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑ל וְהִתְבָּרְכ֣וּ בְזַרְעֲךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
26.englishText: I will make your heirs as numerous as the stars of heaven, and assign to your heirs all these lands, so that all the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your heirs—
26.transliteration: vְhִrְbֵּytִ֤y aֶֽt־zַrְaֲךָ֙ kְּkvֹkְbֵ֣y hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vְnָtַtִּ֣y lְzַrְaֲךָ֔ aֵ֥t kׇּl־hָaֲrָtsֹ֖t hָaֵ֑l vְhִtְbָּrְk֣vּ bְzַrְaֲךָ֔ kֹּ֖l gּvֹyֵ֥y hָaָֽrֶץ׃

26.hebrewText: עֵ֕קֶב אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמַ֥ע אַבְרָהָ֖ם בְּקֹלִ֑י וַיִּשְׁמֹר֙ מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֔י מִצְוֺתַ֖י חֻקּוֹתַ֥י וְתוֹרֹתָֽי׃
26.englishText: inasmuch as Abraham obeyed Me and kept My charge: My commandments, My laws, and My teachings.”
26.transliteration: aֵ֕kֶb aֲshֶׁr־shָׁmַ֥a aַbְrָhָ֖ם bְּkֹlִ֑y vַyִּshְׁmֹr֙ mִshְׁmַrְtִּ֔y mִtsְvֺtַ֖y chֻkּvֹtַ֥y vְtvֹrֹtָֽy׃

26.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יִצְחָ֖ק בִּגְרָֽר׃
26.englishText: So Isaac stayed in Gerar.
26.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥shֶׁb yִtsְchָ֖k bִּgְrָֽr׃

26.hebrewText: וַֽיִּשְׁאֲל֞וּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמָּקוֹם֙ לְאִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֑וא כִּ֤י יָרֵא֙ לֵאמֹ֣ר אִשְׁתִּ֔י פֶּן־יַֽהַרְגֻ֜נִי אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמָּקוֹם֙ עַל־רִבְקָ֔ה כִּֽי־טוֹבַ֥ת מַרְאֶ֖ה הִֽוא׃
26.englishText: When the local leaders*local leaders Or “locals.” Heb. ’anshe ha-maqom; NJPS “the men of the place.” Cf., e.g., Gen. 34.20; Judg. 8.15–17. See the Dictionary under ’ish. asked him about his wife, he said, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say “my wife,” thinking, “The local leaders might kill me on account of Rebekah, for she is beautiful.”
26.transliteration: vַֽyִּshְׁaֲl֞vּ aַnְshֵׁ֤y hַmָּkvֹם֙ lְaִshְׁtּ֔vֹ vַyֹּ֖amֶr aֲchֹ֣tִy hִ֑va kִּ֤y yָrֵa֙ lֵamֹ֣r aִshְׁtִּ֔y pֶּן־yַֽhַrְgֻ֜nִy aַnְshֵׁ֤y hַmָּkvֹם֙ aַl־rִbְkָ֔h kִּֽy־tvֹbַ֥t mַrְaֶ֖h hִֽva׃

26.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י כִּ֣י אָֽרְכוּ־ל֥וֹ שָׁם֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וַיַּשְׁקֵ֗ף אֲבִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים בְּעַ֖ד הַֽחַלּ֑וֹן וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה יִצְחָק֙ מְצַחֵ֔ק אֵ֖ת רִבְקָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
26.englishText: When some time had passed, Abimelech king of the Philistines, looking out of the window, saw Isaac fondling his wife Rebekah.
26.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y kִּ֣y aָֽrְkvּ־l֥vֹ shָׁם֙ hַyָּmִ֔yם vַyַּshְׁkֵ֗ף aֲbִymֶ֙lֶךְ֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ pְּlִshְׁtִּ֔yם bְּaַ֖d hַֽchַlּ֑vֹן vַyַּ֗rְa vְhִnֵּ֤h yִtsְchָk֙ mְtsַchֵ֔k aֵ֖t rִbְkָ֥h aִshְׁtּֽvֹ׃
