26.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ לְיִצְחָ֗ק וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַ֣ךְ הִנֵּ֤ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֙ הִ֔וא וְאֵ֥יךְ אָמַ֖רְתָּ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֑וא וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ יִצְחָ֔ק כִּ֣י אָמַ֔רְתִּי פֶּן־אָמ֖וּת עָלֶֽיהָ׃
26.englishText: Abimelech sent for Isaac and said, “So she is your wife! Why then did you say: ‘She is my sister’?” Isaac said to him, “Because I thought I might lose my life on account of her.”
26.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֨a aֲbִymֶ֜lֶךְ lְyִtsְchָ֗k vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ aַ֣ךְ hִnֵּ֤h aִshְׁtְּךָ֙ hִ֔va vְaֵ֥yךְ aָmַ֖rְtָּ aֲchֹ֣tִy hִ֑va vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֵlָyv֙ yִtsְchָ֔k kִּ֣y aָmַ֔rְtִּy pֶּן־aָm֖vּt aָlֶֽyhָ׃

26.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ מַה־זֹּ֖את עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֑נוּ כִּ֠מְעַ֠ט שָׁכַ֞ב אַחַ֤ד הָעָם֙ אֶת־אִשְׁתֶּ֔ךָ וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ עָלֵ֖ינוּ אָשָֽׁם׃
26.englishText: Abimelech said, “What have you done to us! One of the men*men NJPS “people.” See the Dictionary under ‘am. might have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt upon us.”
26.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֲbִymֶ֔lֶךְ mַh־zֹּ֖at aָshִׂ֣ytָ lָּ֑nvּ kִּ֠mְaַ֠t shָׁkַ֞b aַchַ֤d hָaָם֙ aֶt־aִshְׁtֶּ֔ךָ vְhֵbֵatָ֥ aָlֵ֖ynvּ aָshָֽׁם׃

26.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֣ו אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר הַנֹּגֵ֜עַ בָּאִ֥ישׁ הַזֶּ֛ה וּבְאִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
26.englishText: Abimelech then charged all the people, saying, “Anyone who molests this man or his wife shall be put to death.”
26.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֣v aֲbִymֶ֔lֶךְ aֶt־kׇּl־hָaָ֖ם lֵamֹ֑r hַnֹּgֵ֜aַ bָּaִ֥yshׁ hַzֶּ֛h vּbְaִshְׁtּ֖vֹ m֥vֹt yvּmָֽt׃

26.hebrewText: וַיִּזְרַ֤ע יִצְחָק֙ בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֔וא וַיִּמְצָ֛א בַּשָּׁנָ֥ה הַהִ֖וא מֵאָ֣ה שְׁעָרִ֑ים וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֖הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
26.englishText: Isaac sowed in that land and reaped a hundredfold the same year. יהוה blessed him,
26.transliteration: vַyִּzְrַ֤a yִtsְchָk֙ bָּaָ֣rֶץ hַhִ֔va vַyִּmְtsָ֛a bַּshָּׁnָ֥h hַhִ֖va mֵaָ֣h shְׁaָrִ֑yם vַֽyְbָrְkֵ֖hvּ yְhֹvָֽh׃

26.hebrewText: וַיִּגְדַּ֖ל הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ הָלוֹךְ֙ וְגָדֵ֔ל עַ֥ד כִּֽי־גָדַ֖ל מְאֹֽד׃
26.englishText: and the man grew richer and richer until he was very wealthy:
26.transliteration: vַyִּgְdַּ֖l hָaִ֑yshׁ vַyֵּ֤lֶךְ hָlvֹךְ֙ vְgָdֵ֔l aַ֥d kִּֽy־gָdַ֖l mְaֹֽd׃

26.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־ל֤וֹ מִקְנֵה־צֹאן֙ וּמִקְנֵ֣ה בָקָ֔ר וַעֲבֻדָּ֖ה רַבָּ֑ה וַיְקַנְא֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
26.englishText: he acquired flocks and herds, and a large household, so that the Philistines envied him.
26.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־l֤vֹ mִkְnֵh־tsֹaן֙ vּmִkְnֵ֣h bָkָ֔r vַaֲbֻdָּ֖h rַbָּ֑h vַyְkַnְa֥vּ aֹt֖vֹ pְּlִshְׁtִּֽyם׃

26.hebrewText: וְכׇל־הַבְּאֵרֹ֗ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָֽפְרוּ֙ עַבְדֵ֣י אָבִ֔יו בִּימֵ֖י אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֑יו סִתְּמ֣וּם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיְמַלְא֖וּם עָפָֽר׃
26.englishText: And the Philistines stopped up all the wells which his father’s servants had dug in the days of his father Abraham, filling them with earth.
26.transliteration: vְkׇl־hַbְּaֵrֹ֗t aֲshֶׁ֤r chָֽpְrvּ֙ aַbְdֵ֣y aָbִ֔yv bִּymֵ֖y aַbְrָhָ֣ם aָbִ֑yv sִtְּm֣vּם pְּlִshְׁtִּ֔yם vַyְmַlְa֖vּם aָpָֽr׃

26.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־יִצְחָ֑ק לֵ֚ךְ מֵֽעִמָּ֔נוּ כִּֽי־עָצַ֥מְתָּ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ מְאֹֽד׃
26.englishText: And Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you have become far too big for us.”
26.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֲbִymֶ֖lֶךְ aֶl־yִtsְchָ֑k lֵ֚ךְ mֵֽaִmָּ֔nvּ kִּֽy־aָtsַ֥mְtָּ mִmֶּ֖nּvּ mְaֹֽd׃

26.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מִשָּׁ֖ם יִצְחָ֑ק וַיִּ֥חַן בְּנַֽחַל־גְּרָ֖ר וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב שָֽׁם׃
26.englishText: So Isaac departed from there and encamped in the wadi of Gerar, where he settled.
26.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥lֶךְ mִshָּׁ֖ם yִtsְchָ֑k vַyִּ֥chַן bְּnַֽchַl־gְּrָ֖r vַyֵּ֥shֶׁb shָֽׁם׃

26.hebrewText: וַיָּ֨שׇׁב יִצְחָ֜ק וַיַּחְפֹּ֣ר ׀ אֶת־בְּאֵרֹ֣ת הַמַּ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָֽפְרוּ֙ בִּימֵי֙ אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֔יו וַיְסַתְּמ֣וּם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֖י מ֣וֹת אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֤א לָהֶן֙ שֵׁמ֔וֹת כַּשֵּׁמֹ֕ת אֲשֶׁר־קָרָ֥א לָהֶ֖ן אָבִֽיו׃
26.englishText: Isaac dug anew the wells which had been dug in the days of his father Abraham and which the Philistines had stopped up after Abraham’s death; and he gave them the same names that his father had given them.
26.transliteration: vַyָּ֨shׇׁb yִtsְchָ֜k vַyַּchְpֹּ֣r ׀ aֶt־bְּaֵrֹ֣t hַmַּ֗yִם aֲshֶׁ֤r chָֽpְrvּ֙ bִּymֵy֙ aַbְrָhָ֣ם aָbִ֔yv vַyְsַtְּm֣vּם pְּlִshְׁtִּ֔yם aַchֲrֵ֖y m֣vֹt aַbְrָhָ֑ם vַyִּkְrָ֤a lָhֶן֙ shֵׁm֔vֹt kַּshֵּׁmֹ֕t aֲshֶׁr־kָrָ֥a lָhֶ֖ן aָbִֽyv׃

26.hebrewText: וַיַּחְפְּר֥וּ עַבְדֵֽי־יִצְחָ֖ק בַּנָּ֑חַל וַיִּ֨מְצְאוּ־שָׁ֔ם בְּאֵ֖ר מַ֥יִם חַיִּֽים׃
26.englishText: But when Isaac’s servants, digging in the wadi, found there a well of spring water,
26.transliteration: vַyַּchְpְּr֥vּ aַbְdֵֽy־yִtsְchָ֖k bַּnָּ֑chַl vַyִּ֨mְtsְavּ־shָׁ֔ם bְּaֵ֖r mַ֥yִם chַyִּֽyם׃

26.hebrewText: וַיָּרִ֜יבוּ רֹעֵ֣י גְרָ֗ר עִם־רֹעֵ֥י יִצְחָ֛ק לֵאמֹ֖ר לָ֣נוּ הַמָּ֑יִם וַיִּקְרָ֤א שֵֽׁם־הַבְּאֵר֙ עֵ֔שֶׂק כִּ֥י הִֽתְעַשְּׂק֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
26.englishText: the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac’s herdsmen, saying, “The water is ours.” He named that well Esek,*Esek I.e., “contention.” because they contended with him.
26.transliteration: vַyָּrִ֜ybvּ rֹaֵ֣y gְrָ֗r aִם־rֹaֵ֥y yִtsְchָ֛k lֵamֹ֖r lָ֣nvּ hַmָּ֑yִם vַyִּkְrָ֤a shֵֽׁם־hַbְּaֵr֙ aֵ֔shֶׂk kִּ֥y hִֽtְaַshְּׂk֖vּ aִmּֽvֹ׃

26.hebrewText: וַֽיַּחְפְּרוּ֙ בְּאֵ֣ר אַחֶ֔רֶת וַיָּרִ֖יבוּ גַּם־עָלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמָ֖הּ שִׂטְנָֽה׃
26.englishText: And when they dug another well, they disputed over that one also; so he named it Sitnah.*Sitnah I.e., “harassment.”
26.transliteration: vַֽyַּchְpְּrvּ֙ bְּaֵ֣r aַchֶ֔rֶt vַyָּrִ֖ybvּ gַּם־aָlֶ֑yhָ vַyִּkְrָ֥a shְׁmָ֖hּ shִׂtְnָֽh׃

26.hebrewText: וַיַּעְתֵּ֣ק מִשָּׁ֗ם וַיַּחְפֹּר֙ בְּאֵ֣ר אַחֶ֔רֶת וְלֹ֥א רָב֖וּ עָלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּקְרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ רְחֹב֔וֹת וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־עַתָּ֞ה הִרְחִ֧יב יְהֹוָ֛ה לָ֖נוּ וּפָרִ֥ינוּ בָאָֽרֶץ׃
26.englishText: He moved from there and dug yet another well, and they did not quarrel over it; so he called it Rehoboth, saying, “Now at last יהוה has granted us ample space*ample space Heb. hirḥib, connected with “Rehoboth.” to increase in the land.”
26.transliteration: vַyַּaְtֵּ֣k mִshָּׁ֗ם vַyַּchְpֹּr֙ bְּaֵ֣r aַchֶ֔rֶt vְlֹ֥a rָb֖vּ aָlֶ֑yhָ vַyִּkְrָ֤a shְׁmָhּ֙ rְchֹb֔vֹt vַyֹּ֗amֶr kִּֽy־aַtָּ֞h hִrְchִ֧yb yְhֹvָ֛h lָ֖nvּ vּpָrִ֥ynvּ bָaָֽrֶץ׃

26.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַל מִשָּׁ֖ם בְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
26.englishText: From there he went up to Beer-sheba.
26.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַl mִshָּׁ֖ם bְּaֵ֥r shָֽׁbַa׃

26.hebrewText: וַיֵּרָ֨א אֵלָ֤יו יְהֹוָה֙ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֔וּא וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָנֹכִ֕י אֱלֹהֵ֖י אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֑יךָ אַל־תִּירָא֙ כִּֽי־אִתְּךָ֣ אָנֹ֔כִי וּבֵֽרַכְתִּ֙יךָ֙ וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֣י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֔ בַּעֲב֖וּר אַבְרָהָ֥ם עַבְדִּֽי׃
26.englishText: That night יהוה appeared to him and said, “I am the God of your father Abraham’s [house]. Fear not, for I am with you, and I will bless you and increase your offspring for the sake of My servant Abraham.”
26.transliteration: vַyֵּrָ֨a aֵlָ֤yv yְhֹvָh֙ bַּlַּ֣yְlָh hַh֔vּa vַyֹּ֕amֶr aָnֹkִ֕y aֱlֹhֵ֖y aַbְrָhָ֣ם aָbִ֑yךָ aַl־tִּyrָa֙ kִּֽy־aִtְּךָ֣ aָnֹ֔kִy vּbֵֽrַkְtִּ֙yךָ֙ vְhִrְbֵּytִ֣y aֶֽt־zַrְaֲךָ֔ bַּaֲb֖vּr aַbְrָhָ֥ם aַbְdִּֽy׃

26.hebrewText: וַיִּ֧בֶן שָׁ֣ם מִזְבֵּ֗חַ וַיִּקְרָא֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֶּט־שָׁ֖ם אׇהֳל֑וֹ וַיִּכְרוּ־שָׁ֥ם עַבְדֵי־יִצְחָ֖ק בְּאֵֽר׃
26.englishText: So he built an altar there and invoked יהוה by name. Isaac pitched his tent there and his servants started digging a well.
26.transliteration: vַyִּ֧bֶן shָׁ֣ם mִzְbֵּ֗chַ vַyִּkְrָa֙ bְּshֵׁ֣ם yְhֹvָ֔h vַyֶּt־shָׁ֖ם aׇhֳl֑vֹ vַyִּkְrvּ־shָׁ֥ם aַbְdֵy־yִtsְchָ֖k bְּaֵֽr׃

26.hebrewText: וַאֲבִימֶ֕לֶךְ הָלַ֥ךְ אֵלָ֖יו מִגְּרָ֑ר וַאֲחֻזַּת֙ מֵֽרֵעֵ֔הוּ וּפִיכֹ֖ל שַׂר־צְבָאֽוֹ׃
26.englishText: And Abimelech came to him from Gerar, with Ahuzzath his councilor and Phicol chief of his troops.
26.transliteration: vַaֲbִymֶ֕lֶךְ hָlַ֥ךְ aֵlָ֖yv mִgְּrָ֑r vַaֲchֻzַּt֙ mֵֽrֵaֵ֔hvּ vּpִykֹ֖l shַׂr־tsְbָaֽvֹ׃

26.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ יִצְחָ֔ק מַדּ֖וּעַ בָּאתֶ֣ם אֵלָ֑י וְאַתֶּם֙ שְׂנֵאתֶ֣ם אֹתִ֔י וַתְּשַׁלְּח֖וּנִי מֵאִתְּכֶֽם׃
26.englishText: Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, seeing that you have been hostile to me and have driven me away from you?”
26.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֲlֵhֶם֙ yִtsְchָ֔k mַdּ֖vּaַ bָּatֶ֣ם aֵlָ֑y vְaַtֶּם֙ shְׂnֵatֶ֣ם aֹtִ֔y vַtְּshַׁlְּch֖vּnִy mֵaִtְּkֶֽם׃

26.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ רָא֣וֹ רָאִ֘ינוּ֮ כִּֽי־הָיָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> עִמָּךְ֒ וַנֹּ֗אמֶר תְּהִ֨י נָ֥א אָלָ֛ה בֵּינוֹתֵ֖ינוּ בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ וְנִכְרְתָ֥ה בְרִ֖ית עִמָּֽךְ׃
26.englishText: And they said, “We now see plainly that יהוה has been with you, and we thought: Let there be a sworn treaty between our two parties, between you and us. Let us make a pact with you
26.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֗vּ rָa֣vֹ rָaִ֘ynvּ֮ kִּֽy־hָyָ֣h yְhֹvָ֣h <small>׀</small> aִmָּךְ֒ vַnֹּ֗amֶr tְּhִ֨y nָ֥a aָlָ֛h bֵּynvֹtֵ֖ynvּ bֵּynֵ֣ynvּ vּbֵynֶ֑ךָ vְnִkְrְtָ֥h bְrִ֖yt aִmָּֽךְ׃

26.hebrewText: אִם־תַּעֲשֵׂ֨ה עִמָּ֜נוּ רָעָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א נְגַֽעֲנ֔וּךָ וְכַאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשִׂ֤ינוּ עִמְּךָ֙ רַק־ט֔וֹב וַנְּשַׁלֵּֽחֲךָ֖ בְּשָׁל֑וֹם אַתָּ֥ה עַתָּ֖ה בְּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃
26.englishText: that you will not do us harm, just as we have not molested you but have always dealt kindly with you and sent you away in peace. From now on, be you blessed of יהוה!”
26.transliteration: aִם־tַּaֲshֵׂ֨h aִmָּ֜nvּ rָaָ֗h kַּaֲshֶׁr֙ lֹ֣a nְgַֽaֲn֔vּךָ vְkַaֲshֶׁ֨r aָshִׂ֤ynvּ aִmְּךָ֙ rַk־t֔vֹb vַnְּshַׁlֵּֽchֲךָ֖ bְּshָׁl֑vֹם aַtָּ֥h aַtָּ֖h bְּr֥vּךְ yְhֹvָֽh׃

26.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לָהֶם֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ וַיִּשְׁתּֽוּ׃
26.englishText: Then he made for them a feast, and they ate and drank.
26.transliteration: vַyַּ֤aַshׂ lָhֶם֙ mִshְׁtֶּ֔h vַyֹּakְl֖vּ vַyִּshְׁtּֽvּ׃

26.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣ימוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּשָּׁבְע֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ לְאָחִ֑יו וַיְשַׁלְּחֵ֣ם יִצְחָ֔ק וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ מֵאִתּ֖וֹ בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
26.englishText: Early in the morning, they exchanged oaths. Isaac then bade them farewell, and they departed from him in peace.
26.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkִּ֣ymvּ bַbֹּ֔kֶr vַyִּshָּׁbְa֖vּ aִ֣yshׁ lְaָchִ֑yv vַyְshַׁlְּchֵ֣ם yִtsְchָ֔k vַyֵּlְk֥vּ mֵaִtּ֖vֹ bְּshָׁlֽvֹם׃

26.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ עַבְדֵ֣י יִצְחָ֔ק וַיַּגִּ֣דוּ ל֔וֹ עַל־אֹד֥וֹת הַבְּאֵ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָפָ֑רוּ וַיֹּ֥אמְרוּ ל֖וֹ מָצָ֥אנוּ מָֽיִם׃
26.englishText: That same day Isaac’s servants came and told him about the well they had dug, and said to him, “We have found water!”
26.transliteration: vַyְhִ֣y ׀ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַh֗vּa vַyָּbֹ֙avּ֙ aַbְdֵ֣y yִtsְchָ֔k vַyַּgִּ֣dvּ l֔vֹ aַl־aֹd֥vֹt hַbְּaֵ֖r aֲshֶׁ֣r chָpָ֑rvּ vַyֹּ֥amְrvּ l֖vֹ mָtsָ֥anvּ mָֽyִם׃

26.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֹתָ֖הּ שִׁבְעָ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֤ן שֵׁם־הָעִיר֙ בְּאֵ֣ר שֶׁ֔בַע עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
26.englishText: He named it Shibah;*Shibah As though “oath.” therefore the name of the city is Beer-sheba to this day.
26.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֥a aֹtָ֖hּ shִׁbְaָ֑h aַl־kֵּ֤ן shֵׁם־hָaִyr֙ bְּaֵ֣r shֶׁ֔bַa aַ֖d hַyּ֥vֹם hַzֶּֽh׃ {s}

26.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֤י עֵשָׂו֙ בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וַיִּקַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ אֶת־יְהוּדִ֔ית בַּת־בְּאֵרִ֖י הַֽחִתִּ֑י וְאֶת־בָּ֣שְׂמַ֔ת בַּת־אֵילֹ֖ן הַֽחִתִּֽי׃
26.englishText: When Esau was forty years old, he took to wife Judith daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath daughter of Elon the Hittite;
26.transliteration: vַyְhִ֤y aֵshָׂv֙ bֶּן־aַrְbָּaִ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h vַyִּkַּ֤ch aִshָּׁh֙ aֶt־yְhvּdִ֔yt bַּt־bְּaֵrִ֖y hַֽchִtִּ֑y vְaֶt־bָּ֣shְׂmַ֔t bַּt־aֵylֹ֖ן hַֽchִtִּֽy׃

26.hebrewText: וַתִּהְיֶ֖יןָ מֹ֣רַת ר֑וּחַ לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּלְרִבְקָֽה׃ {ס}
26.englishText: and they were a source of bitterness to Isaac and Rebekah.
26.transliteration: vַtִּhְyֶ֖yןָ mֹ֣rַt r֑vּchַ lְyִtsְchָ֖k vּlְrִbְkָֽh׃ {s}

27.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּֽי־זָקֵ֣ן יִצְחָ֔ק וַתִּכְהֶ֥יןָ עֵינָ֖יו מֵרְאֹ֑ת וַיִּקְרָ֞א אֶת־עֵשָׂ֣ו ׀ בְּנ֣וֹ הַגָּדֹ֗ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ בְּנִ֔י וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו הִנֵּֽנִי׃
27.englishText: When Isaac was old and his eyes were too dim to see, he called his older son Esau and said to him, “My son.” He answered, “Here I am.”
27.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ kִּֽy־zָkֵ֣ן yִtsְchָ֔k vַtִּkְhֶ֥yןָ aֵynָ֖yv mֵrְaֹ֑t vַyִּkְrָ֞a aֶt־aֵshָׂ֣v ׀ bְּn֣vֹ hַgָּdֹ֗l vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֵlָyv֙ bְּnִ֔y vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֵlָ֖yv hִnֵּֽnִy׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּה־נָ֖א זָקַ֑נְתִּי לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְתִּי י֥וֹם מוֹתִֽי׃
27.englishText: And he said, “I am old now, and I do not know how soon I may die.
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr hִnֵּh־nָ֖a zָkַ֑nְtִּy lֹ֥a yָdַ֖aְtִּy y֥vֹם mvֹtִֽy׃

27.hebrewText: וְעַתָּה֙ שָׂא־נָ֣א כֵלֶ֔יךָ תֶּלְיְךָ֖ וְקַשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וְצֵא֙ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וְצ֥וּדָה לִּ֖י (צידה) [צָֽיִד]׃
27.englishText: Take your gear, your quiver and bow, and go out into the open and hunt me some game.
27.transliteration: vְaַtָּh֙ shָׂa־nָ֣a kֵlֶ֔yךָ tֶּlְyְךָ֖ vְkַshְׁtֶּ֑ךָ vְtsֵa֙ hַshָּׂdֶ֔h vְts֥vּdָh lִּ֖y (tsydh) [tsָֽyִd]׃

27.hebrewText: וַעֲשֵׂה־לִ֨י מַטְעַמִּ֜ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אָהַ֛בְתִּי וְהָבִ֥יאָה לִּ֖י וְאֹכֵ֑לָה בַּעֲב֛וּר תְּבָרֶכְךָ֥ נַפְשִׁ֖י בְּטֶ֥רֶם אָמֽוּת׃
27.englishText: Then prepare a dish for me such as I like, and bring it to me to eat, so that I may give you my innermost blessing before I die.”
27.transliteration: vַaֲshֵׂh־lִ֨y mַtְaַmִּ֜yם kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r aָhַ֛bְtִּy vְhָbִ֥yaָh lִּ֖y vְaֹkֵ֑lָh bַּaֲb֛vּr tְּbָrֶkְךָ֥ nַpְshִׁ֖y bְּtֶ֥rֶם aָmֽvּt׃

27.hebrewText: וְרִבְקָ֣ה שֹׁמַ֔עַת בְּדַבֵּ֣ר יִצְחָ֔ק אֶל־עֵשָׂ֖ו בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ עֵשָׂו֙ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לָצ֥וּד צַ֖יִד לְהָבִֽיא׃
27.englishText: Rebekah had been listening as Isaac spoke to his son Esau. When Esau had gone out into the open to hunt game to bring home,
27.transliteration: vְrִbְkָ֣h shֹׁmַ֔aַt bְּdַbֵּ֣r yִtsְchָ֔k aֶl־aֵshָׂ֖v bְּn֑vֹ vַyֵּ֤lֶךְ aֵshָׂv֙ hַshָּׂdֶ֔h lָts֥vּd tsַ֖yִd lְhָbִֽya׃

27.hebrewText: וְרִבְקָה֙ אָֽמְרָ֔ה אֶל־יַעֲקֹ֥ב בְּנָ֖הּ לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֤ה שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־אָבִ֔יךָ מְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶל־עֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִ֖יךָ לֵאמֹֽר׃
27.englishText: Rebekah said to her son Jacob, “I overheard your father speaking to your brother Esau, saying,
27.transliteration: vְrִbְkָh֙ aָֽmְrָ֔h aֶl־yַaֲkֹ֥b bְּnָ֖hּ lֵamֹ֑r hִnֵּ֤h shָׁmַ֙aְtִּy֙ aֶt־aָbִ֔yךָ mְdַbֵּ֛r aֶl־aֵshָׂ֥v aָchִ֖yךָ lֵamֹֽr׃

27.hebrewText: הָבִ֨יאָה לִּ֥י צַ֛יִד וַעֲשֵׂה־לִ֥י מַטְעַמִּ֖ים וְאֹכֵ֑לָה וַאֲבָרֶכְכָ֛ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹתִֽי׃
27.englishText: ‘Bring me some game and prepare a dish for me to eat, that I may bless you, with יהוה’s approval, before I die.’
27.transliteration: hָbִ֨yaָh lִּ֥y tsַ֛yִd vַaֲshֵׂh־lִ֥y mַtְaַmִּ֖yם vְaֹkֵ֑lָh vַaֲbָrֶkְkָ֛h lִpְnֵ֥y yְhֹvָ֖h lִpְnֵ֥y mvֹtִֽy׃

27.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֥ה בְנִ֖י שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלִ֑י לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י מְצַוָּ֥ה אֹתָֽךְ׃
27.englishText: Now, my son, listen carefully as I instruct you.
27.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֥h bְnִ֖y shְׁmַ֣a bְּkֹlִ֑y lַaֲshֶׁ֥r aֲnִ֖y mְtsַvָּ֥h aֹtָֽךְ׃

27.hebrewText: לֶךְ־נָא֙ אֶל־הַצֹּ֔אן וְקַֽח־לִ֣י מִשָּׁ֗ם שְׁנֵ֛י גְּדָיֵ֥י עִזִּ֖ים טֹבִ֑ים וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂ֨ה אֹתָ֧ם מַטְעַמִּ֛ים לְאָבִ֖יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אָהֵֽב׃
27.englishText: Go to the flock and fetch me two choice kids, and I will make of them a dish for your father, such as he likes.
27.transliteration: lֶךְ־nָa֙ aֶl־hַtsֹּ֔aן vְkַֽch־lִ֣y mִshָּׁ֗ם shְׁnֵ֛y gְּdָyֵ֥y aִzִּ֖yם tֹbִ֑yם vְaֶֽaֱshֶׂ֨h aֹtָ֧ם mַtְaַmִּ֛yם lְaָbִ֖yךָ kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r aָhֵֽb׃

27.hebrewText: וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ לְאָבִ֖יךָ וְאָכָ֑ל בַּעֲבֻ֛ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְבָרֶכְךָ֖ לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹתֽוֹ׃
27.englishText: Then take it to your father to eat, in order that he may bless you before he dies.”
27.transliteration: vְhֵbֵatָ֥ lְaָbִ֖yךָ vְaָkָ֑l bַּaֲbֻ֛r aֲshֶׁ֥r yְbָrֶkְךָ֖ lִpְnֵ֥y mvֹtֽvֹ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶל־רִבְקָ֖ה אִמּ֑וֹ הֵ֣ן עֵשָׂ֤ו אָחִי֙ אִ֣ישׁ שָׂעִ֔ר וְאָנֹכִ֖י אִ֥ישׁ חָלָֽק׃
27.englishText: Jacob answered his mother Rebekah, “But my brother Esau is a hairy man and I am smooth-skinned.
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yַaֲkֹ֔b aֶl־rִbְkָ֖h aִmּ֑vֹ hֵ֣ן aֵshָׂ֤v aָchִy֙ aִ֣yshׁ shָׂaִ֔r vְaָnֹkִ֖y aִ֥yshׁ chָlָֽk׃

27.hebrewText: אוּלַ֤י יְמֻשֵּׁ֙נִי֙ אָבִ֔י וְהָיִ֥יתִי בְעֵינָ֖יו כִּמְתַעְתֵּ֑עַ וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י עָלַ֛י קְלָלָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א בְרָכָֽה׃
27.englishText: If my father touches me, I shall appear to him as a trickster and bring upon myself a curse, not a blessing.”
27.transliteration: avּlַ֤y yְmֻshֵּׁ֙nִy֙ aָbִ֔y vְhָyִ֥ytִy bְaֵynָ֖yv kִּmְtַaְtֵּ֑aַ vְhֵbֵatִ֥y aָlַ֛y kְlָlָ֖h vְlֹ֥a bְrָkָֽh׃

27.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אִמּ֔וֹ עָלַ֥י קִלְלָתְךָ֖ בְּנִ֑י אַ֛ךְ שְׁמַ֥ע בְּקֹלִ֖י וְלֵ֥ךְ קַֽח־לִֽי׃
27.englishText: But his mother said to him, “Your curse, my son, be upon me! Just do as I say and go fetch them for me.”
27.transliteration: vַtֹּ֤amֶr lvֹ֙ aִmּ֔vֹ aָlַ֥y kִlְlָtְךָ֖ bְּnִ֑y aַ֛ךְ shְׁmַ֥a bְּkֹlִ֖y vְlֵ֥ךְ kַֽch־lִֽy׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ וַיִּקַּ֔ח וַיָּבֵ֖א לְאִמּ֑וֹ וַתַּ֤עַשׂ אִמּוֹ֙ מַטְעַמִּ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָהֵ֥ב אָבִֽיו׃
27.englishText: He got them and brought them to his mother, and his mother prepared a dish such as his father liked.
27.transliteration: vַyֵּ֙lֶךְ֙ vַyִּkַּ֔ch vַyָּbֵ֖a lְaִmּ֑vֹ vַtַּ֤aַshׂ aִmּvֹ֙ mַtְaַmִּ֔yם kַּaֲshֶׁ֖r aָhֵ֥b aָbִֽyv׃

27.hebrewText: וַתִּקַּ֣ח רִ֠בְקָ֠ה אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֨י עֵשָׂ֜ו בְּנָ֤הּ הַגָּדֹל֙ הַחֲמֻדֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתָּ֖הּ בַּבָּ֑יִת וַתַּלְבֵּ֥שׁ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֖ב בְּנָ֥הּ הַקָּטָֽן׃
27.englishText: Rebekah then took the best clothes of her older son Esau, which were there*there Or “in her charge”—an acknowledgment of authority; Heb. ’itah, lit. “with her.” in the house, and had her younger son Jacob put them on;
27.transliteration: vַtִּkַּ֣ch rִ֠bְkָ֠h aֶt־bִּgְdֵ֨y aֵshָׂ֜v bְּnָ֤hּ hַgָּdֹl֙ hַchֲmֻdֹ֔t aֲshֶׁ֥r aִtָּ֖hּ bַּbָּ֑yִt vַtַּlְbֵּ֥shׁ aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹ֖b bְּnָ֥hּ hַkָּtָֽן׃

27.hebrewText: וְאֵ֗ת עֹרֹת֙ גְּדָיֵ֣י הָֽעִזִּ֔ים הִלְבִּ֖ישָׁה עַל־יָדָ֑יו וְעַ֖ל חֶלְקַ֥ת צַוָּארָֽיו׃
27.englishText: and she covered his hands and the hairless part of his neck with the skins of the kids.
27.transliteration: vְaֵ֗t aֹrֹt֙ gְּdָyֵ֣y hָֽaִzִּ֔yם hִlְbִּ֖yshָׁh aַl־yָdָ֑yv vְaַ֖l chֶlְkַ֥t tsַvָּarָֽyv׃

27.hebrewText: וַתִּתֵּ֧ן אֶת־הַמַּטְעַמִּ֛ים וְאֶת־הַלֶּ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑תָה בְּיַ֖ד יַעֲקֹ֥ב בְּנָֽהּ׃
27.englishText: Then she put in the hands of her son Jacob the dish and the bread that she had prepared.
27.transliteration: vַtִּtֵּ֧ן aֶt־hַmַּtְaַmִּ֛yם vְaֶt־hַlֶּ֖chֶם aֲshֶׁ֣r aָshָׂ֑tָh bְּyַ֖d yַaֲkֹ֥b bְּnָֽhּ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֥א אֶל־אָבִ֖יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אָבִ֑י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הִנֶּ֔נִּי מִ֥י אַתָּ֖ה בְּנִֽי׃
27.englishText: He went to his father and said, “Father.” And he said, “Yes, which of my sons are you?”
27.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֥a aֶl־aָbִ֖yv vַyֹּ֣amֶr aָbִ֑y vַyֹּ֣amֶr hִnֶּ֔nִּy mִ֥y aַtָּ֖h bְּnִֽy׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶל־אָבִ֗יו אָנֹכִי֙ עֵשָׂ֣ו בְּכֹרֶ֔ךָ עָשִׂ֕יתִי כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ אֵלָ֑י קֽוּם־נָ֣א שְׁבָ֗ה וְאׇכְלָה֙ מִצֵּידִ֔י בַּעֲב֖וּר תְּבָרְכַ֥נִּי נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
27.englishText: Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau, your first-born; I have done as you told me. Pray sit up and eat of my game, that you may give me your innermost blessing.”
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yַaֲkֹ֜b aֶl־aָbִ֗yv aָnֹkִy֙ aֵshָׂ֣v bְּkֹrֶ֔ךָ aָshִׂ֕ytִy kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbַּ֖rְtָּ aֵlָ֑y kֽvּם־nָ֣a shְׁbָ֗h vְaׇkְlָh֙ mִtsֵּydִ֔y bַּaֲb֖vּr tְּbָrְkַ֥nִּy nַpְshֶֽׁךָ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִצְחָק֙ אֶל־בְּנ֔וֹ מַה־זֶּ֛ה מִהַ֥רְתָּ לִמְצֹ֖א בְּנִ֑י וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֥י הִקְרָ֛ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְפָנָֽי׃
27.englishText: Isaac said to his son, “How did you succeed so quickly, my son?” And he said, “Because your God יהוה granted me good fortune.”
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yִtsְchָk֙ aֶl־bְּn֔vֹ mַh־zֶּ֛h mִhַ֥rְtָּ lִmְtsֹ֖a bְּnִ֑y vַyֹּ֕amֶr kִּ֥y hִkְrָ֛h yְhֹvָ֥h aֱlֹhֶ֖yךָ lְpָnָֽy׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִצְחָק֙ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֔ב גְּשָׁה־נָּ֥א וַאֲמֻֽשְׁךָ֖ בְּנִ֑י הַֽאַתָּ֥ה זֶ֛ה בְּנִ֥י עֵשָׂ֖ו אִם־לֹֽא׃
27.englishText: Isaac said to Jacob, “Come closer that I may feel you, my son—whether you are really my son Esau or not.”
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yִtsְchָk֙ aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֔b gְּshָׁh־nָּ֥a vַaֲmֻֽshְׁךָ֖ bְּnִ֑y hַֽaַtָּ֥h zֶ֛h bְּnִ֥y aֵshָׂ֖v aִם־lֹֽa׃

27.hebrewText: וַיִּגַּ֧שׁ יַעֲקֹ֛ב אֶל־יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו וַיְמֻשֵּׁ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הַקֹּל֙ ק֣וֹל יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְהַיָּדַ֖יִם יְדֵ֥י עֵשָֽׂו׃
27.englishText: So Jacob drew close to his father Isaac, who felt him and wondered. “The voice is the voice of Jacob, yet the hands are the hands of Esau.”
27.transliteration: vַyִּgַּ֧shׁ yַaֲkֹ֛b aֶl־yִtsְchָ֥k aָbִ֖yv vַyְmֻshֵּׁ֑hvּ vַyֹּ֗amֶr hַkֹּl֙ k֣vֹl yַaֲkֹ֔b vְhַyָּdַ֖yִם yְdֵ֥y aֵshָֽׂv׃

27.hebrewText: וְלֹ֣א הִכִּיר֔וֹ כִּֽי־הָי֣וּ יָדָ֗יו כִּידֵ֛י עֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִ֖יו שְׂעִרֹ֑ת וַֽיְבָרְכֵֽהוּ׃
27.englishText: He did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like those of his brother Esau; and so he blessed him.
27.transliteration: vְlֹ֣a hִkִּyr֔vֹ kִּֽy־hָy֣vּ yָdָ֗yv kִּydֵ֛y aֵshָׂ֥v aָchִ֖yv shְׂaִrֹ֑t vַֽyְbָrְkֵֽhvּ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אַתָּ֥ה זֶ֖ה בְּנִ֣י עֵשָׂ֑ו וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָֽנִי׃
27.englishText: He asked, “Are you really my son Esau?” And when he said, “I am,”
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr aַtָּ֥h zֶ֖h bְּnִ֣y aֵshָׂ֑v vַyֹּ֖amֶr aָֽnִy׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הַגִּ֤שָׁה לִּי֙ וְאֹֽכְלָה֙ מִצֵּ֣יד בְּנִ֔י לְמַ֥עַן תְּבָֽרֶכְךָ֖ נַפְשִׁ֑י וַיַּגֶּשׁ־לוֹ֙ וַיֹּאכַ֔ל וַיָּ֧בֵא ל֦וֹ יַ֖יִן וַיֵּֽשְׁתְּ׃
27.englishText: he said, “Serve me and let me eat of my son’s game that I may give you my innermost blessing.” So he served him and he ate, and he brought him wine and he drank.
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr hַgִּ֤shָׁh lִּy֙ vְaֹֽkְlָh֙ mִtsֵּ֣yd bְּnִ֔y lְmַ֥aַן tְּbָֽrֶkְךָ֖ nַpְshִׁ֑y vַyַּgֶּshׁ־lvֹ֙ vַyֹּakַ֔l vַyָּ֧bֵa l֦vֹ yַ֖yִן vַyֵּֽshְׁtְּ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו יִצְחָ֣ק אָבִ֑יו גְּשָׁה־נָּ֥א וּשְׁקָה־לִּ֖י בְּנִֽי׃
27.englishText: Then his father Isaac said to him, “Come close and kiss me, my son”;
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֵlָ֖yv yִtsְchָ֣k aָbִ֑yv gְּshָׁh־nָּ֥a vּshְׁkָh־lִּ֖y bְּnִֽy׃

27.hebrewText: וַיִּגַּשׁ֙ וַיִּשַּׁק־ל֔וֹ וַיָּ֛רַח אֶת־רֵ֥יחַ בְּגָדָ֖יו וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר רְאֵה֙ רֵ֣יחַ בְּנִ֔י כְּרֵ֣יחַ שָׂדֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּרְכ֖וֹ יְהֹוָֽה׃
27.englishText: and he went up and kissed him. And he smelled his clothes and he blessed him, saying, “Ah, the smell of my son is like the smell of the fields that יהוה has blessed.
27.transliteration: vַyִּgַּshׁ֙ vַyִּshַּׁk־l֔vֹ vַyָּ֛rַch aֶt־rֵ֥ychַ bְּgָdָ֖yv vַֽyְbָrְkֵ֑hvּ vַyֹּ֗amֶr rְaֵh֙ rֵ֣ychַ bְּnִ֔y kְּrֵ֣ychַ shָׂdֶ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r bֵּrְk֖vֹ yְhֹvָֽh׃

27.hebrewText: וְיִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֙ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מִטַּל֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּמִשְׁמַנֵּ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְרֹ֥ב דָּגָ֖ן וְתִירֹֽשׁ׃
27.englishText:
“May God give you
Of the dew of heaven and the fat of the earth,
Abundance of new grain and wine.
27.transliteration: vְyִֽtֶּן־lְךָ֙ hָaֱlֹhִ֔yם mִtַּl֙ hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם vּmִshְׁmַnֵּ֖y hָaָ֑rֶץ vְrֹ֥b dָּgָ֖ן vְtִyrֹֽshׁ׃

27.hebrewText: יַֽעַבְד֣וּךָ עַמִּ֗ים (וישתחו) [וְיִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֤וּ] לְךָ֙ לְאֻמִּ֔ים הֱוֵ֤ה גְבִיר֙ לְאַחֶ֔יךָ וְיִשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לְךָ֖ בְּנֵ֣י אִמֶּ֑ךָ אֹרְרֶ֣יךָ אָר֔וּר וּֽמְבָרְכֶ֖יךָ בָּרֽוּךְ׃
27.englishText:
Let peoples serve you,
And nations bow to you;
Be master over your brothers,
And let your mother’s sons bow to you.
Cursed be they who curse you,
Blessed they who bless you.”
27.transliteration: yַֽaַbְd֣vּךָ aַmִּ֗yם (vyshtchv) [vְyִֽshְׁtַּchֲv֤vּ] lְךָ֙ lְaֻmִּ֔yם hֱvֵ֤h gְbִyr֙ lְaַchֶ֔yךָ vְyִshְׁtַּchֲv֥vּ lְךָ֖ bְּnֵ֣y aִmֶּ֑ךָ aֹrְrֶ֣yךָ aָr֔vּr vּֽmְbָrְkֶ֖yךָ bָּrֽvּךְ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר כִּלָּ֣ה יִצְחָק֮ לְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹב֒ וַיְהִ֗י אַ֣ךְ יָצֹ֤א יָצָא֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב מֵאֵ֥ת פְּנֵ֖י יִצְחָ֣ק אָבִ֑יו וְעֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֔יו בָּ֖א מִצֵּידֽוֹ׃
27.englishText: No sooner had Jacob left the presence of his father Isaac—after Isaac had finished blessing Jacob—than his brother Esau came back from his hunt.
27.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y kַּaֲshֶׁ֨r kִּlָּ֣h yִtsְchָk֮ lְbָrֵ֣ךְ aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹb֒ vַyְhִ֗y aַ֣ךְ yָtsֹ֤a yָtsָa֙ yַaֲkֹ֔b mֵaֵ֥t pְּnֵ֖y yִtsְchָ֣k aָbִ֑yv vְaֵshָׂ֣v aָchִ֔yv bָּ֖a mִtsֵּydֽvֹ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ גַּם־הוּא֙ מַטְעַמִּ֔ים וַיָּבֵ֖א לְאָבִ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאָבִ֗יו יָקֻ֤ם אָבִי֙ וְיֹאכַל֙ מִצֵּ֣יד בְּנ֔וֹ בַּעֲבֻ֖ר תְּבָרְכַ֥נִּי נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
27.englishText: He too prepared a dish and brought it to his father. And he said to his father, “Let my father sit up and eat of his son’s game, so that you may give me your innermost blessing.”
27.transliteration: vַyַּ֤aַshׂ gַּם־hvּa֙ mַtְaַmִּ֔yם vַyָּbֵ֖a lְaָbִ֑yv vַyֹּ֣amֶr lְaָbִ֗yv yָkֻ֤ם aָbִy֙ vְyֹakַl֙ mִtsֵּ֣yd bְּn֔vֹ bַּaֲbֻ֖r tְּbָrְkַ֥nִּy nַpְshֶֽׁךָ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֛וֹ יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו מִי־אָ֑תָּה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֲנִ֛י בִּנְךָ֥ בְכֹֽרְךָ֖ עֵשָֽׂו׃
27.englishText: His father Isaac said to him, “Who are you?” And he said, “I am your son, Esau, your first-born!”
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr l֛vֹ yִtsְchָ֥k aָbִ֖yv mִy־aָ֑tָּh vַyֹּ֕amֶr aֲnִ֛y bִּnְךָ֥ bְkֹֽrְךָ֖ aֵshָֽׂv׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֶּחֱרַ֨ד יִצְחָ֣ק חֲרָדָה֮ גְּדֹלָ֣ה עַד־מְאֹד֒ וַיֹּ֡אמֶר מִֽי־אֵפ֡וֹא ה֣וּא הַצָּֽד־צַ֩יִד֩ וַיָּ֨בֵא לִ֜י וָאֹכַ֥ל מִכֹּ֛ל בְּטֶ֥רֶם תָּב֖וֹא וָאֲבָרְכֵ֑הוּ גַּם־בָּר֖וּךְ יִהְיֶֽה׃
27.englishText: Isaac was seized with very violent trembling. “Who was it then,” he demanded, “that hunted game and brought it to me? Moreover, I ate of it before you came, and I blessed him; now he must remain blessed!”
27.transliteration: vַyֶּchֱrַ֨d yִtsְchָ֣k chֲrָdָh֮ gְּdֹlָ֣h aַd־mְaֹd֒ vַyֹּ֡amֶr mִֽy־aֵp֡vֹa h֣vּa hַtsָּֽd־tsַ֩yִd֩ vַyָּ֨bֵa lִ֜y vָaֹkַ֥l mִkֹּ֛l bְּtֶ֥rֶם tָּb֖vֹa vָaֲbָrְkֵ֑hvּ gַּם־bָּr֖vּךְ yִhְyֶֽh׃

27.hebrewText: כִּשְׁמֹ֤עַ עֵשָׂו֙ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י אָבִ֔יו וַיִּצְעַ֣ק צְעָקָ֔ה גְּדֹלָ֥ה וּמָרָ֖ה עַד־מְאֹ֑ד וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאָבִ֔יו בָּרְכֵ֥נִי גַם־אָ֖נִי אָבִֽי׃
27.englishText: When Esau heard his father’s words, he burst into wild and bitter sobbing, and said to his father, “Bless me too, Father!”
27.transliteration: kִּshְׁmֹ֤aַ aֵshָׂv֙ aֶt־dִּbְrֵ֣y aָbִ֔yv vַyִּtsְaַ֣k tsְaָkָ֔h gְּdֹlָ֥h vּmָrָ֖h aַd־mְaֹ֑d vַyֹּ֣amֶr lְaָbִ֔yv bָּrְkֵ֥nִy gַם־aָ֖nִy aָbִֽy׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בָּ֥א אָחִ֖יךָ בְּמִרְמָ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֖ח בִּרְכָתֶֽךָ׃
27.englishText: But he answered, “Your brother came with guile and took away your blessing.”
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr bָּ֥a aָchִ֖yךָ bְּmִrְmָ֑h vַyִּkַּ֖ch bִּrְkָtֶֽךָ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר הֲכִי֩ קָרָ֨א שְׁמ֜וֹ יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַֽיַּעְקְבֵ֙נִי֙ זֶ֣ה פַעֲמַ֔יִם אֶת־בְּכֹרָתִ֣י לָקָ֔ח וְהִנֵּ֥ה עַתָּ֖ה לָקַ֣ח בִּרְכָתִ֑י וַיֹּאמַ֕ר הֲלֹא־אָצַ֥לְתָּ לִּ֖י בְּרָכָֽה׃
27.englishText: [Esau] said, “Was he, then, named Jacob that he might supplant*supplant Heb. ‘aqab, connected with “Jacob.” me these two times? First he took away my birthright and now he has taken away my blessing!” And he added, “Have you not reserved a blessing for me?”
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֡amֶr hֲkִy֩ kָrָ֨a shְׁm֜vֹ yַaֲkֹ֗b vַֽyַּaְkְbֵ֙nִy֙ zֶ֣h pַaֲmַ֔yִם aֶt־bְּkֹrָtִ֣y lָkָ֔ch vְhִnֵּ֥h aַtָּ֖h lָkַ֣ch bִּrְkָtִ֑y vַyֹּamַ֕r hֲlֹa־aָtsַ֥lְtָּ lִּ֖y bְּrָkָֽh׃

27.hebrewText: וַיַּ֨עַן יִצְחָ֜ק וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְעֵשָׂ֗ו הֵ֣ן גְּבִ֞יר שַׂמְתִּ֥יו לָךְ֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֶחָ֗יו נָתַ֤תִּי לוֹ֙ לַעֲבָדִ֔ים וְדָגָ֥ן וְתִירֹ֖שׁ סְמַכְתִּ֑יו וּלְכָ֣ה אֵפ֔וֹא מָ֥ה אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה בְּנִֽי׃
27.englishText: Isaac answered, saying to Esau, “But I have made him master over you: I have given him all his brothers for servants, and sustained him with grain and wine. What, then, can I still do for you, my son?”
27.transliteration: vַyַּ֨aַן yִtsְchָ֜k vַyֹּ֣amֶr lְaֵshָׂ֗v hֵ֣ן gְּbִ֞yr shַׂmְtִּ֥yv lָךְ֙ vְaֶt־kׇּl־aֶchָ֗yv nָtַ֤tִּy lvֹ֙ lַaֲbָdִ֔yם vְdָgָ֥ן vְtִyrֹ֖shׁ sְmַkְtִּ֑yv vּlְkָ֣h aֵp֔vֹa mָ֥h aֶֽaֱshֶׂ֖h bְּnִֽy׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו אֶל־אָבִ֗יו הַֽבְרָכָ֨ה אַחַ֤ת הִֽוא־לְךָ֙ אָבִ֔י בָּרְכֵ֥נִי גַם־אָ֖נִי אָבִ֑י וַיִּשָּׂ֥א עֵשָׂ֛ו קֹל֖וֹ וַיֵּֽבְךְּ׃
27.englishText: And Esau said to his father, “Have you but one blessing, Father? Bless me too, Father!” And Esau wept aloud.
27.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֵshָׂ֜v aֶl־aָbִ֗yv hַֽbְrָkָ֨h aַchַ֤t hִֽva־lְךָ֙ aָbִ֔y bָּrְkֵ֥nִy gַם־aָ֖nִy aָbִ֑y vַyִּshָּׂ֥a aֵshָׂ֛v kֹl֖vֹ vַyֵּֽbְךְּ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיַּ֛עַן יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו הִנֵּ֞ה מִשְׁמַנֵּ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה מֽוֹשָׁבֶ֔ךָ וּמִטַּ֥ל הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם מֵעָֽל׃
27.englishText:
And his father Isaac answered, saying to him,
“See, your abode shall enjoy the fat of the earth
And*enjoy the fat of the earth / And Others “be away from the fat of the earth and from.” the dew of heaven above.
27.transliteration: vַyַּ֛aַן yִtsְchָ֥k aָbִ֖yv vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵlָ֑yv hִnֵּ֞h mִshְׁmַnֵּ֤y hָaָ֙rֶץ֙ yִhְyֶ֣h mֽvֹshָׁbֶ֔ךָ vּmִtַּ֥l hַshָּׁmַ֖yִם mֵaָֽl׃

27.hebrewText: וְעַל־חַרְבְּךָ֣ תִֽחְיֶ֔ה וְאֶת־אָחִ֖יךָ תַּעֲבֹ֑ד וְהָיָה֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּרִ֔יד וּפָרַקְתָּ֥ עֻלּ֖וֹ מֵעַ֥ל צַוָּארֶֽךָ׃
27.englishText:
Yet by your sword you shall live,
And you shall serve your brother;
But when you grow restive,
You shall break his yoke from your neck.”
27.transliteration: vְaַl־chַrְbְּךָ֣ tִֽchְyֶ֔h vְaֶt־aָchִ֖yךָ tַּaֲbֹ֑d vְhָyָh֙ kַּaֲshֶׁ֣r tָּrִ֔yd vּpָrַkְtָּ֥ aֻlּ֖vֹ mֵaַ֥l tsַvָּarֶֽךָ׃

27.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׂטֹ֤ם עֵשָׂו֙ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב עַ֨ל־הַבְּרָכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּרְכ֖וֹ אָבִ֑יו וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו בְּלִבּ֗וֹ יִקְרְבוּ֙ יְמֵי֙ אֵ֣בֶל אָבִ֔י וְאַֽהַרְגָ֖ה אֶת־יַעֲקֹ֥ב אָחִֽי׃
27.englishText: Now Esau harbored a grudge against Jacob because of the blessing which his father had given him, and Esau said to himself, “Let but the mourning period of my father come, and I will kill my brother Jacob.”
27.transliteration: vַyִּshְׂtֹ֤ם aֵshָׂv֙ aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹ֔b aַ֨l־hַbְּrָkָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r bֵּrְk֖vֹ aָbִ֑yv vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֵshָׂ֜v bְּlִbּ֗vֹ yִkְrְbvּ֙ yְmֵy֙ aֵ֣bֶl aָbִ֔y vְaַֽhַrְgָ֖h aֶt־yַaֲkֹ֥b aָchִֽy׃

27.hebrewText: וַיֻּגַּ֣ד לְרִבְקָ֔ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י עֵשָׂ֖ו בְּנָ֣הּ הַגָּדֹ֑ל וַתִּשְׁלַ֞ח וַתִּקְרָ֤א לְיַעֲקֹב֙ בְּנָ֣הּ הַקָּטָ֔ן וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּה֙ עֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֔יךָ מִתְנַחֵ֥ם לְךָ֖ לְהׇרְגֶֽךָ׃
27.englishText: When the words of her older son Esau were reported to Rebekah, she sent for her younger son Jacob and said to him, “Your brother Esau is consoling himself by planning to kill you.
27.transliteration: vַyֻּgַּ֣d lְrִbְkָ֔h aֶt־dִּbְrֵ֥y aֵshָׂ֖v bְּnָ֣hּ hַgָּdֹ֑l vַtִּshְׁlַ֞ch vַtִּkְrָ֤a lְyַaֲkֹb֙ bְּnָ֣hּ hַkָּtָ֔ן vַtֹּ֣amֶr aֵlָ֔yv hִnֵּh֙ aֵshָׂ֣v aָchִ֔yךָ mִtְnַchֵ֥ם lְךָ֖ lְhׇrְgֶֽךָ׃

27.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֥ה בְנִ֖י שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלִ֑י וְק֧וּם בְּרַח־לְךָ֛ אֶל־לָבָ֥ן אָחִ֖י חָרָֽנָה׃
27.englishText: Now, my son, listen to me. Flee at once to Haran, to my brother Laban.
27.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֥h bְnִ֖y shְׁmַ֣a bְּkֹlִ֑y vְk֧vּם bְּrַch־lְךָ֛ aֶl־lָbָ֥ן aָchִ֖y chָrָֽnָh׃

27.hebrewText: וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֥ עִמּ֖וֹ יָמִ֣ים אֲחָדִ֑ים עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־תָּשׁ֖וּב חֲמַ֥ת אָחִֽיךָ׃
27.englishText: Stay with him a while, until your brother’s fury subsides—
27.transliteration: vְyָshַׁbְtָּ֥ aִmּ֖vֹ yָmִ֣yם aֲchָdִ֑yם aַ֥d aֲshֶׁr־tָּshׁ֖vּb chֲmַ֥t aָchִֽyךָ׃

27.hebrewText: עַד־שׁ֨וּב אַף־אָחִ֜יךָ מִמְּךָ֗ וְשָׁכַח֙ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֖י וּלְקַחְתִּ֣יךָ מִשָּׁ֑ם לָמָ֥ה אֶשְׁכַּ֛ל גַּם־שְׁנֵיכֶ֖ם י֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃
27.englishText: until your brother’s anger against you subsides—and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will fetch you from there. Let me not lose you both in one day!”
27.transliteration: aַd־shׁ֨vּb aַף־aָchִ֜yךָ mִmְּךָ֗ vְshָׁkַch֙ aֵ֣t aֲshֶׁr־aָshִׂ֣ytָ lּ֔vֹ vְshָׁlַchְtִּ֖y vּlְkַchְtִּ֣yךָ mִshָּׁ֑ם lָmָ֥h aֶshְׁkַּ֛l gַּם־shְׁnֵykֶ֖ם y֥vֹם aֶchָֽd׃

27.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר רִבְקָה֙ אֶל־יִצְחָ֔ק <small>קַ֣</small>צְתִּי בְחַיַּ֔י מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנ֣וֹת חֵ֑ת אִם־לֹקֵ֣חַ יַ֠עֲקֹ֠ב אִשָּׁ֨ה מִבְּנֽוֹת־חֵ֤ת כָּאֵ֙לֶּה֙ מִבְּנ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ לָ֥מָּה לִּ֖י חַיִּֽים׃
27.englishText: Rebekah said to Isaac, “I am disgusted with my life because of the Hittite women. If Jacob marries a Hittite woman like these, from among the native women, what good will life be to me?”
27.transliteration: vַtֹּ֤amֶr rִbְkָh֙ aֶl־yִtsְchָ֔k <small>kַ֣</small>tsְtִּy bְchַyַּ֔y mִpְּnֵ֖y bְּn֣vֹt chֵ֑t aִם־lֹkֵ֣chַ yַ֠aֲkֹ֠b aִshָּׁ֨h mִbְּnֽvֹt־chֵ֤t kָּaֵ֙lֶּh֙ mִbְּn֣vֹt hָaָ֔rֶץ lָ֥mָּh lִּ֖y chַyִּֽyם׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֥א יִצְחָ֛ק אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹת֑וֹ וַיְצַוֵּ֙הוּ֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ לֹֽא־תִקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
28.englishText: So Isaac sent for Jacob and blessed him. He instructed him, saying, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women.
28.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֥a yִtsְchָ֛k aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֖b vַyְbָ֣rֶךְ aֹt֑vֹ vַyְtsַvֵּ֙hvּ֙ vַyֹּ֣amֶr l֔vֹ lֹֽa־tִkַּ֥ch aִshָּׁ֖h mִbְּn֥vֹt kְּnָֽaַן׃

28.hebrewText: ק֥וּם לֵךְ֙ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֔ם בֵּ֥יתָה בְתוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִ֣י אִמֶּ֑ךָ וְקַח־לְךָ֤ מִשָּׁם֙ אִשָּׁ֔ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֥י אִמֶּֽךָ׃
28.englishText: Up, go to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father, and take a wife there from among the daughters of Laban, your mother’s brother.
28.transliteration: k֥vּם lֵךְ֙ pַּdֶּ֣nָֽh aֲrָ֔ם bֵּ֥ytָh bְtvּaֵ֖l aֲbִ֣y aִmֶּ֑ךָ vְkַch־lְךָ֤ mִshָּׁם֙ aִshָּׁ֔h mִbְּn֥vֹt lָbָ֖ן aֲchִ֥y aִmֶּֽךָ׃

28.hebrewText: וְאֵ֤ל שַׁדַּי֙ יְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֹֽתְךָ֔ וְיַפְרְךָ֖ וְיַרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְהָיִ֖יתָ לִקְהַ֥ל עַמִּֽים׃
28.englishText: May El Shaddai*El Shaddai See note at 17.1. bless you, make you fertile and numerous, so that you become an assembly of peoples.
28.transliteration: vְaֵ֤l shַׁdַּy֙ yְbָrֵ֣ךְ aֹֽtְךָ֔ vְyַpְrְךָ֖ vְyַrְbֶּ֑ךָ vְhָyִ֖ytָ lִkְhַ֥l aַmִּֽyם׃

28.hebrewText: וְיִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֙ אֶת־בִּרְכַּ֣ת אַבְרָהָ֔ם לְךָ֖ וּלְזַרְעֲךָ֣ אִתָּ֑ךְ לְרִשְׁתְּךָ֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מְגֻרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְאַבְרָהָֽם׃
28.englishText: May you and your offspring be granted the blessing of Abraham, that you may possess the land where you are sojourning, which God assigned to Abraham.”
28.transliteration: vְyִֽtֶּן־lְךָ֙ aֶt־bִּrְkַּ֣t aַbְrָhָ֔ם lְךָ֖ vּlְzַrְaֲךָ֣ aִtָּ֑ךְ lְrִshְׁtְּךָ֙ aֶt־aֶ֣rֶץ mְgֻrֶ֔yךָ aֲshֶׁr־nָtַ֥ן aֱlֹhִ֖yם lְaַbְrָhָֽם׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יִצְחָק֙ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֑ם אֶל־לָבָ֤ן בֶּן־בְּתוּאֵל֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּ֔י אֲחִ֣י רִבְקָ֔ה אֵ֥ם יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְעֵשָֽׂו׃
28.englishText: Then Isaac sent Jacob off, and he went to Paddan-aram, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, mother of Jacob and Esau.
28.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁlַ֤ch yִtsְchָk֙ aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹ֔b vַyֵּ֖lֶךְ pַּdֶּ֣nָֽh aֲrָ֑ם aֶl־lָbָ֤ן bֶּן־bְּtvּaֵl֙ hָֽaֲrַmִּ֔y aֲchִ֣y rִbְkָ֔h aֵ֥ם yַaֲkֹ֖b vְaֵshָֽׂv׃

28.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣רְא עֵשָׂ֗ו כִּֽי־בֵרַ֣ךְ יִצְחָק֮ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹב֒ וְשִׁלַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֔ם לָקַֽחַת־ל֥וֹ מִשָּׁ֖ם אִשָּׁ֑ה בְּבָרְכ֣וֹ אֹת֔וֹ וַיְצַ֤ו עָלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹֽא־תִקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
28.englishText: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him off to Paddan-aram to take a wife from there, charging him, as he blessed him, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women,”
28.transliteration: vַyַּ֣rְa aֵshָׂ֗v kִּֽy־bֵrַ֣ךְ yִtsְchָk֮ aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹb֒ vְshִׁlַּ֤ch aֹtvֹ֙ pַּdֶּ֣nָֽh aֲrָ֔ם lָkַֽchַt־l֥vֹ mִshָּׁ֖ם aִshָּׁ֑h bְּbָrְk֣vֹ aֹt֔vֹ vַyְtsַ֤v aָlָyv֙ lֵamֹ֔r lֹֽa־tִkַּ֥ch aִshָּׁ֖h mִbְּn֥vֹt kְּnָֽaַן׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶל־אָבִ֖יו וְאֶל־אִמּ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ פַּדֶּ֥נָֽה אֲרָֽם׃
28.englishText: and that Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and gone to Paddan-aram,
28.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֣a yַaֲkֹ֔b aֶl־aָbִ֖yv vְaֶl־aִmּ֑vֹ vַyֵּ֖lֶךְ pַּdֶּ֥nָֽh aֲrָֽם׃

28.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣רְא עֵשָׂ֔ו כִּ֥י רָע֖וֹת בְּנ֣וֹת כְּנָ֑עַן בְּעֵינֵ֖י יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִֽיו׃
28.englishText: Esau realized that the Canaanite women displeased his father Isaac.
28.transliteration: vַyַּ֣rְa aֵshָׂ֔v kִּ֥y rָa֖vֹt bְּn֣vֹt kְּnָ֑aַן bְּaֵynֵ֖y yִtsְchָ֥k aָbִֽyv׃

28.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ עֵשָׂ֖ו אֶל־יִשְׁמָעֵ֑אל וַיִּקַּ֡ח אֶֽת־מָחֲלַ֣ת ׀ בַּת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֨אל בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֲח֧וֹת נְבָי֛וֹת עַל־נָשָׁ֖יו ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
28.englishText: So Esau went to Ishmael and took to wife, in addition to the wives he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael son of Abraham, sister of Nebaioth.
28.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥lֶךְ aֵshָׂ֖v aֶl־yִshְׁmָaֵ֑al vַyִּkַּ֡ch aֶֽt־mָchֲlַ֣t ׀ bַּt־yִshְׁmָaֵ֨al bֶּן־aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֲch֧vֹt nְbָy֛vֹt aַl־nָshָׁ֖yv l֥vֹ lְaִshָּֽׁh׃ {s}

28.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִבְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ חָרָֽנָה׃
28.englishText: Jacob left Beer-sheba, and set out for Haran.
28.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֥a yַaֲkֹ֖b mִbְּaֵ֣r shָׁ֑bַa vַyֵּ֖lֶךְ chָrָֽnָh׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּפְגַּ֨ע בַּמָּק֜וֹם וַיָּ֤לֶן שָׁם֙ כִּי־בָ֣א הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ וַיִּקַּח֙ מ��אַבְנֵ֣י הַמָּק֔וֹם וַיָּ֖שֶׂם מְרַֽאֲשֹׁתָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁכַּ֖ב בַּמָּק֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
28.englishText: He came upon a certain place and stopped there for the night, for the sun had set. Taking one of the stones of that place, he put it under his head and lay down in that place.
28.transliteration: vַyִּpְgַּ֨a bַּmָּk֜vֹם vַyָּ֤lֶן shָׁם֙ kִּy־bָ֣a hַshֶּׁ֔mֶshׁ vַyִּkַּch֙ m��aַbְnֵ֣y hַmָּk֔vֹם vַyָּ֖shֶׂם mְrַֽaֲshֹׁtָ֑yv vַyִּshְׁkַּ֖b bַּmָּk֥vֹם hַhֽvּa׃

28.hebrewText: וַֽיַּחֲלֹ֗ם וְהִנֵּ֤ה סֻלָּם֙ מֻצָּ֣ב אַ֔רְצָה וְרֹאשׁ֖וֹ מַגִּ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמָ֑יְמָה וְהִנֵּה֙ מַלְאֲכֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֔ים עֹלִ֥ים וְיֹרְדִ֖ים בּֽוֹ׃
28.englishText: He had a dream; a stairway*stairway Or “ramp”; others “ladder.” Heb. sullam. was set on the ground and its top reached to the sky, and messengers of God were going up and down on it.
28.transliteration: vַֽyַּchֲlֹ֗ם vְhִnֵּ֤h sֻlָּם֙ mֻtsָּ֣b aַ֔rְtsָh vְrֹashׁ֖vֹ mַgִּ֣yaַ hַshָּׁmָ֑yְmָh vְhִnֵּh֙ mַlְaֲkֵ֣y aֱlֹhִ֔yם aֹlִ֥yם vְyֹrְdִ֖yם bּֽvֹ׃

28.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה נִצָּ֣ב עָלָיו֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֔יךָ וֵאלֹהֵ֖י יִצְחָ֑ק הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ שֹׁכֵ֣ב עָלֶ֔יהָ לְךָ֥ אֶתְּנֶ֖נָּה וּלְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
28.englishText: And standing beside him was יהוה, who said, “I am יהוה, the God of your father Abraham’s [house] and the God of Isaac’s [house]: the ground on which you are lying I will assign to you and to your offspring.
28.transliteration: vְhִnֵּ֨h yְhֹvָ֜h nִtsָּ֣b aָlָyv֮ vַyֹּamַr֒ aֲnִ֣y yְhֹvָ֗h aֱlֹhֵy֙ aַbְrָhָ֣ם aָbִ֔yךָ vֵalֹhֵ֖y yִtsְchָ֑k hָaָ֗rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֤r aַtָּh֙ shֹׁkֵ֣b aָlֶ֔yhָ lְךָ֥ aֶtְּnֶ֖nָּh vּlְzַrְaֶֽךָ׃

28.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֤ה זַרְעֲךָ֙ כַּעֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ וּפָרַצְתָּ֛ יָ֥מָּה וָקֵ֖דְמָה וְצָפֹ֣נָה וָנֶ֑גְבָּה וְנִבְרְכ֥וּ בְךָ֛ כׇּל־מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הָאֲדָמָ֖ה וּבְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
28.englishText: Your descendants shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread out to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south. All the families of the earth shall bless themselves by you and your descendants.
28.transliteration: vְhָyָ֤h zַrְaֲךָ֙ kַּaֲpַ֣r hָaָ֔rֶץ vּpָrַtsְtָּ֛ yָ֥mָּh vָkֵ֖dְmָh vְtsָpֹ֣nָh vָnֶ֑gְbָּh vְnִbְrְk֥vּ bְךָ֛ kׇּl־mִshְׁpְּchֹ֥t hָaֲdָmָ֖h vּbְzַrְaֶֽךָ׃

28.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י עִמָּ֗ךְ וּשְׁמַרְתִּ֙יךָ֙ בְּכֹ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־תֵּלֵ֔ךְ וַהֲשִׁ֣בֹתִ֔יךָ אֶל־הָאֲדָמָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את כִּ֚י לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱזׇבְךָ֔ עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִם־עָשִׂ֔יתִי אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי לָֽךְ׃
28.englishText: Remember, I am with you: I will protect you wherever you go and will bring you back to this land. I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”
28.transliteration: vְhִnֵּ֨h aָnֹkִ֜y aִmָּ֗ךְ vּshְׁmַrְtִּ֙yךָ֙ bְּkֹ֣l aֲshֶׁr־tֵּlֵ֔ךְ vַhֲshִׁ֣bֹtִ֔yךָ aֶl־hָaֲdָmָ֖h hַzֹּ֑at kִּ֚y lֹ֣a aֶֽaֱzׇbְךָ֔ aַ֚d aֲshֶׁ֣r aִם־aָshִׂ֔ytִy aֵ֥t aֲshֶׁr־dִּbַּ֖rְtִּy lָֽךְ׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּיקַ֣ץ יַעֲקֹב֮ מִשְּׁנָתוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָכֵן֙ יֵ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְאָנֹכִ֖י לֹ֥א יָדָֽעְתִּי׃
28.englishText: Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely יהוה is present in this place, and I did not know it!”
28.transliteration: vַyִּykַ֣ץ yַaֲkֹb֮ mִshְּׁnָtvֹ֒ vַyֹּ֕amֶr aָkֵן֙ yֵ֣shׁ yְhֹvָ֔h bַּmָּk֖vֹם hַzֶּ֑h vְaָnֹkִ֖y lֹ֥a yָdָֽaְtִּy׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּירָא֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר מַה־נּוֹרָ֖א הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה אֵ֣ין זֶ֗ה כִּ֚י אִם־בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְזֶ֖ה שַׁ֥עַר הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
28.englishText: Shaken, he said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the abode of God, and that is the gateway to heaven.”
28.transliteration: vַyִּyrָa֙ vַyֹּamַ֔r mַh־nּvֹrָ֖a hַmָּk֣vֹם hַzֶּ֑h aֵ֣yן zֶ֗h kִּ֚y aִם־bֵּ֣yt aֱlֹhִ֔yם vְzֶ֖h shַׁ֥aַr hַshָּׁmָֽyִם׃

28.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם יַעֲקֹ֜ב בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם מְרַֽאֲשֹׁתָ֔יו וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֹתָ֖הּ מַצֵּבָ֑ה וַיִּצֹ֥ק שֶׁ֖מֶן עַל־רֹאשָֽׁהּ׃
28.englishText: Early in the morning, Jacob took the stone that he had put under his head and set it up as a pillar and poured oil on the top of it.
28.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֨ם yַaֲkֹ֜b bַּbֹּ֗kֶr vַyִּkַּ֤ch aֶt־hָaֶ֙bֶן֙ aֲshֶׁr־shָׂ֣ם mְrַֽaֲshֹׁtָ֔yv vַyָּ֥shֶׂם aֹtָ֖hּ mַtsֵּbָ֑h vַyִּtsֹ֥k shֶׁ֖mֶן aַl־rֹashָֽׁhּ׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְאוּלָ֛ם ל֥וּז שֵׁם־הָעִ֖יר לָרִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
28.englishText: He named that site Bethel;*Bethel I.e., “house of God.” but previously the name of the city had been Luz.
28.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֛a aֶt־shֵֽׁם־hַmָּk֥vֹם hַh֖vּa bֵּֽyt־aֵ֑l vְavּlָ֛ם l֥vּz shֵׁם־hָaִ֖yr lָrִashֹׁnָֽh׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּדַּ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב נֶ֣דֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־יִהְיֶ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים עִמָּדִ֗י וּשְׁמָרַ֙נִי֙ בַּדֶּ֤רֶךְ הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י הוֹלֵ֔ךְ וְנָֽתַן־לִ֥י לֶ֛חֶם לֶאֱכֹ֖ל וּבֶ֥גֶד לִלְבֹּֽשׁ׃
28.englishText: Jacob then made a vow, saying, “If God remains with me, protecting me on this journey that I am making, and giving me bread to eat and clothing to wear,
28.transliteration: vַyִּdַּ֥r yַaֲkֹ֖b nֶ֣dֶr lֵamֹ֑r aִם־yִhְyֶ֨h aֱlֹhִ֜yם aִmָּdִ֗y vּshְׁmָrַ֙nִy֙ bַּdֶּ֤rֶךְ hַzֶּh֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aָnֹkִ֣y hvֹlֵ֔ךְ vְnָֽtַן־lִ֥y lֶ֛chֶם lֶaֱkֹ֖l vּbֶ֥gֶd lִlְbֹּֽshׁ׃

28.hebrewText: וְשַׁבְתִּ֥י בְשָׁל֖וֹם אֶל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑י וְהָיָ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה לִ֖י לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
28.englishText: and I return safe to my father’s house— יהוה shall be my God.
28.transliteration: vְshַׁbְtִּ֥y bְshָׁl֖vֹם aֶl־bֵּ֣yt aָbִ֑y vְhָyָ֧h yְhֹvָ֛h lִ֖y lֵalֹhִֽyם׃

28.hebrewText: וְהָאֶ֣בֶן הַזֹּ֗את אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֙מְתִּי֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה יִהְיֶ֖ה בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתֶּן־לִ֔י עַשֵּׂ֖ר אֲעַשְּׂרֶ֥נּוּ לָֽךְ׃
28.englishText: And this stone, which I have set up as a pillar, shall be God’s abode; and of all that You give me, I will set aside a tithe for You.”
28.transliteration: vְhָaֶ֣bֶן hַzֹּ֗at aֲshֶׁr־shַׂ֙mְtִּy֙ mַtsֵּbָ֔h yִhְyֶ֖h bֵּ֣yt aֱlֹhִ֑yם vְkֹl֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tִּtֶּן־lִ֔y aַshֵּׂ֖r aֲaַshְּׂrֶ֥nּvּ lָֽךְ׃

vayetzei.name: Vayetzei
vayetzei.summary: Jacob's dream of the ladder, Jacob meets Rachel, Jacob works for Laban, the birth of Jacob's children, Jacob's wealth, and Jacob's return to Canaan.

28.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֥א יִצְחָ֛ק אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹת֑וֹ וַיְצַוֵּ֙הוּ֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ לֹֽא־תִקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
28.englishText: So Isaac sent for Jacob and blessed him. He instructed him, saying, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women.
28.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֥a yִtsְchָ֛k aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֖b vַyְbָ֣rֶךְ aֹt֑vֹ vַyְtsַvֵּ֙hvּ֙ vַyֹּ֣amֶr l֔vֹ lֹֽa־tִkַּ֥ch aִshָּׁ֖h mִbְּn֥vֹt kְּnָֽaַן׃

28.hebrewText: ק֥וּם לֵךְ֙ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֔ם בֵּ֥יתָה בְתוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִ֣י אִמֶּ֑ךָ וְקַח־לְךָ֤ מִשָּׁם֙ אִשָּׁ֔ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֥י אִמֶּֽךָ׃
28.englishText: Up, go to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father, and take a wife there from among the daughters of Laban, your mother’s brother.
28.transliteration: k֥vּם lֵךְ֙ pַּdֶּ֣nָֽh aֲrָ֔ם bֵּ֥ytָh bְtvּaֵ֖l aֲbִ֣y aִmֶּ֑ךָ vְkַch־lְךָ֤ mִshָּׁם֙ aִshָּׁ֔h mִbְּn֥vֹt lָbָ֖ן aֲchִ֥y aִmֶּֽךָ׃

28.hebrewText: וְאֵ֤ל שַׁדַּי֙ יְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֹֽתְךָ֔ וְיַפְרְךָ֖ וְיַרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְהָיִ֖יתָ לִקְהַ֥ל עַמִּֽים׃
28.englishText: May El Shaddai*El Shaddai See note at 17.1. bless you, make you fertile and numerous, so that you become an assembly of peoples.
28.transliteration: vְaֵ֤l shַׁdַּy֙ yְbָrֵ֣ךְ aֹֽtְךָ֔ vְyַpְrְךָ֖ vְyַrְbֶּ֑ךָ vְhָyִ֖ytָ lִkְhַ֥l aַmִּֽyם׃

28.hebrewText: וְיִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֙ אֶת־בִּרְכַּ֣ת אַבְרָהָ֔ם לְךָ֖ וּלְזַרְעֲךָ֣ אִתָּ֑ךְ לְרִשְׁתְּךָ֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מְגֻרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְאַבְרָהָֽם׃
28.englishText: May you and your offspring be granted the blessing of Abraham, that you may possess the land where you are sojourning, which God assigned to Abraham.”
28.transliteration: vְyִֽtֶּן־lְךָ֙ aֶt־bִּrְkַּ֣t aַbְrָhָ֔ם lְךָ֖ vּlְzַrְaֲךָ֣ aִtָּ֑ךְ lְrִshְׁtְּךָ֙ aֶt־aֶ֣rֶץ mְgֻrֶ֔yךָ aֲshֶׁr־nָtַ֥ן aֱlֹhִ֖yם lְaַbְrָhָֽם׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יִצְחָק֙ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֑ם אֶל־לָבָ֤ן בֶּן־בְּתוּאֵל֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּ֔י אֲחִ֣י רִבְקָ֔ה אֵ֥ם יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְעֵשָֽׂו׃
28.englishText: Then Isaac sent Jacob off, and he went to Paddan-aram, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, mother of Jacob and Esau.
28.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁlַ֤ch yִtsְchָk֙ aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹ֔b vַyֵּ֖lֶךְ pַּdֶּ֣nָֽh aֲrָ֑ם aֶl־lָbָ֤ן bֶּן־bְּtvּaֵl֙ hָֽaֲrַmִּ֔y aֲchִ֣y rִbְkָ֔h aֵ֥ם yַaֲkֹ֖b vְaֵshָֽׂv׃

28.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣רְא עֵשָׂ֗ו כִּֽי־בֵרַ֣ךְ יִצְחָק֮ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹב֒ וְשִׁלַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֔ם לָקַֽחַת־ל֥וֹ מִשָּׁ֖ם אִשָּׁ֑ה בְּבָרְכ֣וֹ אֹת֔וֹ וַיְצַ֤ו עָלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹֽא־תִקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
28.englishText: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him off to Paddan-aram to take a wife from there, charging him, as he blessed him, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women,”
28.transliteration: vַyַּ֣rְa aֵshָׂ֗v kִּֽy־bֵrַ֣ךְ yִtsְchָk֮ aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹb֒ vְshִׁlַּ֤ch aֹtvֹ֙ pַּdֶּ֣nָֽh aֲrָ֔ם lָkַֽchַt־l֥vֹ mִshָּׁ֖ם aִshָּׁ֑h bְּbָrְk֣vֹ aֹt֔vֹ vַyְtsַ֤v aָlָyv֙ lֵamֹ֔r lֹֽa־tִkַּ֥ch aִshָּׁ֖h mִbְּn֥vֹt kְּnָֽaַן׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶל־אָבִ֖יו וְאֶל־אִמּ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ פַּדֶּ֥נָֽה אֲרָֽם׃
28.englishText: and that Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and gone to Paddan-aram,
28.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֣a yַaֲkֹ֔b aֶl־aָbִ֖yv vְaֶl־aִmּ֑vֹ vַyֵּ֖lֶךְ pַּdֶּ֥nָֽh aֲrָֽם׃

28.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣רְא עֵשָׂ֔ו כִּ֥י רָע֖וֹת בְּנ֣וֹת כְּנָ֑עַן בְּעֵינֵ֖י יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִֽיו׃
28.englishText: Esau realized that the Canaanite women displeased his father Isaac.
28.transliteration: vַyַּ֣rְa aֵshָׂ֔v kִּ֥y rָa֖vֹt bְּn֣vֹt kְּnָ֑aַן bְּaֵynֵ֖y yִtsְchָ֥k aָbִֽyv׃

28.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ עֵשָׂ֖ו אֶל־יִשְׁמָעֵ֑אל וַיִּקַּ֡ח אֶֽת־מָחֲלַ֣ת ׀ בַּת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֨אל בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֲח֧וֹת נְבָי֛וֹת עַל־נָשָׁ֖יו ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
28.englishText: So Esau went to Ishmael and took to wife, in addition to the wives he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael son of Abraham, sister of Nebaioth.
28.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥lֶךְ aֵshָׂ֖v aֶl־yִshְׁmָaֵ֑al vַyִּkַּ֡ch aֶֽt־mָchֲlַ֣t ׀ bַּt־yִshְׁmָaֵ֨al bֶּן־aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֲch֧vֹt nְbָy֛vֹt aַl־nָshָׁ֖yv l֥vֹ lְaִshָּֽׁh׃ {s}

28.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִבְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ חָרָֽנָה׃
28.englishText: Jacob left Beer-sheba, and set out for Haran.
28.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֥a yַaֲkֹ֖b mִbְּaֵ֣r shָׁ֑bַa vַyֵּ֖lֶךְ chָrָֽnָh׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּפְגַּ֨ע בַּמָּק֜וֹם וַיָּ֤לֶן שָׁם֙ כִּי־בָ֣א הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ וַיִּקַּח֙ מֵאַבְנֵ֣י הַמָּק֔וֹם וַיָּ֖שֶׂם מְרַֽאֲשֹׁתָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁכַּ֖ב בַּמָּק֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
28.englishText: He came upon a certain place and stopped there for the night, for the sun had set. Taking one of the stones of that place, he put it under his head and lay down in that place.
28.transliteration: vַyִּpְgַּ֨a bַּmָּk֜vֹם vַyָּ֤lֶן shָׁם֙ kִּy־bָ֣a hַshֶּׁ֔mֶshׁ vַyִּkַּch֙ mֵaַbְnֵ֣y hַmָּk֔vֹם vַyָּ֖shֶׂם mְrַֽaֲshֹׁtָ֑yv vַyִּshְׁkַּ֖b bַּmָּk֥vֹם hַhֽvּa׃

28.hebrewText: וַֽיַּחֲלֹ֗ם וְהִנֵּ֤ה סֻלָּם֙ מֻצָּ֣ב אַ֔רְצָה וְרֹאשׁ֖וֹ מַגִּ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמָ֑יְמָה וְהִנֵּה֙ מַלְאֲכֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֔ים עֹלִ֥ים וְיֹרְדִ֖ים בּֽוֹ׃
28.englishText: He had a dream; a stairway*stairway Or “ramp”; others “ladder.” Heb. sullam. was set on the ground and its top reached to the sky, and messengers of God were going up and down on it.
28.transliteration: vַֽyַּchֲlֹ֗ם vְhִnֵּ֤h sֻlָּם֙ mֻtsָּ֣b aַ֔rְtsָh vְrֹashׁ֖vֹ mַgִּ֣yaַ hַshָּׁmָ֑yְmָh vְhִnֵּh֙ mַlְaֲkֵ֣y aֱlֹhִ֔yם aֹlִ֥yם vְyֹrְdִ֖yם bּֽvֹ׃

28.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה נִצָּ֣ב עָלָיו֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֔יךָ וֵאלֹהֵ֖י יִצְחָ֑ק הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ שֹׁכֵ֣ב עָלֶ֔יהָ לְךָ֥ אֶתְּנֶ֖נָּה וּלְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
28.englishText: And standing beside him was יהוה, who said, “I am יהוה, the God of your father Abraham’s [house] and the God of Isaac’s [house]: the ground on which you are lying I will assign to you and to your offspring.
28.transliteration: vְhִnֵּ֨h yְhֹvָ֜h nִtsָּ֣b aָlָyv֮ vַyֹּamַr֒ aֲnִ֣y yְhֹvָ֗h aֱlֹhֵy֙ aַbְrָhָ֣ם aָbִ֔yךָ vֵalֹhֵ֖y yִtsְchָ֑k hָaָ֗rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֤r aַtָּh֙ shֹׁkֵ֣b aָlֶ֔yhָ lְךָ֥ aֶtְּnֶ֖nָּh vּlְzַrְaֶֽךָ׃

28.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֤ה זַרְעֲךָ֙ כַּעֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ וּפָרַצְתָּ֛ יָ֥מָּה וָקֵ֖דְמָה וְצָפֹ֣נָה וָנֶ֑גְבָּה וְנִבְרְכ֥וּ בְךָ֛ כׇּל־מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הָאֲדָמָ֖ה וּבְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
28.englishText: Your descendants shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread out to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south. All the families of the earth shall bless themselves by you and your descendants.
28.transliteration: vְhָyָ֤h zַrְaֲךָ֙ kַּaֲpַ֣r hָaָ֔rֶץ vּpָrַtsְtָּ֛ yָ֥mָּh vָkֵ֖dְmָh vְtsָpֹ֣nָh vָnֶ֑gְbָּh vְnִbְrְk֥vּ bְךָ֛ kׇּl־mִshְׁpְּchֹ֥t hָaֲdָmָ֖h vּbְzַrְaֶֽךָ׃

28.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י עִמָּ֗ךְ וּשְׁמַרְתִּ֙יךָ֙ בְּכֹ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־תֵּלֵ֔ךְ וַהֲשִׁ֣בֹתִ֔יךָ אֶל־הָאֲדָמָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את כִּ֚י לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱזׇבְךָ֔ עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִם־עָשִׂ֔יתִי אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי לָֽךְ׃
28.englishText: Remember, I am with you: I will protect you wherever you go and will bring you back to this land. I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”
28.transliteration: vְhִnֵּ֨h aָnֹkִ֜y aִmָּ֗ךְ vּshְׁmַrְtִּ֙yךָ֙ bְּkֹ֣l aֲshֶׁr־tֵּlֵ֔ךְ vַhֲshִׁ֣bֹtִ֔yךָ aֶl־hָaֲdָmָ֖h hַzֹּ֑at kִּ֚y lֹ֣a aֶֽaֱzׇbְךָ֔ aַ֚d aֲshֶׁ֣r aִם־aָshִׂ֔ytִy aֵ֥t aֲshֶׁr־dִּbַּ֖rְtִּy lָֽךְ׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּיקַ֣ץ יַעֲקֹב֮ מִשְּׁנָתוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָכֵן֙ יֵ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְאָנֹכִ֖י לֹ֥א יָדָֽעְתִּי׃
28.englishText: Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely יהוה is present in this place, and I did not know it!”
28.transliteration: vַyִּykַ֣ץ yַaֲkֹb֮ mִshְּׁnָtvֹ֒ vַyֹּ֕amֶr aָkֵן֙ yֵ֣shׁ yְhֹvָ֔h bַּmָּk֖vֹם hַzֶּ֑h vְaָnֹkִ֖y lֹ֥a yָdָֽaְtִּy׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּירָא֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר מַה־נּוֹרָ֖א הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה אֵ֣ין זֶ֗ה כִּ֚י אִם־בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְזֶ֖ה שַׁ֥עַר הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
28.englishText: Shaken, he said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the abode of God, and that is the gateway to heaven.”
28.transliteration: vַyִּyrָa֙ vַyֹּamַ֔r mַh־nּvֹrָ֖a hַmָּk֣vֹם hַzֶּ֑h aֵ֣yן zֶ֗h kִּ֚y aִם־bֵּ֣yt aֱlֹhִ֔yם vְzֶ֖h shַׁ֥aַr hַshָּׁmָֽyִם׃

28.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם יַעֲקֹ֜ב בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם מְרַֽאֲשֹׁתָ֔יו וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֹתָ֖הּ מַצֵּבָ֑ה וַיִּצֹ֥ק שֶׁ֖מֶן עַל־רֹאשָֽׁהּ׃
28.englishText: Early in the morning, Jacob took the stone that he had put under his head and set it up as a pillar and poured oil on the top of it.
28.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֨ם yַaֲkֹ֜b bַּbֹּ֗kֶr vַyִּkַּ֤ch aֶt־hָaֶ֙bֶן֙ aֲshֶׁr־shָׂ֣ם mְrַֽaֲshֹׁtָ֔yv vַyָּ֥shֶׂם aֹtָ֖hּ mַtsֵּbָ֑h vַyִּtsֹ֥k shֶׁ֖mֶן aַl־rֹashָֽׁhּ׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְאוּלָ֛ם ל֥וּז שֵׁם־הָעִ֖יר לָרִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
28.englishText: He named that site Bethel;*Bethel I.e., “house of God.” but previously the name of the city had been Luz.
28.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֛a aֶt־shֵֽׁם־hַmָּk֥vֹם hַh֖vּa bֵּֽyt־aֵ֑l vְavּlָ֛ם l֥vּz shֵׁם־hָaִ֖yr lָrִashֹׁnָֽh׃

28.hebrewText: וַיִּדַּ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב נֶ֣דֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־יִהְיֶ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים עִמָּדִ֗י וּשְׁמָרַ֙נִי֙ בַּדֶּ֤רֶךְ הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י הוֹלֵ֔ךְ וְנָֽתַן־לִ֥י לֶ֛חֶם לֶאֱכֹ֖ל וּבֶ֥גֶד לִלְבֹּֽשׁ׃
28.englishText: Jacob then made a vow, saying, “If God remains with me, protecting me on this journey that I am making, and giving me bread to eat and clothing to wear,
28.transliteration: vַyִּdַּ֥r yַaֲkֹ֖b nֶ֣dֶr lֵamֹ֑r aִם־yִhְyֶ֨h aֱlֹhִ֜yם aִmָּdִ֗y vּshְׁmָrַ֙nִy֙ bַּdֶּ֤rֶךְ hַzֶּh֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aָnֹkִ֣y hvֹlֵ֔ךְ vְnָֽtַן־lִ֥y lֶ֛chֶם lֶaֱkֹ֖l vּbֶ֥gֶd lִlְbֹּֽshׁ׃

28.hebrewText: וְשַׁבְתִּ֥י בְשָׁל֖וֹם אֶל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑י וְהָיָ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה לִ֖י לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
28.englishText: and I return safe to my father’s house— יהוה shall be my God.
28.transliteration: vְshַׁbְtִּ֥y bְshָׁl֖vֹם aֶl־bֵּ֣yt aָbִ֑y vְhָyָ֧h yְhֹvָ֛h lִ֖y lֵalֹhִֽyם׃

28.hebrewText: וְהָאֶ֣בֶן הַזֹּ֗את אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֙מְתִּי֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה יִהְיֶ֖ה בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתֶּן־לִ֔י עַשֵּׂ֖ר אֲעַשְּׂרֶ֥נּוּ לָֽךְ׃
28.englishText: And this stone, which I have set up as a pillar, shall be God’s abode; and of all that You give me, I will set aside a tithe for You.”
28.transliteration: vְhָaֶ֣bֶן hַzֹּ֗at aֲshֶׁr־shַׂ֙mְtִּy֙ mַtsֵּbָ֔h yִhְyֶ֖h bֵּ֣yt aֱlֹhִ֑yם vְkֹl֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tִּtֶּן־lִ֔y aַshֵּׂ֖r aֲaַshְּׂrֶ֥nּvּ lָֽךְ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב רַגְלָ֑יו וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ אַ֥רְצָה בְנֵי־קֶֽדֶם׃
29.englishText: Jacob resumed his journey*resumed his journey Lit. “lifted up his feet.” and came to the land of the Easterners.
29.transliteration: vַyִּshָּׂ֥a yַaֲkֹ֖b rַgְlָ֑yv vַyֵּ֖lֶךְ aַ֥rְtsָh bְnֵy־kֶֽdֶם׃

29.hebrewText: וַיַּ֞רְא וְהִנֵּ֧ה בְאֵ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֗ה וְהִנֵּה־שָׁ֞ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עֶדְרֵי־צֹאן֙ רֹבְצִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יהָ כִּ֚י מִן־הַבְּאֵ֣ר הַהִ֔וא יַשְׁק֖וּ הָעֲדָרִ֑ים וְהָאֶ֥בֶן גְּדֹלָ֖ה עַל־פִּ֥י הַבְּאֵֽר׃
29.englishText: There before his eyes was a well in the open. Three flocks of sheep were lying there beside it, for the flocks were watered from that well. The stone on the mouth of the well was large.
29.transliteration: vַyַּ֞rְa vְhִnֵּ֧h bְaֵ֣r bַּshָּׂdֶ֗h vְhִnֵּh־shָׁ֞ם shְׁlֹshָׁ֤h aֶdְrֵy־tsֹaן֙ rֹbְtsִ֣yם aָlֶ֔yhָ kִּ֚y mִן־hַbְּaֵ֣r hַhִ֔va yַshְׁk֖vּ hָaֲdָrִ֑yם vְhָaֶ֥bֶן gְּdֹlָ֖h aַl־pִּ֥y hַbְּaֵֽr׃

29.hebrewText: וְנֶאֶסְפוּ־שָׁ֣מָּה כׇל־הָעֲדָרִ֗ים וְגָלְל֤וּ אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ מֵעַל֙ פִּ֣י הַבְּאֵ֔ר וְהִשְׁק֖וּ אֶת־הַצֹּ֑אן וְהֵשִׁ֧יבוּ אֶת־הָאֶ֛בֶן עַל־פִּ֥י הַבְּאֵ֖ר לִמְקֹמָֽהּ׃
29.englishText: When all the flocks were gathered there, the stone would be rolled from the mouth of the well and the sheep watered; then the stone would be put back in its place on the mouth of the well.
29.transliteration: vְnֶaֶsְpvּ־shָׁ֣mָּh kׇl־hָaֲdָrִ֗yם vְgָlְl֤vּ aֶt־hָaֶ֙bֶן֙ mֵaַl֙ pִּ֣y hַbְּaֵ֔r vְhִshְׁk֖vּ aֶt־hַtsֹּ֑aן vְhֵshִׁ֧ybvּ aֶt־hָaֶ֛bֶן aַl־pִּ֥y hַbְּaֵ֖r lִmְkֹmָֽhּ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב אַחַ֖י מֵאַ֣יִן אַתֶּ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵחָרָ֖ן אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
29.englishText: Jacob said to them, “My friends, where are you from?” And they said, “We are from Haran.”
29.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr lָhֶם֙ yַaֲkֹ֔b aַchַ֖y mֵaַ֣yִן aַtֶּ֑ם vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ mֵchָrָ֖ן aֲnָֽchְnvּ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם הַיְדַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־לָבָ֣ן בֶּן־נָח֑וֹר וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ יָדָֽעְנוּ׃
29.englishText: He said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “Yes, we do.”
29.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr lָhֶ֔ם hַyְdַaְtֶּ֖ם aֶt־lָbָ֣ן bֶּן־nָch֑vֹr vַyֹּamְr֖vּ yָdָֽaְnvּ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָהֶ֖ם הֲשָׁל֣וֹם ל֑וֹ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ שָׁל֔וֹם וְהִנֵּה֙ רָחֵ֣ל בִּתּ֔וֹ בָּאָ֖ה עִם־הַצֹּֽאן׃
29.englishText: He continued, “Is he well?” They answered, “Yes, he is; and there is his daughter Rachel, coming with the flock.”
29.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr lָhֶ֖ם hֲshָׁl֣vֹם l֑vֹ vַyֹּamְr֣vּ shָׁl֔vֹם vְhִnֵּh֙ rָchֵ֣l bִּtּ֔vֹ bָּaָ֖h aִם־hַtsֹּֽaן׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֵ֥ן עוֹד֙ הַיּ֣וֹם גָּד֔וֹל לֹא־עֵ֖ת הֵאָסֵ֣ף הַמִּקְנֶ֑ה הַשְׁק֥וּ הַצֹּ֖אן וּלְכ֥וּ רְעֽוּ׃
29.englishText: He said, “It is still broad daylight, too early to round up the animals; water the flock and take them to pasture.”
29.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr hֵ֥ן avֹd֙ hַyּ֣vֹם gָּd֔vֹl lֹa־aֵ֖t hֵaָsֵ֣ף hַmִּkְnֶ֑h hַshְׁk֥vּ hַtsֹּ֖aן vּlְk֥vּ rְaֽvּ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֮ לֹ֣א נוּכַל֒ עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֵאָֽסְפוּ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֲדָרִ֔ים וְגָֽלְלוּ֙ אֶת־הָאֶ֔בֶן מֵעַ֖ל פִּ֣י הַבְּאֵ֑ר וְהִשְׁקִ֖ינוּ הַצֹּֽאן׃
29.englishText: But they said, “We cannot, until all the flocks are rounded up; then the stone is rolled off the mouth of the well and we water the sheep.”
29.transliteration: vַyֹּamְrvּ֮ lֹ֣a nvּkַl֒ aַ֣d aֲshֶׁ֤r yֵaָֽsְpvּ֙ kׇּl־hָ֣aֲdָrִ֔yם vְgָֽlְlvּ֙ aֶt־hָaֶ֔bֶן mֵaַ֖l pִּ֣y hַbְּaֵ֑r vְhִshְׁkִ֖ynvּ hַtsֹּֽaן׃

29.hebrewText: עוֹדֶ֖נּוּ מְדַבֵּ֣ר עִמָּ֑ם וְרָחֵ֣ל ׀ בָּ֗אָה עִם־הַצֹּאן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֔יהָ כִּ֥י רֹעָ֖ה הִֽוא׃
29.englishText: While he was still speaking with them, Rachel came with her father’s flock—for she was its shepherd.
29.transliteration: avֹdֶ֖nּvּ mְdַbֵּ֣r aִmָּ֑ם vְrָchֵ֣l ׀ bָּ֗aָh aִם־hַtsֹּaן֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r lְaָbִ֔yhָ kִּ֥y rֹaָ֖h hִֽva׃

29.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ רָאָ֨ה יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶת־רָחֵ֗ל בַּת־לָבָן֙ אֲחִ֣י אִמּ֔וֹ וְאֶת־צֹ֥אן לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֣י אִמּ֑וֹ וַיִּגַּ֣שׁ יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַיָּ֤גֶל אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ מֵעַל֙ פִּ֣י הַבְּאֵ֔ר וַיַּ֕שְׁקְ אֶת־צֹ֥אן לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֥י אִמּֽוֹ׃
29.englishText: And when Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of his uncle*uncle Lit. “mother’s brother.” Laban, and the flock of his uncle Laban, Jacob went up and rolled the stone off the mouth of the well, and watered the flock of his uncle Laban.
29.transliteration: vַyְhִ֡y kַּaֲshֶׁr֩ rָaָ֨h yַaֲkֹ֜b aֶt־rָchֵ֗l bַּt־lָbָן֙ aֲchִ֣y aִmּ֔vֹ vְaֶt־tsֹ֥aן lָbָ֖ן aֲchִ֣y aִmּ֑vֹ vַyִּgַּ֣shׁ yַaֲkֹ֗b vַyָּ֤gֶl aֶt־hָaֶ֙bֶן֙ mֵaַl֙ pִּ֣y hַbְּaֵ֔r vַyַּ֕shְׁkְ aֶt־tsֹ֥aן lָbָ֖ן aֲchִ֥y aִmּֽvֹ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיִּשַּׁ֥ק יַעֲקֹ֖ב לְרָחֵ֑ל וַיִּשָּׂ֥א אֶת־קֹל֖וֹ וַיֵּֽבְךְּ׃
29.englishText: Then Jacob kissed Rachel, and broke into tears.
29.transliteration: vַyִּshַּׁ֥k yַaֲkֹ֖b lְrָchֵ֑l vַyִּshָּׂ֥a aֶt־kֹl֖vֹ vַyֵּֽbְךְּ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיַּגֵּ֨ד יַעֲקֹ֜ב לְרָחֵ֗ל כִּ֣י אֲחִ֤י אָבִ֙יהָ֙ ה֔וּא וְכִ֥י בֶן־רִבְקָ֖ה ה֑וּא וַתָּ֖רׇץ וַתַּגֵּ֥ד לְאָבִֽיהָ׃
29.englishText: Jacob told Rachel that he was her father’s kinsman, that he was Rebekah’s son; and she ran and told her father.
29.transliteration: vַyַּgֵּ֨d yַaֲkֹ֜b lְrָchֵ֗l kִּ֣y aֲchִ֤y aָbִ֙yhָ֙ h֔vּa vְkִ֥y bֶן־rִbְkָ֖h h֑vּa vַtָּ֖rׇץ vַtַּgֵּ֥d lְaָbִֽyhָ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ לָבָ֜ן אֶת־שֵׁ֣מַע ׀ יַעֲקֹ֣ב בֶּן־אֲחֹת֗וֹ וַיָּ֤רׇץ לִקְרָאתוֹ֙ וַיְחַבֶּק־לוֹ֙ וַיְנַשֶּׁק־ל֔וֹ וַיְבִיאֵ֖הוּ אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וַיְסַפֵּ֣ר לְלָבָ֔ן אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
29.englishText: On hearing the news of his sister’s son Jacob, Laban ran to greet him; he embraced him and kissed him, and took him into his house. He told Laban all that had happened,
29.transliteration: vַyְhִy֩ kִshְׁmֹ֨aַ lָbָ֜ן aֶt־shֵׁ֣mַa ׀ yַaֲkֹ֣b bֶּן־aֲchֹt֗vֹ vַyָּ֤rׇץ lִkְrָatvֹ֙ vַyְchַbֶּk־lvֹ֙ vַyְnַshֶּׁk־l֔vֹ vַyְbִyaֵ֖hvּ aֶl־bֵּyt֑vֹ vַyְsַpֵּ֣r lְlָbָ֔ן aֵ֥t kׇּl־hַdְּbָrִ֖yם hָaֵֽlֶּh׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ לָבָ֔ן אַ֛ךְ עַצְמִ֥י וּבְשָׂרִ֖י אָ֑תָּה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב עִמּ֖וֹ חֹ֥דֶשׁ יָמִֽים׃
29.englishText: and Laban said to him, “You are truly my bone and flesh.” When he had stayed with him a month’s time,
29.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr lvֹ֙ lָbָ֔ן aַ֛ךְ aַtsְmִ֥y vּbְshָׂrִ֖y aָ֑tָּh vַyֵּ֥shֶׁb aִmּ֖vֹ chֹ֥dֶshׁ yָmִֽyם׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָבָן֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב הֲכִי־אָחִ֣י אַ֔תָּה וַעֲבַדְתַּ֖נִי חִנָּ֑ם הַגִּ֥ידָה לִּ֖י מַה־מַּשְׂכֻּרְתֶּֽךָ׃
29.englishText: Laban said to Jacob, “Just because you are a kinsman, should you serve me for nothing? Tell me, what shall your wages be?”
29.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr lָbָן֙ lְyַaֲkֹ֔b hֲkִy־aָchִ֣y aַ֔tָּh vַaֲbַdְtַּ֖nִy chִnָּ֑ם hַgִּ֥ydָh lִּ֖y mַh־mַּshְׂkֻּrְtֶּֽךָ׃

29.hebrewText: וּלְלָבָ֖ן שְׁתֵּ֣י בָנ֑וֹת שֵׁ֤ם הַגְּדֹלָה֙ לֵאָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַקְּטַנָּ֖ה רָחֵֽל׃
29.englishText: Now Laban had two daughters; the name of the older one was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
29.transliteration: vּlְlָbָ֖ן shְׁtֵּ֣y bָn֑vֹt shֵׁ֤ם hַgְּdֹlָh֙ lֵaָ֔h vְshֵׁ֥ם hַkְּtַnָּ֖h rָchֵֽl׃

29.hebrewText: וְעֵינֵ֥י לֵאָ֖ה רַכּ֑וֹת וְרָחֵל֙ הָֽיְתָ֔ה יְפַת־תֹּ֖אַר וִיפַ֥ת מַרְאֶֽה׃
29.englishText: Leah had weak eyes; Rachel was shapely and beautiful.
29.transliteration: vְaֵynֵ֥y lֵaָ֖h rַkּ֑vֹt vְrָchֵl֙ hָֽyְtָ֔h yְpַt־tֹּ֖aַr vִypַ֥t mַrְaֶֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־רָחֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֶֽעֱבׇדְךָ֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים בְּרָחֵ֥ל בִּתְּךָ֖ הַקְּטַנָּֽה׃
29.englishText: Jacob loved Rachel; so he answered, “I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.”
29.transliteration: vַyֶּaֱhַ֥b yַaֲkֹ֖b aֶt־rָchֵ֑l vַyֹּ֗amֶr aֶֽaֱbׇdְךָ֙ shֶׁ֣bַa shָׁnִ֔yם bְּrָchֵ֥l bִּtְּךָ֖ hַkְּtַnָּֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָבָ֗ן ט֚וֹב תִּתִּ֣י אֹתָ֣הּ לָ֔ךְ מִתִּתִּ֥י אֹתָ֖הּ לְאִ֣ישׁ אַחֵ֑ר שְׁבָ֖ה עִמָּדִֽי׃
29.englishText: Laban said, “Better that I give her to you than that I should give her to an outsider. Stay with me.”
29.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr lָbָ֗ן t֚vֹb tִּtִּ֣y aֹtָ֣hּ lָ֔ךְ mִtִּtִּ֥y aֹtָ֖hּ lְaִ֣yshׁ aַchֵ֑r shְׁbָ֖h aִmָּdִֽy׃

29.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲבֹ֧ד יַעֲקֹ֛ב בְּרָחֵ֖ל שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיִּהְי֤וּ בְעֵינָיו֙ כְּיָמִ֣ים אֲחָדִ֔ים בְּאַהֲבָת֖וֹ אֹתָֽהּ׃
29.englishText: So Jacob served seven years for Rachel and they seemed to him but a few days because of his love for her.
29.transliteration: vַyַּaֲbֹ֧d yַaֲkֹ֛b bְּrָchֵ֖l shֶׁ֣bַa shָׁnִ֑yם vַyִּhְy֤vּ bְaֵynָyv֙ kְּyָmִ֣yם aֲchָdִ֔yם bְּaַhֲbָt֖vֹ aֹtָֽhּ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֤ב אֶל־לָבָן֙ הָבָ֣ה אֶת־אִשְׁתִּ֔י כִּ֥י מָלְא֖וּ יָמָ֑י וְאָב֖וֹאָה אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
29.englishText: Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my time is fulfilled, that I may cohabit with her.”
29.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yַaֲkֹ֤b aֶl־lָbָן֙ hָbָ֣h aֶt־aִshְׁtִּ֔y kִּ֥y mָlְa֖vּ yָmָ֑y vְaָb֖vֹaָh aֵlֶֽyhָ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף לָבָ֛ן אֶת־כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַמָּק֖וֹם וַיַּ֥עַשׂ מִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
29.englishText: And Laban gathered all the people of the place*people of the place Or “the locals” or “the local dignitaries,” whose presence clearly validated a marriage; Heb. ’anshe ha-maqom. See the Dictionary under ’ish. and made a feast.
29.transliteration: vַyֶּaֱsֹ֥ף lָbָ֛ן aֶt־kׇּl־aַnְshֵׁ֥y hַmָּk֖vֹם vַyַּ֥aַshׂ mִshְׁtֶּֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֣י בָעֶ֔רֶב וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־לֵאָ֣ה בִתּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֵ֥א אֹתָ֖הּ אֵלָ֑יו וַיָּבֹ֖א אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
29.englishText: When evening came, he took his daughter Leah and brought her to him; and he cohabited with her.—
29.transliteration: vַyְhִ֣y bָaֶ֔rֶb vַyִּkַּch֙ aֶt־lֵaָ֣h bִtּ֔vֹ vַyָּbֵ֥a aֹtָ֖hּ aֵlָ֑yv vַyָּbֹ֖a aֵlֶֽyhָ׃

29.hebrewText: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן לָבָן֙ לָ֔הּ אֶת־זִלְפָּ֖ה שִׁפְחָת֑וֹ לְלֵאָ֥ה בִתּ֖וֹ שִׁפְחָֽה׃
29.englishText: Laban had given his maidservant Zilpah to his daughter Leah as her maid.—
29.transliteration: vַyִּtֵּ֤ן lָbָן֙ lָ֔hּ aֶt־zִlְpָּ֖h shִׁpְchָt֑vֹ lְlֵaָ֥h bִtּ֖vֹ shִׁpְchָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֣י בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְהִנֵּה־הִ֖וא לֵאָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־לָבָ֗ן מַה־זֹּאת֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ לִּ֔י הֲלֹ֤א בְרָחֵל֙ עָבַ֣דְתִּי עִמָּ֔ךְ וְלָ֖מָּה רִמִּיתָֽנִי׃
29.englishText: When morning came, there was Leah! So he said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me? I was in your service for Rachel! Why did you deceive me?”
29.transliteration: vַyְhִ֣y bַbֹּ֔kֶr vְhִnֵּh־hִ֖va lֵaָ֑h vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֶl־lָbָ֗ן mַh־zֹּat֙ aָshִׂ֣ytָ lִּ֔y hֲlֹ֤a bְrָchֵl֙ aָbַ֣dְtִּy aִmָּ֔ךְ vְlָ֖mָּh rִmִּytָֽnִy׃

29.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָבָ֔ן לֹא־יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה כֵ֖ן בִּמְקוֹמֵ֑נוּ לָתֵ֥ת הַצְּעִירָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הַבְּכִירָֽה׃
29.englishText: Laban said, “It is not the practice in our place to marry off the younger before the older.
29.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr lָbָ֔ן lֹa־yֵaָshֶׂ֥h kֵ֖ן bִּmְkvֹmֵ֑nvּ lָtֵ֥t hַtsְּaִyrָ֖h lִpְnֵ֥y hַbְּkִyrָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: מַלֵּ֖א שְׁבֻ֣עַ זֹ֑את וְנִתְּנָ֨ה לְךָ֜ גַּם־אֶת־זֹ֗את בַּעֲבֹדָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲבֹ֣ד עִמָּדִ֔י ע֖וֹד שֶֽׁבַע־שָׁנִ֥ים אֲחֵרֽוֹת׃
29.englishText: Wait until the bridal week of this one is over and we will give you that one too, provided you serve me another seven years.”
29.transliteration: mַlֵּ֖a shְׁbֻ֣aַ zֹ֑at vְnִtְּnָ֨h lְךָ֜ gַּם־aֶt־zֹ֗at bַּaֲbֹdָh֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tַּaֲbֹ֣d aִmָּdִ֔y a֖vֹd shֶֽׁbַa־shָׁnִ֥yם aֲchֵrֽvֹt׃

29.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ יַעֲקֹב֙ כֵּ֔ן וַיְמַלֵּ֖א שְׁבֻ֣עַ זֹ֑את וַיִּתֶּן־ל֛וֹ אֶת־רָחֵ֥ל בִּתּ֖וֹ ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
29.englishText: Jacob did so; he waited out the bridal week of the one, and then he gave him his daughter Rachel as wife.—
29.transliteration: vַyַּ֤aַshׂ yַaֲkֹb֙ kֵּ֔ן vַyְmַlֵּ֖a shְׁbֻ֣aַ zֹ֑at vַyִּtֶּן־l֛vֹ aֶt־rָchֵ֥l bִּtּ֖vֹ l֥vֹ lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

29.hebrewText: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן לָבָן֙ לְרָחֵ֣ל בִּתּ֔וֹ אֶת־בִּלְהָ֖ה שִׁפְחָת֑וֹ לָ֖הּ לְשִׁפְחָֽה׃
29.englishText: Laban had given his maidservant Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as her maid.—
29.transliteration: vַyִּtֵּ֤ן lָbָן֙ lְrָchֵ֣l bִּtּ֔vֹ aֶt־bִּlְhָ֖h shִׁpְchָt֑vֹ lָ֖hּ lְshִׁpְchָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹא֙ גַּ֣ם אֶל־רָחֵ֔ל וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב גַּֽם־אֶת־רָחֵ֖ל מִלֵּאָ֑ה וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ד עִמּ֔וֹ ע֖וֹד שֶֽׁבַע־שָׁנִ֥ים אֲחֵרֽוֹת׃
29.englishText: And Jacob cohabited with Rachel also; indeed, he loved Rachel more than Leah. And he served him another seven years.
29.transliteration: vַyָּbֹa֙ gַּ֣ם aֶl־rָchֵ֔l vַyֶּaֱhַ֥b gַּֽם־aֶt־rָchֵ֖l mִlֵּaָ֑h vַyַּaֲbֹ֣d aִmּ֔vֹ a֖vֹd shֶֽׁbַa־shָׁnִ֥yם aֲchֵrֽvֹt׃

29.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤רְא יְהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־שְׂנוּאָ֣ה לֵאָ֔ה וַיִּפְתַּ֖ח אֶת־רַחְמָ֑הּ וְרָחֵ֖ל עֲקָרָֽה׃
29.englishText: Seeing that Leah was unloved, יהוה opened her womb; but Rachel was barren.
29.transliteration: vַyַּ֤rְa yְhֹvָh֙ kִּֽy־shְׂnvּaָ֣h lֵaָ֔h vַyִּpְtַּ֖ch aֶt־rַchְmָ֑hּ vְrָchֵ֖l aֲkָrָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וַתַּ֤הַר לֵאָה֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ רְאוּבֵ֑ן כִּ֣י אָֽמְרָ֗ה כִּֽי־רָאָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בְּעׇנְיִ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֖ה יֶאֱהָבַ֥נִי אִישִֽׁי׃
29.englishText: Leah conceived and bore a son, and named him Reuben;*Reuben Understood as “See a son.” for she declared, “It means: ‘יהוה has seen*has seen Heb. ra’ah, connected with the first part of “Reuben.” my affliction’; it also means: ‘Now my husband will love me.’”*will love me Heb. ye’ehabani, connected with the end of “Reuben.”
29.transliteration: vַtַּ֤hַr lֵaָh֙ vַtֵּ֣lֶd bֵּ֔ן vַtִּkְrָ֥a shְׁm֖vֹ rְavּbֵ֑ן kִּ֣y aָֽmְrָ֗h kִּֽy־rָaָ֤h yְhֹvָh֙ bְּaׇnְyִ֔y kִּ֥y aַtָּ֖h yֶaֱhָbַ֥nִy aִyshִֽׁy׃

29.hebrewText: וַתַּ֣הַר עוֹד֮ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּן֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־שְׂנוּאָ֣ה אָנֹ֔כִי וַיִּתֶּן־לִ֖י גַּם־אֶת־זֶ֑ה וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃
29.englishText: She conceived again and bore a son, and declared, “This is because יהוה heard*heard Heb. shama‘, connected with “Simeon.” that I was unloved and has given me this one also”; so she named him Simeon.
29.transliteration: vַtַּ֣hַr avֹd֮ vַtֵּ֣lֶd bֵּן֒ vַtֹּ֗amֶr kִּֽy־shָׁmַ֤a yְhֹvָh֙ kִּֽy־shְׂnvּaָ֣h aָnֹ֔kִy vַyִּtֶּן־lִ֖y gַּם־aֶt־zֶ֑h vַtִּkְrָ֥a shְׁm֖vֹ shִׁmְaֽvֹן׃

29.hebrewText: וַתַּ֣הַר עוֹד֮ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּן֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר עַתָּ֤ה הַפַּ֙עַם֙ יִלָּוֶ֤ה אִישִׁי֙ אֵלַ֔י כִּֽי־יָלַ֥דְתִּי ל֖וֹ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ לֵוִֽי׃
29.englishText: Again she conceived and bore a son and declared, “This time my husband will become attached*will become attached Heb. yillaweh, connected with “Levi.” to me, for I have borne him three sons.” Therefore he was named Levi.
29.transliteration: vַtַּ֣hַr avֹd֮ vַtֵּ֣lֶd bֵּן֒ vַtֹּ֗amֶr aַtָּ֤h hַpַּ֙aַם֙ yִlָּvֶ֤h aִyshִׁy֙ aֵlַ֔y kִּֽy־yָlַ֥dְtִּy l֖vֹ shְׁlֹshָׁ֣h bָnִ֑yם aַl־kֵּ֥ן kָrָֽa־shְׁm֖vֹ lֵvִֽy׃

29.hebrewText: וַתַּ֨הַר ע֜וֹד וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֗ן וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַפַּ֙עַם֙ אוֹדֶ֣ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרְאָ֥ה שְׁמ֖וֹ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד מִלֶּֽדֶת׃
29.englishText: She conceived again and bore a son, and declared, “This time I will praise*I will praise Heb. ’odeh, connected with “Judah.” יהוה.” Therefore she named him Judah. Then she stopped bearing.
29.transliteration: vַtַּ֨hַr a֜vֹd vַtֵּ֣lֶd bֵּ֗ן vַtֹּ֙amֶr֙ hַpַּ֙aַם֙ avֹdֶ֣h aֶt־yְhֹvָ֔h aַl־kֵּ֛ן kָrְaָ֥h shְׁm֖vֹ yְhvּdָ֑h vַֽtַּaֲmֹ֖d mִlֶּֽdֶt׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֣רֶא רָחֵ֗ל כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָֽלְדָה֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב וַתְּקַנֵּ֥א רָחֵ֖ל בַּאֲחֹתָ֑הּ וַתֹּ֤אמֶר אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹב֙ הָֽבָה־לִּ֣י בָנִ֔ים וְאִם־אַ֖יִן מֵתָ֥ה אָנֹֽכִי׃
30.englishText: When Rachel saw that she had borne Jacob no children, she became envious of her sister; and Rachel said to Jacob, “Give me children, or I shall die.”
30.transliteration: vַtֵּ֣rֶa rָchֵ֗l kִּ֣y lֹ֤a yָֽlְdָh֙ lְyַaֲkֹ֔b vַtְּkַnֵּ֥a rָchֵ֖l bַּaֲchֹtָ֑hּ vַtֹּ֤amֶr aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹb֙ hָֽbָh־lִּ֣y bָnִ֔yם vְaִם־aַ֖yִן mֵtָ֥h aָnֹֽkִy׃

30.hebrewText: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יַעֲקֹ֖ב בְּרָחֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲתַ֤חַת אֱלֹהִים֙ אָנֹ֔כִי אֲשֶׁר־מָנַ֥ע מִמֵּ֖ךְ פְּרִי־בָֽטֶן׃
30.englishText: Jacob was incensed at Rachel, and said, “Can I take the place of God, who has denied you fruit of the womb?”
30.transliteration: vַyִּֽchַr־aַ֥ף yַaֲkֹ֖b bְּrָchֵ֑l vַyֹּ֗amֶr hֲtַ֤chַt aֱlֹhִyם֙ aָnֹ֔kִy aֲshֶׁr־mָnַ֥a mִmֵּ֖ךְ pְּrִy־bָֽtֶן׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֛ה אֲמָתִ֥י בִלְהָ֖ה בֹּ֣א אֵלֶ֑יהָ וְתֵלֵד֙ עַל־בִּרְכַּ֔י וְאִבָּנֶ֥ה גַם־אָנֹכִ֖י מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
30.englishText: She said, “Here is my maid Bilhah. Consort with her, that she may bear on my knees and that through her I too may have children.”
30.transliteration: vַtֹּ֕amֶr hִnֵּ֛h aֲmָtִ֥y bִlְhָ֖h bֹּ֣a aֵlֶ֑yhָ vְtֵlֵd֙ aַl־bִּrְkַּ֔y vְaִbָּnֶ֥h gַם־aָnֹkִ֖y mִmֶּֽnָּh׃

30.hebrewText: וַתִּתֶּן־ל֛וֹ אֶת־בִּלְהָ֥ה שִׁפְחָתָ֖הּ לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיָּבֹ֥א אֵלֶ֖יהָ יַעֲקֹֽב׃
30.englishText: So she gave him her maid Bilhah as concubine, and Jacob cohabited with her.
30.transliteration: vַtִּtֶּן־l֛vֹ aֶt־bִּlְhָ֥h shִׁpְchָtָ֖hּ lְaִshָּׁ֑h vַyָּbֹ֥a aֵlֶ֖yhָ yַaֲkֹֽb׃

30.hebrewText: וַתַּ֣הַר בִּלְהָ֔ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב בֵּֽן׃
30.englishText: Bilhah conceived and bore Jacob a son.
30.transliteration: vַtַּ֣hַr bִּlְhָ֔h vַtֵּ֥lֶd lְyַaֲkֹ֖b bֵּֽן׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר רָחֵל֙ דָּנַ֣נִּי אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְגַם֙ שָׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלִ֔י וַיִּתֶּן־לִ֖י בֵּ֑ן עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרְאָ֥ה שְׁמ֖וֹ דָּֽן׃
30.englishText: And Rachel said, “God has vindicated me;*has vindicated me Heb. dananni, connected with “Dan.” indeed, [God] has heeded my plea and given me a son.” Therefore she named him Dan.
30.transliteration: vַtֹּ֤amֶr rָchֵl֙ dָּnַ֣nִּy aֱlֹhִ֔yם vְgַם֙ shָׁmַ֣a bְּkֹlִ֔y vַyִּtֶּן־lִ֖y bֵּ֑ן aַl־kֵּ֛ן kָrְaָ֥h shְׁm֖vֹ dָּֽן׃

30.hebrewText: וַתַּ֣הַר ע֔וֹד וַתֵּ֕לֶד בִּלְהָ֖ה שִׁפְחַ֣ת רָחֵ֑ל בֵּ֥ן שֵׁנִ֖י לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
30.englishText: Rachel’s maid Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.
30.transliteration: vַtַּ֣hַr a֔vֹd vַtֵּ֕lֶd bִּlְhָ֖h shִׁpְchַ֣t rָchֵ֑l bֵּ֥ן shֵׁnִ֖y lְyַaֲkֹֽb׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר רָחֵ֗ל נַפְתּוּלֵ֨י אֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> נִפְתַּ֛לְתִּי עִם־אֲחֹתִ֖י גַּם־יָכֹ֑לְתִּי וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ נַפְתָּלִֽי׃
30.englishText: And Rachel said, “A fateful contest I waged*A fateful contest I waged Heb. naphtule … naphtalti, connected with “Naphtali.” Lit. “A contest of God….” with my sister; yes, and I have prevailed.” So she named him Naphtali.
30.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr rָchֵ֗l nַpְtּvּlֵ֨y aֱlֹhִ֧yם <small>׀</small> nִpְtַּ֛lְtִּy aִם־aֲchֹtִ֖y gַּם־yָkֹ֑lְtִּy vַtִּkְrָ֥a shְׁm֖vֹ nַpְtָּlִֽy׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֣רֶא לֵאָ֔ה כִּ֥י עָמְדָ֖ה מִלֶּ֑דֶת וַתִּקַּח֙ אֶת־זִלְפָּ֣ה שִׁפְחָתָ֔הּ וַתִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛הּ לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
30.englishText: When Leah saw that she had stopped bearing children, she took her maid Zilpah and gave her to Jacob as concubine.
30.transliteration: vַtֵּ֣rֶa lֵaָ֔h kִּ֥y aָmְdָ֖h mִlֶּ֑dֶt vַtִּkַּch֙ aֶt־zִlְpָּ֣h shִׁpְchָtָ֔hּ vַtִּtֵּ֥ן aֹtָ֛hּ lְyַaֲkֹ֖b lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֗לֶד זִלְפָּ֛ה שִׁפְחַ֥ת לֵאָ֖ה לְיַעֲקֹ֥ב בֵּֽן׃
30.englishText: And when Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a son,
30.transliteration: vַtֵּ֗lֶd zִlְpָּ֛h shִׁpְchַ֥t lֵaָ֖h lְyַaֲkֹ֥b bֵּֽן׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֥אמֶר לֵאָ֖ה (בגד) [בָּ֣א גָ֑ד] וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ גָּֽד׃
30.englishText: Leah said, “What luck!”*What luck! So the kethib, which reads begad; the qere reads ba’ gad “luck has come”; connected with “Gad.” So she named him Gad.
30.transliteration: vַtֹּ֥amֶr lֵaָ֖h (bgd) [bָּ֣a gָ֑d] vַtִּkְrָ֥a aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ gָּֽd׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֗לֶד זִלְפָּה֙ שִׁפְחַ֣ת לֵאָ֔ה בֵּ֥ן שֵׁנִ֖י לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
30.englishText: When Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a second son,
30.transliteration: vַtֵּ֗lֶd zִlְpָּh֙ shִׁpְchַ֣t lֵaָ֔h bֵּ֥ן shֵׁnִ֖y lְyַaֲkֹֽb׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לֵאָ֔ה בְּאׇשְׁרִ֕י כִּ֥י אִשְּׁר֖וּנִי בָּנ֑וֹת וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ אָשֵֽׁר׃
30.englishText: Leah declared, “What fortune!”*What fortune! Heb. be’oshri, connected with “Asher.” meaning, “Women will deem me fortunate.” So she named him Asher.
30.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr lֵaָ֔h bְּaׇshְׁrִ֕y kִּ֥y aִshְּׁr֖vּnִy bָּn֑vֹt vַtִּkְrָ֥a aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ aָshֵֽׁr׃

30.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ רְאוּבֵ֜ן בִּימֵ֣י קְצִיר־חִטִּ֗ים וַיִּמְצָ֤א דֽוּדָאִים֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה וַיָּבֵ֣א אֹתָ֔ם אֶל־לֵאָ֖ה אִמּ֑וֹ וַתֹּ֤אמֶר רָחֵל֙ אֶל־לֵאָ֔ה תְּנִי־נָ֣א לִ֔י מִדּוּדָאֵ֖י בְּנֵֽךְ׃
30.englishText: Once, at the time of the wheat harvest, Reuben came upon some mandrakes in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Rachel said to Leah, “Please give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”
30.transliteration: vַyֵּ֨lֶךְ rְavּbֵ֜ן bִּymֵ֣y kְtsִyr־chִtִּ֗yם vַyִּmְtsָ֤a dֽvּdָaִyם֙ bַּshָּׂdֶ֔h vַyָּbֵ֣a aֹtָ֔ם aֶl־lֵaָ֖h aִmּ֑vֹ vַtֹּ֤amֶr rָchֵl֙ aֶl־lֵaָ֔h tְּnִy־nָ֣a lִ֔y mִdּvּdָaֵ֖y bְּnֵֽךְ׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לָ֗הּ הַמְעַט֙ קַחְתֵּ֣ךְ אֶת־אִישִׁ֔י וְלָקַ֕חַת גַּ֥ם אֶת־דּוּדָאֵ֖י בְּנִ֑י וַתֹּ֣אמֶר רָחֵ֗ל לָכֵן֙ יִשְׁכַּ֤ב עִמָּךְ֙ הַלַּ֔יְלָה תַּ֖חַת דּוּדָאֵ֥י בְנֵֽךְ׃
30.englishText: But she said to her, “Was it not enough for you to take away my husband, that you would also take my son’s mandrakes?” Rachel replied, “I promise, he shall lie with you tonight, in return for your son’s mandrakes.”
30.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr lָ֗hּ hַmְaַt֙ kַchְtֵּ֣ךְ aֶt־aִyshִׁ֔y vְlָkַ֕chַt gַּ֥ם aֶt־dּvּdָaֵ֖y bְּnִ֑y vַtֹּ֣amֶr rָchֵ֗l lָkֵן֙ yִshְׁkַּ֤b aִmָּךְ֙ hַlַּ֔yְlָh tַּ֖chַt dּvּdָaֵ֥y bְnֵֽךְ׃

30.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֨א יַעֲקֹ֣ב מִן־הַשָּׂדֶה֮ בָּעֶ֒רֶב֒ וַתֵּצֵ֨א לֵאָ֜ה לִקְרָאת֗וֹ וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֵלַ֣י תָּב֔וֹא כִּ֚י שָׂכֹ֣ר שְׂכַרְתִּ֔יךָ בְּדוּדָאֵ֖י בְּנִ֑י וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב עִמָּ֖הּ בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הֽוּא׃
30.englishText: When Jacob came home from the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, “You are to sleep with me, for I have hired you with my son’s mandrakes.” And he lay with her that night.
30.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֨a yַaֲkֹ֣b mִן־hַshָּׂdֶh֮ bָּaֶ֒rֶb֒ vַtֵּtsֵ֨a lֵaָ֜h lִkְrָat֗vֹ vַtֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֵlַ֣y tָּb֔vֹa kִּ֚y shָׂkֹ֣r shְׂkַrְtִּ֔yךָ bְּdvּdָaֵ֖y bְּnִ֑y vַyִּshְׁkַּ֥b aִmָּ֖hּ bַּlַּ֥yְlָh hֽvּa׃

30.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־לֵאָ֑ה וַתַּ֛הַר וַתֵּ֥לֶד לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב בֵּ֥ן חֲמִישִֽׁי׃
30.englishText: God heeded Leah, and she conceived and bore him a fifth son.
30.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֥a aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶl־lֵaָ֑h vַtַּ֛hַr vַtֵּ֥lֶd lְyַaֲkֹ֖b bֵּ֥ן chֲmִyshִֽׁy׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לֵאָ֗ה נָתַ֤ן אֱלֹהִים֙ שְׂכָרִ֔י אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי שִׁפְחָתִ֖י לְאִישִׁ֑י וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יִשָּׂשכָֽר׃
30.englishText: And Leah said, “God has given me my reward*my reward Heb. sekhari, connected with “Issachar.” for having given my maid to my husband.” So she named him Issachar.
30.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr lֵaָ֗h nָtַ֤ן aֱlֹhִyם֙ shְׂkָrִ֔y aֲshֶׁr־nָtַ֥tִּy shִׁpְchָtִ֖y lְaִyshִׁ֑y vַtִּkְrָ֥a shְׁm֖vֹ yִshָּׂshkָֽr׃

30.hebrewText: וַתַּ֤הַר עוֹד֙ לֵאָ֔ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד בֵּן־שִׁשִּׁ֖י לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
30.englishText: When Leah conceived again and bore Jacob a sixth son,
30.transliteration: vַtַּ֤hַr avֹd֙ lֵaָ֔h vַtֵּ֥lֶd bֵּן־shִׁshִּׁ֖y lְyַaֲkֹֽb׃

30.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לֵאָ֗ה זְבָדַ֨נִי אֱלֹהִ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֹתִי֮ זֵ֣בֶד טוֹב֒ הַפַּ֙עַם֙ יִזְבְּלֵ֣נִי אִישִׁ֔י כִּֽי־יָלַ֥דְתִּי ל֖וֹ שִׁשָּׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ זְבֻלֽוּן׃
30.englishText: Leah said, “God has given me a choice gift;*has given me a choice gift Heb. zebadani … zebed. this time my husband will exalt me,*will exalt me Heb. yizbeleni; others “will dwell with me.” for I have borne him six sons.” So she named him Zebulun.
30.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr lֵaָ֗h zְbָdַ֨nִy aֱlֹhִ֥yם <small>׀</small> aֹtִy֮ zֵ֣bֶd tvֹb֒ hַpַּ֙aַם֙ yִzְbְּlֵ֣nִy aִyshִׁ֔y kִּֽy־yָlַ֥dְtִּy l֖vֹ shִׁshָּׁ֣h bָnִ֑yם vַtִּkְrָ֥a aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ zְbֻlֽvּן׃

30.hebrewText: וְאַחַ֖ר יָ֣לְדָה בַּ֑ת וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמָ֖הּ דִּינָֽה׃
30.englishText: Last, she bore him a daughter, and named her Dinah.
30.transliteration: vְaַchַ֖r yָ֣lְdָh bַּ֑t vַtִּkְrָ֥a aֶt־shְׁmָ֖hּ dִּynָֽh׃

30.hebrewText: וַיִּזְכֹּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־רָחֵ֑ל וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיִּפְתַּ֖ח אֶת־רַחְמָֽהּ׃
30.englishText: Now God remembered Rachel; God heeded her and opened her womb.
30.transliteration: vַyִּzְkֹּ֥r aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־rָchֵ֑l vַyִּshְׁmַ֤a aֵlֶ֙yhָ֙ aֱlֹhִ֔yם vַyִּpְtַּ֖ch aֶt־rַchְmָֽhּ׃

30.hebrewText: וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתֹּ֕אמֶר אָסַ֥ף אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־חֶרְפָּתִֽי׃
30.englishText: She conceived and bore a son, and said, “God has taken away*has taken away Heb. ’asaph, connected with “Joseph.” my disgrace.”
30.transliteration: vַtַּ֖hַr vַtֵּ֣lֶd bֵּ֑ן vַtֹּ֕amֶr aָsַ֥ף aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־chֶrְpָּtִֽy׃

30.hebrewText: וַתִּקְרָ֧א אֶת־שְׁמ֛וֹ יוֹסֵ֖ף לֵאמֹ֑ר יֹסֵ֧ף יְהֹוָ֛ה לִ֖י בֵּ֥ן אַחֵֽר׃
30.englishText: So she named him Joseph, which is to say, “May יהוה add*add Heb. yoseph, connected with “Joseph.” another son for me.”
30.transliteration: vַtִּkְrָ֧a aֶt־shְׁm֛vֹ yvֹsֵ֖ף lֵamֹ֑r yֹsֵ֧ף yְhֹvָ֛h lִ֖y bֵּ֥ן aַchֵֽr׃

30.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יָלְדָ֥ה רָחֵ֖ל אֶת־יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־לָבָ֔ן שַׁלְּחֵ֙נִי֙ וְאֵ֣לְכָ֔ה אֶל־מְקוֹמִ֖י וּלְאַרְצִֽי׃
30.englishText: After Rachel had borne Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Give me leave to go back to my own homeland.
30.transliteration: vַyְhִ֕y kַּaֲshֶׁ֛r yָlְdָ֥h rָchֵ֖l aֶt־yvֹsֵ֑ף vַyֹּ֤amֶr yַaֲkֹb֙ aֶl־lָbָ֔ן shַׁlְּchֵ֙nִy֙ vְaֵ֣lְkָ֔h aֶl־mְkvֹmִ֖y vּlְaַrְtsִֽy׃

30.hebrewText: תְּנָ֞ה אֶת־נָשַׁ֣י וְאֶת־יְלָדַ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָבַ֧דְתִּי אֹֽתְךָ֛ בָּהֵ֖ן וְאֵלֵ֑כָה כִּ֚י אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתָּ אֶת־עֲבֹדָתִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲבַדְתִּֽיךָ׃
30.englishText: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served you, that I may go; for well you know what services I have rendered you.”
30.transliteration: tְּnָ֞h aֶt־nָshַׁ֣y vְaֶt־yְlָdַ֗y aֲshֶׁ֨r aָbַ֧dְtִּy aֹֽtְךָ֛ bָּhֵ֖ן vְaֵlֵ֑kָh kִּ֚y aַtָּ֣h yָdַ֔aְtָּ aֶt־aֲbֹdָtִ֖y aֲshֶׁ֥r aֲbַdְtִּֽyךָ׃

30.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ לָבָ֔ן אִם־נָ֛א מָצָ֥אתִי חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ נִחַ֕שְׁתִּי וַיְבָרְכֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּגְלָלֶֽךָ׃
30.englishText: But Laban said to him, “If you will indulge me,*If you will indulge me Lit. “If I have found favor in your eyes.” I have learned by divination that יהוה has blessed me on your account.”
30.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֵlָyv֙ lָbָ֔ן aִם־nָ֛a mָtsָ֥atִy chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynֶ֑yךָ nִchַ֕shְׁtִּy vַyְbָrְkֵ֥nִy yְhֹvָ֖h bִּgְlָlֶֽךָ׃

30.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר נׇקְבָ֧ה שְׂכָרְךָ֛ עָלַ֖י וְאֶתֵּֽנָה׃
30.englishText: And he continued, “Name the wages due from me, and I will pay you.”
30.transliteration: vַyֹּamַ֑r nׇkְbָ֧h shְׂkָrְךָ֛ aָlַ֖y vְaֶtֵּֽnָh׃

30.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתָּ אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲבַדְתִּ֑יךָ וְאֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה מִקְנְךָ֖ אִתִּֽי׃
30.englishText: But he said, “You know well how I have served you and how your livestock has fared with me.
30.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵlָ֔yv aַtָּ֣h yָdַ֔aְtָּ aֵ֖t aֲshֶׁ֣r aֲbַdְtִּ֑yךָ vְaֵ֛t aֲshֶׁr־hָyָ֥h mִkְnְךָ֖ aִtִּֽy׃

30.hebrewText: כִּ֡י מְעַט֩ אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֨ה לְךָ֤ לְפָנַי֙ וַיִּפְרֹ֣ץ לָרֹ֔ב וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה אֹתְךָ֖ לְרַגְלִ֑י וְעַתָּ֗ה מָתַ֛י אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה גַם־אָנֹכִ֖י לְבֵיתִֽי׃
30.englishText: For the little you had before I came has grown to much, since יהוה has blessed you wherever I turned. And now, when shall I make provision for my own household?”
30.transliteration: kִּ֡y mְaַt֩ aֲshֶׁr־hָyָ֨h lְךָ֤ lְpָnַy֙ vַyִּpְrֹ֣ץ lָrֹ֔b vַyְbָ֧rֶךְ yְhֹvָ֛h aֹtְךָ֖ lְrַgְlִ֑y vְaַtָּ֗h mָtַ֛y aֶֽaֱshֶׂ֥h gַם־aָnֹkִ֖y lְbֵytִֽy׃

30.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מָ֣ה אֶתֶּן־לָ֑ךְ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ לֹא־תִתֶּן־לִ֣י מְא֔וּמָה אִם־תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לִּי֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה אָשׁ֛וּבָה אֶרְעֶ֥ה צֹֽאנְךָ֖ אֶשְׁמֹֽר׃
30.englishText: He said, “What shall I pay you?” And Jacob said, “Pay me nothing! If you will do this thing for me, I will again pasture and keep your flocks:
30.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr mָ֣h aֶtֶּן־lָ֑ךְ vַyֹּ֤amֶr yַaֲkֹb֙ lֹa־tִtֶּן־lִ֣y mְa֔vּmָh aִם־tַּֽaֲshֶׂh־lִּy֙ hַdָּbָ֣r hַzֶּ֔h aָshׁ֛vּbָh aֶrְaֶ֥h tsֹֽanְךָ֖ aֶshְׁmֹֽr׃

30.hebrewText: אֶֽעֱבֹ֨ר בְּכׇל־צֹֽאנְךָ֜ הַיּ֗וֹם הָסֵ֨ר מִשָּׁ֜ם כׇּל־שֶׂ֣ה ׀ נָקֹ֣ד וְטָל֗וּא וְכׇל־שֶׂה־חוּם֙ בַּכְּשָׂבִ֔ים וְטָל֥וּא וְנָקֹ֖ד בָּעִזִּ֑ים וְהָיָ֖ה שְׂכָרִֽי׃
30.englishText: let me pass through your whole flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted animal—every dark-colored sheep and every spotted and speckled goat. Such shall be my wages.
30.transliteration: aֶֽaֱbֹ֨r bְּkׇl־tsֹֽanְךָ֜ hַyּ֗vֹם hָsֵ֨r mִshָּׁ֜ם kׇּl־shֶׂ֣h ׀ nָkֹ֣d vְtָl֗vּa vְkׇl־shֶׂh־chvּם֙ bַּkְּshָׂbִ֔yם vְtָl֥vּa vְnָkֹ֖d bָּaִzִּ֑yם vְhָyָ֖h shְׂkָrִֽy׃

30.hebrewText: וְעָֽנְתָה־בִּ֤י צִדְקָתִי֙ בְּי֣וֹם מָחָ֔ר כִּֽי־תָב֥וֹא עַל־שְׂכָרִ֖י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־אֵינֶ֩נּוּ֩ נָקֹ֨ד וְטָל֜וּא בָּֽעִזִּ֗ים וְחוּם֙ בַּכְּשָׂבִ֔ים גָּנ֥וּב ה֖וּא אִתִּֽי׃
30.englishText: In the future when you go over my wages, let my honesty toward you testify for me: if there are among my goats any that are not speckled or spotted or any sheep that are not dark-colored, they got there by theft.”
