30.transliteration: vְaָֽnְtָh־bִּ֤y tsִdְkָtִy֙ bְּy֣vֹם mָchָ֔r kִּֽy־tָb֥vֹa aַl־shְׂkָrִ֖y lְpָnֶ֑yךָ kֹּ֣l aֲshֶׁr־aֵynֶ֩nּvּ֩ nָkֹ֨d vְtָl֜vּa bָּֽaִzִּ֗yם vְchvּם֙ bַּkְּshָׂbִ֔yם gָּn֥vּb h֖vּa aִtִּֽy׃

30.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָבָ֖ן הֵ֑ן ל֖וּ יְהִ֥י כִדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
30.englishText: And Laban said, “Very well, let it be as you say.”
30.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr lָbָ֖ן hֵ֑ן l֖vּ yְhִ֥y kִdְbָrֶֽךָ׃

30.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣סַר בַּיּוֹם֩ הַה֨וּא אֶת־הַתְּיָשִׁ֜ים הָֽעֲקֻדִּ֣ים וְהַטְּלֻאִ֗ים וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־הָֽעִזִּים֙ הַנְּקֻדּ֣וֹת וְהַטְּלֻאֹ֔ת כֹּ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־לָבָן֙ בּ֔וֹ וְכׇל־ח֖וּם בַּכְּשָׂבִ֑ים וַיִּתֵּ֖ן בְּיַד־בָּנָֽיו׃
30.englishText: But that same day he removed the streaked and spotted he-goats and all the speckled and spotted she-goats—every one that had white on it—and all the dark-colored sheep, and left them in the charge of his sons.
30.transliteration: vַyָּ֣sַr bַּyּvֹם֩ hַh֨vּa aֶt־hַtְּyָshִׁ֜yם hָֽaֲkֻdִּ֣yם vְhַtְּlֻaִ֗yם vְaֵ֤t kׇּl־hָֽaִzִּyם֙ hַnְּkֻdּ֣vֹt vְhַtְּlֻaֹ֔t kֹּ֤l aֲshֶׁr־lָbָן֙ bּ֔vֹ vְkׇl־ch֖vּם bַּkְּshָׂbִ֑yם vַyִּtֵּ֖ן bְּyַd־bָּnָֽyv׃

30.hebrewText: וַיָּ֗שֶׂם דֶּ֚רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים בֵּינ֖וֹ וּבֵ֣ין יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיַעֲקֹ֗ב רֹעֶ֛ה אֶת־צֹ֥אן לָבָ֖ן הַנּוֹתָרֹֽת׃
30.englishText: And he put a distance of three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, while Jacob was pasturing the rest of Laban’s flock.
30.transliteration: vַyָּ֗shֶׂם dֶּ֚rֶךְ shְׁlֹ֣shֶׁt yָmִ֔yם bֵּyn֖vֹ vּbֵ֣yן yַaֲkֹ֑b vְyַaֲkֹ֗b rֹaֶ֛h aֶt־tsֹ֥aן lָbָ֖ן hַnּvֹtָrֹֽt׃

30.hebrewText: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֣וֹ יַעֲקֹ֗ב מַקַּ֥ל לִבְנֶ֛ה לַ֖ח וְל֣וּז וְעַרְמ֑וֹן וַיְפַצֵּ֤ל בָּהֵן֙ פְּצָל֣וֹת לְבָנ֔וֹת מַחְשֹׂף֙ הַלָּבָ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמַּקְלֽוֹת׃
30.englishText: Jacob then got fresh shoots of poplar, and of almond and plane, and peeled white stripes in them, laying bare the white of the shoots.
30.transliteration: vַyִּֽkַּֽch־l֣vֹ yַaֲkֹ֗b mַkַּ֥l lִbְnֶ֛h lַ֖ch vְl֣vּz vְaַrְm֑vֹן vַyְpַtsֵּ֤l bָּhֵן֙ pְּtsָl֣vֹt lְbָn֔vֹt mַchְshֹׂף֙ hַlָּbָ֔ן aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־hַmַּkְlֽvֹt׃

30.hebrewText: וַיַּצֵּ֗ג אֶת־הַמַּקְלוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר פִּצֵּ֔ל בָּרְהָטִ֖ים בְּשִֽׁקְת֣וֹת הַמָּ֑יִם אֲשֶׁר֩ תָּבֹ֨אןָ הַצֹּ֤אן לִשְׁתּוֹת֙ לְנֹ֣כַח הַצֹּ֔אן וַיֵּחַ֖מְנָה בְּבֹאָ֥ן לִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃
30.englishText: The rods that he had peeled he set up in front of the goats*goats Lit. “flocks.” in the troughs, the water receptacles, that the goats came to drink from. Their mating occurred when they came to drink,
30.transliteration: vַyַּtsֵּ֗g aֶt־hַmַּkְlvֹt֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r pִּtsֵּ֔l bָּrְhָtִ֖yם bְּshִֽׁkְt֣vֹt hַmָּ֑yִם aֲshֶׁr֩ tָּbֹ֨aןָ hַtsֹּ֤aן lִshְׁtּvֹt֙ lְnֹ֣kַch hַtsֹּ֔aן vַyֵּchַ֖mְnָh bְּbֹaָ֥ן lִshְׁtּֽvֹt׃

30.hebrewText: וַיֶּחֱמ֥וּ הַצֹּ֖אן א��ל־הַמַּקְל֑וֹת וַתֵּלַ֣דְןָ הַצֹּ֔אן עֲקֻדִּ֥ים נְקֻדִּ֖ים וּטְלֻאִֽים׃
30.englishText: and since the goats mated by the rods, the goats brought forth streaked, speckled, and spotted young.
30.transliteration: vַyֶּchֱm֥vּ hַtsֹּ֖aן a��l־hַmַּkְl֑vֹt vַtֵּlַ֣dְןָ hַtsֹּ֔aן aֲkֻdִּ֥yם nְkֻdִּ֖yם vּtְlֻaִֽyם׃

30.hebrewText: וְהַכְּשָׂבִים֮ הִפְרִ֣יד יַעֲקֹב֒ וַ֠יִּתֵּ֠ן פְּנֵ֨י הַצֹּ֧אן אֶל־עָקֹ֛ד וְכׇל־ח֖וּם בְּצֹ֣אן לָבָ֑ן וַיָּֽשֶׁת־ל֤וֹ עֲדָרִים֙ לְבַדּ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א שָׁתָ֖ם עַל־צֹ֥אן לָבָֽן׃
30.englishText: But Jacob dealt separately with the sheep; he made these animals face the streaked or wholly dark-colored animals in Laban’s flock. And so he produced special flocks for himself, which he did not put with Laban’s flocks.
30.transliteration: vְhַkְּshָׂbִyם֮ hִpְrִ֣yd yַaֲkֹb֒ vַ֠yִּtֵּ֠ן pְּnֵ֨y hַtsֹּ֧aן aֶl־aָkֹ֛d vְkׇl־ch֖vּם bְּtsֹ֣aן lָbָ֑ן vַyָּֽshֶׁt־l֤vֹ aֲdָrִyם֙ lְbַdּ֔vֹ vְlֹ֥a shָׁtָ֖ם aַl־tsֹ֥aן lָbָֽן׃

30.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֗ה בְּכׇל־יַחֵם֮ הַצֹּ֣אן הַמְקֻשָּׁרוֹת֒ וְשָׂ֨ם יַעֲקֹ֧ב אֶת־הַמַּקְל֛וֹת לְעֵינֵ֥י הַצֹּ֖אן בָּרְהָטִ֑ים לְיַחְמֵ֖נָּה בַּמַּקְלֽוֹת׃
30.englishText: Moreover, when the sturdier*sturdier Or “early-breeding.” animals were mating, Jacob would place the rods in the troughs, in full view of the animals, so that they mated by the rods;
30.transliteration: vְhָyָ֗h bְּkׇl־yַchֵם֮ hַtsֹּ֣aן hַmְkֻshָּׁrvֹt֒ vְshָׂ֨ם yַaֲkֹ֧b aֶt־hַmַּkְl֛vֹt lְaֵynֵ֥y hַtsֹּ֖aן bָּrְhָtִ֑yם lְyַchְmֵ֖nָּh bַּmַּkְlֽvֹt׃

30.hebrewText: וּבְהַעֲטִ֥יף הַצֹּ֖אן לֹ֣א יָשִׂ֑ים וְהָיָ֤ה הָעֲטֻפִים֙ לְלָבָ֔ן וְהַקְּשֻׁרִ֖ים לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
30.englishText: but with the feebler*feebler Or “late-breeding.” animals he would not place them there. Thus the feeble*feeble Cf. previous note. ones went to Laban and the sturdy to Jacob.
30.transliteration: vּbְhַaֲtִ֥yף hַtsֹּ֖aן lֹ֣a yָshִׂ֑yם vְhָyָ֤h hָaֲtֻpִyם֙ lְlָbָ֔ן vְhַkְּshֻׁrִ֖yם lְyַaֲkֹֽb׃

30.hebrewText: וַיִּפְרֹ֥ץ הָאִ֖ישׁ מְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד וַֽיְהִי־לוֹ֙ צֹ֣אן רַבּ֔וֹת וּשְׁפָחוֹת֙ וַעֲבָדִ֔ים וּגְמַלִּ֖ים וַחֲמֹרִֽים׃
30.englishText: So the man grew exceedingly prosperous, and came to own large flocks, maidservants and menservants, camels and asses.
30.transliteration: vַyִּpְrֹ֥ץ hָaִ֖yshׁ mְaֹ֣d mְaֹ֑d vַֽyְhִy־lvֹ֙ tsֹ֣aן rַbּ֔vֹt vּshְׁpָchvֹt֙ vַaֲbָdִ֔yם vּgְmַlִּ֖yם vַchֲmֹrִֽyם׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֗ע אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֤י בְנֵֽי־לָבָן֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לָקַ֣ח יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֑ינוּ וּמֵאֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֔ינוּ עָשָׂ֕ה אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַכָּבֹ֖ד הַזֶּֽה׃
31.englishText: Now he heard the things that Laban’s sons were saying: “Jacob has taken all that was our father’s, and from that which was our father’s he has built up all this wealth.”
31.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֗a aֶt־dִּbְrֵ֤y bְnֵֽy־lָbָן֙ lֵamֹ֔r lָkַ֣ch yַaֲkֹ֔b aֵ֖t kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֣r lְaָbִ֑ynvּ vּmֵaֲshֶׁ֣r lְaָbִ֔ynvּ aָshָׂ֕h aֵ֥t kׇּl־hַkָּbֹ֖d hַzֶּֽh׃

31.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥רְא יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י לָבָ֑ן וְהִנֵּ֥ה אֵינֶ֛נּוּ עִמּ֖וֹ כִּתְמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֽׁוֹם׃
31.englishText: Jacob also saw that Laban’s manner toward him was not as it had been in the past.
31.transliteration: vַyַּ֥rְa yַaֲkֹ֖b aֶt־pְּnֵ֣y lָbָ֑ן vְhִnֵּ֥h aֵynֶ֛nּvּ aִmּ֖vֹ kִּtְm֥vֹl shִׁlְshֽׁvֹם׃

31.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֔ב שׁ֛וּב אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ אֲבוֹתֶ֖יךָ וּלְמוֹלַדְתֶּ֑ךָ וְאֶֽהְיֶ֖ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
31.englishText: Then יהוה said to Jacob, “Return to your ancestors’ land—where you were born—and I will be with you.”
31.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֔b shׁ֛vּb aֶl־aֶ֥rֶץ aֲbvֹtֶ֖yךָ vּlְmvֹlַdְtֶּ֑ךָ vְaֶֽhְyֶ֖h aִmָּֽךְ׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח יַעֲקֹ֔ב וַיִּקְרָ֖א לְרָחֵ֣ל וּלְלֵאָ֑ה הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה אֶל־צֹאנֽוֹ׃
31.englishText: Jacob had Rachel and Leah called to the field, where his flock was,
31.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁlַ֣ch yַaֲkֹ֔b vַyִּkְrָ֖a lְrָchֵ֣l vּlְlֵaָ֑h hַshָּׂdֶ֖h aֶl־tsֹanֽvֹ׃

31.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ן רֹאֶ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י אֲבִיכֶ֔ן כִּֽי־אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אֵלַ֖י כִּתְמֹ֣ל שִׁלְשֹׁ֑ם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֔י הָיָ֖ה עִמָּדִֽי׃
31.englishText: and said to them, “I see that your father’s manner toward me is not as it has been in the past. But the God of my father’s [house] has been with me.
31.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr lָhֶ֗ן rֹaֶ֤h aָnֹkִy֙ aֶt־pְּnֵ֣y aֲbִykֶ֔ן kִּֽy־aֵynֶ֥nּvּ aֵlַ֖y kִּtְmֹ֣l shִׁlְshֹׁ֑ם vֵֽalֹhֵ֣y aָbִ֔y hָyָ֖h aִmָּdִֽy׃

31.hebrewText: וְאַתֵּ֖נָה יְדַעְתֶּ֑ן כִּ֚י בְּכׇל־כֹּחִ֔י עָבַ֖דְתִּי אֶת־אֲבִיכֶֽן׃
31.englishText: As you know, I have served your father with all my might;
31.transliteration: vְaַtֵּ֖nָh yְdַaְtֶּ֑ן kִּ֚y bְּkׇl־kֹּchִ֔y aָbַ֖dְtִּy aֶt־aֲbִykֶֽן׃

31.hebrewText: וַאֲבִיכֶן֙ הֵ֣תֶל בִּ֔י וְהֶחֱלִ֥ף אֶת־מַשְׂכֻּרְתִּ֖י עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת מֹנִ֑ים וְלֹֽא־נְתָנ֣וֹ אֱלֹהִ֔ים לְהָרַ֖ע עִמָּדִֽי׃
31.englishText: but your father has cheated me, changing my wages time and again.*time and again Lit. “ten times.” God, however, would not let him do me harm.
31.transliteration: vַaֲbִykֶן֙ hֵ֣tֶl bִּ֔y vְhֶchֱlִ֥ף aֶt־mַshְׂkֻּrְtִּ֖y aֲshֶׂ֣rֶt mֹnִ֑yם vְlֹֽa־nְtָn֣vֹ aֱlֹhִ֔yם lְhָrַ֖a aִmָּdִֽy׃

31.hebrewText: אִם־כֹּ֣ה יֹאמַ֗ר נְקֻדִּים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה שְׂכָרֶ֔ךָ וְיָלְד֥וּ כׇל־הַצֹּ֖אן נְקֻדִּ֑ים וְאִם־כֹּ֣ה יֹאמַ֗ר עֲקֻדִּים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה שְׂכָרֶ֔ךָ וְיָלְד֥וּ כׇל־הַצֹּ֖אן עֲקֻדִּֽים׃
31.englishText: If he said thus, ‘The speckled shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop speckled young; and if he said thus, ‘The streaked shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop streaked young.
31.transliteration: aִם־kֹּ֣h yֹamַ֗r nְkֻdִּyם֙ yִhְyֶ֣h shְׂkָrֶ֔ךָ vְyָlְd֥vּ kׇl־hַtsֹּ֖aן nְkֻdִּ֑yם vְaִם־kֹּ֣h yֹamַ֗r aֲkֻdִּyם֙ yִhְyֶ֣h shְׂkָrֶ֔ךָ vְyָlְd֥vּ kׇl־hַtsֹּ֖aן aֲkֻdִּֽyם׃

31.hebrewText: וַיַּצֵּ֧ל אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־מִקְנֵ֥ה אֲבִיכֶ֖ם וַיִּתֶּן־לִֽי׃
31.englishText: God has taken away your father’s livestock and given it to me.
31.transliteration: vַyַּtsֵּ֧l aֱlֹhִ֛yם aֶt־mִkְnֵ֥h aֲbִykֶ֖ם vַyִּtֶּן־lִֽy׃

31.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י בְּעֵת֙ יַחֵ֣ם הַצֹּ֔אן וָאֶשָּׂ֥א עֵינַ֛י וָאֵ֖רֶא בַּחֲל֑וֹם וְהִנֵּ֤ה הָֽעַתֻּדִים֙ הָעֹלִ֣ים עַל־הַצֹּ֔אן עֲקֻדִּ֥ים נְקֻדִּ֖ים וּבְרֻדִּֽים׃
31.englishText: “Once, at the mating time of the flocks, I had a dream in which I saw*I had a dream in which I saw Lit. “I raised my eyes and saw in a dream, behold.” that the he-goats mating with the flock were streaked, speckled, and mottled.
31.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y bְּaֵt֙ yַchֵ֣ם hַtsֹּ֔aן vָaֶshָּׂ֥a aֵynַ֛y vָaֵ֖rֶa bַּchֲl֑vֹם vְhִnֵּ֤h hָֽaַtֻּdִyם֙ hָaֹlִ֣yם aַl־hַtsֹּ֔aן aֲkֻdִּ֥yם nְkֻdִּ֖yם vּbְrֻdִּֽyם׃

31.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלַ֜י מַלְאַ֧ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים בַּחֲל֖וֹם יַֽעֲקֹ֑ב וָאֹמַ֖ר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
31.englishText: And in the dream a messenger of God said to me, ‘Jacob!’ ‘Here,’ I answered.
31.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֵlַ֜y mַlְaַ֧ךְ hָaֱlֹhִ֛yם bַּchֲl֖vֹם yַֽaֲkֹ֑b vָaֹmַ֖r hִnֵּֽnִy׃

31.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר שָׂא־נָ֨א עֵינֶ֤יךָ וּרְאֵה֙ כׇּל־הָֽעַתֻּדִים֙ הָעֹלִ֣ים עַל־הַצֹּ֔אן עֲקֻדִּ֥ים נְקֻדִּ֖ים וּבְרֻדִּ֑ים כִּ֣י רָאִ֔יתִי אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָבָ֖ן עֹ֥שֶׂה לָּֽךְ׃
31.englishText: And the messenger said, ‘Note well that all the he-goats which are mating with the flock are streaked, speckled, and mottled; for I have noted all that Laban has been doing to you.
31.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr shָׂa־nָ֨a aֵynֶ֤yךָ vּrְaֵh֙ kׇּl־hָֽaַtֻּdִyם֙ hָaֹlִ֣yם aַl־hַtsֹּ֔aן aֲkֻdִּ֥yם nְkֻdִּ֖yם vּbְrֻdִּ֑yם kִּ֣y rָaִ֔ytִy aֵ֛t kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֥r lָbָ֖ן aֹ֥shֶׂh lָּֽךְ׃

31.hebrewText: אָנֹכִ֤י הָאֵל֙ בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר מָשַׁ֤חְתָּ שָּׁם֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָדַ֥רְתָּ לִּ֛י שָׁ֖ם נֶ֑דֶר עַתָּ֗ה ק֥וּם צֵא֙ מִן־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וְשׁ֖וּב אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ מוֹלַדְתֶּֽךָ׃
31.englishText: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar and where you made a vow to Me. Now, arise and leave this land and return to your native land.’”
31.transliteration: aָnֹkִ֤y hָaֵl֙ bֵּֽyt־aֵ֔l aֲshֶׁ֨r mָshַׁ֤chְtָּ shָּׁם֙ mַtsֵּbָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֨r nָdַ֥rְtָּ lִּ֛y shָׁ֖ם nֶ֑dֶr aַtָּ֗h k֥vּם tsֵa֙ mִן־hָaָ֣rֶץ hַzֹּ֔at vְshׁ֖vּb aֶl־aֶ֥rֶץ mvֹlַdְtֶּֽךָ׃

31.hebrewText: וַתַּ֤עַן רָחֵל֙ וְלֵאָ֔ה וַתֹּאמַ֖רְנָה ל֑וֹ הַע֥וֹד לָ֛נוּ חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה בְּבֵ֥ית אָבִֽינוּ׃
31.englishText: Then Rachel and Leah answered him, saying, “Have we still a share in the inheritance of our father’s house?
31.transliteration: vַtַּ֤aַן rָchֵl֙ vְlֵaָ֔h vַtֹּamַ֖rְnָh l֑vֹ hַa֥vֹd lָ֛nvּ chֵ֥lֶk vְnַchֲlָ֖h bְּbֵ֥yt aָbִֽynvּ׃

31.hebrewText: הֲל֧וֹא נׇכְרִיּ֛וֹת נֶחְשַׁ֥בְנוּ ל֖וֹ כִּ֣י מְכָרָ֑נוּ וַיֹּ֥אכַל גַּם־אָכ֖וֹל אֶת־כַּסְפֵּֽנוּ׃
31.englishText: Surely, he regards us as outsiders, now that he has sold us and has used up our purchase price.
31.transliteration: hֲl֧vֹa nׇkְrִyּ֛vֹt nֶchְshַׁ֥bְnvּ l֖vֹ kִּ֣y mְkָrָ֑nvּ vַyֹּ֥akַl gַּם־aָk֖vֹl aֶt־kַּsְpֵּֽnvּ׃

31.hebrewText: כִּ֣י כׇל־הָעֹ֗שֶׁר אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצִּ֤יל אֱלֹהִים֙ מֵֽאָבִ֔ינוּ לָ֥נוּ ה֖וּא וּלְבָנֵ֑ינוּ וְעַתָּ֗ה כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֧ר אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֵלֶ֖יךָ עֲשֵֽׂה׃
31.englishText: Truly, all the wealth that God has taken away from our father belongs to us and to our children. Now then, do just as God has told you.”
31.transliteration: kִּ֣y kׇl־hָaֹ֗shֶׁr aֲshֶׁ֨r hִtsִּ֤yl aֱlֹhִyם֙ mֵֽaָbִ֔ynvּ lָ֥nvּ h֖vּa vּlְbָnֵ֑ynvּ vְaַtָּ֗h kֹּl֩ aֲshֶׁ֨r aָmַ֧r aֱlֹhִ֛yם aֵlֶ֖yךָ aֲshֵֽׂh׃

31.hebrewText: וַיָּ֖קׇם יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיִּשָּׂ֛א אֶת־בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶת־נָשָׁ֖יו עַל־הַגְּמַלִּֽים׃
31.englishText: Thereupon Jacob put his children and wives on camels;
31.transliteration: vַyָּ֖kׇם yַaֲkֹ֑b vַyִּshָּׂ֛a aֶt־bָּnָ֥yv vְaֶt־nָshָׁ֖yv aַl־hַgְּmַlִּֽyם׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּנְהַ֣ג אֶת־כׇּל־מִקְנֵ֗הוּ וְאֶת־כׇּל־רְכֻשׁוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָכָ֔שׁ מִקְנֵה֙ קִנְיָנ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָכַ֖שׁ בְּפַדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֑ם לָב֛וֹא אֶל־יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
31.englishText: and he drove off all his livestock and all the wealth that he had amassed, the livestock in his possession that he had acquired in Paddan-aram, to go to his father Isaac in the land of Canaan.
31.transliteration: vַyִּnְhַ֣g aֶt־kׇּl־mִkְnֵ֗hvּ vְaֶt־kׇּl־rְkֻshׁvֹ֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r rָkָ֔shׁ mִkְnֵh֙ kִnְyָn֔vֹ aֲshֶׁ֥r rָkַ֖shׁ bְּpַdַּ֣ן aֲrָ֑ם lָb֛vֹa aֶl־yִtsְchָ֥k aָbִ֖yv aַ֥rְtsָh kְּnָֽaַן׃

31.hebrewText: וְלָבָ֣ן הָלַ֔ךְ לִגְזֹ֖ז אֶת־צֹאנ֑וֹ וַתִּגְנֹ֣ב רָחֵ֔ל אֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְאָבִֽיהָ׃
31.englishText: Meanwhile Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel stole her father’s household idols.
31.transliteration: vְlָbָ֣ן hָlַ֔ךְ lִgְzֹ֖z aֶt־tsֹan֑vֹ vַtִּgְnֹ֣b rָchֵ֔l aֶt־hַtְּrָpִ֖yם aֲshֶׁ֥r lְaָbִֽyhָ׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּגְנֹ֣ב יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶת־לֵ֥ב לָבָ֖ן הָאֲרַמִּ֑י עַל־בְּלִי֙ הִגִּ֣יד ל֔וֹ כִּ֥י בֹרֵ֖חַ הֽוּא׃
31.englishText: Jacob kept Laban the Aramean in the dark,*kept Laban the Aramean in the dark Lit. “stole the mind of Laban the Aramean”; similarly in v. 26. not telling him that he was fleeing,
31.transliteration: vַyִּgְnֹ֣b yַaֲkֹ֔b aֶt־lֵ֥b lָbָ֖ן hָaֲrַmִּ֑y aַl־bְּlִy֙ hִgִּ֣yd l֔vֹ kִּ֥y bֹrֵ֖chַ hֽvּa׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּבְרַ֥ח הוּא֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וַיָּ֖קׇם וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר אֶת־הַנָּהָ֑ר וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־פָּנָ֖יו הַ֥ר הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
31.englishText: and fled with all that he had. Soon he was across the Euphrates and heading toward the hill country of Gilead.
31.transliteration: vַyִּbְrַ֥ch hvּa֙ vְkׇl־aֲshֶׁr־l֔vֹ vַyָּ֖kׇם vַyַּaֲbֹ֣r aֶt־hַnָּhָ֑r vַyָּ֥shֶׂם aֶt־pָּnָ֖yv hַ֥r hַgִּlְaָֽd׃

31.hebrewText: וַיֻּגַּ֥ד לְלָבָ֖ן בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י כִּ֥י בָרַ֖ח יַעֲקֹֽב׃
31.englishText: On the third day, Laban was told that Jacob had fled.
31.transliteration: vַyֻּgַּ֥d lְlָbָ֖ן bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֑y kִּ֥y bָrַ֖ch yַaֲkֹֽb׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־אֶחָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וַיִּרְדֹּ֣ף אַחֲרָ֔יו דֶּ֖רֶךְ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וַיַּדְבֵּ֥ק אֹת֖וֹ בְּהַ֥ר הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
31.englishText: So he took his kinsmen with him and pursued him a distance of seven days, catching up with him in the hill country of Gilead.
31.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֤ch aֶt־aֶchָyv֙ aִmּ֔vֹ vַyִּrְdֹּ֣ף aַchֲrָ֔yv dֶּ֖rֶךְ shִׁbְaַ֣t yָmִ֑yם vַyַּdְbֵּ֥k aֹt֖vֹ bְּhַ֥r hַgִּlְaָֽd׃

31.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֧א אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶל־לָבָ֥ן הָאֲרַמִּ֖י בַּחֲלֹ֣ם הַלָּ֑יְלָה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ הִשָּׁ֧מֶר לְךָ֛ פֶּן־תְּדַבֵּ֥ר עִֽם־יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִטּ֥וֹב עַד־רָֽע׃
31.englishText: But God appeared to Laban the Aramean in a dream by night and said to him, “Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.”
31.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֧a aֱlֹhִ֛yם aֶl־lָbָ֥ן hָaֲrַmִּ֖y bַּchֲlֹ֣ם hַlָּ֑yְlָh vַyֹּ֣amֶr l֗vֹ hִshָּׁ֧mֶr lְךָ֛ pֶּן־tְּdַbֵּ֥r aִֽם־yַaֲkֹ֖b mִtּ֥vֹb aַd־rָֽa׃

31.hebrewText: וַיַּשֵּׂ֥ג לָבָ֖ן אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיַעֲקֹ֗ב תָּקַ֤ע אֶֽת־אׇהֳלוֹ֙ בָּהָ֔ר וְלָבָ֛ן תָּקַ֥ע אֶת־אֶחָ֖יו בְּהַ֥ר הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
31.englishText: Laban overtook Jacob. Jacob had pitched his tent on the Height, and Laban with his kinsmen encamped in the hill country of Gilead.
31.transliteration: vַyַּshֵּׂ֥g lָbָ֖ן aֶֽt־yַaֲkֹ֑b vְyַaֲkֹ֗b tָּkַ֤a aֶֽt־aׇhֳlvֹ֙ bָּhָ֔r vְlָbָ֛ן tָּkַ֥a aֶt־aֶchָ֖yv bְּhַ֥r hַgִּlְaָֽd׃

31.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָבָן֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֔יתָ וַתִּגְנֹ֖ב אֶת־לְבָבִ֑י וַתְּנַהֵג֙ אֶת־בְּנֹתַ֔י כִּשְׁבֻי֖וֹת חָֽרֶב׃
31.englishText: And Laban said to Jacob, “What did you mean by keeping me in the dark and carrying off my daughters like captives of the sword?
31.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr lָbָן֙ lְyַaֲkֹ֔b mֶ֣h aָshִׂ֔ytָ vַtִּgְnֹ֖b aֶt־lְbָbִ֑y vַtְּnַhֵg֙ aֶt־bְּnֹtַ֔y kִּshְׁbֻy֖vֹt chָֽrֶb׃

31.hebrewText: לָ֤מָּה נַחְבֵּ֙אתָ֙ לִבְרֹ֔חַ וַתִּגְנֹ֖ב אֹתִ֑י וְלֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֔י וָֽאֲשַׁלֵּחֲךָ֛ בְּשִׂמְחָ֥ה וּבְשִׁרִ֖ים בְּתֹ֥ף וּבְכ��נּֽוֹר׃
31.englishText: Why did you flee in secrecy and mislead me and not tell me? I would have sent you off with festive music, with timbrel and lyre.
31.transliteration: lָ֤mָּh nַchְbֵּ֙atָ֙ lִbְrֹ֔chַ vַtִּgְnֹ֖b aֹtִ֑y vְlֹa־hִgַּ֣dְtָּ lִּ֔y vָֽaֲshַׁlֵּchֲךָ֛ bְּshִׂmְchָ֥h vּbְshִׁrִ֖yם bְּtֹ֥ף vּbְk��nּֽvֹr׃

31.hebrewText: וְלֹ֣א נְטַשְׁתַּ֔נִי לְנַשֵּׁ֥ק לְבָנַ֖י וְלִבְנֹתָ֑י עַתָּ֖ה הִסְכַּ֥לְתָּֽ עֲשֽׂוֹ׃
31.englishText: You did not even let me kiss my sons and daughters*sons and daughters So NJPS; Heb. levanai we-livnotai, a stock phrase (see, e.g., 46.15; 1 Sam. 30.6; Neh. 5.5) that means “progeny,” thus including grandchildren. good-by! It was a foolish thing for you to do.
31.transliteration: vְlֹ֣a nְtַshְׁtַּ֔nִy lְnַshֵּׁ֥k lְbָnַ֖y vְlִbְnֹtָ֑y aַtָּ֖h hִsְkַּ֥lְtָּֽ aֲshֽׂvֹ׃

31.hebrewText: יֶשׁ־לְאֵ֣ל יָדִ֔י לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת עִמָּכֶ֖ם רָ֑ע וֵֽאלֹהֵ֨י אֲבִיכֶ֜ם אֶ֣מֶשׁ ׀ אָמַ֧ר אֵלַ֣י לֵאמֹ֗ר הִשָּׁ֧מֶר לְךָ֛ מִדַּבֵּ֥ר עִֽם־יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִטּ֥וֹב עַד־רָֽע׃
31.englishText: I have it in my power to do you harm; but the God of your father’s [house] said to me last night, ‘Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.’
31.transliteration: yֶshׁ־lְaֵ֣l yָdִ֔y lַaֲshׂ֥vֹt aִmָּkֶ֖ם rָ֑a vֵֽalֹhֵ֨y aֲbִykֶ֜ם aֶ֣mֶshׁ ׀ aָmַ֧r aֵlַ֣y lֵamֹ֗r hִshָּׁ֧mֶr lְךָ֛ mִdַּbֵּ֥r aִֽם־yַaֲkֹ֖b mִtּ֥vֹb aַd־rָֽa׃

31.hebrewText: וְעַתָּה֙ הָלֹ֣ךְ הָלַ֔כְתָּ כִּֽי־נִכְסֹ֥ף נִכְסַ֖פְתָּה לְבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יךָ לָ֥מָּה גָנַ֖בְתָּ אֶת־אֱלֹהָֽי׃
31.englishText: Very well, you had to leave because you were longing for your father’s house; but why did you steal my gods?”
31.transliteration: vְaַtָּh֙ hָlֹ֣ךְ hָlַ֔kְtָּ kִּֽy־nִkְsֹ֥ף nִkְsַ֖pְtָּh lְbֵ֣yt aָbִ֑yךָ lָ֥mָּh gָnַ֖bְtָּ aֶt־aֱlֹhָֽy׃

31.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַן יַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְלָבָ֑ן כִּ֣י יָרֵ֔אתִי כִּ֣י אָמַ֔רְתִּי פֶּן־תִּגְזֹ֥ל אֶת־בְּנוֹתֶ֖יךָ מֵעִמִּֽי׃
31.englishText: Jacob answered Laban, saying, “I was afraid because I thought you would take your daughters from me by force.
31.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַן yַaֲkֹ֖b vַyֹּ֣amֶr lְlָbָ֑ן kִּ֣y yָrֵ֔atִy kִּ֣y aָmַ֔rְtִּy pֶּן־tִּgְzֹ֥l aֶt־bְּnvֹtֶ֖yךָ mֵaִmִּֽy׃

31.hebrewText: עִ֠ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּמְצָ֣א אֶת־אֱלֹהֶ֘יךָ֮ לֹ֣א יִֽחְיֶה֒ נֶ֣גֶד אַחֵ֧ינוּ הַֽכֶּר־לְךָ֛ מָ֥ה עִמָּדִ֖י וְקַֽח־לָ֑ךְ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב כִּ֥י רָחֵ֖ל גְּנָבָֽתַם׃
31.englishText: But anyone with whom you find your gods shall not remain alive! In the presence of our kin, point out what I have of yours and take it.” Jacob, of course, did not know that Rachel had stolen them.
31.transliteration: aִ֠ם aֲshֶׁ֨r tִּmְtsָ֣a aֶt־aֱlֹhֶ֘yךָ֮ lֹ֣a yִֽchְyֶh֒ nֶ֣gֶd aַchֵ֧ynvּ hַֽkֶּr־lְךָ֛ mָ֥h aִmָּdִ֖y vְkַֽch־lָ֑ךְ vְlֹֽa־yָdַ֣a yַaֲkֹ֔b kִּ֥y rָchֵ֖l gְּnָbָֽtַם׃

31.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֨א לָבָ֜ן בְּאֹ֥הֶל יַעֲקֹ֣ב ׀ וּבְאֹ֣הֶל לֵאָ֗ה וּבְאֹ֛הֶל שְׁתֵּ֥י הָאֲמָהֹ֖ת וְלֹ֣א מָצָ֑א וַיֵּצֵא֙ מֵאֹ֣הֶל לֵאָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖א בְּאֹ֥הֶל רָחֵֽל׃
31.englishText: So Laban went into Jacob’s tent and Leah’s tent and the tents of the two maidservants; but he did not find them. Leaving Leah’s tent, he entered Rachel’s tent.
31.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֨a lָbָ֜ן bְּaֹ֥hֶl yַaֲkֹ֣b ׀ vּbְaֹ֣hֶl lֵaָ֗h vּbְaֹ֛hֶl shְׁtֵּ֥y hָaֲmָhֹ֖t vְlֹ֣a mָtsָ֑a vַyֵּtsֵa֙ mֵaֹ֣hֶl lֵaָ֔h vַyָּbֹ֖a bְּaֹ֥hֶl rָchֵֽl׃

31.hebrewText: וְרָחֵ֞ל לָקְחָ֣ה אֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֗ים וַתְּשִׂמֵ֛ם בְּכַ֥ר הַגָּמָ֖ל וַתֵּ֣שֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַיְמַשֵּׁ֥שׁ לָבָ֛ן אֶת־כׇּל־הָאֹ֖הֶל וְלֹ֥א מָצָֽא׃
31.englishText: Rachel, meanwhile, had taken the idols and placed them in the camel cushion and sat on them; and Laban rummaged through the tent without finding them.
31.transliteration: vְrָchֵ֞l lָkְchָ֣h aֶt־hַtְּrָpִ֗yם vַtְּshִׂmֵ֛ם bְּkַ֥r hַgָּmָ֖l vַtֵּ֣shֶׁb aֲlֵyhֶ֑ם vַyְmַshֵּׁ֥shׁ lָbָ֛ן aֶt־kׇּl־hָaֹ֖hֶl vְlֹ֥a mָtsָֽa׃

31.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־אָבִ֗יהָ אַל־יִ֙חַר֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י כִּ֣י ל֤וֹא אוּכַל֙ לָק֣וּם מִפָּנֶ֔יךָ כִּי־דֶ֥רֶךְ נָשִׁ֖ים לִ֑י וַיְחַפֵּ֕שׂ וְלֹ֥א מָצָ֖א אֶת־הַתְּרָפִֽים׃
31.englishText: For she said to her father, “Let not my lord take it amiss that I cannot rise before you, for I am in a womanly way.” Thus he searched, but could not find the household idols.
31.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr aֶl־aָbִ֗yhָ aַl־yִ֙chַr֙ bְּaֵynֵ֣y aֲdֹnִ֔y kִּ֣y l֤vֹa avּkַl֙ lָk֣vּם mִpָּnֶ֔yךָ kִּy־dֶ֥rֶךְ nָshִׁ֖yם lִ֑y vַyְchַpֵּ֕shׂ vְlֹ֥a mָtsָ֖a aֶt־hַtְּrָpִֽyם׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּ֥חַר לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיָּ֣רֶב בְּלָבָ֑ן וַיַּ֤עַן יַעֲקֹב֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְלָבָ֔ן מַה־פִּשְׁעִי֙ מַ֣ה חַטָּאתִ֔י כִּ֥י דָלַ֖קְתָּ אַחֲרָֽי׃
31.englishText: Now Jacob became incensed and took up his grievance with Laban. Jacob spoke up and said to Laban, “What is my crime, what is my guilt that you should pursue me?
31.transliteration: vַyִּ֥chַr lְyַaֲkֹ֖b vַyָּ֣rֶb bְּlָbָ֑ן vַyַּ֤aַן yַaֲkֹb֙ vַyֹּ֣amֶr lְlָbָ֔ן mַh־pִּshְׁaִy֙ mַ֣h chַtָּatִ֔y kִּ֥y dָlַ֖kְtָּ aַchֲrָֽy׃

31.hebrewText: כִּֽי־מִשַּׁ֣שְׁתָּ אֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלַ֗י מַה־מָּצָ֙אתָ֙ מִכֹּ֣ל כְּלֵי־בֵיתֶ֔ךָ שִׂ֣ים כֹּ֔ה נֶ֥גֶד אַחַ֖י וְאַחֶ֑יךָ וְיוֹכִ֖יחוּ בֵּ֥ין שְׁנֵֽינוּ׃
31.englishText: You rummaged through all my things; what have you found of all your household objects? Set it here, before my kin and yours, and let them decide between us two.
31.transliteration: kִּֽy־mִshַּׁ֣shְׁtָּ aֶt־kׇּl־kֵּlַ֗y mַh־mָּtsָ֙atָ֙ mִkֹּ֣l kְּlֵy־bֵytֶ֔ךָ shִׂ֣yם kֹּ֔h nֶ֥gֶd aַchַ֖y vְaַchֶ֑yךָ vְyvֹkִ֖ychvּ bֵּ֥yן shְׁnֵֽynvּ׃

31.hebrewText: זֶה֩ עֶשְׂרִ֨ים שָׁנָ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ רְחֵלֶ֥יךָ וְעִזֶּ֖יךָ לֹ֣א שִׁכֵּ֑לוּ וְאֵילֵ֥י צֹאנְךָ֖ לֹ֥א אָכָֽלְתִּי׃
31.englishText: “These twenty years I have spent in your service, your ewes and she-goats never miscarried, nor did I feast on rams from your flock.
31.transliteration: zֶh֩ aֶshְׂrִ֨yם shָׁnָ֤h aָnֹkִy֙ aִmָּ֔ךְ rְchֵlֶ֥yךָ vְaִzֶּ֖yךָ lֹ֣a shִׁkֵּ֑lvּ vְaֵylֵ֥y tsֹanְךָ֖ lֹ֥a aָkָֽlְtִּy׃

31.hebrewText: טְרֵפָה֙ לֹא־הֵבֵ֣אתִי אֵלֶ֔יךָ אָנֹכִ֣י אֲחַטֶּ֔נָּה מִיָּדִ֖י תְּבַקְשֶׁ֑נָּה גְּנֻֽבְתִ֣י י֔וֹם וּגְנֻֽבְתִ֖י לָֽיְלָה׃
31.englishText: That which was torn by beasts I never brought to you; I myself made good the loss; you exacted it of me, whether snatched by day or snatched by night.
31.transliteration: tְrֵpָh֙ lֹa־hֵbֵ֣atִy aֵlֶ֔yךָ aָnֹkִ֣y aֲchַtֶּ֔nָּh mִyָּdִ֖y tְּbַkְshֶׁ֑nָּh gְּnֻֽbְtִ֣y y֔vֹם vּgְnֻֽbְtִ֖y lָֽyְlָh׃

31.hebrewText: הָיִ֧יתִי בַיּ֛וֹם אֲכָלַ֥נִי חֹ֖רֶב וְקֶ֣רַח בַּלָּ֑יְלָה וַתִּדַּ֥ד שְׁנָתִ֖י מֵֽעֵינָֽי׃
31.englishText: Often,*Often Lit. “I was.” scorching heat ravaged me by day and frost by night; and sleep fled from my eyes.
31.transliteration: hָyִ֧ytִy bַyּ֛vֹם aֲkָlַ֥nִy chֹ֖rֶb vְkֶ֣rַch bַּlָּ֑yְlָh vַtִּdַּ֥d shְׁnָtִ֖y mֵֽaֵynָֽy׃

31.hebrewText: זֶה־לִּ֞י עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָה֮ בְּבֵיתֶ֒ךָ֒ עֲבַדְתִּ֜יךָ אַרְבַּֽע־עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ בִּשְׁתֵּ֣י בְנֹתֶ֔יךָ וְשֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים בְּצֹאנֶ֑ךָ וַתַּחֲלֵ֥ף אֶת־מַשְׂכֻּרְתִּ֖י עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת מֹנִֽים׃
31.englishText: Of the twenty years that I spent in your household, I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flocks; and you changed my wages time and again.*time and again Lit. “ten times.”
31.transliteration: zֶh־lִּ֞y aֶshְׂrִ֣yם shָׁnָh֮ bְּbֵytֶ֒ךָ֒ aֲbַdְtִּ֜yךָ aַrְbַּֽa־aֶshְׂrֵ֤h shָׁnָh֙ bִּshְׁtֵּ֣y bְnֹtֶ֔yךָ vְshֵׁ֥shׁ shָׁnִ֖yם bְּtsֹanֶ֑ךָ vַtַּchֲlֵ֥ף aֶt־mַshְׂkֻּrְtִּ֖y aֲshֶׂ֥rֶt mֹnִֽyם׃

31.hebrewText: לוּלֵ֡י אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִי֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם וּפַ֤חַד יִצְחָק֙ הָ֣יָה לִ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֖ה רֵיקָ֣ם שִׁלַּחְתָּ֑נִי אֶת־עׇנְיִ֞י וְאֶת־יְגִ֧יעַ כַּפַּ֛י רָאָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים וַיּ֥וֹכַח אָֽמֶשׁ׃
31.englishText: Had not the God of my father’s [house]—the God of Abraham and the Fear*Fear Meaning of Heb. paḥad uncertain. of Isaac—been with me, you would have sent me away empty-handed. But it was my plight and the toil of my hands that God took notice of—and gave judgment on last night.”
31.transliteration: lvּlֵ֡y aֱlֹhֵ֣y aָbִy֩ aֱlֹhֵ֨y aַbְrָhָ֜ם vּpַ֤chַd yִtsְchָk֙ hָ֣yָh lִ֔y kִּ֥y aַtָּ֖h rֵykָ֣ם shִׁlַּchְtָּ֑nִy aֶt־aׇnְyִ֞y vְaֶt־yְgִ֧yaַ kַּpַּ֛y rָaָ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם vַyּ֥vֹkַch aָֽmֶshׁ׃

31.hebrewText: וַיַּ֨עַן לָבָ֜ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הַבָּנ֨וֹת בְּנֹתַ֜י וְהַבָּנִ֤ים בָּנַי֙ וְהַצֹּ֣אן צֹאנִ֔י וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה רֹאֶ֖ה לִי־ה֑וּא וְלִבְנֹתַ֞י מָֽה־אֶעֱשֶׂ֤ה לָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הַיּ֔וֹם א֥וֹ לִבְנֵיהֶ֖ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלָֽדוּ׃
31.englishText: Then Laban spoke up and said to Jacob, “The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, and the flocks are my flocks; all that you see is mine. Yet what can I do now about my daughters or the children they have borne?
31.transliteration: vַyַּ֨aַן lָbָ֜ן vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֗b hַbָּn֨vֹt bְּnֹtַ֜y vְhַbָּnִ֤yם bָּnַy֙ vְhַtsֹּ֣aן tsֹanִ֔y vְkֹ֛l aֲshֶׁr־aַtָּ֥h rֹaֶ֖h lִy־h֑vּa vְlִbְnֹtַ֞y mָֽh־aֶaֱshֶׂ֤h lָaֵ֙lֶּh֙ hַyּ֔vֹם a֥vֹ lִbְnֵyhֶ֖ן aֲshֶׁ֥r yָlָֽdvּ׃

31.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֗ה לְכָ֛ה נִכְרְתָ֥ה בְרִ֖ית אֲנִ֣י וָאָ֑תָּה וְהָיָ֥ה לְעֵ֖ד בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽךָ׃
31.englishText: Come, then, let us make a pact, you and I, that there may be a witness between you and me.”
31.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֗h lְkָ֛h nִkְrְtָ֥h bְrִ֖yt aֲnִ֣y vָaָ֑tָּh vְhָyָ֥h lְaֵ֖d bֵּynִ֥y vּbֵynֶֽךָ׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֥ח יַעֲקֹ֖ב אָ֑בֶן וַיְרִימֶ֖הָ מַצֵּבָֽה׃
31.englishText: Thereupon Jacob took a stone and set it up as a pillar.
31.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֥ch yַaֲkֹ֖b aָ֑bֶן vַyְrִymֶ֖hָ mַtsֵּbָֽh׃

31.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֤ב לְאֶחָיו֙ לִקְט֣וּ אֲבָנִ֔ים וַיִּקְח֥וּ אֲבָנִ֖ים וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־גָ֑ל וַיֹּ֥אכְלוּ שָׁ֖ם עַל־הַגָּֽל׃
31.englishText: And Jacob said to his kinsmen, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a mound; and they partook of a meal there by the mound.
31.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yַaֲkֹ֤b lְaֶchָyv֙ lִkְt֣vּ aֲbָnִ֔yם vַyִּkְch֥vּ aֲbָnִ֖yם vַyַּֽaֲshׂvּ־gָ֑l vַyֹּ֥akְlvּ shָׁ֖ם aַl־hַgָּֽl׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָא־ל֣וֹ לָבָ֔ן יְגַ֖ר שָׂהֲדוּתָ֑א וְיַֽעֲקֹ֔ב קָ֥רָא ל֖וֹ גַּלְעֵֽד׃
31.englishText: Laban named it Yegar-sahadutha,*Yegar-sahadutha Aramaic for “the mound (or: stone-heap) of witness.” but Jacob named it Gal-ed.*Gal-ed Heb. for “the mound (or: stone-heap) of witness,” reflecting the name Gilead, v. 23.
31.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָa־l֣vֹ lָbָ֔ן yְgַ֖r shָׂhֲdvּtָ֑a vְyַֽaֲkֹ֔b kָ֥rָa l֖vֹ gַּlְaֵֽd׃

31.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָבָ֔ן הַגַּ֨ל הַזֶּ֥ה עֵ֛ד בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינְךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ גַּלְעֵֽד׃
31.englishText: And Laban declared, “This mound is a witness between you and me this day.” That is why it was named Gal-ed;
31.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr lָbָ֔ן hַgַּ֨l hַzֶּ֥h aֵ֛d bֵּynִ֥y vּbֵynְךָ֖ hַyּ֑vֹם aַl־kֵּ֥ן kָrָֽa־shְׁm֖vֹ gַּlְaֵֽd׃

31.hebrewText: וְהַמִּצְפָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔ר יִ֥צֶף יְהֹוָ֖ה בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ כִּ֥י נִסָּתֵ֖ר אִ֥ישׁ מֵרֵעֵֽהוּ׃
31.englishText: and [it was called] Mizpah, because he said, “May יהוה watch*watch Heb. yiṣeph, associated with Mizpah. between you and me, when we are out of sight of each other.
31.transliteration: vְhַmִּtsְpָּh֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aָmַ֔r yִ֥tsֶף yְhֹvָ֖h bֵּynִ֣y vּbֵynֶ֑ךָ kִּ֥y nִsָּtֵ֖r aִ֥yshׁ mֵrֵaֵֽhvּ׃

31.hebrewText: אִם־תְּעַנֶּ֣ה אֶת־בְּנֹתַ֗י וְאִם־תִּקַּ֤ח נָשִׁים֙ עַל־בְּנֹתַ֔י אֵ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ עִמָּ֑נוּ רְאֵ֕ה אֱלֹהִ֥ים עֵ֖ד בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽךָ׃
31.englishText: If you ill-treat my daughters or take other wives besides my daughters—though no one else*one else Or “participant,” i.e., one of the witnesses to this agreement, who is thereby authorized to intervene if it is violated; cf. Kimhi, and see the Dictionary under ’ish. be about, remember, it is God who will be witness between you and me.”
31.transliteration: aִם־tְּaַnֶּ֣h aֶt־bְּnֹtַ֗y vְaִם־tִּkַּ֤ch nָshִׁyם֙ aַl־bְּnֹtַ֔y aֵ֥yן aִ֖yshׁ aִmָּ֑nvּ rְaֵ֕h aֱlֹhִ֥yם aֵ֖d bֵּynִ֥y vּbֵynֶֽךָ׃

31.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָבָ֖ן לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ הַגַּ֣ל הַזֶּ֗ה וְהִנֵּה֙ הַמַּצֵּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָרִ֖יתִי בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽךָ׃
31.englishText: And Laban said to Jacob, “Here is this mound and here the pillar which I have set up between you and me:
31.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr lָbָ֖ן lְyַaֲkֹ֑b hִnֵּ֣h ׀ hַgַּ֣l hַzֶּ֗h vְhִnֵּh֙ hַmַּtsֵּbָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r yָrִ֖ytִy bֵּynִ֥y vּbֵynֶֽךָ׃

31.hebrewText: עֵ֚ד הַגַּ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה וְעֵדָ֖ה הַמַּצֵּבָ֑ה אִם־אָ֗נִי לֹֽא־אֶעֱבֹ֤ר אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־הַגַּ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה וְאִם־אַ֠תָּ֠ה לֹא־תַעֲבֹ֨ר אֵלַ֜י אֶת־הַגַּ֥ל הַזֶּ֛ה וְאֶת־הַמַּצֵּבָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְרָעָֽה׃
31.englishText: this mound shall be witness and this pillar shall be witness that I am not to cross to you past this mound, and that you are not to cross to me past this mound and this pillar, with hostile intent.
31.transliteration: aֵ֚d hַgַּ֣l hַzֶּ֔h vְaֵdָ֖h hַmַּtsֵּbָ֑h aִם־aָ֗nִy lֹֽa־aֶaֱbֹ֤r aֵlֶ֙yךָ֙ aֶt־hַgַּ֣l hַzֶּ֔h vְaִם־aַ֠tָּ֠h lֹa־tַaֲbֹ֨r aֵlַ֜y aֶt־hַgַּ֥l hַzֶּ֛h vְaֶt־hַmַּtsֵּbָ֥h hַzֹּ֖at lְrָaָֽh׃

31.hebrewText: אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֤י נָחוֹר֙ יִשְׁפְּט֣וּ בֵינֵ֔ינוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖י אֲבִיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּפַ֖חַד אָבִ֥יו יִצְחָֽק׃
31.englishText: May the God of Abraham’s [house] and the god of Nahor’s [house]”—their ancestral deities—“judge between us.” And Jacob swore by the Fear*Fear Meaning of Heb. paḥad uncertain. of his father Isaac’s [house].
31.transliteration: aֱlֹhֵ֨y aַbְrָhָ֜ם vֵֽalֹhֵ֤y nָchvֹr֙ yִshְׁpְּt֣vּ bֵynֵ֔ynvּ aֱlֹhֵ֖y aֲbִyhֶ֑ם vַyִּshָּׁbַ֣a yַaֲkֹ֔b bְּpַ֖chַd aָbִ֥yv yִtsְchָֽk׃

31.hebrewText: וַיִּזְבַּ֨ח יַעֲקֹ֥ב זֶ֙בַח֙ בָּהָ֔ר וַיִּקְרָ֥א לְאֶחָ֖יו לֶאֱכׇל־לָ֑חֶם וַיֹּ֣אכְלוּ לֶ֔חֶם וַיָּלִ֖ינוּ בָּהָֽר׃
31.englishText: Jacob then offered up a sacrifice on the Height, and invited his kinsmen to partake of the meal. After the meal, they spent the night on the Height.
31.transliteration: vַyִּzְbַּ֨ch yַaֲkֹ֥b zֶ֙bַch֙ bָּhָ֔r vַyִּkְrָ֥a lְaֶchָ֖yv lֶaֱkׇl־lָ֑chֶם vַyֹּ֣akְlvּ lֶ֔chֶם vַyָּlִ֖ynvּ bָּhָֽr׃

32.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם לָבָ֜ן בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיְנַשֵּׁ֧ק לְבָנָ֛יו וְלִבְנוֹתָ֖יו וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֶתְהֶ֑ם וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ וַיָּ֥שׇׁב לָבָ֖ן לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: Early in the morning, Laban kissed his sons and daughters*sons and daughters See note at 31.28. and bade them good-by; then Laban left on his journey homeward.
32.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֨ם lָbָ֜ן bַּbֹּ֗kֶr vַyְnַshֵּׁ֧k lְbָnָ֛yv vְlִbְnvֹtָ֖yv vַyְbָ֣rֶךְ aֶtְhֶ֑ם vַyֵּ֛lֶךְ vַyָּ֥shׇׁb lָbָ֖ן lִmְkֹmֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וְיַעֲקֹ֖ב הָלַ֣ךְ לְדַרְכּ֑וֹ וַיִּפְגְּעוּ־ב֖וֹ מַלְאֲכֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
32.englishText: Jacob went on his way, and messengers of God encountered him.
32.transliteration: vְyַaֲkֹ֖b hָlַ֣ךְ lְdַrְkּ֑vֹ vַyִּpְgְּavּ־b֖vֹ mַlְaֲkֵ֥y aֱlֹhִֽyם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר רָאָ֔ם מַחֲנֵ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים זֶ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֛א שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא מַֽחֲנָֽיִם׃ {פ}
32.englishText: When he saw them, Jacob said, “This is God’s camp.” So he named that place Mahanaim.*Mahanaim Connected with Heb. maḥaneh “camp.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yַaֲkֹb֙ kַּaֲshֶׁ֣r rָaָ֔ם mַchֲnֵ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם zֶ֑h vַyִּkְrָ֛a shֵֽׁם־hַmָּk֥vֹם hַh֖vּa mַֽchֲnָֽyִם׃ {p}

32.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח יַעֲקֹ֤ב מַלְאָכִים֙ לְפָנָ֔יו אֶל־עֵשָׂ֖ו אָחִ֑יו אַ֥רְצָה שֵׂעִ֖יר שְׂדֵ֥ה אֱדֽוֹם׃
32.englishText: Jacob sent messengers ahead to his brother Esau in the land of Seir, the country of Edom,
32.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁlַ֨ch yַaֲkֹ֤b mַlְaָkִyם֙ lְpָnָ֔yv aֶl־aֵshָׂ֖v aָchִ֑yv aַ֥rְtsָh shֵׂaִ֖yr shְׂdֵ֥h aֱdֽvֹם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֤ו אֹתָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֣ה תֹאמְר֔וּן לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לְעֵשָׂ֑ו כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ עַבְדְּךָ֣ יַעֲקֹ֔ב עִם־לָבָ֣ן גַּ֔רְתִּי וָאֵחַ֖ר עַד־עָֽתָּה׃
32.englishText: and instructed them as follows, “Thus shall you say, ‘To my lord Esau, thus says your servant Jacob:*Thus shall you say, ‘To my lord Esau, thus says your servant Jacob…’ Or “Thus you shall say to my lord Esau, ‘Thus says your servant Jacob…’” I stayed with Laban and remained until now;
32.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֤v aֹtָם֙ lֵamֹ֔r kֹּ֣h tֹamְr֔vּן lַֽadֹnִ֖y lְaֵshָׂ֑v kֹּ֤h aָmַr֙ aַbְdְּךָ֣ yַaֲkֹ֔b aִם־lָbָ֣ן gַּ֔rְtִּy vָaֵchַ֖r aַd־aָֽtָּh׃

32.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־לִי֙ שׁ֣וֹר וַחֲמ֔וֹר צֹ֖אן וְעֶ֣בֶד וְשִׁפְחָ֑ה וָֽאֶשְׁלְחָה֙ לְהַגִּ֣יד לַֽאדֹנִ֔י לִמְצֹא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
32.englishText: I have acquired cattle, asses, sheep, and male and female slaves; and I send this message to my lord in the hope of gaining your favor.’”
32.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־lִy֙ shׁ֣vֹr vַchֲm֔vֹr tsֹ֖aן vְaֶ֣bֶd vְshִׁpְchָ֑h vָֽaֶshְׁlְchָh֙ lְhַgִּ֣yd lַֽadֹnִ֔y lִmְtsֹa־chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynֶֽyךָ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב לֵאמֹ֑ר בָּ֤אנוּ אֶל־אָחִ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־עֵשָׂ֔ו וְגַם֙ הֹלֵ֣ךְ לִקְרָֽאתְךָ֔ וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת אִ֖ישׁ עִמּֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau; he himself is coming to meet you, and his retinue*retinue Trad. “men,” yet women may be in view. See 33.15; cf. 24.59; contrast Judg. 9.49 with Exod. 32.28. See further the Dictionary under ’ish. numbers four hundred.”
32.transliteration: vַyָּshֻׁ֙bvּ֙ hַmַּlְaָkִ֔yם aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֖b lֵamֹ֑r bָּ֤anvּ aֶl־aָchִ֙yךָ֙ aֶl־aֵshָׂ֔v vְgַם֙ hֹlֵ֣ךְ lִkְrָֽatְךָ֔ vְaַrְbַּa־mֵa֥vֹt aִ֖yshׁ aִmּֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּירָ֧א יַעֲקֹ֛ב מְאֹ֖ד וַיֵּ֣צֶר ל֑וֹ וַיַּ֜חַץ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֗וֹ וְאֶת־הַצֹּ֧אן וְאֶת־הַבָּקָ֛ר וְהַגְּמַלִּ֖ים לִשְׁנֵ֥י מַחֲנֽוֹת׃
32.englishText: Jacob was greatly frightened; in his anxiety, he divided the people with him, and the flocks and herds and camels, into two camps,
32.transliteration: vַyִּyrָ֧a yַaֲkֹ֛b mְaֹ֖d vַyֵּ֣tsֶr l֑vֹ vַyַּ֜chַץ aֶt־hָaָ֣ם aֲshֶׁr־aִtּ֗vֹ vְaֶt־hַtsֹּ֧aן vְaֶt־hַbָּkָ֛r vְhַgְּmַlִּ֖yם lִshְׁnֵ֥y mַchֲnֽvֹt׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אִם־יָב֥וֹא עֵשָׂ֛ו אֶל־הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הָאַחַ֖ת וְהִכָּ֑הוּ וְהָיָ֛ה הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הַנִּשְׁאָ֖ר לִפְלֵיטָֽה׃
32.englishText: thinking, “If Esau comes to the one camp and attacks it, the other camp may yet escape.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr aִם־yָb֥vֹa aֵshָׂ֛v aֶl־hַmַּchֲnֶ֥h hָaַchַ֖t vְhִkָּ֑hvּ vְhָyָ֛h hַmַּchֲnֶ֥h hַnִּshְׁaָ֖r lִpְlֵytָֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ יַעֲקֹב֒ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אָבִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם וֵאלֹהֵ֖י אָבִ֣י יִצְחָ֑ק יְהֹוָ֞ה הָאֹמֵ֣ר אֵלַ֗י שׁ֧וּב לְאַרְצְךָ֛ וּלְמוֹלַדְתְּךָ֖ וְאֵיטִ֥יבָה עִמָּֽךְ׃
32.englishText: Then Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham’s [house] and God of my father Isaac’s [house], O יהוה, who said to me, ‘Return to your native land and I will deal bountifully with you’!
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֘amֶr֮ yַaֲkֹb֒ aֱlֹhֵy֙ aָbִ֣y aַbְrָhָ֔ם vֵalֹhֵ֖y aָbִ֣y yִtsְchָ֑k yְhֹvָ֞h hָaֹmֵ֣r aֵlַ֗y shׁ֧vּb lְaַrְtsְךָ֛ vּlְmvֹlַdְtְּךָ֖ vְaֵytִ֥ybָh aִmָּֽךְ׃

32.hebrewText: קָטֹ֜נְתִּי מִכֹּ֤ל הַחֲסָדִים֙ וּמִכׇּל־הָ֣אֱמֶ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתָ אֶת־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֣י בְמַקְלִ֗י עָבַ֙רְתִּי֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֣ן הַזֶּ֔ה וְעַתָּ֥ה הָיִ֖יתִי לִשְׁנֵ֥י מַחֲנֽוֹת׃
32.englishText: I am unworthy of all the kindness that You have so steadfastly shown Your servant: with my staff alone I crossed this Jordan, and now I have become two camps.
32.transliteration: kָtֹ֜nְtִּy mִkֹּ֤l hַchֲsָdִyם֙ vּmִkׇּl־hָ֣aֱmֶ֔t aֲshֶׁ֥r aָshִׂ֖ytָ aֶt־aַbְdֶּ֑ךָ kִּ֣y bְmַkְlִ֗y aָbַ֙rְtִּy֙ aֶt־hַyַּrְdֵּ֣ן hַzֶּ֔h vְaַtָּ֥h hָyִ֖ytִy lִshְׁnֵ֥y mַchֲnֽvֹt׃

32.hebrewText: הַצִּילֵ֥נִי נָ֛א מִיַּ֥ד אָחִ֖י מִיַּ֣ד עֵשָׂ֑ו כִּֽי־יָרֵ֤א אָנֹכִי֙ אֹת֔וֹ פֶּן־יָב֣וֹא וְהִכַּ֔נִי אֵ֖ם עַל־בָּנִֽים׃
32.englishText: Deliver me, I pray, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau; else, I fear, he may come and strike me down, mothers and children alike.
32.transliteration: hַtsִּylֵ֥nִy nָ֛a mִyַּ֥d aָchִ֖y mִyַּ֣d aֵshָׂ֑v kִּֽy־yָrֵ֤a aָnֹkִy֙ aֹt֔vֹ pֶּן־yָb֣vֹa vְhִkַּ֔nִy aֵ֖ם aַl־bָּnִֽyם׃

32.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֣ה אָמַ֔רְתָּ הֵיטֵ֥ב אֵיטִ֖יב עִמָּ֑ךְ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּח֣וֹל הַיָּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יִסָּפֵ֖ר מֵרֹֽב׃
32.englishText: Yet You have said, ‘I will deal bountifully with you and make your offspring as the sands of the sea, which are too numerous to count.’”
32.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֣h aָmַ֔rְtָּ hֵytֵ֥b aֵytִ֖yb aִmָּ֑ךְ vְshַׂmְtִּ֤y aֶֽt־zַrְaֲךָ֙ kְּch֣vֹl hַyָּ֔ם aֲshֶׁ֥r lֹa־yִsָּpֵ֖r mֵrֹֽb׃

32.hebrewText: וַיָּ֥לֶן שָׁ֖ם בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֑וּא וַיִּקַּ֞ח מִן־הַבָּ֧א בְיָד֛וֹ מִנְחָ֖ה לְעֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִֽיו׃
32.englishText: After spending the night there, he selected from what was at hand these presents for his brother Esau:
32.transliteration: vַyָּ֥lֶן shָׁ֖ם bַּlַּ֣yְlָh hַh֑vּa vַyִּkַּ֞ch mִן־hַbָּ֧a bְyָd֛vֹ mִnְchָ֖h lְaֵshָׂ֥v aָchִֽyv׃

32.hebrewText: עִזִּ֣ים מָאתַ֔יִם וּתְיָשִׁ֖ים עֶשְׂרִ֑ים רְחֵלִ֥ים מָאתַ֖יִם וְאֵילִ֥ים עֶשְׂרִֽים׃
32.englishText: 200 she-goats and 20 he-goats; 200 ewes and 20 rams;
32.transliteration: aִzִּ֣yם mָatַ֔yִם vּtְyָshִׁ֖yם aֶshְׂrִ֑yם rְchֵlִ֥yם mָatַ֖yִם vְaֵylִ֥yם aֶshְׂrִֽyם׃

32.hebrewText: גְּמַלִּ֧ים מֵינִיק֛וֹת וּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֑ים פָּר֤וֹת אַרְבָּעִים֙ וּפָרִ֣ים עֲשָׂרָ֔ה אֲתֹנֹ֣ת עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וַעְיָרִ֖ם עֲשָׂרָֽה׃
32.englishText: 30 milch camels with their colts; 40 cows and 10 bulls; 20 she-asses and 10 he-asses.
32.transliteration: gְּmַlִּ֧yם mֵynִyk֛vֹt vּbְnֵyhֶ֖ם shְׁlֹshִׁ֑yם pָּr֤vֹt aַrְbָּaִyם֙ vּpָrִ֣yם aֲshָׂrָ֔h aֲtֹnֹ֣t aֶshְׂrִ֔yם vַaְyָrִ֖ם aֲshָׂrָֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּתֵּן֙ בְּיַד־עֲבָדָ֔יו עֵ֥דֶר עֵ֖דֶר לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־עֲבָדָיו֙ עִבְר֣וּ לְפָנַ֔י וְרֶ֣וַח תָּשִׂ֔ימוּ בֵּ֥ין עֵ֖דֶר וּבֵ֥ין עֵֽדֶר׃
32.englishText: These he put in the charge of his servants, drove by drove, and he told his servants, “Go on ahead, and keep a distance between droves.”
32.transliteration: vַyִּtֵּן֙ bְּyַd־aֲbָdָ֔yv aֵ֥dֶr aֵ֖dֶr lְbַdּ֑vֹ vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֶl־aֲbָdָyv֙ aִbְr֣vּ lְpָnַ֔y vְrֶ֣vַch tָּshִׂ֔ymvּ bֵּ֥yן aֵ֖dֶr vּbֵ֥yן aֵֽdֶr׃

32.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֥ו אֶת־הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן לֵאמֹ֑ר כִּ֣י יִֽפְגׇשְׁךָ֞ עֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֗י וּשְׁאֵֽלְךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְמִי־אַ֙תָּה֙ וְאָ֣נָה תֵלֵ֔ךְ וּלְמִ֖י אֵ֥לֶּה לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
32.englishText: He instructed the one in front as follows, “When my brother Esau meets you and asks you, ‘Who’s your master? Where are you going? And whose [animals] are these ahead of you?’
32.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֥v aֶt־hָrִashׁ֖vֹן lֵamֹ֑r kִּ֣y yִֽpְgׇshְׁךָ֞ aֵshָׂ֣v aָchִ֗y vּshְׁaֵֽlְךָ֙ lֵamֹ֔r lְmִy־aַ֙tָּh֙ vְaָ֣nָh tֵlֵ֔ךְ vּlְmִ֖y aֵ֥lֶּh lְpָnֶֽyךָ׃

32.hebrewText: וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ לְעַבְדְּךָ֣ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב מִנְחָ֥ה הִוא֙ שְׁלוּחָ֔ה לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לְעֵשָׂ֑ו וְהִנֵּ֥ה גַם־ה֖וּא אַחֲרֵֽינוּ׃
32.englishText: you shall answer, ‘Your servant Jacob’s; they are a gift sent to my lord Esau; and [Jacob] himself is right behind us.’”
32.transliteration: vְaָֽmַrְtָּ֙ lְaַbְdְּךָ֣ lְyַaֲkֹ֔b mִnְchָ֥h hִva֙ shְׁlvּchָ֔h lַֽadֹnִ֖y lְaֵshָׂ֑v vְhִnֵּ֥h gַם־h֖vּa aַchֲrֵֽynvּ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֞ו גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַשֵּׁנִ֗י גַּ֚ם אֶת־הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י גַּ֚ם אֶת־כׇּל־הַהֹ֣לְכִ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֥י הָעֲדָרִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ תְּדַבְּר֣וּן אֶל־עֵשָׂ֔ו בְּמֹצַאֲכֶ֖ם אֹתֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: He gave similar instructions to the second one, and the third, and all the others who followed the droves, namely, “Thus and so shall you say to Esau when you reach him.
32.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֞v gַּ֣ם aֶt־hַshֵּׁnִ֗y gַּ֚ם aֶt־hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֔y gַּ֚ם aֶt־kׇּl־hַhֹ֣lְkִ֔yם aַchֲrֵ֥y hָaֲdָrִ֖yם lֵamֹ֑r kַּdָּbָ֤r hַzֶּh֙ tְּdַbְּr֣vּן aֶl־aֵshָׂ֔v bְּmֹtsַaֲkֶ֖ם aֹtֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֕ם גַּ֗ם הִנֵּ֛ה עַבְדְּךָ֥ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אַחֲרֵ֑ינוּ כִּֽי־אָמַ֞ר אֲכַפְּרָ֣ה פָנָ֗יו בַּמִּנְחָה֙ הַהֹלֶ֣כֶת לְפָנָ֔י וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵן֙ אֶרְאֶ֣ה פָנָ֔יו אוּלַ֖י יִשָּׂ֥א פָנָֽי׃
32.englishText: And you shall add, ‘And your servant Jacob himself is right behind us.’” For he reasoned, “If I propitiate him with presents in advance, and then face him, perhaps he will show me favor.”
32.transliteration: vַaֲmַrְtֶּ֕ם gַּ֗ם hִnֵּ֛h aַbְdְּךָ֥ yַaֲkֹ֖b aַchֲrֵ֑ynvּ kִּֽy־aָmַ֞r aֲkַpְּrָ֣h pָnָ֗yv bַּmִּnְchָh֙ hַhֹlֶ֣kֶt lְpָnָ֔y vְaַchֲrֵy־kֵן֙ aֶrְaֶ֣h pָnָ֔yv avּlַ֖y yִshָּׂ֥a pָnָֽy׃

32.hebrewText: וַתַּעֲבֹ֥ר הַמִּנְחָ֖ה עַל־פָּנָ֑יו וְה֛וּא לָ֥ן בַּלַּֽיְלָה־הַה֖וּא בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
32.englishText: And so the gift went on ahead, while he remained in camp that night.
32.transliteration: vַtַּaֲbֹ֥r hַmִּnְchָ֖h aַl־pָּnָ֑yv vְh֛vּa lָ֥ן bַּlַּֽyְlָh־hַh֖vּa bַּֽmַּchֲnֶֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣קׇם ׀ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה ה֗וּא וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֤י נָשָׁיו֙ וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י שִׁפְחֹתָ֔יו וְאֶת־אַחַ֥ד עָשָׂ֖ר יְלָדָ֑יו וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֔ר אֵ֖ת מַעֲבַ֥ר יַבֹּֽק׃
32.englishText: That same night he arose, and taking his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven sons,*sons NJPS “children”; Heb. yeladim. Given the specified number, the reference cannot include Jacob’s daughter(s). English idiom warrants the greater gender specificity. he crossed the ford of the Jabbok.
32.transliteration: vַyָּ֣kׇם ׀ bַּlַּ֣yְlָh h֗vּa vַyִּkַּ֞ch aֶt־shְׁtֵּ֤y nָshָׁyv֙ vְaֶt־shְׁtֵּ֣y shִׁpְchֹtָ֔yv vְaֶt־aַchַ֥d aָshָׂ֖r yְlָdָ֑yv vַֽyַּaֲbֹ֔r aֵ֖t mַaֲbַ֥r yַbֹּֽk׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּ֨קָּחֵ֔ם וַיַּֽעֲבִרֵ֖ם אֶת־הַנָּ֑חַל וַֽיַּעֲבֵ֖ר אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: After taking them across the stream, he sent across all his possessions.
32.transliteration: vַyִּ֨kָּchֵ֔ם vַyַּֽaֲbִrֵ֖ם aֶt־hַnָּ֑chַl vַֽyַּaֲbֵ֖r aֶt־aֲshֶׁr־lֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּוָּתֵ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַיֵּאָבֵ֥ק אִישׁ֙ עִמּ֔וֹ עַ֖ד עֲל֥וֹת הַשָּֽׁחַר׃
32.englishText: Jacob was left alone. And a figure*figure Or “[divine] agent.” The expectation of divine intervention (see 28.15; 32.10–13) via a nearby agent (see 32.2–3) evokes this extended sense. Cf. 18.2; see further the Dictionary under ’ish; Agent. wrestled with him until the break of dawn.
32.transliteration: vַyִּvָּtֵ֥r yַaֲkֹ֖b lְbַdּ֑vֹ vַyֵּaָbֵ֥k aִyshׁ֙ aִmּ֔vֹ aַ֖d aֲl֥vֹt hַshָּֽׁchַr׃

32.hebrewText: וַיַּ֗רְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָכֹל֙ ל֔וֹ וַיִּגַּ֖ע בְּכַף־יְרֵכ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֙קַע֙ כַּף־יֶ֣רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּהֵאָֽבְק֖וֹ עִמּֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: When he saw that he had not prevailed against him, he wrenched Jacob’s hip at its socket, so that the socket of his hip was strained as he wrestled with him.
32.transliteration: vַyַּ֗rְa kִּ֣y lֹ֤a yָkֹl֙ l֔vֹ vַyִּgַּ֖a bְּkַף־yְrֵk֑vֹ vַtֵּ֙kַa֙ kַּף־yֶ֣rֶךְ yַaֲkֹ֔b bְּhֵaָֽbְk֖vֹ aִmּֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שַׁלְּחֵ֔נִי כִּ֥י עָלָ֖ה הַשָּׁ֑חַר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֲשַֽׁלֵּחֲךָ֔ כִּ֖י אִם־בֵּרַכְתָּֽנִי׃
32.englishText: Then he said, “Let me go, for dawn is breaking.” But he answered, “I will not let you go, unless you bless me.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr shַׁlְּchֵ֔nִy kִּ֥y aָlָ֖h hַshָּׁ֑chַr vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lֹ֣a aֲshַֽׁlֵּchֲךָ֔ kִּ֖y aִם־bֵּrַkְtָּֽnִy׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו מַה־שְּׁמֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹֽב׃
32.englishText: Said the other, “What is your name?” He replied, “Jacob.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֵlָ֖yv mַh־shְּׁmֶ֑ךָ vַyֹּ֖amֶr yַaֲkֹֽb׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לֹ֤א יַעֲקֹב֙ יֵאָמֵ֥ר עוֹד֙ שִׁמְךָ֔ כִּ֖י אִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־שָׂרִ֧יתָ עִם־אֱלֹהִ֛ים וְעִם־אֲנָשִׁ֖ים וַתּוּכָֽל׃
32.englishText: Said he, “Your name shall no longer be Jacob, but Israel, for you have striven*striven Heb. saritha, connected with first part of “Israel.” with beings divine and human,*beings divine and human Or “God (Elohim, connected with second part of ‘Israel’) and human beings.” and have prevailed.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr lֹ֤a yַaֲkֹb֙ yֵaָmֵ֥r avֹd֙ shִׁmְךָ֔ kִּ֖y aִם־yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l kִּֽy־shָׂrִ֧ytָ aִם־aֱlֹhִ֛yם vְaִם־aֲnָshִׁ֖yם vַtּvּkָֽl׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁאַ֣ל יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַגִּֽידָה־נָּ֣א שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה תִּשְׁאַ֣ל לִשְׁמִ֑י וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֹת֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
32.englishText: Jacob asked, “Pray tell me your name.” But he said, “You must not ask my name!” And he took leave of him there.
32.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁaַ֣l yַaֲkֹ֗b vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ hַgִּֽydָh־nָּ֣a shְׁmֶ֔ךָ vַyֹּ֕amֶr lָ֥mָּh zֶּ֖h tִּshְׁaַ֣l lִshְׁmִ֑y vַyְbָ֥rֶךְ aֹt֖vֹ shָֽׁם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֧א יַעֲקֹ֛ב שֵׁ֥ם הַמָּק֖וֹם פְּנִיאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־רָאִ֤יתִי אֱלֹהִים֙ פָּנִ֣ים אֶל־פָּנִ֔ים וַתִּנָּצֵ֖ל נַפְשִֽׁי׃
32.englishText: So Jacob named the place Peniel,*Peniel Understood as “face of God.” meaning, “I have seen a divine being face to face, yet my life has been preserved.”
32.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֧a yַaֲkֹ֛b shֵׁ֥ם hַmָּk֖vֹם pְּnִyaֵ֑l kִּֽy־rָaִ֤ytִy aֱlֹhִyם֙ pָּnִ֣yם aֶl־pָּnִ֔yם vַtִּnָּtsֵ֖l nַpְshִֽׁy׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּֽזְרַֽח־ל֣וֹ הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָבַ֖ר אֶת־פְּנוּאֵ֑ל וְה֥וּא צֹלֵ֖עַ עַל־יְרֵכֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: The sun rose upon him as he passed Penuel, limping on his hip.
32.transliteration: vַyִּֽzְrַֽch־l֣vֹ hַshֶּׁ֔mֶshׁ kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r aָbַ֖r aֶt־pְּnvּaֵ֑l vְh֥vּa tsֹlֵ֖aַ aַl־yְrֵkֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: עַל־כֵּ֡ן לֹֽא־יֹאכְל֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־גִּ֣יד הַנָּשֶׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־כַּ֣ף הַיָּרֵ֔ךְ עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֤י נָגַע֙ בְּכַף־יֶ֣רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּגִ֖יד הַנָּשֶֽׁה׃
32.englishText: That is why the children of Israel to this day do not eat the thigh muscle that is on the socket of the hip, since Jacob’s hip socket was wrenched at the thigh muscle.
32.transliteration: aַl־kֵּ֡ן lֹֽa־yֹakְl֨vּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֜l aֶt־gִּ֣yd hַnָּshֶׁ֗h aֲshֶׁr֙ aַl־kַּ֣ף hַyָּrֵ֔ךְ aַ֖d hַyּ֣vֹם hַzֶּ֑h kִּ֤y nָgַa֙ bְּkַף־yֶ֣rֶךְ yַaֲkֹ֔b bְּgִ֖yd hַnָּshֶֽׁh׃

vayishlach.name: Vayishlach
vayishlach.summary: Jacob prepares to meet Esau, Jacob wrestles with an angel, the reunion with Esau, the rape of Dinah, the revenge of Simeon and Levi, and the death of Rachel.

32.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם לָבָ֜ן בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיְנַשֵּׁ֧ק לְבָנָ֛יו וְלִבְנוֹתָ֖יו וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֶתְהֶ֑ם וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ וַיָּ֥שׇׁב לָבָ֖ן לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: Early in the morning, Laban kissed his sons and daughters*sons and daughters See note at 31.28. and bade them good-by; then Laban left on his journey homeward.
32.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֨ם lָbָ֜ן bַּbֹּ֗kֶr vַyְnַshֵּׁ֧k lְbָnָ֛yv vְlִbְnvֹtָ֖yv vַyְbָ֣rֶךְ aֶtְhֶ֑ם vַyֵּ֛lֶךְ vַyָּ֥shׇׁb lָbָ֖ן lִmְkֹmֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וְיַעֲקֹ֖ב הָלַ֣ךְ לְדַרְכּ֑וֹ וַיִּפְגְּעוּ־ב֖וֹ מַלְאֲכֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
32.englishText: Jacob went on his way, and messengers of God encountered him.
32.transliteration: vְyַaֲkֹ֖b hָlַ֣ךְ lְdַrְkּ֑vֹ vַyִּpְgְּavּ־b֖vֹ mַlְaֲkֵ֥y aֱlֹhִֽyם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר רָאָ֔ם מַחֲנֵ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים זֶ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֛א שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא מַֽחֲנָֽיִם׃ {פ}
32.englishText: When he saw them, Jacob said, “This is God’s camp.” So he named that place Mahanaim.*Mahanaim Connected with Heb. maḥaneh “camp.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yַaֲkֹb֙ kַּaֲshֶׁ֣r rָaָ֔ם mַchֲnֵ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם zֶ֑h vַyִּkְrָ֛a shֵֽׁם־hַmָּk֥vֹם hַh֖vּa mַֽchֲnָֽyִם׃ {p}

32.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח יַעֲקֹ֤ב מַלְאָכִים֙ לְפָנָ֔יו אֶל־עֵשָׂ֖ו אָחִ֑יו אַ֥רְצָה שֵׂעִ֖יר שְׂדֵ֥ה אֱדֽוֹם׃
32.englishText: Jacob sent messengers ahead to his brother Esau in the land of Seir, the country of Edom,
32.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁlַ֨ch yַaֲkֹ֤b mַlְaָkִyם֙ lְpָnָ֔yv aֶl־aֵshָׂ֖v aָchִ֑yv aַ֥rְtsָh shֵׂaִ֖yr shְׂdֵ֥h aֱdֽvֹם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֤ו אֹתָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֣ה תֹאמְר֔וּן לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לְעֵשָׂ֑ו כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ עַבְדְּךָ֣ יַעֲקֹ֔ב עִם־לָבָ֣ן גַּ֔רְתִּי וָאֵחַ֖ר עַד־עָֽתָּה׃
32.englishText: and instructed them as follows, “Thus shall you say, ‘To my lord Esau, thus says your servant Jacob:*Thus shall you say, ‘To my lord Esau, thus says your servant Jacob…’ Or “Thus you shall say to my lord Esau, ‘Thus says your servant Jacob…’” I stayed with Laban and remained until now;
32.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֤v aֹtָם֙ lֵamֹ֔r kֹּ֣h tֹamְr֔vּן lַֽadֹnִ֖y lְaֵshָׂ֑v kֹּ֤h aָmַr֙ aַbְdְּךָ֣ yַaֲkֹ֔b aִם־lָbָ֣ן gַּ֔rְtִּy vָaֵchַ֖r aַd־aָֽtָּh׃

32.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־לִי֙ שׁ֣וֹר וַחֲמ֔וֹר צֹ֖אן וְעֶ֣בֶד וְשִׁפְחָ֑ה וָֽאֶשְׁלְחָה֙ לְהַגִּ֣יד לַֽאדֹנִ֔י לִמְצֹא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
32.englishText: I have acquired cattle, asses, sheep, and male and female slaves; and I send this message to my lord in the hope of gaining your favor.’”
32.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־lִy֙ shׁ֣vֹr vַchֲm֔vֹr tsֹ֖aן vְaֶ֣bֶd vְshִׁpְchָ֑h vָֽaֶshְׁlְchָh֙ lְhַgִּ֣yd lַֽadֹnִ֔y lִmְtsֹa־chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynֶֽyךָ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב לֵאמֹ֑ר בָּ֤אנוּ אֶל־אָחִ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־עֵשָׂ֔ו וְגַם֙ הֹלֵ֣ךְ לִקְרָֽאתְךָ֔ וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת אִ֖ישׁ עִמּֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau; he himself is coming to meet you, and his retinue*retinue Trad. “men,” yet women may be in view. See 33.15; cf. 24.59; contrast Judg. 9.49 with Exod. 32.28. See further the Dictionary under ’ish. numbers four hundred.”
32.transliteration: vַyָּshֻׁ֙bvּ֙ hַmַּlְaָkִ֔yם aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֖b lֵamֹ֑r bָּ֤anvּ aֶl־aָchִ֙yךָ֙ aֶl־aֵshָׂ֔v vְgַם֙ hֹlֵ֣ךְ lִkְrָֽatְךָ֔ vְaַrְbַּa־mֵa֥vֹt aִ֖yshׁ aִmּֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּירָ֧א יַעֲקֹ֛ב מְאֹ֖ד וַיֵּ֣צֶר ל֑וֹ וַיַּ֜חַץ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֗וֹ וְאֶת־הַצֹּ֧אן וְאֶת־הַבָּקָ֛ר וְהַגְּמַלִּ֖ים לִשְׁנֵ֥י מַחֲנֽוֹת׃
32.englishText: Jacob was greatly frightened; in his anxiety, he divided the people with him, and the flocks and herds and camels, into two camps,
32.transliteration: vַyִּyrָ֧a yַaֲkֹ֛b mְaֹ֖d vַyֵּ֣tsֶr l֑vֹ vַyַּ֜chַץ aֶt־hָaָ֣ם aֲshֶׁr־aִtּ֗vֹ vְaֶt־hַtsֹּ֧aן vְaֶt־hַbָּkָ֛r vְhַgְּmַlִּ֖yם lִshְׁnֵ֥y mַchֲnֽvֹt׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אִם־יָב֥וֹא עֵשָׂ֛ו אֶל־הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הָאַחַ֖ת וְהִכָּ֑הוּ וְהָיָ֛ה הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הַנִּשְׁאָ֖ר לִפְלֵיטָֽה׃
32.englishText: thinking, “If Esau comes to the one camp and attacks it, the other camp may yet escape.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr aִם־yָb֥vֹa aֵshָׂ֛v aֶl־hַmַּchֲnֶ֥h hָaַchַ֖t vְhִkָּ֑hvּ vְhָyָ֛h hַmַּchֲnֶ֥h hַnִּshְׁaָ֖r lִpְlֵytָֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ יַעֲקֹב֒ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אָבִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם וֵאלֹהֵ֖י אָבִ֣י יִצְחָ֑ק יְהֹוָ֞ה הָאֹמֵ֣ר אֵלַ֗י שׁ֧וּב לְאַרְצְךָ֛ וּלְמוֹלַדְתְּךָ֖ וְאֵיטִ֥יבָה עִמָּֽךְ׃
32.englishText: Then Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham’s [house] and God of my father Isaac’s [house], O יהוה, who said to me, ‘Return to your native land and I will deal bountifully with you’!
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֘amֶr֮ yַaֲkֹb֒ aֱlֹhֵy֙ aָbִ֣y aַbְrָhָ֔ם vֵalֹhֵ֖y aָbִ֣y yִtsְchָ֑k yְhֹvָ֞h hָaֹmֵ֣r aֵlַ֗y shׁ֧vּb lְaַrְtsְךָ֛ vּlְmvֹlַdְtְּךָ֖ vְaֵytִ֥ybָh aִmָּֽךְ׃

32.hebrewText: קָטֹ֜נְתִּי מִכֹּ֤ל הַחֲסָדִים֙ וּמִכׇּל־הָ֣אֱמֶ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתָ אֶת־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֣י בְמַקְלִ֗י עָבַ֙רְתִּי֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֣ן הַזֶּ֔ה וְעַתָּ֥ה הָיִ֖יתִי לִשְׁנֵ֥י מַחֲנֽוֹת׃
32.englishText: I am unworthy of all the kindness that You have so steadfastly shown Your servant: with my staff alone I crossed this Jordan, and now I have become two camps.
32.transliteration: kָtֹ֜nְtִּy mִkֹּ֤l hַchֲsָdִyם֙ vּmִkׇּl־hָ֣aֱmֶ֔t aֲshֶׁ֥r aָshִׂ֖ytָ aֶt־aַbְdֶּ֑ךָ kִּ֣y bְmַkְlִ֗y aָbַ֙rְtִּy֙ aֶt־hַyַּrְdֵּ֣ן hַzֶּ֔h vְaַtָּ֥h hָyִ֖ytִy lִshְׁnֵ֥y mַchֲnֽvֹt׃

32.hebrewText: הַצִּילֵ֥נִי נָ֛א מִיַּ֥ד אָחִ֖י מִיַּ֣ד עֵשָׂ֑ו כִּֽי־יָרֵ֤א אָנֹכִי֙ אֹת֔וֹ פֶּן־יָב֣וֹא וְהִכַּ֔נִי אֵ֖ם עַל־בָּנִֽים׃
32.englishText: Deliver me, I pray, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau; else, I fear, he may come and strike me down, mothers and children alike.
32.transliteration: hַtsִּylֵ֥nִy nָ֛a mִyַּ֥d aָchִ֖y mִyַּ֣d aֵshָׂ֑v kִּֽy־yָrֵ֤a aָnֹkִy֙ aֹt֔vֹ pֶּן־yָb֣vֹa vְhִkַּ֔nִy aֵ֖ם aַl־bָּnִֽyם׃

32.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֣ה אָמַ֔רְתָּ הֵיטֵ֥ב אֵיטִ֖יב עִמָּ֑ךְ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּח֣וֹל הַיָּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יִסָּפֵ֖ר מֵרֹֽב׃
32.englishText: Yet You have said, ‘I will deal bountifully with you and make your offspring as the sands of the sea, which are too numerous to count.’”
32.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֣h aָmַ֔rְtָּ hֵytֵ֥b aֵytִ֖yb aִmָּ֑ךְ vְshַׂmְtִּ֤y aֶֽt־zַrְaֲךָ֙ kְּch֣vֹl hַyָּ֔ם aֲshֶׁ֥r lֹa־yִsָּpֵ֖r mֵrֹֽb׃

32.hebrewText: וַיָּ֥לֶן שָׁ֖ם בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֑וּא וַיִּקַּ֞ח מִן־הַבָּ֧א בְיָד֛וֹ מִנְחָ֖ה לְעֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִֽיו׃
32.englishText: After spending the night there, he selected from what was at hand these presents for his brother Esau:
32.transliteration: vַyָּ֥lֶן shָׁ֖ם bַּlַּ֣yְlָh hַh֑vּa vַyִּkַּ֞ch mִן־hַbָּ֧a bְyָd֛vֹ mִnְchָ֖h lְaֵshָׂ֥v aָchִֽyv׃

32.hebrewText: עִזִּ֣ים מָאתַ֔יִם וּתְיָשִׁ֖ים עֶשְׂרִ֑ים רְחֵלִ֥ים מָאתַ֖יִם וְאֵילִ֥ים עֶשְׂרִֽים׃
32.englishText: 200 she-goats and 20 he-goats; 200 ewes and 20 rams;
32.transliteration: aִzִּ֣yם mָatַ֔yִם vּtְyָshִׁ֖yם aֶshְׂrִ֑yם rְchֵlִ֥yם mָatַ֖yִם vְaֵylִ֥yם aֶshְׂrִֽyם׃

32.hebrewText: גְּמַלִּ֧ים מֵינִיק֛וֹת וּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֑ים פָּר֤וֹת אַרְבָּעִים֙ וּפָרִ֣ים עֲשָׂרָ֔ה אֲתֹנֹ֣ת עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וַעְיָרִ֖ם עֲשָׂרָֽה׃
32.englishText: 30 milch camels with their colts; 40 cows and 10 bulls; 20 she-asses and 10 he-asses.
32.transliteration: gְּmַlִּ֧yם mֵynִyk֛vֹt vּbְnֵyhֶ֖ם shְׁlֹshִׁ֑yם pָּr֤vֹt aַrְbָּaִyם֙ vּpָrִ֣yם aֲshָׂrָ֔h aֲtֹnֹ֣t aֶshְׂrִ֔yם vַaְyָrִ֖ם aֲshָׂrָֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּתֵּן֙ בְּיַד־עֲבָדָ֔יו עֵ֥דֶר עֵ֖דֶר לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־עֲבָדָיו֙ עִבְר֣וּ לְפָנַ֔י וְרֶ֣וַח תָּשִׂ֔ימוּ בֵּ֥ין עֵ֖דֶר וּבֵ֥ין עֵֽדֶר׃
32.englishText: These he put in the charge of his servants, drove by drove, and he told his servants, “Go on ahead, and keep a distance between droves.”
32.transliteration: vַyִּtֵּן֙ bְּyַd־aֲbָdָ֔yv aֵ֥dֶr aֵ֖dֶr lְbַdּ֑vֹ vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֶl־aֲbָdָyv֙ aִbְr֣vּ lְpָnַ֔y vְrֶ֣vַch tָּshִׂ֔ymvּ bֵּ֥yן aֵ֖dֶr vּbֵ֥yן aֵֽdֶr׃

32.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֥ו אֶת־הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן לֵאמֹ֑ר כִּ֣י יִֽפְגׇשְׁךָ֞ עֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֗י וּשְׁאֵֽלְךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְמִי־אַ֙תָּה֙ וְאָ֣נָה תֵלֵ֔ךְ וּלְמִ֖י אֵ֥לֶּה לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
32.englishText: He instructed the one in front as follows, “When my brother Esau meets you and asks you, ‘Who’s your master? Where are you going? And whose [animals] are these ahead of you?’
32.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֥v aֶt־hָrִashׁ֖vֹן lֵamֹ֑r kִּ֣y yִֽpְgׇshְׁךָ֞ aֵshָׂ֣v aָchִ֗y vּshְׁaֵֽlְךָ֙ lֵamֹ֔r lְmִy־aַ֙tָּh֙ vְaָ֣nָh tֵlֵ֔ךְ vּlְmִ֖y aֵ֥lֶּh lְpָnֶֽyךָ׃

32.hebrewText: וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ לְעַבְדְּךָ֣ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב מִנְחָ֥ה הִוא֙ שְׁלוּחָ֔ה לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לְעֵשָׂ֑ו וְהִנֵּ֥ה גַם־ה֖וּא אַחֲרֵֽינוּ׃
32.englishText: you shall answer, ‘Your servant Jacob’s; they are a gift sent to my lord Esau; and [Jacob] himself is right behind us.’”
32.transliteration: vְaָֽmַrְtָּ֙ lְaַbְdְּךָ֣ lְyַaֲkֹ֔b mִnְchָ֥h hִva֙ shְׁlvּchָ֔h lַֽadֹnִ֖y lְaֵshָׂ֑v vְhִnֵּ֥h gַם־h֖vּa aַchֲrֵֽynvּ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֞ו גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַשֵּׁנִ֗י גַּ֚ם אֶת־הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י גַּ֚ם אֶת־כׇּל־הַהֹ֣לְכִ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֥י הָעֲדָרִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ תְּדַבְּר֣וּן אֶל־עֵשָׂ֔ו בְּמֹצַאֲכֶ֖ם אֹתֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: He gave similar instructions to the second one, and the third, and all the others who followed the droves, namely, “Thus and so shall you say to Esau when you reach him.
32.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֞v gַּ֣ם aֶt־hַshֵּׁnִ֗y gַּ֚ם aֶt־hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֔y gַּ֚ם aֶt־kׇּl־hַhֹ֣lְkִ֔yם aַchֲrֵ֥y hָaֲdָrִ֖yם lֵamֹ֑r kַּdָּbָ֤r hַzֶּh֙ tְּdַbְּr֣vּן aֶl־aֵshָׂ֔v bְּmֹtsַaֲkֶ֖ם aֹtֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֕ם גַּ֗ם הִנֵּ֛ה עַבְדְּךָ֥ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אַחֲרֵ֑ינוּ כִּֽי־אָמַ֞ר אֲכַפְּרָ֣ה פָנָ֗יו בַּמִּנְחָה֙ הַהֹלֶ֣כֶת לְפָנָ֔י וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵן֙ אֶרְאֶ֣ה פָנָ֔יו אוּלַ֖י יִשָּׂ֥א פָנָֽי׃
32.englishText: And you shall add, ‘And your servant Jacob himself is right behind us.’” For he reasoned, “If I propitiate him with presents in advance, and then face him, perhaps he will show me favor.”
32.transliteration: vַaֲmַrְtֶּ֕ם gַּ֗ם hִnֵּ֛h aַbְdְּךָ֥ yַaֲkֹ֖b aַchֲrֵ֑ynvּ kִּֽy־aָmַ֞r aֲkַpְּrָ֣h pָnָ֗yv bַּmִּnְchָh֙ hַhֹlֶ֣kֶt lְpָnָ֔y vְaַchֲrֵy־kֵן֙ aֶrְaֶ֣h pָnָ֔yv avּlַ֖y yִshָּׂ֥a pָnָֽy׃

32.hebrewText: וַתַּעֲבֹ֥ר הַמִּנְחָ֖ה עַל־פָּנָ֑יו וְה֛וּא לָ֥ן בַּלַּֽיְלָה־הַה֖וּא בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
32.englishText: And so the gift went on ahead, while he remained in camp that night.
32.transliteration: vַtַּaֲbֹ֥r hַmִּnְchָ֖h aַl־pָּnָ֑yv vְh֛vּa lָ֥ן bַּlַּֽyְlָh־hַh֖vּa bַּֽmַּchֲnֶֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣קׇם ׀ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה ה֗וּא וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֤י נָשָׁיו֙ וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י שִׁפְחֹתָ֔יו וְאֶת־אַחַ֥ד עָשָׂ֖ר יְלָדָ֑יו וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֔ר אֵ֖ת מַעֲבַ֥ר יַבֹּֽק׃
32.englishText: That same night he arose, and taking his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven sons,*sons NJPS “children”; Heb. yeladim. Given the specified number, the reference cannot include Jacob’s daughter(s). English idiom warrants the greater gender specificity. he crossed the ford of the Jabbok.
32.transliteration: vַyָּ֣kׇם ׀ bַּlַּ֣yְlָh h֗vּa vַyִּkַּ֞ch aֶt־shְׁtֵּ֤y nָshָׁyv֙ vְaֶt־shְׁtֵּ֣y shִׁpְchֹtָ֔yv vְaֶt־aַchַ֥d aָshָׂ֖r yְlָdָ֑yv vַֽyַּaֲbֹ֔r aֵ֖t mַaֲbַ֥r yַbֹּֽk׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּ֨קָּחֵ֔ם וַיַּֽעֲבִרֵ֖ם אֶת־הַנָּ֑חַל וַֽיַּעֲבֵ֖ר אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: After taking them across the stream, he sent across all his possessions.
32.transliteration: vַyִּ֨kָּchֵ֔ם vַyַּֽaֲbִrֵ֖ם aֶt־hַnָּ֑chַl vַֽyַּaֲbֵ֖r aֶt־aֲshֶׁr־lֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּוָּתֵ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַיֵּאָבֵ֥ק אִישׁ֙ עִמּ֔וֹ עַ֖ד עֲל֥וֹת הַשָּֽׁחַר׃
32.englishText: Jacob was left alone. And a figure*figure Or “[divine] agent.” The expectation of divine intervention (see 28.15; 32.10–13) via a nearby agent (see 32.2–3) evokes this extended sense. Cf. 18.2; see further the Dictionary under ’ish; Agent. wrestled with him until the break of dawn.
32.transliteration: vַyִּvָּtֵ֥r yַaֲkֹ֖b lְbַdּ֑vֹ vַyֵּaָbֵ֥k aִyshׁ֙ aִmּ֔vֹ aַ֖d aֲl֥vֹt hַshָּֽׁchַr׃

32.hebrewText: וַיַּ֗רְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָכֹל֙ ל֔וֹ וַיִּגַּ֖ע בְּכַף־יְרֵכ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֙קַע֙ כַּף־יֶ֣רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּהֵאָֽבְק֖וֹ עִמּֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: When he saw that he had not prevailed against him, he wrenched Jacob’s hip at its socket, so that the socket of his hip was strained as he wrestled with him.
32.transliteration: vַyַּ֗rְa kִּ֣y lֹ֤a yָkֹl֙ l֔vֹ vַyִּgַּ֖a bְּkַף־yְrֵk֑vֹ vַtֵּ֙kַa֙ kַּף־yֶ֣rֶךְ yַaֲkֹ֔b bְּhֵaָֽbְk֖vֹ aִmּֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שַׁלְּחֵ֔נִי כִּ֥י עָלָ֖ה הַשָּׁ֑חַר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֲשַֽׁלֵּחֲךָ֔ כִּ֖י אִם־בֵּרַכְתָּֽנִי׃
32.englishText: Then he said, “Let me go, for dawn is breaking.” But he answered, “I will not let you go, unless you bless me.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr shַׁlְּchֵ֔nִy kִּ֥y aָlָ֖h hַshָּׁ֑chַr vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lֹ֣a aֲshַֽׁlֵּchֲךָ֔ kִּ֖y aִם־bֵּrַkְtָּֽnִy׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו מַה־שְּׁמֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹֽב׃
32.englishText: Said the other, “What is your name?” He replied, “Jacob.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֵlָ֖yv mַh־shְּׁmֶ֑ךָ vַyֹּ֖amֶr yַaֲkֹֽb׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לֹ֤א יַעֲקֹב֙ יֵאָמֵ֥ר עוֹד֙ שִׁמְךָ֔ כִּ֖י אִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־שָׂרִ֧יתָ עִם־אֱלֹהִ֛ים וְעִם־אֲנָשִׁ֖ים וַתּוּכָֽל׃
32.englishText: Said he, “Your name shall no longer be Jacob, but Israel, for you have striven*striven Heb. saritha, connected with first part of “Israel.” with beings divine and human,*beings divine and human Or “God (Elohim, connected with second part of ‘Israel’) and human beings.” and have prevailed.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr lֹ֤a yַaֲkֹb֙ yֵaָmֵ֥r avֹd֙ shִׁmְךָ֔ kִּ֖y aִם־yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l kִּֽy־shָׂrִ֧ytָ aִם־aֱlֹhִ֛yם vְaִם־aֲnָshִׁ֖yם vַtּvּkָֽl׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁאַ֣ל יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַגִּֽידָה־נָּ֣א שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה תִּשְׁאַ֣ל לִשְׁמִ֑י וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֹת֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
32.englishText: Jacob asked, “Pray tell me your name.” But he said, “You must not ask my name!” And he took leave of him there.
32.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁaַ֣l yַaֲkֹ֗b vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ hַgִּֽydָh־nָּ֣a shְׁmֶ֔ךָ vַyֹּ֕amֶr lָ֥mָּh zֶּ֖h tִּshְׁaַ֣l lִshְׁmִ֑y vַyְbָ֥rֶךְ aֹt֖vֹ shָֽׁם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֧א יַעֲקֹ֛ב שֵׁ֥ם הַמָּק֖וֹם פְּנִיאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־רָאִ֤יתִי אֱלֹהִים֙ פָּנִ֣ים אֶל־פָּנִ֔ים וַתִּנָּצֵ֖ל נַפְשִֽׁי׃
32.englishText: So Jacob named the place Peniel,*Peniel Understood as “face of God.” meaning, “I have seen a divine being face to face, yet my life has been preserved.”
32.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֧a yַaֲkֹ֛b shֵׁ֥ם hַmָּk֖vֹם pְּnִyaֵ֑l kִּֽy־rָaִ֤ytִy aֱlֹhִyם֙ pָּnִ֣yם aֶl־pָּnִ֔yם vַtִּnָּtsֵ֖l nַpְshִֽׁy׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּֽזְרַֽח־ל֣וֹ הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָבַ֖ר אֶת־פְּנוּאֵ֑ל וְה֥וּא צֹלֵ֖עַ עַל־יְרֵכֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: The sun rose upon him as he passed Penuel, limping on his hip.
32.transliteration: vַyִּֽzְrַֽch־l֣vֹ hַshֶּׁ֔mֶshׁ kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r aָbַ֖r aֶt־pְּnvּaֵ֑l vְh֥vּa tsֹlֵ֖aַ aַl־yְrֵkֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: עַל־כֵּ֡ן לֹֽא־יֹאכְל֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־גִּ֣יד הַנָּשֶׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־כַּ֣ף הַיָּרֵ֔ךְ עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֤י נָגַע֙ בְּכַף־יֶ֣רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּגִ֖יד הַנָּשֶֽׁה׃
32.englishText: That is why the children of Israel to this day do not eat the thigh muscle that is on the socket of the hip, since Jacob’s hip socket was wrenched at the thigh muscle.
32.transliteration: aַl־kֵּ֡ן lֹֽa־yֹakְl֨vּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֜l aֶt־gִּ֣yd hַnָּshֶׁ֗h aֲshֶׁr֙ aַl־kַּ֣ף hַyָּrֵ֔ךְ aַ֖d hַyּ֣vֹם hַzֶּ֑h kִּ֤y nָgַa֙ bְּkַף־yֶ֣rֶךְ yַaֲkֹ֔b bְּgִ֖yd hַnָּshֶֽׁh׃

33.hebrewText: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א יַעֲקֹ֜ב עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ וְהִנֵּ֣ה עֵשָׂ֣ו בָּ֔א וְעִמּ֕וֹ אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת אִ֑ישׁ וַיַּ֣חַץ אֶת־הַיְלָדִ֗ים עַל־לֵאָה֙ וְעַל־רָחֵ֔ל וְעַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֥י הַשְּׁפָחֽוֹת׃
33.englishText: Looking up, Jacob saw Esau coming, with a retinue*retinue See note at 32.7. of four hundred. He divided the children*children Heb. yeladim, referring here only to Jacob’s sons (see 32.23) in anticipation of their becoming the progenitors of Israel’s tribes; and so through v. 14. among Leah, Rachel, and the two maids,
33.transliteration: vַyִּshָּׂ֨a yַaֲkֹ֜b aֵynָ֗yv vַyַּrְa֙ vְhִnֵּ֣h aֵshָׂ֣v bָּ֔a vְaִmּ֕vֹ aַrְbַּ֥a mֵa֖vֹt aִ֑yshׁ vַyַּ֣chַץ aֶt־hַyְlָdִ֗yם aַl־lֵaָh֙ vְaַl־rָchֵ֔l vְaַ֖l shְׁtֵּ֥y hַshְּׁpָchֽvֹt׃

33.hebrewText: וַיָּ֧שֶׂם אֶת־הַשְּׁפָח֛וֹת וְאֶת־יַלְדֵיהֶ֖ן רִֽאשֹׁנָ֑ה וְאֶת־לֵאָ֤ה וִֽילָדֶ֙יהָ֙ אַחֲרֹנִ֔ים וְאֶת־רָחֵ֥ל וְאֶת־יוֹסֵ֖ף אַחֲרֹנִֽים׃
33.englishText: putting the maids and their children first, Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph last.
33.transliteration: vַyָּ֧shֶׂם aֶt־hַshְּׁpָch֛vֹt vְaֶt־yַlְdֵyhֶ֖ן rִֽashֹׁnָ֑h vְaֶt־lֵaָ֤h vִֽylָdֶ֙yhָ֙ aַchֲrֹnִ֔yם vְaֶt־rָchֵ֥l vְaֶt־yvֹsֵ֖ף aַchֲrֹnִֽyם׃

33.hebrewText: וְה֖וּא עָבַ֣ר לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֤חוּ אַ֙רְצָה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֔ים עַד־גִּשְׁתּ֖וֹ עַד־אָחִֽיו׃
33.englishText: He himself went on ahead and bowed low to the ground seven times until he was near his brother.
33.transliteration: vְh֖vּa aָbַ֣r lִpְnֵyhֶ֑ם vַyִּshְׁtַּ֤chvּ aַ֙rְtsָh֙ shֶׁ֣bַa pְּaָmִ֔yם aַd־gִּshְׁtּ֖vֹ aַd־aָchִֽyv׃

33.hebrewText: וַיָּ֨רׇץ עֵשָׂ֤ו לִקְרָאתוֹ֙ וַֽיְחַבְּקֵ֔הוּ וַיִּפֹּ֥ל עַל־צַוָּארָ֖ו וַׄיִּׄשָּׁׄקֵ֑ׄהׄוּׄ וַיִּבְכּֽוּ׃
33.englishText: Esau ran to greet him. He embraced him and, falling on his neck, he kissed him; and they wept.
33.transliteration: vַyָּ֨rׇץ aֵshָׂ֤v lִkְrָatvֹ֙ vַֽyְchַbְּkֵ֔hvּ vַyִּpֹּ֥l aַl־tsַvָּarָ֖v vַׄyִּׄshָּׁׄkֵ֑ׄhׄvּׄ vַyִּbְkּֽvּ׃

33.hebrewText: וַיִּשָּׂ֣א אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּ֤רְא אֶת־הַנָּשִׁים֙ וְאֶת־הַיְלָדִ֔ים וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מִי־אֵ֣לֶּה לָּ֑ךְ וַיֹּאמַ֕ר הַיְלָדִ֕ים אֲשֶׁר־חָנַ֥ן אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
33.englishText: Looking about, he saw the women and the children. “Who,” he asked, “are these with you?” He answered, “The children with whom God has favored your servant.”
33.transliteration: vַyִּshָּׂ֣a aֶt־aֵynָ֗yv vַyַּ֤rְa aֶt־hַnָּshִׁyם֙ vְaֶt־hַyְlָdִ֔yם vַyֹּ֖amֶr mִy־aֵ֣lֶּh lָּ֑ךְ vַyֹּamַ֕r hַyְlָdִ֕yם aֲshֶׁr־chָnַ֥ן aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־aַbְdֶּֽךָ׃

33.hebrewText: וַתִּגַּ֧שְׁןָ הַשְּׁפָח֛וֹת הֵ֥נָּה וְיַלְדֵיהֶ֖ן וַתִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶֽיןָ׃
33.englishText: Then the maids, with their children, came forward and bowed low;
33.transliteration: vַtִּgַּ֧shְׁןָ hַshְּׁpָch֛vֹt hֵ֥nָּh vְyַlְdֵyhֶ֖ן vַtִּֽshְׁtַּchֲvֶֽyןָ׃

33.hebrewText: וַתִּגַּ֧שׁ גַּם־לֵאָ֛ה וִילָדֶ֖יהָ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֑וּ וְאַחַ֗ר נִגַּ֥שׁ יוֹסֵ֛ף וְרָחֵ֖ל וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
33.englishText: next Leah, with her children, came forward and bowed low; and last, Joseph and Rachel came forward and bowed low.
33.transliteration: vַtִּgַּ֧shׁ gַּם־lֵaָ֛h vִylָdֶ֖yhָ vַyִּֽshְׁtַּchֲv֑vּ vְaַchַ֗r nִgַּ֥shׁ yvֹsֵ֛ף vְrָchֵ֖l vַyִּֽshְׁtַּchֲvֽvּ׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֥י לְךָ֛ כׇּל־הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּגָ֑שְׁתִּי וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לִמְצֹא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
33.englishText: And he asked, “What do you mean by all this company which I have met?” He answered, “To gain my lord’s favor.”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr mִ֥y lְךָ֛ kׇּl־hַmַּchֲnֶ֥h hַzֶּ֖h aֲshֶׁ֣r pָּgָ֑shְׁtִּy vַyֹּ֕amֶr lִmְtsֹa־chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynֵ֥y aֲdֹnִֽy׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר עֵשָׂ֖ו יֶשׁ־לִ֣י רָ֑ב אָחִ֕י יְהִ֥י לְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
33.englishText: Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; let what you have remain yours.”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֵshָׂ֖v yֶshׁ־lִ֣y rָ֑b aָchִ֕y yְhִ֥y lְךָ֖ aֲshֶׁr־lָֽךְ׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֗ב אַל־נָא֙ אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ מִנְחָתִ֖י מִיָּדִ֑י כִּ֣י עַל־כֵּ֞ן רָאִ֣יתִי פָנֶ֗יךָ כִּרְאֹ֛ת פְּנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים וַתִּרְצֵֽנִי׃
33.englishText: But Jacob said, “No, I pray you; if you would do me this favor, accept from me this gift; for to see your face is like seeing the face of God, and you have received me favorably.
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yַaֲkֹ֗b aַl־nָa֙ aִם־nָ֨a mָtsָ֤atִy chֵן֙ bְּaֵynֶ֔yךָ vְlָkַchְtָּ֥ mִnְchָtִ֖y mִyָּdִ֑y kִּ֣y aַl־kֵּ֞ן rָaִ֣ytִy pָnֶ֗yךָ kִּrְaֹ֛t pְּnֵ֥y aֱlֹhִ֖yם vַtִּrְtsֵֽnִy׃

33.hebrewText: קַח־נָ֤א אֶת־בִּרְכָתִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֻבָ֣את לָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־חַנַּ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְכִ֣י יֶשׁ־לִי־כֹ֑ל וַיִּפְצַר־בּ֖וֹ וַיִּקָּֽח׃
33.englishText: Please accept my present which has been brought to you, for God has favored me and I have plenty.” And when he urged him, he accepted.
33.transliteration: kַch־nָ֤a aֶt־bִּrְkָtִy֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r hֻbָ֣at lָ֔ךְ kִּֽy־chַnַּ֥nִy aֱlֹhִ֖yם vְkִ֣y yֶshׁ־lִy־kֹ֑l vַyִּpְtsַr־bּ֖vֹ vַyִּkָּֽch׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר נִסְעָ֣ה וְנֵלֵ֑כָה וְאֵלְכָ֖ה לְנֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃
33.englishText: And [Esau] said, “Let us start on our journey, and I will proceed at your pace.”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr nִsְaָ֣h vְnֵlֵ֑kָh vְaֵlְkָ֖h lְnֶgְdֶּֽךָ׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו אֲדֹנִ֤י יֹדֵ֙עַ֙ כִּֽי־הַיְלָדִ֣ים רַכִּ֔ים וְהַצֹּ֥אן וְהַבָּקָ֖ר עָל֣וֹת עָלָ֑י וּדְפָקוּם֙ י֣וֹם אֶחָ֔ד וָמֵ֖תוּ כׇּל־הַצֹּֽאן׃
33.englishText: But he said to him, “My lord knows that the children are frail and that the flocks and herds, which are nursing, are a care to me; if they are driven hard a single day, all the flocks will die.
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵlָ֗yv aֲdֹnִ֤y yֹdֵ֙aַ֙ kִּֽy־hַyְlָdִ֣yם rַkִּ֔yם vְhַtsֹּ֥aן vְhַbָּkָ֖r aָl֣vֹt aָlָ֑y vּdְpָkvּם֙ y֣vֹם aֶchָ֔d vָmֵ֖tvּ kׇּl־hַtsֹּֽaן׃

33.hebrewText: יַעֲבׇר־נָ֥א אֲדֹנִ֖י לִפְנֵ֣י עַבְדּ֑וֹ וַאֲנִ֞י אֶֽתְנָהֲלָ֣ה לְאִטִּ֗י לְרֶ֨גֶל הַמְּלָאכָ֤ה אֲשֶׁר־לְפָנַי֙ וּלְרֶ֣גֶל הַיְלָדִ֔ים עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־אָבֹ֥א אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֖י שֵׂעִֽירָה׃
33.englishText: Let my lord go on ahead of his servant, while I travel slowly, at the pace of the cattle before me and at the pace of the children, until I come to my lord in Seir.”
33.transliteration: yַaֲbׇr־nָ֥a aֲdֹnִ֖y lִpְnֵ֣y aַbְdּ֑vֹ vַaֲnִ֞y aֶֽtְnָhֲlָ֣h lְaִtִּ֗y lְrֶ֨gֶl hַmְּlָakָ֤h aֲshֶׁr־lְpָnַy֙ vּlְrֶ֣gֶl hַyְlָdִ֔yם aַ֛d aֲshֶׁr־aָbֹ֥a aֶl־aֲdֹnִ֖y shֵׂaִֽyrָh׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר עֵשָׂ֔ו אַצִּֽיגָה־נָּ֣א עִמְּךָ֔ מִן־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתִּ֑י וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לָ֣מָּה זֶּ֔ה אֶמְצָא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
33.englishText: Then Esau said, “Let me assign to you some of the people who are with me.” But he said, “Oh no, my lord is too kind to me!”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵshָׂ֔v aַtsִּֽygָh־nָּ֣a aִmְּךָ֔ mִן־hָaָ֖ם aֲshֶׁ֣r aִtִּ֑y vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lָ֣mָּh zֶּ֔h aֶmְtsָa־chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynֵ֥y aֲdֹnִֽy׃

33.hebrewText: וַיָּ֩שׇׁב֩ בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֥וּא עֵשָׂ֛ו לְדַרְכּ֖וֹ שֵׂעִֽירָה׃
33.englishText: So Esau started back that day on his way to Seir.
33.transliteration: vַyָּ֩shׇׁb֩ bַּyּ֨vֹם hַh֥vּa aֵshָׂ֛v lְdַrְkּ֖vֹ shֵׂaִֽyrָh׃

33.hebrewText: וְיַעֲקֹב֙ נָסַ֣ע סֻכֹּ֔תָה וַיִּ֥בֶן ל֖וֹ בָּ֑יִת וּלְמִקְנֵ֙הוּ֙ עָשָׂ֣ה סֻכֹּ֔ת עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרָ֥א שֵׁם־הַמָּק֖וֹם סֻכּֽוֹת׃ {ס}
33.englishText: But Jacob journeyed on to Succoth, and built a house for himself and made stalls for his cattle; that is why the place was called Succoth.*Succoth Meaning “stalls,” “huts,” “booths.”
33.transliteration: vְyַaֲkֹb֙ nָsַ֣a sֻkֹּ֔tָh vַyִּ֥bֶן l֖vֹ bָּ֑yִt vּlְmִkְnֵ֙hvּ֙ aָshָׂ֣h sֻkֹּ֔t aַl־kֵּ֛ן kָrָ֥a shֵׁם־hַmָּk֖vֹם sֻkּֽvֹt׃ {s}

33.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹא֩ יַעֲקֹ֨ב שָׁלֵ֜ם עִ֣יר שְׁכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן בְּבֹא֖וֹ מִפַּדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֑ם וַיִּ֖חַן אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י הָעִֽיר׃
33.englishText: Jacob arrived safe in the city of Shechem which is in the land of Canaan—having come thus from Paddan-aram—and he encamped before the city.
33.transliteration: vַyָּbֹa֩ yַaֲkֹ֨b shָׁlֵ֜ם aִ֣yr shְׁkֶ֗ם aֲshֶׁr֙ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ kְּnַ֔aַן bְּbֹa֖vֹ mִpַּdַּ֣ן aֲrָ֑ם vַyִּ֖chַן aֶt־pְּnֵ֥y hָaִֽyr׃

33.hebrewText: וַיִּ֜קֶן אֶת־חֶלְקַ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָֽטָה־שָׁם֙ אׇהֳל֔וֹ מִיַּ֥ד בְּנֵֽי־חֲמ֖וֹר אֲבִ֣י שְׁכֶ֑ם בְּמֵאָ֖ה קְשִׂיטָֽה׃
33.englishText: The parcel of land where he pitched his tent he purchased from the kin of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred kesitahs.*kesitahs Heb. qesiṭah, a unit of unknown value.
33.transliteration: vַyִּ֜kֶן aֶt־chֶlְkַ֣t hַshָּׂdֶ֗h aֲshֶׁ֤r nָֽtָh־shָׁם֙ aׇhֳl֔vֹ mִyַּ֥d bְּnֵֽy־chֲm֖vֹr aֲbִ֣y shְׁkֶ֑ם bְּmֵaָ֖h kְshִׂytָֽh׃

33.hebrewText: וַיַּצֶּב־שָׁ֖ם מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּ֨קְרָא־ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ל אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
33.englishText: He set up an altar there, and called it El-elohe-yisrael.*El-elohe-yisrael “El, God of Israel.”
33.transliteration: vַyַּtsֶּb־shָׁ֖ם mִzְbֵּ֑chַ vַyִּ֨kְrָa־l֔vֹ aֵ֖l aֱlֹhֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃ {s}

34.hebrewText: וַתֵּצֵ֤א דִינָה֙ בַּת־לֵאָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלְדָ֖ה לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב לִרְא֖וֹת בִּבְנ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
34.englishText: Now Dinah, the daughter whom Leah had borne to Jacob, went out to visit the daughters of the land.
34.transliteration: vַtֵּtsֵ֤a dִynָh֙ bַּt־lֵaָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r yָlְdָ֖h lְyַaֲkֹ֑b lִrְa֖vֹt bִּbְn֥vֹt hָaָֽrֶץ׃

34.hebrewText: וַיַּ֨רְא אֹתָ֜הּ שְׁכֶ֧ם בֶּן־חֲמ֛וֹר הַֽחִוִּ֖י נְשִׂ֣יא הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּקַּ֥ח אֹתָ֛הּ וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב אֹתָ֖הּ וַיְעַנֶּֽהָ׃
34.englishText: Shechem son of Hamor the Hivite, chief of the country, saw her, and took her and lay with her and disgraced her.*and disgraced her Heb. wa-y‘anneha, lit. “and violated her.” NJPS “by force,” but whether Dinah consented is not stated, and is not at issue; regardless, by the norms of the ancient Near East, she was disgraced. OJPS “and humbled her.”
34.transliteration: vַyַּ֨rְa aֹtָ֜hּ shְׁkֶ֧ם bֶּן־chֲm֛vֹr hַֽchִvִּ֖y nְshִׂ֣ya hָaָ֑rֶץ vַyִּkַּ֥ch aֹtָ֛hּ vַyִּshְׁkַּ֥b aֹtָ֖hּ vַyְaַnֶּֽhָ׃

34.hebrewText: וַתִּדְבַּ֣ק נַפְשׁ֔וֹ בְּדִינָ֖ה בַּֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיֶּֽאֱהַב֙ אֶת־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר עַל־לֵ֥ב הַֽנַּעֲרָֽ׃
34.englishText: Being strongly drawn to Dinah daughter of Jacob, and in love with the maiden, he spoke to the maiden tenderly.
34.transliteration: vַtִּdְbַּ֣k nַpְshׁ֔vֹ bְּdִynָ֖h bַּֽt־yַaֲkֹ֑b vַyֶּֽaֱhַb֙ aֶt־hַֽnַּaֲrָ֔ vַyְdַbֵּ֖r aַl־lֵ֥b hַֽnַּaֲrָֽ׃

34.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁכֶ֔ם אֶל־חֲמ֥וֹר אָבִ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר קַֽח־לִ֛י אֶת־הַיַּלְדָּ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
34.englishText: So Shechem said to his father Hamor, “Get me this girl as a wife.”
34.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr shְׁkֶ֔ם aֶl־chֲm֥vֹr aָbִ֖yv lֵamֹ֑r kַֽch־lִ֛y aֶt־hַyַּlְdָּ֥h hַzֹּ֖at lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

34.hebrewText: וְיַעֲקֹ֣ב שָׁמַ֗ע כִּ֤י טִמֵּא֙ אֶת־דִּינָ֣ה בִתּ֔וֹ וּבָנָ֛יו הָי֥וּ אֶת־מִקְנֵ֖הוּ בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְהֶחֱרִ֥שׁ יַעֲקֹ֖ב עַד־בֹּאָֽם׃
34.englishText: Jacob heard that he had defiled his daughter Dinah; but since his sons were in the field with his cattle, Jacob kept silent until they came home.
34.transliteration: vְyַaֲkֹ֣b shָׁmַ֗a kִּ֤y tִmֵּa֙ aֶt־dִּynָ֣h bִtּ֔vֹ vּbָnָ֛yv hָy֥vּ aֶt־mִkְnֵ֖hvּ bַּshָּׂdֶ֑h vְhֶchֱrִ֥shׁ yַaֲkֹ֖b aַd־bֹּaָֽם׃

34.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֛א חֲמ֥וֹר אֲבִֽי־שְׁכֶ֖ם אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֑ב לְדַבֵּ֖ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
34.englishText: Then Shechem’s father Hamor came out to Jacob to speak to him.
34.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֛a chֲm֥vֹr aֲbִֽy־shְׁkֶ֖ם aֶֽl־yַaֲkֹ֑b lְdַbֵּ֖r aִtּֽvֹ׃

34.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֨י יַעֲקֹ֜ב בָּ֤אוּ מִן־הַשָּׂדֶה֙ כְּשׇׁמְעָ֔ם וַיִּֽתְעַצְּבוּ֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיִּ֥חַר לָהֶ֖ם מְאֹ֑ד כִּֽי־נְבָלָ֞ה עָשָׂ֣ה בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לִשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־בַּֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְכֵ֖ן לֹ֥א יֵעָשֶֽׂה׃
34.englishText: Meanwhile Jacob’s sons, having heard the news, came in from the field. The men*The men More precisely, “the [salient] participants [in the situation],” namely Jacob’s sons. See the Dictionary under ’ish. were distressed and very angry, because he had committed an outrage in Israel by lying with Jacob’s daughter—a thing not to be done.
34.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֨y yַaֲkֹ֜b bָּ֤avּ mִן־hַshָּׂdֶh֙ kְּshׇׁmְaָ֔ם vַyִּֽtְaַtsְּbvּ֙ hָֽaֲnָshִׁ֔yם vַyִּ֥chַr lָhֶ֖ם mְaֹ֑d kִּֽy־nְbָlָ֞h aָshָׂ֣h bְyִshְׂrָaֵ֗l lִshְׁkַּb֙ aֶt־bַּֽt־yַaֲkֹ֔b vְkֵ֖ן lֹ֥a yֵaָshֶֽׂh׃

34.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר חֲמ֖וֹר אִתָּ֣ם לֵאמֹ֑ר שְׁכֶ֣ם בְּנִ֗י חָֽשְׁקָ֤ה נַפְשׁוֹ֙ בְּבִתְּכֶ֔ם תְּנ֨וּ נָ֥א אֹתָ֛הּ ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
34.englishText: And Hamor spoke with them, saying, “My son Shechem longs for your daughter. Please give her to him in marriage.
34.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r chֲm֖vֹr aִtָּ֣ם lֵamֹ֑r shְׁkֶ֣ם bְּnִ֗y chָֽshְׁkָ֤h nַpְshׁvֹ֙ bְּbִtְּkֶ֔ם tְּn֨vּ nָ֥a aֹtָ֛hּ l֖vֹ lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

34.hebrewText: וְהִֽתְחַתְּנ֖וּ אֹתָ֑נוּ בְּנֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ תִּתְּנוּ־לָ֔נוּ וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֖ינוּ תִּקְח֥וּ לָכֶֽם׃
34.englishText: Intermarry with us: give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves:
34.transliteration: vְhִֽtְchַtְּn֖vּ aֹtָ֑nvּ bְּnֹֽtֵykֶם֙ tִּtְּnvּ־lָ֔nvּ vְaֶt־bְּnֹtֵ֖ynvּ tִּkְch֥vּ lָkֶֽם׃

34.hebrewText: וְאִתָּ֖נוּ תֵּשֵׁ֑בוּ וְהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם שְׁבוּ֙ וּסְחָר֔וּהָ וְהֵֽאָחֲז֖וּ בָּֽהּ׃
34.englishText: You will dwell among us, and the land will be open before you; settle, move about, and acquire holdings in it.”
34.transliteration: vְaִtָּ֖nvּ tֵּshֵׁ֑bvּ vְhָaָ֙rֶץ֙ tִּhְyֶ֣h lִpְnֵykֶ֔ם shְׁbvּ֙ vּsְchָr֔vּhָ vְhֵֽaָchֲz֖vּ bָּֽhּ׃

34.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁכֶם֙ אֶל־אָבִ֣יהָ וְאֶל־אַחֶ֔יהָ אֶמְצָא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֑ם וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר תֹּאמְר֛וּ אֵלַ֖י אֶתֵּֽן׃
34.englishText: Then Shechem said to her father and brothers, “Do me this favor, and I will pay whatever you tell me.
34.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr shְׁkֶם֙ aֶl־aָbִ֣yhָ vְaֶl־aַchֶ֔yhָ aֶmְtsָa־chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynֵykֶ֑ם vַaֲshֶׁ֥r tֹּamְr֛vּ aֵlַ֖y aֶtֵּֽן׃

34.hebrewText: הַרְבּ֨וּ עָלַ֤י מְאֹד֙ מֹ֣הַר וּמַתָּ֔ן וְאֶ֨תְּנָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תֹּאמְר֖וּ אֵלָ֑י וּתְנוּ־לִ֥י אֶת־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
34.englishText: Ask of me a bride-price ever so high, as well as gifts, and I will pay what you tell me; only give me the maiden for a wife.”
34.transliteration: hַrְbּ֨vּ aָlַ֤y mְaֹd֙ mֹ֣hַr vּmַtָּ֔ן vְaֶ֨tְּnָ֔h kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r tֹּamְr֖vּ aֵlָ֑y vּtְnvּ־lִ֥y aֶt־hַֽnַּaֲrָ֖ lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

34.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲנ֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶת־שְׁכֶ֨ם וְאֶת־חֲמ֥וֹר אָבִ֛יו בְּמִרְמָ֖ה וַיְדַבֵּ֑רוּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר טִמֵּ֔א אֵ֖ת דִּינָ֥ה אֲחֹתָֽם׃
34.englishText: Jacob’s sons answered Shechem and his father Hamor—speaking with guile because he had defiled their sister Dinah—
34.transliteration: vַyַּaֲn֨vּ bְnֵֽy־yַaֲkֹ֜b aֶt־shְׁkֶ֨ם vְaֶt־chֲm֥vֹr aָbִ֛yv bְּmִrְmָ֖h vַyְdַbֵּ֑rvּ aֲshֶׁ֣r tִmֵּ֔a aֵ֖t dִּynָ֥h aֲchֹtָֽם׃

34.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם לֹ֤א נוּכַל֙ לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לָתֵת֙ אֶת־אֲחֹתֵ֔נוּ לְאִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־ל֣וֹ עׇרְלָ֑ה כִּֽי־חֶרְפָּ֥ה הִ֖וא לָֽנוּ׃
34.englishText: and said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man who is uncircumcised, for that is a disgrace among us.
34.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֣vּ aֲlֵyhֶ֗ם lֹ֤a nvּkַl֙ lַaֲshׂvֹt֙ hַdָּbָ֣r hַzֶּ֔h lָtֵt֙ aֶt־aֲchֹtֵ֔nvּ lְaִ֖yshׁ aֲshֶׁr־l֣vֹ aׇrְlָ֑h kִּֽy־chֶrְpָּ֥h hִ֖va lָֽnvּ׃

34.hebrewText: אַךְ־בְּזֹ֖את נֵא֣וֹת לָכֶ֑ם אִ֚ם תִּהְי֣וּ כָמֹ֔נוּ לְהִמֹּ֥ל לָכֶ֖ם כׇּל־זָכָֽר׃
34.englishText: Only on this condition will we agree with you; that you will become like us in that every male among you is circumcised.
34.transliteration: aַךְ־bְּzֹ֖at nֵa֣vֹt lָkֶ֑ם aִ֚ם tִּhְy֣vּ kָmֹ֔nvּ lְhִmֹּ֥l lָkֶ֖ם kׇּl־zָkָֽr׃

34.hebrewText: וְנָתַ֤נּוּ אֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ לָכֶ֔ם וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵיכֶ֖ם נִֽקַּֽח־לָ֑נוּ וְיָשַׁ֣בְנוּ אִתְּכֶ֔ם וְהָיִ֖ינוּ לְעַ֥ם אֶחָֽד׃
34.englishText: Then we will give our daughters to you and take your daughters to ourselves; and we will dwell among you and become as one kindred.
34.transliteration: vְnָtַ֤nּvּ aֶt־bְּnֹtֵ֙ynvּ֙ lָkֶ֔ם vְaֶt־bְּnֹtֵykֶ֖ם nִֽkַּֽch־lָ֑nvּ vְyָshַׁ֣bְnvּ aִtְּkֶ֔ם vְhָyִ֖ynvּ lְaַ֥ם aֶchָֽd׃

34.hebrewText: וְאִם־לֹ֧א תִשְׁמְע֛וּ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ לְהִמּ֑וֹל וְלָקַ֥חְנוּ אֶת־בִּתֵּ֖נוּ וְהָלָֽכְנוּ׃
34.englishText: But if you will not listen to us and become circumcised, we will take our daughter and go.”
34.transliteration: vְaִם־lֹ֧a tִshְׁmְa֛vּ aֵlֵ֖ynvּ lְhִmּ֑vֹl vְlָkַ֥chְnvּ aֶt־bִּtֵּ֖nvּ vְhָlָֽkְnvּ׃

34.hebrewText: וַיִּֽיטְב֥וּ דִבְרֵיהֶ֖ם בְּעֵינֵ֣י חֲמ֑וֹר וּבְעֵינֵ֖י שְׁכֶ֥ם בֶּן־חֲמֽוֹר׃
34.englishText: Their words pleased Hamor and Hamor’s son Shechem.
34.transliteration: vַyִּֽytְb֥vּ dִbְrֵyhֶ֖ם bְּaֵynֵ֣y chֲm֑vֹr vּbְaֵynֵ֖y shְׁkֶ֥ם bֶּן־chֲmֽvֹr׃

34.hebrewText: וְלֹֽא־אֵחַ֤ר הַנַּ֙עַר֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הַדָּבָ֔ר כִּ֥י חָפֵ֖ץ בְּבַֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְה֣וּא נִכְבָּ֔ד מִכֹּ֖ל בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיו׃
34.englishText: And the youth lost no time in doing the thing, for he wanted Jacob’s daughter. Now he was the most respected in his father’s house.
34.transliteration: vְlֹֽa־aֵchַ֤r hַnַּ֙aַr֙ lַaֲshׂ֣vֹt hַdָּbָ֔r kִּ֥y chָpֵ֖ץ bְּbַֽt־yַaֲkֹ֑b vְh֣vּa nִkְbָּ֔d mִkֹּ֖l bֵּ֥yt aָbִֽyv׃

34.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֥א חֲמ֛וֹר וּשְׁכֶ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ אֶל־שַׁ֣עַר עִירָ֑ם וַֽיְדַבְּר֛וּ אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י עִירָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
34.englishText: So Hamor and his son Shechem went to the public place*public place Lit. “gate.” of their town and spoke to their town council,*their town council Heb. ’anshe ‘iram; NJPS “their fellow townsmen,” trad. “the men of their city.” Cf. Ruth 3.11; 4.1–2. See the Dictionary under ’ish. saying,
34.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֥a chֲm֛vֹr vּshְׁkֶ֥ם bְּn֖vֹ aֶl־shַׁ֣aַr aִyrָ֑ם vַֽyְdַbְּr֛vּ aֶl־aַnְshֵׁ֥y aִyrָ֖ם lֵamֹֽr׃

34.hebrewText: הָאֲנָשִׁ֨ים הָאֵ֜לֶּה שְֽׁלֵמִ֧ים הֵ֣ם אִתָּ֗נוּ וְיֵשְׁב֤וּ בָאָ֙רֶץ֙ וְיִסְחֲר֣וּ אֹתָ֔הּ וְהָאָ֛רֶץ הִנֵּ֥ה רַֽחֲבַת־יָדַ֖יִם לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם אֶת־בְּנֹתָם֙ נִקַּֽח־לָ֣נוּ לְנָשִׁ֔ים וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֖ינוּ נִתֵּ֥ן לָהֶֽם׃
34.englishText: “These people*people (So NJPS.) Lit. “participants whose involvement defines the depicted situation.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. are our friends; let them settle in the land and move about in it, for the land is large enough for them; we will take their daughters to ourselves as wives and give our daughters to them.
34.transliteration: hָaֲnָshִׁ֨yם hָaֵ֜lֶּh shְֽׁlֵmִ֧yם hֵ֣ם aִtָּ֗nvּ vְyֵshְׁb֤vּ bָaָ֙rֶץ֙ vְyִsְchֲr֣vּ aֹtָ֔hּ vְhָaָ֛rֶץ hִnֵּ֥h rַֽchֲbַt־yָdַ֖yִם lִpְnֵyhֶ֑ם aֶt־bְּnֹtָם֙ nִkַּֽch־lָ֣nvּ lְnָshִׁ֔yם vְaֶt־bְּnֹtֵ֖ynvּ nִtֵּ֥ן lָhֶֽם׃

34.hebrewText: אַךְ־בְּ֠זֹ֠את יֵאֹ֨תוּ לָ֤נוּ הָאֲנָשִׁים֙ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת אִתָּ֔נוּ לִהְי֖וֹת לְעַ֣ם אֶחָ֑ד בְּהִמּ֥וֹל לָ֙נוּ֙ כׇּל־זָכָ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר הֵ֥ם נִמֹּלִֽים׃
34.englishText: But only on this condition will their representatives*their representatives NJPS “the men.” Cf. note on v. 21. agree with us to dwell among us and be as one kindred: that all our males become circumcised as they are circumcised.
34.transliteration: aַךְ־bְּ֠zֹ֠at yֵaֹ֨tvּ lָ֤nvּ hָaֲnָshִׁyם֙ lָshֶׁ֣bֶt aִtָּ֔nvּ lִhְy֖vֹt lְaַ֣ם aֶchָ֑d bְּhִmּ֥vֹl lָ֙nvּ֙ kׇּl־zָkָ֔r kַּaֲshֶׁ֖r hֵ֥ם nִmֹּlִֽyם׃

34.hebrewText: מִקְנֵהֶ֤ם וְקִנְיָנָם֙ וְכׇל־בְּהֶמְתָּ֔ם הֲל֥וֹא לָ֖נוּ הֵ֑ם אַ֚ךְ נֵא֣וֹתָה לָהֶ֔ם וְיֵשְׁב֖וּ אִתָּֽנוּ׃
34.englishText: Their cattle and substance and all their beasts will be ours, if we only agree to their terms, so that they will settle among us.”
34.transliteration: mִkְnֵhֶ֤ם vְkִnְyָnָם֙ vְkׇl־bְּhֶmְtָּ֔ם hֲl֥vֹa lָ֖nvּ hֵ֑ם aַ֚ךְ nֵa֣vֹtָh lָhֶ֔ם vְyֵshְׁb֖vּ aִtָּֽnvּ׃

34.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמְע֤וּ אֶל־חֲמוֹר֙ וְאֶל־שְׁכֶ֣ם בְּנ֔וֹ כׇּל־יֹצְאֵ֖י שַׁ֣עַר עִיר֑וֹ וַיִּמֹּ֙לוּ֙ כׇּל־זָכָ֔ר כׇּל־יֹצְאֵ֖י שַׁ֥עַר עִירֽוֹ׃
34.englishText: All his fellow townsmen*All his fellow townsmen So the NJPS footnote; the reading in NJPS itself is more literal (“all who went out of the gate of his town”), yet here, women are not in view. heeded Hamor and his son Shechem, and all males, all his fellow townsmen,*all his fellow townsmen See the previous note. were circumcised.
34.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmְa֤vּ aֶl־chֲmvֹr֙ vְaֶl־shְׁkֶ֣ם bְּn֔vֹ kׇּl־yֹtsְaֵ֖y shַׁ֣aַr aִyr֑vֹ vַyִּmֹּ֙lvּ֙ kׇּl־zָkָ֔r kׇּl־yֹtsְaֵ֖y shַׁ֥aַr aִyrֽvֹ׃

34.hebrewText: וַיְהִי֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֜י בִּֽהְיוֹתָ֣ם כֹּֽאֲבִ֗ים וַיִּקְח֣וּ שְׁנֵֽי־בְנֵי־יַ֠עֲקֹ֠ב שִׁמְע֨וֹן וְלֵוִ֜י אֲחֵ֤י דִינָה֙ אִ֣ישׁ חַרְבּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ עַל־הָעִ֖יר בֶּ֑טַח וַיַּֽהַרְג֖וּ כׇּל־זָכָֽר׃
34.englishText: On the third day, when they were in pain, Simeon and Levi, two of Jacob’s sons, brothers of Dinah, took each his sword, came upon the city unmolested, and slew all the males.
34.transliteration: vַyְhִy֩ bַyּ֨vֹם hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֜y bִּֽhְyvֹtָ֣ם kֹּֽaֲbִ֗yם vַyִּkְch֣vּ shְׁnֵֽy־bְnֵy־yַ֠aֲkֹ֠b shִׁmְa֨vֹן vְlֵvִ֜y aֲchֵ֤y dִynָh֙ aִ֣yshׁ chַrְbּ֔vֹ vַyָּbֹ֥avּ aַl־hָaִ֖yr bֶּ֑tַch vַyַּֽhַrְg֖vּ kׇּl־zָkָֽr׃

34.hebrewText: וְאֶת־חֲמוֹר֙ וְאֶת־שְׁכֶ֣ם בְּנ֔וֹ הָרְג֖וּ לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וַיִּקְח֧וּ אֶת־דִּינָ֛ה מִבֵּ֥ית שְׁכֶ֖ם וַיֵּצֵֽאוּ׃
34.englishText: They put Hamor and his son Shechem to the sword, took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went away.
34.transliteration: vְaֶt־chֲmvֹr֙ vְaֶt־shְׁkֶ֣ם bְּn֔vֹ hָrְg֖vּ lְpִy־chָ֑rֶb vַyִּkְch֧vּ aֶt־dִּynָ֛h mִbֵּ֥yt shְׁkֶ֖ם vַyֵּtsֵֽavּ׃

34.hebrewText: בְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֗ב בָּ֚אוּ עַל־הַ֣חֲלָלִ֔ים וַיָּבֹ֖זּוּ הָעִ֑יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר טִמְּא֖וּ אֲחוֹתָֽם׃
34.englishText: The other sons of Jacob came upon the slain and plundered the town, because their sister had been defiled.
