40.hebrewText: וַיָּ֛שֶׁב אֶת־שַׂ֥ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֖ים עַל־מַשְׁקֵ֑הוּ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן הַכּ֖וֹס עַל־כַּ֥ף פַּרְעֹֽה׃
40.englishText: He restored the chief cupbearer to his cupbearing, and he placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand;
40.transliteration: vַyָּ֛shֶׁb aֶt־shַׂ֥r hַmַּshְׁkִ֖yם aַl־mַshְׁkֵ֑hvּ vַyִּtֵּ֥ן hַkּ֖vֹs aַl־kַּ֥ף pַּrְaֹֽh׃

40.hebrewText: וְאֵ֛ת שַׂ֥ר הָאֹפִ֖ים תָּלָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּתַ֛ר לָהֶ֖ם יוֹסֵֽף׃
40.englishText: but the chief baker he impaled—just as Joseph had interpreted to them.
40.transliteration: vְaֵ֛t shַׂ֥r hָaֹpִ֖yם tָּlָ֑h kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r pָּtַ֛r lָhֶ֖ם yvֹsֵֽף׃

40.hebrewText: וְלֹֽא־זָכַ֧ר שַֽׂר־הַמַּשְׁקִ֛ים אֶת־יוֹסֵ֖ף וַיִּשְׁכָּחֵֽהוּ׃ {פ}
40.englishText: Yet the chief cupbearer did not think of Joseph; he forgot him.
40.transliteration: vְlֹֽa־zָkַ֧r shַֽׂr־hַmַּshְׁkִ֛yם aֶt־yvֹsֵ֖ף vַyִּshְׁkָּchֵֽhvּ׃ {p}

miketz.name: Miketz
miketz.summary: Pharaoh's dreams, Joseph's interpretation and rise to power, the first journey of Joseph's brothers to Egypt, the second journey with Benjamin, and the silver cup incident.

41.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֕י מִקֵּ֖ץ שְׁנָתַ֣יִם יָמִ֑ים וּפַרְעֹ֣ה חֹלֵ֔ם וְהִנֵּ֖ה עֹמֵ֥ד עַל־הַיְאֹֽר׃
41.englishText: After two years’ time, Pharaoh dreamed that he was standing by the Nile,
41.transliteration: vַyְhִ֕y mִkֵּ֖ץ shְׁnָtַ֣yִם yָmִ֑yם vּpַrְaֹ֣h chֹlֵ֔ם vְhִnֵּ֖h aֹmֵ֥d aַl־hַyְaֹֽr׃

41.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּ֣ה מִן־הַיְאֹ֗ר עֹלֹת֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פָּר֔וֹת יְפ֥וֹת מַרְאֶ֖ה וּבְרִיאֹ֣ת בָּשָׂ֑ר וַתִּרְעֶ֖ינָה בָּאָֽחוּ׃
41.englishText: when out of the Nile there came up seven cows, handsome and sturdy, and they grazed in the reed grass.
41.transliteration: vְhִnֵּ֣h mִן־hַyְaֹ֗r aֹlֹt֙ shֶׁ֣bַa pָּr֔vֹt yְp֥vֹt mַrְaֶ֖h vּbְrִyaֹ֣t bָּshָׂ֑r vַtִּrְaֶ֖ynָh bָּaָֽchvּ׃

41.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּ֞ה שֶׁ֧בַע פָּר֣וֹת אֲחֵר֗וֹת עֹל֤וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶן֙ מִן־הַיְאֹ֔ר רָע֥וֹת מַרְאֶ֖ה וְדַקּ֣וֹת בָּשָׂ֑ר וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֛דְנָה אֵ֥צֶל הַפָּר֖וֹת עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
41.englishText: But presently, seven other cows came up from the Nile close behind them, ugly and gaunt, and stood beside the cows on the bank of the Nile;
41.transliteration: vְhִnֵּ֞h shֶׁ֧bַa pָּr֣vֹt aֲchֵr֗vֹt aֹl֤vֹt aַchֲrֵyhֶן֙ mִן־hַyְaֹ֔r rָa֥vֹt mַrְaֶ֖h vְdַkּ֣vֹt bָּshָׂ֑r vַֽtַּaֲmֹ֛dְnָh aֵ֥tsֶl hַpָּr֖vֹt aַl־shְׂpַ֥t hַyְaֹֽr׃

41.hebrewText: וַתֹּאכַ֣לְנָה הַפָּר֗וֹת רָע֤וֹת הַמַּרְאֶה֙ וְדַקֹּ֣ת הַבָּשָׂ֔ר אֵ֚ת שֶׁ֣בַע הַפָּר֔וֹת יְפֹ֥ת הַמַּרְאֶ֖ה וְהַבְּרִיאֹ֑ת וַיִּיקַ֖ץ פַּרְעֹֽה׃
41.englishText: and the ugly gaunt cows ate up the seven handsome sturdy cows. And Pharaoh awoke.
41.transliteration: vַtֹּakַ֣lְnָh hַpָּr֗vֹt rָa֤vֹt hַmַּrְaֶh֙ vְdַkֹּ֣t hַbָּshָׂ֔r aֵ֚t shֶׁ֣bַa hַpָּr֔vֹt yְpֹ֥t hַmַּrְaֶ֖h vְhַbְּrִyaֹ֑t vַyִּykַ֖ץ pַּrְaֹֽh׃

41.hebrewText: וַיִּישָׁ֕ן וַֽיַּחֲלֹ֖ם שֵׁנִ֑ית וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֗ים עֹל֛וֹת בְּקָנֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד בְּרִיא֥וֹת וְטֹבֽוֹת׃
41.englishText: He fell asleep and dreamed a second time: Seven ears of grain, solid and healthy, grew on a single stalk.
41.transliteration: vַyִּyshָׁ֕ן vַֽyַּchֲlֹ֖ם shֵׁnִ֑yt vְhִnֵּ֣h ׀ shֶׁ֣bַa shִׁbֳּlִ֗yם aֹl֛vֹt bְּkָnֶ֥h aֶchָ֖d bְּrִya֥vֹt vְtֹbֽvֹt׃

41.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֔ים דַּקּ֖וֹת וּשְׁדוּפֹ֣ת קָדִ֑ים צֹמְח֖וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶֽן׃
41.englishText: But close behind them sprouted seven ears, thin and scorched by the east wind.
41.transliteration: vְhִnֵּh֙ shֶׁ֣bַa shִׁbֳּlִ֔yם dַּkּ֖vֹt vּshְׁdvּpֹ֣t kָdִ֑yם tsֹmְch֖vֹt aַchֲrֵyhֶֽן׃

41.hebrewText: וַתִּבְלַ֙עְנָה֙ הַשִּׁבֳּלִ֣ים הַדַּקּ֔וֹת אֵ֚ת שֶׁ֣בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִ֔ים הַבְּרִיא֖וֹת וְהַמְּלֵא֑וֹת וַיִּיקַ֥ץ פַּרְעֹ֖ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה חֲלֽוֹם׃
41.englishText: And the thin ears swallowed up the seven solid and full ears. Then Pharaoh awoke: it was a dream!
41.transliteration: vַtִּbְlַ֙aְnָh֙ hַshִּׁbֳּlִ֣yם hַdַּkּ֔vֹt aֵ֚t shֶׁ֣bַa hַֽshִּׁbֳּlִ֔yם hַbְּrִya֖vֹt vְhַmְּlֵa֑vֹt vַyִּykַ֥ץ pַּrְaֹ֖h vְhִnֵּ֥h chֲlֽvֹם׃

41.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֤י בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ וַתִּפָּ֣עֶם רוּח֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח וַיִּקְרָ֛א אֶת־כׇּל־חַרְטֻמֵּ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם וְאֶת־כׇּל־חֲכָמֶ֑יהָ וַיְסַפֵּ֨ר פַּרְעֹ֤ה לָהֶם֙ אֶת־חֲלֹמ֔וֹ וְאֵין־פּוֹתֵ֥ר אוֹתָ֖ם לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
41.englishText: Next morning, his spirit was agitated, and he sent for all the magician-priests of Egypt, and all its sages; and Pharaoh told them his dreams, but none could interpret them for Pharaoh.
41.transliteration: vַyְhִ֤y bַbֹּ֙kֶr֙ vַtִּpָּ֣aֶם rvּch֔vֹ vַyִּshְׁlַ֗ch vַyִּkְrָ֛a aֶt־kׇּl־chַrְtֻmֵּ֥y mִtsְrַ֖yִם vְaֶt־kׇּl־chֲkָmֶ֑yhָ vַyְsַpֵּ֨r pַּrְaֹ֤h lָhֶם֙ aֶt־chֲlֹm֔vֹ vְaֵyן־pּvֹtֵ֥r avֹtָ֖ם lְpַrְaֹֽh׃

41.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּר֙ שַׂ֣ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֔ים אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אֶת־חֲטָאַ֕י אֲנִ֖י מַזְכִּ֥יר הַיּֽוֹם׃
41.englishText: The chief cupbearer then spoke up and said to Pharaoh, “I must make mention today of my offenses.
41.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּr֙ shַׂ֣r hַmַּshְׁkִ֔yם aֶt־pַּrְaֹ֖h lֵamֹ֑r aֶt־chֲtָaַ֕y aֲnִ֖y mַzְkִּ֥yr hַyּֽvֹם׃

41.hebrewText: פַּרְעֹ֖ה קָצַ֣ף עַל־עֲבָדָ֑יו וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אֹתִ֜י בְּמִשְׁמַ֗ר בֵּ֚ית שַׂ֣ר הַטַּבָּחִ֔ים אֹתִ֕י וְאֵ֖ת שַׂ֥ר הָאֹפִֽים׃
41.englishText: Once Pharaoh was angry with his servants, and placed me in custody in the house of the prefect,*prefect See note at 37.36. together with the chief baker.
41.transliteration: pַּrְaֹ֖h kָtsַ֣ף aַl־aֲbָdָ֑yv vַyִּtֵּ֨ן aֹtִ֜y bְּmִshְׁmַ֗r bֵּ֚yt shַׂ֣r hַtַּbָּchִ֔yם aֹtִ֕y vְaֵ֖t shַׂ֥r hָaֹpִֽyם׃

41.hebrewText: וַנַּֽחַלְמָ֥ה חֲל֛וֹם בְּלַ֥יְלָה אֶחָ֖ד אֲנִ֣י וָה֑וּא אִ֛ישׁ כְּפִתְר֥וֹן חֲלֹמ֖וֹ חָלָֽמְנוּ׃
41.englishText: We had dreams the same night, he and I, each of us a dream with a meaning of its own.
41.transliteration: vַnַּֽchַlְmָ֥h chֲl֛vֹם bְּlַ֥yְlָh aֶchָ֖d aֲnִ֣y vָh֑vּa aִ֛yshׁ kְּpִtְr֥vֹן chֲlֹm֖vֹ chָlָֽmְnvּ׃

41.hebrewText: וְשָׁ֨ם אִתָּ֜נוּ נַ֣עַר עִבְרִ֗י עֶ֚בֶד לְשַׂ֣ר הַטַּבָּחִ֔ים וַ֨נְּסַפֶּר־ל֔וֹ וַיִּפְתׇּר־לָ֖נוּ אֶת־חֲלֹמֹתֵ֑ינוּ אִ֥ישׁ כַּחֲלֹמ֖וֹ פָּתָֽר׃
41.englishText: A Hebrew youth was there with us, a servant of the prefect; and when we told him our dreams, he interpreted them for us, telling each of the meaning of his dream.
41.transliteration: vְshָׁ֨ם aִtָּ֜nvּ nַ֣aַr aִbְrִ֗y aֶ֚bֶd lְshַׂ֣r hַtַּbָּchִ֔yם vַ֨nְּsַpֶּr־l֔vֹ vַyִּpְtׇּr־lָ֖nvּ aֶt־chֲlֹmֹtֵ֑ynvּ aִ֥yshׁ kַּchֲlֹm֖vֹ pָּtָֽr׃

41.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֛י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּֽתַר־לָ֖נוּ כֵּ֣ן הָיָ֑ה אֹתִ֛י הֵשִׁ֥יב עַל־כַּנִּ֖י וְאֹת֥וֹ תָלָֽה׃
41.englishText: And as he interpreted for us, so it came to pass: I was restored to my post, and the other was impaled.”
41.transliteration: vַyְhִ֛y kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r pָּֽtַr־lָ֖nvּ kֵּ֣ן hָyָ֑h aֹtִ֛y hֵshִׁ֥yb aַl־kַּnִּ֖y vְaֹt֥vֹ tָlָֽh׃

41.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח פַּרְעֹה֙ וַיִּקְרָ֣א אֶת־יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיְרִיצֻ֖הוּ מִן־הַבּ֑וֹר וַיְגַלַּח֙ וַיְחַלֵּ֣ף שִׂמְלֹתָ֔יו וַיָּבֹ֖א אֶל־פַּרְעֹֽה׃
41.englishText: Thereupon Pharaoh sent for Joseph, and he was rushed from the dungeon. He had his hair cut and changed his clothes, and he appeared before Pharaoh.
41.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁlַ֤ch pַּrְaֹh֙ vַyִּkְrָ֣a aֶt־yvֹsֵ֔ף vַyְrִytsֻ֖hvּ mִן־hַbּ֑vֹr vַyְgַlַּch֙ vַyְchַlֵּ֣ף shִׂmְlֹtָ֔yv vַyָּbֹ֖a aֶl־pַּrְaֹֽh׃

41.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף חֲל֣וֹם חָלַ֔מְתִּי וּפֹתֵ֖ר אֵ֣ין אֹת֑וֹ וַאֲנִ֗י שָׁמַ֤עְתִּי עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר תִּשְׁמַ֥ע חֲל֖וֹם לִפְתֹּ֥ר אֹתֽוֹ׃
41.englishText: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I have had a dream, but no one can interpret it. Now I have heard it said of you that for you to hear a dream is to tell its meaning.”
41.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr pַּrְaֹh֙ aֶl־yvֹsֵ֔ף chֲl֣vֹם chָlַ֔mְtִּy vּpֹtֵ֖r aֵ֣yן aֹt֑vֹ vַaֲnִ֗y shָׁmַ֤aְtִּy aָlֶ֙yךָ֙ lֵamֹ֔r tִּshְׁmַ֥a chֲl֖vֹם lִpְtֹּ֥r aֹtֽvֹ׃

41.hebrewText: וַיַּ֨עַן יוֹסֵ֧ף אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֛ה לֵאמֹ֖ר בִּלְעָדָ֑י אֱלֹהִ֕ים יַעֲנֶ֖ה אֶת־שְׁל֥וֹם פַּרְעֹֽה׃
41.englishText: Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, “Not I! God will see to Pharaoh’s welfare.”
41.transliteration: vַyַּ֨aַן yvֹsֵ֧ף aֶt־pַּrְaֹ֛h lֵamֹ֖r bִּlְaָdָ֑y aֱlֹhִ֕yם yַaֲnֶ֖h aֶt־shְׁl֥vֹם pַּrְaֹֽh׃

41.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף בַּחֲלֹמִ֕י הִנְנִ֥י עֹמֵ֖ד עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
41.englishText: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “In my dream, I was standing on the bank of the Nile,
41.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r pַּrְaֹ֖h aֶl־yvֹsֵ֑ף bַּchֲlֹmִ֕y hִnְnִ֥y aֹmֵ֖d aַl־shְׂpַ֥t hַyְaֹֽr׃

41.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּ֣ה מִן־הַיְאֹ֗ר עֹלֹת֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פָּר֔וֹת בְּרִיא֥וֹת בָּשָׂ֖ר וִיפֹ֣ת תֹּ֑אַר וַתִּרְעֶ֖ינָה בָּאָֽחוּ׃
41.englishText: when out of the Nile came up seven sturdy and well-formed cows and grazed in the reed grass.
41.transliteration: vְhִnֵּ֣h mִן־hַyְaֹ֗r aֹlֹt֙ shֶׁ֣bַa pָּr֔vֹt bְּrִya֥vֹt bָּshָׂ֖r vִypֹ֣t tֹּ֑aַr vַtִּrְaֶ֖ynָh bָּaָֽchvּ׃

41.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּ֞ה שֶֽׁבַע־פָּר֤וֹת אֲחֵרוֹת֙ עֹל֣וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ן דַּלּ֨וֹת וְרָע֥וֹת תֹּ֛אַר מְאֹ֖ד וְרַקּ֣וֹת בָּשָׂ֑ר לֹֽא־רָאִ֧יתִי כָהֵ֛נָּה בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לָרֹֽעַ׃
41.englishText: Presently there followed them seven other cows, scrawny, ill-formed, and emaciated—never had I seen their likes for ugliness in all the land of Egypt!
41.transliteration: vְhִnֵּ֞h shֶֽׁbַa־pָּr֤vֹt aֲchֵrvֹt֙ aֹl֣vֹt aַchֲrֵyhֶ֔ן dַּlּ֨vֹt vְrָa֥vֹt tֹּ֛aַr mְaֹ֖d vְrַkּ֣vֹt bָּshָׂ֑r lֹֽa־rָaִ֧ytִy kָhֵ֛nָּh bְּkׇl־aֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrַ֖yִם lָrֹֽaַ׃

41.hebrewText: וַתֹּאכַ֙לְנָה֙ הַפָּר֔וֹת הָרַקּ֖וֹת וְהָרָע֑וֹת אֵ֣ת שֶׁ֧בַע הַפָּר֛וֹת הָרִאשֹׁנ֖וֹת הַבְּרִיאֹֽת׃
41.englishText: And the seven lean and ugly cows ate up the first seven cows, the sturdy ones;
41.transliteration: vַtֹּakַ֙lְnָh֙ hַpָּr֔vֹt hָrַkּ֖vֹt vְhָrָa֑vֹt aֵ֣t shֶׁ֧bַa hַpָּr֛vֹt hָrִashֹׁn֖vֹt hַbְּrִyaֹֽt׃

41.hebrewText: וַתָּבֹ֣אנָה אֶל־קִרְבֶּ֗נָה וְלֹ֤א נוֹדַע֙ כִּי־בָ֣אוּ אֶל־קִרְבֶּ֔נָה וּמַרְאֵיהֶ֣ן רַ֔ע כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּתְּחִלָּ֑ה וָאִיקָֽץ׃
41.englishText: but when they had consumed them, one could not tell that they had consumed them, for they looked just as bad as before. And I awoke.
41.transliteration: vַtָּbֹ֣anָh aֶl־kִrְbֶּ֗nָh vְlֹ֤a nvֹdַa֙ kִּy־bָ֣avּ aֶl־kִrְbֶּ֔nָh vּmַrְaֵyhֶ֣ן rַ֔a kַּaֲshֶׁ֖r bַּtְּchִlָּ֑h vָaִykָֽץ׃

41.hebrewText: וָאֵ֖רֶא בַּחֲלֹמִ֑י וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֗ים עֹלֹ֛ת בְּקָנֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד מְלֵאֹ֥ת וְטֹבֽוֹת׃
41.englishText: In my other dream, I saw seven ears of grain, full and healthy, growing on a single stalk;
41.transliteration: vָaֵ֖rֶa bַּchֲlֹmִ֑y vְhִnֵּ֣h ׀ shֶׁ֣bַa shִׁbֳּlִ֗yם aֹlֹ֛t bְּkָnֶ֥h aֶchָ֖d mְlֵaֹ֥t vְtֹbֽvֹt׃

41.hebrewText: וְהִנֵּה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֔ים צְנֻמ֥וֹת דַּקּ֖וֹת שְׁדֻפ֣וֹת קָדִ֑ים צֹמְח֖וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
41.englishText: but right behind them sprouted seven ears, shriveled, thin, and scorched by the east wind.
41.transliteration: vְhִnֵּh֙ shֶׁ֣bַa shִׁbֳּlִ֔yם tsְnֻm֥vֹt dַּkּ֖vֹt shְׁdֻp֣vֹt kָdִ֑yם tsֹmְch֖vֹt aַchֲrֵyhֶֽם׃

41.hebrewText: וַתִּבְלַ֙עְןָ֙ הַשִּׁבֳּלִ֣ים הַדַּקֹּ֔ת אֵ֛ת שֶׁ֥בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִ֖ים הַטֹּב֑וֹת וָֽאֹמַר֙ אֶל־הַֽחַרְטֻמִּ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין מַגִּ֖יד לִֽי׃
41.englishText: And the thin ears swallowed the seven healthy ears. I have told my magician-priests, but none has an explanation for me.”
41.transliteration: vַtִּbְlַ֙aְןָ֙ hַshִּׁbֳּlִ֣yם hַdַּkֹּ֔t aֵ֛t shֶׁ֥bַa hַֽshִּׁbֳּlִ֖yם hַtֹּb֑vֹt vָֽaֹmַr֙ aֶl־hַֽchַrְtֻmִּ֔yם vְaֵ֥yן mַgִּ֖yd lִֽy׃

41.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה חֲל֥וֹם פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶחָ֣ד ה֑וּא אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים עֹשֶׂ֖ה הִגִּ֥יד לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
41.englishText: And Joseph said to Pharaoh, “Pharaoh’s dreams are one and the same: Pharaoh has been told what God is about to do.
41.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yvֹsֵף֙ aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֔h chֲl֥vֹם pַּrְaֹ֖h aֶchָ֣d h֑vּa aֵ֣t aֲshֶׁ֧r hָaֱlֹhִ֛yם aֹshֶׂ֖h hִgִּ֥yd lְpַrְaֹֽh׃

41.hebrewText: שֶׁ֧בַע פָּרֹ֣ת הַטֹּבֹ֗ת שֶׁ֤בַע שָׁנִים֙ הֵ֔נָּה וְשֶׁ֤בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִים֙ הַטֹּבֹ֔ת שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים הֵ֑נָּה חֲל֖וֹם אֶחָ֥ד הֽוּא׃
41.englishText: The seven healthy cows are seven years, and the seven healthy ears are seven years; it is the same dream.
41.transliteration: shֶׁ֧bַa pָּrֹ֣t hַtֹּbֹ֗t shֶׁ֤bַa shָׁnִyם֙ hֵ֔nָּh vְshֶׁ֤bַa hַֽshִּׁbֳּlִyם֙ hַtֹּbֹ֔t shֶׁ֥bַa shָׁnִ֖yם hֵ֑nָּh chֲl֖vֹם aֶchָ֥d hֽvּa׃

41.hebrewText: וְשֶׁ֣בַע הַ֠פָּר֠וֹת הָֽרַקּ֨וֹת וְהָרָעֹ֜ת הָעֹלֹ֣ת אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ן שֶׁ֤בַע שָׁנִים֙ הֵ֔נָּה וְשֶׁ֤בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִים֙ הָרֵק֔וֹת שְׁדֻפ֖וֹת הַקָּדִ֑ים יִהְי֕וּ שֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֥י רָעָֽב׃
41.englishText: The seven lean and ugly cows that followed are seven years, as are also the seven empty ears scorched by the east wind; they are seven years of famine.
41.transliteration: vְshֶׁ֣bַa hַ֠pָּr֠vֹt hָֽrַkּ֨vֹt vְhָrָaֹ֜t hָaֹlֹ֣t aַchֲrֵyhֶ֗ן shֶׁ֤bַa shָׁnִyם֙ hֵ֔nָּh vְshֶׁ֤bַa hַֽshִּׁbֳּlִyם֙ hָrֵk֔vֹt shְׁdֻp֖vֹt hַkָּdִ֑yם yִhְy֕vּ shֶׁ֖bַa shְׁnֵ֥y rָaָֽb׃

41.hebrewText: ה֣וּא הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים עֹשֶׂ֖ה הֶרְאָ֥ה אֶת־פַּרְעֹֽה׃
41.englishText: It is just as I have told Pharaoh: Pharaoh has been shown what God is about to do.
41.transliteration: h֣vּa hַdָּbָ֔r aֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbַּ֖rְtִּy aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֑h aֲshֶׁ֧r hָaֱlֹhִ֛yם aֹshֶׂ֖h hֶrְaָ֥h aֶt־pַּrְaֹֽh׃

41.hebrewText: הִנֵּ֛ה שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים בָּא֑וֹת שָׂבָ֥ע גָּד֖וֹל בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
41.englishText: Immediately ahead are seven years of great abundance in all the land of Egypt.
41.transliteration: hִnֵּ֛h shֶׁ֥bַa shָׁnִ֖yם bָּa֑vֹt shָׂbָ֥a gָּd֖vֹl bְּkׇl־aֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

41.hebrewText: וְ֠קָ֠מוּ שֶׁ֜בַע שְׁנֵ֤י רָעָב֙ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ן וְנִשְׁכַּ֥ח כׇּל־הַשָּׂבָ֖ע בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְכִלָּ֥ה הָרָעָ֖ב אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
41.englishText: After them will come seven years of famine, and all the abundance in the land of Egypt will be forgotten. As the land is ravaged by famine,
41.transliteration: vְ֠kָ֠mvּ shֶׁ֜bַa shְׁnֵ֤y rָaָb֙ aַchֲrֵyhֶ֔ן vְnִshְׁkַּ֥ch kׇּl־hַshָּׂbָ֖a bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrָ֑yִם vְkִlָּ֥h hָrָaָ֖b aֶt־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

41.hebrewText: וְלֹֽא־יִוָּדַ֤ע הַשָּׂבָע֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ מִפְּנֵ֛י הָרָעָ֥ב הַה֖וּא אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֑ן כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד ה֖וּא מְאֹֽד׃
41.englishText: no trace of the abundance will be left in the land because of the famine thereafter, for it will be very severe.
41.transliteration: vְlֹֽa־yִvָּdַ֤a hַshָּׂbָa֙ bָּaָ֔rֶץ mִpְּnֵ֛y hָrָaָ֥b hַh֖vּa aַchֲrֵy־kֵ֑ן kִּֽy־kָbֵ֥d h֖vּa mְaֹֽd׃

41.hebrewText: וְעַ֨ל הִשָּׁנ֧וֹת הַחֲל֛וֹם אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה פַּעֲמָ֑יִם כִּֽי־נָכ֤וֹן הַדָּבָר֙ מֵעִ֣ם הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וּמְמַהֵ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים לַעֲשֹׂתֽוֹ׃
41.englishText: As for Pharaoh having had the same dream twice, it means that the matter has been determined by God, and that God will soon carry it out.
41.transliteration: vְaַ֨l hִshָּׁn֧vֹt hַchֲl֛vֹם aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֖h pַּaֲmָ֑yִם kִּֽy־nָk֤vֹן hַdָּbָr֙ mֵaִ֣ם hָaֱlֹhִ֔yם vּmְmַhֵ֥r hָaֱlֹhִ֖yם lַaֲshֹׂtֽvֹ׃

41.hebrewText: וְעַתָּה֙ יֵרֶ֣א פַרְעֹ֔ה אִ֖ישׁ נָב֣וֹן וְחָכָ֑ם וִישִׁיתֵ֖הוּ עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
41.englishText: “Accordingly, let Pharaoh find someone*someone Lit. “a participant whose involvement defines the (proposed) situation.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. who’s discerning and wise, whom you can set over the land of Egypt.
41.transliteration: vְaַtָּh֙ yֵrֶ֣a pַrְaֹ֔h aִ֖yshׁ nָb֣vֹן vְchָkָ֑ם vִyshִׁytֵ֖hvּ aַl־aֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

41.hebrewText: יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה פַרְעֹ֔ה וְיַפְקֵ֥ד פְּקִדִ֖ים עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְחִמֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּשֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֥י הַשָּׂבָֽע׃
41.englishText: And let Pharaoh take steps to appoint overseers over the land, and organize*organize Others “take a fifth part of”; meaning of Heb. uncertain. the land of Egypt in the seven years of plenty.
41.transliteration: yַaֲshֶׂ֣h pַrְaֹ֔h vְyַpְkֵ֥d pְּkִdִ֖yם aַl־hָaָ֑rֶץ vְchִmֵּshׁ֙ aֶt־aֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם bְּshֶׁ֖bַa shְׁnֵ֥y hַshָּׂbָֽa׃

41.hebrewText: וְיִקְבְּצ֗וּ אֶת־כׇּל־אֹ֙כֶל֙ הַשָּׁנִ֣ים הַטֹּב֔וֹת הַבָּאֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְיִצְבְּרוּ־בָ֞ר תַּ֧חַת יַד־פַּרְעֹ֛ה אֹ֥כֶל בֶּעָרִ֖ים וְשָׁמָֽרוּ׃
41.englishText: Let all the food of these good years that are coming be gathered, and let the grain be collected under Pharaoh’s authority as food to be stored in the cities.
41.transliteration: vְyִkְbְּts֗vּ aֶt־kׇּl־aֹ֙kֶl֙ hַshָּׁnִ֣yם hַtֹּb֔vֹt hַbָּaֹ֖t hָaֵ֑lֶּh vְyִtsְbְּrvּ־bָ֞r tַּ֧chַt yַd־pַּrְaֹ֛h aֹ֥kֶl bֶּaָrִ֖yם vְshָׁmָֽrvּ׃

41.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֨ה הָאֹ֤כֶל לְפִקָּדוֹן֙ לָאָ֔רֶץ לְשֶׁ֙בַע֙ שְׁנֵ֣י הָרָעָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּהְיֶ֖יןָ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹֽא־תִכָּרֵ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּרָעָֽב׃
41.englishText: Let that food be a reserve for the land for the seven years of famine which will come upon the land of Egypt, so that the land may not perish in the famine.”
41.transliteration: vְhָyָ֨h hָaֹ֤kֶl lְpִkָּdvֹן֙ lָaָ֔rֶץ lְshֶׁ֙bַa֙ shְׁnֵ֣y hָrָaָ֔b aֲshֶׁ֥r tִּhְyֶ֖yןָ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrָ֑yִם vְlֹֽa־tִkָּrֵ֥t hָaָ֖rֶץ bָּrָaָֽb׃

41.hebrewText: וַיִּיטַ֥ב הַדָּבָ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וּבְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־עֲבָדָֽיו׃
41.englishText: The plan pleased Pharaoh and all his courtiers.
41.transliteration: vַyִּytַ֥b hַdָּbָ֖r bְּaֵynֵ֣y pַrְaֹ֑h vּbְaֵynֵ֖y kׇּl־aֲbָdָֽyv׃

41.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶל־עֲבָדָ֑יו הֲנִמְצָ֣א כָזֶ֔ה אִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֛ר ר֥וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֖ים בּֽוֹ׃
41.englishText: And Pharaoh said to his courtiers, “Could we find another like him—a man with the divine spirit?”
41.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr pַּrְaֹ֖h aֶl־aֲbָdָ֑yv hֲnִmְtsָ֣a kָzֶ֔h aִ֕yshׁ aֲshֶׁ֛r r֥vּchַ aֱlֹhִ֖yם bּֽvֹ׃

41.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אַחֲרֵ֨י הוֹדִ֧יעַ אֱלֹהִ֛ים אוֹתְךָ֖ אֶת־כׇּל־זֹ֑את אֵין־נָב֥וֹן וְחָכָ֖ם כָּמֽוֹךָ׃
41.englishText: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Since God has made all this known to you, there is none so discerning and wise as you.
41.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr pַּrְaֹh֙ aֶl־yvֹsֵ֔ף aַchֲrֵ֨y hvֹdִ֧yaַ aֱlֹhִ֛yם avֹtְךָ֖ aֶt־kׇּl־zֹ֑at aֵyן־nָb֥vֹן vְchָkָ֖ם kָּmֽvֹךָ׃

41.hebrewText: אַתָּה֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה עַל־בֵּיתִ֔י וְעַל־פִּ֖יךָ יִשַּׁ֣ק כׇּל־עַמִּ֑י רַ֥ק הַכִּסֵּ֖א אֶגְדַּ֥ל מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
41.englishText: You shall be in charge of my court, and by your command shall all my people be directed;*be directed Others “order themselves” or “pay homage”; meaning of Heb. yishshaq uncertain. only with respect to the throne shall I be superior to you.”
41.transliteration: aַtָּh֙ tִּhְyֶ֣h aַl־bֵּytִ֔y vְaַl־pִּ֖yךָ yִshַּׁ֣k kׇּl־aַmִּ֑y rַ֥k hַkִּsֵּ֖a aֶgְdַּ֥l mִmֶּֽךָּ׃

41.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף רְאֵה֙ נָתַ֣תִּי אֹֽתְךָ֔ עַ֖ל כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
41.englishText: Pharaoh further said to Joseph, “See, I put you in charge of all the land of Egypt.”
41.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr pַּrְaֹ֖h aֶl־yvֹsֵ֑ף rְaֵh֙ nָtַ֣tִּy aֹֽtְךָ֔ aַ֖l kׇּl־aֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

41.hebrewText: וַיָּ֨סַר פַּרְעֹ֤ה אֶת־טַבַּעְתּוֹ֙ מֵעַ֣ל יָד֔וֹ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֖הּ עַל־יַ֣ד יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיַּלְבֵּ֤שׁ אֹתוֹ֙ בִּגְדֵי־שֵׁ֔שׁ וַיָּ֛שֶׂם רְבִ֥ד הַזָּהָ֖ב עַל־צַוָּארֽוֹ׃
41.englishText: And removing his signet ring from his hand, Pharaoh put it on Joseph’s hand; and he had him dressed in robes of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck.
41.transliteration: vַyָּ֨sַr pַּrְaֹ֤h aֶt־tַbַּaְtּvֹ֙ mֵaַ֣l yָd֔vֹ vַyִּtֵּ֥ן aֹtָ֖hּ aַl־yַ֣d yvֹsֵ֑ף vַyַּlְbֵּ֤shׁ aֹtvֹ֙ bִּgְdֵy־shֵׁ֔shׁ vַyָּ֛shֶׂם rְbִ֥d hַzָּhָ֖b aַl־tsַvָּarֽvֹ׃

41.hebrewText: וַיַּרְכֵּ֣ב אֹת֗וֹ בְּמִרְכֶּ֤בֶת הַמִּשְׁנֶה֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וַיִּקְרְא֥וּ לְפָנָ֖יו אַבְרֵ֑ךְ וְנָת֣וֹן אֹת֔וֹ עַ֖ל כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
41.englishText: He had him ride in the chariot of his second-in-command, and they cried before him, “Abrek!”*Abrek Others “Bow the knee,” as though from Heb. barakh “to kneel”; perhaps from an Egyptian word of unknown meaning. Thus he placed him over all the land of Egypt.
41.transliteration: vַyַּrְkֵּ֣b aֹt֗vֹ bְּmִrְkֶּ֤bֶt hַmִּshְׁnֶh֙ aֲshֶׁr־l֔vֹ vַyִּkְrְa֥vּ lְpָnָ֖yv aַbְrֵ֑ךְ vְnָt֣vֹן aֹt֔vֹ aַ֖l kׇּl־aֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

41.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֛ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף אֲנִ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וּבִלְעָדֶ֗יךָ לֹֽא־יָרִ֨ים אִ֧ישׁ אֶת־יָד֛וֹ וְאֶת־רַגְל֖וֹ בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
41.englishText: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh; yet without you, no one shall lift up hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”
41.transliteration: vַyֹּ֧amֶr pַּrְaֹ֛h aֶl־yvֹsֵ֖ף aֲnִ֣y pַrְaֹ֑h vּbִlְaָdֶ֗yךָ lֹֽa־yָrִ֨yם aִ֧yshׁ aֶt־yָd֛vֹ vְaֶt־rַgְl֖vֹ bְּkׇl־aֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

41.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֨א פַרְעֹ֣ה שֵׁם־יוֹסֵף֮ צָֽפְנַ֣ת פַּעְנֵ֒חַ֒ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֣וֹ אֶת־אָֽסְנַ֗ת בַּת־פּ֥וֹטִי פֶ֛רַע*(בספרי תימן פּֽוֹטִיפֶ֛רַע בתיבה אחת) כֹּהֵ֥ן אֹ֖ן לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֖ף עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
41.englishText: Pharaoh then gave Joseph the name Zaphenath-paneah;*Zaphenath-paneah Egyptian for “God speaks; he lives,” or “creator of life.” and he gave him for a wife Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On. Thus Joseph emerged in charge of the land of Egypt.—
41.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֨a pַrְaֹ֣h shֵׁם־yvֹsֵף֮ tsָֽpְnַ֣t pַּaְnֵ֒chַ֒ vַyִּtֶּן־l֣vֹ aֶt־aָֽsְnַ֗t bַּt־pּ֥vֹtִy pֶ֛rַa*(bspry tymן pּֽvֹtִypֶ֛rַa btybh acht) kֹּhֵ֥ן aֹ֖ן lְaִshָּׁ֑h vַyֵּtsֵ֥a yvֹsֵ֖ף aַl־aֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

41.hebrewText: וְיוֹסֵף֙ בֶּן־שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּעׇמְד֕וֹ לִפְנֵ֖י פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיֵּצֵ֤א יוֹסֵף֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֖ר בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
41.englishText: Joseph was thirty years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh king of Egypt.—Leaving Pharaoh’s presence, Joseph traveled through all the land of Egypt.
41.transliteration: vְyvֹsֵף֙ bֶּן־shְׁlֹshִׁ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h bְּaׇmְd֕vֹ lִpְnֵ֖y pַּrְaֹ֣h mֶֽlֶךְ־mִtsְrָ֑yִם vַyֵּtsֵ֤a yvֹsֵף֙ mִlִּpְnֵ֣y pַrְaֹ֔h vַֽyַּaֲbֹ֖r bְּkׇl־aֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

41.hebrewText: וַתַּ֣עַשׂ הָאָ֔רֶץ בְּשֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֣י הַשָּׂבָ֑ע לִקְמָצִֽים׃
41.englishText: During the seven years of plenty, the land produced in abundance.
41.transliteration: vַtַּ֣aַshׂ hָaָ֔rֶץ bְּshֶׁ֖bַa shְׁnֵ֣y hַshָּׂbָ֑a lִkְmָtsִֽyם׃

41.hebrewText: וַיִּקְבֹּ֞ץ אֶת־כׇּל־אֹ֣כֶל ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָיוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּתֶּן־אֹ֖כֶל בֶּעָרִ֑ים אֹ֧כֶל שְׂדֵה־הָעִ֛יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר סְבִיבֹתֶ֖יהָ נָתַ֥ן בְּתוֹכָֽהּ׃
41.englishText: And he gathered all the grain of the seven years that the land of Egypt was enjoying,*the seven years that the land of Egypt was enjoying Lit. “the seven years that were in the land of Egypt.” and stored the grain in the cities; he put in each city the grain of the fields around it.
41.transliteration: vַyִּkְbֹּ֞ץ aֶt־kׇּl־aֹ֣kֶl ׀ shֶׁ֣bַa shָׁnִ֗yם aֲshֶׁ֤r hָyvּ֙ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם vַyִּtֶּן־aֹ֖kֶl bֶּaָrִ֑yם aֹ֧kֶl shְׂdֵh־hָaִ֛yr aֲshֶׁ֥r sְbִybֹtֶ֖yhָ nָtַ֥ן bְּtvֹkָֽhּ׃

41.hebrewText: וַיִּצְבֹּ֨ר יוֹסֵ֥ף בָּ֛ר כְּח֥וֹל הַיָּ֖ם הַרְבֵּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד עַ֛ד כִּי־חָדַ֥ל לִסְפֹּ֖ר כִּי־אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
41.englishText: So Joseph collected produce in very large quantity, like the sands of the sea, until he ceased to measure it, for it could not be measured.
41.transliteration: vַyִּtsְbֹּ֨r yvֹsֵ֥ף bָּ֛r kְּch֥vֹl hַyָּ֖ם hַrְbֵּ֣h mְaֹ֑d aַ֛d kִּy־chָdַ֥l lִsְpֹּ֖r kִּy־aֵ֥yן mִsְpָּֽr׃

41.hebrewText: וּלְיוֹסֵ֤ף יֻלַּד֙ שְׁנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים בְּטֶ֥רֶם תָּב֖וֹא שְׁנַ֣ת הָרָעָ֑ב אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָֽלְדָה־לּוֹ֙ אָֽסְנַ֔ת בַּת־פּ֥וֹטִי פֶ֖רַע*(בספרי תימן פּֽוֹטִיפֶ֖רַע בתיבה אחת) כֹּהֵ֥ן אֽוֹן׃
41.englishText: Before the years of famine came, Joseph became the father of two sons, whom Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On, bore to him.
41.transliteration: vּlְyvֹsֵ֤ף yֻlַּd֙ shְׁnֵ֣y bָnִ֔yם bְּtֶ֥rֶם tָּb֖vֹa shְׁnַ֣t hָrָaָ֑b aֲshֶׁ֤r yָֽlְdָh־lּvֹ֙ aָֽsְnַ֔t bַּt־pּ֥vֹtִy pֶ֖rַa*(bspry tymן pּֽvֹtִypֶ֖rַa btybh acht) kֹּhֵ֥ן aֽvֹן׃

41.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם הַבְּכ֖וֹר מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה כִּֽי־נַשַּׁ֤נִי אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־כׇּל־עֲמָלִ֔י וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽי׃
41.englishText: Joseph named the first-born Manasseh, meaning, “God has made me forget*has made me forget Heb. nashshani, connected with “Manasseh” (Menashsheh). completely my hardship and my parental home.”
41.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֥a yvֹsֵ֛ף aֶt־shֵׁ֥ם hַbְּk֖vֹr mְnַshֶּׁ֑h kִּֽy־nַshַּׁ֤nִy aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶt־kׇּl־aֲmָlִ֔y vְaֵ֖t kׇּl־bֵּ֥yt aָbִֽy׃

41.hebrewText: וְאֵ֛ת שֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖י קָרָ֣א אֶפְרָ֑יִם כִּֽי־הִפְרַ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּאֶ֥רֶץ עׇנְיִֽי׃
41.englishText: And the second he named Ephraim, meaning, “God has made me fertile*has made me fertile Heb. hiphrani, connected with “Ephraim.” in the land of my affliction.”
41.transliteration: vְaֵ֛t shֵׁ֥ם hַshֵּׁnִ֖y kָrָ֣a aֶpְrָ֑yִם kִּֽy־hִpְrַ֥nִy aֱlֹhִ֖yם bְּaֶ֥rֶץ aׇnְyִֽy׃

41.hebrewText: וַתִּכְלֶ֕ינָה שֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֣י הַשָּׂבָ֑ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
41.englishText: The seven years of abundance that the land of Egypt enjoyed came to an end,
41.transliteration: vַtִּkְlֶ֕ynָh shֶׁ֖bַa shְׁnֵ֣y hַshָּׂbָ֑a aֲshֶׁ֥r hָyָ֖h bְּaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

41.hebrewText: וַתְּחִלֶּ֜ינָה שֶׁ֣בַע שְׁנֵ֤י הָרָעָב֙ לָב֔וֹא כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֣ר יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיְהִ֤י רָעָב֙ בְּכׇל־הָ֣אֲרָצ֔וֹת וּבְכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם הָ֥יָה לָֽחֶם׃
41.englishText: and the seven years of famine set in, just as Joseph had foretold. There was famine in all lands, but throughout the land of Egypt there was bread.
41.transliteration: vַtְּchִlֶּ֜ynָh shֶׁ֣bַa shְׁnֵ֤y hָrָaָb֙ lָb֔vֹa kַּaֲshֶׁ֖r aָmַ֣r yvֹsֵ֑ף vַyְhִ֤y rָaָb֙ bְּkׇl־hָ֣aֲrָts֔vֹt vּbְkׇl־aֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrַ֖yִם hָ֥yָh lָֽchֶם׃

41.hebrewText: וַתִּרְעַב֙ כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּצְעַ֥ק הָעָ֛ם אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לַלָּ֑חֶם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֤ה לְכׇל־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לְכ֣וּ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֲשֶׁר־יֹאמַ֥ר לָכֶ֖ם תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃
41.englishText: And when all the land of Egypt felt the hunger, the people cried out to Pharaoh for bread; and Pharaoh said to all the Egyptians, “Go to Joseph; whatever he tells you, you shall do.”—
41.transliteration: vַtִּrְaַb֙ kׇּl־aֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם vַyִּtsְaַ֥k hָaָ֛ם aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֖h lַlָּ֑chֶם vַyֹּ֨amֶr pַּrְaֹ֤h lְkׇl־mִtsְrַ֙yִם֙ lְk֣vּ aֶl־yvֹsֵ֔ף aֲshֶׁr־yֹamַ֥r lָkֶ֖ם tַּaֲshֽׂvּ׃

41.hebrewText: וְהָרָעָ֣ב הָיָ֔ה עַ֖ל כׇּל־פְּנֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּפְתַּ֨ח יוֹסֵ֜ף אֶֽת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּהֶם֙ וַיִּשְׁבֹּ֣ר לְמִצְרַ֔יִם וַיֶּחֱזַ֥ק הָֽרָעָ֖ב בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
41.englishText: Accordingly, when the famine became severe in the land of Egypt, Joseph laid open all that was within, and rationed out grain to the Egyptians. The famine, however, spread over the whole world.
41.transliteration: vְhָrָaָ֣b hָyָ֔h aַ֖l kׇּl־pְּnֵ֣y hָaָ֑rֶץ vַyִּpְtַּ֨ch yvֹsֵ֜ף aֶֽt־kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֤r bָּhֶם֙ vַyִּshְׁbֹּ֣r lְmִtsְrַ֔yִם vַyֶּchֱzַ֥k hָֽrָaָ֖b bְּaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

41.hebrewText: וְכׇל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ בָּ֣אוּ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה לִשְׁבֹּ֖ר אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף כִּֽי־חָזַ֥ק הָרָעָ֖ב בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
41.englishText: So all the world came to Joseph in Egypt to procure rations, for the famine had become severe throughout the world.
41.transliteration: vְkׇl־hָaָ֙rֶץ֙ bָּ֣avּ mִtsְrַ֔yְmָh lִshְׁbֹּ֖r aֶl־yvֹsֵ֑ף kִּֽy־chָzַ֥k hָrָaָ֖b bְּkׇl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

42.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣רְא יַעֲקֹ֔ב כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־שֶׁ֖בֶר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ לְבָנָ֔יו לָ֖מָּה תִּתְרָאֽוּ׃
42.englishText: When Jacob saw that there were food rations to be had in Egypt, he*he Lit. “Jacob.” said to his sons, “Why do you keep looking at one another?
42.transliteration: vַyַּ֣rְa yַaֲkֹ֔b kִּ֥y yֶshׁ־shֶׁ֖bֶr bְּmִtsְrָ֑yִם vַyֹּ֤amֶr yַaֲkֹb֙ lְbָnָ֔yv lָ֖mָּh tִּtְrָaֽvּ׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֣ה שָׁמַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־שֶׁ֖בֶר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם רְדוּ־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ וְשִׁבְרוּ־לָ֣נוּ מִשָּׁ֔ם וְנִחְיֶ֖ה וְלֹ֥א נָמֽוּת׃
42.englishText: Now I hear,” he went on, “that there are rations to be had in Egypt. Go down and procure rations for us there, that we may live and not die.”
42.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr hִnֵּ֣h shָׁmַ֔aְtִּy kִּ֥y yֶshׁ־shֶׁ֖bֶr bְּmִtsְrָ֑yִם rְdvּ־shָׁ֙mָּh֙ vְshִׁbְrvּ־lָ֣nvּ mִshָּׁ֔ם vְnִchְyֶ֖h vְlֹ֥a nָmֽvּt׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֵּרְד֥וּ אֲחֵֽי־יוֹסֵ֖ף עֲשָׂרָ֑ה לִשְׁבֹּ֥ר בָּ֖ר מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
42.englishText: So ten of Joseph’s brothers went down to get grain rations in Egypt;
42.transliteration: vַyֵּrְd֥vּ aֲchֵֽy־yvֹsֵ֖ף aֲshָׂrָ֑h lִshְׁbֹּ֥r bָּ֖r mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

42.hebrewText: וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִין֙ אֲחִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף לֹא־שָׁלַ֥ח יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־אֶחָ֑יו כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר פֶּן־יִקְרָאֶ֖נּוּ אָסֽוֹן׃
42.englishText: for Jacob did not send Joseph’s brother Benjamin with his brothers, since he feared that he might meet with disaster.
42.transliteration: vְaֶt־bִּnְyָmִyן֙ aֲchִ֣y yvֹsֵ֔ף lֹa־shָׁlַ֥ch yַaֲkֹ֖b aֶt־aֶchָ֑yv kִּ֣y aָmַ֔r pֶּן־yִkְrָaֶ֖nּvּ aָsֽvֹן׃

42.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִשְׁבֹּ֖ר בְּת֣וֹךְ הַבָּאִ֑ים כִּֽי־הָיָ֥ה הָרָעָ֖ב בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
42.englishText: Thus the sons of Israel were among those who came to procure rations, for the famine extended to the land of Canaan.
42.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֙avּ֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l lִshְׁbֹּ֖r bְּt֣vֹךְ hַbָּaִ֑yם kִּֽy־hָyָ֥h hָrָaָ֖b bְּaֶ֥rֶץ kְּnָֽaַן׃

42.hebrewText: וְיוֹסֵ֗ף ה֚וּא הַשַּׁלִּ֣יט עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ ה֥וּא הַמַּשְׁבִּ֖יר לְכׇל־עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֲחֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיִּשְׁתַּֽחֲווּ־ל֥וֹ אַפַּ֖יִם אָֽרְצָה׃
42.englishText: Now Joseph was the vizier of the land; it was he who dispensed rations to all the people of the land. And Joseph’s brothers came and bowed low to him, with their faces to the ground.
42.transliteration: vְyvֹsֵ֗ף h֚vּa hַshַּׁlִּ֣yt aַl־hָaָ֔rֶץ h֥vּa hַmַּshְׁbִּ֖yr lְkׇl־aַ֣ם hָaָ֑rֶץ vַyָּbֹ֙avּ֙ aֲchֵ֣y yvֹsֵ֔ף vַyִּshְׁtַּֽchֲvvּ־l֥vֹ aַpַּ֖yִם aָֽrְtsָh׃

42.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥רְא יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־אֶחָ֖יו וַיַּכִּרֵ֑ם וַיִּתְנַכֵּ֨ר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר אִתָּ֣ם קָשׁ֗וֹת וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֵאַ֣יִן בָּאתֶ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנַ֖עַן לִשְׁבׇּר־אֹֽכֶל׃
42.englishText: When Joseph saw his brothers, he recognized them; but he acted like a stranger toward them and spoke harshly to them. He asked them, “Where do you come from?” And they said, “From the land of Canaan, to procure food.”
42.transliteration: vַyַּ֥rְa yvֹsֵ֛ף aֶt־aֶchָ֖yv vַyַּkִּrֵ֑ם vַyִּtְnַkֵּ֨r aֲlֵyhֶ֜ם vַyְdַbֵּ֧r aִtָּ֣ם kָshׁ֗vֹt vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֲlֵhֶם֙ mֵaַ֣yִן bָּatֶ֔ם vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ mֵaֶ֥rֶץ kְּnַ֖aַן lִshְׁbׇּr־aֹֽkֶl׃

42.hebrewText: וַיַּכֵּ֥ר יוֹסֵ֖ף אֶת־אֶחָ֑יו וְהֵ֖ם לֹ֥א הִכִּרֻֽהוּ׃
42.englishText: For though Joseph recognized his brothers, they did not recognize him.
42.transliteration: vַyַּkֵּ֥r yvֹsֵ֖ף aֶt־aֶchָ֑yv vְhֵ֖ם lֹ֥a hִkִּrֻֽhvּ׃

42.hebrewText: וַיִּזְכֹּ֣ר יוֹסֵ֔ף אֵ֚ת הַחֲלֹמ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָלַ֖ם לָהֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מְרַגְּלִ֣ים אַתֶּ֔ם לִרְא֛וֹת אֶת־עֶרְוַ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּאתֶֽם׃
42.englishText: Recalling the dreams that he had dreamed about them, Joseph said to them, “You are spies, you have come to see the land in its nakedness.”
42.transliteration: vַyִּzְkֹּ֣r yvֹsֵ֔ף aֵ֚t hַchֲlֹm֔vֹt aֲshֶׁ֥r chָlַ֖ם lָhֶ֑ם vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֲlֵhֶם֙ mְrַgְּlִ֣yם aַtֶּ֔ם lִrְa֛vֹt aֶt־aֶrְvַ֥t hָaָ֖rֶץ bָּatֶֽם׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו לֹ֣א אֲדֹנִ֑י וַעֲבָדֶ֥יךָ בָּ֖אוּ לִשְׁבׇּר־אֹֽכֶל׃
42.englishText: But they said to him, “No, my lord! Truly, your servants have come to procure food.
42.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֥vּ aֵlָ֖yv lֹ֣a aֲdֹnִ֑y vַaֲbָdֶ֥yךָ bָּ֖avּ lִshְׁbׇּr־aֹֽkֶl׃

42.hebrewText: כֻּלָּ֕נוּ בְּנֵ֥י אִישׁ־אֶחָ֖ד נָ֑חְנוּ כֵּנִ֣ים אֲנַ֔חְנוּ לֹא־הָי֥וּ עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ מְרַגְּלִֽים׃
42.englishText: We are all of us sons of the same man; we are being honest; your servants have never been spies!”
42.transliteration: kֻּlָּ֕nvּ bְּnֵ֥y aִyshׁ־aֶchָ֖d nָ֑chְnvּ kֵּnִ֣yם aֲnַ֔chְnvּ lֹa־hָy֥vּ aֲbָdֶ֖yךָ mְrַgְּlִֽyם׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם לֹ֕א כִּֽי־עֶרְוַ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּאתֶ֥ם לִרְאֽוֹת׃
42.englishText: And he said to them, “No, you have come to see the land in its nakedness!”
42.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr aֲlֵhֶ֑ם lֹ֕a kִּֽy־aֶrְvַ֥t hָaָ֖rֶץ bָּatֶ֥ם lִrְaֽvֹt׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂר֩ עֲבָדֶ֨יךָ אַחִ֧ים <small>׀</small> אֲנַ֛חְנוּ בְּנֵ֥י אִישׁ־אֶחָ֖ד בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְהִנֵּ֨ה הַקָּטֹ֤ן אֶת־אָבִ֙ינוּ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם וְהָאֶחָ֖ד אֵינֶֽנּוּ׃
42.englishText: And they replied, “We your servants were twelve brothers, sons of a certain man in the land of Canaan; the youngest, however, is now with our father, and one is no more.”
42.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֗vּ shְׁnֵ֣yם aָshָׂr֩ aֲbָdֶ֨yךָ aַchִ֧yם <small>׀</small> aֲnַ֛chְnvּ bְּnֵ֥y aִyshׁ־aֶchָ֖d bְּaֶ֣rֶץ kְּnָ֑aַן vְhִnֵּ֨h hַkָּtֹ֤ן aֶt־aָbִ֙ynvּ֙ hַyּ֔vֹם vְhָaֶchָ֖d aֵynֶֽnּvּ׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֖ם יוֹסֵ֑ף ה֗וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבַּ֧רְתִּי אֲלֵכֶ֛ם לֵאמֹ֖ר מְרַגְּלִ֥ים אַתֶּֽם׃
42.englishText: But Joseph said to them, “It is just as I have told you: You are spies!
42.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֲlֵhֶ֖ם yvֹsֵ֑ף h֗vּa aֲshֶׁ֨r dִּbַּ֧rְtִּy aֲlֵkֶ֛ם lֵamֹ֖r mְrַgְּlִ֥yם aַtֶּֽם׃

42.hebrewText: בְּזֹ֖את תִּבָּחֵ֑נוּ חֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ אִם־תֵּצְא֣וּ מִזֶּ֔ה כִּ֧י אִם־בְּב֛וֹא אֲחִיכֶ֥ם הַקָּטֹ֖ן הֵֽנָּה׃
42.englishText: By this you shall be put to the test: unless your youngest brother comes here, by Pharaoh, you shall not depart from this place!
42.transliteration: bְּzֹ֖at tִּbָּchֵ֑nvּ chֵ֤y pַrְaֹh֙ aִם־tֵּtsְa֣vּ mִzֶּ֔h kִּ֧y aִם־bְּb֛vֹa aֲchִykֶ֥ם hַkָּtֹ֖ן hֵֽnָּh׃

42.hebrewText: שִׁלְח֨וּ מִכֶּ֣ם אֶחָד֮ וְיִקַּ֣ח אֶת־אֲחִיכֶם֒ וְאַתֶּם֙ הֵאָ֣סְר֔וּ וְיִבָּֽחֲנוּ֙ דִּבְרֵיכֶ֔ם הַֽאֱמֶ֖ת אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְאִם־לֹ֕א חֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה כִּ֥י מְרַגְּלִ֖ים אַתֶּֽם׃
42.englishText: Let one of you go and bring your brother, while the rest of you remain confined, that your words may be put to the test whether there is truth in you. Else, by Pharaoh, you are nothing but spies!”
42.transliteration: shִׁlְch֨vּ mִkֶּ֣ם aֶchָd֮ vְyִkַּ֣ch aֶt־aֲchִykֶם֒ vְaַtֶּם֙ hֵaָ֣sְr֔vּ vְyִbָּֽchֲnvּ֙ dִּbְrֵykֶ֔ם hַֽaֱmֶ֖t aִtְּkֶ֑ם vְaִם־lֹ֕a chֵ֣y pַrְaֹ֔h kִּ֥y mְrַgְּlִ֖yם aַtֶּֽם׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף אֹתָ֛ם אֶל־מִשְׁמָ֖ר שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִֽים׃
42.englishText: And he confined them in the guardhouse for three days.
42.transliteration: vַyֶּaֱsֹ֥ף aֹtָ֛ם aֶl־mִshְׁmָ֖r shְׁlֹ֥shֶׁt yָmִֽyם׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֤ם יוֹסֵף֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י זֹ֥את עֲשׂ֖וּ וִֽחְי֑וּ אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֲנִ֥י יָרֵֽא׃
42.englishText: On the third day Joseph said to them, “Do this and you shall live, for I fear God.
42.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֲlֵhֶ֤ם yvֹsֵף֙ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֔y zֹ֥at aֲshׂ֖vּ vִֽchְy֑vּ aֶt־hָaֱlֹhִ֖yם aֲnִ֥y yָrֵֽa׃

42.hebrewText: אִם־כֵּנִ֣ים אַתֶּ֔ם אֲחִיכֶ֣ם אֶחָ֔ד יֵאָסֵ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית מִשְׁמַרְכֶ֑ם וְאַתֶּם֙ לְכ֣וּ הָבִ֔יאוּ שֶׁ֖בֶר רַעֲב֥וֹן בָּתֵּיכֶֽם׃
42.englishText: If you are being honest, let one of your brothers be held in your place of detention, while the rest of you go and take home rations for your starving households;
42.transliteration: aִם־kֵּnִ֣yם aַtֶּ֔ם aֲchִykֶ֣ם aֶchָ֔d yֵaָsֵ֖r bְּbֵ֣yt mִshְׁmַrְkֶ֑ם vְaַtֶּם֙ lְk֣vּ hָbִ֔yavּ shֶׁ֖bֶr rַaֲb֥vֹן bָּtֵּykֶֽם׃

42.hebrewText: וְאֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֤ם הַקָּטֹן֙ תָּבִ֣יאוּ אֵלַ֔י וְיֵאָמְנ֥וּ דִבְרֵיכֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א תָמ֑וּתוּ וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵֽן׃
42.englishText: but you must bring me your youngest brother, that your words may be verified and that you may not die.” And they did accordingly.
42.transliteration: vְaֶt־aֲchִykֶ֤ם hַkָּtֹן֙ tָּbִ֣yavּ aֵlַ֔y vְyֵaָmְn֥vּ dִbְrֵykֶ֖ם vְlֹ֣a tָm֑vּtvּ vַyַּaֲshׂvּ־kֵֽן׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֗יו אֲבָל֮ אֲשֵׁמִ֣ים <small>׀</small> אֲנַ֘חְנוּ֮ עַל־אָחִ֒ינוּ֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר רָאִ֜ינוּ צָרַ֥ת נַפְשׁ֛וֹ בְּהִתְחַֽנְנ֥וֹ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ וְלֹ֣א שָׁמָ֑עְנוּ עַל־כֵּן֙ בָּ֣אָה אֵלֵ֔ינוּ הַצָּרָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
42.englishText: They said to one another, “Alas, we are being punished on account of our brother, because we looked on at his anguish, yet paid no heed as he pleaded with us. That is why this distress has come upon us.”
42.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֞vּ aִ֣yshׁ aֶl־aָchִ֗yv aֲbָl֮ aֲshֵׁmִ֣yם <small>׀</small> aֲnַ֘chְnvּ֮ aַl־aָchִ֒ynvּ֒ aֲshֶׁ֨r rָaִ֜ynvּ tsָrַ֥t nַpְshׁ֛vֹ bְּhִtְchַֽnְn֥vֹ aֵlֵ֖ynvּ vְlֹ֣a shָׁmָ֑aְnvּ aַl־kֵּן֙ bָּ֣aָh aֵlֵ֔ynvּ hַtsָּrָ֖h hַzֹּֽat׃

42.hebrewText: וַיַּ֩עַן֩ רְאוּבֵ֨ן אֹתָ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר הֲלוֹא֩ אָמַ֨רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֧ם <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֛ר אַל־תֶּחֶטְא֥וּ בַיֶּ֖לֶד וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֑ם וְגַם־דָּמ֖וֹ הִנֵּ֥ה נִדְרָֽשׁ׃
42.englishText: Then Reuben spoke up and said to them, “Did I not tell you, ‘Do no wrong to the boy’? But you paid no heed. Now comes the reckoning for his blood.”
42.transliteration: vַyַּ֩aַן֩ rְavּbֵ֨ן aֹtָ֜ם lֵamֹ֗r hֲlvֹa֩ aָmַ֨rְtִּy aֲlֵykֶ֧ם <small>׀</small> lֵamֹ֛r aַl־tֶּchֶtְa֥vּ bַyֶּ֖lֶd vְlֹ֣a shְׁmַaְtֶּ֑ם vְgַם־dָּm֖vֹ hִnֵּ֥h nִdְrָֽshׁ׃

42.hebrewText: וְהֵם֙ לֹ֣א יָֽדְע֔וּ כִּ֥י שֹׁמֵ֖עַ יוֹסֵ֑ף כִּ֥י הַמֵּלִ֖יץ בֵּינֹתָֽם׃
42.englishText: They did not know that Joseph understood, for there was an interpreter between him and them.
42.transliteration: vְhֵם֙ lֹ֣a yָֽdְa֔vּ kִּ֥y shֹׁmֵ֖aַ yvֹsֵ֑ף kִּ֥y hַmֵּlִ֖yץ bֵּynֹtָֽם׃

42.hebrewText: וַיִּסֹּ֥ב מֵֽעֲלֵיהֶ֖ם וַיֵּ֑בְךְּ וַיָּ֤שׇׁב אֲלֵהֶם֙ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֵֽאִתָּם֙ אֶת־שִׁמְע֔וֹן וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ר אֹת֖וֹ לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
42.englishText: He turned away from them and wept. But he came back to them and spoke to them; and he took Simeon from among them and had him bound before their eyes.
42.transliteration: vַyִּsֹּ֥b mֵֽaֲlֵyhֶ֖ם vַyֵּ֑bְךְּ vַyָּ֤shׇׁb aֲlֵhֶם֙ vַyְdַbֵּ֣r aֲlֵhֶ֔ם vַyִּkַּ֤ch mֵֽaִtָּם֙ aֶt־shִׁmְa֔vֹן vַyֶּaֱsֹ֥r aֹt֖vֹ lְaֵynֵyhֶֽם׃

42.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֣ו יוֹסֵ֗ף וַיְמַלְא֣וּ אֶת־כְּלֵיהֶם֮ בָּר֒ וּלְהָשִׁ֤יב כַּסְפֵּיהֶם֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־שַׂקּ֔וֹ וְלָתֵ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם צֵדָ֖ה לַדָּ֑רֶךְ וַיַּ֥עַשׂ לָהֶ֖ם כֵּֽן׃
42.englishText: Then Joseph gave orders to fill their bags with grain, return each one’s money to his sack, and give them provisions for the journey; and this was done for them.
42.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֣v yvֹsֵ֗ף vַyְmַlְa֣vּ aֶt־kְּlֵyhֶם֮ bָּr֒ vּlְhָshִׁ֤yb kַּsְpֵּyhֶם֙ aִ֣yshׁ aֶl־shַׂkּ֔vֹ vְlָtֵ֥t lָhֶ֛ם tsֵdָ֖h lַdָּ֑rֶךְ vַyַּ֥aַshׂ lָhֶ֖ם kֵּֽן׃

42.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ אֶת־שִׁבְרָ֖ם עַל־חֲמֹרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ מִשָּֽׁם׃
42.englishText: So they loaded their asses with the rations and departed from there.
42.transliteration: vַyִּshְׂa֥vּ aֶt־shִׁbְrָ֖ם aַl־chֲmֹrֵyhֶ֑ם vַyֵּlְk֖vּ mִshָּֽׁם׃

42.hebrewText: וַיִּפְתַּ֨ח הָאֶחָ֜ד אֶת־שַׂקּ֗וֹ לָתֵ֥ת מִסְפּ֛וֹא לַחֲמֹר֖וֹ בַּמָּל֑וֹן וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־כַּסְפּ֔וֹ וְהִנֵּה־ה֖וּא בְּפִ֥י אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
42.englishText: As one of them was opening his sack to give feed to his ass at the night encampment, he saw his money right there at the mouth of his bag.
42.transliteration: vַyִּpְtַּ֨ch hָaֶchָ֜d aֶt־shַׂkּ֗vֹ lָtֵ֥t mִsְpּ֛vֹa lַchֲmֹr֖vֹ bַּmָּl֑vֹן vַyַּrְa֙ aֶt־kַּsְpּ֔vֹ vְhִnֵּh־h֖vּa bְּpִ֥y aַmְtַּchְtּֽvֹ׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ הוּשַׁ֣ב כַּסְפִּ֔י וְגַ֖ם הִנֵּ֣ה בְאַמְתַּחְתִּ֑י וַיֵּצֵ֣א לִבָּ֗ם וַיֶּֽחֶרְד֞וּ אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־אָחִיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מַה־זֹּ֛את עָשָׂ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים לָֽנוּ׃
42.englishText: And he said to his brothers, “My money has been returned! It is here in my bag!” Their hearts sank; and, trembling, they turned to one another, saying, “What is this that God has done to us?”
42.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֶl־aֶchָyv֙ hvּshַׁ֣b kַּsְpִּ֔y vְgַ֖ם hִnֵּ֣h bְaַmְtַּchְtִּ֑y vַyֵּtsֵ֣a lִbָּ֗ם vַyֶּֽchֶrְd֞vּ aִ֤yshׁ aֶl־aָchִyv֙ lֵamֹ֔r mַh־zֹּ֛at aָshָׂ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם lָֽnvּ׃

42.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֛אוּ אֶל־יַעֲקֹ֥ב אֲבִיהֶ֖ם אַ֣רְצָה כְּנָ֑עַן וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ ל֔וֹ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הַקֹּרֹ֥ת אֹתָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
42.englishText: When they came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan, they told him all that had befallen them, saying,
42.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֛avּ aֶl־yַaֲkֹ֥b aֲbִyhֶ֖ם aַ֣rְtsָh kְּnָ֑aַן vַyַּgִּ֣ydvּ l֔vֹ aֵ֛t kׇּl־hַkֹּrֹ֥t aֹtָ֖ם lֵamֹֽr׃

42.hebrewText: דִּ֠בֶּ֠ר הָאִ֨ישׁ אֲדֹנֵ֥י הָאָ֛רֶץ אִתָּ֖נוּ קָשׁ֑וֹת וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֹתָ֔נוּ כִּֽמְרַגְּלִ֖ים אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
42.englishText: “The man*The man More precisely, “the participant [whose involvement defines the depicted situation].” See the Dictionary under ’ish. who is lord of the land spoke harshly to us and accused us of spying on the land.
42.transliteration: dִּ֠bֶּ֠r hָaִ֨yshׁ aֲdֹnֵ֥y hָaָ֛rֶץ aִtָּ֖nvּ kָshׁ֑vֹt vַyִּtֵּ֣ן aֹtָ֔nvּ kִּֽmְrַgְּlִ֖yם aֶt־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

42.hebrewText: וַנֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו כֵּנִ֣ים אֲנָ֑חְנוּ לֹ֥א הָיִ֖ינוּ מְרַגְּלִֽים׃
42.englishText: We said to him, ‘We are being honest; we have never been spies!
42.transliteration: vַnֹּ֥amֶr aֵlָ֖yv kֵּnִ֣yם aֲnָ֑chְnvּ lֹ֥a hָyִ֖ynvּ mְrַgְּlִֽyם׃

42.hebrewText: שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֲנַ֛חְנוּ אַחִ֖ים בְּנֵ֣י אָבִ֑ינוּ הָאֶחָ֣ד אֵינֶ֔נּוּ וְהַקָּטֹ֥ן הַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־אָבִ֖ינוּ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
42.englishText: There were twelve of us brothers, sons by the same father; but one is no more, and the youngest is now with our father in the land of Canaan.’
42.transliteration: shְׁnֵyם־aָshָׂ֥r aֲnַ֛chְnvּ aַchִ֖yם bְּnֵ֣y aָbִ֑ynvּ hָaֶchָ֣d aֵynֶ֔nּvּ vְhַkָּtֹ֥ן hַyּ֛vֹם aֶt־aָbִ֖ynvּ bְּaֶ֥rֶץ kְּnָֽaַן׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֵ֗ינוּ הָאִישׁ֙ אֲדֹנֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ בְּזֹ֣את אֵדַ֔ע כִּ֥י כֵנִ֖ים אַתֶּ֑ם אֲחִיכֶ֤ם הָֽאֶחָד֙ הַנִּ֣יחוּ אִתִּ֔י וְאֶת־רַעֲב֥וֹן בָּתֵּיכֶ֖ם קְח֥וּ וָלֵֽכוּ׃
42.englishText: But the man—who is lord of the land—said to us, ‘By this I shall know that you are being honest: leave one of your brothers with me, and take something for your starving households and be off.
42.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֵlֵ֗ynvּ hָaִyshׁ֙ aֲdֹnֵ֣y hָaָ֔rֶץ bְּzֹ֣at aֵdַ֔a kִּ֥y kֵnִ֖yם aַtֶּ֑ם aֲchִykֶ֤ם hָֽaֶchָd֙ hַnִּ֣ychvּ aִtִּ֔y vְaֶt־rַaֲb֥vֹן bָּtֵּykֶ֖ם kְch֥vּ vָlֵֽkvּ׃

42.hebrewText: וְ֠הָבִ֠יאוּ אֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֣ם הַקָּטֹן֮ אֵלַי֒ וְאֵֽדְעָ֗ה כִּ֣י לֹ֤א מְרַגְּלִים֙ אַתֶּ֔ם כִּ֥י כֵנִ֖ים אַתֶּ֑ם אֶת־אֲחִיכֶם֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן לָכֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ תִּסְחָֽרוּ׃
42.englishText: And bring your youngest brother to me, that I may know that you are not spies, that you are being honest. I will then restore your brother to you, and you shall be free to move about in the land.’”
42.transliteration: vְ֠hָbִ֠yavּ aֶt־aֲchִykֶ֣ם hַkָּtֹן֮ aֵlַy֒ vְaֵֽdְaָ֗h kִּ֣y lֹ֤a mְrַgְּlִyם֙ aַtֶּ֔ם kִּ֥y kֵnִ֖yם aַtֶּ֑ם aֶt־aֲchִykֶם֙ aֶtֵּ֣ן lָkֶ֔ם vְaֶt־hָaָ֖rֶץ tִּsְchָֽrvּ׃

42.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י הֵ֚ם מְרִיקִ֣ים שַׂקֵּיהֶ֔ם וְהִנֵּה־אִ֥ישׁ צְרוֹר־כַּסְפּ֖וֹ בְּשַׂקּ֑וֹ וַיִּרְא֞וּ אֶת־צְרֹר֧וֹת כַּסְפֵּיהֶ֛ם הֵ֥מָּה וַאֲבִיהֶ֖ם וַיִּירָֽאוּ׃
42.englishText: As they were emptying their sacks, there, in each one’s sack, was his money-bag! When they and their father saw their money-bags, they were dismayed.
42.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y hֵ֚ם mְrִykִ֣yם shַׂkֵּyhֶ֔ם vְhִnֵּh־aִ֥yshׁ tsְrvֹr־kַּsְpּ֖vֹ bְּshַׂkּ֑vֹ vַyִּrְa֞vּ aֶt־tsְrֹr֧vֹt kַּsְpֵּyhֶ֛ם hֵ֥mָּh vַaֲbִyhֶ֖ם vַyִּyrָֽavּ׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ יַעֲקֹ֣ב אֲבִיהֶ֔ם אֹתִ֖י שִׁכַּלְתֶּ֑ם יוֹסֵ֤ף אֵינֶ֙נּוּ֙ וְשִׁמְע֣וֹן אֵינֶ֔נּוּ וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֣ן תִּקָּ֔חוּ עָלַ֖י הָי֥וּ כֻלָּֽנָה׃
42.englishText: Their father Jacob said to them, “It is always me that you bereave: Joseph is no more and Simeon is no more, and now you would take away Benjamin. These things always happen to me!”
42.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֲlֵhֶם֙ yַaֲkֹ֣b aֲbִyhֶ֔ם aֹtִ֖y shִׁkַּlְtֶּ֑ם yvֹsֵ֤ף aֵynֶ֙nּvּ֙ vְshִׁmְa֣vֹן aֵynֶ֔nּvּ vְaֶt־bִּnְyָmִ֣ן tִּkָּ֔chvּ aָlַ֖y hָy֥vּ kֻlָּֽnָh׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר רְאוּבֵן֙ אֶל־אָבִ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר אֶת־שְׁנֵ֤י בָנַי֙ תָּמִ֔ית אִם־לֹ֥א אֲבִיאֶ֖נּוּ אֵלֶ֑יךָ תְּנָ֤ה אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־יָדִ֔י וַאֲנִ֖י אֲשִׁיבֶ֥נּוּ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
42.englishText: Then Reuben said to his father, “You may kill my two sons if I do not bring him back to you. Put him in my care, and I will return him to you.”
42.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr rְavּbֵן֙ aֶl־aָbִ֣yv lֵamֹ֔r aֶt־shְׁnֵ֤y bָnַy֙ tָּmִ֔yt aִם־lֹ֥a aֲbִyaֶ֖nּvּ aֵlֶ֑yךָ tְּnָ֤h aֹtvֹ֙ aַl־yָdִ֔y vַaֲnִ֖y aֲshִׁybֶ֥nּvּ aֵlֶֽyךָ׃

42.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹֽא־יֵרֵ֥ד בְּנִ֖י עִמָּכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אָחִ֨יו מֵ֜ת וְה֧וּא לְבַדּ֣וֹ נִשְׁאָ֗ר וּקְרָאָ֤הוּ אָסוֹן֙ בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּֽלְכוּ־בָ֔הּ וְהוֹרַדְתֶּ֧ם אֶת־שֵׂיבָתִ֛י בְּיָג֖וֹן שְׁאֽוֹלָה׃
42.englishText: But he said, “My son must not go down with you, for his brother is dead and he alone is left. If he meets with disaster on the journey you are taking, you will send my white head down to Sheol in grief.”
42.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr lֹֽa־yֵrֵ֥d bְּnִ֖y aִmָּkֶ֑ם kִּֽy־aָchִ֨yv mֵ֜t vְh֧vּa lְbַdּ֣vֹ nִshְׁaָ֗r vּkְrָaָ֤hvּ aָsvֹן֙ bַּdֶּ֙rֶךְ֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tֵּֽlְkvּ־bָ֔hּ vְhvֹrַdְtֶּ֧ם aֶt־shֵׂybָtִ֛y bְּyָg֖vֹן shְׁaֽvֹlָh׃

43.englishText: But the famine in the land was severe.

43.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר כִּלּוּ֙ לֶאֱכֹ֣ל אֶת־הַשֶּׁ֔בֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵבִ֖יאוּ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ אֲבִיהֶ֔ם שֻׁ֖בוּ שִׁבְרוּ־לָ֥נוּ מְעַט־אֹֽכֶל׃
43.englishText: And when they had eaten up the rations which they had brought from Egypt, their father said to them, “Go again and procure some food for us.”
43.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y kַּaֲshֶׁ֤r kִּlּvּ֙ lֶaֱkֹ֣l aֶt־hַshֶּׁ֔bֶr aֲshֶׁ֥r hֵbִ֖yavּ mִmִּtsְrָ֑yִם vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֲlֵyhֶם֙ aֲbִyhֶ֔ם shֻׁ֖bvּ shִׁbְrvּ־lָ֥nvּ mְaַt־aֹֽkֶl׃

43.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלָ֛יו יְהוּדָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הָעֵ֣ד הֵעִד֩ בָּ֨נוּ הָאִ֤ישׁ לֵאמֹר֙ לֹֽא־תִרְא֣וּ פָנַ֔י בִּלְתִּ֖י אֲחִיכֶ֥ם אִתְּכֶֽם׃
43.englishText: But Judah said to him, “The man*See note at 42.30. warned us, ‘Do not let me see your faces*Do not let me see your faces Lit. “Do not see my face.” unless your brother is with you.’
43.transliteration: vַyֹּ֧amֶr aֵlָ֛yv yְhvּdָ֖h lֵamֹ֑r hָaֵ֣d hֵaִd֩ bָּ֨nvּ hָaִ֤yshׁ lֵamֹr֙ lֹֽa־tִrְa֣vּ pָnַ֔y bִּlְtִּ֖y aֲchִykֶ֥ם aִtְּkֶֽם׃

43.hebrewText: אִם־יֶשְׁךָ֛ מְשַׁלֵּ֥חַ אֶת־אָחִ֖ינוּ אִתָּ֑נוּ נֵרְדָ֕ה וְנִשְׁבְּרָ֥ה לְךָ֖ אֹֽכֶל׃
43.englishText: If you will let our brother go with us, we will go down and procure food for you;
43.transliteration: aִם־yֶshְׁךָ֛ mְshַׁlֵּ֥chַ aֶt־aָchִ֖ynvּ aִtָּ֑nvּ nֵrְdָ֕h vְnִshְׁbְּrָ֥h lְךָ֖ aֹֽkֶl׃

43.hebrewText: וְאִם־אֵינְךָ֥ מְשַׁלֵּ֖חַ לֹ֣א נֵרֵ֑ד כִּֽי־הָאִ֞ישׁ אָמַ֤ר אֵלֵ֙ינוּ֙ לֹֽא־תִרְא֣וּ פָנַ֔י בִּלְתִּ֖י אֲחִיכֶ֥ם אִתְּכֶֽם׃
43.englishText: but if you will not let him go, we will not go down, for that man said to us, ‘Do not let me see your faces*Do not let me see your faces See note at v. 3. unless your brother is with you.’”
43.transliteration: vְaִם־aֵynְךָ֥ mְshַׁlֵּ֖chַ lֹ֣a nֵrֵ֑d kִּֽy־hָaִ֞yshׁ aָmַ֤r aֵlֵ֙ynvּ֙ lֹֽa־tִrְa֣vּ pָnַ֔y bִּlְtִּ֖y aֲchִykֶ֥ם aִtְּkֶֽם׃

43.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לָמָ֥ה הֲרֵעֹתֶ֖ם לִ֑י לְהַגִּ֣יד לָאִ֔ישׁ הַע֥וֹד לָכֶ֖ם אָֽח׃
43.englishText: And Israel said, “Why did you serve me so ill as to tell the man that you had another brother?”
43.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l lָmָ֥h hֲrֵaֹtֶ֖ם lִ֑y lְhַgִּ֣yd lָaִ֔yshׁ hַa֥vֹd lָkֶ֖ם aָֽch׃

43.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֡וּ שָׁא֣וֹל שָֽׁאַל־הָ֠אִ֠ישׁ לָ֣נוּ וּלְמֽוֹלַדְתֵּ֜נוּ לֵאמֹ֗ר הַע֨וֹד אֲבִיכֶ֥ם חַי֙ הֲיֵ֣שׁ לָכֶ֣ם אָ֔ח וַנַּ֨גֶּד־ל֔וֹ עַל־פִּ֖י הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה הֲיָד֣וֹעַ נֵדַ֔ע כִּ֣י יֹאמַ֔ר הוֹרִ֖ידוּ אֶת־אֲחִיכֶֽם׃
43.englishText: They replied, “But the man kept asking about us and our family, saying, ‘Is your father still living? Have you another brother?’ And we answered him accordingly. How were we to know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother here’?”
43.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֡vּ shָׁa֣vֹl shָֽׁaַl־hָ֠aִ֠yshׁ lָ֣nvּ vּlְmֽvֹlַdְtֵּ֜nvּ lֵamֹ֗r hַa֨vֹd aֲbִykֶ֥ם chַy֙ hֲyֵ֣shׁ lָkֶ֣ם aָ֔ch vַnַּ֨gֶּd־l֔vֹ aַl־pִּ֖y hַdְּbָrִ֣yם hָaֵ֑lֶּh hֲyָd֣vֹaַ nֵdַ֔a kִּ֣y yֹamַ֔r hvֹrִ֖ydvּ aֶt־aֲchִykֶֽם׃

43.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוּדָ֜ה אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל אָבִ֗יו שִׁלְחָ֥ה הַנַּ֛עַר אִתִּ֖י וְנָק֣וּמָה וְנֵלֵ֑כָה וְנִֽחְיֶה֙ וְלֹ֣א נָמ֔וּת גַּם־אֲנַ֥חְנוּ גַם־אַתָּ֖ה גַּם־טַפֵּֽנוּ׃
43.englishText: Then Judah said to his father Israel, “Send the boy in my care, and let us be on our way, that we may live and not die—you and we and our children.
43.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhvּdָ֜h aֶl־yִshְׂrָaֵ֣l aָbִ֗yv shִׁlְchָ֥h hַnַּ֛aַr aִtִּ֖y vְnָk֣vּmָh vְnֵlֵ֑kָh vְnִֽchְyֶh֙ vְlֹ֣a nָm֔vּt gַּם־aֲnַ֥chְnvּ gַם־aַtָּ֖h gַּם־tַpֵּֽnvּ׃

43.hebrewText: אָֽנֹכִי֙ אֶֽעֶרְבֶ֔נּוּ מִיָּדִ֖י תְּבַקְשֶׁ֑נּוּ אִם־לֹ֨א הֲבִיאֹתִ֤יו אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ וְהִצַּגְתִּ֣יו לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְחָטָ֥אתִֽי לְךָ֖ כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
43.englishText: I myself will be surety for him; you may hold me responsible: if I do not bring him back to you and set him before you, I shall stand guilty before you forever.
43.transliteration: aָֽnֹkִy֙ aֶֽaֶrְbֶ֔nּvּ mִyָּdִ֖y tְּbַkְshֶׁ֑nּvּ aִם־lֹ֨a hֲbִyaֹtִ֤yv aֵlֶ֙yךָ֙ vְhִtsַּgְtִּ֣yv lְpָnֶ֔yךָ vְchָtָ֥atִֽy lְךָ֖ kׇּl־hַyָּmִֽyם׃

43.hebrewText: כִּ֖י לוּלֵ֣א הִתְמַהְמָ֑הְנוּ כִּֽי־עַתָּ֥ה שַׁ֖בְנוּ זֶ֥ה פַעֲמָֽיִם׃
43.englishText: For we could have been there and back twice if we had not dawdled.”
43.transliteration: kִּ֖y lvּlֵ֣a hִtְmַhְmָ֑hְnvּ kִּֽy־aַtָּ֥h shַׁ֖bְnvּ zֶ֥h pַaֲmָֽyִם׃

43.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל אֲבִיהֶ֗ם אִם־כֵּ֣ן <small>׀</small> אֵפוֹא֮ זֹ֣את עֲשׂוּ֒ קְח֞וּ מִזִּמְרַ֤ת הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ בִּכְלֵיכֶ֔ם וְהוֹרִ֥ידוּ לָאִ֖ישׁ מִנְחָ֑ה מְעַ֤ט צֳרִי֙ וּמְעַ֣ט דְּבַ֔שׁ נְכֹ֣את וָלֹ֔ט בׇּטְנִ֖ים וּשְׁקֵדִֽים׃
43.englishText: Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, do this: take some of the choice products of the land in your baggage, and carry them down as a gift for the man—some balm and some honey, gum, ladanum, pistachio nuts, and almonds.
43.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֲlֵhֶ֜ם yִshְׂrָaֵ֣l aֲbִyhֶ֗ם aִם־kֵּ֣ן <small>׀</small> aֵpvֹa֮ zֹ֣at aֲshׂvּ֒ kְch֞vּ mִzִּmְrַ֤t hָaָ֙rֶץ֙ bִּkְlֵykֶ֔ם vְhvֹrִ֥ydvּ lָaִ֖yshׁ mִnְchָ֑h mְaַ֤t tsֳrִy֙ vּmְaַ֣t dְּbַ֔shׁ nְkֹ֣at vָlֹ֔t bׇּtְnִ֖yם vּshְׁkֵdִֽyם׃

43.hebrewText: וְכֶ֥סֶף מִשְׁנֶ֖ה קְח֣וּ בְיֶדְכֶ֑ם וְאֶת־הַכֶּ֜סֶף הַמּוּשָׁ֨ב בְּפִ֤י אַמְתְּחֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ תָּשִׁ֣יבוּ בְיֶדְכֶ֔ם אוּלַ֥י מִשְׁגֶּ֖ה הֽוּא׃
43.englishText: And take with you double the money, carrying back with you the money that was replaced in the mouths of your bags; perhaps it was a mistake.
43.transliteration: vְkֶ֥sֶף mִshְׁnֶ֖h kְch֣vּ bְyֶdְkֶ֑ם vְaֶt־hַkֶּ֜sֶף hַmּvּshָׁ֨b bְּpִ֤y aַmְtְּchֹֽtֵykֶם֙ tָּshִׁ֣ybvּ bְyֶdְkֶ֔ם avּlַ֥y mִshְׁgֶּ֖h hֽvּa׃

43.hebrewText: וְאֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֖ם קָ֑חוּ וְק֖וּמוּ שׁ֥וּבוּ אֶל־הָאִֽישׁ׃
43.englishText: Take your brother too; and go back at once to the man.
43.transliteration: vְaֶt־aֲchִykֶ֖ם kָ֑chvּ vְk֖vּmvּ shׁ֥vּbvּ aֶl־hָaִֽyshׁ׃

43.hebrewText: וְאֵ֣ל שַׁדַּ֗י יִתֵּ֨ן לָכֶ֤ם רַחֲמִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָאִ֔ישׁ וְשִׁלַּ֥ח לָכֶ֛ם אֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֥ם אַחֵ֖ר וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֑ין וַאֲנִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁכֹ֖לְתִּי שָׁכָֽלְתִּי׃
43.englishText: And may El Shaddai dispose the man to mercy toward you, that he may release to you your other brother, as well as Benjamin. As for me, if I am to be bereaved, I shall be bereaved.”
43.transliteration: vְaֵ֣l shַׁdַּ֗y yִtֵּ֨ן lָkֶ֤ם rַchֲmִyם֙ lִpְnֵ֣y hָaִ֔yshׁ vְshִׁlַּ֥ch lָkֶ֛ם aֶt־aֲchִykֶ֥ם aַchֵ֖r vְaֶt־bִּnְyָmִ֑yן vַaֲnִ֕y kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r shָׁkֹ֖lְtִּy shָׁkָֽlְtִּy׃

43.hebrewText: וַיִּקְח֤וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את וּמִשְׁנֶה־כֶּ֛סֶף לָקְח֥וּ בְיָדָ֖ם וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֑ן וַיָּקֻ֙מוּ֙ וַיֵּרְד֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיַּֽעַמְד֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י יוֹסֵֽף׃
43.englishText: So the agents*agents More precisely, “participants whose involvement defines the depicted situation”—i.e., the sons who have been delegated as their father’s agents. See the Dictionary under ’ish; Agent. took that gift, and they took with them double the money, as well as Benjamin. They made their way down to Egypt, where they presented themselves to Joseph.
43.transliteration: vַyִּkְch֤vּ hָֽaֲnָshִׁyם֙ aֶt־hַmִּnְchָ֣h hַzֹּ֔at vּmִshְׁnֶh־kֶּ֛sֶף lָkְch֥vּ bְyָdָ֖ם vְaֶt־bִּnְyָmִ֑ן vַyָּkֻ֙mvּ֙ vַyֵּrְd֣vּ mִtsְrַ֔yִם vַyַּֽaַmְd֖vּ lִpְnֵ֥y yvֹsֵֽף׃

43.hebrewText: וַיַּ֨רְא יוֹסֵ֣ף אִתָּם֮ אֶת־בִּנְיָמִין֒ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לַֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּית֔וֹ הָבֵ֥א אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים הַבָּ֑יְתָה וּטְבֹ֤חַ טֶ֙בַח֙ וְהָכֵ֔ן כִּ֥י אִתִּ֛י יֹאכְל֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים בַּֽצׇּהֳרָֽיִם׃
43.englishText: When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to his house steward, “Take those men*those men More precisely, “the [salient] participants.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. into the house; slaughter and prepare an animal, for those men will dine with me at noon.”
43.transliteration: vַyַּ֨rְa yvֹsֵ֣ף aִtָּם֮ aֶt־bִּnְyָmִyן֒ vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lַֽaֲshֶׁ֣r aַl־bֵּyt֔vֹ hָbֵ֥a aֶt־hָaֲnָshִׁ֖yם hַbָּ֑yְtָh vּtְbֹ֤chַ tֶ֙bַch֙ vְhָkֵ֔ן kִּ֥y aִtִּ֛y yֹakְl֥vּ hָaֲnָshִׁ֖yם bַּֽtsׇּhֳrָֽyִם׃

43.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ הָאִ֔ישׁ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֣ר יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיָּבֵ֥א הָאִ֛ישׁ אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים בֵּ֥יתָה יוֹסֵֽף׃
43.englishText: The man did as Joseph said, and he brought the men into Joseph’s house.
43.transliteration: vַyַּ֣aַshׂ hָaִ֔yshׁ kַּֽaֲshֶׁ֖r aָmַ֣r yvֹsֵ֑ף vַyָּbֵ֥a hָaִ֛yshׁ aֶt־hָaֲnָshִׁ֖yם bֵּ֥ytָh yvֹsֵֽף׃

43.hebrewText: וַיִּֽירְא֣וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֗ים כִּ֣י הֽוּבְאוּ֮ בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵף֒ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ עַל־דְּבַ֤ר הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ הַשָּׁ֤ב בְּאַמְתְּחֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ בַּתְּחִלָּ֔ה אֲנַ֖חְנוּ מֽוּבָאִ֑ים לְהִתְגֹּלֵ֤ל עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ וּלְהִתְנַפֵּ֣ל עָלֵ֔ינוּ וְלָקַ֧חַת אֹתָ֛נוּ לַעֲבָדִ֖ים וְאֶת־חֲמֹרֵֽינוּ׃
43.englishText: But the men were frightened at being brought into Joseph’s house. “It must be,” they thought, “because of the money replaced in our bags the first time that we have been brought inside, as a pretext to attack us and seize us as slaves, with our pack animals.”
43.transliteration: vַyִּֽyrְa֣vּ hָֽaֲnָshִׁ֗yם kִּ֣y hֽvּbְavּ֮ bֵּ֣yt yvֹsֵף֒ vַyֹּamְr֗vּ aַl־dְּbַ֤r hַkֶּ֙sֶף֙ hַshָּׁ֤b bְּaַmְtְּchֹtֵ֙ynvּ֙ bַּtְּchִlָּ֔h aֲnַ֖chְnvּ mֽvּbָaִ֑yם lְhִtְgֹּlֵ֤l aָlֵ֙ynvּ֙ vּlְhִtְnַpֵּ֣l aָlֵ֔ynvּ vְlָkַ֧chַt aֹtָ֛nvּ lַaֲbָdִ֖yם vְaֶt־chֲmֹrֵֽynvּ׃

43.hebrewText: וַֽיִּגְּשׁוּ֙ אֶל־הָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיְדַבְּר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו פֶּ֥תַח הַבָּֽיִת׃
43.englishText: So they went up to Joseph’s house steward and spoke to him at the entrance of the house.
43.transliteration: vַֽyִּgְּshׁvּ֙ aֶl־hָaִ֔yshׁ aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־bֵּ֣yt yvֹsֵ֑ף vַyְdַbְּr֥vּ aֵlָ֖yv pֶּ֥tַch hַbָּֽyִt׃

43.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִ֑י יָרֹ֥ד יָרַ֛דְנוּ בַּתְּחִלָּ֖ה לִשְׁבׇּר־אֹֽכֶל׃
43.englishText: “If you please, my lord,” they said, “we came down once before to procure food.
43.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֖vּ bִּ֣y aֲdֹnִ֑y yָrֹ֥d yָrַ֛dְnvּ bַּtְּchִlָּ֖h lִshְׁbׇּr־aֹֽkֶl׃

43.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֞י כִּי־בָ֣אנוּ אֶל־הַמָּל֗וֹן וַֽנִּפְתְּחָה֙ אֶת־אַמְתְּחֹתֵ֔ינוּ וְהִנֵּ֤ה כֶֽסֶף־אִישׁ֙ בְּפִ֣י אַמְתַּחְתּ֔וֹ כַּסְפֵּ֖נוּ בְּמִשְׁקָל֑וֹ וַנָּ֥שֶׁב אֹת֖וֹ בְּיָדֵֽנוּ׃
43.englishText: But when we arrived at the night encampment and opened our bags, there was each one’s money in the mouth of his bag, our money in full.*in full Lit. “by its weight.” So we have brought it back with us.
43.transliteration: vַyְhִ֞y kִּy־bָ֣anvּ aֶl־hַmָּl֗vֹן vַֽnִּpְtְּchָh֙ aֶt־aַmְtְּchֹtֵ֔ynvּ vְhִnֵּ֤h kֶֽsֶף־aִyshׁ֙ bְּpִ֣y aַmְtַּchְtּ֔vֹ kַּsְpֵּ֖nvּ bְּmִshְׁkָl֑vֹ vַnָּ֥shֶׁb aֹt֖vֹ bְּyָdֵֽnvּ׃

43.hebrewText: וְכֶ֧סֶף אַחֵ֛ר הוֹרַ֥דְנוּ בְיָדֵ֖נוּ לִשְׁבׇּר־אֹ֑כֶל לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְנוּ מִי־שָׂ֥ם כַּסְפֵּ֖נוּ בְּאַמְתְּחֹתֵֽינוּ׃
43.englishText: And we have brought down with us other money to procure food. We do not know who put the money in our bags.”
43.transliteration: vְkֶ֧sֶף aַchֵ֛r hvֹrַ֥dְnvּ bְyָdֵ֖nvּ lִshְׁbׇּr־aֹ֑kֶl lֹ֣a yָdַ֔aְnvּ mִy־shָׂ֥ם kַּsְpֵּ֖nvּ bְּaַmְtְּchֹtֵֽynvּ׃

43.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ שָׁל֨וֹם לָכֶ֜ם אַל־תִּירָ֗אוּ אֱלֹ֨הֵיכֶ֜ם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֤י אֲבִיכֶם֙ נָתַ֨ן לָכֶ֤ם מַטְמוֹן֙ בְּאַמְתְּחֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם כַּסְפְּכֶ֖ם בָּ֣א אֵלָ֑י וַיּוֹצֵ֥א אֲלֵהֶ֖ם אֶת־שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃
43.englishText: He replied, “All is well with you; do not be afraid. Your God, the God of your father’s [house], must have put treasure in your bags for you. I got your payment.” And he brought out Simeon to them.
43.transliteration: vַyֹּ֩amֶr֩ shָׁl֨vֹם lָkֶ֜ם aַl־tִּyrָ֗avּ aֱlֹ֨hֵykֶ֜ם vֵֽalֹhֵ֤y aֲbִykֶם֙ nָtַ֨ן lָkֶ֤ם mַtְmvֹן֙ bְּaַmְtְּchֹ֣tֵykֶ֔ם kַּsְpְּkֶ֖ם bָּ֣a aֵlָ֑y vַyּvֹtsֵ֥a aֲlֵhֶ֖ם aֶt־shִׁmְaֽvֹן׃

43.hebrewText: וַיָּבֵ֥א הָאִ֛ישׁ אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים בֵּ֣יתָה יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיִּתֶּן־מַ֙יִם֙ וַיִּרְחֲצ֣וּ רַגְלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּתֵּ֥ן מִסְפּ֖וֹא לַחֲמֹֽרֵיהֶֽם׃
43.englishText: Then the steward brought the men into Joseph’s house; he gave them water to bathe their feet, and he provided feed for their asses.
43.transliteration: vַyָּbֵ֥a hָaִ֛yshׁ aֶt־hָaֲnָshִׁ֖yם bֵּ֣ytָh yvֹsֵ֑ף vַyִּtֶּן־mַ֙yִם֙ vַyִּrְchֲts֣vּ rַgְlֵyhֶ֔ם vַyִּtֵּ֥ן mִsְpּ֖vֹa lַchֲmֹֽrֵyhֶֽם׃

43.hebrewText: וַיָּכִ֙ינוּ֙ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה עַד־בּ֥וֹא יוֹסֵ֖ף בַּֽצׇּהֳרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י שָֽׁמְע֔וּ כִּי־שָׁ֖ם יֹ֥אכְלוּ לָֽחֶם׃
43.englishText: They laid out their gifts to await Joseph’s arrival at noon, for they had heard that they were to dine there.
43.transliteration: vַyָּkִ֙ynvּ֙ aֶt־hַmִּnְchָ֔h aַd־bּ֥vֹa yvֹsֵ֖ף bַּֽtsׇּhֳrָ֑yִם kִּ֣y shָֽׁmְa֔vּ kִּy־shָׁ֖ם yֹ֥akְlvּ lָֽchֶם׃

43.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֤א יוֹסֵף֙ הַבַּ֔יְתָה וַיָּבִ֥יאּוּ ל֛וֹ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בְּיָדָ֖ם הַבָּ֑יְתָה וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲווּ־ל֖וֹ אָֽרְצָה׃
43.englishText: When Joseph came home, they presented to him the gifts that they had brought with them into the house, bowing low before him to the ground.
43.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֤a yvֹsֵף֙ hַbַּ֔yְtָh vַyָּbִ֥yaּvּ l֛vֹ aֶt־hַmִּnְchָ֥h aֲshֶׁr־bְּyָdָ֖ם hַbָּ֑yְtָh vַyִּshְׁtַּchֲvvּ־l֖vֹ aָֽrְtsָh׃

43.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁאַ֤ל לָהֶם֙ לְשָׁל֔וֹם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲשָׁל֛וֹם אֲבִיכֶ֥ם הַזָּקֵ֖ן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֑ם הַעוֹדֶ֖נּוּ חָֽי׃
43.englishText: He greeted them, and he said, “How is your aged father of whom you spoke? Is he still in good health?”
43.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁaַ֤l lָhֶם֙ lְshָׁl֔vֹם vַyֹּ֗amֶr hֲshָׁl֛vֹם aֲbִykֶ֥ם hַzָּkֵ֖ן aֲshֶׁ֣r aֲmַrְtֶּ֑ם hַavֹdֶ֖nּvּ chָֽy׃

43.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ שָׁל֛וֹם לְעַבְדְּךָ֥ לְאָבִ֖ינוּ עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ חָ֑י וַֽיִּקְּד֖וּ (וישתחו) [וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ]׃
43.englishText: They replied, “It is well with your servant our father; he is still in good health.” And they bowed and made obeisance.
43.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֗vּ shָׁl֛vֹם lְaַbְdְּךָ֥ lְaָbִ֖ynvּ avֹdֶ֣nּvּ chָ֑y vַֽyִּkְּd֖vּ (vyshtchv) [vַyִּֽshְׁtַּchֲvֽvּ]׃

43.hebrewText: וַיִּשָּׂ֣א עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּ֞רְא אֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֣ין אָחִיו֮ בֶּן־אִמּוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲזֶה֙ אֲחִיכֶ֣ם הַקָּטֹ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֵלָ֑י וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אֱלֹהִ֥ים יׇחְנְךָ֖ בְּנִֽי׃
43.englishText: Looking about, he saw his brother Benjamin, his mother’s son, and asked, “Is this your youngest brother of whom you spoke to me?” And he went on, “May God be gracious to you, my boy.”
43.transliteration: vַyִּshָּׂ֣a aֵynָ֗yv vַyַּ֞rְa aֶt־bִּnְyָmִ֣yן aָchִyv֮ bֶּן־aִmּvֹ֒ vַyֹּ֗amֶr hֲzֶh֙ aֲchִykֶ֣ם hַkָּtֹ֔ן aֲshֶׁ֥r aֲmַrְtֶּ֖ם aֵlָ֑y vַyֹּamַ֕r aֱlֹhִ֥yם yׇchְnְךָ֖ bְּnִֽy׃

43.hebrewText: וַיְמַהֵ֣ר יוֹסֵ֗ף כִּֽי־נִכְמְר֤וּ רַחֲמָיו֙ אֶל־אָחִ֔יו וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ לִבְכּ֑וֹת וַיָּבֹ֥א הַחַ֖דְרָה וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ שָֽׁמָּה׃
43.englishText: With that, Joseph hurried out, for he was overcome with feeling toward his brother and was on the verge of tears; he went into a room and wept there.
43.transliteration: vַyְmַhֵ֣r yvֹsֵ֗ף kִּֽy־nִkְmְr֤vּ rַchֲmָyv֙ aֶl־aָchִ֔yv vַyְbַkֵּ֖shׁ lִbְkּ֑vֹt vַyָּbֹ֥a hַchַ֖dְrָh vַyֵּ֥bְךְּ shָֽׁmָּh׃

43.hebrewText: וַיִּרְחַ֥ץ פָּנָ֖יו וַיֵּצֵ֑א וַיִּ֨תְאַפַּ֔ק וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שִׂ֥ימוּ לָֽחֶם׃
43.englishText: Then he washed his face, reappeared, and—now in control of himself—gave the order, “Serve the meal.”
43.transliteration: vַyִּrְchַ֥ץ pָּnָ֖yv vַyֵּtsֵ֑a vַyִּ֨tְaַpַּ֔k vַyֹּ֖amֶr shִׂ֥ymvּ lָֽchֶם׃

43.hebrewText: וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ ל֛וֹ לְבַדּ֖וֹ וְלָהֶ֣ם לְבַדָּ֑ם וְלַמִּצְרִ֞ים הָאֹכְלִ֤ים אִתּוֹ֙ לְבַדָּ֔ם כִּי֩ לֹ֨א יוּכְל֜וּן הַמִּצְרִ֗ים לֶאֱכֹ֤ל אֶת־הָֽעִבְרִים֙ לֶ֔חֶם כִּי־תוֹעֵבָ֥ה הִ֖וא לְמִצְרָֽיִם׃
43.englishText: They served him by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves; for the Egyptians could not dine with the Hebrews, since that would be abhorrent to the Egyptians.
43.transliteration: vַyָּshִׂ֥ymvּ l֛vֹ lְbַdּ֖vֹ vְlָhֶ֣ם lְbַdָּ֑ם vְlַmִּtsְrִ֞yם hָaֹkְlִ֤yם aִtּvֹ֙ lְbַdָּ֔ם kִּy֩ lֹ֨a yvּkְl֜vּן hַmִּtsְrִ֗yם lֶaֱkֹ֤l aֶt־hָֽaִbְrִyם֙ lֶ֔chֶם kִּy־tvֹaֵbָ֥h hִ֖va lְmִtsְrָֽyִם׃

43.hebrewText: וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ לְפָנָ֔יו הַבְּכֹר֙ כִּבְכֹ֣רָת֔וֹ וְהַצָּעִ֖יר כִּצְעִרָת֑וֹ וַיִּתְמְה֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים אִ֥ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
43.englishText: As they were seated by his direction, from the oldest in the order of his seniority to the youngest in the order of his youth, the men looked at one another in astonishment.
43.transliteration: vַyֵּshְׁb֣vּ lְpָnָ֔yv hַbְּkֹr֙ kִּbְkֹ֣rָt֔vֹ vְhַtsָּaִ֖yr kִּtsְaִrָt֑vֹ vַyִּtְmְh֥vּ hָaֲnָshִׁ֖yם aִ֥yshׁ aֶl־rֵaֵֽhvּ׃

43.hebrewText: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א מַשְׂאֹ֜ת מֵאֵ֣ת פָּנָיו֮ אֲלֵהֶם֒ וַתֵּ֜רֶב מַשְׂאַ֧ת בִּנְיָמִ֛ן מִמַּשְׂאֹ֥ת כֻּלָּ֖ם חָמֵ֣שׁ יָד֑וֹת וַיִּשְׁתּ֥וּ וַֽיִּשְׁכְּר֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
43.englishText: Portions were served them from his table; but Benjamin’s portion was several*several Lit. “five.” times that of anyone else. And they drank their fill with him.
43.transliteration: vַyִּshָּׂ֨a mַshְׂaֹ֜t mֵaֵ֣t pָּnָyv֮ aֲlֵhֶם֒ vַtֵּ֜rֶb mַshְׂaַ֧t bִּnְyָmִ֛ן mִmַּshְׂaֹ֥t kֻּlָּ֖ם chָmֵ֣shׁ yָd֑vֹt vַyִּshְׁtּ֥vּ vַֽyִּshְׁkְּr֖vּ aִmּֽvֹ׃

44.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֞ו אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּיתוֹ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ מַלֵּ֞א אֶת־אַמְתְּחֹ֤ת הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֹ֔כֶל כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יוּכְל֖וּן שְׂאֵ֑ת וְשִׂ֥ים כֶּֽסֶף־אִ֖ישׁ בְּפִ֥י אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
44.englishText: Then he instructed his house steward as follows, “Fill the men’s bags with food, as much as they can carry, and put each one’s money in the mouth of his bag.
44.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֞v aֶt־aֲshֶׁ֣r aַl־bֵּytvֹ֮ lֵamֹr֒ mַlֵּ֞a aֶt־aַmְtְּchֹ֤t hָֽaֲnָshִׁyם֙ aֹ֔kֶl kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r yvּkְl֖vּן shְׂaֵ֑t vְshִׂ֥yם kֶּֽsֶף־aִ֖yshׁ bְּpִ֥y aַmְtַּchְtּֽvֹ׃

44.hebrewText: וְאֶת־גְּבִיעִ֞י גְּבִ֣יעַ הַכֶּ֗סֶף תָּשִׂים֙ בְּפִי֙ אַמְתַּ֣חַת הַקָּטֹ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת כֶּ֣סֶף שִׁבְר֑וֹ וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כִּדְבַ֥ר יוֹסֵ֖ף אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃
44.englishText: Put my silver goblet in the mouth of the bag of the youngest one, together with his money for the rations.” And he did as Joseph told him.
44.transliteration: vְaֶt־gְּbִyaִ֞y gְּbִ֣yaַ hַkֶּ֗sֶף tָּshִׂyם֙ bְּpִy֙ aַmְtַּ֣chַt hַkָּtֹ֔ן vְaֵ֖t kֶּ֣sֶף shִׁbְr֑vֹ vַyַּ֕aַshׂ kִּdְbַ֥r yvֹsֵ֖ף aֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbֵּֽr׃

44.hebrewText: הַבֹּ֖קֶר א֑וֹר וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים שֻׁלְּח֔וּ הֵ֖מָּה וַחֲמֹרֵיהֶֽם׃
44.englishText: With the first light of morning, the men were sent off with their pack animals.
44.transliteration: hַbֹּ֖kֶr a֑vֹr vְhָaֲnָshִׁ֣yם shֻׁlְּch֔vּ hֵ֖mָּh vַchֲmֹrֵyhֶֽם׃

44.hebrewText: הֵ֠ם יָֽצְא֣וּ אֶת־הָעִיר֮ לֹ֣א הִרְחִ֒יקוּ֒ וְיוֹסֵ֤ף אָמַר֙ לַֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּית֔וֹ ק֥וּם רְדֹ֖ף אַחֲרֵ֣י הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֑ים וְהִשַּׂגְתָּם֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם לָ֛מָּה שִׁלַּמְתֶּ֥ם רָעָ֖ה תַּ֥חַת טוֹבָֽה׃
44.englishText: They had just left the city and had not gone far, when Joseph said to his house steward, “Up, go after those men! And when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why did you repay good with evil?
44.transliteration: hֵ֠ם yָֽtsְa֣vּ aֶt־hָaִyr֮ lֹ֣a hִrְchִ֒ykvּ֒ vְyvֹsֵ֤ף aָmַr֙ lַֽaֲshֶׁ֣r aַl־bֵּyt֔vֹ k֥vּם rְdֹ֖ף aַchֲrֵ֣y hָֽaֲnָshִׁ֑yם vְhִshַּׂgְtָּם֙ vְaָmַrְtָּ֣ aֲlֵhֶ֔ם lָ֛mָּh shִׁlַּmְtֶּ֥ם rָaָ֖h tַּ֥chַt tvֹbָֽh׃

44.hebrewText: הֲל֣וֹא זֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁתֶּ֤ה אֲדֹנִי֙ בּ֔וֹ וְה֕וּא נַחֵ֥שׁ יְנַחֵ֖שׁ בּ֑וֹ הֲרֵעֹתֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲשִׂיתֶֽם׃
44.englishText: It is the very one from which my master drinks and which he uses for divination. It was a wicked thing for you to do!’”
44.transliteration: hֲl֣vֹa zֶ֗h aֲshֶׁ֨r yִshְׁtֶּ֤h aֲdֹnִy֙ bּ֔vֹ vְh֕vּa nַchֵ֥shׁ yְnַchֵ֖shׁ bּ֑vֹ hֲrֵaֹtֶ֖ם aֲshֶׁ֥r aֲshִׂytֶֽם׃

44.hebrewText: וַֽיַּשִּׂגֵ֑ם וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
44.englishText: He overtook them and spoke those words to them.
44.transliteration: vַֽyַּshִּׂgֵ֑ם vַyְdַbֵּ֣r aֲlֵhֶ֔ם aֶt־hַdְּbָrִ֖yם hָaֵֽlֶּh׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו לָ֚מָּה יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲדֹנִ֔י כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה חָלִ֙ילָה֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ מֵעֲשׂ֖וֹת כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
44.englishText: And they said to him, “Why does my lord say such things? Far be it from your servants to do anything of the kind!
44.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֣vּ aֵlָ֔yv lָ֚mָּh yְdַbֵּ֣r aֲdֹnִ֔y kַּdְּbָrִ֖yם hָaֵ֑lֶּh chָlִ֙ylָh֙ lַaֲbָdֶ֔yךָ mֵaֲshׂ֖vֹt kַּdָּbָ֥r hַzֶּֽh׃

44.hebrewText: הֵ֣ן כֶּ֗סֶף אֲשֶׁ֤ר מָצָ֙אנוּ֙ בְּפִ֣י אַמְתְּחֹתֵ֔ינוּ הֱשִׁיבֹ֥נוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְאֵ֗יךְ נִגְנֹב֙ מִבֵּ֣ית אֲדֹנֶ֔יךָ כֶּ֖סֶף א֥וֹ זָהָֽב׃
44.englishText: Here we brought back to you from the land of Canaan the money that we found in the mouths of our bags. How then could we have stolen any silver or gold from your master’s house!
44.transliteration: hֵ֣ן kֶּ֗sֶף aֲshֶׁ֤r mָtsָ֙anvּ֙ bְּpִ֣y aַmְtְּchֹtֵ֔ynvּ hֱshִׁybֹ֥nvּ aֵlֶ֖yךָ mֵaֶ֣rֶץ kְּnָ֑aַן vְaֵ֗yךְ nִgְnֹb֙ mִbֵּ֣yt aֲdֹnֶ֔yךָ kֶּ֖sֶף a֥vֹ zָhָֽb׃

44.hebrewText: אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֥א אִתּ֛וֹ מֵעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ וָמֵ֑ת וְגַם־אֲנַ֕חְנוּ נִֽהְיֶ֥ה לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לַעֲבָדִֽים׃
44.englishText: Whichever of your servants it is found with shall die; the rest of us, moreover, shall become slaves to my lord.”
44.transliteration: aֲshֶׁ֨r yִmָּtsֵ֥a aִtּ֛vֹ mֵaֲbָdֶ֖yךָ vָmֵ֑t vְgַם־aֲnַ֕chְnvּ nִֽhְyֶ֥h lַֽadֹnִ֖y lַaֲbָdִֽyם׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר גַּם־עַתָּ֥ה כְדִבְרֵיכֶ֖ם כֶּן־ה֑וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֤א אִתּוֹ֙ יִהְיֶה־לִּ֣י עָ֔בֶד וְאַתֶּ֖ם תִּהְי֥וּ נְקִיִּֽם׃
44.englishText: He replied, “Although what you are proposing is right, only the one with whom it is found shall be my slave; but the rest of you shall go free.”
44.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr gַּם־aַtָּ֥h kְdִbְrֵykֶ֖ם kֶּן־h֑vּa aֲshֶׁ֨r yִmָּtsֵ֤a aִtּvֹ֙ yִhְyֶh־lִּ֣y aָ֔bֶd vְaַtֶּ֖ם tִּhְy֥vּ nְkִyִּֽם׃

44.hebrewText: וַֽיְמַהֲר֗וּ וַיּוֹרִ֛דוּ אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־אַמְתַּחְתּ֖וֹ אָ֑רְצָה וַֽיִּפְתְּח֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
44.englishText: So each one hastened to lower his bag to the ground, and each one opened his bag.
44.transliteration: vַֽyְmַhֲr֗vּ vַyּvֹrִ֛dvּ aִ֥yshׁ aֶt־aַmְtַּchְtּ֖vֹ aָ֑rְtsָh vַֽyִּpְtְּch֖vּ aִ֥yshׁ aַmְtַּchְtּֽvֹ׃

44.hebrewText: וַיְחַפֵּ֕שׂ בַּגָּד֣וֹל הֵחֵ֔ל וּבַקָּטֹ֖ן כִּלָּ֑ה וַיִּמָּצֵא֙ הַגָּבִ֔יעַ בְּאַמְתַּ֖חַת בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
44.englishText: He searched, beginning with the oldest and ending with the youngest; and the goblet turned up in Benjamin’s bag.
44.transliteration: vַyְchַpֵּ֕shׂ bַּgָּd֣vֹl hֵchֵ֔l vּbַkָּtֹ֖ן kִּlָּ֑h vַyִּmָּtsֵa֙ hַgָּbִ֔yaַ bְּaַmְtַּ֖chַt bִּnְyָmִֽן׃

44.hebrewText: וַֽיִּקְרְע֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲמֹס֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־חֲמֹר֔וֹ וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ הָעִֽירָה׃
44.englishText: At this they rent their clothes. Each reloaded his pack animal, and they returned to the city.
44.transliteration: vַֽyִּkְrְa֖vּ shִׂmְlֹtָ֑ם vַֽyַּaֲmֹs֙ aִ֣yshׁ aַl־chֲmֹr֔vֹ vַyָּshֻׁ֖bvּ hָaִֽyrָh׃

44.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֨א יְהוּדָ֤ה וְאֶחָיו֙ בֵּ֣יתָה יוֹסֵ֔ף וְה֖וּא עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ שָׁ֑ם וַיִּפְּל֥וּ לְפָנָ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
44.englishText: When Judah and his brothers reentered the house of Joseph, who was still there, they threw themselves on the ground before him.
44.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֨a yְhvּdָ֤h vְaֶchָyv֙ bֵּ֣ytָh yvֹsֵ֔ף vְh֖vּa avֹdֶ֣nּvּ shָׁ֑ם vַyִּpְּl֥vּ lְpָnָ֖yv aָֽrְtsָh׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף מָֽה־הַמַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֑ם הֲל֣וֹא יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם כִּֽי־נַחֵ֧שׁ יְנַחֵ֛שׁ אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּמֹֽנִי׃
44.englishText: Joseph said to them, “What is this deed that you have done? Do you not know that a man like me practices divination?”
44.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr lָhֶם֙ yvֹsֵ֔ף mָֽh־hַmַּaֲshֶׂ֥h hַzֶּ֖h aֲshֶׁ֣r aֲshִׂytֶ֑ם hֲl֣vֹa yְdַaְtֶּ֔ם kִּֽy־nַchֵ֧shׁ yְnַchֵ֛shׁ aִ֖yshׁ aֲshֶׁ֥r kָּmֹֽnִy׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוּדָ֗ה מַה־נֹּאמַר֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י מַה־נְּדַבֵּ֖ר וּמַה־נִּצְטַדָּ֑ק הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים מָצָא֙ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ הִנֶּ֤נּוּ עֲבָדִים֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י גַּם־אֲנַ֕חְנוּ גַּ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־נִמְצָ֥א הַגָּבִ֖יעַ בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
44.englishText: Judah replied, “What can we say to my lord? How can we plead, how can we prove our innocence? God has uncovered the crime of your servants. Here we are, then, slaves of my lord, the rest of us as much as he in whose possession the goblet was found.”
44.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhvּdָ֗h mַh־nֹּamַr֙ lַֽadֹnִ֔y mַh־nְּdַbֵּ֖r vּmַh־nִּtsְtַdָּ֑k hָaֱlֹhִ֗yם mָtsָa֙ aֶt־aֲvֺ֣ן aֲbָdֶ֔yךָ hִnֶּ֤nּvּ aֲbָdִyם֙ lַֽadֹnִ֔y gַּם־aֲnַ֕chְnvּ gַּ֛ם aֲshֶׁr־nִmְtsָ֥a hַgָּbִ֖yaַ bְּyָdֽvֹ׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר חָלִ֣ילָה לִּ֔י מֵעֲשׂ֖וֹת זֹ֑את הָאִ֡ישׁ אֲשֶׁר֩ נִמְצָ֨א הַגָּבִ֜יעַ בְּיָד֗וֹ ה֚וּא יִהְיֶה־לִּ֣י עָ֔בֶד וְאַתֶּ֕ם עֲל֥וּ לְשָׁל֖וֹם אֶל־אֲבִיכֶֽם׃ {ס}
44.englishText: But he replied, “Far be it from me to act thus! Only the one in whose possession the goblet was found shall be my slave; the rest of you go back in peace to your father.”
44.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr chָlִ֣ylָh lִּ֔y mֵaֲshׂ֖vֹt zֹ֑at hָaִ֡yshׁ aֲshֶׁr֩ nִmְtsָ֨a hַgָּbִ֜yaַ bְּyָd֗vֹ h֚vּa yִhְyֶh־lִּ֣y aָ֔bֶd vְaַtֶּ֕ם aֲl֥vּ lְshָׁl֖vֹם aֶl־aֲbִykֶֽם׃ {s}

44.hebrewText: וַיִּגַּ֨שׁ אֵלָ֜יו יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִי֒ יְדַבֶּר־נָ֨א עַבְדְּךָ֤ דָבָר֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י וְאַל־יִ֥חַר אַפְּךָ֖ בְּעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י כָמ֖וֹךָ כְּפַרְעֹֽה׃
44.englishText: Then Judah went up to him and said, “Please, my lord, let your servant appeal to my lord, and do not be impatient with your servant, you who are the equal of Pharaoh.
44.transliteration: vַyִּgַּ֨shׁ aֵlָ֜yv yְhvּdָ֗h vַyֹּ֘amֶr֮ bִּ֣y aֲdֹnִy֒ yְdַbֶּr־nָ֨a aַbְdְּךָ֤ dָbָr֙ bְּaׇzְnֵ֣y aֲdֹnִ֔y vְaַl־yִ֥chַr aַpְּךָ֖ bְּaַbְdֶּ֑ךָ kִּ֥y kָm֖vֹךָ kְּpַrְaֹֽh׃

44.hebrewText: אֲדֹנִ֣י שָׁאַ֔ל אֶת־עֲבָדָ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר הֲיֵשׁ־לָכֶ֥ם אָ֖ב אוֹ־אָֽח׃
44.englishText: My lord asked his servants, ‘Have you a father or another brother?’
44.transliteration: aֲdֹnִ֣y shָׁaַ֔l aֶt־aֲbָdָ֖yv lֵamֹ֑r hֲyֵshׁ־lָkֶ֥ם aָ֖b avֹ־aָֽch׃

44.hebrewText: וַנֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֔י יֶשׁ־לָ֙נוּ֙ אָ֣ב זָקֵ֔ן וְיֶ֥לֶד זְקֻנִ֖ים קָטָ֑ן וְאָחִ֣יו מֵ֔ת וַיִּוָּתֵ֨ר ה֧וּא לְבַדּ֛וֹ לְאִמּ֖וֹ וְאָבִ֥יו אֲהֵבֽוֹ׃
44.englishText: We told my lord, ‘We have an old father, and there is a child of his old age, the youngest; his full brother is dead, so that he alone is left of his mother, and his father dotes on him.’
44.transliteration: vַnֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֶl־aֲdֹnִ֔y yֶshׁ־lָ֙nvּ֙ aָ֣b zָkֵ֔ן vְyֶ֥lֶd zְkֻnִ֖yם kָtָ֑ן vְaָchִ֣yv mֵ֔t vַyִּvָּtֵ֨r h֧vּa lְbַdּ֛vֹ lְaִmּ֖vֹ vְaָbִ֥yv aֲhֵbֽvֹ׃

44.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ הוֹרִדֻ֖הוּ אֵלָ֑י וְאָשִׂ֥ימָה עֵינִ֖י עָלָֽיו׃
44.englishText: Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me, that I may set eyes on him.’
44.transliteration: vַtֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֶl־aֲbָdֶ֔yךָ hvֹrִdֻ֖hvּ aֵlָ֑y vְaָshִׂ֥ymָh aֵynִ֖y aָlָֽyv׃

44.hebrewText: וַנֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֔י לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל הַנַּ֖עַר לַעֲזֹ֣ב אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וְעָזַ֥ב אֶת־אָבִ֖יו וָמֵֽת׃
44.englishText: We said to my lord, ‘The boy cannot leave his father; if he were to leave him, his father would die.’
44.transliteration: vַnֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֶl־aֲdֹnִ֔y lֹa־yvּkַ֥l hַnַּ֖aַr lַaֲzֹ֣b aֶt־aָbִ֑yv vְaָzַ֥b aֶt־aָbִ֖yv vָmֵֽt׃

44.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ אִם־לֹ֥א יֵרֵ֛ד אֲחִיכֶ֥ם הַקָּטֹ֖ן אִתְּכֶ֑ם לֹ֥א תֹסִפ֖וּן לִרְא֥וֹת פָּנָֽי׃
44.englishText: But you said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, do not let me see your faces.’
44.transliteration: vַtֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֶl־aֲbָdֶ֔yךָ aִם־lֹ֥a yֵrֵ֛d aֲchִykֶ֥ם hַkָּtֹ֖ן aִtְּkֶ֑ם lֹ֥a tֹsִp֖vּן lִrְa֥vֹt pָּnָֽy׃

44.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּ֣י עָלִ֔ינוּ אֶֽל־עַבְדְּךָ֖ אָבִ֑י וַנַּ֨גֶּד־ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
44.englishText: When we came back to your servant my father, we reported my lord’s words to him.
44.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ kִּ֣y aָlִ֔ynvּ aֶֽl־aַbְdְּךָ֖ aָbִ֑y vַnַּ֨gֶּd־l֔vֹ aֵ֖t dִּbְrֵ֥y aֲdֹnִֽy׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָבִ֑ינוּ שֻׁ֖בוּ שִׁבְרוּ־לָ֥נוּ מְעַט־אֹֽכֶל׃
44.englishText: “Later our father said, ‘Go back and procure some food for us.’
44.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr aָbִ֑ynvּ shֻׁ֖bvּ shִׁbְrvּ־lָ֥nvּ mְaַt־aֹֽkֶl׃

44.hebrewText: וַנֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א נוּכַ֖ל לָרֶ֑דֶת אִם־יֵשׁ֩ אָחִ֨ינוּ הַקָּטֹ֤ן אִתָּ֙נוּ֙ וְיָרַ֔דְנוּ כִּי־לֹ֣א נוּכַ֗ל לִרְאוֹת֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָאִ֔ישׁ וְאָחִ֥ינוּ הַקָּטֹ֖ן אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אִתָּֽנוּ׃
44.englishText: We answered, ‘We cannot go down; only if our youngest brother is with us can we go down, for we may not show our faces to the man*show our faces to the man Lit. “see the [salient] participant’s face.” unless our youngest brother is with us.’
44.transliteration: vַnֹּ֕amֶr lֹ֥a nvּkַ֖l lָrֶ֑dֶt aִם־yֵshׁ֩ aָchִ֨ynvּ hַkָּtֹ֤ן aִtָּ֙nvּ֙ vְyָrַ֔dְnvּ kִּy־lֹ֣a nvּkַ֗l lִrְavֹt֙ pְּnֵ֣y hָaִ֔yshׁ vְaָchִ֥ynvּ hַkָּtֹ֖ן aֵynֶ֥nּvּ aִtָּֽnvּ׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר עַבְדְּךָ֥ אָבִ֖י אֵלֵ֑ינוּ אַתֶּ֣ם יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם כִּ֥י שְׁנַ֖יִם יָֽלְדָה־לִּ֥י אִשְׁתִּֽי׃
44.englishText: Your servant my father said to us, ‘As you know, my wife bore me two sons.
44.transliteration: vַyֹּ֛amֶr aַbְdְּךָ֥ aָbִ֖y aֵlֵ֑ynvּ aַtֶּ֣ם yְdַaְtֶּ֔ם kִּ֥y shְׁnַ֖yִם yָֽlְdָh־lִּ֥y aִshְׁtִּֽy׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֤א הָֽאֶחָד֙ מֵֽאִתִּ֔י וָאֹמַ֕ר אַ֖ךְ טָרֹ֣ף טֹרָ֑ף וְלֹ֥א רְאִיתִ֖יו עַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
44.englishText: But one is gone from me, and I said: Alas, he was torn by a beast! And I have not seen him since.
44.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֤a hָֽaֶchָd֙ mֵֽaִtִּ֔y vָaֹmַ֕r aַ֖ךְ tָrֹ֣ף tֹrָ֑ף vְlֹ֥a rְaִytִ֖yv aַd־hֵֽnָּh׃

44.hebrewText: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֧ם גַּם־אֶת־זֶ֛ה מֵעִ֥ם פָּנַ֖י וְקָרָ֣הוּ אָס֑וֹן וְהֽוֹרַדְתֶּ֧ם אֶת־שֵׂיבָתִ֛י בְּרָעָ֖ה שְׁאֹֽלָה׃
44.englishText: If you take this one from me, too, and he meets with disaster, you will send my white head down to Sheol in sorrow.’
44.transliteration: vּlְkַchְtֶּ֧ם gַּם־aֶt־zֶ֛h mֵaִ֥ם pָּnַ֖y vְkָrָ֣hvּ aָs֑vֹן vְhֽvֹrַdְtֶּ֧ם aֶt־shֵׂybָtִ֛y bְּrָaָ֖h shְׁaֹֽlָh׃

44.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֗ה כְּבֹאִי֙ אֶל־עַבְדְּךָ֣ אָבִ֔י וְהַנַּ֖עַר אֵינֶ֣נּוּ אִתָּ֑נוּ וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹ קְשׁוּרָ֥ה בְנַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
44.englishText: “Now, if I come to your servant my father and the boy is not with us—since his own life is so bound up with his—
44.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֗h kְּbֹaִy֙ aֶl־aַbְdְּךָ֣ aָbִ֔y vְhַnַּ֖aַr aֵynֶ֣nּvּ aִtָּ֑nvּ vְnַpְshׁ֖vֹ kְshׁvּrָ֥h bְnַpְshֽׁvֹ׃

44.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּרְאוֹת֛וֹ כִּי־אֵ֥ין הַנַּ֖עַר וָמֵ֑ת וְהוֹרִ֨ידוּ עֲבָדֶ֜יךָ אֶת־שֵׂיבַ֨ת עַבְדְּךָ֥ אָבִ֛ינוּ בְּיָג֖וֹן שְׁאֹֽלָה׃
44.englishText: when he sees that the boy is not with us, he will die, and your servants will send the white head of your servant our father down to Sheol in grief.
44.transliteration: vְhָyָ֗h kִּrְavֹt֛vֹ kִּy־aֵ֥yן hַnַּ֖aַr vָmֵ֑t vְhvֹrִ֨ydvּ aֲbָdֶ֜yךָ aֶt־shֵׂybַ֨t aַbְdְּךָ֥ aָbִ֛ynvּ bְּyָg֖vֹן shְׁaֹֽlָh׃

44.hebrewText: כִּ֤י עַבְדְּךָ֙ עָרַ֣ב אֶת־הַנַּ֔עַר מֵעִ֥ם אָבִ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־לֹ֤א אֲבִיאֶ֙נּוּ֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְחָטָ֥אתִי לְאָבִ֖י כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
44.englishText: Now your servant has pledged himself for the boy to my father, saying, ‘If I do not bring him back to you, I shall stand guilty before my father forever.’
44.transliteration: kִּ֤y aַbְdְּךָ֙ aָrַ֣b aֶt־hַnַּ֔aַr mֵaִ֥ם aָbִ֖y lֵamֹ֑r aִם־lֹ֤a aֲbִyaֶ֙nּvּ֙ aֵlֶ֔yךָ vְchָtָ֥atִy lְaָbִ֖y kׇּl־hַyָּmִֽyם׃

44.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֗ה יֵֽשֶׁב־נָ֤א עַבְדְּךָ֙ תַּ֣חַת הַנַּ֔עַר עֶ֖בֶד לַֽאדֹנִ֑י וְהַנַּ֖עַר יַ֥עַל עִם־אֶחָֽיו׃
44.englishText: Therefore, please let your servant remain as a slave to my lord instead of the boy, and let the boy go back with his brothers.
44.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֗h yֵֽshֶׁb־nָ֤a aַbְdְּךָ֙ tַּ֣chַt hַnַּ֔aַr aֶ֖bֶd lַֽadֹnִ֑y vְhַnַּ֖aַr yַ֥aַl aִם־aֶchָֽyv׃

44.hebrewText: כִּי־אֵיךְ֙ אֶֽעֱלֶ֣ה אֶל־אָבִ֔י וְהַנַּ֖עַר אֵינֶ֣נּוּ אִתִּ֑י פֶּ֚ן אֶרְאֶ֣ה בָרָ֔ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִמְצָ֖א אֶת־אָבִֽי׃
44.englishText: For how can I go back to my father unless the boy is with me? Let me not be witness to the woe that would overtake my father!”
44.transliteration: kִּy־aֵyךְ֙ aֶֽaֱlֶ֣h aֶl־aָbִ֔y vְhַnַּ֖aַr aֵynֶ֣nּvּ aִtִּ֑y pֶּ֚ן aֶrְaֶ֣h bָrָ֔a aֲshֶׁ֥r yִmְtsָ֖a aֶt־aָbִֽy׃

vayigash.name: Vayigash
vayigash.summary: Judah's plea, Joseph reveals himself, the brothers return to Canaan, Jacob's journey to Egypt, and the settlement in Goshen.

44.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֞ו אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּיתוֹ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ מַלֵּ֞א אֶת־אַמְתְּחֹ֤ת הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֹ֔כֶל כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יוּכְל֖וּן שְׂאֵ֑ת וְשִׂ֥ים כֶּֽסֶף־אִ֖ישׁ בְּפִ֥י אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
44.englishText: Then he instructed his house steward as follows, “Fill the men’s bags with food, as much as they can carry, and put each one’s money in the mouth of his bag.
44.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֞v aֶt־aֲshֶׁ֣r aַl־bֵּytvֹ֮ lֵamֹr֒ mַlֵּ֞a aֶt־aַmְtְּchֹ֤t hָֽaֲnָshִׁyם֙ aֹ֔kֶl kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r yvּkְl֖vּן shְׂaֵ֑t vְshִׂ֥yם kֶּֽsֶף־aִ֖yshׁ bְּpִ֥y aַmְtַּchְtּֽvֹ׃

44.hebrewText: וְאֶת־גְּבִיעִ֞י גְּבִ֣יעַ הַכֶּ֗סֶף תָּשִׂים֙ בְּפִי֙ אַמְתַּ֣חַת הַקָּטֹ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת כֶּ֣סֶף שִׁבְר֑וֹ וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כִּדְבַ֥ר יוֹסֵ֖ף אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃
44.englishText: Put my silver goblet in the mouth of the bag of the youngest one, together with his money for the rations.” And he did as Joseph told him.
44.transliteration: vְaֶt־gְּbִyaִ֞y gְּbִ֣yaַ hַkֶּ֗sֶף tָּshִׂyם֙ bְּpִy֙ aַmְtַּ֣chַt hַkָּtֹ֔ן vְaֵ֖t kֶּ֣sֶף shִׁbְr֑vֹ vַyַּ֕aַshׂ kִּdְbַ֥r yvֹsֵ֖ף aֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbֵּֽr׃

44.hebrewText: הַבֹּ֖קֶר א֑וֹר וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים שֻׁלְּח֔וּ הֵ֖מָּה וַחֲמֹרֵיהֶֽם׃
44.englishText: With the first light of morning, the men were sent off with their pack animals.
44.transliteration: hַbֹּ֖kֶr a֑vֹr vְhָaֲnָshִׁ֣yם shֻׁlְּch֔vּ hֵ֖mָּh vַchֲmֹrֵyhֶֽם׃

44.hebrewText: הֵ֠ם יָֽצְא֣וּ אֶת־הָעִיר֮ לֹ֣א הִרְחִ֒יקוּ֒ וְיוֹסֵ֤ף אָמַר֙ לַֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּית֔וֹ ק֥וּם רְדֹ֖ף אַחֲרֵ֣י הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֑ים וְהִשַּׂגְתָּם֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם לָ֛מָּה שִׁלַּמְתֶּ֥ם רָעָ֖ה תַּ֥חַת טוֹבָֽה׃
44.englishText: They had just left the city and had not gone far, when Joseph said to his house steward, “Up, go after those men! And when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why did you repay good with evil?
44.transliteration: hֵ֠ם yָֽtsְa֣vּ aֶt־hָaִyr֮ lֹ֣a hִrְchִ֒ykvּ֒ vְyvֹsֵ֤ף aָmַr֙ lַֽaֲshֶׁ֣r aַl־bֵּyt֔vֹ k֥vּם rְdֹ֖ף aַchֲrֵ֣y hָֽaֲnָshִׁ֑yם vְhִshַּׂgְtָּם֙ vְaָmַrְtָּ֣ aֲlֵhֶ֔ם lָ֛mָּh shִׁlַּmְtֶּ֥ם rָaָ֖h tַּ֥chַt tvֹbָֽh׃

44.hebrewText: הֲל֣וֹא זֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁתֶּ֤ה אֲדֹנִי֙ בּ֔וֹ וְה֕וּא נַחֵ֥שׁ יְנַחֵ֖שׁ בּ֑וֹ הֲרֵעֹתֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲשִׂיתֶֽם׃
44.englishText: It is the very one from which my master drinks and which he uses for divination. It was a wicked thing for you to do!’”
44.transliteration: hֲl֣vֹa zֶ֗h aֲshֶׁ֨r yִshְׁtֶּ֤h aֲdֹnִy֙ bּ֔vֹ vְh֕vּa nַchֵ֥shׁ yְnַchֵ֖shׁ bּ֑vֹ hֲrֵaֹtֶ֖ם aֲshֶׁ֥r aֲshִׂytֶֽם׃

44.hebrewText: וַֽיַּשִּׂגֵ֑ם וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
44.englishText: He overtook them and spoke those words to them.
44.transliteration: vַֽyַּshִּׂgֵ֑ם vַyְdַbֵּ֣r aֲlֵhֶ֔ם aֶt־hַdְּbָrִ֖yם hָaֵֽlֶּh׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו לָ֚מָּה יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲדֹנִ֔י כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה חָלִ֙ילָה֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ מֵעֲשׂ֖וֹת כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
44.englishText: And they said to him, “Why does my lord say such things? Far be it from your servants to do anything of the kind!
44.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֣vּ aֵlָ֔yv lָ֚mָּh yְdַbֵּ֣r aֲdֹnִ֔y kַּdְּbָrִ֖yם hָaֵ֑lֶּh chָlִ֙ylָh֙ lַaֲbָdֶ֔yךָ mֵaֲshׂ֖vֹt kַּdָּbָ֥r hַzֶּֽh׃

44.hebrewText: הֵ֣ן כֶּ֗סֶף אֲשֶׁ֤ר מָצָ֙אנוּ֙ בְּפִ֣י אַמְתְּחֹתֵ֔ינוּ הֱשִׁיבֹ֥נוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְאֵ֗יךְ נִגְנֹב֙ מִבֵּ֣ית אֲדֹנֶ֔יךָ כֶּ֖סֶף א֥וֹ זָהָֽב׃
44.englishText: Here we brought back to you from the land of Canaan the money that we found in the mouths of our bags. How then could we have stolen any silver or gold from your master’s house!
44.transliteration: hֵ֣ן kֶּ֗sֶף aֲshֶׁ֤r mָtsָ֙anvּ֙ bְּpִ֣y aַmְtְּchֹtֵ֔ynvּ hֱshִׁybֹ֥nvּ aֵlֶ֖yךָ mֵaֶ֣rֶץ kְּnָ֑aַן vְaֵ֗yךְ nִgְnֹb֙ mִbֵּ֣yt aֲdֹnֶ֔yךָ kֶּ֖sֶף a֥vֹ zָhָֽb׃

44.hebrewText: אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֥א אִתּ֛וֹ מֵעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ וָמֵ֑ת וְגַם־אֲנַ֕חְנוּ נִֽהְיֶ֥ה לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לַעֲבָדִֽים׃
44.englishText: Whichever of your servants it is found with shall die; the rest of us, moreover, shall become slaves to my lord.”
44.transliteration: aֲshֶׁ֨r yִmָּtsֵ֥a aִtּ֛vֹ mֵaֲbָdֶ֖yךָ vָmֵ֑t vְgַם־aֲnַ֕chְnvּ nִֽhְyֶ֥h lַֽadֹnִ֖y lַaֲbָdִֽyם׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר גַּם־עַתָּ֥ה כְדִבְרֵיכֶ֖ם כֶּן־ה֑וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֤א אִתּוֹ֙ יִהְיֶה־לִּ֣י עָ֔בֶד וְאַתֶּ֖ם תִּהְי֥וּ נְקִיִּֽם׃
44.englishText: He replied, “Although what you are proposing is right, only the one with whom it is found shall be my slave; but the rest of you shall go free.”
44.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr gַּם־aַtָּ֥h kְdִbְrֵykֶ֖ם kֶּן־h֑vּa aֲshֶׁ֨r yִmָּtsֵ֤a aִtּvֹ֙ yִhְyֶh־lִּ֣y aָ֔bֶd vְaַtֶּ֖ם tִּhְy֥vּ nְkִyִּֽם׃

44.hebrewText: וַֽיְמַהֲר֗וּ וַיּוֹרִ֛דוּ אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־אַמְתַּחְתּ֖וֹ אָ֑רְצָה וַֽיִּפְתְּח֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
44.englishText: So each one hastened to lower his bag to the ground, and each one opened his bag.
44.transliteration: vַֽyְmַhֲr֗vּ vַyּvֹrִ֛dvּ aִ֥yshׁ aֶt־aַmְtַּchְtּ֖vֹ aָ֑rְtsָh vַֽyִּpְtְּch֖vּ aִ֥yshׁ aַmְtַּchְtּֽvֹ׃

44.hebrewText: וַיְחַפֵּ֕שׂ בַּגָּד֣וֹל הֵחֵ֔ל וּבַקָּטֹ֖ן כִּלָּ֑ה וַיִּמָּצֵא֙ הַגָּבִ֔יעַ בְּאַמְתַּ֖חַת בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
44.englishText: He searched, beginning with the oldest and ending with the youngest; and the goblet turned up in Benjamin’s bag.
44.transliteration: vַyְchַpֵּ֕shׂ bַּgָּd֣vֹl hֵchֵ֔l vּbַkָּtֹ֖ן kִּlָּ֑h vַyִּmָּtsֵa֙ hַgָּbִ֔yaַ bְּaַmְtַּ֖chַt bִּnְyָmִֽן׃

44.hebrewText: וַֽיִּקְרְע֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲמֹס֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־חֲמֹר֔וֹ וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ הָעִֽירָה׃
44.englishText: At this they rent their clothes. Each reloaded his pack animal, and they returned to the city.
44.transliteration: vַֽyִּkְrְa֖vּ shִׂmְlֹtָ֑ם vַֽyַּaֲmֹs֙ aִ֣yshׁ aַl־chֲmֹr֔vֹ vַyָּshֻׁ֖bvּ hָaִֽyrָh׃

44.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֨א יְהוּדָ֤ה וְאֶחָיו֙ בֵּ֣יתָה יוֹסֵ֔ף וְה֖וּא עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ שָׁ֑ם וַיִּפְּל֥וּ לְפָנָ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
44.englishText: When Judah and his brothers reentered the house of Joseph, who was still there, they threw themselves on the ground before him.
44.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֨a yְhvּdָ֤h vְaֶchָyv֙ bֵּ֣ytָh yvֹsֵ֔ף vְh֖vּa avֹdֶ֣nּvּ shָׁ֑ם vַyִּpְּl֥vּ lְpָnָ֖yv aָֽrְtsָh׃

44.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף מָֽה־הַמַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֑ם הֲל֣וֹא יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם כִּֽי־נַחֵ֧שׁ יְנַחֵ֛שׁ אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּמֹֽנִי׃
44.englishText: Joseph said to them, “What is this deed that you have done? Do you not know that a man like me practices divination?”
