For when angry they slay a man,*slay a man (So trad.) Or “slayed any [opposing] party”; cf. Gen. 4.23. Or, with NJPS, taking ’ish as a collective: “slay men.” See next note and Dictionary under ’ish.
And when pleased they maim an ox.*maim an ox Or, with Canaanite literary usage and taking this verse as referring to the events of chapter 34: “overthrew a dignitary.” Or, with NJPS, taking shor as a collective: “maimed oxen.”
49.transliteration: bְּsֹdָם֙ aַl־tָּbֹ֣a nַpְshִׁ֔y bִּkְhָlָ֖ם aַl־tֵּchַ֣d kְּbֹdִ֑y kִּ֤y bְaַpָּם֙ hָ֣rְgvּ aִ֔yshׁ vּbִrְtsֹnָ֖ם aִkְּrvּ־shֽׁvֹr׃

49.hebrewText: אָר֤וּר אַפָּם֙ כִּ֣י עָ֔ז וְעֶבְרָתָ֖ם כִּ֣י קָשָׁ֑תָה אֲחַלְּקֵ֣ם בְּיַעֲקֹ֔ב וַאֲפִיצֵ֖ם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
49.englishText:
Cursed be their anger so fierce,
And their wrath so relentless.
I will divide them in Jacob,
Scatter them in Israel.
49.transliteration: aָr֤vּr aַpָּם֙ kִּ֣y aָ֔z vְaֶbְrָtָ֖ם kִּ֣y kָshָׁ֑tָh aֲchַlְּkֵ֣ם bְּyַaֲkֹ֔b vַaֲpִytsֵ֖ם bְּyִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃ {p}

49.hebrewText: יְהוּדָ֗ה אַתָּה֙ יוֹד֣וּךָ אַחֶ֔יךָ יָדְךָ֖ בְּעֹ֣רֶף אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ יִשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לְךָ֖ בְּנֵ֥י אָבִֽיךָ׃
49.englishText:
You, O Judah, your brothers shall praise;
Your hand shall be on the nape of your foes;
Your father’s sons shall bow low to you.
49.transliteration: yְhvּdָ֗h aַtָּh֙ yvֹd֣vּךָ aַchֶ֔yךָ yָdְךָ֖ bְּaֹ֣rֶף aֹyְbֶ֑yךָ yִshְׁtַּchֲv֥vּ lְךָ֖ bְּnֵ֥y aָbִֽyךָ׃

49.hebrewText: גּ֤וּר אַרְיֵה֙ יְהוּדָ֔ה מִטֶּ֖רֶף בְּנִ֣י עָלִ֑יתָ כָּרַ֨ע רָבַ֧ץ כְּאַרְיֵ֛ה וּכְלָבִ֖יא מִ֥י יְקִימֶֽנּוּ׃
49.englishText:
Judah is a lion’s whelp;
On prey, my son, have you grown.
He crouches, lies down like a lion,
Like a lioness*lioness (So trad.) Taking Heb. lavi’ as referring to a different sex than ’ari earlier in the verse, given that it is the females who hunt for their pride. NJPS “king of beasts,” taking lavi’ as a breed of lion. —who dare rouse him?
49.transliteration: gּ֤vּr aַrְyֵh֙ yְhvּdָ֔h mִtֶּ֖rֶף bְּnִ֣y aָlִ֑ytָ kָּrַ֨a rָbַ֧ץ kְּaַrְyֵ֛h vּkְlָbִ֖ya mִ֥y yְkִymֶֽnּvּ׃

49.hebrewText: לֹֽא־יָס֥וּר שֵׁ֙בֶט֙ מִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וּמְחֹקֵ֖ק מִבֵּ֣ין רַגְלָ֑יו עַ֚ד כִּֽי־יָבֹ֣א שִׁילֹ֔ה וְל֖וֹ יִקְּהַ֥ת עַמִּֽים׃
49.englishText:
The scepter shall not depart from Judah,
Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet;
So that tribute shall come to him*So that tribute shall come to him Construing shiloh as shai loh “tribute to him,” following the Midrash; cf. Isa. 18.7. Meaning of Heb. uncertain; lit. “Until he comes to Shiloh.”
And the homage of peoples be his.
49.transliteration: lֹֽa־yָs֥vּr shֵׁ֙bֶt֙ mִֽyhvּdָ֔h vּmְchֹkֵ֖k mִbֵּ֣yן rַgְlָ֑yv aַ֚d kִּֽy־yָbֹ֣a shִׁylֹ֔h vְl֖vֹ yִkְּhַ֥t aַmִּֽyם׃

49.hebrewText: אֹסְרִ֤י לַגֶּ֙פֶן֙ עִירֹ֔ה וְלַשֹּׂרֵקָ֖ה בְּנִ֣י אֲתֹנ֑וֹ כִּבֵּ֤ס בַּיַּ֙יִן֙ לְבֻשׁ֔וֹ וּבְדַם־עֲנָבִ֖ים סוּתֹֽה׃
49.englishText:
He tethers his ass to a vine,
His ass’s foal to a choice vine;
He washes his garment in wine,
His robe in blood of grapes.
49.transliteration: aֹsְrִ֤y lַgֶּ֙pֶן֙ aִyrֹ֔h vְlַshֹּׂrֵkָ֖h bְּnִ֣y aֲtֹn֑vֹ kִּbֵּ֤s bַּyַּ֙yִן֙ lְbֻshׁ֔vֹ vּbְdַם־aֲnָbִ֖yם svּtֹֽh׃

49.hebrewText: חַכְלִילִ֥י עֵינַ֖יִם מִיָּ֑יִן וּלְבֶן־שִׁנַּ֖יִם מֵחָלָֽב׃ {פ}
49.englishText:
His eyes are darker than wine;
His teeth are whiter than milk.*His eyes are darker than wine; / His teeth are whiter than milk Or “His eyes are dark from wine, / And his teeth are white from milk.”
49.transliteration: chַkְlִylִ֥y aֵynַ֖yִם mִyָּ֑yִן vּlְbֶן־shִׁnַּ֖yִם mֵchָlָֽb׃ {p}

49.hebrewText: זְבוּלֻ֕ן לְח֥וֹף יַמִּ֖ים יִשְׁכֹּ֑ן וְהוּא֙ לְח֣וֹף אֳנִיֹּ֔ת וְיַרְכָת֖וֹ עַל־צִידֹֽן׃ {פ}
49.englishText:
Zebulun shall dwell by the seashore;
He shall be a haven for ships,
And his flank shall rest on Sidon.
49.transliteration: zְbvּlֻ֕ן lְch֥vֹף yַmִּ֖yם yִshְׁkֹּ֑ן vְhvּa֙ lְch֣vֹף aֳnִyֹּ֔t vְyַrְkָt֖vֹ aַl־tsִydֹֽן׃ {p}

49.hebrewText: יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר חֲמֹ֣ר גָּ֑רֶם רֹבֵ֖ץ בֵּ֥ין הַֽמִּשְׁפְּתָֽיִם׃
49.englishText:
Issachar is a strong-boned ass,
Crouching among the sheepfolds.
49.transliteration: yִshָּׂshkָ֖r chֲmֹ֣r gָּ֑rֶם rֹbֵ֖ץ bֵּ֥yן hַֽmִּshְׁpְּtָֽyִם׃

49.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤רְא מְנֻחָה֙ כִּ֣י ט֔וֹב וְאֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ כִּ֣י נָעֵ֑מָה וַיֵּ֤ט שִׁכְמוֹ֙ לִסְבֹּ֔ל וַיְהִ֖י לְמַס־עֹבֵֽד׃ {ס}
49.englishText:
When he saw how good was security,
And how pleasant was the country,
He bent his shoulder to the burden,
And became a toiling serf.
49.transliteration: vַyַּ֤rְa mְnֻchָh֙ kִּ֣y t֔vֹb vְaֶt־hָaָ֖rֶץ kִּ֣y nָaֵ֑mָh vַyֵּ֤t shִׁkְmvֹ֙ lִsְbֹּ֔l vַyְhִ֖y lְmַs־aֹbֵֽd׃ {s}

49.hebrewText: דָּ֖ן יָדִ֣ין עַמּ֑וֹ כְּאַחַ֖ד שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
49.englishText:
Dan shall govern his people,
As one of the tribes of Israel.
49.transliteration: dָּ֖ן yָdִ֣yן aַmּ֑vֹ kְּaַchַ֖d shִׁbְtֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

49.hebrewText: יְהִי־דָן֙ נָחָ֣שׁ עֲלֵי־דֶ֔רֶךְ שְׁפִיפֹ֖ן עֲלֵי־אֹ֑רַח הַנֹּשֵׁךְ֙ עִקְּבֵי־ס֔וּס וַיִּפֹּ֥ל רֹכְב֖וֹ אָחֽוֹר׃
49.englishText:
Dan shall be a serpent by the road,
A viper by the path,
That bites the horse’s heels
So that his rider is thrown backward.
49.transliteration: yְhִy־dָן֙ nָchָ֣shׁ aֲlֵy־dֶ֔rֶךְ shְׁpִypֹ֖ן aֲlֵy־aֹ֑rַch hַnֹּshֵׁךְ֙ aִkְּbֵy־s֔vּs vַyִּpֹּ֥l rֹkְb֖vֹ aָchֽvֹr׃

49.hebrewText: לִישׁוּעָֽתְךָ֖ קִוִּ֥יתִי יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
49.englishText: I wait for Your deliverance, O יהוה !
49.transliteration: lִyshׁvּaָֽtְךָ֖ kִvִּ֥ytִy yְhֹvָֽh׃ {s}

49.hebrewText: גָּ֖ד גְּד֣וּד יְגוּדֶ֑נּוּ וְה֖וּא יָגֻ֥ד עָקֵֽב׃ {ס}
49.englishText:
Gad shall be raided by raiders,
But he shall raid at their heels.
49.transliteration: gָּ֖d gְּd֣vּd yְgvּdֶ֑nּvּ vְh֖vּa yָgֻ֥d aָkֵֽb׃ {s}

49.hebrewText: מֵאָשֵׁ֖ר שְׁמֵנָ֣ה לַחְמ֑וֹ וְה֥וּא יִתֵּ֖ן מַֽעֲדַנֵּי־מֶֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
49.englishText:
Asher’s bread shall be rich,
And he shall yield royal dainties.
49.transliteration: mֵaָshֵׁ֖r shְׁmֵnָ֣h lַchְm֑vֹ vְh֥vּa yִtֵּ֖ן mַֽaֲdַnֵּy־mֶֽlֶךְ׃ {s}

49.hebrewText: נַפְתָּלִ֖י אַיָּלָ֣ה שְׁלֻחָ֑ה הַנֹּתֵ֖ן אִמְרֵי־שָֽׁפֶר׃ {ס}
49.englishText:
Naphtali is a hind let loose,
Which yields lovely fawns.
49.transliteration: nַpְtָּlִ֖y aַyָּlָ֣h shְׁlֻchָ֑h hַnֹּtֵ֖ן aִmְrֵy־shָֽׁpֶr׃ {s}

49.hebrewText: בֵּ֤ן פֹּרָת֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף בֵּ֥ן פֹּרָ֖ת עֲלֵי־עָ֑יִן בָּנ֕וֹת צָעֲדָ֖ה עֲלֵי־שֽׁוּר׃
49.englishText:
Joseph is a wild ass,
A wild ass by a spring
—Wild colts on a hillside.*Joseph is a wild ass, / A wild ass by a spring / —Wild colts on a hillside Others “Joseph is a fruitful bough, / A fruitful bough by a spring, / Its branches run over a wall.”
49.transliteration: bֵּ֤ן pֹּrָt֙ yvֹsֵ֔ף bֵּ֥ן pֹּrָ֖t aֲlֵy־aָ֑yִן bָּn֕vֹt tsָaֲdָ֖h aֲlֵy־shֽׁvּr׃

49.hebrewText: וַֽיְמָרְרֻ֖הוּ וָרֹ֑בּוּ וַֽיִּשְׂטְמֻ֖הוּ בַּעֲלֵ֥י חִצִּֽים׃
49.englishText:
Archers bitterly assailed him;
They shot at him and harried him.
49.transliteration: vַֽyְmָrְrֻ֖hvּ vָrֹ֑bּvּ vַֽyִּshְׂtְmֻ֖hvּ bַּaֲlֵ֥y chִtsִּֽyם׃

49.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֤שֶׁב בְּאֵיתָן֙ קַשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַיָּפֹ֖זּוּ זְרֹעֵ֣י יָדָ֑יו מִידֵי֙ אֲבִ֣יר יַעֲקֹ֔ב מִשָּׁ֥ם רֹעֶ֖ה אֶ֥בֶן יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
49.englishText:
Yet his bow stayed taut,
And his arms*his arms Heb. “the arms of his hands.” were made firm
By the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob—
There, the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel—
49.transliteration: vַtֵּ֤shֶׁb bְּaֵytָן֙ kַshְׁtּ֔vֹ vַyָּpֹ֖zּvּ zְrֹaֵ֣y yָdָ֑yv mִydֵy֙ aֲbִ֣yr yַaֲkֹ֔b mִshָּׁ֥ם rֹaֶ֖h aֶ֥bֶן yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

49.hebrewText: מֵאֵ֨ל אָבִ֜יךָ וְיַעְזְרֶ֗ךָּ וְאֵ֤ת שַׁדַּי֙ וִיבָ֣רְכֶ֔ךָּ בִּרְכֹ֤ת שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ מֵעָ֔ל בִּרְכֹ֥ת תְּה֖וֹם רֹבֶ֣צֶת תָּ֑חַת בִּרְכֹ֥ת שָׁדַ֖יִם וָרָֽחַם׃
49.englishText:
The God of your father’s [house], who helps you,
And Shaddai who blesses you
With blessings of heaven above,
Blessings of the deep that couches below,
Blessings of the breast and womb.
49.transliteration: mֵaֵ֨l aָbִ֜yךָ vְyַaְzְrֶ֗ךָּ vְaֵ֤t shַׁdַּy֙ vִybָ֣rְkֶ֔ךָּ bִּrְkֹ֤t shָׁmַ֙yִם֙ mֵaָ֔l bִּrְkֹ֥t tְּh֖vֹם rֹbֶ֣tsֶt tָּ֑chַt bִּrְkֹ֥t shָׁdַ֖yִם vָrָֽchַם׃

49.hebrewText: בִּרְכֹ֣ת אָבִ֗יךָ גָּֽבְרוּ֙ עַל־בִּרְכֹ֣ת הוֹרַ֔י עַֽד־תַּאֲוַ֖ת גִּבְעֹ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם תִּֽהְיֶ֙יןָ֙ לְרֹ֣אשׁ יוֹסֵ֔ף וּלְקׇדְקֹ֖ד נְזִ֥יר אֶחָֽיו׃ {פ}
49.englishText:
The blessings of your father
Surpass the blessings of my ancestors,
To the utmost bounds of the eternal hills.*The blessings of your father … hills Meaning of Heb. uncertain.
May they rest on the head of Joseph,
On the brow of the elect of his brothers.
49.transliteration: bִּrְkֹ֣t aָbִ֗yךָ gָּֽbְrvּ֙ aַl־bִּrְkֹ֣t hvֹrַ֔y aַֽd־tַּaֲvַ֖t gִּbְaֹ֣t avֹlָ֑ם tִּֽhְyֶ֙yןָ֙ lְrֹ֣ashׁ yvֹsֵ֔ף vּlְkׇdְkֹ֖d nְzִ֥yr aֶchָֽyv׃ {p}

49.hebrewText: בִּנְיָמִין֙ זְאֵ֣ב יִטְרָ֔ף בַּבֹּ֖קֶר יֹ֣אכַל עַ֑ד וְלָעֶ֖רֶב יְחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁלָֽל׃
49.englishText:
Benjamin is a ravenous wolf;
In the morning he consumes the foe,*foe Meaning of Heb. ‘ad uncertain; others “booty.”
And in the evening he divides the spoil.”
49.transliteration: bִּnְyָmִyן֙ zְaֵ֣b yִtְrָ֔ף bַּbֹּ֖kֶr yֹ֣akַl aַ֑d vְlָaֶ֖rֶb yְchַlֵּ֥k shָׁlָֽl׃

49.hebrewText: כׇּל־אֵ֛לֶּה שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֑ר וְ֠זֹ֠את אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֨ר לָהֶ֤ם אֲבִיהֶם֙ וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אוֹתָ֔ם אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כְּבִרְכָת֖וֹ בֵּרַ֥ךְ אֹתָֽם׃
49.englishText: All these were the tribes of Israel, twelve in number, and this is what their father said to them as he bade them farewell, addressing to each a parting word appropriate to him.
49.transliteration: kׇּl־aֵ֛lֶּh shִׁbְtֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l shְׁnֵ֣yם aָshָׂ֑r vְ֠zֹ֠at aֲshֶׁr־dִּbֶּ֨r lָhֶ֤ם aֲbִyhֶם֙ vַyְbָ֣rֶךְ avֹtָ֔ם aִ֛yshׁ aֲshֶׁ֥r kְּbִrְkָt֖vֹ bֵּrַ֥ךְ aֹtָֽם׃

49.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֣ו אוֹתָ֗ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אֲנִי֙ נֶאֱסָ֣ף אֶל־עַמִּ֔י קִבְר֥וּ אֹתִ֖י אֶל־אֲבֹתָ֑י אֶ֨ל־הַמְּעָרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּשְׂדֵ֖ה עֶפְר֥וֹן הַֽחִתִּֽי׃
49.englishText: Then he instructed them, saying to them, “I am about to be gathered to my kin. Bury me with my ancestors*ancestors Heb. ’avothai; trad. “fathers.” See the Dictionary under “predecessors.” in the cave which is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
49.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֣v avֹtָ֗ם vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֲlֵhֶם֙ aֲnִy֙ nֶaֱsָ֣ף aֶl־aַmִּ֔y kִbְr֥vּ aֹtִ֖y aֶl־aֲbֹtָ֑y aֶ֨l־hַmְּaָrָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r bִּshְׂdֵ֖h aֶpְr֥vֹן hַֽchִtִּֽy׃

49.hebrewText: בַּמְּעָרָ֞ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר בִּשְׂדֵ֧ה הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־פְּנֵי־מַמְרֵ֖א בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן אֲשֶׁר֩ קָנָ֨ה אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה מֵאֵ֛ת עֶפְרֹ֥ן הַחִתִּ֖י לַאֲחֻזַּת־קָֽבֶר׃
49.englishText: the cave which is in the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre, in the land of Canaan, the field that Abraham bought from Ephron the Hittite for a burial site—
49.transliteration: bַּmְּaָrָ֞h aֲshֶׁ֨r bִּshְׂdֵ֧h hַmַּkְpֵּlָ֛h aֲshֶׁ֥r aַl־pְּnֵy־mַmְrֵ֖a bְּaֶ֣rֶץ kְּnָ֑aַן aֲshֶׁr֩ kָnָ֨h aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֶt־hַshָּׂdֶ֗h mֵaֵ֛t aֶpְrֹ֥ן hַchִtִּ֖y lַaֲchֻzַּt־kָֽbֶr׃

49.hebrewText: שָׁ֣מָּה קָֽבְר֞וּ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֗ם וְאֵת֙ שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ שָׁ֚מָּה קָבְר֣וּ אֶת־יִצְחָ֔ק וְאֵ֖ת רִבְקָ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְשָׁ֥מָּה קָבַ֖רְתִּי אֶת־לֵאָֽה׃
49.englishText: there Abraham and his wife Sarah were buried; there Isaac and his wife Rebekah were buried; and there I buried Leah—
49.transliteration: shָׁ֣mָּh kָֽbְr֞vּ aֶt־aַbְrָhָ֗ם vְaֵt֙ shָׂrָ֣h aִshְׁtּ֔vֹ shָׁ֚mָּh kָbְr֣vּ aֶt־yִtsְchָ֔k vְaֵ֖t rִbְkָ֣h aִshְׁtּ֑vֹ vְshָׁ֥mָּh kָbַ֖rְtִּy aֶt־lֵaָֽh׃

49.hebrewText: מִקְנֵ֧ה הַשָּׂדֶ֛ה וְהַמְּעָרָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ מֵאֵ֥ת בְּנֵי־חֵֽת׃
49.englishText: the field and the cave in it, bought from the Hittites.”
49.transliteration: mִkְnֵ֧h hַshָּׂdֶ֛h vְhַmְּaָrָ֥h aֲshֶׁr־bּ֖vֹ mֵaֵ֥t bְּnֵy־chֵֽt׃

49.hebrewText: וַיְכַ֤ל יַעֲקֹב֙ לְצַוֺּ֣ת אֶת־בָּנָ֔יו וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף רַגְלָ֖יו אֶל־הַמִּטָּ֑ה וַיִּגְוַ֖ע וַיֵּאָ֥סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
49.englishText: When Jacob finished his instructions to his sons, he drew his feet into the bed and, breathing his last, he was gathered to his kin.*kin As in Gen. 17.14; 25.8, 17; 35.29; 49.29; Num. 20.24; 31.2; cf. Lev. 21.1–3. NJPS “people,” a trad. yet inconsistent rendering. See the Dictionary under “predecessors.”
49.transliteration: vַyְkַ֤l yַaֲkֹb֙ lְtsַvֺּ֣t aֶt־bָּnָ֔yv vַyֶּaֱsֹ֥ף rַgְlָ֖yv aֶl־hַmִּtָּ֑h vַyִּgְvַ֖a vַyֵּaָ֥sֶף aֶl־aַmָּֽyv׃

50.hebrewText: וַיִּפֹּ֥ל יוֹסֵ֖ף עַל־פְּנֵ֣י אָבִ֑יו וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ עָלָ֖יו וַיִּשַּׁק־לֽוֹ׃
50.englishText: Joseph flung himself upon his father’s face and wept over him and kissed him.
50.transliteration: vַyִּpֹּ֥l yvֹsֵ֖ף aַl־pְּnֵ֣y aָbִ֑yv vַyֵּ֥bְךְּ aָlָ֖yv vַyִּshַּׁk־lֽvֹ׃

50.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֨ו יוֹסֵ֤ף אֶת־עֲבָדָיו֙ אֶת־הָרֹ֣פְאִ֔ים לַחֲנֹ֖ט אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וַיַּחַנְט֥וּ הָרֹפְאִ֖ים אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
50.englishText: Then Joseph ordered the physicians in his service to embalm his father, and the physicians embalmed Israel.
50.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֨v yvֹsֵ֤ף aֶt־aֲbָdָyv֙ aֶt־hָrֹ֣pְaִ֔yם lַchֲnֹ֖t aֶt־aָbִ֑yv vַyַּchַnְt֥vּ hָrֹpְaִ֖yם aֶt־yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

50.hebrewText: וַיִּמְלְאוּ־לוֹ֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם כִּ֛י כֵּ֥ן יִמְלְא֖וּ יְמֵ֣י הַחֲנֻטִ֑ים וַיִּבְכּ֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ מִצְרַ֖יִם שִׁבְעִ֥ים יֽוֹם׃
50.englishText: It required forty days, for such is the full period of embalming. The Egyptians bewailed him seventy days;
50.transliteration: vַyִּmְlְavּ־lvֹ֙ aַrְbָּaִ֣yם y֔vֹם kִּ֛y kֵּ֥ן yִmְlְa֖vּ yְmֵ֣y hַchֲnֻtִ֑yם vַyִּbְkּ֥vּ aֹt֛vֹ mִtsְrַ֖yִם shִׁbְaִ֥yם yֽvֹם׃

50.hebrewText: וַיַּֽעַבְרוּ֙ יְמֵ֣י בְכִית֔וֹ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יוֹסֵ֔ף אֶל־בֵּ֥ית פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם דַּבְּרוּ־נָ֕א בְּאׇזְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
50.englishText: and when the wailing period was over, Joseph spoke to Pharaoh’s court, saying, “Do me this favor, and lay this appeal before Pharaoh:
50.transliteration: vַyַּֽaַbְrvּ֙ yְmֵ֣y bְkִyt֔vֹ vַyְdַbֵּ֣r yvֹsֵ֔ף aֶl־bֵּ֥yt pַּrְaֹ֖h lֵamֹ֑r aִם־nָ֨a mָtsָ֤atִy chֵן֙ bְּaֵ֣ynֵykֶ֔ם dַּbְּrvּ־nָ֕a bְּaׇzְnֵ֥y pַrְaֹ֖h lֵamֹֽr׃

50.hebrewText: אָבִ֞י הִשְׁבִּיעַ֣נִי לֵאמֹ֗ר הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִי֮ מֵת֒ בְּקִבְרִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּרִ֤יתִי לִי֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן שָׁ֖מָּה תִּקְבְּרֵ֑נִי וְעַתָּ֗ה אֶֽעֱלֶה־נָּ֛א וְאֶקְבְּרָ֥ה אֶת־אָבִ֖י וְאָשֽׁוּבָה׃
50.englishText: ‘My father made me swear, saying, “I am about to die. Be sure to bury me in the grave which I made ready for myself in the land of Canaan.” Now, therefore, let me go up and bury my father; then I shall return.’”
50.transliteration: aָbִ֞y hִshְׁbִּyaַ֣nִy lֵamֹ֗r hִnֵּ֣h aָnֹkִy֮ mֵt֒ bְּkִbְrִ֗y aֲshֶׁ֨r kָּrִ֤ytִy lִy֙ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ kְּnַ֔aַן shָׁ֖mָּh tִּkְbְּrֵ֑nִy vְaַtָּ֗h aֶֽaֱlֶh־nָּ֛a vְaֶkְbְּrָ֥h aֶt־aָbִ֖y vְaָshֽׁvּbָh׃

50.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֑ה עֲלֵ֛ה וּקְבֹ֥ר אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁבִּיעֶֽךָ׃
50.englishText: And Pharaoh said, “Go up and bury your father, as he made you promise on oath.”
50.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr pַּrְaֹ֑h aֲlֵ֛h vּkְbֹ֥r aֶt־aָbִ֖yךָ kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r hִshְׁbִּyaֶֽךָ׃

50.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַל יוֹסֵ֖ף לִקְבֹּ֣ר אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וַיַּֽעֲל֨וּ אִתּ֜וֹ כׇּל־עַבְדֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ זִקְנֵ֣י בֵית֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל זִקְנֵ֥י אֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
50.englishText: So Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the officials of Pharaoh, the senior members of his court, and all of Egypt’s dignitaries,
50.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַl yvֹsֵ֖ף lִkְbֹּ֣r aֶt־aָbִ֑yv vַyַּֽaֲl֨vּ aִtּ֜vֹ kׇּl־aַbְdֵ֤y pַrְaֹh֙ zִkְnֵ֣y bֵyt֔vֹ vְkֹ֖l zִkְnֵ֥y aֶֽrֶץ־mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

50.hebrewText: וְכֹל֙ בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵ֔ף וְאֶחָ֖יו וּבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יו רַ֗ק טַפָּם֙ וְצֹאנָ֣ם וּבְקָרָ֔ם עָזְב֖וּ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
50.englishText: together with all of Joseph’s household, his brothers, and his father’s household; only their children, their flocks, and their herds were left in the region of Goshen.
50.transliteration: vְkֹl֙ bֵּ֣yt yvֹsֵ֔ף vְaֶchָ֖yv vּbֵ֣yt aָbִ֑yv rַ֗k tַpָּם֙ vְtsֹanָ֣ם vּbְkָrָ֔ם aָzְb֖vּ bְּaֶ֥rֶץ gֹּֽshֶׁן׃

50.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣עַל עִמּ֔וֹ גַּם־רֶ֖כֶב גַּם־פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וַיְהִ֥י הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה כָּבֵ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
50.englishText: Chariots, too, and horsemen went up with him; it was a very large troop.
50.transliteration: vַyַּ֣aַl aִmּ֔vֹ gַּם־rֶ֖kֶb gַּם־pָּrָshִׁ֑yם vַyְhִ֥y hַֽmַּchֲnֶ֖h kָּbֵ֥d mְaֹֽd׃

50.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ עַד־גֹּ֣רֶן הָאָטָ֗ד אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וַיִּ֨סְפְּדוּ־שָׁ֔ם מִסְפֵּ֛ד גָּד֥וֹל וְכָבֵ֖ד מְאֹ֑ד וַיַּ֧עַשׂ לְאָבִ֛יו אֵ֖בֶל שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
50.englishText: When they came to Goren*Goren Or “the threshing floor of.” ha-Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, they held there a very great and solemn lamentation; and he observed a mourning period of seven days for his father.
50.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֜avּ aַd־gֹּ֣rֶן hָaָtָ֗d aֲshֶׁr֙ bְּaֵ֣bֶr hַyַּrְdֵּ֔ן vַyִּ֨sְpְּdvּ־shָׁ֔ם mִsְpֵּ֛d gָּd֥vֹl vְkָbֵ֖d mְaֹ֑d vַyַּ֧aַshׂ lְaָbִ֛yv aֵ֖bֶl shִׁbְaַ֥t yָmִֽyם׃

50.hebrewText: וַיַּ֡רְא יוֹשֵׁב֩ הָאָ֨רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֜י אֶת־הָאֵ֗בֶל בְּגֹ֙רֶן֙ הָֽאָטָ֔ד וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵֽבֶל־כָּבֵ֥ד זֶ֖ה לְמִצְרָ֑יִם עַל־כֵּ֞ן קָרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ אָבֵ֣ל מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
50.englishText: And when the Canaanite inhabitants of the land saw the mourning at Goren ha-Atad, they said, “This is a solemn mourning on the part of the Egyptians.” That is why it was named Abel-mizraim,*Abel-mizraim Interpreted as “the mourning of the Egyptians.” which is beyond the Jordan.
50.transliteration: vַyַּ֡rְa yvֹshֵׁb֩ hָaָ֨rֶץ hַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֜y aֶt־hָaֵ֗bֶl bְּgֹ֙rֶן֙ hָֽaָtָ֔d vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ aֵֽbֶl־kָּbֵ֥d zֶ֖h lְmִtsְrָ֑yִם aַl־kֵּ֞ן kָrָ֤a shְׁmָhּ֙ aָbֵ֣l mִtsְrַ֔yִם aֲshֶׁ֖r bְּaֵ֥bֶr hַyַּrְdֵּֽן׃

50.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ בָנָ֖יו ל֑וֹ כֵּ֖ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽם׃
50.englishText: Thus his sons did for him as he had instructed them.
50.transliteration: vַyַּaֲshׂ֥vּ bָnָ֖yv l֑vֹ kֵּ֖ן kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r tsִvָּֽם׃

50.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׂא֨וּ אֹת֤וֹ בָנָיו֙ אַ֣רְצָה כְּנַ֔עַן וַיִּקְבְּר֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ בִּמְעָרַ֖ת שְׂדֵ֣ה הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר קָנָה֩ אַבְרָהָ֨ם אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה לַאֲחֻזַּת־קֶ֗בֶר מֵאֵ֛ת עֶפְרֹ֥ן הַחִתִּ֖י עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵֽא׃
50.englishText: His sons carried him to the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, the field near Mamre, which Abraham had bought for a burial site from Ephron the Hittite.
50.transliteration: vַyִּshְׂa֨vּ aֹt֤vֹ bָnָyv֙ aַ֣rְtsָh kְּnַ֔aַן vַyִּkְbְּr֣vּ aֹt֔vֹ bִּmְaָrַ֖t shְׂdֵ֣h hַmַּkְpֵּlָ֑h aֲshֶׁ֣r kָnָh֩ aַbְrָhָ֨ם aֶt־hַshָּׂdֶ֜h lַaֲchֻzַּt־kֶ֗bֶr mֵaֵ֛t aֶpְrֹ֥ן hַchִtִּ֖y aַl־pְּnֵ֥y mַmְrֵֽa׃

50.hebrewText: וַיָּ֨שׇׁב יוֹסֵ֤ף מִצְרַ֙יְמָה֙ ה֣וּא וְאֶחָ֔יו וְכׇל־הָעֹלִ֥ים אִתּ֖וֹ לִקְבֹּ֣ר אֶת־אָבִ֑יו אַחֲרֵ֖י קׇבְר֥וֹ אֶת־אָבִֽיו׃
50.englishText: After burying his father, Joseph returned to Egypt, he and his brothers and all who had gone up with him to bury his father.
50.transliteration: vַyָּ֨shׇׁb yvֹsֵ֤ף mִtsְrַ֙yְmָh֙ h֣vּa vְaֶchָ֔yv vְkׇl־hָaֹlִ֥yם aִtּ֖vֹ lִkְbֹּ֣r aֶt־aָbִ֑yv aַchֲrֵ֖y kׇbְr֥vֹ aֶt־aָbִֽyv׃

50.hebrewText: וַיִּרְא֤וּ אֲחֵֽי־יוֹסֵף֙ כִּי־מֵ֣ת אֲבִיהֶ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ ל֥וּ יִשְׂטְמֵ֖נוּ יוֹסֵ֑ף וְהָשֵׁ֤ב יָשִׁיב֙ לָ֔נוּ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר גָּמַ֖לְנוּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
50.englishText: When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, “What if Joseph still bears a grudge against us and pays us back for all the wrong that we did him!”
50.transliteration: vַyִּrְa֤vּ aֲchֵֽy־yvֹsֵף֙ kִּy־mֵ֣t aֲbִyhֶ֔ם vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ l֥vּ yִshְׂtְmֵ֖nvּ yvֹsֵ֑ף vְhָshֵׁ֤b yָshִׁyb֙ lָ֔nvּ aֵ֚t kׇּl־hָ֣rָaָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r gָּmַ֖lְnvּ aֹtֽvֹ׃

50.hebrewText: וַיְצַוּ֕וּ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף לֵאמֹ֑ר אָבִ֣יךָ צִוָּ֔ה לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹת֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
50.englishText: So they sent this message to Joseph, “Before his death your father left this instruction:
50.transliteration: vַyְtsַvּ֕vּ aֶl־yvֹsֵ֖ף lֵamֹ֑r aָbִ֣yךָ tsִvָּ֔h lִpְnֵ֥y mvֹt֖vֹ lֵamֹֽr׃

50.hebrewText: כֹּֽה־תֹאמְר֣וּ לְיוֹסֵ֗ף אָ֣נָּ֡א שָׂ֣א נָ֠א פֶּ֣שַׁע אַחֶ֤יךָ וְחַטָּאתָם֙ כִּי־רָעָ֣ה גְמָל֔וּךָ וְעַתָּה֙ שָׂ֣א נָ֔א לְפֶ֥שַׁע עַבְדֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֑יךָ וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ יוֹסֵ֖ף בְּדַבְּרָ֥ם אֵלָֽיו׃
50.englishText: So shall you say to Joseph, ‘Forgive, I urge you, the offense and guilt of your brothers who treated you so harshly.’ Therefore, please forgive the offense of the servants of the God of your father’s [house].” And Joseph was in tears as they spoke to him.
50.transliteration: kֹּֽh־tֹamְr֣vּ lְyvֹsֵ֗ף aָ֣nָּ֡a shָׂ֣a nָ֠a pֶּ֣shַׁa aַchֶ֤yךָ vְchַtָּatָם֙ kִּy־rָaָ֣h gְmָl֔vּךָ vְaַtָּh֙ shָׂ֣a nָ֔a lְpֶ֥shַׁa aַbְdֵ֖y aֱlֹhֵ֣y aָbִ֑yךָ vַyֵּ֥bְךְּ yvֹsֵ֖ף bְּdַbְּrָ֥ם aֵlָֽyv׃

50.hebrewText: וַיֵּלְכוּ֙ גַּם־אֶחָ֔יו וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ לְפָנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ הִנֶּ֥נּֽוּ לְךָ֖ לַעֲבָדִֽים׃
50.englishText: His brothers went to him themselves, flung themselves before him, and said, “We are prepared to be your slaves.”
50.transliteration: vַyֵּlְkvּ֙ gַּם־aֶchָ֔yv vַֽyִּpְּl֖vּ lְpָnָ֑yv vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ hִnֶּ֥nּֽvּ lְךָ֖ lַaֲbָdִֽyם׃

50.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֛ם יוֹסֵ֖ף אַל־תִּירָ֑אוּ כִּ֛י הֲתַ֥חַת אֱלֹהִ֖ים אָֽנִי׃
50.englishText: But Joseph said to them, “Have no fear! Am I a substitute for God?
50.transliteration: vַyֹּ֧amֶr aֲlֵhֶ֛ם yvֹsֵ֖ף aַl־tִּyrָ֑avּ kִּ֛y hֲtַ֥chַt aֱlֹhִ֖yם aָֽnִy׃

50.hebrewText: וְאַתֶּ֕ם חֲשַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עָלַ֖י רָעָ֑ה אֱלֹהִים֙ חֲשָׁבָ֣הּ לְטֹבָ֔ה לְמַ֗עַן עֲשֹׂ֛ה כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה לְהַחֲיֹ֥ת עַם־רָֽב׃
50.englishText: Besides, although you intended me harm, God intended it for good, so as to bring about the present result—the survival of many people.
50.transliteration: vְaַtֶּ֕ם chֲshַׁbְtֶּ֥ם aָlַ֖y rָaָ֑h aֱlֹhִyם֙ chֲshָׁbָ֣hּ lְtֹbָ֔h lְmַ֗aַן aֲshֹׂ֛h kַּyּ֥vֹם hַzֶּ֖h lְhַchֲyֹ֥t aַם־rָֽb׃

50.hebrewText: וְעַתָּה֙ אַל־תִּירָ֔אוּ אָנֹכִ֛י אֲכַלְכֵּ֥ל אֶתְכֶ֖ם וְאֶֽת־טַפְּכֶ֑ם וַיְנַחֵ֣ם אוֹתָ֔ם וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר עַל־לִבָּֽם׃
50.englishText: And so, fear not. I will sustain you and your dependents.”*dependents NJPS “children,” trad. “little ones.” See the Dictionary under ṭaph. Thus he reassured them, speaking kindly to them.
50.transliteration: vְaַtָּh֙ aַl־tִּyrָ֔avּ aָnֹkִ֛y aֲkַlְkֵּ֥l aֶtְkֶ֖ם vְaֶֽt־tַpְּkֶ֑ם vַyְnַchֵ֣ם avֹtָ֔ם vַyְdַbֵּ֖r aַl־lִbָּֽם׃

50.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב יוֹסֵף֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם ה֖וּא וּבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יו וַיְחִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף מֵאָ֥ה וָעֶ֖שֶׂר שָׁנִֽים׃
50.englishText: So Joseph and his father’s household remained in Egypt. Joseph lived one hundred and ten years.
50.transliteration: vַyֵּ֤shֶׁb yvֹsֵף֙ bְּmִtsְrַ֔yִם h֖vּa vּbֵ֣yt aָbִ֑yv vַyְchִ֣y yvֹsֵ֔ף mֵaָ֥h vָaֶ֖shֶׂr shָׁnִֽyם׃

50.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤רְא יוֹסֵף֙ לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם בְּנֵ֖י שִׁלֵּשִׁ֑ים גַּ֗ם בְּנֵ֤י מָכִיר֙ בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה יֻלְּד֖וּ עַל־בִּרְכֵּ֥י יוֹסֵֽף׃
50.englishText: Joseph lived to see children of the third generation of Ephraim; the children of Machir son of Manasseh were likewise born upon Joseph’s knees.
50.transliteration: vַyַּ֤rְa yvֹsֵף֙ lְaֶpְrַ֔yִם bְּnֵ֖y shִׁlֵּshִׁ֑yם gַּ֗ם bְּnֵ֤y mָkִyr֙ bֶּן־mְnַshֶּׁ֔h yֻlְּd֖vּ aַl־bִּrְkֵּ֥y yvֹsֵֽף׃

50.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־אֶחָ֔יו אָנֹכִ֖י מֵ֑ת וֵֽאלֹהִ֞ים פָּקֹ֧ד יִפְקֹ֣ד אֶתְכֶ֗ם וְהֶעֱלָ֤ה אֶתְכֶם֙ מִן־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֛ע לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
50.englishText: At length, Joseph said to his brothers, “I am about to die. God will surely take notice of you and bring you up from this land to the land promised on oath to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.”
50.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yvֹsֵף֙ aֶl־aֶchָ֔yv aָnֹkִ֖y mֵ֑t vֵֽalֹhִ֞yם pָּkֹ֧d yִpְkֹ֣d aֶtְkֶ֗ם vְhֶaֱlָ֤h aֶtְkֶם֙ mִן־hָaָ֣rֶץ hַzֹּ֔at aֶl־hָaָ֕rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֥r nִshְׁbַּ֛a lְaַbְrָhָ֥ם lְyִtsְchָ֖k vּֽlְyַaֲkֹֽb׃

50.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁבַּ֣ע יוֹסֵ֔ף אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר פָּקֹ֨ד יִפְקֹ֤ד אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהַעֲלִתֶ֥ם אֶת־עַצְמֹתַ֖י מִזֶּֽה׃
50.englishText: So Joseph made the sons of Israel swear, saying, “When God has taken notice of you, you shall carry up my bones from here.”
50.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁbַּ֣a yvֹsֵ֔ף aֶt־bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l lֵamֹ֑r pָּkֹ֨d yִpְkֹ֤d aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶtְkֶ֔ם vְhַaֲlִtֶ֥ם aֶt־aַtsְmֹtַ֖y mִzֶּֽh׃

50.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣מׇת יוֹסֵ֔ף בֶּן־מֵאָ֥ה וָעֶ֖שֶׂר שָׁנִ֑ים וַיַּחַנְט֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ וַיִּ֥ישֶׂם בָּאָר֖וֹן בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
50.englishText: Joseph died at the age of one hundred and ten years; and he was embalmed and placed in a coffin in Egypt.
50.transliteration: vַyָּ֣mׇt yvֹsֵ֔ף bֶּן־mֵaָ֥h vָaֶ֖shֶׂr shָׁnִ֑yם vַyַּchַnְt֣vּ aֹt֔vֹ vַyִּ֥yshֶׂם bָּaָr֖vֹן bְּmִtsְrָֽyִם׃

shemot.name: Shemot
shemot.summary: The enslavement of the Israelites in Egypt, the birth and early life of Moses, the burning bush, Moses' mission, and the first meeting with Pharaoh.

1.hebrewText: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַבָּאִ֖ים מִצְרָ֑יְמָה אֵ֣ת יַעֲקֹ֔ב אִ֥ישׁ וּבֵית֖וֹ בָּֽאוּ׃
1.englishText: These are the names of the sons of Israel who came to Egypt with Jacob, each coming with his household:
1.transliteration: vְaֵ֗lֶּh shְׁmvֹt֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l hַbָּaִ֖yם mִtsְrָ֑yְmָh aֵ֣t yַaֲkֹ֔b aִ֥yshׁ vּbֵyt֖vֹ bָּֽavּ׃

1.hebrewText: רְאוּבֵ֣ן שִׁמְע֔וֹן לֵוִ֖י וִיהוּדָֽה׃
1.englishText: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;
1.transliteration: rְavּbֵ֣ן shִׁmְa֔vֹן lֵvִ֖y vִyhvּdָֽh׃

1.hebrewText: יִשָּׂשכָ֥ר זְבוּלֻ֖ן וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃
1.englishText: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;
1.transliteration: yִshָּׂshkָ֥r zְbvּlֻ֖ן vּbִnְyָmִֽן׃

1.hebrewText: דָּ֥ן וְנַפְתָּלִ֖י גָּ֥ד וְאָשֵֽׁר׃
1.englishText: Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
1.transliteration: dָּ֥ן vְnַpְtָּlִ֖y gָּ֥d vְaָshֵֽׁr׃

1.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִ֗י כׇּל־נֶ֛פֶשׁ יֹצְאֵ֥י יֶֽרֶךְ־יַעֲקֹ֖ב שִׁבְעִ֣ים נָ֑פֶשׁ וְיוֹסֵ֖ף הָיָ֥ה בְמִצְרָֽיִם׃
1.englishText: The total number of persons that were of Jacob’s issue came to seventy, Joseph being already in Egypt.
1.transliteration: vַֽyְhִ֗y kׇּl־nֶ֛pֶshׁ yֹtsְaֵ֥y yֶֽrֶךְ־yַaֲkֹ֖b shִׁbְaִ֣yם nָ֑pֶshׁ vְyvֹsֵ֖ף hָyָ֥h bְmִtsְrָֽyִם׃

1.hebrewText: וַיָּ֤מׇת יוֹסֵף֙ וְכׇל־אֶחָ֔יו וְכֹ֖ל הַדּ֥וֹר הַהֽוּא׃
1.englishText: Joseph died, and all his brothers, and all that generation.
1.transliteration: vַyָּ֤mׇt yvֹsֵף֙ vְkׇl־aֶchָ֔yv vְkֹ֖l hַdּ֥vֹr hַhֽvּa׃

1.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל פָּר֧וּ וַֽיִּשְׁרְצ֛וּ וַיִּרְבּ֥וּ וַיַּֽעַצְמ֖וּ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ אֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
1.englishText: But the Israelites were fertile and prolific; they multiplied and increased very greatly, so that the land was filled with them.
1.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l pָּr֧vּ vַֽyִּshְׁrְts֛vּ vַyִּrְbּ֥vּ vַyַּֽaַtsְm֖vּ bִּmְaֹ֣d mְaֹ֑d vַtִּmָּlֵ֥a hָaָ֖rֶץ aֹtָֽם׃ {p}

1.hebrewText: וַיָּ֥קׇם מֶֽלֶךְ־חָדָ֖שׁ עַל־מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָדַ֖ע אֶת־יוֹסֵֽף׃
1.englishText: A new king arose over Egypt who did not know Joseph.
1.transliteration: vַyָּ֥kׇם mֶֽlֶךְ־chָdָ֖shׁ aַl־mִtsְrָ֑yִם aֲshֶׁ֥r lֹֽa־yָdַ֖a aֶt־yvֹsֵֽף׃

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֶל־עַמּ֑וֹ הִנֵּ֗ה עַ֚ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רַ֥ב וְעָצ֖וּם מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
1.englishText: And he said to his people, “Look, the Israelite people are much too numerous for us.
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr aֶl־aַmּ֑vֹ hִnֵּ֗h aַ֚ם bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l rַ֥b vְaָts֖vּם mִmֶּֽnּvּ׃

1.hebrewText: הָ֥בָה נִֽתְחַכְּמָ֖ה ל֑וֹ פֶּן־יִרְבֶּ֗ה וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־תִקְרֶ֤אנָה מִלְחָמָה֙ וְנוֹסַ֤ף גַּם־הוּא֙ עַל־שֹׂ֣נְאֵ֔ינוּ וְנִלְחַם־בָּ֖נוּ וְעָלָ֥ה מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
1.englishText: Let us deal shrewdly with them, so that they may not increase; otherwise in the event of war they may join our enemies in fighting against us and rise from the ground.”*rise from the ground Meaning perhaps from their wretched condition, cf. Hos. 2.2; or “gain ascendancy over the country.” Others “get them up out of the land.”
1.transliteration: hָ֥bָh nִֽtְchַkְּmָ֖h l֑vֹ pֶּן־yִrְbֶּ֗h vְhָyָ֞h kִּֽy־tִkְrֶ֤anָh mִlְchָmָh֙ vְnvֹsַ֤ף gַּם־hvּa֙ aַl־shֹׂ֣nְaֵ֔ynvּ vְnִlְchַם־bָּ֖nvּ vְaָlָ֥h mִן־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

1.hebrewText: וַיָּשִׂ֤ימוּ עָלָיו֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מִסִּ֔ים לְמַ֥עַן עַנֹּת֖וֹ בְּסִבְלֹתָ֑ם וַיִּ֜בֶן עָרֵ֤י מִסְכְּנוֹת֙ לְפַרְעֹ֔ה אֶת־פִּתֹ֖ם וְאֶת־רַעַמְסֵֽס׃
1.englishText: So they set taskmasters over them to oppress them with forced labor; and they built garrison cities*garrison cities Others “store cities.” for Pharaoh: Pithom and Raamses.
1.transliteration: vַyָּshִׂ֤ymvּ aָlָyv֙ shָׂrֵ֣y mִsִּ֔yם lְmַ֥aַן aַnֹּt֖vֹ bְּsִbְlֹtָ֑ם vַyִּ֜bֶן aָrֵ֤y mִsְkְּnvֹt֙ lְpַrְaֹ֔h aֶt־pִּtֹ֖ם vְaֶt־rַaַmְsֵֽs׃

1.hebrewText: וְכַאֲשֶׁר֙ יְעַנּ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ כֵּ֥ן יִרְבֶּ֖ה וְכֵ֣ן יִפְרֹ֑ץ וַיָּקֻ֕צוּ מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
1.englishText: But the more they were oppressed, the more they increased and spread out, so that the [Egyptians] came to dread the Israelites.
1.transliteration: vְkַaֲshֶׁr֙ yְaַnּ֣vּ aֹt֔vֹ kֵּ֥ן yִrְbֶּ֖h vְkֵ֣ן yִpְrֹ֑ץ vַyָּkֻ֕tsvּ mִpְּnֵ֖y bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

1.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲבִ֧דוּ מִצְרַ֛יִם אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃
1.englishText: The Egyptians ruthlessly imposed upon the Israelites
1.transliteration: vַyַּaֲbִ֧dvּ mִtsְrַ֛yִם aֶt־bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l bְּpָֽrֶךְ׃

1.hebrewText: וַיְמָרְר֨וּ אֶת־חַיֵּיהֶ֜ם בַּעֲבֹדָ֣ה קָשָׁ֗ה בְּחֹ֙מֶר֙ וּבִלְבֵנִ֔ים וּבְכׇל־עֲבֹדָ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־עֲבֹ֣דָתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־עָבְד֥וּ בָהֶ֖ם בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃
1.englishText: the various labors that they made them perform. Ruthlessly*the various labors that they made them perform. Ruthlessly Brought up from the end of the verse for clarity. they made life bitter for them with harsh labor at mortar and bricks and with all sorts of tasks in the field.
1.transliteration: vַyְmָrְr֨vּ aֶt־chַyֵּyhֶ֜ם bַּaֲbֹdָ֣h kָshָׁ֗h bְּchֹ֙mֶr֙ vּbִlְbֵnִ֔yם vּbְkׇl־aֲbֹdָ֖h bַּshָּׂdֶ֑h aֵ֚t kׇּl־aֲbֹ֣dָtָ֔ם aֲshֶׁr־aָbְd֥vּ bָhֶ֖ם bְּpָֽrֶךְ׃

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֖ת הָֽעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאַחַת֙ שִׁפְרָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית פּוּעָֽה׃
1.englishText: The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, one of whom was named Shiphrah and the other Puah,
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ mִtsְrַ֔yִם lַֽmְyַlְּdֹ֖t hָֽaִbְrִyֹּ֑t aֲshֶׁ֨r shֵׁ֤ם hָֽaַchַt֙ shִׁpְrָ֔h vְshֵׁ֥ם hַshֵּׁnִ֖yt pּvּaָֽh׃

1.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בְּיַלֶּדְכֶן֙ אֶת־הָֽעִבְרִיּ֔וֹת וּרְאִיתֶ֖ן עַל־הָאׇבְנָ֑יִם אִם־בֵּ֥ן הוּא֙ וַהֲמִתֶּ֣ן אֹת֔וֹ וְאִם־בַּ֥ת הִ֖וא וָחָֽיָה׃
1.englishText: saying, “When you deliver the Hebrew women, look at the birthstool:*birthstool More precisely, the brick or stone supports used by Egyptian women during childbirth. if it is a boy, kill him; if it is a girl, let her live.”
1.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr bְּyַlֶּdְkֶן֙ aֶt־hָֽaִbְrִyּ֔vֹt vּrְaִytֶ֖ן aַl־hָaׇbְnָ֑yִם aִם־bֵּ֥ן hvּa֙ vַhֲmִtֶּ֣ן aֹt֔vֹ vְaִם־bַּ֥t hִ֖va vָchָֽyָh׃

1.hebrewText: וַתִּירֶ֤אןָ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹת֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְלֹ֣א עָשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ן מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם וַתְּחַיֶּ֖יןָ אֶת־הַיְלָדִֽים׃
1.englishText: The midwives, fearing God, did not do as the king of Egypt had told them; they let the boys live.
1.transliteration: vַtִּyrֶ֤aןָ hַֽmְyַlְּdֹt֙ aֶt־hָ֣aֱlֹhִ֔yם vְlֹ֣a aָshׂ֔vּ kַּaֲshֶׁ֛r dִּbֶּ֥r aֲlֵyhֶ֖ן mֶ֣lֶךְ mִtsְrָ֑yִם vַtְּchַyֶּ֖yןָ aֶt־hַyְlָdִֽyם׃

1.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֤א מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֔ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ן מַדּ֥וּעַ עֲשִׂיתֶ֖ן הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַתְּחַיֶּ֖יןָ אֶת־הַיְלָדִֽים׃
1.englishText: So the king of Egypt summoned the midwives and said to them, “Why have you done this thing, letting the boys live?”
1.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֤a mֶֽlֶךְ־mִtsְrַ֙yִם֙ lַֽmְyַlְּdֹ֔t vַyֹּ֣amֶr lָhֶ֔ן mַdּ֥vּaַ aֲshִׂytֶ֖ן hַdָּbָ֣r hַzֶּ֑h vַtְּchַyֶּ֖yןָ aֶt־hַyְlָdִֽyם׃

1.hebrewText: וַתֹּאמַ֤רְןָ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹת֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה כִּ֣י לֹ֧א כַנָּשִׁ֛ים הַמִּצְרִיֹּ֖ת הָֽעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת כִּֽי־חָי֣וֹת הֵ֔נָּה בְּטֶ֨רֶם תָּב֧וֹא אֲלֵהֶ֛ן*(בכתר ארם צובה היה כתוב אֲלֵיהֶ֛ן) הַמְיַלֶּ֖דֶת וְיָלָֽדוּ׃
1.englishText: The midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women: they are vigorous. Before the midwife can come to them, they have given birth.”
1.transliteration: vַtֹּamַ֤rְןָ hַֽmְyַlְּdֹt֙ aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֔h kִּ֣y lֹ֧a kַnָּshִׁ֛yם hַmִּtsְrִyֹּ֖t hָֽaִbְrִyֹּ֑t kִּֽy־chָy֣vֹt hֵ֔nָּh bְּtֶ֨rֶם tָּb֧vֹa aֲlֵhֶ֛ן*(bktr arם tsvbh hyh ktvb aֲlֵyhֶ֛ן) hַmְyַlֶּ֖dֶt vְyָlָֽdvּ׃

1.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥יטֶב אֱלֹהִ֖ים לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֑ת וַיִּ֧רֶב הָעָ֛ם וַיַּֽעַצְמ֖וּ מְאֹֽד׃
1.englishText: And God dealt well with the midwives; and the people multiplied and increased greatly.
1.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥ytֶb aֱlֹhִ֖yם lַֽmְyַlְּdֹ֑t vַyִּ֧rֶb hָaָ֛ם vַyַּֽaַtsְm֖vּ mְaֹֽd׃

1.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֕י כִּֽי־יָרְא֥וּ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֖ת אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיַּ֥עַשׂ לָהֶ֖ם בָּתִּֽים׃
1.englishText: And [God] established households*households Meaning of Heb. batim uncertain. for the midwives, because they feared God.
1.transliteration: vַyְhִ֕y kִּֽy־yָrְa֥vּ hַֽmְyַlְּdֹ֖t aֶt־hָaֱlֹhִ֑yם vַyַּ֥aַshׂ lָhֶ֖ם bָּtִּֽyם׃

1.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֣ו פַּרְעֹ֔ה לְכׇל־עַמּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹ֑ר כׇּל־הַבֵּ֣ן הַיִּלּ֗וֹד הַיְאֹ֙רָה֙ תַּשְׁלִיכֻ֔הוּ וְכׇל־הַבַּ֖ת תְּחַיּֽוּן׃ {פ}
1.englishText: Then Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, “Every boy that is born you shall throw into the Nile, but let every girl live.”
1.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֣v pַּrְaֹ֔h lְkׇl־aַmּ֖vֹ lֵamֹ֑r kׇּl־hַbֵּ֣ן hַyִּlּ֗vֹd hַyְaֹ֙rָh֙ tַּshְׁlִykֻ֔hvּ vְkׇl־hַbַּ֖t tְּchַyּֽvּן׃ {p}

2.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אִ֖ישׁ מִבֵּ֣ית לֵוִ֑י וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־בַּת־לֵוִֽי׃
2.englishText: A certain member*member NJPS “man.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. of the house of Levi went and took [into his household as his wife] a woman of Levi.
2.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥lֶךְ aִ֖yshׁ mִbֵּ֣yt lֵvִ֑y vַyִּkַּ֖ch aֶt־bַּt־lֵvִֽy׃

2.hebrewText: וַתַּ֥הַר הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתֵּ֤רֶא אֹתוֹ֙ כִּי־ט֣וֹב ה֔וּא וַֽתִּצְפְּנֵ֖הוּ שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה יְרָחִֽים׃
2.englishText: The woman conceived and bore a son; and when she saw how beautiful he was, she hid him for three months.
2.transliteration: vַtַּ֥hַr hָaִshָּׁ֖h vַtֵּ֣lֶd bֵּ֑ן vַtֵּ֤rֶa aֹtvֹ֙ kִּy־t֣vֹb h֔vּa vַֽtִּtsְpְּnֵ֖hvּ shְׁlֹshָׁ֥h yְrָchִֽyם׃

2.hebrewText: וְלֹא־יָכְלָ֣ה עוֹד֮ הַצְּפִינוֹ֒ וַתִּֽקַּֽח־לוֹ֙ תֵּ֣בַת גֹּ֔מֶא וַתַּחְמְרָ֥הֿ בַחֵמָ֖ר וּבַזָּ֑פֶת וַתָּ֤שֶׂם בָּהּ֙ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד וַתָּ֥שֶׂם בַּסּ֖וּף עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
2.englishText: When she could hide him no longer, she got a wicker basket for him and caulked it with bitumen and pitch. She put the child into it and placed it among the reeds by the bank of the Nile.
2.transliteration: vְlֹa־yָkְlָ֣h avֹd֮ hַtsְּpִynvֹ֒ vַtִּֽkַּֽch־lvֹ֙ tֵּ֣bַt gֹּ֔mֶa vַtַּchְmְrָ֥hֿ bַchֵmָ֖r vּbַzָּ֑pֶt vַtָּ֤shֶׂם bָּhּ֙ aֶt־hַyֶּ֔lֶd vַtָּ֥shֶׂם bַּsּ֖vּף aַl־shְׂpַ֥t hַyְaֹֽr׃

2.hebrewText: וַתֵּתַצַּ֥ב אֲחֹת֖וֹ מֵרָחֹ֑ק לְדֵעָ֕ה מַה־יֵּעָשֶׂ֖ה לֽוֹ׃
2.englishText: And his sister stationed herself at a distance, to learn what would befall him.
2.transliteration: vַtֵּtַtsַּ֥b aֲchֹt֖vֹ mֵrָchֹ֑k lְdֵaָ֕h mַh־yֵּaָshֶׂ֖h lֽvֹ׃

2.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֤רֶד בַּת־פַּרְעֹה֙ לִרְחֹ֣ץ עַל־הַיְאֹ֔ר וְנַעֲרֹתֶ֥יהָ הֹלְכֹ֖ת עַל־יַ֣ד הַיְאֹ֑ר וַתֵּ֤רֶא אֶת־הַתֵּבָה֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַסּ֔וּף וַתִּשְׁלַ֥ח אֶת־אֲמָתָ֖הּ וַתִּקָּחֶֽהָ׃
2.englishText: The daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe in the Nile, while her maidens walked along the Nile. She spied the basket among the reeds and sent her slave girl to fetch it.
2.transliteration: vַtֵּ֤rֶd bַּt־pַּrְaֹh֙ lִrְchֹ֣ץ aַl־hַyְaֹ֔r vְnַaֲrֹtֶ֥yhָ hֹlְkֹ֖t aַl־yַ֣d hַyְaֹ֑r vַtֵּ֤rֶa aֶt־hַtֵּbָh֙ bְּt֣vֹךְ hַsּ֔vּף vַtִּshְׁlַ֥ch aֶt־aֲmָtָ֖hּ vַtִּkָּchֶֽhָ׃

2.hebrewText: וַתִּפְתַּח֙ וַתִּרְאֵ֣הוּ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד וְהִנֵּה־נַ֖עַר בֹּכֶ֑ה וַתַּחְמֹ֣ל עָלָ֔יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר מִיַּלְדֵ֥י הָֽעִבְרִ֖ים זֶֽה׃
2.englishText: When she opened it, she saw that it was a child, a boy crying. She took pity on it and said, “This must be a Hebrew child.”
2.transliteration: vַtִּpְtַּch֙ vַtִּrְaֵ֣hvּ aֶt־hַyֶּ֔lֶd vְhִnֵּh־nַ֖aַr bֹּkֶ֑h vַtַּchְmֹ֣l aָlָ֔yv vַtֹּ֕amֶr mִyַּlְdֵ֥y hָֽaִbְrִ֖yם zֶֽh׃

2.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֲחֹתוֹ֮ אֶל־בַּת־פַּרְעֹה֒ הַאֵלֵ֗ךְ וְקָרָ֤אתִי לָךְ֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה מֵינֶ֔קֶת מִ֖ן הָעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת וְתֵינִ֥ק לָ֖ךְ אֶת־הַיָּֽלֶד׃
2.englishText: Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and get you a Hebrew nurse to suckle the child for you?”
2.transliteration: vַtֹּ֣amֶr aֲchֹtvֹ֮ aֶl־bַּt־pַּrְaֹh֒ hַaֵlֵ֗ךְ vְkָrָ֤atִy lָךְ֙ aִshָּׁ֣h mֵynֶ֔kֶt mִ֖ן hָaִbְrִyֹּ֑t vְtֵynִ֥k lָ֖ךְ aֶt־hַyָּֽlֶd׃

2.hebrewText: וַתֹּֽאמֶר־לָ֥הּ בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵ֑כִי וַתֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ הָֽעַלְמָ֔ה וַתִּקְרָ֖א אֶת־אֵ֥ם הַיָּֽלֶד׃
2.englishText: And Pharaoh’s daughter answered, “Yes.” So the girl went and called the child’s mother.
2.transliteration: vַtֹּֽamֶr־lָ֥hּ bַּt־pַּrְaֹ֖h lֵ֑kִy vַtֵּ֙lֶךְ֙ hָֽaַlְmָ֔h vַtִּkְrָ֖a aֶt־aֵ֥ם hַyָּֽlֶd׃

2.hebrewText: וַתֹּ֧אמֶר לָ֣הּ בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֗ה הֵילִ֜יכִי אֶת־הַיֶּ֤לֶד הַזֶּה֙ וְהֵינִקִ֣הוּ לִ֔י וַאֲנִ֖י אֶתֵּ֣ן אֶת־שְׂכָרֵ֑ךְ וַתִּקַּ֧ח הָאִשָּׁ֛ה הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַתְּנִיקֵֽהוּ׃
2.englishText: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child and nurse it for me, and I will pay your wages.” So the woman took the child and nursed it.
2.transliteration: vַtֹּ֧amֶr lָ֣hּ bַּt־pַּrְaֹ֗h hֵylִ֜ykִy aֶt־hַyֶּ֤lֶd hַzֶּh֙ vְhֵynִkִ֣hvּ lִ֔y vַaֲnִ֖y aֶtֵּ֣ן aֶt־shְׂkָrֵ֑ךְ vַtִּkַּ֧ch hָaִshָּׁ֛h hַyֶּ֖lֶd vַtְּnִykֵֽhvּ׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּגְדַּ֣ל הַיֶּ֗לֶד וַתְּבִאֵ֙הוּ֙ לְבַת־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַֽיְהִי־לָ֖הּ לְבֵ֑ן וַתִּקְרָ֤א שְׁמוֹ֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַתֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֥י מִן־הַמַּ֖יִם מְשִׁיתִֽהוּ׃
2.englishText: When the child grew up, she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, who made him her son. She named him Moses,*Moses Heb. Mosheh from Egyptian for “born of”; here associated with mashah “draw out.” explaining, “I drew him out of the water.”
2.transliteration: vַyִּgְdַּ֣l hַyֶּ֗lֶd vַtְּbִaֵ֙hvּ֙ lְbַt־pַּrְaֹ֔h vַֽyְhִy־lָ֖hּ lְbֵ֑ן vַtִּkְrָ֤a shְׁmvֹ֙ mֹshֶׁ֔h vַtֹּ֕amֶr kִּ֥y mִן־hַmַּ֖yִם mְshִׁytִֽhvּ׃

2.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֗ם וַיִּגְדַּ֤ל מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיֵּצֵ֣א אֶל־אֶחָ֔יו וַיַּ֖רְא בְּסִבְלֹתָ֑ם וַיַּרְא֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י מַכֶּ֥ה אִישׁ־עִבְרִ֖י מֵאֶחָֽיו׃
2.englishText: Some time after that, when Moses had grown up, he went out to his kinsfolk and witnessed their labors. He saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his kinsmen.
2.transliteration: vַyְhִ֣y ׀ bַּyָּmִ֣yם hָhֵ֗ם vַyִּgְdַּ֤l mֹshֶׁh֙ vַyֵּtsֵ֣a aֶl־aֶchָ֔yv vַyַּ֖rְa bְּsִbְlֹtָ֑ם vַyַּrְa֙ aִ֣yshׁ mִtsְrִ֔y mַkֶּ֥h aִyshׁ־aִbְrִ֖y mֵaֶchָֽyv׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּ֤פֶן כֹּה֙ וָכֹ֔ה וַיַּ֖רְא כִּ֣י אֵ֣ין אִ֑ישׁ וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־הַמִּצְרִ֔י וַֽיִּטְמְנֵ֖הוּ בַּחֽוֹל׃
2.englishText: He turned this way and that and, seeing no one about, he struck down the Egyptian and hid him in the sand.
2.transliteration: vַyִּ֤pֶן kֹּh֙ vָkֹ֔h vַyַּ֖rְa kִּ֣y aֵ֣yן aִ֑yshׁ vַyַּךְ֙ aֶt־hַmִּtsְrִ֔y vַֽyִּtְmְnֵ֖hvּ bַּchֽvֹl׃

2.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵא֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וְהִנֵּ֛ה שְׁנֵֽי־אֲנָשִׁ֥ים עִבְרִ֖ים נִצִּ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לָֽרָשָׁ֔ע לָ֥מָּה תַכֶּ֖ה רֵעֶֽךָ׃
2.englishText: When he went out the next day, he found two Hebrews fighting; so he said to the offender, “Why do you strike your fellow?”
2.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵa֙ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshֵּׁnִ֔y vְhִnֵּ֛h shְׁnֵֽy־aֲnָshִׁ֥yם aִbְrִ֖yם nִtsִּ֑yם vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lָֽrָshָׁ֔a lָ֥mָּh tַkֶּ֖h rֵaֶֽךָ׃

2.hebrewText: וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר מִ֣י שָֽׂמְךָ֞ לְאִ֨ישׁ שַׂ֤ר וְשֹׁפֵט֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ הַלְהׇרְגֵ֙נִי֙ אַתָּ֣ה אֹמֵ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָרַ֖גְתָּ אֶת־הַמִּצְרִ֑י וַיִּירָ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר אָכֵ֖ן נוֹדַ֥ע הַדָּבָֽר׃
2.englishText: He retorted, “Who made you chief and ruler over us? Do you mean to kill me as you killed the Egyptian?” Moses was frightened, and thought: Then the matter is known!
2.transliteration: vַ֠yֹּ֠amֶr mִ֣y shָֽׂmְךָ֞ lְaִ֨yshׁ shַׂ֤r vְshֹׁpֵt֙ aָlֵ֔ynvּ hַlְhׇrְgֵ֙nִy֙ aַtָּ֣h aֹmֵ֔r kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r hָrַ֖gְtָּ aֶt־hַmִּtsְrִ֑y vַyִּyrָ֤a mֹshֶׁh֙ vַyֹּamַ֔r aָkֵ֖ן nvֹdַ֥a hַdָּbָֽr׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ לַהֲרֹ֣ג אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּבְרַ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בְּאֶֽרֶץ־מִדְיָ֖ן וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב עַֽל־הַבְּאֵֽר׃
2.englishText: When Pharaoh learned of the matter, he sought to kill Moses; but Moses fled from Pharaoh. He arrived*arrived Lit. “sat” or “settled.” in the land of Midian, and sat down beside a well.
2.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֤a pַּrְaֹh֙ aֶt־hַdָּbָ֣r hַzֶּ֔h vַyְbַkֵּ֖shׁ lַhֲrֹ֣g aֶt־mֹshֶׁ֑h vַyִּbְrַ֤ch mֹshֶׁh֙ mִpְּnֵ֣y pַrְaֹ֔h vַyֵּ֥shֶׁb bְּaֶֽrֶץ־mִdְyָ֖ן vַyֵּ֥shֶׁb aַֽl־hַbְּaֵֽr׃

2.hebrewText: וּלְכֹהֵ֥ן מִדְיָ֖ן שֶׁ֣בַע בָּנ֑וֹת וַתָּבֹ֣אנָה וַתִּדְלֶ֗נָה וַתְּמַלֶּ֙אנָה֙ אֶת־הָ֣רְהָטִ֔ים לְהַשְׁק֖וֹת צֹ֥אן אֲבִיהֶֽן׃
2.englishText: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. They came to draw water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock;
2.transliteration: vּlְkֹhֵ֥ן mִdְyָ֖ן shֶׁ֣bַa bָּn֑vֹt vַtָּbֹ֣anָh vַtִּdְlֶ֗nָh vַtְּmַlֶּ֙anָh֙ aֶt־hָ֣rְhָtִ֔yם lְhַshְׁk֖vֹt tsֹ֥aן aֲbִyhֶֽן׃

2.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ הָרֹעִ֖ים וַיְגָרְשׁ֑וּם וַיָּ֤קׇם מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיּ֣וֹשִׁעָ֔ן וַיַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־צֹאנָֽם׃
2.englishText: but shepherds came and drove them off. Moses rose to their defense, and he watered their flock.
2.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֥avּ hָrֹaִ֖yם vַyְgָrְshׁ֑vּם vַyָּ֤kׇם mֹshֶׁh֙ vַyּ֣vֹshִׁaָ֔ן vַyַּ֖shְׁkְ aֶt־tsֹanָֽם׃

2.hebrewText: וַתָּבֹ֕אנָה אֶל־רְעוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִיהֶ֑ן וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַדּ֛וּעַ מִהַרְתֶּ֥ן בֹּ֖א הַיּֽוֹם׃
2.englishText: When they returned to their father Reuel, he said, “How is it that you have come back so soon today?”
2.transliteration: vַtָּbֹ֕anָh aֶl־rְavּaֵ֖l aֲbִyhֶ֑ן vַyֹּ֕amֶr mַdּ֛vּaַ mִhַrְtֶּ֥ן bֹּ֖a hַyּֽvֹם׃

2.hebrewText: וַתֹּאמַ֕רְןָ אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י הִצִּילָ֖נוּ מִיַּ֣ד הָרֹעִ֑ים וְגַם־דָּלֹ֤ה דָלָה֙ לָ֔נוּ וַיַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־הַצֹּֽאן׃
2.englishText: They answered, “An Egyptian rescued us from the shepherds; he even drew water for us and watered the flock.”
2.transliteration: vַtֹּamַ֕rְןָ aִ֣yshׁ mִtsְrִ֔y hִtsִּylָ֖nvּ mִyַּ֣d hָrֹaִ֑yם vְgַם־dָּlֹ֤h dָlָh֙ lָ֔nvּ vַyַּ֖shְׁkְ aֶt־hַtsֹּֽaן׃

2.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֶל־בְּנֹתָ֖יו וְאַיּ֑וֹ לָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ עֲזַבְתֶּ֣ן אֶת־הָאִ֔ישׁ קִרְאֶ֥ן ל֖וֹ וְיֹ֥אכַל לָֽחֶם׃
2.englishText: He said to his daughters, “Where is he then? Why did you leave the man? Ask him in to break bread.”
2.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr aֶl־bְּnֹtָ֖yv vְaַyּ֑vֹ lָ֤mָּh zֶּh֙ aֲzַbְtֶּ֣ן aֶt־hָaִ֔yshׁ kִrְaֶ֥ן l֖vֹ vְyֹ֥akַl lָֽchֶם׃

2.hebrewText: וַיּ֥וֹאֶל מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָשֶׁ֣בֶת אֶת־הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיִּתֵּ֛ן אֶת־צִפֹּרָ֥ה בִתּ֖וֹ לְמֹשֶֽׁה׃
2.englishText: Moses consented to stay with the man, and he gave Moses his daughter Zipporah as wife.
2.transliteration: vַyּ֥vֹaֶl mֹshֶׁ֖h lָshֶׁ֣bֶt aֶt־hָaִ֑yshׁ vַyִּtֵּ֛ן aֶt־tsִpֹּrָ֥h bִtּ֖vֹ lְmֹshֶֽׁh׃

2.hebrewText: וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ גֵּרְשֹׁ֑ם כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר גֵּ֣ר הָיִ֔יתִי בְּאֶ֖רֶץ נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃ {פ}
2.englishText: She bore a son whom he named Gershom,*Gershom Associated with ger sham, “a stranger there.” for he said, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land.”
2.transliteration: vַtֵּ֣lֶd bֵּ֔ן vַyִּkְrָ֥a aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ gֵּrְshֹׁ֑ם kִּ֣y aָmַ֔r gֵּ֣r hָyִ֔ytִy bְּaֶ֖rֶץ nׇkְrִyָּֽh׃ {p}

2.hebrewText: וַיְהִי֩ בַיָּמִ֨ים הָֽרַבִּ֜ים הָהֵ֗ם וַיָּ֙מׇת֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיֵּאָנְח֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מִן־הָעֲבֹדָ֖ה וַיִּזְעָ֑קוּ וַתַּ֧עַל שַׁוְעָתָ֛ם אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים מִן־הָעֲבֹדָֽה׃
2.englishText: A long time after that, the king of Egypt died. The Israelites were groaning under the bondage and cried out; and their cry for help from the bondage rose up to God.
2.transliteration: vַyְhִy֩ bַyָּmִ֨yם hָֽrַbִּ֜yם hָhֵ֗ם vַyָּ֙mׇt֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ mִtsְrַ֔yִם vַyֵּaָnְch֧vּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l mִן־hָaֲbֹdָ֖h vַyִּzְaָ֑kvּ vַtַּ֧aַl shַׁvְaָtָ֛ם aֶl־hָaֱlֹhִ֖yם mִן־hָaֲbֹdָֽh׃

2.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־נַאֲקָתָ֑ם וַיִּזְכֹּ֤ר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־בְּרִית֔וֹ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־יִצְחָ֥ק וְאֶֽת־יַעֲקֹֽב׃
2.englishText: God heard their moaning, and God remembered the covenant with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob.
2.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֥a aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־nַaֲkָtָ֑ם vַyִּzְkֹּ֤r aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶt־bְּrִyt֔vֹ aֶt־aַbְrָhָ֖ם aֶt־yִtsְchָ֥k vְaֶֽt־yַaֲkֹֽb׃

2.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּ֖דַע אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
2.englishText: God looked upon the Israelites, and God took notice of them.
2.transliteration: vַyַּ֥rְa aֱlֹhִ֖yם aֶt־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vַyֵּ֖dַa aֱlֹhִֽyם׃ {s}

3.hebrewText: וּמֹשֶׁ֗ה הָיָ֥ה רֹעֶ֛ה אֶת־צֹ֛אן יִתְר֥וֹ חֹתְנ֖וֹ כֹּהֵ֣ן מִדְיָ֑ן וַיִּנְהַ֤ג אֶת־הַצֹּאן֙ אַחַ֣ר הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר וַיָּבֹ֛א אֶל־הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים חֹרֵֽבָה׃
3.englishText: Now Moses, tending the flock of his father-in-law Jethro, the priest of Midian, drove the flock into the wilderness, and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.
3.transliteration: vּmֹshֶׁ֗h hָyָ֥h rֹaֶ֛h aֶt־tsֹ֛aן yִtְr֥vֹ chֹtְn֖vֹ kֹּhֵ֣ן mִdְyָ֑ן vַyִּnְhַ֤g aֶt־hַtsֹּaן֙ aַchַ֣r hַmִּdְbָּ֔r vַyָּbֹ֛a aֶl־hַ֥r hָaֱlֹhִ֖yם chֹrֵֽbָh׃

3.hebrewText: וַ֠יֵּרָ֠א מַלְאַ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֵלָ֛יו בְּלַבַּת־אֵ֖שׁ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַסְּנֶ֑ה וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה הַסְּנֶה֙ בֹּעֵ֣ר בָּאֵ֔שׁ וְהַסְּנֶ֖ה אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אֻכָּֽל׃
3.englishText: A messenger of יהוה appeared to him in a blazing fire out of a bush. He gazed, and there was a bush all aflame, yet the bush was not consumed.
3.transliteration: vַ֠yֵּrָ֠a mַlְaַ֨ךְ yְhֹvָ֥h aֵlָ֛yv bְּlַbַּt־aֵ֖shׁ mִtּ֣vֹךְ hַsְּnֶ֑h vַyַּ֗rְa vְhִnֵּ֤h hַsְּnֶh֙ bֹּaֵ֣r bָּaֵ֔shׁ vְhַsְּnֶ֖h aֵynֶ֥nּvּ aֻkָּֽl׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אָסֻֽרָה־נָּ֣א וְאֶרְאֶ֔ה אֶת־הַמַּרְאֶ֥ה הַגָּדֹ֖ל הַזֶּ֑ה מַדּ֖וּעַ לֹא־יִבְעַ֥ר הַסְּנֶֽה׃
3.englishText: Moses said, “I must turn aside to look at this marvelous sight; why doesn’t the bush burn up?”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr mֹshֶׁ֔h aָsֻֽrָh־nָּ֣a vְaֶrְaֶ֔h aֶt־hַmַּrְaֶ֥h hַgָּdֹ֖l hַzֶּ֑h mַdּ֖vּaַ lֹa־yִbְaַ֥r hַsְּnֶֽh׃

3.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥רְא יְהֹוָ֖ה כִּ֣י סָ֣ר לִרְא֑וֹת וַיִּקְרָא֩ אֵלָ֨יו אֱלֹהִ֜ים מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַסְּנֶ֗ה וַיֹּ֛אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֥ה מֹשֶׁ֖ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
3.englishText: When יהוה saw that he had turned aside to look, God called to him out of the bush: “Moses! Moses!” He answered, “Here I am.”
3.transliteration: vַyַּ֥rְa yְhֹvָ֖h kִּ֣y sָ֣r lִrְa֑vֹt vַyִּkְrָa֩ aֵlָ֨yv aֱlֹhִ֜yם mִtּ֣vֹךְ hַsְּnֶ֗h vַyֹּ֛amֶr mֹshֶׁ֥h mֹshֶׁ֖h vַyֹּ֥amֶr hִnֵּֽnִy׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַל־תִּקְרַ֣ב הֲלֹ֑ם שַׁל־נְעָלֶ֙יךָ֙ מֵעַ֣ל רַגְלֶ֔יךָ כִּ֣י הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ עוֹמֵ֣ד עָלָ֔יו אַדְמַת־קֹ֖דֶשׁ הֽוּא׃
3.englishText: And [God] said, “Do not come closer! Remove your sandals from your feet, for the place on which you stand is holy ground!”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr aַl־tִּkְrַ֣b hֲlֹ֑ם shַׁl־nְaָlֶ֙yךָ֙ mֵaַ֣l rַgְlֶ֔yךָ kִּ֣y hַmָּk֗vֹם aֲshֶׁ֤r aַtָּh֙ avֹmֵ֣d aָlָ֔yv aַdְmַt־kֹ֖dֶshׁ hֽvּa׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אָנֹכִי֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֔יךָ אֱלֹהֵ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֖ק וֵאלֹהֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיַּסְתֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ פָּנָ֔יו כִּ֣י יָרֵ֔א מֵהַבִּ֖יט אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
3.englishText: and continued, “I am the God of your father’s [house]—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look at God.
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr aָnֹkִy֙ aֱlֹhֵ֣y aָbִ֔yךָ aֱlֹhֵ֧y aַbְrָhָ֛ם aֱlֹhֵ֥y yִtsְchָ֖k vֵalֹhֵ֣y yַaֲkֹ֑b vַyַּsְtֵּ֤r mֹshֶׁh֙ pָּnָ֔yv kִּ֣y yָrֵ֔a mֵhַbִּ֖yt aֶl־hָaֱlֹhִֽyם׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה רָאֹ֥ה רָאִ֛יתִי אֶת־עֳנִ֥י עַמִּ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְאֶת־צַעֲקָתָ֤ם שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י נֹֽגְשָׂ֔יו כִּ֥י יָדַ֖עְתִּי אֶת־מַכְאֹבָֽיו׃
3.englishText: And יהוה continued, “I have marked well the plight of My people in Egypt and have heeded their outcry because of their taskmasters; yes, I am mindful of their sufferings.
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָ֔h rָaֹ֥h rָaִ֛ytִy aֶt־aֳnִ֥y aַmִּ֖y aֲshֶׁ֣r bְּmִtsְrָ֑yִם vְaֶt־tsַaֲkָtָ֤ם shָׁmַ֙aְtִּy֙ mִpְּnֵ֣y nֹֽgְshָׂ֔yv kִּ֥y yָdַ֖aְtִּy aֶt־mַkְaֹbָֽyv׃

3.hebrewText: וָאֵרֵ֞ד לְהַצִּיל֣וֹ ׀ מִיַּ֣ד מִצְרַ֗יִם וּֽלְהַעֲלֹתוֹ֮ מִן־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַהִוא֒ אֶל־אֶ֤רֶץ טוֹבָה֙ וּרְחָבָ֔ה אֶל־אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ אֶל־מְק֤וֹם הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
3.englishText: I have come down to rescue them from the Egyptians and to bring them out of that land to a good and spacious land, a land flowing with milk and honey, the region of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
3.transliteration: vָaֵrֵ֞d lְhַtsִּyl֣vֹ ׀ mִyַּ֣d mִtsְrַ֗yִם vּֽlְhַaֲlֹtvֹ֮ mִן־hָaָ֣rֶץ hַhִva֒ aֶl־aֶ֤rֶץ tvֹbָh֙ vּrְchָbָ֔h aֶl־aֶ֛rֶץ zָbַ֥t chָlָ֖b vּdְbָ֑shׁ aֶl־mְk֤vֹם hַֽkְּnַaֲnִy֙ vְhַ֣chִtִּ֔y vְhָֽaֱmֹrִy֙ vְhַpְּrִzִּ֔y vְhַchִvִּ֖y vְhַyְbvּsִֽy׃

3.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֕ה הִנֵּ֛ה צַעֲקַ֥ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּ֣אָה אֵלָ֑י וְגַם־רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הַלַּ֔חַץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִצְרַ֖יִם לֹחֲצִ֥ים אֹתָֽם׃
3.englishText: Now the cry of the Israelites has reached Me; moreover, I have seen how the Egyptians oppress them.
3.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֕h hִnֵּ֛h tsַaֲkַ֥t bְּnֵy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l bָּ֣aָh aֵlָ֑y vְgַם־rָaִ֙ytִy֙ aֶt־hַlַּ֔chַץ aֲshֶׁ֥r mִtsְrַ֖yִם lֹchֲtsִ֥yם aֹtָֽם׃

3.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֣ה לְכָ֔ה וְאֶֽשְׁלָחֲךָ֖ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְהוֹצֵ֛א אֶת־עַמִּ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
3.englishText: Come, therefore, I will send you to Pharaoh, and you shall free My people, the Israelites, from Egypt.”
3.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֣h lְkָ֔h vְaֶֽshְׁlָchֲךָ֖ aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֑h vְhvֹtsֵ֛a aֶt־aַmִּ֥y bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים מִ֣י אָנֹ֔כִי כִּ֥י אֵלֵ֖ךְ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְכִ֥י אוֹצִ֛יא אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
3.englishText: But Moses said to God, “Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh and free the Israelites from Egypt?”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶl־hָ֣aֱlֹhִ֔yם mִ֣y aָnֹ֔kִy kִּ֥y aֵlֵ֖ךְ aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֑h vְkִ֥y avֹtsִ֛ya aֶt־bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כִּֽי־אֶֽהְיֶ֣ה עִמָּ֔ךְ וְזֶה־לְּךָ֣ הָא֔וֹת כִּ֥י אָנֹכִ֖י שְׁלַחְתִּ֑יךָ בְּהוֹצִֽיאֲךָ֤ אֶת־הָעָם֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם תַּֽעַבְדוּן֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים עַ֖ל הָהָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
3.englishText: And [God] said, “I will be with you; that shall be your sign that it was I who sent you. And when you have freed the people from Egypt, you shall worship God at this mountain.”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ kִּֽy־aֶֽhְyֶ֣h aִmָּ֔ךְ vְzֶh־lְּךָ֣ hָa֔vֹt kִּ֥y aָnֹkִ֖y shְׁlַchְtִּ֑yךָ bְּhvֹtsִֽyaֲךָ֤ aֶt־hָaָם֙ mִmִּtsְrַ֔yִם tַּֽaַbְdvּן֙ aֶt־hָ֣aֱlֹhִ֔yם aַ֖l hָhָ֥r hַzֶּֽh׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֗ים הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֣י בָא֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְאָמַרְתִּ֣י לָהֶ֔ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם שְׁלָחַ֣נִי אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְאָֽמְרוּ־לִ֣י מַה־שְּׁמ֔וֹ מָ֥ה אֹמַ֖ר אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
3.englishText: Moses said to God, “When I come to the Israelites and say to them, ‘The God of your fathers’ [house] has sent me to you,’ and they ask me, ‘What is [God’s] name?’ what shall I say to them?”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr mֹshֶׁ֜h aֶl־hָֽaֱlֹhִ֗yם hִnֵּ֨h aָnֹkִ֣y bָa֮ aֶl־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵl֒ vְaָmַrְtִּ֣y lָhֶ֔ם aֱlֹhֵ֥y aֲbvֹtֵykֶ֖ם shְׁlָchַ֣nִy aֲlֵykֶ֑ם vְaָֽmְrvּ־lִ֣y mַh־shְּׁm֔vֹ mָ֥h aֹmַ֖r aֲlֵhֶֽם׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶֽהְיֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כֹּ֤ה תֹאמַר֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה שְׁלָחַ֥נִי אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
3.englishText: And God said to Moses, “Ehyeh-Asher-Ehyeh,”*Ehyeh-Asher-Ehyeh Meaning of Heb. uncertain; variously translated: “I Am That I Am”; “I Am Who I Am”; “I Will Be What I Will Be”; etc. continuing, “Thus shall you say to the Israelites, ‘Ehyeh*Ehyeh Others “I Am” or “I Will Be.” sent me to you.’”
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h aֶֽhְyֶ֖h aֲshֶׁ֣r aֶֽhְyֶ֑h vַyֹּ֗amֶr kֹּ֤h tֹamַr֙ lִbְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l aֶֽhְyֶ֖h shְׁlָchַ֥nִy aֲlֵykֶֽם׃

3.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ ע֨וֹד אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כֹּֽה־תֹאמַר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֗ם אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֛ק וֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹ֖ב שְׁלָחַ֣נִי אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם זֶה־שְּׁמִ֣י לְעֹלָ֔ם וְזֶ֥ה זִכְרִ֖י לְדֹ֥ר דֹּֽר׃
3.englishText:
And God said further to Moses, “Thus shall you speak to the Israelites: יהוה,*יהוה This name (y-h-w-h; traditionally read Adonai “the Lord”) is here associated with the verb hayah “to be.” the God of your fathers’ [house]—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob—has sent me to you:
This shall be My name forever,
This My appellation for all eternity.
3.transliteration: vַyֹּ֩amֶr֩ a֨vֹd aֱlֹhִ֜yם aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h kֹּֽh־tֹamַr֮ aֶl־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵl֒ yְhֹvָ֞h aֱlֹhֵ֣y aֲbֹtֵykֶ֗ם aֱlֹhֵ֨y aַbְrָhָ֜ם aֱlֹhֵ֥y yִtsְchָ֛k vֵalֹhֵ֥y yַaֲkֹ֖b shְׁlָchַ֣nִy aֲlֵykֶ֑ם zֶh־shְּׁmִ֣y lְaֹlָ֔ם vְzֶ֥h zִkְrִ֖y lְdֹ֥r dֹּֽr׃

3.hebrewText: לֵ֣ךְ וְאָֽסַפְתָּ֞ אֶת־זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֤ אֲלֵהֶם֙ יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י אֲבֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ נִרְאָ֣ה אֵלַ֔י אֱלֹהֵ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם יִצְחָ֥ק וְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לֵאמֹ֑ר פָּקֹ֤ד פָּקַ֙דְתִּי֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הֶעָשׂ֥וּי לָכֶ֖ם בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
3.englishText: “Go and assemble the elders of Israel and say to them: יהוה, the God of your fathers’ [house]—the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—has appeared to me and said, ‘I have taken note of you and of what is being done to you in Egypt,
3.transliteration: lֵ֣ךְ vְaָֽsַpְtָּ֞ aֶt־zִkְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l vְaָmַrְtָּ֤ aֲlֵhֶם֙ yְhֹvָ֞h aֱlֹhֵ֤y aֲbֹֽtֵykֶם֙ nִrְaָ֣h aֵlַ֔y aֱlֹhֵ֧y aַbְrָhָ֛ם yִtsְchָ֥k vְyַaֲkֹ֖b lֵamֹ֑r pָּkֹ֤d pָּkַ֙dְtִּy֙ aֶtְkֶ֔ם vְaֶt־hֶaָshׂ֥vּy lָkֶ֖ם bְּmִtsְrָֽyִם׃

3.hebrewText: וָאֹמַ֗ר אַעֲלֶ֣ה אֶתְכֶם֮ מֵעֳנִ֣י מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ אֶל־אֶ֤רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י אֶל־אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
3.englishText: and I have declared: I will take you out of the misery of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, to a land flowing with milk and honey.’
3.transliteration: vָaֹmַ֗r aַaֲlֶ֣h aֶtְkֶם֮ mֵaֳnִ֣y mִtsְrַ֒yִם֒ aֶl־aֶ֤rֶץ hַֽkְּnַaֲnִy֙ vְhַ֣chִtִּ֔y vְhָֽaֱmֹrִy֙ vְhַpְּrִzִּ֔y vְhַchִvִּ֖y vְhַyְbvּsִ֑y aֶl־aֶ֛rֶץ zָbַ֥t chָlָ֖b vּdְbָֽshׁ׃

3.hebrewText: וְשָׁמְע֖וּ לְקֹלֶ֑ךָ וּבָאתָ֡ אַתָּה֩ וְזִקְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֗יִם וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י הָֽעִבְרִיִּים֙ נִקְרָ֣ה עָלֵ֔ינוּ וְעַתָּ֗ה נֵֽלְכָה־נָּ֞א דֶּ֣רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וְנִזְבְּחָ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
3.englishText: They will listen to you; then you shall go with the elders of Israel to the king of Egypt and you shall say to him, ‘יהוה, the God of the Hebrews, became manifest to us. Now therefore, let us go a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to our God יהוה.’
3.transliteration: vְshָׁmְa֖vּ lְkֹlֶ֑ךָ vּbָatָ֡ aַtָּh֩ vְzִkְnֵ֨y yִshְׂrָaֵ֜l aֶl־mֶ֣lֶךְ mִtsְrַ֗yִם vַaֲmַrְtֶּ֤ם aֵlָyv֙ yְhֹvָ֞h aֱlֹhֵ֤y hָֽaִbְrִyִּyם֙ nִkְrָ֣h aָlֵ֔ynvּ vְaַtָּ֗h nֵֽlְkָh־nָּ֞a dֶּ֣rֶךְ shְׁlֹ֤shֶׁt yָmִyם֙ bַּmִּdְbָּ֔r vְnִzְbְּchָ֖h lַֽyhֹvָ֥h aֱlֹhֵֽynvּ׃

3.hebrewText: וַאֲנִ֣י יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֠י לֹֽא־יִתֵּ֥ן אֶתְכֶ֛ם מֶ֥לֶךְ מִצְרַ֖יִם לַהֲלֹ֑ךְ וְלֹ֖א בְּיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
3.englishText: Yet I know that the king of Egypt will let you go only because of a greater might.
3.transliteration: vַaֲnִ֣y yָdַ֔aְtִּy kִּ֠y lֹֽa־yִtֵּ֥ן aֶtְkֶ֛ם mֶ֥lֶךְ mִtsְrַ֖yִם lַhֲlֹ֑ךְ vְlֹ֖a bְּyָ֥d chֲzָkָֽh׃

3.hebrewText: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֤י אֶת־יָדִי֙ וְהִכֵּיתִ֣י אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּכֹל֙ נִפְלְאֹתַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה בְּקִרְבּ֑וֹ וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן יְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶתְכֶֽם׃
3.englishText: So I will stretch out My hand and smite Egypt with various wonders which I will work upon them; after that he shall let you go.
3.transliteration: vְshָׁlַchְtִּ֤y aֶt־yָdִy֙ vְhִkֵּytִ֣y aֶt־mִtsְrַ֔yִם bְּkֹl֙ nִpְlְaֹtַ֔y aֲshֶׁ֥r aֶֽaֱshֶׂ֖h bְּkִrְbּ֑vֹ vְaַchֲrֵy־kֵ֖ן yְshַׁlַּ֥ch aֶtְkֶֽם׃

3.hebrewText: וְנָתַתִּ֛י אֶת־חֵ֥ן הָֽעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה בְּעֵינֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהָיָה֙ כִּ֣י תֵֽלֵכ֔וּן לֹ֥א תֵלְכ֖וּ רֵיקָֽם׃
3.englishText: And I will dispose the Egyptians favorably toward this people, so that when you go, you will not go away empty-handed.
3.transliteration: vְnָtַtִּ֛y aֶt־chֵ֥ן hָֽaָם־hַzֶּ֖h bְּaֵynֵ֣y mִtsְrָ֑yִם vְhָyָh֙ kִּ֣y tֵֽlֵk֔vּן lֹ֥a tֵlְk֖vּ rֵykָֽם׃

3.hebrewText: וְשָׁאֲלָ֨ה אִשָּׁ֤ה מִשְּׁכֶנְתָּהּ֙ וּמִגָּרַ֣ת בֵּיתָ֔הּ כְּלֵי־כֶ֛סֶף וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָ֖ב וּשְׂמָלֹ֑ת וְשַׂמְתֶּ֗ם עַל־בְּנֵיכֶם֙ וְעַל־בְּנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְנִצַּלְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
3.englishText: Each woman shall borrow from her neighbor and the lodger in her house objects of silver and gold, and clothing, and you shall put these on your sons and daughters, thus stripping the Egyptians.”
3.transliteration: vְshָׁaֲlָ֨h aִshָּׁ֤h mִshְּׁkֶnְtָּhּ֙ vּmִgָּrַ֣t bֵּytָ֔hּ kְּlֵy־kֶ֛sֶף vּkְlֵ֥y zָhָ֖b vּshְׂmָlֹ֑t vְshַׂmְtֶּ֗ם aַl־bְּnֵykֶם֙ vְaַl־bְּnֹ֣tֵykֶ֔ם vְnִtsַּlְtֶּ֖ם aֶt־mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

4.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤עַן מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר וְהֵן֙ לֹֽא־יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לִ֔י וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמְע֖וּ בְּקֹלִ֑י כִּ֣י יֹֽאמְר֔וּ לֹֽא־נִרְאָ֥ה אֵלֶ֖יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
4.englishText: But Moses spoke up and said, “What if they do not believe me and do not listen to me, but say: יהוה did not appear to you?”
4.transliteration: vַyַּ֤aַן mֹshֶׁh֙ vַyֹּ֔amֶr vְhֵן֙ lֹֽa־yַaֲmִ֣ynvּ lִ֔y vְlֹ֥a yִshְׁmְa֖vּ bְּkֹlִ֑y kִּ֣y yֹֽamְr֔vּ lֹֽa־nִrְaָ֥h aֵlֶ֖yךָ yְhֹvָֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלָ֛יו יְהֹוָ֖ה (מזה) [מַה־זֶּ֣ה] בְיָדֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מַטֶּֽה׃
4.englishText: יהוה said to him, “What is that in your hand?” And he replied, “A rod.”
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֧amֶr aֵlָ֛yv yְhֹvָ֖h (mzh) [mַh־zֶּ֣h] bְyָdֶ֑ךָ vַyֹּ֖amֶr mַtֶּֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַשְׁלִיכֵ֣הוּ אַ֔רְצָה וַיַּשְׁלִכֵ֥הוּ אַ֖רְצָה וַיְהִ֣י לְנָחָ֑שׁ וַיָּ֥נׇס מֹשֶׁ֖ה מִפָּנָֽיו׃
4.englishText: [God] said, “Cast it on the ground.” He cast it on the ground and it became a snake; and Moses recoiled from it.
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ hַshְׁlִykֵ֣hvּ aַ֔rְtsָh vַyַּshְׁlִkֵ֥hvּ aַ֖rְtsָh vַyְhִ֣y lְnָchָ֑shׁ vַyָּ֥nׇs mֹshֶׁ֖h mִpָּnָֽyv׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה שְׁלַח֙ יָֽדְךָ֔ וֶאֱחֹ֖ז בִּזְנָב֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ וַיַּ֣חֲזֶק בּ֔וֹ וַיְהִ֥י לְמַטֶּ֖ה בְּכַפּֽוֹ׃
4.englishText: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Put out your hand and grasp it by the tail”—he put out his hand and seized it, and it became a rod in his hand—
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h shְׁlַch֙ yָֽdְךָ֔ vֶaֱchֹ֖z bִּzְnָb֑vֹ vַyִּshְׁlַ֤ch yָdvֹ֙ vַyַּ֣chֲzֶk bּ֔vֹ vַyְhִ֥y lְmַtֶּ֖h bְּkַpּֽvֹ׃

4.hebrewText: לְמַ֣עַן יַאֲמִ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־נִרְאָ֥ה אֵלֶ֛יךָ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתָ֑ם אֱלֹהֵ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֖ק וֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
4.englishText: “that they may believe that יהוה, the God of their ancestors, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, did appear to you.”
4.transliteration: lְmַ֣aַן yַaֲmִ֔ynvּ kִּֽy־nִrְaָ֥h aֵlֶ֛yךָ yְhֹvָ֖h aֱlֹhֵ֣y aֲbֹtָ֑ם aֱlֹhֵ֧y aַbְrָhָ֛ם aֱlֹhֵ֥y yִtsְchָ֖k vֵalֹhֵ֥y yַaֲkֹֽb׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה ל֜וֹ ע֗וֹד הָֽבֵא־נָ֤א יָֽדְךָ֙ בְּחֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַיָּבֵ֥א יָד֖וֹ בְּחֵיק֑וֹ וַיּ֣וֹצִאָ֔הּ וְהִנֵּ֥ה יָד֖וֹ מְצֹרַ֥עַת כַּשָּֽׁלֶג׃
4.englishText: יהוה said to him further, “Put your hand into your bosom.” He put his hand into his bosom; and when he took it out, his hand was encrusted with snowy scales!*scales Cf. Lev. 13.2–3.
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֩amֶr֩ yְhֹvָ֨h l֜vֹ a֗vֹd hָֽbֵa־nָ֤a yָֽdְךָ֙ bְּchֵykֶ֔ךָ vַyָּbֵ֥a yָd֖vֹ bְּchֵyk֑vֹ vַyּ֣vֹtsִaָ֔hּ vְhִnֵּ֥h yָd֖vֹ mְtsֹrַ֥aַt kַּshָּֽׁlֶg׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הָשֵׁ֤ב יָֽדְךָ֙ אֶל־חֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַיָּ֥שֶׁב יָד֖וֹ אֶל־חֵיק֑וֹ וַיּֽוֹצִאָהּ֙ מֵֽחֵיק֔וֹ וְהִנֵּה־שָׁ֖בָה כִּבְשָׂרֽוֹ׃
4.englishText: And [God] said, “Put your hand back into your bosom.”—He put his hand back into his bosom; and when he took it out of his bosom, there it was again like the rest of his body.—
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr hָshֵׁ֤b yָֽdְךָ֙ aֶl־chֵykֶ֔ךָ vַyָּ֥shֶׁb yָd֖vֹ aֶl־chֵyk֑vֹ vַyּֽvֹtsִaָhּ֙ mֵֽchֵyk֔vֹ vְhִnֵּh־shָׁ֖bָh kִּbְshָׂrֽvֹ׃

4.hebrewText: וְהָיָה֙ אִם־לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לָ֔ךְ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמְע֔וּ לְקֹ֖ל הָאֹ֣ת הָרִאשׁ֑וֹן וְהֶֽאֱמִ֔ינוּ לְקֹ֖ל הָאֹ֥ת הָאַחֲרֽוֹן׃
4.englishText: “And if they do not believe you or pay heed to the first sign, they will believe the second.
4.transliteration: vְhָyָh֙ aִם־lֹ֣a yַaֲmִ֣ynvּ lָ֔ךְ vְlֹ֣a yִshְׁmְa֔vּ lְkֹ֖l hָaֹ֣t hָrִashׁ֑vֹן vְhֶֽaֱmִ֔ynvּ lְkֹ֖l hָaֹ֥t hָaַchֲrֽvֹן׃

4.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֡ה אִם־לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֡ינוּ גַּם֩ לִשְׁנֵ֨י הָאֹת֜וֹת הָאֵ֗לֶּה וְלֹ֤א יִשְׁמְעוּן֙ לְקֹלֶ֔ךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֙ מִמֵּימֵ֣י הַיְאֹ֔ר וְשָׁפַכְתָּ֖ הַיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וְהָי֤וּ הַמַּ֙יִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּקַּ֣ח מִן־הַיְאֹ֔ר וְהָי֥וּ לְדָ֖ם בַּיַּבָּֽשֶׁת׃
4.englishText: And if they are not convinced by both these signs and still do not heed you, take some water from the Nile and pour it on the dry ground, and it—the water that you take from the Nile—will turn to blood on the dry ground.”
4.transliteration: vְhָyָ֡h aִם־lֹ֣a yַaֲmִ֡ynvּ gַּם֩ lִshְׁnֵ֨y hָaֹt֜vֹt hָaֵ֗lֶּh vְlֹ֤a yִshְׁmְavּן֙ lְkֹlֶ֔ךָ vְlָkַchְtָּ֙ mִmֵּymֵ֣y hַyְaֹ֔r vְshָׁpַkְtָּ֖ hַyַּbָּshָׁ֑h vְhָy֤vּ hַmַּ֙yִם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tִּkַּ֣ch mִן־hַyְaֹ֔r vְhָy֥vּ lְdָ֖ם bַּyַּbָּֽshֶׁt׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־יְהֹוָה֮ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנָי֒ לֹא֩ אִ֨ישׁ דְּבָרִ֜ים אָנֹ֗כִי גַּ֤ם מִתְּמוֹל֙ גַּ֣ם מִשִּׁלְשֹׁ֔ם גַּ֛ם מֵאָ֥ז דַּבֶּרְךָ֖ אֶל־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֧י כְבַד־פֶּ֛ה וּכְבַ֥ד לָשׁ֖וֹן אָנֹֽכִי׃
4.englishText: But Moses said to יהוה, “Please, O my lord, I have never been a man of words, either in times past or now that You have spoken to Your servant; I am slow of speech and slow of tongue.”
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr mֹshֶׁ֣h aֶl־yְhֹvָh֮ bִּ֣y aֲdֹnָy֒ lֹa֩ aִ֨yshׁ dְּbָrִ֜yם aָnֹ֗kִy gַּ֤ם mִtְּmvֹl֙ gַּ֣ם mִshִּׁlְshֹׁ֔ם gַּ֛ם mֵaָ֥z dַּbֶּrְךָ֖ aֶl־aַbְdֶּ֑ךָ kִּ֧y kְbַd־pֶּ֛h vּkְbַ֥d lָshׁ֖vֹן aָnֹֽkִy׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו מִ֣י שָׂ֣ם פֶּה֮ לָֽאָדָם֒ א֚וֹ מִֽי־יָשׂ֣וּם אִלֵּ֔ם א֣וֹ חֵרֵ֔שׁ א֥וֹ פִקֵּ֖חַ א֣וֹ עִוֵּ֑ר הֲלֹ֥א אָנֹכִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
4.englishText: And יהוה said to him, “Who gives humans speech? Who makes them dumb or deaf, seeing or blind? Is it not I, יהוה?
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h aֵlָ֗yv mִ֣y shָׂ֣ם pֶּh֮ lָֽaָdָם֒ a֚vֹ mִֽy־yָshׂ֣vּם aִlֵּ֔ם a֣vֹ chֵrֵ֔shׁ a֥vֹ pִkֵּ֖chַ a֣vֹ aִvֵּ֑r hֲlֹ֥a aָnֹkִ֖y yְhֹvָֽh׃

4.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֖ה לֵ֑ךְ וְאָנֹכִי֙ אֶֽהְיֶ֣ה עִם־פִּ֔יךָ וְהוֹרֵיתִ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּדַבֵּֽר׃
4.englishText: Now go, and I will be with you as you speak and will instruct you what to say.”
4.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֖h lֵ֑ךְ vְaָnֹkִy֙ aֶֽhְyֶ֣h aִם־pִּ֔yךָ vְhvֹrֵytִ֖yךָ aֲshֶׁ֥r tְּdַbֵּֽr׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר בִּ֣י אֲדֹנָ֑י שְֽׁלַֽח־נָ֖א בְּיַד־תִּשְׁלָֽח׃
4.englishText: But he said, “Please, O my lord, make someone else Your agent.”*make someone else Your agent Lit. “send through whomever You will send.”
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr bִּ֣y aֲdֹnָ֑y shְֽׁlַֽch־nָ֖a bְּyַd־tִּshְׁlָֽch׃

4.hebrewText: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֨ף יְהֹוָ֜ה בְּמֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הֲלֹ֨א אַהֲרֹ֤ן אָחִ֙יךָ֙ הַלֵּוִ֔י יָדַ֕עְתִּי כִּֽי־דַבֵּ֥ר יְדַבֵּ֖ר ה֑וּא וְגַ֤ם הִנֵּה־הוּא֙ יֹצֵ֣א לִקְרָאתֶ֔ךָ וְרָאֲךָ֖ וְשָׂמַ֥ח בְּלִבּֽוֹ׃
4.englishText: יהוה became angry with Moses and said, “There is your brother Aaron the Levite. He, I know, speaks readily. Even now he is setting out to meet you, and he will be happy to see you.
4.transliteration: vַyִּֽchַr־aַ֨ף yְhֹvָ֜h bְּmֹshֶׁ֗h vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ hֲlֹ֨a aַhֲrֹ֤ן aָchִ֙yךָ֙ hַlֵּvִ֔y yָdַ֕aְtִּy kִּֽy־dַbֵּ֥r yְdַbֵּ֖r h֑vּa vְgַ֤ם hִnֵּh־hvּa֙ yֹtsֵ֣a lִkְrָatֶ֔ךָ vְrָaֲךָ֖ vְshָׂmַ֥ch bְּlִbּֽvֹ׃

4.hebrewText: וְדִבַּרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֔יו וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים בְּפִ֑יו וְאָנֹכִ֗י אֶֽהְיֶ֤ה עִם־פִּ֙יךָ֙ וְעִם־פִּ֔יהוּ וְהוֹרֵיתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֽׂוּן׃
4.englishText: You shall speak to him and put the words in his mouth—I will be with you and with him as you speak, and tell both of you what to do—
4.transliteration: vְdִbַּrְtָּ֣ aֵlָ֔yv vְshַׂmְtָּ֥ aֶt־hַdְּbָrִ֖yם bְּpִ֑yv vְaָnֹkִ֗y aֶֽhְyֶ֤h aִם־pִּ֙yךָ֙ vְaִם־pִּ֔yhvּ vְhvֹrֵytִ֣y aֶtְkֶ֔ם aֵ֖t aֲshֶׁ֥r tַּaֲshֽׂvּן׃

4.hebrewText: וְדִבֶּר־ה֥וּא לְךָ֖ אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וְהָ֤יָה הוּא֙ יִֽהְיֶה־לְּךָ֣ לְפֶ֔ה וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּֽהְיֶה־לּ֥וֹ לֵֽאלֹהִֽים׃
4.englishText: and he shall speak for you to the people. Thus he shall serve as your spokesman, with you playing the role of God*playing the role of God Cf. 7.1. to him.
4.transliteration: vְdִbֶּr־h֥vּa lְךָ֖ aֶl־hָaָ֑ם vְhָ֤yָh hvּa֙ yִֽhְyֶh־lְּךָ֣ lְpֶ֔h vְaַtָּ֖h tִּֽhְyֶh־lּ֥vֹ lֵֽalֹhִֽyם׃

4.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַמַּטֶּ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה תִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂה־בּ֖וֹ אֶת־הָאֹתֹֽת׃ {פ}
4.englishText: And take with you this rod, with which you shall perform the signs.”
4.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַmַּtֶּ֥h hַzֶּ֖h tִּkַּ֣ch bְּyָdֶ֑ךָ aֲshֶׁ֥r tַּaֲshֶׂh־bּ֖vֹ aֶt־hָaֹtֹֽt׃ {p}

4.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ מֹשֶׁ֜ה וַיָּ֣שׇׁב ׀ אֶל־יֶ֣תֶר חֹֽתְנ֗וֹ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אֵ֣לְכָה נָּ֗א וְאָשׁ֙וּבָה֙ אֶל־אַחַ֣י אֲשֶׁר־בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְאֶרְאֶ֖ה הַעוֹדָ֣ם חַיִּ֑ים וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יִתְר֛וֹ לְמֹשֶׁ֖ה לֵ֥ךְ לְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
4.englishText: Moses went back to his father-in-law Jether*Jether I.e., Jethro. and said to him, “Let me go back to my kinsfolk in Egypt and see how they are faring.”*how they are faring Lit. “whether they are still alive.” And Jethro said to Moses, “Go in peace.”
4.transliteration: vַyֵּ֨lֶךְ mֹshֶׁ֜h vַyָּ֣shׇׁb ׀ aֶl־yֶ֣tֶr chֹֽtְn֗vֹ vַyֹּ֤amֶr lvֹ֙ aֵ֣lְkָh nָּ֗a vְaָshׁ֙vּbָh֙ aֶl־aַchַ֣y aֲshֶׁr־bְּmִtsְrַ֔yִם vְaֶrְaֶ֖h hַavֹdָ֣ם chַyִּ֑yם vַyֹּ֧amֶr yִtְr֛vֹ lְmֹshֶׁ֖h lֵ֥ךְ lְshָׁlֽvֹם׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ בְּמִדְיָ֔ן לֵ֖ךְ שֻׁ֣ב מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּי־מֵ֙תוּ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים הַֽמְבַקְשִׁ֖ים אֶת־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
4.englishText: יהוה said to Moses in Midian, “Go back to Egypt, for all those who sought to kill you are dead.”
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֤h aֶl־mֹshֶׁh֙ bְּmִdְyָ֔ן lֵ֖ךְ shֻׁ֣b mִtsְrָ֑yִם kִּy־mֵ֙tvּ֙ kׇּl־hָ֣aֲnָshִׁ֔yם hַֽmְbַkְshִׁ֖yם aֶt־nַpְshֶֽׁךָ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֣וֹ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֗יו וַיַּרְכִּבֵם֙ עַֽל־הַחֲמֹ֔ר וַיָּ֖שׇׁב אַ֣רְצָה מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־מַטֵּ֥ה הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
4.englishText: So Moses took his wife and sons, mounted them on an ass, and went back to the land of Egypt; and Moses took the rod of God with him.
4.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֨ch mֹshֶׁ֜h aֶt־aִshְׁtּ֣vֹ vְaֶt־bָּnָ֗yv vַyַּrְkִּbֵם֙ aַֽl־hַchֲmֹ֔r vַyָּ֖shׇׁb aַ֣rְtsָh mִtsְrָ֑yִם vַyִּkַּ֥ch mֹshֶׁ֛h aֶt־mַtֵּ֥h hָaֱlֹhִ֖yם bְּyָdֽvֹ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ בְּלֶכְתְּךָ֙ לָשׁ֣וּב מִצְרַ֔יְמָה רְאֵ֗ה כׇּל־הַמֹּֽפְתִים֙ אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּי בְיָדֶ֔ךָ וַעֲשִׂיתָ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַאֲנִי֙ אֲחַזֵּ֣ק אֶת־לִבּ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א יְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָעָֽם׃
4.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses, “When you return to Egypt, see that you perform before Pharaoh all the marvels that I have put within your power. I, however, will stiffen his heart so that he will not let the people go.
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָh֮ aֶl־mֹshֶׁh֒ bְּlֶkְtְּךָ֙ lָshׁ֣vּb mִtsְrַ֔yְmָh rְaֵ֗h kׇּl־hַmֹּֽpְtִyם֙ aֲshֶׁr־shַׂ֣mְtִּy bְyָdֶ֔ךָ vַaֲshִׂytָ֖ם lִpְnֵ֣y pַrְaֹ֑h vַaֲnִy֙ aֲchַzֵּ֣k aֶt־lִbּ֔vֹ vְlֹ֥a yְshַׁlַּ֖ch aֶt־hָaָֽם׃

4.hebrewText: וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּנִ֥י בְכֹרִ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
4.englishText: Then you shall say to Pharaoh, ‘Thus says יהוה: Israel is My first-born son.
4.transliteration: vְaָmַrְtָּ֖ aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֑h kֹּ֚h aָmַ֣r yְhֹvָ֔h bְּnִ֥y bְkֹrִ֖y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

4.hebrewText: וָאֹמַ֣ר אֵלֶ֗יךָ שַׁלַּ֤ח אֶת־בְּנִי֙ וְיַֽעַבְדֵ֔נִי וַתְּמָאֵ֖ן לְשַׁלְּח֑וֹ הִנֵּה֙ אָנֹכִ֣י הֹרֵ֔ג אֶת־בִּנְךָ֖ בְּכֹרֶֽךָ׃
4.englishText: I have said to you, “Let My son go, that he may worship Me,” yet you refuse to let him go. Now I will slay your first-born son.’”
4.transliteration: vָaֹmַ֣r aֵlֶ֗yךָ shַׁlַּ֤ch aֶt־bְּnִy֙ vְyַֽaַbְdֵ֔nִy vַtְּmָaֵ֖ן lְshַׁlְּch֑vֹ hִnֵּh֙ aָnֹkִ֣y hֹrֵ֔g aֶt־bִּnְךָ֖ bְּkֹrֶֽךָ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֥י בַדֶּ֖רֶךְ בַּמָּל֑וֹן וַיִּפְגְּשֵׁ֣הוּ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ הֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
4.englishText: At a night encampment on the way, יהוה encountered him and sought to kill him.
4.transliteration: vַyְhִ֥y bַdֶּ֖rֶךְ bַּmָּl֑vֹן vַyִּpְgְּshֵׁ֣hvּ yְhֹvָ֔h vַyְbַkֵּ֖shׁ hֲmִytֽvֹ׃

4.hebrewText: וַתִּקַּ֨ח צִפֹּרָ֜ה צֹ֗ר וַתִּכְרֹת֙ אֶת־עׇרְלַ֣ת בְּנָ֔הּ וַתַּגַּ֖ע לְרַגְלָ֑יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֧י חֲתַן־דָּמִ֛ים אַתָּ֖ה לִֽי׃
4.englishText: *Meaning of verse uncertain. So Zipporah took a flint and cut off her son’s foreskin, and touched his legs with it, saying, “You are truly a bridegroom of blood to me!”
4.transliteration: vַtִּkַּ֨ch tsִpֹּrָ֜h tsֹ֗r vַtִּkְrֹt֙ aֶt־aׇrְlַ֣t bְּnָ֔hּ vַtַּgַּ֖a lְrַgְlָ֑yv vַtֹּ֕amֶr kִּ֧y chֲtַן־dָּmִ֛yם aַtָּ֖h lִֽy׃

4.hebrewText: וַיִּ֖רֶף מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אָ֚ז אָֽמְרָ֔ה חֲתַ֥ן דָּמִ֖ים לַמּוּלֹֽת׃ {פ}
4.englishText: And when [God] let him alone, she added, “A bridegroom of blood because of the circumcision.”
4.transliteration: vַyִּ֖rֶף mִmֶּ֑nּvּ aָ֚z aָֽmְrָ֔h chֲtַ֥ן dָּmִ֖yם lַmּvּlֹֽt׃ {p}

4.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן לֵ֛ךְ לִקְרַ֥את מֹשֶׁ֖ה הַמִּדְבָּ֑רָה וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַֽיִּפְגְּשֵׁ֛הוּ בְּהַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וַיִּשַּׁק־לֽוֹ׃
4.englishText: יהוה said to Aaron, “Go to meet Moses in the wilderness.” He went and met him at the mountain of God, and he kissed him.
4.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶֽl־aַhֲrֹ֔ן lֵ֛ךְ lִkְrַ֥at mֹshֶׁ֖h hַmִּdְbָּ֑rָh vַyֵּ֗lֶךְ vַֽyִּpְgְּshֵׁ֛hvּ bְּhַ֥r hָaֱlֹhִ֖yם vַyִּshַּׁk־lֽvֹ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיַּגֵּ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ לְאַֽהֲרֹ֔ן אֵ֛ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׁלָח֑וֹ וְאֵ֥ת כׇּל־הָאֹתֹ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽהוּ׃
4.englishText: Moses told Aaron about all the things that יהוה had committed to him and all the signs about which he had been instructed.
4.transliteration: vַyַּgֵּ֤d mֹshֶׁh֙ lְaַֽhֲrֹ֔ן aֵ֛t kׇּl־dִּbְrֵ֥y yְhֹvָ֖h aֲshֶׁ֣r shְׁlָch֑vֹ vְaֵ֥t kׇּl־hָaֹtֹ֖t aֲshֶׁ֥r tsִvָּֽhvּ׃

4.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיַּ֣אַסְפ֔וּ אֶת־כׇּל־זִקְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
4.englishText: Then Moses and Aaron went and assembled all the elders of the Israelites.
4.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥lֶךְ mֹshֶׁ֖h vְaַhֲrֹ֑ן vַyַּ֣aַsְp֔vּ aֶt־kׇּl־zִkְnֵ֖y bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

4.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָאֹתֹ֖ת לְעֵינֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃
4.englishText: Aaron repeated all the words that יהוה had spoken to Moses, and he performed the signs in the sight of those assembled,
4.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֣r aַhֲrֹ֔ן aֵ֚t kׇּl־hַdְּbָrִ֔yם aֲshֶׁr־dִּbֶּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֑h vַyַּ֥aַshׂ hָaֹtֹ֖t lְaֵynֵ֥y hָaָֽם׃

4.hebrewText: וַֽיַּאֲמֵ֖ן הָעָ֑ם וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֡וּ כִּֽי־פָקַ֨ד יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְכִ֤י רָאָה֙ אֶת־עׇנְיָ֔ם וַֽיִּקְּד֖וּ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
4.englishText: and the assembly was convinced. When they heard that יהוה had taken note of the Israelites and that [God] had seen their plight, they bowed low in homage.
4.transliteration: vַֽyַּaֲmֵ֖ן hָaָ֑ם vַֽyִּshְׁmְa֡vּ kִּֽy־pָkַ֨d yְhֹvָ֜h aֶt־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l vְkִ֤y rָaָh֙ aֶt־aׇnְyָ֔ם vַֽyִּkְּd֖vּ vַyִּֽshְׁtַּchֲvֽvּ׃

5.hebrewText: וְאַחַ֗ר בָּ֚אוּ מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י וְיָחֹ֥גּוּ לִ֖י בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
5.englishText: Afterward Moses and Aaron went and said to Pharaoh, “Thus says יהוה, the God of Israel: Let My people go that they may celebrate a festival for Me in the wilderness.”
5.transliteration: vְaַchַ֗r bָּ֚avּ mֹshֶׁ֣h vְaַhֲrֹ֔ן vַyֹּamְr֖vּ aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֑h kֹּֽh־aָmַ֤r yְhֹvָh֙ aֱlֹhֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l shַׁlַּch֙ aֶt־aַmִּ֔y vְyָchֹ֥gּvּ lִ֖y bַּmִּdְbָּֽr׃

5.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה מִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶשְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹל֔וֹ לְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לֹ֤א יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְגַ֥ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹ֥א אֲשַׁלֵּֽחַ׃
5.englishText: But Pharaoh said, “Who is יהוה that I should heed him and let Israel go? I do not know יהוה, nor will I let Israel go.”
5.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr pַּrְaֹ֔h mִ֤y yְhֹvָh֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aֶshְׁmַ֣a bְּkֹl֔vֹ lְshַׁlַּ֖ch aֶt־yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l lֹ֤a yָdַ֙aְtִּy֙ aֶt־yְhֹvָ֔h vְgַ֥ם aֶt־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l lֹ֥a aֲshַׁlֵּֽchַ׃

5.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָעִבְרִ֖ים נִקְרָ֣א עָלֵ֑ינוּ נֵ֣לְכָה נָּ֡א דֶּ֩רֶךְ֩ שְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת יָמִ֜ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר וְנִזְבְּחָה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ פֶּ֨ן־יִפְגָּעֵ֔נוּ בַּדֶּ֖בֶר א֥וֹ בֶחָֽרֶב׃
5.englishText: They answered, “The God of the Hebrews has become manifest to us. Let us go, we pray, a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to our God יהוה, lest [God] strike us with pestilence or sword.”
5.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ aֱlֹhֵ֥y hָaִbְrִ֖yם nִkְrָ֣a aָlֵ֑ynvּ nֵ֣lְkָh nָּ֡a dֶּ֩rֶךְ֩ shְׁlֹ֨shֶׁt yָmִ֜yם bַּmִּdְbָּ֗r vְnִzְbְּchָh֙ lַֽyhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhֵ֔ynvּ pֶּ֨ן־yִpְgָּaֵ֔nvּ bַּdֶּ֖bֶr a֥vֹ bֶchָֽrֶb׃

5.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לָ֚מָּה מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן תַּפְרִ֥יעוּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם מִֽמַּעֲשָׂ֑יו לְכ֖וּ לְסִבְלֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
5.englishText: But the king of Egypt said to them, “Moses and Aaron, why do you distract the people from their tasks? Get to your labors!”
5.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֲlֵhֶם֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ mִtsְrַ֔yִם lָ֚mָּh mֹshֶׁ֣h vְaַhֲrֹ֔ן tַּpְrִ֥yavּ aֶt־hָaָ֖ם mִֽmַּaֲshָׂ֑yv lְk֖vּ lְsִbְlֹtֵykֶֽם׃

5.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה הֵן־רַבִּ֥ים עַתָּ֖ה עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהִשְׁבַּתֶּ֥ם אֹתָ֖ם מִסִּבְלֹתָֽם׃
5.englishText: And Pharaoh continued, “The people of the land are already so numerous,*The people of the land are already so numerous Samaritan “Even now they are more numerous than the people of the land,” i.e., than the native population (cf. Gen. 23.7). and you would have them cease from their labors!”*from their labors See 1.5–11.
5.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr pַּrְaֹ֔h hֵן־rַbִּ֥yם aַtָּ֖h aַ֣ם hָaָ֑rֶץ vְhִshְׁbַּtֶּ֥ם aֹtָ֖ם mִsִּbְlֹtָֽם׃

5.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֥ו פַּרְעֹ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא אֶת־הַנֹּגְשִׂ֣ים בָּעָ֔ם וְאֶת־שֹׁטְרָ֖יו לֵאמֹֽר׃
5.englishText: That same day Pharaoh charged the taskmasters and overseers of the people, saying,
5.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֥v pַּrְaֹ֖h bַּyּ֣vֹם hַh֑vּa aֶt־hַnֹּgְshִׂ֣yם bָּaָ֔ם vְaֶt־shֹׁtְrָ֖yv lֵamֹֽr׃

5.hebrewText: לֹ֣א תֹאסִפ֞וּן לָתֵ֨ת תֶּ֧בֶן לָעָ֛ם לִלְבֹּ֥ן הַלְּבֵנִ֖ים כִּתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֑ם הֵ֚ם יֵֽלְכ֔וּ וְקֹשְׁשׁ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם תֶּֽבֶן׃
5.englishText: “You shall no longer provide the people with straw for making bricks as heretofore; let them go and gather straw for themselves.
5.transliteration: lֹ֣a tֹasִp֞vּן lָtֵ֨t tֶּ֧bֶן lָaָ֛ם lִlְbֹּ֥ן hַlְּbֵnִ֖yם kִּtְm֣vֹl shִׁlְshֹׁ֑ם hֵ֚ם yֵֽlְk֔vּ vְkֹshְׁshׁ֥vּ lָhֶ֖ם tֶּֽbֶן׃

5.hebrewText: וְאֶת־מַתְכֹּ֨נֶת הַלְּבֵנִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵם֩ עֹשִׂ֨ים תְּמ֤וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁם֙ תָּשִׂ֣ימוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם לֹ֥א תִגְרְע֖וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־נִרְפִּ֣ים הֵ֔ם עַל־כֵּ֗ן הֵ֤ם צֹֽעֲקִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר נֵלְכָ֖ה נִזְבְּחָ֥ה לֵאלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
5.englishText: But impose upon them the same quota of bricks as they have been making heretofore; do not reduce it, for they are shirkers; that is why they cry, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to our God!’
5.transliteration: vְaֶt־mַtְkֹּ֨nֶt hַlְּbֵnִ֜yם aֲshֶׁ֣r hֵם֩ aֹshִׂ֨yם tְּm֤vֹl shִׁlְshֹׁם֙ tָּshִׂ֣ymvּ aֲlֵyhֶ֔ם lֹ֥a tִgְrְa֖vּ mִmֶּ֑nּvּ kִּֽy־nִrְpִּ֣yם hֵ֔ם aַl־kֵּ֗ן hֵ֤ם tsֹֽaֲkִyם֙ lֵamֹ֔r nֵlְkָ֖h nִzְbְּchָ֥h lֵalֹhֵֽynvּ׃

5.hebrewText: תִּכְבַּ֧ד הָעֲבֹדָ֛ה עַל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים וְיַעֲשׂוּ־בָ֑הּ וְאַל־יִשְׁע֖וּ בְּדִבְרֵי־שָֽׁקֶר׃
5.englishText: Let heavier work be laid upon those involved;*those involved Lit. “the [salient] participants.” Trad. “the men.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. let them keep at it and not pay attention to deceitful promises.”
5.transliteration: tִּkְbַּ֧d hָaֲbֹdָ֛h aַl־hָaֲnָshִׁ֖yם vְyַaֲshׂvּ־bָ֑hּ vְaַl־yִshְׁa֖vּ bְּdִbְrֵy־shָֽׁkֶr׃

5.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֨צְא֜וּ נֹגְשֵׂ֤י הָעָם֙ וְשֹׁ֣טְרָ֔יו וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֶל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֵינֶ֛נִּי נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֖ם תֶּֽבֶן׃
5.englishText: So the taskmasters and overseers of the people went out and said to the people, “Thus says Pharaoh: I will not give you any straw.
5.transliteration: vַyֵּ֨tsְa֜vּ nֹgְshֵׂ֤y hָaָם֙ vְshֹׁ֣tְrָ֔yv vַyֹּamְr֥vּ aֶl־hָaָ֖ם lֵamֹ֑r kֹּ֚h aָmַ֣r pַּrְaֹ֔h aֵynֶ֛nִּy nֹtֵ֥ן lָkֶ֖ם tֶּֽbֶן׃

5.hebrewText: אַתֶּ֗ם לְכ֨וּ קְח֤וּ לָכֶם֙ תֶּ֔בֶן מֵאֲשֶׁ֖ר תִּמְצָ֑אוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין נִגְרָ֛ע מֵעֲבֹדַתְכֶ֖ם דָּבָֽר׃
5.englishText: You must go and get the straw yourselves wherever you can find it; but there shall be no decrease whatever in your work.”
5.transliteration: aַtֶּ֗ם lְk֨vּ kְch֤vּ lָkֶם֙ tֶּ֔bֶן mֵaֲshֶׁ֖r tִּmְtsָ֑avּ kִּ֣y aֵ֥yן nִgְrָ֛a mֵaֲbֹdַtְkֶ֖ם dָּbָֽr׃

5.hebrewText: וַיָּ֥פֶץ הָעָ֖ם בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְקֹשֵׁ֥שׁ קַ֖שׁ לַתֶּֽבֶן׃
5.englishText: Then the people scattered throughout the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.
5.transliteration: vַyָּ֥pֶץ hָaָ֖ם bְּkׇl־aֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrָ֑yִם lְkֹshֵׁ֥shׁ kַ֖shׁ lַtֶּֽbֶן׃

5.hebrewText: וְהַנֹּגְשִׂ֖ים אָצִ֣ים לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּלּ֤וּ מַעֲשֵׂיכֶם֙ דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּהְי֥וֹת הַתֶּֽבֶן׃
5.englishText: And the taskmasters pressed them, saying, “You must complete the same work assignment each day as when you had straw.”
5.transliteration: vְhַnֹּgְshִׂ֖yם aָtsִ֣yם lֵamֹ֑r kַּlּ֤vּ mַaֲshֵׂykֶם֙ dְּbַr־y֣vֹם bְּyvֹm֔vֹ kַּaֲshֶׁ֖r bִּhְy֥vֹt hַtֶּֽbֶן׃

5.hebrewText: וַיֻּכּ֗וּ שֹֽׁטְרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣מוּ עֲלֵהֶ֔ם נֹגְשֵׂ֥י פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר מַדּ֡וּעַ לֹא֩ כִלִּיתֶ֨ם חׇקְכֶ֤ם לִלְבֹּן֙ כִּתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם גַּם־תְּמ֖וֹל גַּם־הַיּֽוֹם׃
5.englishText: And the overseers of the Israelites, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten. “Why,” they were asked, “did you not complete the prescribed amount of bricks, either yesterday or today, as you did before?”
5.transliteration: vַyֻּkּ֗vּ shֹֽׁtְrֵy֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l aֲshֶׁr־shָׂ֣mvּ aֲlֵhֶ֔ם nֹgְshֵׂ֥y pַrְaֹ֖h lֵamֹ֑r mַdּ֡vּaַ lֹa֩ kִlִּytֶ֨ם chׇkְkֶ֤ם lִlְbֹּן֙ kִּtְm֣vֹl shִׁlְshֹׁ֔ם gַּם־tְּm֖vֹl gַּם־hַyּֽvֹם׃

5.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ שֹֽׁטְרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּצְעֲק֥וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר לָ֧מָּה תַעֲשֶׂ֦ה כֹ֖ה לַעֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
5.englishText: Then the overseers of the Israelites came to Pharaoh and cried: “Why do you deal thus with your servants?
5.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֗avּ shֹֽׁtְrֵy֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l vַyִּtsְaֲk֥vּ aֶl־pַּrְaֹ֖h lֵamֹ֑r lָ֧mָּh tַaֲshֶׂ֦h kֹ֖h lַaֲbָdֶֽyךָ׃

5.hebrewText: תֶּ֗בֶן אֵ֤ין נִתָּן֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ וּלְבֵנִ֛ים אֹמְרִ֥ים לָ֖נוּ עֲשׂ֑וּ וְהִנֵּ֧ה עֲבָדֶ֛יךָ מֻכִּ֖ים וְחָטָ֥את עַמֶּֽךָ׃
5.englishText: No straw is issued to your servants, yet they demand of us: Make bricks! Thus your servants are being beaten, when the fault is with your own people.”
5.transliteration: tֶּ֗bֶן aֵ֤yן nִtָּן֙ lַaֲbָdֶ֔yךָ vּlְbֵnִ֛yם aֹmְrִ֥yם lָ֖nvּ aֲshׂ֑vּ vְhִnֵּ֧h aֲbָdֶ֛yךָ mֻkִּ֖yם vְchָtָ֥at aַmֶּֽךָ׃

5.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר נִרְפִּ֥ים אַתֶּ֖ם נִרְפִּ֑ים עַל־כֵּן֙ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹֽמְרִ֔ים נֵלְכָ֖ה נִזְבְּחָ֥ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
5.englishText: He replied, “You are shirkers, shirkers! That is why you say, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to יהוה.’
5.transliteration: vַyֹּ֛amֶr nִrְpִּ֥yם aַtֶּ֖ם nִrְpִּ֑yם aַl־kֵּן֙ aַtֶּ֣ם aֹֽmְrִ֔yם nֵlְkָ֖h nִzְbְּchָ֥h lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃

5.hebrewText: וְעַתָּה֙ לְכ֣וּ עִבְד֔וּ וְתֶ֖בֶן לֹא־יִנָּתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם וְתֹ֥כֶן לְבֵנִ֖ים תִּתֵּֽנוּ׃
5.englishText: Be off now to your work! No straw shall be issued to you, but you must produce your quota of bricks!”
5.transliteration: vְaַtָּh֙ lְk֣vּ aִbְd֔vּ vְtֶ֖bֶן lֹa־yִnָּtֵ֣ן lָkֶ֑ם vְtֹ֥kֶן lְbֵnִ֖yם tִּtֵּֽnvּ׃

5.hebrewText: וַיִּרְא֞וּ שֹֽׁטְרֵ֧י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֹתָ֖ם בְּרָ֣ע לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־תִגְרְע֥וּ מִלִּבְנֵיכֶ֖ם דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
5.englishText: Now the overseers of the Israelites found themselves in trouble because of the order, “You must not reduce your daily quantity of bricks.”
5.transliteration: vַyִּrְa֞vּ shֹֽׁtְrֵ֧y bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l aֹtָ֖ם bְּrָ֣a lֵamֹ֑r lֹa־tִgְrְa֥vּ mִlִּbְnֵykֶ֖ם dְּbַr־y֥vֹם bְּyvֹmֽvֹ׃

5.hebrewText: וַֽיִּפְגְּעוּ֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֔ן נִצָּבִ֖ים לִקְרָאתָ֑ם בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מֵאֵ֥ת פַּרְעֹֽה׃
5.englishText: As they left Pharaoh’s presence, they came upon Moses and Aaron standing in their path,
5.transliteration: vַֽyִּpְgְּavּ֙ aֶt־mֹshֶׁ֣h vְaֶֽt־aַhֲrֹ֔ן nִtsָּbִ֖yם lִkְrָatָ֑ם bְּtsֵatָ֖ם mֵaֵ֥t pַּrְaֹֽh׃

5.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם יֵ֧רֶא יְהֹוָ֛ה עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם וְיִשְׁפֹּ֑ט אֲשֶׁ֧ר הִבְאַשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־רֵיחֵ֗נוּ בְּעֵינֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ וּבְעֵינֵ֣י עֲבָדָ֔יו לָֽתֶת־חֶ֥רֶב בְּיָדָ֖ם לְהׇרְגֵֽנוּ׃
5.englishText: and they said to them, “May יהוה look upon you and punish you for making us loathsome to Pharaoh and his courtiers—putting a sword in their hands to slay us.”
5.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֣vּ aֲlֵhֶ֔ם yֵ֧rֶa yְhֹvָ֛h aֲlֵykֶ֖ם vְyִshְׁpֹּ֑t aֲshֶׁ֧r hִbְaַshְׁtֶּ֣ם aֶt־rֵychֵ֗nvּ bְּaֵynֵ֤y pַrְaֹh֙ vּbְaֵynֵ֣y aֲbָdָ֔yv lָֽtֶt־chֶ֥rֶb bְּyָdָ֖ם lְhׇrְgֵֽnvּ׃

5.hebrewText: וַיָּ֧שׇׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֗י לָמָ֤ה הֲרֵעֹ֙תָה֙ לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה שְׁלַחְתָּֽנִי׃
5.englishText: Then Moses returned to יהוה and said, “O my lord, why did You bring harm upon this people? Why did You send me?
5.transliteration: vַyָּ֧shׇׁb mֹshֶׁ֛h aֶl־yְhֹvָ֖h vַyֹּamַ֑r aֲdֹnָ֗y lָmָ֤h hֲrֵaֹ֙tָh֙ lָaָ֣ם hַzֶּ֔h lָ֥mָּh zֶּ֖h shְׁlַchְtָּֽnִy׃

5.hebrewText: וּמֵאָ֞ז בָּ֤אתִי אֶל־פַּרְעֹה֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר בִּשְׁמֶ֔ךָ הֵרַ֖ע לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה וְהַצֵּ֥ל לֹא־הִצַּ֖לְתָּ אֶת־עַמֶּֽךָ׃
5.englishText: Ever since I came to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has dealt worse with this people; and still You have not delivered Your people.”
5.transliteration: vּmֵaָ֞z bָּ֤atִy aֶl־pַּrְaֹh֙ lְdַbֵּ֣r bִּshְׁmֶ֔ךָ hֵrַ֖a lָaָ֣ם hַzֶּ֑h vְhַtsֵּ֥l lֹa־hִtsַּ֖lְtָּ aֶt־aַmֶּֽךָ׃

6.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַתָּ֣ה תִרְאֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה לְפַרְעֹ֑ה כִּ֣י בְיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ יְשַׁלְּחֵ֔ם וּבְיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֔ה יְגָרְשֵׁ֖ם מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃ {ס}
6.englishText: Then יהוה said to Moses, “You shall soon see what I will do to Pharaoh: he shall let them go because of a greater might; indeed, because of a greater might he shall drive them from his land.”
6.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h aַtָּ֣h tִrְaֶ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r aֶֽaֱshֶׂ֖h lְpַrְaֹ֑h kִּ֣y bְyָ֤d chֲzָkָh֙ yְshַׁlְּchֵ֔ם vּbְyָ֣d chֲzָkָ֔h yְgָrְshֵׁ֖ם mֵaַrְtsֽvֹ׃ {s}
