10.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֨א פַרְעֹ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְכוּ֙ עִבְד֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה רַ֛ק צֹאנְכֶ֥ם וּבְקַרְכֶ֖ם יֻצָּ֑ג גַּֽם־טַפְּכֶ֖ם יֵלֵ֥ךְ עִמָּכֶֽם׃
10.englishText: Pharaoh then summoned Moses and said, “Go, worship יהוה ! Only your flocks and your herds shall be left behind; even your dependents may go with you.”
10.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֨a pַrְaֹ֜h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ lְkvּ֙ aִbְd֣vּ aֶt־yְhֹvָ֔h rַ֛k tsֹanְkֶ֥ם vּbְkַrְkֶ֖ם yֻtsָּ֑g gַּֽם־tַpְּkֶ֖ם yֵlֵ֥ךְ aִmָּkֶֽם׃

10.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה גַּם־אַתָּ֛ה תִּתֵּ֥ן בְּיָדֵ֖נוּ זְבָחִ֣ים וְעֹלֹ֑ת וְעָשִׂ֖ינוּ לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
10.englishText: But Moses said, “You yourself must provide us with sacrifices and burnt offerings to offer up to our God יהוה;
10.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr mֹshֶׁ֔h gַּם־aַtָּ֛h tִּtֵּ֥ן bְּyָdֵ֖nvּ zְbָchִ֣yם vְaֹlֹ֑t vְaָshִׂ֖ynvּ lַyhֹvָ֥h aֱlֹhֵֽynvּ׃

10.hebrewText: וְגַם־מִקְנֵ֜נוּ יֵלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֗נוּ לֹ֤א תִשָּׁאֵר֙ פַּרְסָ֔ה כִּ֚י מִמֶּ֣נּוּ נִקַּ֔ח לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ לֹֽא־נֵדַ֗ע מַֽה־נַּעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַד־בֹּאֵ֖נוּ שָֽׁמָּה׃
10.englishText: our own livestock, too, shall go along with us—not a hoof shall remain behind: for we must select from it for the worship of our God יהוה; and we shall not know with what we are to worship יהוה until we arrive there.”
10.transliteration: vְgַם־mִkְnֵ֜nvּ yֵlֵ֣ךְ aִmָּ֗nvּ lֹ֤a tִshָּׁaֵr֙ pַּrְsָ֔h kִּ֚y mִmֶּ֣nּvּ nִkַּ֔ch lַaֲbֹ֖d aֶt־yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhֵ֑ynvּ vַaֲnַ֣chְnvּ lֹֽa־nֵdַ֗a mַֽh־nַּaֲbֹd֙ aֶt־yְhֹvָ֔h aַd־bֹּaֵ֖nvּ shָֽׁmָּh׃

10.hebrewText: וַיְחַזֵּ֥ק יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה לְשַׁלְּחָֽם׃
10.englishText: But יהוה stiffened Pharaoh’s heart and he would not agree to let them go.
10.transliteration: vַyְchַzֵּ֥k yְhֹvָ֖h aֶt־lֵ֣b pַּrְaֹ֑h vְlֹ֥a aָbָ֖h lְshַׁlְּchָֽם׃

10.hebrewText: וַיֹּֽאמֶר־ל֥וֹ פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵ֣ךְ מֵעָלָ֑י הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֗ אַל־תֹּ֙סֶף֙ רְא֣וֹת פָּנַ֔י כִּ֗י בְּי֛וֹם רְאֹתְךָ֥ פָנַ֖י תָּמֽוּת׃
10.englishText: Pharaoh said to him, “Be gone from me! Take care not to see me again, for the moment you look upon my face you shall die.”
10.transliteration: vַyֹּֽamֶr־l֥vֹ pַrְaֹ֖h lֵ֣ךְ mֵaָlָ֑y hִshָּׁ֣mֶr lְךָ֗ aַl־tֹּ֙sֶף֙ rְa֣vֹt pָּnַ֔y kִּ֗y bְּy֛vֹם rְaֹtְךָ֥ pָnַ֖y tָּmֽvּt׃

10.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה כֵּ֣ן דִּבַּ֑רְתָּ לֹא־אֹסִ֥ף ע֖וֹד רְא֥וֹת פָּנֶֽיךָ׃ {פ}
10.englishText: And Moses replied, “You have spoken rightly. I shall not see your face again!”
10.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr mֹshֶׁ֖h kֵּ֣ן dִּbַּ֑rְtָּ lֹa־aֹsִ֥ף a֖vֹd rְa֥vֹt pָּnֶֽyךָ׃ {p}

11.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה ע֣וֹד נֶ֤גַע אֶחָד֙ אָבִ֤יא עַל־פַּרְעֹה֙ וְעַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֕ן יְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּ֑ה כְּשַׁ֨לְּח֔וֹ כָּלָ֕ה גָּרֵ֛שׁ יְגָרֵ֥שׁ אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּֽה׃
11.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses, “I will bring but one more plague upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt; after that he shall let you go from here; indeed, when he lets you go, he will drive you out of here one and all.
11.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h a֣vֹd nֶ֤gַa aֶchָd֙ aָbִ֤ya aַl־pַּrְaֹh֙ vְaַl־mִtsְrַ֔yִם aַֽchֲrֵy־kֵ֕ן yְshַׁlַּ֥ch aֶtְkֶ֖ם mִzֶּ֑h kְּshַׁ֨lְּch֔vֹ kָּlָ֕h gָּrֵ֛shׁ yְgָrֵ֥shׁ aֶtְkֶ֖ם mִzֶּֽh׃

11.hebrewText: דַּבֶּר־נָ֖א בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וְיִשְׁאֲל֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ ׀ מֵאֵ֣ת רֵעֵ֗הוּ וְאִשָּׁה֙ מֵאֵ֣ת רְעוּתָ֔הּ כְּלֵי־כֶ֖סֶף וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
11.englishText: Tell the people to borrow, each man from his neighbor and each woman from hers, objects of silver and gold.”
11.transliteration: dַּbֶּr־nָ֖a bְּaׇzְnֵ֣y hָaָ֑ם vְyִshְׁaֲl֞vּ aִ֣yshׁ ׀ mֵaֵ֣t rֵaֵ֗hvּ vְaִshָּׁh֙ mֵaֵ֣t rְavּtָ֔hּ kְּlֵy־kֶ֖sֶף vּkְlֵ֥y zָhָֽb׃

11.hebrewText: וַיִּתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־חֵ֥ן הָעָ֖ם בְּעֵינֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם גַּ֣ם ׀ הָאִ֣ישׁ מֹשֶׁ֗ה גָּד֤וֹל מְאֹד֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּעֵינֵ֥י עַבְדֵֽי־פַרְעֹ֖ה וּבְעֵינֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
11.englishText: יהוה disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people. Moreover, Moses himself*Moses himself Lit. “the participant whose involvement defines the depicted situation, Moses”; trad. “the man Moses.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. was much esteemed in the land of Egypt, among Pharaoh’s courtiers and among the people.
11.transliteration: vַyִּtֵּ֧ן yְhֹvָ֛h aֶt־chֵ֥ן hָaָ֖ם bְּaֵynֵ֣y mִtsְrָ֑yִם gַּ֣ם ׀ hָaִ֣yshׁ mֹshֶׁ֗h gָּd֤vֹl mְaֹd֙ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם bְּaֵynֵ֥y aַbְdֵֽy־pַrְaֹ֖h vּbְaֵynֵ֥y hָaָֽם׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּחֲצֹ֣ת הַלַּ֔יְלָה אֲנִ֥י יוֹצֵ֖א בְּת֥וֹךְ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
11.englishText: Moses said, “Thus says יהוה: Toward midnight I will go forth among the Egyptians,
11.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr mֹshֶׁ֔h kֹּ֖h aָmַ֣r yְhֹvָ֑h kַּchֲtsֹ֣t hַlַּ֔yְlָh aֲnִ֥y yvֹtsֵ֖a bְּt֥vֹךְ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

11.hebrewText: וּמֵ֣ת כׇּל־בְּכוֹר֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ מִבְּכ֤וֹר פַּרְעֹה֙ הַיֹּשֵׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְא֔וֹ עַ֚ד בְּכ֣וֹר הַשִּׁפְחָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר אַחַ֣ר הָרֵחָ֑יִם וְכֹ֖ל בְּכ֥וֹר בְּהֵמָֽה׃
11.englishText: and every [male] first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sits on his throne to the first-born of the slave girl who is behind the millstones; and all the first-born of the cattle.
11.transliteration: vּmֵ֣t kׇּl־bְּkvֹr֮ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֒yִם֒ mִbְּk֤vֹr pַּrְaֹh֙ hַyֹּshֵׁ֣b aַl־kִּsְa֔vֹ aַ֚d bְּk֣vֹr hַshִּׁpְchָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֖r aַchַ֣r hָrֵchָ֑yִם vְkֹ֖l bְּk֥vֹr bְּhֵmָֽh׃

11.hebrewText: וְהָ֥יְתָ֛ה צְעָקָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר כָּמֹ֙הוּ֙ לֹ֣א נִהְיָ֔תָה וְכָמֹ֖הוּ לֹ֥א תֹסִֽף׃
11.englishText: And there shall be a loud cry in all the land of Egypt, such as has never been or will ever be again;
11.transliteration: vְhָ֥yְtָ֛h tsְaָkָ֥h gְdֹlָ֖h bְּkׇl־aֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrָ֑yִם aֲshֶׁ֤r kָּmֹ֙hvּ֙ lֹ֣a nִhְyָ֔tָh vְkָmֹ֖hvּ lֹ֥a tֹsִֽף׃

11.hebrewText: וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֹ֤א יֶֽחֱרַץ־כֶּ֙לֶב֙ לְשֹׁנ֔וֹ לְמֵאִ֖ישׁ וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה לְמַ֙עַן֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּן אֲשֶׁר֙ יַפְלֶ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה בֵּ֥ין מִצְרַ֖יִם וּבֵ֥ין יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
11.englishText: but not a dog shall snarl*snarl Others “move (or whet) his tongue.” at any of the Israelites, at human or beast—in order that you may know that יהוה makes a distinction between Egypt and Israel.
11.transliteration: vּlְkֹ֣l ׀ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l lֹ֤a yֶֽchֱrַץ־kֶּ֙lֶb֙ lְshֹׁn֔vֹ lְmֵaִ֖yshׁ vְaַd־bְּhֵmָ֑h lְmַ֙aַן֙ tֵּֽdְa֔vּן aֲshֶׁr֙ yַpְlֶ֣h yְhֹvָ֔h bֵּ֥yן mִtsְrַ֖yִם vּbֵ֥yן yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

11.hebrewText: וְיָרְד֣וּ כׇל־עֲבָדֶ֩יךָ֩ אֵ֨לֶּה אֵלַ֜י וְהִשְׁתַּֽחֲווּ־לִ֣י לֵאמֹ֗ר צֵ֤א אַתָּה֙ וְכׇל־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־בְּרַגְלֶ֔יךָ וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן אֵצֵ֑א וַיֵּצֵ֥א מֵֽעִם־פַּרְעֹ֖ה בׇּחֳרִי־אָֽף׃ {ס}
11.englishText: “Then all these courtiers of yours shall come down to me and bow low to me, saying, ‘Depart, you and all the people who follow you!’ After that I will depart.” And he left Pharaoh’s presence in hot anger.
11.transliteration: vְyָrְd֣vּ kׇl־aֲbָdֶ֩yךָ֩ aֵ֨lֶּh aֵlַ֜y vְhִshְׁtַּֽchֲvvּ־lִ֣y lֵamֹ֗r tsֵ֤a aַtָּh֙ vְkׇl־hָaָ֣ם aֲshֶׁr־bְּrַgְlֶ֔yךָ vְaַchֲrֵy־kֵ֖ן aֵtsֵ֑a vַyֵּtsֵ֥a mֵֽaִם־pַּrְaֹ֖h bׇּchֳrִy־aָֽף׃ {s}

11.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה לֹא־יִשְׁמַ֥ע אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה לְמַ֛עַן רְב֥וֹת מוֹפְתַ֖י בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
11.englishText: Now יהוה had said to Moses, “Pharaoh will not heed you, in order that My marvels may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”
11.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h lֹa־yִshְׁmַ֥a aֲlֵykֶ֖ם pַּrְaֹ֑h lְmַ֛aַן rְb֥vֹt mvֹpְtַ֖y bְּaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

11.hebrewText: וּמֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֗ן עָשׂ֛וּ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמֹּפְתִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַיְחַזֵּ֤ק יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹֽא־שִׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃ {ס}
11.englishText: Moses and Aaron had performed all these marvels before Pharaoh, but יהוה had stiffened the heart of Pharaoh so that he would not let the Israelites go from his land.
11.transliteration: vּmֹshֶׁ֣h vְaַhֲrֹ֗ן aָshׂ֛vּ aֶt־kׇּl־hַmֹּpְtִ֥yם hָaֵ֖lֶּh lִpְnֵ֣y pַrְaֹ֑h vַyְchַzֵּ֤k yְhֹvָh֙ aֶt־lֵ֣b pַּrְaֹ֔h vְlֹֽa־shִׁlַּ֥ch aֶt־bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mֵaַrְtsֽvֹ׃ {s}

12.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לֵאמֹֽר׃
12.englishText: יהוה said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt:
12.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֣h vְaֶֽl־aַhֲrֹ֔ן bְּaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrַ֖yִם lֵamֹֽr׃

12.hebrewText: הַחֹ֧דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם רֹ֣אשׁ חֳדָשִׁ֑ים רִאשׁ֥וֹן הוּא֙ לָכֶ֔ם לְחׇדְשֵׁ֖י הַשָּׁנָֽה׃
12.englishText: This month shall mark for you the beginning of the months; it shall be the first of the months of the year for you.
12.transliteration: hַchֹ֧dֶshׁ hַzֶּ֛h lָkֶ֖ם rֹ֣ashׁ chֳdָshִׁ֑yם rִashׁ֥vֹן hvּa֙ lָkֶ֔ם lְchׇdְshֵׁ֖y hַshָּׁnָֽh׃

12.hebrewText: דַּבְּר֗וּ אֶֽל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֤ת יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בֶּעָשֹׂ֖ר לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וְיִקְח֣וּ לָהֶ֗ם אִ֛ישׁ שֶׂ֥ה לְבֵית־אָבֹ֖ת שֶׂ֥ה לַבָּֽיִת׃
12.englishText: Speak to the community leadership of Israel*community leadership of Israel Heb. kol ‘adat yisra’el, lit. “whole community of Israel,” which here denotes the part (“leadership”) that acts on behalf of the whole (“community”). See the Dictionary under ‘edah. and say that on the tenth of this month each of them shall take a lamb*lamb Or “kid.” Heb. seh means either “sheep” or “goat”; cf. v. 5. to a family, a lamb to a household.
12.transliteration: dַּbְּr֗vּ aֶֽl־kׇּl־aֲdַ֤t yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ lֵamֹ֔r bֶּaָshֹׂ֖r lַchֹ֣dֶshׁ hַzֶּ֑h vְyִkְch֣vּ lָhֶ֗ם aִ֛yshׁ shֶׂ֥h lְbֵyt־aָbֹ֖t shֶׂ֥h lַbָּֽyִt׃

12.hebrewText: וְאִם־יִמְעַ֣ט הַבַּ֘יִת֮ מִהְי֣וֹת מִשֶּׂה֒ וְלָקַ֣ח ה֗וּא וּשְׁכֵנ֛וֹ הַקָּרֹ֥ב אֶל־בֵּית֖וֹ בְּמִכְסַ֣ת נְפָשֹׁ֑ת אִ֚ישׁ לְפִ֣י אׇכְל֔וֹ תָּכֹ֖סּוּ עַל־הַשֶּֽׂה׃
12.englishText: But if the household is too small for a lamb, let it share one with a neighbor who dwells nearby, in proportion to the number of persons: you shall contribute for the lamb according to what each household will eat.
12.transliteration: vְaִם־yִmְaַ֣t hַbַּ֘yִt֮ mִhְy֣vֹt mִshֶּׂh֒ vְlָkַ֣ch h֗vּa vּshְׁkֵn֛vֹ hַkָּrֹ֥b aֶl־bֵּyt֖vֹ bְּmִkְsַ֣t nְpָshֹׁ֑t aִ֚yshׁ lְpִ֣y aׇkְl֔vֹ tָּkֹ֖sּvּ aַl־hַshֶּֽׂh׃

12.hebrewText: שֶׂ֥ה תָמִ֛ים זָכָ֥ר בֶּן־שָׁנָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם מִן־הַכְּבָשִׂ֥ים וּמִן־הָעִזִּ֖ים תִּקָּֽחוּ׃
12.englishText: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a yearling male; you may take it from the sheep or from the goats.
12.transliteration: shֶׂ֥h tָmִ֛yם zָkָ֥r bֶּן־shָׁnָ֖h yִhְyֶ֣h lָkֶ֑ם mִן־hַkְּbָshִׂ֥yם vּmִן־hָaִzִּ֖yם tִּkָּֽchvּ׃

12.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֤ה לָכֶם֙ לְמִשְׁמֶ֔רֶת עַ֣ד אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וְשָׁחֲט֣וּ אֹת֗וֹ כֹּ֛ל קְהַ֥ל עֲדַֽת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבָּֽיִם׃
12.englishText: You shall keep watch over it until the fourteenth day of this month; and all the assembled congregation of the Israelites shall slaughter it at twilight.
12.transliteration: vְhָyָ֤h lָkֶם֙ lְmִshְׁmֶ֔rֶt aַ֣d aַrְbָּaָ֥h aָshָׂ֛r y֖vֹם lַchֹ֣dֶshׁ hַzֶּ֑h vְshָׁchֲt֣vּ aֹt֗vֹ kֹּ֛l kְhַ֥l aֲdַֽt־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l bֵּ֥yן hָaַrְbָּֽyִם׃

12.hebrewText: וְלָֽקְחוּ֙ מִן־הַדָּ֔ם וְנָ֥תְנ֛וּ עַל־שְׁתֵּ֥י הַמְּזוּזֹ֖ת וְעַל־הַמַּשְׁק֑וֹף עַ֚ל הַבָּ֣תִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יֹאכְל֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֶֽם׃
12.englishText: They shall take some of the blood and put it on the two doorposts and the lintel of the houses in which they are to eat it.
12.transliteration: vְlָֽkְchvּ֙ mִן־hַdָּ֔ם vְnָ֥tְn֛vּ aַl־shְׁtֵּ֥y hַmְּzvּzֹ֖t vְaַl־hַmַּshְׁk֑vֹף aַ֚l hַbָּ֣tִּ֔yם aֲshֶׁr־yֹakְl֥vּ aֹt֖vֹ bָּhֶֽם׃

12.hebrewText: וְאָכְל֥וּ אֶת־הַבָּשָׂ֖ר בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַזֶּ֑ה צְלִי־אֵ֣שׁ וּמַצּ֔וֹת עַל־מְרֹרִ֖ים יֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
12.englishText: They shall eat the flesh that same night; they shall eat it roasted over the fire, with unleavened bread and with bitter herbs.
12.transliteration: vְaָkְl֥vּ aֶt־hַbָּshָׂ֖r bַּlַּ֣yְlָh hַzֶּ֑h tsְlִy־aֵ֣shׁ vּmַtsּ֔vֹt aַl־mְrֹrִ֖yם yֹakְlֻֽhvּ׃

12.hebrewText: אַל־תֹּאכְל֤וּ מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ נָ֔א וּבָשֵׁ֥ל מְבֻשָּׁ֖ל בַּמָּ֑יִם כִּ֣י אִם־צְלִי־אֵ֔שׁ רֹאשׁ֥וֹ עַל־כְּרָעָ֖יו וְעַל־קִרְבּֽוֹ׃
12.englishText: Do not eat any of it raw, or cooked in any way with water, but roasted—head, legs, and entrails—over the fire.
12.transliteration: aַl־tֹּakְl֤vּ mִmֶּ֙nּvּ֙ nָ֔a vּbָshֵׁ֥l mְbֻshָּׁ֖l bַּmָּ֑yִם kִּ֣y aִם־tsְlִy־aֵ֔shׁ rֹashׁ֥vֹ aַl־kְּrָaָ֖yv vְaַl־kִrְbּֽvֹ׃

12.hebrewText: וְלֹא־תוֹתִ֥ירוּ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּ֑קֶר וְהַנֹּתָ֥ר מִמֶּ֛נּוּ עַד־בֹּ֖קֶר בָּאֵ֥שׁ תִּשְׂרֹֽפוּ׃
12.englishText: You shall not leave any of it over until morning; if any of it is left until morning, you shall burn it.
12.transliteration: vְlֹa־tvֹtִ֥yrvּ mִmֶּ֖nּvּ aַd־bֹּ֑kֶr vְhַnֹּtָ֥r mִmֶּ֛nּvּ aַd־bֹּ֖kֶr bָּaֵ֥shׁ tִּshְׂrֹֽpvּ׃

12.hebrewText: וְכָ֘כָה֮ תֹּאכְל֣וּ אֹתוֹ֒ מׇתְנֵיכֶ֣ם חֲגֻרִ֔ים נַֽעֲלֵיכֶם֙ בְּרַגְלֵיכֶ֔ם וּמַקֶּלְכֶ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶ֑ם וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ בְּחִפָּז֔וֹן פֶּ֥סַח ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃
12.englishText: This is how you shall eat it: your loins girded, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and you shall eat it hurriedly: it is a passover offering*passover offering Or “protective offering”; Heb. pesaḥ. to יהוה.
12.transliteration: vְkָ֘kָh֮ tֹּakְl֣vּ aֹtvֹ֒ mׇtְnֵykֶ֣ם chֲgֻrִ֔yם nַֽaֲlֵykֶם֙ bְּrַgְlֵykֶ֔ם vּmַkֶּlְkֶ֖ם bְּyֶdְkֶ֑ם vַaֲkַlְtֶּ֤ם aֹtvֹ֙ bְּchִpָּz֔vֹן pֶּ֥sַch h֖vּa lַyhֹvָֽh׃

12.hebrewText: וְעָבַרְתִּ֣י בְאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֘יִם֮ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַזֶּה֒ וְהִכֵּיתִ֤י כׇל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מֵאָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה וּבְכׇל־אֱלֹהֵ֥י מִצְרַ֛יִם אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה שְׁפָטִ֖ים אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
12.englishText: For that night I will go through the land of Egypt and strike down every [male] first-born in the land of Egypt, both human and beast; and I will mete out punishments to all the gods of Egypt, I יהוה.
12.transliteration: vְaָbַrְtִּ֣y bְaֶֽrֶץ־mִtsְrַ֘yִם֮ bַּlַּ֣yְlָh hַzֶּh֒ vְhִkֵּytִ֤y kׇl־bְּkvֹr֙ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם mֵaָdָ֖ם vְaַd־bְּhֵmָ֑h vּbְkׇl־aֱlֹhֵ֥y mִtsְrַ֛yִם aֶֽaֱshֶׂ֥h shְׁpָtִ֖yם aֲnִ֥y yְhֹvָֽh׃

12.hebrewText: וְהָיָה֩ הַדָּ֨ם לָכֶ֜ם לְאֹ֗ת עַ֤ל הַבָּתִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתֶּ֣ם שָׁ֔ם וְרָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וּפָסַחְתִּ֖י עֲלֵכֶ֑ם וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֨ה בָכֶ֥ם נֶ֙גֶף֙ לְמַשְׁחִ֔ית בְּהַכֹּתִ֖י בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
12.englishText: And the blood on the houses where you are staying shall be a sign for you: when I see the blood I will pass over*pass over Or “protect”; cf. v. 11 and note there. you, so that no plague will destroy you when I strike the land of Egypt.
12.transliteration: vְhָyָh֩ hַdָּ֨ם lָkֶ֜ם lְaֹ֗t aַ֤l hַbָּtִּyם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aַtֶּ֣ם shָׁ֔ם vְrָaִ֙ytִy֙ aֶt־hַdָּ֔ם vּpָsַchְtִּ֖y aֲlֵkֶ֑ם vְlֹֽa־yִֽhְyֶ֨h bָkֶ֥ם nֶ֙gֶף֙ lְmַshְׁchִ֔yt bְּhַkֹּtִ֖y bְּaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

12.hebrewText: וְהָיָה֩ הַיּ֨וֹם הַזֶּ֤ה לָכֶם֙ לְזִכָּר֔וֹן וְחַגֹּתֶ֥ם אֹת֖וֹ חַ֣ג לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם תְּחׇגֻּֽהוּ׃
12.englishText: This day shall be to you one of remembrance: you shall celebrate it as a festival to יהוה throughout the ages; you shall celebrate it as an institution for all time.
12.transliteration: vְhָyָh֩ hַyּ֨vֹם hַzֶּ֤h lָkֶם֙ lְzִkָּr֔vֹן vְchַgֹּtֶ֥ם aֹt֖vֹ chַ֣g lַֽyhֹvָ֑h lְdֹrֹ֣tֵykֶ֔ם chֻkַּ֥t avֹlָ֖ם tְּchׇgֻּֽhvּ׃

12.hebrewText: שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ מַצּ֣וֹת תֹּאכֵ֔לוּ אַ֚ךְ בַּיּ֣וֹם הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן תַּשְׁבִּ֥יתוּ שְּׂאֹ֖ר מִבָּתֵּיכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ׀ כׇּל־אֹכֵ֣ל חָמֵ֗ץ וְנִכְרְתָ֞ה הַנֶּ֤פֶשׁ הַהִוא֙ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשֹׁ֖ן עַד־י֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
12.englishText: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread; on the very first day you shall remove leaven from your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day to the seventh day, that person shall be cut off from Israel.
12.transliteration: shִׁbְaַ֤t yָmִyם֙ mַtsּ֣vֹt tֹּakֵ֔lvּ aַ֚ךְ bַּyּ֣vֹם hָrִashׁ֔vֹן tַּshְׁbִּ֥ytvּ shְּׂaֹ֖r mִbָּtֵּykֶ֑ם kִּ֣y ׀ kׇּl־aֹkֵ֣l chָmֵ֗ץ vְnִkְrְtָ֞h hַnֶּ֤pֶshׁ hַhִva֙ mִyִּshְׂrָaֵ֔l mִyּ֥vֹם hָrִashֹׁ֖ן aַd־y֥vֹם hַshְּׁbִaִֽy׃

12.hebrewText: וּבַיּ֤וֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן֙ מִקְרָא־קֹ֔דֶשׁ וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מִקְרָא־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כׇּל־מְלָאכָה֙ לֹא־יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה בָהֶ֔ם אַ֚ךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵאָכֵ֣ל לְכׇל־נֶ֔פֶשׁ ה֥וּא לְבַדּ֖וֹ יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
12.englishText: You shall celebrate a sacred occasion on the first day, and a sacred occasion on the seventh day; no work at all shall be done on them; only what every person is to eat, that alone may be prepared for you.
12.transliteration: vּbַyּ֤vֹם hָrִashׁvֹן֙ mִkְrָa־kֹ֔dֶshׁ vּbַyּvֹם֙ hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔y mִkְrָa־kֹ֖dֶshׁ yִhְyֶ֣h lָkֶ֑ם kׇּl־mְlָakָh֙ lֹa־yֵaָshֶׂ֣h bָhֶ֔ם aַ֚ךְ aֲshֶׁ֣r yֵaָkֵ֣l lְkׇl־nֶ֔pֶshׁ h֥vּa lְbַdּ֖vֹ yֵaָshֶׂ֥h lָkֶֽם׃

12.hebrewText: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֮ אֶת־הַמַּצּוֹת֒ כִּ֗י בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֶת־צִבְאוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֞ם אֶת־הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֛ה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֖ם חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָֽם׃
12.englishText: You shall observe the [Feast of] Unleavened Bread, for on this very day I brought your ranks out of the land of Egypt; you shall observe this day throughout the ages as an institution for all time.
12.transliteration: vּshְׁmַrְtֶּם֮ aֶt־hַmַּtsּvֹt֒ kִּ֗y bְּaֶ֙tsֶם֙ hַyּ֣vֹם hַzֶּ֔h hvֹtsֵ֥atִy aֶt־tsִbְavֹtֵykֶ֖ם mֵaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrָ֑yִם vּshְׁmַrְtֶּ֞ם aֶt־hַyּ֥vֹם hַzֶּ֛h lְdֹrֹtֵykֶ֖ם chֻkַּ֥t avֹlָֽם׃

12.hebrewText: בָּרִאשֹׁ֡ן בְּאַרְבָּעָה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֤וֹם לַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ בָּעֶ֔רֶב תֹּאכְל֖וּ מַצֹּ֑ת עַ֠ד י֣וֹם הָאֶחָ֧ד וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים לַחֹ֖דֶשׁ בָּעָֽרֶב׃
12.englishText: In the first month, from the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.
12.transliteration: bָּrִashֹׁ֡ן bְּaַrְbָּaָh֩ aָshָׂ֨r y֤vֹם lַchֹ֙dֶshׁ֙ bָּaֶ֔rֶb tֹּakְl֖vּ mַtsֹּ֑t aַ֠d y֣vֹם hָaֶchָ֧d vְaֶshְׂrִ֛yם lַchֹ֖dֶshׁ bָּaָֽrֶb׃

12.hebrewText: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים שְׂאֹ֕ר לֹ֥א יִמָּצֵ֖א בְּבָתֵּיכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ׀ כׇּל־אֹכֵ֣ל מַחְמֶ֗צֶת וְנִכְרְתָ֞ה הַנֶּ֤פֶשׁ הַהִוא֙ מֵעֲדַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בַּגֵּ֖ר וּבְאֶזְרַ֥ח הָאָֽרֶץ׃
12.englishText: No leaven shall be found in your houses for seven days. For whoever eats what is leavened, that person—whether a stranger or a citizen of the country—shall be cut off from the community of Israel.
12.transliteration: shִׁbְaַ֣t yָmִ֔yם shְׂaֹ֕r lֹ֥a yִmָּtsֵ֖a bְּbָtֵּykֶ֑ם kִּ֣y ׀ kׇּl־aֹkֵ֣l mַchְmֶ֗tsֶt vְnִkְrְtָ֞h hַnֶּ֤pֶshׁ hַhִva֙ mֵaֲdַ֣t yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l bַּgֵּ֖r vּbְaֶzְrַ֥ch hָaָֽrֶץ׃

12.hebrewText: כׇּל־מַחְמֶ֖צֶת לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑לוּ בְּכֹל֙ מוֹשְׁבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם תֹּאכְל֖וּ מַצּֽוֹת׃ {פ}
12.englishText: You shall eat nothing leavened; in all your settlements you shall eat unleavened bread.
12.transliteration: kׇּl־mַchְmֶ֖tsֶt lֹ֣a tֹakֵ֑lvּ bְּkֹl֙ mvֹshְׁbֹ֣tֵykֶ֔ם tֹּakְl֖vּ mַtsּֽvֹt׃ {p}

12.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה לְכׇל־זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם מִֽשְׁכ֗וּ וּקְח֨וּ לָכֶ֥ם צֹ֛אן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתֵיכֶ֖ם וְשַׁחֲט֥וּ הַפָּֽסַח׃
12.englishText: Moses then summoned all the elders of Israel and said to them, “Go, pick out lambs for your families, and slaughter the passover offering.
12.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֥a mֹshֶׁ֛h lְkׇl־zִkְnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֲlֵhֶ֑ם mִֽshְׁk֗vּ vּkְch֨vּ lָkֶ֥ם tsֹ֛aן lְmִshְׁpְּchֹtֵykֶ֖ם vְshַׁchֲt֥vּ hַpָּֽsַch׃

12.hebrewText: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֞ם אֲגֻדַּ֣ת אֵז֗וֹב וּטְבַלְתֶּם֮ בַּדָּ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־בַּסַּף֒ וְהִגַּעְתֶּ֤ם אֶל־הַמַּשְׁקוֹף֙ וְאֶל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַמְּזוּזֹ֔ת מִן־הַדָּ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּסָּ֑ף וְאַתֶּ֗ם לֹ֥א תֵצְא֛וּ אִ֥ישׁ מִפֶּֽתַח־בֵּית֖וֹ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
12.englishText: Take a bunch of hyssop, dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and apply some of the blood that is in the basin to the lintel and to the two doorposts. None of you shall go outside the door of your house until morning.
12.transliteration: vּlְkַchְtֶּ֞ם aֲgֻdַּ֣t aֵz֗vֹb vּtְbַlְtֶּם֮ bַּdָּ֣ם aֲshֶׁr־bַּsַּף֒ vְhִgַּaְtֶּ֤ם aֶl־hַmַּshְׁkvֹף֙ vְaֶl־shְׁtֵּ֣y hַmְּzvּzֹ֔t mִן־hַdָּ֖ם aֲshֶׁ֣r bַּsָּ֑ף vְaַtֶּ֗ם lֹ֥a tֵtsְa֛vּ aִ֥yshׁ mִpֶּֽtַch־bֵּyt֖vֹ aַd־bֹּֽkֶr׃

12.hebrewText: וְעָבַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ לִנְגֹּ֣ף אֶת־מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ וְרָאָ֤ה אֶת־הַדָּם֙ עַל־הַמַּשְׁק֔וֹף וְעַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֣י הַמְּזוּזֹ֑ת וּפָסַ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ עַל־הַפֶּ֔תַח וְלֹ֤א יִתֵּן֙ הַמַּשְׁחִ֔ית לָבֹ֥א אֶל־בָּתֵּיכֶ֖ם לִנְגֹּֽף׃
12.englishText: For יהוה, when going through to smite the Egyptians, will see the blood on the lintel and the two doorposts, and יהוה will pass over*pass over See note at v. 13. the door and not let the Destroyer enter and smite your home.
12.transliteration: vְaָbַ֣r yְhֹvָh֮ lִnְgֹּ֣ף aֶt־mִtsְrַ֒yִם֒ vְrָaָ֤h aֶt־hַdָּם֙ aַl־hַmַּshְׁk֔vֹף vְaַ֖l shְׁtֵּ֣y hַmְּzvּzֹ֑t vּpָsַ֤ch yְhֹvָh֙ aַl־hַpֶּ֔tַch vְlֹ֤a yִtֵּן֙ hַmַּshְׁchִ֔yt lָbֹ֥a aֶl־bָּtֵּykֶ֖ם lִnְgֹּֽף׃

12.hebrewText: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה לְחׇק־לְךָ֥ וּלְבָנֶ֖יךָ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
12.englishText: “You shall observe this as an institution for all time, for you and for your descendants.
12.transliteration: vּshְׁmַrְtֶּ֖ם aֶt־hַdָּbָ֣r hַzֶּ֑h lְchׇk־lְךָ֥ vּlְbָnֶ֖yךָ aַd־avֹlָֽם׃

12.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־תָבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּ֑ר וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
12.englishText: And when you enter the land that יהוה will give you, as promised, you shall observe this rite.
12.transliteration: vְhָyָ֞h kִּֽy־tָbֹ֣avּ aֶl־hָaָ֗rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֨r yִtֵּ֧ן yְhֹvָ֛h lָkֶ֖ם kַּaֲshֶׁ֣r dִּbֵּ֑r vּshְׁmַrְtֶּ֖ם aֶt־hָaֲbֹdָ֥h hַzֹּֽat׃

12.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֕ה כִּֽי־יֹאמְר֥וּ אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בְּנֵיכֶ֑ם מָ֛ה הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לָכֶֽם׃
12.englishText: And when your children ask you, ‘What do you mean by this rite?’
12.transliteration: vְhָyָ֕h kִּֽy־yֹamְr֥vּ aֲlֵykֶ֖ם bְּnֵykֶ֑ם mָ֛h hָaֲbֹdָ֥h hַzֹּ֖at lָkֶֽם׃

12.hebrewText: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֡ם זֶֽבַח־פֶּ֨סַח ה֜וּא לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּ֠סַ֠ח עַל־בָּתֵּ֤י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם בְּנׇגְפּ֥וֹ אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּ֣ינוּ הִצִּ֑יל וַיִּקֹּ֥ד הָעָ֖ם וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
12.englishText: you shall say, ‘It is the passover sacrifice to יהוה, who passed over the houses of the Israelites in Egypt when smiting the Egyptians, but saved our houses.’ Those assembled then bowed low in homage.
12.transliteration: vַaֲmַrְtֶּ֡ם zֶֽbַch־pֶּ֨sַch h֜vּa lַֽyhֹvָ֗h aֲshֶׁ֣r pָּ֠sַ֠ch aַl־bָּtֵּ֤y bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ bְּmִtsְrַ֔yִם bְּnׇgְpּ֥vֹ aֶt־mִtsְrַ֖yִם vְaֶt־bָּtֵּ֣ynvּ hִtsִּ֑yl vַyִּkֹּ֥d hָaָ֖ם vַyִּֽshְׁtַּchֲvֽvּ׃

12.hebrewText: וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
12.englishText: And the Israelites went and did so; just as יהוה had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
12.transliteration: vַyֵּlְk֥vּ vַֽyַּaֲshׂ֖vּ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l kַּaֲshֶׁ֨r tsִvָּ֧h yְhֹvָ֛h aֶt־mֹshֶׁ֥h vְaַhֲrֹ֖ן kֵּ֥ן aָshֽׂvּ׃ {s}

12.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּחֲצִ֣י הַלַּ֗יְלָה וַֽיהֹוָה֮ הִכָּ֣ה כׇל־בְּכוֹר֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ מִבְּכֹ֤ר פַּרְעֹה֙ הַיֹּשֵׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְא֔וֹ עַ֚ד בְּכ֣וֹר הַשְּׁבִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית הַבּ֑וֹר וְכֹ֖ל בְּכ֥וֹר בְּהֵמָֽה׃
12.englishText: In the middle of the night יהוה struck down all the [male] first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sat on the throne to the first-born of the captive who was in the dungeon, and all the first-born of the cattle.
12.transliteration: vַyְhִ֣y ׀ bַּchֲtsִ֣y hַlַּ֗yְlָh vַֽyhֹvָh֮ hִkָּ֣h kׇl־bְּkvֹr֮ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֒yִם֒ mִbְּkֹ֤r pַּrְaֹh֙ hַyֹּshֵׁ֣b aַl־kִּsְa֔vֹ aַ֚d bְּk֣vֹr hַshְּׁbִ֔y aֲshֶׁ֖r bְּbֵ֣yt hַbּ֑vֹr vְkֹ֖l bְּk֥vֹr bְּhֵmָֽh׃

12.hebrewText: וַיָּ֨קׇם פַּרְעֹ֜ה לַ֗יְלָה ה֤וּא וְכׇל־עֲבָדָיו֙ וְכׇל־מִצְרַ֔יִם וַתְּהִ֛י צְעָקָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם כִּֽי־אֵ֣ין בַּ֔יִת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽין־שָׁ֖ם מֵֽת׃
12.englishText: And Pharaoh arose in the night, with all his courtiers and all the Egyptians—because there was a loud cry in Egypt; for there was no house where there was not someone dead.
12.transliteration: vַyָּ֨kׇם pַּrְaֹ֜h lַ֗yְlָh h֤vּa vְkׇl־aֲbָdָyv֙ vְkׇl־mִtsְrַ֔yִם vַtְּhִ֛y tsְaָkָ֥h gְdֹlָ֖h bְּmִtsְrָ֑yִם kִּֽy־aֵ֣yן bַּ֔yִt aֲshֶׁ֥r aֵֽyן־shָׁ֖ם mֵֽt׃

12.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָא֩ לְמֹשֶׁ֨ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֜ן לַ֗יְלָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ ק֤וּמוּ צְּאוּ֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ עַמִּ֔י גַּם־אַתֶּ֖ם גַּם־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּלְכ֛וּ עִבְד֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה כְּדַבֶּרְכֶֽם׃
12.englishText: He summoned Moses and Aaron in the night and said, “Up, depart from among my people, you and the Israelites with you! Go, worship יהוה as you said!
12.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָa֩ lְmֹshֶׁ֨h vּֽlְaַhֲrֹ֜ן lַ֗yְlָh vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ k֤vּmvּ tsְּavּ֙ mִtּ֣vֹךְ aַmִּ֔y gַּם־aַtֶּ֖ם gַּם־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vּlְk֛vּ aִbְd֥vּ aֶt־yְhֹvָ֖h kְּdַbֶּrְkֶֽם׃

12.hebrewText: גַּם־צֹאנְכֶ֨ם גַּם־בְּקַרְכֶ֥ם קְח֛וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּרְתֶּ֖ם וָלֵ֑כוּ וּבֵֽרַכְתֶּ֖ם גַּם־אֹתִֽי׃
12.englishText: Take also your flocks and your herds, as you said, and begone! And may you bring a blessing upon me also!”
12.transliteration: gַּם־tsֹanְkֶ֨ם gַּם־bְּkַrְkֶ֥ם kְch֛vּ kַּaֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbַּrְtֶּ֖ם vָlֵ֑kvּ vּbֵֽrַkְtֶּ֖ם gַּם־aֹtִֽy׃

12.hebrewText: וַתֶּחֱזַ֤ק מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ עַל־הָעָ֔ם לְמַהֵ֖ר לְשַׁלְּחָ֣ם מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּ֥י אָמְר֖וּ כֻּלָּ֥נוּ מֵתִֽים׃
12.englishText: The Egyptians urged the people on, impatient to have them leave the country, for they said, “We shall all be dead.”
12.transliteration: vַtֶּchֱzַ֤k mִtsְrַ֙yִם֙ aַl־hָaָ֔ם lְmַhֵ֖r lְshַׁlְּchָ֣ם mִן־hָaָ֑rֶץ kִּ֥y aָmְr֖vּ kֻּlָּ֥nvּ mֵtִֽyם׃

12.hebrewText: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א הָעָ֛ם אֶת־בְּצֵק֖וֹ טֶ֣רֶם יֶחְמָ֑ץ מִשְׁאֲרֹתָ֛ם צְרֻרֹ֥ת בְּשִׂמְלֹתָ֖ם עַל־שִׁכְמָֽם׃
12.englishText: So the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading bowls wrapped in their cloaks upon their shoulders.
12.transliteration: vַyִּshָּׂ֥a hָaָ֛ם aֶt־bְּtsֵk֖vֹ tֶ֣rֶם yֶchְmָ֑ץ mִshְׁaֲrֹtָ֛ם tsְrֻrֹ֥t bְּshִׂmְlֹtָ֖ם aַl־shִׁkְmָֽם׃

12.hebrewText: וּבְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עָשׂ֖וּ כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַֽיִּשְׁאֲלוּ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם כְּלֵי־כֶ֛סֶף וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָ֖ב וּשְׂמָלֹֽת׃
12.englishText: The Israelites had done Moses’ bidding and borrowed from the Egyptians objects of silver and gold, and clothing.
12.transliteration: vּbְnֵy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֥l aָshׂ֖vּ kִּdְbַ֣r mֹshֶׁ֑h vַֽyִּshְׁaֲlvּ֙ mִmִּtsְrַ֔yִם kְּlֵy־kֶ֛sֶף vּkְlֵ֥y zָhָ֖b vּshְׂmָlֹֽt׃

12.hebrewText: וַֽיהֹוָ֞ה נָתַ֨ן אֶת־חֵ֥ן הָעָ֛ם בְּעֵינֵ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם וַיַּשְׁאִל֑וּם וַֽיְנַצְּל֖וּ אֶת־מִצְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
12.englishText: And יהוה had disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people, and they let them have their request; thus they stripped the Egyptians.
12.transliteration: vַֽyhֹvָ֞h nָtַ֨ן aֶt־chֵ֥ן hָaָ֛ם bְּaֵynֵ֥y mִtsְrַ֖yִם vַyַּshְׁaִl֑vּם vַֽyְnַtsְּl֖vּ aֶt־mִtsְrָֽyִם׃ {p}

12.hebrewText: וַיִּסְע֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵרַעְמְסֵ֖ס סֻכֹּ֑תָה כְּשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֨וֹת אֶ֧לֶף רַגְלִ֛י הַגְּבָרִ֖ים לְבַ֥ד מִטָּֽף׃
12.englishText: The Israelites journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand fighting men on foot, aside from noncombatants.
12.transliteration: vַyִּsְa֧vּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l mֵrַaְmְsֵ֖s sֻkֹּ֑tָh kְּshֵׁshׁ־mֵa֨vֹt aֶ֧lֶף rַgְlִ֛y hַgְּbָrִ֖yם lְbַ֥d mִtָּֽף׃

12.hebrewText: וְגַם־עֵ֥רֶב רַ֖ב עָלָ֣ה אִתָּ֑ם וְצֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֔ר מִקְנֶ֖ה כָּבֵ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
12.englishText: Moreover, a mixed multitude went up with them, and very much livestock, both flocks and herds.
12.transliteration: vְgַם־aֵ֥rֶb rַ֖b aָlָ֣h aִtָּ֑ם vְtsֹ֣aן vּbָkָ֔r mִkְnֶ֖h kָּbֵ֥d mְaֹֽd׃

12.hebrewText: וַיֹּאפ֨וּ אֶת־הַבָּצֵ֜ק אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצִ֧יאוּ מִמִּצְרַ֛יִם עֻגֹ֥ת מַצּ֖וֹת כִּ֣י לֹ֣א חָמֵ֑ץ כִּֽי־גֹרְשׁ֣וּ מִמִּצְרַ֗יִם וְלֹ֤א יָֽכְלוּ֙ לְהִתְמַהְמֵ֔הַּ וְגַם־צֵדָ֖ה לֹא־עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶֽם׃
12.englishText: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough that they had taken out of Egypt, for it was not leavened, since they had been driven out of Egypt and could not delay; nor had they prepared any provisions for themselves.
12.transliteration: vַyֹּap֨vּ aֶt־hַbָּtsֵ֜k aֲshֶׁ֨r hvֹtsִ֧yavּ mִmִּtsְrַ֛yִם aֻgֹ֥t mַtsּ֖vֹt kִּ֣y lֹ֣a chָmֵ֑ץ kִּֽy־gֹrְshׁ֣vּ mִmִּtsְrַ֗yִם vְlֹ֤a yָֽkְlvּ֙ lְhִtְmַhְmֵ֔hַּ vְgַם־tsֵdָ֖h lֹa־aָshׂ֥vּ lָhֶֽם׃

12.hebrewText: וּמוֹשַׁב֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָשְׁב֖וּ בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָֽה׃
12.englishText: The length of time that the Israelites lived in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years;
12.transliteration: vּmvֹshַׁb֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l aֲshֶׁ֥r yָshְׁb֖vּ bְּmִtsְrָ֑yִם shְׁlֹshִׁ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h vְaַrְbַּ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָֽh׃

12.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י מִקֵּץ֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיְהִ֗י בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה יָ֥צְא֛וּ כׇּל־צִבְא֥וֹת יְהֹוָ֖ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
12.englishText: at the end of the four hundred and thirtieth year, to the very day, all the ranks of יהוה departed from the land of Egypt.
12.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y mִkֵּץ֙ shְׁlֹshִׁ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h vְaַrְbַּ֥a mֵa֖vֹt shָׁnָ֑h vַyְhִ֗y bְּaֶ֙tsֶם֙ hַyּ֣vֹם hַzֶּ֔h yָ֥tsְa֛vּ kׇּl־tsִbְa֥vֹt yְhֹvָ֖h mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

12.hebrewText: לֵ֣יל שִׁמֻּרִ֥ים הוּא֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לְהוֹצִיאָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם הֽוּא־הַלַּ֤יְלָה הַזֶּה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה שִׁמֻּרִ֛ים לְכׇל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
12.englishText: That was for יהוה a night of vigil to bring them out of the land of Egypt; that same night is יהוה’s, one of vigil for all the children of Israel throughout the ages.
12.transliteration: lֵ֣yl shִׁmֻּrִ֥yם hvּa֙ lַֽyhֹvָ֔h lְhvֹtsִyaָ֖ם mֵaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrָ֑yִם hֽvּa־hַlַּ֤yְlָh hַzֶּh֙ lַֽyhֹvָ֔h shִׁmֻּrִ֛yם lְkׇl־bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l lְdֹrֹtָֽם׃ {p}

12.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן זֹ֖את חֻקַּ֣ת הַפָּ֑סַח כׇּל־בֶּן־נֵכָ֖ר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
12.englishText: יהוה said to Moses and Aaron: This is the law of the passover offering: No foreigner shall eat of it.
12.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֣h vְaַhֲrֹ֔ן zֹ֖at chֻkַּ֣t hַpָּ֑sַch kׇּl־bֶּן־nֵkָ֖r lֹa־yֹ֥akַl bּֽvֹ׃

12.hebrewText: וְכׇל־עֶ֥בֶד אִ֖ישׁ מִקְנַת־כָּ֑סֶף וּמַלְתָּ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ אָ֖ז יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
12.englishText: But any householder’s*householder’s NJPS “a man [has bought]”; trad. “man’s.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. purchased male slave may eat of it once he has been circumcised.
12.transliteration: vְkׇl־aֶ֥bֶd aִ֖yshׁ mִkְnַt־kָּ֑sֶף vּmַlְtָּ֣h aֹt֔vֹ aָ֖z yֹ֥akַl bּֽvֹ׃

12.hebrewText: תּוֹשָׁ֥ב וְשָׂכִ֖יר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
12.englishText: No bound or hired laborer shall eat of it.
12.transliteration: tּvֹshָׁ֥b vְshָׂkִ֖yr lֹa־yֹ֥akַl bּֽvֹ׃

12.hebrewText: בְּבַ֤יִת אֶחָד֙ יֵאָכֵ֔ל לֹא־תוֹצִ֧יא מִן־הַבַּ֛יִת מִן־הַבָּשָׂ֖ר ח֑וּצָה וְעֶ֖צֶם לֹ֥א תִשְׁבְּרוּ־בֽוֹ׃
12.englishText: It shall be eaten in one house: you shall not take any of the flesh outside the house; nor shall you break a bone of it.
12.transliteration: bְּbַ֤yִt aֶchָd֙ yֵaָkֵ֔l lֹa־tvֹtsִ֧ya mִן־hַbַּ֛yִt mִן־hַbָּshָׂ֖r ch֑vּtsָh vְaֶ֖tsֶם lֹ֥a tִshְׁbְּrvּ־bֽvֹ׃

12.hebrewText: כׇּל־עֲדַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יַעֲשׂ֥וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
12.englishText: The whole community of Israel shall offer it.
12.transliteration: kׇּl־aֲdַ֥t yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l yַaֲshׂ֥vּ aֹtֽvֹ׃

12.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יָג֨וּר אִתְּךָ֜ גֵּ֗ר וְעָ֣שָׂה פֶ֘סַח֮ לַיהֹוָה֒ הִמּ֧וֹל ל֣וֹ כׇל־זָכָ֗ר וְאָז֙ יִקְרַ֣ב לַעֲשֹׂת֔וֹ וְהָיָ֖ה כְּאֶזְרַ֣ח הָאָ֑רֶץ וְכׇל־עָרֵ֖ל לֹֽא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
12.englishText: If a male stranger who dwells with you would offer the passover to יהוה, all his males must be circumcised; then he shall be admitted to offer it; he shall then be as a citizen of the country. But no uncircumcised man may eat of it.
12.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yָg֨vּr aִtְּךָ֜ gֵּ֗r vְaָ֣shָׂh pֶ֘sַch֮ lַyhֹvָh֒ hִmּ֧vֹl l֣vֹ kׇl־zָkָ֗r vְaָz֙ yִkְrַ֣b lַaֲshֹׂt֔vֹ vְhָyָ֖h kְּaֶzְrַ֣ch hָaָ֑rֶץ vְkׇl־aָrֵ֖l lֹֽa־yֹ֥akַl bּֽvֹ׃

12.hebrewText: תּוֹרָ֣ה אַחַ֔ת יִהְיֶ֖ה לָֽאֶזְרָ֑ח וְלַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכְכֶֽם׃
12.englishText: There shall be one law for the citizen and for the stranger who dwells among you.
12.transliteration: tּvֹrָ֣h aַchַ֔t yִhְyֶ֖h lָֽaֶzְrָ֑ch vְlַgֵּ֖r hַgָּ֥r bְּtvֹkְkֶֽם׃

12.hebrewText: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֖ן כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
12.englishText: And all the Israelites did so; as יהוה had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
12.transliteration: vַֽyַּaֲshׂ֖vּ kׇּl־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l kַּaֲshֶׁ֨r tsִvָּ֧h yְhֹvָ֛h aֶt־mֹshֶׁ֥h vְaֶֽt־aַhֲrֹ֖ן kֵּ֥ן aָshֽׂvּ׃ {s}

12.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֕י בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה הוֹצִ֨יא יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם עַל־צִבְאֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
12.englishText: That very day יהוה freed the Israelites from the land of Egypt, troop by troop.
12.transliteration: vַyְhִ֕y bְּaֶ֖tsֶם hַyּ֣vֹם hַzֶּ֑h hvֹtsִ֨ya yְhֹvָ֜h aֶt־bְּnֵ֧y yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrַ֖yִם aַl־tsִbְaֹtָֽם׃ {p}

13.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
13.englishText: יהוה spoke further to Moses, saying,
13.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

13.hebrewText: קַדֶּשׁ־לִ֨י כׇל־בְּכ֜וֹר פֶּ֤טֶר כׇּל־רֶ֙חֶם֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה לִ֖י הֽוּא׃
13.englishText: “Consecrate to Me every male first-born; human and beast, the first [male] issue of every womb among the Israelites is Mine.”
13.transliteration: kַdֶּshׁ־lִ֨y kׇl־bְּk֜vֹr pֶּ֤tֶr kׇּl־rֶ֙chֶם֙ bִּbְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l bָּaָdָ֖ם vּbַbְּhֵmָ֑h lִ֖y hֽvּa׃

13.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־הָעָ֗ם זָכ֞וֹר אֶת־הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְצָאתֶ֤ם מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ מִבֵּ֣ית עֲבָדִ֔ים כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֔ד הוֹצִ֧יא יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּ֑ה וְלֹ֥א יֵאָכֵ֖ל חָמֵֽץ׃
13.englishText: And Moses said to the people,“Remember this day, on which you went free from Egypt, the house of bondage, how יהוה freed you from it with a mighty hand: no leavened bread shall be eaten.
13.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr mֹshֶׁ֜h aֶl־hָaָ֗ם zָk֞vֹr aֶt־hַyּ֤vֹם hַzֶּh֙ aֲshֶׁ֨r yְtsָatֶ֤ם mִmִּtsְrַ֙yִם֙ mִbֵּ֣yt aֲbָdִ֔yם kִּ֚y bְּchֹ֣zֶk yָ֔d hvֹtsִ֧ya yְhֹvָ֛h aֶtְkֶ֖ם mִzֶּ֑h vְlֹ֥a yֵaָkֵ֖l chָmֵֽץ׃

13.hebrewText: הַיּ֖וֹם אַתֶּ֣ם יֹצְאִ֑ים בְּחֹ֖דֶשׁ הָאָבִֽיב׃
13.englishText: You go free on this day, in the month*in the month Or “on the new moon.” of Abib.
13.transliteration: hַyּ֖vֹם aַtֶּ֣ם yֹtsְaִ֑yם bְּchֹ֖dֶshׁ hָaָbִֽyb׃

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֣ה כִֽי־יְבִיאֲךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֡ה אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽ֠כְּנַעֲנִ֠י וְהַחִתִּ֨י וְהָאֱמֹרִ֜י וְהַחִוִּ֣י וְהַיְבוּסִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֤ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֣תֶת לָ֔ךְ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ וְעָבַדְתָּ֛ אֶת־הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַזֶּֽה׃
13.englishText: So, when יהוה has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which was sworn to your fathers to be given you, a land flowing with milk and honey, you shall observe in this month the following practice:
13.transliteration: vְhָyָ֣h kִֽy־yְbִyaֲךָ֣ yְhֹvָ֡h aֶl־aֶ֣rֶץ hַֽ֠kְּnַaֲnִ֠y vְhַchִtִּ֨y vְhָaֱmֹrִ֜y vְhַchִvִּ֣y vְhַyְbvּsִ֗y aֲshֶׁ֨r nִshְׁbַּ֤a lַaֲbֹtֶ֙yךָ֙ lָ֣tֶt lָ֔ךְ aֶ֛rֶץ zָbַ֥t chָlָ֖b vּdְbָ֑shׁ vְaָbַdְtָּ֛ aֶt־hָaֲbֹdָ֥h hַzֹּ֖at bַּchֹ֥dֶshׁ hַzֶּֽh׃

13.hebrewText: שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תֹּאכַ֣ל מַצֹּ֑ת וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י חַ֖ג לַיהֹוָֽה׃
13.englishText: “Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a festival of יהוה.
13.transliteration: shִׁbְaַ֥t yָmִ֖yם tֹּakַ֣l mַtsֹּ֑t vּbַyּvֹם֙ hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔y chַ֖g lַyhֹvָֽh׃

13.hebrewText: מַצּוֹת֙ יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת שִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֑ים וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֨ה לְךָ֜ חָמֵ֗ץ וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ שְׂאֹ֖ר בְּכׇל־גְּבֻלֶֽךָ׃
13.englishText: Throughout the seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten; no leavened bread shall be found with you, and no leaven shall be found in all your territory.
13.transliteration: mַtsּvֹt֙ yֵֽaָkֵ֔l aֵ֖t shִׁbְaַ֣t hַyָּmִ֑yם vְlֹֽa־yֵrָaֶ֨h lְךָ֜ chָmֵ֗ץ vְlֹֽa־yֵrָaֶ֥h lְךָ֛ shְׂaֹ֖r bְּkׇl־gְּbֻlֶֽךָ׃

13.hebrewText: וְהִגַּדְתָּ֣ לְבִנְךָ֔ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לֵאמֹ֑ר בַּעֲב֣וּר זֶ֗ה עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לִ֔י בְּצֵאתִ֖י מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
13.englishText: And you shall explain to your child on that day, ‘It is because of what יהוה did for me when I went free from Egypt.’
13.transliteration: vְhִgַּdְtָּ֣ lְbִnְךָ֔ bַּyּ֥vֹם hַh֖vּa lֵamֹ֑r bַּaֲb֣vּr zֶ֗h aָshָׂ֤h yְhֹvָh֙ lִ֔y bְּtsֵatִ֖y mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָה֩ לְךָ֨ לְא֜וֹת עַל־יָדְךָ֗ וּלְזִכָּרוֹן֙ בֵּ֣ין עֵינֶ֔יךָ לְמַ֗עַן תִּהְיֶ֛ה תּוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּפִ֑יךָ כִּ֚י בְּיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֔ה הוֹצִֽאֲךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
13.englishText: “And this shall serve you as a sign on your hand and as a reminder on your forehead*on your forehead Lit. “between your eyes”; cf. Deut. 6.8. —in order that the Teaching of יהוה may be in your mouth—that with a mighty hand יהוה freed you from Egypt.
13.transliteration: vְhָyָh֩ lְךָ֨ lְa֜vֹt aַl־yָdְךָ֗ vּlְzִkָּrvֹן֙ bֵּ֣yן aֵynֶ֔yךָ lְmַ֗aַן tִּhְyֶ֛h tּvֹrַ֥t yְhֹvָ֖h bְּpִ֑yךָ kִּ֚y bְּyָ֣d chֲzָkָ֔h hvֹtsִֽaֲךָ֥ yְhֹvָ֖h mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

13.hebrewText: וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֛ אֶת־הַחֻקָּ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְמוֹעֲדָ֑הּ מִיָּמִ֖ים יָמִֽימָה׃ {פ}
13.englishText: You shall keep this institution at its set time from year to year.
13.transliteration: vְshָׁmַrְtָּ֛ aֶt־hַchֻkָּ֥h hַzֹּ֖at lְmvֹaֲdָ֑hּ mִyָּmִ֖yם yָmִֽymָh׃ {p}

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־יְבִאֲךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לְךָ֖ וְלַֽאֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וּנְתָנָ֖הּ לָֽךְ׃
13.englishText: “And when יהוה has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, as [God] swore to you and to your fathers, and has given it to you,
13.transliteration: vְhָyָ֞h kִּֽy־yְbִaֲךָ֤ yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־aֶ֣rֶץ hַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֔y kַּaֲshֶׁ֛r nִshְׁbַּ֥a lְךָ֖ vְlַֽaֲbֹtֶ֑yךָ vּnְtָnָ֖hּ lָֽךְ׃

13.hebrewText: וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ֥ כׇל־פֶּֽטֶר־רֶ֖חֶם לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וְכׇל־פֶּ֣טֶר ׀ שֶׁ֣גֶר בְּהֵמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ הַזְּכָרִ֖ים לַיהֹוָֽה׃
13.englishText: you shall set apart for יהוה every first issue of the womb: every male firstling that your cattle drop shall be יהוה’s.
13.transliteration: vְhַaֲbַrְtָּ֥ kׇl־pֶּֽtֶr־rֶ֖chֶם lַֽyhֹvָ֑h vְkׇl־pֶּ֣tֶr ׀ shֶׁ֣gֶr bְּhֵmָ֗h aֲshֶׁ֨r yִhְyֶ֥h lְךָ֛ hַzְּkָrִ֖yם lַyhֹvָֽh׃

13.hebrewText: וְכׇל־פֶּ֤טֶר חֲמֹר֙ תִּפְדֶּ֣ה בְשֶׂ֔ה וְאִם־לֹ֥א תִפְדֶּ֖ה וַעֲרַפְתּ֑וֹ וְכֹ֨ל בְּכ֥וֹר אָדָ֛ם בְּבָנֶ֖יךָ תִּפְדֶּֽה׃
13.englishText: But every firstling ass you shall redeem with a sheep; if you do not redeem it, you must break its neck. And you must redeem every male first-born among your children.
13.transliteration: vְkׇl־pֶּ֤tֶr chֲmֹr֙ tִּpְdֶּ֣h bְshֶׂ֔h vְaִם־lֹ֥a tִpְdֶּ֖h vַaֲrַpְtּ֑vֹ vְkֹ֨l bְּk֥vֹr aָdָ֛ם bְּbָnֶ֖yךָ tִּpְdֶּֽh׃

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־יִשְׁאָלְךָ֥ בִנְךָ֛ מָחָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֣ר מַה־זֹּ֑את וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֔יו בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֗ד הוֹצִיאָ֧נוּ יְהֹוָ֛ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
13.englishText: And when, in time to come, a child of yours asks you, saying, ‘What does this mean?’ you shall reply, ‘It was with a mighty hand that יהוה brought us out from Egypt, the house of bondage.
13.transliteration: vְhָyָ֞h kִּֽy־yִshְׁaָlְךָ֥ bִnְךָ֛ mָchָ֖r lֵamֹ֣r mַh־zֹּ֑at vְaָmַrְtָּ֣ aֵlָ֔yv bְּchֹ֣zֶk yָ֗d hvֹtsִyaָ֧nvּ yְhֹvָ֛h mִmִּtsְrַ֖yִם mִbֵּ֥yt aֲbָdִֽyם׃

13.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י כִּֽי־הִקְשָׁ֣ה פַרְעֹה֮ לְשַׁלְּחֵ֒נוּ֒ וַיַּהֲרֹ֨ג יְהֹוָ֤ה כׇּל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מִבְּכֹ֥ר אָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּכ֣וֹר בְּהֵמָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֩ אֲנִ֨י זֹבֵ֜חַ לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־פֶּ֤טֶר רֶ֙חֶם֙ הַזְּכָרִ֔ים וְכׇל־בְּכ֥וֹר בָּנַ֖י אֶפְדֶּֽה׃
13.englishText: When Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, יהוה slew every [male] first-born in the land of Egypt, the first-born of both human and beast. Therefore I sacrifice to יהוה every first male issue of the womb, but redeem every male first-born among my children.’
13.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y kִּֽy־hִkְshָׁ֣h pַrְaֹh֮ lְshַׁlְּchֵ֒nvּ֒ vַyַּhֲrֹ֨g yְhֹvָ֤h kׇּl־bְּkvֹr֙ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם mִbְּkֹ֥r aָdָ֖ם vְaַd־bְּk֣vֹr bְּhֵmָ֑h aַl־kֵּן֩ aֲnִ֨y zֹbֵ֜chַ lַֽyhֹvָ֗h kׇּl־pֶּ֤tֶr rֶ֙chֶם֙ hַzְּkָrִ֔yם vְkׇl־bְּk֥vֹr bָּnַ֖y aֶpְdֶּֽh׃

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֤ה לְאוֹת֙ עַל־יָ֣דְכָ֔ה וּלְטוֹטָפֹ֖ת בֵּ֣ין עֵינֶ֑יךָ כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֔ד הוֹצִיאָ֥נוּ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃ {ס}
13.englishText: “And so it shall be as a sign upon your hand and as a symbol*symbol Others “frontlet.” on your forehead that with a mighty hand יהוה freed us from Egypt.”
13.transliteration: vְhָyָ֤h lְavֹt֙ aַl־yָ֣dְkָ֔h vּlְtvֹtָpֹ֖t bֵּ֣yן aֵynֶ֑yךָ kִּ֚y bְּchֹ֣zֶk yָ֔d hvֹtsִyaָ֥nvּ yְhֹvָ֖h mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃ {s}

13.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י בְּשַׁלַּ֣ח פַּרְעֹה֮ אֶת־הָעָם֒ וְלֹא־נָחָ֣ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים דֶּ֚רֶךְ אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים כִּ֥י קָר֖וֹב ה֑וּא כִּ֣י ׀ אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים פֶּֽן־יִנָּחֵ֥ם הָעָ֛ם בִּרְאֹתָ֥ם מִלְחָמָ֖ה וְשָׁ֥בוּ מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
13.englishText: Now when Pharaoh let the people go, God did not lead them by way of the land of the Philistines, although it was nearer; for God said, “The people may have a change of heart when they see war, and return to Egypt.”
13.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y bְּshַׁlַּ֣ch pַּrְaֹh֮ aֶt־hָaָם֒ vְlֹa־nָchָ֣ם aֱlֹhִ֗yם dֶּ֚rֶךְ aֶ֣rֶץ pְּlִshְׁtִּ֔yם kִּ֥y kָr֖vֹb h֑vּa kִּ֣y ׀ aָmַ֣r aֱlֹhִ֗yם pֶּֽן־yִnָּchֵ֥ם hָaָ֛ם bִּrְaֹtָ֥ם mִlְchָmָ֖h vְshָׁ֥bvּ mִtsְrָֽyְmָh׃

13.hebrewText: וַיַּסֵּ֨ב אֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> אֶת־הָעָ֛ם דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר יַם־ס֑וּף וַחֲמֻשִׁ֛ים עָל֥וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
13.englishText: So God led the people round about, by way of the wilderness at the Sea of Reeds. Now the Israelites went up armed*armed Meaning of Heb. ḥamushim uncertain. out of the land of Egypt.
13.transliteration: vַyַּsֵּ֨b aֱlֹhִ֧yם <small>׀</small> aֶt־hָaָ֛ם dֶּ֥rֶךְ hַmִּdְbָּ֖r yַם־s֑vּף vַchֲmֻshִׁ֛yם aָl֥vּ bְnֵy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

13.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־עַצְמ֥וֹת יוֹסֵ֖ף עִמּ֑וֹ כִּי֩ הַשְׁבֵּ֨עַ הִשְׁבִּ֜יעַ אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר פָּקֹ֨ד יִפְקֹ֤ד אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהַעֲלִיתֶ֧ם אֶת־עַצְמֹתַ֛י מִזֶּ֖ה אִתְּכֶֽם׃
13.englishText: And Moses took with him the bones of Joseph, who had exacted an oath from the children of Israel, saying, “God will be sure to take notice of you: then you shall carry up my bones from here with you.”
13.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֥ch mֹshֶׁ֛h aֶt־aַtsְm֥vֹt yvֹsֵ֖ף aִmּ֑vֹ kִּy֩ hַshְׁbֵּ֨aַ hִshְׁbִּ֜yaַ aֶt־bְּnֵ֤y yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ lֵamֹ֔r pָּkֹ֨d yִpְkֹ֤d aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶtְkֶ֔ם vְhַaֲlִytֶ֧ם aֶt־aַtsְmֹtַ֛y mִzֶּ֖h aִtְּkֶֽם׃

13.hebrewText: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִסֻּכֹּ֑ת וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בְאֵתָ֔ם בִּקְצֵ֖ה הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
13.englishText: They set out from Succoth, and encamped at Etham, at the edge of the wilderness.
13.transliteration: vַyִּsְa֖vּ mִsֻּkֹּ֑t vַyַּchֲn֣vּ bְaֵtָ֔ם bִּkְtsֵ֖h hַmִּdְbָּֽr׃

13.hebrewText: וַֽיהֹוָ֡ה הֹלֵךְ֩ לִפְנֵיהֶ֨ם יוֹמָ֜ם בְּעַמּ֤וּד עָנָן֙ לַנְחֹתָ֣ם הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְלַ֛יְלָה בְּעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ לְהָאִ֣יר לָהֶ֑ם לָלֶ֖כֶת יוֹמָ֥ם וָלָֽיְלָה׃
13.englishText: יהוה went before them in a pillar of cloud by day, to guide them along the way, and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light, that they might travel day and night.
13.transliteration: vַֽyhֹvָ֡h hֹlֵךְ֩ lִpְnֵyhֶ֨ם yvֹmָ֜ם bְּaַmּ֤vּd aָnָן֙ lַnְchֹtָ֣ם hַdֶּ֔rֶךְ vְlַ֛yְlָh bְּaַmּ֥vּd aֵ֖shׁ lְhָaִ֣yr lָhֶ֑ם lָlֶ֖kֶt yvֹmָ֥ם vָlָֽyְlָh׃

13.hebrewText: לֹֽא־יָמִ֞ישׁ עַמּ֤וּד הֶֽעָנָן֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וְעַמּ֥וּד הָאֵ֖שׁ לָ֑יְלָה לִפְנֵ֖י הָעָֽם׃ {פ}
13.englishText: The pillar of cloud by day and the pillar of fire by night did not depart from before the people.
13.transliteration: lֹֽa־yָmִ֞yshׁ aַmּ֤vּd hֶֽaָnָן֙ yvֹmָ֔ם vְaַmּ֥vּd hָaֵ֖shׁ lָ֑yְlָh lִpְnֵ֖y hָaָֽם׃ {p}

beshalach.name: Beshalach
beshalach.summary: The crossing of the Red Sea, the Song of the Sea, the bitter waters of Marah, the manna, the quail, and the water from the rock.

13.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
13.englishText: יהוה spoke further to Moses, saying,
13.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

13.hebrewText: קַדֶּשׁ־לִ֨י כׇל־בְּכ֜וֹר פֶּ֤טֶר כׇּל־רֶ֙חֶם֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה לִ֖י הֽוּא׃
13.englishText: “Consecrate to Me every male first-born; human and beast, the first [male] issue of every womb among the Israelites is Mine.”
13.transliteration: kַdֶּshׁ־lִ֨y kׇl־bְּk֜vֹr pֶּ֤tֶr kׇּl־rֶ֙chֶם֙ bִּbְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l bָּaָdָ֖ם vּbַbְּhֵmָ֑h lִ֖y hֽvּa׃

13.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־הָעָ֗ם זָכ֞וֹר אֶת־הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְצָאתֶ֤ם מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ מִבֵּ֣ית עֲבָדִ֔ים כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֔ד הוֹצִ֧יא יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּ֑ה וְלֹ֥א יֵאָכֵ֖ל חָמֵֽץ׃
13.englishText: And Moses said to the people,“Remember this day, on which you went free from Egypt, the house of bondage, how יהוה freed you from it with a mighty hand: no leavened bread shall be eaten.
13.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr mֹshֶׁ֜h aֶl־hָaָ֗ם zָk֞vֹr aֶt־hַyּ֤vֹם hַzֶּh֙ aֲshֶׁ֨r yְtsָatֶ֤ם mִmִּtsְrַ֙yִם֙ mִbֵּ֣yt aֲbָdִ֔yם kִּ֚y bְּchֹ֣zֶk yָ֔d hvֹtsִ֧ya yְhֹvָ֛h aֶtְkֶ֖ם mִzֶּ֑h vְlֹ֥a yֵaָkֵ֖l chָmֵֽץ׃

13.hebrewText: הַיּ֖וֹם אַתֶּ֣ם יֹצְאִ֑ים בְּחֹ֖דֶשׁ הָאָבִֽיב׃
13.englishText: You go free on this day, in the month*in the month Or “on the new moon.” of Abib.
13.transliteration: hַyּ֖vֹם aַtֶּ֣ם yֹtsְaִ֑yם bְּchֹ֖dֶshׁ hָaָbִֽyb׃

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֣ה כִֽי־יְבִיאֲךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֡ה אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽ֠כְּנַעֲנִ֠י וְהַחִתִּ֨י וְהָאֱמֹרִ֜י וְהַחִוִּ֣י וְהַיְבוּסִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֤ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֣תֶת לָ֔ךְ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ וְעָבַדְתָּ֛ אֶת־הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַזֶּֽה׃
13.englishText: So, when יהוה has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which was sworn to your fathers to be given you, a land flowing with milk and honey, you shall observe in this month the following practice:
13.transliteration: vְhָyָ֣h kִֽy־yְbִyaֲךָ֣ yְhֹvָ֡h aֶl־aֶ֣rֶץ hַֽ֠kְּnַaֲnִ֠y vְhַchִtִּ֨y vְhָaֱmֹrִ֜y vְhַchִvִּ֣y vְhַyְbvּsִ֗y aֲshֶׁ֨r nִshְׁbַּ֤a lַaֲbֹtֶ֙yךָ֙ lָ֣tֶt lָ֔ךְ aֶ֛rֶץ zָbַ֥t chָlָ֖b vּdְbָ֑shׁ vְaָbַdְtָּ֛ aֶt־hָaֲbֹdָ֥h hַzֹּ֖at bַּchֹ֥dֶshׁ hַzֶּֽh׃

13.hebrewText: שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תֹּאכַ֣ל מַצֹּ֑ת וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י חַ֖ג לַיהֹוָֽה׃
13.englishText: “Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a festival of יהוה.
13.transliteration: shִׁbְaַ֥t yָmִ֖yם tֹּakַ֣l mַtsֹּ֑t vּbַyּvֹם֙ hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔y chַ֖g lַyhֹvָֽh׃

13.hebrewText: מַצּוֹת֙ יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת שִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֑ים וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֨ה לְךָ֜ חָמֵ֗ץ וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ שְׂאֹ֖ר בְּכׇל־גְּבֻלֶֽךָ׃
13.englishText: Throughout the seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten; no leavened bread shall be found with you, and no leaven shall be found in all your territory.
13.transliteration: mַtsּvֹt֙ yֵֽaָkֵ֔l aֵ֖t shִׁbְaַ֣t hַyָּmִ֑yם vְlֹֽa־yֵrָaֶ֨h lְךָ֜ chָmֵ֗ץ vְlֹֽa־yֵrָaֶ֥h lְךָ֛ shְׂaֹ֖r bְּkׇl־gְּbֻlֶֽךָ׃

13.hebrewText: וְהִגַּדְתָּ֣ לְבִנְךָ֔ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לֵאמֹ֑ר בַּעֲב֣וּר זֶ֗ה עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לִ֔י בְּצֵאתִ֖י מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
13.englishText: And you shall explain to your child on that day, ‘It is because of what יהוה did for me when I went free from Egypt.’
13.transliteration: vְhִgַּdְtָּ֣ lְbִnְךָ֔ bַּyּ֥vֹם hַh֖vּa lֵamֹ֑r bַּaֲb֣vּr zֶ֗h aָshָׂ֤h yְhֹvָh֙ lִ֔y bְּtsֵatִ֖y mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָה֩ לְךָ֨ לְא֜וֹת עַל־יָדְךָ֗ וּלְזִכָּרוֹן֙ בֵּ֣ין עֵינֶ֔יךָ לְמַ֗עַן תִּהְיֶ֛ה תּוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּפִ֑יךָ כִּ֚י בְּיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֔ה הוֹ��ִֽאֲךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
13.englishText: “And this shall serve you as a sign on your hand and as a reminder on your forehead*on your forehead Lit. “between your eyes”; cf. Deut. 6.8. —in order that the Teaching of יהוה may be in your mouth—that with a mighty hand יהוה freed you from Egypt.
13.transliteration: vְhָyָh֩ lְךָ֨ lְa֜vֹt aַl־yָdְךָ֗ vּlְzִkָּrvֹן֙ bֵּ֣yן aֵynֶ֔yךָ lְmַ֗aַן tִּhְyֶ֛h tּvֹrַ֥t yְhֹvָ֖h bְּpִ֑yךָ kִּ֚y bְּyָ֣d chֲzָkָ֔h hvֹ��ִֽaֲךָ֥ yְhֹvָ֖h mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

13.hebrewText: וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֛ אֶת־הַחֻקָּ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְמוֹעֲדָ֑הּ מִיָּמִ֖ים יָמִֽימָה׃ {פ}
13.englishText: You shall keep this institution at its set time from year to year.
13.transliteration: vְshָׁmַrְtָּ֛ aֶt־hַchֻkָּ֥h hַzֹּ֖at lְmvֹaֲdָ֑hּ mִyָּmִ֖yם yָmִֽymָh׃ {p}

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־יְבִאֲךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לְךָ֖ וְלַֽאֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וּנְתָנָ֖הּ לָֽךְ׃
13.englishText: “And when יהוה has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, as [God] swore to you and to your fathers, and has given it to you,
13.transliteration: vְhָyָ֞h kִּֽy־yְbִaֲךָ֤ yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־aֶ֣rֶץ hַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֔y kַּaֲshֶׁ֛r nִshְׁbַּ֥a lְךָ֖ vְlַֽaֲbֹtֶ֑yךָ vּnְtָnָ֖hּ lָֽךְ׃

13.hebrewText: וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ֥ כׇל־פֶּֽטֶר־רֶ֖חֶם לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וְכׇל־פֶּ֣טֶר ׀ שֶׁ֣גֶר בְּהֵמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ הַזְּכָרִ֖ים לַיהֹוָֽה׃
13.englishText: you shall set apart for יהוה every first issue of the womb: every male firstling that your cattle drop shall be יהוה’s.
13.transliteration: vְhַaֲbַrְtָּ֥ kׇl־pֶּֽtֶr־rֶ֖chֶם lַֽyhֹvָ֑h vְkׇl־pֶּ֣tֶr ׀ shֶׁ֣gֶr bְּhֵmָ֗h aֲshֶׁ֨r yִhְyֶ֥h lְךָ֛ hַzְּkָrִ֖yם lַyhֹvָֽh׃

13.hebrewText: וְכׇל־פֶּ֤טֶר חֲמֹר֙ תִּפְדֶּ֣ה בְשֶׂ֔ה וְאִם־לֹ֥א תִפְדֶּ֖ה וַעֲרַפְתּ֑וֹ וְכֹ֨ל בְּכ֥וֹר אָדָ֛ם בְּבָנֶ֖יךָ תִּפְדֶּֽה׃
13.englishText: But every firstling ass you shall redeem with a sheep; if you do not redeem it, you must break its neck. And you must redeem every male first-born among your children.
13.transliteration: vְkׇl־pֶּ֤tֶr chֲmֹr֙ tִּpְdֶּ֣h bְshֶׂ֔h vְaִם־lֹ֥a tִpְdֶּ֖h vַaֲrַpְtּ֑vֹ vְkֹ֨l bְּk֥vֹr aָdָ֛ם bְּbָnֶ֖yךָ tִּpְdֶּֽh׃

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־יִשְׁאָלְךָ֥ בִנְךָ֛ מָחָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֣ר מַה־זֹּ֑את וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֔יו בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֗ד הוֹצִיאָ֧נוּ יְהֹוָ֛ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
13.englishText: And when, in time to come, a child of yours asks you, saying, ‘What does this mean?’ you shall reply, ‘It was with a mighty hand that יהוה brought us out from Egypt, the house of bondage.
13.transliteration: vְhָyָ֞h kִּֽy־yִshְׁaָlְךָ֥ bִnְךָ֛ mָchָ֖r lֵamֹ֣r mַh־zֹּ֑at vְaָmַrְtָּ֣ aֵlָ֔yv bְּchֹ֣zֶk yָ֗d hvֹtsִyaָ֧nvּ yְhֹvָ֛h mִmִּtsְrַ֖yִם mִbֵּ֥yt aֲbָdִֽyם׃

13.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י כִּֽי־הִקְשָׁ֣ה פַרְעֹה֮ לְשַׁלְּחֵ֒נוּ֒ וַיַּהֲרֹ֨ג יְהֹוָ֤ה כׇּל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מִבְּכֹ֥ר אָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּכ֣וֹר בְּהֵמָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֩ אֲנִ֨י זֹבֵ֜חַ לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־פֶּ֤טֶר רֶ֙חֶם֙ הַזְּכָרִ֔ים וְכׇל־בְּכ֥וֹר בָּנַ֖י אֶפְדֶּֽה׃
13.englishText: When Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, יהוה slew every [male] first-born in the land of Egypt, the first-born of both human and beast. Therefore I sacrifice to יהוה every first male issue of the womb, but redeem every male first-born among my children.’
13.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y kִּֽy־hִkְshָׁ֣h pַrְaֹh֮ lְshַׁlְּchֵ֒nvּ֒ vַyַּhֲrֹ֨g yְhֹvָ֤h kׇּl־bְּkvֹr֙ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם mִbְּkֹ֥r aָdָ֖ם vְaַd־bְּk֣vֹr bְּhֵmָ֑h aַl־kֵּן֩ aֲnִ֨y zֹbֵ֜chַ lַֽyhֹvָ֗h kׇּl־pֶּ֤tֶr rֶ֙chֶם֙ hַzְּkָrִ֔yם vְkׇl־bְּk֥vֹr bָּnַ֖y aֶpְdֶּֽh׃

13.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֤ה לְאוֹת֙ עַל־יָ֣דְכָ֔ה וּלְטוֹטָפֹ֖ת בֵּ֣ין עֵינֶ֑יךָ כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֔ד הוֹצִיאָ֥נוּ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃ {ס}
13.englishText: “And so it shall be as a sign upon your hand and as a symbol*symbol Others “frontlet.” on your forehead that with a mighty hand יהוה freed us from Egypt.”
13.transliteration: vְhָyָ֤h lְavֹt֙ aַl־yָ֣dְkָ֔h vּlְtvֹtָpֹ֖t bֵּ֣yן aֵynֶ֑yךָ kִּ֚y bְּchֹ֣zֶk yָ֔d hvֹtsִyaָ֥nvּ yְhֹvָ֖h mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃ {s}

13.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י בְּשַׁלַּ֣ח פַּרְעֹה֮ אֶת־הָעָם֒ וְלֹא־נָחָ֣ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים דֶּ֚רֶךְ אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים כִּ֥י קָר֖וֹב ה֑וּא כִּ֣י ׀ אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים פֶּֽן־יִנָּחֵ֥ם הָעָ֛ם בִּרְאֹתָ֥ם מִלְחָמָ֖ה וְשָׁ֥בוּ מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
13.englishText: Now when Pharaoh let the people go, God did not lead them by way of the land of the Philistines, although it was nearer; for God said, “The people may have a change of heart when they see war, and return to Egypt.”
13.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y bְּshַׁlַּ֣ch pַּrְaֹh֮ aֶt־hָaָם֒ vְlֹa־nָchָ֣ם aֱlֹhִ֗yם dֶּ֚rֶךְ aֶ֣rֶץ pְּlִshְׁtִּ֔yם kִּ֥y kָr֖vֹb h֑vּa kִּ֣y ׀ aָmַ֣r aֱlֹhִ֗yם pֶּֽן־yִnָּchֵ֥ם hָaָ֛ם bִּrְaֹtָ֥ם mִlְchָmָ֖h vְshָׁ֥bvּ mִtsְrָֽyְmָh׃

13.hebrewText: וַיַּסֵּ֨ב אֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> אֶת־הָעָ֛ם דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר יַם־ס֑וּף וַחֲמֻשִׁ֛ים עָל֥וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
13.englishText: So God led the people round about, by way of the wilderness at the Sea of Reeds. Now the Israelites went up armed*armed Meaning of Heb. ḥamushim uncertain. out of the land of Egypt.
13.transliteration: vַyַּsֵּ֨b aֱlֹhִ֧yם <small>׀</small> aֶt־hָaָ֛ם dֶּ֥rֶךְ hַmִּdְbָּ֖r yַם־s֑vּף vַchֲmֻshִׁ֛yם aָl֥vּ bְnֵy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

13.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־עַצְמ֥וֹת יוֹסֵ֖ף עִמּ֑וֹ כִּי֩ הַשְׁבֵּ֨עַ הִשְׁבִּ֜יעַ אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר פָּקֹ֨ד יִפְקֹ֤ד אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהַעֲלִיתֶ֧ם אֶת־עַצְמֹתַ֛י מִזֶּ֖ה אִתְּכֶֽם׃
13.englishText: And Moses took with him the bones of Joseph, who had exacted an oath from the children of Israel, saying, “God will be sure to take notice of you: then you shall carry up my bones from here with you.”
13.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֥ch mֹshֶׁ֛h aֶt־aַtsְm֥vֹt yvֹsֵ֖ף aִmּ֑vֹ kִּy֩ hַshְׁbֵּ֨aַ hִshְׁbִּ֜yaַ aֶt־bְּnֵ֤y yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ lֵamֹ֔r pָּkֹ֨d yִpְkֹ֤d aֱlֹhִyם֙ aֶtְkֶ֔ם vְhַaֲlִytֶ֧ם aֶt־aַtsְmֹtַ֛y mִzֶּ֖h aִtְּkֶֽם׃

13.hebrewText: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִסֻּכֹּ֑ת וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בְאֵתָ֔ם בִּקְצֵ֖ה הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
13.englishText: They set out from Succoth, and encamped at Etham, at the edge of the wilderness.
13.transliteration: vַyִּsְa֖vּ mִsֻּkֹּ֑t vַyַּchֲn֣vּ bְaֵtָ֔ם bִּkְtsֵ֖h hַmִּdְbָּֽr׃

13.hebrewText: וַֽיהֹוָ֡ה הֹלֵךְ֩ לִפְנֵיהֶ֨ם יוֹמָ֜ם בְּעַמּ֤וּד עָנָן֙ לַנְחֹתָ֣ם הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְלַ֛יְלָה בְּעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ לְהָאִ֣יר לָהֶ֑ם לָלֶ֖כֶת יוֹמָ֥ם וָלָֽיְלָה׃
13.englishText: יהוה went before them in a pillar of cloud by day, to guide them along the way, and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light, that they might travel day and night.
13.transliteration: vַֽyhֹvָ֡h hֹlֵךְ֩ lִpְnֵyhֶ֨ם yvֹmָ֜ם bְּaַmּ֤vּd aָnָן֙ lַnְchֹtָ֣ם hַdֶּ֔rֶךְ vְlַ֛yְlָh bְּaַmּ֥vּd aֵ֖shׁ lְhָaִ֣yr lָhֶ֑ם lָlֶ֖kֶt yvֹmָ֥ם vָlָֽyְlָh׃

13.hebrewText: לֹֽא־יָמִ֞ישׁ עַמּ֤וּד הֶֽעָנָן֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וְעַמּ֥וּד הָאֵ֖שׁ לָ֑יְלָה לִפְנֵ֖י הָעָֽם׃ {פ}
13.englishText: The pillar of cloud by day and the pillar of fire by night did not depart from before the people.
13.transliteration: lֹֽa־yָmִ֞yshׁ aַmּ֤vּd hֶֽaָnָן֙ yvֹmָ֔ם vְaַmּ֥vּd hָaֵ֖shׁ lָ֑yְlָh lִpְnֵ֖y hָaָֽם׃ {p}

14.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
14.englishText: יהוה said to Moses:
14.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

14.hebrewText: דַּבֵּר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְיָשֻׁ֗בוּ וְיַחֲנוּ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ פִּ֣י הַחִירֹ֔ת בֵּ֥ין מִגְדֹּ֖ל וּבֵ֣ין הַיָּ֑ם לִפְנֵי֙ בַּ֣עַל צְפֹ֔ן נִכְח֥וֹ תַחֲנ֖וּ עַל־הַיָּֽם׃
14.englishText: Tell the Israelites to turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal-zephon; you shall encamp facing it, by the sea.
14.transliteration: dַּbֵּr֮ aֶl־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵl֒ vְyָshֻׁ֗bvּ vְyַchֲnvּ֙ lִpְnֵy֙ pִּ֣y hַchִyrֹ֔t bֵּ֥yן mִgְdֹּ֖l vּbֵ֣yן hַyָּ֑ם lִpְnֵy֙ bַּ֣aַl tsְpֹ֔ן nִkְch֥vֹ tַchֲn֖vּ aַl־hַyָּֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וְאָמַ֤ר פַּרְעֹה֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְבֻכִ֥ים הֵ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ סָגַ֥ר עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
14.englishText: Pharaoh will say of the Israelites, “They are astray in the land; the wilderness has closed in on them.”
14.transliteration: vְaָmַ֤r pַּrְaֹh֙ lִbְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l nְbֻkִ֥yם hֵ֖ם bָּaָ֑rֶץ sָgַ֥r aֲlֵyhֶ֖ם hַmִּdְbָּֽr׃

14.hebrewText: וְחִזַּקְתִּ֣י אֶת־לֵב־פַּרְעֹה֮ וְרָדַ֣ף אַחֲרֵיהֶם֒ וְאִכָּבְדָ֤ה בְּפַרְעֹה֙ וּבְכׇל־חֵיל֔וֹ וְיָדְע֥וּ מִצְרַ֖יִם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵֽן׃
14.englishText: Then I will stiffen Pharaoh’s heart and he will pursue them, that I may gain glory through Pharaoh and all his host; and the Egyptians shall know that I am יהוה. And they did so.
14.transliteration: vְchִzַּkְtִּ֣y aֶt־lֵb־pַּrְaֹh֮ vְrָdַ֣ף aַchֲrֵyhֶם֒ vְaִkָּbְdָ֤h bְּpַrְaֹh֙ vּbְkׇl־chֵyl֔vֹ vְyָdְa֥vּ mִtsְrַ֖yִם kִּֽy־aֲnִ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h vַyַּֽaֲshׂvּ־kֵֽן׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֻּגַּד֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּ֥י בָרַ֖ח הָעָ֑ם וַ֠יֵּהָפֵ֠ךְ לְבַ֨ב פַּרְעֹ֤ה וַעֲבָדָיו֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ מַה־זֹּ֣את עָשִׂ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־שִׁלַּ֥חְנוּ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵעׇבְדֵֽנוּ׃
14.englishText: When the king of Egypt was told that the people had fled, Pharaoh and his courtiers had a change of heart about the people and said, “What is this we have done, releasing Israel from our service?”
14.transliteration: vַyֻּgַּd֙ lְmֶ֣lֶךְ mִtsְrַ֔yִם kִּ֥y bָrַ֖ch hָaָ֑ם vַ֠yֵּhָpֵ֠ךְ lְbַ֨b pַּrְaֹ֤h vַaֲbָdָyv֙ aֶl־hָaָ֔ם vַyֹּֽamְrvּ֙ mַh־zֹּ֣at aָshִׂ֔ynvּ kִּֽy־shִׁlַּ֥chְnvּ aֶt־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mֵaׇbְdֵֽnvּ׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֶּאְסֹ֖ר אֶת־רִכְבּ֑וֹ וְאֶת־עַמּ֖וֹ לָקַ֥ח עִמּֽוֹ׃
14.englishText: He ordered*ordered See note at Gen. 46.29. his chariot and took his force with him;
14.transliteration: vַyֶּaְsֹ֖r aֶt־rִkְbּ֑vֹ vְaֶt־aַmּ֖vֹ lָkַ֥ch aִmּֽvֹ׃

14.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֗ח שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת רֶ֙כֶב֙ בָּח֔וּר וְכֹ֖ל רֶ֣כֶב מִצְרָ֑יִם וְשָׁלִשִׁ֖ם עַל־כֻּלּֽוֹ׃
14.englishText: he took six hundred of his picked chariots, and the rest of the chariots of Egypt, with officers*officers Heb. shalish; originally “third man on royal chariot”; hence “adjutant,” “officer.” in all of them.
14.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֗ch shֵׁshׁ־mֵa֥vֹt rֶ֙kֶb֙ bָּch֔vּr vְkֹ֖l rֶ֣kֶb mִtsְrָ֑yִם vְshָׁlִshִׁ֖ם aַl־kֻּlּֽvֹ׃

14.hebrewText: וַיְחַזֵּ֣ק יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־לֵ֤ב פַּרְעֹה֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּרְדֹּ֕ף אַחֲרֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יֹצְאִ֖ים בְּיָ֥ד רָמָֽה׃
14.englishText: יהוה stiffened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he gave chase to the Israelites. As the Israelites were departing defiantly,*defiantly Lit. “with upraised hand”; cf. Num. 33.3.
14.transliteration: vַyְchַzֵּ֣k yְhֹvָ֗h aֶt־lֵ֤b pַּrְaֹh֙ mֶ֣lֶךְ mִtsְrַ֔yִם vַyִּrְdֹּ֕ף aַchֲrֵ֖y bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vּbְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l yֹtsְaִ֖yם bְּyָ֥d rָmָֽh׃

14.hebrewText: וַיִּרְדְּפ֨וּ מִצְרַ֜יִם אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם וַיַּשִּׂ֤יגוּ אוֹתָם֙ חֹנִ֣ים עַל־הַיָּ֔ם כׇּל־סוּס֙ רֶ֣כֶב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וּפָרָשָׁ֖יו וְחֵיל֑וֹ עַל־פִּי֙ הַֽחִירֹ֔ת לִפְנֵ֖י בַּ֥עַל צְפֹֽן׃
14.englishText: the Egyptians gave chase to them, and all the chariot horses of Pharaoh, his riders, and his warriors overtook them encamped by the sea, near Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.
14.transliteration: vַyִּrְdְּp֨vּ mִtsְrַ֜yִם aַchֲrֵyhֶ֗ם vַyַּshִּׂ֤ygvּ avֹtָם֙ chֹnִ֣yם aַl־hַyָּ֔ם kׇּl־svּs֙ rֶ֣kֶb pַּrְaֹ֔h vּpָrָshָׁ֖yv vְchֵyl֑vֹ aַl־pִּy֙ hַֽchִyrֹ֔t lִpְnֵ֖y bַּ֥aַl tsְpֹֽן׃

14.hebrewText: וּפַרְעֹ֖ה הִקְרִ֑יב וַיִּשְׂאוּ֩ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל אֶת־עֵינֵיהֶ֜ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה מִצְרַ֣יִם ׀ נֹסֵ֣עַ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם וַיִּֽירְאוּ֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַיִּצְעֲק֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
14.englishText: As Pharaoh drew near, the Israelites caught sight of the Egyptians advancing upon them. Greatly frightened, the Israelites cried out to יהוה.
14.transliteration: vּpַrְaֹ֖h hִkְrִ֑yb vַyִּshְׂavּ֩ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֨l aֶt־aֵynֵyhֶ֜ם vְhִnֵּ֥h mִtsְrַ֣yִם ׀ nֹsֵ֣aַ aַchֲrֵyhֶ֗ם vַyִּֽyrְavּ֙ mְaֹ֔d vַyִּtsְaֲk֥vּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l aֶl־yְhֹvָֽh׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ הֲֽמִבְּלִ֤י אֵין־קְבָרִים֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם לְקַחְתָּ֖נוּ לָמ֣וּת בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר מַה־זֹּאת֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֔נוּ לְהוֹצִיאָ֖נוּ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
14.englishText: And they said to Moses, “Was it for want of graves in Egypt that you brought us to die in the wilderness? What have you done to us, taking us out of Egypt?
14.transliteration: vַyֹּamְrvּ֮ aֶl־mֹshֶׁh֒ hֲֽmִbְּlִ֤y aֵyן־kְbָrִyם֙ bְּmִtsְrַ֔yִם lְkַchְtָּ֖nvּ lָm֣vּt bַּmִּdְbָּ֑r mַh־zֹּat֙ aָshִׂ֣ytָ lָּ֔nvּ lְhvֹtsִyaָ֖nvּ mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

14.hebrewText: הֲלֹא־זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבַּ֨רְנוּ אֵלֶ֤יךָ בְמִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר חֲדַ֥ל מִמֶּ֖נּוּ וְנַֽעַבְדָ֣ה אֶת־מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י ט֥וֹב לָ֙נוּ֙ עֲבֹ֣ד אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם מִמֻּתֵ֖נוּ בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
14.englishText: Is this not the very thing we told you in Egypt, saying, ‘Let us be, and we will serve the Egyptians, for it is better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the wilderness’?”
14.transliteration: hֲlֹa־zֶ֣h hַdָּbָ֗r aֲshֶׁr֩ dִּbַּ֨rְnvּ aֵlֶ֤yךָ bְmִtsְrַ֙yִם֙ lֵamֹ֔r chֲdַ֥l mִmֶּ֖nּvּ vְnַֽaַbְdָ֣h aֶt־mִtsְrָ֑yִם kִּ֣y t֥vֹb lָ֙nvּ֙ aֲbֹ֣d aֶt־mִtsְrַ֔yִם mִmֻּtֵ֖nvּ bַּmִּdְbָּֽr׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־הָעָם֮ אַל־תִּירָ֒אוּ֒ הִֽתְיַצְּב֗וּ וּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־יְשׁוּעַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם כִּ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר רְאִיתֶ֤ם אֶת־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ הַיּ֔וֹם לֹ֥א תֹסִ֛פוּ לִרְאֹתָ֥ם ע֖וֹד עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
14.englishText: But Moses said to the people, “Have no fear! Stand by, and witness the deliverance which יהוה will work for you today; for the Egyptians whom you see today you will never see again.
14.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr mֹshֶׁ֣h aֶl־hָaָם֮ aַl־tִּyrָ֒avּ֒ hִֽtְyַtsְּb֗vּ vּrְavּ֙ aֶt־yְshׁvּaַ֣t yְhֹvָ֔h aֲshֶׁr־yַaֲshֶׂ֥h lָkֶ֖ם hַyּ֑vֹם kִּ֗y aֲshֶׁ֨r rְaִytֶ֤ם aֶt־mִtsְrַ֙yִם֙ hַyּ֔vֹם lֹ֥a tֹsִ֛pvּ lִrְaֹtָ֥ם a֖vֹd aַd־avֹlָֽם׃

14.hebrewText: יְהֹוָ֖ה יִלָּחֵ֣ם לָכֶ֑ם וְאַתֶּ֖ם תַּחֲרִשֽׁוּן׃ {פ}
14.englishText: יהוה will battle for you; you hold your peace!”
14.transliteration: yְhֹvָ֖h yִlָּchֵ֣ם lָkֶ֑ם vְaַtֶּ֖ם tַּchֲrִshֽׁvּן׃ {p}

14.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מַה־תִּצְעַ֖ק אֵלָ֑י דַּבֵּ֥ר אֶל־בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְיִסָּֽעוּ׃
14.englishText: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Why do you cry out to Me? Tell the Israelites to go forward.
14.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h mַh־tִּtsְaַ֖k aֵlָ֑y dַּbֵּ֥r aֶl־bְּnֵy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l vְyִsָּֽavּ׃

14.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֞ה הָרֵ֣ם אֶֽת־מַטְּךָ֗ וּנְטֵ֧ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֛ עַל־הַיָּ֖ם וּבְקָעֵ֑הוּ וְיָבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּ֖ם בַּיַּבָּשָֽׁה׃
14.englishText: And you lift up your rod and hold out your arm over the sea and split it, so that the Israelites may march into the sea on dry ground.
14.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֞h hָrֵ֣ם aֶֽt־mַtְּךָ֗ vּnְtֵ֧h aֶt־yָdְךָ֛ aַl־hַyָּ֖ם vּbְkָaֵ֑hvּ vְyָbֹ֧avּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l bְּt֥vֹךְ hַyָּ֖ם bַּyַּbָּshָֽׁh׃

14.hebrewText: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנְנִ֤י מְחַזֵּק֙ אֶת־לֵ֣ב מִצְרַ֔יִם וְיָבֹ֖אוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וְאִכָּבְדָ֤ה בְּפַרְעֹה֙ וּבְכׇל־חֵיל֔וֹ בְּרִכְבּ֖וֹ וּבְפָרָשָֽׁיו׃
14.englishText: And I will stiffen the hearts of the Egyptians so that they go in after them; and I will gain glory through Pharaoh and all his warriors, his chariots, and his riders.
14.transliteration: vַaֲnִ֗y hִnְnִ֤y mְchַzֵּk֙ aֶt־lֵ֣b mִtsְrַ֔yִם vְyָbֹ֖avּ aַchֲrֵyhֶ֑ם vְaִkָּbְdָ֤h bְּpַrְaֹh֙ vּbְkׇl־chֵyl֔vֹ bְּrִkְbּ֖vֹ vּbְpָrָshָֽׁyv׃

14.hebrewText: וְיָדְע֥וּ מִצְרַ֖יִם כִּי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּהִכָּבְדִ֣י בְּפַרְעֹ֔ה בְּרִכְבּ֖וֹ וּבְפָרָשָֽׁיו׃
14.englishText: Let the Egyptians know that I am יהוה, when I gain glory through Pharaoh, his chariots, and his riders.”
14.transliteration: vְyָdְa֥vּ mִtsְrַ֖yִם kִּy־aֲnִ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h bְּhִkָּbְdִ֣y bְּpַrְaֹ֔h bְּrִkְbּ֖vֹ vּbְpָrָshָֽׁyv׃

14.hebrewText: וַיִּסַּ֞ע מַלְאַ֣ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים הַהֹלֵךְ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּסַּ֞ע עַמּ֤וּד הֶֽעָנָן֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
14.englishText: The messenger of God, who had been going ahead of the Israelite army, now moved and followed behind them; and the pillar of cloud shifted from in front of them and took up a place behind them,
14.transliteration: vַyִּsַּ֞a mַlְaַ֣ךְ hָaֱlֹhִ֗yם hַhֹlֵךְ֙ lִpְnֵy֙ mַchֲnֵ֣h yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l vַyֵּ֖lֶךְ mֵaַchֲrֵyhֶ֑ם vַyִּsַּ֞a aַmּ֤vּd hֶֽaָnָן֙ mִpְּnֵyhֶ֔ם vַֽyַּaֲmֹ֖d mֵaַchֲrֵyhֶֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֞א בֵּ֣ין ׀ מַחֲנֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֗יִם וּבֵין֙ מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְהִ֤י הֶֽעָנָן֙ וְהַחֹ֔שֶׁךְ וַיָּ֖אֶר אֶת־הַלָּ֑יְלָה וְלֹא־קָרַ֥ב זֶ֛ה אֶל־זֶ֖ה כׇּל־הַלָּֽיְלָה׃
14.englishText: and it came between the army of the Egyptians and the army of Israel. Thus there was the cloud with the darkness, and it cast a spell upon*and it cast a spell upon From root ’-r-r, “cast a spell” or “curse.” Others “and it lit up.” the night, so that the one could not come near the other all through the night.
14.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֞a bֵּ֣yן ׀ mַchֲnֵ֣h mִtsְrַ֗yִם vּbֵyן֙ mַchֲnֵ֣h yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l vַyְhִ֤y hֶֽaָnָן֙ vְhַchֹ֔shֶׁךְ vַyָּ֖aֶr aֶt־hַlָּ֑yְlָh vְlֹa־kָrַ֥b zֶ֛h aֶl־zֶ֖h kׇּl־hַlָּֽyְlָh׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֨ט מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶת־יָדוֹ֮ עַל־הַיָּם֒ וַיּ֣וֹלֶךְ יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> אֶת־הַ֠יָּ֠ם בְּר֨וּחַ קָדִ֤ים עַזָּה֙ כׇּל־הַלַּ֔יְלָה וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם לֶחָרָבָ֑ה וַיִּבָּקְע֖וּ הַמָּֽיִם׃
14.englishText: Then Moses held out his arm over the sea and יהוה drove back the sea with a strong east wind all that night, and turned the sea into dry ground. The waters were split,
14.transliteration: vַyֵּ֨t mֹshֶׁ֣h aֶt־yָdvֹ֮ aַl־hַyָּם֒ vַyּ֣vֹlֶךְ yְhֹvָ֣h <small>׀</small> aֶt־hַ֠yָּ֠ם bְּr֨vּchַ kָdִ֤yם aַzָּh֙ kׇּl־hַlַּ֔yְlָh vַyָּ֥shֶׂם aֶt־hַyָּ֖ם lֶchָrָbָ֑h vַyִּbָּkְa֖vּ hַmָּֽyִם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּ֖ם בַּיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וְהַמַּ֤יִם לָהֶם֙ חוֹמָ֔ה מִֽימִינָ֖ם וּמִשְּׂמֹאלָֽם׃
14.englishText: and the Israelites went into the sea on dry ground, the waters forming a wall for them on their right and on their left.
14.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֧avּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l bְּt֥vֹךְ hַyָּ֖ם bַּyַּbָּshָׁ֑h vְhַmַּ֤yִם lָhֶם֙ chvֹmָ֔h mִֽymִynָ֖ם vּmִshְּׂmֹalָֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיִּרְדְּפ֤וּ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֚ל ס֣וּס פַּרְעֹ֔ה רִכְבּ֖וֹ וּפָרָשָׁ֑יו אֶל־תּ֖וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
14.englishText: The Egyptians came in pursuit after them into the sea, all of Pharaoh’s horses, chariots, and riders.
14.transliteration: vַyִּrְdְּp֤vּ mִtsְrַ֙yִם֙ vַyָּbֹ֣avּ aַchֲrֵyhֶ֔ם kֹּ֚l s֣vּs pַּrְaֹ֔h rִkְbּ֖vֹ vּpָrָshָׁ֑yv aֶl־tּ֖vֹךְ hַyָּֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ בְּאַשְׁמֹ֣רֶת הַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיַּשְׁקֵ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ וְעָנָ֑ן וַיָּ֕הׇם אֵ֖ת מַחֲנֵ֥ה מִצְרָֽיִם׃
14.englishText: At the morning watch, יהוה looked down upon the Egyptian army from a pillar of fire and cloud, and threw the Egyptian army into panic.
14.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ bְּaַshְׁmֹ֣rֶt hַbֹּ֔kֶr vַyַּshְׁkֵ֤ף yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mַchֲnֵ֣h mִtsְrַ֔yִם bְּaַmּ֥vּd aֵ֖shׁ vְaָnָ֑ן vַyָּ֕hׇם aֵ֖t mַchֲnֵ֥h mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיָּ֗סַר אֵ֚ת אֹפַ֣ן מַרְכְּבֹתָ֔יו וַֽיְנַהֲגֵ֖הוּ בִּכְבֵדֻ֑ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מִצְרַ֗יִם אָנ֙וּסָה֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה נִלְחָ֥ם לָהֶ֖ם בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
14.englishText: [God] locked*locked From root ’-s-r, with several ancient versions. Others “took off.” the wheels of their chariots so that they moved forward with difficulty. And the Egyptians said, “Let us flee from the Israelites, for יהוה is fighting for them against Egypt.”
14.transliteration: vַyָּ֗sַr aֵ֚t aֹpַ֣ן mַrְkְּbֹtָ֔yv vַֽyְnַhֲgֵ֖hvּ bִּkְbֵdֻ֑t vַyֹּ֣amֶr mִtsְrַ֗yִם aָn֙vּsָh֙ mִpְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l kִּ֣y yְhֹvָ֔h nִlְchָ֥ם lָhֶ֖ם bְּmִtsְrָֽyִם׃ {p}

14.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה נְטֵ֥ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֖ עַל־הַיָּ֑ם וְיָשֻׁ֤בוּ הַמַּ֙יִם֙ עַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם עַל־רִכְבּ֖וֹ וְעַל־פָּרָשָֽׁיו׃
14.englishText: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Hold out your arm over the sea, that the waters may come back upon the Egyptians and upon their chariots and upon their riders.”
14.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h nְtֵ֥h aֶt־yָdְךָ֖ aַl־hַyָּ֑ם vְyָshֻׁ֤bvּ hַmַּ֙yִם֙ aַl־mִtsְrַ֔yִם aַl־rִkְbּ֖vֹ vְaַl־pָּrָshָֽׁyv׃

14.hebrewText: וַיֵּט֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה אֶת־יָד֜וֹ עַל־הַיָּ֗ם וַיָּ֨שׇׁב הַיָּ֜ם לִפְנ֥וֹת בֹּ֙קֶר֙ לְאֵ֣יתָנ֔וֹ וּמִצְרַ֖יִם נָסִ֣ים לִקְרָאת֑וֹ וַיְנַעֵ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
14.englishText: Moses held out his arm over the sea, and at daybreak the sea returned to its normal state, and the Egyptians fled at its approach. But יהוה hurled the Egyptians into the sea.
14.transliteration: vַyֵּt֩ mֹshֶׁ֨h aֶt־yָd֜vֹ aַl־hַyָּ֗ם vַyָּ֨shׇׁb hַyָּ֜ם lִpְn֥vֹt bֹּ֙kֶr֙ lְaֵ֣ytָn֔vֹ vּmִtsְrַ֖yִם nָsִ֣yם lִkְrָat֑vֹ vַyְnַaֵ֧r yְhֹvָ֛h aֶt־mִtsְrַ֖yִם bְּt֥vֹךְ hַyָּֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ הַמַּ֗יִם וַיְכַסּ֤וּ אֶת־הָרֶ֙כֶב֙ וְאֶת־הַפָּ֣רָשִׁ֔ים לְכֹל֙ חֵ֣יל פַּרְעֹ֔ה הַבָּאִ֥ים אַחֲרֵיהֶ֖ם בַּיָּ֑ם לֹֽא־נִשְׁאַ֥ר בָּהֶ֖ם עַד־אֶחָֽד׃
14.englishText: The waters turned back and covered the chariots and the riders—Pharaoh’s entire army that followed them into the sea; not one of them remained.
14.transliteration: vַyָּshֻׁ֣bvּ hַmַּ֗yִם vַyְkַsּ֤vּ aֶt־hָrֶ֙kֶb֙ vְaֶt־hַpָּ֣rָshִׁ֔yם lְkֹl֙ chֵ֣yl pַּrְaֹ֔h hַbָּaִ֥yם aַchֲrֵyhֶ֖ם bַּyָּ֑ם lֹֽa־nִshְׁaַ֥r bָּhֶ֖ם aַd־aֶchָֽd׃

14.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָלְכ֥וּ בַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ הַיָּ֑ם וְהַמַּ֤יִם לָהֶם֙ חֹמָ֔ה מִֽימִינָ֖ם וּמִשְּׂמֹאלָֽם׃
14.englishText: But the Israelites had marched through the sea on dry ground, the waters forming a wall for them on their right and on their left.
14.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֧y yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l hָlְk֥vּ bַyַּbָּshָׁ֖h bְּt֣vֹךְ hַyָּ֑ם vְhַmַּ֤yִם lָhֶם֙ chֹmָ֔h mִֽymִynָ֖ם vּmִshְּׂmֹalָֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיּ֨וֹשַׁע יְהֹוָ֜ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֛וּא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִיַּ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיַּ֤רְא יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם מֵ֖ת עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיָּֽם׃
14.englishText: Thus יהוה delivered Israel that day from the Egyptians. Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the shore of the sea.
14.transliteration: vַyּ֨vֹshַׁa yְhֹvָ֜h bַּyּ֥vֹם hַh֛vּa aֶt־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mִyַּ֣d mִtsְrָ֑yִם vַyַּ֤rְa yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ aֶt־mִtsְrַ֔yִם mֵ֖t aַl־shְׂpַ֥t hַyָּֽם׃

14.hebrewText: וַיַּ֨רְא יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַיָּ֣ד הַגְּדֹלָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּֽירְא֥וּ הָעָ֖ם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַֽיַּאֲמִ֙ינוּ֙ בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה וּבְמֹשֶׁ֖ה עַבְדּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
14.englishText: And when Israel saw the wondrous power which יהוה had wielded against the Egyptians, the people feared יהוה; they had faith in יהוה and in God’s servant Moses.
14.transliteration: vַyַּ֨rְa yִshְׂrָaֵ֜l aֶt־hַyָּ֣d hַgְּdֹlָ֗h aֲshֶׁ֨r aָshָׂ֤h yְhֹvָh֙ bְּmִtsְrַ֔yִם vַyִּֽyrְa֥vּ hָaָ֖ם aֶt־yְhֹvָ֑h vַֽyַּaֲmִ֙ynvּ֙ bַּֽyhֹvָ֔h vּbְmֹshֶׁ֖h aַbְdּֽvֹ׃ {p}

15.hebrewText: אָ֣ז יָשִֽׁיר־מֹשֶׁה֩ וּבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לֵאמֹ֑ר        אָשִׁ֤ירָה לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־גָאֹ֣ה גָּאָ֔ה        ס֥וּס וְרֹכְב֖וֹ רָמָ֥ה בַיָּֽם׃
15.englishText:
Then Moses and the Israelites sang this song to יהוה. They said:
I will sing to יהוה, for He*He The poetic figure in vv. 1–4 takes ancient Near Eastern gender roles as a given: the (male) role of expert warrior represented salvation from military threats. See the Dictionary under “male metaphors for God.” has triumphed gloriously;
Horse and driver He has hurled into the sea.
15.transliteration: aָ֣z yָshִֽׁyr־mֹshֶׁh֩ vּbְnֵ֨y yִshְׂrָaֵ֜l aֶt־hַshִּׁyrָ֤h hַzֹּat֙ lַֽyhֹvָ֔h vַyֹּamְr֖vּ lֵamֹ֑r        aָshִׁ֤yrָh lַֽyhֹvָh֙ kִּֽy־gָaֹ֣h gָּaָ֔h        s֥vּs vְrֹkְb֖vֹ rָmָ֥h bַyָּֽם׃

15.hebrewText: עׇזִּ֤י וְזִמְרָת֙ יָ֔הּ וַֽיְהִי־לִ֖י לִֽישׁוּעָ֑ה        זֶ֤ה אֵלִי֙ וְאַנְוֵ֔הוּ        אֱלֹהֵ֥י אָבִ֖י וַאֲרֹמְמֶֽנְהוּ׃
15.englishText:
יהוה* יהוה Heb. Yah. is my strength and might;*might Others “song.”
He is become my deliverance.
This is my God and I will enshrine*enshrine Others “glorify.” Him;
The God of my father’s [house], and I will exalt Him.
15.transliteration: aׇzִּ֤y vְzִmְrָt֙ yָ֔hּ vַֽyְhִy־lִ֖y lִֽyshׁvּaָ֑h        zֶ֤h aֵlִy֙ vְaַnְvֵ֔hvּ        aֱlֹhֵ֥y aָbִ֖y vַaֲrֹmְmֶֽnְhvּ׃

15.hebrewText: יְהֹוָ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֑ה יְהֹוָ֖ה שְׁמֽוֹ׃
15.englishText:
יהוה, the Warrior—
יהוה is His name!
15.transliteration: yְhֹvָ֖h aִ֣yshׁ mִlְchָmָ֑h yְhֹvָ֖h shְׁmֽvֹ׃

15.hebrewText: מַרְכְּבֹ֥ת פַּרְעֹ֛ה וְחֵיל֖וֹ יָרָ֣ה בַיָּ֑ם        וּמִבְחַ֥ר שָֽׁלִשָׁ֖יו טֻבְּע֥וּ בְיַם־סֽוּף׃
15.englishText:
Pharaoh’s chariots and his army
He has cast into the sea;
And the pick of his officers
Are drowned in the Sea of Reeds.
15.transliteration: mַrְkְּbֹ֥t pַּrְaֹ֛h vְchֵyl֖vֹ yָrָ֣h bַyָּ֑ם        vּmִbְchַ֥r shָֽׁlִshָׁ֖yv tֻbְּa֥vּ bְyַם־sֽvּף׃

15.hebrewText: תְּהֹמֹ֖ת יְכַסְיֻ֑מוּ יָרְד֥וּ בִמְצוֹלֹ֖ת כְּמוֹ־אָֽבֶן׃
15.englishText:
The deeps covered them;
They went down into the depths like a stone.
15.transliteration: tְּhֹmֹ֖t yְkַsְyֻ֑mvּ yָrְd֥vּ bִmְtsvֹlֹ֖t kְּmvֹ־aָֽbֶן׃

15.hebrewText: יְמִֽינְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֔ה נֶאְדָּרִ֖י בַּכֹּ֑חַ        יְמִֽינְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה תִּרְעַ֥ץ אוֹיֵֽב׃
15.englishText:
Your right hand, יהוה, glorious in power,
Your right hand, יהוה, shatters the foe!
15.transliteration: yְmִֽynְךָ֣ yְhֹvָ֔h nֶaְdָּrִ֖y bַּkֹּ֑chַ        yְmִֽynְךָ֥ yְhֹvָ֖h tִּrְaַ֥ץ avֹyֵֽb׃

15.hebrewText: וּבְרֹ֥ב גְּאוֹנְךָ֖ תַּהֲרֹ֣ס קָמֶ֑יךָ        תְּשַׁלַּח֙ חֲרֹ֣נְךָ֔ יֹאכְלֵ֖מוֹ כַּקַּֽשׁ׃
15.englishText:
In Your great triumph You break Your opponents;
You send forth Your fury, it consumes them like straw.
15.transliteration: vּbְrֹ֥b gְּavֹnְךָ֖ tַּhֲrֹ֣s kָmֶ֑yךָ        tְּshַׁlַּch֙ chֲrֹ֣nְךָ֔ yֹakְlֵ֖mvֹ kַּkַּֽshׁ׃

15.hebrewText: וּבְר֤וּחַ אַפֶּ֙יךָ֙ נֶ֣עֶרְמוּ מַ֔יִם        נִצְּב֥וּ כְמוֹ־נֵ֖ד נֹזְלִ֑ים        קָֽפְא֥וּ תְהֹמֹ֖ת בְּלֶב־יָֽם׃
15.englishText:
At the blast of Your nostrils the waters piled up,
The floods stood straight like a wall;
The deeps froze in the heart of the sea.
15.transliteration: vּbְr֤vּchַ aַpֶּ֙yךָ֙ nֶ֣aֶrְmvּ mַ֔yִם        nִtsְּb֥vּ kְmvֹ־nֵ֖d nֹzְlִ֑yם        kָֽpְa֥vּ tְhֹmֹ֖t bְּlֶb־yָֽם׃

15.hebrewText: אָמַ֥ר אוֹיֵ֛ב אֶרְדֹּ֥ף אַשִּׂ֖יג        אֲחַלֵּ֣ק שָׁלָ֑ל תִּמְלָאֵ֣מוֹ נַפְשִׁ֔י        אָרִ֣יק חַרְבִּ֔י תּוֹרִישֵׁ֖מוֹ יָדִֽי׃
15.englishText:
The foe said,
“I will pursue, I will overtake,
I will divide the spoil;
My desire shall have its fill of them.
I will bare my sword—
My hand shall subdue them.”
15.transliteration: aָmַ֥r avֹyֵ֛b aֶrְdֹּ֥ף aַshִּׂ֖yg        aֲchַlֵּ֣k shָׁlָ֑l tִּmְlָaֵ֣mvֹ nַpְshִׁ֔y        aָrִ֣yk chַrְbִּ֔y tּvֹrִyshֵׁ֖mvֹ yָdִֽy׃

15.hebrewText: נָשַׁ֥פְתָּ בְרוּחֲךָ֖ כִּסָּ֣מוֹ יָ֑ם        צָֽלְלוּ֙ כַּֽעוֹפֶ֔רֶת בְּמַ֖יִם אַדִּירִֽים׃
15.englishText:
You made Your wind blow, the sea covered them;
They sank like lead in the majestic waters.
15.transliteration: nָshַׁ֥pְtָּ bְrvּchֲךָ֖ kִּsָּ֣mvֹ yָ֑ם        tsָֽlְlvּ֙ kַּֽavֹpֶ֔rֶt bְּmַ֖yִם aַdִּyrִֽyם׃

15.hebrewText: מִֽי־כָמֹ֤כָה בָּֽאֵלִם֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה        מִ֥י כָּמֹ֖כָה נֶאְדָּ֣ר בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ        נוֹרָ֥א תְהִלֹּ֖ת עֹ֥שֵׂה פֶֽלֶא׃
15.englishText:
Who is like You, יהוה, among the celestials;*celestials Others “mighty.”
Who is like You, majestic in holiness,
Awesome in splendor, working wonders!
15.transliteration: mִֽy־kָmֹ֤kָh bָּֽaֵlִם֙ yְhֹvָ֔h        mִ֥y kָּmֹ֖kָh nֶaְdָּ֣r bַּkֹּ֑dֶshׁ        nvֹrָ֥a tְhִlֹּ֖t aֹ֥shֵׂh pֶֽlֶa׃

15.hebrewText: נָטִ֙יתָ֙ יְמִ֣ינְךָ֔ תִּבְלָעֵ֖מוֹ אָֽרֶץ׃
15.englishText:
You put out Your right hand,
The earth swallowed them.
15.transliteration: nָtִ֙ytָ֙ yְmִ֣ynְךָ֔ tִּbְlָaֵ֖mvֹ aָֽrֶץ׃

15.hebrewText: נָחִ֥יתָ בְחַסְדְּךָ֖ עַם־ז֣וּ גָּאָ֑לְתָּ        נֵהַ֥לְתָּ בְעׇזְּךָ֖ אֶל־נְוֵ֥ה קׇדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
15.englishText:
In Your love You lead the people You redeemed;
In Your strength You guide them to Your holy abode.
15.transliteration: nָchִ֥ytָ bְchַsְdְּךָ֖ aַם־z֣vּ gָּaָ֑lְtָּ        nֵhַ֥lְtָּ bְaׇzְּךָ֖ aֶl־nְvֵ֥h kׇdְshֶֽׁךָ׃

15.hebrewText: שָֽׁמְע֥וּ עַמִּ֖ים יִרְגָּז֑וּן        חִ֣יל אָחַ֔ז יֹשְׁבֵ֖י פְּלָֽשֶׁת׃
15.englishText:
The peoples hear, they tremble;
Agony grips the dwellers in Philistia.
15.transliteration: shָֽׁmְa֥vּ aַmִּ֖yם yִrְgָּz֑vּן        chִ֣yl aָchַ֔z yֹshְׁbֵ֖y pְּlָֽshֶׁt׃

15.hebrewText: אָ֤ז נִבְהֲלוּ֙ אַלּוּפֵ֣י אֱד֔וֹם        אֵילֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב יֹֽאחֲזֵ֖מוֹ רָ֑עַד        נָמֹ֕גוּ כֹּ֖ל יֹשְׁבֵ֥י כְנָֽעַן׃
15.englishText:
Now are the clans of Edom dismayed;
The tribes of Moab—trembling grips them;
All the dwellers in Canaan are aghast.
15.transliteration: aָ֤z nִbְhֲlvּ֙ aַlּvּpֵ֣y aֱd֔vֹם        aֵylֵ֣y mvֹaָ֔b yֹֽachֲzֵ֖mvֹ rָ֑aַd        nָmֹ֕gvּ kֹּ֖l yֹshְׁbֵ֥y kְnָֽaַן׃

15.hebrewText: תִּפֹּ֨ל עֲלֵיהֶ֤ם אֵימָ֙תָה֙ וָפַ֔חַד        בִּגְדֹ֥ל זְרוֹעֲךָ֖ יִדְּמ֣וּ כָּאָ֑בֶן        עַד־יַעֲבֹ֤ר עַמְּךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה        עַֽד־יַעֲבֹ֖ר עַם־ז֥וּ קָנִֽיתָ׃
15.englishText:
Terror and dread descend upon them;
Through the might of Your arm they are still as stone—
Till Your people cross over, יהוה,
Till Your people cross whom You have ransomed.
15.transliteration: tִּpֹּ֨l aֲlֵyhֶ֤ם aֵymָ֙tָh֙ vָpַ֔chַd        bִּgְdֹ֥l zְrvֹaֲךָ֖ yִdְּm֣vּ kָּaָ֑bֶן        aַd־yַaֲbֹ֤r aַmְּךָ֙ yְhֹvָ֔h        aַֽd־yַaֲbֹ֖r aַם־z֥vּ kָnִֽytָ׃

15.hebrewText: תְּבִאֵ֗מוֹ וְתִטָּעֵ֙מוֹ֙ בְּהַ֣ר נַחֲלָֽתְךָ֔        מָכ֧וֹן לְשִׁבְתְּךָ֛ פָּעַ֖לְתָּ יְהֹוָ֑ה        מִקְּדָ֕שׁ אֲדֹנָ֖י כּוֹנְנ֥וּ יָדֶֽיךָ׃
15.englishText:
You will bring them and plant them in Your own mountain,
The place You made to dwell in, יהוה,
The sanctuary, O my lord, which Your hands established.
15.transliteration: tְּbִaֵ֗mvֹ vְtִtָּaֵ֙mvֹ֙ bְּhַ֣r nַchֲlָֽtְךָ֔        mָk֧vֹן lְshִׁbְtְּךָ֛ pָּaַ֖lְtָּ yְhֹvָ֑h        mִkְּdָ֕shׁ aֲdֹnָ֖y kּvֹnְn֥vּ yָdֶֽyךָ׃

15.hebrewText: יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> יִמְלֹ֖ךְ לְעֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
15.englishText: יהוה will reign for ever and ever!
15.transliteration: yְhֹvָ֥h <small>׀</small> yִmְlֹ֖ךְ lְaֹlָ֥ם vָaֶֽd׃

15.hebrewText: כִּ֣י בָא֩ ס֨וּס פַּרְעֹ֜ה בְּרִכְבּ֤וֹ וּבְפָרָשָׁיו֙ בַּיָּ֔ם        וַיָּ֧שֶׁב יְהֹוָ֛ה עֲלֵהֶ֖ם אֶת־מֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם        וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָלְכ֥וּ בַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃ {פ}
15.englishText: For the horses of Pharaoh, with his chariots and riders, went into the sea; and יהוה turned back on them the waters of the sea; but the Israelites marched on dry ground in the midst of the sea.
15.transliteration: kִּ֣y bָa֩ s֨vּs pַּrְaֹ֜h bְּrִkְbּ֤vֹ vּbְpָrָshָׁyv֙ bַּyָּ֔ם        vַyָּ֧shֶׁb yְhֹvָ֛h aֲlֵhֶ֖ם aֶt־mֵ֣y hַyָּ֑ם        vּbְnֵ֧y yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l hָlְk֥vּ bַyַּbָּshָׁ֖h bְּt֥vֹךְ hַyָּֽם׃ {p}

15.hebrewText: וַתִּקַּח֩ מִרְיָ֨ם הַנְּבִיאָ֜ה אֲח֧וֹת אַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶת־הַתֹּ֖ף בְּיָדָ֑הּ וַתֵּצֶ֤אןָ כׇֽל־הַנָּשִׁים֙ אַחֲרֶ֔יהָ בְּתֻפִּ֖ים וּבִמְחֹלֹֽת׃
15.englishText: Then Miriam the prophet, Aaron’s sister, picked up a hand-drum,*hand-drum Trad. “timbrel,” which is often construed anachronistically as a tambourine. (As drummers, Israelite women set the tempo at public celebrations.) and all the women went out after her in dance with hand-drums.
15.transliteration: vַtִּkַּch֩ mִrְyָ֨ם hַnְּbִyaָ֜h aֲch֧vֹt aַhֲrֹ֛ן aֶt־hַtֹּ֖ף bְּyָdָ֑hּ vַtֵּtsֶ֤aןָ kׇֽl־hַnָּshִׁyם֙ aַchֲrֶ֔yhָ bְּtֻpִּ֖yם vּbִmְchֹlֹֽt׃

15.hebrewText: וַתַּ֥עַן לָהֶ֖ם מִרְיָ֑ם שִׁ֤ירוּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־גָאֹ֣ה גָּאָ֔ה ס֥וּס וְרֹכְב֖וֹ רָמָ֥ה בַיָּֽם׃ {ס}
15.englishText:
And Miriam chanted for them:
Sing to יהוה, for He*He See note at 15.1. has triumphed gloriously;
Horse and driver He has hurled into the sea.
15.transliteration: vַtַּ֥aַן lָhֶ֖ם mִrְyָ֑ם shִׁ֤yrvּ lַֽyhֹvָh֙ kִּֽy־gָaֹ֣h gָּaָ֔h s֥vּs vְrֹkְb֖vֹ rָmָ֥h bַyָּֽם׃ {s}

15.hebrewText: וַיַּסַּ֨ע מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִיַּם־ס֔וּף וַיֵּצְא֖וּ אֶל־מִדְבַּר־שׁ֑וּר וַיֵּלְכ֧וּ שְׁלֹֽשֶׁת־יָמִ֛ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר וְלֹא־מָ֥צְאוּ מָֽיִם׃
15.englishText: Then Moses caused Israel to set out from the Sea of Reeds. They went on into the wilderness of Shur; they traveled three days in the wilderness and found no water.
15.transliteration: vַyַּsַּ֨a mֹshֶׁ֤h aֶt־yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ mִyַּם־s֔vּף vַyֵּtsְa֖vּ aֶl־mִdְbַּr־shׁ֑vּr vַyֵּlְk֧vּ shְׁlֹֽshֶׁt־yָmִ֛yם bַּmִּdְbָּ֖r vְlֹa־mָ֥tsְavּ mָֽyִם׃

15.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ מָרָ֔תָה וְלֹ֣א יָֽכְל֗וּ לִשְׁתֹּ֥ת מַ֙יִם֙ מִמָּרָ֔ה כִּ֥י מָרִ֖ים הֵ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמָ֖הּ מָרָֽה׃
15.englishText: They came to Marah, but they could not drink the water of Marah because it was bitter; that is why it was named Marah.*Marah I.e., “bitter.”
15.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֣avּ mָrָ֔tָh vְlֹ֣a yָֽkְl֗vּ lִshְׁtֹּ֥t mַ֙yִם֙ mִmָּrָ֔h kִּ֥y mָrִ֖yם hֵ֑ם aַl־kֵּ֥ן kָrָֽa־shְׁmָ֖hּ mָrָֽh׃

15.hebrewText: וַיִּלֹּ֧נוּ הָעָ֛ם עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹ֖ר מַה־נִּשְׁתֶּֽה׃
15.englishText: And the people grumbled against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”
15.transliteration: vַyִּlֹּ֧nvּ hָaָ֛ם aַl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹ֖r mַh־nִּshְׁtֶּֽh׃

15.hebrewText: וַיִּצְעַ֣ק אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיּוֹרֵ֤הוּ יְהֹוָה֙ עֵ֔ץ וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ֙ אֶל־הַמַּ֔יִם וַֽיִּמְתְּק֖וּ הַמָּ֑יִם שָׁ֣ם שָׂ֥ם ל֛וֹ חֹ֥ק וּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט וְשָׁ֥ם נִסָּֽהוּ׃
15.englishText: So he cried out to יהוה, and יהוה showed him a piece of wood; he threw it into the water and the water became sweet. There [God] made for them a fixed rule; there they were put to the test.
15.transliteration: vַyִּtsְaַ֣k aֶl־yְhֹvָ֗h vַyּvֹrֵ֤hvּ yְhֹvָh֙ aֵ֔ץ vַyַּshְׁlֵךְ֙ aֶl־hַmַּ֔yִם vַֽyִּmְtְּk֖vּ hַmָּ֑yִם shָׁ֣ם shָׂ֥ם l֛vֹ chֹ֥k vּmִshְׁpָּ֖t vְshָׁ֥ם nִsָּֽhvּ׃

15.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אִם־שָׁמ֨וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַ֜ע לְק֣וֹל ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ וְהַיָּשָׁ֤ר בְּעֵינָיו֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְהַֽאֲזַנְתָּ֙ לְמִצְוֺתָ֔יו וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֖ כׇּל־חֻקָּ֑יו כׇּֽל־הַמַּחֲלָ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֤מְתִּי בְמִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לֹא־אָשִׂ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה רֹפְאֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
15.englishText: [God] said, “If you will heed your God יהוה diligently, doing what is upright in God’s sight, giving ear to God’s commandments and keeping all God’s laws, then I will not bring upon you any of the diseases that I brought upon the Egyptians, for I יהוה am your healer.”
15.transliteration: vַyֹּ֩amֶr֩ aִם־shָׁm֨vֹaַ tִּshְׁmַ֜a lְk֣vֹl ׀ yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhֶ֗yךָ vְhַyָּshָׁ֤r bְּaֵynָyv֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֔h vְhַֽaֲzַnְtָּ֙ lְmִtsְvֺtָ֔yv vְshָׁmַrְtָּ֖ kׇּl־chֻkָּ֑yv kׇּֽl־hַmַּchֲlָ֞h aֲshֶׁr־shַׂ֤mְtִּy bְmִtsְrַ֙yִם֙ lֹa־aָshִׂ֣yם aָlֶ֔yךָ kִּ֛y aֲnִ֥y yְhֹvָ֖h rֹpְaֶֽךָ׃ {s}

15.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אֵילִ֔מָה וְשָׁ֗ם שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֛ה עֵינֹ֥ת מַ֖יִם וְשִׁבְעִ֣ים תְּמָרִ֑ים וַיַּחֲנוּ־שָׁ֖ם עַל־הַמָּֽיִם׃
15.englishText: And they came to Elim, where there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees; and they encamped there beside the water.
15.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֣avּ aֵylִ֔mָh vְshָׁ֗ם shְׁtֵּ֥yם aֶshְׂrֵ֛h aֵynֹ֥t mַ֖yִם vְshִׁbְaִ֣yם tְּmָrִ֑yם vַyַּchֲnvּ־shָׁ֖ם aַl־hַmָּֽyִם׃
