16.hebrewText: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מֵֽאֵילִ֔ם וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־מִדְבַּר־סִ֔ין אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּין־אֵילִ֖ם וּבֵ֣ין סִינָ֑י בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י לְצֵאתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
16.englishText: Setting out from Elim, the whole Israelite community came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departure from the land of Egypt.
16.transliteration: vַyִּsְavּ֙ mֵֽaֵylִ֔ם vַyָּbֹ֜avּ kׇּl־aֲdַ֤t bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ aֶl־mִdְbַּr־sִ֔yן aֲshֶׁ֥r bֵּyן־aֵylִ֖ם vּbֵ֣yן sִynָ֑y bַּchֲmִshָּׁ֨h aָshָׂ֥r yvֹם֙ lַchֹ֣dֶshׁ hַshֵּׁnִ֔y lְtsֵatָ֖ם mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

16.hebrewText: (וילינו) [וַיִּלּ֜וֹנוּ] כׇּל־עֲדַ֧ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
16.englishText: In the wilderness, the whole Israelite community grumbled against Moses and Aaron.
16.transliteration: (vylynv) [vַyִּlּ֜vֹnvּ] kׇּl־aֲdַ֧t bְּnֵy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l aַl־mֹshֶׁ֥h vְaַֽl־aַhֲrֹ֖ן bַּmִּdְbָּֽr׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֲלֵהֶ֜ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מִֽי־יִתֵּ֨ן מוּתֵ֤נוּ בְיַד־יְהֹוָה֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּשִׁבְתֵּ֙נוּ֙ עַל־סִ֣יר הַבָּשָׂ֔ר בְּאׇכְלֵ֥נוּ לֶ֖חֶם לָשֹׂ֑בַע כִּֽי־הוֹצֵאתֶ֤ם אֹתָ֙נוּ֙ אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לְהָמִ֛ית אֶת־כׇּל־הַקָּהָ֥ל הַזֶּ֖ה בָּרָעָֽב׃ {ס}
16.englishText: The Israelites said to them, “If only we had died by the hand of יהוה in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the fleshpots, when we ate our fill of bread! For you have brought us out into this wilderness to starve this whole congregation to death.”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּamְr֨vּ aֲlֵhֶ֜ם bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l mִֽy־yִtֵּ֨ן mvּtֵ֤nvּ bְyַd־yְhֹvָh֙ bְּaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם bְּshִׁbְtֵּ֙nvּ֙ aַl־sִ֣yr hַbָּshָׂ֔r bְּaׇkְlֵ֥nvּ lֶ֖chֶם lָshֹׂ֑bַa kִּֽy־hvֹtsֵatֶ֤ם aֹtָ֙nvּ֙ aֶl־hַmִּdְbָּ֣r hַzֶּ֔h lְhָmִ֛yt aֶt־kׇּl־hַkָּhָ֥l hַzֶּ֖h bָּrָaָֽb׃ {s}

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י מַמְטִ֥יר לָכֶ֛ם לֶ֖חֶם מִן־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְיָצָ֨א הָעָ֤ם וְלָֽקְטוּ֙ דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֔וֹ לְמַ֧עַן אֲנַסֶּ֛נּוּ הֲיֵלֵ֥ךְ בְּתוֹרָתִ֖י אִם־לֹֽא׃
16.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses, “I will rain down bread for you from the sky, and the people shall go out and gather each day that day’s portion—that I may thus test them, to see whether they will follow My instructions or not.
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h hִnְnִ֨y mַmְtִ֥yr lָkֶ֛ם lֶ֖chֶם mִן־hַshָּׁmָ֑yִם vְyָtsָ֨a hָaָ֤ם vְlָֽkְtvּ֙ dְּbַr־y֣vֹם bְּyvֹm֔vֹ lְmַ֧aַן aֲnַsֶּ֛nּvּ hֲyֵlֵ֥ךְ bְּtvֹrָtִ֖y aִם־lֹֽa׃

16.hebrewText: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔י וְהֵכִ֖ינוּ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־יָבִ֑יאוּ וְהָיָ֣ה מִשְׁנֶ֔ה עַ֥ל אֲשֶֽׁר־יִלְקְט֖וּ י֥וֹם <small>׀</small> יֽוֹם׃
16.englishText: But on the sixth day, when they apportion what they have brought in, it shall prove to be double the amount they gather each day.”
16.transliteration: vְhָyָh֙ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshִּׁshִּׁ֔y vְhֵkִ֖ynvּ aֵ֣t aֲshֶׁr־yָbִ֑yavּ vְhָyָ֣h mִshְׁnֶ֔h aַ֥l aֲshֶֽׁr־yִlְkְt֖vּ y֥vֹם <small>׀</small> yֽvֹם׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶֽל־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עֶ֕רֶב וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה הוֹצִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
16.englishText: So Moses and Aaron said to all the Israelites, “By evening you shall know it was יהוה who brought you out from the land of Egypt;
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr mֹshֶׁh֙ vְaַhֲrֹ֔ן aֶֽl־kׇּl־bְּnֵ֖y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l aֶ֕rֶb vִֽydַaְtֶּ֕ם kִּ֧y yְhֹvָ֛h hvֹtsִ֥ya aֶtְkֶ֖ם mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

16.hebrewText: וּבֹ֗קֶר וּרְאִיתֶם֙ אֶת־כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּשׇׁמְע֥וֹ אֶת־תְּלֻנֹּתֵיכֶ֖ם עַל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְנַ֣חְנוּ מָ֔ה כִּ֥י (תלונו) [תַלִּ֖ינוּ] עָלֵֽינוּ׃
16.englishText: and in the morning you shall behold the Presence*Presence Others “glory.” of יהוה, because [God] has heard your grumblings against יהוה. For who are we that you should grumble against us?
16.transliteration: vּbֹ֗kֶr vּrְaִytֶם֙ aֶt־kְּb֣vֹd yְhֹvָ֔h bְּshׇׁmְa֥vֹ aֶt־tְּlֻnֹּtֵykֶ֖ם aַl־yְhֹvָ֑h vְnַ֣chְnvּ mָ֔h kִּ֥y (tlvnv) [tַlִּ֖ynvּ] aָlֵֽynvּ׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה בְּתֵ֣ת יְהֹוָה֩ לָכֶ֨ם בָּעֶ֜רֶב בָּשָׂ֣ר לֶאֱכֹ֗ל וְלֶ֤חֶם בַּבֹּ֙קֶר֙ לִשְׂבֹּ֔עַ בִּשְׁמֹ֤עַ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־תְּלֻנֹּ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם מַלִּינִ֖ם עָלָ֑יו וְנַ֣חְנוּ מָ֔ה לֹא־עָלֵ֥ינוּ תְלֻנֹּתֵיכֶ֖ם כִּ֥י עַל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
16.englishText: Since it is יהוה,” Moses continued, “who will give you flesh to eat in the evening and bread in the morning to the full—because יהוה has heard the grumblings you utter—what is our part? Your grumbling is against יהוה, not against us!”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr mֹshֶׁ֗h bְּtֵ֣t yְhֹvָh֩ lָkֶ֨ם bָּaֶ֜rֶb bָּshָׂ֣r lֶaֱkֹ֗l vְlֶ֤chֶם bַּbֹּ֙kֶr֙ lִshְׂbֹּ֔aַ bִּshְׁmֹ֤aַ yְhֹvָh֙ aֶt־tְּlֻnֹּ֣tֵykֶ֔ם aֲshֶׁr־aַtֶּ֥ם mַlִּynִ֖ם aָlָ֑yv vְnַ֣chְnvּ mָ֔h lֹa־aָlֵ֥ynvּ tְlֻnֹּtֵykֶ֖ם kִּ֥y aַl־yְhֹvָֽh׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֱמֹ֗ר אֶֽל־כׇּל־עֲדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל קִרְב֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֔ע אֵ֖ת תְּלֻנֹּתֵיכֶֽם׃
16.englishText: Then Moses said to Aaron, “Say to the whole Israelite community: Advance toward יהוה, who has heard your grumbling.”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶֽl־aַhֲrֹ֔ן aֱmֹ֗r aֶֽl־kׇּl־aֲdַt֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l kִrְb֖vּ lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h kִּ֣y shָׁmַ֔a aֵ֖t tְּlֻnֹּtֵykֶֽם׃

16.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י כְּדַבֵּ֤ר אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּפְנ֖וּ אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְהִנֵּה֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה נִרְאָ֖ה בֶּעָנָֽן׃ {פ}
16.englishText: And as Aaron spoke to the whole Israelite community, they turned toward the wilderness, and there, in a cloud, appeared the Presence of יהוה.
16.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y kְּdַbֵּ֤r aַhֲrֹן֙ aֶl־kׇּl־aֲdַ֣t bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l vַyִּpְn֖vּ aֶl־hַmִּdְbָּ֑r vְhִnֵּh֙ kְּb֣vֹd yְhֹvָ֔h nִrְaָ֖h bֶּaָnָֽן׃ {p}

16.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
16.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses:
16.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

16.hebrewText: שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי אֶת־תְּלוּנֹּת֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ דַּבֵּ֨ר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר בֵּ֤ין הָֽעַרְבַּ֙יִם֙ תֹּאכְל֣וּ בָשָׂ֔ר וּבַבֹּ֖קֶר תִּשְׂבְּעוּ־לָ֑חֶם וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
16.englishText: “I have heard the grumbling of the Israelites. Speak to them and say: By evening you shall eat flesh, and in the morning you shall have your fill of bread; and you shall know that I יהוה am your God.”
16.transliteration: shָׁmַ֗aְtִּy aֶt־tְּlvּnֹּt֮ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵl֒ dַּbֵּ֨r aֲlֵhֶ֜ם lֵamֹ֗r bֵּ֤yן hָֽaַrְbַּ֙yִם֙ tֹּakְl֣vּ bָshָׂ֔r vּbַbֹּ֖kֶr tִּshְׂbְּavּ־lָ֑chֶם vִֽydַaְtֶּ֕ם kִּ֛y aֲnִ֥y yְhֹvָ֖h aֱlֹhֵykֶֽם׃

16.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֣י בָעֶ֔רֶב וַתַּ֣עַל הַשְּׂלָ֔ו וַתְּכַ֖ס אֶת־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וּבַבֹּ֗קֶר הָֽיְתָה֙ שִׁכְבַ֣ת הַטַּ֔ל סָבִ֖יב לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
16.englishText: In the evening quail appeared and covered the camp; in the morning there was a fall of dew about the camp.
16.transliteration: vַyְhִ֣y bָaֶ֔rֶb vַtַּ֣aַl hַshְּׂlָ֔v vַtְּkַ֖s aֶt־hַֽmַּchֲnֶ֑h vּbַbֹּ֗kֶr hָֽyְtָh֙ shִׁkְbַ֣t hַtַּ֔l sָbִ֖yb lַֽmַּchֲnֶֽh׃

16.hebrewText: וַתַּ֖עַל שִׁכְבַ֣ת הַטָּ֑ל וְהִנֵּ֞ה עַל־פְּנֵ֤י הַמִּדְבָּר֙ דַּ֣ק מְחֻסְפָּ֔ס דַּ֥ק כַּכְּפֹ֖ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
16.englishText: When the fall of dew lifted, there, over the surface of the wilderness, lay a fine and flaky substance, as fine as frost on the ground.
16.transliteration: vַtַּ֖aַl shִׁkְbַ֣t hַtָּ֑l vְhִnֵּ֞h aַl־pְּnֵ֤y hַmִּdְbָּr֙ dַּ֣k mְchֻsְpָּ֔s dַּ֥k kַּkְּpֹ֖r aַl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

16.hebrewText: וַיִּרְא֣וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־אָחִיו֙ מָ֣ן ה֔וּא כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ מַה־ה֑וּא וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם ה֣וּא הַלֶּ֔חֶם אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
16.englishText: When the Israelites saw it, they said to one another, “What is it?”*What is it? Heb. man hu; others “It is manna.” —for they did not know what it was. And Moses said to them, “That is the bread which יהוה has given you to eat.
16.transliteration: vַyִּrְa֣vּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l vַyֹּ֨amְr֜vּ aִ֤yshׁ aֶl־aָchִyv֙ mָ֣ן h֔vּa kִּ֛y lֹ֥a yָdְa֖vּ mַh־h֑vּa vַyֹּ֤amֶr mֹshֶׁh֙ aֲlֵhֶ֔ם h֣vּa hַlֶּ֔chֶם aֲshֶׁ֨r nָtַ֧ן yְhֹvָ֛h lָkֶ֖ם lְaׇkְlָֽh׃

16.hebrewText: זֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה לִקְט֣וּ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ אִ֖ישׁ לְפִ֣י אׇכְל֑וֹ עֹ֣מֶר לַגֻּלְגֹּ֗לֶת מִסְפַּר֙ נַפְשֹׁ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אִ֛ישׁ לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאׇהֳל֖וֹ תִּקָּֽחוּ׃
16.englishText: This is what יהוה has commanded: Each household shall gather as much as it requires to eat—an omer to a person for as many of you as there are; each household shall fetch according to those in its tent.”
16.transliteration: zֶ֤h hַdָּbָr֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tsִvָּ֣h yְhֹvָ֔h lִkְt֣vּ mִmֶּ֔nּvּ aִ֖yshׁ lְpִ֣y aׇkְl֑vֹ aֹ֣mֶr lַgֻּlְgֹּ֗lֶt mִsְpַּr֙ nַpְshֹׁ֣tֵykֶ֔ם aִ֛yshׁ lַaֲshֶׁ֥r bְּaׇhֳl֖vֹ tִּkָּֽchvּ׃

16.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֖ן בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיִּלְקְט֔וּ הַמַּרְבֶּ֖ה וְהַמַּמְעִֽיט׃
16.englishText: The Israelites did so, some gathering much, some little.
16.transliteration: vַyַּaֲshׂvּ־kֵ֖ן bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vַֽyִּlְkְt֔vּ hַmַּrְbֶּ֖h vְhַmַּmְaִֽyt׃

16.hebrewText: וַיָּמֹ֣דּוּ בָעֹ֔מֶר וְלֹ֤א הֶעְדִּיף֙ הַמַּרְבֶּ֔ה וְהַמַּמְעִ֖יט לֹ֣א הֶחְסִ֑יר אִ֥ישׁ לְפִֽי־אׇכְל֖וֹ לָקָֽטוּ׃
16.englishText: But when they measured it by the omer, anyone who had gathered much had no excess, and anyone who had gathered little had no deficiency: each household had gathered as much as it needed to eat.
16.transliteration: vַyָּmֹ֣dּvּ bָaֹ֔mֶr vְlֹ֤a hֶaְdִּyף֙ hַmַּrְbֶּ֔h vְhַmַּmְaִ֖yt lֹ֣a hֶchְsִ֑yr aִ֥yshׁ lְpִֽy־aׇkְl֖vֹ lָkָֽtvּ׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֕ישׁ אַל־יוֹתֵ֥ר מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
16.englishText: And Moses said to them, “Let no one leave any of it over until morning.”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr mֹshֶׁ֖h aֲlֵhֶ֑ם aִ֕yshׁ aַl־yvֹtֵ֥r mִmֶּ֖nּvּ aַd־bֹּֽkֶr׃

16.hebrewText: וְלֹא־שָׁמְע֣וּ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיּוֹתִ֨רוּ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ עַד־בֹּ֔קֶר וַיָּ֥רֻם תּוֹלָעִ֖ים וַיִּבְאַ֑שׁ וַיִּקְצֹ֥ף עֲלֵהֶ֖ם מֹשֶֽׁה׃
16.englishText: But they paid no attention to Moses; some of them left of it until morning, and it became infested with maggots and stank. And Moses was angry with them.
16.transliteration: vְlֹa־shָׁmְa֣vּ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h vַyּvֹtִ֨rvּ aֲnָshִׁ֤yם mִmֶּ֙nּvּ֙ aַd־bֹּ֔kֶr vַyָּ֥rֻם tּvֹlָaִ֖yם vַyִּbְaַ֑shׁ vַyִּkְtsֹ֥ף aֲlֵhֶ֖ם mֹshֶֽׁh׃

16.hebrewText: וַיִּלְקְט֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֔קֶר אִ֖ישׁ כְּפִ֣י אׇכְל֑וֹ וְחַ֥ם הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ וְנָמָֽס׃
16.englishText: So they gathered it every morning, as much as each one needed to eat; for when the sun grew hot, it would melt.
16.transliteration: vַyִּlְkְt֤vּ aֹtvֹ֙ bַּbֹּ֣kֶr bַּbֹּ֔kֶr aִ֖yshׁ kְּpִ֣y aׇkְl֑vֹ vְchַ֥ם hַshֶּׁ֖mֶshׁ vְnָmָֽs׃

16.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֗י לָֽקְט֥וּ לֶ֙חֶם֙ מִשְׁנֶ֔ה שְׁנֵ֥י הָעֹ֖מֶר לָאֶחָ֑ד וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ כׇּל־נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הָֽעֵדָ֔ה וַיַּגִּ֖ידוּ לְמֹשֶֽׁה׃
16.englishText: On the sixth day they gathered double the amount of food, two omers for each; and when all the chieftains of the community came and told Moses,
16.transliteration: vַyְhִ֣y ׀ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshִּׁshִּׁ֗y lָֽkְt֥vּ lֶ֙chֶם֙ mִshְׁnֶ֔h shְׁnֵ֥y hָaֹ֖mֶr lָaֶchָ֑d vַyָּbֹ֙avּ֙ kׇּl־nְshִׂyaֵ֣y hָֽaֵdָ֔h vַyַּgִּ֖ydvּ lְmֹshֶֽׁh׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם ה֚וּא אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שַׁבָּת֧וֹן שַׁבַּת־קֹ֛דֶשׁ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה מָחָ֑ר אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאפ֞וּ אֵפ֗וּ וְאֵ֤ת אֲשֶֽׁר־תְּבַשְּׁלוּ֙ בַּשֵּׁ֔לוּ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֹדֵ֔ף הַנִּ֧יחוּ לָכֶ֛ם לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת עַד־הַבֹּֽקֶר׃
16.englishText: he said to them, “This is what יהוה meant: Tomorrow is a day of rest, a holy sabbath of יהוה. Bake what you would bake and boil what you would boil; and all that is left put aside to be kept until morning.”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֲlֵhֶ֗ם h֚vּa aֲshֶׁ֣r dִּbֶּ֣r yְhֹvָ֔h shַׁbָּt֧vֹן shַׁbַּt־kֹ֛dֶshׁ lַֽyhֹvָ֖h mָchָ֑r aֵ֣t aֲshֶׁr־tֹּap֞vּ aֵp֗vּ vְaֵ֤t aֲshֶֽׁr־tְּbַshְּׁlvּ֙ bַּshֵּׁ֔lvּ vְaֵt֙ kׇּl־hָ֣aֹdֵ֔ף hַnִּ֧ychvּ lָkֶ֛ם lְmִshְׁmֶ֖rֶt aַd־hַbֹּֽkֶr׃

16.hebrewText: וַיַּנִּ֤יחוּ אֹתוֹ֙ עַד־הַבֹּ֔קֶר כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְלֹ֣א הִבְאִ֔ישׁ וְרִמָּ֖ה לֹא־הָ֥יְתָה בּֽוֹ׃
16.englishText: So they put it aside until morning, as Moses had ordered; and it did not turn foul, and there were no maggots in it.
16.transliteration: vַyַּnִּ֤ychvּ aֹtvֹ֙ aַd־hַbֹּ֔kֶr kַּaֲshֶׁ֖r tsִvָּ֣h mֹshֶׁ֑h vְlֹ֣a hִbְaִ֔yshׁ vְrִmָּ֖h lֹa־hָ֥yְtָh bּֽvֹ׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אִכְלֻ֣הוּ הַיּ֔וֹם כִּֽי־שַׁבָּ֥ת הַיּ֖וֹם לַיהֹוָ֑ה הַיּ֕וֹם לֹ֥א תִמְצָאֻ֖הוּ בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
16.englishText: Then Moses said, “Eat it today, for today is a sabbath of יהוה; you will not find it today on the plain.
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr mֹshֶׁh֙ aִkְlֻ֣hvּ hַyּ֔vֹם kִּֽy־shַׁbָּ֥t hַyּ֖vֹם lַyhֹvָ֑h hַyּ֕vֹם lֹ֥a tִmְtsָaֻ֖hvּ bַּshָּׂdֶֽh׃

16.hebrewText: שֵׁ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים תִּלְקְטֻ֑הוּ וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֛י שַׁבָּ֖ת לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־בּֽוֹ׃
16.englishText: Six days you shall gather it; on the seventh day, the sabbath, there will be none.”
16.transliteration: shֵׁ֥shֶׁt yָmִ֖yם tִּlְkְtֻ֑hvּ vּbַyּ֧vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֛y shַׁbָּ֖t lֹ֥a yִֽhְyֶh־bּֽvֹ׃

16.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י יָצְא֥וּ מִן־הָעָ֖ם לִלְקֹ֑ט וְלֹ֖א מָצָֽאוּ׃ {ס}
16.englishText: Yet some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, but they found nothing.
16.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔y yָtsְa֥vּ mִן־hָaָ֖ם lִlְkֹ֑t vְlֹ֖a mָtsָֽavּ׃ {s}

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה עַד־אָ֙נָה֙ מֵֽאַנְתֶּ֔ם לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מִצְוֺתַ֖י וְתוֹרֹתָֽי׃
16.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses, “How long will you all refuse to obey My commandments and My teachings?
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֑h aַd־aָ֙nָh֙ mֵֽaַnְtֶּ֔ם lִshְׁmֹ֥r mִtsְvֺtַ֖y vְtvֹrֹtָֽy׃

16.hebrewText: רְא֗וּ כִּֽי־יְהֹוָה֮ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֣ם הַשַּׁבָּת֒ עַל־כֵּ֠ן ה֣וּא נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֛ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֖י לֶ֣חֶם יוֹמָ֑יִם שְׁב֣וּ ׀ אִ֣ישׁ תַּחְתָּ֗יו אַל־יֵ֥צֵא אִ֛ישׁ מִמְּקֹמ֖וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃
16.englishText: Mark that it is יהוה who, having given you the sabbath, therefore gives you two days’ food on the sixth day. Let everyone remain in place: let no one leave the vicinity on the seventh day.”
16.transliteration: rְa֗vּ kִּֽy־yְhֹvָh֮ nָtַ֣ן lָkֶ֣ם hַshַּׁbָּt֒ aַl־kֵּ֠ן h֣vּa nֹtֵ֥ן lָkֶ֛ם bַּyּ֥vֹם hַshִּׁshִּׁ֖y lֶ֣chֶם yvֹmָ֑yִם shְׁb֣vּ ׀ aִ֣yshׁ tַּchְtָּ֗yv aַl־yֵ֥tsֵa aִ֛yshׁ mִmְּkֹm֖vֹ bַּyּ֥vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִֽy׃

16.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁבְּת֥וּ הָעָ֖ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
16.englishText: So the people remained inactive on the seventh day.
16.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁbְּt֥vּ hָaָ֖ם bַּyּ֥vֹם hַshְּׁbִaִֽy׃

16.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרְא֧וּ בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ מָ֑ן וְה֗וּא כְּזֶ֤רַע גַּד֙ לָבָ֔ן וְטַעְמ֖וֹ כְּצַפִּיחִ֥ת בִּדְבָֽשׁ׃
16.englishText: The house of Israel named it manna;*manna Heb. man. it was like coriander seed, white, and it tasted like wafers*wafers Meaning of Heb. ṣappiḥith uncertain. in honey.
16.transliteration: vַyִּkְrְa֧vּ bֵֽyt־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ mָ֑ן vְh֗vּa kְּzֶ֤rַa gַּd֙ lָbָ֔ן vְtַaְm֖vֹ kְּtsַpִּychִ֥t bִּdְbָֽshׁ׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה זֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה מְלֹ֤א הָעֹ֙מֶר֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֑ם לְמַ֣עַן ׀ יִרְא֣וּ אֶת־הַלֶּ֗חֶם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶאֱכַ֤לְתִּי אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר בְּהוֹצִיאִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
16.englishText: Moses said, “This is what יהוה has commanded: Let one omer of it be kept throughout the ages, in order that they may see the bread that I fed you in the wilderness when I brought you out from the land of Egypt.”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr mֹshֶׁ֗h zֶ֤h hַdָּbָr֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tsִvָּ֣h yְhֹvָ֔h mְlֹ֤a hָaֹ֙mֶr֙ mִmֶּ֔nּvּ lְmִshְׁmֶ֖rֶt lְdֹrֹtֵykֶ֑ם lְmַ֣aַן ׀ yִrְa֣vּ aֶt־hַlֶּ֗chֶם aֲshֶׁ֨r hֶaֱkַ֤lְtִּy aֶtְkֶם֙ bַּmִּdְbָּ֔r bְּhvֹtsִyaִ֥y aֶtְkֶ֖ם mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

16.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַ֚ח צִנְצֶ֣נֶת אַחַ֔ת וְתֶן־שָׁ֥מָּה מְלֹֽא־הָעֹ֖מֶר מָ֑ן וְהַנַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
16.englishText: And Moses said to Aaron, “Take a jar, put one omer of manna in it, and place it before יהוה, to be kept throughout the ages.”
16.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr mֹshֶׁ֜h aֶֽl־aַhֲrֹ֗ן kַ֚ch tsִnְtsֶ֣nֶt aַchַ֔t vְtֶן־shָׁ֥mָּh mְlֹֽa־hָaֹ֖mֶr mָ֑ן vְhַnַּ֤ch aֹtvֹ֙ lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֔h lְmִshְׁmֶ֖rֶt lְdֹrֹtֵykֶֽם׃

16.hebrewText: כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיַּנִּיחֵ֧הוּ אַהֲרֹ֛ן לִפְנֵ֥י הָעֵדֻ֖ת לְמִשְׁמָֽרֶת׃
16.englishText: As יהוה had commanded Moses, Aaron placed it before the Pact,*Pact Others “Testimony.” to be kept.
16.transliteration: kַּaֲshֶׁ֛r tsִvָּ֥h yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֑h vַyַּnִּychֵ֧hvּ aַhֲrֹ֛ן lִpְnֵ֥y hָaֵdֻ֖t lְmִshְׁmָֽrֶt׃

16.hebrewText: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אָֽכְל֤וּ אֶת־הַמָּן֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה עַד־בֹּאָ֖ם אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ נוֹשָׁ֑בֶת אֶת־הַמָּן֙ אָֽכְל֔וּ עַד־בֹּאָ֕ם אֶל־קְצֵ֖ה אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
16.englishText: And the Israelites ate manna forty years, until they came to a settled land; they ate the manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.
16.transliteration: vּbְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l aָֽkְl֤vּ aֶt־hַmָּן֙ aַrְbָּaִ֣yם shָׁnָ֔h aַd־bֹּaָ֖ם aֶl־aֶ֣rֶץ nvֹshָׁ֑bֶt aֶt־hַmָּן֙ aָֽkְl֔vּ aַd־bֹּaָ֕ם aֶl־kְtsֵ֖h aֶ֥rֶץ kְּnָֽaַן׃

16.hebrewText: וְהָעֹ֕מֶר עֲשִׂרִ֥ית הָאֵיפָ֖ה הֽוּא׃ {פ}
16.englishText: The omer is a tenth of an ephah.
16.transliteration: vְhָaֹ֕mֶr aֲshִׂrִ֥yt hָaֵypָ֖h hֽvּa׃ {p}

17.hebrewText: וַ֠יִּסְע֠וּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל מִמִּדְבַּר־סִ֛ין לְמַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בִּרְפִידִ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין מַ֖יִם לִשְׁתֹּ֥ת הָעָֽם׃
17.englishText: From the wilderness of Sin the whole Israelite community continued by stages as יהוה would command. They encamped at Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.
17.transliteration: vַ֠yִּsְa֠vּ kׇּl־aֲdַ֨t bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֧l mִmִּdְbַּr־sִ֛yן lְmַsְaֵyhֶ֖ם aַl־pִּ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h vַֽyַּchֲnvּ֙ bִּrְpִydִ֔yם vְaֵ֥yן mַ֖yִם lִshְׁtֹּ֥t hָaָֽם׃

17.hebrewText: וַיָּ֤רֶב הָעָם֙ עִם־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ תְּנוּ־לָ֥נוּ מַ֖יִם וְנִשְׁתֶּ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה מַה־תְּרִיבוּן֙ עִמָּדִ֔י מַה־תְּנַסּ֖וּן אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
17.englishText: The people quarreled with Moses. “Give us water to drink,” they said; and Moses replied to them, “Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you try יהוה ?”
17.transliteration: vַyָּ֤rֶb hָaָם֙ aִם־mֹshֶׁ֔h vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ tְּnvּ־lָ֥nvּ mַ֖yִם vְnִshְׁtֶּ֑h vַyֹּ֤amֶr lָhֶם֙ mֹshֶׁ֔h mַh־tְּrִybvּן֙ aִmָּdִ֔y mַh־tְּnַsּ֖vּן aֶt־yְhֹvָֽh׃

17.hebrewText: וַיִּצְמָ֨א שָׁ֤ם הָעָם֙ לַמַּ֔יִם וַיָּ֥לֶן הָעָ֖ם עַל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ הֶעֱלִיתָ֣נוּ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם לְהָמִ֥ית אֹתִ֛י וְאֶת־בָּנַ֥י וְאֶת־מִקְנַ֖י בַּצָּמָֽא׃
17.englishText: But the people thirsted there for water; and the people grumbled against Moses and said, “Why did you bring us up from Egypt, to kill us and our children and livestock with thirst?”
17.transliteration: vַyִּtsְmָ֨a shָׁ֤ם hָaָם֙ lַmַּ֔yִם vַyָּ֥lֶן hָaָ֖ם aַl־mֹshֶׁ֑h vַyֹּ֗amֶr lָ֤mָּh zֶּh֙ hֶaֱlִytָ֣nvּ mִmִּtsְrַ֔yִם lְhָmִ֥yt aֹtִ֛y vְaֶt־bָּnַ֥y vְaֶt־mִkְnַ֖y bַּtsָּmָֽa׃

17.hebrewText: וַיִּצְעַ֤ק מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה לֵאמֹ֔ר מָ֥ה אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה ע֥וֹד מְעַ֖ט וּסְקָלֻֽנִי׃
17.englishText: Moses cried out to יהוה, saying, “What shall I do with this people? Before long they will be stoning me!”
17.transliteration: vַyִּtsְaַ֤k mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶl־yְhֹvָ֣h lֵamֹ֔r mָ֥h aֶaֱshֶׂ֖h lָaָ֣ם hַzֶּ֑h a֥vֹd mְaַ֖t vּsְkָlֻֽnִy׃

17.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲבֹר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם וְקַ֥ח אִתְּךָ֖ מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּמַטְּךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכִּ֤יתָ בּוֹ֙ אֶת־הַיְאֹ֔ר קַ֥ח בְּיָדְךָ֖ וְהָלָֽכְתָּ׃
17.englishText: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Pass before the people; take with you some of the elders of Israel, and take along the rod with which you struck the Nile, and set out.
17.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h aֲbֹr֙ lִpְnֵ֣y hָaָ֔ם vְkַ֥ch aִtְּךָ֖ mִzִּkְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vּmַtְּךָ֗ aֲshֶׁ֨r hִkִּ֤ytָ bּvֹ֙ aֶt־hַyְaֹ֔r kַ֥ch bְּyָdְךָ֖ vְhָlָֽkְtָּ׃

17.hebrewText: הִנְנִ֣י עֹמֵד֩ לְפָנֶ֨יךָ שָּׁ֥ם <small>׀</small> עַֽל־הַצּוּר֮ בְּחֹרֵב֒ וְהִכִּ֣יתָ בַצּ֗וּר וְיָצְא֥וּ מִמֶּ֛נּוּ מַ֖יִם וְשָׁתָ֣ה הָעָ֑ם וַיַּ֤עַשׂ כֵּן֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
17.englishText: I will be standing there before you on the rock at Horeb. Strike the rock and water will issue from it, and the people will drink.” And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
17.transliteration: hִnְnִ֣y aֹmֵd֩ lְpָnֶ֨yךָ shָּׁ֥ם <small>׀</small> aַֽl־hַtsּvּr֮ bְּchֹrֵb֒ vְhִkִּ֣ytָ bַtsּ֗vּr vְyָtsְa֥vּ mִmֶּ֛nּvּ mַ֖yִם vְshָׁtָ֣h hָaָ֑ם vַyַּ֤aַshׂ kֵּן֙ mֹshֶׁ֔h lְaֵynֵ֖y zִkְnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

17.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָא֙ שֵׁ֣ם הַמָּק֔וֹם מַסָּ֖ה וּמְרִיבָ֑ה עַל־רִ֣יב ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְעַ֨ל נַסֹּתָ֤ם אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הֲיֵ֧שׁ יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּקִרְבֵּ֖נוּ אִם־אָֽיִן׃ {פ}
17.englishText: The place was named Massah*Massah I.e., “Trial.” and Meribah,*Meribah I.e., “Quarrel.” because the Israelites quarreled and because they tried יהוה, saying, “Is יהוה present among us or not?”
17.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָa֙ shֵׁ֣ם hַmָּk֔vֹם mַsָּ֖h vּmְrִybָ֑h aַl־rִ֣yb ׀ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l vְaַ֨l nַsֹּtָ֤ם aֶt־yְhֹvָh֙ lֵamֹ֔r hֲyֵ֧shׁ yְhֹvָ֛h bְּkִrְbֵּ֖nvּ aִם־aָֽyִן׃ {p}

17.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֖א עֲמָלֵ֑ק וַיִּלָּ֥חֶם עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בִּרְפִידִֽם׃
17.englishText: Amalek came and fought with Israel at Rephidim.
17.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֖a aֲmָlֵ֑k vַyִּlָּ֥chֶם aִם־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l bִּrְpִydִֽם׃

17.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ בְּחַר־לָ֣נוּ אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְצֵ֖א הִלָּחֵ֣ם בַּעֲמָלֵ֑ק מָחָ֗ר אָנֹכִ֤י נִצָּב֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַגִּבְעָ֔ה וּמַטֵּ֥ה הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדִֽי׃
17.englishText: Moses said to Joshua, “Pick some troops*troops Lit. “participants whose involvement defines the depicted situation”; trad. “men.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. for us, and go out and do battle with Amalek. Tomorrow I will station myself on the top of the hill, with the rod of God in my hand.”
17.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr mֹshֶׁ֤h aֶl־yְhvֹshֻׁ֙aַ֙ bְּchַr־lָ֣nvּ aֲnָshִׁ֔yם vְtsֵ֖a hִlָּchֵ֣ם bַּaֲmָlֵ֑k mָchָ֗r aָnֹkִ֤y nִtsָּb֙ aַl־rֹ֣ashׁ hַgִּbְaָ֔h vּmַtֵּ֥h hָaֱlֹhִ֖yם bְּyָdִֽy׃

17.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר אָֽמַר־לוֹ֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם בַּעֲמָלֵ֑ק וּמֹשֶׁה֙ אַהֲרֹ֣ן וְח֔וּר עָל֖וּ רֹ֥אשׁ הַגִּבְעָֽה׃
17.englishText: Joshua did as Moses told him and fought with Amalek, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
17.transliteration: vַyַּ֣aַshׂ yְhvֹshֻׁ֗aַ kַּaֲshֶׁ֤r aָֽmַr־lvֹ֙ mֹshֶׁ֔h lְhִlָּchֵ֖ם bַּaֲmָlֵ֑k vּmֹshֶׁh֙ aַhֲrֹ֣ן vְch֔vּr aָl֖vּ rֹ֥ashׁ hַgִּbְaָֽh׃

17.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֥ים מֹשֶׁ֛ה יָד֖וֹ וְגָבַ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנִ֛יחַ יָד֖וֹ וְגָבַ֥ר עֲמָלֵֽק׃
17.englishText: Then, whenever Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed; but whenever he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
17.transliteration: vְhָyָ֗h kַּaֲshֶׁ֨r yָrִ֥yם mֹshֶׁ֛h yָd֖vֹ vְgָbַ֣r yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vְkַaֲshֶׁ֥r yָnִ֛ychַ yָd֖vֹ vְgָbַ֥r aֲmָlֵֽk׃

17.hebrewText: וִידֵ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ כְּבֵדִ֔ים וַיִּקְחוּ־אֶ֛בֶן וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ תַחְתָּ֖יו וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב עָלֶ֑יהָ וְאַהֲרֹ֨ן וְח֜וּר תָּֽמְכ֣וּ בְיָדָ֗יו מִזֶּ֤ה אֶחָד֙ וּמִזֶּ֣ה אֶחָ֔ד וַיְהִ֥י יָדָ֛יו אֱמוּנָ֖ה עַד־בֹּ֥א הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
17.englishText: But Moses’ hands grew heavy; so they took a stone and put it under him and he sat on it, while Aaron and Hur, one on each side, supported his hands; thus his hands remained steady until the sun set.
17.transliteration: vִydֵ֤y mֹshֶׁh֙ kְּbֵdִ֔yם vַyִּkְchvּ־aֶ֛bֶן vַyָּshִׂ֥ymvּ tַchְtָּ֖yv vַyֵּ֣shֶׁb aָlֶ֑yhָ vְaַhֲrֹ֨ן vְch֜vּr tָּֽmְk֣vּ bְyָdָ֗yv mִzֶּ֤h aֶchָd֙ vּmִzֶּ֣h aֶchָ֔d vַyְhִ֥y yָdָ֛yv aֱmvּnָ֖h aַd־bֹּ֥a hַshָּֽׁmֶshׁ׃

17.hebrewText: וַיַּחֲלֹ֧שׁ יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֥ק וְאֶת־עַמּ֖וֹ לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃ {פ}
17.englishText: And Joshua overwhelmed the people of Amalek*the people of Amalek Lit. “Amalek and his people.” with the sword.
17.transliteration: vַyַּchֲlֹ֧shׁ yְhvֹshֻׁ֛aַ aֶt־aֲmָlֵ֥k vְaֶt־aַmּ֖vֹ lְpִy־chָֽrֶb׃ {p}

17.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כְּתֹ֨ב זֹ֤את זִכָּרוֹן֙ בַּסֵּ֔פֶר וְשִׂ֖ים בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ כִּֽי־מָחֹ֤ה אֶמְחֶה֙ אֶת־זֵ֣כֶר עֲמָלֵ֔ק מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
17.englishText: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Inscribe this in a document as a reminder, and read it aloud to Joshua: I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven!”
17.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h kְּtֹ֨b zֹ֤at zִkָּrvֹן֙ bַּsֵּ֔pֶr vְshִׂ֖yם bְּaׇzְnֵ֣y yְhvֹshֻׁ֑aַ kִּֽy־mָchֹ֤h aֶmְchֶh֙ aֶt־zֵ֣kֶr aֲmָlֵ֔k mִtַּ֖chַt hַshָּׁmָֽyִם׃

17.hebrewText: וַיִּ֥בֶן מֹשֶׁ֖ה מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> נִסִּֽי׃
17.englishText: And Moses built an altar and named it Adonai-nissi.*Adonai-nissi I.e., “יהוה is my banner.”
17.transliteration: vַyִּ֥bֶן mֹshֶׁ֖h mִzְbֵּ֑chַ vַyִּkְrָ֥a shְׁm֖vֹ yְhֹvָ֥h <small>׀</small> nִsִּֽy׃

17.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־יָד֙ עַל־כֵּ֣ס יָ֔הּ*(בכתר ארם צובה היה כתוב כֵּ֣סְיָ֔הּ בתיבה אחת) מִלְחָמָ֥ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה בַּֽעֲמָלֵ֑ק מִדֹּ֖ר דֹּֽר׃ {פ}
17.englishText: He said, “It means, ‘Hand upon the throne*throne Meaning of Heb. kes uncertain. of יהוה !’ יהוה will be at war with Amalek throughout the ages.”
17.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr kִּֽy־yָd֙ aַl־kֵּ֣s yָ֔hּ*(bktr arם tsvbh hyh ktvb kֵּ֣sְyָ֔hּ btybh acht) mִlְchָmָ֥h lַyhֹvָ֖h bַּֽaֲmָlֵ֑k mִdֹּ֖r dֹּֽr׃ {p}

yitro.name: Yitro
yitro.summary: Jethro's advice to Moses, the preparation for receiving the Torah, and the giving of the Ten Commandments at Mount Sinai.

18.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֞ע יִתְר֨וֹ כֹהֵ֤ן מִדְיָן֙ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ לְמֹשֶׁ֔ה וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַמּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־הוֹצִ֧יא יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
18.englishText: Jethro priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard all that God had done for Moses and for Israel, God’s people, how יהוה had brought Israel out from Egypt.
18.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֞a yִtְr֨vֹ kֹhֵ֤ן mִdְyָן֙ chֹtֵ֣ן mֹshֶׁ֔h aֵt֩ kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֨r aָshָׂ֤h aֱlֹhִyם֙ lְmֹshֶׁ֔h vּlְyִshְׂrָaֵ֖l aַmּ֑vֹ kִּֽy־hvֹtsִ֧ya yְhֹvָ֛h aֶt־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

18.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֗ח יִתְרוֹ֙ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־צִפֹּרָ֖ה אֵ֣שֶׁת מֹשֶׁ֑ה אַחַ֖ר שִׁלּוּחֶֽיהָ׃
18.englishText: So Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after she had been sent home,
18.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֗ch yִtְrvֹ֙ chֹtֵ֣ן mֹshֶׁ֔h aֶt־tsִpֹּrָ֖h aֵ֣shֶׁt mֹshֶׁ֑h aַchַ֖r shִׁlּvּchֶֽyhָ׃

18.hebrewText: וְאֵ֖ת שְׁנֵ֣י בָנֶ֑יהָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאֶחָד֙ גֵּֽרְשֹׁ֔ם כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר גֵּ֣ר הָיִ֔יתִי בְּאֶ֖רֶץ נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃
18.englishText: and her two sons—of whom one was named Gershom, that is to say, “I have been a stranger*stranger Heb. ger. in a foreign land”;
18.transliteration: vְaֵ֖t shְׁnֵ֣y bָnֶ֑yhָ aֲshֶׁ֨r shֵׁ֤ם hָֽaֶchָd֙ gֵּֽrְshֹׁ֔ם kִּ֣y aָmַ֔r gֵּ֣r hָyִ֔ytִy bְּaֶ֖rֶץ nׇkְrִyָּֽh׃

18.hebrewText: וְשֵׁ֥ם הָאֶחָ֖ד אֱלִיעֶ֑זֶר כִּֽי־אֱלֹהֵ֤י אָבִי֙ בְּעֶזְרִ֔י וַיַּצִּלֵ֖נִי מֵחֶ֥רֶב פַּרְעֹֽה׃
18.englishText: and the other was named Eliezer,*Eliezer Lit. “(My) God is help.” meaning, “The God of my father’s [house] was my help, delivering me from the sword of Pharaoh.”
18.transliteration: vְshֵׁ֥ם hָaֶchָ֖d aֱlִyaֶ֑zֶr kִּֽy־aֱlֹhֵ֤y aָbִy֙ bְּaֶzְrִ֔y vַyַּtsִּlֵ֖nִy mֵchֶ֥rֶb pַּrְaֹֽh׃

18.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֞א יִתְר֨וֹ חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֛ה וּבָנָ֥יו וְאִשְׁתּ֖וֹ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֗ר אֲשֶׁר־ה֛וּא חֹנֶ֥ה שָׁ֖ם הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
18.englishText: Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought Moses’ sons and wife to him in the wilderness, where he was encamped at the mountain of God.
18.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֞a yִtְr֨vֹ chֹtֵ֥ן mֹshֶׁ֛h vּbָnָ֥yv vְaִshְׁtּ֖vֹ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֑h aֶl־hַmִּdְbָּ֗r aֲshֶׁr־h֛vּa chֹnֶ֥h shָׁ֖ם hַ֥r hָaֱlֹhִֽyם׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֲנִ֛י חֹתֶנְךָ֥ יִתְר֖וֹ בָּ֣א אֵלֶ֑יךָ וְאִ֨שְׁתְּךָ֔ וּשְׁנֵ֥י בָנֶ֖יהָ עִמָּֽהּ׃
18.englishText: He sent word to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you, with your wife and her two sons.”
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h aֲnִ֛y chֹtֶnְךָ֥ yִtְr֖vֹ bָּ֣a aֵlֶ֑yךָ vְaִ֨shְׁtְּךָ֔ vּshְׁnֵ֥y bָnֶ֖yhָ aִmָּֽhּ׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֵּצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה לִקְרַ֣את חֹֽתְנ֗וֹ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֙חוּ֙ וַיִּשַּׁק־ל֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁאֲל֥וּ אִישׁ־לְרֵעֵ֖הוּ לְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ הָאֹֽהֱלָה׃
18.englishText: Moses went out to meet his father-in-law; he bowed low and kissed him; each asked after the other’s welfare, and they went into the tent.
18.transliteration: vַyֵּtsֵ֨a mֹshֶׁ֜h lִkְrַ֣at chֹֽtְn֗vֹ vַyִּshְׁtַּ֙chvּ֙ vַyִּshַּׁk־l֔vֹ vַyִּshְׁaֲl֥vּ aִyshׁ־lְrֵaֵ֖hvּ lְshָׁl֑vֹם vַyָּbֹ֖avּ hָaֹֽhֱlָh׃

18.hebrewText: וַיְסַפֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ לְחֹ֣תְנ֔וֹ אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לְפַרְעֹ֣ה וּלְמִצְרַ֔יִם עַ֖ל אוֹדֹ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַתְּלָאָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מְצָאָ֣תַם בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וַיַּצִּלֵ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
18.englishText: Moses then recounted to his father-in-law everything that יהוה had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardships that had befallen them on the way, and how יהוה had delivered them.
18.transliteration: vַyְsַpֵּ֤r mֹshֶׁh֙ lְchֹ֣tְn֔vֹ aֵt֩ kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֨r aָshָׂ֤h yְhֹvָh֙ lְpַrְaֹ֣h vּlְmִtsְrַ֔yִם aַ֖l avֹdֹ֣t yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l aֵ֤t kׇּl־hַtְּlָaָh֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r mְtsָaָ֣tַם bַּdֶּ֔rֶךְ vַyַּtsִּlֵ֖ם yְhֹvָֽh׃

18.hebrewText: וַיִּ֣חַדְּ יִתְר֔וֹ עַ֚ל כׇּל־הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִצִּיל֖וֹ מִיַּ֥ד מִצְרָֽיִם׃
18.englishText: And Jethro rejoiced over all the kindness that יהוה had shown Israel when delivering them from the Egyptians.
18.transliteration: vַyִּ֣chַdְּ yִtְr֔vֹ aַ֚l kׇּl־hַtּvֹbָ֔h aֲshֶׁr־aָshָׂ֥h yְhֹvָ֖h lְyִshְׂrָaֵ֑l aֲshֶׁ֥r hִtsִּyl֖vֹ mִyַּ֥d mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ יִתְרוֹ֒ בָּר֣וּךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצִּ֥יל אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִיַּ֥ד מִצְרַ֖יִם וּמִיַּ֣ד פַּרְעֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִצִּיל֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת יַד־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
18.englishText: “Blessed be יהוה,” Jethro said, “who delivered you from the Egyptians and from Pharaoh, and who delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֘amֶr֮ yִtְrvֹ֒ bָּr֣vּךְ yְhֹvָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֨r hִtsִּ֥yl aֶtְkֶ֛ם mִyַּ֥d mִtsְrַ֖yִם vּmִyַּ֣d pַּrְaֹ֑h aֲshֶׁ֤r hִtsִּyl֙ aֶt־hָaָ֔ם mִtַּ֖chַt yַd־mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

18.hebrewText: עַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּֽי־גָד֥וֹל יְהֹוָ֖ה מִכׇּל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֣י בַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר זָד֖וּ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
18.englishText: Now I know that יהוה is greater than all gods, yes, by the result of their very schemes against [the people].”*yes, by the result of their very schemes against [the people] Meaning of Heb. uncertain.
18.transliteration: aַtָּ֣h yָdַ֔aְtִּy kִּֽy־gָd֥vֹl yְhֹvָ֖h mִkׇּl־hָaֱlֹhִ֑yם kִּ֣y bַdָּbָ֔r aֲshֶׁ֥r zָd֖vּ aֲlֵyhֶֽם׃

18.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֞ח יִתְר֨וֹ חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֛ה עֹלָ֥ה וּזְבָחִ֖ים לֵֽאלֹהִ֑ים וַיָּבֹ֨א אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְכֹ֣ל ׀ זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֶאֱכׇל־לֶ֛חֶם עִם־חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
18.englishText: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices for God; and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to partake of the meal before God with Moses’ father-in-law.
18.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֞ch yִtְr֨vֹ chֹtֵ֥ן mֹshֶׁ֛h aֹlָ֥h vּzְbָchִ֖yם lֵֽalֹhִ֑yם vַyָּbֹ֨a aַhֲrֹ֜ן vְkֹ֣l ׀ zִkְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l lֶaֱkׇl־lֶ֛chֶם aִם־chֹtֵ֥ן mֹshֶׁ֖h lִpְnֵ֥y hָaֱlֹhִֽyם׃

18.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִשְׁפֹּ֣ט אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיַּעֲמֹ֤ד הָעָם֙ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִן־הַבֹּ֖קֶר עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
18.englishText: Next day, Moses sat as magistrate among the people, while the people stood about Moses from morning until evening.
18.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ mִֽmׇּchֳrָ֔t vַyֵּ֥shֶׁb mֹshֶׁ֖h lִshְׁpֹּ֣t aֶt־hָaָ֑ם vַyַּaֲmֹ֤d hָaָם֙ aַl־mֹshֶׁ֔h mִן־hַbֹּ֖kֶr aַd־hָaָֽrֶb׃

18.hebrewText: וַיַּרְא֙ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ה֥וּא עֹשֶׂ֖ה לָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מָֽה־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֤ה עֹשֶׂה֙ לָעָ֔ם מַדּ֗וּעַ אַתָּ֤ה יוֹשֵׁב֙ לְבַדֶּ֔ךָ וְכׇל־הָעָ֛ם נִצָּ֥ב עָלֶ֖יךָ מִן־בֹּ֥קֶר עַד־עָֽרֶב׃
18.englishText: But when Moses’ father-in-law saw how much he had to do for the people, he said, “What is this thing that you are doing to the people? Why do you act*act Lit. “sit” as magistrate; cf. v. 13. alone, while all the people stand about you from morning until evening?”
18.transliteration: vַyַּrְa֙ chֹtֵ֣ן mֹshֶׁ֔h aֵ֛t kׇּl־aֲshֶׁr־h֥vּa aֹshֶׂ֖h lָaָ֑ם vַyֹּ֗amֶr mָֽh־hַdָּbָ֤r hַzֶּh֙ aֲshֶׁ֨r aַtָּ֤h aֹshֶׂh֙ lָaָ֔ם mַdּ֗vּaַ aַtָּ֤h yvֹshֵׁb֙ lְbַdֶּ֔ךָ vְkׇl־hָaָ֛ם nִtsָּ֥b aָlֶ֖yךָ mִן־bֹּ֥kֶr aַd־aָֽrֶb׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה לְחֹתְנ֑וֹ כִּֽי־יָבֹ֥א אֵלַ֛י הָעָ֖ם לִדְרֹ֥שׁ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
18.englishText: Moses replied to his father-in-law, “It is because the people come to me to inquire of God.
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr mֹshֶׁ֖h lְchֹtְn֑vֹ kִּֽy־yָbֹ֥a aֵlַ֛y hָaָ֖ם lִdְrֹ֥shׁ aֱlֹhִֽyם׃

18.hebrewText: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֨ה לָהֶ֤ם דָּבָר֙ בָּ֣א אֵלַ֔י וְשָׁ֣פַטְתִּ֔י בֵּ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ וּבֵ֣ין רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְהוֹדַעְתִּ֛י אֶת־חֻקֵּ֥י הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וְאֶת־תּוֹרֹתָֽיו׃
18.englishText: When they have a dispute, it comes before me, and I decide between one party and another, and I make known the laws and teachings of God.”
18.transliteration: kִּֽy־yִhְyֶ֨h lָhֶ֤ם dָּbָr֙ bָּ֣a aֵlַ֔y vְshָׁ֣pַtְtִּ֔y bֵּ֥yן aִ֖yshׁ vּbֵ֣yן rֵaֵ֑hvּ vְhvֹdַaְtִּ֛y aֶt־chֻkֵּ֥y hָaֱlֹhִ֖yם vְaֶt־tּvֹrֹtָֽyv׃

18.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֵלָ֑יו לֹא־טוֹב֙ הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
18.englishText: But Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “The thing you are doing is not right;
18.transliteration: vַyֹּ֛amֶr chֹtֵ֥ן mֹshֶׁ֖h aֵlָ֑yv lֹa־tvֹb֙ hַdָּbָ֔r aֲshֶׁ֥r aַtָּ֖h aֹshֶֽׂh׃

18.hebrewText: נָבֹ֣ל תִּבֹּ֔ל גַּם־אַתָּ֕ה גַּם־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמָּ֑ךְ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֤ד מִמְּךָ֙ הַדָּבָ֔ר לֹא־תוּכַ֥ל עֲשֹׂ֖הוּ לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
18.englishText: you will surely wear yourself out, and these people as well. For the task is too heavy for you; you cannot do it alone.
18.transliteration: nָbֹ֣l tִּbֹּ֔l gַּם־aַtָּ֕h gַּם־hָaָ֥ם hַzֶּ֖h aֲshֶׁ֣r aִmָּ֑ךְ kִּֽy־kָbֵ֤d mִmְּךָ֙ hַdָּbָ֔r lֹa־tvּkַ֥l aֲshֹׂ֖hvּ lְbַdֶּֽךָ׃

18.hebrewText: עַתָּ֞ה שְׁמַ֤ע בְּקֹלִי֙ אִיעָ֣צְךָ֔ וִיהִ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים עִמָּ֑ךְ הֱיֵ֧ה אַתָּ֣ה לָעָ֗ם מ֚וּל הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ אַתָּ֛ה אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
18.englishText: Now listen to me. I will give you counsel, and God be with you! You represent the people before God: you bring the disputes before God,
18.transliteration: aַtָּ֞h shְׁmַ֤a bְּkֹlִy֙ aִyaָ֣tsְךָ֔ vִyhִ֥y aֱlֹhִ֖yם aִmָּ֑ךְ hֱyֵ֧h aַtָּ֣h lָaָ֗ם m֚vּl hָֽaֱlֹhִ֔yם vְhֵbֵatָ֥ aַtָּ֛h aֶt־hַdְּbָrִ֖yם aֶl־hָaֱlֹhִֽyם׃

18.hebrewText: וְהִזְהַרְתָּ֣ה אֶתְהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַחֻקִּ֖ים וְאֶת־הַתּוֹרֹ֑ת וְהוֹדַעְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֗ם אֶת־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ יֵ֣לְכוּ בָ֔הּ וְאֶת־הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲשֽׂוּן׃
18.englishText: and enjoin upon them the laws and the teachings, and make known to them the way they are to go and the practices they are to follow.
18.transliteration: vְhִzְhַrְtָּ֣h aֶtְhֶ֔ם aֶt־hַchֻkִּ֖yם vְaֶt־hַtּvֹrֹ֑t vְhvֹdַaְtָּ֣ lָhֶ֗ם aֶt־hַdֶּ֙rֶךְ֙ yֵ֣lְkvּ bָ֔hּ vְaֶt־hַֽmַּaֲshֶׂ֖h aֲshֶׁ֥r yַaֲshֽׂvּן׃

18.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֣ה תֶחֱזֶ֣ה מִכׇּל־הָ֠עָ֠ם אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֜יִל יִרְאֵ֧י אֱלֹהִ֛ים אַנְשֵׁ֥י אֱמֶ֖ת שֹׂ֣נְאֵי בָ֑צַע וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ עֲלֵהֶ֗ם שָׂרֵ֤י אֲלָפִים֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֔וֹת שָׂרֵ֥י חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י עֲשָׂרֹֽת׃
18.englishText: You shall also seek out, from among all the people, capable individuals*individuals Lit. “participants whose involvement defines the depicted situation”; trad. “men.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. who fear God—trustworthy ones who spurn ill-gotten gain. Set these over them as chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens, and
18.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֣h tֶchֱzֶ֣h mִkׇּl־hָ֠aָ֠ם aַnְshֵׁy־chַ֜yִl yִrְaֵ֧y aֱlֹhִ֛yם aַnְshֵׁ֥y aֱmֶ֖t shֹׂ֣nְaֵy bָ֑tsַa vְshַׂmְtָּ֣ aֲlֵhֶ֗ם shָׂrֵ֤y aֲlָpִyם֙ shָׂrֵ֣y mֵa֔vֹt shָׂrֵ֥y chֲmִshִּׁ֖yם vְshָׂrֵ֥y aֲshָׂrֹֽt׃

18.hebrewText: וְשָׁפְט֣וּ אֶת־הָעָם֮ בְּכׇל־עֵת֒ וְהָיָ֞ה כׇּל־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַגָּדֹל֙ יָבִ֣יאוּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְכׇל־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַקָּטֹ֖ן יִשְׁפְּטוּ־הֵ֑ם וְהָקֵל֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְנָשְׂא֖וּ אִתָּֽךְ׃
18.englishText: let them judge the people at all times. Have them bring every major dispute to you, but let them decide every minor dispute themselves. Make it easier for yourself by letting them share the burden with you.
18.transliteration: vְshָׁpְt֣vּ aֶt־hָaָם֮ bְּkׇl־aֵt֒ vְhָyָ֞h kׇּl־hַdָּbָ֤r hַgָּdֹl֙ yָbִ֣yavּ aֵlֶ֔yךָ vְkׇl־hַdָּbָ֥r hַkָּtֹ֖ן yִshְׁpְּtvּ־hֵ֑ם vְhָkֵl֙ mֵֽaָlֶ֔yךָ vְnָshְׂa֖vּ aִtָּֽךְ׃

18.hebrewText: אִ֣ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְצִוְּךָ֣ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְיָֽכׇלְתָּ֖ עֲמֹ֑ד וְגַם֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה עַל־מְקֹמ֖וֹ יָבֹ֥א בְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
18.englishText: If you do this—and God so commands you—you will be able to bear up; and all these people too will go home unwearied.”
18.transliteration: aִ֣ם aֶt־hַdָּbָ֤r hַzֶּh֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֔h vְtsִvְּךָ֣ aֱlֹhִ֔yם vְyָֽkׇlְtָּ֖ aֲmֹ֑d vְgַם֙ kׇּl־hָaָ֣ם hַzֶּ֔h aַl־mְkֹm֖vֹ yָbֹ֥a bְshָׁlֽvֹם׃

18.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע מֹשֶׁ֖ה לְק֣וֹל חֹתְנ֑וֹ וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָמָֽר׃
18.englishText: Moses heeded his father-in-law and did just as he had said.
18.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֥a mֹshֶׁ֖h lְk֣vֹl chֹtְn֑vֹ vַyַּ֕aַshׂ kֹּ֖l aֲshֶׁ֥r aָmָֽr׃

18.hebrewText: וַיִּבְחַ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֤ה אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֙יִל֙ מִכׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם רָאשִׁ֖ים עַל־הָעָ֑ם שָׂרֵ֤י אֲלָפִים֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֔וֹת שָׂרֵ֥י חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י עֲשָׂרֹֽת׃
18.englishText: Moses chose capable individuals*individuals See note at v. 21. out of all Israel, and appointed them heads over the people—chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens;
18.transliteration: vַyִּbְchַ֨r mֹshֶׁ֤h aַnְshֵׁy־chַ֙yִl֙ mִkׇּl־yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l vַyִּtֵּ֥ן aֹtָ֛ם rָashִׁ֖yם aַl־hָaָ֑ם shָׂrֵ֤y aֲlָpִyם֙ shָׂrֵ֣y mֵa֔vֹt shָׂrֵ֥y chֲmִshִּׁ֖yם vְshָׂrֵ֥y aֲshָׂrֹֽt׃

18.hebrewText: וְשָׁפְט֥וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם בְּכׇל־עֵ֑ת אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַקָּשֶׁה֙ יְבִיא֣וּן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְכׇל־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַקָּטֹ֖ן יִשְׁפּוּט֥וּ הֵֽם׃
18.englishText: and they judged the people at all times: the difficult matters they would bring to Moses, and all the minor matters they would decide themselves.
18.transliteration: vְshָׁpְt֥vּ aֶt־hָaָ֖ם bְּkׇl־aֵ֑t aֶt־hַdָּbָ֤r hַkָּshֶׁh֙ yְbִya֣vּן aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h vְkׇl־hַdָּbָ֥r hַkָּtֹ֖ן yִshְׁpּvּt֥vּ hֵֽם׃

18.hebrewText: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־חֹתְנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ ל֖וֹ אֶל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃ {פ}
18.englishText: Then Moses bade his father-in-law farewell, and he went his way to his own land.
18.transliteration: vַyְshַׁlַּ֥ch mֹshֶׁ֖h aֶt־chֹtְn֑vֹ vַyֵּ֥lֶךְ l֖vֹ aֶl־aַrְtsֽvֹ׃ {p}

19.hebrewText: בַּחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י לְצֵ֥את בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה בָּ֖אוּ מִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
19.englishText: On the third new moon after the Israelites had gone forth from the land of Egypt, on that very day, they entered the wilderness of Sinai.
19.transliteration: bַּchֹ֙dֶshׁ֙ hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֔y lְtsֵ֥at bְּnֵy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mֵaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrָ֑yִם bַּyּ֣vֹם hַzֶּ֔h bָּ֖avּ mִdְbַּ֥r sִynָֽy׃

19.hebrewText: וַיִּסְע֣וּ מֵרְפִידִ֗ים וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ מִדְבַּ֣ר סִינַ֔י וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַיִּֽחַן־שָׁ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נֶ֥גֶד הָהָֽר׃
19.englishText: Having journeyed from Rephidim, they entered the wilderness of Sinai and encamped in the wilderness. Israel encamped there in front of the mountain,
19.transliteration: vַyִּsְa֣vּ mֵrְpִydִ֗yם vַyָּbֹ֙avּ֙ mִdְbַּ֣r sִynַ֔y vַֽyַּchֲn֖vּ bַּmִּdְbָּ֑r vַyִּֽchַן־shָׁ֥ם yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l nֶ֥gֶd hָhָֽr׃

19.hebrewText: וּמֹשֶׁ֥ה עָלָ֖ה אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֵלָ֤יו יְהֹוָה֙ מִן־הָהָ֣ר לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֤ה תֹאמַר֙ לְבֵ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְתַגֵּ֖יד לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
19.englishText: and Moses went up to God. יהוה called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus shall you say to the house of Jacob and declare to the children of Israel:
19.transliteration: vּmֹshֶׁ֥h aָlָ֖h aֶl־hָaֱlֹhִ֑yם vַyִּkְrָ֨a aֵlָ֤yv yְhֹvָh֙ mִן־hָhָ֣r lֵamֹ֔r kֹּ֤h tֹamַr֙ lְbֵ֣yt yַaֲkֹ֔b vְtַgֵּ֖yd lִbְnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

19.hebrewText: אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי לְמִצְרָ֑יִם וָאֶשָּׂ֤א אֶתְכֶם֙ עַל־כַּנְפֵ֣י נְשָׁרִ֔ים וָאָבִ֥א אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
19.englishText: ‘You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, how I bore you on eagles’ wings and brought you to Me.
19.transliteration: aַtֶּ֣ם rְaִytֶ֔ם aֲshֶׁ֥r aָshִׂ֖ytִy lְmִtsְrָ֑yִם vָaֶshָּׂ֤a aֶtְkֶם֙ aַl־kַּnְpֵ֣y nְshָׁrִ֔yם vָaָbִ֥a aֶtְkֶ֖ם aֵlָֽy׃

19.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֗ה אִם־שָׁמ֤וֹעַ תִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ בְּקֹלִ֔י וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֑י וִהְיִ֨יתֶם לִ֤י סְגֻלָּה֙ מִכׇּל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים כִּי־לִ֖י כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
19.englishText: Now then, if you will obey Me faithfully and keep My covenant, you shall be My treasured possession among all the peoples. Indeed, all the earth is Mine,
19.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֗h aִם־shָׁm֤vֹaַ tִּshְׁmְavּ֙ bְּkֹlִ֔y vּshְׁmַrְtֶּ֖ם aֶt־bְּrִytִ֑y vִhְyִ֨ytֶם lִ֤y sְgֻlָּh֙ mִkׇּl־hָ֣aַmִּ֔yם kִּy־lִ֖y kׇּl־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

19.hebrewText: וְאַתֶּ֧ם תִּהְיוּ־לִ֛י מַמְלֶ֥כֶת כֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְג֣וֹי קָד֑וֹשׁ אֵ֚לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
19.englishText: but you shall be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words that you shall speak to the children of Israel.”
19.transliteration: vְaַtֶּ֧ם tִּhְyvּ־lִ֛y mַmְlֶ֥kֶt kֹּhֲnִ֖yם vְg֣vֹy kָd֑vֹshׁ aֵ֚lֶּh hַdְּbָrִ֔yם aֲshֶׁ֥r tְּdַbֵּ֖r aֶl־bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

19.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֖א לְזִקְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיָּ֣שֶׂם לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
19.englishText: Moses came and summoned the elders of the people and put before them all that יהוה had commanded him.
19.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֣a mֹshֶׁ֔h vַyִּkְrָ֖a lְzִkְnֵ֣y hָaָ֑ם vַyָּ֣shֶׂם lִpְnֵyhֶ֗ם aֵ֚t kׇּl־hַdְּbָrִ֣yם hָaֵ֔lֶּh aֲshֶׁ֥r tsִvָּ֖hvּ yְhֹvָֽh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲנ֨וּ כׇל־הָעָ֤ם יַחְדָּו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וַיָּ֧שֶׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
19.englishText: All those assembled answered as one, saying, “All that יהוה has spoken we will do!” And Moses brought back the people’s words to יהוה.
19.transliteration: vַyַּaֲn֨vּ kׇl־hָaָ֤ם yַchְdָּv֙ vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ kֹּ֛l aֲshֶׁr־dִּbֶּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h nַaֲshֶׂ֑h vַyָּ֧shֶׁb mֹshֶׁ֛h aֶt־dִּbְrֵ֥y hָaָ֖ם aֶl־yְhֹvָֽh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י בָּ֣א אֵלֶ֘יךָ֮ בְּעַ֣ב הֶֽעָנָן֒ בַּעֲב֞וּר יִשְׁמַ֤ע הָעָם֙ בְּדַבְּרִ֣י עִמָּ֔ךְ וְגַם־בְּךָ֖ יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לְעוֹלָ֑ם וַיַּגֵּ֥ד מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
19.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses, “I will come to you in a thick cloud, in order that the people may hear when I speak with you and so trust you ever after.” Then Moses reported the people’s words to יהוה,
19.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h hִnֵּ֨h aָnֹkִ֜y bָּ֣a aֵlֶ֘yךָ֮ bְּaַ֣b hֶֽaָnָן֒ bַּaֲb֞vּr yִshְׁmַ֤a hָaָם֙ bְּdַbְּrִ֣y aִmָּ֔ךְ vְgַם־bְּךָ֖ yַaֲmִ֣ynvּ lְavֹlָ֑ם vַyַּgֵּ֥d mֹshֶׁ֛h aֶt־dִּbְrֵ֥y hָaָ֖ם aֶl־yְhֹvָֽh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ לֵ֣ךְ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ם הַיּ֖וֹם וּמָחָ֑ר וְכִבְּס֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָֽם׃
19.englishText: and יהוה said to Moses, “Go to the people and warn them to stay pure*pure Cf. v. 15. today and tomorrow. Let them wash their clothes.
19.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֤h aֶl־mֹshֶׁh֙ lֵ֣ךְ aֶl־hָaָ֔ם vְkִdַּshְׁtָּ֥ם hַyּ֖vֹם vּmָchָ֑r vְkִbְּs֖vּ shִׂmְlֹtָֽם׃

19.hebrewText: וְהָי֥וּ נְכֹנִ֖ים לַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י כִּ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֗י יֵרֵ֧ד יְהֹוָ֛ה לְעֵינֵ֥י כׇל־הָעָ֖ם עַל־הַ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
19.englishText: Let them be ready for the third day; for on the third day יהוה will come down, in the sight of all the people, on Mount Sinai.
19.transliteration: vְhָy֥vּ nְkֹnִ֖yם lַyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֑y kִּ֣y ׀ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁlִshִׁ֗y yֵrֵ֧d yְhֹvָ֛h lְaֵynֵ֥y kׇl־hָaָ֖ם aַl־hַ֥r sִynָֽy׃

19.hebrewText: וְהִגְבַּלְתָּ֤ אֶת־הָעָם֙ סָבִ֣יב לֵאמֹ֔ר הִשָּׁמְר֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם עֲל֥וֹת בָּהָ֖ר וּנְגֹ֣עַ בְּקָצֵ֑הוּ כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהָ֖ר מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
19.englishText: You shall set bounds for the people round about, saying, ‘Beware of going up the mountain or touching the border of it. Whoever touches the mountain shall be put to death
19.transliteration: vְhִgְbַּlְtָּ֤ aֶt־hָaָם֙ sָbִ֣yb lֵamֹ֔r hִshָּׁmְr֥vּ lָkֶ֛ם aֲl֥vֹt bָּhָ֖r vּnְgֹ֣aַ bְּkָtsֵ֑hvּ kׇּl־hַnֹּgֵ֥aַ bָּhָ֖r m֥vֹt yvּmָֽt׃

19.hebrewText: לֹא־תִגַּ֨ע בּ֜וֹ יָ֗ד כִּֽי־סָק֤וֹל יִסָּקֵל֙ אוֹ־יָרֹ֣ה יִיָּרֶ֔ה אִם־בְּהֵמָ֥ה אִם־אִ֖ישׁ לֹ֣א יִחְיֶ֑ה בִּמְשֹׁךְ֙ הַיֹּבֵ֔ל הֵ֖מָּה יַעֲל֥וּ בָהָֽר׃
19.englishText: without being touched—by being either stoned or shot; beast or person, a trespasser shall not live.’ When the ram’s horn sounds a long blast,*sounds a long blast Meaning of Heb. uncertain. they may go up on the mountain.”
19.transliteration: lֹa־tִgַּ֨a bּ֜vֹ yָ֗d kִּֽy־sָk֤vֹl yִsָּkֵl֙ avֹ־yָrֹ֣h yִyָּrֶ֔h aִם־bְּhֵmָ֥h aִם־aִ֖yshׁ lֹ֣a yִchְyֶ֑h bִּmְshֹׁךְ֙ hַyֹּbֵ֔l hֵ֖mָּh yַaֲl֥vּ bָhָֽr׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֧רֶד מֹשֶׁ֛ה מִן־הָהָ֖ר אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וַיְקַדֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וַֽיְכַבְּס֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָֽם׃
19.englishText: Moses came down from the mountain to the people and warned the people to stay pure, and they washed their clothes.
19.transliteration: vַyֵּ֧rֶd mֹshֶׁ֛h mִן־hָhָ֖r aֶl־hָaָ֑ם vַyְkַdֵּshׁ֙ aֶt־hָaָ֔ם vַֽyְkַbְּs֖vּ shִׂmְlֹtָֽם׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם הֱי֥וּ נְכֹנִ֖ים לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים אַֽל־תִּגְּשׁ֖וּ אֶל־אִשָּֽׁה׃
19.englishText: And he said to the people, “Be ready for the third day: [the men among]*[the men among] See the Dictionary under “you.” you should not go near a woman.”
19.transliteration: vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֶl־hָaָ֔ם hֱy֥vּ nְkֹnִ֖yם lִshְׁlֹ֣shֶׁt yָmִ֑yם aַֽl־tִּgְּshׁ֖vּ aֶl־aִshָּֽׁh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיְהִי֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֜י בִּֽהְיֹ֣ת הַבֹּ֗קֶר וַיְהִי֩ קֹלֹ֨ת וּבְרָקִ֜ים וְעָנָ֤ן כָּבֵד֙ עַל־הָהָ֔ר וְקֹ֥ל שֹׁפָ֖ר חָזָ֣ק מְאֹ֑ד וַיֶּחֱרַ֥ד כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
19.englishText: On the third day, as morning dawned, there was thunder, and lightning, and a dense cloud upon the mountain, and a very loud blast of the horn; and all the people who were in the camp trembled.
19.transliteration: vַyְhִy֩ bַyּ֨vֹם hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֜y bִּֽhְyֹ֣t hַbֹּ֗kֶr vַyְhִy֩ kֹlֹ֨t vּbְrָkִ֜yם vְaָnָ֤ן kָּbֵd֙ aַl־hָhָ֔r vְkֹ֥l shֹׁpָ֖r chָzָ֣k mְaֹ֑d vַyֶּchֱrַ֥d kׇּl־hָaָ֖ם aֲshֶׁ֥r bַּֽmַּchֲnֶֽh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֧ה אֶת־הָעָ֛ם לִקְרַ֥את הָֽאֱלֹהִ֖ים מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיִּֽתְיַצְּב֖וּ בְּתַחְתִּ֥ית הָהָֽר׃
19.englishText: Moses led the people out of the camp toward God, and they took their places at the foot of the mountain.
19.transliteration: vַyּvֹtsֵ֨a mֹshֶׁ֧h aֶt־hָaָ֛ם lִkְrַ֥at hָֽaֱlֹhִ֖yם mִן־hַֽmַּchֲnֶ֑h vַyִּֽtְyַtsְּb֖vּ bְּtַchְtִּ֥yt hָhָֽr׃

19.hebrewText: וְהַ֤ר סִינַי֙ עָשַׁ֣ן כֻּלּ֔וֹ מִ֠פְּנֵ֠י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרַ֥ד עָלָ֛יו יְהֹוָ֖ה בָּאֵ֑שׁ וַיַּ֤עַל עֲשָׁנוֹ֙ כְּעֶ֣שֶׁן הַכִּבְשָׁ֔ן וַיֶּחֱרַ֥ד כׇּל־הָהָ֖ר מְאֹֽד׃
19.englishText: Now Mount Sinai was all in smoke, for יהוה had come down upon it in fire; the smoke rose like the smoke of a kiln, and the whole mountain*the whole mountain Some Hebrew manuscripts and the Greek read “all the people”; cf. v. 16. trembled violently.
19.transliteration: vְhַ֤r sִynַy֙ aָshַׁ֣ן kֻּlּ֔vֹ mִ֠pְּnֵ֠y aֲshֶׁ֨r yָrַ֥d aָlָ֛yv yְhֹvָ֖h bָּaֵ֑shׁ vַyַּ֤aַl aֲshָׁnvֹ֙ kְּaֶ֣shֶׁן hַkִּbְshָׁ֔ן vַyֶּchֱrַ֥d kׇּl־hָhָ֖r mְaֹֽd׃

19.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ ק֣וֹל הַשֹּׁפָ֔ר הוֹלֵ֖ךְ וְחָזֵ֣ק מְאֹ֑ד מֹשֶׁ֣ה יְדַבֵּ֔ר וְהָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יַעֲנֶ֥נּוּ בְקֽוֹל׃
19.englishText: The blare of the horn grew louder and louder. As Moses spoke, God answered him in thunder.
19.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ k֣vֹl hַshֹּׁpָ֔r hvֹlֵ֖ךְ vְchָzֵ֣k mְaֹ֑d mֹshֶׁ֣h yְdַbֵּ֔r vְhָaֱlֹhִ֖yם yַaֲnֶ֥nּvּ bְkֽvֹl׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֧רֶד יְהֹוָ֛ה עַל־הַ֥ר סִינַ֖י אֶל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר וַיִּקְרָ֨א יְהֹוָ֧ה לְמֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָהָ֖ר וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶֽׁה׃
19.englishText: יהוה came down upon Mount Sinai, on the top of the mountain, and יהוה called Moses to the top of the mountain and Moses went up.
19.transliteration: vַyֵּ֧rֶd yְhֹvָ֛h aַl־hַ֥r sִynַ֖y aֶl־rֹ֣ashׁ hָhָ֑r vַyִּkְrָ֨a yְhֹvָ֧h lְmֹshֶׁ֛h aֶl־rֹ֥ashׁ hָhָ֖r vַyַּ֥aַl mֹshֶֽׁh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה רֵ֖ד הָעֵ֣ד בָּעָ֑ם פֶּן־יֶהֶרְס֤וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ לִרְא֔וֹת וְנָפַ֥ל מִמֶּ֖נּוּ רָֽב׃
19.englishText: יהוה said to Moses, “Go down, warn the people not to break through to יהוה to gaze, lest many of them perish.
19.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h rֵ֖d hָaֵ֣d bָּaָ֑ם pֶּן־yֶhֶrְs֤vּ aֶl־yְhֹvָh֙ lִrְa֔vֹt vְnָpַ֥l mִmֶּ֖nּvּ rָֽb׃

19.hebrewText: וְגַ֧ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים הַנִּגָּשִׁ֥ים אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה יִתְקַדָּ֑שׁוּ פֶּן־יִפְרֹ֥ץ בָּהֶ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
19.englishText: The priests also, who come near יהוה, must stay pure, lest יהוה break out against them.”
19.transliteration: vְgַ֧ם hַkֹּhֲnִ֛yם hַnִּgָּshִׁ֥yם aֶl־yְhֹvָ֖h yִtְkַdָּ֑shׁvּ pֶּן־yִpְrֹ֥ץ bָּhֶ֖ם yְhֹvָֽh׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה לֹא־יוּכַ֣ל הָעָ֔ם לַעֲלֹ֖ת אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינָ֑י כִּֽי־אַתָּ֞ה הַעֵדֹ֤תָה בָּ֙נוּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַגְבֵּ֥ל אֶת־הָהָ֖ר וְקִדַּשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
19.englishText: But Moses said to יהוה, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for You warned us saying, ‘Set bounds about the mountain and sanctify it.’”
19.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶl־yְhֹvָ֔h lֹa־yvּkַ֣l hָaָ֔ם lַaֲlֹ֖t aֶl־hַ֣r sִynָ֑y kִּֽy־aַtָּ֞h hַaֵdֹ֤tָh bָּ֙nvּ֙ lֵamֹ֔r hַgְbֵּ֥l aֶt־hָhָ֖r vְkִdַּshְׁtּֽvֹ׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֤יו יְהֹוָה֙ לֶךְ־רֵ֔ד וְעָלִ֥יתָ אַתָּ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן עִמָּ֑ךְ וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהָעָ֗ם אַל־יֶֽהֶרְס֛וּ לַעֲלֹ֥ת אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה פֶּן־יִפְרׇץ־בָּֽם׃
19.englishText: So יהוה said to him, “Go down, and come back together with Aaron; but let not the priests or the people break through to come up to יהוה, lest [God] break out against them.”
19.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr aֵlָ֤yv yְhֹvָh֙ lֶךְ־rֵ֔d vְaָlִ֥ytָ aַtָּ֖h vְaַhֲrֹ֣ן aִmָּ֑ךְ vְhַkֹּhֲnִ֣yם vְhָaָ֗ם aַl־yֶֽhֶrְs֛vּ lַaֲlֹ֥t aֶl־yְhֹvָ֖h pֶּן־yִpְrׇץ־bָּֽם׃

19.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥רֶד מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲלֵהֶֽם׃ {ס}
19.englishText: And Moses went down to the people and spoke to them.
19.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥rֶd mֹshֶׁ֖h aֶl־hָaָ֑ם vַyֹּ֖amֶr aֲlֵhֶֽם׃ {s}

20.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לֵאמֹֽר׃ {ס}
20.englishText: God spoke all these words,*these words Tradition varies as to the division of the Commandments in vv. 2–14, and as to the numbering of the verses from 2 on. Cf. note at Deut. 5.6. saying:
20.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֣r aֱlֹhִ֔yם aֵ֛t kׇּl־hַdְּbָrִ֥yם hָaֵ֖lֶּh lֵamֹֽr׃ {s}

20.hebrewText: אָֽנֹכִ֖י֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֧ר הוֹצֵאתִ֛יךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֣֥ית עֲבָדִ֑͏ֽים׃
20.englishText: I יהוה am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage:
20.transliteration: aָֽnֹkִ֖y֙ yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhֶ֑֔yךָ aֲshֶׁ֧r hvֹtsֵatִ֛yךָ mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrַ֖yִם mִbֵּ֣֥yt aֲbָdִ֑͏ֽyם׃

20.englishText: You*You The Decalogue is couched both in the second-person masculine singular and in terms of a household—the basic social and economic unit. Such a format addresses the legal provisions to whichever responsible party they apply—most typically the (male) householder, or he and his (primary) wife as household administrators, or every man, or every adult member of the community. Cf. note at Deut. 12.7. See further the Dictionary under “house,” “householder,” and “you.” shall have no other gods besides Me.
20.transliteration: lֹֽ֣a־yִhְyֶ֥͏ֽh־lְךָ֛֩ aֱlֹhִ֥֨yם aֲchֵrִ֖֜yם aַl־pָּnָֽ͏ַ֗y׃

20.hebrewText: לֹֽ֣א־תַעֲשֶֽׂ֨ה־לְךָ֥֣ פֶ֣֙סֶל֙ ׀ וְכׇל־תְּמוּנָ֔֡ה אֲשֶׁ֤֣ר בַּשָּׁמַ֣֙יִם֙ ׀ מִמַּ֔֡עַל וַֽאֲשֶׁ֥ר֩ בָּאָ֖֨רֶץ מִתָּ֑͏ַ֜חַת וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּמַּ֖֣יִם ׀ מִתַּ֥֣חַת לָאָֽ֗רֶץ׃
20.englishText: You shall not make for yourself a sculptured image, or any likeness of what is in the heavens above, or on the earth below, or in the waters under the earth.
20.transliteration: lֹֽ֣a־tַaֲshֶֽׂ֨h־lְךָ֥֣ pֶ֣֙sֶl֙ ׀ vְkׇl־tְּmvּnָ֔֡h aֲshֶׁ֤֣r bַּshָּׁmַ֣֙yִם֙ ׀ mִmַּ֔֡aַl vַֽaֲshֶׁ֥r֩ bָּaָ֖֨rֶץ mִtָּ֑͏ַ֜chַt vַaֲshֶׁ֥r bַּmַּ֖֣yִם ׀ mִtַּ֥֣chַt lָaָֽ֗rֶץ׃

20.hebrewText: לֹֽא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֥֣ה לָהֶ֖ם֮ וְלֹ֣א תׇעׇבְדֵ֑ם֒ כִּ֣י אָֽנֹכִ֞י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵ֣ל קַנָּ֔א פֹּ֠קֵ֠ד עֲוֺ֨ן אָבֹ֧ת עַל־בָּנִ֛ים עַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֥ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִ֖ים לְשֹׂנְאָֽ֑י׃
20.englishText: You shall not bow down to them or serve them. For I your God יהוה am an impassioned God, visiting the guilt of the parents upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generations of those who reject Me.
20.transliteration: lֹֽa־tִshְׁtַּchֲvֶ֥֣h lָhֶ֖ם֮ vְlֹ֣a tׇaׇbְdֵ֑ם֒ kִּ֣y aָֽnֹkִ֞y yְhֹvָ֤h aֱlֹhֶ֙yךָ֙ aֵ֣l kַnָּ֔a pֹּ֠kֵ֠d aֲvֺ֨ן aָbֹ֧t aַl־bָּnִ֛yם aַl־shִׁlֵּshִׁ֥yם vְaַl־rִbֵּaִ֖yם lְshֹׂnְaָֽ֑y׃

20.hebrewText: וְעֹ֥֤שֶׂה חֶ֖֙סֶד֙ לַאֲלָפִ֑֔ים לְאֹהֲבַ֖י וּלְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י מִצְוֺתָֽי׃ {ס}
20.englishText: but showing kindness to the thousandth generation of those who love Me and keep My commandments.
20.transliteration: vְaֹ֥֤shֶׂh chֶ֖֙sֶd֙ lַaֲlָpִ֑֔yם lְaֹhֲbַ֖y vּlְshֹׁmְrֵ֥y mִtsְvֺtָֽy׃ {s}

20.hebrewText: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לַשָּׁ֑וְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יְנַקֶּה֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־יִשָּׂ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ לַשָּֽׁוְא׃ {פ}
20.englishText: You shall not swear falsely by*swear falsely by Others “take in vain.” the name of your God יהוה; for יהוה will not clear one who swears falsely by God’s name.
20.transliteration: lֹ֥a tִshָּׂ֛a aֶt־shֵֽׁם־yְhֹvָ֥h aֱlֹhֶ֖yךָ lַshָּׁ֑vְa kִּ֣y lֹ֤a yְnַkֶּh֙ yְhֹvָ֔h aֵ֛t aֲshֶׁr־yִshָּׂ֥a aֶt־shְׁm֖vֹ lַshָּֽׁvְa׃ {p}

20.hebrewText: זָכ֛וֹר֩ אֶת־י֥֨וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖֜ת לְקַדְּשֽׁ֗וֹ׃
20.englishText: Remember the sabbath day and keep it holy.
20.transliteration: zָk֛vֹr֩ aֶt־y֥֨vֹם hַshַּׁbָּ֖֜t lְkַdְּshֽׁ֗vֹ׃

20.englishText: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
20.transliteration: shֵׁ֤֣shֶׁt yָmִ֣yם֙ tַּֽaֲbֹ֔d֮ vְaָshִׂ֖֣ytָ kׇּֿl־mְlַakְtֶּֽךָ֒׃

20.hebrewText: וְי֨וֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔֜י שַׁבָּ֖֣ת ׀ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑֗יךָ לֹֽ֣א־תַעֲשֶׂ֣֨ה כׇל־מְלָאכָ֜֡ה אַתָּ֣ה ׀ וּבִנְךָ֣͏ֽ־וּ֠בִתֶּ֗ךָ עַבְדְּךָ֤֨ וַאֲמָֽתְךָ֜֙ וּבְהֶמְתֶּ֔֗ךָ וְגֵרְךָ֖֙ אֲשֶׁ֥֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶֽ֔יךָ׃
20.englishText: but the seventh day is a sabbath of your God יהוה: you shall not do any work—you, your son or daughter, your male or female slave, or your cattle, or the stranger who is within your settlements.
20.transliteration: vְy֨vֹם֙ hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔֜y shַׁbָּ֖֣t ׀ lַyhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhֶ֑֗yךָ lֹֽ֣a־tַaֲshֶׂ֣֨h kׇl־mְlָakָ֜֡h aַtָּ֣h ׀ vּbִnְךָ֣͏ֽ־vּ֠bִtֶּ֗ךָ aַbְdְּךָ֤֨ vַaֲmָֽtְךָ֜֙ vּbְhֶmְtֶּ֔֗ךָ vְgֵrְךָ֖֙ aֲshֶׁ֥֣r bִּshְׁaָrֶֽ֔yךָ׃

20.hebrewText: כִּ֣י שֵֽׁשֶׁת־יָמִים֩ עָשָׂ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֶת־הַיָּם֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֔ם וַיָּ֖נַח בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י עַל־כֵּ֗ן בֵּרַ֧ךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־י֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖ת וַֽיְקַדְּשֵֽׁהוּ׃ {ס}
20.englishText: For in six days יהוה made heaven and earth and sea—and all that is in them—and then rested on the seventh day; therefore יהוה blessed the sabbath day and hallowed it.
20.transliteration: kִּ֣y shֵֽׁshֶׁt־yָmִyם֩ aָshָׂ֨h yְhֹvָ֜h aֶt־hַshָּׁmַ֣yִם vְaֶt־hָaָ֗rֶץ aֶt־hַyָּם֙ vְaֶt־kׇּl־aֲshֶׁr־bָּ֔ם vַyָּ֖nַch bַּyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֑y aַl־kֵּ֗ן bֵּrַ֧ךְ yְhֹvָ֛h aֶt־y֥vֹם hַshַּׁbָּ֖t vַֽyְkַdְּshֵֽׁhvּ׃ {s}

20.hebrewText: כַּבֵּ֥ד אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ וְאֶת־אִמֶּ֑ךָ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יַאֲרִכ֣וּן יָמֶ֔יךָ עַ֚ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱל��הֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
20.englishText: Honor your father and your mother, that you may long endure on the land that your God יהוה is assigning to you.
20.transliteration: kַּbֵּ֥d aֶt־aָbִ֖yךָ vְaֶt־aִmֶּ֑ךָ lְmַ֙aַן֙ yַaֲrִk֣vּן yָmֶ֔yךָ aַ֚l hָaֲdָmָ֔h aֲshֶׁr־yְhֹvָ֥h aֱl��hֶ֖yךָ nֹtֵ֥ן lָֽךְ׃ {s}

20.hebrewText: לֹ֥֖א תִּֿרְצָ֖͏ֽח׃ {ס}        לֹ֣֖א תִּֿנְאָ֑͏ֽף׃ {ס}        לֹ֣֖א תִּֿגְנֹֽ֔ב׃ {ס}        לֹֽא־תַעֲנֶ֥ה בְרֵעֲךָ֖ עֵ֥ד שָֽׁקֶר׃ {ס}
20.englishText: You shall not murder. You shall not commit adultery. You shall not steal. You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
20.transliteration: lֹ֥֖a tִּֿrְtsָ֖͏ֽch׃ {s}        lֹ֣֖a tִּֿnְaָ֑͏ֽף׃ {s}        lֹ֣֖a tִּֿgְnֹֽ֔b׃ {s}        lֹֽa־tַaֲnֶ֥h bְrֵaֲךָ֖ aֵ֥d shָֽׁkֶr׃ {s}

20.hebrewText: לֹ֥א תַחְמֹ֖ד בֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֑ךָ {ס}        לֹֽא־תַחְמֹ֞ד אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֶ֗ךָ וְעַבְדּ֤וֹ וַאֲמָתוֹ֙ וְשׁוֹר֣וֹ וַחֲמֹר֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְרֵעֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
20.englishText: You shall not covet your neighbor’s house:*house I.e., the corporate household, both persons and possessions. (Cf. Deut. 5.18.) Heb. bayith, in construct form (beth). See the Dictionary under “house.” you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife,*wife In ancient Israel, a typical man could take a woman (even more than one) into his household as a wife; but a typical woman was not in a symmetrical position—which explains why “husband” is not also mentioned. See also note at v. 3. or male or female slave, or ox or ass, or anything that is your neighbor’s.
20.transliteration: lֹ֥a tַchְmֹ֖d bֵּ֣yt rֵaֶ֑ךָ {s}        lֹֽa־tַchְmֹ֞d aֵ֣shֶׁt rֵaֶ֗ךָ vְaַbְdּ֤vֹ vַaֲmָtvֹ֙ vְshׁvֹr֣vֹ vַchֲmֹr֔vֹ vְkֹ֖l aֲshֶׁ֥r lְrֵaֶֽךָ׃ {p}

20.hebrewText: וְכׇל־הָעָם֩ רֹאִ֨ים אֶת־הַקּוֹלֹ֜ת וְאֶת־הַלַּפִּידִ֗ם וְאֵת֙ ק֣וֹל הַשֹּׁפָ֔ר וְאֶת־הָהָ֖ר עָשֵׁ֑ן וַיַּ֤רְא הָעָם֙ וַיָּנֻ֔עוּ וַיַּֽעַמְד֖וּ מֵֽרָחֹֽק׃
20.englishText: All the people witnessed the thunder and lightning, the blare of the horn and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they fell back and stood at a distance.
20.transliteration: vְkׇl־hָaָם֩ rֹaִ֨yם aֶt־hַkּvֹlֹ֜t vְaֶt־hַlַּpִּydִ֗ם vְaֵt֙ k֣vֹl hַshֹּׁpָ֔r vְaֶt־hָhָ֖r aָshֵׁ֑ן vַyַּ֤rְa hָaָם֙ vַyָּnֻ֔avּ vַyַּֽaַmְd֖vּ mֵֽrָchֹֽk׃

20.hebrewText: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה דַּבֵּר־אַתָּ֥ה עִמָּ֖נוּ וְנִשְׁמָ֑עָה וְאַל־יְדַבֵּ֥ר עִמָּ֛נוּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים פֶּן־נָמֽוּת׃
20.englishText: “You speak to us,” they said to Moses, “and we will obey; but let not God speak to us, lest we die.”
20.transliteration: vַyֹּֽamְrvּ֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h dַּbֵּr־aַtָּ֥h aִmָּ֖nvּ vְnִshְׁmָ֑aָh vְaַl־yְdַbֵּ֥r aִmָּ֛nvּ aֱlֹhִ֖yם pֶּן־nָmֽvּt׃

20.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־הָעָם֮ אַל־תִּירָ֒אוּ֒ כִּ֗י לְבַֽעֲבוּר֙ נַסּ֣וֹת אֶתְכֶ֔ם בָּ֖א הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וּבַעֲב֗וּר תִּהְיֶ֧ה יִרְאָת֛וֹ עַל־פְּנֵיכֶ֖ם לְבִלְתִּ֥י תֶחֱטָֽאוּ׃
20.englishText: Moses answered the people, “Be not afraid; for God has come only in order to test you, and in order that the fear of God may be ever with you, so that you do not go astray.”
20.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr mֹshֶׁ֣h aֶl־hָaָם֮ aַl־tִּyrָ֒avּ֒ kִּ֗y lְbַֽaֲbvּr֙ nַsּ֣vֹt aֶtְkֶ֔ם bָּ֖a hָaֱlֹhִ֑yם vּbַaֲb֗vּr tִּhְyֶ֧h yִrְaָt֛vֹ aַl־pְּnֵykֶ֖ם lְbִlְtִּ֥y tֶchֱtָֽavּ׃

20.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד הָעָ֖ם מֵרָחֹ֑ק וּמֹשֶׁה֙ נִגַּ֣שׁ אֶל־הָֽעֲרָפֶ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
20.englishText: So the people remained at a distance, while Moses approached the thick cloud where God was.
20.transliteration: vַyַּaֲmֹ֥d hָaָ֖ם mֵrָchֹ֑k vּmֹshֶׁh֙ nִgַּ֣shׁ aֶl־hָֽaֲrָpֶ֔l aֲshֶׁr־shָׁ֖ם hָaֱlֹhִֽyם׃ {s}

20.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֹּ֥ה תֹאמַ֖ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֔ם כִּ֚י מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי עִמָּכֶֽם׃
20.englishText: יהוה said to Moses: Thus shall you say to the Israelites: You yourselves saw that I spoke to you from the very heavens:
20.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h kֹּ֥h tֹamַ֖r aֶl־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l aַtֶּ֣ם rְaִytֶ֔ם kִּ֚y mִן־hַshָּׁmַ֔yִם dִּbַּ֖rְtִּy aִmָּkֶֽם׃

20.hebrewText: לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּן אִתִּ֑י אֱלֹ֤הֵי כֶ֙סֶף֙ וֵאלֹהֵ֣י זָהָ֔ב לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶֽם׃
20.englishText: With Me, therefore, you shall not make any gods of silver, nor shall you make for yourselves any gods of gold.
20.transliteration: lֹ֥a tַaֲshׂ֖vּן aִtִּ֑y aֱlֹ֤hֵy kֶ֙sֶף֙ vֵalֹhֵ֣y zָhָ֔b lֹ֥a tַaֲshׂ֖vּ lָkֶֽם׃

20.hebrewText: מִזְבַּ֣ח אֲדָמָה֮ תַּעֲשֶׂה־לִּי֒ וְזָבַחְתָּ֣ עָלָ֗יו אֶת־עֹלֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ וְאֶת־שְׁלָמֶ֔יךָ אֶת־צֹֽאנְךָ֖ וְאֶת־בְּקָרֶ֑ךָ בְּכׇל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַזְכִּ֣יר אֶת־שְׁמִ֔י אָב֥וֹא אֵלֶ֖יךָ וּבֵרַכְתִּֽיךָ׃
20.englishText: Make for Me an altar of earth and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your sacrifices of well-being,*sacrifices of well-being Others “peace-offering.” Meaning of Heb. shelamim uncertain. your sheep and your oxen; in every place where I cause My name to be mentioned I will come to you and bless you.
20.transliteration: mִzְbַּ֣ch aֲdָmָh֮ tַּaֲshֶׂh־lִּy֒ vְzָbַchְtָּ֣ aָlָ֗yv aֶt־aֹlֹtֶ֙yךָ֙ vְaֶt־shְׁlָmֶ֔yךָ aֶt־tsֹֽanְךָ֖ vְaֶt־bְּkָrֶ֑ךָ bְּkׇl־hַmָּkvֹם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aַzְkִּ֣yr aֶt־shְׁmִ֔y aָb֥vֹa aֵlֶ֖yךָ vּbֵrַkְtִּֽyךָ׃

20.hebrewText: וְאִם־מִזְבַּ֤ח אֲבָנִים֙ תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֔י לֹֽא־תִבְנֶ֥ה אֶתְהֶ֖ן גָּזִ֑ית כִּ֧י חַרְבְּךָ֛ הֵנַ֥פְתָּ עָלֶ֖יהָ וַתְּחַֽלְלֶֽהָ׃
20.englishText: And if you make for Me an altar of stones, do not build it of hewn stones; for by wielding your tool upon them you have profaned them.
20.transliteration: vְaִם־mִzְbַּ֤ch aֲbָnִyם֙ tַּֽaֲshֶׂh־lִּ֔y lֹֽa־tִbְnֶ֥h aֶtְhֶ֖ן gָּzִ֑yt kִּ֧y chַrְbְּךָ֛ hֵnַ֥pְtָּ aָlֶ֖yhָ vַtְּchַֽlְlֶֽhָ׃

20.hebrewText: וְלֹֽא־תַעֲלֶ֥ה בְמַעֲלֹ֖ת עַֽל־מִזְבְּחִ֑י אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־תִגָּלֶ֥ה עֶרְוָתְךָ֖ עָלָֽיו׃ {פ}
20.englishText: Do not ascend My altar by steps, that your nakedness may not be exposed upon it.
20.transliteration: vְlֹֽa־tַaֲlֶ֥h bְmַaֲlֹ֖t aַֽl־mִzְbְּchִ֑y aֲshֶׁ֛r lֹֽa־tִgָּlֶ֥h aֶrְvָtְךָ֖ aָlָֽyv׃ {p}

mishpatim.name: Mishpatim
mishpatim.summary: Civil and criminal laws, the three pilgrimage festivals, the promise of the Land of Israel, and the covenant at Mount Sinai.

21.hebrewText: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּשִׂ֖ים לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
21.englishText: These are the rules that you shall set before them:
21.transliteration: vְaֵ֙lֶּh֙ hַmִּshְׁpָּtִ֔yם aֲshֶׁ֥r tָּshִׂ֖yם lִpְnֵyhֶֽם׃

21.hebrewText: כִּ֤י תִקְנֶה֙ עֶ֣בֶד עִבְרִ֔י שֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים יַעֲבֹ֑ד וּבַ֨שְּׁבִעִ֔ת יֵצֵ֥א לַֽחׇפְשִׁ֖י חִנָּֽם׃
21.englishText: When you acquire a Hebrew slave, that person shall serve six years—and shall go free in the seventh year, without payment.
21.transliteration: kִּ֤y tִkְnֶh֙ aֶ֣bֶd aִbְrִ֔y shֵׁ֥shׁ shָׁnִ֖yם yַaֲbֹ֑d vּbַ֨shְּׁbִaִ֔t yֵtsֵ֥a lַֽchׇpְshִׁ֖y chִnָּֽם׃

21.hebrewText: אִם־בְּגַפּ֥וֹ יָבֹ֖א בְּגַפּ֣וֹ יֵצֵ֑א אִם־בַּ֤עַל אִשָּׁה֙ ה֔וּא וְיָצְאָ֥ה אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ עִמּֽוֹ׃
21.englishText: If [a male slave] came single, he shall leave single; if he had a wife, his wife shall leave with him.
21.transliteration: aִם־bְּgַpּ֥vֹ yָbֹ֖a bְּgַpּ֣vֹ yֵtsֵ֑a aִם־bַּ֤aַl aִshָּׁh֙ h֔vּa vְyָtsְaָ֥h aִshְׁtּ֖vֹ aִmּֽvֹ׃

21.hebrewText: אִם־אֲדֹנָיו֙ יִתֶּן־ל֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֔ה וְיָלְדָה־ל֥וֹ בָנִ֖ים א֣וֹ בָנ֑וֹת הָאִשָּׁ֣ה וִילָדֶ֗יהָ תִּהְיֶה֙ לַֽאדֹנֶ֔יהָ וְה֖וּא יֵצֵ֥א בְגַפּֽוֹ׃
21.englishText: If his master gave him a wife, and she has borne him children, the wife and her children shall belong to the master, and he shall leave alone.
21.transliteration: aִם־aֲdֹnָyv֙ yִtֶּן־l֣vֹ aִshָּׁ֔h vְyָlְdָh־l֥vֹ bָnִ֖yם a֣vֹ bָn֑vֹt hָaִshָּׁ֣h vִylָdֶ֗yhָ tִּhְyֶh֙ lַֽadֹnֶ֔yhָ vְh֖vּa yֵtsֵ֥a bְgַpּֽvֹ׃

21.hebrewText: וְאִם־אָמֹ֤ר יֹאמַר֙ הָעֶ֔בֶד אָהַ֙בְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֔י אֶת־אִשְׁתִּ֖י וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑י לֹ֥א אֵצֵ֖א חׇפְשִֽׁי׃
21.englishText: But if the slave declares, “I love my master, and my wife and children: I do not wish to go free,”
21.transliteration: vְaִם־aָmֹ֤r yֹamַr֙ hָaֶ֔bֶd aָhַ֙bְtִּy֙ aֶt־aֲdֹnִ֔y aֶt־aִshְׁtִּ֖y vְaֶt־bָּnָ֑y lֹ֥a aֵtsֵ֖a chׇpְshִֽׁy׃

21.hebrewText: וְהִגִּישׁ֤וֹ אֲדֹנָיו֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְהִגִּישׁוֹ֙ אֶל־הַדֶּ֔לֶת א֖וֹ אֶל־הַמְּזוּזָ֑ה וְרָצַ֨ע אֲדֹנָ֤יו אֶת־אׇזְנוֹ֙ בַּמַּרְצֵ֔עַ וַעֲבָד֖וֹ לְעֹלָֽם׃ {ס}
21.englishText: his master shall take him before God.*before God Others “to the judges.” He shall be brought to the door or the doorpost, and his master shall pierce his ear with an awl; and he shall then remain his master’s slave for life.
21.transliteration: vְhִgִּyshׁ֤vֹ aֲdֹnָyv֙ aֶl־hָ֣aֱlֹhִ֔yם vְhִgִּyshׁvֹ֙ aֶl־hַdֶּ֔lֶt a֖vֹ aֶl־hַmְּzvּzָ֑h vְrָtsַ֨a aֲdֹnָ֤yv aֶt־aׇzְnvֹ֙ bַּmַּrְtsֵ֔aַ vַaֲbָd֖vֹ lְaֹlָֽם׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יִמְכֹּ֥ר אִ֛ישׁ אֶת־בִּתּ֖וֹ לְאָמָ֑ה לֹ֥א תֵצֵ֖א כְּצֵ֥את הָעֲבָדִֽים׃
21.englishText: When a parent*parent More precisely, “[salient] participant [in the situation],” which would include the girl’s mother; cf. 2 Kings 4.1. Trad. “man.” See the Dictionary under ’ish. sells a daughter as a slave, she shall not go free as other slaves do.
21.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yִmְkֹּ֥r aִ֛yshׁ aֶt־bִּtּ֖vֹ lְaָmָ֑h lֹ֥a tֵtsֵ֖a kְּtsֵ֥at hָaֲbָdִֽyם׃

21.hebrewText: אִם־רָעָ֞ה בְּעֵינֵ֧י אֲדֹנֶ֛יהָ אֲשֶׁר־[ל֥וֹ] (לא) יְעָדָ֖הּ וְהֶפְדָּ֑הּ לְעַ֥ם נׇכְרִ֛י לֹא־יִמְשֹׁ֥ל לְמׇכְרָ֖הּ בְּבִגְדוֹ־בָֽהּ׃
21.englishText: If she proves to be displeasing to her master, who designated her for himself, he must let her be redeemed; he shall not have the right to sell her to outsiders, since he broke faith with her.
21.transliteration: aִם־rָaָ֞h bְּaֵynֵ֧y aֲdֹnֶ֛yhָ aֲshֶׁr־[l֥vֹ] (la) yְaָdָ֖hּ vְhֶpְdָּ֑hּ lְaַ֥ם nׇkְrִ֛y lֹa־yִmְshֹׁ֥l lְmׇkְrָ֖hּ bְּbִgְdvֹ־bָֽhּ׃

21.hebrewText: וְאִם־לִבְנ֖וֹ יִֽיעָדֶ֑נָּה כְּמִשְׁפַּ֥ט הַבָּנ֖וֹת יַעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽהּ׃
21.englishText: And if the master designated her for a son, he shall deal with her as is the practice with free maidens.
21.transliteration: vְaִם־lִbְn֖vֹ yִֽyaָdֶ֑nָּh kְּmִshְׁpַּ֥t hַbָּn֖vֹt yַaֲshֶׂh־lָּֽhּ׃

21.hebrewText: אִם־אַחֶ֖רֶת יִֽקַּֽח־ל֑וֹ שְׁאֵרָ֛הּ כְּסוּתָ֥הּ וְעֹנָתָ֖הּ לֹ֥א יִגְרָֽע׃
21.englishText: If he takes another [into the household as his wife], he must not withhold from this one her food, her clothing, or her conjugal rights.*conjugal rights Or “ointments.”
21.transliteration: aִם־aַchֶ֖rֶt yִֽkַּֽch־l֑vֹ shְׁaֵrָ֛hּ kְּsvּtָ֥hּ vְaֹnָtָ֖hּ lֹ֥a yִgְrָֽa׃

21.hebrewText: וְאִ֨ם־שְׁלׇשׁ־אֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה לָ֑הּ וְיָצְאָ֥ה חִנָּ֖ם אֵ֥ין כָּֽסֶף׃ {ס}
21.englishText: If he fails her in these three ways, she shall go free, without payment.
21.transliteration: vְaִ֨ם־shְׁlׇshׁ־aֵ֔lֶּh lֹ֥a yַaֲshֶׂ֖h lָ֑hּ vְyָtsְaָ֥h chִnָּ֖ם aֵ֥yן kָּֽsֶף׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: מַכֵּ֥ה אִ֛ישׁ וָמֵ֖ת מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
21.englishText: One who fatally strikes another party shall be put to death.
21.transliteration: mַkֵּ֥h aִ֛yshׁ vָmֵ֖t m֥vֹt yvּmָֽt׃

21.hebrewText: וַאֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א צָדָ֔ה וְהָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אִנָּ֣ה לְיָד֑וֹ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י לְךָ֙ מָק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנ֖וּס שָֽׁמָּה׃ {ס}
21.englishText: If [a man]*[a man] Like all ancient Near Eastern law collections, the Torah’s laws are illustrative rather than comprehensive. Its asylum schema does not appear to treat the case of a woman who kills someone, which would have been more complicated. did so but not by design—it came about by an act of God—I will assign you a place to which he can flee.
21.transliteration: vַaֲshֶׁr֙ lֹ֣a tsָdָ֔h vְhָaֱlֹhִ֖yם aִnָּ֣h lְyָd֑vֹ vְshַׂmְtִּ֤y lְךָ֙ mָk֔vֹם aֲshֶׁ֥r yָn֖vּs shָֽׁmָּh׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יָזִ֥ד אִ֛ישׁ עַל־רֵעֵ֖הוּ לְהׇרְג֣וֹ בְעׇרְמָ֑ה מֵעִ֣ם מִזְבְּחִ֔י תִּקָּחֶ֖נּוּ לָמֽוּת׃ {ס}
21.englishText: When one party schemes against another and kills through treachery, you shall take that person from My very altar to be put to death.
21.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yָzִ֥d aִ֛yshׁ aַl־rֵaֵ֖hvּ lְhׇrְg֣vֹ bְaׇrְmָ֑h mֵaִ֣ם mִzְbְּchִ֔y tִּkָּchֶ֖nּvּ lָmֽvּt׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וּמַכֵּ֥ה אָבִ֛יו וְאִמּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ {ס}
21.englishText: One who strikes one’s father or mother shall be put to death.
21.transliteration: vּmַkֵּ֥h aָbִ֛yv vְaִmּ֖vֹ m֥vֹt yvּmָֽt׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וְגֹנֵ֨ב אִ֧ישׁ וּמְכָר֛וֹ וְנִמְצָ֥א בְיָד֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ {ס}
21.englishText: One who kidnaps another party—whether having sold or still holding the victim—shall be put to death.
21.transliteration: vְgֹnֵ֨b aִ֧yshׁ vּmְkָr֛vֹ vְnִmְtsָ֥a bְyָd֖vֹ m֥vֹt yvּmָֽt׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וּמְקַלֵּ֥ל אָבִ֛יו וְאִמּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ {ס}
21.englishText: One who insults*insults Or “reviles.” one’s father or mother shall be put to death.
21.transliteration: vּmְkַlֵּ֥l aָbִ֛yv vְaִmּ֖vֹ m֥vֹt yvּmָֽt׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יְרִיבֻ֣ן אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְהִכָּה־אִישׁ֙ אֶת־רֵעֵ֔הוּ בְּאֶ֖בֶן א֣וֹ בְאֶגְרֹ֑ף וְלֹ֥א יָמ֖וּת וְנָפַ֥ל לְמִשְׁכָּֽב׃
21.englishText: When [two] parties quarrel and one strikes the other with stone or fist, and the victim does not die but has to take to bed.
21.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yְrִybֻ֣ן aֲnָshִׁ֔yם vְhִkָּh־aִyshׁ֙ aֶt־rֵaֵ֔hvּ bְּaֶ֖bֶן a֣vֹ bְaֶgְrֹ֑ף vְlֹ֥a yָm֖vּt vְnָpַ֥l lְmִshְׁkָּֽb׃

21.hebrewText: אִם־יָק֞וּם וְהִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בַּח֛וּץ עַל־מִשְׁעַנְתּ֖וֹ וְנִקָּ֣ה הַמַּכֶּ֑ה רַ֥ק שִׁבְתּ֛וֹ יִתֵּ֖ן וְרַפֹּ֥א יְרַפֵּֽא׃ {ס}
21.englishText: if that victim then gets up and walks outdoors upon a staff, the assailant shall go unpunished—except for paying for the idleness and the cure.
21.transliteration: aִם־yָk֞vּם vְhִtְhַlֵּ֥ךְ bַּch֛vּץ aַl־mִshְׁaַnְtּ֖vֹ vְnִkָּ֣h hַmַּkֶּ֑h rַ֥k shִׁbְtּ֛vֹ yִtֵּ֖ן vְrַpֹּ֥a yְrַpֵּֽa׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יַכֶּה֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶת־עַבְדּ֜וֹ א֤וֹ אֶת־אֲמָתוֹ֙ בַּשֵּׁ֔בֶט וּמֵ֖ת תַּ֣חַת יָד֑וֹ נָקֹ֖ם יִנָּקֵֽם׃
21.englishText: When a slave-owning party strikes a slave, male or female, with a rod, who dies there and then,*there and then Lit. “under his hand.” this must be avenged.
21.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yַkֶּh֩ aִ֨yshׁ aֶt־aַbְdּ֜vֹ a֤vֹ aֶt־aֲmָtvֹ֙ bַּshֵּׁ֔bֶt vּmֵ֖t tַּ֣chַt yָd֑vֹ nָkֹ֖ם yִnָּkֵֽם׃

21.hebrewText: אַ֥ךְ אִם־י֛וֹם א֥וֹ יוֹמַ֖יִם יַעֲמֹ֑ד לֹ֣א יֻקַּ֔ם כִּ֥י כַסְפּ֖וֹ הֽוּא׃ {ס}
21.englishText: But if the victim survives a day or two, this is not to be avenged, since the one is the other’s property.
21.transliteration: aַ֥ךְ aִם־y֛vֹם a֥vֹ yvֹmַ֖yִם yַaֲmֹ֑d lֹ֣a yֻkַּ֔ם kִּ֥y kַsְpּ֖vֹ hֽvּa׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יִנָּצ֣וּ אֲנָשִׁ֗ים וְנָ֨גְפ֜וּ אִשָּׁ֤ה הָרָה֙ וְיָצְא֣וּ יְלָדֶ֔יהָ וְלֹ֥א יִהְיֶ֖ה אָס֑וֹן עָנ֣וֹשׁ יֵעָנֵ֗שׁ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָשִׁ֤ית עָלָיו֙ בַּ֣עַל הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וְנָתַ֖ן בִּפְלִלִֽים׃
21.englishText: When [two or more] parties fight, and one of them pushes a pregnant woman and a miscarriage results, but no other damage ensues, the one responsible*the one responsible Heb. “he.” shall be fined according as the woman’s husband may exact, the payment to be based on reckoning.*on reckoning Others “as the judges determine.”
21.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yִnָּts֣vּ aֲnָshִׁ֗yם vְnָ֨gְp֜vּ aִshָּׁ֤h hָrָh֙ vְyָtsְa֣vּ yְlָdֶ֔yhָ vְlֹ֥a yִhְyֶ֖h aָs֑vֹן aָn֣vֹshׁ yֵaָnֵ֗shׁ kַּֽaֲshֶׁ֨r yָshִׁ֤yt aָlָyv֙ bַּ֣aַl hָֽaִshָּׁ֔h vְnָtַ֖ן bִּpְlִlִֽyם׃

21.hebrewText: וְאִם־אָס֖וֹן יִהְיֶ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֥ה נֶ֖פֶשׁ תַּ֥חַת נָֽפֶשׁ׃
21.englishText: But if other damage ensues, the penalty shall be life for life,
21.transliteration: vְaִם־aָs֖vֹן yִhְyֶ֑h vְnָtַtָּ֥h nֶ֖pֶshׁ tַּ֥chַt nָֽpֶshׁ׃

21.hebrewText: עַ֚יִן תַּ֣חַת עַ֔יִן שֵׁ֖ן תַּ֣חַת שֵׁ֑ן יָ֚ד תַּ֣חַת יָ֔ד רֶ֖גֶל תַּ֥חַת רָֽגֶל׃
21.englishText: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
21.transliteration: aַ֚yִן tַּ֣chַt aַ֔yִן shֵׁ֖ן tַּ֣chַt shֵׁ֑ן yָ֚d tַּ֣chַt yָ֔d rֶ֖gֶl tַּ֥chַt rָֽgֶl׃

21.hebrewText: כְּוִיָּה֙ תַּ֣חַת כְּוִיָּ֔ה פֶּ֖צַע תַּ֣חַת פָּ֑צַע חַבּוּרָ֕ה תַּ֖חַת חַבּוּרָֽה׃ {ס}
21.englishText: burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise.
21.transliteration: kְּvִyָּh֙ tַּ֣chַt kְּvִyָּ֔h pֶּ֖tsַa tַּ֣chַt pָּ֑tsַa chַbּvּrָ֕h tַּ֖chַt chַbּvּrָֽh׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יַכֶּ֨ה אִ֜ישׁ אֶת־עֵ֥ין עַבְדּ֛וֹ אֽוֹ־אֶת־עֵ֥ין אֲמָת֖וֹ וְשִֽׁחֲתָ֑הּ לַֽחׇפְשִׁ֥י יְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ תַּ֥חַת עֵינֽוֹ׃
21.englishText: When a slave-owning party strikes the eye of a slave, male or female, and destroys it, that person shall let the slave go free on account of the eye.
21.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yַkֶּ֨h aִ֜yshׁ aֶt־aֵ֥yן aַbְdּ֛vֹ aֽvֹ־aֶt־aֵ֥yן aֲmָt֖vֹ vְshִֽׁchֲtָ֑hּ lַֽchׇpְshִׁ֥y yְshַׁlְּchֶ֖nּvּ tַּ֥chַt aֵynֽvֹ׃

21.hebrewText: וְאִם־שֵׁ֥ן עַבְדּ֛וֹ אֽוֹ־שֵׁ֥ן אֲמָת֖וֹ יַפִּ֑יל לַֽחׇפְשִׁ֥י יְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ תַּ֥חַת שִׁנּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
21.englishText: If the owner knocks out the tooth of a slave, male or female, that person shall let the slave go free on account of the tooth.
21.transliteration: vְaִם־shֵׁ֥ן aַbְdּ֛vֹ aֽvֹ־shֵׁ֥ן aֲmָt֖vֹ yַpִּ֑yl lַֽchׇpְshִׁ֥y yְshַׁlְּchֶ֖nּvּ tַּ֥chַt shִׁnּֽvֹ׃ {p}

21.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יִגַּ֨ח שׁ֥וֹר אֶת־אִ֛ישׁ א֥וֹ אֶת־אִשָּׁ֖ה וָמֵ֑ת סָק֨וֹל יִסָּקֵ֜ל הַשּׁ֗וֹר וְלֹ֤א יֵאָכֵל֙ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֔וֹ וּבַ֥עַל הַשּׁ֖וֹר נָקִֽי׃
21.englishText: When an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall be stoned and its flesh shall not be eaten, but the owner of the ox is not to be punished.
21.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yִgַּ֨ch shׁ֥vֹr aֶt־aִ֛yshׁ a֥vֹ aֶt־aִshָּׁ֖h vָmֵ֑t sָk֨vֹl yִsָּkֵ֜l hַshּׁ֗vֹr vְlֹ֤a yֵaָkֵl֙ aֶt־bְּshָׂr֔vֹ vּbַ֥aַl hַshּׁ֖vֹr nָkִֽy׃

21.hebrewText: וְאִ֡ם שׁוֹר֩ נַגָּ֨ח ה֜וּא מִתְּמֹ֣ל שִׁלְשֹׁ֗ם וְהוּעַ֤ד בִּבְעָלָיו֙ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמְרֶ֔נּוּ וְהֵמִ֥ית אִ֖ישׁ א֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֑ה הַשּׁוֹר֙ יִסָּקֵ֔ל וְגַם־בְּעָלָ֖יו יוּמָֽת׃
21.englishText: If, however, that ox has been in the habit of goring, and its owner, though warned, has failed to guard it, and it kills a man or a woman—the ox shall be stoned and its owner, too, shall be put to death.
21.transliteration: vְaִ֡ם shׁvֹr֩ nַgָּ֨ch h֜vּa mִtְּmֹ֣l shִׁlְshֹׁ֗ם vְhvּaַ֤d bִּbְaָlָyv֙ vְlֹ֣a yִshְׁmְrֶ֔nּvּ vְhֵmִ֥yt aִ֖yshׁ a֣vֹ aִshָּׁ֑h hַshּׁvֹr֙ yִsָּkֵ֔l vְgַם־bְּaָlָ֖yv yvּmָֽt׃

21.hebrewText: אִם־כֹּ֖פֶר יוּשַׁ֣ת עָלָ֑יו וְנָתַן֙ פִּדְיֹ֣ן נַפְשׁ֔וֹ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יוּשַׁ֖ת עָלָֽיו׃
21.englishText: If ransom is imposed, the owner must pay whatever is imposed to redeem the owner’s own life.
21.transliteration: aִם־kֹּ֖pֶr yvּshַׁ֣t aָlָ֑yv vְnָtַן֙ pִּdְyֹ֣ן nַpְshׁ֔vֹ kְּkֹ֥l aֲshֶׁr־yvּshַׁ֖t aָlָֽyv׃

21.hebrewText: אוֹ־בֵ֥ן יִגָּ֖ח אוֹ־בַ֣ת יִגָּ֑ח כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֥ט הַזֶּ֖ה יֵעָ֥שֶׂה לּֽוֹ׃
21.englishText: So, too, if it gores a minor, male or female, [its owner] shall be dealt with according to the same rule.
21.transliteration: avֹ־bֵ֥ן yִgָּ֖ch avֹ־bַ֣t yִgָּ֑ch kַּmִּshְׁpָּ֥t hַzֶּ֖h yֵaָ֥shֶׂh lּֽvֹ׃

21.hebrewText: אִם־עֶ֛בֶד יִגַּ֥ח הַשּׁ֖וֹר א֣וֹ אָמָ֑ה כֶּ֣סֶף ׀ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שְׁקָלִ֗ים יִתֵּן֙ לַֽאדֹנָ֔יו וְהַשּׁ֖וֹר יִסָּקֵֽל׃ {ס}
21.englishText: But if the ox gores a slave, male or female, [its owner] shall pay thirty shekels of silver to the master, and the ox shall be stoned.
21.transliteration: aִם־aֶ֛bֶd yִgַּ֥ch hַshּׁ֖vֹr a֣vֹ aָmָ֑h kֶּ֣sֶף ׀ shְׁlֹshִׁ֣yם shְׁkָlִ֗yם yִtֵּן֙ lַֽadֹnָ֔yv vְhַshּׁ֖vֹr yִsָּkֵֽl׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יִפְתַּ֨ח אִ֜ישׁ בּ֗וֹר א֠וֹ כִּֽי־יִכְרֶ֥ה אִ֛ישׁ בֹּ֖ר וְלֹ֣א יְכַסֶּ֑נּוּ וְנָֽפַל־שָׁ֥מָּה שּׁ֖וֹר א֥וֹ חֲמֽוֹר׃
21.englishText: When any party opens a pit, or when any party digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or an ass falls into it,
21.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yִpְtַּ֨ch aִ֜yshׁ bּ֗vֹr a֠vֹ kִּֽy־yִkְrֶ֥h aִ֛yshׁ bֹּ֖r vְlֹ֣a yְkַsֶּ֑nּvּ vְnָֽpַl־shָׁ֥mָּh shּׁ֖vֹr a֥vֹ chֲmֽvֹr׃

21.hebrewText: בַּ֤עַל הַבּוֹר֙ יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם כֶּ֖סֶף יָשִׁ֣יב לִבְעָלָ֑יו וְהַמֵּ֖ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
21.englishText: the one responsible for the pit must make restitution—paying the price to the owner, but keeping the dead animal.
21.transliteration: bַּ֤aַl hַbּvֹr֙ yְshַׁlֵּ֔ם kֶּ֖sֶף yָshִׁ֣yb lִbְaָlָ֑yv vְhַmֵּ֖t yִֽhְyֶh־lּֽvֹ׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יִגֹּ֧ף שֽׁוֹר־אִ֛ישׁ אֶת־שׁ֥וֹר רֵעֵ֖הוּ וָמֵ֑ת וּמָ֨כְר֜וּ אֶת־הַשּׁ֤וֹר הַחַי֙ וְחָצ֣וּ אֶת־כַּסְפּ֔וֹ וְגַ֥ם אֶת־הַמֵּ֖ת יֶֽחֱצֽוּן׃
21.englishText: When any party’s ox injures a neighbor’s ox and it dies, they shall sell the live ox and divide its price; they shall also divide the dead animal.
21.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yִgֹּ֧ף shֽׁvֹr־aִ֛yshׁ aֶt־shׁ֥vֹr rֵaֵ֖hvּ vָmֵ֑t vּmָ֨kְr֜vּ aֶt־hַshּׁ֤vֹr hַchַy֙ vְchָts֣vּ aֶt־kַּsְpּ֔vֹ vְgַ֥ם aֶt־hַmֵּ֖t yֶֽchֱtsֽvּן׃

21.hebrewText: א֣וֹ נוֹדַ֗ע כִּ֠י שׁ֣וֹר נַגָּ֥ח הוּא֙ מִתְּמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמְרֶ֖נּוּ בְּעָלָ֑יו שַׁלֵּ֨ם יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שׁוֹר֙ תַּ֣חַת הַשּׁ֔וֹר וְהַמֵּ֖ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
21.englishText: If, however, it is known that the ox was in the habit of goring, and its owner has failed to guard it, that person must restore ox for ox, but shall keep the dead animal.
21.transliteration: a֣vֹ nvֹdַ֗a kִּ֠y shׁ֣vֹr nַgָּ֥ch hvּa֙ mִtְּm֣vֹl shִׁlְshֹׁ֔ם vְlֹ֥a yִshְׁmְrֶ֖nּvּ bְּaָlָ֑yv shַׁlֵּ֨ם yְshַׁlֵּ֥ם shׁvֹr֙ tַּ֣chַt hַshּׁ֔vֹr vְhַmֵּ֖t yִֽhְyֶh־lּֽvֹ׃ {s}

21.hebrewText: כִּ֤י יִגְנֹֽב־אִישׁ֙ שׁ֣וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֔ה וּטְבָח֖וֹ א֣וֹ מְכָר֑וֹ חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בָקָ֗ר יְשַׁלֵּם֙ תַּ֣חַת הַשּׁ֔וֹר וְאַרְבַּע־צֹ֖אן תַּ֥חַת הַשֶּֽׂה׃
21.englishText: *This verse constitutes 22.1 in some editions. When any party steals an ox or a sheep, and slaughters it or sells it, that person shall pay five oxen for the ox, and four sheep for the sheep.—
21.transliteration: kִּ֤y yִgְnֹֽb־aִyshׁ֙ shׁ֣vֹr avֹ־shֶׂ֔h vּtְbָch֖vֹ a֣vֹ mְkָr֑vֹ chֲmִshָּׁ֣h bָkָ֗r yְshַׁlֵּם֙ tַּ֣chַt hַshּׁ֔vֹr vְaַrְbַּa־tsֹ֖aן tַּ֥chַt hַshֶּֽׂh׃

22.hebrewText: אִם־בַּמַּחְתֶּ֛רֶת יִמָּצֵ֥א הַגַּנָּ֖ב וְהֻכָּ֣ה וָמֵ֑ת אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ דָּמִֽים׃
22.englishText: If the thief is seized while tunneling*tunneling I.e., under a wall for housebreaking. and beaten to death, there is no bloodguilt in that case.
22.transliteration: aִם־bַּmַּchְtֶּ֛rֶt yִmָּtsֵ֥a hַgַּnָּ֖b vְhֻkָּ֣h vָmֵ֑t aֵ֥yן l֖vֹ dָּmִֽyם׃

22.hebrewText: אִם־זָרְחָ֥ה הַשֶּׁ֛מֶשׁ עָלָ֖יו דָּמִ֣ים ל֑וֹ שַׁלֵּ֣ם יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם אִם־אֵ֣ין ל֔וֹ וְנִמְכַּ֖ר בִּגְנֵבָתֽוֹ׃
22.englishText: If the sun had already risen, there is bloodguilt in that case.—[The thief] must make restitution, and if lacking the means, shall be sold for the theft.
22.transliteration: aִם־zָrְchָ֥h hַshֶּׁ֛mֶshׁ aָlָ֖yv dָּmִ֣yם l֑vֹ shַׁlֵּ֣ם yְshַׁlֵּ֔ם aִם־aֵ֣yן l֔vֹ vְnִmְkַּ֖r bִּgְnֵbָtֽvֹ׃

22.hebrewText: אִֽם־הִמָּצֵא֩ תִמָּצֵ֨א בְיָד֜וֹ הַגְּנֵבָ֗ה מִשּׁ֧וֹר עַד־חֲמ֛וֹר עַד־שֶׂ֖ה חַיִּ֑ים שְׁנַ֖יִם יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ {ס}
22.englishText: But if what was stolen—whether ox or ass or sheep—is found alive and in hand, that person shall pay double.
22.transliteration: aִֽם־hִmָּtsֵa֩ tִmָּtsֵ֨a bְyָd֜vֹ hַgְּnֵbָ֗h mִshּׁ֧vֹr aַd־chֲm֛vֹr aַd־shֶׂ֖h chַyִּ֑yם shְׁnַ֖yִם yְshַׁlֵּֽם׃ {s}

22.hebrewText: כִּ֤י יַבְעֶר־אִישׁ֙ שָׂדֶ֣ה אוֹ־כֶ֔רֶם וְשִׁלַּח֙ אֶת־בְּעִירֹ֔ה וּבִעֵ֖ר בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה אַחֵ֑ר מֵיטַ֥ב שָׂדֵ֛הוּ וּמֵיטַ֥ב כַּרְמ֖וֹ יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ {ס}
22.englishText: When any party who owns livestock lets it loose to graze in another’s land, and so allows a field or a vineyard to be grazed bare, restitution must be made for the impairment*impairment Lit. “excellence.” of that field or vineyard.
22.transliteration: kִּ֤y yַbְaֶr־aִyshׁ֙ shָׂdֶ֣h avֹ־kֶ֔rֶם vְshִׁlַּch֙ aֶt־bְּaִyrֹ֔h vּbִaֵ֖r bִּshְׂdֵ֣h aַchֵ֑r mֵytַ֥b shָׂdֵ֛hvּ vּmֵytַ֥b kַּrְm֖vֹ yְshַׁlֵּֽם׃ {s}

22.hebrewText: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֨א אֵ֜שׁ וּמָצְאָ֤ה קֹצִים֙ וְנֶאֱכַ֣ל גָּדִ֔ישׁ א֥וֹ הַקָּמָ֖ה א֣וֹ הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה שַׁלֵּ֣ם יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם הַמַּבְעִ֖ר אֶת־הַבְּעֵרָֽה׃ {ס}
22.englishText: When a fire is started and spreads to thorns, so that stacked, standing, or growing*growing Lit. “field.” grain is consumed, the one who started the fire must make restitution.
22.transliteration: kִּֽy־tֵtsֵ֨a aֵ֜shׁ vּmָtsְaָ֤h kֹtsִyם֙ vְnֶaֱkַ֣l gָּdִ֔yshׁ a֥vֹ hַkָּmָ֖h a֣vֹ hַshָּׂdֶ֑h shַׁlֵּ֣ם yְshַׁlֵּ֔ם hַmַּbְaִ֖r aֶt־hַbְּaֵrָֽh׃ {s}

22.hebrewText: כִּֽי־יִתֵּן֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֜הוּ כֶּ֤סֶף אֽוֹ־כֵלִים֙ לִשְׁמֹ֔ר וְגֻנַּ֖ב מִבֵּ֣ית הָאִ֑ישׁ אִם־יִמָּצֵ֥א הַגַּנָּ֖ב יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שְׁנָֽיִם׃
22.englishText: When any party gives money or goods to another for safekeeping, and they are stolen from that other party’s house: if caught, the thief shall pay double;
22.transliteration: kִּֽy־yִtֵּן֩ aִ֨yshׁ aֶl־rֵaֵ֜hvּ kֶּ֤sֶף aֽvֹ־kֵlִyם֙ lִshְׁmֹ֔r vְgֻnַּ֖b mִbֵּ֣yt hָaִ֑yshׁ aִם־yִmָּtsֵ֥a hַgַּnָּ֖b yְshַׁlֵּ֥ם shְׁnָֽyִם׃

22.hebrewText: אִם־לֹ֤א יִמָּצֵא֙ הַגַּנָּ֔ב וְנִקְרַ֥ב בַּֽעַל־הַבַּ֖יִת אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים אִם־לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֛ח יָד֖וֹ בִּמְלֶ֥אכֶת רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
22.englishText: if the thief is not caught, the owner of the house shall depose before God*before God See note at 21.6. and deny laying hands on the other’s property.
22.transliteration: aִם־lֹ֤a yִmָּtsֵa֙ hַgַּnָּ֔b vְnִkְrַ֥b bַּֽaַl־hַbַּ֖yִt aֶl־hָֽaֱlֹhִ֑yם aִם־lֹ֥a shָׁlַ֛ch yָd֖vֹ bִּmְlֶ֥akֶt rֵaֵֽhvּ׃

22.hebrewText: עַֽל־כׇּל־דְּבַר־פֶּ֡שַׁע עַל־שׁ֡וֹר עַל־חֲ֠מ֠וֹר עַל־שֶׂ֨ה עַל־שַׂלְמָ֜ה עַל־כׇּל־אֲבֵדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֹאמַר֙ כִּי־ה֣וּא זֶ֔ה עַ֚ד הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים יָבֹ֖א דְּבַר־שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַרְשִׁיעֻן֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שְׁנַ֖יִם לְרֵעֵֽהוּ׃ {ס}
22.englishText: (In all charges of misappropriation—pertaining to an ox, an ass, a sheep, a garment, or any other loss, whereof one party alleges, “This is it”—the case of both parties shall come before God: the one whom God declares guilty shall pay double to the other.)
22.transliteration: aַֽl־kׇּl־dְּbַr־pֶּ֡shַׁa aַl־shׁ֡vֹr aַl־chֲ֠m֠vֹr aַl־shֶׂ֨h aַl־shַׂlְmָ֜h aַl־kׇּl־aֲbֵdָ֗h aֲshֶׁ֤r yֹamַr֙ kִּy־h֣vּa zֶ֔h aַ֚d hָֽaֱlֹhִ֔yם yָbֹ֖a dְּbַr־shְׁnֵyhֶ֑ם aֲshֶׁ֤r yַrְshִׁyaֻן֙ aֱlֹhִ֔yם yְshַׁlֵּ֥ם shְׁnַ֖yִם lְrֵaֵֽhvּ׃ {s}

22.hebrewText: כִּֽי־יִתֵּן֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֜הוּ חֲמ֨וֹר אוֹ־שׁ֥וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֛ה וְכׇל־בְּהֵמָ֖ה לִשְׁמֹ֑ר וּמֵ֛ת אוֹ־נִשְׁבַּ֥ר אוֹ־נִשְׁבָּ֖ה אֵ֥ין רֹאֶֽה׃
22.englishText: When any party gives to another an ass, an ox, a sheep or any other animal to guard, and it dies or is injured or is carried off, with no witness about,
22.transliteration: kִּֽy־yִtֵּן֩ aִ֨yshׁ aֶl־rֵaֵ֜hvּ chֲm֨vֹr avֹ־shׁ֥vֹr avֹ־shֶׂ֛h vְkׇl־bְּhֵmָ֖h lִshְׁmֹ֑r vּmֵ֛t avֹ־nִshְׁbַּ֥r avֹ־nִshְׁbָּ֖h aֵ֥yן rֹaֶֽh׃
