22.hebrewText: שְׁבֻעַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה תִּהְיֶה֙ בֵּ֣ין שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם אִם־לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֛ח יָד֖וֹ בִּמְלֶ֣אכֶת רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְלָקַ֥ח בְּעָלָ֖יו וְלֹ֥א יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
22.englishText: an oath before יהוה shall decide between the two of them that the one has not laid hands on the property of the other; the owner must acquiesce, and no restitution shall be made.
22.transliteration: shְׁbֻaַ֣t yְhֹvָ֗h tִּhְyֶh֙ bֵּ֣yן shְׁnֵyhֶ֔ם aִם־lֹ֥a shָׁlַ֛ch yָd֖vֹ bִּmְlֶ֣akֶt rֵaֵ֑hvּ vְlָkַ֥ch bְּaָlָ֖yv vְlֹ֥a yְshַׁlֵּֽם׃

22.hebrewText: וְאִם־גָּנֹ֥ב יִגָּנֵ֖ב מֵעִמּ֑וֹ יְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לִבְעָלָֽיו׃
22.englishText: But if [the animal] was stolen from the guardian, restitution shall be made to its owner.
22.transliteration: vְaִם־gָּnֹ֥b yִgָּnֵ֖b mֵaִmּ֑vֹ yְshַׁlֵּ֖ם lִbְaָlָֽyv׃

22.hebrewText: אִם־טָרֹ֥ף יִטָּרֵ֖ף יְבִאֵ֣הוּ עֵ֑ד הַטְּרֵפָ֖ה לֹ֥א יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ {פ}
22.englishText: If it was torn by beasts, the guardian shall bring it as evidence—not needing to replace what has been torn by beasts.
22.transliteration: aִם־tָrֹ֥ף yִtָּrֵ֖ף yְbִaֵ֣hvּ aֵ֑d hַtְּrֵpָ֖h lֹ֥a yְshַׁlֵּֽם׃ {p}

22.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יִשְׁאַ֥ל אִ֛ישׁ מֵעִ֥ם רֵעֵ֖הוּ וְנִשְׁבַּ֣ר אוֹ־מֵ֑ת בְּעָלָ֥יו אֵין־עִמּ֖וֹ שַׁלֵּ֥ם יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
22.englishText: When any party borrows [an animal] from another and it dies or is injured, its owner not being with it, restitution must be made.
22.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yִshְׁaַ֥l aִ֛yshׁ mֵaִ֥ם rֵaֵ֖hvּ vְnִshְׁbַּ֣r avֹ־mֵ֑t bְּaָlָ֥yv aֵyן־aִmּ֖vֹ shַׁlֵּ֥ם yְshַׁlֵּֽם׃

22.hebrewText: אִם־בְּעָלָ֥יו עִמּ֖וֹ לֹ֣א יְשַׁלֵּ֑ם אִם־שָׂכִ֣יר ה֔וּא בָּ֖א בִּשְׂכָרֽוֹ׃ {ס}
22.englishText: If its owner was with it, no restitution need be made; but if it was hired, that payment is due.
22.transliteration: aִם־bְּaָlָ֥yv aִmּ֖vֹ lֹ֣a yְshַׁlֵּ֑ם aִם־shָׂkִ֣yr h֔vּa bָּ֖a bִּshְׂkָrֽvֹ׃ {s}

22.hebrewText: וְכִֽי־יְפַתֶּ֣ה אִ֗ישׁ בְּתוּלָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־אֹרָ֖שָׂה וְשָׁכַ֣ב עִמָּ֑הּ מָהֹ֛ר יִמְהָרֶ֥נָּה לּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
22.englishText: If a man seduces a virgin for whom the bride-price has not been paid,*the bride-price has not been paid So that she is unmarried; cf. Deut. 20.7; 22.23ff. and lies with her, he must make her his wife by payment of a bride-price.
22.transliteration: vְkִֽy־yְpַtֶּ֣h aִ֗yshׁ bְּtvּlָ֛h aֲshֶׁ֥r lֹa־aֹrָ֖shָׂh vְshָׁkַ֣b aִmָּ֑hּ mָhֹ֛r yִmְhָrֶ֥nָּh lּ֖vֹ lְaִshָּֽׁh׃

22.hebrewText: אִם־מָאֵ֧ן יְמָאֵ֛ן אָבִ֖יהָ לְתִתָּ֣הּ ל֑וֹ כֶּ֣סֶף יִשְׁקֹ֔ל כְּמֹ֖הַר הַבְּתוּלֹֽת׃ {ס}
22.englishText: If her father refuses to give her to him, he must still weigh out silver in accordance with the bride-price for virgins.
22.transliteration: aִם־mָaֵ֧ן yְmָaֵ֛ן aָbִ֖yhָ lְtִtָּ֣hּ l֑vֹ kֶּ֣sֶף yִshְׁkֹ֔l kְּmֹ֖hַr hַbְּtvּlֹֽt׃ {s}

22.hebrewText: מְכַשֵּׁפָ֖ה לֹ֥א תְחַיֶּֽה׃
22.englishText: You shall not tolerate*tolerate Lit. “let live.” a sorceress.
22.transliteration: mְkַshֵּׁpָ֖h lֹ֥a tְchַyֶּֽh׃

22.hebrewText: כׇּל־שֹׁכֵ֥ב עִם־בְּהֵמָ֖ה מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ {ס}
22.englishText: Whoever lies with a beast shall be put to death.
22.transliteration: kׇּl־shֹׁkֵ֥b aִם־bְּhֵmָ֖h m֥vֹt yvּmָֽt׃ {s}

22.hebrewText: זֹבֵ֥חַ לָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יׇֽחֳרָ֑ם בִּלְתִּ֥י לַיהֹוָ֖ה לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
22.englishText: Whoever sacrifices to a god other than יהוה alone shall be proscribed.*proscribed See Lev. 27.29.
22.transliteration: zֹbֵ֥chַ lָaֱlֹhִ֖yם yׇֽchֳrָ֑ם bִּlְtִּ֥y lַyhֹvָ֖h lְbַdּֽvֹ׃

22.hebrewText: וְגֵ֥ר לֹא־תוֹנֶ֖ה וְלֹ֣א תִלְחָצֶ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
22.englishText: You shall not wrong or oppress a stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
22.transliteration: vְgֵ֥r lֹa־tvֹnֶ֖h vְlֹ֣a tִlְchָtsֶ֑nּvּ kִּֽy־gֵrִ֥yם hֱyִytֶ֖ם bְּaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

22.hebrewText: כׇּל־אַלְמָנָ֥ה וְיָת֖וֹם לֹ֥א תְעַנּֽוּן׃
22.englishText: You [communal leaders]*[communal leaders] In ancient Israel (and the Near East), the responsibility for assisting and protecting widows and the fatherless was understood to rest upon local householders, elders, priests, and the king. See, e.g., Zech. 7.10; Ezek. 22.6–7; Isa. 1.23; Jer. 22.3. shall not ill-treat any widow or orphan.
22.transliteration: kׇּl־aַlְmָnָ֥h vְyָt֖vֹם lֹ֥a tְaַnּֽvּן׃

22.hebrewText: אִם־עַנֵּ֥ה תְעַנֶּ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ כִּ֣י אִם־צָעֹ֤ק יִצְעַק֙ אֵלַ֔י שָׁמֹ֥עַ אֶשְׁמַ֖ע צַעֲקָתֽוֹ׃
22.englishText: If you do mistreat them, I will heed their outcry as soon as they cry out to Me,
22.transliteration: aִם־aַnֵּ֥h tְaַnֶּ֖h aֹt֑vֹ kִּ֣y aִם־tsָaֹ֤k yִtsְaַk֙ aֵlַ֔y shָׁmֹ֥aַ aֶshְׁmַ֖a tsַaֲkָtֽvֹ׃

22.hebrewText: וְחָרָ֣ה אַפִּ֔י וְהָרַגְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם בֶּחָ֑רֶב וְהָי֤וּ נְשֵׁיכֶם֙ אַלְמָנ֔וֹת וּבְנֵיכֶ֖ם יְתֹמִֽים׃ {פ}
22.englishText: and My anger shall blaze forth and I will put you to the sword, and your own wives shall become widows and your children orphans.
22.transliteration: vְchָrָ֣h aַpִּ֔y vְhָrַgְtִּ֥y aֶtְkֶ֖ם bֶּchָ֑rֶb vְhָy֤vּ nְshֵׁykֶם֙ aַlְmָn֔vֹt vּbְnֵykֶ֖ם yְtֹmִֽyם׃ {p}

22.hebrewText: אִם־כֶּ֣סֶף ׀ תַּלְוֶ֣ה אֶת־עַמִּ֗י אֶת־הֶֽעָנִי֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ה ל֖וֹ כְּנֹשֶׁ֑ה לֹֽא־תְשִׂימ֥וּן עָלָ֖יו נֶֽשֶׁךְ׃
22.englishText: If you lend money to My people, to the poor among you, do not act toward them as a creditor; exact no interest from them.
22.transliteration: aִם־kֶּ֣sֶף ׀ tַּlְvֶ֣h aֶt־aַmִּ֗y aֶt־hֶֽaָnִy֙ aִmָּ֔ךְ lֹa־tִhְyֶ֥h l֖vֹ kְּnֹshֶׁ֑h lֹֽa־tְshִׂym֥vּן aָlָ֖yv nֶֽshֶׁךְ׃

22.hebrewText: אִם־חָבֹ֥ל תַּחְבֹּ֖ל שַׂלְמַ֣ת רֵעֶ֑ךָ עַד־בֹּ֥א הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ תְּשִׁיבֶ֥נּוּ לֽוֹ׃
22.englishText: If you take your neighbor’s garment in pledge, you must return it before the sun sets;
22.transliteration: aִם־chָbֹ֥l tַּchְbֹּ֖l shַׂlְmַ֣t rֵaֶ֑ךָ aַd־bֹּ֥a hַshֶּׁ֖mֶshׁ tְּshִׁybֶ֥nּvּ lֽvֹ׃

22.hebrewText: כִּ֣י הִ֤וא כְסוּתֹה֙ לְבַדָּ֔הּ הִ֥וא שִׂמְלָת֖וֹ לְעֹר֑וֹ בַּמֶּ֣ה יִשְׁכָּ֔ב וְהָיָה֙ כִּֽי־יִצְעַ֣ק אֵלַ֔י וְשָׁמַעְתִּ֖י כִּֽי־חַנּ֥וּן אָֽנִי׃ {ס}
22.englishText: it is the only available clothing—it is what covers the skin. In what else shall [your neighbor] sleep? Therefore, if that person cries out to Me, I will pay heed, for I am compassionate.
22.transliteration: kִּ֣y hִ֤va kְsvּtֹh֙ lְbַdָּ֔hּ hִ֥va shִׂmְlָt֖vֹ lְaֹr֑vֹ bַּmֶּ֣h yִshְׁkָּ֔b vְhָyָh֙ kִּֽy־yִtsְaַ֣k aֵlַ֔y vְshָׁmַaְtִּ֖y kִּֽy־chַnּ֥vּן aָֽnִy׃ {s}

22.hebrewText: אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֹ֣א תְקַלֵּ֑ל וְנָשִׂ֥יא בְעַמְּךָ֖ לֹ֥א תָאֹֽר׃
22.englishText: You shall not revile God, nor put a curse upon a chieftain among your people.
22.transliteration: aֱlֹhִ֖yם lֹ֣a tְkַlֵּ֑l vְnָshִׂ֥ya bְaַmְּךָ֖ lֹ֥a tָaֹֽr׃

22.hebrewText: מְלֵאָתְךָ֥ וְדִמְעֲךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְאַחֵ֑ר בְּכ֥וֹר בָּנֶ֖יךָ תִּתֶּן־לִֽי׃
22.englishText: You shall not put off the skimming of the first yield of your vats.*put off the skimming of the first yield of your vats Meaning of Heb. uncertain. You shall give Me the male first-born among your children.
22.transliteration: mְlֵaָtְךָ֥ vְdִmְaֲךָ֖ lֹ֣a tְaַchֵ֑r bְּk֥vֹr bָּnֶ֖yךָ tִּtֶּן־lִֽy׃

22.hebrewText: כֵּֽן־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְשֹׁרְךָ֖ לְצֹאנֶ֑ךָ שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה עִם־אִמּ֔וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֖י תִּתְּנוֹ־לִֽי׃
22.englishText: You shall do the same with your cattle and your flocks: seven days the male first-born*the male first-born Lit. “it.” shall remain with its mother; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.
22.transliteration: kֵּֽן־tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h lְshֹׁrְךָ֖ lְtsֹanֶ֑ךָ shִׁbְaַ֤t yָmִyם֙ yִhְyֶ֣h aִם־aִmּ֔vֹ bַּyּ֥vֹם hַshְּׁmִynִ֖y tִּtְּnvֹ־lִֽy׃

22.hebrewText: וְאַנְשֵׁי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ תִּהְי֣וּן לִ֑י וּבָשָׂ֨ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֤ה טְרֵפָה֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ לַכֶּ֖לֶב תַּשְׁלִכ֥וּן אֹתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
22.englishText: You shall be holy people to Me: you must not eat flesh torn by beasts in the field; you shall cast it to the dogs.
22.transliteration: vְaַnְshֵׁy־kֹ֖dֶshׁ tִּhְy֣vּן lִ֑y vּbָshָׂ֨r bַּshָּׂdֶ֤h tְrֵpָh֙ lֹ֣a tֹakֵ֔lvּ lַkֶּ֖lֶb tַּshְׁlִk֥vּן aֹtֽvֹ׃ {s}

23.hebrewText: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֖א שֵׁ֣מַע שָׁ֑וְא אַל־תָּ֤שֶׁת יָֽדְךָ֙ עִם־רָשָׁ֔ע לִהְיֹ֖ת עֵ֥ד חָמָֽס׃
23.englishText: You must not carry false rumors; you shall not join hands with the guilty to act as a malicious witness:
23.transliteration: lֹ֥a tִshָּׂ֖a shֵׁ֣mַa shָׁ֑vְa aַl־tָּ֤shֶׁt yָֽdְךָ֙ aִם־rָshָׁ֔a lִhְyֹ֖t aֵ֥d chָmָֽs׃

23.hebrewText: לֹֽא־תִהְיֶ֥ה אַחֲרֵֽי־רַבִּ֖ים לְרָעֹ֑ת וְלֹא־תַעֲנֶ֣ה עַל־רִ֗ב לִנְטֹ֛ת אַחֲרֵ֥י רַבִּ֖ים לְהַטֹּֽת׃
23.englishText: You shall neither side with the mighty*mighty Others “multitude.” to do wrong—you shall not give perverse testimony in a dispute so as to pervert it in favor of the mighty—
23.transliteration: lֹֽa־tִhְyֶ֥h aַchֲrֵֽy־rַbִּ֖yם lְrָaֹ֑t vְlֹa־tַaֲnֶ֣h aַl־rִ֗b lִnְtֹ֛t aַchֲrֵ֥y rַbִּ֖yם lְhַtֹּֽt׃

23.hebrewText: וְדָ֕ל לֹ֥א תֶהְדַּ֖ר בְּרִיבֽוֹ׃ {ס}
23.englishText: nor shall you show deference to a poor person in a dispute.
23.transliteration: vְdָ֕l lֹ֥a tֶhְdַּ֖r bְּrִybֽvֹ׃ {s}

23.hebrewText: כִּ֣י תִפְגַּ֞ע שׁ֧וֹר אֹֽיִבְךָ֛ א֥וֹ חֲמֹר֖וֹ תֹּעֶ֑ה הָשֵׁ֥ב תְּשִׁיבֶ֖נּוּ לֽוֹ׃ {ס}
23.englishText: When you encounter your enemy’s ox or ass wandering, you must take it back.
23.transliteration: kִּ֣y tִpְgַּ֞a shׁ֧vֹr aֹֽyִbְךָ֛ a֥vֹ chֲmֹr֖vֹ tֹּaֶ֑h hָshֵׁ֥b tְּshִׁybֶ֖nּvּ lֽvֹ׃ {s}

23.hebrewText: כִּֽי־תִרְאֶ֞ה חֲמ֣וֹר שֹׂנַאֲךָ֗ רֹבֵץ֙ תַּ֣חַת מַשָּׂא֔וֹ וְחָדַלְתָּ֖ מֵעֲזֹ֣ב ל֑וֹ עָזֹ֥ב תַּעֲזֹ֖ב עִמּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
23.englishText: When you see the ass of your enemy lying under its burden and would refrain from raising*raising For this use of the verb ‘zb, cf. Neh. 3.8, 34. For the whole verse, see Deut. 22.4. it, you must nevertheless help raise it.
23.transliteration: kִּֽy־tִrְaֶ֞h chֲm֣vֹr shֹׂnַaֲךָ֗ rֹbֵץ֙ tַּ֣chַt mַshָּׂa֔vֹ vְchָdַlְtָּ֖ mֵaֲzֹ֣b l֑vֹ aָzֹ֥b tַּaֲzֹ֖b aִmּֽvֹ׃ {s}

23.hebrewText: לֹ֥א תַטֶּ֛ה מִשְׁפַּ֥ט אֶבְיֹנְךָ֖ בְּרִיבֽוֹ׃
23.englishText: You shall not subvert the rights of your needy in their disputes.
23.transliteration: lֹ֥a tַtֶּ֛h mִshְׁpַּ֥t aֶbְyֹnְךָ֖ bְּrִybֽvֹ׃

23.hebrewText: מִדְּבַר־שֶׁ֖קֶר תִּרְחָ֑ק וְנָקִ֤י וְצַדִּיק֙ אַֽל־תַּהֲרֹ֔ג כִּ֥י לֹא־אַצְדִּ֖יק רָשָֽׁע׃
23.englishText: Keep far from a false charge; do not bring death on those who are innocent and in the right, for I will not acquit the wrongdoer.
23.transliteration: mִdְּbַr־shֶׁ֖kֶr tִּrְchָ֑k vְnָkִ֤y vְtsַdִּyk֙ aַֽl־tַּhֲrֹ֔g kִּ֥y lֹa־aַtsְdִּ֖yk rָshָֽׁa׃

23.hebrewText: וְשֹׁ֖חַד לֹ֣א תִקָּ֑ח כִּ֤י הַשֹּׁ֙חַד֙ יְעַוֵּ֣ר פִּקְחִ֔ים וִֽיסַלֵּ֖ף דִּבְרֵ֥י צַדִּיקִֽים׃
23.englishText: Do not take bribes, for bribes blind the clear-sighted and upset the pleas of those who are in the right.
23.transliteration: vְshֹׁ֖chַd lֹ֣a tִkָּ֑ch kִּ֤y hַshֹּׁ֙chַd֙ yְaַvֵּ֣r pִּkְchִ֔yם vִֽysַlֵּ֖ף dִּbְrֵ֥y tsַdִּykִֽyם׃

23.hebrewText: וְגֵ֖ר לֹ֣א תִלְחָ֑ץ וְאַתֶּ֗ם יְדַעְתֶּם֙ אֶת־נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַגֵּ֔ר כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
23.englishText: You shall not oppress a stranger, for you know the feelings of the stranger, having yourselves been strangers in the land of Egypt.
23.transliteration: vְgֵ֖r lֹ֣a tִlְchָ֑ץ vְaַtֶּ֗ם yְdַaְtֶּם֙ aֶt־nֶ֣pֶshׁ hַgֵּ֔r kִּֽy־gֵrִ֥yם hֱyִytֶ֖ם bְּaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

23.hebrewText: וְשֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים תִּזְרַ֣ע אֶת־אַרְצֶ֑ךָ וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֶת־תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
23.englishText: Six years you shall sow your land and gather in its yield;
23.transliteration: vְshֵׁ֥shׁ shָׁnִ֖yם tִּzְrַ֣a aֶt־aַrְtsֶ֑ךָ vְaָsַpְtָּ֖ aֶt־tְּbvּaָtָֽhּ׃

23.hebrewText: וְהַשְּׁבִיעִ֞ת תִּשְׁמְטֶ֣נָּה וּנְטַשְׁתָּ֗הּ וְאָֽכְלוּ֙ אֶבְיֹנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֔ךָ וְיִתְרָ֕ם תֹּאכַ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה כֵּֽן־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְכַרְמְךָ֖ לְזֵיתֶֽךָ׃
23.englishText: but in the seventh you shall let it rest and lie fallow. Let the needy among your people eat of it, and what they leave let the wild beasts eat. You shall do the same with your vineyards and your olive groves.
23.transliteration: vְhַshְּׁbִyaִ֞t tִּshְׁmְtֶ֣nָּh vּnְtַshְׁtָּ֗hּ vְaָֽkְlvּ֙ aֶbְyֹnֵ֣y aַmֶּ֔ךָ vְyִtְrָ֕ם tֹּakַ֖l chַyַּ֣t hַshָּׂdֶ֑h kֵּֽן־tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h lְkַrְmְךָ֖ lְzֵytֶֽךָ׃

23.hebrewText: שֵׁ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה מַעֲשֶׂ֔יךָ וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י תִּשְׁבֹּ֑ת לְמַ֣עַן יָנ֗וּחַ שֽׁוֹרְךָ֙ וַחֲמֹרֶ֔ךָ וְיִנָּפֵ֥שׁ בֶּן־אֲמָתְךָ֖ וְהַגֵּֽר׃
23.englishText: Six days you shall do your work, but on the seventh day you shall cease from labor, in order that your ox and your ass may rest, and that your home-born slave and the stranger may be refreshed.
23.transliteration: shֵׁ֤shֶׁt yָmִyם֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h mַaֲshֶׂ֔yךָ vּbַyּ֥vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֖y tִּshְׁbֹּ֑t lְmַ֣aַן yָn֗vּchַ shֽׁvֹrְךָ֙ vַchֲmֹrֶ֔ךָ vְyִnָּpֵ֥shׁ bֶּן־aֲmָtְךָ֖ vְhַgֵּֽr׃

23.hebrewText: וּבְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אָמַ֥רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם תִּשָּׁמֵ֑רוּ וְשֵׁ֨ם אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֲחֵרִים֙ לֹ֣א תַזְכִּ֔ירוּ לֹ֥א יִשָּׁמַ֖ע עַל־פִּֽיךָ׃
23.englishText: Be on guard concerning all that I have told you. Make no mention of the names of other gods; they shall not be heard on your lips.
23.transliteration: vּbְkֹ֛l aֲshֶׁr־aָmַ֥rְtִּy aֲlֵykֶ֖ם tִּshָּׁmֵ֑rvּ vְshֵׁ֨ם aֱlֹhִ֤yם aֲchֵrִyם֙ lֹ֣a tַzְkִּ֔yrvּ lֹ֥a yִshָּׁmַ֖a aַl־pִּֽyךָ׃

23.hebrewText: שָׁלֹ֣שׁ רְגָלִ֔ים תָּחֹ֥ג לִ֖י בַּשָּׁנָֽה׃
23.englishText: Three times a year you shall hold a festival for Me:
23.transliteration: shָׁlֹ֣shׁ rְgָlִ֔yם tָּchֹ֥g lִ֖y bַּshָּׁnָֽh׃

23.hebrewText: אֶת־חַ֣ג הַמַּצּוֹת֮ תִּשְׁמֹר֒ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִים֩ תֹּאכַ֨ל מַצּ֜וֹת כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֗ךָ לְמוֹעֵד֙ חֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽאָבִ֔יב כִּי־ב֖וֹ יָצָ֣אתָ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹא־יֵרָא֥וּ פָנַ֖י רֵיקָֽם׃
23.englishText: You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread—eating unleavened bread for seven days as I have commanded you—at the set time in the month*in the month See note at 13.4. of Abib, for in it you went forth from Egypt; and none shall appear before Me empty-handed;
23.transliteration: aֶt־chַ֣g hַmַּtsּvֹt֮ tִּshְׁmֹr֒ shִׁbְaַ֣t yָmִyם֩ tֹּakַ֨l mַtsּ֜vֹt kַּֽaֲshֶׁ֣r tsִvִּytִ֗ךָ lְmvֹaֵd֙ chֹ֣dֶshׁ hָֽaָbִ֔yb kִּy־b֖vֹ yָtsָ֣atָ mִmִּtsְrָ֑yִם vְlֹa־yֵrָa֥vּ pָnַ֖y rֵykָֽם׃

23.hebrewText: וְחַ֤ג הַקָּצִיר֙ בִּכּוּרֵ֣י מַעֲשֶׂ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּזְרַ֖ע בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְחַ֤ג הָֽאָסִף֙ בְּצֵ֣את הַשָּׁנָ֔ה בְּאׇסְפְּךָ֥ אֶֽת־מַעֲשֶׂ֖יךָ מִן־הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
23.englishText: and the Feast of the Harvest, of the first fruits of your work, of what you sow in the field; and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in the results of your work from the field.
23.transliteration: vְchַ֤g hַkָּtsִyr֙ bִּkּvּrֵ֣y mַaֲshֶׂ֔yךָ aֲshֶׁ֥r tִּzְrַ֖a bַּshָּׂdֶ֑h vְchַ֤g hָֽaָsִף֙ bְּtsֵ֣at hַshָּׁnָ֔h bְּaׇsְpְּךָ֥ aֶֽt־mַaֲshֶׂ֖yךָ mִן־hַshָּׂdֶֽh׃

23.hebrewText: שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה יֵרָאֶה֙ כׇּל־זְכ֣וּרְךָ֔ אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י הָאָדֹ֥ן <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָֽה׃
23.englishText: Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Sovereign, יהוה.
23.transliteration: shָׁlֹ֥shׁ pְּaָmִ֖yם bַּshָּׁnָ֑h yֵrָaֶh֙ kׇּl־zְk֣vּrְךָ֔ aֶl־pְּnֵ֖y hָaָdֹ֥ן <small>׀</small> yְhֹvָֽh׃

23.hebrewText: לֹֽא־תִזְבַּ֥ח עַל־חָמֵ֖ץ דַּם־זִבְחִ֑י וְלֹֽא־יָלִ֥ין חֵֽלֶב־חַגִּ֖י עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
23.englishText: You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with anything leavened; and the fat of My festal offering shall not be left lying until morning.
23.transliteration: lֹֽa־tִzְbַּ֥ch aַl־chָmֵ֖ץ dַּם־zִbְchִ֑y vְlֹֽa־yָlִ֥yן chֵֽlֶb־chַgִּ֖y aַd־bֹּֽkֶr׃

23.hebrewText: רֵאשִׁ֗ית בִּכּוּרֵי֙ אַדְמָ֣תְךָ֔ תָּבִ֕יא בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹֽא־תְבַשֵּׁ֥ל גְּדִ֖י בַּחֲלֵ֥ב אִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
23.englishText: The choice first fruits of your soil you shall bring to the house of your God יהוה. You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
23.transliteration: rֵashִׁ֗yt bִּkּvּrֵy֙ aַdְmָ֣tְךָ֔ tָּbִ֕ya bֵּ֖yt yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhֶ֑yךָ lֹֽa־tְbַshֵּׁ֥l gְּdִ֖y bַּchֲlֵ֥b aִmּֽvֹ׃ {p}

23.hebrewText: הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י שֹׁלֵ֤חַ מַלְאָךְ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמׇרְךָ֖ בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ וְלַהֲבִ֣יאֲךָ֔ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲכִנֹֽתִי׃
23.englishText: I am sending a messenger before you to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that I have made ready.
23.transliteration: hִnֵּ֨h aָnֹkִ֜y shֹׁlֵ֤chַ mַlְaָךְ֙ lְpָnֶ֔yךָ lִshְׁmׇrְךָ֖ bַּdָּ֑rֶךְ vְlַhֲbִ֣yaֲךָ֔ aֶl־hַmָּk֖vֹם aֲshֶׁ֥r hֲkִnֹֽtִy׃

23.hebrewText: הִשָּׁ֧מֶר מִפָּנָ֛יו וּשְׁמַ֥ע בְּקֹל֖וֹ אַל־תַּמֵּ֣ר בּ֑וֹ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יִשָּׂא֙ לְפִשְׁעֲכֶ֔ם כִּ֥י שְׁמִ֖י בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
23.englishText: Pay heed to him and obey him. Do not defy him, for he will not pardon your offenses, since My Name is in him;
23.transliteration: hִshָּׁ֧mֶr mִpָּnָ֛yv vּshְׁmַ֥a bְּkֹl֖vֹ aַl־tַּmֵּ֣r bּ֑vֹ kִּ֣y lֹ֤a yִshָּׂa֙ lְpִshְׁaֲkֶ֔ם kִּ֥y shְׁmִ֖y bְּkִrְbּֽvֹ׃

23.hebrewText: כִּ֣י אִם־שָׁמ֤וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַע֙ בְּקֹל֔וֹ וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וְאָֽיַבְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֹ֣יְבֶ֔יךָ וְצַרְתִּ֖י אֶת־צֹרְרֶֽיךָ׃
23.englishText: but if you obey him and do all that I say, I will be an enemy to your enemies and a foe to your foes.
23.transliteration: kִּ֣y aִם־shָׁm֤vֹaַ tִּshְׁmַa֙ bְּkֹl֔vֹ vְaָshִׂ֕ytָ kֹּ֖l aֲshֶׁ֣r aֲdַbֵּ֑r vְaָֽyַbְtִּy֙ aֶt־aֹ֣yְbֶ֔yךָ vְtsַrְtִּ֖y aֶt־tsֹrְrֶֽyךָ׃

23.hebrewText: כִּֽי־יֵלֵ֣ךְ מַלְאָכִי֮ לְפָנֶ֒יךָ֒ וֶהֱבִֽיאֲךָ֗ אֶל־הָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהַפְּרִזִּי֙ וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י וְהִכְחַדְתִּֽיו׃
23.englishText: When My messenger goes before you and brings you to the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I annihilate them,
23.transliteration: kִּֽy־yֵlֵ֣ךְ mַlְaָkִy֮ lְpָnֶ֒yךָ֒ vֶhֱbִֽyaֲךָ֗ aֶl־hָֽaֱmֹrִy֙ vְhַ֣chִtִּ֔y vְhַpְּrִzִּy֙ vְhַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֔y hַchִvִּ֖y vְhַyְbvּsִ֑y vְhִkְchַdְtִּֽyv׃

23.hebrewText: לֹֽא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֤ה לֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א תׇֽעׇבְדֵ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂ֖ה כְּמַֽעֲשֵׂיהֶ֑ם כִּ֤י הָרֵס֙ תְּהָ֣רְסֵ֔ם וְשַׁבֵּ֥ר תְּשַׁבֵּ֖ר מַצֵּבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
23.englishText: you shall not bow down to their gods in worship or follow their practices, but shall tear them down and smash their pillars to bits.
23.transliteration: lֹֽa־tִshְׁtַּchֲvֶ֤h lֵalֹֽhֵyhֶם֙ vְlֹ֣a tׇֽaׇbְdֵ֔ם vְlֹ֥a tַaֲshֶׂ֖h kְּmַֽaֲshֵׂyhֶ֑ם kִּ֤y hָrֵs֙ tְּhָ֣rְsֵ֔ם vְshַׁbֵּ֥r tְּshַׁbֵּ֖r mַtsֵּbֹtֵyhֶֽם׃

23.hebrewText: וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֗ם אֵ֚ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵרַ֥ךְ אֶֽת־לַחְמְךָ֖ וְאֶת־מֵימֶ֑יךָ וַהֲסִרֹתִ֥י מַחֲלָ֖ה מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ {ס}
23.englishText: You shall serve your God יהוה, who will bless your bread and your water. And I will remove sickness from your midst.
23.transliteration: vַaֲbַdְtֶּ֗ם aֵ֚t yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹֽhֵykֶ֔ם vּbֵrַ֥ךְ aֶֽt־lַchְmְךָ֖ vְaֶt־mֵymֶ֑yךָ vַhֲsִrֹtִ֥y mַchֲlָ֖h mִkִּrְbֶּֽךָ׃ {s}

23.hebrewText: לֹ֥א תִהְיֶ֛ה מְשַׁכֵּלָ֥ה וַעֲקָרָ֖ה בְּאַרְצֶ֑ךָ אֶת־מִסְפַּ֥ר יָמֶ֖יךָ אֲמַלֵּֽא׃
23.englishText: No woman in your land shall miscarry or be barren. I will let you enjoy the full count of your days.
23.transliteration: lֹ֥a tִhְyֶ֛h mְshַׁkֵּlָ֥h vַaֲkָrָ֖h bְּaַrְtsֶ֑ךָ aֶt־mִsְpַּ֥r yָmֶ֖yךָ aֲmַlֵּֽa׃

23.hebrewText: אֶת־אֵֽימָתִי֙ אֲשַׁלַּ֣ח לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְהַמֹּתִי֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּבֹ֖א בָּהֶ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֧י אֶת־כׇּל־אֹיְבֶ֛יךָ אֵלֶ֖יךָ עֹֽרֶף׃
23.englishText: I will send forth My terror before you, and I will throw into panic all the people among whom you come, and I will make all your enemies turn tail*tail Lit. “back.” before you.
23.transliteration: aֶt־aֵֽymָtִy֙ aֲshַׁlַּ֣ch lְpָnֶ֔yךָ vְhַmֹּtִy֙ aֶt־kׇּl־hָaָ֔ם aֲshֶׁ֥r tָּbֹ֖a bָּhֶ֑ם vְnָtַtִּ֧y aֶt־kׇּl־aֹyְbֶ֛yךָ aֵlֶ֖yךָ aֹֽrֶף׃

23.hebrewText: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֥י אֶת־הַצִּרְעָ֖ה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְגֵרְשָׁ֗ה אֶת־הַחִוִּ֧י אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֛י וְאֶת־הַחִתִּ֖י מִלְּפָנֶֽיךָ׃
23.englishText: I will send a plague*plague Others “hornet”; meaning of Heb. ṣir‘ah uncertain. Cf. Deut. 7.20. ahead of you, and it shall drive out before you the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites.
23.transliteration: vְshָׁlַchְtִּ֥y aֶt־hַtsִּrְaָ֖h lְpָnֶ֑yךָ vְgֵrְshָׁ֗h aֶt־hַchִvִּ֧y aֶt־hַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֛y vְaֶt־hַchִtִּ֖y mִlְּpָnֶֽyךָ׃

23.hebrewText: לֹ֧א אֲגָרְשֶׁ֛נּוּ מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ בְּשָׁנָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת פֶּן־תִּהְיֶ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ שְׁמָמָ֔ה וְרַבָּ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
23.englishText: I will not drive them out before you in a single year, lest the land become desolate and the wild beasts multiply to your hurt.
23.transliteration: lֹ֧a aֲgָrְshֶׁ֛nּvּ mִpָּnֶ֖yךָ bְּshָׁnָ֣h aֶchָ֑t pֶּן־tִּhְyֶ֤h hָaָ֙rֶץ֙ shְׁmָmָ֔h vְrַbָּ֥h aָlֶ֖yךָ chַyַּ֥t hַshָּׂdֶֽh׃

23.hebrewText: מְעַ֥ט מְעַ֛ט אֲגָרְשֶׁ֖נּוּ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּפְרֶ֔ה וְנָחַלְתָּ֖ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
23.englishText: I will drive them out before you little by little, until you have increased and possess the land.
23.transliteration: mְaַ֥t mְaַ֛t aֲgָrְshֶׁ֖nּvּ mִpָּnֶ֑yךָ aַ֚d aֲshֶׁ֣r tִּpְrֶ֔h vְnָchַlְtָּ֖ aֶt־hָaָֽrֶץ׃

23.hebrewText: וְשַׁתִּ֣י אֶת־גְּבֻלְךָ֗ מִיַּם־סוּף֙ וְעַד־יָ֣ם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וּמִמִּדְבָּ֖ר עַד־הַנָּהָ֑ר כִּ֣י ׀ אֶתֵּ֣ן בְּיֶדְכֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וְגֵרַשְׁתָּ֖מוֹ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
23.englishText: I will set your borders from the Sea of Reeds to the Sea of Philistia, and from the wilderness to the Euphrates; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hands, and you will drive them out before you.
23.transliteration: vְshַׁtִּ֣y aֶt־gְּbֻlְךָ֗ mִyַּם־svּף֙ vְaַd־yָ֣ם pְּlִshְׁtִּ֔yם vּmִmִּdְbָּ֖r aַd־hַnָּhָ֑r kִּ֣y ׀ aֶtֵּ֣ן bְּyֶdְkֶ֗ם aֵ֚t yֹshְׁbֵ֣y hָaָ֔rֶץ vְgֵrַshְׁtָּ֖mvֹ mִpָּnֶֽyךָ׃

23.hebrewText: לֹֽא־תִכְרֹ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם וְלֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶ֖ם בְּרִֽית׃
23.englishText: You shall make no covenant with them and their gods.
23.transliteration: lֹֽa־tִkְrֹ֥t lָhֶ֛ם vְlֵalֹֽhֵyhֶ֖ם bְּrִֽyt׃

23.hebrewText: לֹ֤א יֵשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאַרְצְךָ֔ פֶּן־יַחֲטִ֥יאוּ אֹתְךָ֖ לִ֑י כִּ֤י תַעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃ {פ}
23.englishText: They shall not remain in your land, lest they cause you to sin against Me; for you will serve their gods—and it will prove a snare to you.
23.transliteration: lֹ֤a yֵshְׁbvּ֙ bְּaַrְtsְךָ֔ pֶּן־yַchֲtִ֥yavּ aֹtְךָ֖ lִ֑y kִּ֤y tַaֲbֹd֙ aֶt־aֱlֹ֣hֵyhֶ֔ם kִּֽy־yִhְyֶ֥h lְךָ֖ lְmvֹkֵֽshׁ׃ {p}

24.hebrewText: וְאֶל־מֹשֶׁ֨ה אָמַ֜ר עֲלֵ֣ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה אַתָּה֙ וְאַהֲרֹן֙ נָדָ֣ב וַאֲבִיה֔וּא וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֖ם מֵרָחֹֽק׃
24.englishText: Then [God] said to Moses, “Come up to יהוה, with Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel, and bow low from afar.
24.transliteration: vְaֶl־mֹshֶׁ֨h aָmַ֜r aֲlֵ֣h aֶl־yְhֹvָ֗h aַtָּh֙ vְaַhֲrֹן֙ nָdָ֣b vַaֲbִyh֔vּa vְshִׁbְaִ֖yם mִzִּkְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vְhִshְׁtַּchֲvִytֶ֖ם mֵrָchֹֽk׃

24.hebrewText: וְנִגַּ֨שׁ מֹשֶׁ֤ה לְבַדּוֹ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהֵ֖ם לֹ֣א יִגָּ֑שׁוּ וְהָעָ֕ם לֹ֥א יַעֲל֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
24.englishText: Moses alone shall come near יהוה; but the others shall not come near, nor shall the people come up with him.”
24.transliteration: vְnִgַּ֨shׁ mֹshֶׁ֤h lְbַdּvֹ֙ aֶl־yְhֹvָ֔h vְhֵ֖ם lֹ֣a yִgָּ֑shׁvּ vְhָaָ֕ם lֹ֥a yַaֲl֖vּ aִmּֽvֹ׃

24.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיְסַפֵּ֤ר לָעָם֙ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים וַיַּ֨עַן כׇּל־הָעָ֜ם ק֤וֹל אֶחָד֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
24.englishText: Moses went and repeated to the people all the commands of יהוה and all the rules; and all the people answered with one voice, saying, “All the things that יהוה has commanded we will do!”
24.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֣a mֹshֶׁ֗h vַyְsַpֵּ֤r lָaָם֙ aֵ֚t kׇּl־dִּbְrֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֔h vְaֵ֖t kׇּl־hַmִּshְׁpָּtִ֑yם vַyַּ֨aַן kׇּl־hָaָ֜ם k֤vֹl aֶchָd֙ vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ kׇּl־hַdְּbָrִ֛yם aֲshֶׁr־dִּbֶּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h nַaֲshֶֽׂh׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֣ם בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּ֥בֶן מִזְבֵּ֖חַ תַּ֣חַת הָהָ֑ר וּשְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה לִשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
24.englishText: Moses then wrote down all the commands of יהוה. Early in the morning, he set up an altar at the foot of the mountain, with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.
24.transliteration: vַyִּkְtֹּ֣b mֹshֶׁ֗h aֵ֚t kׇּl־dִּbְrֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֔h vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֣ם bַּbֹּ֔kֶr vַyִּ֥bֶן mִzְbֵּ֖chַ tַּ֣chַt hָhָ֑r vּshְׁtֵּ֤yם aֶshְׂrֵh֙ mַtsֵּbָ֔h lִshְׁnֵ֥yם aָshָׂ֖r shִׁbְtֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֶֽת־נַעֲרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ עֹלֹ֑ת וַֽיִּזְבְּח֞וּ זְבָחִ֧ים שְׁלָמִ֛ים לַיהֹוָ֖ה פָּרִֽים׃
24.englishText: He designated some assistants*some assistants Heb. na‘arim (in construct); NJPS “some young men.” See the Dictionary under na‘ar. among the Israelites, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed bulls as offerings of well-being to יהוה.
24.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁlַ֗ch aֶֽt־nַaֲrֵy֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l vַֽyַּaֲl֖vּ aֹlֹ֑t vַֽyִּzְbְּch֞vּ zְbָchִ֧yם shְׁlָmִ֛yם lַyhֹvָ֖h pָּrִֽyם׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ חֲצִ֣י הַדָּ֔ם וַיָּ֖שֶׂם בָּאַגָּנֹ֑ת וַחֲצִ֣י הַדָּ֔ם זָרַ֖ק עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
24.englishText: Moses took one part of the blood and put it in basins, and the other part of the blood he dashed against the altar.
24.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֤ch mֹshֶׁh֙ chֲtsִ֣y hַdָּ֔ם vַyָּ֖shֶׂם bָּaַgָּnֹ֑t vַchֲtsִ֣y hַdָּ֔ם zָrַ֖k aַl־hַmִּzְbֵּֽchַ׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּח֙ סֵ֣פֶר הַבְּרִ֔ית וַיִּקְרָ֖א בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶׂ֥ה וְנִשְׁמָֽע׃
24.englishText: Then he took the record of the covenant and read it aloud to the people. And they said, “All that יהוה has spoken we will faithfully do!”*we will faithfully do Lit. “we will do and obey.”
24.transliteration: vַyִּkַּch֙ sֵ֣pֶr hַbְּrִ֔yt vַyִּkְrָ֖a bְּaׇzְnֵ֣y hָaָ֑ם vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ kֹּ֛l aֲshֶׁr־dִּbֶּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h nַaֲshֶׂ֥h vְnִshְׁmָֽa׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וַיִּזְרֹ֖ק עַל־הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֤ה דַֽם־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּרַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם עַ֥ל כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
24.englishText: Moses took the blood and dashed it on the people and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that יהוה now makes with you concerning all these commands.”
24.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֤ch mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶt־hַdָּ֔ם vַyִּzְrֹ֖k aַl־hָaָ֑ם vַyֹּ֗amֶr hִnֵּ֤h dַֽם־hַbְּrִyt֙ aֲshֶׁ֨r kָּrַ֤t yְhֹvָh֙ aִmָּkֶ֔ם aַ֥l kׇּl־hַdְּbָrִ֖yם hָaֵֽlֶּh׃

24.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן נָדָב֙ וַאֲבִיה֔וּא וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים מִזִּקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
24.englishText: Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel ascended;
24.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַl mֹshֶׁ֖h vְaַhֲrֹ֑ן nָdָb֙ vַaֲbִyh֔vּa vְshִׁbְaִ֖yם mִzִּkְnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּרְא֕וּ אֵ֖ת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְתַ֣חַת רַגְלָ֗יו כְּמַעֲשֵׂה֙ לִבְנַ֣ת הַסַּפִּ֔יר וּכְעֶ֥צֶם הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָטֹֽהַר׃
24.englishText: and they saw the God of Israel—under whose feet was the likeness of a pavement of sapphire, like the very sky for purity.
24.transliteration: vַyִּrְa֕vּ aֵ֖t aֱlֹhֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vְtַ֣chַt rַgְlָ֗yv kְּmַaֲshֵׂh֙ lִbְnַ֣t hַsַּpִּ֔yr vּkְaֶ֥tsֶם hַshָּׁmַ֖yִם lָtֹֽhַr׃

24.hebrewText: וְאֶל־אֲצִילֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֖ח יָד֑וֹ וַיֶּֽחֱזוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ וַיִּשְׁתּֽוּ׃ {ס}
24.englishText: Yet [God] did not raise a hand against the leaders*leaders Meaning of Heb. ’aṣilim uncertain. of the Israelites; they beheld God, and they ate and drank.
24.transliteration: vְaֶl־aֲtsִylֵy֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l lֹ֥a shָׁlַ֖ch yָd֑vֹ vַyֶּֽchֱzvּ֙ aֶt־hָ֣aֱlֹhִ֔yם vַyֹּakְl֖vּ vַyִּshְׁtּֽvּ׃ {s}

24.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲלֵ֥ה אֵלַ֛י הָהָ֖רָה ��ֶהְיֵה־שָׁ֑ם וְאֶתְּנָ֨ה לְךָ֜ אֶת־לֻחֹ֣ת הָאֶ֗בֶן וְהַתּוֹרָה֙ וְהַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּתַ֖בְתִּי לְהוֹרֹתָֽם׃
24.englishText: יהוה said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and wait there, and I will give you the stone tablets with the teachings and commandments which I have inscribed to instruct them.”
24.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h aֲlֵ֥h aֵlַ֛y hָhָ֖rָh ��ֶhְyֵh־shָׁ֑ם vְaֶtְּnָ֨h lְךָ֜ aֶt־lֻchֹ֣t hָaֶ֗bֶן vְhַtּvֹrָh֙ vְhַmִּtsְvָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r kָּtַ֖bְtִּy lְhvֹrֹtָֽם׃

24.hebrewText: וַיָּ֣קׇם מֹשֶׁ֔ה וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ מְשָׁרְת֑וֹ וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
24.englishText: So Moses and his attendant Joshua arose, and Moses ascended the mountain of God.
24.transliteration: vַyָּ֣kׇם mֹshֶׁ֔h vִyhvֹshֻׁ֖aַ mְshָׁrְt֑vֹ vַyַּ֥aַl mֹshֶׁ֖h aֶl־hַ֥r hָaֱlֹhִֽyם׃

24.hebrewText: וְאֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֤ים אָמַר֙ שְׁבוּ־לָ֣נוּ בָזֶ֔ה עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־נָשׁ֖וּב אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֨ה אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְחוּר֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם מִי־בַ֥עַל דְּבָרִ֖ים יִגַּ֥שׁ אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
24.englishText: To the elders he had said, “Wait here for us until we return to you. You have Aaron and Hur with you; let anyone who has a legal matter approach them.”
24.transliteration: vְaֶl־hַzְּkֵnִ֤yם aָmַr֙ shְׁbvּ־lָ֣nvּ bָzֶ֔h aַ֥d aֲshֶׁr־nָshׁ֖vּb aֲlֵykֶ֑ם vְhִnֵּ֨h aַhֲrֹ֤ן vְchvּr֙ aִmָּkֶ֔ם mִy־bַ֥aַl dְּbָrִ֖yם yִgַּ֥shׁ aֲlֵhֶֽם׃

24.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָהָ֑ר וַיְכַ֥ס הֶעָנָ֖ן אֶת־הָהָֽר׃
24.englishText: When Moses had ascended the mountain, the cloud covered the mountain.
24.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַl mֹshֶׁ֖h aֶl־hָhָ֑r vַyְkַ֥s hֶaָnָ֖ן aֶt־hָhָֽr׃

24.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁכֹּ֤ן כְּבוֹד־יְהֹוָה֙ עַל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וַיְכַסֵּ֥הוּ הֶעָנָ֖ן שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֛ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י מִתּ֥וֹךְ הֶעָנָֽן׃
24.englishText: The Presence of יהוה abode on Mount Sinai, and the cloud hid it for six days. On the seventh day [God] called to Moses from the midst of the cloud.
24.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁkֹּ֤ן kְּbvֹd־yְhֹvָh֙ aַl־hַ֣r sִynַ֔y vַyְkַsֵּ֥hvּ hֶaָnָ֖ן shֵׁ֣shֶׁt yָmִ֑yם vַyִּkְrָ֧a aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֛h bַּyּ֥vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֖y mִtּ֥vֹךְ hֶaָnָֽן׃

24.hebrewText: וּמַרְאֵה֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה כְּאֵ֥שׁ אֹכֶ֖לֶת בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר לְעֵינֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
24.englishText: Now the Presence of יהוה appeared in the sight of the Israelites as a consuming fire on the top of the mountain.
24.transliteration: vּmַrְaֵh֙ kְּb֣vֹd yְhֹvָ֔h kְּaֵ֥shׁ aֹkֶ֖lֶt bְּrֹ֣ashׁ hָhָ֑r lְaֵynֵ֖y bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

24.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הֶעָנָ֖ן וַיַּ֣עַל אֶל־הָהָ֑ר וַיְהִ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ בָּהָ֔ר אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָֽיְלָה׃ {פ}
24.englishText: Moses went inside the cloud and ascended the mountain; and Moses remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights.
24.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֥a mֹshֶׁ֛h bְּt֥vֹךְ hֶaָnָ֖ן vַyַּ֣aַl aֶl־hָhָ֑r vַyְhִ֤y mֹshֶׁh֙ bָּhָ֔r aַrְbָּaִ֣yם y֔vֹם vְaַrְbָּaִ֖yם lָֽyְlָh׃ {p}

terumah.name: Terumah
terumah.summary: The command to build the Tabernacle, the ark, the table, the menorah, the structure of the Tabernacle, and the altar.

25.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
25.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
25.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

25.hebrewText: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְיִקְחוּ־לִ֖י תְּרוּמָ֑ה מֵאֵ֤ת כׇּל־אִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִדְּבֶ֣נּוּ לִבּ֔וֹ תִּקְח֖וּ אֶת־תְּרוּמָתִֽי׃
25.englishText: Tell the Israelite people to bring Me gifts; you shall accept gifts for Me from every person whose heart is so moved.
25.transliteration: dַּbֵּr֙ aֶl־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l vְyִkְchvּ־lִ֖y tְּrvּmָ֑h mֵaֵ֤t kׇּl־aִyshׁ֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r yִdְּbֶ֣nּvּ lִbּ֔vֹ tִּkְch֖vּ aֶt־tְּrvּmָtִֽy׃

25.hebrewText: וְזֹאת֙ הַתְּרוּמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּקְח֖וּ מֵאִתָּ֑ם זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף וּנְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
25.englishText: And these are the gifts that you shall accept from them: gold, silver, and copper;
25.transliteration: vְzֹat֙ hַtְּrvּmָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r tִּkְch֖vּ mֵaִtָּ֑ם zָhָ֥b vָkֶ֖sֶף vּnְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

25.hebrewText: וּתְכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ וְעִזִּֽים׃
25.englishText: blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, goats’ hair;
25.transliteration: vּtְkֵ֧lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֛ן vְtvֹlַ֥aַt shָׁnִ֖y vְshֵׁ֥shׁ vְaִzִּֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאׇדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים וַעֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּֽים׃
25.englishText: tanned ram skins,*tanned ram skins Others “rams’ skins dyed red.” dolphin*dolphin Or “dugong”; meaning of Hebrew taḥash uncertain. skins, and acacia wood;
25.transliteration: vְaֹrֹ֨t aֵylִ֧ם mְaׇdָּmִ֛yם vְaֹrֹ֥t tְּchָshִׁ֖yם vַaֲtsֵ֥y shִׁtִּֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: שֶׁ֖מֶן לַמָּאֹ֑ר בְּשָׂמִים֙ לְשֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
25.englishText: oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for the aromatic incense;
25.transliteration: shֶׁ֖mֶן lַmָּaֹ֑r bְּshָׂmִyם֙ lְshֶׁ֣mֶן hַmִּshְׁchָ֔h vְlִkְtֹ֖rֶt hַsַּmִּֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: אַבְנֵי־שֹׁ֕הַם וְאַבְנֵ֖י מִלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפֹ֖ד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
25.englishText: lapis lazuli*lapis lazuli Cf. Gen. 2.12 and note. and other stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
25.transliteration: aַbְnֵy־shֹׁ֕hַם vְaַbְnֵ֖y mִlֻּaִ֑yם lָaֵpֹ֖d vְlַchֹֽshֶׁן׃

25.hebrewText: וְעָ֥שׂוּ לִ֖י מִקְדָּ֑שׁ וְשָׁכַנְתִּ֖י בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
25.englishText: And let them make Me a sanctuary that I may dwell among them.
25.transliteration: vְaָ֥shׂvּ lִ֖y mִkְdָּ֑shׁ vְshָׁkַnְtִּ֖y bְּtvֹkָֽם׃

25.hebrewText: כְּכֹ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִי֙ מַרְאֶ֣ה אוֹתְךָ֔ אֵ֚ת תַּבְנִ֣ית הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת תַּבְנִ֣ית כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְכֵ֖ן תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
25.englishText: Exactly as I show you—the pattern of the Tabernacle and the pattern of all its furnishings—so shall you make it.
25.transliteration: kְּkֹ֗l aֲshֶׁ֤r aֲnִy֙ mַrְaֶ֣h avֹtְךָ֔ aֵ֚t tַּbְnִ֣yt hַmִּshְׁkָּ֔ן vְaֵ֖t tַּbְnִ֣yt kׇּl־kֵּlָ֑yv vְkֵ֖ן tַּaֲshֽׂvּ׃ {s}

25.hebrewText: וְעָשׂ֥וּ אֲר֖וֹן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֨יִם וָחֵ֜צִי אׇרְכּ֗וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה וָחֵ֙צִי֙ רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
25.englishText: They shall make an ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
25.transliteration: vְaָshׂ֥vּ aֲr֖vֹן aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם aַmָּtַ֨yִם vָchֵ֜tsִy aׇrְkּ֗vֹ vְaַmָּ֤h vָchֵ֙tsִy֙ rׇchְbּ֔vֹ vְaַmָּ֥h vָchֵ֖tsִy kֹmָtֽvֹ׃

25.hebrewText: וְצִפִּיתָ֤ אֹתוֹ֙ זָהָ֣ב טָה֔וֹר מִבַּ֥יִת וּמִח֖וּץ תְּצַפֶּ֑נּוּ וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ עָלָ֛יו זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
25.englishText: Overlay it with pure gold—overlay it inside and out—and make upon it a gold molding round about.
25.transliteration: vְtsִpִּytָ֤ aֹtvֹ֙ zָhָ֣b tָh֔vֹr mִbַּ֥yִt vּmִch֖vּץ tְּtsַpֶּ֑nּvּ vְaָshִׂ֧ytָ aָlָ֛yv zֵ֥r zָhָ֖b sָbִֽyb׃

25.hebrewText: וְיָצַ֣קְתָּ לּ֗וֹ אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב וְנָ֣תַתָּ֔ה עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פַּעֲמֹתָ֑יו וּשְׁתֵּ֣י טַבָּעֹ֗ת עַל־צַלְעוֹ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת וּשְׁתֵּי֙ טַבָּעֹ֔ת עַל־צַלְע֖וֹ הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
25.englishText: Cast four gold rings for it, to be attached to its four feet, two rings on one of its side walls and two on the other.
25.transliteration: vְyָtsַ֣kְtָּ lּ֗vֹ aַrְbַּa֙ tַbְּaֹ֣t zָhָ֔b vְnָ֣tַtָּ֔h aַ֖l aַrְbַּ֣a pַּaֲmֹtָ֑yv vּshְׁtֵּ֣y tַbָּaֹ֗t aַl־tsַlְavֹ֙ hָֽaֶchָ֔t vּshְׁtֵּy֙ tַbָּaֹ֔t aַl־tsַlְa֖vֹ hַshֵּׁnִֽyt׃

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בַדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
25.englishText: Make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold;
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ bַdֵּ֖y aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֹtָ֖ם zָhָֽb׃

25.hebrewText: וְהֵבֵאתָ֤ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ בַּטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֖ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הָאָרֹ֑ן לָשֵׂ֥את אֶת־הָאָרֹ֖ן בָּהֶֽם׃
25.englishText: then insert the poles into the rings on the side walls of the ark, for carrying the ark.
25.transliteration: vְhֵbֵatָ֤ aֶt־hַbַּdִּyם֙ bַּtַּbָּaֹ֔t aַ֖l tsַlְaֹ֣t hָaָrֹ֑ן lָshֵׂ֥at aֶt־hָaָrֹ֖ן bָּhֶֽם׃

25.hebrewText: בְּטַבְּעֹת֙ הָאָרֹ֔ן יִהְי֖וּ הַבַּדִּ֑ים לֹ֥א יָסֻ֖רוּ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
25.englishText: The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark: they shall not be removed from it.
25.transliteration: bְּtַbְּaֹt֙ hָaָrֹ֔ן yִhְy֖vּ hַbַּdִּ֑yם lֹ֥a yָsֻ֖rvּ mִmֶּֽnּvּ׃

25.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֖ אֶל־הָאָרֹ֑ן אֵ֚ת הָעֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶתֵּ֖ן אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
25.englishText: And deposit in the Ark [the tablets of] the Pact which I will give you.
25.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֖ aֶl־hָaָrֹ֑ן aֵ֚t hָaֵdֻ֔t aֲshֶׁ֥r aֶtֵּ֖ן aֵlֶֽyךָ׃

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ כַפֹּ֖רֶת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר אַמָּתַ֤יִם וָחֵ֙צִי֙ אׇרְכָּ֔הּ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי רׇחְבָּֽהּ׃
25.englishText: You shall make a cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ kַpֹּ֖rֶt zָhָ֣b tָh֑vֹr aַmָּtַ֤yִם vָchֵ֙tsִy֙ aׇrְkָּ֔hּ vְaַmָּ֥h vָchֵ֖tsִy rׇchְbָּֽhּ׃

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ שְׁנַ֥יִם כְּר��בִ֖ים זָהָ֑ב מִקְשָׁה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם מִשְּׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
25.englishText: Make two cherubim of gold—make them of hammered work—at the two ends of the cover.
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֛ytָ shְׁnַ֥yִם kְּr��bִ֖yם zָhָ֑b mִkְshָׁh֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h aֹtָ֔ם mִshְּׁnֵ֖y kְts֥vֹt hַkַּpֹּֽrֶt׃

25.hebrewText: וַ֠עֲשֵׂ֠ה כְּר֨וּב אֶחָ֤ד מִקָּצָה֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וּכְרוּב־אֶחָ֥ד מִקָּצָ֖ה מִזֶּ֑ה מִן־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֖ים עַל־שְׁנֵ֥י קְצוֹתָֽיו׃
25.englishText: Make one cherub at one end and the other cherub at the other end; of one piece with the cover shall you make the cherubim at its two ends.
25.transliteration: vַ֠aֲshֵׂ֠h kְּr֨vּb aֶchָ֤d mִkָּtsָh֙ mִzֶּ֔h vּkְrvּb־aֶchָ֥d mִkָּtsָ֖h mִzֶּ֑h mִן־hַkַּpֹּ֛rֶt tַּaֲshׂ֥vּ aֶt־hַkְּrֻbִ֖yם aַl־shְׁnֵ֥y kְtsvֹtָֽyv׃

25.hebrewText: וְהָי֣וּ הַכְּרֻבִים֩ פֹּרְשֵׂ֨י כְנָפַ֜יִם לְמַ֗עְלָה סֹכְכִ֤ים בְּכַנְפֵיהֶם֙ עַל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת וּפְנֵיהֶ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו אֶ֨ל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת יִהְי֖וּ פְּנֵ֥י הַכְּרֻבִֽים׃
25.englishText: The cherubim shall have their wings spread out above, shielding the cover with their wings. They shall confront each other, the faces of the cherubim being turned toward the cover.
25.transliteration: vְhָy֣vּ hַkְּrֻbִyם֩ pֹּrְshֵׂ֨y kְnָpַ֜yִם lְmַ֗aְlָh sֹkְkִ֤yם bְּkַnְpֵyhֶם֙ aַl־hַkַּpֹּ֔rֶt vּpְnֵyhֶ֖ם aִ֣yshׁ aֶl־aָchִ֑yv aֶ֨l־hַkַּpֹּ֔rֶt yִhְy֖vּ pְּnֵ֥y hַkְּrֻbִֽyם׃

25.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֧ אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת עַל־הָאָרֹ֖ן מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְאֶל־הָ֣אָרֹ֔ן תִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶתֵּ֖ן אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
25.englishText: Place the cover on top of the Ark, after depositing inside the Ark the Pact that I will give you.
25.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֧ aֶt־hַkַּpֹּ֛rֶt aַl־hָaָrֹ֖ן mִlְmָ֑aְlָh vְaֶl־hָ֣aָrֹ֔ן tִּtֵּן֙ aֶt־hָ֣aֵdֻ֔t aֲshֶׁ֥r aֶtֵּ֖ן aֵlֶֽyךָ׃

25.hebrewText: וְנוֹעַדְתִּ֣י לְךָ֮ שָׁם֒ וְדִבַּרְתִּ֨י אִתְּךָ֜ מֵעַ֣ל הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת מִבֵּין֙ שְׁנֵ֣י הַכְּרֻבִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵדֻ֑ת אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֧ר אֲצַוֶּ֛ה אוֹתְךָ֖ אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
25.englishText: There I will meet with you, and I will impart to you—from above the cover, from between the two cherubim that are on top of the Ark of the Pact—all that I will command you concerning the Israelite people.
25.transliteration: vְnvֹaַdְtִּ֣y lְךָ֮ shָׁם֒ vְdִbַּrְtִּ֨y aִtְּךָ֜ mֵaַ֣l hַkַּpֹּ֗rֶt mִbֵּyן֙ shְׁnֵ֣y hַkְּrֻbִ֔yם aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־aֲr֣vֹן hָaֵdֻ֑t aֵ֣t kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֧r aֲtsַvֶּ֛h avֹtְךָ֖ aֶl־bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃ {p}

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ שֻׁלְחָ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֤יִם אׇרְכּוֹ֙ וְאַמָּ֣ה רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
25.englishText: You shall make a table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ shֻׁlְchָ֖ן aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם aַmָּtַ֤yִם aׇrְkּvֹ֙ vְaַmָּ֣h rׇchְbּ֔vֹ vְaַmָּ֥h vָchֵ֖tsִy kֹmָtֽvֹ׃

25.hebrewText: וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹת֖וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לּ֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
25.englishText: Overlay it with pure gold, and make a gold molding around it.
25.transliteration: vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֹt֖vֹ zָhָ֣b tָh֑vֹr vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ lּ֛vֹ zֵ֥r zָhָ֖b sָbִֽyb׃

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֨יתָ לּ֥וֹ מִסְגֶּ֛רֶת טֹ֖פַח סָבִ֑יב וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ זֵר־זָהָ֛ב לְמִסְגַּרְתּ֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
25.englishText: Make a rim of a hand’s breadth around it, and make a gold molding for its rim round about.
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֨ytָ lּ֥vֹ mִsְgֶּ֛rֶt tֹ֖pַch sָbִ֑yb vְaָshִׂ֧ytָ zֵr־zָhָ֛b lְmִsְgַּrְtּ֖vֹ sָbִֽyb׃

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ אַרְבַּ֖ע טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב וְנָתַתָּ֙ אֶת־הַטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע הַפֵּאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאַרְבַּ֥ע רַגְלָֽיו׃
25.englishText: Make four gold rings for it, and attach the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ lּ֔vֹ aַrְbַּ֖a tַbְּaֹ֣t zָhָ֑b vְnָtַtָּ֙ aֶt־hַtַּbָּaֹ֔t aַ֚l aַrְbַּ֣a hַpֵּaֹ֔t aֲshֶׁ֖r lְaַrְbַּ֥a rַgְlָֽyv׃

25.hebrewText: לְעֻמַּת֙ הַמִּסְגֶּ֔רֶת תִּהְיֶ֖יןָ הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
25.englishText: The rings shall be next to the rim, as holders for poles to carry the table.
25.transliteration: lְaֻmַּt֙ hַmִּsְgֶּ֔rֶt tִּhְyֶ֖yןָ hַtַּbָּaֹ֑t lְbָtִּ֣yם lְbַdִּ֔yם lָshֵׂ֖at aֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָֽן׃

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְנִשָּׂא־בָ֖ם אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
25.englishText: Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold; by these the table shall be carried.
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ aֶt־hַbַּdִּyם֙ aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֔yם vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֹtָ֖ם zָhָ֑b vְnִshָּׂa־bָ֖ם aֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָֽן׃

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֨יתָ קְּעָרֹתָ֜יו וְכַפֹּתָ֗יו וּקְשׂוֹתָיו֙ וּמְנַקִּיֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻסַּ֖ךְ בָּהֵ֑ן זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
25.englishText: Make its bowls, ladles, jars and jugs with which to offer libations; make them of pure gold.
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֨ytָ kְּaָrֹtָ֜yv vְkַpֹּtָ֗yv vּkְshׂvֹtָyv֙ vּmְnַkִּyֹּtָ֔yv aֲshֶׁ֥r yֻsַּ֖ךְ bָּhֵ֑ן zָhָ֥b tָh֖vֹr tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtָֽם׃

25.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֧ עַֽל־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֛ן לֶ֥חֶם פָּנִ֖ים לְפָנַ֥י תָּמִֽיד׃ {פ}
25.englishText: And on the table you shall set the bread of display, to be before Me always.
25.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֧ aַֽl־hַshֻּׁlְchָ֛ן lֶ֥chֶם pָּnִ֖yם lְpָnַ֥y tָּmִֽyd׃ {p}

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מְנֹרַ֖ת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר מִקְשָׁ֞ה תֵּעָשֶׂ֤ה*(בספרי ספרד ואשכנז תֵּיעָשֶׂ֤ה) הַמְּנוֹרָה֙ יְרֵכָ֣הּ וְקָנָ֔הּ גְּבִיעֶ֛יהָ כַּפְתֹּרֶ֥יהָ וּפְרָחֶ֖יהָ מִמֶּ֥נָּה יִהְיֽוּ׃
25.englishText: You shall make a lampstand of pure gold; the lampstand shall be made of hammered work; its base and its shaft, its cups, calyxes, and petals shall be of one piece.
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ mְnֹrַ֖t zָhָ֣b tָh֑vֹr mִkְshָׁ֞h tֵּaָshֶׂ֤h*(bspry sprd vashknz tֵּyaָshֶׂ֤h) hַmְּnvֹrָh֙ yְrֵkָ֣hּ vְkָnָ֔hּ gְּbִyaֶ֛yhָ kַּpְtֹּrֶ֥yhָ vּpְrָchֶ֖yhָ mִmֶּ֥nָּh yִhְyֽvּ׃

25.hebrewText: וְשִׁשָּׁ֣ה קָנִ֔ים יֹצְאִ֖ים מִצִּדֶּ֑יהָ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה ׀ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֗ה מִצִּדָּהּ֙ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֔ה מִצִּדָּ֖הּ הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
25.englishText: Six branches shall issue from its sides; three branches from one side of the lampstand and three branches from the other side of the lampstand.
25.transliteration: vְshִׁshָּׁ֣h kָnִ֔yם yֹtsְaִ֖yם mִtsִּdֶּ֑yhָ shְׁlֹshָׁ֣h ׀ kְnֵ֣y mְnֹrָ֗h mִtsִּdָּhּ֙ hָaֶchָ֔d vּshְׁlֹshָׁh֙ kְnֵ֣y mְnֹrָ֔h mִtsִּdָּ֖hּ hַshֵּׁnִֽy׃

25.hebrewText: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְ֠בִעִ֠ים מְֽשֻׁקָּדִ֞ים בַּקָּנֶ֣ה הָאֶחָד֮ כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפֶ֒רַח֒ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְבִעִ֗ים מְשֻׁקָּדִ֛ים בַּקָּנֶ֥ה הָאֶחָ֖ד כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפָ֑רַח כֵּ֚ן לְשֵׁ֣שֶׁת הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִן־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃
25.englishText: On one branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals, and on the next branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.
25.transliteration: shְׁlֹshָׁ֣h gְ֠bִaִ֠yם mְֽshֻׁkָּdִ֞yם bַּkָּnֶ֣h hָaֶchָd֮ kַּpְtֹּ֣r vָpֶ֒rַch֒ vּshְׁlֹshָׁ֣h gְbִaִ֗yם mְshֻׁkָּdִ֛yם bַּkָּnֶ֥h hָaֶchָ֖d kַּpְtֹּ֣r vָpָ֑rַch kֵּ֚ן lְshֵׁ֣shֶׁt hַkָּnִ֔yם hַyֹּtsְaִ֖yם mִן־hַmְּnֹrָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: וּבַמְּנֹרָ֖ה אַרְבָּעָ֣ה גְבִעִ֑ים מְשֻׁ֨קָּדִ֔ים כַּפְתֹּרֶ֖יהָ וּפְרָחֶֽיהָ׃
25.englishText: And on the lampstand itself there shall be four cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals:
25.transliteration: vּbַmְּnֹrָ֖h aַrְbָּaָ֣h gְbִaִ֑yם mְshֻׁ֨kָּdִ֔yם kַּpְtֹּrֶ֖yhָ vּpְrָchֶֽyhָ׃

25.hebrewText: וְכַפְתֹּ֡ר תַּ֩חַת֩ שְׁנֵ֨י הַקָּנִ֜ים מִמֶּ֗נָּה וְכַפְתֹּר֙ תַּ֣חַת שְׁנֵ֤י הַקָּנִים֙ מִמֶּ֔נָּה וְכַפְתֹּ֕ר תַּחַת־שְׁנֵ֥י הַקָּנִ֖ים מִמֶּ֑נָּה לְשֵׁ֙שֶׁת֙ הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִן־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃
25.englishText: a calyx, of one piece with it, under a pair of branches; and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the second pair of branches, and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the last pair of branches; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.
25.transliteration: vְkַpְtֹּ֡r tַּ֩chַt֩ shְׁnֵ֨y hַkָּnִ֜yם mִmֶּ֗nָּh vְkַpְtֹּr֙ tַּ֣chַt shְׁnֵ֤y hַkָּnִyם֙ mִmֶּ֔nָּh vְkַpְtֹּ֕r tַּchַt־shְׁnֵ֥y hַkָּnִ֖yם mִmֶּ֑nָּh lְshֵׁ֙shֶׁt֙ hַkָּnִ֔yם hַyֹּtsְaִ֖yם mִן־hַmְּnֹrָֽh׃

25.hebrewText: כַּפְתֹּרֵיהֶ֥ם וּקְנֹתָ֖ם מִמֶּ֣נָּה יִהְי֑וּ כֻּלָּ֛הּ מִקְשָׁ֥ה אַחַ֖ת זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
25.englishText: Their calyxes and their stems shall be of one piece with it, the whole of it a single hammered piece of pure gold.
25.transliteration: kַּpְtֹּrֵyhֶ֥ם vּkְnֹtָ֖ם mִmֶּ֣nָּh yִhְy֑vּ kֻּlָּ֛hּ mִkְshָׁ֥h aַchַ֖t zָhָ֥b tָhֽvֹr׃

25.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֖יהָ שִׁבְעָ֑ה וְהֶֽעֱלָה֙ אֶת־נֵ֣רֹתֶ֔יהָ וְהֵאִ֖יר עַל־עֵ֥בֶר פָּנֶֽיהָ׃
25.englishText: Make its seven lamps—the lamps shall be so mounted as to give the light on its front side—
25.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ aֶt־nֵrֹtֶ֖yhָ shִׁbְaָ֑h vְhֶֽaֱlָh֙ aֶt־nֵ֣rֹtֶ֔yhָ vְhֵaִ֖yr aַl־aֵ֥bֶr pָּnֶֽyhָ׃

25.hebrewText: וּמַלְקָחֶ֥יהָ וּמַחְתֹּתֶ֖יהָ זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
25.englishText: and its tongs and fire pans of pure gold.
25.transliteration: vּmַlְkָchֶ֥yhָ vּmַchְtֹּtֶ֖yhָ zָhָ֥b tָhֽvֹr׃

25.hebrewText: כִּכָּ֛ר זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑הּ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
25.englishText: It shall be made, with all these furnishings, out of a talent of pure gold.
25.transliteration: kִּkָּ֛r zָhָ֥b tָh֖vֹr yַaֲshֶׂ֣h aֹtָ֑hּ aֵ֥t kׇּl־hַkֵּlִ֖yם hָaֵֽlֶּh׃

25.hebrewText: וּרְאֵ֖ה וַעֲשֵׂ֑ה בְּתַ֨בְנִיתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה מׇרְאֶ֖ה בָּהָֽר׃ {ס}
25.englishText: Note well, and follow the patterns for them that are being shown you on the mountain.
25.transliteration: vּrְaֵ֖h vַaֲshֵׂ֑h bְּtַ֨bְnִytָ֔ם aֲshֶׁr־aַtָּ֥h mׇrְaֶ֖h bָּhָֽr׃ {s}

26.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֥ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עֶ֣שֶׂר יְרִיעֹ֑ת שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֗ר וּתְכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י כְּרֻבִ֛ים מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֖ב תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
26.englishText: As for the tabernacle,*tabernacle Heb. mishkan refers here specifically to the lowest of the covers of the Tabernacle, and so its rendering is not capitalized. make it of ten strips of cloth; make these of fine twisted linen, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, with a design of cherubim worked into them.
26.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֥ן tַּaֲshֶׂ֖h aֶ֣shֶׂr yְrִyaֹ֑t shֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֗r vּtְkֵ֤lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָן֙ vְtֹlַ֣aַt shָׁnִ֔y kְּrֻbִ֛yם mַaֲshֵׂ֥h chֹshֵׁ֖b tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtָֽם׃

26.hebrewText: אֹ֣רֶךְ ׀ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁמֹנֶ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לְכׇל־הַיְרִיעֹֽת׃
26.englishText: The length of each cloth shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, all the cloths to have the same measurements.
26.transliteration: aֹ֣rֶךְ ׀ hַyְrִyaָ֣h hָֽaַchַ֗t shְׁmֹnֶ֤h vְaֶshְׂrִyם֙ bָּֽaַmָּ֔h vְrֹ֙chַb֙ aַrְbַּ֣a bָּaַmָּ֔h hַyְrִyaָ֖h hָaֶchָ֑t mִdָּ֥h aַchַ֖t lְkׇl־hַyְrִyaֹֽt׃

26.hebrewText: חֲמֵ֣שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֗ת תִּֽהְיֶ֙יןָ֙ חֹֽבְרֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָ֑הּ וְחָמֵ֤שׁ יְרִיעֹת֙ חֹֽבְרֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָֽהּ׃
26.englishText: Five of the cloths shall be joined to one another, and the other five cloths shall be joined to one another.
26.transliteration: chֲmֵ֣shׁ hַyְrִyaֹ֗t tִּֽhְyֶ֙yןָ֙ chֹֽbְrֹ֔t aִshָּׁ֖h aֶl־aֲchֹtָ֑hּ vְchָmֵ֤shׁ yְrִyaֹt֙ chֹֽbְrֹ֔t aִshָּׁ֖h aֶl־aֲchֹtָֽhּ׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ לֻֽלְאֹ֣ת תְּכֵ֗לֶת עַ֣ל שְׂפַ֤ת הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָאֶחָ֔ת מִקָּצָ֖ה בַּחֹבָ֑רֶת וְכֵ֤ן תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ בִּשְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַקִּ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה בַּמַּחְבֶּ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
26.englishText: Make loops of blue wool on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set; and do likewise on the edge of the outermost cloth of the other set:
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֜ytָ lֻֽlְaֹ֣t tְּkֵ֗lֶt aַ֣l shְׂpַ֤t hַyְrִyaָh֙ hָaֶchָ֔t mִkָּtsָ֖h bַּchֹbָ֑rֶt vְkֵ֤ן tַּaֲshֶׂh֙ bִּshְׂpַ֣t hַyְrִyaָ֔h hַkִּ֣ytsvֹnָ֔h bַּmַּchְbֶּ֖rֶt hַshֵּׁnִֽyt׃

26.hebrewText: חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת תַּעֲשֶׂה֮ בַּיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָת֒ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַיְרִיעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּמַּחְבֶּ֣רֶת הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית מַקְבִּילֹת֙ הַלֻּ֣לָאֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָֽהּ׃
26.englishText: make fifty loops on the one cloth, and fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set, the loops to be opposite one another.
26.transliteration: chֲmִshִּׁ֣yם lֻֽlָaֹ֗t tַּaֲshֶׂh֮ bַּyְrִyaָ֣h hָaֶchָt֒ vַchֲmִshִּׁ֣yם lֻֽlָaֹ֗t tַּaֲshֶׂh֙ bִּkְtsֵ֣h hַyְrִyaָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֖r bַּmַּchְbֶּ֣rֶt hַshֵּׁnִ֑yt mַkְbִּylֹt֙ hַlֻּ֣lָaֹ֔t aִshָּׁ֖h aֶl־aֲchֹtָֽhּ׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים קַרְסֵ֣י זָהָ֑ב וְחִבַּרְתָּ֨ אֶת־הַיְרִיעֹ֜ת אִשָּׁ֤ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָהּ֙ בַּקְּרָסִ֔ים וְהָיָ֥ה הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן אֶחָֽד׃
26.englishText: And make fifty gold clasps, and couple the cloths to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle becomes one whole.
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֕ytָ chֲmִshִּׁ֖yם kַrְsֵ֣y zָhָ֑b vְchִbַּrְtָּ֨ aֶt־hַyְrִyaֹ֜t aִshָּׁ֤h aֶl־aֲchֹtָhּ֙ bַּkְּrָsִ֔yם vְhָyָ֥h hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן aֶchָֽd׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ יְרִיעֹ֣ת עִזִּ֔ים לְאֹ֖הֶל עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עַשְׁתֵּי־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה יְרִיעֹ֖ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
26.englishText: You shall then make cloths of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; make the cloths eleven in number.
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֙ytָ֙ yְrִyaֹ֣t aִzִּ֔yם lְaֹ֖hֶl aַl־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן aַshְׁtֵּy־aֶshְׂrֵ֥h yְrִyaֹ֖t tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtָֽם׃

26.hebrewText: אֹ֣רֶךְ ׀ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֣ה אַחַ֔ת לְעַשְׁתֵּ֥י עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה יְרִיעֹֽת׃
26.englishText: The length of each cloth shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, the eleven cloths to have the same measurements.
26.transliteration: aֹ֣rֶךְ ׀ hַyְrִyaָ֣h hָֽaַchַ֗t shְׁlֹshִׁyם֙ bָּֽaַmָּ֔h vְrֹ֙chַb֙ aַrְbַּ֣a bָּaַmָּ֔h hַyְrִyaָ֖h hָaֶchָ֑t mִdָּ֣h aַchַ֔t lְaַshְׁtֵּ֥y aֶshְׂrֵ֖h yְrִyaֹֽt׃

26.hebrewText: וְחִבַּרְתָּ֞ אֶת־חֲמֵ֤שׁ הַיְרִיעֹת֙ לְבָ֔ד וְאֶת־שֵׁ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָ֑ד וְכָפַלְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔ית אֶל־מ֖וּל פְּנֵ֥י הָאֹֽהֶל׃
26.englishText: Join five of the cloths by themselves, and the other six cloths by themselves; and fold over the sixth cloth at the front of the tent.
26.transliteration: vְchִbַּrְtָּ֞ aֶt־chֲmֵ֤shׁ hַyְrִyaֹt֙ lְbָ֔d vְaֶt־shֵׁ֥shׁ hַyְrִyaֹ֖t lְbָ֑d vְkָpַlְtָּ֙ aֶt־hַyְrִyaָ֣h hַshִּׁshִּׁ֔yt aֶl־m֖vּl pְּnֵ֥y hָaֹֽhֶl׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת עַ֣ל שְׂפַ֤ת הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת הַקִּיצֹנָ֖ה בַּחֹבָ֑רֶת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת עַ֚ל שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַחֹבֶ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
26.englishText: Make fifty loops on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and fifty loops on the edge of the cloth of the other set.
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֜ytָ chֲmִshִּׁ֣yם lֻֽlָaֹ֗t aַ֣l shְׂpַ֤t hַyְrִyaָh֙ hָֽaֶchָ֔t hַkִּytsֹnָ֖h bַּchֹbָ֑rֶt vַchֲmִshִּׁ֣yם lֻֽlָaֹ֗t aַ֚l shְׂpַ֣t hַyְrִyaָ֔h hַchֹbֶ֖rֶt hַshֵּׁnִֽyt׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ קַרְסֵ֥י נְחֹ֖שֶׁת חֲמִשִּׁ֑ים וְהֵבֵאתָ֤ אֶת־הַקְּרָסִים֙ בַּלֻּ֣לָאֹ֔ת וְחִבַּרְתָּ֥ אֶת־הָאֹ֖הֶל וְהָיָ֥ה אֶחָֽד׃
26.englishText: Make fifty copper clasps, and fit the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together so that it becomes one whole.
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֛ytָ kַrְsֵ֥y nְchֹ֖shֶׁt chֲmִshִּׁ֑yם vְhֵbֵatָ֤ aֶt־hַkְּrָsִyם֙ bַּlֻּ֣lָaֹ֔t vְchִbַּrְtָּ֥ aֶt־hָaֹ֖hֶl vְhָyָ֥h aֶchָֽd׃

26.hebrewText: וְסֶ֙רַח֙ הָעֹדֵ֔ף בִּירִיעֹ֖ת הָאֹ֑הֶל חֲצִ֤י הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָעֹדֶ֔פֶת תִּסְרַ֕ח עַ֖ל אֲחֹרֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
26.englishText: As for the overlapping excess of the cloths of the tent, the extra half-cloth shall overlap the back of the tabernacle,
26.transliteration: vְsֶ֙rַch֙ hָaֹdֵ֔ף bִּyrִyaֹ֖t hָaֹ֑hֶl chֲtsִ֤y hַyְrִyaָh֙ hָaֹdֶ֔pֶt tִּsְrַ֕ch aַ֖l aֲchֹrֵ֥y hַmִּshְׁkָּֽן׃

26.hebrewText: וְהָאַמָּ֨ה מִזֶּ֜ה וְהָאַמָּ֤ה מִזֶּה֙ בָּעֹדֵ֔ף בְּאֹ֖רֶךְ יְרִיעֹ֣ת הָאֹ֑הֶל יִהְיֶ֨ה סָר֜וּחַ עַל־צִדֵּ֧י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן מִזֶּ֥ה וּמִזֶּ֖ה לְכַסֹּתֽוֹ׃
26.englishText: while the extra cubit at either end of each length of tent cloth shall hang down to the bottom of the two sides of the tabernacle and cover it.
26.transliteration: vְhָaַmָּ֨h mִzֶּ֜h vְhָaַmָּ֤h mִzֶּh֙ bָּaֹdֵ֔ף bְּaֹ֖rֶךְ yְrִyaֹ֣t hָaֹ֑hֶl yִhְyֶ֨h sָr֜vּchַ aַl־tsִdֵּ֧y hַmִּshְׁkָּ֛ן mִzֶּ֥h vּmִzֶּ֖h lְkַsֹּtֽvֹ׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ מִכְסֶה֙ לָאֹ֔הֶל עֹרֹ֥ת אֵילִ֖ם מְאׇדָּמִ֑ים וּמִכְסֵ֛ה עֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃ {פ}
26.englishText: And make for the tent a covering of tanned ram skins, and a covering of dolphin skins above.
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ mִkְsֶh֙ lָaֹ֔hֶl aֹrֹ֥t aֵylִ֖ם mְaׇdָּmִ֑yם vּmִkְsֵ֛h aֹrֹ֥t tְּchָshִׁ֖yם mִlְmָֽaְlָh׃ {p}

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים עֹמְדִֽים׃
26.englishText: You shall make the planks for the Tabernacle of acacia wood, upright.
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ aֶt־hַkְּrָshִׁ֖yם lַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן aֲtsֵ֥y shִׁtִּ֖yם aֹmְdִֽyם׃

26.hebrewText: עֶ֥שֶׂר אַמּ֖וֹת אֹ֣רֶךְ הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ וְאַמָּה֙ וַחֲצִ֣י הָֽאַמָּ֔ה רֹ֖חַב הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
26.englishText: The length of each plank shall be ten cubits and the width of each plank a cubit and a half.
26.transliteration: aֶ֥shֶׂr aַmּ֖vֹt aֹ֣rֶךְ hַkָּ֑rֶshׁ vְaַmָּh֙ vַchֲtsִ֣y hָֽaַmָּ֔h rֹ֖chַb hַkֶּ֥rֶshׁ hָaֶchָֽd׃

26.hebrewText: שְׁתֵּ֣י יָד֗וֹת לַקֶּ֙רֶשׁ֙ הָאֶחָ֔ד מְשֻׁ֨לָּבֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָ֑הּ כֵּ֣ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל קַרְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
26.englishText: Each plank shall have two tenons, parallel*parallel Meaning of Heb. meshullaboth uncertain. to each other; do the same with all the planks of the Tabernacle.
26.transliteration: shְׁtֵּ֣y yָd֗vֹt lַkֶּ֙rֶshׁ֙ hָaֶchָ֔d mְshֻׁ֨lָּbֹ֔t aִshָּׁ֖h aֶl־aֲchֹtָ֑hּ kֵּ֣ן tַּaֲshֶׂ֔h lְkֹ֖l kַrְshֵׁ֥y hַmִּshְׁkָּֽן׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֶשְׂרִ֣ים קֶ֔רֶשׁ לִפְאַ֖ת נֶ֥גְבָּה תֵימָֽנָה׃
26.englishText: Of the planks of the Tabernacle, make twenty planks on the south*south Heb. uses two terms for “south,” one after the other. side:
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ aֶt־hַkְּrָshִׁ֖yם lַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן aֶshְׂrִ֣yם kֶ֔rֶshׁ lִpְaַ֖t nֶ֥gְbָּh tֵymָֽnָh׃

26.hebrewText: וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אַדְנֵי־כֶ֔סֶף תַּעֲשֶׂ֕ה תַּ֖חַת עֶשְׂרִ֣ים הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ שְׁנֵ֨י אֲדָנִ֜ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֤רֶשׁ הָאֶחָד֙ לִשְׁתֵּ֣י יְדֹתָ֔יו וּשְׁנֵ֧י אֲדָנִ֛ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֖ד לִשְׁתֵּ֥י יְדֹתָֽיו׃
26.englishText: making forty silver sockets under the twenty planks, two sockets under the one plank for its two tenons and two sockets under each following plank for its two tenons;
26.transliteration: vְaַrְbָּaִyם֙ aַdְnֵy־kֶ֔sֶף tַּaֲshֶׂ֕h tַּ֖chַt aֶshְׂrִ֣yם hַkָּ֑rֶshׁ shְׁnֵ֨y aֲdָnִ֜yם tַּֽchַt־hַkֶּ֤rֶshׁ hָaֶchָd֙ lִshְׁtֵּ֣y yְdֹtָ֔yv vּshְׁnֵ֧y aֲdָnִ֛yם tַּֽchַt־hַkֶּ֥rֶshׁ hָaֶchָ֖d lִshְׁtֵּ֥y yְdֹtָֽyv׃

26.hebrewText: וּלְצֶ֧לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית לִפְאַ֣ת צָפ֑וֹן עֶשְׂרִ֖ים קָֽרֶשׁ׃
26.englishText: and for the other side wall of the Tabernacle, on the north side, twenty planks,
26.transliteration: vּlְtsֶ֧lַa hַmִּshְׁkָּ֛ן hַshֵּׁnִ֖yt lִpְaַ֣t tsָp֑vֹן aֶshְׂrִ֖yם kָֽrֶshׁ׃

26.hebrewText: וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
26.englishText: with their forty silver sockets, two sockets under the one plank and two sockets under each following plank.
26.transliteration: vְaַrְbָּaִ֥yם aַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם kָּ֑sֶף shְׁnֵ֣y aֲdָnִ֗yם tַּ֚chַt hַkֶּ֣rֶshׁ hָֽaֶchָ֔d vּshְׁnֵ֣y aֲdָnִ֔yם tַּ֖chַt hַkֶּ֥rֶshׁ hָaֶchָֽd׃

26.hebrewText: וּֽלְיַרְכְּתֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יָ֑מָּה תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה שִׁשָּׁ֥ה קְרָשִֽׁים׃
26.englishText: And for the rear of the Tabernacle, to the west, make six planks;
26.transliteration: vּֽlְyַrְkְּtֵ֥y hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן yָ֑mָּh tַּaֲshֶׂ֖h shִׁshָּׁ֥h kְrָshִֽׁyם׃

26.hebrewText: וּשְׁנֵ֤י קְרָשִׁים֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה לִמְקֻצְעֹ֖ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן בַּיַּרְכָתָֽיִם׃
26.englishText: and make two planks for the corners of the Tabernacle at the rear.
26.transliteration: vּshְׁnֵ֤y kְrָshִׁyם֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֔h lִmְkֻtsְaֹ֖t hַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן bַּyַּrְkָtָֽyִם׃

26.hebrewText: וְיִֽהְי֣וּ תֹֽאֲמִם֮ מִלְּמַ֒טָּה֒ וְיַחְדָּ֗ו יִהְי֤וּ תַמִּים֙ עַל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ אֶל־הַטַּבַּ֖עַת הָאֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֚ן יִהְיֶ֣ה לִשְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם לִשְׁנֵ֥י הַמִּקְצֹעֹ֖ת יִהְיֽוּ׃
26.englishText: They shall match at the bottom, and terminate alike at the top inside one ring;*They shall match … inside one ring Meaning of Heb. uncertain. thus shall it be with both of them: they shall form the two corners.
26.transliteration: vְyִֽhְy֣vּ tֹֽaֲmִם֮ mִlְּmַ֒tָּh֒ vְyַchְdָּ֗v yִhְy֤vּ tַmִּyם֙ aַl־rֹashׁ֔vֹ aֶl־hַtַּbַּ֖aַt hָaֶchָ֑t kֵּ֚ן yִhְyֶ֣h lִshְׁnֵyhֶ֔ם lִshְׁnֵ֥y hַmִּkְtsֹaֹ֖t yִhְyֽvּ׃

26.hebrewText: וְהָיוּ֙ שְׁמֹנָ֣ה קְרָשִׁ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אֲדָנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
26.englishText: Thus there shall be eight planks with their sockets of silver: sixteen sockets, two sockets under the first plank, and two sockets under each of the other planks.
26.transliteration: vְhָyvּ֙ shְׁmֹnָ֣h kְrָshִׁ֔yם vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֣ם kֶּ֔sֶף shִׁshָּׁ֥h aָshָׂ֖r aֲdָnִ֑yם shְׁnֵ֣y aֲdָnִ֗yם tַּ֚chַt hַkֶּ֣rֶshׁ hָaֶchָ֔d vּshְׁnֵ֣y aֲdָnִ֔yם tַּ֖chַt hַkֶּ֥rֶshׁ hָaֶchָֽd׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בְרִיחִ֖ם עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חֲמִשָּׁ֕ה לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הָאֶחָֽד׃
26.englishText: You shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the planks of the one side wall of the Tabernacle,
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ bְrִychִ֖ם aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם chֲmִshָּׁ֕h lְkַrְshֵׁ֥y tsֶֽlַa־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן hָaֶchָֽd׃

26.hebrewText: וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְ��ִיחִ֔ם לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְרִיחִ֗ם לְקַרְשֵׁי֙ צֶ֣לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן לַיַּרְכָתַ֖יִם יָֽמָּה׃
26.englishText: five bars for the planks of the other side wall of the Tabernacle, and five bars for the planks of the wall of the Tabernacle at the rear to the west.
26.transliteration: vַchֲmִshָּׁ֣h bְ��ִychִ֔ם lְkַrְshֵׁ֥y tsֶֽlַa־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן hַshֵּׁnִ֑yt vַchֲmִshָּׁ֣h bְrִychִ֗ם lְkַrְshֵׁy֙ tsֶ֣lַa hַmִּshְׁkָּ֔ן lַyַּrְkָtַ֖yִם yָֽmָּh׃

26.hebrewText: וְהַבְּרִ֥יחַ הַתִּיכֹ֖ן בְּת֣וֹךְ הַקְּרָשִׁ֑ים מַבְרִ֕חַ מִן־הַקָּצֶ֖ה אֶל־הַקָּצֶֽה׃
26.englishText: The center bar halfway up the planks shall run from end to end.
26.transliteration: vְhַbְּrִ֥ychַ hַtִּykֹ֖ן bְּt֣vֹךְ hַkְּrָshִׁ֑yם mַbְrִ֕chַ mִן־hַkָּtsֶ֖h aֶl־hַkָּtsֶֽh׃

26.hebrewText: וְֽאֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֞ים תְּצַפֶּ֣ה זָהָ֗ב וְאֶת־טַבְּעֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה זָהָ֔ב בָּתִּ֖ים לַבְּרִיחִ֑ם וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֶת־הַבְּרִיחִ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
26.englishText: Overlay the planks with gold, and make their rings of gold, as holders for the bars; and overlay the bars with gold.
26.transliteration: vְֽaֶt־hַkְּrָshִׁ֞yם tְּtsַpֶּ֣h zָhָ֗b vְaֶt־tַbְּaֹֽtֵyhֶם֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h zָhָ֔b bָּtִּ֖yם lַbְּrִychִ֑ם vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֶt־hַbְּrִychִ֖ם zָhָֽb׃

26.hebrewText: וַהֲקֵמֹתָ֖ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן כְּמִ֨שְׁפָּט֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הׇרְאֵ֖יתָ בָּהָֽר׃ {ס}
26.englishText: Then set up the Tabernacle according to the manner of it that you were shown on the mountain.
26.transliteration: vַhֲkֵmֹtָ֖ aֶt־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן kְּmִ֨shְׁpָּt֔vֹ aֲshֶׁ֥r hׇrְaֵ֖ytָ bָּhָֽr׃ {s}

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ פָרֹ֗כֶת תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֛ב יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖הּ כְּרֻבִֽים׃
26.englishText: You shall make a curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen; it shall have a design of cherubim worked into it.
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ pָrֹ֗kֶt tְּkֵ֧lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֛ן vְtvֹlַ֥aַt shָׁnִ֖y vְshֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֑r mַaֲshֵׂ֥h chֹshֵׁ֛b yַaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtָ֖hּ kְּrֻbִֽyם׃

26.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֗הּ עַל־אַרְבָּעָה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים מְצֻפִּ֣ים זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב עַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה אַדְנֵי־כָֽסֶף׃
26.englishText: Hang it upon four posts of acacia wood overlaid with gold and having hooks of gold, [set] in four sockets of silver.
26.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֣h aֹtָ֗hּ aַl־aַrְbָּaָh֙ aַmּvּdֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֔yם mְtsֻpִּ֣yם zָhָ֔b vָvֵyhֶ֖ם zָhָ֑b aַl־aַrְbָּaָ֖h aַdְnֵy־kָֽsֶף׃

26.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֶת־הַפָּרֹ֘כֶת֮ תַּ֣חַת הַקְּרָסִים֒ וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ שָׁ֙מָּה֙ מִבֵּ֣ית לַפָּרֹ֔כֶת אֵ֖ת אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵד֑וּת וְהִבְדִּילָ֤ה הַפָּרֹ֙כֶת֙ לָכֶ֔ם בֵּ֣ין הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וּבֵ֖ין קֹ֥דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
26.englishText: Hang the curtain under the clasps, and carry the Ark of the Pact there, behind the curtain, so that the curtain shall serve you as a partition between the Holy and the Holy of Holies.
26.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֣h aֶt־hַpָּrֹ֘kֶt֮ tַּ֣chַt hַkְּrָsִyם֒ vְhֵbֵatָ֥ shָׁ֙mָּh֙ mִbֵּ֣yt lַpָּrֹ֔kֶt aֵ֖t aֲr֣vֹן hָaֵd֑vּt vְhִbְdִּylָ֤h hַpָּrֹ֙kֶt֙ lָkֶ֔ם bֵּ֣yן hַkֹּ֔dֶshׁ vּbֵ֖yן kֹ֥dֶshׁ hַkֳּdָshִֽׁyם׃

26.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֙ אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת עַ֖ל אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵדֻ֑ת בְּקֹ֖דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
26.englishText: Place the cover upon the Ark of the Pact in the Holy of Holies.
26.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֙ aֶt־hַkַּpֹּ֔rֶt aַ֖l aֲr֣vֹן hָaֵdֻ֑t bְּkֹ֖dֶshׁ hַkֳּdָshִֽׁyם׃

26.hebrewText: וְשַׂמְתָּ֤ אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ מִח֣וּץ לַפָּרֹ֔כֶת וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָה֙ נֹ֣כַח הַשֻּׁלְחָ֔ן עַ֛ל צֶ֥לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן תֵּימָ֑נָה וְהַ֨שֻּׁלְחָ֔ן תִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־צֶ֥לַע צָפֽוֹן׃
26.englishText: Place the table outside the curtain, and the lampstand by the south wall of the Tabernacle opposite the table, which is to be placed by the north wall.
26.transliteration: vְshַׂmְtָּ֤ aֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָן֙ mִch֣vּץ lַpָּrֹ֔kֶt vְaֶt־hַmְּnֹrָh֙ nֹ֣kַch hַshֻּׁlְchָ֔ן aַ֛l tsֶ֥lַa hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן tֵּymָ֑nָh vְhַ֨shֻּׁlְchָ֔ן tִּtֵּ֖ן aַl־tsֶ֥lַa tsָpֽvֹן׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ מָסָךְ֙ לְפֶ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽם׃
26.englishText: You shall make a screen for the entrance of the Tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery.
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ mָsָךְ֙ lְpֶ֣tַch hָaֹ֔hֶl tְּkֵ֧lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֛ן vְtvֹlַ֥aַt shָׁnִ֖y vְshֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֑r mַaֲshֵׂ֖h rֹkֵֽם׃

26.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לַמָּסָ֗ךְ חֲמִשָּׁה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וְצִפִּיתָ֤ אֹתָם֙ זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְיָצַקְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֔ם חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אַדְנֵ֥י נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {ס}
26.englishText: Make five posts of acacia wood for the screen and overlay them with gold—their hooks being of gold—and cast for them five sockets of copper.
26.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ lַmָּsָ֗ךְ chֲmִshָּׁh֙ aַmּvּdֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֔yם vְtsִpִּytָ֤ aֹtָם֙ zָhָ֔b vָvֵyhֶ֖ם zָhָ֑b vְyָtsַkְtָּ֣ lָhֶ֔ם chֲmִshָּׁ֖h aַdְnֵ֥y nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃ {s}

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חָמֵשׁ֩ אַמּ֨וֹת אֹ֜רֶךְ וְחָמֵ֧שׁ אַמּ֣וֹת רֹ֗חַב רָב֤וּעַ יִהְיֶה֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְשָׁלֹ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
27.englishText: You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar is to be square—and three cubits high.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ aֶt־hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם chָmֵshׁ֩ aַmּ֨vֹt aֹ֜rֶךְ vְchָmֵ֧shׁ aַmּ֣vֹt rֹ֗chַb rָb֤vּaַ yִhְyֶh֙ hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ vְshָׁlֹ֥shׁ aַmּ֖vֹt kֹmָtֽvֹ׃

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ קַרְנֹתָ֗יו עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פִּנֹּתָ֔יו מִמֶּ֖נּוּ תִּהְיֶ֣יןָ קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹת֖וֹ נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: Make its horns on the four corners, the horns to be of one piece with it; and overlay it with copper.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ kַrְnֹtָ֗yv aַ֚l aַrְbַּ֣a pִּnֹּtָ֔yv mִmֶּ֖nּvּ tִּhְyֶ֣yןָ kַrְnֹtָ֑yv vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֹt֖vֹ nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ סִּֽירֹתָיו֙ לְדַשְּׁנ֔וֹ וְיָעָיו֙ וּמִזְרְקֹתָ֔יו וּמִזְלְגֹתָ֖יו וּמַחְתֹּתָ֑יו לְכׇל־כֵּלָ֖יו תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: Make the pails for removing its ashes, as well as its scrapers, basins, flesh hooks, and fire pans—make all its utensils of copper.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ sִּֽyrֹtָyv֙ lְdַshְּׁn֔vֹ vְyָaָyv֙ vּmִzְrְkֹtָ֔yv vּmִzְlְgֹtָ֖yv vּmַchְtֹּtָ֑yv lְkׇl־kֵּlָ֖yv tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ לּוֹ֙ מִכְבָּ֔ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֶ֣שֶׁת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ עַל־הָרֶ֗שֶׁת אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת נְחֹ֔שֶׁת עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֥ע קְצוֹתָֽיו׃
27.englishText: Make for it a grating of meshwork in copper; and on the mesh make four copper rings at its four corners.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ lּvֹ֙ mִkְbָּ֔r mַaֲshֵׂ֖h rֶ֣shֶׁt nְchֹ֑shֶׁt vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ aַl־hָrֶ֗shֶׁt aַrְbַּa֙ tַbְּaֹ֣t nְchֹ֔shֶׁt aַ֖l aַrְbַּ֥a kְtsvֹtָֽyv׃

27.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֗הּ תַּ֛חַת כַּרְכֹּ֥ב הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ מִלְּמָ֑טָּה וְהָיְתָ֣ה הָרֶ֔שֶׁת עַ֖ד חֲצִ֥י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
27.englishText: Set the mesh below, under the ledge of the altar, so that it extends to the middle of the altar.
27.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֣h aֹtָ֗hּ tַּ֛chַt kַּrְkֹּ֥b hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ mִlְּmָ֑tָּh vְhָyְtָ֣h hָrֶ֔shֶׁt aַ֖d chֲtsִ֥y hַmִּzְbֵּֽchַ׃

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ בַדִּים֙ לַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בַּדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: And make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with copper.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ bַdִּyם֙ lַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ bַּdֵּ֖y aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֹtָ֖ם nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: וְהוּבָ֥א אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו בַּטַּבָּעֹ֑ת וְהָי֣וּ הַבַּדִּ֗ים עַל־שְׁתֵּ֛י צַלְעֹ֥ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ בִּשְׂאֵ֥ת אֹתֽוֹ׃
27.englishText: The poles shall be inserted into the rings, so that the poles remain on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.
27.transliteration: vְhvּbָ֥a aֶt־bַּdָּ֖yv bַּtַּbָּaֹ֑t vְhָy֣vּ hַbַּdִּ֗yם aַl־shְׁtֵּ֛y tsַlְaֹ֥t hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ bִּshְׂaֵ֥t aֹtֽvֹ׃

27.hebrewText: נְב֥וּב לֻחֹ֖ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹת֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶרְאָ֥ה אֹתְךָ֛ בָּהָ֖ר כֵּ֥ן יַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
27.englishText: Make it hollow, of boards. As you were shown on the mountain, so shall they be made.
27.transliteration: nְb֥vּb lֻchֹ֖t tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h aֹt֑vֹ kַּaֲshֶׁ֨r hֶrְaָ֥h aֹtְךָ֛ bָּhָ֖r kֵּ֥ן yַaֲshֽׂvּ׃ {s}

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ אֵ֖ת חֲצַ֣ר הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן לִפְאַ֣ת נֶֽגֶב־תֵּ֠ימָ֠נָה קְלָעִ֨ים לֶחָצֵ֜ר שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֗ר מֵאָ֤ה בָֽאַמָּה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ לַפֵּאָ֖ה הָאֶחָֽת׃
27.englishText: You shall make the enclosure of the Tabernacle: On the south side,*south side Cf. note at 26.18. a hundred cubits of hangings of fine twisted linen for the length of the enclosure on that side—
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֕ytָ aֵ֖t chֲtsַ֣r hַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן lִpְaַ֣t nֶֽgֶb־tֵּ֠ymָ֠nָh kְlָaִ֨yם lֶchָtsֵ֜r shֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֗r mֵaָ֤h bָֽaַmָּh֙ aֹ֔rֶךְ lַpֵּaָ֖h hָaֶchָֽt׃

27.hebrewText: וְעַמֻּדָ֣יו עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
27.englishText: with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.
27.transliteration: vְaַmֻּdָ֣yv aֶshְׂrִ֔yם vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֥ם aֶshְׂrִ֖yם nְchֹ֑shֶׁt vָvֵ֧y hָaַmֻּdִ֛yם vַchֲshֻׁkֵyhֶ֖ם kָּֽsֶף׃

27.hebrewText: וְכֵ֨ן לִפְאַ֤ת צָפוֹן֙ בָּאֹ֔רֶךְ קְלָעִ֖ים מֵ֣אָה אֹ֑רֶךְ וְעַמֻּדָ֣ו עֶשְׂרִ֗ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֤ם עֶשְׂרִים֙ נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָֽעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
27.englishText: Again a hundred cubits of hangings for its length along the north side—with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.
27.transliteration: vְkֵ֨ן lִpְaַ֤t tsָpvֹן֙ bָּaֹ֔rֶךְ kְlָaִ֖yם mֵ֣aָh aֹ֑rֶךְ vְaַmֻּdָ֣v aֶshְׂrִ֗yם vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֤ם aֶshְׂrִyם֙ nְchֹ֔shֶׁt vָvֵ֧y hָֽaַmֻּdִ֛yם vַchֲshֻׁkֵyhֶ֖ם kָּֽsֶף׃

27.hebrewText: וְרֹ֤חַב הֶֽחָצֵר֙ לִפְאַת־יָ֔ם קְלָעִ֖ים חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֑ה עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֲשָׂרָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם עֲשָׂרָֽה׃
27.englishText: For the width of the enclosure, on the west side, fifty cubits of hangings, with their ten posts and their ten sockets.
27.transliteration: vְrֹ֤chַb hֶֽchָtsֵr֙ lִpְaַt־yָ֔ם kְlָaִ֖yם chֲmִshִּׁ֣yם aַmָּ֑h aַmֻּdֵyhֶ֣ם aֲshָׂrָ֔h vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם aֲshָׂrָֽh׃

27.hebrewText: וְרֹ֣חַב הֶֽחָצֵ֗ר לִפְאַ֛ת קֵ֥דְמָה מִזְרָ֖חָה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
27.englishText: For the width of the enclosure on the front, or east side, fifty cubits:
27.transliteration: vְrֹ֣chַb hֶֽchָtsֵ֗r lִpְaַ֛t kֵ֥dְmָh mִzְrָ֖chָh chֲmִshִּׁ֥yם aַmָּֽh׃

27.hebrewText: וַחֲמֵ֨שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה אַמָּ֛ה קְלָעִ֖ים לַכָּתֵ֑ף עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
27.englishText: fifteen cubits of hangings on the one flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;
27.transliteration: vַchֲmֵ֨shׁ aֶshְׂrֵ֥h aַmָּ֛h kְlָaִ֖yם lַkָּtֵ֑ף aַmֻּdֵyhֶ֣ם shְׁlֹshָׁ֔h vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם shְׁlֹshָֽׁh׃

27.hebrewText: וְלַכָּתֵף֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔ית חֲמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה קְלָעִ֑ים עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
27.englishText: fifteen cubits of hangings on the other flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;
27.transliteration: vְlַkָּtֵף֙ hַshֵּׁnִ֔yt chֲmֵ֥shׁ aֶshְׂrֵ֖h kְlָaִ֑yם aַmֻּdֵyhֶ֣ם shְׁlֹshָׁ֔h vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם shְׁlֹshָֽׁh׃

27.hebrewText: וּלְשַׁ֨עַר הֶֽחָצֵ֜ר מָסָ֣ךְ ׀ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אַמָּ֗ה תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן וְתוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֖ר מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑ם עַמֻּֽדֵיהֶם֙ אַרְבָּעָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם אַרְבָּעָֽה׃
27.englishText: and for the gate of the enclosure, a screen of twenty cubits, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery, with their four posts and their four sockets.
27.transliteration: vּlְshַׁ֨aַr hֶֽchָtsֵ֜r mָsָ֣ךְ ׀ aֶshְׂrִ֣yם aַmָּ֗h tְּkֵ֨lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֜ן vְtvֹlַ֧aַt shָׁnִ֛y vְshֵׁ֥shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֖r mַaֲshֵׂ֣h rֹkֵ֑ם aַmֻּֽdֵyhֶם֙ aַrְbָּaָ֔h vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם aַrְbָּaָֽh׃

27.hebrewText: כׇּל־עַמּוּדֵ֨י הֶֽחָצֵ֤ר סָבִיב֙ מְחֻשָּׁקִ֣ים כֶּ֔סֶף וָוֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: All the posts round the enclosure shall be banded with silver and their hooks shall be of silver; their sockets shall be of copper.
27.transliteration: kׇּl־aַmּvּdֵ֨y hֶֽchָtsֵ֤r sָbִyb֙ mְchֻshָּׁkִ֣yם kֶּ֔sֶף vָvֵyhֶ֖ם kָּ֑sֶף vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: אֹ֣רֶךְ הֶֽחָצֵר֩ מֵאָ֨ה בָֽאַמָּ֜ה וְרֹ֣חַב ׀ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים בַּחֲמִשִּׁ֗ים וְקֹמָ֛ה חָמֵ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: The length of the enclosure shall be a hundred cubits, and the width fifty throughout; and the height five cubits—[with hangings] of fine twisted linen. The sockets shall be of copper:
27.transliteration: aֹ֣rֶךְ hֶֽchָtsֵr֩ mֵaָ֨h bָֽaַmָּ֜h vְrֹ֣chַb ׀ chֲmִshִּׁ֣yם bַּchֲmִshִּׁ֗yם vְkֹmָ֛h chָmֵ֥shׁ aַmּ֖vֹt shֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֑r vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: לְכֹל֙ כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן בְּכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָת֑וֹ וְכׇל־יְתֵדֹתָ֛יו וְכׇל־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {ס}
27.englishText: all the utensils of the Tabernacle,*of the Tabernacle I.e., of the outer enclosure. (Inside the tent, the furnishings are to be of gold.) for all its service, as well as all its pegs and all the pegs of the court, shall be of copper.
27.transliteration: lְkֹl֙ kְּlֵ֣y hַmִּshְׁkָּ֔ן bְּkֹ֖l aֲbֹdָt֑vֹ vְkׇl־yְtֵdֹtָ֛yv vְkׇl־yִtְdֹ֥t hֶchָtsֵ֖r nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃ {s}

27.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֞ה תְּצַוֶּ֣ה ׀ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִקְח֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יךָ שֶׁ֣מֶן זַ֥יִת זָ֛ךְ כָּתִ֖ית לַמָּא֑וֹר לְהַעֲלֹ֥ת נֵ֖ר תָּמִֽיד׃
27.englishText: You shall further instruct the Israelites to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.
27.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֞h tְּtsַvֶּ֣h ׀ aֶt־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l vְyִkְch֨vּ aֵlֶ֜yךָ shֶׁ֣mֶן zַ֥yִt zָ֛ךְ kָּtִ֖yt lַmָּa֑vֹr lְhַaֲlֹ֥t nֵ֖r tָּmִֽyd׃

27.hebrewText: בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֩ מִח֨וּץ לַפָּרֹ֜כֶת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָעֵדֻ֗ת יַעֲרֹךְ֩ אֹת֨וֹ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו מֵעֶ֥רֶב עַד־בֹּ֖קֶר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹ֣רֹתָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
27.englishText: Aaron and his sons shall set them up in the Tent of Meeting, outside the curtain which is over [the Ark of] the Pact, [to burn] from evening to morning before יהוה. It shall be a due from the Israelites for all time, throughout the ages.
27.transliteration: bְּaֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵd֩ mִch֨vּץ lַpָּrֹ֜kֶt aֲshֶׁ֣r aַl־hָaֵdֻ֗t yַaֲrֹךְ֩ aֹt֨vֹ aַhֲrֹ֧ן vּbָnָ֛yv mֵaֶ֥rֶb aַd־bֹּ֖kֶr lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h chֻkַּ֤t avֹlָם֙ lְdֹ֣rֹtָ֔ם mֵaֵ֖t bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃ {s}

tetzaveh.name: Tetzaveh
tetzaveh.summary: The command to kindle the menorah, the priestly garments, the consecration of the priests, and the incense altar.

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חָמֵשׁ֩ אַמּ֨וֹת אֹ֜רֶךְ וְחָמֵ֧שׁ אַמּ֣וֹת רֹ֗חַב רָב֤וּעַ יִהְיֶה֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְשָׁלֹ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
27.englishText: You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar is to be square—and three cubits high.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ aֶt־hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם chָmֵshׁ֩ aַmּ֨vֹt aֹ֜rֶךְ vְchָmֵ֧shׁ aַmּ֣vֹt rֹ֗chַb rָb֤vּaַ yִhְyֶh֙ hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ vְshָׁlֹ֥shׁ aַmּ֖vֹt kֹmָtֽvֹ׃

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ קַרְנֹתָ֗יו עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פִּנֹּתָ֔יו מִמֶּ֖נּוּ תִּהְיֶ֣יןָ קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹת֖וֹ נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: Make its horns on the four corners, the horns to be of one piece with it; and overlay it with copper.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ kַrְnֹtָ֗yv aַ֚l aַrְbַּ֣a pִּnֹּtָ֔yv mִmֶּ֖nּvּ tִּhְyֶ֣yןָ kַrְnֹtָ֑yv vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֹt֖vֹ nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ סִּֽירֹתָיו֙ לְדַשְּׁנ֔וֹ וְיָעָיו֙ וּמִזְרְקֹתָ֔יו וּמִזְלְגֹתָ֖יו וּמַחְתֹּתָ֑יו לְכׇל־כֵּלָ֖יו תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: Make the pails for removing its ashes, as well as its scrapers, basins, flesh hooks, and fire pans—make all its utensils of copper.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ sִּֽyrֹtָyv֙ lְdַshְּׁn֔vֹ vְyָaָyv֙ vּmִzְrְkֹtָ֔yv vּmִzְlְgֹtָ֖yv vּmַchְtֹּtָ֑yv lְkׇl־kֵּlָ֖yv tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ לּוֹ֙ מִכְבָּ֔ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֶ֣שֶׁת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ עַל־הָרֶ֗שֶׁת אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת נְחֹ֔שֶׁת עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֥ע קְצוֹתָֽיו׃
27.englishText: Make for it a grating of meshwork in copper; and on the mesh make four copper rings at its four corners.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ lּvֹ֙ mִkְbָּ֔r mַaֲshֵׂ֖h rֶ֣shֶׁt nְchֹ֑shֶׁt vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ aַl־hָrֶ֗shֶׁt aַrְbַּa֙ tַbְּaֹ֣t nְchֹ֔shֶׁt aַ֖l aַrְbַּ֥a kְtsvֹtָֽyv׃

27.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֗הּ תַּ֛חַת כַּרְכֹּ֥ב הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ מִלְּמָ֑טָּה וְהָיְתָ֣ה הָרֶ֔שֶׁת עַ֖ד חֲצִ֥י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
27.englishText: Set the mesh below, under the ledge of the altar, so that it extends to the middle of the altar.
27.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֣h aֹtָ֗hּ tַּ֛chַt kַּrְkֹּ֥b hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ mִlְּmָ֑tָּh vְhָyְtָ֣h hָrֶ֔shֶׁt aַ֖d chֲtsִ֥y hַmִּzְbֵּֽchַ׃

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ בַדִּים֙ לַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בַּדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: And make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with copper.
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ bַdִּyם֙ lַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ bַּdֵּ֖y aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֹtָ֖ם nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: וְהוּבָ֥א אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו בַּטַּבָּעֹ֑ת וְהָי֣וּ הַבַּדִּ֗ים עַל־שְׁתֵּ֛י צַלְעֹ֥ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ בִּשְׂאֵ֥ת אֹתֽוֹ׃
27.englishText: The poles shall be inserted into the rings, so that the poles remain on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.
27.transliteration: vְhvּbָ֥a aֶt־bַּdָּ֖yv bַּtַּbָּaֹ֑t vְhָy֣vּ hַbַּdִּ֗yם aַl־shְׁtֵּ֛y tsַlְaֹ֥t hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ bִּshְׂaֵ֥t aֹtֽvֹ׃

27.hebrewText: נְב֥וּב לֻחֹ֖ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹת֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶרְאָ֥ה אֹתְךָ֛ בָּהָ֖ר כֵּ֥ן יַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
27.englishText: Make it hollow, of boards. As you were shown on the mountain, so shall they be made.
27.transliteration: nְb֥vּb lֻchֹ֖t tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h aֹt֑vֹ kַּaֲshֶׁ֨r hֶrְaָ֥h aֹtְךָ֛ bָּhָ֖r kֵּ֥ן yַaֲshֽׂvּ׃ {s}

27.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ אֵ֖ת חֲצַ֣ר הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן לִפְאַ֣ת נֶֽגֶב־תֵּ֠ימָ֠נָה קְלָעִ֨ים לֶחָצֵ֜ר שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֗ר מֵאָ֤ה בָֽאַמָּה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ לַפֵּאָ֖ה הָאֶחָֽת׃
27.englishText: You shall make the enclosure of the Tabernacle: On the south side,*south side Cf. note at 26.18. a hundred cubits of hangings of fine twisted linen for the length of the enclosure on that side—
27.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֕ytָ aֵ֖t chֲtsַ֣r hַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן lִpְaַ֣t nֶֽgֶb־tֵּ֠ymָ֠nָh kְlָaִ֨yם lֶchָtsֵ֜r shֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֗r mֵaָ֤h bָֽaַmָּh֙ aֹ֔rֶךְ lַpֵּaָ֖h hָaֶchָֽt׃

27.hebrewText: וְעַמֻּדָ֣יו עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
27.englishText: with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.
27.transliteration: vְaַmֻּdָ֣yv aֶshְׂrִ֔yם vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֥ם aֶshְׂrִ֖yם nְchֹ֑shֶׁt vָvֵ֧y hָaַmֻּdִ֛yם vַchֲshֻׁkֵyhֶ֖ם kָּֽsֶף׃

27.hebrewText: וְכֵ֨ן לִפְאַ֤ת צָפוֹן֙ בָּאֹ֔רֶךְ קְלָעִ֖ים מֵ֣אָה אֹ֑רֶךְ וְעַמֻּדָ֣ו עֶשְׂרִ֗ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֤ם עֶשְׂרִים֙ נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָֽעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
27.englishText: Again a hundred cubits of hangings for its length along the north side—with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.
27.transliteration: vְkֵ֨ן lִpְaַ֤t tsָpvֹן֙ bָּaֹ֔rֶךְ kְlָaִ֖yם mֵ֣aָh aֹ֑rֶךְ vְaַmֻּdָ֣v aֶshְׂrִ֗yם vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֤ם aֶshְׂrִyם֙ nְchֹ֔shֶׁt vָvֵ֧y hָֽaַmֻּdִ֛yם vַchֲshֻׁkֵyhֶ֖ם kָּֽsֶף׃

27.hebrewText: וְרֹ֤חַב הֶֽחָצֵר֙ לִפְאַת־יָ֔ם קְלָעִ֖ים חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֑ה עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֲשָׂרָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם עֲשָׂרָֽה׃
27.englishText: For the width of the enclosure, on the west side, fifty cubits of hangings, with their ten posts and their ten sockets.
27.transliteration: vְrֹ֤chַb hֶֽchָtsֵr֙ lִpְaַt־yָ֔ם kְlָaִ֖yם chֲmִshִּׁ֣yם aַmָּ֑h aַmֻּdֵyhֶ֣ם aֲshָׂrָ֔h vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם aֲshָׂrָֽh׃

27.hebrewText: וְרֹ֣חַב הֶֽחָצֵ֗ר לִפְאַ֛ת קֵ֥דְמָה מִזְרָ֖חָה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
27.englishText: For the width of the enclosure on the front, or east side, fifty cubits:
27.transliteration: vְrֹ֣chַb hֶֽchָtsֵ֗r lִpְaַ֛t kֵ֥dְmָh mִzְrָ֖chָh chֲmִshִּׁ֥yם aַmָּֽh׃

27.hebrewText: וַחֲמֵ֨שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה אַמָּ֛ה קְלָעִ֖ים לַכָּתֵ֑ף עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
27.englishText: fifteen cubits of hangings on the one flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;
27.transliteration: vַchֲmֵ֨shׁ aֶshְׂrֵ֥h aַmָּ֛h kְlָaִ֖yם lַkָּtֵ֑ף aַmֻּdֵyhֶ֣ם shְׁlֹshָׁ֔h vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם shְׁlֹshָֽׁh׃

27.hebrewText: וְלַכָּתֵף֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔ית חֲמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה קְלָעִ֑ים עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
27.englishText: fifteen cubits of hangings on the other flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;
27.transliteration: vְlַkָּtֵף֙ hַshֵּׁnִ֔yt chֲmֵ֥shׁ aֶshְׂrֵ֖h kְlָaִ֑yם aַmֻּdֵyhֶ֣ם shְׁlֹshָׁ֔h vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם shְׁlֹshָֽׁh׃

27.hebrewText: וּלְשַׁ֨עַר הֶֽחָצֵ֜ר מָסָ֣ךְ ׀ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אַמָּ֗ה תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן וְתוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֖ר מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑ם עַמֻּֽדֵיהֶם֙ אַרְבָּעָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם אַרְבָּעָֽה׃
27.englishText: and for the gate of the enclosure, a screen of twenty cubits, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery, with their four posts and their four sockets.
27.transliteration: vּlְshַׁ֨aַr hֶֽchָtsֵ֜r mָsָ֣ךְ ׀ aֶshְׂrִ֣yם aַmָּ֗h tְּkֵ֨lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֜ן vְtvֹlַ֧aַt shָׁnִ֛y vְshֵׁ֥shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֖r mַaֲshֵׂ֣h rֹkֵ֑ם aַmֻּֽdֵyhֶם֙ aַrְbָּaָ֔h vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם aַrְbָּaָֽh׃

27.hebrewText: כׇּל־עַמּוּדֵ֨י הֶֽחָצֵ֤ר סָבִיב֙ מְחֻשָּׁקִ֣ים כֶּ֔סֶף וָוֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: All the posts round the enclosure shall be banded with silver and their hooks shall be of silver; their sockets shall be of copper.
27.transliteration: kׇּl־aַmּvּdֵ֨y hֶֽchָtsֵ֤r sָbִyb֙ mְchֻshָּׁkִ֣yם kֶּ֔sֶף vָvֵyhֶ֖ם kָּ֑sֶף vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: אֹ֣רֶךְ הֶֽחָצֵר֩ מֵאָ֨ה בָֽאַמָּ֜ה וְרֹ֣חַב ׀ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים בַּחֲמִשִּׁ֗ים וְקֹמָ֛ה חָמֵ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
27.englishText: The length of the enclosure shall be a hundred cubits, and the width fifty throughout; and the height five cubits—[with hangings] of fine twisted linen. The sockets shall be of copper:
27.transliteration: aֹ֣rֶךְ hֶֽchָtsֵr֩ mֵaָ֨h bָֽaַmָּ֜h vְrֹ֣chַb ׀ chֲmִshִּׁ֣yם bַּchֲmִshִּׁ֗yם vְkֹmָ֛h chָmֵ֥shׁ aַmּ֖vֹt shֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֑r vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

27.hebrewText: לְכֹל֙ כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן בְּכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָת֑וֹ וְכׇל־יְתֵדֹתָ֛יו וְכׇל־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {ס}
27.englishText: all the utensils of the Tabernacle,*of the Tabernacle I.e., of the outer enclosure. (Inside the tent, the furnishings are to be of gold.) for all its service, as well as all its pegs and all the pegs of the court, shall be of copper.
27.transliteration: lְkֹl֙ kְּlֵ֣y hַmִּshְׁkָּ֔ן bְּkֹ֖l aֲbֹdָt֑vֹ vְkׇl־yְtֵdֹtָ֛yv vְkׇl־yִtְdֹ֥t hֶchָtsֵ֖r nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃ {s}

27.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֞ה תְּצַוֶּ֣ה ׀ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִקְח֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יךָ שֶׁ֣מֶן זַ֥יִת זָ֛ךְ כָּתִ֖ית לַמָּא֑וֹר לְהַעֲלֹ֥ת נֵ֖ר תָּמִֽיד׃
27.englishText: You shall further instruct the Israelites to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.
27.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֞h tְּtsַvֶּ֣h ׀ aֶt־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l vְyִkְch֨vּ aֵlֶ֜yךָ shֶׁ֣mֶן zַ֥yִt zָ֛ךְ kָּtִ֖yt lַmָּa֑vֹr lְhַaֲlֹ֥t nֵ֖r tָּmִֽyd׃

27.hebrewText: בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֩ מִח֨וּץ לַפָּרֹ֜כֶת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָעֵדֻ֗ת יַעֲרֹךְ֩ אֹת֨וֹ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו מֵעֶ֥רֶב עַד־בֹּ֖קֶר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹ֣רֹתָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
27.englishText: Aaron and his sons shall set them up in the Tent of Meeting, outside the curtain which is over [the Ark of] the Pact, [to burn] from evening to morning before יהוה. It shall be a due from the Israelites for all time, throughout the ages.
27.transliteration: bְּaֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵd֩ mִch֨vּץ lַpָּrֹ֜kֶt aֲshֶׁ֣r aַl־hָaֵdֻ֗t yַaֲrֹךְ֩ aֹt֨vֹ aַhֲrֹ֧ן vּbָnָ֛yv mֵaֶ֥rֶb aַd־bֹּ֖kֶr lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h chֻkַּ֤t avֹlָם֙ lְdֹ֣rֹtָ֔ם mֵaֵ֖t bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃ {s}
