28.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֡ה הַקְרֵ֣ב אֵלֶ֩יךָ֩ אֶת־אַהֲרֹ֨ן אָחִ֜יךָ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו אִתּ֗וֹ מִתּ֛וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִ֑י אַהֲרֹ֕ן נָדָ֧ב וַאֲבִיה֛וּא אֶלְעָזָ֥ר וְאִיתָמָ֖ר בְּנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹֽן׃
28.englishText: You shall bring forward your brother Aaron, with his sons, from among the Israelites, to serve Me as priests: Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron.
28.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֡h hַkְrֵ֣b aֵlֶ֩yךָ֩ aֶt־aַhֲrֹ֨ן aָchִ֜yךָ vְaֶt־bָּnָ֣yv aִtּ֗vֹ mִtּ֛vֹךְ bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l lְkַhֲnvֹ־lִ֑y aַhֲrֹ֕ן nָdָ֧b vַaֲbִyh֛vּa aֶlְaָzָ֥r vְaִytָmָ֖r bְּnֵ֥y aַhֲrֹֽן׃

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בִגְדֵי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֑יךָ לְכָב֖וֹד וּלְתִפְאָֽרֶת׃
28.englishText: Make sacral vestments for your brother Aaron, for dignity and adornment.
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ bִgְdֵy־kֹ֖dֶshׁ lְaַhֲrֹ֣ן aָchִ֑yךָ lְkָb֖vֹd vּlְtִpְaָֽrֶt׃

28.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֗ה תְּדַבֵּר֙ אֶל־כׇּל־חַכְמֵי־לֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִלֵּאתִ֖יו ר֣וּחַ חׇכְמָ֑ה וְעָשׂ֞וּ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֧י אַהֲרֹ֛ן לְקַדְּשׁ֖וֹ לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃
28.englishText: Next you shall instruct all who are skillful, whom I have endowed with the gift of skill,*skillful, whom I have endowed with the gift of skill Lit. “wise of heart, whom I have filled with a spirit of wisdom.” to make Aaron’s vestments, for consecrating him to serve Me as priest.
28.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֗h tְּdַbֵּr֙ aֶl־kׇּl־chַkְmֵy־lֵ֔b aֲshֶׁ֥r mִlֵּatִ֖yv r֣vּchַ chׇkְmָ֑h vְaָshׂ֞vּ aֶt־bִּgְdֵ֧y aַhֲrֹ֛ן lְkַdְּshׁ֖vֹ lְkַhֲnvֹ־lִֽy׃

28.hebrewText: וְאֵ֨לֶּה הַבְּגָדִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַעֲשׂ֗וּ חֹ֤שֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד֙ וּמְעִ֔יל וּכְתֹ֥נֶת תַּשְׁבֵּ֖ץ מִצְנֶ֣פֶת וְאַבְנֵ֑ט וְעָשׂ֨וּ בִגְדֵי־קֹ֜דֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹ֥ן אָחִ֛יךָ וּלְבָנָ֖יו לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃
28.englishText: These are the vestments they are to make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a fringed*fringed Others “checkered.” tunic, a headdress, and a sash. They shall make those sacral vestments for your brother Aaron and his sons, for priestly service to Me;
28.transliteration: vְaֵ֨lֶּh hַbְּgָdִ֜yם aֲshֶׁ֣r yַaֲshׂ֗vּ chֹ֤shֶׁן vְaֵpvֹd֙ vּmְaִ֔yl vּkְtֹ֥nֶt tַּshְׁbֵּ֖ץ mִtsְnֶ֣pֶt vְaַbְnֵ֑t vְaָshׂ֨vּ bִgְdֵy־kֹ֜dֶshׁ lְaַhֲrֹ֥ן aָchִ֛yךָ vּlְbָnָ֖yv lְkַhֲnvֹ־lִֽy׃

28.hebrewText: וְהֵם֙ יִקְח֣וּ אֶת־הַזָּהָ֔ב וְאֶת־הַתְּכֵ֖לֶת וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֑ן וְאֶת־תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃ {פ}
28.englishText: they, therefore, shall receive the gold, the blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and the fine linen.
28.transliteration: vְhֵם֙ yִkְch֣vּ aֶt־hַzָּhָ֔b vְaֶt־hַtְּkֵ֖lֶt vְaֶt־hָֽaַrְgָּmָ֑ן vְaֶt־tּvֹlַ֥aַt hַshָּׁnִ֖y vְaֶt־hַshֵּֽׁshׁ׃ {p}

28.hebrewText: וְעָשׂ֖וּ אֶת־הָאֵפֹ֑ד זָ֠הָ֠ב תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן תּוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֖ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵֽׁב׃
28.englishText: They shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen, worked into designs.
28.transliteration: vְaָshׂ֖vּ aֶt־hָaֵpֹ֑d zָ֠hָ֠b tְּkֵ֨lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֜ן tּvֹlַ֧aַt shָׁnִ֛y vְshֵׁ֥shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֖r mַaֲshֵׂ֥h chֹshֵֽׁb׃

28.hebrewText: שְׁתֵּ֧י כְתֵפֹ֣ת חֹֽבְרֹ֗ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֛וֹ אֶל־שְׁנֵ֥י קְצוֹתָ֖יו וְחֻבָּֽר׃
28.englishText: It shall have two shoulder-pieces attached; they shall be attached at its two ends.
28.transliteration: shְׁtֵּ֧y kְtֵpֹ֣t chֹֽbְrֹ֗t yִֽhְyֶh־lּ֛vֹ aֶl־shְׁnֵ֥y kְtsvֹtָ֖yv vְchֻbָּֽr׃

28.hebrewText: וְחֵ֤שֶׁב אֲפֻדָּתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֔יו כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֖הוּ מִמֶּ֣נּוּ יִהְיֶ֑ה זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָֽר׃
28.englishText: And the decorated band that is upon it shall be made like it, of one piece with it: of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.
28.transliteration: vְchֵ֤shֶׁb aֲpֻdָּtvֹ֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aָlָ֔yv kְּmַaֲshֵׂ֖hvּ mִmֶּ֣nּvּ yִhְyֶ֑h zָhָ֗b tְּkֵ֧lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֛ן vְtvֹlַ֥aַt shָׁnִ֖y vְshֵׁ֥shׁ mׇshְׁzָֽr׃

28.hebrewText: וְלָ֣קַחְתָּ֔ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֖י אַבְנֵי־שֹׁ֑הַם וּפִתַּחְתָּ֣ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁמ֖וֹת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
28.englishText: Then take two lazuli stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel:
28.transliteration: vְlָ֣kַchְtָּ֔ aֶt־shְׁtֵּ֖y aַbְnֵy־shֹׁ֑hַם vּpִtַּchְtָּ֣ aֲlֵyhֶ֔ם shְׁm֖vֹt bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

28.hebrewText: שִׁשָּׁה֙ מִשְּׁמֹתָ֔ם עַ֖ל הָאֶ֣בֶן הָאֶחָ֑ת וְאֶת־שְׁמ֞וֹת הַשִּׁשָּׁ֧ה הַנּוֹתָרִ֛ים עַל־הָאֶ֥בֶן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית כְּתוֹלְדֹתָֽם׃
28.englishText: six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, in the order of their birth.
28.transliteration: shִׁshָּׁh֙ mִshְּׁmֹtָ֔ם aַ֖l hָaֶ֣bֶן hָaֶchָ֑t vְaֶt־shְׁm֞vֹt hַshִּׁshָּׁ֧h hַnּvֹtָrִ֛yם aַl־hָaֶ֥bֶן hַshֵּׁnִ֖yt kְּtvֹlְdֹtָֽם׃

28.hebrewText: מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה חָרַשׁ֮ אֶ֒בֶן֒ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חֹתָ֗ם תְּפַתַּח֙ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י הָאֲבָנִ֔ים עַל־שְׁמֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מֻסַבֹּ֛ת מִשְׁבְּצ֥וֹת זָהָ֖ב תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
28.englishText: On the two stones you shall make seal engravings—the work of a lapidary—of the names of the sons of Israel. Having bordered them with frames of gold,
28.transliteration: mַaֲshֵׂ֣h chָrַshׁ֮ aֶ֒bֶן֒ pִּtּvּchֵ֣y chֹtָ֗ם tְּpַtַּch֙ aֶt־shְׁtֵּ֣y hָaֲbָnִ֔yם aַl־shְׁmֹ֖t bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l mֻsַbֹּ֛t mִshְׁbְּts֥vֹt zָhָ֖b tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtָֽם׃

28.hebrewText: וְשַׂמְתָּ֞ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י הָאֲבָנִ֗ים עַ֚ל כִּתְפֹ֣ת הָֽאֵפֹ֔ד אַבְנֵ֥י זִכָּרֹ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנָשָׂא֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן אֶת־שְׁמוֹתָ֜ם לִפְנֵ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה עַל־שְׁתֵּ֥י כְתֵפָ֖יו לְזִכָּרֹֽן׃ {ס}
28.englishText: attach the two stones to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, as stones for remembrance of the Israelite people, whose names Aaron shall carry upon his two shoulder-pieces for remembrance before יהוה.
28.transliteration: vְshַׂmְtָּ֞ aֶt־shְׁtֵּ֣y hָaֲbָnִ֗yם aַ֚l kִּtְpֹ֣t hָֽaֵpֹ֔d aַbְnֵ֥y zִkָּrֹ֖ן lִbְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vְnָshָׂa֩ aַhֲrֹ֨ן aֶt־shְׁmvֹtָ֜ם lִpְnֵ֧y yְhֹvָ֛h aַl־shְׁtֵּ֥y kְtֵpָ֖yv lְzִkָּrֹֽן׃ {s}

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מִשְׁבְּצֹ֖ת זָהָֽב׃
28.englishText: Then make frames of gold
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ mִshְׁbְּtsֹ֖t zָhָֽb׃

28.hebrewText: וּשְׁתֵּ֤י שַׁרְשְׁרֹת֙ זָהָ֣ב טָה֔וֹר מִגְבָּלֹ֛ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת וְנָתַתָּ֛ה אֶת־שַׁרְשְׁרֹ֥ת הָעֲבֹתֹ֖ת עַל־הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצֹֽת׃ {ס}
28.englishText: and two chains of pure gold; braid these like corded work, and fasten the corded chains to the frames.
28.transliteration: vּshְׁtֵּ֤y shַׁrְshְׁrֹt֙ zָhָ֣b tָh֔vֹr mִgְbָּlֹ֛t tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtָ֖ם mַaֲshֵׂ֣h aֲbֹ֑t vְnָtַtָּ֛h aֶt־shַׁrְshְׁrֹ֥t hָaֲbֹtֹ֖t aַl־hַֽmִּshְׁbְּtsֹֽt׃ {s}

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ חֹ֤שֶׁן מִשְׁפָּט֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה חֹשֵׁ֔ב כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה אֵפֹ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֑נּוּ זָ֠הָ֠ב תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן וְתוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֖ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
28.englishText: You shall make a breastpiece of decision,*decision See v. 30 below; others “judgment.” worked into a design; make it in the style of the ephod: make it of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֜ytָ chֹ֤shֶׁן mִshְׁpָּt֙ mַaֲshֵׂ֣h chֹshֵׁ֔b kְּmַaֲshֵׂ֥h aֵpֹ֖d tַּaֲshֶׂ֑nּvּ zָ֠hָ֠b tְּkֵ֨lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֜ן vְtvֹlַ֧aַt shָׁnִ֛y vְshֵׁ֥shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֖r tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtֽvֹ׃

28.hebrewText: רָב֥וּעַ יִֽהְיֶ֖ה כָּפ֑וּל זֶ֥רֶת אׇרְכּ֖וֹ וְזֶ֥רֶת רׇחְבּֽוֹ׃
28.englishText: It shall be square and doubled, a span in length and a span in width.
28.transliteration: rָb֥vּaַ yִֽhְyֶ֖h kָּp֑vּl zֶ֥rֶt aׇrְkּ֖vֹ vְzֶ֥rֶt rׇchְbּֽvֹ׃

28.hebrewText: וּמִלֵּאתָ֥ בוֹ֙ מִלֻּ֣אַת אֶ֔בֶן אַרְבָּעָ֖ה טוּרִ֣ים אָ֑בֶן ט֗וּר אֹ֤דֶם פִּטְדָה֙ וּבָרֶ֔קֶת הַטּ֖וּר הָאֶחָֽד׃
28.englishText: Set in it mounted stones, in four rows of stones. The first row shall be a row of*carnelian, chrysolite,… The identity of several of the following twelve stones is uncertain. carnelian, chrysolite, and emerald;
28.transliteration: vּmִlֵּatָ֥ bvֹ֙ mִlֻּ֣aַt aֶ֔bֶן aַrְbָּaָ֖h tvּrִ֣yם aָ֑bֶן t֗vּr aֹ֤dֶם pִּtְdָh֙ vּbָrֶ֔kֶt hַtּ֖vּr hָaֶchָֽd׃

28.hebrewText: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשֵּׁנִ֑י נֹ֥פֶךְ סַפִּ֖יר וְיָהֲלֹֽם׃
28.englishText: the second row: a turquoise, a sapphire, and an amethyst;
28.transliteration: vְhַtּ֖vּr hַshֵּׁnִ֑y nֹ֥pֶךְ sַpִּ֖yr vְyָhֲlֹֽם׃

28.hebrewText: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י לֶ֥שֶׁם שְׁב֖וֹ וְאַחְלָֽמָה׃
28.englishText: the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and a crystal;
28.transliteration: vְhַtּ֖vּr hַshְּׁlִyshִׁ֑y lֶ֥shֶׁם shְׁb֖vֹ vְaַchְlָֽmָh׃

28.hebrewText: וְהַטּוּר֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔י תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ וְשֹׁ֖הַם וְיָשְׁפֵ֑ה מְשֻׁבָּצִ֥ים זָהָ֛ב יִהְי֖וּ בְּמִלּוּאֹתָֽם׃
28.englishText: and the fourth row: a beryl, a lapis lazuli, and a jasper. They shall be framed with gold in their mountings.
28.transliteration: vְhַtּvּr֙ hָrְbִyaִ֔y tַּrְshִׁ֥yshׁ vְshֹׁ֖hַם vְyָshְׁpֵ֑h mְshֻׁbָּtsִ֥yם zָhָ֛b yִhְy֖vּ bְּmִlּvּaֹtָֽם׃

28.hebrewText: וְ֠הָאֲבָנִ֠ים תִּֽהְיֶ֜יןָ עַל־שְׁמֹ֧ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה עַל־שְׁמֹתָ֑ם פִּתּוּחֵ֤י חוֹתָם֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־שְׁמ֔וֹ תִּֽהְיֶ֕יןָ לִשְׁנֵ֥י עָשָׂ֖ר שָֽׁבֶט׃
28.englishText: The stones shall correspond [in number] to the names of the sons of Israel: twelve, corresponding to their names. They shall be engraved like seals, each with its name, for the twelve tribes.
28.transliteration: vְ֠hָaֲbָnִ֠yם tִּֽhְyֶ֜yןָ aַl־shְׁmֹ֧t bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l shְׁtֵּ֥yם aֶshְׂrֵ֖h aַl־shְׁmֹtָ֑ם pִּtּvּchֵ֤y chvֹtָם֙ aִ֣yshׁ aַl־shְׁm֔vֹ tִּֽhְyֶ֕yןָ lִshְׁnֵ֥y aָshָׂ֖r shָֽׁbֶt׃

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ עַל־הַחֹ֛שֶׁן שַֽׁרְשֹׁ֥ת גַּבְלֻ֖ת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת זָהָ֖ב טָהֽוֹר׃
28.englishText: On the breastpiece make braided chains of corded work in pure gold.
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֧ytָ aַl־hַchֹ֛shֶׁן shַֽׁrְshֹׁ֥t gַּbְlֻ֖t mַaֲshֵׂ֣h aֲbֹ֑t zָhָ֖b tָhֽvֹr׃

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ עַל־הַחֹ֔שֶׁן שְׁתֵּ֖י טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָ֑ב וְנָתַתָּ֗ אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ הַטַּבָּע֔וֹת עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
28.englishText: Make two rings of gold on the breastpiece, and fasten the two rings at the two ends of the breastpiece,
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֙ytָ֙ aַl־hַchֹ֔shֶׁן shְׁtֵּ֖y tַbְּa֣vֹt zָhָ֑b vְnָtַtָּ֗ aֶt־shְׁtֵּy֙ hַtַּbָּa֔vֹt aַl־shְׁnֵ֖y kְts֥vֹt hַchֹֽshֶׁן׃

28.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֗ה אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ עֲבֹתֹ֣ת הַזָּהָ֔ב עַל־שְׁתֵּ֖י הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת אֶל־קְצ֖וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
28.englishText: attaching the two golden cords to the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece.
28.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֗h aֶt־shְׁtֵּy֙ aֲbֹtֹ֣t hַzָּhָ֔b aַl־shְׁtֵּ֖y hַtַּbָּaֹ֑t aֶl־kְts֖vֹt hַchֹֽshֶׁן׃

28.hebrewText: וְאֵ֨ת שְׁתֵּ֤י קְצוֹת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הָעֲבֹתֹ֔ת תִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצ֑וֹת וְנָתַתָּ֛ה עַל־כִּתְפ֥וֹת הָאֵפֹ֖ד אֶל־מ֥וּל פָּנָֽיו׃
28.englishText: Then fasten the two ends of the cords to the two frames, which you shall attach to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, at the front.
28.transliteration: vְaֵ֨t shְׁtֵּ֤y kְtsvֹt֙ shְׁtֵּ֣y hָaֲbֹtֹ֔t tִּtֵּ֖ן aַl־shְׁtֵּ֣y hַֽmִּshְׁbְּts֑vֹt vְnָtַtָּ֛h aַl־kִּtְp֥vֹt hָaֵpֹ֖d aֶl־m֥vּl pָּnָֽyv׃

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֗יתָ שְׁתֵּי֙ טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָ֔ב וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֣וֹת הַחֹ֑שֶׁן עַל־שְׂפָת֕וֹ אֲשֶׁ֛ר אֶל־עֵ֥בֶר הָאֵפֹ֖ד*(בספרי ספרד ואשכנז הָאֵפ֖וֹד) בָּֽיְתָה׃
28.englishText: Make two rings of gold and attach them to the two ends of the breastpiece, at its inner edge, which faces the ephod.
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֗ytָ shְׁtֵּy֙ tַbְּa֣vֹt zָhָ֔b vְshַׂmְtָּ֣ aֹtָ֔ם aַl־shְׁnֵ֖y kְts֣vֹt hַchֹ֑shֶׁן aַl־shְׂpָt֕vֹ aֲshֶׁ֛r aֶl־aֵ֥bֶr hָaֵpֹ֖d*(bspry sprd vashknz hָaֵp֖vֹd) bָּֽyְtָh׃

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֘יתָ֮ שְׁתֵּ֣י טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָב֒ וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֡ם עַל־שְׁתֵּי֩ כִתְפ֨וֹת הָאֵפ֤וֹד מִלְּמַ֙טָּה֙ מִמּ֣וּל פָּנָ֔יו לְעֻמַּ֖ת מַחְבַּרְתּ֑וֹ מִמַּ֕עַל לְחֵ֖שֶׁב הָאֵפֽוֹד׃
28.englishText: And make two other rings of gold and fasten them on the front of the ephod, low on the two shoulder-pieces, close to its seam above the decorated band.
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֘ytָ֮ shְׁtֵּ֣y tַbְּa֣vֹt zָhָb֒ vְnָtַtָּ֣h aֹtָ֡ם aַl־shְׁtֵּy֩ kִtְp֨vֹt hָaֵp֤vֹd mִlְּmַ֙tָּh֙ mִmּ֣vּl pָּnָ֔yv lְaֻmַּ֖t mַchְbַּrְtּ֑vֹ mִmַּ֕aַl lְchֵ֖shֶׁb hָaֵpֽvֹd׃

28.hebrewText: וְיִרְכְּס֣וּ אֶת־הַ֠חֹ֠שֶׁן מִֽטַּבְּעֹתָ֞ו אֶל־טַבְּעֹ֤ת הָאֵפוֹד֙ בִּפְתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֔לֶת לִֽהְי֖וֹת עַל־חֵ֣שֶׁב הָאֵפ֑וֹד וְלֹֽא־יִזַּ֣ח הַחֹ֔שֶׁן מֵעַ֖ל הָאֵפֽוֹד׃
28.englishText: The breastpiece shall be held in place by a cord of blue from its rings to the rings of the ephod, so that the breastpiece rests on the decorated band and does not come loose from the ephod.
28.transliteration: vְyִrְkְּs֣vּ aֶt־hַ֠chֹ֠shֶׁן mִֽtַּbְּaֹtָ֞v aֶl־tַbְּaֹ֤t hָaֵpvֹd֙ bִּpְtִ֣yl tְּkֵ֔lֶt lִֽhְy֖vֹt aַl־chֵ֣shֶׁb hָaֵp֑vֹd vְlֹֽa־yִzַּ֣ch hַchֹ֔shֶׁן mֵaַ֖l hָaֵpֽvֹd׃

28.hebrewText: וְנָשָׂ֣א אַ֠הֲרֹ֠ן אֶת־שְׁמ֨וֹת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בְּחֹ֧שֶׁן הַמִּשְׁפָּ֛ט עַל־לִבּ֖וֹ בְּבֹא֣וֹ אֶל־הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְזִכָּרֹ֥ן לִפְנֵֽי־יְהֹוָ֖ה תָּמִֽיד׃
28.englishText: Aaron shall carry the names of the sons of Israel on the breastpiece of decision over his heart, when he enters the sanctuary, for remembrance before יהוה at all times.
28.transliteration: vְnָshָׂ֣a aַ֠hֲrֹ֠ן aֶt־shְׁm֨vֹt bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֜l bְּchֹ֧shֶׁן hַmִּshְׁpָּ֛t aַl־lִbּ֖vֹ bְּbֹa֣vֹ aֶl־hַkֹּ֑dֶshׁ lְzִkָּrֹ֥ן lִpְnֵֽy־yְhֹvָ֖h tָּmִֽyd׃

28.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֞ אֶל־חֹ֣שֶׁן הַמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט אֶת־הָאוּרִים֙ וְאֶת־הַתֻּמִּ֔ים וְהָיוּ֙ עַל־לֵ֣ב אַהֲרֹ֔ן בְּבֹא֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְנָשָׂ֣א אַ֠הֲרֹ֠ן אֶת־מִשְׁפַּ֨ט בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל עַל־לִבּ֛וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה תָּמִֽיד׃ {ס}
28.englishText: Inside the breastpiece of decision you shall place the Urim and Thummim,*Urim and Thummim Meaning of these two words uncertain. They designate a kind of oracle; cf. Num. 27.21. so that they are over Aaron’s heart when he comes before יהוה. Thus Aaron shall carry the instrument of decision for the Israelites over his heart before יהוה at all times.
28.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֞ aֶl־chֹ֣shֶׁן hַmִּshְׁpָּ֗t aֶt־hָavּrִyם֙ vְaֶt־hַtֻּmִּ֔yם vְhָyvּ֙ aַl־lֵ֣b aַhֲrֹ֔ן bְּbֹa֖vֹ lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h vְnָshָׂ֣a aַ֠hֲrֹ֠ן aֶt־mִshְׁpַּ֨t bְּnֵy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֧l aַl־lִbּ֛vֹ lִpְnֵ֥y yְhֹvָ֖h tָּmִֽyd׃ {s}

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ אֶת־מְעִ֥יל הָאֵפ֖וֹד כְּלִ֥יל תְּכֵֽלֶת׃
28.englishText: You shall make the robe of the ephod of pure blue.*of pure blue Others “all of blue.”
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֛ytָ aֶt־mְaִ֥yl hָaֵp֖vֹd kְּlִ֥yl tְּkֵֽlֶt׃

28.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֥ה פִֽי־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ בְּתוֹכ֑וֹ שָׂפָ֡ה יִֽהְיֶה֩ לְפִ֨יו סָבִ֜יב מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹרֵ֗ג כְּפִ֥י תַחְרָ֛א יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֖וֹ לֹ֥א יִקָּרֵֽעַ׃
28.englishText: The opening for the head shall be in the middle of it; the opening shall have a binding of woven work round about—it shall be like the opening of a coat of mail—so that it does not tear.
28.transliteration: vְhָyָ֥h pִֽy־rֹashׁ֖vֹ bְּtvֹk֑vֹ shָׂpָ֡h yִֽhְyֶh֩ lְpִ֨yv sָbִ֜yb mַaֲshֵׂ֣h aֹrֵ֗g kְּpִ֥y tַchְrָ֛a yִֽhְyֶh־lּ֖vֹ lֹ֥a yִkָּrֵֽaַ׃

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ עַל־שׁוּלָ֗יו רִמֹּנֵי֙ תְּכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י עַל־שׁוּלָ֖יו סָבִ֑יב וּפַעֲמֹנֵ֥י זָהָ֛ב בְּתוֹכָ֖ם סָבִֽיב׃
28.englishText: On its hem make pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, all around the hem, with bells of gold between them all around:
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ aַl־shׁvּlָ֗yv rִmֹּnֵy֙ tְּkֵ֤lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָן֙ vְtvֹlַ֣aַt shָׁnִ֔y aַl־shׁvּlָ֖yv sָbִ֑yb vּpַaֲmֹnֵ֥y zָhָ֛b bְּtvֹkָ֖ם sָbִֽyb׃

28.hebrewText: פַּעֲמֹ֤ן זָהָב֙ וְרִמּ֔וֹן פַּֽעֲמֹ֥ן זָהָ֖ב וְרִמּ֑וֹן עַל־שׁוּלֵ֥י הַמְּעִ֖יל סָבִֽיב׃
28.englishText: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe.
28.transliteration: pַּaֲmֹ֤ן zָhָb֙ vְrִmּ֔vֹן pַּֽaֲmֹ֥ן zָhָ֖b vְrִmּ֑vֹן aַl־shׁvּlֵ֥y hַmְּaִ֖yl sָbִֽyb׃

28.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֥ה עַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לְשָׁרֵ֑ת וְנִשְׁמַ֣ע ק֠וֹל֠וֹ בְּבֹא֨וֹ אֶל־הַקֹּ֜דֶשׁ לִפְנֵ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה וּבְצֵאת֖וֹ וְלֹ֥א יָמֽוּת׃ {ס}
28.englishText: Aaron shall wear it while officiating, so that the sound of it is heard when he comes into the sanctuary before יהוה and when he goes out—that he may not die.
28.transliteration: vְhָyָ֥h aַֽl־aַhֲrֹ֖ן lְshָׁrֵ֑t vְnִshְׁmַ֣a k֠vֹl֠vֹ bְּbֹa֨vֹ aֶl־hַkֹּ֜dֶshׁ lִpְnֵ֧y yְhֹvָ֛h vּbְtsֵat֖vֹ vְlֹ֥a yָmֽvּt׃ {s}

28.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ צִּ֖יץ זָהָ��ב טָה֑וֹר וּפִתַּחְתָּ֤ עָלָיו֙ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חֹתָ֔ם קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
28.englishText: You shall make a frontlet of pure gold and engrave on it the seal inscription: “Holy to יהוה.”
28.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ tsִּ֖yץ zָhָ��b tָh֑vֹr vּpִtַּchְtָּ֤ aָlָyv֙ pִּtּvּchֵ֣y chֹtָ֔ם kֹ֖dֶshׁ lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃

28.hebrewText: וְשַׂמְתָּ֤ אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־פְּתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֔לֶת וְהָיָ֖ה עַל־הַמִּצְנָ֑פֶת אֶל־מ֥וּל פְּנֵֽי־הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת יִהְיֶֽה׃
28.englishText: Suspend it on a cord of blue, so that it may remain on the headdress; it shall remain on the front of the headdress.
28.transliteration: vְshַׂmְtָּ֤ aֹtvֹ֙ aַl־pְּtִ֣yl tְּkֵ֔lֶt vְhָyָ֖h aַl־hַmִּtsְnָ֑pֶt aֶl־m֥vּl pְּnֵֽy־hַmִּtsְnֶ֖pֶt yִhְyֶֽh׃

28.hebrewText: וְהָיָה֮ עַל־מֵ֣צַח אַהֲרֹן֒ וְנָשָׂ֨א אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן הַקֳּדָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַקְדִּ֙ישׁוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְכׇֽל־מַתְּנֹ֖ת קׇדְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם וְהָיָ֤ה עַל־מִצְחוֹ֙ תָּמִ֔יד לְרָצ֥וֹן לָהֶ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
28.englishText: It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may take away any sin arising from the holy things that the Israelites consecrate, from any of their sacred donations; it shall be on his forehead at all times, to win acceptance for them before יהוה.
28.transliteration: vְhָyָh֮ aַl־mֵ֣tsַch aַhֲrֹן֒ vְnָshָׂ֨a aַhֲrֹ֜ן aֶt־aֲvֺ֣ן hַkֳּdָshִׁ֗yם aֲshֶׁ֤r yַkְdִּ֙yshׁvּ֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l lְkׇֽl־mַtְּnֹ֖t kׇdְshֵׁyhֶ֑ם vְhָyָ֤h aַl־mִtsְchvֹ֙ tָּmִ֔yd lְrָts֥vֹן lָhֶ֖ם lִpְnֵ֥y yְhֹvָֽh׃

28.hebrewText: וְשִׁבַּצְתָּ֙ הַכְּתֹ֣נֶת שֵׁ֔שׁ וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ מִצְנֶ֣פֶת שֵׁ֑שׁ וְאַבְנֵ֥ט תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה רֹקֵֽם׃
28.englishText: You shall make the fringed tunic of fine linen. You shall make the headdress of fine linen. You shall make the sash of embroidered work.
28.transliteration: vְshִׁbַּtsְtָּ֙ hַkְּtֹ֣nֶt shֵׁ֔shׁ vְaָshִׂ֖ytָ mִtsְnֶ֣pֶt shֵׁ֑shׁ vְaַbְnֵ֥t tַּaֲshֶׂ֖h mַaֲshֵׂ֥h rֹkֵֽם׃

28.hebrewText: וְלִבְנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה כֻתֳּנֹ֔ת וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם אַבְנֵטִ֑ים וּמִגְבָּעוֹת֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לָהֶ֔ם לְכָב֖וֹד וּלְתִפְאָֽרֶת׃
28.englishText: And for Aaron’s sons also you shall make tunics, and make sashes for them, and make turbans for them, for dignity and adornment.
28.transliteration: vְlִbְnֵ֤y aַhֲrֹן֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h kֻtֳּnֹ֔t vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ lָhֶ֖ם aַbְnֵtִ֑yם vּmִgְbָּavֹt֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h lָhֶ֔ם lְkָb֖vֹd vּlְtִpְaָֽrֶt׃

28.hebrewText: וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ אֶת־אַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֔יךָ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֨ אֹתָ֜ם וּמִלֵּאתָ֧ אֶת־יָדָ֛ם וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם וְכִהֲנ֥וּ לִֽי׃
28.englishText: Put these on your brother Aaron and on his sons as well; anoint them, and ordain them*and ordain them Lit. “and fill their hands.” and consecrate them to serve Me as priests.
28.transliteration: vְhִlְbַּshְׁtָּ֤ aֹtָם֙ aֶt־aַhֲrֹ֣ן aָchִ֔yךָ vְaֶt־bָּnָ֖yv aִtּ֑vֹ vּmָshַׁchְtָּ֨ aֹtָ֜ם vּmִlֵּatָ֧ aֶt־yָdָ֛ם vְkִdַּshְׁtָּ֥ aֹtָ֖ם vְkִhֲn֥vּ lִֽy׃

28.hebrewText: וַעֲשֵׂ֤ה לָהֶם֙ מִכְנְסֵי־בָ֔ד לְכַסּ֖וֹת בְּשַׂ֣ר עֶרְוָ֑ה מִמׇּתְנַ֥יִם וְעַד־יְרֵכַ֖יִם יִהְיֽוּ׃
28.englishText: You shall also make for them linen breeches to cover their nakedness; they shall extend from the hips to the thighs.
28.transliteration: vַaֲshֵׂ֤h lָhֶם֙ mִkְnְsֵy־bָ֔d lְkַsּ֖vֹt bְּshַׂ֣r aֶrְvָ֑h mִmׇּtְnַ֥yִם vְaַd־yְrֵkַ֖yִם yִhְyֽvּ׃

28.hebrewText: וְהָיוּ֩ עַל־אַהֲרֹ֨ן וְעַל־בָּנָ֜יו בְּבֹאָ֣ם ׀ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד א֣וֹ בְגִשְׁתָּ֤ם אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְלֹא־יִשְׂא֥וּ עָוֺ֖ן וָמֵ֑תוּ חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֛ם ל֖וֹ וּלְזַרְע֥וֹ אַחֲרָֽיו׃ {ס}
28.englishText: They shall be worn by Aaron and his sons when they enter the Tent of Meeting or when they approach the altar to officiate in the sanctuary, so that they do not incur punishment and die. It shall be a law for all time for him and for his offspring to come.
28.transliteration: vְhָyvּ֩ aַl־aַhֲrֹ֨ן vְaַl־bָּnָ֜yv bְּbֹaָ֣ם ׀ aֶl־aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֗d a֣vֹ bְgִshְׁtָּ֤ם aֶl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֙chַ֙ lְshָׁrֵ֣t bַּkֹּ֔dֶshׁ vְlֹa־yִshְׂa֥vּ aָvֺ֖ן vָmֵ֑tvּ chֻkַּ֥t avֹlָ֛ם l֖vֹ vּlְzַrְa֥vֹ aַchֲrָֽyv׃ {s}

29.hebrewText: וְזֶ֨ה הַדָּבָ֜ר אֲשֶֽׁר־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם לְקַדֵּ֥שׁ אֹתָ֖ם לְכַהֵ֣ן לִ֑י לְ֠קַ֠ח פַּ֣ר אֶחָ֧ד בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר וְאֵילִ֥ם שְׁנַ֖יִם תְּמִימִֽם׃
29.englishText: This is what you shall do to them in consecrating them to serve Me as priests: Take a young bull of the herd and two rams without blemish;
29.transliteration: vְzֶ֨h hַdָּbָ֜r aֲshֶֽׁr־tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h lָhֶ֛ם lְkַdֵּ֥shׁ aֹtָ֖ם lְkַhֵ֣ן lִ֑y lְ֠kַ֠ch pַּ֣r aֶchָ֧d bֶּן־bָּkָ֛r vְaֵylִ֥ם shְׁnַ֖yִם tְּmִymִֽם׃

29.hebrewText: וְלֶ֣חֶם מַצּ֗וֹת וְחַלֹּ֤ת מַצֹּת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֣ים בַּשָּׁ֑מֶן סֹ֥לֶת חִטִּ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
29.englishText: also unleavened bread, unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, and unleavened wafers spread with oil—make these of choice wheat flour.
29.transliteration: vְlֶ֣chֶם mַtsּ֗vֹt vְchַlֹּ֤t mַtsֹּt֙ bְּlvּlֹ֣t bַּshֶּׁ֔mֶן vּrְkִykֵ֥y mַtsּ֖vֹt mְshֻׁchִ֣yם bַּshָּׁ֑mֶן sֹ֥lֶt chִtִּ֖yם tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtָֽם׃

29.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֤ אוֹתָם֙ עַל־סַ֣ל אֶחָ֔ד וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּסָּ֑ל וְאֶ֨ת־הַפָּ֔ר וְאֵ֖ת שְׁנֵ֥י הָאֵילִֽם׃
29.englishText: Place these in one basket and present them in the basket, along with the bull and the two rams.
29.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֤ avֹtָם֙ aַl־sַ֣l aֶchָ֔d vְhִkְrַbְtָּ֥ aֹtָ֖ם bַּsָּ֑l vְaֶ֨t־hַpָּ֔r vְaֵ֖t shְׁnֵ֥y hָaֵylִֽם׃

29.hebrewText: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְאֶת־בָּנָיו֙ תַּקְרִ֔יב אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְרָחַצְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּמָּֽיִם׃
29.englishText: Lead Aaron and his sons up to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and wash them with water.
29.transliteration: vְaֶt־aַhֲrֹ֤ן vְaֶt־bָּnָyv֙ tַּkְrִ֔yb aֶl־pֶּ֖tַch aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֑d vְrָchַtsְtָּ֥ aֹtָ֖ם bַּmָּֽyִם׃

29.hebrewText: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הַבְּגָדִ֗ים וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֤ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־הַכֻּתֹּ֔נֶת וְאֵת֙ מְעִ֣יל הָאֵפֹ֔ד וְאֶת־הָאֵפֹ֖ד וְאֶת־הַחֹ֑שֶׁן וְאָפַדְתָּ֣ ל֔וֹ בְּחֵ֖שֶׁב הָאֵפֹֽד׃
29.englishText: Then take the vestments, and clothe Aaron with the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breastpiece, and gird him with the decorated band of the ephod.
29.transliteration: vְlָkַchְtָּ֣ aֶt־hַbְּgָdִ֗yם vְhִlְbַּshְׁtָּ֤ aֶֽt־aַhֲrֹן֙ aֶt־hַkֻּtֹּ֔nֶt vְaֵt֙ mְaִ֣yl hָaֵpֹ֔d vְaֶt־hָaֵpֹ֖d vְaֶt־hַchֹ֑shֶׁן vְaָpַdְtָּ֣ l֔vֹ bְּchֵ֖shֶׁb hָaֵpֹֽd׃

29.hebrewText: וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וְנָתַתָּ֛ אֶת־נֵ֥זֶר הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ עַל־הַמִּצְנָֽפֶת׃
29.englishText: Put the headdress on his head, and place the holy diadem upon the headdress.
29.transliteration: vְshַׂmְtָּ֥ hַmִּtsְnֶ֖pֶt aַl־rֹashׁ֑vֹ vְnָtַtָּ֛ aֶt־nֵ֥zֶr hַkֹּ֖dֶshׁ aַl־hַmִּtsְnָֽpֶt׃

29.hebrewText: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְיָצַקְתָּ֖ עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֖ אֹתֽוֹ׃
29.englishText: Take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.
29.transliteration: vְlָֽkַchְtָּ֙ aֶt־shֶׁ֣mֶן hַmִּshְׁchָ֔h vְyָtsַkְtָּ֖ aַl־rֹashׁ֑vֹ vּmָshַׁchְtָּ֖ aֹtֽvֹ׃

29.hebrewText: וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תַּקְרִ֑יב וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֖ם כֻּתֳּנֹֽת׃
29.englishText: Then bring his sons forward; clothe them with tunics
29.transliteration: vְaֶt־bָּnָ֖yv tַּkְrִ֑yb vְhִlְbַּshְׁtָּ֖ם kֻּtֳּnֹֽt׃

29.hebrewText: וְחָגַרְתָּ֩ אֹתָ֨ם אַבְנֵ֜ט אַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֗יו וְחָבַשְׁתָּ֤ לָהֶם֙ מִגְבָּעֹ֔ת וְהָיְתָ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם כְּהֻנָּ֖ה לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם וּמִלֵּאתָ֥ יַֽד־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְיַד־בָּנָֽיו׃
29.englishText: and wind turbans upon them. And gird both Aaron and his sons with sashes. And so they shall have priesthood as their right for all time. You shall then ordain Aaron and his sons.
29.transliteration: vְchָgַrְtָּ֩ aֹtָ֨ם aַbְnֵ֜t aַhֲrֹ֣ן vּbָnָ֗yv vְchָbַshְׁtָּ֤ lָhֶם֙ mִgְbָּaֹ֔t vְhָyְtָ֥h lָhֶ֛ם kְּhֻnָּ֖h lְchֻkַּ֣t avֹlָ֑ם vּmִlֵּatָ֥ yַֽd־aַhֲrֹ֖ן vְyַd־bָּnָֽyv׃

29.hebrewText: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַפָּ֔ר לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הַפָּֽר׃
29.englishText: Lead the bull up to the front of the Tent of Meeting, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the head of the bull.
29.transliteration: vְhִkְrַbְtָּ֙ aֶt־hַpָּ֔r lִpְnֵ֖y aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֑d vְsָmַ֨ךְ aַhֲrֹ֧ן vּbָnָ֛yv aֶt־yְdֵyhֶ֖ם aַl־rֹ֥ashׁ hַpָּֽr׃

29.hebrewText: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַפָּ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
29.englishText: Slaughter the bull before יהוה, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,
29.transliteration: vְshָׁchַtְtָּ֥ aֶt־hַpָּ֖r lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h pֶּ֖tַch aֹ֥hֶl mvֹaֵֽd׃

29.hebrewText: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ מִדַּ֣ם הַפָּ֔ר וְנָתַתָּ֛ה עַל־קַרְנֹ֥ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ בְּאֶצְבָּעֶ֑ךָ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַדָּ֣ם תִּשְׁפֹּ֔ךְ אֶל־יְס֖וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
29.englishText: and take some of the bull’s blood and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; then pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
29.transliteration: vְlָֽkַchְtָּ֙ mִdַּ֣ם hַpָּ֔r vְnָtַtָּ֛h aַl־kַrְnֹ֥t hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ bְּaֶtsְbָּaֶ֑ךָ vְaֶt־kׇּl־hַdָּ֣ם tִּshְׁpֹּ֔ךְ aֶl־yְs֖vֹd hַmִּzְbֵּֽchַ׃

29.hebrewText: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֗ אֶֽת־כׇּל־הַחֵ֘לֶב֮ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּ֒רֶב֒ וְאֵ֗ת הַיֹּתֶ֙רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֑ן וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֖ הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
29.englishText: Take all the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, and the two kidneys with the fat on them, and turn them into smoke upon the altar.
29.transliteration: vְlָֽkַchְtָּ֗ aֶֽt־kׇּl־hַchֵ֘lֶb֮ hַֽmְkַsֶּ֣h aֶt־hַkֶּ֒rֶb֒ vְaֵ֗t hַyֹּtֶ֙rֶt֙ aַl־hַkָּbֵ֔d vְaֵt֙ shְׁtֵּ֣y hַkְּlָyֹ֔t vְaֶt־hַchֵ֖lֶb aֲshֶׁ֣r aֲlֵyhֶ֑ן vְhִkְtַrְtָּ֖ hַmִּzְbֵּֽchָh׃

29.hebrewText: וְאֶת־בְּשַׂ֤ר הַפָּר֙ וְאֶת־עֹר֣וֹ וְאֶת־פִּרְשׁ֔וֹ תִּשְׂרֹ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה חַטָּ֖את הֽוּא׃
29.englishText: The rest of the flesh of the bull, its hide, and its dung shall be put to the fire outside the camp; it is a sin offering.*sin offering So throughout this translation and traditionally; more precisely, “offering of purgation.”
29.transliteration: vְaֶt־bְּshַׂ֤r hַpָּr֙ vְaֶt־aֹr֣vֹ vְaֶt־pִּrְshׁ֔vֹ tִּshְׂrֹ֣ף bָּaֵ֔shׁ mִch֖vּץ lַֽmַּchֲnֶ֑h chַtָּ֖at hֽvּa׃

29.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הָאַ֥יִל הָאֶחָ֖ד תִּקָּ֑ח וְסָ֨מְכ֜וּ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
29.englishText: Next take the one ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.
29.transliteration: vְaֶt־hָaַ֥yִl hָaֶchָ֖d tִּkָּ֑ch vְsָ֨mְk֜vּ aַhֲrֹ֧ן vּbָnָ֛yv aֶt־yְdֵyhֶ֖ם aַl־rֹ֥ashׁ hָaָֽyִl׃

29.hebrewText: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֖ אֶת־הָאָ֑יִל וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־דָּמ֔וֹ וְזָרַקְתָּ֥ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
29.englishText: Slaughter the ram, and take its blood and dash it against all sides of the altar.
29.transliteration: vְshָׁchַtְtָּ֖ aֶt־hָaָ֑yִl vְlָֽkַchְtָּ֙ aֶt־dָּm֔vֹ vְzָrַkְtָּ֥ aַl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ sָbִֽyb׃

29.hebrewText: וְאֶ֨ת־הָאַ֔יִל תְּנַתֵּ֖חַ לִנְתָחָ֑יו וְרָחַצְתָּ֤ קִרְבּוֹ֙ וּכְרָעָ֔יו וְנָתַתָּ֥ עַל־נְתָחָ֖יו וְעַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
29.englishText: Cut up the ram into sections, wash its entrails and legs, and put them with its quarters and its head.
29.transliteration: vְaֶ֨t־hָaַ֔yִl tְּnַtֵּ֖chַ lִnְtָchָ֑yv vְrָchַtsְtָּ֤ kִrְbּvֹ֙ vּkְrָaָ֔yv vְnָtַtָּ֥ aַl־nְtָchָ֖yv vְaַl־rֹashֽׁvֹ׃

29.hebrewText: וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֤ אֶת־כׇּל־הָאַ֙יִל֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עֹלָ֥ה ה֖וּא לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה רֵ֣יחַ נִיח֔וֹחַ אִשֶּׁ֥ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
29.englishText: Turn all of the ram into smoke upon the altar. It is a burnt offering to יהוה, a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to יהוה.
29.transliteration: vְhִkְtַrְtָּ֤ aֶt־kׇּl־hָaַ֙yִl֙ hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chָh aֹlָ֥h h֖vּa lַֽyhֹvָ֑h rֵ֣ychַ nִych֔vֹchַ aִshֶּׁ֥h lַyhֹvָ֖h hֽvּa׃

29.hebrewText: וְלָ֣קַחְתָּ֔ אֵ֖ת הָאַ֣יִל הַשֵּׁנִ֑י וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
29.englishText: Then take the other ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.
29.transliteration: vְlָ֣kַchְtָּ֔ aֵ֖t hָaַ֣yִl hַshֵּׁnִ֑y vְsָmַ֨ךְ aַhֲrֹ֧ן vּbָnָ֛yv aֶt־yְdֵyhֶ֖ם aַl־rֹ֥ashׁ hָaָֽyִl׃

29.hebrewText: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֣ אֶת־הָאַ֗יִל וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ מִדָּמוֹ֙ וְנָֽתַתָּ֡ה עַל־תְּנוּךְ֩ אֹ֨זֶן אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְעַל־תְּנ֨וּךְ אֹ֤זֶן בָּנָיו֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְלָ֖ם הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְזָרַקְתָּ֧ אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
29.englishText: Slaughter the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the ridge*ridge Or “lobe.” of Aaron’s right ear and on the ridges of his sons’ right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; and dash the rest of the blood against every side of the altar round about.
29.transliteration: vְshָׁchַtְtָּ֣ aֶt־hָaַ֗yִl vְlָkַchְtָּ֤ mִdָּmvֹ֙ vְnָֽtַtָּ֡h aַl־tְּnvּךְ֩ aֹ֨zֶן aַhֲrֹ֜ן vְaַl־tְּn֨vּךְ aֹ֤zֶן bָּnָyv֙ hַyְmָnִ֔yt vְaַl־bֹּ֤hֶן yָdָם֙ hַyְmָnִ֔yt vְaַl־bֹּ֥hֶן rַgְlָ֖ם hַyְmָnִ֑yt vְzָrַkְtָּ֧ aֶt־hַdָּ֛ם aַl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ sָbִֽyb׃

29.hebrewText: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ מִן־הַדָּ֨ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַֽל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֘חַ֮ וּמִשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה֒ וְהִזֵּיתָ֤ עַֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְעַל־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְעַל־בָּנָ֛יו וְעַל־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וְקָדַ֥שׁ הוּא֙ וּבְגָדָ֔יו וּבָנָ֛יו וּבִגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
29.englishText: Take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle upon Aaron and his vestments, and also upon his sons and his sons’ vestments. Thus shall he and his vestments be holy, as well as his sons and his sons’ vestments.
29.transliteration: vְlָkַchְtָּ֞ mִן־hַdָּ֨ם aֲshֶׁ֥r aַֽl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֘chַ֮ vּmִshֶּׁ֣mֶן hַmִּshְׁchָh֒ vְhִzֵּytָ֤ aַֽl־aַhֲrֹן֙ vְaַl־bְּgָdָ֔yv vְaַl־bָּnָ֛yv vְaַl־bִּgְdֵ֥y bָnָ֖yv aִtּ֑vֹ vְkָdַ֥shׁ hvּa֙ vּbְgָdָ֔yv vּbָnָ֛yv vּbִgְdֵ֥y bָnָ֖yv aִtּֽvֹ׃

29.hebrewText: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ מִן־הָ֠אַ֠יִל הַחֵ֨לֶב וְהָֽאַלְיָ֜ה וְאֶת־הַחֵ֣לֶב ׀ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּ֗רֶב וְאֵ֨ת יֹתֶ֤רֶת הַכָּבֵד֙ וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֗ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת שׁ֣וֹק הַיָּמִ֑ין כִּ֛י אֵ֥יל מִלֻּאִ֖ים הֽוּא׃
29.englishText: You shall take from the ram the fat parts—the broad tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, the two kidneys with the fat on them—and the right thigh; for this is a ram of ordination.
29.transliteration: vְlָkַchְtָּ֣ mִן־hָ֠aַ֠yִl hַchֵ֨lֶb vְhָֽaַlְyָ֜h vְaֶt־hַchֵ֣lֶb ׀ hַֽmְkַsֶּ֣h aֶt־hַkֶּ֗rֶb vְaֵ֨t yֹtֶ֤rֶt hַkָּbֵd֙ vְaֵ֣t ׀ shְׁtֵּ֣y hַkְּlָyֹ֗t vְaֶt־hַchֵ֙lֶb֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r aֲlֵyhֶ֔ן vְaֵ֖t shׁ֣vֹk hַyָּmִ֑yן kִּ֛y aֵ֥yl mִlֻּaִ֖yם hֽvּa׃

29.hebrewText: וְכִכַּ֨ר לֶ֜חֶם אַחַ֗ת וְֽחַלַּ֨ת לֶ֥חֶם שֶׁ֛מֶן אַחַ֖ת וְרָקִ֣יק אֶחָ֑ד מִסַּל֙ הַמַּצּ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
29.englishText: Add one flat loaf of bread, one cake of oil bread, and one wafer, from the basket of unleavened bread that is before יהוה.
29.transliteration: vְkִkַּ֨r lֶ֜chֶם aַchַ֗t vְֽchַlַּ֨t lֶ֥chֶם shֶׁ֛mֶן aַchַ֖t vְrָkִ֣yk aֶchָ֑d mִsַּl֙ hַmַּtsּ֔vֹt aֲshֶׁ֖r lִpְnֵ֥y yְhֹvָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ הַכֹּ֔ל עַ֚ל כַּפֵּ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְעַ֖ל כַּפֵּ֣י בָנָ֑יו וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
29.englishText: Place all these on the palms of Aaron and his sons, and offer them as an elevation offering before יהוה.
29.transliteration: vְshַׂmְtָּ֣ hַkֹּ֔l aַ֚l kַּpֵּ֣y aַhֲrֹ֔ן vְaַ֖l kַּpֵּ֣y bָnָ֑yv vְhֵnַpְtָּ֥ aֹtָ֛ם tְּnvּpָ֖h lִpְnֵ֥y yְhֹvָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ מִיָּדָ֔ם וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֥ הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חָה עַל־הָעֹלָ֑ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיח֙וֹחַ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אִשֶּׁ֥ה ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃
29.englishText: Take them from their hands and turn them into smoke upon the altar with the burnt offering, as a pleasing odor before יהוה; it is an offering by fire to יהוה.
29.transliteration: vְlָkַchְtָּ֤ aֹtָם֙ mִyָּdָ֔ם vְhִkְtַrְtָּ֥ hַmִּzְbֵּ֖chָh aַl־hָaֹlָ֑h lְrֵ֤ychַ nִych֙vֹchַ֙ lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֔h aִshֶּׁ֥h h֖vּa lַyhֹvָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הֶֽחָזֶ֗ה מֵאֵ֤יל הַמִּלֻּאִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹת֛וֹ תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְמָנָֽה׃
29.englishText: Then take the breast of Aaron’s ram of ordination and offer it as an elevation offering before יהוה; it shall be your portion.
29.transliteration: vְlָkַchְtָּ֣ aֶt־hֶֽchָzֶ֗h mֵaֵ֤yl hַmִּlֻּaִyם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r lְaַhֲrֹ֔ן vְhֵnַpְtָּ֥ aֹt֛vֹ tְּnvּpָ֖h lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h vְhָyָ֥h lְךָ֖ lְmָnָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֞ אֵ֣ת ׀ חֲזֵ֣ה הַתְּנוּפָ֗ה וְאֵת֙ שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוּנַ֖ף וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר הוּרָ֑ם מֵאֵיל֙ הַמִּלֻּאִ֔ים מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּמֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר לְבָנָֽיו׃
29.englishText: You shall consecrate the breast that was offered as an elevation offering and the thigh that was offered as a gift offering from the ram of ordination—from that which was Aaron’s and from that which was his sons’—
29.transliteration: vְkִdַּshְׁtָּ֞ aֵ֣t ׀ chֲzֵ֣h hַtְּnvּpָ֗h vְaֵt֙ shׁ֣vֹk hַtְּrvּmָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r hvּnַ֖ף vַaֲshֶׁ֣r hvּrָ֑ם mֵaֵyl֙ hַmִּlֻּaִ֔yם mֵaֲshֶׁ֥r lְaַhֲrֹ֖ן vּmֵaֲshֶׁ֥r lְbָnָֽyv׃

29.hebrewText: וְהָיָה֩ לְאַהֲרֹ֨ן וּלְבָנָ֜יו לְחׇק־עוֹלָ֗ם מֵאֵת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י תְרוּמָ֖ה ה֑וּא וּתְרוּמָ֞ה יִהְיֶ֨ה מֵאֵ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִזִּבְחֵ֣י שַׁלְמֵיהֶ֔ם תְּרוּמָתָ֖ם לַיהֹוָֽה׃
29.englishText: and those parts shall be a due for all time from the Israelites to Aaron and his sons. For they are a gift; and so shall they be a gift from the Israelites, their gift to יהוה out of their sacrifices of well-being.
29.transliteration: vְhָyָh֩ lְaַhֲrֹ֨ן vּlְbָnָ֜yv lְchׇk־avֹlָ֗ם mֵaֵt֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l kִּ֥y tְrvּmָ֖h h֑vּa vּtְrvּmָ֞h yִhְyֶ֨h mֵaֵ֤t bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ mִzִּbְchֵ֣y shַׁlְmֵyhֶ֔ם tְּrvּmָtָ֖ם lַyhֹvָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: וּבִגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן יִהְי֥וּ לְבָנָ֖יו אַחֲרָ֑יו לְמׇשְׁחָ֣ה בָהֶ֔ם וּלְמַלֵּא־בָ֖ם אֶת־יָדָֽם׃
29.englishText: The sacral vestments of Aaron shall pass on to his sons after him, for them to be anointed and ordained in.
29.transliteration: vּbִgְdֵ֤y hַkֹּ֙dֶshׁ֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r lְaַhֲrֹ֔ן yִhְy֥vּ lְbָnָ֖yv aַchֲrָ֑yv lְmׇshְׁchָ֣h bָhֶ֔ם vּlְmַlֵּa־bָ֖ם aֶt־yָdָֽם׃

29.hebrewText: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים יִלְבָּשָׁ֧ם הַכֹּהֵ֛ן תַּחְתָּ֖יו מִבָּנָ֑יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָבֹ֛א אֶל־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֥ת בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
29.englishText: He among his sons who becomes priest in his stead, who enters the Tent of Meeting to officiate within the sanctuary, shall wear them seven days.
29.transliteration: shִׁbְaַ֣t yָmִ֗yם yִlְbָּshָׁ֧ם hַkֹּhֵ֛ן tַּchְtָּ֖yv mִbָּnָ֑yv aֲshֶׁ֥r yָbֹ֛a aֶl־aֹ֥hֶl mvֹaֵ֖d lְshָׁrֵ֥t bַּkֹּֽdֶshׁ׃

29.hebrewText: וְאֵ֛ת אֵ֥יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֖ים תִּקָּ֑ח וּבִשַּׁלְתָּ֥ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בְּמָקֹ֥ם קָדֹֽשׁ׃
29.englishText: You shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in the sacred precinct;
29.transliteration: vְaֵ֛t aֵ֥yl hַmִּlֻּaִ֖yם tִּkָּ֑ch vּbִshַּׁlְtָּ֥ aֶt־bְּshָׂr֖vֹ bְּmָkֹ֥ם kָdֹֽshׁ׃

29.hebrewText: וְאָכַ֨ל אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר הָאַ֔יִל וְאֶת־הַלֶּ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּסָּ֑ל פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
29.englishText: and Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
29.transliteration: vְaָkַ֨l aַhֲrֹ֤ן vּbָnָyv֙ aֶt־bְּshַׂ֣r hָaַ֔yִl vְaֶt־hַlֶּ֖chֶם aֲshֶׁ֣r bַּsָּ֑l pֶּ֖tַch aֹ֥hֶl mvֹaֵֽd׃

29.hebrewText: וְאָכְל֤וּ אֹתָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר כֻּפַּ֣ר בָּהֶ֔ם לְמַלֵּ֥א אֶת־יָדָ֖ם לְקַדֵּ֣שׁ אֹתָ֑ם וְזָ֥ר לֹא־יֹאכַ֖ל כִּי־קֹ֥דֶשׁ הֵֽם׃
29.englishText: These things shall be eaten only by those for whom expiation was made with them when they were ordained and consecrated; they may not be eaten by a lay person, for they are holy.
29.transliteration: vְaָkְl֤vּ aֹtָם֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r kֻּpַּ֣r bָּhֶ֔ם lְmַlֵּ֥a aֶt־yָdָ֖ם lְkַdֵּ֣shׁ aֹtָ֑ם vְzָ֥r lֹa־yֹakַ֖l kִּy־kֹ֥dֶshׁ hֵֽם׃

29.hebrewText: וְֽאִם־יִוָּתֵ֞ר מִבְּשַׂ֧ר הַמִּלֻּאִ֛ים וּמִן־הַלֶּ֖חֶם עַד־הַבֹּ֑קֶר וְשָׂרַפְתָּ֤ אֶת־הַנּוֹתָר֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ לֹ֥א יֵאָכֵ֖ל כִּי־קֹ֥דֶשׁ הֽוּא׃
29.englishText: And if any of the flesh of ordination, or any of the bread, is left until morning, you shall put what is left to the fire; it shall not be eaten, for it is holy.
29.transliteration: vְֽaִם־yִvָּtֵ֞r mִbְּshַׂ֧r hַmִּlֻּaִ֛yם vּmִן־hַlֶּ֖chֶם aַd־hַbֹּ֑kֶr vְshָׂrַpְtָּ֤ aֶt־hַnּvֹtָr֙ bָּaֵ֔shׁ lֹ֥a yֵaָkֵ֖l kִּy־kֹ֥dֶshׁ hֽvּa׃

29.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ לְאַהֲרֹ֤ן וּלְבָנָיו֙ כָּ֔כָה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּ֖יתִי אֹתָ֑כָה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תְּמַלֵּ֥א יָדָֽם׃
29.englishText: Thus you shall do to Aaron and his sons, just as I have commanded you. You shall ordain them through seven days,
29.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֜ytָ lְaַhֲrֹ֤ן vּlְbָnָyv֙ kָּ֔kָh kְּkֹ֥l aֲshֶׁr־tsִvִּ֖ytִy aֹtָ֑kָh shִׁbְaַ֥t yָmִ֖yם tְּmַlֵּ֥a yָdָֽם׃

29.hebrewText: וּפַ֨ר חַטָּ֜את תַּעֲשֶׂ֤ה לַיּוֹם֙ עַל־הַכִּפֻּרִ֔ים וְחִטֵּאתָ֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בְּכַפֶּרְךָ֖ עָלָ֑יו וּמָֽשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֹת֖וֹ לְקַדְּשֽׁוֹ׃
29.englishText: and each day you shall prepare a bull as a sin offering for expiation; you shall purge the altar by performing purification upon it, and you shall anoint it to consecrate it.
29.transliteration: vּpַ֨r chַtָּ֜at tַּaֲshֶׂ֤h lַyּvֹם֙ aַl־hַkִּpֻּrִ֔yם vְchִtֵּatָ֙ aַl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ bְּkַpֶּrְךָ֖ aָlָ֑yv vּmָֽshַׁchְtָּ֥ aֹt֖vֹ lְkַdְּshֽׁvֹ׃

29.hebrewText: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים תְּכַפֵּר֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֖ אֹת֑וֹ וְהָיָ֤ה הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֔ים כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בַּמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃ {ס}
29.englishText: Seven days you shall perform purification for the altar to consecrate it, and the altar shall become most holy; whatever touches the altar shall become consecrated.
29.transliteration: shִׁbְaַ֣t yָmִ֗yם tְּkַpֵּr֙ aַl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ vְkִdַּshְׁtָּ֖ aֹt֑vֹ vְhָyָ֤h hַmִּzְbֵּ֙chַ֙ kֹ֣dֶshׁ kׇֽdָshִׁ֔yם kׇּl־hַnֹּgֵ֥aַ bַּmִּzְbֵּ֖chַ yִkְdָּֽshׁ׃ {s}

29.hebrewText: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה שְׁנַ֥יִם לַיּ֖וֹם תָּמִֽיד׃
29.englishText: Now this is what you shall offer upon the altar: two yearling lambs each day, regularly.
29.transliteration: vְzֶ֕h aֲshֶׁ֥r tַּaֲshֶׂ֖h aַl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֑chַ kְּbָshִׂ֧yם bְּnֵֽy־shָׁnָ֛h shְׁnַ֥yִם lַyּ֖vֹם tָּmִֽyd׃

29.hebrewText: אֶת־הַכֶּ֥בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה בַבֹּ֑קֶר וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבָּֽיִם׃
29.englishText: You shall offer the one lamb in the morning, and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight.
29.transliteration: aֶt־hַkֶּ֥bֶshׂ hָaֶchָ֖d tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h bַbֹּ֑kֶr vְaֵt֙ hַkֶּ֣bֶshׂ hַshֵּׁnִ֔y tַּaֲshֶׂ֖h bֵּ֥yן hָaַrְbָּֽyִם׃

29.hebrewText: וְעִשָּׂרֹ֨ן סֹ֜לֶת בָּל֨וּל בְּשֶׁ֤מֶן כָּתִית֙ רֶ֣בַע הַהִ֔ין וְנֵ֕סֶךְ רְבִיעִ֥ת הַהִ֖ין יָ֑יִן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָֽד׃
29.englishText: There shall be a tenth of a measure of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in, and a libation of a quarter hin of wine for one lamb;
29.transliteration: vְaִshָּׂrֹ֨ן sֹ֜lֶt bָּl֨vּl bְּshֶׁ֤mֶן kָּtִyt֙ rֶ֣bַa hַhִ֔yן vְnֵ֕sֶךְ rְbִyaִ֥t hַhִ֖yן yָ֑yִן lַkֶּ֖bֶshׂ hָaֶchָֽd׃

29.hebrewText: וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֣ין הָעַרְבָּ֑יִם כְּמִנְחַ֨ת הַבֹּ֤קֶר וּכְנִסְכָּהּ֙ תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֔הּ לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
29.englishText: and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight, repeating with it the meal offering of the morning with its libation—an offering by fire for a pleasing odor to יהוה,
29.transliteration: vְaֵt֙ hַkֶּ֣bֶshׂ hַshֵּׁnִ֔y tַּaֲshֶׂ֖h bֵּ֣yן hָaַrְbָּ֑yִם kְּmִnְchַ֨t hַbֹּ֤kֶr vּkְnִsְkָּhּ֙ tַּֽaֲshֶׂh־lָּ֔hּ lְrֵ֣ychַ nִychֹ֔chַ aִshֶּׁ֖h lַyhֹvָֽh׃

29.hebrewText: עֹלַ֤ת תָּמִיד֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אִוָּעֵ֤ד לָכֶם֙ שָׁ֔מָּה לְדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ שָֽׁם׃
29.englishText: a regular burnt offering throughout the generations, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting before יהוה. For there I will meet with you, and there I will speak with you,
29.transliteration: aֹlַ֤t tָּmִyd֙ lְdֹrֹ֣tֵykֶ֔ם pֶּ֥tַch aֹֽhֶl־mvֹaֵ֖d lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֑h aֲshֶׁ֨r aִvָּaֵ֤d lָkֶם֙ shָׁ֔mָּh lְdַbֵּ֥r aֵlֶ֖yךָ shָֽׁם׃

29.hebrewText: וְנֹעַדְתִּ֥י שָׁ֖מָּה לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנִקְדַּ֖שׁ בִּכְבֹדִֽי׃
29.englishText: and there I will meet with the Israelites, and it shall be sanctified by My Presence.
29.transliteration: vְnֹaַdְtִּ֥y shָׁ֖mָּh lִbְnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vְnִkְdַּ֖shׁ bִּkְbֹdִֽy׃

29.hebrewText: וְקִדַּשְׁתִּ֛י אֶת־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֧ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֛יו אֲקַדֵּ֖שׁ לְכַהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
29.englishText: I will sanctify the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and I will consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve Me as priests.
29.transliteration: vְkִdַּshְׁtִּ֛y aֶt־aֹ֥hֶl mvֹaֵ֖d vְaֶt־hַmִּzְbֵּ֑chַ vְaֶt־aַhֲrֹ֧ן vְaֶt־bָּnָ֛yv aֲkַdֵּ֖shׁ lְkַhֵ֥ן lִֽy׃

29.hebrewText: וְשָׁ֣כַנְתִּ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
29.englishText: I will abide among the Israelites, and I will be their God.
29.transliteration: vְshָׁ֣kַnְtִּ֔y bְּt֖vֹךְ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vְhָyִ֥ytִy lָhֶ֖ם lֵalֹhִֽyם׃

29.hebrewText: וְיָדְע֗וּ כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֧אתִי אֹתָ֛ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לְשׇׁכְנִ֣י בְתוֹכָ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
29.englishText: And they shall know that I יהוה am their God, who brought them out from the land of Egypt that I might abide among them—I, their God יהוה.
29.transliteration: vְyָdְa֗vּ kִּ֣y aֲnִ֤y yְhֹvָh֙ aֱlֹ֣hֵyhֶ֔ם aֲshֶׁ֨r hvֹtsֵ֧atִy aֹtָ֛ם mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrַ֖yִם lְshׇׁkְnִ֣y bְtvֹkָ֑ם aֲnִ֖y yְhֹvָ֥h aֱlֹhֵyhֶֽם׃ {p}

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מִזְבֵּ֖חַ מִקְטַ֣ר קְטֹ֑רֶת עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
30.englishText: You shall make an altar for burning incense; make it of acacia wood.
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ mִzְbֵּ֖chַ mִkְtַ֣r kְtֹ֑rֶt aֲtsֵ֥y shִׁtִּ֖yם tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtֽvֹ׃

30.hebrewText: אַמָּ֨ה אׇרְכּ֜וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה רׇחְבּוֹ֙ רָב֣וּעַ יִהְיֶ֔ה וְאַמָּתַ֖יִם קֹמָת֑וֹ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ קַרְנֹתָֽיו׃
30.englishText: It shall be a cubit long and a cubit wide—it shall be square—and two cubits high, its horns of one piece with it.
30.transliteration: aַmָּ֨h aׇrְkּ֜vֹ vְaַmָּ֤h rׇchְbּvֹ֙ rָb֣vּaַ yִhְyֶ֔h vְaַmָּtַ֖yִם kֹmָt֑vֹ mִmֶּ֖nּvּ kַrְnֹtָֽyv׃

30.hebrewText: וְצִפִּיתָ֨ אֹת֜וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֗וֹר אֶת־גַּגּ֧וֹ וְאֶת־קִירֹתָ֛יו סָבִ֖יב וְאֶת־קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לּ֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
30.englishText: Overlay it with pure gold: its top, its sides round about, and its horns; and make a gold molding for it round about.
30.transliteration: vְtsִpִּytָ֨ aֹt֜vֹ zָhָ֣b tָh֗vֹr aֶt־gַּgּ֧vֹ vְaֶt־kִyrֹtָ֛yv sָbִ֖yb vְaֶt־kַrְnֹtָ֑yv vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ lּ֛vֹ zֵ֥r zָhָ֖b sָbִֽyb׃

30.hebrewText: וּשְׁתֵּי֩ טַבְּעֹ֨ת זָהָ֜ב תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ ׀ מִתַּ֣חַת לְזֵר֗וֹ עַ֚ל שְׁתֵּ֣י צַלְעֹתָ֔יו תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַל־שְׁנֵ֣י צִדָּ֑יו וְהָיָה֙ לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֵֽמָּה׃
30.englishText: And make two gold rings for it under its molding; make them on its two side walls, on opposite*opposite Lit. “its two.” sides. They shall serve as holders for poles with which to carry it.
30.transliteration: vּshְׁtֵּy֩ tַbְּaֹ֨t zָhָ֜b tַּֽaֲshֶׂh־lּ֣vֹ ׀ mִtַּ֣chַt lְzֵr֗vֹ aַ֚l shְׁtֵּ֣y tsַlְaֹtָ֔yv tַּaֲshֶׂ֖h aַl־shְׁnֵ֣y tsִdָּ֑yv vְhָyָh֙ lְbָtִּ֣yם lְbַdִּ֔yם lָshֵׂ֥at aֹt֖vֹ bָּhֵֽmָּh׃

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
30.englishText: Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ aֶt־hַbַּdִּ֖yם aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֹtָ֖ם zָhָֽb׃

30.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אֹתוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־אֲרֹ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֑ת לִפְנֵ֣י הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־הָ֣עֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לְךָ֖ שָֽׁמָּה׃
30.englishText: Place it in front of the curtain that is over the Ark of the Pact—in front of the cover that is over the Pact—where I will meet with you.
30.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֤h aֹtvֹ֙ lִpְnֵ֣y hַpָּrֹ֔kֶt aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־aֲrֹ֣ן hָaֵdֻ֑t lִpְnֵ֣y hַkַּpֹּ֗rֶt aֲshֶׁr֙ aַl־hָ֣aֵdֻ֔t aֲshֶׁ֛r aִvָּaֵ֥d lְךָ֖ shָֽׁmָּh׃

30.hebrewText: וְהִקְטִ֥יר עָלָ֛יו אַהֲרֹ֖ן קְטֹ֣רֶת סַמִּ֑ים בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֗קֶר בְּהֵיטִיב֛וֹ אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֖ת יַקְטִירֶֽנָּה׃
30.englishText: On it Aaron shall burn aromatic incense: he shall burn it every morning when he tends the lamps,
30.transliteration: vְhִkְtִ֥yr aָlָ֛yv aַhֲrֹ֖ן kְtֹ֣rֶt sַmִּ֑yם bַּbֹּ֣kֶr bַּbֹּ֗kֶr bְּhֵytִyb֛vֹ aֶt־hַnֵּrֹ֖t yַkְtִyrֶֽnָּh׃

30.hebrewText: וּבְהַעֲלֹ֨ת אַהֲרֹ֧ן אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֛ת בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבַּ֖יִם יַקְטִירֶ֑נָּה קְטֹ֧רֶת תָּמִ֛יד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: and Aaron shall burn it at twilight when he lights the lamps—a regular incense offering before יהוה throughout the ages.
30.transliteration: vּbְhַaֲlֹ֨t aַhֲrֹ֧ן aֶt־hַnֵּrֹ֛t bֵּ֥yן hָaַrְbַּ֖yִם yַkְtִyrֶ֑nָּh kְtֹ֧rֶt tָּmִ֛yd lִpְnֵ֥y yְhֹvָ֖h lְdֹrֹtֵykֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: לֹא־תַעֲל֥וּ עָלָ֛יו קְטֹ֥רֶת זָרָ֖ה וְעֹלָ֣ה וּמִנְחָ֑ה וְנֵ֕סֶךְ לֹ֥א תִסְּכ֖וּ עָלָֽיו׃
30.englishText: You shall not offer alien incense on it, or a burnt offering or a meal offering; neither shall you pour a libation on it.
30.transliteration: lֹa־tַaֲl֥vּ aָlָ֛yv kְtֹ֥rֶt zָrָ֖h vְaֹlָ֣h vּmִnְchָ֑h vְnֵ֕sֶךְ lֹ֥a tִsְּk֖vּ aָlָֽyv׃

30.hebrewText: וְכִפֶּ֤ר אַהֲרֹן֙ עַל־קַרְנֹתָ֔יו אַחַ֖ת בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה מִדַּ֞ם חַטַּ֣את הַכִּפֻּרִ֗ים אַחַ֤ת בַּשָּׁנָה֙ יְכַפֵּ֤ר עָלָיו֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם קֹֽדֶשׁ־קׇדָשִׁ֥ים ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
30.englishText: Once a year Aaron shall perform purification upon its horns with blood of the sin offering of purification; purification shall be performed upon it once a year throughout the ages. It is most holy to יהוה.
30.transliteration: vְkִpֶּ֤r aַhֲrֹן֙ aַl־kַrְnֹtָ֔yv aַchַ֖t bַּshָּׁnָ֑h mִdַּ֞ם chַtַּ֣at hַkִּpֻּrִ֗yם aַchַ֤t bַּshָּׁnָh֙ yְkַpֵּ֤r aָlָyv֙ lְdֹrֹ֣tֵykֶ֔ם kֹֽdֶshׁ־kׇdָshִׁ֥yם h֖vּa lַyhֹvָֽh׃ {p}

30.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
30.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
30.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

30.hebrewText: כִּ֣י תִשָּׂ֞א אֶת־רֹ֥אשׁ בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לִפְקֻדֵיהֶם֒ וְנָ֨תְנ֜וּ אִ֣ישׁ כֹּ֧פֶר נַפְשׁ֛וֹ לַיהֹוָ֖ה בִּפְקֹ֣ד אֹתָ֑ם וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה בָהֶ֛ם נֶ֖גֶף בִּפְקֹ֥ד אֹתָֽם׃
30.englishText: When you take a census of the Israelite men according to their army enrollment, each shall pay יהוה a ransom for himself on being enrolled, that no plague may come upon them through their being enrolled.
30.transliteration: kִּ֣y tִshָּׂ֞a aֶt־rֹ֥ashׁ bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵl֮ lִpְkֻdֵyhֶם֒ vְnָ֨tְn֜vּ aִ֣yshׁ kֹּ֧pֶr nַpְshׁ֛vֹ lַyhֹvָ֖h bִּpְkֹ֣d aֹtָ֑ם vְlֹa־yִhְyֶ֥h bָhֶ֛ם nֶ֖gֶף bִּpְkֹ֥d aֹtָֽם׃

30.hebrewText: זֶ֣ה ׀ יִתְּנ֗וּ כׇּל־הָעֹבֵר֙ עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים מַחֲצִ֥ית הַשֶּׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ עֶשְׂרִ֤ים גֵּרָה֙ הַשֶּׁ֔קֶל מַחֲצִ֣ית הַשֶּׁ֔קֶל תְּרוּמָ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
30.englishText: This is what everyone who is entered in the records shall pay: a half-shekel by the sanctuary weight—twenty gerahs to the shekel—a half-shekel as an offering to יהוה.
30.transliteration: zֶ֣h ׀ yִtְּn֗vּ kׇּl־hָaֹbֵr֙ aַl־hַpְּkֻdִ֔yם mַchֲtsִ֥yt hַshֶּׁ֖kֶl bְּshֶׁ֣kֶl hַkֹּ֑dֶshׁ aֶshְׂrִ֤yם gֵּrָh֙ hַshֶּׁ֔kֶl mַchֲtsִ֣yt hַshֶּׁ֔kֶl tְּrvּmָ֖h lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃

30.hebrewText: כֹּ֗ל הָעֹבֵר֙ עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָ֑עְלָה יִתֵּ֖ן תְּרוּמַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
30.englishText: Everyone who is entered in the records, from the age of twenty years up, shall give יהוה’s offering:
30.transliteration: kֹּ֗l hָaֹbֵr֙ aַl־hַpְּkֻdִ֔yם mִbֶּ֛ן aֶshְׂrִ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h vָmָ֑aְlָh yִtֵּ֖ן tְּrvּmַ֥t yְhֹvָֽh׃

30.hebrewText: הֶֽעָשִׁ֣יר לֹֽא־יַרְבֶּ֗ה וְהַדַּל֙ לֹ֣א יַמְעִ֔יט מִֽמַּחֲצִ֖ית הַשָּׁ֑קֶל לָתֵת֙ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: the rich shall not pay more and the poor shall not pay less than half a shekel when giving יהוה’s offering as expiation for your persons.
30.transliteration: hֶֽaָshִׁ֣yr lֹֽa־yַrְbֶּ֗h vְhַdַּl֙ lֹ֣a yַmְaִ֔yt mִֽmַּchֲtsִ֖yt hַshָּׁ֑kֶl lָtֵt֙ aֶt־tְּrvּmַ֣t yְhֹvָ֔h lְkַpֵּ֖r aַl־nַpְshֹׁtֵykֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ אֶת־כֶּ֣סֶף הַכִּפֻּרִ֗ים מֵאֵת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְנָתַתָּ֣ אֹת֔וֹ עַל־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהָיָה֩ לִבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל לְזִכָּרוֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
30.englishText: You shall take the expiation money from the Israelites and assign it to the service of the Tent of Meeting; it shall serve the Israelites as a reminder before יהוה, as expiation for your persons.
30.transliteration: vְlָkַchְtָּ֞ aֶt־kֶּ֣sֶף hַkִּpֻּrִ֗yם mֵaֵt֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l vְnָtַtָּ֣ aֹt֔vֹ aַl־aֲbֹdַ֖t aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֑d vְhָyָh֩ lִbְnֵ֨y yִshְׂrָaֵ֤l lְzִkָּrvֹן֙ lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֔h lְkַpֵּ֖r aַl־nַpְshֹׁtֵykֶֽם׃ {p}

30.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
30.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
30.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ כִּיּ֥וֹר נְחֹ֛שֶׁת וְכַנּ֥וֹ נְחֹ֖שֶׁת לְרׇחְצָ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֣ אֹת֗וֹ בֵּֽין־אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְנָתַתָּ֥ שָׁ֖מָּה מָֽיִם׃
30.englishText: Make a laver of copper and a stand of copper for it, for washing; and place it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar. Put water in it,
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֜ytָ kִּyּ֥vֹr nְchֹ֛shֶׁt vְkַnּ֥vֹ nְchֹ֖shֶׁt lְrׇchְtsָ֑h vְnָtַtָּ֣ aֹt֗vֹ bֵּֽyן־aֹ֤hֶl mvֹaֵd֙ vּbֵ֣yן hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ vְnָtַtָּ֥ shָׁ֖mָּh mָֽyִם׃

30.hebrewText: וְרָחֲצ֛וּ אַהֲרֹ֥ן וּבָנָ֖יו מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־רַגְלֵיהֶֽם׃
30.englishText: and let Aaron and his sons wash their hands and feet [in water drawn] from it.
30.transliteration: vְrָchֲts֛vּ aַhֲrֹ֥ן vּbָnָ֖yv mִmֶּ֑nּvּ aֶt־yְdֵyhֶ֖ם vְaֶt־rַgְlֵyhֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: בְּבֹאָ֞ם אֶל־אֹ֧הֶל מוֹעֵ֛ד יִרְחֲצוּ־מַ֖יִם וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֑תוּ א֣וֹ בְגִשְׁתָּ֤ם אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לְשָׁרֵ֔ת לְהַקְטִ֥יר אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
30.englishText: When they enter the Tent of Meeting they shall wash with water, that they may not die; or when they approach the altar to serve, to turn into smoke an offering by fire to יהוה,
30.transliteration: bְּbֹaָ֞ם aֶl־aֹ֧hֶl mvֹaֵ֛d yִrְchֲtsvּ־mַ֖yִם vְlֹ֣a yָmֻ֑tvּ a֣vֹ bְgִshְׁtָּ֤ם aֶl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֙chַ֙ lְshָׁrֵ֔t lְhַkְtִ֥yr aִshֶּׁ֖h lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃

30.hebrewText: וְרָחֲצ֛וּ יְדֵיהֶ֥ם וְרַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֑תוּ וְהָיְתָ֨ה לָהֶ֧ם חׇק־עוֹלָ֛ם ל֥וֹ וּלְזַרְע֖וֹ לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
30.englishText: they shall wash their hands and feet, that they may not die. It shall be a law for all time for them—for him and his offspring—throughout the ages.
30.transliteration: vְrָchֲts֛vּ yְdֵyhֶ֥ם vְrַgְlֵyhֶ֖ם vְlֹ֣a yָmֻ֑tvּ vְhָyְtָ֨h lָhֶ֧ם chׇk־avֹlָ֛ם l֥vֹ vּlְzַrְa֖vֹ lְdֹrֹtָֽם׃ {p}

30.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
30.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
30.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

30.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֣ה קַח־לְךָ֮ בְּשָׂמִ֣ים רֹאשׁ֒ מׇר־דְּרוֹר֙ חֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וְקִנְּמׇן־בֶּ֥שֶׂם מַחֲצִית֖וֹ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתָ֑יִם וּקְנֵה־בֹ֖שֶׂם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
30.englishText: Next take choice spices: five hundred weight of solidified*solidified Others “flowing.” myrrh, half as much—two hundred and fifty—of fragrant cinnamon, two hundred and fifty of aromatic cane,
30.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֣h kַch־lְךָ֮ bְּshָׂmִ֣yם rֹashׁ֒ mׇr־dְּrvֹr֙ chֲmֵ֣shׁ mֵa֔vֹt vְkִnְּmׇן־bֶּ֥shֶׂם mַchֲtsִyt֖vֹ chֲmִshִּׁ֣yם vּmָatָ֑yִם vּkְnֵh־bֹ֖shֶׂם chֲmִshִּׁ֥yם vּmָatָֽyִם׃

30.hebrewText: וְקִדָּ֕ה חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְשֶׁ֥מֶן זַ֖יִת הִֽין׃
30.englishText: five hundred—by the sanctuary weight—of cassia, and a hin of olive oil.
30.transliteration: vְkִdָּ֕h chֲmֵ֥shׁ mֵa֖vֹt bְּshֶׁ֣kֶl hַkֹּ֑dֶshׁ vְshֶׁ֥mֶן zַ֖yִt hִֽyן׃

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ אֹת֗וֹ שֶׁ֚מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֔דֶשׁ רֹ֥קַח מִרְקַ֖חַת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑חַ שֶׁ֥מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶֽה׃
30.englishText: Make of this a sacred anointing oil, a compound of ingredients expertly blended, to serve as sacred anointing oil.
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ aֹt֗vֹ shֶׁ֚mֶן mִshְׁchַt־kֹ֔dֶshׁ rֹ֥kַch mִrְkַ֖chַt mַaֲshֵׂ֣h rֹkֵ֑chַ shֶׁ֥mֶן mִshְׁchַt־kֹ֖dֶshׁ yִhְyֶֽh׃

30.hebrewText: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ ב֖וֹ אֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְאֵ֖ת אֲר֥וֹן הָעֵדֻֽת׃
30.englishText: With it anoint the Tent of Meeting, the Ark of the Pact,
30.transliteration: vּmָshַׁchְtָּ֥ b֖vֹ aֶt־aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֑d vְaֵ֖t aֲr֥vֹן hָaֵdֻֽt׃

30.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֖ה וְאֶת־כֵּלֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃
30.englishText: the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and all its fittings, the altar of incense,
30.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָן֙ vְaֶt־kׇּl־kֵּlָ֔yv vְaֶt־hַmְּnֹrָ֖h vְaֶt־kֵּlֶ֑yhָ vְaֵ֖t mִzְbַּ֥ch hַkְּtֹֽrֶt׃

30.hebrewText: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
30.englishText: the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand.
30.transliteration: vְaֶt־mִzְbַּ֥ch hָaֹlָ֖h vְaֶt־kׇּl־kֵּlָ֑yv vְaֶt־hַkִּyֹּ֖r vְaֶt־kַּnּֽvֹ׃

30.hebrewText: וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם וְהָי֖וּ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֑ים כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהֶ֖ם יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃
30.englishText: Thus you shall consecrate them so that they may be most holy; whatever touches them shall be consecrated.
30.transliteration: vְkִdַּshְׁtָּ֣ aֹtָ֔ם vְhָy֖vּ kֹ֣dֶshׁ kׇֽdָshִׁ֑yם kׇּl־hַnֹּgֵ֥aַ bָּhֶ֖ם yִkְdָּֽshׁ׃

30.hebrewText: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֥ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תִּמְשָׁ֑ח וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם לְכַהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
30.englishText: You shall also anoint Aaron and his sons, consecrating them to serve Me as priests.
30.transliteration: vְaֶt־aַhֲrֹ֥ן vְaֶt־bָּnָ֖yv tִּmְshָׁ֑ch vְkִdַּshְׁtָּ֥ aֹtָ֖ם lְkַhֵ֥ן lִֽy׃

30.hebrewText: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר שֶׁ֠מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֨דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֥ה זֶ֛ה לִ֖י לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: And speak to the Israelite people, as follows: This shall be an anointing oil sacred to Me throughout the ages.
30.transliteration: vְaֶl־bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l tְּdַbֵּ֣r lֵamֹ֑r shֶׁ֠mֶן mִshְׁchַt־kֹ֨dֶshׁ yִhְyֶ֥h zֶ֛h lִ֖y lְdֹrֹtֵykֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: עַל־בְּשַׂ֤ר אָדָם֙ לֹ֣א יִיסָ֔ךְ וּ֨בְמַתְכֻּנְתּ֔וֹ לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ כָּמֹ֑הוּ קֹ֣דֶשׁ ה֔וּא קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: It must not be rubbed on any person’s body, and you must not make anything like it in the same proportions; it is sacred, to be held sacred by you.
30.transliteration: aַl־bְּshַׂ֤r aָdָם֙ lֹ֣a yִysָ֔ךְ vּ֨bְmַtְkֻּnְtּ֔vֹ lֹ֥a tַaֲshׂ֖vּ kָּmֹ֑hvּ kֹ֣dֶshׁ h֔vּa kֹ֖dֶshׁ yִhְyֶ֥h lָkֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: אִ֚ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִרְקַ֣ח כָּמֹ֔הוּ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִתֵּ֛ן מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַל־זָ֑ר וְנִכְרַ֖ת מֵעַמָּֽיו׃ {ס}
30.englishText: Any party who compounds its like, or puts any of it on a lay person, shall be cut off from kin.
30.transliteration: aִ֚yshׁ aֲshֶׁ֣r yִrְkַ֣ch kָּmֹ֔hvּ vַaֲshֶׁ֥r yִtֵּ֛ן mִmֶּ֖nּvּ aַl־zָ֑r vְnִkְrַ֖t mֵaַmָּֽyv׃ {s}

30.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֜ה קַח־לְךָ֣ סַמִּ֗ים נָטָ֤ף <small>׀</small> וּשְׁחֵ֙לֶת֙ וְחֶלְבְּנָ֔ה סַמִּ֖ים וּלְבֹנָ֣ה זַכָּ֑ה בַּ֥ד בְּבַ֖ד יִהְיֶֽה׃
30.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses: Take the herbs stacte, onycha, and galbanum—these herbs together with pure frankincense; let there be an equal part of each.
30.transliteration: vַyֹּ֩amֶr֩ yְhֹvָ֨h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֜h kַch־lְךָ֣ sַmִּ֗yם nָtָ֤ף <small>׀</small> vּshְׁchֵ֙lֶt֙ vְchֶlְbְּnָ֔h sַmִּ֖yם vּlְbֹnָ֣h zַkָּ֑h bַּ֥d bְּbַ֖d yִhְyֶֽh׃

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ אֹתָהּ֙ קְטֹ֔רֶת רֹ֖קַח מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רוֹקֵ֑חַ מְמֻלָּ֖ח טָה֥וֹר קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
30.englishText: Make them into incense, a compound expertly blended, refined, pure, sacred.
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ aֹtָhּ֙ kְtֹ֔rֶt rֹ֖kַch mַaֲshֵׂ֣h rvֹkֵ֑chַ mְmֻlָּ֖ch tָh֥vֹr kֹֽdֶshׁ׃

30.hebrewText: וְשָֽׁחַקְתָּ֣ מִמֶּ֘נָּה֮ הָדֵק֒ וְנָתַתָּ֨ה מִמֶּ֜נָּה לִפְנֵ֤י הָעֵדֻת֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לְךָ֖ שָׁ֑מָּה קֹ֥דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֖ים תִּהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: Beat some of it into powder, and put some before the Pact in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you; it shall be most holy to you.
30.transliteration: vְshָֽׁchַkְtָּ֣ mִmֶּ֘nָּh֮ hָdֵk֒ vְnָtַtָּ֨h mִmֶּ֜nָּh lִpְnֵ֤y hָaֵdֻt֙ bְּaֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֔d aֲshֶׁ֛r aִvָּaֵ֥d lְךָ֖ shָׁ֑mָּh kֹ֥dֶshׁ kׇֽdָshִׁ֖yם tִּhְyֶ֥h lָkֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: וְהַקְּטֹ֙רֶת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה בְּמַ֨תְכֻּנְתָּ֔הּ לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶ֑ם קֹ֛דֶשׁ תִּהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
30.englishText: But when you make this incense, you must not make any in the same proportions for yourselves; it shall be held by you sacred to יהוה.
30.transliteration: vְhַkְּtֹ֙rֶt֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tַּaֲshֶׂ֔h bְּmַ֨tְkֻּnְtָּ֔hּ lֹ֥a tַaֲshׂ֖vּ lָkֶ֑ם kֹ֛dֶshׁ tִּhְyֶ֥h lְךָ֖ lַyhֹvָֽh׃

30.hebrewText: אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה כָמ֖וֹהָ לְהָרִ֣יחַ בָּ֑הּ וְנִכְרַ֖ת מֵעַמָּֽיו׃ {ס}
30.englishText: Any party who makes any like it, to smell of it, shall be cut off from kin.
30.transliteration: aִ֛yshׁ aֲshֶׁr־yַaֲshֶׂ֥h kָm֖vֹhָ lְhָrִ֣ychַ bָּ֑hּ vְnִkְrַ֖t mֵaַmָּֽyv׃ {s}

ki-tisa.name: Ki Tisa
ki-tisa.summary: The census tax, the copper laver, the anointing oil, the incense, the golden calf, Moses' intercession, and the second set of tablets.

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מִזְבֵּ֖חַ מִקְטַ֣ר קְטֹ֑רֶת עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
30.englishText: You shall make an altar for burning incense; make it of acacia wood.
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ mִzְbֵּ֖chַ mִkְtַ֣r kְtֹ֑rֶt aֲtsֵ֥y shִׁtִּ֖yם tַּaֲshֶׂ֥h aֹtֽvֹ׃

30.hebrewText: אַמָּ֨ה אׇרְכּ֜וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה רׇחְבּוֹ֙ רָב֣וּעַ יִהְיֶ֔ה וְאַמָּתַ֖יִם קֹמָת֑וֹ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ קַרְנֹתָֽיו׃
30.englishText: It shall be a cubit long and a cubit wide—it shall be square—and two cubits high, its horns of one piece with it.
30.transliteration: aַmָּ֨h aׇrְkּ֜vֹ vְaַmָּ֤h rׇchְbּvֹ֙ rָb֣vּaַ yִhְyֶ֔h vְaַmָּtַ֖yִם kֹmָt֑vֹ mִmֶּ֖nּvּ kַrְnֹtָֽyv׃

30.hebrewText: וְצִפִּיתָ֨ אֹת֜וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֗וֹר אֶת־גַּגּ֧וֹ וְאֶת־קִירֹתָ֛יו סָבִ֖יב וְאֶת־קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לּ֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
30.englishText: Overlay it with pure gold: its top, its sides round about, and its horns; and make a gold molding for it round about.
30.transliteration: vְtsִpִּytָ֨ aֹt֜vֹ zָhָ֣b tָh֗vֹr aֶt־gַּgּ֧vֹ vְaֶt־kִyrֹtָ֛yv sָbִ֖yb vְaֶt־kַrְnֹtָ֑yv vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ lּ֛vֹ zֵ֥r zָhָ֖b sָbִֽyb׃

30.hebrewText: וּשְׁתֵּי֩ טַבְּעֹ֨ת זָהָ֜ב תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ ׀ מִתַּ֣חַת לְזֵר֗וֹ עַ֚ל שְׁתֵּ֣י צַלְעֹתָ֔יו תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַל־שְׁנֵ֣י צִדָּ֑יו וְהָיָה֙ לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֵֽמָּה׃
30.englishText: And make two gold rings for it under its molding; make them on its two side walls, on opposite*opposite Lit. “its two.” sides. They shall serve as holders for poles with which to carry it.
30.transliteration: vּshְׁtֵּy֩ tַbְּaֹ֨t zָhָ֜b tַּֽaֲshֶׂh־lּ֣vֹ ׀ mִtַּ֣chַt lְzֵr֗vֹ aַ֚l shְׁtֵּ֣y tsַlְaֹtָ֔yv tַּaֲshֶׂ֖h aַl־shְׁnֵ֣y tsִdָּ֑yv vְhָyָh֙ lְbָtִּ֣yם lְbַdִּ֔yם lָshֵׂ֥at aֹt֖vֹ bָּhֵֽmָּh׃

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
30.englishText: Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֥ytָ aֶt־hַbַּdִּ֖yם aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם vְtsִpִּytָ֥ aֹtָ֖ם zָhָֽb׃

30.hebrewText: וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אֹתוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־אֲרֹ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֑ת לִפְנֵ֣י הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־הָ֣עֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לְךָ֖ שָֽׁמָּה׃
30.englishText: Place it in front of the curtain that is over the Ark of the Pact—in front of the cover that is over the Pact—where I will meet with you.
30.transliteration: vְnָtַtָּ֤h aֹtvֹ֙ lִpְnֵ֣y hַpָּrֹ֔kֶt aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־aֲrֹ֣ן hָaֵdֻ֑t lִpְnֵ֣y hַkַּpֹּ֗rֶt aֲshֶׁr֙ aַl־hָ֣aֵdֻ֔t aֲshֶׁ֛r aִvָּaֵ֥d lְךָ֖ shָֽׁmָּh׃

30.hebrewText: וְהִקְטִ֥יר עָלָ֛יו אַהֲרֹ֖ן קְטֹ֣רֶת סַמִּ֑ים בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֗קֶר בְּהֵיטִיב֛וֹ אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֖ת יַקְטִירֶֽנָּה׃
30.englishText: On it Aaron shall burn aromatic incense: he shall burn it every morning when he tends the lamps,
30.transliteration: vְhִkְtִ֥yr aָlָ֛yv aַhֲrֹ֖ן kְtֹ֣rֶt sַmִּ֑yם bַּbֹּ֣kֶr bַּbֹּ֗kֶr bְּhֵytִyb֛vֹ aֶt־hַnֵּrֹ֖t yַkְtִyrֶֽnָּh׃

30.hebrewText: וּבְהַעֲלֹ֨ת אַהֲרֹ֧ן אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֛ת בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבַּ֖יִם יַקְטִירֶ֑נָּה קְטֹ֧רֶת תָּמִ֛יד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: and Aaron shall burn it at twilight when he lights the lamps—a regular incense offering before יהוה throughout the ages.
30.transliteration: vּbְhַaֲlֹ֨t aַhֲrֹ֧ן aֶt־hַnֵּrֹ֛t bֵּ֥yן hָaַrְbַּ֖yִם yַkְtִyrֶ֑nָּh kְtֹ֧rֶt tָּmִ֛yd lִpְnֵ֥y yְhֹvָ֖h lְdֹrֹtֵykֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: לֹא־תַעֲל֥וּ עָלָ֛יו קְטֹ֥רֶת זָרָ֖ה וְעֹלָ֣ה וּמִנְחָ֑ה וְנֵ֕סֶךְ לֹ֥א תִסְּכ֖וּ עָלָֽיו׃
30.englishText: You shall not offer alien incense on it, or a burnt offering or a meal offering; neither shall you pour a libation on it.
30.transliteration: lֹa־tַaֲl֥vּ aָlָ֛yv kְtֹ֥rֶt zָrָ֖h vְaֹlָ֣h vּmִnְchָ֑h vְnֵ֕sֶךְ lֹ֥a tִsְּk֖vּ aָlָֽyv׃

30.hebrewText: וְכִפֶּ֤ר אַהֲרֹן֙ עַל־קַרְנֹתָ֔יו אַחַ֖ת בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה מִדַּ֞ם חַטַּ֣את הַכִּפֻּרִ֗ים אַחַ֤ת בַּשָּׁנָה֙ יְכַפֵּ֤ר עָלָיו֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם קֹֽדֶשׁ־קׇדָשִׁ֥ים ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
30.englishText: Once a year Aaron shall perform purification upon its horns with blood of the sin offering of purification; purification shall be performed upon it once a year throughout the ages. It is most holy to יהוה.
30.transliteration: vְkִpֶּ֤r aַhֲrֹן֙ aַl־kַrְnֹtָ֔yv aַchַ֖t bַּshָּׁnָ֑h mִdַּ֞ם chַtַּ֣at hַkִּpֻּrִ֗yם aַchַ֤t bַּshָּׁnָh֙ yְkַpֵּ֤r aָlָyv֙ lְdֹrֹ֣tֵykֶ֔ם kֹֽdֶshׁ־kׇdָshִׁ֥yם h֖vּa lַyhֹvָֽh׃ {p}

30.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
30.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
30.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

30.hebrewText: כִּ֣י תִשָּׂ֞א אֶת־רֹ֥אשׁ בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לִפְקֻדֵיהֶם֒ וְנָ֨תְנ֜וּ אִ֣ישׁ כֹּ֧פֶר נַפְשׁ֛וֹ לַיהֹוָ֖ה בִּפְקֹ֣ד אֹתָ֑ם וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה בָהֶ֛ם נֶ֖גֶף בִּפְקֹ֥ד אֹתָֽם׃
30.englishText: When you take a census of the Israelite men according to their army enrollment, each shall pay יהוה a ransom for himself on being enrolled, that no plague may come upon them through their being enrolled.
30.transliteration: kִּ֣y tִshָּׂ֞a aֶt־rֹ֥ashׁ bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵl֮ lִpְkֻdֵyhֶם֒ vְnָ֨tְn֜vּ aִ֣yshׁ kֹּ֧pֶr nַpְshׁ֛vֹ lַyhֹvָ֖h bִּpְkֹ֣d aֹtָ֑ם vְlֹa־yִhְyֶ֥h bָhֶ֛ם nֶ֖gֶף bִּpְkֹ֥d aֹtָֽם׃

30.hebrewText: זֶ֣ה ׀ יִתְּנ֗וּ כׇּל־הָעֹבֵר֙ עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים מַחֲצִ֥ית הַשֶּׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ עֶשְׂרִ֤ים גֵּרָה֙ הַשֶּׁ֔קֶל מַחֲצִ֣ית הַשֶּׁ֔קֶל תְּרוּמָ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
30.englishText: This is what everyone who is entered in the records shall pay: a half-shekel by the sanctuary weight—twenty gerahs to the shekel—a half-shekel as an offering to יהוה.
30.transliteration: zֶ֣h ׀ yִtְּn֗vּ kׇּl־hָaֹbֵr֙ aַl־hַpְּkֻdִ֔yם mַchֲtsִ֥yt hַshֶּׁ֖kֶl bְּshֶׁ֣kֶl hַkֹּ֑dֶshׁ aֶshְׂrִ֤yם gֵּrָh֙ hַshֶּׁ֔kֶl mַchֲtsִ֣yt hַshֶּׁ֔kֶl tְּrvּmָ֖h lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃

30.hebrewText: כֹּ֗ל הָעֹבֵר֙ עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָ֑עְלָה יִתֵּ֖ן תְּרוּמַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
30.englishText: Everyone who is entered in the records, from the age of twenty years up, shall give יהוה’s offering:
30.transliteration: kֹּ֗l hָaֹbֵr֙ aַl־hַpְּkֻdִ֔yם mִbֶּ֛ן aֶshְׂrִ֥yם shָׁnָ֖h vָmָ֑aְlָh yִtֵּ֖ן tְּrvּmַ֥t yְhֹvָֽh׃

30.hebrewText: הֶֽעָשִׁ֣יר לֹֽא־יַרְבֶּ֗ה וְהַדַּל֙ לֹ֣א יַמְעִ֔יט מִֽמַּחֲצִ֖ית הַשָּׁ֑קֶל לָתֵת֙ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: the rich shall not pay more and the poor shall not pay less than half a shekel when giving יהוה’s offering as expiation for your persons.
30.transliteration: hֶֽaָshִׁ֣yr lֹֽa־yַrְbֶּ֗h vְhַdַּl֙ lֹ֣a yַmְaִ֔yt mִֽmַּchֲtsִ֖yt hַshָּׁ֑kֶl lָtֵt֙ aֶt־tְּrvּmַ֣t yְhֹvָ֔h lְkַpֵּ֖r aַl־nַpְshֹׁtֵykֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ אֶת־כֶּ֣סֶף הַכִּפֻּרִ֗ים מֵאֵת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְנָתַתָּ֣ אֹת֔וֹ עַל־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהָיָה֩ לִבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל לְזִכָּרוֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
30.englishText: You shall take the expiation money from the Israelites and assign it to the service of the Tent of Meeting; it shall serve the Israelites as a reminder before יהוה, as expiation for your persons.
30.transliteration: vְlָkַchְtָּ֞ aֶt־kֶּ֣sֶף hַkִּpֻּrִ֗yם mֵaֵt֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l vְnָtַtָּ֣ aֹt֔vֹ aַl־aֲbֹdַ֖t aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֑d vְhָyָh֩ lִbְnֵ֨y yִshְׂrָaֵ֤l lְzִkָּrvֹן֙ lִpְnֵ֣y yְhֹvָ֔h lְkַpֵּ֖r aַl־nַpְshֹׁtֵykֶֽם׃ {p}

30.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
30.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
30.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ כִּיּ֥וֹר נְחֹ֛שֶׁת וְכַנּ֥וֹ נְחֹ֖שֶׁת לְרׇחְצָ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֣ אֹת֗וֹ בֵּֽין־אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְנָתַתָּ֥ שָׁ֖מָּה מָֽיִם׃
30.englishText: Make a laver of copper and a stand of copper for it, for washing; and place it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar. Put water in it,
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֜ytָ kִּyּ֥vֹr nְchֹ֛shֶׁt vְkַnּ֥vֹ nְchֹ֖shֶׁt lְrׇchְtsָ֑h vְnָtַtָּ֣ aֹt֗vֹ bֵּֽyן־aֹ֤hֶl mvֹaֵd֙ vּbֵ֣yן hַmִּzְbֵּ֔chַ vְnָtַtָּ֥ shָׁ֖mָּh mָֽyִם׃

30.hebrewText: וְרָחֲצ֛וּ אַהֲרֹ֥ן וּבָנָ֖יו מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־רַגְלֵיהֶֽם׃
30.englishText: and let Aaron and his sons wash their hands and feet [in water drawn] from it.
30.transliteration: vְrָchֲts֛vּ aַhֲrֹ֥ן vּbָnָ֖yv mִmֶּ֑nּvּ aֶt־yְdֵyhֶ֖ם vְaֶt־rַgְlֵyhֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: בְּבֹאָ֞ם אֶל־אֹ֧הֶל מוֹעֵ֛ד יִרְחֲצוּ־מַ֖יִם וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֑תוּ א֣וֹ בְגִשְׁתָּ֤ם אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לְשָׁרֵ֔ת לְהַקְטִ֥יר אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
30.englishText: When they enter the Tent of Meeting they shall wash with water, that they may not die; or when they approach the altar to serve, to turn into smoke an offering by fire to יהוה,
30.transliteration: bְּbֹaָ֞ם aֶl־aֹ֧hֶl mvֹaֵ֛d yִrְchֲtsvּ־mַ֖yִם vְlֹ֣a yָmֻ֑tvּ a֣vֹ bְgִshְׁtָּ֤ם aֶl־hַmִּzְbֵּ֙chַ֙ lְshָׁrֵ֔t lְhַkְtִ֥yr aִshֶּׁ֖h lַֽyhֹvָֽh׃

30.hebrewText: וְרָחֲצ֛וּ יְדֵיהֶ֥ם וְרַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֑תוּ וְהָיְתָ֨ה לָהֶ֧ם חׇק־עוֹלָ֛ם ל֥וֹ וּלְזַרְע֖וֹ לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
30.englishText: they shall wash their hands and feet, that they may not die. It shall be a law for all time for them—for him and his offspring—throughout the ages.
30.transliteration: vְrָchֲts֛vּ yְdֵyhֶ֥ם vְrַgְlֵyhֶ֖ם vְlֹ֣a yָmֻ֑tvּ vְhָyְtָ֨h lָhֶ֧ם chׇk־avֹlָ֛ם l֥vֹ vּlְzַrְa֖vֹ lְdֹrֹtָֽם׃ {p}

30.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
30.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
30.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

30.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֣ה קַח־לְךָ֮ בְּשָׂמִ֣ים רֹאשׁ֒ מׇר־דְּרוֹר֙ חֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וְקִנְּמׇן־בֶּ֥שֶׂם מַחֲצִית֖וֹ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתָ֑יִם וּקְנֵה־בֹ֖שֶׂם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
30.englishText: Next take choice spices: five hundred weight of solidified*solidified Others “flowing.” myrrh, half as much—two hundred and fifty—of fragrant cinnamon, two hundred and fifty of aromatic cane,
30.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֣h kַch־lְךָ֮ bְּshָׂmִ֣yם rֹashׁ֒ mׇr־dְּrvֹr֙ chֲmֵ֣shׁ mֵa֔vֹt vְkִnְּmׇן־bֶּ֥shֶׂם mַchֲtsִyt֖vֹ chֲmִshִּׁ֣yם vּmָatָ֑yִם vּkְnֵh־bֹ֖shֶׂם chֲmִshִּׁ֥yם vּmָatָֽyִם׃

30.hebrewText: וְקִדָּ֕ה חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְשֶׁ֥מֶן זַ֖יִת הִֽין׃
30.englishText: five hundred—by the sanctuary weight—of cassia, and a hin of olive oil.
30.transliteration: vְkִdָּ֕h chֲmֵ֥shׁ mֵa֖vֹt bְּshֶׁ֣kֶl hַkֹּ֑dֶshׁ vְshֶׁ֥mֶן zַ֖yִt hִֽyן׃

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ אֹת֗וֹ שֶׁ֚מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֔דֶשׁ רֹ֥קַח מִרְקַ֖חַת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑חַ שֶׁ֥מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶֽה׃
30.englishText: Make of this a sacred anointing oil, a compound of ingredients expertly blended, to serve as sacred anointing oil.
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֣ytָ aֹt֗vֹ shֶׁ֚mֶן mִshְׁchַt־kֹ֔dֶshׁ rֹ֥kַch mִrְkַ֖chַt mַaֲshֵׂ֣h rֹkֵ֑chַ shֶׁ֥mֶן mִshְׁchַt־kֹ֖dֶshׁ yִhְyֶֽh׃

30.hebrewText: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ ב֖וֹ אֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְאֵ֖ת אֲר֥וֹן הָעֵדֻֽת׃
30.englishText: With it anoint the Tent of Meeting, the Ark of the Pact,
30.transliteration: vּmָshַׁchְtָּ֥ b֖vֹ aֶt־aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֑d vְaֵ֖t aֲr֥vֹן hָaֵdֻֽt׃

30.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֖ה וְאֶת־כֵּלֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃
30.englishText: the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and all its fittings, the altar of incense,
30.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָן֙ vְaֶt־kׇּl־kֵּlָ֔yv vְaֶt־hַmְּnֹrָ֖h vְaֶt־kֵּlֶ֑yhָ vְaֵ֖t mִzְbַּ֥ch hַkְּtֹֽrֶt׃

30.hebrewText: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
30.englishText: the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand.
30.transliteration: vְaֶt־mִzְbַּ֥ch hָaֹlָ֖h vְaֶt־kׇּl־kֵּlָ֑yv vְaֶt־hַkִּyֹּ֖r vְaֶt־kַּnּֽvֹ׃

30.hebrewText: וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם וְהָי֖וּ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֑ים כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהֶ֖ם יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃
30.englishText: Thus you shall consecrate them so that they may be most holy; whatever touches them shall be consecrated.
30.transliteration: vְkִdַּshְׁtָּ֣ aֹtָ֔ם vְhָy֖vּ kֹ֣dֶshׁ kׇֽdָshִׁ֑yם kׇּl־hַnֹּgֵ֥aַ bָּhֶ֖ם yִkְdָּֽshׁ׃

30.hebrewText: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֥ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תִּמְשָׁ֑ח וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם לְכַהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
30.englishText: You shall also anoint Aaron and his sons, consecrating them to serve Me as priests.
30.transliteration: vְaֶt־aַhֲrֹ֥ן vְaֶt־bָּnָ֖yv tִּmְshָׁ֑ch vְkִdַּshְׁtָּ֥ aֹtָ֖ם lְkַhֵ֥ן lִֽy׃

30.hebrewText: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר שֶׁ֠מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֨דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֥ה זֶ֛ה לִ֖י לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: And speak to the Israelite people, as follows: This shall be an anointing oil sacred to Me throughout the ages.
30.transliteration: vְaֶl־bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l tְּdַbֵּ֣r lֵamֹ֑r shֶׁ֠mֶן mִshְׁchַt־kֹ֨dֶshׁ yִhְyֶ֥h zֶ֛h lִ֖y lְdֹrֹtֵykֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: עַל־בְּשַׂ֤ר אָדָם֙ לֹ֣א יִיסָ֔ךְ וּ֨בְמַתְכֻּנְתּ֔וֹ לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ כָּמֹ֑הוּ קֹ֣דֶשׁ ה֔וּא קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: It must not be rubbed on any person’s body, and you must not make anything like it in the same proportions; it is sacred, to be held sacred by you.
30.transliteration: aַl־bְּshַׂ֤r aָdָם֙ lֹ֣a yִysָ֔ךְ vּ֨bְmַtְkֻּnְtּ֔vֹ lֹ֥a tַaֲshׂ֖vּ kָּmֹ֑hvּ kֹ֣dֶshׁ h֔vּa kֹ֖dֶshׁ yִhְyֶ֥h lָkֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: אִ֚ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִרְקַ֣ח כָּמֹ֔הוּ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִתֵּ֛ן מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַל־זָ֑ר וְנִכְרַ֖ת מֵעַמָּֽיו׃ {ס}
30.englishText: Any party who compounds its like, or puts any of it on a lay person, shall be cut off from kin.
30.transliteration: aִ֚yshׁ aֲshֶׁ֣r yִrְkַ֣ch kָּmֹ֔hvּ vַaֲshֶׁ֥r yִtֵּ֛ן mִmֶּ֖nּvּ aַl־zָ֑r vְnִkְrַ֖t mֵaַmָּֽyv׃ {s}

30.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֜ה קַח־לְךָ֣ סַמִּ֗ים נָטָ֤ף <small>׀</small> וּשְׁחֵ֙לֶת֙ וְחֶלְבְּנָ֔ה סַמִּ֖ים וּלְבֹנָ֣ה זַכָּ֑ה בַּ֥ד בְּבַ֖ד יִהְיֶֽה׃
30.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses: Take the herbs stacte, onycha, and galbanum—these herbs together with pure frankincense; let there be an equal part of each.
30.transliteration: vַyֹּ֩amֶr֩ yְhֹvָ֨h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֜h kַch־lְךָ֣ sַmִּ֗yם nָtָ֤ף <small>׀</small> vּshְׁchֵ֙lֶt֙ vְchֶlְbְּnָ֔h sַmִּ֖yם vּlְbֹnָ֣h zַkָּ֑h bַּ֥d bְּbַ֖d yִhְyֶֽh׃

30.hebrewText: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ אֹתָהּ֙ קְטֹ֔רֶת רֹ֖קַח מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רוֹקֵ֑חַ מְמֻלָּ֖ח טָה֥וֹר קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
30.englishText: Make them into incense, a compound expertly blended, refined, pure, sacred.
30.transliteration: vְaָshִׂ֤ytָ aֹtָhּ֙ kְtֹ֔rֶt rֹ֖kַch mַaֲshֵׂ֣h rvֹkֵ֑chַ mְmֻlָּ֖ch tָh֥vֹr kֹֽdֶshׁ׃

30.hebrewText: וְשָֽׁחַקְתָּ֣ מִמֶּ֘נָּה֮ הָדֵק֒ וְנָתַתָּ֨ה מִמֶּ֜נָּה לִפְנֵ֤י הָעֵדֻת֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לְךָ֖ שָׁ֑מָּה קֹ֥דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֖ים תִּהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
30.englishText: Beat some of it into powder, and put some before the Pact in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you; it shall be most holy to you.
30.transliteration: vְshָֽׁchַkְtָּ֣ mִmֶּ֘nָּh֮ hָdֵk֒ vְnָtַtָּ֨h mִmֶּ֜nָּh lִpְnֵ֤y hָaֵdֻt֙ bְּaֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֔d aֲshֶׁ֛r aִvָּaֵ֥d lְךָ֖ shָׁ֑mָּh kֹ֥dֶshׁ kׇֽdָshִׁ֖yם tִּhְyֶ֥h lָkֶֽם׃

30.hebrewText: וְהַקְּטֹ֙רֶת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה בְּמַ֨תְכֻּנְתָּ֔הּ לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶ֑ם קֹ֛דֶשׁ תִּהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
30.englishText: But when you make this incense, you must not make any in the same proportions for yourselves; it shall be held by you sacred to יהוה.
30.transliteration: vְhַkְּtֹ֙rֶt֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tַּaֲshֶׂ֔h bְּmַ֨tְkֻּnְtָּ֔hּ lֹ֥a tַaֲshׂ֖vּ lָkֶ֑ם kֹ֛dֶshׁ tִּhְyֶ֥h lְךָ֖ lַyhֹvָֽh׃

30.hebrewText: אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה כָמ֖וֹהָ לְהָרִ֣יחַ בָּ֑הּ וְנִכְרַ֖ת מֵעַמָּֽיו׃ {ס}
30.englishText: Any party who makes any like it, to smell of it, shall be cut off from kin.
30.transliteration: aִ֛yshׁ aֲshֶׁr־yַaֲshֶׂ֥h kָm֖vֹhָ lְhָrִ֣ychַ bָּ֑hּ vְnִkְrַ֖t mֵaַmָּֽyv׃ {s}

31.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
31.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses:
31.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

31.hebrewText: רְאֵ֖ה קָרָ֣אתִֽי בְשֵׁ֑ם בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל בֶּן־אוּרִ֥י בֶן־ח֖וּר לְמַטֵּ֥ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
31.englishText: See, I have singled out by name Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
31.transliteration: rְaֵ֖h kָrָ֣atִֽy bְshֵׁ֑ם bְּtsַlְaֵ֛l bֶּן־avּrִ֥y bֶן־ch֖vּr lְmַtֵּ֥h yְhvּdָֽh׃

31.hebrewText: וָאֲמַלֵּ֥א אֹת֖וֹ ר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּחׇכְמָ֛ה וּבִתְבוּנָ֥ה וּבְדַ֖עַת וּבְכׇל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
31.englishText: I have endowed him with a divine spirit of skill, ability, and knowledge in every kind of craft;
31.transliteration: vָaֲmַlֵּ֥a aֹt֖vֹ r֣vּchַ aֱlֹhִ֑yם bְּchׇkְmָ֛h vּbִtְbvּnָ֥h vּbְdַ֖aַt vּbְkׇl־mְlָakָֽh׃

31.hebrewText: לַחְשֹׁ֖ב מַחֲשָׁבֹ֑ת לַעֲשׂ֛וֹת בַּזָּהָ֥ב וּבַכֶּ֖סֶף וּבַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃
31.englishText: to make designs for work in gold, silver, and copper,
31.transliteration: lַchְshֹׁ֖b mַchֲshָׁbֹ֑t lַaֲshׂ֛vֹt bַּzָּhָ֥b vּbַkֶּ֖sֶף vּbַnְּchֹֽshֶׁt׃

31.hebrewText: וּבַחֲרֹ֥שֶׁת אֶ֛בֶן לְמַלֹּ֖את וּבַחֲרֹ֣שֶׁת עֵ֑ץ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּכׇל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
31.englishText: to cut stones for setting and to carve wood—to work in every kind of craft.
31.transliteration: vּbַchֲrֹ֥shֶׁt aֶ֛bֶן lְmַlֹּ֖at vּbַchֲrֹ֣shֶׁt aֵ֑ץ lַaֲshׂ֖vֹt bְּkׇl־mְlָakָֽh׃

31.hebrewText: וַאֲנִ֞י הִנֵּ֧ה נָתַ֣תִּי אִתּ֗וֹ אֵ֣ת אׇהֳלִיאָ֞ב בֶּן־אֲחִֽיסָמָךְ֙ לְמַטֵּה־דָ֔ן וּבְלֵ֥ב כׇּל־חֲכַם־לֵ֖ב נָתַ֣תִּי חׇכְמָ֑ה וְעָשׂ֕וּ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתִֽךָ׃
31.englishText: Moreover, I have assigned to him Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and I have also granted skill to all who are skillful, that they may make everything that I have commanded you:
31.transliteration: vַaֲnִ֞y hִnֵּ֧h nָtַ֣tִּy aִtּ֗vֹ aֵ֣t aׇhֳlִyaָ֞b bֶּן־aֲchִֽysָmָךְ֙ lְmַtֵּh־dָ֔ן vּbְlֵ֥b kׇּl־chֲkַם־lֵ֖b nָtַ֣tִּy chׇkְmָ֑h vְaָshׂ֕vּ aֵ֖t kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֥r tsִvִּytִֽךָ׃

31.hebrewText: אֵ֣ת ׀ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד וְאֶת־הָֽאָרֹן֙ לָֽעֵדֻ֔ת וְאֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֖רֶת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־כְּלֵ֥י הָאֹֽהֶל׃
31.englishText: the Tent of Meeting, the Ark for the Pact and the cover upon it, and all the furnishings of the Tent;
31.transliteration: aֵ֣t ׀ aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֗d vְaֶt־hָֽaָrֹן֙ lָֽaֵdֻ֔t vְaֶt־hַkַּpֹּ֖rֶt aֲshֶׁ֣r aָlָ֑yv vְaֵ֖t kׇּl־kְּlֵ֥y hָaֹֽhֶl׃

31.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ וְאֶת־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֥ה הַטְּהֹרָ֖ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃
31.englishText: the table and its utensils, the pure lampstand*pure lampstand Or “lampstand of pure gold.” and all its fittings, and the altar of incense;
31.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָן֙ vְaֶt־kֵּlָ֔yv vְaֶt־hַmְּnֹrָ֥h hַtְּhֹrָ֖h vְaֶt־kׇּl־kֵּlֶ֑yhָ vְaֵ֖t mִzְbַּ֥ch hַkְּtֹֽrֶt׃

31.hebrewText: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֶת־הַכִּיּ֖וֹר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
31.englishText: the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand;
31.transliteration: vְaֶt־mִzְbַּ֥ch hָaֹlָ֖h vְaֶt־kׇּl־kֵּlָ֑yv vְaֶt־hַkִּyּ֖vֹr vְaֶt־kַּnּֽvֹ׃

31.hebrewText: וְאֵ֖ת בִּגְדֵ֣י הַשְּׂרָ֑ד וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו לְכַהֵֽן׃
31.englishText: the service*service Others “plaited.” vestments, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest and the vestments of his sons, for their service as priests;
31.transliteration: vְaֵ֖t bִּgְdֵ֣y hַshְּׂrָ֑d vְaֶt־bִּgְdֵ֤y hַkֹּ֙dֶshׁ֙ lְaַhֲrֹ֣ן hַkֹּhֵ֔ן vְaֶt־bִּgְdֵ֥y bָnָ֖yv lְkַhֵֽן׃

31.hebrewText: וְאֵ֨ת שֶׁ֧מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֛ה וְאֶת־קְטֹ֥רֶת הַסַּמִּ֖ים לַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּיתִ֖ךָ יַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ {פ}
31.englishText: as well as the anointing oil and the aromatic incense for the sanctuary. Just as I have commanded you, they shall do.
31.transliteration: vְaֵ֨t shֶׁ֧mֶן hַmִּshְׁchָ֛h vְaֶt־kְtֹ֥rֶt hַsַּmִּ֖yם lַkֹּ֑dֶshׁ kְּkֹ֥l aֲshֶׁr־tsִvִּytִ֖ךָ yַaֲshֽׂvּ׃ {p}

31.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
31.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses:
31.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֥h lֵּamֹֽr׃

31.hebrewText: וְאַתָּ֞ה דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַ֥ךְ אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֖י תִּשְׁמֹ֑רוּ כִּי֩ א֨וֹת הִ֜וא בֵּינִ֤י וּבֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם לָדַ֕עַת כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
31.englishText: Speak to the Israelite people and say: Nevertheless, you must keep My sabbaths, for this is a sign between Me and you throughout the ages, that you may know that I יהוה have consecrated you.
31.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֞h dַּbֵּ֨r aֶl־bְּnֵ֤y yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ lֵamֹ֔r aַ֥ךְ aֶt־shַׁbְּtֹtַ֖y tִּshְׁmֹ֑rvּ kִּy֩ a֨vֹt hִ֜va bֵּynִ֤y vּbֵֽynֵykֶם֙ lְdֹrֹ֣tֵykֶ֔ם lָdַ֕aַt kִּ֛y aֲnִ֥y yְhֹvָ֖h mְkַdִּshְׁkֶֽם׃

31.hebrewText: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת כִּ֛י קֹ֥דֶשׁ הִ֖וא לָכֶ֑ם מְחַֽלְלֶ֙יהָ֙ מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֔ת כִּ֗י כׇּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה בָהּ֙ מְלָאכָ֔ה וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמֶּֽיהָ׃
31.englishText: You shall keep the sabbath, for it is holy for you. One who profanes it shall be put to death: whoever does work on it, that person shall be cut off from among kin.
31.transliteration: vּshְׁmַrְtֶּם֙ aֶt־hַshַּׁbָּ֔t kִּ֛y kֹ֥dֶshׁ hִ֖va lָkֶ֑ם mְchַֽlְlֶ֙yhָ֙ m֣vֹt yvּmָ֔t kִּ֗y kׇּl־hָaֹshֶׂ֥h bָhּ֙ mְlָakָ֔h vְnִkְrְtָ֛h hַnֶּ֥pֶshׁ hַhִ֖va mִkֶּ֥rֶb aַmֶּֽyhָ׃

31.hebrewText: שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִים֮ יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה מְלָאכָה֒ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י שַׁבַּ֧ת שַׁבָּת֛וֹן קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהֹוָ֑ה כׇּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֧ה מְלָאכָ֛ה בְּי֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖ת מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
31.englishText: Six days may work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, holy to יהוה; whoever does work on the sabbath day shall be put to death.
31.transliteration: shֵׁ֣shֶׁt yָmִyם֮ yֵaָshֶׂ֣h mְlָakָh֒ vּbַyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֗y shַׁbַּ֧t shַׁbָּt֛vֹן kֹ֖dֶshׁ lַyhֹvָ֑h kׇּl־hָaֹshֶׂ֧h mְlָakָ֛h bְּy֥vֹם hַshַּׁbָּ֖t m֥vֹt yvּmָֽt׃

31.hebrewText: וְשָׁמְר֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת לַעֲשׂ֧וֹת אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּ֛ת לְדֹרֹתָ֖ם בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
31.englishText: The Israelite people shall keep the sabbath, observing the sabbath throughout the ages as a covenant for all time:
31.transliteration: vְshָׁmְr֥vּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l aֶt־hַshַּׁbָּ֑t lַaֲshׂ֧vֹt aֶt־hַshַּׁbָּ֛t lְdֹrֹtָ֖ם bְּrִ֥yt avֹlָֽם׃

31.hebrewText: בֵּינִ֗י וּבֵין֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל א֥וֹת הִ֖וא לְעֹלָ֑ם כִּי־שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י שָׁבַ֖ת וַיִּנָּפַֽשׁ׃ {ס}
31.englishText: it shall be a sign for all time between Me and the people of Israel. For in six days יהוה made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day [God] ceased from work and was refreshed.
31.transliteration: bֵּynִ֗y vּbֵyן֙ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l a֥vֹt hִ֖va lְaֹlָ֑ם kִּy־shֵׁ֣shֶׁt yָmִ֗yם aָshָׂ֤h yְhֹvָh֙ aֶt־hַshָּׁmַ֣yִם vְaֶt־hָaָ֔rֶץ vּbַyּvֹם֙ hַshְּׁbִyaִ֔y shָׁbַ֖t vַyִּnָּpַֽshׁ׃ {s}

31.hebrewText: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כְּכַלֹּתוֹ֙ לְדַבֵּ֤ר אִתּוֹ֙ בְּהַ֣ר סִינַ֔י שְׁנֵ֖י לֻחֹ֣ת הָעֵדֻ֑ת לֻחֹ֣ת אֶ֔בֶן כְּתֻבִ֖ים בְּאֶצְבַּ֥ע אֱלֹהִֽים׃
31.englishText: Upon finishing speaking with him on Mount Sinai, [God] gave Moses the two tablets of the Pact, stone tablets inscribed with the finger of God.
31.transliteration: vַyִּtֵּ֣ן aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h kְּkַlֹּtvֹ֙ lְdַbֵּ֤r aִtּvֹ֙ bְּhַ֣r sִynַ֔y shְׁnֵ֖y lֻchֹ֣t hָaֵdֻ֑t lֻchֹ֣t aֶ֔bֶן kְּtֻbִ֖yם bְּaֶtsְbַּ֥a aֱlֹhִֽyם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣רְא הָעָ֔ם כִּֽי־בֹשֵׁ֥שׁ מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָרֶ֣דֶת מִן־הָהָ֑ר וַיִּקָּהֵ֨ל הָעָ֜ם עַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ אֵלָיו֙ ק֣וּם ׀ עֲשֵׂה־לָ֣נוּ אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֵֽלְכוּ֙ לְפָנֵ֔ינוּ כִּי־זֶ֣ה ׀ מֹשֶׁ֣ה הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶֽעֱלָ֙נוּ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְנוּ מֶה־הָ֥יָה לֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: When the people saw that Moses was so long in coming down from the mountain, the people gathered against Aaron and said to him, “Come, make us a god who shall go before us, for that fellow Moses—the man who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.”
32.transliteration: vַyַּ֣rְa hָaָ֔ם kִּֽy־bֹshֵׁ֥shׁ mֹshֶׁ֖h lָrֶ֣dֶt mִן־hָhָ֑r vַyִּkָּhֵ֨l hָaָ֜ם aַֽl־aַhֲrֹ֗ן vַyֹּamְr֤vּ aֵlָyv֙ k֣vּם ׀ aֲshֵׂh־lָ֣nvּ aֱlֹhִ֗yם aֲshֶׁ֤r yֵֽlְkvּ֙ lְpָnֵ֔ynvּ kִּy־zֶ֣h ׀ mֹshֶׁ֣h hָaִ֗yshׁ aֲshֶׁ֤r hֶֽaֱlָ֙nvּ֙ mֵaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם lֹ֥a yָdַ֖aְnvּ mֶh־hָ֥yָh lֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אַהֲרֹ֔ן פָּֽרְקוּ֙ נִזְמֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י נְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם בְּנֵיכֶ֖ם וּבְנֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָבִ֖יאוּ אֵלָֽי׃
32.englishText: Aaron said to them, “[You men,] take off the gold rings that are on the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr aֲlֵhֶם֙ aַhֲrֹ֔ן pָּֽrְkvּ֙ nִzְmֵ֣y hַzָּhָ֔b aֲshֶׁr֙ bְּaׇzְnֵ֣y nְshֵׁykֶ֔ם bְּnֵykֶ֖ם vּbְnֹtֵykֶ֑ם vְhָbִ֖yavּ aֵlָֽy׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּתְפָּֽרְקוּ֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם אֶת־נִזְמֵ֥י הַזָּהָ֖ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיָּבִ֖יאוּ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹֽן׃
32.englishText: And all the people took off the gold rings that were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.
32.transliteration: vַyִּtְpָּֽrְkvּ֙ kׇּl־hָaָ֔ם aֶt־nִzְmֵ֥y hַzָּhָ֖b aֲshֶׁ֣r bְּaׇzְnֵyhֶ֑ם vַyָּbִ֖yavּ aֶֽl־aַhֲrֹֽן׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֣ח מִיָּדָ֗ם וַיָּ֤צַר אֹתוֹ֙ בַּחֶ֔רֶט וַֽיַּעֲשֵׂ֖הוּ עֵ֣גֶל מַסֵּכָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵ֤לֶּה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶעֱל֖וּךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
