32.englishText: This he took from them and cast in a mold,*cast in a mold Cf. Zech. 11.13 (beth hayyoṣer, “foundry”); others “fashioned it with a graving tool.” and made it into a molten calf. And they exclaimed, “This is your god,*This is your god Others “These are your gods.” O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!”
32.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֣ch mִyָּdָ֗ם vַyָּ֤tsַr aֹtvֹ֙ bַּchֶ֔rֶt vַֽyַּaֲshֵׂ֖hvּ aֵ֣gֶl mַsֵּkָ֑h vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ aֵ֤lֶּh aֱlֹhֶ֙yךָ֙ yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l aֲshֶׁ֥r hֶaֱl֖vּךָ mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣רְא אַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיִּ֥בֶן מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לְפָנָ֑יו וַיִּקְרָ֤א אַֽהֲרֹן֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר חַ֥ג לַיהֹוָ֖ה מָחָֽר׃
32.englishText: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron announced: “Tomorrow shall be a festival of יהוה!”
32.transliteration: vַyַּ֣rְa aַhֲrֹ֔ן vַyִּ֥bֶן mִzְbֵּ֖chַ lְpָnָ֑yv vַyִּkְrָ֤a aַֽhֲrֹן֙ vַyֹּamַ֔r chַ֥g lַyhֹvָ֖h mָchָֽr׃

32.hebrewText: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֙ימוּ֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיַּעֲל֣וּ עֹלֹ֔ת וַיַּגִּ֖שׁוּ שְׁלָמִ֑ים וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב הָעָם֙ לֶֽאֱכֹ֣ל וְשָׁת֔וֹ וַיָּקֻ֖מוּ לְצַחֵֽק׃ {פ}
32.englishText: Early next day, the people offered up burnt offerings and brought sacrifices of well-being; they sat down to eat and drink, and then rose to dance.
32.transliteration: vַyַּshְׁkִּ֙ymvּ֙ mִֽmׇּchֳrָ֔t vַyַּaֲl֣vּ aֹlֹ֔t vַyַּgִּ֖shׁvּ shְׁlָmִ֑yם vַyֵּ֤shֶׁb hָaָם֙ lֶֽaֱkֹ֣l vְshָׁt֔vֹ vַyָּkֻ֖mvּ lְtsַchֵֽk׃ {p}

32.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה לֶךְ־רֵ֕ד כִּ֚י שִׁחֵ֣ת עַמְּךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶעֱלֵ֖יתָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
32.englishText: יהוה spoke to Moses, “Hurry down, for your people, whom you brought out of the land of Egypt, have acted basely.
32.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֥r yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֑h lֶךְ־rֵ֕d kִּ֚y shִׁchֵ֣t aַmְּךָ֔ aֲshֶׁ֥r hֶaֱlֵ֖ytָ mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

32.hebrewText: סָ֣רוּ מַהֵ֗ר מִן־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ם עָשׂ֣וּ לָהֶ֔ם עֵ֖גֶל מַסֵּכָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁתַּֽחֲווּ־לוֹ֙ וַיִּזְבְּחוּ־ל֔וֹ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵ֤לֶּה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶֽעֱל֖וּךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
32.englishText: They have been quick to turn aside from the way that I enjoined upon them. They have made themselves a molten calf and bowed low to it and sacrificed to it, saying: ‘This is your god, O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!’”
32.transliteration: sָ֣rvּ mַhֵ֗r mִן־hַdֶּ֙rֶךְ֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tsִvִּytִ֔ם aָshׂ֣vּ lָhֶ֔ם aֵ֖gֶl mַsֵּkָ֑h vַyִּshְׁtַּֽchֲvvּ־lvֹ֙ vַyִּzְbְּchvּ־l֔vֹ vַyֹּ֣amְr֔vּ aֵ֤lֶּh aֱlֹhֶ֙yךָ֙ yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l aֲshֶׁ֥r hֶֽaֱl֖vּךָ mֵaֶ֥rֶץ mִtsְrָֽyִם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֖רֶף הֽוּא׃
32.englishText: יהוה further said to Moses, “I see that this is a stiffnecked people.
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֑h rָaִ֙ytִy֙ aֶt־hָaָ֣ם hַzֶּ֔h vְhִnֵּ֥h aַם־kְshֵׁh־aֹ֖rֶף hֽvּa׃

32.hebrewText: וְעַתָּה֙ הַנִּ֣יחָה לִּ֔י וְיִֽחַר־אַפִּ֥י בָהֶ֖ם וַאֲכַלֵּ֑ם וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה אוֹתְךָ֖ לְג֥וֹי גָּדֽוֹל׃
32.englishText: Now, let Me be, that My anger may blaze forth against them and that I may destroy them, and make of you a great nation.”
32.transliteration: vְaַtָּh֙ hַnִּ֣ychָh lִּ֔y vְyִֽchַr־aַpִּ֥y bָhֶ֖ם vַaֲkַlֵּ֑ם vְaֶֽaֱshֶׂ֥h avֹtְךָ֖ lְg֥vֹy gָּdֽvֹl׃

32.hebrewText: וַיְחַ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לָמָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ יֶחֱרֶ֤ה אַפְּךָ֙ בְּעַמֶּ֔ךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הוֹצֵ֙אתָ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּכֹ֥חַ גָּד֖וֹל וּבְיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
32.englishText: But Moses implored his God יהוה, saying, “Let not Your anger, יהוה, blaze forth against Your people, whom You delivered from the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand.
32.transliteration: vַyְchַ֣l mֹshֶׁ֔h aֶt־pְּnֵ֖y yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhָ֑yv vַyֹּ֗amֶr lָmָ֤h yְhֹvָh֙ yֶchֱrֶ֤h aַpְּךָ֙ bְּaַmֶּ֔ךָ aֲshֶׁ֤r hvֹtsֵ֙atָ֙ mֵaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם bְּkֹ֥chַ gָּd֖vֹl vּbְyָ֥d chֲzָkָֽh׃

32.hebrewText: לָ֩מָּה֩ יֹאמְר֨וּ מִצְרַ֜יִם לֵאמֹ֗ר בְּרָעָ֤ה הֽוֹצִיאָם֙ לַהֲרֹ֤ג אֹתָם֙ בֶּֽהָרִ֔ים וּ֨לְכַלֹּתָ֔ם מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה שׁ֚וּב מֵחֲר֣וֹן אַפֶּ֔ךָ וְהִנָּחֵ֥ם עַל־הָרָעָ֖ה לְעַמֶּֽךָ׃
32.englishText: Let not the Egyptians say, ‘It was with evil intent that he delivered them, only to kill them off in the mountains and annihilate them from the face of the earth.’ Turn from Your blazing anger, and renounce the plan to punish Your people.
32.transliteration: lָ֩mָּh֩ yֹamְr֨vּ mִtsְrַ֜yִם lֵamֹ֗r bְּrָaָ֤h hֽvֹtsִyaָם֙ lַhֲrֹ֤g aֹtָם֙ bֶּֽhָrִ֔yם vּ֨lְkַlֹּtָ֔ם mֵaַ֖l pְּnֵ֣y hָֽaֲdָmָ֑h shׁ֚vּb mֵchֲr֣vֹן aַpֶּ֔ךָ vְhִnָּchֵ֥ם aַl־hָrָaָ֖h lְaַmֶּֽךָ׃

32.hebrewText: זְכֹ֡ר לְאַבְרָהָם֩ לְיִצְחָ֨ק וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל עֲבָדֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתָּ לָהֶם֮ בָּךְ֒ וַתְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַרְבֶּה֙ אֶֽת־זַרְעֲכֶ֔ם כְּכוֹכְבֵ֖י הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְכׇל־הָאָ֨רֶץ הַזֹּ֜את אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֗רְתִּי אֶתֵּן֙ לְזַרְעֲכֶ֔ם וְנָחֲל֖וּ לְעֹלָֽם׃
32.englishText: Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, how You swore to them by Your Self and said to them: I will make your offspring as numerous as the stars of heaven, and I will give to your offspring this whole land of which I spoke, to possess forever.”
32.transliteration: zְkֹ֡r lְaַbְrָhָם֩ lְyִtsְchָ֨k vּlְyִshְׂrָaֵ֜l aֲbָdֶ֗yךָ aֲshֶׁ֨r nִshְׁbַּ֣aְtָּ lָhֶם֮ bָּךְ֒ vַtְּdַbֵּ֣r aֲlֵhֶ֔ם aַrְbֶּh֙ aֶֽt־zַrְaֲkֶ֔ם kְּkvֹkְbֵ֖y hַshָּׁmָ֑yִם vְkׇl־hָaָ֨rֶץ hַzֹּ֜at aֲshֶׁ֣r aָmַ֗rְtִּy aֶtֵּן֙ lְzַrְaֲkֶ֔ם vְnָchֲl֖vּ lְaֹlָֽם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּנָּ֖חֶם יְהֹוָ֑ה עַל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לְעַמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
32.englishText: And יהוה renounced the punishment planned for God’s people.
32.transliteration: vַyִּnָּ֖chֶם yְhֹvָ֑h aַl־hָ֣rָaָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbֶּ֖r lַaֲshׂ֥vֹt lְaַmּֽvֹ׃ {p}

32.hebrewText: וַיִּ֜פֶן וַיֵּ֤רֶד מֹשֶׁה֙ מִן־הָהָ֔ר וּשְׁנֵ֛י לֻחֹ֥ת הָעֵדֻ֖ת בְּיָד֑וֹ לֻחֹ֗ת כְּתֻבִים֙ מִשְּׁנֵ֣י עֶבְרֵיהֶ֔ם מִזֶּ֥ה וּמִזֶּ֖ה הֵ֥ם כְּתֻבִֽים׃
32.englishText: Thereupon Moses turned and went down from the mountain bearing the two tablets of the Pact, tablets inscribed on both their surfaces: they were inscribed on the one side and on the other.
32.transliteration: vַyִּ֜pֶן vַyֵּ֤rֶd mֹshֶׁh֙ mִן־hָhָ֔r vּshְׁnֵ֛y lֻchֹ֥t hָaֵdֻ֖t bְּyָd֑vֹ lֻchֹ֗t kְּtֻbִyם֙ mִshְּׁnֵ֣y aֶbְrֵyhֶ֔ם mִzֶּ֥h vּmִzֶּ֖h hֵ֥ם kְּtֻbִֽyם׃

32.hebrewText: וְהַ֨לֻּחֹ֔ת מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים הֵ֑מָּה וְהַמִּכְתָּ֗ב מִכְתַּ֤ב אֱלֹהִים֙ ה֔וּא חָר֖וּת עַל־הַלֻּחֹֽת׃
32.englishText: The tablets were God’s work, and the writing was God’s writing, incised upon the tablets.
32.transliteration: vְhַ֨lֻּchֹ֔t mַaֲshֵׂ֥h aֱlֹhִ֖yם hֵ֑mָּh vְhַmִּkְtָּ֗b mִkְtַּ֤b aֱlֹhִyם֙ h֔vּa chָr֖vּt aַl־hַlֻּchֹֽt׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֧ע יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶת־ק֥וֹל הָעָ֖ם בְּרֵעֹ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה ק֥וֹל מִלְחָמָ֖ה בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
32.englishText: When Joshua heard the sound of the people in its boisterousness, he said to Moses, “There is a cry of war in the camp.”
32.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֧a yְhvֹshֻׁ֛aַ aֶt־k֥vֹl hָaָ֖ם bְּrֵaֹ֑h vַyֹּ֙amֶr֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h k֥vֹl mִlְchָmָ֖h bַּֽmַּchֲnֶֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֵ֥ין קוֹל֙ עֲנ֣וֹת גְּבוּרָ֔ה וְאֵ֥ין ק֖וֹל עֲנ֣וֹת חֲלוּשָׁ֑ה ק֣וֹל עַנּ֔וֹת אָנֹכִ֖י שֹׁמֵֽעַ׃
32.englishText:
But he answered,
“It is not the sound of the tune of triumph,
Or the sound of the tune of defeat;
It is the sound of song that I hear!”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr aֵ֥yן kvֹl֙ aֲn֣vֹt gְּbvּrָ֔h vְaֵ֥yן k֖vֹl aֲn֣vֹt chֲlvּshָׁ֑h k֣vֹl aַnּ֔vֹt aָnֹkִ֖y shֹׁmֵֽaַ׃

32.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר קָרַב֙ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיַּ֥רְא אֶת־הָעֵ֖גֶל וּמְחֹלֹ֑ת וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֣ף מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיַּשְׁלֵ֤ךְ מִיָּדָו֙ אֶת־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת וַיְשַׁבֵּ֥ר אֹתָ֖ם תַּ֥חַת הָהָֽר׃
32.englishText: As soon as Moses came near the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, he became enraged; and he hurled the tablets from his hands and shattered them at the foot of the mountain.
32.transliteration: vַֽyְhִ֗y kַּaֲshֶׁ֤r kָrַb֙ aֶl־hַֽmַּchֲnֶ֔h vַyַּ֥rְa aֶt־hָaֵ֖gֶl vּmְchֹlֹ֑t vַyִּֽchַr־aַ֣ף mֹshֶׁ֗h vַyַּshְׁlֵ֤ךְ mִyָּdָv֙ aֶt־hַlֻּchֹ֔t vַyְshַׁbֵּ֥r aֹtָ֖ם tַּ֥chַt hָhָֽr׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־הָעֵ֨גֶל אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ וַיִּשְׂרֹ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ וַיִּטְחַ֖ן עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁר־דָּ֑ק וַיִּ֙זֶר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַמַּ֔יִם וַיַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
32.englishText: He took the calf that they had made and burned it; he ground it to powder and strewed it upon the water and so made the Israelites drink it.
32.transliteration: vַyִּkַּ֞ch aֶt־hָaֵ֨gֶl aֲshֶׁ֤r aָshׂvּ֙ vַyִּshְׂrֹ֣ף bָּaֵ֔shׁ vַyִּtְchַ֖ן aַ֣d aֲshֶׁr־dָּ֑k vַyִּ֙zֶr֙ aַl־pְּnֵ֣y hַmַּ֔yִם vַyַּ֖shְׁkְ aֶt־bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן מֶֽה־עָשָׂ֥ה לְךָ֖ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּֽי־הֵבֵ֥אתָ עָלָ֖יו חֲטָאָ֥ה גְדֹלָֽה׃
32.englishText: Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you that you have brought such great sin upon them?”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶֽl־aַhֲrֹ֔ן mֶֽh־aָshָׂ֥h lְךָ֖ hָaָ֣ם hַzֶּ֑h kִּֽy־hֵbֵ֥atָ aָlָ֖yv chֲtָaָ֥h gְdֹlָֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַהֲרֹ֔ן אַל־יִ֥חַר אַ֖ף אֲדֹנִ֑י אַתָּה֙ יָדַ֣עְתָּ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם כִּ֥י בְרָ֖ע הֽוּא׃
32.englishText: Aaron said, “Let not my lord be enraged. You know that this people is bent on evil.
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr aַhֲrֹ֔ן aַl־yִ֥chַr aַ֖ף aֲdֹnִ֑y aַtָּh֙ yָdַ֣aְtָּ aֶt־hָaָ֔ם kִּ֥y bְrָ֖a hֽvּa׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ לִ֔י עֲשֵׂה־לָ֣נוּ אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֵלְכ֖וּ לְפָנֵ֑ינוּ כִּי־זֶ֣ה ׀ מֹשֶׁ֣ה הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶֽעֱלָ֙נוּ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְנוּ מֶה־הָ֥יָה לֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: They said to me, ‘Make us a god to lead us; for that fellow Moses—the man who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.’
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amְrvּ lִ֔y aֲshֵׂh־lָ֣nvּ aֱlֹhִ֔yם aֲshֶׁ֥r yֵlְk֖vּ lְpָnֵ֑ynvּ kִּy־zֶ֣h ׀ mֹshֶׁ֣h hָaִ֗yshׁ aֲshֶׁ֤r hֶֽaֱlָ֙nvּ֙ mֵaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrַ֔yִם lֹ֥a yָdַ֖aְnvּ mֶh־hָ֥yָh lֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וָאֹמַ֤ר לָהֶם֙ לְמִ֣י זָהָ֔ב הִתְפָּרָ֖קוּ וַיִּתְּנוּ־לִ֑י וָאַשְׁלִכֵ֣הוּ בָאֵ֔שׁ וַיֵּצֵ֖א הָעֵ֥גֶל הַזֶּֽה׃
32.englishText: So I said to them, ‘Whoever has gold, take it off!’ They gave it to me and I hurled it into the fire and out came this calf!”
32.transliteration: vָaֹmַ֤r lָhֶם֙ lְmִ֣y zָhָ֔b hִtְpָּrָ֖kvּ vַyִּtְּnvּ־lִ֑y vָaַshְׁlִkֵ֣hvּ bָaֵ֔shׁ vַyֵּtsֵ֖a hָaֵ֥gֶl hַzֶּֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤רְא מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם כִּ֥י פָרֻ֖עַ ה֑וּא כִּֽי־פְרָעֹ֣ה אַהֲרֹ֔ן לְשִׁמְצָ֖ה בְּקָמֵיהֶֽם׃
32.englishText: Moses saw that the people were out of control—since Aaron had let them get out of control—so that they were a menace*a menace Others “an object of derision.” to any who might oppose them.
32.transliteration: vַyַּ֤rְa mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶt־hָaָ֔ם kִּ֥y pָrֻ֖aַ h֑vּa kִּֽy־pְrָaֹ֣h aַhֲrֹ֔ן lְshִׁmְtsָ֖h bְּkָmֵyhֶֽם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲמֹ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ בְּשַׁ֣עַר הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֥י לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י וַיֵּאָסְפ֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י לֵוִֽי׃
32.englishText: Moses stood up in the gate of the camp and said, “Whoever is for יהוה, come here!” And all the men of Levi rallied to him.
32.transliteration: vַyַּaֲmֹ֤d mֹshֶׁh֙ bְּshַׁ֣aַr hַֽmַּchֲnֶ֔h vַyֹּ֕amֶr mִ֥y lַyhֹvָ֖h aֵlָ֑y vַyֵּaָsְp֥vּ aֵlָ֖yv kׇּl־bְּnֵ֥y lֵvִֽy׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שִׂ֥ימוּ אִישׁ־חַרְבּ֖וֹ עַל־יְרֵכ֑וֹ עִבְר֨וּ וָשׁ֜וּבוּ מִשַּׁ֤עַר לָשַׁ֙עַר֙ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְהִרְג֧וּ אִֽישׁ־אֶת־אָחִ֛יו וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶת־רֵעֵ֖הוּ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶת־קְרֹבֽוֹ׃
32.englishText: He said to them, “Thus says יהוה, the God of Israel: Each of you put sword on thigh, go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and slay sibling, neighbor, and kin.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr lָhֶ֗ם kֹּֽh־aָmַ֤r yְhֹvָh֙ aֱlֹhֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l shִׂ֥ymvּ aִyshׁ־chַrְbּ֖vֹ aַl־yְrֵk֑vֹ aִbְr֨vּ vָshׁ֜vּbvּ mִshַּׁ֤aַr lָshַׁ֙aַr֙ bַּֽmַּchֲnֶ֔h vְhִrְg֧vּ aִֽyshׁ־aֶt־aָchִ֛yv vְaִ֥yshׁ aֶt־rֵaֵ֖hvּ vְaִ֥yshׁ aֶt־kְrֹbֽvֹ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֥וּ בְנֵֽי־לֵוִ֖י כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּפֹּ֤ל מִן־הָעָם֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא כִּשְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אַלְפֵ֖י אִֽישׁ׃
32.englishText: The men of Levi did as Moses had bidden; and some three thousand of the people fell that day.
32.transliteration: vַyַּֽaֲshׂ֥vּ bְnֵֽy־lֵvִ֖y kִּdְbַ֣r mֹshֶׁ֑h vַyִּpֹּ֤l mִן־hָaָם֙ bַּyּ֣vֹם hַh֔vּa kִּshְׁlֹ֥shֶׁt aַlְpֵ֖y aִֽyshׁ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה מִלְא֨וּ יֶדְכֶ֤ם הַיּוֹם֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ בִּבְנ֖וֹ וּבְאָחִ֑יו וְלָתֵ֧ת עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם הַיּ֖וֹם בְּרָכָֽה׃
32.englishText: And Moses said, “Dedicate yourselves*Dedicate yourselves Lit. “fill your hands.” to יהוה this day—for each of you has been against blood relations—that [God] may bestow a blessing upon you today.”
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr mֹshֶׁ֗h mִlְa֨vּ yֶdְkֶ֤ם hַyּvֹם֙ lַֽyhֹvָ֔h kִּ֛y aִ֥yshׁ bִּbְn֖vֹ vּbְaָchִ֑yv vְlָtֵ֧t aֲlֵykֶ֛ם hַyּ֖vֹם bְּrָkָֽh׃

32.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם אַתֶּ֥ם חֲטָאתֶ֖ם חֲטָאָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֑ה וְעַתָּה֙ אֶֽעֱלֶ֣ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה אוּלַ֥י אֲכַפְּרָ֖ה בְּעַ֥ד חַטַּאתְכֶֽם׃
32.englishText: The next day Moses said to the people, “You have been guilty of a great sin. Yet I will now go up to יהוה; perhaps I may win forgiveness for your sin.”
32.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy֙ mִֽmׇּchֳrָ֔t vַyֹּ֤amֶr mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶl־hָaָ֔ם aַtֶּ֥ם chֲtָatֶ֖ם chֲtָaָ֣h gְdֹlָ֑h vְaַtָּh֙ aֶֽaֱlֶ֣h aֶl־yְhֹvָ֔h avּlַ֥y aֲkַpְּrָ֖h bְּaַ֥d chַtַּatְkֶֽם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיָּ֧שׇׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אָ֣נָּ֗א חָטָ֞א הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ חֲטָאָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֔ה וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
32.englishText: Moses went back to יהוה and said, “Alas, this people is guilty of a great sin in making for themselves a god of gold.
32.transliteration: vַyָּ֧shׇׁb mֹshֶׁ֛h aֶl־yְhֹvָ֖h vַyֹּamַ֑r aָ֣nָּ֗a chָtָ֞a hָaָ֤ם hַzֶּh֙ chֲtָaָ֣h gְdֹlָ֔h vַyַּֽaֲshׂ֥vּ lָhֶ֖ם aֱlֹhֵ֥y zָhָֽb׃

32.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֖ה אִם־תִּשָּׂ֣א חַטָּאתָ֑ם וְאִם־אַ֕יִן מְחֵ֣נִי נָ֔א מִֽסִּפְרְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּתָֽבְתָּ׃
32.englishText: Now, if You will forgive their sin [well and good]; but if not, erase me from the record which You have written!”
32.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֖h aִם־tִּshָּׂ֣a chַtָּatָ֑ם vְaִם־aַ֕yִן mְchֵ֣nִy nָ֔a mִֽsִּpְrְךָ֖ aֲshֶׁ֥r kָּtָֽbְtָּ׃

32.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה מִ֚י אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָֽטָא־לִ֔י אֶמְחֶ֖נּוּ מִסִּפְרִֽי׃
32.englishText: But יהוה said to Moses, “Only one who has sinned against Me will I erase from My record.
32.transliteration: vַyֹּ֥amֶr yְhֹvָ֖h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֑h mִ֚y aֲshֶׁ֣r chָֽtָa־lִ֔y aֶmְchֶ֖nּvּ mִsִּpְrִֽy׃

32.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֞ה לֵ֣ךְ ׀ נְחֵ֣ה אֶת־הָעָ֗ם אֶ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֙רְתִּי֙ לָ֔ךְ הִנֵּ֥ה מַלְאָכִ֖י יֵלֵ֣ךְ לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וּבְי֣וֹם פׇּקְדִ֔י וּפָקַדְתִּ֥י עֲלֵהֶ֖ם חַטָּאתָֽם׃
32.englishText: Go now, lead the people where I told you. See, My messenger shall go before you. But when I make an accounting, I will bring them to account for their sins.”
32.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֞h lֵ֣ךְ ׀ nְchֵ֣h aֶt־hָaָ֗ם aֶ֤l aֲshֶׁr־dִּbַּ֙rְtִּy֙ lָ֔ךְ hִnֵּ֥h mַlְaָkִ֖y yֵlֵ֣ךְ lְpָnֶ֑yךָ vּbְy֣vֹם pׇּkְdִ֔y vּpָkַdְtִּ֥y aֲlֵhֶ֖ם chַtָּatָֽם׃

32.hebrewText: וַיִּגֹּ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־הָעָ֑ם עַ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂ֣וּ אֶת־הָעֵ֔גֶל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה אַהֲרֹֽן׃ {ס}
32.englishText: Then יהוה sent a plague upon the people, for what they did with the calf that Aaron made.*for what they did with the calf that Aaron made Meaning of Heb. uncertain.
32.transliteration: vַyִּgֹּ֥ף yְhֹvָ֖h aֶt־hָaָ֑ם aַ֚l aֲshֶׁ֣r aָshׂ֣vּ aֶt־hָaֵ֔gֶl aֲshֶׁ֥r aָshָׂ֖h aַhֲrֹֽן׃ {s}

33.hebrewText: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ לֵ֣ךְ עֲלֵ֣ה מִזֶּ֔ה אַתָּ֣ה וְהָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶֽעֱלִ֖יתָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִ֠שְׁבַּ֠עְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֨ם לְיִצְחָ֤ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹב֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְזַרְעֲךָ֖ אֶתְּנֶֽנָּה׃
33.englishText: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Set out from here, you and the people that you have brought up from the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘To your offspring will I give it’—
33.transliteration: vַyְdַbֵּ֨r yְhֹvָ֤h aֶl־mֹshֶׁh֙ lֵ֣ךְ aֲlֵ֣h mִzֶּ֔h aַtָּ֣h vְhָaָ֔ם aֲshֶׁ֥r hֶֽaֱlִ֖ytָ mֵaֶ֣rֶץ mִtsְrָ֑yִם aֶl־hָaָ֗rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֣r nִ֠shְׁbַּ֠aְtִּy lְaַbְrָhָ֨ם lְyִtsְchָ֤k vּֽlְyַaֲkֹb֙ lֵamֹ֔r lְzַrְaֲךָ֖ aֶtְּnֶֽnָּh׃

33.hebrewText: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֥י לְפָנֶ֖יךָ מַלְאָ֑ךְ וְגֵֽרַשְׁתִּ֗י אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י וְהַֽחִתִּי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
33.englishText: I will send a messenger before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites—
33.transliteration: vְshָׁlַchְtִּ֥y lְpָnֶ֖yךָ mַlְaָ֑ךְ vְgֵֽrַshְׁtִּ֗y aֶt־hַֽkְּnַaֲnִy֙ hָֽaֱmֹrִ֔y vְhַֽchִtִּy֙ vְhַpְּrִzִּ֔y hַchִvִּ֖y vְhַyְbvּsִֽy׃

33.hebrewText: אֶל־אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ כִּי֩ לֹ֨א אֶֽעֱלֶ֜ה בְּקִרְבְּךָ֗ כִּ֤י עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֙רֶף֙ אַ֔תָּה פֶּן־אֲכֶלְךָ֖ בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
33.englishText: a land flowing with milk and honey. But I will not go in your midst, since you are a stiffnecked people, lest I destroy you on the way.”
33.transliteration: aֶl־aֶ֛rֶץ zָbַ֥t chָlָ֖b vּdְbָ֑shׁ kִּy֩ lֹ֨a aֶֽaֱlֶ֜h bְּkִrְbְּךָ֗ kִּ֤y aַם־kְshֵׁh־aֹ֙rֶף֙ aַ֔tָּh pֶּן־aֲkֶlְךָ֖ bַּdָּֽrֶךְ׃

33.hebrewText: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע הָעָ֗ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הָרָ֛ע הַזֶּ֖ה וַיִּתְאַבָּ֑לוּ וְלֹא־שָׁ֛תוּ אִ֥ישׁ עֶדְי֖וֹ עָלָֽיו׃
33.englishText: When the people heard this harsh word, they went into mourning, and none put on finery.
33.transliteration: vַyִּshְׁmַ֣a hָaָ֗ם aֶt־hַdָּbָ֥r hָrָ֛a hַzֶּ֖h vַyִּtְaַbָּ֑lvּ vְlֹa־shָׁ֛tvּ aִ֥yshׁ aֶdְy֖vֹ aָlָֽyv׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֱמֹ֤ר אֶל־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אַתֶּ֣ם עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֔רֶף רֶ֧גַע אֶחָ֛ד אֶֽעֱלֶ֥ה בְקִרְבְּךָ֖ וְכִלִּיתִ֑יךָ וְעַתָּ֗ה הוֹרֵ֤ד עֶדְיְךָ֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְאֵדְעָ֖ה מָ֥ה אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
33.englishText: יהוה said to Moses, “Say to the Israelite people, ‘You are a stiffnecked people. If I were to go in your midst for one moment, I would destroy you. Now, then, leave off your finery, and I will consider what to do to you.’”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr yְhֹvָ֜h aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֗h aֱmֹ֤r aֶl־bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ aַtֶּ֣ם aַם־kְshֵׁh־aֹ֔rֶף rֶ֧gַa aֶchָ֛d aֶֽaֱlֶ֥h bְkִrְbְּךָ֖ vְkִlִּytִ֑yךָ vְaַtָּ֗h hvֹrֵ֤d aֶdְyְךָ֙ mֵֽaָlֶ֔yךָ vְaֵdְaָ֖h mָ֥h aֶֽaֱshֶׂh־lָּֽךְ׃

33.hebrewText: וַיִּֽתְנַצְּל֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־עֶדְיָ֖ם מֵהַ֥ר חוֹרֵֽב׃
33.englishText: So the Israelites remained stripped of their finery from Mount Horeb on.
33.transliteration: vַyִּֽtְnַtsְּl֧vּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l aֶt־aֶdְyָ֖ם mֵhַ֥r chvֹrֵֽb׃

33.hebrewText: וּמֹשֶׁה֩ יִקַּ֨ח אֶת־הָאֹ֜הֶל וְנָֽטָה־ל֣וֹ ׀ מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֗ה הַרְחֵק֙ מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְקָ֥רָא ל֖וֹ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהָיָה֙ כׇּל־מְבַקֵּ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה יֵצֵא֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֖ר מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
33.englishText: Now Moses would take the Tent and pitch it outside the camp, at some distance from the camp. It was called the Tent of Meeting, and whoever sought יהוה would go out to the Tent of Meeting that was outside the camp.
33.transliteration: vּmֹshֶׁh֩ yִkַּ֨ch aֶt־hָaֹ֜hֶl vְnָֽtָh־l֣vֹ ׀ mִch֣vּץ lַֽmַּchֲnֶ֗h hַrְchֵk֙ mִן־hַֽmַּchֲnֶ֔h vְkָ֥rָa l֖vֹ aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֑d vְhָyָh֙ kׇּl־mְbַkֵּ֣shׁ yְhֹvָ֔h yֵtsֵa֙ aֶl־aֹ֣hֶl mvֹaֵ֔d aֲshֶׁ֖r mִch֥vּץ lַֽmַּchֲnֶֽh׃

33.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֗ה כְּצֵ֤את מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָאֹ֔הֶל יָק֙וּמוּ֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם וְנִ֨צְּב֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ פֶּ֣תַח אׇהֳל֑וֹ וְהִבִּ֙יטוּ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַד־בֹּא֖וֹ הָאֹֽהֱלָה׃
33.englishText: Whenever Moses went out to the Tent, all the people would rise and stand, at the entrance of each tent, and gaze after Moses until he had entered the Tent.
33.transliteration: vְhָyָ֗h kְּtsֵ֤at mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶl־hָaֹ֔hֶl yָk֙vּmvּ֙ kׇּl־hָaָ֔ם vְnִ֨tsְּb֔vּ aִ֖yshׁ pֶּ֣tַch aׇhֳl֑vֹ vְhִbִּ֙ytvּ֙ aַchֲrֵ֣y mֹshֶׁ֔h aַd־bֹּa֖vֹ hָaֹֽhֱlָh׃

33.hebrewText: וְהָיָ֗ה כְּבֹ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ הָאֹ֔הֱלָה יֵרֵד֙ עַמּ֣וּד הֶֽעָנָ֔ן וְעָמַ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֑הֶל וְדִבֶּ֖ר עִם־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
33.englishText: And when Moses entered the Tent, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the Tent, while [God] spoke with Moses.
33.transliteration: vְhָyָ֗h kְּbֹ֤a mֹshֶׁh֙ hָaֹ֔hֱlָh yֵrֵd֙ aַmּ֣vּd hֶֽaָnָ֔ן vְaָmַ֖d pֶּ֣tַch hָaֹ֑hֶl vְdִbֶּ֖r aִם־mֹshֶֽׁh׃

33.hebrewText: וְרָאָ֤ה כׇל־הָעָם֙ אֶת־עַמּ֣וּד הֶֽעָנָ֔ן עֹמֵ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֑הֶל וְקָ֤ם כׇּל־הָעָם֙ וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ פֶּ֥תַח אׇהֳלֽוֹ׃
33.englishText: When all the people saw the pillar of cloud poised at the entrance of the Tent, all the people would rise and bow low, at the entrance of each tent.
33.transliteration: vְrָaָ֤h kׇl־hָaָם֙ aֶt־aַmּ֣vּd hֶֽaָnָ֔ן aֹmֵ֖d pֶּ֣tַch hָaֹ֑hֶl vְkָ֤ם kׇּl־hָaָם֙ vְhִֽshְׁtַּchֲv֔vּ aִ֖yshׁ pֶּ֥tַch aׇhֳlֽvֹ׃

33.hebrewText: וְדִבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ פָּנִ֣ים אֶל־פָּנִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יְדַבֵּ֥ר אִ֖ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְשָׁב֙ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וּמְשָׁ֨רְת֜וֹ יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ בִּן־נוּן֙ נַ֔עַר לֹ֥א יָמִ֖ישׁ מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֹֽהֶל׃ {פ}
33.englishText: יהוה would speak to Moses face to face, as one person speaks to another. And he would then return to the camp; but his attendant, Joshua son of Nun, [serving as] deputy,*[serving as] deputy Trad. “a youth.” See Dictionary under na‘ar. would not stir out of the Tent.
33.transliteration: vְdִbֶּ֨r yְhֹvָ֤h aֶl־mֹshֶׁh֙ pָּnִ֣yם aֶl־pָּnִ֔yם kַּaֲshֶׁ֛r yְdַbֵּ֥r aִ֖yshׁ aֶl־rֵaֵ֑hvּ vְshָׁb֙ aֶl־hַֽmַּchֲnֶ֔h vּmְshָׁ֨rְt֜vֹ yְhvֹshֻׁ֤aַ bִּן־nvּן֙ nַ֔aַr lֹ֥a yָmִ֖yshׁ mִtּ֥vֹךְ hָaֹֽhֶl׃ {p}

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה רְ֠אֵ֠ה אַתָּ֞ה אֹמֵ֤ר אֵלַי֙ הַ֚עַל אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְאַתָּה֙ לֹ֣א הֽוֹדַעְתַּ֔נִי אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־תִּשְׁלַ֖ח עִמִּ֑י וְאַתָּ֤ה אָמַ֙רְתָּ֙ יְדַעְתִּ֣יךָֽ בְשֵׁ֔ם וְגַם־מָצָ֥אתָ חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינָֽי׃
33.englishText: Moses said to יהוה, “See, You say to me, ‘Lead this people forward,’ but You have not made known to me whom You will send with me. Further, You have said, ‘I have singled you out by name, and you have, indeed, gained My favor.’
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֨amֶr mֹshֶׁ֜h aֶl־yְhֹvָ֗h rְ֠aֵ֠h aַtָּ֞h aֹmֵ֤r aֵlַy֙ hַ֚aַl aֶt־hָaָ֣ם hַzֶּ֔h vְaַtָּh֙ lֹ֣a hֽvֹdַaְtַּ֔nִy aֵ֥t aֲshֶׁr־tִּshְׁlַ֖ch aִmִּ֑y vְaַtָּ֤h aָmַ֙rְtָּ֙ yְdַaְtִּ֣yךָֽ bְshֵׁ֔ם vְgַם־mָtsָ֥atָ chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynָֽy׃

33.hebrewText: וְעַתָּ֡ה אִם־נָא֩ מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֜ן בְּעֵינֶ֗יךָ הוֹדִעֵ֤נִי נָא֙ אֶת־דְּרָכֶ֔ךָ וְאֵדָ֣עֲךָ֔ לְמַ֥עַן אֶמְצָא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ וּרְאֵ֕ה כִּ֥י עַמְּךָ֖ הַגּ֥וֹי הַזֶּֽה׃
33.englishText: Now, if I have truly gained Your favor, pray let me know Your ways, that I may know You and continue in Your favor. Consider, too, that this nation is Your people.”
33.transliteration: vְaַtָּ֡h aִם־nָa֩ mָtsָ֨atִy chֵ֜ן bְּaֵynֶ֗yךָ hvֹdִaֵ֤nִy nָa֙ aֶt־dְּrָkֶ֔ךָ vְaֵdָ֣aֲךָ֔ lְmַ֥aַן aֶmְtsָa־chֵ֖ן bְּaֵynֶ֑yךָ vּrְaֵ֕h kִּ֥y aַmְּךָ֖ hַgּ֥vֹy hַzֶּֽh׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר פָּנַ֥י יֵלֵ֖כוּ וַהֲנִחֹ֥תִי לָֽךְ׃
33.englishText: And [God] said, “I will go in the lead and will*I will go in the lead and will Lit. “My face will go and I will.” lighten your burden.”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּamַ֑r pָּnַ֥y yֵlֵ֖kvּ vַhֲnִchֹ֥tִy lָֽךְ׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו אִם־אֵ֤ין פָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ הֹלְכִ֔ים אַֽל־תַּעֲלֵ֖נוּ מִזֶּֽה׃
33.englishText: And he replied, “Unless You go in the lead, do not make us leave this place.
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֖amֶr aֵlָ֑yv aִם־aֵ֤yן pָּnֶ֙yךָ֙ hֹlְkִ֔yם aַֽl־tַּaֲlֵ֖nvּ mִzֶּֽh׃

33.hebrewText: וּבַמֶּ֣ה ׀ יִוָּדַ֣ע אֵפ֗וֹא כִּֽי־מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲנִ֣י וְעַמֶּ֔ךָ הֲל֖וֹא בְּלֶכְתְּךָ֣ עִמָּ֑נוּ וְנִפְלִ֙ינוּ֙ אֲנִ֣י וְעַמְּךָ֔ מִכׇּ֨ל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ {פ}
33.englishText: For how shall it be known that Your people have gained Your favor unless You go with us, so that we may be distinguished, Your people and I, from every people on the face of the earth?”
33.transliteration: vּbַmֶּ֣h ׀ yִvָּdַ֣a aֵp֗vֹa kִּֽy־mָtsָ֨atִy chֵ֤ן bְּaֵynֶ֙yךָ֙ aֲnִ֣y vְaַmֶּ֔ךָ hֲl֖vֹa bְּlֶkְtְּךָ֣ aִmָּ֑nvּ vְnִpְlִ֙ynvּ֙ aֲnִ֣y vְaַmְּךָ֔ mִkׇּ֨l־hָaָ֔ם aֲshֶׁ֖r aַl־pְּnֵ֥y hָaֲdָmָֽh׃ {p}

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֑ה כִּֽי־מָצָ֤אתָ חֵן֙ בְּעֵינַ֔י וָאֵדָעֲךָ֖ בְּשֵֽׁם׃
33.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses, “I will also do this thing that you have asked; for you have truly gained My favor and I have singled you out by name.”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h gַּ֣ם aֶt־hַdָּbָ֥r hַzֶּ֛h aֲshֶׁ֥r dִּbַּ֖rְtָּ aֶֽaֱshֶׂ֑h kִּֽy־mָtsָ֤atָ chֵן֙ bְּaֵynַ֔y vָaֵdָaֲךָ֖ bְּshֵֽׁם׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַרְאֵ֥נִי נָ֖א אֶת־כְּבֹדֶֽךָ׃
33.englishText: He said, “Oh, let me behold Your Presence!”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּamַ֑r hַrְaֵ֥nִy nָ֖a aֶt־kְּbֹdֶֽךָ׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֲנִ֨י אַעֲבִ֤יר כׇּל־טוּבִי֙ עַל־פָּנֶ֔יךָ וְקָרָ֧אתִֽי בְשֵׁ֛ם יְהֹוָ֖ה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְחַנֹּתִי֙ אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָחֹ֔ן וְרִחַמְתִּ֖י אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲרַחֵֽם׃
33.englishText: And [God] answered, “I will make all My goodness pass before you, and I will proclaim before you the name יהוה, and the grace that I grant and the compassion that I show,”*and the grace that I grant and the compassion that I show Lit. “and I will grant the grace that I will grant and show the compassion that I will show.”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr aֲnִ֨y aַaֲbִ֤yr kׇּl־tvּbִy֙ aַl־pָּnֶ֔yךָ vְkָrָ֧atִֽy bְshֵׁ֛ם yְhֹvָ֖h lְpָnֶ֑yךָ vְchַnֹּtִy֙ aֶt־aֲshֶׁ֣r aָchֹ֔ן vְrִchַmְtִּ֖y aֶt־aֲshֶׁ֥r aֲrַchֵֽם׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א תוּכַ֖ל לִרְאֹ֣ת אֶת־פָּנָ֑י כִּ֛י לֹֽא־יִרְאַ֥נִי הָאָדָ֖ם וָחָֽי׃
33.englishText: continuing, “But you cannot see My face, for a human being may not see Me and live.”
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֕amֶr lֹ֥a tvּkַ֖l lִrְaֹ֣t aֶt־pָּnָ֑y kִּ֛y lֹֽa־yִrְaַ֥nִy hָaָdָ֖ם vָchָֽy׃

33.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנֵּ֥ה מָק֖וֹם אִתִּ֑י וְנִצַּבְתָּ֖ עַל־הַצּֽוּר׃
33.englishText: And יהוה said, “See, there is a place near Me. Station yourself on the rock
33.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr yְhֹvָ֔h hִnֵּ֥h mָk֖vֹם aִtִּ֑y vְnִtsַּbְtָּ֖ aַl־hַtsּֽvּr׃

33.hebrewText: וְהָיָה֙ בַּעֲבֹ֣ר כְּבֹדִ֔י וְשַׂמְתִּ֖יךָ בְּנִקְרַ֣ת הַצּ֑וּר וְשַׂכֹּתִ֥י כַפִּ֛י עָלֶ֖יךָ עַד־עׇבְרִֽי׃
33.englishText: and, as My Presence passes by, I will put you in a cleft of the rock and shield you with My hand until I have passed by.
33.transliteration: vְhָyָh֙ bַּaֲbֹ֣r kְּbֹdִ֔y vְshַׂmְtִּ֖yךָ bְּnִkְrַ֣t hַtsּ֑vּr vְshַׂkֹּtִ֥y kַpִּ֛y aָlֶ֖yךָ aַd־aׇbְrִֽy׃

33.hebrewText:
וַהֲסִרֹתִי֙ אֶת־כַּפִּ֔י וְרָאִ֖יתָ אֶת־אֲחֹרָ֑י וּפָנַ֖י לֹ֥א יֵרָאֽוּ׃ {פ}
*(ספק פרשה סתומה בכתר ארם צובה)
33.englishText: Then I will take My hand away and you will see My back; but My face must not be seen.”
33.transliteration:
vַhֲsִrֹtִy֙ aֶt־kַּpִּ֔y vְrָaִ֖ytָ aֶt־aֲchֹrָ֑y vּpָnַ֖y lֹ֥a yֵrָaֽvּ׃ {p}
*(spk prshh stvmh bktr arם tsvbh)

34.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה פְּסׇל־לְךָ֛ שְׁנֵֽי־לֻחֹ֥ת אֲבָנִ֖ים כָּרִאשֹׁנִ֑ים וְכָתַבְתִּי֙ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת אֶ֨ת־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֛וּ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֥ת הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שִׁבַּֽרְתָּ׃
34.englishText: יהוה said to Moses: “Carve two tablets of stone like the first, and I will inscribe upon the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you shattered.
34.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h pְּsׇl־lְךָ֛ shְׁnֵֽy־lֻchֹ֥t aֲbָnִ֖yם kָּrִashֹׁnִ֑yם vְkָtַbְtִּy֙ aַl־hַlֻּchֹ֔t aֶ֨t־hַdְּbָrִ֔yם aֲshֶׁ֥r hָy֛vּ aַl־hַlֻּchֹ֥t hָrִashֹׁnִ֖yם aֲshֶׁ֥r shִׁbַּֽrְtָּ׃

34.hebrewText: וֶהְיֵ֥ה נָכ֖וֹן לַבֹּ֑קֶר וְעָלִ֤יתָ בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וְנִצַּבְתָּ֥ לִ֛י שָׁ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָהָֽר׃
34.englishText: Be ready by morning, and in the morning come up to Mount Sinai and present yourself there to Me, on the top of the mountain.
34.transliteration: vֶhְyֵ֥h nָk֖vֹן lַbֹּ֑kֶr vְaָlִ֤ytָ bַbֹּ֙kֶr֙ aֶl־hַ֣r sִynַ֔y vְnִtsַּbְtָּ֥ lִ֛y shָׁ֖ם aַl־rֹ֥ashׁ hָhָֽr׃

34.hebrewText: וְאִישׁ֙ לֹֽא־יַעֲלֶ֣ה עִמָּ֔ךְ וְגַם־אִ֥ישׁ אַל־יֵרָ֖א בְּכׇל־הָהָ֑ר גַּם־הַצֹּ֤אן וְהַבָּקָר֙ אַל־יִרְע֔וּ אֶל־מ֖וּל הָהָ֥ר הַהֽוּא׃
34.englishText: No one else shall come up with you, and no one else shall be seen anywhere on the mountain; neither shall the flocks and the herds graze at the foot of this mountain.”
34.transliteration: vְaִyshׁ֙ lֹֽa־yַaֲlֶ֣h aִmָּ֔ךְ vְgַם־aִ֥yshׁ aַl־yֵrָ֖a bְּkׇl־hָhָ֑r gַּם־hַtsֹּ֤aן vְhַbָּkָr֙ aַl־yִrְa֔vּ aֶl־m֖vּl hָhָ֥r hַhֽvּa׃

34.hebrewText: וַיִּפְסֹ֡ל שְׁנֵֽי־לֻחֹ֨ת אֲבָנִ֜ים כָּרִאשֹׁנִ֗ים וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם מֹשֶׁ֤ה בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ וַיַּ֙עַל֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ וַיִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָד֔וֹ שְׁנֵ֖י לֻחֹ֥ת אֲבָנִֽים׃
34.englishText: So Moses carved two tablets of stone, like the first, and early in the morning he went up on Mount Sinai, as יהוה had commanded him, taking the two stone tablets with him.
34.transliteration: vַyִּpְsֹ֡l shְׁnֵֽy־lֻchֹ֨t aֲbָnִ֜yם kָּrִashֹׁnִ֗yם vַyַּshְׁkֵּ֨ם mֹshֶׁ֤h bַbֹּ֙kֶr֙ vַyַּ֙aַl֙ aֶl־hַ֣r sִynַ֔y kַּaֲshֶׁ֛r tsִvָּ֥h yְhֹvָ֖h aֹt֑vֹ vַyִּkַּ֣ch bְּyָd֔vֹ shְׁnֵ֖y lֻchֹ֥t aֲbָnִֽyם׃

34.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֤רֶד יְהֹוָה֙ בֶּֽעָנָ֔ן וַיִּתְיַצֵּ֥ב עִמּ֖וֹ שָׁ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֥א בְשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
34.englishText: יהוה came down in a cloud—and stood with him there, proclaiming the name יהוה.
34.transliteration: vַyֵּ֤rֶd yְhֹvָh֙ bֶּֽaָnָ֔ן vַyִּtְyַtsֵּ֥b aִmּ֖vֹ shָׁ֑ם vַyִּkְrָ֥a bְshֵׁ֖ם yְhֹvָֽh׃

34.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲבֹ֨ר יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> עַל־פָּנָיו֮ וַיִּקְרָא֒ יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֔ה אֵ֥ל רַח֖וּם וְחַנּ֑וּן אֶ֥רֶךְ אַפַּ֖יִם וְרַב־חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶֽת׃
34.englishText: יהוה passed before him and proclaimed: “!יהוה! יהוה*and proclaimed: “יהוה! יהוה!…” Or “and יהוה proclaimed: ‘יהוה! a God compassionate…’”; cf. Num. 14.17–18. a God compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in kindness and faithfulness,
34.transliteration: vַyַּaֲbֹ֨r yְhֹvָ֥h <small>׀</small> aַl־pָּnָyv֮ vַyִּkְrָa֒ yְhֹvָ֣h <small>׀</small> yְhֹvָ֔h aֵ֥l rַch֖vּם vְchַnּ֑vּן aֶ֥rֶךְ aַpַּ֖yִם vְrַb־chֶ֥sֶd vֶaֱmֶֽt׃

34.hebrewText: נֹצֵ֥ר*(בספרי תימן נֹצֵ֥ר בנו״ן רגילה) חֶ֙סֶד֙ לָאֲלָפִ֔ים נֹשֵׂ֥א עָוֺ֛ן וָפֶ֖שַׁע וְחַטָּאָ֑ה וְנַקֵּה֙ לֹ֣א יְנַקֶּ֔ה פֹּקֵ֣ד ׀ עֲוֺ֣ן אָב֗וֹת עַל־בָּנִים֙ וְעַל־בְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים עַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֖ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִֽים׃
34.englishText: extending kindness to the thousandth generation, forgiving iniquity, transgression, and sin—yet not remitting all punishment, but visiting the iniquity of parents upon children and children’s children, upon the third and fourth generations.”
34.transliteration: nֹtsֵ֥r*(bspry tymן nֹtsֵ֥r bnv״ן rgylh) chֶ֙sֶd֙ lָaֲlָpִ֔yם nֹshֵׂ֥a aָvֺ֛ן vָpֶ֖shַׁa vְchַtָּaָ֑h vְnַkֵּh֙ lֹ֣a yְnַkֶּ֔h pֹּkֵ֣d ׀ aֲvֺ֣ן aָb֗vֹt aַl־bָּnִyם֙ vְaַl־bְּnֵ֣y bָnִ֔yם aַl־shִׁlֵּshִׁ֖yם vְaַl־rִbֵּaִֽyם׃

34.hebrewText: וַיְמַהֵ֖ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּקֹּ֥ד אַ֖רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּֽחוּ׃
34.englishText: Moses hastened to bow low to the ground in homage,
34.transliteration: vַyְmַhֵ֖r mֹshֶׁ֑h vַyִּkֹּ֥d aַ֖rְtsָh vַyִּshְׁtָּֽchvּ׃

34.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר אִם־נָא֩ מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲדֹנָ֔י יֵֽלֶךְ־נָ֥א אֲדֹנָ֖י בְּקִרְבֵּ֑נוּ כִּ֤י עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֙רֶף֙ ה֔וּא וְסָלַחְתָּ֛ לַעֲוֺנֵ֥נוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵ֖נוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ׃
34.englishText: and said, “If I have gained Your favor, O my lord, pray, let my lord go in our midst, even though this is a stiffnecked people. Pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your own!”
34.transliteration: vַyֹּ֡amֶr aִם־nָa֩ mָtsָ֨atִy chֵ֤ן bְּaֵynֶ֙yךָ֙ aֲdֹnָ֔y yֵֽlֶךְ־nָ֥a aֲdֹnָ֖y bְּkִrְbֵּ֑nvּ kִּ֤y aַם־kְshֵׁh־aֹ֙rֶף֙ h֔vּa vְsָlַchְtָּ֛ lַaֲvֺnֵ֥nvּ vּlְchַtָּatֵ֖nvּ vּnְchַlְtָּֽnvּ׃

34.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִי֮ כֹּרֵ֣ת בְּרִית֒ נֶ֤גֶד כׇּֽל־עַמְּךָ֙ אֶעֱשֶׂ֣ה נִפְלָאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־נִבְרְא֥וּ בְכׇל־הָאָ֖רֶץ וּבְכׇל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וְרָאָ֣ה כׇל־הָ֠עָ֠ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֨ה בְקִרְבּ֜וֹ אֶת־מַעֲשֵׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־נוֹרָ֣א ה֔וּא אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י עֹשֶׂ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
34.englishText: [God] said: I hereby make a covenant. Before all your people I will work such wonders as have not been wrought on all the earth or in any nation; and all the people who are with you*who are with you Lit. “in whose midst you are.” shall see how awesome are יהוה’s deeds which I will perform for you.
34.transliteration: vַyֹּ֗amֶr hִnֵּ֣h aָnֹkִy֮ kֹּrֵ֣t bְּrִyt֒ nֶ֤gֶd kׇּֽl־aַmְּךָ֙ aֶaֱshֶׂ֣h nִpְlָaֹ֔t aֲshֶׁ֛r lֹֽa־nִbְrְa֥vּ bְkׇl־hָaָ֖rֶץ vּbְkׇl־hַgּvֹyִ֑ם vְrָaָ֣h kׇl־hָ֠aָ֠ם aֲshֶׁr־aַtָּ֨h bְkִrְbּ֜vֹ aֶt־mַaֲshֵׂ֤h yְhֹvָh֙ kִּֽy־nvֹrָ֣a h֔vּa aֲshֶׁ֥r aֲnִ֖y aֹshֶׂ֥h aִmָּֽךְ׃

34.hebrewText: שְׁמׇ֨ר־לְךָ֔ אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוְּךָ֣ הַיּ֑וֹם הִנְנִ֧י גֹרֵ֣שׁ מִפָּנֶ֗יךָ אֶת־הָאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י וְהַחִתִּי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
34.englishText: Mark well what I command you this day. I will drive out before you the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
34.transliteration: shְׁmׇ֨r־lְךָ֔ aֵ֛t aֲshֶׁ֥r aָnֹkִ֖y mְtsַvְּךָ֣ hַyּ֑vֹם hִnְnִ֧y gֹrֵ֣shׁ mִpָּnֶ֗yךָ aֶt־hָaֱmֹrִy֙ vְhַֽkְּnַaֲnִ֔y vְhַchִtִּy֙ vְhַpְּrִzִּ֔y vְhַchִvִּ֖y vְhַyְbvּsִֽy׃

34.hebrewText: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֗ פֶּן־תִּכְרֹ֤ת בְּרִית֙ לְיוֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה בָּ֣א עָלֶ֑יהָ פֶּן־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְמוֹקֵ֖שׁ בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃
34.englishText: Beware of making a covenant with the inhabitants of the land against which you are advancing, lest they be a snare in your midst.
34.transliteration: hִshָּׁ֣mֶr lְךָ֗ pֶּן־tִּkְrֹ֤t bְּrִyt֙ lְyvֹshֵׁ֣b hָaָ֔rֶץ aֲshֶׁ֥r aַtָּ֖h bָּ֣a aָlֶ֑yhָ pֶּן־yִhְyֶ֥h lְmvֹkֵ֖shׁ bְּkִrְbֶּֽךָ׃

34.hebrewText: כִּ֤י אֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתָם֙ תִּתֹּצ֔וּן וְאֶת־מַצֵּבֹתָ֖ם תְּשַׁבֵּר֑וּן וְאֶת־אֲשֵׁרָ֖יו תִּכְרֹתֽוּן׃
34.englishText: No, you must tear down their altars, smash their pillars, and cut down their sacred posts;
34.transliteration: kִּ֤y aֶt־mִzְbְּchֹtָם֙ tִּtֹּts֔vּן vְaֶt־mַtsֵּbֹtָ֖ם tְּshַׁbֵּr֑vּן vְaֶt־aֲshֵׁrָ֖yv tִּkְrֹtֽvּן׃

34.hebrewText: כִּ֛י לֹ֥א תִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה לְאֵ֣ל אַחֵ֑<big>ר</big> כִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ קַנָּ֣א שְׁמ֔וֹ אֵ֥ל קַנָּ֖א הֽוּא׃
34.englishText: for you must not worship any other god, because יהוה, whose name is Impassioned, is an impassioned God.
34.transliteration: kִּ֛y lֹ֥a tִֽshְׁtַּchֲvֶ֖h lְaֵ֣l aַchֵ֑<big>r</big> kִּ֤y yְhֹvָh֙ kַnָּ֣a shְׁm֔vֹ aֵ֥l kַnָּ֖a hֽvּa׃

34.hebrewText: פֶּן־תִּכְרֹ֥ת בְּרִ֖ית לְיוֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֑רֶץ וְזָנ֣וּ ׀ אַחֲרֵ֣י אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֗ם וְזָבְחוּ֙ לֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם וְקָרָ֣א לְךָ֔ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ מִזִּבְחֽוֹ׃
34.englishText: You must not make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, for they will lust after their gods and sacrifice to their gods and invite you, and you will eat of their sacrifices.
34.transliteration: pֶּן־tִּkְrֹ֥t bְּrִ֖yt lְyvֹshֵׁ֣b hָaָ֑rֶץ vְzָn֣vּ ׀ aַchֲrֵ֣y aֱlֹֽhֵyhֶ֗ם vְzָbְchvּ֙ lֵalֹ֣hֵyhֶ֔ם vְkָrָ֣a lְךָ֔ vְaָkַlְtָּ֖ mִzִּbְchֽvֹ׃

34.hebrewText: וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ מִבְּנֹתָ֖יו לְבָנֶ֑יךָ וְזָנ֣וּ בְנֹתָ֗יו אַחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ן וְהִזְנוּ֙ אֶת־בָּנֶ֔יךָ אַחֲרֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽן׃
34.englishText: And when you take [wives into your households] from among their daughters for your sons, their daughters will lust after their gods and will cause your sons to lust after their gods.
34.transliteration: vְlָkַchְtָּ֥ mִbְּnֹtָ֖yv lְbָnֶ֑yךָ vְzָn֣vּ bְnֹtָ֗yv aַchֲrֵy֙ aֱlֹ֣hֵyhֶ֔ן vְhִzְnvּ֙ aֶt־bָּnֶ֔yךָ aַchֲrֵ֖y aֱlֹhֵyhֶֽן׃

34.hebrewText: אֱלֹהֵ֥י מַסֵּכָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
34.englishText: You shall not make molten gods for yourselves.
34.transliteration: aֱlֹhֵ֥y mַsֵּkָ֖h lֹ֥a tַaֲshֶׂh־lָּֽךְ׃

34.hebrewText: אֶת־חַ֣ג הַמַּצּוֹת֮ תִּשְׁמֹר֒ שִׁבְעַ֨ת יָמִ֜ים תֹּאכַ֤ל מַצּוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ךָ לְמוֹעֵ֖ד חֹ֣דֶשׁ הָאָבִ֑יב כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽאָבִ֔יב יָצָ֖אתָ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
34.englishText: You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread—eating unleavened bread for seven days, as I have commanded you—at the set time of the month*of the month See note at 13.4. of Abib, for in the month of Abib you went forth from Egypt.
34.transliteration: aֶt־chַ֣g hַmַּtsּvֹt֮ tִּshְׁmֹr֒ shִׁbְaַ֨t yָmִ֜yם tֹּakַ֤l mַtsּvֹt֙ aֲshֶׁ֣r tsִvִּytִ֔ךָ lְmvֹaֵ֖d chֹ֣dֶshׁ hָaָbִ֑yb kִּ֚y bְּchֹ֣dֶshׁ hָֽaָbִ֔yb yָtsָ֖atָ mִmִּtsְrָֽyִם׃

34.hebrewText: כׇּל־פֶּ֥טֶר רֶ֖חֶם לִ֑י וְכׇֽל־מִקְנְךָ֙ תִּזָּכָ֔ר פֶּ֖טֶר שׁ֥וֹר וָשֶֽׂה׃
34.englishText: Every first issue of the womb is Mine, from all your livestock that drop a male*male Heb. tizzakhar, form uncertain. as firstling, whether cattle or sheep.
34.transliteration: kׇּl־pֶּ֥tֶr rֶ֖chֶם lִ֑y vְkׇֽl־mִkְnְךָ֙ tִּzָּkָ֔r pֶּ֖tֶr shׁ֥vֹr vָshֶֽׂh׃

34.hebrewText: וּפֶ֤טֶר חֲמוֹר֙ תִּפְדֶּ֣ה בְשֶׂ֔ה וְאִם־לֹ֥א תִפְדֶּ֖ה וַעֲרַפְתּ֑וֹ כֹּ֣ל בְּכ֤וֹר בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ תִּפְדֶּ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יֵרָא֥וּ פָנַ֖י רֵיקָֽם׃
34.englishText: But the firstling of an ass you shall redeem with a sheep; if you do not redeem it, you must break its neck. And you must redeem every male first-born among your children. None shall appear before Me empty-handed.
34.transliteration: vּpֶ֤tֶr chֲmvֹr֙ tִּpְdֶּ֣h bְshֶׂ֔h vְaִם־lֹ֥a tִpְdֶּ֖h vַaֲrַpְtּ֑vֹ kֹּ֣l bְּk֤vֹr bָּnֶ֙yךָ֙ tִּpְdֶּ֔h vְlֹֽa־yֵrָa֥vּ pָnַ֖y rֵykָֽם׃

34.hebrewText: שֵׁ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ תַּעֲבֹ֔ד וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י תִּשְׁבֹּ֑ת בֶּחָרִ֥ישׁ וּבַקָּצִ֖יר תִּשְׁבֹּֽת׃
34.englishText: Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall cease from labor; you shall cease from labor even at plowing time and harvest time.
34.transliteration: shֵׁ֤shֶׁt yָmִyם֙ tַּaֲbֹ֔d vּbַyּ֥vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֖y tִּshְׁbֹּ֑t bֶּchָrִ֥yshׁ vּbַkָּtsִ֖yr tִּshְׁbֹּֽt׃

34.hebrewText: וְחַ֤ג שָׁבֻעֹת֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לְךָ֔ בִּכּוּרֵ֖י קְצִ֣יר חִטִּ֑ים וְחַג֙ הָֽאָסִ֔יף תְּקוּפַ֖ת הַשָּׁנָֽה׃
34.englishText: You shall observe the Feast of Weeks, of the first fruits of the wheat harvest; and the Feast of Ingathering at the turn of the year.
34.transliteration: vְchַ֤g shָׁbֻaֹt֙ tַּaֲshֶׂ֣h lְךָ֔ bִּkּvּrֵ֖y kְtsִ֣yr chִtִּ֑yם vְchַg֙ hָֽaָsִ֔yף tְּkvּpַ֖t hַshָּׁnָֽh׃

34.hebrewText: שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה יֵרָאֶה֙ כׇּל־זְכ֣וּרְךָ֔ אֶת־פְּנֵ֛י הָֽאָדֹ֥ן <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
34.englishText: Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Sovereign יהוה, the God of Israel.
34.transliteration: shָׁlֹ֥shׁ pְּaָmִ֖yם bַּshָּׁnָ֑h yֵrָaֶh֙ kׇּl־zְk֣vּrְךָ֔ aֶt־pְּnֵ֛y hָֽaָdֹ֥ן <small>׀</small> yְhֹvָ֖h aֱlֹhֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

34.hebrewText: כִּֽי־אוֹרִ֤ישׁ גּוֹיִם֙ מִפָּנֶ֔יךָ וְהִרְחַבְתִּ֖י אֶת־גְּבֻלֶ֑ךָ וְלֹא־יַחְמֹ֥ד אִישׁ֙ אֶֽת־אַרְצְךָ֔ בַּעֲלֹֽתְךָ֗ לֵרָאוֹת֙ אֶת־פְּנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָֽה׃
34.englishText: I will drive out nations from your path and enlarge your territory; no one will covet your land when you go up to appear before your God יהוה three times a year.
34.transliteration: kִּֽy־avֹrִ֤yshׁ gּvֹyִם֙ mִpָּnֶ֔yךָ vְhִrְchַbְtִּ֖y aֶt־gְּbֻlֶ֑ךָ vְlֹa־yַchְmֹ֥d aִyshׁ֙ aֶֽt־aַrְtsְךָ֔ bַּaֲlֹֽtְךָ֗ lֵrָavֹt֙ aֶt־pְּnֵy֙ yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhֶ֔yךָ shָׁlֹ֥shׁ pְּaָmִ֖yם bַּshָּׁnָֽh׃

34.hebrewText: לֹֽא־תִשְׁחַ֥ט עַל־חָמֵ֖ץ דַּם־זִבְחִ֑י וְלֹא־יָלִ֣ין לַבֹּ֔קֶר זֶ֖בַח חַ֥ג הַפָּֽסַח׃
34.englishText: You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with anything leavened; and the sacrifice of the Feast of Passover shall not be left lying until morning.
34.transliteration: lֹֽa־tִshְׁchַ֥t aַl־chָmֵ֖ץ dַּם־zִbְchִ֑y vְlֹa־yָlִ֣yן lַbֹּ֔kֶr zֶ֖bַch chַ֥g hַpָּֽsַch׃

34.hebrewText: רֵאשִׁ֗ית בִּכּוּרֵי֙ אַדְמָ֣תְךָ֔ תָּבִ֕יא בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹא־תְבַשֵּׁ֥ל גְּדִ֖י בַּחֲלֵ֥ב אִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
34.englishText: The choice first fruits of your soil you shall bring to the house of your God יהוה. You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
34.transliteration: rֵashִׁ֗yt bִּkּvּrֵy֙ aַdְmָ֣tְךָ֔ tָּbִ֕ya bֵּ֖yt yְhֹvָ֣h aֱlֹhֶ֑yךָ lֹa־tְbַshֵּׁ֥l gְּdִ֖y bַּchֲlֵ֥b aִmּֽvֹ׃ {p}

34.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כְּתׇב־לְךָ֖ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֞י עַל־פִּ֣י ׀ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה כָּרַ֧תִּי אִתְּךָ֛ בְּרִ֖ית וְאֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
34.englishText: And יהוה said to Moses: Write down these commandments, for in accordance with these commandments I make a covenant with you and with Israel.
34.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr yְhֹvָh֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֔h kְּtׇb־lְךָ֖ aֶt־hַdְּbָrִ֣yם hָaֵ֑lֶּh kִּ֞y aַl־pִּ֣y ׀ hַdְּbָrִ֣yם hָaֵ֗lֶּh kָּrַ֧tִּy aִtְּךָ֛ bְּrִ֖yt vְaֶt־yִshְׂrָaֵֽl׃

34.hebrewText: וַֽיְהִי־שָׁ֣ם עִם־יְהֹוָ֗ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים לַ֔יְלָה לֶ֚חֶם לֹ֣א אָכַ֔ל וּמַ֖יִם לֹ֣א שָׁתָ֑ה וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֗ת אֵ֚ת דִּבְרֵ֣י הַבְּרִ֔ית עֲשֶׂ֖רֶת הַדְּבָרִֽים׃
34.englishText: And he was there with יהוה forty days and forty nights; he ate no bread and drank no water; and he wrote down on the tablets the terms of the covenant, the Ten Commandments.
34.transliteration: vַֽyְhִy־shָׁ֣ם aִם־yְhֹvָ֗h aַrְbָּaִ֥yם yvֹם֙ vְaַrְbָּaִ֣yם lַ֔yְlָh lֶ֚chֶם lֹ֣a aָkַ֔l vּmַ֖yִם lֹ֣a shָׁtָ֑h vַyִּkְtֹּ֣b aַl־hַlֻּchֹ֗t aֵ֚t dִּbְrֵ֣y hַbְּrִ֔yt aֲshֶׂ֖rֶt hַdְּbָrִֽyם׃

34.hebrewText: וַיְהִ֗י בְּרֶ֤דֶת מֹשֶׁה֙ מֵהַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וּשְׁנֵ֨י לֻחֹ֤ת הָֽעֵדֻת֙ בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בְּרִדְתּ֖וֹ מִן־הָהָ֑ר וּמֹשֶׁ֣ה לֹֽא־יָדַ֗ע כִּ֥י קָרַ֛ן ע֥וֹר פָּנָ֖יו בְּדַבְּר֥וֹ אִתּֽוֹ׃
34.englishText: So Moses came down from Mount Sinai. And as Moses came down from the mountain bearing the two tablets of the Pact, Moses was not aware that the skin of his face was radiant, since he had spoken with God.
34.transliteration: vַyְhִ֗y bְּrֶ֤dֶt mֹshֶׁh֙ mֵhַ֣r sִynַ֔y vּshְׁnֵ֨y lֻchֹ֤t hָֽaֵdֻt֙ bְּyַd־mֹshֶׁ֔h bְּrִdְtּ֖vֹ mִן־hָhָ֑r vּmֹshֶׁ֣h lֹֽa־yָdַ֗a kִּ֥y kָrַ֛ן a֥vֹr pָּnָ֖yv bְּdַbְּr֥vֹ aִtּֽvֹ׃

34.hebrewText: וַיַּ֨רְא אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְכׇל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה קָרַ֖ן ע֣וֹר פָּנָ֑יו וַיִּֽירְא֖וּ מִגֶּ֥שֶׁת אֵלָֽיו׃
34.englishText: Aaron and all the Israelites saw that the skin of Moses’ face was radiant; and they shrank from coming near him.
34.transliteration: vַyַּ֨rְa aַhֲrֹ֜ן vְkׇl־bְּnֵ֤y yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ aֶt־mֹshֶׁ֔h vְhִnֵּ֥h kָrַ֖ן a֣vֹr pָּnָ֑yv vַyִּֽyrְa֖vּ mִgֶּ֥shֶׁt aֵlָֽyv׃

34.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיָּשֻׁ֧בוּ אֵלָ֛יו אַהֲרֹ֥ן וְכׇל־הַנְּשִׂאִ֖ים בָּעֵדָ֑ה וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
34.englishText: But Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the chieftains in the assembly returned to him, and Moses spoke to them.
34.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֤a aֲlֵhֶם֙ mֹshֶׁ֔h vַyָּshֻׁ֧bvּ aֵlָ֛yv aַhֲrֹ֥ן vְkׇl־hַnְּshִׂaִ֖yם bָּaֵdָ֑h vַyְdַbֵּ֥r mֹshֶׁ֖h aֲlֵhֶֽם׃

34.hebrewText: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֥ן נִגְּשׁ֖וּ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיְצַוֵּ֕ם אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אִתּ֖וֹ בְּהַ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
34.englishText: Afterward all the Israelites came near, and he instructed them concerning all that יהוה had imparted to him on Mount Sinai.
34.transliteration: vְaַchֲrֵy־kֵ֥ן nִgְּshׁ֖vּ kׇּl־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֑l vַyְtsַvֵּ֕ם aֵt֩ kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֨r dִּbֶּ֧r yְhֹvָ֛h aִtּ֖vֹ bְּhַ֥r sִynָֽy׃

34.hebrewText: וַיְכַ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִדַּבֵּ֖ר אִתָּ֑ם וַיִּתֵּ֥ן עַל־פָּנָ֖יו מַסְוֶֽה׃
34.englishText: And when Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil over his face.
34.transliteration: vַyְkַ֣l mֹshֶׁ֔h mִdַּbֵּ֖r aִtָּ֑ם vַyִּtֵּ֥ן aַl־pָּnָ֖yv mַsְvֶֽh׃

34.hebrewText: וּבְבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ יָסִ֥יר אֶת־הַמַּסְוֶ֖ה עַד־צֵאת֑וֹ וְיָצָ֗א וְדִבֶּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְצֻוֶּֽה׃
34.englishText: Whenever Moses went in before יהוה to converse, he would leave the veil off until he came out; and when he came out and told the Israelites what he had been commanded,
34.transliteration: vּbְbֹ֨a mֹshֶׁ֜h lִpְnֵ֤y yְhֹvָh֙ lְdַbֵּ֣r aִtּ֔vֹ yָsִ֥yr aֶt־hַmַּsְvֶ֖h aַd־tsֵat֑vֹ vְyָtsָ֗a vְdִbֶּr֙ aֶl־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l aֵ֖t aֲshֶׁ֥r yְtsֻvֶּֽh׃

34.hebrewText: וְרָא֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה כִּ֣י קָרַ֔ן ע֖וֹר פְּנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְהֵשִׁ֨יב מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־הַמַּסְוֶה֙ עַל־פָּנָ֔יו עַד־בֹּא֖ו�� לְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
34.englishText: the Israelites would see how radiant the skin of Moses’ face was. Moses would then put the veil back over his face until he went in to speak with God.
34.transliteration: vְrָa֤vּ bְnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵl֙ aֶt־pְּnֵ֣y mֹshֶׁ֔h kִּ֣y kָrַ֔ן a֖vֹr pְּnֵ֣y mֹshֶׁ֑h vְhֵshִׁ֨yb mֹshֶׁ֤h aֶt־hַmַּsְvֶh֙ aַl־pָּnָ֔yv aַd־bֹּa֖v�� lְdַbֵּ֥r aִtּֽvֹ׃ {s}

vayakhel.name: Vayakhel
vayakhel.summary: The gathering of the people, the Sabbath laws, the collection of materials, and the construction of the Tabernacle and its vessels.

35.hebrewText: וַיַּקְהֵ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־עֲדַ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אֵ֚לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽם׃
35.englishText: Moses then convoked the whole Israelite community and said to them: These are the things that יהוה has commanded you to do:
35.transliteration: vַyַּkְhֵ֣l mֹshֶׁ֗h aֶֽt־kׇּl־aֲdַ֛t bְּnֵ֥y yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l vַyֹּ֣amֶr aֲlֵhֶ֑ם aֵ֚lֶּh hַdְּbָrִ֔yם aֲshֶׁr־tsִvָּ֥h yְhֹvָ֖h lַaֲshֹׂ֥t aֹtָֽם׃

35.hebrewText: שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִים֮ תֵּעָשֶׂ֣ה מְלָאכָה֒ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י יִהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֥ם קֹ֛דֶשׁ שַׁבַּ֥ת שַׁבָּת֖וֹן לַיהֹוָ֑ה כׇּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה ב֛וֹ מְלָאכָ֖ה יוּמָֽת׃
35.englishText: On six days work may be done, but on the seventh day you shall have a sabbath of complete rest, holy to יהוה; whoever does any work on it shall be put to death.
35.transliteration: shֵׁ֣shֶׁt yָmִyם֮ tֵּaָshֶׂ֣h mְlָakָh֒ vּbַyּ֣vֹם hַshְּׁbִyaִ֗y yִhְyֶ֨h lָkֶ֥ם kֹ֛dֶshׁ shַׁbַּ֥t shַׁbָּt֖vֹן lַyhֹvָ֑h kׇּl־hָaֹshֶׂ֥h b֛vֹ mְlָakָ֖h yvּmָֽt׃

35.hebrewText: לֹא־תְבַעֲר֣וּ אֵ֔שׁ בְּכֹ֖ל מֹשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּי֖וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃ {פ}
35.englishText: You shall kindle no fire throughout your settlements on the sabbath day.
35.transliteration: lֹa־tְbַaֲr֣vּ aֵ֔shׁ bְּkֹ֖l mֹshְׁbֹֽtֵykֶ֑ם bְּy֖vֹם hַshַּׁbָּֽt׃ {p}

35.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
35.englishText: Moses said further to the whole community of Israelites: This is what יהוה has commanded:
35.transliteration: vַyֹּ֣amֶr mֹshֶׁ֔h aֶl־kׇּl־aֲdַ֥t bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l lֵamֹ֑r zֶ֣h hַdָּbָ֔r aֲshֶׁr־tsִvָּ֥h yְhֹvָ֖h lֵamֹֽr׃

35.hebrewText: קְח֨וּ מֵֽאִתְּכֶ֤ם תְּרוּמָה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה כֹּ֚ל נְדִ֣יב לִבּ֔וֹ יְבִיאֶ֕הָ אֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף וּנְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
35.englishText: Take from among you gifts to יהוה; everyone whose heart is so moved shall bring them—gifts for יהוה:*On the list that follows, see 25.4–7 and the notes there. gold, silver, and copper;
35.transliteration: kְch֨vּ mֵֽaִtְּkֶ֤ם tְּrvּmָh֙ lַֽyhֹvָ֔h kֹּ֚l nְdִ֣yb lִbּ֔vֹ yְbִyaֶ֕hָ aֵ֖t tְּrvּmַ֣t yְhֹvָ֑h zָhָ֥b vָkֶ֖sֶף vּnְchֹֽshֶׁt׃

35.hebrewText: וּתְכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ וְעִזִּֽים׃
35.englishText: blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, and goats’ hair;
35.transliteration: vּtְkֵ֧lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֛ן vְtvֹlַ֥aַt shָׁnִ֖y vְshֵׁ֥shׁ vְaִzִּֽyם׃

35.hebrewText: וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאׇדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים וַעֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּֽים׃
35.englishText: tanned ram skins, dolphin skins, and acacia wood;
35.transliteration: vְaֹrֹ֨t aֵylִ֧ם mְaׇdָּmִ֛yם vְaֹrֹ֥t tְּchָshִׁ֖yם vַaֲtsֵ֥y shִׁtִּֽyם׃

35.hebrewText: וְשֶׁ֖מֶן לַמָּא֑וֹר וּבְשָׂמִים֙ לְשֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
35.englishText: oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for the aromatic incense;
35.transliteration: vְshֶׁ֖mֶן lַmָּa֑vֹr vּbְshָׂmִyם֙ lְshֶׁ֣mֶן hַmִּshְׁchָ֔h vְlִkְtֹ֖rֶt hַsַּmִּֽyם׃

35.hebrewText: וְאַ֨בְנֵי־שֹׁ֔הַם וְאַבְנֵ֖י מִלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפ֖וֹד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
35.englishText: lapis lazuli and other stones for setting, for the ephod and the breastpiece.
35.transliteration: vְaַ֨bְnֵy־shֹׁ֔hַם vְaַbְnֵ֖y mִlֻּaִ֑yם lָaֵp֖vֹd vְlַchֹֽshֶׁן׃

35.hebrewText: וְכׇל־חֲכַם־לֵ֖ב בָּכֶ֑ם יָבֹ֣אוּ וְיַעֲשׂ֔וּ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה יְהֹוָֽה׃
35.englishText: And let all among you who are skilled come and make all that יהוה has commanded:
35.transliteration: vְkׇl־chֲkַם־lֵ֖b bָּkֶ֑ם yָbֹ֣avּ vְyַaֲshׂ֔vּ aֵ֛t kׇּl־aֲshֶׁ֥r tsִvָּ֖h yְhֹvָֽh׃

35.hebrewText: אֶ֨ת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן אֶֽת־אׇהֳל֖וֹ וְאֶת־מִכְסֵ֑הוּ אֶת־קְרָסָיו֙ וְאֶת־קְרָשָׁ֔יו אֶת־בְּרִיחָ֕ו אֶת־עַמֻּדָ֖יו וְאֶת־אֲדָנָֽיו׃
35.englishText: the Tabernacle, its tent and its covering, its clasps and its planks, its bars, its posts, and its sockets;
35.transliteration: aֶ֨t־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֔ן aֶֽt־aׇhֳl֖vֹ vְaֶt־mִkְsֵ֑hvּ aֶt־kְrָsָyv֙ vְaֶt־kְrָshָׁ֔yv aֶt־bְּrִychָ֕v aֶt־aַmֻּdָ֖yv vְaֶt־aֲdָnָֽyv׃

35.hebrewText: אֶת־הָאָרֹ֥ן וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֑רֶת וְאֵ֖ת פָּרֹ֥כֶת הַמָּסָֽךְ׃
35.englishText: the ark and its poles, the cover, and the curtain for the screen;
35.transliteration: aֶt־hָaָrֹ֥ן vְaֶt־bַּdָּ֖yv aֶt־hַkַּpֹּ֑rֶt vְaֵ֖t pָּrֹ֥kֶt hַmָּsָֽךְ׃

35.hebrewText: אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֥ן וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת לֶ֥חֶם הַפָּנִֽים׃
35.englishText: the table, and its poles and all its utensils; and the bread of display;
35.transliteration: aֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָ֥ן vְaֶt־bַּdָּ֖yv vְaֶt־kׇּl־kֵּlָ֑yv vְaֵ֖t lֶ֥chֶם hַpָּnִֽyם׃

35.hebrewText: וְאֶת־מְנֹרַ֧ת הַמָּא֛וֹר וְאֶת־כֵּלֶ֖יהָ וְאֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת שֶׁ֥מֶן הַמָּאֽוֹר׃
35.englishText: the lampstand for lighting, its furnishings and its lamps, and the oil for lighting;
35.transliteration: vְaֶt־mְnֹrַ֧t hַmָּa֛vֹr vְaֶt־kֵּlֶ֖yhָ vְaֶt־nֵrֹtֶ֑yhָ vְaֵ֖t shֶׁ֥mֶן hַmָּaֽvֹr׃

35.hebrewText: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַקְּטֹ֙רֶת֙ וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֔יו וְאֵת֙ שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת קְטֹ֣רֶת הַסַּמִּ֑ים וְאֶת־מָסַ֥ךְ הַפֶּ֖תַח לְפֶ֥תַח הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
35.englishText: the altar of incense and its poles; the anointing oil and the aromatic incense; and the entrance screen for the entrance of the Tabernacle;
35.transliteration: vְaֶt־mִzְbַּ֤ch hַkְּtֹ֙rֶt֙ vְaֶt־bַּdָּ֔yv vְaֵt֙ shֶׁ֣mֶן hַmִּshְׁchָ֔h vְaֵ֖t kְtֹ֣rֶt hַsַּmִּ֑yם vְaֶt־mָsַ֥ךְ hַpֶּ֖tַch lְpֶ֥tַch hַmִּshְׁkָּֽן׃

35.hebrewText: אֵ֣ת ׀ מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֗ה וְאֶת־מִכְבַּ֤ר הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
35.englishText: the altar of burnt offering, its copper grating, its poles, and all its furnishings; the laver and its stand;
35.transliteration: aֵ֣t ׀ mִzְbַּ֣ch hָaֹlָ֗h vְaֶt־mִkְbַּ֤r hַnְּchֹ֙shֶׁt֙ aֲshֶׁr־l֔vֹ aֶt־bַּdָּ֖yv vְaֶt־kׇּl־kֵּlָ֑yv aֶt־hַkִּyֹּ֖r vְaֶt־kַּnּֽvֹ׃

35.hebrewText: אֵ֚ת קַלְעֵ֣י הֶחָצֵ֔ר אֶת־עַמֻּדָ֖יו וְאֶת־אֲדָנֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֕ת מָסַ֖ךְ שַׁ֥עַר הֶחָצֵֽר׃
35.englishText: the hangings of the enclosure, its posts and its sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court;
35.transliteration: aֵ֚t kַlְaֵ֣y hֶchָtsֵ֔r aֶt־aַmֻּdָ֖yv vְaֶt־aֲdָnֶ֑yhָ vְaֵ֕t mָsַ֖ךְ shַׁ֥aַr hֶchָtsֵֽr׃

35.hebrewText: אֶת־יִתְדֹ֧ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן וְאֶת־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר וְאֶת־מֵיתְרֵיהֶֽם׃
35.englishText: the pegs for the Tabernacle, the pegs for the enclosure, and their cords;
35.transliteration: aֶt־yִtְdֹ֧t hַmִּshְׁkָּ֛ן vְaֶt־yִtְdֹ֥t hֶchָtsֵ֖r vְaֶt־mֵytְrֵyhֶֽם׃

35.hebrewText: אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י הַשְּׂרָ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו לְכַהֵֽן׃
35.englishText: the service vestments for officiating in the sanctuary, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest and the vestments of his sons for priestly service.
35.transliteration: aֶt־bִּgְdֵ֥y hַshְּׂrָ֖d lְshָׁrֵ֣t bַּkֹּ֑dֶshׁ aֶt־bִּgְdֵ֤y hַkֹּ֙dֶshׁ֙ lְaַhֲrֹ֣ן hַkֹּhֵ֔ן vְaֶt־bִּgְdֵ֥y bָnָ֖yv lְkַhֵֽן׃

35.hebrewText: וַיֵּ֥צְא֛וּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִלִּפְנֵ֥י מֹשֶֽׁה׃
35.englishText: So the whole community of the Israelites left Moses’ presence.
35.transliteration: vַyֵּ֥tsְa֛vּ kׇּl־aֲdַ֥t bְּnֵֽy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֖l mִlִּpְnֵ֥y mֹshֶֽׁh׃

35.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֕אוּ כׇּל־אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נְשָׂא֣וֹ לִבּ֑וֹ וְכֹ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נָדְבָ֨ה רוּח֜וֹ אֹת֗וֹ הֵ֠בִ֠יאוּ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֜ה לִמְלֶ֨אכֶת אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ וּלְכׇל־עֲבֹ֣דָת֔וֹ וּלְבִגְדֵ֖י הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
35.englishText: And everyone who excelled in ability and everyone whose spirit was moved came, bringing to יהוה an offering for the work of the Tent of Meeting and for all its service and for the sacral vestments.
35.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֕avּ kׇּl־aִ֖yshׁ aֲshֶׁr־nְshָׂa֣vֹ lִbּ֑vֹ vְkֹ֡l aֲshֶׁr֩ nָdְbָ֨h rvּch֜vֹ aֹt֗vֹ hֵ֠bִ֠yavּ aֶt־tְּrvּmַ֨t yְhֹvָ֜h lִmְlֶ֨akֶt aֹ֤hֶl mvֹaֵd֙ vּlְkׇl־aֲbֹ֣dָt֔vֹ vּlְbִgְdֵ֖y hַkֹּֽdֶshׁ׃

35.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים עַל־הַנָּשִׁ֑ים כֹּ֣ל ׀ נְדִ֣יב לֵ֗ב הֵ֠בִ֠יאוּ חָ֣ח וָנֶ֜זֶם וְטַבַּ֤עַת וְכוּמָז֙ כׇּל־כְּלִ֣י זָהָ֔ב וְכׇל־אִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵנִ֛יף תְּנוּפַ֥ת זָהָ֖ב לַיהֹוָֽה׃
35.englishText: Men and women, all whose hearts moved them, all who would make an elevation offering of gold to יהוה, came bringing brooches, earrings, rings, and pendants*pendants Meaning of Heb. kumaz uncertain; cf. Num. 31.50. —gold objects of all kinds.
35.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֥avּ hָaֲnָshִׁ֖yם aַl־hַnָּshִׁ֑yם kֹּ֣l ׀ nְdִ֣yb lֵ֗b hֵ֠bִ֠yavּ chָ֣ch vָnֶ֜zֶם vְtַbַּ֤aַt vְkvּmָz֙ kׇּl־kְּlִ֣y zָhָ֔b vְkׇl־aִ֕yshׁ aֲshֶׁ֥r hֵnִ֛yף tְּnvּpַ֥t zָhָ֖b lַyhֹvָֽh׃

35.hebrewText: וְכׇל־אִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נִמְצָ֣א אִתּ֗וֹ תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ וְעִזִּ֑ים וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאׇדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
35.englishText: And everyone who possessed blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, goats’ hair, tanned ram skins, and dolphin skins, brought them;
35.transliteration: vְkׇl־aִ֞yshׁ aֲshֶׁr־nִmְtsָ֣a aִtּ֗vֹ tְּkֵ֧lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֛ן vְtvֹlַ֥aַt shָׁnִ֖y vְshֵׁ֣shׁ vְaִzִּ֑yם vְaֹrֹ֨t aֵylִ֧ם mְaׇdָּmִ֛yם vְaֹrֹ֥t tְּchָshִׁ֖yם hֵbִֽyavּ׃

35.hebrewText: כׇּל־מֵרִ֗ים תְּר֤וּמַת כֶּ֙סֶף֙ וּנְחֹ֔שֶׁת הֵבִ֕יאוּ אֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְכֹ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נִמְצָ֨א אִתּ֜וֹ עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֛ים לְכׇל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת הָעֲבֹדָ֖ה הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
35.englishText: everyone who would make gifts of silver or copper brought them as gifts for יהוה; and everyone who possessed acacia wood for any work of the service brought that.
35.transliteration: kׇּl־mֵrִ֗yם tְּr֤vּmַt kֶּ֙sֶף֙ vּnְchֹ֔shֶׁt hֵbִ֕yavּ aֵ֖t tְּrvּmַ֣t yְhֹvָ֑h vְkֹ֡l aֲshֶׁr֩ nִmְtsָ֨a aִtּ֜vֹ aֲtsֵ֥y shִׁtִּ֛yם lְkׇl־mְlֶ֥akֶt hָaֲbֹdָ֖h hֵbִֽyavּ׃

35.hebrewText: וְכׇל־אִשָּׁ֥ה חַכְמַת־לֵ֖ב בְּיָדֶ֣יהָ טָו֑וּ וַיָּבִ֣יאוּ מַטְוֶ֗ה אֶֽת־הַתְּכֵ֙לֶת֙ וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֔ן אֶת־תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃
35.englishText: And all the skilled women spun with their own hands, and brought what they had spun, in blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and in fine linen.
35.transliteration: vְkׇl־aִshָּׁ֥h chַkְmַt־lֵ֖b bְּyָdֶ֣yhָ tָv֑vּ vַyָּbִ֣yavּ mַtְvֶ֗h aֶֽt־hַtְּkֵ֙lֶt֙ vְaֶt־hָֽaַrְgָּmָ֔ן aֶt־tּvֹlַ֥aַt hַshָּׁnִ֖y vְaֶt־hַshֵּֽׁshׁ׃

35.hebrewText: וְכׇ֨ל־הַנָּשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָשָׂ֥א לִבָּ֛ן אֹתָ֖נָה בְּחׇכְמָ֑ה טָו֖וּ אֶת־הָעִזִּֽים׃
35.englishText: And all the women who excelled in that skill spun the goats’ hair.
35.transliteration: vְkׇ֨l־hַnָּshִׁ֔yם aֲshֶׁ֨r nָshָׂ֥a lִbָּ֛ן aֹtָ֖nָh bְּchׇkְmָ֑h tָv֖vּ aֶt־hָaִzִּֽyם׃

35.hebrewText: וְהַנְּשִׂאִ֣ם הֵבִ֔יאוּ אֵ֚ת אַבְנֵ֣י הַשֹּׁ֔הַם וְאֵ֖ת אַבְנֵ֣י הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפ֖וֹד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
35.englishText: And the chieftains brought lapis lazuli and other stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece;
35.transliteration: vְhַnְּshִׂaִ֣ם hֵbִ֔yavּ aֵ֚t aַbְnֵ֣y hַshֹּׁ֔hַם vְaֵ֖t aַbְnֵ֣y hַmִּlֻּaִ֑yם lָaֵp֖vֹd vְlַchֹֽshֶׁן׃

35.hebrewText: וְאֶת־הַבֹּ֖שֶׂם וְאֶת־הַשָּׁ֑מֶן לְמָא֕וֹר וּלְשֶׁ֙מֶן֙ הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
35.englishText: and spices and oil for lighting, for the anointing oil, and for the aromatic incense.
35.transliteration: vְaֶt־hַbֹּ֖shֶׂם vְaֶt־hַshָּׁ֑mֶן lְmָa֕vֹr vּlְshֶׁ֙mֶן֙ hַmִּshְׁchָ֔h vְlִkְtֹ֖rֶt hַsַּmִּֽyם׃

35.hebrewText: כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָדַ֣ב לִבָּם֮ אֹתָם֒ לְהָבִיא֙ לְכׇל־הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֑ה הֵבִ֧יאוּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל נְדָבָ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
35.englishText: Thus the Israelites, all the men and women whose hearts moved them to bring anything for the work that יהוה, through Moses, had commanded to be done, brought it as a freewill offering to יהוה.
35.transliteration: kׇּl־aִ֣yshׁ vְaִshָּׁ֗h aֲshֶׁ֨r nָdַ֣b lִbָּם֮ aֹtָם֒ lְhָbִya֙ lְkׇl־hַmְּlָakָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֨r tsִvָּ֧h yְhֹvָ֛h lַaֲshׂ֖vֹt bְּyַd־mֹshֶׁ֑h hֵbִ֧yavּ bְnֵy־yִshְׂrָaֵ֛l nְdָbָ֖h lַyhֹvָֽh׃ {p}

35.hebrewText: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רְא֛וּ קָרָ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּשֵׁ֑ם בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל בֶּן־אוּרִ֥י בֶן־ח֖וּר לְמַטֵּ֥ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
35.englishText: And Moses said to the Israelites: See, יהוה has singled out by name Bezalel, son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
35.transliteration: vַyֹּ֤amֶr mֹshֶׁh֙ aֶl־bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֔l rְa֛vּ kָrָ֥a yְhֹvָ֖h bְּshֵׁ֑ם bְּtsַlְaֵ֛l bֶּן־avּrִ֥y bֶן־ch֖vּr lְmַtֵּ֥h yְhvּdָֽh׃

35.hebrewText: וַיְמַלֵּ֥א אֹת֖וֹ ר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּחׇכְמָ֛ה בִּתְבוּנָ֥ה וּבְדַ֖עַת וּבְכׇל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
35.englishText: endowing him with a divine spirit of skill, ability, and knowledge in every kind of craft,
35.transliteration: vַyְmַlֵּ֥a aֹt֖vֹ r֣vּchַ aֱlֹhִ֑yם bְּchׇkְmָ֛h bִּtְbvּnָ֥h vּbְdַ֖aַt vּbְkׇl־mְlָakָֽh׃

35.hebrewText: וְלַחְשֹׁ֖ב מַֽחֲשָׁבֹ֑ת לַעֲשֹׂ֛ת בַּזָּהָ֥ב וּבַכֶּ֖סֶף וּבַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃
35.englishText: and inspiring him*inspiring him Moved up from v. 34 for clarity. to make designs for work in gold, silver, and copper,
35.transliteration: vְlַchְshֹׁ֖b mַֽchֲshָׁbֹ֑t lַaֲshֹׂ֛t bַּzָּhָ֥b vּbַkֶּ֖sֶף vּbַnְּchֹֽshֶׁt׃

35.hebrewText: וּבַחֲרֹ֥שֶׁת אֶ֛בֶן לְמַלֹּ֖את וּבַחֲרֹ֣שֶׁת עֵ֑ץ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּכׇל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת מַחֲשָֽׁבֶת׃
35.englishText: to cut stones for setting and to carve wood—to work in every kind of designer’s craft—
35.transliteration: vּbַchֲrֹ֥shֶׁt aֶ֛bֶן lְmַlֹּ֖at vּbַchֲrֹ֣shֶׁt aֵ֑ץ lַaֲshׂ֖vֹt bְּkׇl־mְlֶ֥akֶt mַchֲshָֽׁbֶt׃

35.hebrewText: וּלְהוֹרֹ֖ת נָתַ֣ן בְּלִבּ֑וֹ ה֕וּא וְאׇֽהֳלִיאָ֥ב בֶּן־אֲחִיסָמָ֖ךְ לְמַטֵּה־דָֽ��׃
35.englishText: and to give directions. He and Oholiab son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan
35.transliteration: vּlְhvֹrֹ֖t nָtַ֣ן bְּlִbּ֑vֹ h֕vּa vְaׇֽhֳlִyaָ֥b bֶּן־aֲchִysָmָ֖ךְ lְmַtֵּh־dָֽ��׃

35.hebrewText: מִלֵּ֨א אֹתָ֜ם חׇכְמַת־לֵ֗ב לַעֲשׂוֹת֮ כׇּל־מְלֶ֣אכֶת חָרָ֣שׁ <small>׀</small> וְחֹשֵׁב֒ וְרֹקֵ֞ם בַּתְּכֵ֣לֶת וּבָֽאַרְגָּמָ֗ן בְּתוֹלַ֧עַת הַשָּׁנִ֛י וּבַשֵּׁ֖שׁ וְאֹרֵ֑ג עֹשֵׂי֙ כׇּל־מְלָאכָ֔ה וְחֹשְׁבֵ֖י מַחֲשָׁבֹֽת׃
35.englishText: have been endowed with the skill to do any work—of the carver, the designer, the embroiderer in blue, purple, crimson yarns, and in fine linen, and of the weaver—as workers in all crafts and as makers of designs.
35.transliteration: mִlֵּ֨a aֹtָ֜ם chׇkְmַt־lֵ֗b lַaֲshׂvֹt֮ kׇּl־mְlֶ֣akֶt chָrָ֣shׁ <small>׀</small> vְchֹshֵׁb֒ vְrֹkֵ֞ם bַּtְּkֵ֣lֶt vּbָֽaַrְgָּmָ֗ן bְּtvֹlַ֧aַt hַshָּׁnִ֛y vּbַshֵּׁ֖shׁ vְaֹrֵ֑g aֹshֵׂy֙ kׇּl־mְlָakָ֔h vְchֹshְׁbֵ֖y mַchֲshָׁbֹֽt׃

36.hebrewText: וְעָשָׂה֩ בְצַלְאֵ֨ל וְאׇהֳלִיאָ֜ב וְכֹ֣ל ׀ אִ֣ישׁ חֲכַם־לֵ֗ב אֲשֶׁר֩ נָתַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֜ה חׇכְמָ֤ה וּתְבוּנָה֙ בָּהֵ֔מָּה לָדַ֣עַת לַעֲשֹׂ֔ת אֶֽת־כׇּל־מְלֶ֖אכֶת עֲבֹדַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה יְהֹוָֽה׃
36.englishText: Let, then, Bezalel and Oholiab and all the skilled persons whom יהוה has endowed with skill and ability to perform expertly all the tasks connected with the service of the sanctuary carry out all that יהוה has commanded.
36.transliteration: vְaָshָׂh֩ bְtsַlְaֵ֨l vְaׇhֳlִyaָ֜b vְkֹ֣l ׀ aִ֣yshׁ chֲkַם־lֵ֗b aֲshֶׁr֩ nָtַ֨ן yְhֹvָ֜h chׇkְmָ֤h vּtְbvּnָh֙ bָּhֵ֔mָּh lָdַ֣aַt lַaֲshֹׂ֔t aֶֽt־kׇּl־mְlֶ֖akֶt aֲbֹdַ֣t hַkֹּ֑dֶshׁ lְkֹ֥l aֲshֶׁr־tsִvָּ֖h yְhֹvָֽh׃

36.hebrewText: וַיִּקְרָ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶל־בְּצַלְאֵל֮ וְאֶל־אׇֽהֳלִיאָב֒ וְאֶל֙ כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ חֲכַם־לֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה חׇכְמָ֖ה בְּלִבּ֑וֹ כֹּ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר נְשָׂא֣וֹ לִבּ֔וֹ לְקׇרְבָ֥ה אֶל־הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽהּ׃
36.englishText: Moses then called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every skilled person whom יהוה had endowed with skill, everyone who excelled in ability, to undertake the task and carry it out.
36.transliteration: vַyִּkְrָ֣a mֹshֶׁ֗h aֶl־bְּtsַlְaֵl֮ vְaֶl־aׇֽhֳlִyaָb֒ vְaֶl֙ kׇּl־aִ֣yshׁ chֲkַם־lֵ֔b aֲshֶׁ֨r nָtַ֧ן yְhֹvָ֛h chׇkְmָ֖h bְּlִbּ֑vֹ kֹּ֚l aֲshֶׁ֣r nְshָׂa֣vֹ lִbּ֔vֹ lְkׇrְbָ֥h aֶl־hַmְּlָakָ֖h lַaֲshֹׂ֥t aֹtָֽhּ׃

36.hebrewText: וַיִּקְח֞וּ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַתְּרוּמָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵבִ֜יאוּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לִמְלֶ֛אכֶת עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ לַעֲשֹׂ֣ת אֹתָ֑הּ וְ֠הֵ֠ם הֵבִ֨יאוּ אֵלָ֥יו ע֛וֹד נְדָבָ֖ה בַּבֹּ֥קֶר בַּבֹּֽקֶר׃
36.englishText: They took over from Moses all the gifts that the Israelites had brought, to carry out the tasks connected with the service of the sanctuary. But when these continued to bring freewill offerings to him morning after morning,
36.transliteration: vַyִּkְch֞vּ mִlִּpְnֵ֣y mֹshֶׁ֗h aֵ֤t kׇּl־hַtְּrvּmָh֙ aֲshֶׁ֨r hֵbִ֜yavּ bְּnֵ֣y yִshְׂrָaֵ֗l lִmְlֶ֛akֶt aֲbֹdַ֥t hַkֹּ֖dֶshׁ lַaֲshֹׂ֣t aֹtָ֑hּ vְ֠hֵ֠ם hֵbִ֨yavּ aֵlָ֥yv a֛vֹd nְdָbָ֖h bַּbֹּ֥kֶr bַּbֹּֽkֶr׃

36.hebrewText: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ כׇּל־הַ֣חֲכָמִ֔ים הָעֹשִׂ֕ים אֵ֖ת כׇּל־מְלֶ֣אכֶת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ אִֽישׁ־אִ֥ישׁ מִמְּלַאכְתּ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֥מָּה עֹשִֽׂים׃
36.englishText: all the artisans who were engaged in the tasks of the sanctuary came, from the task upon which each one was engaged,
36.transliteration: vַyָּbֹ֙avּ֙ kׇּl־hַ֣chֲkָmִ֔yם hָaֹshִׂ֕yם aֵ֖t kׇּl־mְlֶ֣akֶt hַkֹּ֑dֶshׁ aִֽyshׁ־aִ֥yshׁ mִmְּlַakְtּ֖vֹ aֲshֶׁr־hֵ֥mָּh aֹshִֽׂyם׃

36.hebrewText: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה לֵּאמֹ֔ר מַרְבִּ֥ים הָעָ֖ם לְהָבִ֑יא מִדֵּ֤י הָֽעֲבֹדָה֙ לַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽהּ׃
36.englishText: and said to Moses, “The people are bringing more than is needed for the tasks entailed in the work that יהוה has commanded to be done.”
36.transliteration: vַyֹּamְrvּ֙ aֶl־mֹshֶׁ֣h lֵּamֹ֔r mַrְbִּ֥yם hָaָ֖ם lְhָbִ֑ya mִdֵּ֤y hָֽaֲbֹdָh֙ lַmְּlָakָ֔h aֲshֶׁr־tsִvָּ֥h yְhֹvָ֖h lַaֲshֹׂ֥t aֹtָֽhּ׃

36.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֣ו מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיַּעֲבִ֨ירוּ ק֥וֹל בַּֽמַּחֲנֶה֮ לֵאמֹר֒ אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אַל־יַעֲשׂוּ־ע֛וֹד מְלָאכָ֖ה לִתְרוּמַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וַיִּכָּלֵ֥א הָעָ֖ם מֵהָבִֽיא׃
36.englishText: Moses thereupon had this proclamation made throughout the camp: “Let no man or woman make further effort toward gifts for the sanctuary!” So the people stopped bringing:
36.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֣v mֹshֶׁ֗h vַyַּaֲbִ֨yrvּ k֥vֹl bַּֽmַּchֲnֶh֮ lֵamֹr֒ aִ֣yshׁ vְaִshָּׁ֗h aַl־yַaֲshׂvּ־a֛vֹd mְlָakָ֖h lִtְrvּmַ֣t hַkֹּ֑dֶshׁ vַyִּkָּlֵ֥a hָaָ֖ם mֵhָbִֽya׃

36.hebrewText: וְהַמְּלָאכָ֗ה הָיְתָ֥ה דַיָּ֛ם לְכׇל־הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת אֹתָ֑הּ וְהוֹתֵֽר׃ {ס}
36.englishText: their efforts had been more than enough for all the tasks to be done.
36.transliteration: vְhַmְּlָakָ֗h hָyְtָ֥h dַyָּ֛ם lְkׇl־hַmְּlָakָ֖h lַaֲshׂ֣vֹt aֹtָ֑hּ vְhvֹtֵֽr׃ {s}

36.hebrewText: וַיַּעֲשׂ֨וּ כׇל־חֲכַם־לֵ֜ב בְּעֹשֵׂ֧י הַמְּלָאכָ֛ה אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן עֶ֣שֶׂר יְרִיעֹ֑ת שֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֗ר וּתְכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י כְּרֻבִ֛ים מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֖ב עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
36.englishText: Then all the skilled among those engaged in the work made the tabernacle of ten strips of cloth, which they made of fine twisted linen, blue, purple, and crimson yarns; into these they worked a design of cherubim.
36.transliteration: vַyַּaֲshׂ֨vּ kׇl־chֲkַם־lֵ֜b bְּaֹshֵׂ֧y hַmְּlָakָ֛h aֶt־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן aֶ֣shֶׂr yְrִyaֹ֑t shֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֗r vּtְkֵ֤lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָן֙ vְtvֹlַ֣aַt shָׁnִ֔y kְּrֻbִ֛yם mַaֲshֵׂ֥h chֹshֵׁ֖b aָshָׂ֥h aֹtָֽם׃

36.hebrewText: אֹ֜רֶךְ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁמֹנֶ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לְכׇל־הַיְרִיעֹֽת׃
36.englishText: The length of each cloth was twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each cloth was four cubits, all cloths having the same measurements.
36.transliteration: aֹ֜rֶךְ hַyְrִyaָ֣h hָֽaַchַ֗t shְׁmֹnֶ֤h vְaֶshְׂrִyם֙ bָּֽaַmָּ֔h vְrֹ֙chַb֙ aַrְbַּ֣a bָּֽaַmָּ֔h hַyְrִyaָ֖h hָaֶchָ֑t mִdָּ֥h aַchַ֖t lְkׇl־hַyְrִyaֹֽt׃

36.hebrewText: וַיְחַבֵּר֙ אֶת־חֲמֵ֣שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָ֑ת וְחָמֵ֤שׁ יְרִיעֹת֙ חִבַּ֔ר אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָֽת׃
36.englishText: They joined five of the cloths to one another, and they joined the other five cloths to one another.
36.transliteration: vַyְchַbֵּr֙ aֶt־chֲmֵ֣shׁ hַyְrִyaֹ֔t aַchַ֖t aֶl־aֶchָ֑t vְchָmֵ֤shׁ yְrִyaֹt֙ chִbַּ֔r aַchַ֖t aֶl־aֶchָֽt׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ לֻֽלְאֹ֣ת תְּכֵ֗לֶת עַ֣ל שְׂפַ֤ת הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת מִקָּצָ֖ה בַּמַּחְבָּ֑רֶת כֵּ֤ן עָשָׂה֙ בִּשְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַקִּ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה בַּמַּחְבֶּ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
36.englishText: They made loops of blue wool on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and did the same on the edge of the outermost cloth of the other set:
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֜aַshׂ lֻֽlְaֹ֣t tְּkֵ֗lֶt aַ֣l shְׂpַ֤t hַyְrִyaָh֙ hָֽaֶchָ֔t mִkָּtsָ֖h bַּmַּchְbָּ֑rֶt kֵּ֤ן aָshָׂh֙ bִּshְׂpַ֣t hַyְrִyaָ֔h hַkִּ֣ytsvֹnָ֔h bַּmַּchְbֶּ֖rֶt hַshֵּׁnִֽyt׃

36.hebrewText: חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻלָאֹ֗ת עָשָׂה֮ בַּיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָת֒ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻלָאֹ֗ת עָשָׂה֙ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַיְרִיעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּמַּחְבֶּ֣רֶת הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית מַקְבִּילֹת֙ הַלֻּ֣לָאֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָֽת׃
36.englishText: they made fifty loops on the one cloth, and they made fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set, the loops being opposite one another.
36.transliteration: chֲmִshִּׁ֣yם lֻlָaֹ֗t aָshָׂh֮ bַּyְrִyaָ֣h hָaֶchָt֒ vַchֲmִshִּׁ֣yם lֻlָaֹ֗t aָshָׂh֙ bִּkְtsֵ֣h hַyְrִyaָ֔h aֲshֶׁ֖r bַּmַּchְbֶּ֣rֶt hַshֵּׁnִ֑yt mַkְbִּylֹt֙ hַlֻּ֣lָaֹ֔t aַchַ֖t aֶl־aֶchָֽt׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֕עַשׂ חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים קַרְסֵ֣י זָהָ֑ב וַיְחַבֵּ֨ר אֶת־הַיְרִיעֹ֜ת אַחַ֤ת אֶל־אַחַת֙ בַּקְּרָסִ֔ים וַיְהִ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן אֶחָֽד׃ {פ}
36.englishText: And they made fifty gold clasps and coupled the units*units Lit. “strip of cloth,” here used collectively. to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle became one whole.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֕aַshׂ chֲmִshִּׁ֖yם kַrְsֵ֣y zָhָ֑b vַyְchַbֵּ֨r aֶt־hַyְrִyaֹ֜t aַchַ֤t aֶl־aַchַt֙ bַּkְּrָsִ֔yם vַyְhִ֥y hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן aֶchָֽd׃ {p}

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ יְרִיעֹ֣ת עִזִּ֔ים לְאֹ֖הֶל עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עַשְׁתֵּֽי־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה יְרִיעֹ֖ת עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
36.englishText: They made cloths of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; they made the cloths eleven in number.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֙aַshׂ֙ yְrִyaֹ֣t aִzִּ֔yם lְaֹ֖hֶl aַl־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן aַshְׁtֵּֽy־aֶshְׂrֵ֥h yְrִyaֹ֖t aָshָׂ֥h aֹtָֽם׃

36.hebrewText: אֹ֜רֶךְ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֣ע אַמּ֔וֹת רֹ֖חַב הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֣ה אַחַ֔ת לְעַשְׁתֵּ֥י עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה יְרִיעֹֽת׃
36.englishText: The length of each cloth was thirty cubits, and the width of each cloth was four cubits, the eleven cloths having the same measurements.
36.transliteration: aֹ֜rֶךְ hַyְrִyaָ֣h hָaַchַ֗t shְׁlֹshִׁyם֙ bָּֽaַmָּ֔h vְaַrְbַּ֣a aַmּ֔vֹt rֹ֖chַb hַyְrִyaָ֣h hָaֶchָ֑t mִdָּ֣h aַchַ֔t lְaַshְׁtֵּ֥y aֶshְׂrֵ֖h yְrִyaֹֽt׃

36.hebrewText: וַיְחַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־חֲמֵ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָ֑ד וְאֶת־שֵׁ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָֽד׃
36.englishText: They joined five of the cloths by themselves, and the other six cloths by themselves.
36.transliteration: vַyְchַbֵּ֛r aֶt־chֲmֵ֥shׁ hַyְrִyaֹ֖t lְbָ֑d vְaֶt־shֵׁ֥shׁ hַyְrִyaֹ֖t lְbָֽd׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ לֻֽלָאֹ֣ת חֲמִשִּׁ֗ים עַ֚ל שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַקִּיצֹנָ֖ה בַּמַּחְבָּ֑רֶת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻלָאֹ֗ת עָשָׂה֙ עַל־שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַחֹבֶ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
36.englishText: They made fifty loops on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and they made fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֜aַshׂ lֻֽlָaֹ֣t chֲmִshִּׁ֗yם aַ֚l shְׂpַ֣t hַyְrִyaָ֔h hַkִּytsֹnָ֖h bַּmַּchְbָּ֑rֶt vַchֲmִshִּׁ֣yם lֻlָaֹ֗t aָshָׂh֙ aַl־shְׂpַ֣t hַyְrִyaָ֔h hַchֹbֶ֖rֶt hַshֵּׁnִֽyt׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ קַרְסֵ֥י נְחֹ֖שֶׁת חֲמִשִּׁ֑ים לְחַבֵּ֥ר אֶת־הָאֹ֖הֶל לִהְיֹ֥ת אֶחָֽד׃
36.englishText: They made fifty copper clasps to couple the tent together so that it might become one whole.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֛aַshׂ kַrְsֵ֥y nְchֹ֖shֶׁt chֲmִshִּׁ֑yם lְchַbֵּ֥r aֶt־hָaֹ֖hֶl lִhְyֹ֥t aֶchָֽd׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מִכְסֶה֙ לָאֹ֔הֶל עֹרֹ֥ת אֵילִ֖ם מְאׇדָּמִ֑ים וּמִכְסֵ֛ה עֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃ {ס}
36.englishText: And they made a covering of tanned ram skins for the tent, and a covering of dolphin skins above.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֤aַshׂ mִkְsֶh֙ lָaֹ֔hֶl aֹrֹ֥t aֵylִ֖ם mְaׇdָּmִ֑yם vּmִkְsֵ֛h aֹrֹ֥t tְּchָshִׁ֖yם mִlְmָֽaְlָh׃ {s}

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים עֹמְדִֽים׃
36.englishText: They made the planks for the Tabernacle of acacia wood, upright.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַshׂ aֶt־hַkְּrָshִׁ֖yם lַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן aֲtsֵ֥y shִׁtִּ֖yם aֹmְdִֽyם׃

36.hebrewText: עֶ֥שֶׂר אַמֹּ֖ת אֹ֣רֶךְ הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ וְאַמָּה֙ וַחֲצִ֣י הָֽאַמָּ֔ה רֹ֖חַב הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
36.englishText: The length of each plank was ten cubits, the width of each plank a cubit and a half.
36.transliteration: aֶ֥shֶׂr aַmֹּ֖t aֹ֣rֶךְ hַkָּ֑rֶshׁ vְaַmָּh֙ vַchֲtsִ֣y hָֽaַmָּ֔h rֹ֖chַb hַkֶּ֥rֶshׁ hָaֶchָֽd׃

36.hebrewText: שְׁתֵּ֣י יָדֹ֗ת לַקֶּ֙רֶשׁ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד מְשֻׁ֨לָּבֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֣ן עָשָׂ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל קַרְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
36.englishText: Each plank had two tenons, parallel*parallel See note at 26.17. to each other; they did the same with all the planks of the Tabernacle.
36.transliteration: shְׁtֵּ֣y yָdֹ֗t lַkֶּ֙rֶshׁ֙ hָֽaֶchָ֔d mְshֻׁ֨lָּbֹ֔t aַchַ֖t aֶl־aֶchָ֑t kֵּ֣ן aָshָׂ֔h lְkֹ֖l kַrְshֵׁ֥y hַmִּshְׁkָּֽן׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֶשְׂרִ֣ים קְרָשִׁ֔ים לִפְאַ֖ת נֶ֥גֶב תֵּימָֽנָה׃
36.englishText: Of the planks of the Tabernacle, they made twenty planks for the south side,*south side See note at 26.18.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַshׂ aֶt־hַkְּrָshִׁ֖yם lַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן aֶshְׂrִ֣yם kְrָshִׁ֔yם lִpְaַ֖t nֶ֥gֶb tֵּymָֽnָh׃

36.hebrewText: וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אַדְנֵי־כֶ֔סֶף עָשָׂ֕ה תַּ֖חַת עֶשְׂרִ֣ים הַקְּרָשִׁ֑ים שְׁנֵ֨י אֲדָנִ֜ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֤רֶשׁ הָאֶחָד֙ לִשְׁתֵּ֣י יְדֹתָ֔יו וּשְׁנֵ֧י אֲדָנִ֛ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֖ד לִשְׁתֵּ֥י יְדֹתָֽיו׃
36.englishText: making forty silver sockets under the twenty planks, two sockets under one plank for its two tenons and two sockets under each following plank for its two tenons;
36.transliteration: vְaַrְbָּaִyם֙ aַdְnֵy־kֶ֔sֶף aָshָׂ֕h tַּ֖chַt aֶshְׂrִ֣yם hַkְּrָshִׁ֑yם shְׁnֵ֨y aֲdָnִ֜yם tַּֽchַt־hַkֶּ֤rֶshׁ hָaֶchָd֙ lִshְׁtֵּ֣y yְdֹtָ֔yv vּshְׁnֵ֧y aֲdָnִ֛yם tַּֽchַt־hַkֶּ֥rֶshׁ hָaֶchָ֖d lִshְׁtֵּ֥y yְdֹtָֽyv׃

36.hebrewText: וּלְצֶ֧לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית לִפְאַ֣ת צָפ֑וֹן עָשָׂ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים קְרָשִֽׁים׃
36.englishText: and for the other side wall of the Tabernacle, the north side, twenty planks,
36.transliteration: vּlְtsֶ֧lַa hַmִּshְׁkָּ֛ן hַshֵּׁnִ֖yt lִpְaַ֣t tsָp֑vֹן aָshָׂ֖h aֶshְׂrִ֥yם kְrָshִֽׁyם׃

36.hebrewText: וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
36.englishText: with their forty silver sockets, two sockets under one plank and two sockets under each following plank.
36.transliteration: vְaַrְbָּaִ֥yם aַdְnֵyhֶ֖ם kָּ֑sֶף shְׁnֵ֣y aֲdָnִ֗yם tַּ֚chַt hַkֶּ֣rֶshׁ hָaֶchָ֔d vּshְׁnֵ֣y aֲdָnִ֔yם tַּ֖chַt hַkֶּ֥rֶshׁ hָaֶchָֽd׃

36.hebrewText: וּֽלְיַרְכְּתֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יָ֑מָּה עָשָׂ֖ה שִׁשָּׁ֥ה קְרָשִֽׁים׃
36.englishText: And for the rear of the Tabernacle, to the west, they made six planks;
36.transliteration: vּֽlְyַrְkְּtֵ֥y hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן yָ֑mָּh aָshָׂ֖h shִׁshָּׁ֥h kְrָshִֽׁyם׃

36.hebrewText: וּשְׁנֵ֤י קְרָשִׁים֙ עָשָׂ֔ה לִמְקֻצְעֹ֖ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן בַּיַּרְכָתָֽיִם׃
36.englishText: and they made two planks for the corners of the Tabernacle at the rear.
36.transliteration: vּshְׁnֵ֤y kְrָshִׁyם֙ aָshָׂ֔h lִmְkֻtsְaֹ֖t hַmִּshְׁkָּ֑ן bַּyַּrְkָtָֽyִם׃

36.hebrewText: וְהָי֣וּ תוֹאֲמִם֮ מִלְּמַ֒טָּה֒ וְיַחְדָּ֗ו יִהְי֤וּ תַמִּים֙ אֶל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ אֶל־הַטַּבַּ֖עַת הָאֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֚ן עָשָׂ֣ה לִשְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם לִשְׁנֵ֖י הַמִּקְצֹעֹֽת׃
36.englishText: They matched at the bottom, but terminated as one at the top into one ring;*They matched … one ring See note at 26.24. they did so with both of them at the two corners.
36.transliteration: vְhָy֣vּ tvֹaֲmִם֮ mִlְּmַ֒tָּh֒ vְyַchְdָּ֗v yִhְy֤vּ tַmִּyם֙ aֶl־rֹashׁ֔vֹ aֶl־hַtַּbַּ֖aַt hָaֶchָ֑t kֵּ֚ן aָshָׂ֣h lִshְׁnֵyhֶ֔ם lִshְׁnֵ֖y hַmִּkְtsֹaֹֽt׃

36.hebrewText: וְהָיוּ֙ שְׁמֹנָ֣ה קְרָשִׁ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אֲדָנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֤י אֲדָנִים֙ שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
36.englishText: Thus there were eight planks with their sockets of silver: sixteen sockets, two under each plank.
36.transliteration: vְhָyvּ֙ shְׁmֹnָ֣h kְrָshִׁ֔yם vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֣ם kֶּ֔sֶף shִׁshָּׁ֥h aָshָׂ֖r aֲdָnִ֑yם shְׁnֵ֤y aֲdָnִyם֙ shְׁnֵ֣y aֲdָnִ֔yם tַּ֖chַt hַkֶּ֥rֶshׁ hָaֶchָֽd׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בְּרִיחֵ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חֲמִשָּׁ֕ה לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הָאֶחָֽת׃
36.englishText: They made bars of acacia wood, five for the planks of the one side wall of the Tabernacle,
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַshׂ bְּrִychֵ֖y aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם chֲmִshָּׁ֕h lְkַrְshֵׁ֥y tsֶֽlַa־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן hָaֶchָֽt׃

36.hebrewText: וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְרִיחִ֔ם לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית וַחֲמִשָּׁ֤ה בְרִיחִם֙ לְקַרְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן לַיַּרְכָתַ֖יִם יָֽמָּה׃
36.englishText: five bars for the planks of the other side wall of the Tabernacle, and five bars for the planks of the wall of the Tabernacle at the rear, to the west;
36.transliteration: vַchֲmִshָּׁ֣h bְrִychִ֔ם lְkַrְshֵׁ֥y tsֶֽlַa־hַmִּshְׁkָּ֖ן hַshֵּׁnִ֑yt vַchֲmִshָּׁ֤h bְrִychִם֙ lְkַrְshֵׁ֣y hַmִּshְׁkָּ֔ן lַyַּrְkָtַ֖yִם yָֽmָּh׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הַבְּרִ֣יחַ הַתִּיכֹ֑ן לִבְרֹ֙חַ֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַקְּרָשִׁ֔ים מִן־הַקָּצֶ֖ה אֶל־הַקָּצֶֽה׃
36.englishText: they made the center bar to run, halfway up the planks, from end to end.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֖aַshׂ aֶt־hַbְּrִ֣ychַ hַtִּykֹ֑ן lִbְrֹ֙chַ֙ bְּt֣vֹךְ hַkְּrָshִׁ֔yם mִן־hַkָּtsֶ֖h aֶl־hַkָּtsֶֽh׃

36.hebrewText: וְֽאֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֞ים צִפָּ֣ה זָהָ֗ב וְאֶת־טַבְּעֹתָם֙ עָשָׂ֣ה זָהָ֔ב בָּתִּ֖ים לַבְּרִיחִ֑ם וַיְצַ֥ף אֶת־הַבְּרִיחִ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
36.englishText: They overlaid the planks with gold, and made their rings of gold, as holders for the bars; and they overlaid the bars with gold.
36.transliteration: vְֽaֶt־hַkְּrָshִׁ֞yם tsִpָּ֣h zָhָ֗b vְaֶt־tַbְּaֹtָם֙ aָshָׂ֣h zָhָ֔b bָּtִּ֖yם lַbְּrִychִ֑ם vַyְtsַ֥ף aֶt־hַbְּrִychִ֖ם zָhָֽb׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ אֶת־הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֛ב עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖הּ כְּרֻבִֽים׃
36.englishText: They made the curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, working into it a design of cherubim.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֙aַshׂ֙ aֶt־hַpָּrֹ֔kֶt tְּkֵ֧lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֛ן vְtvֹlַ֥aַt shָׁnִ֖y vְshֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֑r mַaֲshֵׂ֥h chֹshֵׁ֛b aָshָׂ֥h aֹtָ֖hּ kְּrֻbִֽyם׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ לָ֗הּ אַרְבָּעָה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וַיְצַפֵּ֣ם זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וַיִּצֹ֣ק לָהֶ֔ם אַרְבָּעָ֖ה אַדְנֵי־כָֽסֶף׃
36.englishText: They made for it four posts of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold, with their hooks of gold; and they cast for them four silver sockets.
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֣aַshׂ lָ֗hּ aַrְbָּaָh֙ aַmּvּdֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֔yם vַyְtsַpֵּ֣ם zָhָ֔b vָvֵyhֶ֖ם zָhָ֑b vַyִּtsֹ֣k lָhֶ֔ם aַrְbָּaָ֖h aַdְnֵy־kָֽsֶף׃

36.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מָסָךְ֙ לְפֶ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מׇשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽם׃
36.englishText: They made the screen for the entrance of the Tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery;
36.transliteration: vַyַּ֤aַshׂ mָsָךְ֙ lְpֶ֣tַch hָaֹ֔hֶl tְּkֵ֧lֶt vְaַrְgָּmָ֛ן vְtvֹlַ֥aַt shָׁnִ֖y vְshֵׁ֣shׁ mׇshְׁzָ֑r mַaֲshֵׂ֖h rֹkֵֽם׃

36.hebrewText: וְאֶת־עַמּוּדָ֤יו חֲמִשָּׁה֙ וְאֶת־וָ֣וֵיהֶ֔ם וְצִפָּ֧ה רָאשֵׁיהֶ֛ם וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {פ}
36.englishText: and five posts for it with their hooks. They overlaid their tops and their bands with gold; but the five sockets were of copper.
36.transliteration: vְaֶt־aַmּvּdָ֤yv chֲmִshָּׁh֙ vְaֶt־vָ֣vֵyhֶ֔ם vְtsִpָּ֧h rָashֵׁyhֶ֛ם vַchֲshֻׁkֵyhֶ֖ם zָhָ֑b vְaַdְnֵyhֶ֥ם chֲmִshָּׁ֖h nְchֹֽshֶׁt׃ {p}

37.hebrewText: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל אֶת־הָאָרֹ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֨יִם וָחֵ֜צִי אׇרְכּ֗וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה וָחֵ֙צִי֙ רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
37.englishText: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
37.transliteration: vַyַּ֧aַshׂ bְּtsַlְaֵ֛l aֶt־hָaָrֹ֖ן aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם aַmָּtַ֨yִם vָchֵ֜tsִy aׇrְkּ֗vֹ vְaַmָּ֤h vָchֵ֙tsִy֙ rׇchְbּ֔vֹ vְaַmָּ֥h vָchֵ֖tsִy kֹmָtֽvֹ׃

37.hebrewText: וַיְצַפֵּ֛הוּ זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר מִבַּ֣יִת וּמִח֑וּץ וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
37.englishText: He overlaid it with pure gold, inside and out; and he made a gold molding for it round about.
37.transliteration: vַyְtsַpֵּ֛hvּ zָhָ֥b tָh֖vֹr mִbַּ֣yִt vּmִch֑vּץ vַyַּ֥aַshׂ l֛vֹ zֵ֥r zָhָ֖b sָbִֽyb׃

37.hebrewText: וַיִּצֹ֣ק ל֗וֹ אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פַּעֲמֹתָ֑יו וּשְׁתֵּ֣י טַבָּעֹ֗ת עַל־צַלְעוֹ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת וּשְׁתֵּי֙ טַבָּעֹ֔ת עַל־צַלְע֖וֹ הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
37.englishText: He cast four gold rings for it, for its four feet: two rings on one of its side walls and two rings on the other.
37.transliteration: vַyִּtsֹ֣k l֗vֹ aַrְbַּa֙ tַbְּaֹ֣t zָhָ֔b aַ֖l aַrְbַּ֣a pַּaֲmֹtָ֑yv vּshְׁtֵּ֣y tַbָּaֹ֗t aַl־tsַlְavֹ֙ hָֽaֶchָ֔t vּshְׁtֵּy֙ tַbָּaֹ֔t aַl־tsַlְa֖vֹ hַshֵּׁnִֽyt׃

37.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בַּדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
37.englishText: He made poles of acacia wood, overlaid them with gold,
37.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַshׂ bַּdֵּ֖y aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם vַyְtsַ֥ף aֹtָ֖ם zָhָֽb׃

37.hebrewText: וַיָּבֵ֤א אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ בַּטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֖ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הָאָרֹ֑ן לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הָאָרֹֽן׃
37.englishText: and inserted the poles into the rings on the side walls of the ark for carrying the ark.
37.transliteration: vַyָּbֵ֤a aֶt־hַbַּdִּyם֙ bַּtַּbָּaֹ֔t aַ֖l tsַlְaֹ֣t hָaָrֹ֑ן lָshֵׂ֖at aֶt־hָaָrֹֽן׃

37.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ כַּפֹּ֖רֶת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר אַמָּתַ֤יִם וָחֵ֙צִי֙ אׇרְכָּ֔הּ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי רׇחְבָּֽהּ׃
37.englishText: He made a cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
37.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַshׂ kַּpֹּ֖rֶt zָhָ֣b tָh֑vֹr aַmָּtַ֤yִם vָchֵ֙tsִy֙ aׇrְkָּ֔hּ vְaַmָּ֥h vָchֵ֖tsִy rׇchְbָּֽhּ׃

37.hebrewText: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ שְׁנֵ֥י כְרֻבִ֖ים זָהָ֑ב מִקְשָׁה֙ עָשָׂ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם מִשְּׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
37.englishText: He made two cherubim of gold; he made them of hammered work, at the two ends of the cover:
37.transliteration: vַyַּ֛aַshׂ shְׁnֵ֥y kְrֻbִ֖yם zָhָ֑b mִkְshָׁh֙ aָshָׂ֣h aֹtָ֔ם mִshְּׁnֵ֖y kְts֥vֹt hַkַּpֹּֽrֶt׃

37.hebrewText: כְּרוּב־אֶחָ֤ד מִקָּצָה֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וּכְרוּב־אֶחָ֥ד מִקָּצָ֖ה מִזֶּ֑ה מִן־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת עָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֖ים מִשְּׁנֵ֥י (קצוותו) [קְצוֹתָֽיו]׃
37.englishText: one cherub at one end and the other cherub at the other end; he made the cherubim of one piece with the cover, at its two ends.
37.transliteration: kְּrvּb־aֶchָ֤d mִkָּtsָh֙ mִzֶּ֔h vּkְrvּb־aֶchָ֥d mִkָּtsָ֖h mִzֶּ֑h mִן־hַkַּpֹּ֛rֶt aָshָׂ֥h aֶt־hַkְּrֻbִ֖yם mִshְּׁnֵ֥y (ktsvvtv) [kְtsvֹtָֽyv]׃

37.hebrewText: וַיִּהְי֣וּ הַכְּרֻבִים֩ פֹּרְשֵׂ֨י כְנָפַ֜יִם לְמַ֗עְלָה סֹֽכְכִ֤ים בְּכַנְפֵיהֶם֙ עַל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת וּפְנֵיהֶ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו אֶ֨ל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת הָי֖וּ פְּנֵ֥י הַכְּרֻבִֽים׃ {פ}
37.englishText: The cherubim had their wings spread out above, shielding the cover with their wings. They faced each other; the faces of the cherubim were turned toward the cover.
37.transliteration: vַyִּhְy֣vּ hַkְּrֻbִyם֩ pֹּrְshֵׂ֨y kְnָpַ֜yִם lְmַ֗aְlָh sֹֽkְkִ֤yם bְּkַnְpֵyhֶם֙ aַl־hַkַּpֹּ֔rֶt vּpְnֵyhֶ֖ם aִ֣yshׁ aֶl־aָchִ֑yv aֶ֨l־hַkַּpֹּ֔rֶt hָy֖vּ pְּnֵ֥y hַkְּrֻbִֽyם׃ {p}

37.hebrewText: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֤יִם אׇרְכּוֹ֙ וְאַמָּ֣ה רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
37.englishText: He made the table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high;
37.transliteration: vַyַּ֥aַshׂ aֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָ֖ן aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֑yם aַmָּtַ֤yִם aׇrְkּvֹ֙ vְaַmָּ֣h rׇchְbּ֔vֹ vְaַmָּ֥h vָchֵ֖tsִy kֹmָtֽvֹ׃

37.hebrewText: וַיְצַ֥ף אֹת֖וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
37.englishText: he overlaid it with pure gold and made a gold molding around it.
37.transliteration: vַyְtsַ֥ף aֹt֖vֹ zָhָ֣b tָh֑vֹr vַyַּ֥aַshׂ l֛vֹ zֵ֥r zָhָ֖b sָbִֽyb׃

37.hebrewText: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ ל֥וֹ מִסְגֶּ֛רֶת טֹ֖פַח סָבִ֑יב וַיַּ֧עַשׂ זֵר־זָהָ֛ב לְמִסְגַּרְתּ֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
37.englishText: He made a rim of a hand’s breadth around it and made a gold molding for its rim round about.
37.transliteration: vַyַּ֨aַshׂ l֥vֹ mִsְgֶּ֛rֶt tֹ֖pַch sָbִ֑yb vַyַּ֧aַshׂ zֵr־zָhָ֛b lְmִsְgַּrְtּ֖vֹ sָbִֽyb׃

37.hebrewText: וַיִּצֹ֣ק ל֔וֹ אַרְבַּ֖ע טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הַטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע הַפֵּאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאַרְבַּ֥ע רַגְלָֽיו׃
37.englishText: He cast four gold rings for it and attached the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
37.transliteration: vַyִּtsֹ֣k l֔vֹ aַrְbַּ֖a tַbְּaֹ֣t zָhָ֑b vַyִּtֵּן֙ aֶt־hַtַּbָּaֹ֔t aַ֚l aַrְbַּ֣a hַpֵּaֹ֔t aֲshֶׁ֖r lְaַrְbַּ֥a rַgְlָֽyv׃

37.hebrewText: לְעֻמַּת֙ הַמִּסְגֶּ֔רֶת הָי֖וּ הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת בָּתִּים֙ לַבַּדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
37.englishText: The rings were next to the rim, as holders for the poles to carry the table.
37.transliteration: lְaֻmַּt֙ hַmִּsְgֶּ֔rֶt hָy֖vּ hַtַּbָּaֹ֑t bָּtִּyם֙ lַbַּdִּ֔yם lָshֵׂ֖at aֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָֽן׃

37.hebrewText: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָ֑ב לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
37.englishText: He made the poles of acacia wood for carrying the table, and overlaid them with gold.
37.transliteration: vַyַּ֤aַshׂ aֶt־hַbַּdִּyם֙ aֲtsֵ֣y shִׁtִּ֔yם vַyְtsַ֥ף aֹtָ֖ם zָhָ֑b lָshֵׂ֖at aֶt־hַshֻּׁlְchָֽן׃
